review_body: Outstanding staff, customer service and central NYC location was a winning combination that led to a terrific experience. If you're headed to Broadway and thereabouts, do yourself a favor and stay here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is the best! Hotel is good but nothing special except the rooftop bar with the great view and good ambiance. Room was very clean and comfortable and the view was fabulous! It was a special holiday for my 50th Birthday. My husband had made this known to the hotel in advance and the hotel replied that they would make a note of this. Unfortunately they have not done anything special for this special occasion :( Anyway, we enjoyed our stay and will consider booking this hotel again next time due to its location, clean spacious rooms and the great view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want to be in the theatre district, this is an excellent option. If you can afford a floor above the 25th level, you may end up with amazing views. I specifically asked for a room with a bathtub and their soaker tub is amazing. They just need better pillows and additional blankets in the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I have stayed at this hotel a few times. the rooms are very nice and the location is perfect, if you are coming in for Broadway shows. Every thing is within a very easy walk. But this hotel has a $30/night "resort or destination"fee which is a TOTAL RIPOFF. I do not see anything that you get for this money. Probably will look for another hotel for future stays

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is greta at 45th St and 7th -- right in the heart of times square!The hotel room is spacious. Compared to other hotels, the shower area is ample.I've stayed in 6 different hotels in New York. Out of all 6, I like this hotel the best! and definitely going back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a fantastic trip! I emailed prior to our arrival that it was my husbands 40th birthday. We turned up to see that they had put balloons in the room and had given us some free drinks. The room was very spacious and , even though it was next to the lifts, quiet! The door man (Sean) was lovely, so helpful and always had a smile on his face (even in the freezing cold!). The cleaners were also great, very friendly and did a very thorough job. Location was excellent, can’t go wrong with Times Square. We will definitely return to this hotel if we are lucky enough to go back to New York. Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We do not normally stay in the Times Square area because of the crush of tourists; however, I surrendered this once so that we could be close to the parade route on Thanksgiving, as well as Rockefeller Center. This property was great for our needs, and it was very affordable. I would not recommend that more than two people stay in the regular rooms due to their size, but they were very quiet, and the bathrooms were nice. Strangely, the drawers in one of the rooms were fake, so we could only put clothing in the closet. The front desk staff was very welcoming, and the housekeeper was amazing.This hotel is a solid choice for the location. There is a Starbucks right across the street, and the hotel is located 1/2 block from the craziness of Times Square. The subway is just a couple of blocks away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was in a great location with helpful and friendly personnel. The gym was spacious with updated equipment. The room was clean and relatively quiet. I'm a fan and will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this online and it is a fantastic hotel, very clean, the staff was wonderful and the location was perfect!! The view was everything!! Looked straight out at Freedom Tower, 2 views of the Hudson River. Definitely going back and staying at the same location next year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel on the fly because our in-bound flight was so delayed. We were pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome that Michelle gave us upon our arrival at midnight. Our room was sparkling clean and the beds were so comfortable. The location is a perfect for all those hot spots in the city - Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, Times Square, Subway...etc. I will be staying here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed here before but doubt we would return. This time we were in an inferior cramped room with bizarrely no shelves or drawers to unpack into! Terrible view also. Staff and T45 and Bar 54 all excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fabulous location, lovely king room with floor to ceiling windows with amazing views of Times Square & roof top views of city. Taxes & other fees are ridiculous. Expensive to eat & drink here so we went elsewhere. Very friendly & helpful staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really loved the Hyatt Centric. Not pretentious. Modern and fresh. The front desk, housekeeping, and door staff were very friendly. Amazing views from our king room on the 43rd floor, no noise concerns at all, plenty of space. Floor to ceiling windows with thick blackout curtain when you're ready to sleep. Rooftop bar views are amazing as well. We'll be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were received by a very warm staff. Very happy to find out the hotel was so close to Time Square, Broadway Shows, Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. Oh and the Macy Day Parade! We picked this hotel randomly and we picked a great choice. We will definite refer the hotel and stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed over Thanksgiving and was so impressed with the room -- stayed in an executive king suite and the room was spacious and comfortable. We were on the 25th floor and had decent views. Loved that we were so close to everything but not so in it that it was overly noisy. Teenager stayed on the sofa bed and it was perfect for him. Only downside was the lack of availability to purchase drinks/snacks outside of room service or the bar, which meant that were ridiculously overpriced. Otherwise, perfect stay and will be our go-to hotel in NYC from now on.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really good stay! The one complaint is the "destination fee" that wasn't stated up front. Other than that, it met or exceeded my expectations. Proximity to Times Square, Rockafeller Ctr, etc. is exceptional. Rooms are very clean and nice. Heated bathroom floors are super nice. Plenty of bottle water was nice. I would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I recently visited New York for a little vacation. The Hyatt Centric Times Square was the perfect home base for exploring the city. We could wake up and venture out for some breakfast and sight seeing while still being close to our comfortable and clean home base in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The location is excellent. Most of the hotels you will find near Times Square will be heavily trafficked and will often feature worn interiors and furniture. Not so with this hotel. It is very clean and well maintained. The room size is bigger than most hotels in New York, but there is not a lot of space for unpacking. I think we had a grand total of 3 small drawers and the closet. All in all we had a great experience would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in a perfect location. The rooms are nice and big for NYC. There were a few items not working perfect in the bathroom (drain, shows head) but not a big deal. The 3 rating is due to the exceptionally rude front desk staff. They did not want to help me or understand me. When I checked at 2 to see if my room might be ready early I was rudely told they’d send me a message, and they didn’t have to be ready until 4. Upon check out I was spoken to like I was a dumb tourist. The bellmen outside are quite opposite though. They are friendly, warm, and sincere. They should also work the front desk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The resort fee charged at the time of checkout feels like a trick. It’s not the way business should be done. It really leaves a bad taste at the end of a nice stay. The fee was $35 a day And that adds up? I really thought the price advertised should include this fee. Just bad business.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First and last time to visit this awful hotelThe carpet our suit was covered with stainsSofa bed mattress was so old and uncomfortable All the pillows were flatThe blankets had huge holesThe cushion in the sofa bed had black stains and four long hairs on itConcierge service was a third party & not helpful to reserve restaurant reservation Dialing the operator for at least 2-3 times till operator pick up the phoneOn our last day hot water was shut down and we could take a shower After all hotel charged $200 for hotel fee for 5 nights For sure this hotel didn’t have Hyatt service neither high standard guess servicesPLEASE DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL. There is plenty hotels much cheaper with outstanding service

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is located a block away from TS which I found very convenient since it was my first time in NY with my kids.The staff is mostly cordial, not particularly friendly at the front desk, but the staff at T45 made up for the so-so attention at the front desk.Maria, a night waitress at T45, was spectacular. She was really nice to my kids and very friendly. I would definitely stay there again, nice rooms, good overall service and just a good hotel. Nothing too fancy but comfortable and just nice. It’s always good when you have someone that just makes your life easier, specially after a really long day walking and sightseeing, and we just found that with Maria. Fitting end to a nice visit to NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I give this hotel 3.5 stars because the hotel lobby and restaurant is too cramped with only two chairs and one couch in the lobby. Not adequate for a hotel of this size..Restaurant and room service is not impressive at all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location. We could walk to the plays, Rockefeller Center and to the hotel where we boarded our sightseeing bus. The suite we stayed in was perfect for us: living room, bedroom, bathroom, hall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right in the heart of Times Square. A McDonald’s down the street was convenient. The roof top was awesome. Go on the tour if you have children. The room had a blue tooth radio so we blasted Alicia Keys New York. It made the mood.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We checked in at 4pm and were told that our room wasn't ready. It was after 8PM before we finally got a room. The staff didn't even seem to care. Rooms are clean and quiet, but for the price you pay I will be trying a different hotel the next time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was super great, the rooms were just an average room. Restaurant and bar was $$$$$. As a member I had an upgraded room but the only difference was the view. This was the best part for sure but standard rooms won’t get this view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Customer service was poor from both check-in to the Bar54 waitress. Food and drink prices were high but the quality and selection were poor. The room had a nice view but the bathroom could have been cleaner.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel with a great location! The staff is second to none and restaurant options on-site are great with amazing service! If you’re looking for a hotel in the time square area this is the one to choose!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The central location of this hotel in Midtown Manhattan is particularly convenient, especially for almost all Broadway theaters, restaurants, and Times Square attractions. This property is also an excellent value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is a solid choice. It is clean, has decent size rooms, and good features. It's location is excellent to see shows, shop, or just tour around. The staff are super helpful and friendly. The make it a notch above just a regular 4 star.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: With plans to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall and a one-woman Broadway show, my wife and I found the Hyatt Centric Times Square to be the perfect location. Right within walking distance of where we wanted to be, and an easy subway ride to the 9/11 Memorial & Museum, which we also wanted to see. Our room had a marvelous view of the city and the staff was great. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Staff of this hotel is extraordinary- from front door to front desk to concierge to housekeeping. This was our second stay- we loved it the first time and perhaps even more this time. Great service. Great people.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was checked in early and given a opportunity to upgrade my room. I was checked into a great room on the upper floors. The shower bathroom was simply perfect. Big rain head shower with a hand held faucet. The shower was large, the bathroom floor heated. Bed was very comfortable and the chair and ottoman was very comfortable. So many little details that you take for granted easy plugs for phone. Light switches next to bed turned out all the lights. Chromcast on TV allowed you to broadcast movies to TV. Very friendly staff. In addition a beautiful rooftop bar and observation deck.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel for a celebratory family trip to New York City. The hotel delivers as promised, with rooms being of either average or slightly less-than-average in size versus other hotels. You cannot beat the location for Times Square, Broadway, and being centrally located. However, traffic getting to and from the hotel can be crazy since 45th street leads directly into Times Square. The front-desk staff are very helpful, the rooms are clean, everything appears to be in good condition and working order. My negative comments are as follows: 1. Concierge staff refused to order flowers for me, instead directing me to a third-party vendor (DIY) which is something I have never experienced at another hotel, 2. Some waitstaff at breakfast restaurant are not very friendly and they were playing games with each other over the music and lighting settings in the restaurant to the detriment of the customers, and 3. Security at the hotel is virtually non-existent even though there is usually someone standing between the front desk and the entrance to the elevators. This person was observed to be looking down at her phone more often than not, and there is nothing that prevents someone from going to or from the club on the 54th floor from accessing a guest floor and following you to your hotel room. Access to guest floors in the elevators is not key-controlled but it would not matter as long as club customers have the same access to the same elevators the guests use. If you are a single traveler concerned about about safety and security, consider this when choosing where to stay. One night, there was one person asking to see room keys before you got on the elevators but this was once for a short time over a 5 day / 4 night stay. And they were only asking selected individuals about this. Again, the location is great for NYC activities, the rooms are nice, and you get Hyatt points if that appeals to you, like it did me. But in certain key areas, the hotel needs to improve.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want a place tucked in at Times Square, then this is the place to go! Glad that this was a place so close in proximity to Broadway, Times Square, and transportation. Would stay here again soon!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked an upper floor room and was told at check-in time (4PM), that none were ready and unknown when one would be, so they placed us in a lower floor. If you pay and book an upper floor, arrive at check-in time....then, why wouldn't a room be ready or close to ready?? Very disappointed with our stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is perfect if you want to stay right in Times Square. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are small, smaller than I expected, but clean. It's great for a night or 2, or a business trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was extremely satisfied with my stay. I stayed on the 54th floor with one of the best view of NYC, room was spotless and decent size. Convenient location to walk around Times Square and surroundings. I loved the rooftop bar and enjoyed the food from the restaurant. Receptionist were very nice and the porter staff was incredibly helpful from getting my luggage to the hotel to getting my car off the parking lot and uploading my luggage. Checking in and out was seamless. Would stay here again and again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As most reviews say, the location couldn’t be better if you want to be in the pulsing heart of the city. We had an executive suite, which allowed our grandson to sleep early in the king bed and we could relax in the living room. Wish we had requested a higher floor because the city street noise was a little loud, but hey, it’s NYC. The staff were extremely friendly. Unfortunately our room had been missed for cleaning and even when we called, no one came within the hour, but when we went out and came back after two hours, all was right. Nice to have free bottled water for all our walks, even from the front desk. And the fresh baked cookies at the front desk were exceptional. If you work out, bring your gear because the fitness centre is pretty well laid out. We have previously stayed at the Beacon Hotel on Broadway at about 78th Ave but will consider coming back here in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was top notch. Front desk and and staff very nice and helpful. Doorman great especially for getting cabs. Clean beautiful rooms. Very comfortable room and bed. Easy to get around New York. Concierge Jay very knowledgeable and helpful. Great staff except for Rooftop Bar54. Hostess was very sour. Not much personality, and not friendly. Drinks overly expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean room. Excellent location-quality room with excellent lightning. Lots of plug ins -Great water pressure nice shower. Excellent location. Staff very helpful. Every thing in the room was in great working condition.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took our granddaughter to NYC to celebrate her 13th birthday. We spent 5 nights at the Hyatt Centric Times Square and were very pleased with our stay. The location of the hotel is excellent- Times Square is just at the end of the block. We were able to walk to all of the theaters that we had tickets for. We walked to the Empire State Building and Rockefeller Center. The subway station to get to the Statue of Liberty cruise was a short walk as well. The concierge was very helpful with directions and suggestions. Our room was spacious and well appointed. This is one of the few hotels in this area that offers two queen beds. We loved the walk in shower with two shower heads. We ate breakfast in the restaurant a couple of times and though it was a bit more expensive than some others in the area, the food was good and it was really convenient to be able to have our breakfast before venturing out into the cold for a day of sightseeing. Everyone on the staff was very friendly and provided great service. We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would love to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wh had a 1 bedroom suite on 53rd floor. Clean, spacious and nice decor. Manr cheaper hotels in NYC, but for what you get this was the better value. 1/2 block to 45th and Broadway. Theaters in east walking distance. Roof top bar great views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The views are absolutely incredible from the Hyatt’s rooms. I have stayed here for years now, and I am always impressed with the unobstructed Times Square views that most rooms provide. The Hyatt staff are friendly, and attentive to your needs; they are always happy to assist me in their capacity to do so. I do believe that their rooms are in need of an overhaul; my years of visiting the hotel has shown a consistent decline in the condition of the room furniture (scratches on the meubles, destroyed mouldings, unvarnished furniture, etc). I understand that “wear and tear” are a normal part of the industry, but charging $400USD per night gives no excuse as to why the furniture has not been replaced or maintained. I would also add that there is a heavy focus in sustainability (which I find wonderful), but the Hyatt needs to get its act together on its room service. I order fries and it came packaged in a plastic container placed in a plastic bag, accompanied by plastic forks/knives in plastic wrapping...what ever happened to 5-star room service? The Hyatt always seems to impress me with the quality of its service, rooms and design. Their membership program is awesome too! I would love to see these small issues addressed so that it maintains its prestigious brand.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: To start with, always difficult choosing a hotel as there are so many. Liked the Hyatt from the photos and reviews left by other customers. Great location for us with the things we had in mind to see. Easy check in, and friendly staff. Room was just as described and also very clean. Great view as well. All in all I can say, book this hotel with confidence as you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for a weekend in early November. We went to three Broadways shows and all were within easy walking distance of this hotel. We booked a Deluxe King room with Times Square view and had a full glass wall at the foot of the bed with the Chrysler building visible to the left, Times Square to the right, and lower Manhattan in the middle (just like the picture on their Website). We weren’t in the room much, but enjoyed the view in the daylight and especially at night when we were there. We have stayed at less expensive hotels in the Times Square area in the past, but we will come back to this hotel from now on because the view is worth the extra expense. The location is perfect and the view is amazing. The Dry Bar hairdryer in the room was the best I have ever used. I ordered one on the train on the way home. There were complementary bottles of water, a Keurig coffee maker, and a refrigerator. We also enjoyed the roof top bar one evening. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very convenient for Broadway shows. Safe location and helpful staff. Traveling alone this is the place to be. Unfortunately, you need to book very early around the Christmas tree lighting. Request a room with a city room and stay up all night enjoying the lights!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: ordered room service one day for breakfast and got a lot of plastic boxes, plastic knives/forks,pastic containers with butter... etc - something macdonalds would give me... what happened to 5 star service? so lowered service rating to reflect that...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good value; very central location. Walk to tons of restaurants, Times Sq and entire Theater District. Rooms with Times Sq view are great; rooms clean; housekeeping immaculate. Free water/coffee.Bar54 with Rooftop view is spectacular.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time visiting NY and this hotel is in a great location. Rooms are nice, staff is friendly. Great roof top bar and restaurant/bar on ground level. 1/2 block from Times Square and close to Rockefellar Center, Central Park, etc..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at Hyatt Centric in November and had a wonderful stay. The location of the hotel is one block from times square and the hotel staff were so well trained. The restaurant and bar on floor 54 was absolutely incredible. the views of the city were extraordinary not to mention we were able to witness a full moon from the54th floor

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I should start by saying that I’ve been coming to NYC for weekend stays for over 15 years. On almost every occasion, the Kimpton Muse has been my home away from home. I’ve always had fantastic stays there, and woukd happily have chosen to stay there again when I decided to spend the entire week in the City, but it was just too expensive.With that in mind, after much searching, I stumbled across the Hyatt Centric Times Square, advertising a rate of $281 per night for a king room with a Times Square view. I must say upfront that the real price of this room is not $281 per night. Including taxes ($44.88), destination fee ($34.42) and valet parking ($80), it’s nearly $440 per night. And they will put a hold on your credit card for $100 per night for incidentals (which are credited back at the end of your stay). This is all standard for most hotels, but can be a shock to someone who isn’t expecting it.Charges aside, this hotel is exceptional! Even before we arrived, I was able to check in online and receive a text message when our room was ready (two hours before regular check in time!) The check in process took less than five minutes. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. When we decided to sleep in (very late!) on our first day, a note was slipped under the door telling us to call if we wanted our room serviced. We left at 5pm for dinner and a show, and came back to a freshly made up room. The bed linens are the softest I’ve come across in any hotel - EVER! The room is equipped with all the things you’d expect- TV, keurig, mini fridge, iron, hairdryer, etc. The rooftop bar is reportedly the highest in Manhattan, and the views are spectacular. (Drink prices may also be among the highest in Manhattan, as our tab for 4 drinks was over $100). The location cannot be beat! Steps from Times Square, the Theater District, Fifth Avenue, Grand Central, and LOTS of restaurants on this block of W 45th Street alone! This is likely to become my new home away from home whenever I’m in New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff is wonderful and the rooms, especially the comfortable beds, are fabulous! Wonderful pub next door and Times Squareis just right up the street. The bar dowstairs has a Happy Hour and the bar tenders are very nice and accomodating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stay at this Hotel when visiting NYC for multiple reasons. The location is excellent for shows and other places we visit. The Staff and personnel are super to work with and are professional, knowledgeable about the hotel and New York City and do all they can to make your stay enjoyable. This time around our Guest Services Agent, Rosalba was extremely helpful and made our stay exceptional. We have stayed at this location numerous times and plan to continue to do so.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I'm Discoverist and spent what I felt was a reasonable amount of points for a Friday/Saturday night stay here. First of all, the location was perfect, less than a minute walk to the heart of Times Square. The property is nicely up to date, the rooms are small but comfortable and well appointed. Our only Food and Bev experience was at the Bar 54, the highest rooftop bar in NYC, it says. The view was spectacular, it did not dissapoint. The price for 3 drinks... probably on par for the uniqueness of the location. When we come back to NY, we will certainly look into staying here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful, sleek hotel. Great views from the high floors. Spacious, clean, pretty rooms. Absolutely ideal location to Times Square ~ literally steps away. Close to John's Pizzeria and Junior's as well. We stayed at Hyatt Centric during both of our NYC trips.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for one night with 2 friends. First of all, great location!! So convenient and close to everything! Hotel room was larger than most NYC hotels - very nice accommodations! Will stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. Easy access to everything. There were several Irish Pubs within walking distance. Highly recommend Connoly's. Doorman recommended Cranberry for coffe/lattes/sandwiches whichwas a great choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first stay here and I was very pleased. For starters, it is a in a perfect location on 45th between Sixth and Seventh Avenue, so it is really convenient for mid-town business needs and for theater-goers. I was concerned when I checked in about street noise from my room on the 18th floor, but I did not even notice any noise at all -- the windows did very well in blocking sound.The front desk staff was friendly and efficient. My desk clerk Ritchie was great. The hotel has almost no lobby to sit in because it devotes space to a restaurant, which was the one modest blip.The rooms were very spacious (and not just my skimpy NY room standards), modern, well-designed and well-equipped. They were also quite attractive and functional. The bedding was comfortable and attractive. They offered a "featherless" room, which I requested and got, which could explain the comfort of the bedding and pillows. The lighting was way better than any hotel I have been in recently, with multiple options on switches throughout the room. The bathroom was very modern and attractive with a huge shower stall that had a rainfall shower head. There were two modern phones and a cool clock in the room. The ventilation system had individual settings that actually worked. The entertainment package was state of the art.Most of all, the actual rate was very reasonable for such modern quality. With a AAA discount, the rate (before all the NY taxes) was only $379 a night, which was very low to the prices that I was quoted almost everywhere else at hotels that were not up to the quality and conveniences of the Hyatt Centric.I was really pleased with my stay. My only slight criticism is that this hotel has fallen prey to the unfortunate destination fee ($30 per night) for services that either ought to have been provided in the room rate (like free internet and small plastic water bottles) or provided for discounts for services that I suspect few would really care about. That aside, I certainly would be pleased to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely Hotel with Genuinely committed staff who go out of their way to insure you are having the best experience possible. We had a Double Queen room on the 37th floor - and in what seems like the first time in NYC we had a bathroom that was not only large but also have a huge bathtub. Plenty of space to put out the toiletries. The room was fairly large too. Very Comfortable. And another bonus is the windows would open - which is a must for me as large hotels rooms often get stuffy. The location is fantastic as well - a short walk to the Theater (the Music Box) and Dinner (Dim Sum Palace) and the Subway (to go to the American Natural History Museum!). There is also a short 5 block walk to a Whole Foods. The Concierge was also exceptional - very articulate and informative. I would recommend this hotel to business travelers, families and couples.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location Location. This hotel is right on Times Square and central to everything. If you want a central location this really is it. Despite this we felt that the room was a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle outside, silent, comfy beds, relaxing decor - just what was needed after a long busy day in the city. Rooms also very well thought through in terms of the little things, lighting, storage, bathroom layout. The things I often think could be done better in a hotel room had been done here. Plenty room for a family of 4 which for a city room was impressive. Our minus point - The hotel has an amazing rooftop bar with stunning views. However, children can only go up at 10.30am for a quick view escorted by a staff member. I understand that children up there in the evening may not be what they want. However, we have stayed in city hotels like this all over and have always been able to use this sort of place with the children in the daytime and at least until a certain time of night (they are teenagers not toddlers). It was a shame that as a result none of us could use this space.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric, is literally a minute from time square, it’s position is ideal for exploring New York, with nearby subway links for getting around the city. And plenty nearby which you can walk to including a Rockefeller, Empire State Building, grand central station, Bryant park etc. We had a city view king room, and were on the 35th floor, super fast lift. Helpful staff on reception. Very clean rooms, modern decor. I would stay again. Connolys Irish Bar a couple of doors down from hotel, was great for breakfast to set us up for the day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I’ve stayed at many hotels in NYC over the years and I will say this was a fantastic stay !! The room was two queen comfortable beds ! Spacious & clean . The valet was amazing , the front desk check in and out was great and everyone was so friendly !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and friendly staff. I will stay here again and recommend it. We had a room with two queen beds and it was very spacious for New York City. Amazing view from the Rooftop bar! Towels were abit thin but overall a great experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed this hotel immensely! Room was clean and very well appointed. Desk staff very attentive and helpful. Super location near Times Square. Easy walk to everything! Will definitely return to Hyatt Centric Times Square in the new future. Highly recommend!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived in NYC earlier than expected. It was freezing early in the morning we were tired from a long trip so we decided to go to the hotel already and hang out over there. The front desk that assisted us was so helpful. She was one of a kind, she delivers great customer relation that was satisfactory. I think her name was Diana if I’m not mistaken. The room that we had was perfect. Comfortable bed, clean bathroom and spacious. Maybe just need few more pillows. Lol we had 4 pillows but they were just low, its just we prefer higher ones. But the whole experience was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel in the heart of manhattan . The staff was fantastic, the room was so comfortable. The decor was amazing. It’s a hidden gem . It’s a pity that they do not advertise this hotel more . Very minute you arrive your made very welcome.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Because there was a lack of availability, we did this for just one night. And, we checked in right at check-in time at 4 p.m., and checked out right at the maximum extended check-out time of 12 p.m. Because it is expensive to get the Deluxe King Times Square View, I would go with this strategy. Do you sightseeing, etc. and stay at a lower-priced hotel. Then, when you go to the Hyatt, just stay there, enjoy the view, eat locally and there you go!The room is very good! You pay for it, with the final charge closing in on $500 for one night with the (crazy) resort fee, and all the taxes. There is a good amount of room. There is a small refrigerator, there is a Keurig coffee maker. The floors only have about 10 rooms per floor, so are pretty quiet, and the ice maker is close by.The view is spectacular with floor to ceiling windows! They are well insulated for temperature and sound. You will hear little of what is outside.You can go to the rooftop bar. There is a maître d' who is ready to get people tables. As a hotel guest, I just showed him my room card and told him that I was staying at the hotel. That way, I was able to walk right out to the balcony to enjoy the views. The waiters are unobtrusive, and don't bother you for drink orders, etc. unless you want one and seek them out.Again, the views are beautiful! And, as a guest, you can go up at 10:30 a.m. each morning if you meet in the lobby. You are taken up by guest services for time to enjoy the views before the bar opens for the day.The hotel is designed in the millennial/hipster/European style. Graffiti art adorns the lobby, and the decor is mostly white. So, if that's your thing, you're in luck! The service is in the New York/European detached style. So, warm and friendly ISN'T what to expect! But, the guest services lady who took us up to the rooftop in the morning was very nice and that was appreciated!Also, you WILL NOT be checking in before 4 p.m. So, don't expect it. Even when we were right there at 4 p.m., the room they had set aside for us was STILL not ready. But, luckily, we were given a room on the 50th floor, and it was furthest from the elevator of the two rooms per floor that are the Deluxe King Times Square views.Good stay, will most likely go again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Planned this holiday to NYC & Broadway theatre six months in advance to make this stay affordable. Tried to extend the stay about a week before arrival and found out that it was really unaffordable without planning far in advance. Rooms approached $900 per night when trying to book at the last minute! Love the location. Housekeeping is always friendly and efficient. Rooms are relatively generous in size considering the location and look forward to my next visit to the Hyatt Centric hotel in Times Square! Convenient restaurant downstairs off of lobby, but quite expensive for what you get. However, considering this is in the heart of Times Square, I guess the prices are consistent with the area. Many other options for meals in every direction from the hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quiet hotel, comfy bed right in Times Square! Nice staff. Staff checking us in was happy and nice. Concierge gave great recommendations for restaurants! Black out curtains really worked- no light leaks like in so many hotels I’ve been in. Great central location to everywhere in NYC-easy access to subway. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel has all the amenities and many extras such as variable lighting, extra outlets for phone charging and blue tooth speaker/clock. It is an easy walk to Times Square, subway, and other attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: In spite of the excellent location of the Hotel, the service levels (other than check in by Steven & the Steward at the Breakfast restaurant) is pathetic. The Hotel charges a load of extra Fees in the form of Taxes, which are thrust upon the Guests (no recourse, but, mandatory to pay) and the Offers are ridiculous and completely meaningless. The Free International Calls (through 8011 Dial Out) did not work, even once, when we dialled International numbers; and even the Operator was unable to connect us, even once. When I asked the Reception about this recurring issue, the response of the Guest relations was a 'what can I do about it? This is the only way to dial and if it doesn't work, we can't help you!'Guest Services after 11 pm does not answer. Carpet in the room is musty and dirty. This is one Hyatt property I would definitely not return to, nor, recommend to anyone. Unfortunately, properties like this are not doing any good to the Hyatt brand.Hyatt USA properties staff should learn from the excellent attitude displayed by the staff of its Asian properties.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt, we will be back asap. Localization is the best, nearest Times Square, 54 BAR, food and drinks are memorable. Checkin and checkout perfects.Our room was cleaned every day. I appreciated the silence during the nigth

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed one night during Canadian thanksgiving. Our two kids loved this place just next to time square. You can asked to go to the 52 floor each morning at 10 to see the view. During the night, it is a really nice bar. Our room was big enough for our family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed with our two boys for 2 nights. Room was very clean, light and had a great view. Staff was very friendly and service minded during check in, stay and check out. All in all a great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and helpful staff. Went to NY with a group of friends and this was a perfect base location for our trip. Centrally located and great service too. I would defiantly come back for convenience and ease.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked a high floor room with a view of Times Square about 10 weeks in advance. Was told there was a late checkout and got "upgraded" to a suite. The suite was on a low floor with no view and plenty of street noise. Was told everything in the suite is complimentary, but the refrigerator minibar was conveniently emptied prior to my arrival and never stocked throughout my stay. As a new World of Hyatt Rewards member I felt more than a bit disrespected.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were here on a couples trip in October 2019. Our room was very clean and modern, with a comfortable bed, big TV, good wifi, and nice bathroom. It also had a nice sized closet and in-room safe. It also had a small refrigerator. The hotel has a rooftop bar on the 54th floor with nice views (and expensive drinks). The gym on the 4th floor is very nice. There is also a restaurant on the ground floor (45T). The only problem was that the prices for room service were different than shown on the menu in our room, but they were great and made adjustments.It is walking distance to the Shubert Theater and Times Square.The elevators are very fast (one time, my ears popped). Overall, a very nice hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was very nice and helpful, loved the doorman. Lobby was too small, no where to congregate with guests. Bathroom towels where old and rough. Location was fantastic, close to the shows. Food and drink was expensive, for not so special. Seemed other restaurants in the area where more reasonably priced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A bit overrated, the food is mediocre, the room was not very clean at check-in, a towel was still dirty and folded.It's location is definitely the strongest point, but I would not go back there given the availability of higher end hotels nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is fine. Great Location ...staff was approachable for New York standards. I booked via my company travel website and it stated all taxes and fees were paid for. However during checkout I was told I had to pay resort fees for the use of WiFi/ discount on Food and water or something like that. It came up to about 97 euros for a 2,5 night stay. On the websites states that wifi is free. I never used food and beverage services at the hotel. I find this very disappointing. Just another way to ripoff customers. So be aware when booking here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the typical commercialized business that’s seen guest as numbers and that’s it. Cero personalized service..cero! The securities at the door they were nicer that the font desk. I was expecting good service because ny it’s like that! They tired to see tourist the all time and it’s understandable but you need to train the staff and I mean all the front desk to greet guest correctly and make eye contact! None of that happens incredible! After paying almost 300 at night I was expecting better service but I was wrong!..the price and service were not balance! Breakfast super expensive and very mediocre! Never again !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: They went down . Room service and beverage very unprofessional. Managers don’t care waste of time . Management should make evaluations regard the service and send home whoever needed Thy disappointed us

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spot on location, 2 mins to Times Square in fairly quiet side street, convenient to walk around for Rockefeller/midtown area and 42nd street Subway. Hotel room spacious and comfy, large shower room with wet floor shower alcove which was nice. Thought amenity charge was steep considering you get a cheap plastic bottle of water per day, unwanted toiletries and maid forgetting to replenish drinking glasses..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a wonderful property in a great location just a block off of Times Square. Hotel is well appointed, staff is really friendly and efficient and the rooftop bar (highest in NYC at 54th floor) is worth a stop.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for a conference so there was not really another option for me, but having stayed here I will keep it mind for future trips. The hotel has a great location! I didn't eat at the on site restaurant, but our conference featured dinner prepared by the hotel's catering. It was fantastic!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric last week for 5 nights, 2 adults, one child (age 9). The hotel is in an excellent location next to Times Square and other attractions. We booked a deluxe queen room and were on the 40th floor, the room was large with a great bathroom and was kept spotless throughout our stay. There is a rooftop bar with amazing views, this is for over 21’s, however at 10.30am every day you can take kids to see the view, it would be great if this could be available at night for an hour to see the views over the city. All staff were lovely and very helpful. We didn’t eat in the hotel as there are so many places next to the hotel, there are also a couple of Irish bars which serve great food. I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again on our next stay in New York, just wish we could have stayed longer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very conveniently location and above all the entire staff are extremely friendly and helpful. My home away from home. T45 restaurant is excellent and here as well the staff is amazing. The hotel is a bit pricey at times but definitely worth the value

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Honestly a wonderful hotel to stay at! Location was amazing. Complimentary water, free international and domestic calls included, staff were amazing and it was just so good to stay there! Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this very conveniently located hotel recently. A warm welcome made our stay even more special. They gave us a room with a view over Manhatten and Times Square. Whilst expensive given the holiday period we were very happy with our room located about the hustle and bustle of New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: carpet needs cleaning and cleaner sheets and bed spreads without stains on them. update bedroom furniture it was all miss match, the decore was horible except the bathe rooms was very nice. The customer service was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Travelled with family of 4. Front desk service was good. Offered me the room on 24th floor with Time Square view. The rooms are big unlike in the reviews of many other Manhattan hotels. Water bottles are provided for free. Room service lady was amazing person !!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked for 7 nights stay since my parents does not like to walk far; i figured that if its near Time Square, we wont walk that far. Indeed, it is close to Times Square and if your room is in the Higher Floor, you will have great views. Restaurant is dis-appointing. Hotel Service was good. The hotel is new compared to other hotels in the area and room size is good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is my go to hotel when I visit NY. I love the staff. The rooms are so modern and clean. The hotel is very chic. The location is top notch. Very easy to get a taxi. You will not be disappointed with this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Seems like a good hotel at first glance. Good location if you are looking to be near Times Square. Which we were for a show we were seeing. Hotel lobby is tiny and gets very full, but the line does move fairly quickly, there is no dedicated quick line for world of Hyatt elite members. Check in was great got in earlier than we thought. Room was pretty spacious for New York. Was not a fan of the choice to only have a duvet style blanked covered in a sheet like material as the only cover for the bed. Even with the heat low I was hot at night and a sheet would have been more comfortable for me. There is also no sound proofing in the hotel and you will hear the sirens going by all hours of the night especially being so close to Times Square. Was not a great condition for sleep. Hotel does not have enough wash clothes for each guest in the room, and need to request more if desired from cleaning staff. Found that the phone doesn’t connect to the front desk, and is always a busy signal, only was I found to communicate other then going down to the lobby, was to use the app and chat with someone on there. The bar on the roof is a pretty cool spot. Pricy, but expected and a pretty cool view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 1. Found the zipper of the bag of my baggages has been opened when received my baggages dispositioned after check-out and/but it was quite hard to devan all of the stuffs in robby to check all of the items in back and need to hurry to JFK. When returned to home, further found starbucks bottle in wrapping paper has been missedn from the opened the bag, which bought Starbucks Reserve Shop in NY. 2. Baggages were handed over after quite long time from luggage room located in 1st floor by balck man who is tall but not fat and wonder why he took time to pull out my baggage as it was not busy in the luggage room.3. The black man even forced me to use the car he designated to JFK airport but I have declined and use UBER to JFK.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel right in the centre of Times Square & close to everything we needed, though the road noise was continuous & woke us up several nights. Would definitely recommend the hotel. We booked the suite for 3 people which worked well as we had our own rooms & the sofa bed was relatively comfortable. Would have liked a bigger bathroom for 3 girls sharing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Such hotel provided the full necessary conditions to bring our boys (7 and 4 years) in this special trip for them.Excellent location, fabulous staff, large and clean rooms. Finally I would like to share that a breakfast should be as an important bonus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was the room was great. The hotel is located half a block from Time Square and a very short walk on 45th to the Minskoff Theater. It's in the middle of everything with easy access. We chose the hotel particularly for the great view to lower Manhattan. It was little disappointing after booking a Deluxe Queen Room and not getting the view of lower Manhattan. We should have checked before hand so I guess it was our fault. The hotel offered us $50 in credit to help with the disappointment. We still had a nice view from the 40th floor looking north. If you want the view of lower Manhattan, check before you finalize your booking. On and on about the view, we had no complaints, enjoyed our stay, and would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice location right next to Times Square. Next to fun Irish Pub and a fast service cafe - great for coffee and quick food items. Roomwas nice and clean and quiet. I would stay again. If you like Disney, you will love Frozen.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was nice and comfortable and staff was friendly. Did not spend much time here as we were on the go from morning till night as you would expect visiting New York ! The rooftop bar, I believe was BAR 54 had great views of the city, though, a bit pricey on the drinks I must say, but then again, you are in New York ! 54.00 for two cocktails ! But it was worth every penny compared to the views we were able to enjoy while there...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When you get such great service, you want to share it! The staff was wonderful! Thank you so much! We got there from the airport early, and they had a couple of rooms available, even though it was on lower floors. It was still a great experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First impression getting into the lobby was a bit underwhelming especially after reading so many glowing Tripadvisor reviews. But not a showstopper. The staff was professional. They did their job. The room was decent. The beds were clean and soft. The carpet floor could have been better for the price they charge for the room. Not barefoot worthy. Definitely need slippers. Lots of reviewers mentioned about quite rooms. But we were not so lucky. Being on the 10th floor, street noise was clearly audible. We even heard people talking & laughing from the next room. Other minor things (not issues) which didn't effect our stay but could have been better - there was a spent/used coffee pod in the Keurig coffee maker when we arrived. In their amenities list provided in the room, only few items were available. A few words about "Destination Fee" :- As the trend of adding "Resort Fee" is picking up steam all across US, the $30 Destination fee per night to avail coffee or a 10% discount here, a 20% discount there was a bummer. One may not drink coffee or avail those treatment services. For them it's a sheer waste of money.The Marriot nearby gives you $30 restaurant credit, a tour ticket and more for their destination fee. It might make sense in a casino hotel in Vegas or an actual resort but not in a typical hotel. But more and more run of the mill hotels are adding it. Lesson learned. Will be trying to avoid "Resort Fee/Destination Fee" hotels in future, whether it's possible or not that's a different matter.The best feature is the proximity to the Times Square. Also the 42 street subway is nearby. Overall a decent place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great time.The stuff is nice and very helpfull.They answeed every question and gave us good advice of how to get around in the city.Everything is in a walking distance.The room was big and the shower is better then home!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you have to stay near Time Square this would work but you could consider other areas and not pay as much. Those working for tips are of course very nice. Feel carpet could be replaced and have to call to get needed items in room (towels, toilet paper, k cups, etc) but serivce was qucik.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of the reasons I booked at this hotel was for the rooftop patio. But I was so disappointed and had a really awful experience this hotel. The staff at the rooftop are incredibly insulting and condescending. I went in with my daughter and the greeter felt he had the right to treat us as though we had committed a crime. Unfortunately no one had bothered to properly train their staff in how to treat their guests with courtesy. There is a nice way and a rude way to ask someone who is underaged to leave. This giagantic ignorant man felt entitled to insult me in front of my mom and daughter and it is the last time I will ever stay at a Hyatt. You have better choices available as there is a disgusting sewer smell outside and a food truck that emits so much smoke that it sticks to your hair and clothes every time you pass by. The lobby is extremely small, with very weird pink fluorescent lighting and elevators are inappropriately small. The elevators can also take up to ten minutes which is incredibly frustratingI made a mistake reserving at this hotel and really regret it as the Marriott or W are far classier. They also charge a resort fee which is a real rip-off....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It is a really nice hotel at a great location. Staff is really friendly, rooms are big, compared to other hotels in New York. Breakfast was good as well.We had a drink at the rooftop bar and the view was of course great but the prices are uffffff....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I guess the location of the hotel very close to Times' Square will be very interesting and appreciated by most visitors. The hotel is very busy but once you reach your room you leave the noice and the excitement behind. I had a rather big room with two queens beds.Staff in this hotel is exceptional and always ready to assist, rooms are clean, the AC could probably be somewhat less noisy but all in all it is a nice place to stay, all be it a bit pricey for me being used to European prices;

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful place to stay. Very centrally located near Times Square. Only disappointing aspect of hotel is that they charge a 18% gratuity on all food and beverage, like it or not. Not option to give your own gratuity.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Super clean and modern hotel, very close to Tmes Square. Great staff too! Only drawback is that it's not very kid friendly. The rooftop bar excluded everyone under 18 except for a limited time in the morning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What an amazing experience, my husband and I celebrated our anniversary this past weekend and we could not have asked anything more. We had a seamless check-in and out. Our room was clean and the staff was accommodating, we were greeted with a goody bag of popcorn (my favorite) wine and many other goodies thanks to "Tom" the District Manager (We loved it, thank you). The restaurant downstairs was amazing, don't skip dinner or the crab cakes :) and the rooftop bar is beautiful. It is the perfect location, literally a few steps away from Time Square but tucked away enough so that you are not burdened by the lights and noise. Kid friendly and very secure, we can not wait to visit again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights with friends in September and was surprised at the standard of the hotel in general. Lobby/reception areas all spotlessly clean, our room had 2 queen size beds and was far bigger than I had expected for NYC. We were on the 11th floor and although 2 mins from Times Square, heard very little street noise. Staff were extremely accommodating, without being intrusive. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend or to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean hotel and good room size. Stayed 9 nights. We had 4 women comfortably sharing a room with 2 queen beds (girls trip!). Excellent roof-top bar for views (faces south). Staff were friendly and helpful. Walking distance to Times Square and subway stations. There is a convenience store located 50m towards 6th Ave with hot and cold meal selection, drinks etc, and a Starbucks across the street for a quick breakfast and coffee. There were tea and coffee making facilities in the room, we asked room service for an electric kettle as we mostly drink tea. Great location for all the attractions in Midtown and beyond. We stayed on 17th floor and it was quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great loccation by Times Square and Rockefeller Center with nice modern rooms. Big for normal standards but exceptional for NYCPillows a little flat for my liking but were fine. Bathroom had a rain shower head and were plenty big.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The best asset of this hotel is the location, of course. Rooms are a bit old but very clean. We stayed at the 8th floor and it was very noisy. The breakfast is really below average and rather too expensive; people are nice but the quality of food not good. As I said location is very nice and really few meters from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great stay and this is a great location to be centrally located for shows, subway, shopping, and eating. The rooms are great and so is the view. Very friendly and helpful staff. my only complaint is the Food and Bev service in the 2 bar restaurants are VERY slow and over priced. They also need a better attitude to be more friendly like the regular hotel staff which was awesome!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff were excellent, made available our room early at 10 am. We were greatly appreciative having endure a 17 hrs flight to NYC. Room was clean thru out our 2 nights stay. Quite comfy even the expensive real estate of Manhattan.2 mins walk to Times Square n 5th Av was awesome. Indeed everything's about location in Big Apple.View at Bar 54 equally impressive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I liked the speed at which breakfast to the room was delivered. The packaging (no trays:) too was excellent. Rightly situated close to all lovely places- Times Square, Lion King theatre, etc I loved the easy check-out with the 'drop the key/card' option. Overall, it exceeded my expectation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Yenny provided exceptional customer service throughout the duration of my stay. However, my initial impression of my room was underwhelming, as there were notable carpet stains, including gum stains that appeared to have dried over a period of time. I wanted to address this issue with the front desk, but I had a 12pm lunch reservation, so I returned to the hotel around 3pm to speak with the staff, who happened to be Michael at the time. His immediate response was, “Why didn’t you tell us earlier?” No apologies given on behalf of the hotel whatsoever, but rather an accusatory question to a guest who had higher customer service expectations from a hotel like Hyatt - especially when I had spent a significant amount of money to reserve an executive suite. I approached him politely, and asked if another room was available. He stated that there weren’t any available and even if there were, I would not be able to inspect the room ahead of time; rather, I would have to take a risk and choose the new room (without inspection), or stay at my current suite. He suggested that I check back tomorrow morning.The next morning, I thank God Yenny was available. She quickly apologized and showed me an available room; however, due to the particular arrangement of the new room, I decided to stay at my current suite, as my mother was coming into town and needed extra space. Although I had to stay in the suite with carpeting that desperately needed shampooing (or replacement), the way Yenny approached the matter completely compensated for my poor experience with Michael.Even the simple apology from Yenny made all the difference. She truly cares about her work and goes above and beyond. She deserves a deferential pay raise and recognition from management for demonstrating stellar customer service.As for Michael, he needs additional training on how to approach and respond to guests. He kept a calm tone throughout our conversation, but the way in which he responded with that accusatory question (in addition to statements like “that’s what happens in hotels; we get stains and there’s not much we can do about it”) left such a sour taste of Hyatt Centric Times Square. However, Yenny’s immediate response quickly made up for it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms were bigger than most in NY. Close to Times Square and able to walk to many attractions. The rooftop bar would have been nice to use but you had to be 21 to even be on that floor. That should be listed on the hotel site.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel with clean rooms. There was a fire next door and the staff handled the alarm/evacuation very professionally. Only negative was an unfriendly person at check-out. We don't think she was trying to be rude, just needed more training. "How was your stay?", "Please visit again", or even a simple "Hello" should be pretty standard.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room was booked for 4 nights. My husband, adult daughter and I booked two queen beds. The room was bigger then we thought it would be. It was clean and fully stocked. Maid service was great. The elevators were fast. Other people we talked to said they really enjoyed the bar on the roof of the hotel. Check in and check out was very easy. One thing that was unusual was that we never heard other doors slamming or people talking. It was very quite.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in August. The location of the hotel is perfect, close to great stores, theatres, restaurants and the subway. The staff is just so kind and accomodating. Big shout out to Jorge and to Ritchie, they did everyhting they could to help out at all times. Bathroom is new, super clean, great shower and has an amazing hair dryer (Dry Bar). Our bedroom was also very large and had a great room. The hotel is always very clean and cleaning staff is also very helpful and kind. I hope we can stay at The Hyatt many times again in the future. SUPER RECOMMEND IT.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice hotel. Friendly staff. Showed up at 1pm and our room wasn't ready but they held our bags and texted us when it became available. Very clean room. Prime location. Fridge in the room. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room was clean and beds comfortable.Didn’t have a cozy atmosphere at all being near Times Square. Location was very good. Close to everything but yet quiet. Staff were very average. Breakfast included means you get an allowance for breakfast which would leave you hungry.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our typical vacation is sitting by the beach in Hawaii so I wasn’t sure what to expect in planning a vacation to NYC. It turned out to be incredible and we had so much fun. And it started with an awesome experience at the Hyatt Centric. I have some “status” with Hyatt so maybe that’s why they had my contact info because a week or so before the trip I got an email from Joshua asking if I had any requests and he offered to be of assistance to me. This was so unusual - in a good way! This is the first time I have had this experience so I took him up on his offer to explain that I had reserved two rooms and asked him to help secure two rooms adjacent to each other. And he replied promptly that he would look into this. Then when we arrived in NYC, I asked to say hello to him to say thanks and it was a pleasure to meet him. There was some rain the days we were there and he contacted me to let me know there were ponchos for me and umbrellas at the front desk. So helpful. The hotel is in the perfect location. A block or so away from Times Square so incredibly close but not right in the middle of it. Walking distance to Broadway theaters, United Nations, Rockefeller’s Square, NBC studios, Empire State Building - so many attractions within walking distance. I liked staying in midtown because seemed central to everything. We walked a lot during the trip and saw so much. Uber rides to upper and lower Manhattan was easy too - plenty of sidewalk space for cars to pick up in front of the Hyatt Centric. Never felt rushed or crowded in. The entire staff was awesome. Polite. Courteous. Rooms comfortable and well kept up. Housekeeping was good. Everything met my hopes and expectations. I would definitely recommend the Hyatt Centric. I’m already thinking of another trip to NYC and would stay here for sure. Thank you!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel with generous sized rooms for what I was expecting in New York. Unfortunately there were a few niggling issues with our stay. The main one was that we paid for a Time Square View room however I really thought this was stretch at most this could be described as a sideways glance and you really have to be very high to see over the adjacent buildings. The room was clean however they didn’t refresh any of the shampoo or shower gel over the 5 nights we were there. The room service team were pretty sleepy and would take ages and several times of chasing before anything arrived. We didn’t use the gym however it looked very good with modern gym equipment. The rooftop bar was great to have some skyline views of the city. Overall a pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely hotel, staff and location!I will be back for sure. Main point: big big room!!!!Near subway, restaurants, 6av everything easy and very cool!!! The view of the bar is awesomely as the drinks!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We placed our reservation in June for a stay in September. We book a 1 King Bed Times Square View Deluxe room. The website reads, "Perched from the 41st floor or higher take in the bright light views of Times Square." We did not receive the room we booked. We were "upgraded" without notice to a room on the 24th floor that looked at the side of an adjacent building. When we returned to the front desk to address the issue we were first told that there were no rooms with a view of Times Square due to the way the building is situated. After pulling up the reservation on my phone and showing the representative how the online description reads, I asked if they have any rooms matching that description. The representative left the desk and returned saying that those rooms were unavailable. We were eventually moved to a higher floor with a much better view, but for a once in a lifetime getaway that we had been anticipating for months as a birthday celebration, it was a significant let down to not receive the room described and to be either mislead and/or lied to by the representative at the desk. I reached out to management before writing this survey to find out what happened and I was assured the rooms DO exist and that the change came about because we were "randomly selected" for an upgrade due to being a World of Hyatt member; however, we booked at the Hyatt Centric for our first visit to NYC specifically because of the description of the room we reserved. The manager did say that he would make sure the representative was familiar with the various rooms and views the hotel offers, but beyond that, there was no further compensation. We still don't know why we didn't receive the room we booked. It was a shame to start our stay in such a wonderful city with such confusion and back-and-forth literal months after making the reservation and spending $1.5K. After all that, there was an additional, undefined $103.26 charged to my card on top of the initial reservation charge when we received the final bill. The manager said it was a destination fee, but the destination fees are clearly itemized for each night before that. The additional charge was never explained. Not thrilled.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My room while comfortable was a bit worn on the edges. Still it was clean and the staff was very friendly. The maybe not so hidden gem is the rooftop bar. I met perhaps the best bartender in the world, Justin. In one night, I watched about 20 or so people come up with no clue what they wanted and he steered them with a few simple questions. All of them left satisfied! Super friendly, knowledgeable and a man that know his craft!Enjoy

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hi- I am a regular traveler andWas in New York few days back and stayed at Hyatt Centric from 13th to 16th September. I forgot my IPhone and Charger in my room number 1004 and checked out. I realised once I reached the airport and called up the hotel and instead of making me talk to to someone In house keeping or lost and found departments they asked me to complain online at ilostmystuff.com without realising how important the issue is. To my utter shock I got a email from ilostmystuff.com that nothing have been found in the hotel. It’s not possible as I forgot and hotel just washed there hands. Will never recommend this hotel to anyone and whosoever is travelling then please be careful there. Absolutely pathetic experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Went to NYC to celebrate our daughter’s 16th birthday. The location was perfect for shopping and more and the room was spacious much to our surprise! Staff were friendly and welcoming. Will stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great room, super confortable bed, clean bathroom, amazing view, fast elevators, well located, very nice staff.Our breakfast was included till 74 dollars, either we were 1, 2, 3 or 4 people in the room, I think it should be 111 dollars for 3 people and so on, speacilly with those food and beaverage prices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff at the hotel is terrific. They really go out of their way to help you. I would highly recommend this hotel to folks visiting NY. The restaurant isn't very good, but the rest of the experience is excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This close to Time Square, you’re going to get noise and light — but Hyatt has paid attention to the details that work hard to make the rooms as comfortable as possible. Seriously can’t beat the location for theater and restaurants. Not a boutique hotel space, but functional, clean, and modern. Staff was amazing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I Had a Wonderful Time!New York Fashion Week Was EverythingI Thank Rico and Shawn for Handling Me and My Room Request Fine.I Thoroughly Enjoyed My Stay and Look Forward to Staying Again...Thank Youuuu ❤️

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed in many Hyatt’s all over the country but this one is my least favorite. It was clean, quiet but nothing special for the nightly rate we paid. The bar on the roof has nice views but staff was not the best. We waited for waiter for 15 minutes then we decided to leave. The breakfast downstairs was overpriced. For 2 people we paid over $100. The buffet option would be much better. The waitresses downstairs were great! Next time we will pick different hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a decent property. Clean, well maintained and quitet. But nothing exceptional to write home about. The property is well located half a block off of Times Square. While we had limited interaction with the staff, when we did they were polite and courteous. The room was simple with the regular amenities but was disappointed when for the first 2 days there was no television reception and only reason given was issues with the "satellite". The service desk did offer to send someone up to fix it but if it was a satellite issue that wouldn't help. TV reception did return 2 days later. Have to admit the view was great from our room, in spite of the fact that we had to pay an up-charge to be booked on a higher floor. And the roof-top bar is worth a visit to get an even better view just keep your cocktails limited. So, if you are looking for a reasonably priced property in a central location you can't go wrong with the Hyatt Centric Times Square. Just don't expect anything extraordinary.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were a fantastic size and super quiet considering the location which was perfect to get a good nights rest. The location to the subways to get around the city and the walking distance to a lot of the major attractions was a massive plus and really handy! We were in contact with the hotel before our stay to arrange some extra items and Josh was more than accommodating and very helpful, even offering restaurant suggestions for during our stay. Overall we were very happy with our choice! The only thing we would have changed and a minor thing at that would have been perhaps for a slightly softer bed as we found them a little hard but that's the only thing. Very happy with this hotel and would recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A friend & I stayed here for 6 nights while on a theater trip to NYC. The location is great - any theater is within walking distance (except Lincoln Center) & many restaurants as well. We upgraded to a room on a higher floor & it was spacious & pretty quiet; a little street noise came through, but not enough to bother us. We didn’t have a spectacular view but it was fine. The room was very clean & housekeeping responded quickly to any requests. The staff was very pleasant & also quick to respond to queries.
