We ate at the restaurant several times & thought the food was very good & the staff attentive. Also went up to the bar once - great view but pricey! But that’s NYC!If you’re going to a lot of theater I’d recommend this hotel as a great option. It’s also very convenient to many subway lines, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, The NY Public Library, etc. There’s also a Pret right down the street & a Whole Foods within walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wait staff on Bar 54 was very rude. I asked what beer was on tap and she rolled here eyes. I used please and thank you several times and these words of gratitude were not reciprocated. The bar location is really cool on the roof top.The rest of the staff was cordial.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We love the Hyatt brand and enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Centric. Stayed for six nights over the Labor Day weekend. Small yet efficient lobby. Beautiful room on the 51st floor with amazing view of Times Square. We never waited more than a minute or two for an elevator. Check in was very pleasant after a long travel day. The location was perfect for us. Easy walk to Central Park, Pier 83 - and used the subway to travel further. We opted to have breakfast included and this was perfect. Delicious breakfast each morning - and a big shoutout to Syed in the restaurant. Such a delightful young man - and a great memory. He waited on us most mornings and is an asset to the restaurant!! Room was always clean and well stocked. We went to the rooftop lounge after a play one evening- there were no seats outside, but we enjoyed our drink nevertheless. They offer some creative, delicious options. Yes - you’ll probably pay more than you do at home, but it’s worth it. I have one suggestion for management. The day before we left I spoke with the valet and we reserved a black car for a ride to LGA at 5:15 am. We were quoted a price and were told someone would be waiting for us. When we left the next morning, there was a car waiting outside however the driver was not aware of our reservation. The valet station wasn’t staffed yet, but the gentleman in the car said he would take us to the airport. Either the reservation wasn’t made or something got messed up. Either way we should have been given a bit more info from the valet. Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were visiting New York for the first time. Our room was a 1 King Bed Times Square View Deluxe. It was amazing. The view was incredible and exactly how it looks on their website photo's. The room was clean and tidy. Roof top bar was great as well with a stunning view.They have everything you could need, if it wasn't in the room we could borrow little things such as power adaptors and a jug. We simply called and requested what we needed and the staff were happy to help.Our experience with the staff was superb. Check in and check out was quick and easy. We were unsure of how to get to the airport and the doorman took care of us. He set us up with a cab with a flat rate which was easy and convenient.We would definitely stay here again and I'd recommend it to anyone who is keen to explore times square. We were on the 52nd floor and the view was amazing. The elevator was fast and we never had to wait long for it. Definitely worth the money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked three rooms for three couples. My husband and I brought two other couples to NYC for three nights of exploring the city. We were underwhelmed. Hyatt carries an expectation of comfort and modern luxury. The hotel is nicely appointed, but the lobby is cramped with not enough seating, the elevators were always very busy and waiting space was cramped, rooms small, and rooftop drinks EXTREMELY expensive ($19 USD for a mojito). The hotel is nice and central, beds were comfy, and shower was great. Just not the top shelf hotel I was expecting...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is just off Times Square and easy to get anywhere in New York from by either subway, bus or taxi. The staff and the hotel were excellent. Would stay there again if I am ever back in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I feel like we got reap off ! Over Rated! Over priced! Paid almost $400 per night , for standard room with no views,The room was small, very worn out and old with dirty and stained carpet, even the furniture was totally not in the high standards.The staff didn't know how to fix the problem in the days we were there and could care less for the bad experience we were having, just apologizing they thing they are doing a big change, The room has no view and the pictures on the internet do not show the real truth about what you are getting. Not a 4.5 star hotel at all, maybe a 2.5 star. Very expensive for what you get and you have to also pay a $30 per day "resort "BS" fee" that upsets any customer the most, if you are paying really high taxes and hotel fees, whay they should come with this BS fees to milk up customers, Resort Fees for what??? because they have a little gym that any cheap motel in the side of the road will have, and because they are providing you FREE internet and Cable? so it is not FREE, and in top of that if you have any problem with internet and TV connection they can not do anything in this location to fix it.Ridicules experience! It makes me wonder if all this high rated reviews are paid reviews, There is a misleading and bad use of Luxury and High End and Five Stars Hotels and that should be fixed.Bottom Line, is whatever hotels needs to charge to make their stock holders happy do it, but don't pretend or publicity your self as almost 5 stars hotel if you really can not provide that experience.Location by the way is Chaotic. too much traffic of cars and people specially in that area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything about this hotel is great. The location is fantastic, walking distance to everything, food, shopping and metro stop. The staff was helpful and friendly the rooms were clean and spacious the restaurant and rooftop were fantastic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic hotel. Even though we were next to Planet Rock and a few metres from Times Square, we didn’t hear any noise. Great location. Very clean and spacious room. Drinks available in rooms with free water. The roof top terrace was lovely. The restaurant and bar areas were well kept and tidy. I’d stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a great hotel, and a close walk to everything, from Times Square, train stations, Bryant and Central Parks, fine restaurants, etc. But that's not the best part of this hotel. The best part are the people. Check-in was a great experience, treated very well and was even greeted by the night-time manager, Rommel. Full disclosure, I am a Hyatt Globalist. There service from Brandon's team, including Justin, from Bar54 was superb as well. Ran into other staff on the elevator a couple times and everyone was very pleasant and seemed like they enjoyed their job. I'm looking forward to a return trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The restaurant with rooftop patio made the stay. Unfortunately service left a lot to be desired. They tip themselves, so why on earth would they try? Room was tiny and bathroom had to be entered at an angle if the door was open.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly staff from the moment we walked into the hotel! They made a great deal as it was my birthday, giving me a card, balloon and brownies in the room! The hotel was in an ideal location and rooms were lovely and modern with a lovely view from the room. The roof top bar was a brilliant with fantastic views. Would highly recommend and most definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York is a very good Hotel with a very good location, the Hyatt is between the 7th Ave (Broadway) & 6th Ave (Ave of The Americas) just a very short walk to Times Square, Bryant Park, Subway Stations, Broadway Theatres, very close distance to Radio City Music Hall, Rockefeller Center, etc. I stay in a tow queen bed room very comfortable. I highly recommend Hyatt Centric Times Square New York former Hyatt Times Square New York,and Hyatt is a great hotel chain.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Enjoyable stay with comfortable rooms and beds. Staff and location are great. Upper floors are quiet in this busy area. Great location for tourists right in the heart of Broadway. We stayed in a deluxe suite which gave us ample room view from the bar on the rooftop is beautiful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Big room 2 double beds with rain shower, very clean, nice little coffee/tea maker and handy little fridge. Staff very friendly, helpful and pro-active, which makes a nice change.Close to all the lights and theatres and plenty of places to get food of all varieties. Great for New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband & I stayed several nights last fall & had such a good experience that we booked it again when we brought our 2 kids. The location is prefect - just steps from Times Square. Easy to get to many subway stops but also a bigger metro station like 42nd St Times Square.Staff is always really courteous & my kids appreciated the nightly cookie offered at the front desk. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. Rain head shower & separate tub in our 2 queen bed room. Elevators are efficient which is a plus in Manhattan. Good size rooms for the location. Great bar with wonderful views on 54th floor. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great room. Was handicapped assessable with a huge shower with rain shower. Had a wonderful breakfast in the morning. Nicely appointed room with king bed and decorated on contemporary style. Wish we had time to visit bar on top floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is an easy one. Go for it, you won’t be disappointed. Ideal location for shopping, theatre, sightseeing. Be prepared for the many tourists and the amount of traffic. Hotel will satisfy even the most critical.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Summary: On the whole we had good stay. Would have been better had we not booked with “Breakfast Included.” This concept needs rethinking in my opinion, or until a change is made just book the room.The Good: Our room was on the 36th floor. Was a decent size to not feel claustrophobic considering its location. Located right next to Times Square made its location great for sightseeing. We literally walked everywhere.The valets and most security ladies were very kind and nice so as most waiters in the T45 restaurant in the lobby where breakfast was served. The valets made us feel really welcome when coming in and out. Cannot say the same about the reception staff though (see “The Bad”). Our cleaning ladies were really friendly and accommodating and made us always feel welcome too.The Bad: We were just not able to set the A/C so that it wasn’t blowing directly on our bed. The staff at reception had a general arrogant attitude to them which was not very welcoming. Not only during check in, but in general with any question we had and especially at check out. This did not make us feel welcome or forthcoming at all, as if we should be lucky to be allowed to stay in that hotel with them. Not respectful.The Ugly: We booked with breakfast included and found out at check in, that breakfast was a la carte from their restaurant in the lobby T45 and that per room and day we had a limit of $74. This all sounded ok until we saw the selection available for breakfast, which for most of us was limited with regards to yoghurts and müesli, but the worst part was the price. $9 for 0.75l of water and $10 for 3 slices of smoked salmon! and on top of all this they automatically add 18% service charge to the bill which made our bill over the “free” budget we were given and we only had 1 dish each (2 adults and a child). As a matter of principle and in no way reflecting the quality of service I deducted the service charge from the bill and only signed for the price of the food and tax. However turns out at check out, that the bills were never readjusted and whole amount was charged to our room. Strangely only on one day were we charged with an additional $5 which as a matter of principle I rejected to pay (you can imagine how happy the person at reception was to discuss this with me and adjust my bill). Anyway this was finally cleared and I still don’t understand why we were not charged more, probably our daughter, who’s only 2, was given a budget of $34 herself of which we were not aware or informed. Anyway, bottom line: for the price the breakfast is not worth it. There are lots of diners nearby and even a hotel next door offering a breakfast buffet at a more reasonable price.Another ugly I found was that for the price of the room the room didn’t have any sanitary stuff in it (earbuds or cotton buds) and the quality of the soaps was three star at most. We later found out that lots of additional stuff is available on request, which is a good concept that I support, had we been informed about it during check in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and booked an 8 night stay at the Hyatt Centric; we considered a number of hotels but decided to book with this hotel due to the central location and excellent views, it did not disappoint. An excellent central location on 45th street in the heart of Times Square. The team made us feel incredibly welcome upon arrival and during our stay the guys at reception always did whatever they could to make our stay at both the hotel and New York a memorable occasion. The rooms are modern, clean (cleaned daily) and the fridge helped keep our drinks chilled whilst we explored this amazing city. We had a coffee machine, stocked daily, and the team also provided us with a kettle. We enjoyed our stay so much that upon retunring to the UK we immediately booked another stay at the Hyatt next year - a first class city and a hotel to match.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We decided to take our mom to New York for her 81st birthday. This hotel was recommended by a friend. It is a great location. Convenient and walkable to broadway shows, restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. Very safe and close to subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is 1 block from Times Square. Great location for Broadway shows and more. Easy access to Subways and Meto's. Hotel was very nice, clean, comfortable bed and had friendly staff. The Lobby is small but there is a sitting area and a bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed here before so I had high expectations, and it lived up to them!! Rooms are good size, very well appointed and very comfy beds! Breakfast is very good and service is efficient and nice. Rooms are on high floors and I was expecting some delays with the elevators but it was never a problem!Very highly recommended!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric is a wonderful oasis just off the madness of Times Square. Staff were friendly and welcoming... Walter at the door even came to the corner with a cart to collect us and our luggage as the road was closed due to a parade! The suite was so calming and relaxing! No noise at all (we were on the 49th Floor with an amazing panoramic view) so sleeping was a breeze! Food was great too... I knew it would be as I hosted a small reception there previously for my work. They have an amazing room deck too! I highly recommend staying here if you need a TImes Square location. The rates were extremely reasonable too!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice, clean hotel in a great location. Easy to walk to Times Square and all that the area has to offer. The staff at the rooftop bar as well as housekeeping, awesome! We would definitely stay there again. Ask for a room on a higher floor. The views are amazing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric Times Square is am excellent hotel. Our room was in great condition and well maintained every day (we stayed 5 nights). The staff is courteous and attentive. Definitely visit the rooftop bar B54 while there...the view of the city is amazing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place to stay, but go just to experience the roof top bar. Staff was extremely helpful, and friendly. Didn’t try the in house food, but I’m sure it’s great like everything else. Bellman gave great recommendations for subway travel and places to eat. Will definitely be returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Check in staff are the rudest you could possibly find. Valet lost my car and took over an hour to retrieve it. Female Assistant front desk manager needs to learn how to speak to guests in a civilized and caring manner and not be dismissive and drop the couldn’t care attitude

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Be aware of asking bottled water and bath amenities every day, they were not provided in a common sense. The location is perfect. Breakfast downstairs is not recommended including the taste of food and the poor level of service. All in all, it’s a good hotel to stay for one week in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice service, great location and quality sleep as well.As a Hyatt explorer member, they allowed me early check in and late check out.Check in process was smooth and nice also.And the location is the best factor of this hotel stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our experience at the Hyatt Centric was awesome. Service was great and the hotel was very clean. You can tell these are two of the most important things to them. The hotel has great amenities and is close to everything. Looking forward to staying there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently stayed overnight at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. We loved it. Not only was it central to many of Times Square'sajor theaters and attractions, but it had its own rooftop bar and many Irish pubs around it. The rooms were spacious and immaculate and it was reasonably priced. I would highly recommend staying here when you are in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is good but not amazing. Staff were generally friendly. Room was smaller than I expected. Prices in the roof-top bar are expensive. Location is good for tourists. An experience on leaving the hotel left me with a bad impression of it. I needed a car to take me to JFK. The bell-boy recommend me a car that was parked outside the hotel. He gave me a fee that included taxes and tip. However, when I got to the airport the driver charged me a more and also wanted a tip. There is obviously a deal in place between the hotel and the driver, so I see this a reflection of the hotel, even if the driver is a third party. I called the hotel manager to tell him of this incident but I have yet to see a satisfactory conclusion to the matter.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was here for a week on businesses. Room is decent size for New York, both room and bathroom spotless. Housekeeping responds immediately with requests, 5 minutes or less.Conveniently located between Times Square and Avenue of America’s. Near shopping and business.The food in T54 the restaurant is fabulous and the pastries chef is a master! I hope the Hyatt knows what a gem they have! The cheesecake is like a mousse very light and airy absolutely delicious. Try the chocolate cake, also like a mousse with very high quality ingredients! Valrona chocolate?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the last sector of our Canadian/USA holiday from Australia. I researched hotels before leaving home and due to their positive reviews, decided to use Hyatt Regency in Toronto, Orlando, Washington and Hyatt Centric in New York. We weren't disappointed. The Hyatt Centric was the perfect location to get around for sightseeing, restaurants and shopping and it's close to the subway. Loved the room although my husband kept closing the curtains because we were up so high on the 53rd floor. Times Square was just around the corner but the room was very quiet. Special thanks to Sharnee on the front desk (sorry if I spelt it wrong), the valet guys and the room service staff who were extremely friendly and very accommodating. Thanks Hyatt :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful location at not on Times Square but the Theatre District! Quiet rooms! We could walk to everything--Rockeffler Center, Fifth Ave, Central Park, Circle Lines on 42nd St. The only drawback was there was not a lounge on the main floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed 6 days at the Hyatt Centric while attending an instructional course. The hotel and its staff were friendly, knowledgeable, attentive and very professional. The food and wine were the usual Hyatt Standard...Very Good. I am always reminded why I choose Hyatt above so many other hotel chains.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were so pleasantly surprised at this lovely hotel. Everything was new and fresh. The staff was extremely helpful with everything that we requested. We were going to the theater and location was perfect. I would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We felt welcome to stay here. The room size was nice, and appropriate for the number of lodgers. The location, very near Times Square, made attending a Broadway play very easy. The elevators were very fast. The security was comforting.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazing views, spacious rooms and super comfortable beds...Hyatt Centric exceeded all my expectations. Everyone i encountered from the front desk to the bartenders provided excellent customer service. I cant say enough about this wonderful property. Thank you!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took my wife to New York for her birthday, The view from our room was amazing! The room was great and the bed was so comfortable! Josh was able to have balloons and a card waiting in the room for my wife.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Jorge Lazo and his team really made this business trip a memorable experience - would highly recommend this hotel. Great location, right in the heart of Manhattan, one minute walk from Bryant Park.....lovely staff really made the difference.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I’ve stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square many times because I enjoy the look and feel of the property. However my last two visits to this hotel have been less than ideal because of a receptionist by the name of DeDe. Being in the service industry myself, I know how taxing and exhausting dealing with customers can be, however when you are the front desk person for a major 4-5 star Hotel Chain you must give customers the service they are paying for. In my first encounter with DeDe, I gave her behavior a pass as we all have bad days, and I assumed this was hers. Fast forward to yesterday, when upon checking in to my room, I was told that because the hotel was sold out I would have to wait 30-40 minutes for my room, which was completely okay with me, but before I could say anything she aggressively stated “you can cancel if you want.” I was taken aback and I said that I would prefer not to. Her demeanor is unapproachable and puts customers on the defensive. As I am in the service industry myself I NEVER complain to management or even write reviews because I understand customer focused service is difficult. HOWEVER, I spoke to a manager about DeDe because customers are paying too much money to have to deal with her attitude and unprofessionalism.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right in the middle of Times Square so very convenient for theater goers. The maid did a good job every day. The bathrooms are awesome for NYC. Big and modern with lots of counter space which is truly rare.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 7 nights in August 2019 (2 adults and 2 children). The rooms aren't the biggest (but where are they in NYC) but they were very clean and quiet being close to Times Square. It is close by to major attractions and the subway is also close. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel as there are numerous options nearby. All staff were extremely friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location but expect to pay more at check and there was a 30$ a night add on for free water and other non utilized amenities. Hotel was very clean. Rooms are small but nice. My view was horrible as expected I didn't pay the upgrade. I didnt think until check Overall the hotel is very nice just be prepared to pay a little more than expected and ask for a high level room. Pillows are horrible.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Super location - best place to be in new york - but very poor service. From reception to restaurant you will have no service. Our room was quite and well organised and quite clean. If you dont care for good quality service i reccomend that hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Awesome location, staff was very pleasant and helpful. Bar 54 has amazing views and quality cocktails. The room was spotless and the view was amazing. Checking in and out was a breeze. Everything was perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all the hotel is perfectly placed to see times square,the rooms were ok and every member of staff was professional,courteous and friendly,but for one. ... We checked in at midnight after a long day of travelling with a 10 year old.The lady who checked us in said there was a mix up with the type of room,even though our paper work said contrary.She was abrupt,she never held eye contact and was overall thoroughly unpleasant.The mix up was sorted the next day but not before we had to agree to pay a supplement for the room(later quashed because agent had been in touch)Really not sure who was to blame for the mix up and dont care .The issue was with the check in, even my 10 year old said as we walked to the lift 'what's wrong with her ?'

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice stay. Perfect position very close to Time Square. Size of room above average, very clean and modern. If possible choose South view rooms and high floor. A bit expensive but you should expect this, considering the position.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Best part of this hotel is its location in the heart of Times Square. Close to theatres, public transportation, touristy attractions, food. The room was clean and we had a nice view. Bed was pretty comfortable but not great. Pillows were way too soft. Had to constantly ask for more towels. Very little storage space. See picture of night stand. We needed more storage space, not more flat surfaces. No porn on tv.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I’ve stayed in many midtown hotels and the Hyatt centric is one of my favorite. The little things I like are the view from the 54th floor roof, the gym, and the hairdryer. I know it sounds silly, but the typical wimpy hotel hairdryers are pretty useless, but this was a real professional hairdryer. I had a delicious breakfast at the restaurant. Loved it. Plus it’s right in the center of everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazing stay , great room clean room great view from 34th floor . Definitely will return to bar 54 rooftop bar . Excellent staff from host to cleaning crew to overall every encounter . Best corned beef hash and eggs along with waffle and fresh fruits

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, comfortable and close to everything! My family was able to walk to many of the places we visited. The subway was close and we got everywhere else with ease. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay was more than I expected. I loved staying at this location. Service was wonderful. Staff answered our questions and provided our needs. It was a trip celebrating our fiftieth wedding anniversary and it exceeded my expectations based on previous stays at other hotels in New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel in a busy location. Great bar on the rooftop with fantastic views and service. The cleaning staff is really nice and efficient. Bad part is the $30 destination fee for items you are supposed to get for free or don’t really use. If they want to raise the rates let them do so and be transparent. I may go back but will look for hotels without add-ons first.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I found this hotel on a random search and was not disappointed. First I am thrilled that it had two queen beds in the room. Many doubles in NYC are full size beds. The rooms were a great size. Easy enough for a family of four to move around. The bathroom was a good size as well. The hotel had a restaurant on the ground floor, a bar on the top floor (great views), and a very well equipped fitness center. Other than that no real frills, but for us there was no need for anything else. It was located a block off Times Square, near major subway stations and walking distance to many attractions. The Irish pubs a few doors down were good and the sushi across the street was very good as well. Our room was ready on arrival and very clean throughout our stay. I will, and have recommend it to anyone looking for a good central place to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a great location. It was close to theaters, restaurants, and subway. Rooms were very clean. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the area. Having breakfast delivered to the room was very convenient to get a quick start to the day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When I stay in a city I want to be in the thick of it and this hotel didn’t disappoint! 2 mins from the centre of Times Square. We upgraded to a corner room and booked with Agoda which was notably cheaper than any of the other sites. Our room was on floor 52 and the views were excellent. We had a drink at the roof top bar, it was during the heatwave so extremely hot. Again incredible view, staff was friendly but drinks were expensive even by NYC standard. A cider and a cocktail plus tax and 10% tip was $48. I appreciate you pay for the view but as I could get almost the exact same view from our room we didn’t go back. Cleaner was friendly and almost seemed like she just snuck in when we left the room, never disturbed us or the usual knocking each morning. Not entirely sure she did anything other than made the bed and changed the towels but we didn’t really make things dirty per se so didn’t bother us. Only reason this review is a 5 star and not a 4 star is my husband contacted the hotel twice before our trip. Once by phone and once by email to ask them to arrange flowers for our room a we were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary. He says he was told that was fine and he asked for it to be added to our bill but no flowers for the duration of the stay. Regardless I would 100% stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I cant knock this hotel in regards service, cleanliness and location to Times Square. this was our second visit to NYC and we stayed at the Hyatt again. first on our honeymoon and again for our 2nd wedding anniversary. the staff are always amazing and helpful.My one and only real complaint again is the charge at the end of the stay. an extra hotel charge of $30 dollars per day after an expensive trip can really take you by surprise. The Hotel will state it is on there website and also on the key card when you first check in. I cant dispute that.After the first visit i wanted to make sure we had no surprises this time so i read everything to make sure every tax was included. thought i had covered every angle only to be hit with a charge at the end of the stay anyway. im told this isnt a tax but more like a service charge from the hotel. apparently for Wifi, coffee, Tea, shampoos etc - This is how it was explained to me anyway.It didnt spoil our visit or experience but left a bitter taste as we checked out. Why they dont just include this in the main price i dont know.regardless of this i would still recommend the hotel but just keep in mind you could be hit at the end of your stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first time to New York City and this hotel met all of our needs. Very close to all of the theaters which are walking distance and no need to get a cab. We loved that we were also close enough to several attractions like Rockefeller center, Radio music hall, Times Square, and though a little of a trek Central Park. Hotel very close to lots of restaurants and if you are a coffee drinker like us a Starbucks literally across the street. The Irish pubs near the hotel are also very good and reasonably priced for New York. Felt very safe and far enough from Times Square that helped keep the noise level down. Would definitely recommend the Hyatt Centric Times Square to anyone looking for a great place to stay!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at Hyatt Centric for 5 nights and I was very impressed with the front desk staff! They were incredibly helpful and very polite. The room was extremely clean. We had a wonderful experience and highly recommend this hotel to anybody visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms are full of dust, the carpets are dirty and the service is terrible!! In addition, the room was not even cleaned.When we said we were unsatisfied, they did nothing about it. A waste of money...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The description of the suite I booked says it will be between 44 and 52 floor. Upon check in the lady said it will be between 40 and 50 floor. I corrected her and was met with a rather unfriendly attitude. The suite ended up on the 45 floor, so barely meeting the advertised specification. Not off to a good start for my 9 night stay.The suite itself is sub par, especially the décor and the color, which do not convey warmth or class like other Hyatt properties I stayed at.The rooftop bar on the 54 floor attract a lot of "diverse" folks and they really should have better control of the elevators so hotel guests are not jammed in with bar hoppers, especially when the elevators are not spacious to begin with.They charge $30 a day (destination charge) on top of the room rate and for that you are supposed to get free phone calls....the only problem is the instructions on the phones in the room are incorrect so I ended up having to get the front desk to connect the calls for me, which was a true hassle.The location is convenient but very noisy and the lobby is very tiny with guests lining up to check in or out.The housekeeping lady was very nice though, making sure the room is clean and tidy. She is the highlight of my stay.Will not return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in this hotel during April for a week with my family. Great holiday, pretty impressed with the room. The bathroom and views were lovely (we stayed on the 41st floor). I got a nice comfy bed all to myself so I slept well. If you would like to stay downtown in Manhattan, I would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We've stayed at this hotel many times. We've just returned from another lovely stay. I have written several reviews of this property so feel free to check them out. It was lovely to see the familiar faces of people at the hotel. It makes it feel very comfortable and safe. It makes them approachable. Many have been here for many years. I often see questions about which room is the best......Being I've stayed in a variety of them, I'll address that particular question. The highest floor that I've stayed on was 48, the lowest was in the mid 20's. I've stayed in rooms at the front of the building as well as the back of the building. I've stayed in most every category as well, as it depended on who I was travelling with.My personal favorite when I go with my spouse is the *Executive Suite as it has a separate bedroom. I'm an early riser, so it allows me to get up, make coffee, shower, watch tv, etc, without bothering my travel companion.The rooms at the front of the building have large windows. The windows on the back of the building are more limited. The higher floors are quieter (from street noise) than the lower ones. I've been in two different "two queen beds" rooms. One was really big with two walk in closets and a huge bathroom. Loved this room when I went with my daughter. The other was smaller and more like a regular hotel room. Bottom line on the rooms:Go with your budget and needs. If you can afford a suite, go for it. If you can't, go with your budget. How much time will you be spending in the room?? We're out most of the day. The great location allows us to pop in during the day to drop off any purchases or for a quick freshen up. Personally, I'd rather use the money to shop, visit things, etc. But if you're going to be spending more time in the room, you may want to invest in one with the best view. If your room doesn't offer the best view, there is a rooftop bar which has the most amazing view! You don't need to drink to go take a look at the view. It's totally worth the trip to the top. The beds are super comfy in all the rooms. If you require anything that you don't see, a quick call can usually fix that. Overall, we've stayed at many hotels in NYC, but we've stayed at this one the most and only this one for several years now. The room prices will vary depending on time of year, events in the area, etc. If you don't need to go during specific dates, you may want to browse the dates. At times, a few days earlier or later can make a big difference in price. I don't want to repeat what I've said in my other reviews of this property, but if you have any questions, do feel free to send me a message. I'd be more than happy to answer it if I can.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The lobby and rooms were clean and welcoming, It was easy to get anywhere you wanted to go in the city. perfect location. staff was friendly and very helpful. Cold water in the lobby to greet us on a very hot day!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Every single element of my stay there was excellent. The entire staff was top-notch and the condition of the hotel and the room I stayed in itself was nothing short of perfect. It made the reason I was there an unforgettable experience. This is not some bunch of BS...this is the truth from a regular person who just wants to give credit where credit is due. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When looking for a place to say near time square, read many reviews on this site. Trusting the brand name Hyatt over the negative reviews, I booked a suite at this hotel for our family vacation. That was a huge mistake. Upon entering the room, my wife immediately noticed what appeared to be bodily fluid stains on the leather sofa. We called down to ask for the cushions to be replaced and were told ALL the rooms were like this. REALLY?? That's extremely sad. They offered to cover the couch with a blanket!!!! This is a Hyatt???  Then later that night my wife wanted to take a bath and called out to me in disgust. The water coming out of the facet was brown like sewage. Again, I called down to Mgmt to complain. They explained it was a plumbing issue and that all suites were having his issue in the whole building. They offered to comp us the difference between a suite and a regular room for one night and then transfer us to a regular room the next day. We eventually were able to get clearer water to come out of the facets after running them for over an hour. We NEVER trusted the water after that! The tile in the bathrooms is extremely slick. I slipped but didn't fall. My wife actually fell. It was so bad, we just made rugs out of all the tiles to cover the floor. The hotel does not provide any rugs in the bathroom. So be very, very careful stepping out of the shower or bath. Finally, we were returning from a show and stopped by to pickup a bagel for our daughter who has a sensitive atomic. We then walked into the hotel restaurant to grab a bite before returning to our room. The place was completely empty. When the waiter came over to the table, he said we couldn't have outside food. I explained the situation with my daughter and said both my wife and I would be eating. He had a pissy attitude and said we had to leave. I immediately went to the front desk and asked to speak to the manager. I explained the situation both with my daughter and all the issues we have had with our stay and then asked him to speak with the restaurant to allow us to eat there. He said there was nothing he can do in a very rude manner. At this point, we were so over Hyatt and this hotel. They obviously are not keeping their property up to date (dirty furniture, worn out rugs, breaking pipes, etc..) and then to be rude to guests on top of that. Seriously... if you care about your experience in Time Square, pick another hotel. This place does not care about customer service!!! It's apparent in their actions and words.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We love the centric because you can access all of the shows within 15 minutes. You have the luxury to stay in you room and not stand in line. We would leave 20 minutes before the start of the show and have plenty of time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of Hyatt Centric Times Square New York hotel is excellent in Time square mid-town of New York City, USA. Many local tours start from this area. Taking underground from the hotel is very convenient. You can directly walk to the most of the opera from the hotel as well!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent stay at the Hyatt! Speedy check in process and late check in offered. My family was even offered a free upgrade to a room with a balcony. The location was central to everything and I'd definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed July 2019 2 adults and teens 18 & 16. Really fabulous location, a 2 min walk to Times Square, with Starbucks just across the road. Doesn't have the wow factor as you walk in - just a very basic lobby, no lounge area or anything like that but you don't go to NYC for the hotel! Room itself was quite large, modern with fridge/coffee machine etc. Spotless also. I thought it represented excellent value for money.We were put on the lowest of the 'high floor' rooms and the view was essentially a building site, this is despite my husband emailing the hotel direct to advise we were celebrating a special birthday and had requested a nice view - so perhaps customer service is not their strong point - just a minor gripe. I would definitely stay again, really good value for money

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family received bad customer service from Dede of front desk. After the discussion with her about the extra charges for breakfast that were not clearly explained by front office, we would hear that Dede would murmur to her colleagues about the situation and would mock us.We are frequent travellers and would travel to different parts of the world just for pleasure and we were not treated like that. We went to US for a number of times also, and we were not humiliated like what Dede did.Also, if you would email the hotel, it would take many days before they can reply, or you may need to followup before you can receive a reply.Just avoid the hotel if possible.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From checking in with Aly to checking out with Jeff, and all the other staff that we interacted with ( including security personnel) for the four days we were there , the experience was awesome. And we enjoyed the infused water that is made available to the guest in the lobby. A different flavor each day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very conveniently located near Times Square and the Theater District. King High Floor Room was as spacious as any I've ever had in the city. Fast elevators. Great and responsive desk and staff. I Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros: Clean, comfortable, affordable. Great location. Friendly staff. Girls weekend. Broadway shows, easy walk. Staying there next year. You can't go wrong staying. Cons: not many, restaurants expensive, Starbucks across the street and Perfect Pint.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I planned a weekend getaway to see a Broadway show and stayed at the Hyatt Centric in Times Square. The location is among the best in the area as everything is central to all things in Times Square. It was only one block to our Broadway show. The hotel rooms are very clean, the beds are super comfortable and the service and hotel restaraunt was stellar. Be sure to check out the bar on the high floors of the hotel. Great drinks and fantastic views from the top of Manhattan. We had a great experience staying there!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel met my expectations for a Hyatt caliber hotel; professional staff, hassel free check in and a well maintained lobbey and room. The restaurant dinner menu was limited and not up to par for a Hyatt status hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I went to NYC to see a show. The location of the hotel is fantastic! So close to time square! The room was very clean. The bathroom was very modern and chic. The staff was very friendly, genuine, respectful, and responsive. I had a very pleasant stay and I will definitely stay here again the next time I am in town!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and great value. We loved the ability to easily maneuver in and out of the hotel to view all of the sites. People thru out the hotel were amazing. Great work out facility and the roof top bar was a great place relax

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our first experience of NYC with our two young daughters was arriving at this hotel at 11:30pm on a Sunday night. Going up to our room, we encountered several obviously drunk patrons of the top floor bar. We went to see the lights of Time Square for the first time and passed by several women and men "of the night" as they say (two were topless!). Not the best way to start a trip! Other than that, the service here is top notch, beds comfy, nice gym, friendly, accommodating staff. Just wish they'd warn families arriving late about the crowd and maybe how to avoid it. During the week, it was not as bad... but if you arrive on a weekend night, beware!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was in a perfect location to Time Square & theatre district. Even though it’s that close, the hotel is quiet once inside. Housekeeping did an amazing job tidying the room every day. Room was spotless and stocked daily with water bottles, coffee, toiletries & towels. There is a safe, coffee maker & mini fridge inside of the dresser. Washroom was a nice size, modern with large shower. Umbrellas offered at front desk on rainy days. Fresh infused water daily in lobby. Located 30 second walk down side street from the heart of Time Square. Just beware of destination tax added daily to your room cost. I booked & paid in advance including tax only to receive yet another charge at the end of our 5 evening stay which was the destination tax. Also alcoholic beverages are priced at a premium. Nice pubs on other side of the hotel with reasonable bar pricing and Starbucks across the street. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel and a great location right in Times Square. The staff is friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend them and I would also stay here again when I come to New York City. Special thanks to Josh Olayer who was very helpful and is an absolute asset to the Hyatt hotel and brand.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very convenient location to get to all areas of the City...Especially Fox and Friends Summer Concert series, Fox knows how to create a vibrant and bring an exciting and refreshing act - Runaway June, they were awesome and very good music!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family of four stayed here for three nights. The hotel is very clean and well-maintained. Hotel is close to time square and the theater district. Great, friendly staff throughout. Valet parking is expensive, but that’s to be expected in midtown Manhattan. Would definitely recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a wonderful 9 day stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. It was our first time in NYC and we were right in the center of everything, and yet away from it all when we "came home" to our quiet and beautiful, clean room each day. Daisy kept us in fresh sheets, towels, water and coffee every day. The room was always immaculate when we came home from our daily adventures. And well the bathroom was the best! The king bed had a spectacular view of lower Manhattan and we slept like kittens. I love Midtown as it's such a hub to all of the amazing sites that New York has to offer. The support staff were friendly and very helpful. Everything was perfect!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very convenient to Times Square. We pulled in had valet parking and were checked in very quickly. The rooms were big, well lit and very comfortable. Loved the shower.There was a power failure and the show we were to see was cancelled. We walked around and many restaurants were forced to close so we had a late dinner at the hotel. The menu was varied with burgers and rice bowls. Food was reasonable and very good.Be sure to have drinks at the roof bar. Great view of times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room 4402 - This hotel is gorgeous, and the location is excellent right off Time Square. We stayed on the 44th floor in a South facing King. The room was big the bathroom lovely and the view amazing. Comfortable bed too.Pros - Rooms are lovely, large, windows provide amazing views and the facilities fab.Bar 54 on the roof is excellent and the staff really nice, really friendly and chatty and to be honest the drink aren't that expensive, exactly what you'd expect but the drinks arent short on kick or variety. Great Bar. Location - 10/10Cons... This is where i cannot give it five stars and it bugs me because this is a five star hotel. I thought about giving it less but the building itself is worth it. Staff - the only pleasant staff were the door people. Always with a smile and a hello. The valet parking guy (Walter?) was a real gent, chatty helpful just a nice guy. Wish he ran the place. However the reception staff. Oh my god, seriously, smile. It was bordering on rude. If I got grunted at in a grocery store I would raise and eyebrow. At a nice manhattan hotel? No. That's not acceptable. It wasn't just one, i spoke to three or four during the stay and if a fifth had sneered at me I would of spoken to the manager. I hate rudeness. Communication - prior to the visit I emailed the hotel and was ignored. Then I facebook messaged them, they assured me the email wasn't ignored but asked me to repeat the message.... Then I was ignored. Tbh, this isn't some low rent motel, it's a hyatt and that just rude and ignorant. The staff in general on reception need a kick up the arse and retraining. So so so annoyed about this. Really put a tarnish on the prep for the visit. The coffee - in the room you get a coffee machine. No milk! just these weird bags containing 6 variations of sweetner or sugar then one sachet of creamer. There's two things wrong with this. One, why the waste? I threw away loads of packets of sugar/sweetner to get to one measley creamer. It's stupid. Two.... Just supply milk, there's a fridge in the room and what's wrong with UHT sachets? In short - fabulous building, fabulous bar, fabulous greeting staff.... Shocking, like bluntly rude front desk staff and detail attention to little things just off. 4/5 could of been lower, should of been 5/5

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the perfect location, close to Times Square and near all of the theaters. It's beautiful, spotless, and very comfortable. They have a beautiful bar on the 54th floor with great views, which you pay for. The security is tight, which we appreciated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent customer service from everyone. The view from the rooftop bar is jaw dropping. The bar is an absolute must. Good food too. The room was very nice. We didn’t have a view but could have had that option for a little more. Very very fast elevators. Lobby is small so it takes just a minute to zip down (even from the top floors) and onto the street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square in July 2019 and was very impressed with the hotel. The location was excellent (just off Times Square), the hotel was clean and all staff were extremely helpful. Breakfast in the ground floor bar was delicious and the view from Bar 54 was great,

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in a double queen for 4 adults, and it was on the smaller side but the facilities and not to mention the view was great! Stayed on the 52nd floor and we loved it. The lift was efficient, front desk staff were nice, the rooftop bar lovely and the location perfect. If they had breakfast included, it would have gotten 5 stars. We’ll come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice location right off Times Square. The staff is competent, friendly, helpful. The entire facility is very clean and well kept. Impressive.We highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a place close to Times Square. You won't regret it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is a great place and the rooms lived up to the Hyatt quality. Bar 54 was a great spot to view the city. I have no complaints about the hotel whatsoever as it was close to perfect. The only downside was the proximity to Times Square. It’s right in the heart of the masses of people. Just too many people around. I go to NYC very often and while I absolutely love this place, I would most likely pick a place further away from Times Square. But if you don’t mind the mass of people, this is the place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is very well located for the theatre and restaurants and museums. Rooms are quiet. And the hotel has a terrific staff who were very helpful in all respects. Mywife and I would stay at this hotel again..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Hotel. Great location at Times Square. Perfect room and a helpful staff. The T45 bar serves very delicious foods to reasonable prices (given that this is a luxury hotel). In summary Hyatt Centric is a perfect hotel for a vacation on Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Centrally locates within a short walking distance from Times Square, makes it easier for tourists to explore NYC! Great modern rooms, however we thought we would have a better view from our room. We will stay here again regardless.Our check out experience was rather disappointing, as we received complimentary check out but the member of staff we dealt with was rude & ignorant and was adamant we were still late (by one minute) - even though he was the one who was taking forever to serve us & were consequently charged a late fee. However, this was soon resolved by Hyatt’s customer services.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a lovely stay at this hotel. The hotel is very clean with good facilities. The majority of the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The location is very central, right at Times Square, within walking distance to Top of the Rock, Central Park, shops and the subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked last minute. Super convenient central location - close to theaters, park and shopping. Room was great - clean and well appointed. Staff was friendly. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Another great 7 night stay in the room right next to the one I had last year. Plenty of water in the room each day to help with the heat. Returned one day to find a package in the room that I believed was to be delivered to the store I bought the goods from so hats off for taking it up to the room. The hotel is perfect location wise. Right next to Times Square but still quiet. The thing that may put me off staying there again next year is the resort fee for use of things like the fitness centre. I used none of these so in effect was giving the hotel free money. Surely better to charge guests if they use them and not charge if they don't.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want to ensure a perfect stay, choose this hotel ! The TimesSquare view room worth a million !The services from Valet, check-in, room cleaning, security, check-out is just on the perfect note. Thank you Hyatt Centric TQ for making again our vacation amazing

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric, on 45th Street, just off centre of Times Square, but close enough for a short jaunt to Rockefeller Center, and the "shop t'll you drop" stores of 5th Avenue. Same for the Empire State Building and Central Park where you can crawl, walk or jog t'ill your hearts content.The hotel is accommodating, modern but at times the design seems forced. My room was mildly over-priced and a bit on the bland side.The bath was more appealing, slightly upscale with a spacious shower equipped with a towering shower head. Towels were rough with a light sandpaper feel. I did find that the toiletries were monogrammed as Marilyn Monroe. At first I thought they were a leftover from a Marilyn Monroe wanna-a-be's stay here, but I latter realized the items were from the hotel's spa of the same name.The Centric touts it's T45 restaurant as a multi-purpose facility encompassing a cafe, bar and eatery which serves up breakfast, lunch and dinner, no doubt, in an attempt to service all the dining needs of hotel guests as well as passer-bys. The decor is modern with walls adorned with collages of vintage European maps. Lots of unusual conversation pieces dot the restaurant as illustrated by walls lined with over 8000 antique hotel key tags (if you lose your key you can take one of these). Of particular interest to me was an antique Harvard University card catalog filled with travel tips by the hotel's "in the know" staff (this was cool and useful). It's a matter of convenience to eat in the restaurant of the hotel you are staying at, so I did. I was very disappointed with my "Pan Roasted Atlantic Salmon" (burnt on the edges and not fully cooked). Other attempts at a meal proved just as fatal. The T45 is in dire need of culinary help.Bar54 is a little brother to T45 and is located on the 54th floor of the hotel. It is portrayed as the highest open-air rooftop bar in NYC. It's a great place to soak up the sun in the midst of killer views of the Chrysler Building and Lower Manhattan. At night, one can view the dazzling spectacle of Times Square. This is an enjoyable spot and probably the best in the hotel, with chic interior decor and an expansive fully furnished terrace. It is ideal for a prolonged night cap along with some light pre-bedtime gourmet fare.The 3rd floor houses the Marilyn Monroe Spa. It is quite attractive and offers a full range of services that one would expect of a spa. As an accompaniment to the spa, the hotel sports a mediocre gym, again, with equipment one would associate with this type of facility. There is a 24 hour business center, if you want to work 24 hours.I was disappointed in my experience at Hyatt Centric. It is not in keeping with my thoughts about the Hyatt brand which I frequently use as my hotel of choice. With many other hotels available in the Times Square area which provide a very favourable hotel experience.....so take a pass on the Hyatt Centric..Not The Center Of The Universe.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room was great, it was clean, great view and never in short supply of water, coffee and tea!The location allowed us to walk to everything including the plays, cafes, pub, shopping.Starbucks is right across the road which was a plus. The 10% discount at Macy's also was a pleasant plus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great location and i love the roof top, the service was great and cover my expectations... i recomend this hotel because is really hard to find a good clean hotel in this area!!! the view is amazing and really close to times square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location very close to Time Square. Clean rooms and Bath. Only bad thing I was charged $30+tax per night Destination fees which I think is a pure rip off because I booked through Expedia and all fees was suppose to be included.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Centric Hotel in Times Square with great service from all working staff. However, upon check-out we were asked to give the payment of visiting fees and tax, which over a 5 night stay totalled to $180. We were unaware that this was not included in the price of the booking (through fault of our own), however would like to recommend workers to remind visitors of this fee upon check-in which will allow for them to budget their stay a bit better and not leave with an unwelcome surprise. In addition to this, when asking what it was we were being taxed for, we were told it was to cover the costs of water, wifi and mini bar (which consisted of bottles of water and coffee pods) which customers are told are complimentary during their stay. This is a slight contradiction as a selling point of this hotel was in fact these complimentary services but having to pay tax to cover these costs simply means that we paid for them. This may seem a minor thing to place in a survey, however my partner and I are both 21 and saved for this trip, and $180 nearly completely wiped out one of our budgets for the day. If I was travelling on my own I would not have been able to pay for my taxi to the airport as my deposit of $300 also took 2 days to go back into my account. I hope this review isn't too harsh as we both thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel to others, it was just this handling of payment at the end of our trip which left us feeling deflated on our last day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is extremely close to Times Square. Standard Queen room was decent sized and comfortable for a short stay for a family of four. There was some normal hotel wear and tear, but the room was extremely clean and comfortable. Hotel seemed to have a small staff but all were very friendly and attentive. The price seemed to be better than what was offered at other nearby brand-name hotels. Only regret is that I never visited the rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I’ve stayed at this property for three years in a row while attending an annual hotel industry conference in Times Square. Over the years, I’ve stayed at all the higher-end options in the neighborhood and concluded the Hyatt Centric is the best overall value. This new property is modern, spacious, and QUIET - three things significantly lacking among its competitors. The location is excellent for walking to meetings, shows, dining and is easily accessible for Ubers/taxis. I also find the staff at this hotel to be consistently warm and engaging, year after year. I’m not a huge fan of Times Square, but if you find yourself in the neighborhood, this is your best bet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited New York with my son and grand daughter We had a deluxe room on the 46th floor. The room was clean and large with two queen size beds.The bathroom was great with a huge shower and big bath tub.It was little noisy at night but turned on the fan and drown out the noise.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: All the above & an efficient staff make this a wonderful & repeat stay winner. Stayed in June & the Centric was a welcome destination upon arrival & when wanting to avoid crowds and noise. Looking forward to returning

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was perfect! Price was reasonable and the bedding was comfy. Rooms were super clean. Staff got us in early and was able to accommodate a later check out for us which we appreciated. For being in the middle of times Square we didn’t hear a lot of noise as I have in the past with other area hotels. Loved the bathroom!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here on a very quick business trip, arriving late on a Sunday night from California. The front desk staff offered me a $50 food and beverage credit to grab a bite to each, or in this case, a drink. I thought it was a nice touch and I certainly did not expect it. Room was modern and comfortable, with some good views of the chaos that is the Time Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I thought that the rooms and restaurant area were amazing. However, I am extremely annoyed with the fact that my card was charged every day for a deposit when the card wasn't even supposed to be used (I had a different card on file). I was shocked when I arrived and found a $500 deposit fee, which is completely ridiculous I might add, so I put a different card on file. They continued to charge the first card, very random amounts, and not the correct card. Every time I went down to fix it, they seemed to reverse the chargers but it was the exact same case the next day. I was planning on staying at this place again for my next two trips to NYC but with all these chargers I am not sure I would recommend this place to anyone, which is sad because I loved the room. I am so dissatisfied with the hotel staff service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything was amazing! The room, the view, the staff! We are very happy with our stay! We enjoyed the rooftop bar and view, the gym was excellent, our housekeeper was kind and attentive. We felt taken care of! Thanks Hyatt and Amex for the amazing service

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a one night get away. The Hyatt Centric is located right in the theater district - it was down the block from the play we were seeing, The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again for another get away

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have to have two hundred characters to submit this? Are you attempting to discourage submissions? OK, Wi-fi was great. Yes, that was important. Equally important was full power dsl access. I went out and bought an extra dsl charger to resolve the issue.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a fantastic hotel. Check in was quick and receptionist was lovely. Room was just beautiful with the most amazing view, it was cleaned daily and left immaculate. The stay was for my 40th birthday so they had a bottle of Prosecco delivered to the room and a 70 dollar credit at the roof top bar, was a lovely touch. Being so close to Times Square was great and we heard no noise at all. Could not recommend this hotel enough

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I really enjoyed our stay here. A few reasons why1. Near everything. This is right near Time Square, Broadway shows, great food choices, subway. Even though it was near everything, the rooms were quiet.2. The room. Traveling with kids means 2 beds and I wanted 2 queen size beds - this was one of the cheaper places with that option. Bathroom was good size and I liked the rain shower. 3. The floors. You ever stay at a hotel with 100 rooms per floor and there is always someone who must either get up extremely early or wander in extremely late and does not understand QUIET - and it echoes down the hall? Not a problem as there are only a dozen rooms per floor. So hallway not noisy. And we were near the ice machine and did not hear that either.4. Small refrigerator for storing food - great for putting those water bottles in (I appreciated that too) as well as some basic snacks.All of our interactions with the staff were pleasant.My only complaint is that I wish there was more drawer space (I like unpacking the suitcase completely).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I did not spend much time in the room as I was busy with a conference. However, the view from the 53rd floor was awesome overlooking some of Time Square and was fairly quiet from the street noise. The room as spacious and comfortable with nice amenities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location, dissapointing customer care and very average room quality and attention. Staff attention to customer care was non existant and the rooms were not fully serviced - coffee cups were not replenished daily - in fact not at all during a 3 night stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt has several different brand hotels around the city, but this one is definitely one of the best. The hotel is right in time square (close to everything). Service was good and the hotel was very clean. The A/C in the room is amazing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed on the 46th floor with a view of Times Square - once the mist had cleared up the city lights were beautiful! Room was a good size, bed was big and comfy. Loved the rain shower, water temperature was perfect. My partner got a little gift from the hotel as it was a birthday treat for his 21st. Would love to stay with the chain in the future!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Destination Fee is a farce. Let's do business in an honest way, Hyatt. The destination fee is Hyatt's way of charging $35 ($30 fee plus taxes) more per night without you knowing it while you are making a decision on where to book your hotel. There are no materials benefits for this Destination Fee! Fool me once, shame on me . . .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From check-in to help during our stay to checking out we had the pleasure of dealing with the most helpful, friendly people we have ever met in any hotel we have stayed in over the many years we have traveled.. They wanted our stay to be the best ever and that is what we got.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was wonderful. Starting with our first interaction with the staff. Upon check in we were greeted with smiles and the staff was nothing but kind and friendly during our entire visit. Our room was on the 40th floor and the view was awesome. The window opened so we could hear the city below and get some fresh air. Once the window was closed the room was peaceful and quiet. We never heard a peep from the neighbors. There isn't a ton of storage space - only 3 dresser drawers and a closet. But in NYC space isn't easy to find. The size of the room really was comfortable for 3 adults. There was a safe and refrigerator which is a great feature. Bathroom was typical for the city but we had no issue sharing the space. The hotel has found creative ways to make space for all your "stuff". There is also a mirror outside of the bathroom which I always love. Especially when there is more than one woman in the group. Once you leave the hotel it is literally a 30 second walk to Times Square. Great experience overall and definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I held a meeting here (for a dozen people, all staying at the hotel). Room experience was very positive, with a room that was bright, clean, good bed, good bathroom, shower, amenities. Check in was quick. Rooms are small, so nothing far from elevator. And never had to wait long for an elevator. Location is excellent (right off Times Square). Meeting facility was nice (for up to perhaps 16 people), and food quality and service were good. Definitely friendly and accommodating (not cheap, but if you're holding a meeting in Manhattan, you know that already). Only complaint is room lighting controls -- they use basically the same ones as the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central -- the rooms have "All On/All Off" buttons rather than individual light controls. Result is that you often can't turn lights up without first turning them all off (e.g., if two of you are in a room and one gets up to take a shower, the only way the other one can turn the lights on is to first turn off the bathroom lights!). And this is combined with motion sensors (and maybe a door sensor), with occasional fails (so I've turned on the lights, walked in, and had half of them switch off). Too clever by half, and hopefully one day replaced, but in the meantime, still a nice place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel and a great location. Hotel staff were great especially concierges helping us navigate the subway system. The rooms were nice but there were not enough outlets for a family of four and the bathroom outlet along with the hairdryer didn't work. The clock (military time) was attached to the table so couldn't move it into a central location. Picky stuff, but annoying for an expensive hotel. Also, young teenage daughters weren't allowed in the outside, rooftop dining area after 10:30 AM. Silly it's so early in the day, adults ended up getting drinks elsewhere. Main floor restaurant decent, but service for breakfast was not reliable from day to day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just got back from 3 nights at this perfectly situated hotel. Close to everything, well equipped rooms (although no tea or milk as just catered for coffee drinkers). Rooftop bar is great if you can get past the bloke that controls who is out there . Drinks are very expensive but worth it to take in the view. Staff on reception very unhelpful and mardy. No room to change in for a late check out - just pointed to the toilet. No explanation given to the additional charges on check out. Security staff jumping the queue to use the loo then staying in there ages. Such a shame as a great hotel position but the staff let it down.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When i stayed at the hotel i had rented a car just for 2 days. So i had to park the car in the hotel for that 2 days and i have asked the staff how much is the valet parking fee per 1 time when i parked. The staff only told me the price and nothing else. Later on upon checking out i learned that i was charged several times for the valet parking and when i told the the receptionist why am i being charged so many times when i had only parked the car for 2 times she said that i should have reported to them that i have returned the rental car. Then why didn't anyone told me about this earlier when i asked them and also i had never stayed in a hotel which will auto charge valet parking without the car being there. So ridiculous.Also the pillows in the room is too soft. I had to wake up each morning with a neck pain.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of hotel was excellent and so was the service. The staffs I interacted during my stay was pleasant and friendly. The room was in excellent condition and was cleaned everyday so nicely. Nothing to complain. This place made my trip even more pleasant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in one of the best locations for visiting the sights of NYC. You are a block from Time Square but don't have to deal with the crowds and noise because it is on 45th street. The view was amazing even on the cloudiest of days. The staff was friendly and the rooms were amazing. The hotel was updated and had a sleek modern feel to it with ceiling to floor windows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was beautiful with great Bell Men and Great Housecleaner. The restaurant had such horrible service we ended up leaving. For two sodas the waiter added his gratuity into our bill making it almost 16$ for two sodas. The waiter/ bartender was extremely rude and blamed his manager for the poor service. We asked to sit outside and they said not sitting f outside but then sat two groups two minutes after we sat down outside. Instead of coming to us and asked us if we would like to go sit outside the waiter/bartender said no again and said “blame it on our manager . I don’t know if it was because my friend was disabled and in a wheelchair and they didn’t want us sitting outside or what but it was horrible horrible and totally wrong!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great rooftop bar with amazing views. Rooms were clean and large for NYC. We requested a high floor and had a great view of Times Square and the city. The food was wonderful in the restaurant downstairs and the drinks and service at Bar 54 were great too. Only complaint is the noise from Times Square, but we expected this being so close.
