hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is situated in a very busy and noisy area. If you want tranquillity, try some place.The room was nice and clean with modern furniture.The reception area was not that welcoming.It was just ok

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place has great staff, they are professional and helpful! The room was nice, I thought the beds were pretty comfortable. Not a lot of drawers or hangers made it a bit difficult to fit 4 peoples clothing. Bathroom was nice. There was a mini fridge which was nice for drinks. The only problem I really had was the iron leaked dirty water out onto my shirt when I tried to iron it, I couldn't wear that shirt after that, so only take wrinkle free clothes. Location is great, you can walk to the subway easily and there are plenty of places you can walk to. Once again the staff was great, very accommodating and a big part of my good review. Thank you Hyatt Centric staff for being a part of making my families stay in NY a great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were So pleased with the location and friendliness of the entire staff and felt very safe! The Room was clean, comfortable and such a pleasent surprise for us!We will definitely stay here on every visit to NY City!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location. Rooms were very nice, modern and very clean. Bathroom had heated floors which I loved. Will definitely be staying there stay again in the future. Location was in time square area which worked out great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just off times square good location for Broadway shows roof top bar worth a trip on the 54th floor floor but drinks were expensive 3 local beers and 2 baileys $86 bedding changed everyday nice and friendly staff

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel and its staff and location are a hidden gem in NYC! It's one block off of Times Square, super clean, and the staff is fantastic! The Bellman, Jason, was always willing to help with transportation and the front desk staff - easy check in. Oh and the concierge - he was so helpful!!! We will stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I almost can't say enough good things about our stay at the Times Centric. We spent two nights and it was flawless. Well situated for anyone hoping to take in Broadway shows, nice not-over-the-top rooms, very lovely and hip restaurant and bar, and exceptionally helpful and personable staff. Staff was just great. Plus, we have one handicapped traveler and the accessible room was just right. Rooms were clean, modern, attractive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, amazing location. The only slight issue was that our room wasn't ready until 7:30 pm, which was a little annoying after a long flight, but we just left our luggage in their storage, and went shopping instead. Not sure what we would have done, had we been exhausted and just wanted wanting to get into the room and chill out upon arrival. The USB charger was broken and not fixed, but they lent us a charger plug on our second day, so it wasn't a problem. Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I enjoyed staying here, The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. THe room was clean and nicely sized for a NYC hotel.However, the bar and restaurant try to scam you on tips. They charge an automatic 18% gratuity that is not easily seen and have a line for gratuity, not additional gratuity. The first wo servers said nothing about it, so when I tipped over 20%, I actually tipped 40%! Luckily, my third server was honest and pointed out the imbedded tip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Two minute walk to Times Square, Super Clean, Starbucks across the street. Has everything you need for a comfortable stay. Great WiFi, Nice Staff. Cool view from the 54th Floor. Super fast elevator. Rain Shower, The view was great at night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location for theatres and Times Square. However, one way street in front means every taxi and Uber you call has to head into Times Square which adds on time since it is always so busy. Best food is off the main strip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location could view Times Square from hotel roof bar. Roof bar was very expensive and service was not great. Hotel room was decent, nothing special. Blowdryer was AMAZING. Guest elevators were confusing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a fantastic time at the Hyatt - we were lucky enough to have a beautiful suite with floor to ceiling windows looking South and also smaller windows looking West towards the Chrysler building too. We were on the 48th floor so the views were amazing. Tried the rooftop bar which was nice, the room was serviced every day we were there and when we left for the airport we were offered the use of a driver for a reasonable fee. We'd recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I went down to the business center to print some tickets. The facility is not complimentary, and the computer charges your credit card for computer usage by the minute and for prints by the number of copies. I ordered the prints but the printer didn't work and no prints came out. I asked a Hyatt staff member (Laura) for help. She had me re-attempt the prints, and no prints came. Now my credit card is charged for an outrageous amount of money, including for the retries. The hotel front desk says they cannot refund my money, and the printing service is actually run by a third party provider. They had me wait for several minutes for the "manager" to find a phone number for me. I was then handed a 1-800 number on a post-it with no name or anything. I'm supposed to spend my time calling that number to have my money returned. Also, you are charged a mandatory "resort fee" (known at the time of booking). However, when I went to the front desk multiple times in my 2 day stay (you shouldn't have to go there that many times in a good hotel firstly), I overheard the fee being waived left and right for others. It's some sort of scam and they're not transparent. They need 30+ minutes for the valet to bring your car (they tell you that upfront). Meanwhile, the lobby looks like a greyhound station with many guests sitting on the floor with their luggage. I think you're expected to be spending money at their bar in the meantime.A guest pays the premium to stay in a good hotel exactly for the reason of avoiding this sort of experience. If you want to spend a fixed amount of money for a scam-free pleasant stay where your hotel is not your main point of frustration, I would suggest to look for a Hilton or Marriott property. If you book a Hyatt, spend your mental capacity watching out for Hyatt scams in addition to other tourist traps in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Check in was quick and easy, the hotel is located right off of Broadway in Times Square. The view from the room was great, you could see the majority of Times Square and much of the city view. The window opens up just a little to get fresh air, hear the sounds from the activity in the square or snap a picture without reflection. The room was quiet, clean and worked well for me for this location. The staff were friendly and helpful, I had an issue with a charge on my bill that i didn't make and the Manager corrected it quickly upon checkout.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Front desk staff were so welcoming, the views were amazing. Great location, but difficult and congested to get to the valet parking. We had to circle the block a few times. Rooms were small but clean, had everything you needed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent stay. Great staff. Very clean hotel.Didn't expect that so close to Times Square.Rooms are a very good size. Restaurant food is good but pricey but you are in the heart of Manhattan.Roof bar has great views. If definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything was clean and organize in my room.The hotel is near to the Times Square, Broadway and a walk distance from Central Park. Well servide of public transport. But too busy.We weren’t so well attempt as we use to be in a Hyatt! Só impessoal

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric Times Square is in a great location and all the staff members are very helpful, especially June in housekeeping. The rooms are very clean but they need to replace carpet with wood type flooring like most hotels are doing. The carpet is getting worn and stained after 5 years but other than that the rooms are in great shape. The bathroom was very modern and very clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Ideal hotel for both business and leisure especially because of the convenient location. Very close to financial district and quite close to time square. Rooms are nice and modern. A bit small for king only beds. Staff is friendly. Did not try any food/beverages service. Beautiful beds. Great pillows. Everything perfectly clean. Notice: for those sending packages, first 5 are free which is a cool feature. I would return for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room a.little smaller than expected, no tub to soak in And roof top bar was impossible to sit outside, it seemed as though they let all the younger crowd up there, no one checked if they were a guest at the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a fantastic week long stay at this hotel. Rooms were spacious and really beautifully furnished in a retro way for a family of four and service was great. View from the hotel bar was second to none.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So it was my first time in New York City. So to make it a memorable stay, we stayed here in The Hyatt Centric. The moment we walked in we were greeted with welcoming staff members. We stayed on the 15th floor and even though the view wasn’t too great.(We weren’t facing Times Square) However the amenities were outstanding with very nice smelling soap. The room was very spacious and very much worth the money. If I would to come back to New York City, I would totally stay here again! Would also 10/10 recommend this hotel to a fellow friend! Thank you Hyatt Centric for making my very first stay in New York City, a great one!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family of 5 and I visited New York for Spring Break. Location is Great, It's right by Time Square about a 5 minute walk. Lobby isn't to big and it doesn't offer a snack area to grab a quick bite or any other necessities you might have forgot to pack. Front desk was really nice and check in was no more than 10-15 minutes. Elevators weren't that bad it does get crowded due to the time you go to the lobby. In term's of our room it was really nice. Nice comfortable bed and the carpet was clean. The room was really updated and clean and not a speck of dust. The bathroom is modern style and was equipped with enough towels and other amenities for our visit. They even had a floor warmer. Hallway was spacious and we couldn't hear anyone else next to us. Room service was really quick and food was great but it can be pricey and it's not cheap, just in case if you're on a budget. I also got the time to visit the gym. Equipment was clean and new. It wasn't dirty and a good selection of free weights to tread mills, just in case you want to get a quick sweat in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived as a family of 4 to this Hyatt and the location in Times Square is excellent! The front desk staff and bell staff are very kind and the overall cleanliness of the hotel is good. We stay at multiple Hyatt’s each year and this is the one Hyatt we will not return to. Unfortunately, we had multiple issues at this hotel from the a/c going out in our room and having to pack up and move rooms, the next night our room was not cleaned one day, there was poor service and “ok” food at the restaurant that was VERY expensive. Not worth the price of this Hyatt. Disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: They didn't know how to work their own computers, gave me a key card to a room that was already taken by another guest, and give you plastic silverware for $60 steaks. Terrible stay. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Boutique hotel right off Times Square. We had a suite on the 44th floor with outstanding views and great amenities. Queen size bed in one room, pull out couch in the other room, and enormous bathroom with shower and tub! Free bottledwater and coffee in room. Surrounded by all the glitz of Broadway and lots of restaurants. I would suggest heading to 8th Avenue for more reasonable food choices. But, this is NYC and food is pricey. If you have kids, consider sharing meals since the servings are very large.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is a great place to stay in NYC...close to everything and very nice and super clean. The staff take the stress out of traveling to the big city!!! Cant wait to go back, I have a new favorite place to stay in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: While I was not excited to stay in the heart of loud and busy Times Square for a business trip, the Hyatt Centric changed that for me with its incredible roof top bar (tallest in Manhattan), immaculate, modern and luxurious rooms with spa bathrooms, and efficient, kind, professional courteous service. I ate at the T-45 restaurant numerous times and had a great meal every time. The hotel gym is great, and the location of the hotel itself offers great views and ease to Times Square without all of the noise. The rooms are quiet and the beds are incredibly comfortable. I will be staying here again. The staff was so kind and courteous as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 7 days in April 2019- we had an amazing view of the Times Square on the 15th floor! Check in was great, they acknowledge my Hyatt membership and even credited the daily fee at check out. Rooms are clean, big enough for the 2 of us; bathroom/rain shower was very nice! The only thing that bothered us was the positioning of the air conditioner which blows air directly on our heads so we had to cover it with a cardboard plus the 2 nights that the hotel alarm set off by mistake. Other than that, we enjoyed being at the center of it all; walking distance to many eateries, bars, Times Square and Central Park.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric is well located, quiet, and well managed. We enjoyed our stay very much! The rooms are well appointed, the balcony offers a great view and place to enjoy coffee or a beverage. The bar is definitely NY priced, but a also offers a spectacular view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed on 21 st floor. Did not hear any street noise at all; less than a block from Times Square. Great location. Close to all the Broadway theatres. Front desk staff was not very friendly or helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For being near Times Square, these rooms were very quiet compared to other hotels I've stayed at. The rooms were also spacious, clean and had very cool decor. The staff was friendly and room service options were satisfying. For walking, it's very conveniently located. There's also a rooftop bar, but I did not get a chance to go see it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is on the heart of the city. Everything is walking distance from this property. Now the hotel is nothing special and comparing with the money you spending is below the average. I have to say that the roof bar is very nice with very good service

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a great location literally a half a block from Times Square. Our room was nice, housekeeper was extremely friendly and good at her job. The staff at check in were decent, not the friendliest Hyatt personnel I have experienced, maybe it is just a NYC thing. They had a rooftop bar with excellent views, though it is very pricey. even though we were close to Times Square, our room was relatively quiet. We would stay here again if we wanted to stay in the Theater District again for shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great hotel.in the center of Manhattan. On 45th between Broadway and 6th. Great hotel, great large size room. Clean. Comfortable bed. Large size shower and bathroom. Book the higher floors for less or no noise. Nice bar for drinks at night on the roof 54 floor. Definitely will come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: An excellent stay in New York. Great location and very helpful people everywhere. The food in the restaurant met our needs (open until 11.30 pm, fast and varied) and and exceeded our expectations. And the rooftop bar was great

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric was in Fabulous location steps to Time SQ, and very close to Rockefeller Center/Bryant Park and the Grand Central Terminal. Great hotel, exceptional service. Their rooftop bar has amazing views of the city

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Centric. We were in town to take in a few shows and see the sights. The Hyatt was very convenient to Times Square, and theaters, with just a short walk to both. Be sure to ask for a high room, the view was amazing. Amazing view from the roof top bar on the 54th floor as well. Our rooms were clean, comfy, and roomy. Enjoyed breakfast in the restaurant as well. I’m very specific about how I like my omelet, and they nailed it. That’s enough for me! I will definitely return to the Hyatt Centric.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great location, rooms as expected, nice view, staff is friendly, bar is great but drinks fully overpriced, beds are comfortable, doors are loud when closing, showers but no bath tub, coffee and tea in room

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I you are visiting New York City for a special occasion, stay somewhere else.I contacted the hotel (using Facebook Messenger) the day before our check-in to let them know that I would be proposing to my girfriend during our stay. I was hoping that they might make a little effort to make our stay extra special but all I got was automated reply stating that they'd get back to me soon. There was no personal reply to my message.After we got engaged (2 days after contacting them), I spoke with a lady at the front desk and explained that I had unfortunately not had a reply from them. She apologised and said it was too late to send us a drink to our room (9:45pm), but she would talk to a manager about the situation. When we came back, she wasn't at the desk and there wasn't even a note in the room for us.The morning after, we spoke to another lady at the front desk, who had no notification from her colleague from the night before and, as an apology, waived our resort fee (approx $35 per night). We would have expected at least a little personal note in our room and/or an apology from the manager in person.Besides our personal experience, the roof terrace on the 54th floor is pretty nice, but there is no priority for hotel guests over non-guests, which means that you should book in advance.We stayed on the 33rd floor. The room is fine. Clean and tidy, decent size, but nothing too special. The gym on the 4th floor is very good. The location couldn't be more central. In our experience, the hotel staff in general makes no little effort to make their guests feel special. I'm not talking about our engagement, I'm talking about the general experience.The hotel is OK for business or leisure, but not for a special occasion.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my husbands and my first time in New York and we are Hyatt rewards members. I chose this hotel due to the location in Times Square. We checked in on Wednesday for three nights and the hotel did not disappoint. We got upgraded to a high floor and since it was our anniversary we were given a 50 food and beverage credit from Mike at the front desk, he was so awesome. Rooms were beautiful, and were cleaned perfectly every day. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric and had 2 x adjoining rooms. The hotel is located in a fantastic position and suited our family visit to NYC. Rooms were cleaned every day and water provided. Would stay here again for its convenience and location to subway, theatre shows and activities in the middle of midtown. Also very easy to get to Bryant Park, Library, Central Park and also Interprid Sea Air and Space Museum. Loved our stay. Only downside was no washing machine facilities, which would be a great bonus when staying for 10 nights, like we did.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Well located on 45th midway between 6th and 7th. I've been staying here for over 4 years and the property is looking tired. Carpets need to be cleaned/replaced and some fresh paint would go a long way.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Priced extremely well after joining world of Hyatt.. great location, room was super clean ,comfortable and relaxing night sleep..Staff were very courteous. Bar54 has amazing sights out on the terrace enjoying some drinks.. would highly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel exceeded our expectations. Location, Staff, facilities, cleanness and comfort of the rooms were outstanding. This hotel is located at the heart of the Times square. All attractions and restaurants are at walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I’m from the UK and have been to NYC before, we stayed in a poor hotel last time, so this time decided to go much better, hence we booked the Hyatt Centric, high floor, decent room. Personally the view at the back of the hotel was not really worth paying extra for.I think the hotel is very well located in NY, it’s only half a block from the chaos that is Times Sq, haha it really is a busy place! Being on 45th street that goes down to Times Sq the road had a constant traffic jam outside, if you need a cab, go away from Times Sq to 6th Avenue.The hotel, our bathroom had a large walk in shower only, big room with the essential toiletries etc. The bedroom had a huge double bed, the linen all nice and clean. The was a largish built-in wardrobe, not so many drawers, but enough.There was a large TV in the room that randomly kept switching itself on, in the middle of one night it came on quite a few times...very annoying. Apparently our fellow travellers were told it was a hotel wide problem and that they were “working on it” No apology offered though. The room had an empty fridge, coffee and tea facilities (although no fresh milk...just powder) There was a hair dryer, iron and board.All in all the hotel was very good, sometimes the wait for the lift was long, especially if they had a private event in Bar 54 as this meant 33% of the lifts were out of commission as one was used for that event only. The hotel bars was standard NYC pricing...so high! Bar 54 had a great view, certainly worth a look!The street had a couple of reasonable bars and deli’s that were great for breakfast. You could save some money here Despite paying $3200 for the room in advance, they still managed to add some other tax to my bill at the end...it about sums up NYC to me. We went through $50 notes like confetti...take lots of money, you will need it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Half a block out of Times Square, it’s a beautiful, friendly boutique hotel with great amenities. Great outdoor bar, B54, on the 54th floor. Easy access to everything! Never hopped in a cab, walked everywhere!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Because my cruise was delayed due to a medical emergency, I had to cancel the first night of a two night stay. They increased my remaining night $166.00. I offered to stay a second night, but that rate was even higher.Also, after 45 minutes and a call from me, they finally delivered my luggage.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There was not a single drawer in our room for our clothes. The tv would go on randomly. This happened throughout the night so we didn't get much sleep. Also the lights kept turning off randomly. This was especially a problem as this happened while my wife was showering and the room just turned black. She had to get out mid shower and start feeling around for the light switch and tripped and fell. We will never stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Its location is great, the rooms are excellent, staff very nice and helpful, the gym had all the basic equipment one needs and the bed was not only amazingly comfortable it was perfect for I got the best sleep I’ve had in ages!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved the bar on the 54th floor. Good location of the hotel. Nice card greeted us along with a bottle of rose for our girls weekend. Nice baby amenities like baby wash and lotions. Nice beds. Staff was helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited NYC for a graduation. The location of this hotel was great. Very close to Times Square. Price was relatively affordable. The room condition was really poor. Sheets were filthy, clearly not changed from the night before. Sink was clogged. Staff was not helpful. Eventually changed rooms though definitely not an upgrade as promised. Poor customer service. Young staff that did not care about my problems with the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent Mother’s Day weekend at the Hyatt Centric, and it was marvelous. The staff was so professional and helpful. Room was very nice. They have a rooftop bar on the 54th floor that has a killer view...l highly recommend a visit. But, and there’s always a but when it comes NYC, be prepared for Times Square. You will be about a block away and it is busy, crowded and expensive. Oh yeah, it’s also magical. So go visit, be safe and have fun. Great hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location in central New York. We stayed 5 nights and used both subway and Uber for a couple longer trips. If you are attending a show, this is a great spot for the Theatre district. We walked about 10 minutes from Penn Station, and if your are packing lite, I recommend the journey. For dinners we walked over to 9th street, great small restaurant selections.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Prepaid for everything but still ended up paying a bill of 160.00 hidden fees. Paid for an upgraded suite with a view. The view was partial and there was a pretty good size brown stain on our couch where my wife and I didn't even want to know how that happened.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It’s was our second stay in Hyatt Times Square and as usual everything was just perfect. It’s an elegant, spacious and amazingly beautiful hotel. We had a room at 52nd floor with the skyline of New York that was just breathtaking. The service is so professional and kind, willing to assist anytime. The room is really luxury, nicely decorated with a lot of taste, there is everything that you need and the kind size bad so confortable and huge. There is a coffee machine as well and the bathroom very spacious and well functional. Everything is perfect and after 2nd time already I will definitely be back again in Hyatt Centric Times Square. I can truly say it’s the best experience, so unique and unforgettable. Thank you. Magdalena and Gabriel from Paris, France

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros: Super friendly staff. Was able to check in upon arrival at 10 am. The location of hotel was great. Bed was super comfy. Room was spotless. Cons: No mini fridge in room and I paid $15.00 for 2 soft drinks in hotel restaurant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lost my laundry twice, forgot to make my room once, forgot to resuply water twice, room alarm clock showed wrong month AND time, were late to deliver room service every time... and no I do not want to wear other people’s clothing

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: These are the reasons for 3 stars 5/11 - 5/13:1- Check-in and check-out was truly exceptional2- Staff guarding elevators were tactless and rude (5/12 - 5/13)3- Hair on mattress cover covered by top sheet4- Wash towels were not replaced on 5/125- Great location

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First the good...the location is great for visiting Times Square and seeing shows. The rooms are average size for New York but thoughtfully and efficiently laid out. We stayed in room 5008 - a standard High Floor room. Walk-in shower is quite large and I appreciate the hand sprayer as well as the shelves in the shower and under the mirror for additional storage space. The closet in the room is also a good size for a NYC hotel and there are three drawers for clothing as well. Overall very pleased with the layout, amenities, and cleanliness of the room (and I am super picky). Just be aware that the bedding is European style - there is a bottom sheet and a comforter only. No top sheet. Also, the bedside light switches (which are labeled All On/Off, Reading, Mood, and Nightlight) seemed to do something different every time we pressed them. But plenty of bedside and desk top outlets to charge all your things.Now for the reasons this is a 3/5 instead of a 5/5. A couple of days before check in I received an email giving me some options to customize my stay. One of these options was a guaranteed late check out of 2pm for a fee of $50. I selected and confirmed this and added a note asking if there was any way to extend to 3:30pm. When we arrived at the hotel to check in at about 10pm on Sunday, the hotel had no record of this late checkout option. There was a little back and forth with the associate checking us in, but once we showed the confirmation he said he would "honor the request." Um, the request that i booked and paid for? Thanks so much.We decided to go up to Bar 54 to get a late dinner/snack and a drink and check out the view. The hostess was friendly, the interior space was very nice, and the view is stunning. But the music is loud gangster rap full of expletives and crude language (which doesn't seem fitting for the decor or the clientele we observed), the service was extremely slow and inattentive, they were out of several bar items "because we are about to change our menu over" (which is a BS excuse IMO), the drinks are outrageously overpriced (even adjusting for being at a rooftop bar in Manhattan), and they include an automatic 18% gratuity (which does not motivate the wait staff to actually provide good service).The next night I had dinner at T45 (lobby level restaurant) and the service and food were excellent. As a hotel guest I received 10% off my bill. The 18% gratuity was again included, but my server - Brooke - provided such great service I added additional gratuity. Unfortunately I did not receive the same level of service for breakfast the next day - the server didn't tell me about the breakfast special, I was charged $5.75 for a "Cafe Americano" when I ordered - and received - brewed coffee from a pot and was never offered a refill.Finally, on our check out day, I stopped by the front desk to discuss my late check out. My husband is disabled - he has one leg and uses crutches to get around - and had business meetings scheduled up to 3pm. Our car was picking us up at 3:30. He needed to change from his business clothes to his travel clothes and due to his disability he must sit down to change his pants. I calmly and clearly explained all of this to the front desk clerk and asked if there was any way we could keep the room until 3:15 or if she had any other suggestions of a way to accommodate him. She spoke to a manager and came back and just said no, they were fully committed for that night and could not extend the late check out. She said the lobby level restrooms were quite large and perhaps he could change there. I stated again that he has one leg and must sit to change his pants and asked if she had any other ideas. She checked with the manager again, who now came out and again just said "We are fully booked for tonight. Sorry. Have to be out by 2." I explained to him again my husband's disability and his needs and asked if he had any suggestions or ideas as to how they might accommodate him as disabled guest. Again the manager just said "we're sold out for tonight. Sorry." I shared with him that at other hotels in similar situations we have been offered a different, clean "resting" room where he could change and it would be easy and quick for housekeeping to refresh it for a new guest when we were done. And again the manager's only response was "Sorry. We're fully committed tonight." At that point I simply said "We are lifetime platinum with Marriott and we will just make sure we stay at a Marriott property next time." and walked away.Here's the thing. I understand fully booked. But it's not like all of tonight's guests are going to show up at 4pm and this was an opportunity to make a great impression on a very frequent traveler (100+ nights per year) while also accommodating a disabled guest. We were considering focusing on staying at Hyatts more often to gain status there, but now we are reconsidering that idea. If they had just taken a moment to think outside the box and help provide a solution for my husband I would have forgiven the restaurant and bar issues and this would have been a 5 star review. We would have stayed here on our next trip, but instead we will stay at the Renaissance or the Marriott Marquis or the W or the Edition (all Marriott properties within a block of Times Square).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Unbeatable location. The facilities are totally up to date. Internet is great. And I love the roof top bar. I recommend this hotel to my friends and coworkers. I stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square several times a month.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am not in the habit of writing reviews but felt the need to from my most recent experience at Hyatt Centric New York What was meant to be a memorable mother / daughter holiday turned into something quite traumatic , unfortunately my mum fractured her back from lifting a suitcase on day 1 of a 2 week holiday and Australia is a long way from home ! Hyatt Centric reception staff in particular De De and Martha in housekeeping went over and above anything I have ever experienced , I couldn’t begin to tell you what a positive experience this was with us being in a terrible situation. The did everything possible to make mum more comfortable , particularly Martha as mum spent a lot of her time bedridden . The hotel = The rooms were way larger than normal for NYC , their rooftop bar was simply incredible , very affordable cafe downstairs. Coffee machine and water in the room is unbelievable for a hotel in NYC ! The position is 100% perfect , you can walk to most places easily . But thanks in particular has to go to the staff , pretty much all of them , I cannot thank you enough

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location! 2 minute walk to the Times Square and the Minskoff Theatre. Spacious, nice-view rooms. The Concierge lady and Room Service staff were very helpful. The reception staff as well! Easy check-in, easy check-out. The coffee machine in the room was good.Some minor things: no slippers offered in the room. No cupboards.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great if you are looking for a hotel with a decent size room. All appointments were fine and there is a separate shower and tub in the deluxe queen. Easy walk to Central Park, Grand Central Terminal, Theaters, Times Square and Pier 83. Perfect for your first trip to New York and site seeing. (Otherwise, may be too crowded etc. if you are in NYC to see friends, business etc. ).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful hotel located just at Times Square. We chose the King DeLuxe Times Square view room that gave us amazing views over Times Square but also over the NY Skyline with the Liberty Tower and the Chrysler Building. Rooms are large for NY standards, King Bed is amazingly comfortable and you can choose more firm pillows if the ones you find are too soft. Bathroom is large, practically designed, and for our room it had a bathtub for relaxing. Service was great, from the front desk to the cleaning personel. Security was always welcoming and made you feel safe. Overall, we had a great time and we will be back again next time in NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located at the heart of Times Square, but completely silent in the hotel room. Clean room, plenty of hot water and attentive staff. Would definitely recommend for it's central location. The open air bar on the 54th floor was a fun spot to get a drink late at night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of May. We were visiting New York for a Gaa football match and also celebrating 10 years of marriage. The Hyatt Centric on 45th was superb. Location excellent, right in between Connollys Irish pub and O 'Lunneys Irish pub. Facilities at hotel were A1. Room was high floor city views approx 32 as metres. Carl at reception was lovely. All staff very friendly and attentitive. Only downfall was price of alcohol, we visited rooftop bar to experience it and 2 cocktails cost is $60. Ridiculous expensive. We have visited NYC several times and found this time all food and beverages extremely expensive. We also felt the city was dirtier than any other time. Still love NYC. Defo will reboot Hyatt Centric on 45th.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just spent 4 nights here celebrating my birthday. The hotel became aware and gave went out of their way to make it a little more special. The location is perfect for exploring and the room was so comfortable. Would definitely return

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A friend and I chose this hotel for a weekend ladies trip. We were very please with our stay and the location is perfect! We checked in online and received an email that our room was ready early! Being able to get in our room gave us an entire afternoon to enjoy. The room was very spacious, clean and modern. The entire hotel was beautiful. We were on the 51st floor, with a great view. The express elevators were so fast. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was the outrageous cost of the drinks in the hotel rooftop bar! It is a beautiful bar, but be prepared to spend twice what you might expect. I will certainly stay at this hotel again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I love that hotel because you can choose how high up in the sky you wish to stay during the reservation process. We were eventually granted a room at the 52th floor (out of 53) and the view out of the floor-to-ceiling windows was simply spectacular!The check-in and our processes are straightforward, no waiting at all.Also the fact that all rooms come with free in-room Starbucks coffees and water bottles that are restocked every day is highly appreciated.Finally, you can chromecast eligible content from your smartphone directly on the room TV. Great for Netflix!Overall, I recommend wholeheartedly and would stay there again a thousand times if I could!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My mother, husband and I shared a double room while traveling in the city. The location was perfect. Center of everything. Easy walking distance to all of our destinations and if not the train is close by. The room was big enough for the three of us to not get in each others way and to still have our own corners when needed. The shower and amenities were wonderful, who doesn't love a rain shower! Towels were big and thick and plentiful. Bed comfort is subjective. I thought the beds were great and the pillows too soft, where my husband found the bed too hard but the pillows great. We had little to no noise being on a low floor. Yes, there was construction, yes there was honking and traffic at 3am, but that's not the hotels fault. The windows did their job to keep the sound out as much as possible. Being able to open the window, even a crack made us all happy. The sound of the city is an attraction in itself. All in all it was quiet, even being a busy weekend with lots of people in the building. My only real complaint is the water bottles, While we knew they weren't free there was no information advising of price. I would've liked a small note (maybe on the complimentary coffee sign) advising of the price of water. Our housekeeper was great and kept us stocked up on the shampoos, conditioners and the much needed extra pillow for me. Really a great place for the price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a room with a terrace which had excellent views of Times Square. The carpet needs replaced and the furniture is a bit dated. When I first checked into the room there were a few potato chips on the floor with ants crawling on them. I called the front desk and the housekeeping manager and housekeeper immediately came up to vacuum and apologize. The manager took a picture on her cell phone to document it. Those are the only negatives of my stay. Bottled water is provided in the rooms daily. The bathroom is very nice. Marilyn Monroe spa products that smell nice. All of the hotel staff are very nice. The hallways are pretty quiet with only 11 rooms per floor. Fridge in room, no microwave. There is a Keurig machine.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family stayed for 6 nights early last month for a holiday. Great location next to Times Square. The hotel has a trendy, hip look and feel (perhaps like a small toned-down W hotel). The room has a clean modern look with floor-to-ceiling windows. Bathroom looked great and had a heated floor. No slippers though... We stayed on a high floor and there was very little noise from outside.Most of the ladies at the front desk/lobby clearly did not want to be at work that week. I could almost hear their sighs. One conversation bordered on rude. Not good enough for an upscale hotel. Service with a smile goes a long way. I will make an exception for Steven - he was excellent and very accommodating. The doorman was also very friendly.One of the housekeepers servicing our floor was constantly on her phone. On my way to the lift, I saw her sitting on another guest's bed chatting away more than once. No real impact on my hotel experience, but not a particularly professional look nonetheless.Restaurant staff were very good. Pricey menu. During breakfast they ask if you would like some juice - beware it costs $5 for a small glass of apple/orange!'Overall, the location and nice rooms make up for the mixed service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 5 minute walk to Broadway theatres. Modern hotel, clean, very comfortable, nice and friendly staff. Great value! Will highly recommend this hotel to friends and family visiting New York city. Bar 54 roof top bar had an excellent view!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a modern type of trendy hotel however customer service downright awful and Hyatt Centric does mot deserve to charge such prices. We stay on our trip in Intercontinental, wynn, grand Hyatt and this is by far the worst hotel with no value for money.Rude employees at Reception, chatting and being busy entertaining themselves. I am disappointed that we do not even receive a reply on my partners comment which was made also on Trip Advisor giving feedback. You have left out to respond which is even more outrageous Learn how to serve any guests and dont be selective! Secondly for 550 usd i am expecting a toothbrush and shaver and dont have to call every 5 minutes. Room service disgusting served out of plastic ware in a paper back and highly expensive breakfast which was included but i had to pay for scrambled eggs, juice, yoghurt and coffee 55 usd and pay up on top of 550 usd as my breakfast allowance was not enough! Even in New York this is unacceptable.Trendy yes but have some class! Never return and definitely will not recommend!I

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything about the Hyatt Centric was perfect for a girls’ weekend! SO close to Broadway and super convenient to get on the subway to head south! Front desk folks were incredibly helpful. Book it now!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of the finest experiences staying at a hotel. Room size, cleanliness, staff and location are just top notch. Wish me and my wife could have stayed a little longer. Would definitely recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is perfect and not far from public transportation. Room was clean and hotel staff was great. Roof top bar is very nice, im sure its even better during the warmer seasons. I would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took a quick family vacation and wanted to stay in the heart of NYC. We decided on staying at the Hyatt Centric because their rates were reasonable and it was in Times Square, convenient to all that we wanted to do. They upgraded us to a higher level room for free and the service was great. The room was clean and updated. We had a great visit and will be sure to come back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent 4 nights here with family. Excellent location just off of Times Square. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff friendly, welcoming and always willing to help. Our level 32 room had a great view, was quiet and was kept clean throughout. In addition, the bed was very comfortable and the list of complimentary items was good.Only two issues - the cost of food and drink at the bar and restaurant is ridiculously high! And although there are reception / door staff it seems anyone can walk in to the lifts without being challenged.That said a superb choice and would return in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful place and right in the middle of all the action. NYC is a crazy city. Our second trip back to the city after 10 years. We enjoyed our stand and the city. We'll be back. We saw three (3) plays and were able to walk. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in the Hyatt Centric Times Square to celebrate my sons first time in New York City and my partner and I’s 14 year anniversary. We choose the hotel as we had fallen in love with it when we stayed back in 2016 to celebrate our 11 year anniversary! We loved the rooftop bar and views. We knew we wanted to come back to Hyatt Centric so much so that we booked to stay almost a year in advance of our trip and then sat back and began to look forward to another trip of a lifetime. Little did we know we would come back saying that this trip was the best thing we have ever done, and that we feel that our experience and stay in Hyatt Centric Times Square was likely one that will be impossible to top, and I mean ever. We always like to meet a certain standard for accommodation on any trip, but the stars truly aligned during our stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square, and while normally the goal is to feel as special as possible on any given trip, I would go as far as saying that I felt like the most valued and special customer during our stay here. I even joked I felt like a celebrity to my partner.Prior to arriving, I emailed the hotel a few questions and my emails were picked up by Michelle and Tommasi. Both were so immensely helpful from the start, and I told them what we were travelling to NYC for and they were so patient in answering my likely seemingly never-ending flow of questions. Weeks before we even got to the hotel, I already felt so welcome and it really just added to the anticipation of our arrival.On arrival, we discovered that we had been assigned to a 52nd floor Deluxe View Corner Suite with a view of Times Square. Words can’t describe our reaction when we entered our room and saw the view the whole way to the end of Manhattan looking out our floor-to-ceiling windows. This was so immensely above what we ever expected the standard of our room to be, and unlike anything we had ever seen before. If we looked left we could see the Chrysler Building, if we looked straight ahead we could see One World Observatory at the end of the island and if we looked right and down, we were overlooking Times Square. We were speechless for a few moments and then joked, “Well, we don’t need to go up any buildings for a view now!!” I simply can’t thank Michelle and Tommasi enough for helping us achieve our goal and almost instantly of making sure that our 14 year anniversary trip was unforgettable.This hotel truly is the most spectacular and lavish hotel we have ever stayed in. The reception staff were impeccable from check-in to check-out, any questions we had they answered. A tip for your stay – do not go home without trying breakfast from the T45 restaurant at least once, but ideally do it everyday. It is exceptional and truly gets you ready for the day. I can’t say enough about the hotels location either. Aside from getting to and from the airport, we mostly walked everywhere, and felt as central as you could want. Times Square was literally steps away and everywhere up and down-town was within walking distance because of your location. We felt like we were at the epicentre of the city that never sleeps, but when we wanted to sleep, we just went 52 floors up into the sky, away from the sights and sounds and slept in luxurious comfort. Ever since we’ve left, we just wish we were back there!!The hotel TV was fabulous too, the Good Morning programs and Late Night Talk Shows became my go-to programming after a day strolling about in the heart of the Big Apple, and the best part was, we had a TV in our bedroom and one in the lounge area of our suite for our son who relaxed on his fold out sofa bed, if we ever wanted to watch something different!!The room we were in was so spacious, and the décor was so crisp, modern and clean which I completely adore. Our lounge area was so comfortable and afforded more than enough room for our son on the fold out sofa bed, while allowing us the luxury of space during the day when we folded it away. The room had a spacious fridge, lots of storage space and a wardrobe that our case and all of our clothes fit in, which really helped keep the room looking tidy all the time with any mess out of the way. My partner had access to a hairdryer and the bathroom was spectacular, with a large bath and walk in shower area, which I loved using every morning. The maid service was amazing –we were never disturbed, and every afternoon when we came back, our room was as if we were just walking in on the first day. I’m a neat freak and love this kind of cleanliness. The level of comfort in this hotel and attention to detail is just mind-blowing.We had a pretty packed to do list and got through most of what we aimed to do in NYC, all of which was walkable from the hotel. We took in Times Square, walked the Brooklyn Bridge, took the free Staten Island Ferry, and spent our anniversary afternoon on Roosevelt Island before heading to the Natural History Museum and so much more. For quick lunch bites, if you aren’t in the hotel and can’t go to T45, there is a busy but lovely deli a few doors to your left when you exit the hotel.We loved our drinks at the Rooftop Bar, Bar 54 and we also enjoyed a bottle of wine in our room because we had been assigned a room with such a spectacular view!I could write about this hotel and indeed our experience for pages and pages, but I’ll sum it up by saying that if you are visiting New York City, for the first time or have been before, I don’t think you’ve done it properly until you have stayed at Hyatt Centric Times Square. I can say with conviction that it was the best hotel that I have ever stayed in in my life. I can in addition say that the Customer Service, and indeed personal Customer Service, that we received from Michelle and Tommasi ahead of and during our stay was the most professional, exceptional and welcoming that I have ever received in my life also. While making grand claims, I will reiterate that while we always like to set a benchmark when we travel that we like to beat the next time we go away, whether it be a standard of hotel, a view, etc., I am confident that the view we had from our 52nd floor Deluxe View of Times Square Corner Suite in Hyatt Centric Times Square is likely never going to be beaten.This hotel, and the experience surrounding it, was phenomenal.When we are back in NYC, I know where we’ll be staying.Thanks you Hyatt Times Square for everything!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I’m constantly on the road for work, and have become very particular where I stay. With that said, we definitely found our new spot while traveling into the city. The Hyatt Centric was amazing. From the time we arrived, until the time we left, we were treated like royalty. We decided to do something a bit different and take the short drive into NYC from upper Westchester for our twin daughters 16th birthdays. It turned out to be a great choice. Upon arrival the staff had balloons and a card waiting for the girls in the room. That just set the tone for a great weekend for all of us... There central location is second to none. We went to see King Kong while in town and it was a simple five minute walk. Even in the rain it wasn’t bad at all. The only locations we needed to grab a cab for was the 911 Memorial and the Sugar Shack down in the meatpacking district, which was still extremely easy, and cheep at a cost of $17.00 with the tip. Moving forward this is the only place me and my family will stay when coming down. Because of my frequent travels I’m constantly asked for the best places to stay by family and friends. I’d have to say this is one of the few locations I’d feel 100% confident about recommending.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Early check-in request made at noon was treated with indifference and ended up getting room after 4:00PM. Rude treatment at check-in cast a negative impression over the entire experience. There are many better options in Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Not a friend giving such rating however for the high price I am expecting more also in New York and this starts with a genuine Customer Care which only the Bar Attendants, Doorman snd Housekeeping had however the heart of the hotel which is Front Desk absolutely failed toImpress me with a snooty and cold attitude. Ladies you have to learn why you work at the Reception!Pros: excellent location and like the trendy concept. Housekeeping lady (Chinese) a lovely lady who kept our room well groomed.Beds extremely comfortable and room is well sized for NYCChris (Christopher) a superstar amongst all who really embraced hospitality and helped us with I formations and a smile!Cons: Plenty which can be improved! First of all train your ladies at Reception to smile and greet when a customer pass by. Whenever I passed there was no warmth and sincerity even I greeted they were busy discussing private issues. Sorry Trendy hotels need Trendy staff who know how to treat customers and not chit chat away and give no attention to the guests. Check in equally rude a quick check in no informations no reconfirmation of booking details and Payment Details.I was booked through Agoda paid a surcharge for high floor but was put on floor 29 whilst the lowest is 25 and the highest would be about 50. An absolute scam to charge more. Fire Alarm went of at 1.35 am and even the announcement was first clear than confusion started and next day not even a apology was issued. Inquiring about dining options the Front Desk seem to care less and just give some nonsense answer rather than checking. Front Desk is seemingly preoccupied to talk about private matters, standing there messaging on mobile phones rather than taking care of their job. Absolutely appalling performance.Lastly value for money is below average. We paid 500 usd per night incl breakfast. Once you order breakfast with yoghurt and one hot dish and a fresh juice our bill exceeded more than 110 usd which is outrageous and had to pay the difference on top.Also this hotel seem to care less about environment. Even paper cups are wrapped in the room with plastic, room service served in plastic trays and plastic cutlery which is not the Hyatt environmental standard at all.Would I recommend? Perhaps no with cons outweighing and running a 5 star establishment my self I am truest shocked that the basics of Smile , Greet and Care is not prominent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great place to stay in a wonderful location. Stayed here for the NYC Marathon and was a short walk to the bus stop. Room was small but enough for what we needed. Bed was comfy and staff was friendly and helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am a fan of the Hyatt, but not this one. The front desk agent were rude upon check in. Granted we arrived early. There is nowhere to sit waiting for our room to be ready. We had to go Marriott to wait for the call. When the room was ready, they did not even make the call. We waited and waited and decide to walk back to check on the status. And guess what, the room was ready. I wish they would have a sitting area... I do love the location. Just not the service and attitude I have encountered.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly staff,big room,free coffee at room.The only problem is the noise from the road which of course not hotel fault.The hotel is almost 100 meter from time square,attractions and restaurant .Also Central park is 20 minutes by feet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My children aged 8 & 17 and myself stayed at this hotel in April for a weekend, it was the start of a big holiday travelling to New York, LA and Vegas for my Big Birthday.The hotel was clean and checkin was fast, staff were very efficient and friendly We stayed in a suite with a lovely view. The room was large and the staff had placed balloons and a card signed from all the staff out for me, which was a lovely gesture. beds were good and showers worked well, oh yes there were UK travel plugs which made using our electrical easier. There is a roof top bar, which is meant to have spectacular views, having children with me meant I couldn’t go and have a drink there, but the reception offered to take us all there for a look at 10.30am. But we were too busy and didn’t do this. Maybe next time! Only thing I didn’t like was breakfast on the first day was $99. My youngest only had a crossaint and myself and my older son a small fry up. We ate out after that! Only two minutes walk from Times Square, which was great as the hotel was near the theatres and restaurants. The night doorman was super helpful and friendly a credit to the Hyatt group. Lovely Cadillacs available to run you about too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is very new, simple and clean. Good value for money. Location is perfect for both business and leisure. The rooms are very well sized with floor to ceiling windows, bed is very comfortable, the bathroom has clean lines and good space. The breakfast was a little expensive at almost $50 but there are many other choices nearby. I will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here to celebrate the big 50 birthday. We had a room on the 37th floor and noise from Times Square was not an issue. Nice little market and 2 Irish Pubs nearby. The bar on the 54th floor was neat but quite expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square has the best location. Within walking distance to everywhere in Manhattan. This our our 2nd visit and we returned because of the location and service. The staff was great, we did not encounter one person that wasn't helpful or friendly. From the front desk, housekeeping, maintenance and security all were professionals. (We accidentally locked ourselves out of the bathroom and within 1 minute after the call, maintenance was up to open the door). Clean lobby and rooms, the property is obviously managed well. Josh, The Guest Service Manager did an excellent job of assisting us on things to do and following up if we had any issues (we had none). We will be back.
user_location: Surfside Beach, South Carolina, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we stayed in a 2 queen bed room. location was good but subway was 5+ minutes walk away. there's a nearby 24h cafe but you cant get much in there. small lobby. it can get congested at times with very limited seating you cant wait long in there or would have to transfer if no seat was available. the bed sheets were not changed. they were just neatly made in bed every day. we know this because stains in bed were there. some complimentary items that usually are already available in the room had to be requested like bedroom slippers, tooth brush, etc. the room was averagely sized considering we had 4 big luggages. i would consider the price to be really expensive since there were really a lot of taxes involved including a destination fee.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a really good experience on our recent family vacation. NY City is a little bit overwhelming in many ways but the staff at the Hyatt Centric exceeded our expectations in every area. They were courteous and very helpful in assisting us with everything from dinning recommendations to transportation to the airport when leaving the city. Our room was kept in excellent shape and the housekeeping staff was on top of all our needs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great property not only for leisure travel but also if you travel on business and your customers or events are in Midtown.Friendly staff will feel you welcomed, rooms are very modern and spotless with comfy beds and pillows. if you like to work out...Gym on the 4th floor has all you need.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed with my sister here and from the friendly staff ,comfy beautiful room, delicious food offerings in the restaurant, the bars were incredible.. all impeccable & keeps me coming back!! They treated us with professionalism and we felt safe here as well

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Convenient location and great, friendly staff. Elevators unusually slow, so if that might bother you (there are about 50 floors) then best look elsewhere. Elegant rooftop bar, very nice ground floor restaurant. Everything NYC is right outside the door!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern, clean hotel in terrific location at the heart of the Times Square/Theater district (shows, dining, museums, Central park and shopping). Terrific city view rooms in the upper floors (I upgraded to a King Bed City View 45th floor room upon arrival for $25/nite and was delighted). Fast internet, king beds, floor-ceiling windows, standard closet, Keurig coffee with Peets coffee/teas, modern bathroom + rain shower, hair dryer, 40" TV with basic channels, and a room service which features fast GrubHub delivery of foods delivered in brown paper bags. I ordered double cheeseburger and sweet potato fries that were delivered in under 15 min (they quoted me 45 on the phone).Fitness center, business center and T45 Kitchen+Bar54 (I didn't visit these) are also highlighted.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel location is spot on. All the staff are genuinely friendly, in particular Mickey. He was always attentive even when busy acknowledging us as soon as we sat down. Breakfasts were also the best. Will be returning here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were pleasantly surprised by the Hyatt Centric. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are clean and quiet. A short walk to the theatre district but away from the chaos of Times Square. I will always stay here when going to the theatre...I wish it was closer to the Javits or I would stay here for my work as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great central location and noise proof rooms from the world. Also benefits froma bar with a fab view on the roof. Only reason not to give 5 was lack of working hairdryer and incorrect number or towels / water on a number of occasions (given the ‘resort fee’)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean with nice staff and beautiful views in a great and convenient location, would highly recommend to family and friends. Hotel was great just as expected by reading others reviews before deciding to stay there. Bed was comfortable!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at Hyatt centric this weekModern clean hotelSuperb location Would highly recommend this hotelGreat hotel bar busy and good atmosphere.This hotel is literally 40 second walk to Times Square Will definitely return and recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Traveling with a 7 month old. The hotel provided a high chair and pack n play. Also provideda tea kettle to make formula. Our housekeeper was fantastic. Rooms were spotless and bedsvery comfortable. A great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is great for families, rooms are very large twin double beds, The room was very quiet at night.We had a city view on the 42nd floor which was worth the extra money.The Bathroom is brilliant with large walk in shower & seperate bath. Room was clean and well serviced every day including tea & coffee & bottled water.The roof top bar has fantastic view, but be warned, it is very expensive.All staff where helpful & courteous.I Would recommend for this part of town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were so happy in our modern spotlessly clean Executive suite. The walk in shower was a relief for me and the heated bathroom floor was an added bonus. My 30 yr old grandson enjoyed having a room to himself including a huge closet, tv and independent ac. The breakfast was good but the dinners were fantastic n he took pics from the roof top bar and enjoyed his drink. We would never stay anywhere else . It was hard to leave this hotel and I stayed about 6 days years ago at the Waldorf Astoria n liked the Hyatt Centric more

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good hotel, excellent location, friendly (rather neutral) stuff. We've found the access and location excellent for a first time visit in New York, the view from the room was nice, good phonic isolation considering the conditions (Times Square) and despite the climate control a little bit loud.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed two nights. The hotel is in a great location, close to the action and shopping. Friendly, helpful staff, convenient restaurant, extremely comfortable beds and more room than expected. Very clean and modern bathroom. Bedside lighting controls with nightlight functionality is a great amenity. Definitely would stay here our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Four of us in two queen beds had plenty of room, never felt crowded. And what beds! Great beds and pillows. Sound-proofed so someone showering in the morning didn't wake the others. And loved the hand-held shower. Perfect location for theatre-going.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Accommodations and staff are superb. I will be staying at Hyatt's from here on out! After a huge snafu with another hotel and bad customer service there, the Hyatt's personnel and professionalism were extremely refreshing and much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Large, confortable, clean, executive type room. Excelent location, less than 100m from Times Square near several major attractions, Broadway theatres and subway. No noise from street or other rooms. Friendly and efficient staff. Our room was 2 queen beds deluxe, high floor, with city view towards north. Not deep skyline view but very nice. Interresting 54th floor rooftop bar, but note that children is not allowed (over 21).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Manager and front office attendant were very gracious at solving a situation we had with our reservations. We were satisfied at the solution. They gave us some perks for the inconvenience, such as a high floor and discount.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We love Hyatt hotels around the world and stay there whenever possible. We just spent 4 nights at Hyatt Centric in Times Square. It’s conveniently located. It’s clean and comfortable. We would have given the place a 5-star except for a couple of things.First has little to do with the hotel itself. Times Square has gotten so crowded now. It’s really hard to get to and from the hotel by car. We drove in from Boston and the last mile literally took close to an hour. We were running so late to our dinner appointment that we had to leave our car with the hotel valet for a couple of hours. That resulted a full day charge for parking. We also had multiple ride-share cancellations because the drivers couldn’t get to the hotel. Btw, for some reason, Uber worked a lot better for us than Lyft in NYC.Second our son left his air pods on the bed before we went out on day. When we got back, it was gone. We looked everywhere for it. Our guess is that it got rolled up with the bed sheet and taken out. We contacted housekeeping. They contacted the laundry service company but nothing has turned up so far. While this was nobody’s fault and the hotel staff generally tried to be helpful, it was disappointing nevertheless.Would we stay with Hyatt in NYC again? Absolutely, but perhaps at a different location in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved this hotel. I’d contacted the hotel earlier to advise of my daughters birthday celebration and balloons and a personalised birthday card were in the room for our arrival. We were on the 30th floor and could see a bit of Times Square. Fantastic location and staff were very helpful. Would love to go back and definitely worth a visit. Fantastic view of Manhattan skyline from rooftop bar on 54th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent three nights at this hotel. While nothing glaringly bad, there was absolutely nothing that stood out.The lobby is bland and super understated. Front desk staff was very friendly.On the way to the room, it felt more like a dated condo building than a high end hotel.The room was fine. Good: bed was super comfortable. Bathroom was highlight with heated floors. Living room area is was dated and unimagined.Called down and asked for blankets for pull out. Had to call down a second time an hour later.Location was amazing .... walkable to everything.Just a lack luster experience. At this price point and this brand, expected more.Note: Was told room had Times Square view. Turns out it faces away from Times Swuare. View is of the far end of the square, not the square proper.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric for a week for our anniversary. It was a great experience!! The housekeeping staff left us a note every day, something along the lines of "If you need anything specific just write it at the bottom of this note." The staff was friendly and helped us find things to do when we ran out of ideas mid-week. I came back here alone (and I'm a pretty small mid-20s female) and felt completely safe (and I tend toward being paranoid). There are a lot of blocks in this area that are unsafe, but this particular hotel is next to the Lyceum Theater and Planet Hollywood some other businesses that keep the area safe and full of people/security even late into the night.We loved in-room breakfast for our anniversary trip, and they have pretty healthy options (Greek yogurt, veggie omlette, etc) but they are really pricey. I'd recommend going out for New York bagels instead. :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved this hotel. The staff was kind and efficient. The rooms were small but well organized, very clean and comfortable with great lighting and little noise. I have two other hotels that are my go-to places when I am in NY, so glad they were not available so I had a chance to try Hyatt Centric - it is now on my list.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: as expected. I went to the rooftop bar. The drinks were extremely expensive. When I got the bill, it was not clear that the tip had already been added in. The waitress should have pointed this out. My bed was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very welcoming atmosphere at reception. good size rooms and plenty of draws in the room for your clothes. Good size bathroom enough room for 2 people at the same time. the hotel is around the corner from Times Square and many food and theatre attraction Good place to stay recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is the perfect location. Quick walk to Times Square, but still quiet. Great views from roof top bar drinks are pricey, but view makes up for it! Easy access to subway to go uptown or downtown. Easy walk to Central Park.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located right by Times Square with lots to do! Hyatt Centric is located on a side street from Times Square which allows you to get some peace and quiet from the hustle and bustle. We spent most of our time outside of the hotel, but would recommend Hyatt if you want a good nights sleep after a long day. "Destination fee" of an extra $30 US a night only provided the basics: water bottles, coffee, soap and Wi-Fi.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would definitely recommend this hotel. It’s centrally located. Great food and bars. The hotel staff and security were wonderful. The view from Bar 54 was spectacular. I just wish it was a little warmer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall good value for a Midtown Manhattan Hotel. The cons are slow elevators and inadequate seating in the very small lobby of a very high traffic hotel in Midtown Manhattan. I suppose it is designed this way to minimize loitering, but it is unattractive and inconvenient especially during peak periods of check-in and checkout.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel and the most attentive staff who could not do enough for you. Only let down was breakfast $70 budget is not enough for 4 people with the prices being charged. Otherwise brilliant stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a nice time in this centrally located hotel. Only steps away from Times Square but far enough away from the madness and crowds. Rooms very nicely sized and had nice amenities including a "Dry Bar" hairdryer and charging strip for cell phones, etc. (although ours did not work). Kids enjoyed the rain shower in the bathroom. I would recommend this spot for friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is large and modern. It is a great location for tourist because it is close to Times Square. It’s also a good location for business travelers for offices in Midtown Manhattan. Room Service and housekeeping were exceptional. Fast and courteous. My only negative aspects of my stay were with lobby staff - a) they struggled to give strong recommendations to decent local restaurants (minor point), and b) during an event in their ballroom they blocked off two of the three elevators to get to the upper rooms (very off putting). Otherwise a solid experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the hotel was in a great location , the room was clean, and room cleaning staff was great. we stayed three nights and one thing we did not like was that we were asked rudely if we were their guests and we were asked to show our room key when we came back to the hotel the second night around midnight. i have stayed many hotels in the past (in the u.s, europ, or asia) but never asked such question. if they must, they can at least ask such question nicely. i am very disappointed in this incident

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was in this hotel for 4 nights on a business trip. I feel that the service standards of this hotel has dropped and it’s no longer as good as before.Staff does not generally great people and some are even rude. A lady standing by the elevator apparently to make sure someone holds a room card before taking the elevators was even a little rude when asking to see my room card. Their exception was one lady receptionist who was very nice. She personally came to my roomAnd helped me with my luggage and also was very helpful when I was leaving the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel far exceeded my expectations. I was able to upgrade my room upon arrival. The view was breathtaking. Everyone I encountered at the hotel were so personable and helpful.
