Especially Mikey at the front desk. And Shawn with Valet parking.I utilized the valet parking, (pricy @ $80/day) but worth it. Was centrally located so I walked every where I needed to go. The rooftop bar, on the 54th floor, is a must see. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is a solid business hotel, it seems better suited for tourists. It sits with a great view of Times Square, which is great if you want to bask in New Yorkness. Photo is from my room. If you are a business person like me, you will also note that it makes traffic around the hotel horrible, results in considerable light coming into the room even with the blinds fully drawn, and leads to a certain level of noise that New Yorkers would not notice, but people who live in quiet suburbs may find annoying.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I once again stayed at the Hyatt Centric while working and teaching in NY. As always the service was great. I had a problem with the HVAC in my room and Ciprian, one of the engineers responded quickly, and when it proved difficult to fix the unit Rico, one of the mangers, made it easy to get the whole situation handled. In the hotel business things sometimes happen, and I define great service as how problems are resolved. This Hyatt always has great service!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: you will be woken by garbage trucks all night and won’t get any sleep. Also make sure that if you are on business you are not placed beside a family with kids as the sound proofing is not good enough. Food was good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Absolutely made our trip. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. The room was clean and very large for a NYC room. This was my kids first trip to NYC and the room and staff helped make it a memorable one for them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice and clean hotel. location was excellent where I can see Timesquare from a window. room service was excellent. hotel staff very supportive. not much option for food but quality of food was great. overall great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here with 3 friends for a trip to NYC. The staff were very helpful and friendly, nothing was ever too much trouble. The hotel was perfectly situated in Times Square, but far enough away that the lights/noise didn’t bother you. There was a great shower in the bathroom and the room was cleaned daily with fresh towels and bottled water. If we needed any extra water, cups, coffee, etc. It was always brought up immediately. With 4 girls in one room, we did worry that it would be cramped and hard to get ready, but it was fine. My only suggestion would be perhaps another mirror! Would definitely stay again on the next trip to NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Absolutely perfect location! So conveniently located at the heart of Times Square. I particularly love the heated bathroom floor.You het your valie for money with Hyatt Centric. Will definitely be back soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quiet. Staff are Professional and very helpful and nice. Very clean everywhere. Super fast elevators. Hotel feels quiet and hidden away but its right in the middle of Times Square. Shows were within 3 blocks walk both times we stayed here. .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose the Hyatt Centric as a result of its location and its previous reviews. We weren’t disappointed. It is in a perfect location and the staff were highly attentative, professional and extremely courteous. They made us feel valued and very welcome.The room was very modern with good facilities and very clean. Previous to our arrival, we were contacted by email to ensure our needs were met which was a nice touch. The Hyatt has its own app in order that you can keep an eye on your bill, checkout or make requests. This was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here in January for 4 days with a work conference. The Rooftop Bar has a gorgeous view!! (And at night the lights and busyness is spectacular!)My room was single bed with heated bathroom floors - I felt like a Queen!I ate breakfast at the reception floor level restaurant each day (night capping here with one last until we were moved to the rooftop bar ;) )And the hotel was conveniently located within steps of Time Square and many, many foot carts and corner shops.Simply wonderful and will be back here again when in NY!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square location in the heart of Times Square was perfect. The hotel was centrally located to TS, Broadway, TOTR, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, etc. Wonderful restaurants all nearby and the location allowed for you to go back and have the family rest a bit from all the sight seeing. Hotel room was new, modern and clean. I will definitely stay here on my next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just flew home today from a 6 night stay here to celebrate my mom’s Retirement. This hotel is amazing!! Check in and check out were both a breeze! We arrived early and they said they were just finishing up a few last minute details on our room. So we walked down the street to grab lunch while they held our luggage. Location is PERFECT!! We got back and they had taken our luggage to our room and a surprise gift with balloons was waiting for my mom. She absolutely loved it!! The room was spacious and clean. The AC worked great as well as the hot water!! The bathroom was big and had everything we needed! No need to pack a hairdryer! It was wonderful!! Our beds....OMG!! I slept so great!! Anytime we needed anything the front desk would help out!! They even emailed and left a voicemail checking to make sure we had everything we needed. One day it was raining and they supplied us with umbrellas for the day. I went upstairs to Bar 54 the last evening and enjoyed a glass of wine while soaking up the breathtaking views of the city I have grown to love so much!! Thank you Hyatt Centric for a wonderful stay that we will never forget!! I look forward to my next trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very friendly and accommodating staff. Fast check-in and check-out. Room service was excellent days after days. Concierge always present to support. Every question is answered very professionally by the staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for 2 whole weeks. The room was okay, I had everything I need, the shower head and the shower handle suffered a pretty poor stream. The cleaner opened 4 times the door while I was there even though she knocked and I yelled to her that I'm there. The restaurant downstairs is okay, but overpriced. I had this weird situation that I payed cash for a room service. Added 20 percent tip, and afterwards saw in the tab that it was already included the tip, and eventhough I payed cash, they asked me to pay for this meal in my checkout cause someone didn't notice them that I payed. Of course I didn't pay but it was a very unpleasant situations, and the staff didn't make me feel better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was great, room very clean and I felt very safe. We loved the smell of the hotel! When we came in from sightseeing it was always refreshing and cookies an extra plus also. Would not hesitate to stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice room with window, coffee machine and daily bottled water are pluses for the hotel. Having just a shower stall and sink with enough counter space was great. Friendly & helpful staff hotel is walkable to all theaters. You can't go wrong staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel. My 17 year old daughter and I came to NY for spring break. The location of this hotel is perfect!! you are right in Times Square, and there are tons of places to eat. CVS is close by for light shopping, and the noise level was really low. The staff was friendly, and our room attendant was really nice! I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just visited NYC with my 7 year old daughter. First of all, the location is supreme. We arrived several hours before check-in. I expected to drop our bags off, and our room would be ready later. It seemed about 5 minutes later, I received a text informing me our room was ready. Secondly, if you can, splurge and get a Times Square View. We were on the 46th floor, and the view was breathtaking. I never closed the curtains. The lights at night were stunning. We could even see the Hudson. The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly. They always greeted us, and gave great suggestions when asked questions. This will definitely be my go to place to stay. Perfect for anyone who plans to visit the Theaters, Times Square, and just a block away from 5th Avenue shops, and 3 blocks from Rockefeller Center. Plus it didn’t hurt that the shower had great water pressure. Definitely helped make our trip that much better after long days of outings.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wow, what a wonderful stay we had at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for a surprise trip for my Husband's 30th birthday.On arrival we were greeted by a happy, bubbly member of staff who made check in very easy and fun! We were unexpectedly given the room I requested and boy we were so pleasantly surprised when we got to it (5202) We will never forget the breathtaking views of Times Square and across the city right down to the Freedom Tower. The high floor room ensured we did not hear traffic or outside noise. The bed itself was large and very comfy and was situated in the perfect place to soak in the views. The Nespresso machine came in very handy for coffee in the morning and stocks were replenished daily by the wonderful cleaning staff. The bathroom was quite big and had lots of storage space with a large shower and separate bath tub.The hotel's excellent location meant that we could easily access lots of the main tourist attractions, transport services and restaurants which was ideal. The hotel is spotless and staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. The rooftop bar and the restaurant right next to reception are a must do. Wonderful food and drinks. The staff went over and beyond all of our expectations which we are so grateful for and made such an effort to mark the occasion of my husband's birthday. We cannot fault the hotel and would highly recommend anyone to stay here if travelling to New York and would most definitely stay here again ourselves.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Me and my husband absolutely love this hotel.Starting with location: your are in time square literally but you can’t hear the noise at all. The location is excellent if you’re going to watch any broadway play. It’s really walking distance for any play.Service is amazing specially housekeeping (they are so nice), front desk is very helpful even if they don’t look welcoming, security is amazing too and very polite. Loved that they cleaned our room every day and provided us with free bottled water everyday and also there is a mini fridge in the room. Our room had a balcony which was so nice to sit and drink with the time square view.The rooms are so big compared to many hotels in Manhattan we’ve stayed in. That was a pleasant surprise. We had drinks at the rooftop too every other night, we didn’t get to have room service but we are looking forward too on another visit.Negatives They have a computer which you can use but to browse the internet you have to pay. (Been to more affordable hotels where this is free of charge).Ask every question because no one ever told us check out was at 11am, every where we read it said 4pm (which was different from other hotels but we thought this was such a plus). We were surprised when they called us and told us check out was at 11 and it was 12 so they had to charge 120 for a late check out (little upsetting, due to the fact that no one told us or anything) they let us finish picking our stuff up at least.Overall this is a fantastic hotel, we will definitely stay here again. I wish I could write all the cool little details this hotel has but I just hope by saying this you will consider experience it for yourself.Love they Hyatt Centric TS ❤️

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Bad service and high prices, they don’t have firms pillows, smalls rooms, noises in night... a bad experience in a wonderful city... it’s a shame. If you are thinking in this hotel for vacation in New York I don’t recommend you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is now my go to hotel in Midtown. The rooms are beautiful, clean and surprisingly quiet (try to get above floor 30). The rooftop bar has an amazing view. And the location can't be beat if you are there to see shows or shop.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms were clean. Staff was really helpful. Room orders were completed in a reasonable amount of time. The ice machine did have trouble on my floor so I went to a floor above me. Other than that everything was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location...and would be perfect for families who want to be in the center of Midtown. However solo travelers, including those traveling for work or pleasure, may want to consider something else. Limited space for lounging, seating, and working...traditional hotel lobby nonexistent. Customer service is good, and the housekeeping staff is the nicest I've ever encountered.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent service and good accommodation. Good place to stay over if you want to experience New York Time Square. The staff is very friendly and accommodating to all needs. Located next to Times Square. Impressed with the bar on level 54, great view of NY skyscrapers!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Decent property but expected more for the price and rating of the hotel. Great location. I have back issues and it’s a rare thing to find a decent hotel bed. This one was below average. They offered a courtesy van to the airport. Doorman said $60 tax, tip, everything included. When it came time to pay it was $65 and there was a place for more tip. Pretty cheesy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: No water in the room.Hair dryer doesn’t work No slippers in room . No shower cap . basically you have to ask for everything that is suppose to be included . The shower made a really loud rumble whenever turned on .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great stay over spring break at the Hyatt. They location was fantastic and very convenient to Times Square and the subway. The rooms and beds were very comfortable. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel booked through Trailfinders and excellent. The hotel couldn’t be more convenient as literally two minutes away from Time Square. Nice room with very comfortable beds and an excellent shower - desk provided but with no power or USB sockets co-located. Breakfast in the hotel is expensive so suggest you book room only (as did we) and use the multiplicity of diners or Irish pubs that deliver far better value than the hotel offers though as a frequent traveller this hotel is no different to many others in that regard.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We don't typically stay in Times Square, but when taking our little kids to NYC for the first time for a birthday, we knew that most of our visit would be centered in the area. We have usually had great experiences with Hyatt branded hotels, but this was our first experience with a Hyatt Centric. I contacted the hotel before booking with a few questions and received very prompt replies with all the information I needed to ensure that this would be a good hotel for our visit.We stayed for 2 nights in a 1 bedroom suite on the top floor. The views were great. The room was perfect for us since we were able to put the kids to bed early, but still order dinner to the room and have a separate living area. The room was not huge, but decent size for NYC standards. The room was clean, bathroom very large and clean, and all the right amenities (fridge, coffee with starbucks pods, safe, 2 TV's, heated flooring in the bathroom, huge soaker tub with separate shower, pullout couch in living room, lots of plugs and charging areas). The bed was great! The pullout was not (but it was exactly what we expected and perfect for the little kids once we moved them there before we took over the bed). FYI...there was no misconception about the comfort of the pullout - the general manager even offered a friendly warning that it would be good for kids, but not for two adults. He was right with his advice and honesty. In summary, this suite was perfect for 2 adults and 2 little kids (or 2 adults and 1 older kid/teenager).The hotel location was ideal for Times Square. Half a block from the main strip with views of Times Square from higher rooms. Very close to all restaurants and attractions. It's a bit loud, even on the higher floors, but Times Square is not a quiet place - I don't think you can completely avoid noise unless you stay in a different area of the City (Noise was not an issue for us for sleeping at all). The hotel itself felt new, clean, and modern. The lobby is small, as expected for a NYC hotel with small footprint. But it didn't really need to be big. 2 banks of elevators - 3 to the lower floors and 3 to the upper floors. The wait times for the elevators for us was minimal since the elevator was very fast even to our top floor room. It was good to have 2 banks of elevators since you don't end up stopping at nearly as many floors on the way up or down. The gym was big and clean as well for a quick workout.Most importantly for us, the service level at the hotel was great. Clearly this hotel is very well-managed. From the gentleman outside who arranged our car service to the airport, to the check-in and check-out staff, to the guest services, we were always greeted politely and respectfully. From experience in hospitality, I know that this is because of the culture of the hotel itself as set by the management and general manager of the hotel (he even had little cakes/gifts sent to our room for the kids, which was a really exciting special touch for them to enjoy and not something we expected). We had a small issue with the heat in our room, and had a maintenance person there within minutes to attend to it. He was also very respectful and polite when in our room. Housekeeping kept the room clean and fully stocked. Though we don't typically stay in Times Square, we would not hesitate to return to this hotel again. In fact, we would strongly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Times Square. If you value great service, cleanliness, and quality rooms, you will not be disappointed with the Hyatt Centric Times Squares. I should add that it was great for us as a family, but would be equally good for couples or business as it has all the amenities and location you need for your visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There's a Starbuck's across the street and Junior's Deli is at the end of the block. It's a perfect location for any show that you fancy and the lodging is comfortable, clean, and secure. The staff is very professional. I recommend the Avocado Toast for any meal if you're eating in the restaurant or in your room. It's delightful, fresh baked multigrain toast with plenty of mashed, ripe avocado smeared on, topped with an egg - any style! Satisfying and delicious!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room was not only roomy but very clean. The bed was comfortable, Staff was friendly. Would like to see the breakfast go a little longer on weekends. For example close at 11 AM instead of 10AM. The front desk staff and restaurant staff were very helpful and took time to make sure we were taken care of.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was our second time staying here. We return to this Hyatt because we like this hotel's location, room sizes are great especially for NYC. Quiet too. We also find that the staff are always kind and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I ended up at Hyatt Centric TSQ after leaving the original hotel we reserved and finding it to be a real disaster. Hyatt Centric accommodated me at the last minute, and I couldn't have been more pleased. Latoya at the front desk even gave me a little bit of an upgraded room to a corner room because she knew my day had started off on a bad foot.The minute I opened the door to our room, I knew I had made a good choice to move to this location. The room was spacious, the wifi connected immediately, and there were even two closets.The beds were so comfortable and the soft, flat pillows were so perfect that we ended up sleeping in both mornings because we slept so well. But the best thing about our room was the heated bathroom floor. We were in heaven whenever we walked into the bathroom. In addition the shower was large and had two options in case you're not a fan of the rain shower like I'm not. All of the staff was top notch! The restaurant next door had amazing food and service. We were within walking distance to all the happenings in Times Square and to the theatre district and restaurants we liked. All in all our experience was 150 degrees better than we ever expected. I will stay here whenever I visit NYC again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in town for a show. I’ve never stayed in this hotel and was a little nervous. No need ! Our room was great - clean, quiet and comfortable. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We got into town early and I’d hoped to drop off our bags so we could explore until check-in. Even better - we were able to check in early. Overall a great experience and we will go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic hotel.... with great rooms and super friendly, efficient staff! Location is perfect for theater and has great access to subways. Bar54 has wonderful craft cocktails with excellent service and a tremendous view! All in all, a gem of a hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good location and quiet room. Bar 54 has good selection of sprits and nice night view of Manhattan. Check in desk was little bit crowded and busy. Comfortable beds and room service was very good. Strongly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is literally in the heart of NYC, only couple of steps and you will reach the times square.Room condition was terrible and felt very old compared to other Hyatt hotels which were much more extravagant and elegent.Staff are very friendly and professional.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am already a Hyatt customer and a member of the Hyatt club. I have never had such an unpleasant experience as at Hyatt times square.  We sent an order to the hotel and we notified the same that the order would arrive and the day of arrival to be sure that we would have no problem, however it was in vain upon arrival we had lost (apparently it was "lost" by a former employee). The staff member Mickey was great and helped us a lot, however it still took 3 days for the hotel to make the mistake ... and ensure us full refund of the value, as well as offering us courtesy at the bar (By Manager John).  The day before checked out we spoke to the receptionist DEDE who confirmed us the credit. On the day of check out to our surprise the same DEDE was rude, we were treated poorly like we had never been in a hotel of this level before, it presented us with the expenses of the apartment which included the rates of the bar that we had won as a courtesy and informed us that we had misunderstood, would not reimburse us and we were not entitled to the courtesy, and that there would then be an evaluation on this and sent it to me by email. We demanded to speak to the Manager ... she was polite and solicitous, excluded all fees from our apartment (but did not match the entirety of our credit for the lost order), and not at all the embarrassment and lack of treatment with the guests given by the hotel, much worse than the material loss was the disrespect and lack of concern for guest satisfaction, I will definitely not be returning to this hotel.Orlando De Lucena ( room 3902)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed Overnight 2/23/19. Was very convenient to many venues. About a block and a half from the Rogers Theater. A pub conveniently located next door and restaurants and bars in the hotel. Check in was fast, hotel immaculate. Surprisingly nice size room for. n.y hotel in that area. Staff was very pleasant. Very good location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 3 nights here and had a very good experience. The room was clean, comfortable, and quiet, staff were friendly and helpful, and checking in and out was a breeze. Great location, very close many theatres and within a reasonable walking distance from Central Park, the Met, and the MoMA. I would recommend and would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Family vacation in NYC Booked hotel with Chase Rewards Points. King Executive Suite It is in a great location. Easy access to the Theater District and so many great places to eat. Shopping options plentiful.You will really love this hotel for the staff and the rooms.Plenty of storage space, great size bed, well decorated.We are enjoying our stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is the best value going in times square. The room we stayed in had a balcony and we did not have to go to the rooftop bar as a result. Fantastic place for a romantic weekend. The staff was very accommodating and the value is second to none.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: An excellent stay at such a good location (a stones throw from Times square). Roof top bar has views for miles and includes a view of the empire state building and of course Times square with the best ever view of the News Years Eve ball! A bit expensive on the long drinks, so stick to beer! Can also be a bit chilly to get the best views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed overnight with my wife and two children (10&13 year olds).The Hotel is located just a few feet east of Broadway (Times Square). We were in the city to see the Lion King which was a two minute walk.The check in was less than two minutes and we had a room on the 17th floor with a view of buildings. The elevators seem a little tight and there was a bit of a line.The hotel offers valet parking for $80 but we parked around the corner for $55. Rooms are very spacious for NYC and beds were comfy. The windows open in the room a crack so we kept them overnight to keep the room cooler (I can never work the thermostat ).Would recommend for a Times Square Hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here last May over Memorial Weekend on the way back from Canada. It coincided with our sons birthday, and the hotel staff went out of their way to make it even more memorable than we planned. The hotel is situated just off Times Square - close enough to hear the buzz without being part of the chaos. We had a high floor room, which was well appointed, clean and tastefully decorated. The housekeeping staff were excellent, even handing over the $100cad note our son had managed to lose. Let's face it, how many people would've been tempted to keep it? The ground floor bar and restaurant had a good feel to it and the staff were friendly and welcoming. They treated our son to a free meal when they found out it was his birthday, and the reception staff credited us with a very generous bar tab to celebrate in Bar 54.We had read previously that Bar54 wasn't always open to guests and there might be some 'issues', but we struck lucky. As it was a warm holiday weekend we expected it to be busy, and we weren't disappointed. More than one outside table was taken up by people making one drink last an hour (no joke), but the staff were wise to this and moved them on to allow other people to sit outside. Once outside the views are great, well worth the wait, and really made the day special.To work off the excess we made use of the gym which is surprisingly well equipped.Check in and out was friendly, quick and efficient.All in all the staff, hotel and bar helped make a great end to a great holiday. We'd definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is very central - right off of Times Square but on a side street so it wasn't too crowded. The room was pretty, modern and clean. The rooftop bar was wonderful! We were very happy with our choice to stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel staff was very professional, friendly and super helpful. The room was great with upgraded decor and technology (lighting) and very comfortable. The room had everything to cater for a business trip as well as a short vacation stay. The location was perfect - close to my office, fantastic location for spending the nights so close to Time Square and excellent dining options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel staff is very nice when we arrived. The check-in was easy and quick because we were able to do it online before we arrived. The room was a good size and the view from the window was great. The hotel is right near the heart of Times Square so you're close to shops and restaurants. I would definitely come back in the future!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I wanted to like this hotel. It’s a good location which great views from the roof, but that’s about it.Upon check in, I was greeted with a large charge on my credit card, which is typical for room related “incedentals”, should I throw a party and destroy the room. Nevertheless I wasn’t told about the charge beforehand, so I was kind of surprised when it showed up and I had to figure out what it was for.The room was quite hot and AC didn’t seemed to be working even though it always seemed to be on and temp reading at 65 degrees.Now onto the bed. The top of the sheet (underneath the comforter) seemed clean enough. The underside was another matter. There was bed quite a bit of hair and other nastyness underneath the sheets, so maybe it hadn’t been washed in a while.Lastly, as part of the incentives through my credit card company, I receive a $100 credit to be used at the hotel restaurant if I stay two nights or more, which I did. I probably spent that amount while I was there on food and other miscellaneous items, but upon checkout I was billed for it all and the 100 hadn’t been applied to the applicable spending. They had no idea how to fix it at the front desk and I Was told to call back and deal with the manager.At the time of this writing, the incidental amount (mentioned earlier) is still sitting on my credit card as pending even though the room was left in good order. Hopefully it never posts.As someone who travels for business, my trips are usually filled with good helping of stress, so having to deal with more things to worry about on top of everything else is not something I like to deal with.With all that being said, there are some bright spots at the hotel. The staff that greeted me day one was very nice and the lobby conditions are quite fancy. The rooftop bar is very nice, albeit highly pricy (rooftop prices, you’re paying for the view). One of the brightest spots was the restaurant downstairs which has a great selection of cocktails, beers, and food. The bartenders are very nice and knowledgeable. I wouldn’t mind spending many hours isn’t that place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I in NYC for a quick weekend to see a few shows & visit friends. The hotel is in a perfect location to see shows on Broadway. We were on a high floor and except for hearing an ambulance once, it was quite quiet. The doorman Walter was great and always greeted us and asked if we needed anything. The lobby is small but the front desk was able to help with every need. The room was clean & nice, but just like most hotels in NY a little small. I saved the best for last, The Bar on the 50 something floor was Awesome - Amazing views...We will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My stay exceeded all expectations The staff was wonderful and the food from room service was awesome! Best french toast!! The room was beautiful to see and a great bed to sleep in. The bathroom was pretty big The shower and tub or separate but enclosed together. Great views from my room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are looking for a great hotel - stay here! Every detail was perfect for our trip. Josh was above and beyond in making our stay perfect. The rooms are so clean. Housekeeping was so responsive and quick when we needed something. The front desk folks were always nice, always smiling and I never felt like my questions were a bother to them. Stay here - you will not regret it! Very close to all activities!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The breakfast was horrible and appeared to be precooked. scrambled eggs dry, sausage not cooked and potatoes appeared to be leftover from another day and greasy. cost prohibited at $77.00 included tea and milk. Cocktail lunge on 54th floor very nice but poor customer service by Matre D on our arrival for a drink.. Room was very good and service overall except those mentioned was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You will NOT be disappointed. I stayed in the corner suite and the views were spectacular and the room was spotless!! They even held my bags while my friend and I walked around time square and shopped at 5th ave. Stayyyy here!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the second time I spent at the Hyatt Centric. They are perfect from valet to housekeeping. Checkin was easy and friendly. Checkout was super easy express checkout is the best! Location is amazing, right in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed with my daughter, the, trip was for our 50th and 16th birthdays. The hotel was right in the heart of Times Square. The hotel has 54 floors with the 54th floor being the rooftop bar which provides amazing views. We could even see the Times Square ball from the bar. We had a room with 2 queen sized beds, a 47minch plasma TV and a bathroom with a huge shower. The room had a fridge and a safe which can be set to your own combination. We also had a coffee pod machine. We asked the maid for some breakfast tea pods and she left us half a dozen every day. Our maid was Sonam and she really looked after us. We left her little notes with her tip each morning, asking for more tea. When we returned to the room later in the day, Sonam had left the tea and also a note saying that she hoped we had a nice day and were enjoying our stay. There is an ice machine on each floor. The staff were helpful and friendly and even gave us breakfast in our room one morning for free as the trip was to celebrate our birthdays. We plan on returning when my daughter is 21 and we will definitely be returning to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is a comfortable, well kept Hyatt property with a great location for those wanting to see several Broadway shows during a visit to NYC. This was my second stay at this hotel, and I can’t say enough about the level of service provided by the staff and the large and comfortable rooms. World of Hyatt members feel the recognition for their status at this property and because of that the Hyatt Centric Times Square will be my hotel every time I visit NY.Thank you for the warm welcome!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had stayed recently at this property and what I like the most is it's location. Although it is very near to Times Square the rooms are quiet. Everything is very accessible, especially bars and eat outs that you look out for in the evenings.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this place. Centrally located quite near time square (and Bryant Park) but off the noise. Brand new and modern design. Try to get the time square views which obviously add to the atmosphere. Very friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The HYATT Never disappoints. The staff at the centric were phenomenal from start to finish. Before our arrival Josh emailed me to ask if I had any special request I let him know it was my daughter and her best friends graduation celebration weekend. He was so awesome to ask me what their names and school colors were so he could put balloons and a note in our room pre arrival. What a classy touch! He even called us later to make sure everything was perfect! When I saw him in The elevator 2 Days later he called me by name! The room was stunning and spotless. Beds comfy and all the modern amenities. No detail left unrealized. Walter out front was always smiling and helpful and the front desk staff even stored our luggage for us while we waited for check in. The rooftop bar was phenomenal and has some amazing mixologist who have a passion for making the perfect drink... old school and a nice touch! The views from the patio were breathtaking as well. A very special THANK YOU to the staff at Hyatt centric for making our time in NYC memorable and comfortable! Well done...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location. Good functional design. Some rooms need new carpets. Amenities are not refreshed, including soap even when you stay past a couple of days. Staff is generally friendly. Check-in and check-out are fast

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pleasant staff, clean, well designed rooms. Lighting offers interesting choices from "Mood" to "Reading" to "Night Light" which is fun to try to navigate. My first choice for staying this close to Times Square when travelling either for business or for Broadway. Stayed here months ago when the Mrs. & I saw "Come From Away".

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here while on business in February. Great location for my office in Times Square. Breakfast options were good and well catered for people with allergies (gluten and dairy myself). Book a high floor if you can for a better viewDisappointed that the spa and sauna had closed down- was one of the main reasons I booked this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay was wonderful! Staff was very friendly and accommodating, room was very clean. The location was great as well! We were even able to leave our bags at the hotel after we checked out to get in a little extra time in the city before we had to the airport.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There are few hotels that have such an ideal location for tourists as this one. Nestled right off Times Square, it's a handy property. The city view rooms offer some stunning glances at the city and just can't be beat. Rooms are modern and easy to navigate, and the staff is friendly with any questions or concerns you may have. There are so many great Hyatt properties in New York, with the Andaz Fifth Avenue and Park Hyatt being incrementally better than this one. Still, if you plan to spend the majority of your time catching Broadway shows in this area of town, this is your go-to spot.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean and perfect location. Checking in was easy and fast. From desk personnel was very knowledgeable, resourceful and gracious. We were very pleased and will return again. Thank you for a great experience. Brianna was very patient and took us on a tour to the 54 bar upstairs and we took some amazing pictures. We are very grateful for the experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel can't be beat. It's only about a block away from Times Square, a couple of blocks from Carlos' bakery and about two blocks from the Hershey's and M&M store. The rooms were clean and the staff was nice. Only complaint is that it was noisy at night. We could hear guests doors closing which would wake us up during the night. My mother in law was 5 floors below us and said she didn't have that problem. Not sure if we had noisier neighbors or if she just slept through all that noise on her floor. Other than that, no complaints.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric recently and have nothing but good things to say about it. The view from our room was outstanding and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located extremely close to Times Square and the theater district. When we come back to New York there’s no question on where we will be staying, we will be back to the Hyatt Centric!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt for the first time and we could not have been happier. The staff and restaurant employees were friendly and accommodating. The food at the restaurant was very good. We valet our car which be prepared for the cost, but Walter outside could not have been any more accommodating and friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt hotel has beautifully designed rooms perfect for any occasion. The Hotel has incredible guest services that you can call anytime! They have everything you need so do NOT worry if you under pack. I was so excited when I saw that this place can help you to get where you wanna go because I always forget to plan things ahead of time! When we woke up in the morning the breakfast was fantastic with so many delicious options. I really enjoyed my stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a great overnight at the Hyatt Times Centric. The location is fabulous. Near everything you want- if you want to be a NYC tourist. Walking distance to Times Square (obviously lol) most theaters, Central Park, 5th Avenue... the highlight of our experience at this hotel was dealing with the FANTASTIC Jorge Lazo. All other employees were pleasant, friendly and helpful. Jorge is the standout. They are lucky to have him on their team. I look forward to reaching out to Jorge’s superior to let them know what an amazing employee they have... Jorge truly gets (and seems to love) what giving a memorable hotel EXPERIENCE is all about. My niece, sister and I are grateful for this wonderful weekend. FYI: I did not know Jorge before we booked at this hotel a couple weeks ago.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent Service and Attitude. Check-in staff really took care of me and took into considering my special requests. Cheerful and supportive all the time. Hotel room was quiet even though the hotel was very close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a $60 dining charge which shows that the staff did not check ID and/or ask for a last name. Then it took me 30min on the phone to remove the charge and I had to argue with the customer service person that it wasn’t me and would’ve been impossible since I was at a mandatory 3 hour work event down the street with time stamped photos.Room was not clean, found random black hairs throughout my room. I am a blonde. Noisy maid service in the hallways on both days.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just 2 minute walk to Time Square. Very close to Time Square with lot of great food options all around.Good price. Perfect for business meetings and also personal trips.Elevators can sometime take longer than expected.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: On arrival after poor service from the airline I was warmly welcomed by the staff and from that moment on their attentiveness to help was outstanding. They booked the 27th floor and ensured it was overlooking times square they put welcome posters and notes up relevant to my 50th birthday trip there and all through they helped and supported us. They allowed luggage to stop in hold after checking out so we could spend the day in the city unhindered and ensured we had a taxi for the airport. Hotel spotless and service excellent. Location fantastic. Wouldn't hesitate to go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfectly situated between Times Square and 5th Avenue. Friendly staff from the doorman to the receptionist. Rooms and bathroom fairly sized. Beautiful views from the top floor bar and there are 'igloos' if you want to sit outside in winter. Bottled water is included with the room which is a bonus. Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I woke up sore and tired every morning which is not what you hope for in a vacation. Aside from this we loved the location absolutely the staff was friendly. I was traveling with my 10 year old and the location was perfect. The restaurant connected to the hotel, T45, was delicious and how we started our days. All of this being said it doesn’t matter when you aren’t getting a good night sleep. I don’t know if this is a Hyatt issue in general or just this location. I would love to know so i never make this mistake again. Such a shame because it’s otherwise a good fit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: ❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤What an Awesome Room & Locale!Chromecast TVs! Plenty of Outlets! FantasticView!Was Here for New York Fashion Week (NYFW) and My Accommodation Was Great!Thank You for an Expedited Check In and Out Option!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed (again!) for 4 nights in early January. As the title says, I've lost count. This is our home in NYC. We visit several times a year and have beenchosing to stay here for the last several years. The location is excellent. You're close to subway stations, Broadway Theatres, good eats (pricey or wallet friendly), and train stations. The views are fantastic! The rooms are large and comfortable. If you have any questions, feel free to message me, or read some of my others reviews of this property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Made a last minute reservation and was able to get a standard room with king bed. Room was well appointed with sitting area and large ensuite. The best was the roof top bar on the 54th floor with great views of the World Trade Tower (with we had just been on for lunch) . Food and drinks were good there too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I love this hotel right in Times Square. Excellent hotel for the price and location. There is a Starbucks right across the street or a Kuerig in the room with complimentary coffee. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable with great pillows. They have a gym and a bar/restaurant. The concierge was excellent. I cannot wait to go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean modern hotel in an excellent location, it would be hard to get a bet location , as you are steps away from Times Square, Suggest a high floor room. We were on floor 49 and the view was breathtaking in the evenings which can be viewed from your bed

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Bright clean rooms with excellent customer service. Food and Beverages costs on the high side even for the Times Square location.I would recommend this hotel to business travelers and those on vacation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room was a great size and staff was welcoming . Clean room and bathroom. Great location in Times Square. Check in was speedy even with a line. They upgraded my room to be on same floor as a family member. Check out was amazingly quick.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights and couldn’t have been happier. The hotel is in a great location as others have said. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Great views and very clean. Cookies in the lobby in the afternoon, someone checking keys after 4pm to ensure you’re a guest and the friendliest front desk and cleaning staff. Very happy we stayed there and chose this hotel from all of the reviews on Trip Advisor. Within walking distance to Madison Square Garden, Times Square 5th Avenue and Central Park. Will definitely stay here again and will recommend to friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great oasis in the middle of the city. The staff is fantastic and the breakfast is as well. They offer umbrellas when it’s raining, they have great security, and a fabulous location with high floors and beautiful views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this hotel 3 times - twice for business and once for leisure. I can't say enough about the service and cleanliness of this hotel. I attended an education session here once and, I have to say, the conference rooms are also excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived around 1 a.m. and front desk was friendly and efficient. The young lady who brought our luggage up made sure we were comfortable and brought us extra water. Room was clean and bed very comfortable. Walking distance to theatre we were taking in. We would stay again if we come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: convenient location... lobby gives impression of being a 3 start hotel. one of the towels had been left used from previous occupant the first night.. second night sat outside room for more then 15 minutes as engineering tried to get the lock on the room to work. they ended up using a crow bar to get in to the room which disturbed the next door occupant.. staff was extremely nice but ridiculous to have to wait over 15 minutes to get in your room

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am Hilton Honors gold member, but when I stay in the Times Square area, I would not consider staying anywhere but this hotel. The staff is extremely pleasant and cares about their guests. The hotel is new and clean. The rooms have great views. And their rooftop bar, Bar 54 has some of the best views in the city, (although their drinks are very pricey). The location, on 45th Street, is on one of the quieter streets in the Times Square.The management of this hotel gets it. Provide a great product at a great price, respect your customers and they will come back. Word of mouth and repeat customers are a great way to save money on advertising. Now if only the Hilton hotels in the area understood that, Hilton would not be driving away Gold members.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a hidden gem! Rooftop bar with a great view, large rooms and great service. I was traveling for business and easily accessible to all your needs in and around times sq. I would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our room was well appointed, more like an apartment than a hotel. Very comfortable, cleaned and tidied to a high standard. Speedy lifts( although they can get very busy), quick check in process, even security smiled and said hello sometimes . The team in the bar were the best, willing to chat and share a laugh, share local knowledge and offer advice. Great to grab a coffee before your daily adventures begin, without the queue of “megabucks” across the road. A fabulous location, so close to Times Square and the subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in the heart of Times Square. The staff was exceptional. As an example, the front desk staff remembered me by name at checkout. The rooms are great too; larger than I expected for Times Square. You can't go wrong booking here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt was at the perfect location to spend time with my girlfriends! The room had a beautiful view of the city and the location was central to everything! We were able to get a very reasonable rate and will definitely come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Decent sized room for NYC and in very good shape. Nice bathroom - I don't like a tub so shower only was perfect for us. Lobby is small and sparse, but you're not really paying for that now, are you. The money is in the room and the rooms are very good for the price point. Also very convenient to Times Square / Broadway area. Ask for a room with 06 or 07 - they seem to be a bit larger.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a comfortable and excellent choice! We loved every moment specially visiting in the coldest weather 3 F !!! Lovely and clean bedrooms excellent view from our 35 floor! All amenities and complimentary staff made our stay very home like .. Laura and the morning concierge were very helpful finding all places to visit . We fully recommend this hotel !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just a 100 yards off Times Square, 54 floors, and a great value hotel.Rooms are spacious by downtown NY standards. Staff friendly and helpful.Roof top bar worth a visit. Room menu refreshingly healthy in range.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we stayed in a larger room with a city view. The room was much larger than the standard room and very clean. Bathroom was awesome (large soaking tub with separate shower. The beds were very comfortable. In room thermostat let us control the temperature on the coldest night of the year. Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was second time to this hotel returned because of the wonderful experience the first time and the perfect location for a tourist in Manhattan. Walking distance to all the Times Square activities, Rocketfeller Center and the Theater District. Also just a block away from my two favorite restaurants Carmines and Del Friscos.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked the Hyatt Centric Times Square for a one night stay on a Saturday night because we were going to see a show. We used our points to book. When I got there, the front desk offered to upgrade us to a higher floor for a $25 fee which I felt was reasonable, and in return we would get a $50 credit for Bar54 the rooftop bar/restaurant. The room was on the 28th floor giving us very nice views of the skyline. And the ability to open the window and get some fresh air is definitely a plus. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was large and well appointed. We had some time before dinner, so we decided to go down to the lobby restaurant for a small snack and a drink. It was 3:45PM but the bartender said we could get the happy hour prices anyway, which were very reasonable. The bartender couldn't have been nicer and gave us some great recommendations for bars to go to after the show. After a fun night, we came back around 1AM and decided to use our $50 credit. We got to Bar54 around 1:15AM and got a beautiful picture outside. The bartender again was so nice. It was closing at 1:45AM but we got a drink right away and a meat and cheese board so quickly, which was very tasty. I would definitely return to this location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a stay with some friends. The gentleman, who checked us in, went out of his way to search for a room with a nice view of Times Square. Appreciated the great treatment. Room was excellent and clean. Had food delivered by GrubHub, and security escorted the delivery person. Everyone was so nice. It was a fulfilling stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Don’t expect the grand lobby entrance of a Hyatt hotel, this location is more of a boutique hotel feel where everything is compact but the boujee artistic feel is missing. Comfort - 3The cleanliness of the rooms and hotel overall was good but the compactness of the place was a little tight. Rooms felt like you were in a cocoon but it grew on me and felt comfy. I guess you can’t ask for too much in Manhattan. Friendliness - 4The concierge/door staff is on point. The friendliness and knowledge of the city is very helpful. Of course all done with a smile without seeming like they are being bothered (ie without the New York attitude). The lobby staff was fair, just seemed like they were overworked and tired. Location - 5Placed in the perfect location if you are going to NYC for Times Square or a Broadway show. Just a block away from Times Square and on the correct side where it is still quiet. Will return if I am going to a Broadway show or visiting Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a suite and an adjoining room that was bigger than a New York apartment. Turndown service with fresh towels was impossible to get. Room service was late even though we ordered it the night before. Our food was served in fast food containers and some of it was burnt.I asked the front desk to book a room in the same hotel for my next visit to New York and was told to do it myself.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right, so sure going to New York requires a bit of money. I mean you’ll need a lot just to get through Times Square with all the busters and dancers reaching for your wallet. But I wasn’t expected to have to pay an extra $100 for our stay, FOR WIFI!! But that perhaps I can forgive, a little strange I must admit. After all we weren’t told until we were already there. It was also very busy, by that I mean we had to queue for the elevators more than once and by that time we were tired from all the walking. So that wasn’t brilliant. Another downside is that it wasn’t even that clean, not star standard anyway. But the beds allowed for a great sleep and that certainly brings up the rating. One more plus, or downside, is that it is in peak location. In the heart of Time Square and only walks away from the biggest sights. However that does mean that it is dangerously crowded and it may feel like a hassle day in and day out. Despite everything, I was okay. But do be prepared to make some sacrifices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is located just off Times Square - which at Christmas is a little crazy! Family of 4 with teenage boys 14 & 16 we loved the fact the rooms were more spacious than normal NY room size and the luxurious bathrooms. The bar located on 54th floor was a wonderful treat too. Bottled water provides was definitely a help too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed for one evening and found the rooms very clean and all the basics there. The location is convenient and easy to navigate. Cons: The bed covers however, were very thin and not comfortable relative to other hotels. Coffee was also missing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this property right in the heart of Times Square. Location is convenient and rooms are good size. One bugbear for this hotel is they charge a resort fee irregardless if you use or need the list of perks they offer. I was rudely shocked when I was told about these fees! This fee was not told to me either at time of booking or at time of check in. They should seriously consider removing this fee and aim to provide these perks as standard.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay over Christmas and the new year, was perfect this is a lovely modern hotel, our room was facing Time Square we had a great view but could not see the ball from our room but could see Time Square .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel! Maya at the front desk was very helpful. Will be coming back. Great location to get anywhere in NYC. Corner rooms are very nice. Rooftop bar is very cool. Actually a relatively quiet street close to Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at the hotel - close proximity to Time Square, though not so near to subway. There’s a deli just 10m away from hotel to get hot food, drinks etc and no lack of pubs! Security at hotel is confined to the Guards asking for key card when you get to the lift lobby, would have preferred a security system where access to individual Floor is by key card access only. Bar on L54 is nice with a good view (but it’s so cold in Jan you can barely stay a minute to appreciate!) but really really underwhelming for the price of the cocktails ($26 without tax) compared to everywhere else in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. will still recommend the hotel for your next trip to NYC for the service & location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had booked this hotel through British Airways along with our flights and got a pretty decent deal. We chose this hotel due,to location and floor to ceiling windows. We paid extra for a high floor and we weren't disappointed! We were in NYC as a treat for our son's 18th birthday and we were given a deluxe room, which was beautiful. The nicest hotel room we have ever stayed it. It was comfortable, quiet, huge but really warm and cosy. It had everything you could possibly need...coffee, tea, toiletries, water etc. Cannot fault it at all and it was absolutely spotless. We had breakfast one morning and it was lovely too. All the staff were great, and really helpful. Would we stay here again if we came to New York again....definitely 100%. Thank you all for making our special holiday extra special.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Location and room quality for a very reasonable price. A few minutes walk from Times square, numerous restaurants, all Broadway shows and shopping.The room was modern and clean. The sound insulation is very good for New York standard.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is a great hotel, strategically located. The rooms are a nice size. There was a miscommunication with our travel agent and the staff resolved the issue and made sure our trip less stressful. I will warn you the Times Square area is chaotic, but the Hyatt Centric is an Oasis. Don’t miss the 54th floor lounge - spectacular views!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here between Boxing Day and New Year’s Day, lovely clean hotel staff went in the rooms everyday and cleaned and fresh towels, the rooftop bar is lovely but very pricey one member of staff I found rude there, I believe you should get a % off for staying at the hotel like you do in there lobby restaurant for the rooftop bar but however we had an amazing time and got engaged on the rooftop so this will always remain a special place to us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice luxurious hotel at the center of New York. Great, clean and large rooms with great view especially from high floor. Nice roof garden with big variety of coctails and drinks.Great and polite staff to help you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms were the usual NYC sized, but well-appointed and clean, windows opened which was a nice feature allowing some humidity to get into the typically dry hotel air. It lacks a big lobby, but the rooftop bar makes up for that completely.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at hotel from 21-28th December, hotel was fabulous could not find fault with anything. Rooms clean and great beds, great coffee maker no noise what so ever. No waiting on lifts, great security, prompt check in,fab roof top bar, great maid infact all staff were magic. Loved this hotel really made our Christmas.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Centric hotel in Times Square.We stayed in a high floor king size room, the room was ok and functional.The hotel is really clean and the staff are all very friendly.If you want a base that’s just a stones throw from Times Square you won’t go wrong by booking the Hyatt Centric.The hotel has a bar & restaurant on the 54 floor and what a view at night.In our room we had floor to ceiling windows in both the bedroom and bathroom, you can actually if you want sit on the toilet and what a view to be had.The only downside was paying the bill at the end off our stay, you get charged for using the coffee maker, using the Free WIFI water etc it was around $20 odd $ a day but it would be better hidden in the cost of the room instead of extras at the end of the holiday.To sum it up great base just off Times Square clean and tidy rooms and would use it again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of the hotel is good. It is just a walking distance to time square, Broadway and near by shopping centre. The size of the room is also pretty descent. They gave a lot of efficient wardrobe so that we can organise our clothes inside. The wifi is fast. The staff that works at the front desk is friendly and helpful. For the less good side is the water pressure of the shower is very weak. The use of the mixture inside the bathroom should be using more standard brand for 4-5 stars hotel. The ambience of the hotel and check in counter is pretty basic and plain. They don’t have buffet for breakfast, but they do have ala carte, and the choice is also limited. I personally don’t quite like the restaurant where breakfast is served. Because 50% of the place is really dark with no natural light. Unless if you are seated at the bar counter area there. The pricing is price of the food + state tax + service charge + gratitude .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were invited to a black tie wedding in Times Square and booked a corner suite at the Hyatt Centric so we could walk to the wedding .... the hotel is gorgeous and pristine and we never waited longer than 30 seconds for an elevator to the 49th floor...... the view from our suite was so spectacular that I didn’t even want to go to sleep the first night! We went to B54 on the 54th floor for a night cap and when we went back again, the staff even remembered our drinks ....The hotel is in a perfect location in the middle of the theater district ...we really enjoyed talking to Walter, whose smiling and friendly presence outside the front door was always there ..... the city had closed the street in front of the hotel the morning we were leaving (getting ready for the New Year’s Eve festivities on Times Square that night) and Walter helped us get down to 6th Avenue and hailed a cab for us ..... we will be back!P.S. The bed was the only hotel bed I’ve ever loved!Thanks for a great experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms were nice, reasonably appointed, clean and quiet, and the exercise room had sufficient variety for us and was likewise fairly new and kept very clean. The hotel staff team, however,m made the difference for us - family of 4 traveling to NYC for a short winter vacation. From Walter out front, to the concierge helping us with tickets and honest opinions about family-friendy shows, to the housekeeper/maid on the 11th floor that was always pleasantly smiling and polite - the staff were exceptional.We had drinks on 54, which were NY prices and then some - paying for the view which was worth it.T45 food was pricey, but good. Service was good but when I later learned a 18% suggested gratuity had already been included in the bill and our waiter did not mention...and I didn't catch it...I was upset with them and myself. Our waitress the next day pointed it out, which I appreciated...and she was the best server in the restaurant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Let me start by saying that I've been consistently underwhelmed by NYC hotels. I've just never had a great experience ... something is always lacking. If the room is great, then it's loud, or the staff are rude -- or vice-versa. But Hyatt Centric knocked it out of the park. Let me be clear -- their staff, especially the bellhops and front desk staff -- made the real difference. The hotel itself is very nice, but the people made the stay. My stay began on a rough note when I went to pay my cabdriver only to discover that both my debit card and my corporate card had been compromised, and I didn't have any cash. After being berated (understandably) for thirty minutes by my cab driver, I stepped into the lobby to see if they could recommend a course of action. The bellhop, who had watched the whole scenario unfold, immediately came to check on me. He and the gentleman at the front desk got the manager involved, who paid out of his own pocket and let me Venmo him some cash. After the ordeal, they consoled me a bit and made me feel much less ridiculous. I ordered room service several times while there, and those staff members went above and beyond as well. I stayed for business, but I would have been completely comfortable staying for leisure/personal reasons, as well. If you're looking for a hospitable home-base in NYC, this is the one. Super-easy to walk to 5th Ave and many of the big tourist attractions. Restaurant is quite good, and there's a rooftop bar as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was great! Location was superb! Service was amazing. Staff was professional, polite, and knowledgeable. Although the hotel was booked for New Years Eve week, the hotel was prepared and ready. It rained on one day of our visit and the complimentary umbrellas were a life saver. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The entertainment system was not working the valet is charging 80 usd per entry (not per night).It’s too much crowded nearby the hotel & sometimes you will not be able to reach your hotel because the roads were blocked.The reception staff were good but number of receptionist are not sufficient

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this hotel, especially if we are going to attend Broadway shows. It is convenient, has very nice rooms and outstanding staff who are always ready to please. We have stayed here many times and are always happy to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms are a decent size and kept clean by the friendly cleaners as are the bell boys, who are helpful for useful info too. Thats where the good stuff ends.The experience wasn’t great from arrival. We booked 2 rooms and were not ready by the ‘guaranteed’ 4pm check-in time. When they were, the rooms were on different floors despite both the reservations being made at the same time and under the same name. A $75 credit was added to the room as a good gesture which was greatly appreciated. For the duration of the stay my credit card was charged double (£1,260) for a deposit, which made our stay uncomfortable as paying on my card in shops or restaurants was impacted. Didn’t feel like the reception team were welcoming, had much clue of what was going on or to do. After checkout, reception experience worsened as the team didn’t really want to know us.The T45 restaurant is good, but incredibly overpriced. 4 adult breakfast meals and a kids meal easily racks up well over $150 for a no frills meal. Understand you pay a premium for NY and being in Times Square, but not even places in Mayfair charge that much. Recommend walking up to the top of the block to the Italian cafe where they make the same food in front of you for a third of the price. Additionally, if you want room service, you’re charged $5 for delivery - could not believe this. Been to many hotels in my life, including The Burj, and never been charged to get a lift to deliver some sandwiches or french fries.Was looking forward to staying at the Hyatt but afraid I won’t be returning. Worth staying for a couple of nights for Times Square, but I’m sure you can get better if you book early enough.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in excellent condition and great location. Room was spacious and bathroom was very large. Would highly recommend and will be back when I’m in NYC again! Staff was super friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze with no waiting around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited New York for the first time , stayed in the Hyatt Centric , Times Square. The hotel has a fantastic location on East 45th right on Times Square, we had a deluxe Suite on the 47th floor, great view over Times Square and looking onto the Chrysler Building, typical modern city hotel , clean , comfirtable and functional, as is the case the decor is minimalist but it has all you need, bit dissapointing on arrival to be informed that there was a $25 per night cover charge which wasnt mentioned when i booked and paid for the hotel through Virgin, app this covers your water ?? And you get free use of the phone , still feel it should be disclosed prior to checking in or even at time of booking..also tried to charge us for a meal we didnt have that had been charged to our room , in fairness they removed that from the bill without too much hassle...overall its a very well located hotel to explore Manhattan from.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location, Location, LocationThis property is centrally located to all attractions in the city like Radio City Music Hall, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center to see The Christmas Spectacular Show

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: They had a horrible television malfunction for several days which caused the TV to turn itself on and to the annoyingly loud hotel channel at all hours of the night. For the first few nights, we never got a good night sleep. DO NOT eat in their lobby restaurant. The wait staff enjoys an automatic 18% gratuity, and we had terrible service from ours. We stayed here last year, and it was fantastic. This year, not so much. The location is great, but for the premium, the service was sub standard - especially for Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just returned home after 5 nights staying in the Hyatt Centric. It was perfect! Our 2 young children loved New York! Hotel is perfectly located. Clean and the staff were so friendly! View (47th floor) was great. We faced north but another room we saw a glimpse of had the best view of the city facing south! If we are ever lucky enough to return, we’ll definitely chose this hotel! Thank you

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel staff at this hotel was the worst I ever experienced. They were so unfriendly and not helpful at all. I never saw the concierge the entire time I was there. The elevators were usually congested. I would not recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 21-26 Dec, stayed in room 06 on the 52 floor with Partial View of Time Square.front staff very welcoming on arrival check in very easy ,room was very clean and tidy and was kept that way by our very friendly house keeper Daisy .The Hyatt is just steps away from the gilts and glamour of Times Square which makes it ideal for a stay in New York .Would definitely recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is superb,cleanliness of the room,bathroom and the size of the bed are awesome. Quality of the food at the cafe are good. Valet parking doesn’t have in and out options, that’s the only draw back. But my overall stay is good

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Since 2012, (our last Christmas visit to the Big Apple) I was promising my wife to return to NYC at Christmas time. As I always do, I focused on getting a hotel that was close to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Bryant Park or Central Park to name a few points of interest. This past April we had been at the Sheraton Hotel and we did not dislike it at all, but with my desire to have more variety I was impressed by Hyatt Centric for being in the middle of everything and since we are loyalty member of the Hyatt organization I said: "why not". The hotel has a restaurant with a limited menu and a bar on the 54th floor with incredible views I did my research and immediately booked a gateway of three nights in NYC. The chosen room was the #2901, next to the elevators, I asked the front desk if there were going to be problems with noise due to the proximity of the elevators and the clerk was assure that there would be no inconveniences. We went up to the room, we settled and off we went to the city. When we return to rest, we discover that on the other side of the street there is a building with three large turbines that emit a constant noise throughout the day, return as expected to the front desk and ask in a very good way the possibility of changing rooms, the hotel is full I answer the clerk and reply: "how weird nobody complains about the sounds of the street" .My wife and I have the policy not to complain about things without meaning but this was a valid one and we had to stay in that noisy room for our entire stay. True, we did not ask for the manager just because I think that if someone is in front of a hotel of a firm as prestigious as Hyatt for something will be. I'm writing the same letter to the manager and I'm attaching a receipt for earplugs with the only hope that not only will that money be returned to me but that I also have the delicacy to respond with a valid reason to omit the constant noise in hours that should be used to sleep. Incidentally, the hotel charges a daily fee of $84.78. NYC Sales Tax 8.875% 31.64 NYC Occupancy Tax 5.875% 20.95 NYC Javits Occupancy Tax 1.50 Unit Occupancy Tax 2.00 Destination Fee 25.00 Destination Fee NYC Sales Tax 8.875% 2.22 Destination Fee NYC Occupancy Tax 5.875% 1.47By the way, I stayed in Hyatt Coconut Point in Bonita Beach every 4th of July for the past 5 years and have NOT have a single complain

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
