review_body: This hotel is a huge disappointment for our family It is an overpriced choice offering small rooms, dated decoration at Very expensive prices with very limited view !We are Hyatt fans ...but this hotel is the worse combination of price-view- - size of rooms Shame on Hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Central with wonderful set up Lovely room and awesome bar on 54 floor Only the internal security guards need to be polite. Food was awesome Building neat and very convenient with the greatest bar External guards are excellent

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We selected his hotel dues to the known brand as a upper-medium level national hotel chain and the hotels location. The location was overall as expected, although it's on a dirty and fairly dark side street. While the overall location met our expectations, the quality did not quite meet our expectations for a Hyatt hotel. The overall facility was more in-line with the expectation of a microtel. The facility and the rooms were clean, and the bathrooms, especially the showers, were above par, but the overall room quality - particle board furniture, single wobbly chair, and the lack of top sheets or blankets on the bed in December, as well an inoperable or outdated technology (fancy cordless room phones, but neither of which we could use, even to call down to the lobby, b/c as soon as we picked them up out of the cradle the low-battery light was on) were disappointing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved our stay at the Hyatt Centric. Our room had the perfect view of times square, it was quiet, large and clean. The room service was great and reasonably priced. The location of the hotel was probably our favourite, it was walking distance to every major tourist attraction. I would highly recommend it if you are looking for a large room and a terrific location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean hotel, rooms are well appointed and we received excellent service while onsite. Walking distance to time square and radio City.  Jorge from reservations was awesome and ensured that we have an amazing stay! Thank you Jorge and the Hyatt centric staff! He took time to listen to the needs for our trip and helped recommend the best option for our stay.Walter the doorman was super kind and remembered our names. Hotel provided umbrellas during the rainy day which was a nice touch. Although it’s a busy hotel, the staff made it feel like home for the 3 days we stayed there and that makes it a great hotel to stay at.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was clean, roomy, and is located within walking distance of many attractions(Times Square, Central Park, Radio City, Theaters). The bathroom was clean and roomy. Great shower. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for a week.the rooms are very clean with alot of space.big rooms.the view from the rooms was amazing(47th floor).The service was amazing we felt like home there.the restaurent wsa very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had 2 rooms here for a Christmas trip with my 2 sons and their wives. We could not have been happier with the location, steps from Times Square but quietly steps away. Close to many sights and the best service. The staff was extremely nice and helpful! They even arranged our ride back to the airport! Will definately stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our trip was perfect! The staff at the Hyatt were all very friendly and wonderful! Our rooms were beautiful and exactly where we had booked! They even allowed us an early check in without a prior request. We will definitely be back!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Second time this year we have stayed in This hotel we love the location and rooms they are fresh new and modern. Staff can be more friendly specially at restaurant downstairs specially if you are paying 18% gratuity upfront. Overall great stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Tried to go to the rooftop bar with my family and they wouldn’t let us in because we weren’t all 21 years old. I find it very ridiculous that I’m paying to stay at a place that I can’t even go and see the view from the top. The guy was not respectful and overall I am not pleased with my stay. LET EVERYONE ON THE ROOFTOP. SO DISRESPECTFUL AND I WILL NEVER BE BACK. If I’m coming to New York I’m here to see the view not to be denied of the view because my family isn’t all 21?????? WHAT!?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When we first entered the Hyatt Centric NYC we were pleasantly surprised at how modern it was. In other NY hotels we've tried we have been disappointed that the rooms felt old and uncared for. The Hyatt Centric lives up to other Hyatt hotels around the country as far as the appearance and modernity are concerned. We had a specific problem with the television in our room. It kept turning itself on every 60-90 minutes both day and night. That made trying to sleep an awful experience. Bright light and loud sound woke us up continuously. When we spoke with the front desk, they said that the problem was hotel-wide, and they would have an engineer disconnect the TV. The engineer NEVER showed up. Eventually we figured out how to disconnect the TV ourselves. Later the front desk was telling people that the problem had been fixed. That was not true as people continued to complain about the TV turning itself on.Housekeeping was okay. They could do better. Housekeeping took our face towels and never replaced them. They also never replaced the coffee and tea. That sounds petty, but replacing what is used is a basic goal of housekeeping.I would recommend giving the Hyatt Centric a try - the location is great if you are seeing Broadway shows. Our visit was a couple weeks before Christmas and the price was highly competitive. just be aware that the staff may not be very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What was supposed to be a special 3 day treat for our daughter ended up being a nightmare! The in-house TV system kept turning on by itself throughout the night illuminating the room with the Hyatt Channel and the volume could not be turned off. The sounds and bright lights from the TV turning on by itself every hour or so due to a technical issue with the system meant that weren't able to sleep without being woken up by the TV. We were told it had been fixed and the next night it did the same thing 6-7 times throughout the night the TV would switch on by itself and wake us up. The Hyatt assured us after two nights of little to no sleep it was fixed and on our last night it still wasn't and the TV kept turning on all night long!!!! Three nights without sleep - completely ruined our Birthday / Christmas celebration with our daughter. We were distraught and utterly exhausted when we left. Maybe got 2-3 hours sleep in 3 days!I would NEVER stay in this hotel ever again - false promises and failed attempts at resolving the problem. They should be ashamed of themselves for selling rooms at TOP DOLLAR knowing this problem existed. Very bad service indeed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The carpet was stained in the room. Room cleaning service is poor. TV kept coming on on its own for 2 nights waking us up in the middle of the nights. No bell service to take your luggage to room. better options in Time Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nothing too special about this place except it's location. Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Station much higher quality! Room was OK, nothingmemorable...very small KING ROOM. No drawers for storage. Desk was cluttered with junk stuff from hotel. Issues with TV during the stay.Room was not re-stalked as promised by the front desk (eg. coffee, waters, etc) $25.00+ daily Resort Fee for nothing??!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 7 friends and I traveled to NYC for my 70th birthday. We spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. Wonderful hotel. The front desk staff was polite and professional. Our housekeeper, Amy, kept our room very clean. She was friendly and pleasant. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel front desk service, we worked with mike and he was truly exceptional in helping us to get checked into the correct room. Rooms were clean, spacious for New York Times Square! Would reccomend this hotel near all amenities to time square for walking, and reasonable rates!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this amazing hotel for 8 nights with my mum and sister to celebrate my birthday. The check in process was quick and easy. We arrived at the hotel at 2pm and thought we would have to wait until the usual time of 4pm to check in, but we were given our room key and able to go straight up to our room.Our room was on the 20th floor. The view was outstanding. The room was extremely clean and a really good size. There were adequate amounts of supplies for the 3 of us too. Housekeeping was exceptional and always checked to see if we required any further supplies. Our safe did not work when we tried to enter a code, we informed reception when we went down to the restaurant for an early dinner. Within an hour of returning to our room a member of staff had been up and fixed it. The restaurant was amazing, we ate there twice during our stay.We went up to Bar 54 to see the view from the rooftop. It's safe to say we were not disappointed!!The hotel is in the ideal location for everything to be close by. We even slept with our curtains open each night in order to see the view whenever we woke up. All staff were friendly and could not do enough to make our stay the best it could be. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to family and friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Chose it for location, long story short: I was given a room without bathtub, requested because traveling with a young child.They claimed that it was a deluxe room and wanted to charge extra, but the next day they moved us. Not sure why it would be considered a higher category: the room was 7 floors lower and they do not have sound proof windows, so time square noises till 2 am; the bathtub was all chipped and there was no warming floor in the bathroom contrary to the other room. The lobby resembles a zoo day and night, the guest service often doesn’t pick up the phone and takes hours to come upstairs. The TV doesn’t have Netflix or other services... they are working on it. The good side is that the rooms are an OK size. Definitely NOT at a level expected and way too expensive for the service provided... the location is their only good point, but plenty other options: will not return. In honesty, The front desk manager Maya tried to help... all other staff is very poor

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Being a Marriott Platinum and Hilton Diamond, I don’t have much room to try other properties. The weekend of December 12 - 16 was somewhat high priced in Times Square, so I got to try the Hyatt Centric. The location is fabulous...rooms were modern, clean, large, and way above my expectations. But actually....what really stood out for me was the outstanding help and service of the bellman/doorman Walter. Walter made the hotel well worth the pick!! In NYC it can be challenging sometimes to find really nice folks...he’s got it down!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Chose it for location, booked it through aa.com/booking.com and the description of the quite expensive room stated that “bathtub “ was an option; I also requested a bathtub at time of booking because am traveling with a child. As I never received a reply, a couple of days before the trip I called and was told that bathtubs were available only in a different category of rooms at extra us$50. When I told them that the description was wrong, they replied that they were not responsible and should have booked with then. In the meantime the room category I am in (high floor but no view and no bathtub) had a price rebate of apx us$50 a night, but they refused to upgrade me comp.At check in, same story: absolutely no upgrade.While I was awaiting for the front desk manager for a final refusal, in the small smelly lobby, another guest came in complaining that their TV wasn’t working and that they had awaited an hour and now, being after midnight... they were going to bed.Once upstairs, I found shabby looking doors and a dirty floor with hair pins next to the bed; very slow internet that the description states “high speed”... but again: they are not responsible of what the websites write and booking.com states that they only write what the hotel give them. So far: horrible overpriced experience and total lack of customer service!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric exceeded my expectations in almost every respect. It is located just off Broadway but surprisingly quiet. Staff were welcoming and professional throughout. My room was ready well before the official check-in time and the receptionist was more than happy to grant me a one-hour late check-out. The room was good sized (by NYC standards), the king size bed extremely comfortable and the bathroom equipped with a walk-in rain shower. The room was quiet and the A/C discreet. My only criticism concerns the forceful and noisy way some of the doors are slammed shut by the automatic door closers, and WiFi which was unreliable and, at times, extremely slow. Overall however the Hilton Centric easily deserves a very good rating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Have stayed here before but quality of hotel compared to other Hyatt’s I’ve recently stayed at was not as high. Good location but staff not very friendly. Probably wouldn’t stay here if I visited again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Made welcome with conscious reception staff all restaurant staff James’s the restaurant manager the room maids all cleaned daily freshly water teas coffees all great quality everything was great would stay there again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are willing to pay the price...The location is excellent, walk out the door and you enter Times Square. Small lobby, efficient staff (thank you for sorting out the problems guys!) Had rooms on the topfloor, clean as a whistle. Beds are excellent as is the shower. Free water and coffee. WiFi without any problems. Plenty of restaurants in the area to get your breakfast and dinner.There concierge service is excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want central to many famous locations in NY you cannot go wrong with this hotel. Welcoming, clran & trendy..it has the highest rooftop cocktail bar in the City albeit it pricey but just an all round great hotel. My daughter & I stayed there for a week & always felt like we were coming home. On arrival I had a request which was dealt with efficiently & quickly thanks to Michael on Reception & tbh this made such a difference I don't think he appreciated just how much! The room was cleaned every day including fresh sheets & had coffee/tea facilities which not many places have now. The location could not have been better though and the more we found our way around the City the more we felt that. Cannot recommend this Hotel enough. Thankyou so much to all the Staff for making our stay so nice. Here's to your continued success:):):)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was one of my best hotel experiences! So clean and neat and great service. The hotel is in the perfect location for everything in NYC and would stay here again in a heartbeat and highly reccommend for family to stay here!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was terrific, and the hotel location is perfect - right in the heart of Times Square. Rooms were new and modern (and especially quiet!) Very nice for families, and accommodating (and understanding) of how to cater to young guests!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was at the Hyatt Centric for two nights during the rush of the Holiday season. As always the hotel is comfortable and a place to get a good night's sleep! What was great is even in all the hectic rush of the Holidays the staff had everything under control and working smoothly and promptly!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel is it’s selling point. It’s literally 1 minute walk to the centre of Times Square. Conveniently there is also a Starbucks opposite next door there is an Irish pub called Connolly’s (who do great burgers).Room was very clean, spotless. Very very comfortable bed. Noise was also minimal.On the 50th floor there is a bar with amazing views. Although drinks are pricy.Staff are friendly and helpful. They offer a free secure service on your last day where they hold your luggage for you.Would definitely recommend It’s more expensive than some of the others but it’s comfortable and central EnjoyDonna

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Service at the hotel was excellent throughout. Rooms have also been nice on the 3 occasions I've stayed and I REALLY like the bar on the 54th floor - especially outside (although it is kind of scary!). The breakfast restaurant was nice (ground level) and location really couldn't be better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a frequent traveller and spending at least twice in different brands of hotels every month, the Hyatt Centric in NYC was not as a good as expected. As a party of 4 we spent 3 nights in there with 2 rooms. Check in male staff was not good - questions he asked were not specific and there wasn’t much greeting protocols which I expect more from a 5 star hotel like Hyatt. On the first night we realised the bath gel in one of the rooms was half empty! Amenities were too basic - even Holiday Inn would provide more than that. There were no sleepers provided. We called up reception to borrow a teakettle. It took more than 20 mins and eventually we gave up waiting and went out.On the 3rd night cleaning lady did not top up the complimentary water bottles. In addition, she even collected our personal bath towels as they were all disappeared after we got back to our room! (whereas the first couple of nights there was another nice cleaning lady which was very friendly and gave us extra bottles on request). In the end the hotel manager on duty agreed to waive the destination fees for our room. Also room temperature control was an issue too. It was either too warm or too cold.Overall, the location was excellent with a comfortable bed but I would try out other hotels for my visit in NYC in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. The beds were comfortable yet firm. The views from our 26th floor were very nice. The location just off Broadway and 7th is excellent for sight seeing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was very nice, very accommodating, and very helpful. The room was extremely clean. Our room attendant took great care to make sure we had everything we needed. We felt very safe and well cared for!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Can’t beat the location of this hotel. Located a block of Times Square and close to Broadway shows and shopping on 5th Ave. It’s within walking distance to most anything you want to see in NYC. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 4 nights over Thanksgiving weekend and it was fantastic! We had a very undesirable stay across the street and moved after 1 night to Hyatt Centric Time Square where we were greeted with a smile and a complimentary upgrade. The rooms are large and clean with wonderful amenities. The lobby smells wonderful. Staff is friendly & gracious (especially Rosabla). This location is perfect. Starbucks is across the street and Times Square is a 1-2 minute walk away. I will definitely stay here on our next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived late, staff was very helpful in getting us in our room. Comfortable bed and pillows, room had a clean look and smell to it. Late night drink in the roof top bar which was a little pricey. Breakfast was good and quick. Great location in the center of it all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is clean and in a great location. Check in and out was professional and the staff is attentive. Liked the fact that security checked keys to make sure only guests used the elevators. Only negative was the $10 glass of orange juice and $20 glass of wine....but it is NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Family decided to go to NYC for the Thanksgiving break. I talked to them in advance about arranging Thanksgiving meal and possible upgrade for our room as I’m at Hyatt Explorist. It took 3 separate emails to finally get someone from the hotel to contact me back. Once I did hear back from them they were helpful. The problem starts as we got closer to the date I tried to speak with manager again who was suppose to keep me updated if any other rooms opened up. I never heard back from him and in fact was able to do the upgrade myself online. Come check in day which check in time is 4:00 we arrived early and were told our room wasn’t ready. We understood but come 4:00 when we came back the room still wasn’t ready and it was almost 5:00 before we could get to our room. The room was nice, suite on top floor. The only problem was the A/C and heater. It was very cold that week so if the thermostat was set to 76 it was blazing hot, if you put it down to 75 it was freezing cold. There was no comfort zone. We just marked that up as it was very cold in NYC that week and perhaps it was messing with the room temp. On our arrival in the room one nice touch they had was a special gift for us with a picture frame and a special note telling us if we needed anything to get them a call. It had a ladies name and direct phone number. That was very thoughtful we thought. In fact there was something my wife needed and called this person on our second night. She left a VM but we never heard back from this person. Why tell us to call you then not respond? Very frustrating. The staff in general was very good at the property. The conciere’s were ok. The first person we spoke to us gave us a great Pizza place near us to have lunch. Another concierge didn’t seem to know nearly as much as the first one. One thing consistent with both of them was it took sometimes 15-20 minutes to even talk to them. There was never more then 1 person there at a time and there was always several people in line to talk to them. Overall the stay wasn’t that bad but for a 4 star hotel at that price per night for a suite and me being an Explorist I expected much more out of Hyatt. Next time in Houston I will try another option.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the perfect spot for our family get away/Broadway trip. The hotel was immaculate and beautiful. The staff was kind and welcoming. Our Broadway tickets were literally 2 doors over from the hotel. From the moment we arrived the doormen made us laugh and welcomed us in like family. Our rooms were on the 50th floor and the views were dazzling! We used to stay at another well known hotel on Times Square, but this really changed our minds. Nowhere but here from now on!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked this hotel for my wife, myself and a friend for one night. Showed up very late to check in (3am) and was told we had to wait 20 minutes so they could get the room ready. We are late, I get it. I say no problem and take a seat. After some time we are able to check in and the room is as advertised. We are in our hotel room for roughly 6 hours before we have to check out. No problem, I paid for one night and that's what I got. However I check my credit card statement and I find out I have been charged twice for the same room. Never was informed of any type of additional charge or that due to a late check in, there are extenuating circumstances. I paid for a room, was there for 6 hours and checked out at the agreed check out time on my confirmation. Anyone else have this happen to them? Pretty disappointed in the lack of communication, to say the least.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just enjoyed a three night stay here with spouse and two young teens. We had a double queen deluxe room which was the best value per square foot that we could find in Times Square (with two queen beds as we don't do full size beds or pull out sofas). Our room had a generously sized bathroom with large bathtub in addition to a nice shower and about a seven foot long shelf under the mirror that fit all our toiletries for the four of us. The lighting controls and options in bath and bedroom alike were the best I've ever seen in a hotel. We did take advantage of the 10:30am daily tour of the 54th floor observatory with our kids. It was a nice 15 minutes diversion but not super special so don't worry if you miss it. We had good experience with the elevators and generally did not wait more than 60-90 seconds to be picked up. Cannot beat the location - super easy walk to theater district and Bryant Park. Great housekeeping. Not a crumb or speck of dust to be seen. There were so many other options nearby that we did not try any food or restaurant from the hotel. Definitely would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.Minor cons: room not ready until 4:46PM when check-in time is 4:00PM. Security seems a little lax, anyone can walk in and get on the elevator to any floor of the building. Not sure why they don't have card access required for the guest floors. There is a sign that reads "please show your guest room card" but this didn't seem to be regularly enforced. Can't imagine why card readers are not programmed into the elevators. Cost I suppose. Lobby conveniently located on the ground floor but is super small for a hotel with this many rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel for 10 nights, from November 15-25. We arrived 1AM of November 16 (late international flight arrival) and checking out of the hotel 10PM of November 24 (early 2AM flight back to PHL November 25). We wanted to secure rooms for arrival and departure and didn’t really want to go through the stress of haggling half day rates for our first and last night. So I just went ahead and booked full nights for those 2 days.Everything went well until we checked out. I was surprised that I was being charged an EARLY CHECKOUT penalty of 1 night, despite me releasing a fully paid room half a day early. The front desk officer, Dede, was explaining to me like I was a child that it’s similar to me breaking a contract. That there will be penalties for breaking a contract. She was doing this in a tone that was condescending, she made me feel like I was trying to get one over their hotel. Based on my standards, she is not suited to be a front desk officer in a customer service centric position.I asked for the manager, John, who basically said the same thing. That I was breaking a contract. I explained again to him, as I did with Dede, that I paid for the 10days! I wanted the room for 10days, I paid for 10 days, where is the violation there? Told them they should actually be happy as they can sell the paid for room again, at least half day if it, to someone else. He made some concessions and charged me half of the penalty. I accepted it as my time and effort, I was tired already and was preparing for the long flight home, was worth more than the $150 (full penalty was $299) they were charging. I was fighting for principle and just wanted to get the message across that this penalty/policy, was IMPRACTICAL, ILLOGICAL and was unfair to the customer specially in a case like mine.This negative experience with the property unfortunately was a terrible ending to an otherwise really great trip.And what I couldn’t understand was that they could not even give concessions to a long staying guest (10 nights!) and just waive the stupid penalty off. So many hotel options in Times Square with Air BnBs to add to them and Hyatt Centric could afford to do this. Well, maybe they are very popular and have an overflow of guests and they were trying to eliminate some of them, who knows...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: People aren't exaggerating when they say this location is great. For midtown fun, I don't think it could be much better. We were here to see the Thanksgiving Parade. It was a simple walk out the door, turn left and there it all was for us to enjoy. If you walk out the door and turn right, Times Square is steps away. Many Broadway shows are a 5-8 minute walk away. Rockefeller Center is a 10 minute walk and Central Park took about 15 minutes as did Macy's. Good food is everywhere both inexpensive and fine dining.The view from the top of this hotel is amazing and great for pictures. The real prize here is the staff. We did not meet a single unpleasant staff member. Everyone was patient and accommodating. Dede at the front desk was both helpful and sweet which was a great way to start our stay. Our housekeeper was kind and worked with our schedule without complaint. We had a 2 room corner Jr suite which met our needs. The fridge was helpful (Whole Foods was a 6 minute walk) and the Keurig had a nice selection of coffees and teas. Housekeeping left us extra at our request. I couldn't hear a single sound from any other room. We were next to the elevator and never heard any people walking by.We would stay here again without hesitation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Outstanding location, staff was very friendly and helpful no matter what you asked of them. Always greeted with a smile and a hello. Room was spacious and clean. All the amenities you need in one place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Couldn't believe just how central the hotel was to everything we wanted to see & do and everytime we walked through the doors from outside felt like we were coming home. Staff were efficient, personable & welcoming.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the 5th time in one year that we have stayed at this hotel. We use it for visiting family in the New York area. The rooms are very spacious and immaculate! The staff are a 10 plus! Special kudos to Eva at the front desk although every employee we encountered was very helpful. Looking forward to our next trip even though Thanksgiving was FREEZING!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a lovely time while visiting New York for thanksgiving. Staff friendly and extremely helpful. This is my second visit to this hotel, and would recommend the hotel great location for exploring New York !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Location. Walking distance to a lot of things and the subway for things farther away. Next to the macys thanksgiving day parade route which worked out fantastic!!! We paid extra for deluxe view room, the view wasn't exceptional so I wouldn't recommend that room upgrade, just take the "regular" view. The T45 restaurant is great, ate there twice. Elevators super fast. Highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Poor food & service, overpriced food & beverages, rooms standard but clean, location perfect for a walk to central park or to see a Broadway show, destination fee, just another money grab by the hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel location staff and rooms were all fantastic this hotel is a must stay if you visit the city! The beds are so comfy the was always clean! Best lication as just around the corner from Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great walking distance to everything near Times Square. Rooms were spotless, and early check-in was a breeze. The bar has an outstanding view of the city, and the whiskey selection is excellent!Extremely friendly staff as well.The only complaint is that, like most of NYC hotels, the price in the hotel's restaurant is absolutely absurd. $18 for a two egg omelette!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We needed a Hotel that would be within walking distance to Central Park, for easy access after completing my NY marathon race, but also within Time Square vicinity so that we still experience the best of Downtime Manhattan. So location wise this hotel did not disappoint, everything key NY interest point is within walking distance, it is right at Time Sq! Unlike other hotels that claim to be a Time Sq but are a few blocks away.The hotel feels small, but our room was on the 41st floor, giving great views of the city center especially at night. The rooms are relatively small, but for a couple and staying 3 days was ok. The rooms are modern, clean and well kept.We did not get time to experience the roof top bar. We had breakfast at the hotel once, it was dissapointing, and very expensive! Lots more options around, to have a much better breakfast for that prize....But the most disappointing part is the $25/day resort fee that they charge, I have paid same in other hotels and felt we got value for money. So next time am in NY, we will probably opt for Hiltom Time Sq, where the fee is waived if you are a Hilron Honors member..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Half a block from Times Square and just a little further from Rockefeller Center and Radio City, so the location can't be beat. Nice gym and very good room service food. Housekeeping showed up which has not happened at the last two hotels I stayed at. There's Starbucks right across the street which is nice too. Staff was friendly and extremely helpful and courteous. Also a little less expensive than a few of the other major brand Times Square properties.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: quality bell staff as soon as I pulled up. Great check in and very fast. Quietest elevators in the city. Clean room well taken care of. Nice personal at front desk no matter what time of day. Security very good. Will most likely stay at this property next time in NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: All in all the hotel was great, location great. I only have 2 issues; 1) I wanted to do something really special and since I am not from New York, I called and spoke to a very nice Lady in the Sales Office and she gave me the name, number, and email address for their VIP Manager. I called & emailed the VIP Manager and I never received a call or even an acknowledgement email. (Not Good);2) Check-In: When my niece went to check in, the GSR Michael said that my CC was declined, and this is what I didn't want to happen. That morning on Friday November 2nd, I called and spoke to a very nice GSR Gloria and advised her that I wanted my Auntie Girl to be able to check in without any issues and she suggested that I complete the Credit Card Authorization form and she even told me what to check off to make sure everything went smoothly. I completed the form, and emailed it back to her, then I called to make sure they received it, they ran my credit card and she said everything is good to go. Fast forward to around 6 something my niece calls me while I am on the road traveling to New York, and says that the guy is saying your credit card declined, and I said NO it was not declined, so she puts me on the line with Michael and he doesn't listen to what I am saying, because if he would have then he would have taken the extra step and investigated a little bit more, but he was not listening to me. Then I ask to speak to a Manager and she gets on the phone, and proceeds to tell me the same thing, and I proceed to tell her the same thing that I have told Michael 3 times; all I was offered was excuses and no one putting me on hold to say, "If you could please give me a minute let me double check just to make sure"; but no one did that. I was completely irate, and I work in the Hotel Industry, and know that the first thing you do is 1) Listen to what the customer is saying; 2) You acknowledge the issue; 3) You do your research so that you can resolve the issue. Then finally after a 10-15 minute (maybe longer) phone call, the manager says Oh, I do see that the card has already been charged...Ummmmm...yeah you do and if you would have listened, the problem could have been rectified without me having to become frustrated. Then I was offered a $50 Food & Beverage credit....REALLY? Okay, if that is the best you can do. Either way, my niece was definitely surprised and I was happy. Everything from the Valet to the young lady that checked me in when I arrived that evening was wonderful. The Restaurant Manager was great, food was great. My only issue(s) was with my niece not having a "smooth" check-in, and not having a follow-up call from the VIP Manager.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in an excellent location. Very close to 2 subway stations and right next to Times Square. It was very quiet and the bed was comfortable. Great rooftop bar. Free WiFi and free, unlimited bottled water. Would have been nice to have coffee in the lobby. Otherwise a great stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I enjoyed much the location of the hotel. It is a quite modern hotel which is in good shape and very clean. Housekeeping did a great job.There is also a nice roof top to get a nice view of a part of Manhatten and you even can see the One World Trade Center.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The personnel at this facility are well versed in Customer Service and they practice it 100%. It is very well maintained and its location is super for the entertainment in the area. We have been staying there whenever we visit NYC and plan to continue to do so. Very Highly Recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time to stay here. Nice location. Within walking distance of Times Square, lots of bars and restaurants. Staff was super friendly. Hotel very clean. Rooms good space. A bit pricey but it was a block off of Times Square and it is NYC. Bar upstairs is a must. Felt very safe in the area and hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the room was magnificen,t queen size bed clean and cozy, all the bits in the bath room with good lighting, underfloor heating was a bonus even though we were in the back of the hotel we still had a great view of the NY skyline staff were very slick and very proffesional also we were able to leave our kuggage safel because of alate check outTimes square just around the corner and bars and eating places all by the hotel can i just say this hotel comes highly recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic location, 2 minutes walk to time square, 10 minutes walk to Rockefeller Center, 20 min walk to Central Park.Fantastic room, very clean room, and the view is brilliant.Fantastic service, the receptionist, room attendant, door men are all very professional and friendly.When my taxi arrived, I felt super comfortable from the service of door men until arrived my room.I strongly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly, efficient, helpful staff. Great room and comfy bed! On 54th floor, B54 Skyline Lounge is fantastic - awesome skyline views, good food too! So well located and still a quiet location! An easy walk to Times Square and Broadway shows, 20 minute walk to Central Park, Rockefeller Centre is around the corner and 2 blocks (great shopping!)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The worst food ever!!!We ordered Mac n Cheese for Starter and it was like swimming in a cream soup. There was no taste and flavor.The macaroni was over cooked. The Chargrilled Salmon came over cooked. We ordered medium and it came well done. The location of the hotel is nice but the quality of food is very poor!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is just off of Time Square so it is close to Broadway theaters and many restaurants. We were in a suite, but the rooms were a good size for NY hotels, clean, and well appointed. There is a fun roof top bar. Room service is basic and does come in containers in a bag rather than on a tray, but that is there thing. Rooms were quiet and the higher floors have great views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Checking out today we waited 20 minutes for an elevator. Once finally on we got stuck twice on the 38th and 35th floor with 2 other couples and single. Now I have had a heart attack and have a heart condition and can tell you this had me taking extra medication. The kicker is when we got off and told people they said yeah the engineers working on it. Why the F do you still have people using them?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here over Halloween and into November for a week with family and friends.Had the most amazing suite with a balcony and it really was outstanding, totally worth the extra money for the balcony. Rooms are well appointed and have enough storage for a few days, and the bathrooms are really very good.Spotlessly clean, the entire hotel is well looked after and meticulously run. The jewel in the crown has to be the rooftop bar - amazing views and the food was outstanding. Try the short rib sliders! It’s expensive - but, it’s New York - it’s what you expect. When the hotel is busy, expect to spend a long time waiting on an elevator .... but again, the staff excelled themselves and our housekeeping staff let us use the service elevator!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Super location ,very clean , helpful staff, good room on 7th floor with 2 king sized beds,a super walk in shower with plenty of hot water. There were just 2downsides to the stay, one was very uncomfortable seats and not enough of them in the lobby, and the 54th floor cocktail bar ,which was well appointed and fantastic views ,does not serve coffee even after supper, and the cocktails lacked attractive garnishes even though they were $20 plus . Lovely young waitress served us

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: In town to see Springsteen on Broadway. Hotel was very conveniently located to the theater, right next to Times Square. Clean, comfortable hotel with nice views. Choose a high floor is you can for sweeping views of the skyline.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A very clean hotel in an excellent central location.Questioned the extra $28 (inc tax) per night for the tea, coffee and water which we were unaware of when booking.(£112 for 4 nights).Overall we had a fabulous time in NYC. would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice, clean modern hotel with modern rooms and a great bar on top floor. The bar on the top floor has great views of the city and an outside patio that is nice. The location can be a bit noisy due to its location so if you want a quieter room ask for a room not facing the street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in NYC twice, but this hotel was definitely amazing. A bit pricier than other hotels but worth it in my opinion. The room was very spacious and the bed... comfort!!! Even the hairdryer was amazing. Only negative point is that we were charged more when we got there than we had originally booked, (plus the taxes and other charges) but this wasn't the hotel's fault.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved New York and Hyatt Centric is a great (and very central) place to stay. We loved it. A very serviceminded and helpfull staff.. Rooms are great and comfortable. Very important when travelling with teenagers: Internet connection is good :-). Hope to come back one day. A great place to stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am staying here with my 15 year old daughter. We picked it for location, high rooms with a view and a bar on 54th floor for fabulous views. I would not return or recommend. The location is good. The room is ok but nothing more but view from room itself not great. They do not make clear that you cannot go to the 54th floor unless you are 21. They offer a viewing so minors can see the view at 10.30am . So today. we return to the hotel after being out early to do this but they are not doing it today because it is raining. However, they confirmed the bar will be open as normal. I found the receptionist difficult and unsympathetic. Beware if this is a family visit - there must be better options. It is not cheap - we paid over £300 a night and would expect better service

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at during all my visits to New York City. It is located one block away from Times Square. From the hotel you can easily go to all places in New York. The staff is very friendly. We asked for a High Floor and got a great view. The rooftop-bar is nice to visit during evening hours. I would definately stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We picked this hotel partly because of good reviews, partly because of its prime location and partly because it offers high floor rooms with nice city views. I can tell you we were definetely not disappointed!We stayed for five nights in a deLuxe room facing south with a wonderful view from Times Square til One World Trade Center (Freedom Tower). The room and bathroom were spacious and the bed was comfortable. Coffee machine, fridge and fresh bottles of water each day.Staying this close to Times Square means plenty of noise at night time, and I suspect this might be troublesome if you're a light sleeper on the lower floors facing 45th St, but we had no issues with this on the 49th floor.We only visited the restaurant and rooftop bar once, but food was very nice. Pricey cocktails though!The staff is wonderful and provided such excellent service throughout our stay! We were here for a special occasion, and the staff had placed a wonderful surprise in the room upon our arrival. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the fifth time we have stayed at this particular property. The staff and the physical environment are exceptional as is the proximity to everything New York - Time Square, Theatres, Lincoln Centre, MOMA, Central Park - all within easy walking distance

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is very convenient and within walking distance to many New York City attractions including Broadway shows. It has a wonderful lounge on the 54th floor with a fabulous view. The only downside to the hotel was that the bellman always seemed grumpy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We’ve traveled to New York so many times and frequently have had very bad hotel experiences so it was very refreshing to stay at an excellent hotel near time square, the Hyatt centric. The rooms are beautiful and it excellent modern condition. Beds and linens are very comfortable. The housekeeping staff is amazing we never ran out of anything and the insured we were always fully stocked and then followed up to make sure we didn’t need anything else. The rooms are also very quiet which is unbelievable and such a busy place like New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Service by the staff was not good. Asked for a late check out twice and no reply until lastday.Cleaning lady forgot bath amenities last day and shower was a painReception service very fast but not helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved our stay at the Hyatt. The only complaint we have is that kids are not allowed on the 54th floor bar/restaurant. It was an amazing view that we unfortunately couldn't take advantage of due to our sons age.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have felt at home. Excellent treatment and magnificent rooms. Comfortable beds and excellent cleaning. The rooms are large. It is always nice to start the day with a good morning. The staff has been lovely. The hotel's location is unbeatable, just steps from Times Square. On the rooftop you can have a drink with spectacular views of Manhattan. The detail of the free breakfast for the honeymoon was impressive. We will never forget our stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. Thank you very much for so much. I recommend everyone to visit it. Few hotels in Manhattan I think they can offer what this is. Congratulations. Juan & Isabel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were immediately greeted with friendly staff. Although it was busy the wait to check in was negligible. My first impression was how clean and up to date the hotel interior looked. Our room faced Time Square so our views were amazing. We had a tight schedule, but were able to spend some time at the roof top bar, which is a must see and experience. The location is perfect because the shows we took in were between 8-12 minute strolls. Definitely plan on staying there again in late Dec- Jan to celebrate a few big birthdays with friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Have stayed in many hotels in midtown, and would look forward to staying at the Hyatt Centric Times Square in the future.Pros:- Reliable and fast wifi (never slow, never dropped)- Super accommodating staff; I needed to send a large parcel via UPS but didn't have a box - they sent up several box options AND packing tape for me (I didn't even have to ask for the tape!), and also happily took my parcel for UPS pick-up - really appreciated it- I arrived super early (8-something AM), check-in wasn't till the afternoon and the hotel was sold out the night before; got a text within an hour of walking away that our room was ready. Thank god! I don't know how I would have killed 6+ hours after a red-eye.- Cannot stress how close this hotel is to Times Square and the theatre district; every theatre we went to was within a 10 minute walk (AT MOST!), the hotel is right off the main drag but far enough away that you're not stuck in that crazy crowd situation- Clean room, amenities replenished every day, rooms seemed to be clean pretty promptly (even days where we didn't leave our room until early/mid afternoon)Cons:- Not a fan of the $25/day destination fee but this seems inevitable with a lot of NY hotels nowadays- Minor quibble, but the one wall plug that is close to the work desk is mostly blocked by the side of the desk (which can't move) so I couldn't plug my MacBook in to work- Hotel is a bit pricey for the size of the room, but honestly, for the location and maintenance, I can't complain that much.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this place .Nice rooms .I really loved staying here .Location so perfect .Made me so glad I made right choice of staying at right place .Rooms are well lit with ample sunlight .Would highly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in NYC for our first time and wanted to be near Times Square. The Hyatt Centric is a wonderful hotel. Amazing staff nice clean bright rooms. They have a roof top bar on the 54 floor amazing views for those who have no problem with heights.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a real strategic position: close to all the most interesting sites by walking...Times Square just behind the corner. It is a 4 stars hotel with all the comforts expected at the right price...the staff is very kalo and and make feel you absolutely comfortable. Nice thing: you can ask for bottles of water at any time and how many you want just for free. It is available a luxury taxi service from and to the airport for about 75$: comparable with less comfortable standard taxi service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After staying at the Hyatt Centric in NYC for 9 nights imagine our shock that after paying over $4200.00 for our room we were billed $225.00 for what the hotel calls a “destination fee”. They apparently started this excessive fee in April just in time for the Spring & Summer rush. They claim it is for internet, water & restaurant discounts. Also it includes long distance phone calls. We don’t need their internet, water, long distance & we will never again eat in their restaurant after eating there 2 years ago. We will go to any of the lovely hotels in the same wonderful area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I went for business travel and only spent a night. The hotel is within walking distance to all shows and bustle of Times Square so if you like that scene, it’s a good location. The room was pretty quiet up on the 16th floor. Lobby is small but modern, hip, and clean. Once into the sleeping floors however, all that modernity sort of disappears. Old carpets and depressing hallway leads you to your room. The room is small for a luxury hotel, but this is NYC so I guess this is what we get. It was sufficient. Postage stamp bathroom was clean with the bare minimum of necessities (soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, hairdryer). Keep a spare pair of socks or slippers handy as the carpet is filthy! This is the e of a very few hotels I have spent this kind of money on and which carries a relatively high-end name where I have absolutely refused to touch my bare feet to the floor and worn socks until I climbed into bed. The beds are comfy with good pillows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked an 8 night stay for my wife's birthday. NYC has been on our bucket list forever, so this was our opportunity. Location is perfect, close to everything. We never walked so much in our lives, but better that then sit in traffic. The room was spacious, super clean, TV and bathroom perfect. Rooftop bar views nothing less than spectacular - up there we were part of the famous NYC skyline. Our visit coincided with the 9/11 anniversary, which made the trip even more unforgettable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is not to big, a maximum of 9-11 rooms per floor. A spectacular roof top bar, floor to ceiling windows, with a good view. Not far from the undreground, all the theaters waliking distance to a lot of attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in NYC for my 50th Birthday. After reading reviews about this hotel, I booked it. It was amazing in every way. I had booked via the website and wanted to change my room, we were told by Hyatt direct that it couldn't be done. I contacted the hotel via facebook and we were eventually helped by Lupita Davis who was Director of VIP Experience, she is an absolute star! We arrived to a bottle of wine in our room and a card and a gift from Lupita and the hotel to celebrate my birthday. We really felt that this hotel was an oasis, the smell of the foyer is wonderful. After very full days of exploring the city, we looked forward to coming back to a quiet place - and it really was. This hotel is quiet and very clean, but right in the middle of all the action. I can't say enough about the staff - they were all a real pleasure, made our stay so memorable. Thank you for making our trip to NYC such an amazing one! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! ....... Lupita Davis ..... you are a real credit to the hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were very happy with this hotel and the location is excellent for travel anywhere in Manhattan. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and kept very clean each day. They could have used a larger lobby with more seats but then again - the price of NY real estate!!!Our only negative was with one of the concierges, an older blonde lady. She would not cancel our original comedy show tickets for us and when we wanted to order tickets to Caroline’s Comedy Club, she told us to do it on line. She actually was quite rude. She probably doesn’t get extra money for that or something. We just didn’t get it. We never used the concierge again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staying for few days with some friends.Like the times square area, traffic always jammed around this area.Close to tourist destination , restaurant, station, office , department store, etc.Starting in the afternoon, the security guard stood near elevator to check your room card. Had lunch on the restaurant in the lobby, taste was great but the service was not fast. The waiter was attentive and served well. Room was big and quiet - I got room on the 14th floor. There was a bell lady that came to our room during our check out time , to pick up our luggage .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For our 5 day New York trip we wanted a very central hotel in Times Square. Hyatt Centric has an excellent location...very central. However, when we arrived, we realized that 1 out of the 3 elevators wasn't working. We didn't think it was a big deal at first but it turned out to be a big hassle. There were long lines for the elevators, once the manager even came out and took us up on the service elevator. It gave us some dread whenever we were heading back to the hotel anticipating a long wait for the elevator.We also found the "security" a bit lacking with extremely unfriendly persons requesting to see your room key...when they chose to be there actually.The restaurant food was ok but was very pricey. I must say that we did have a good view from our room and from the rooftop bar. Unfortunately, other than their excellent location I wouldn't stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel. Check in was helpful and concierge desk was very helpful with local attractions. Clean king size room with large bathroom. Just a few steps from Times Square and Broadway shows. Disappointed with the gym. The exercise equipment is equipped with TVs but I was never able to get them to connect, my last day at the hotel I couldn't get into the gym even though my room key worked elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all, no help with luggage. There are a couple of guys outside but at best, they will open the door. Upon check-in, again no help with luggage offered.You don't need to use the card to go to the desired floor so ANYONE can walk into the hotel, go to any floor and walk around. I was only asked once - during a one-week stay - to show my hotel card before entering the elevators (you could also easily use an old card to just wave it). I didn't feel very secure.The "destination fee" is a complete rip-off. It's like being forced to pay for junk mail that you find in your mailbox.The bar upstairs has a nice view, but for an unknown reasons, it's the only place in NY where tipping in not optional, and there is a forced 18% service charge fee. For service, that is slow, disorganized and generally lacking, let me add.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff are very welcoming, had to show your room key to security when entering the building, bedroom always clean and asked for robes & slippers which were provided.Roof top bar is worth a visit but very expensive. Did not use the breakfast service as over the road is a Starbucks and if you turn left out of the hotel between 6th / 5th avenue is Cafe Manhattan. Location is excellent for time square, theatre area and attractions. Also the hotel provides a taxi service for airport drop offs at $75 to JFK.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A clean basic kingroom with a view over new york buildings. A very basic room with coffee facility. No bath only shower. What i found most annoying there was nobody to help with luggage on arrival or departure we had to lug our own 5 cases !A bit of a mass room hotel, no personal touch !If you are looking for basic hotel, near time square this is for you - no frills !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I discovered the hotel after finding Park Hyatt sold out.Hyatt Centric was much nicer than I expected.The room while small had a very nice bath with separate tub and shower.The bed was great and the room was beyond quiet.The roof top bar had a great view and very nice staff.Spa products in room were a bit odd, made in China.Front desk staff worked very hard and made sure check in's were smooth.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Two days before we departed for NYC, the apartment we had booked 6 months previously through Tripadvisor, fell through. At the time we were devastated but now we are very happy about it because we got to stay at the wonderful Hyatt Centric instead. The reason we initially booked an apartment was because we are a family with two teenagers. We wanted to stay all together. Even though we booked the Hyatt Centric at the very last minute, they were able to give us two rooms next to each other in an alcove off the main corridor. Even though they didn't connect it was great to have our kids so close. The rooms were modern and clean and provided us with a great, comfortable base to explore NYC from. We loved started our day with breakfast in the hotel's outdoor eating space. We also loved ending out day with a drink in the beautiful rooftop bar, although the kids couldn't go there because you have to be over 21. The absolute best part of this hotel, is the location. We were exactly where we wanted to be, in the heart of NYC so close to Times Square & Broadway. We were able to walk to so many of the places we wanted to visit and found so many wonderful spots in our immediate area. The green oasis of Bryant Park, only a few blocks away, being one. We hope to return to NYC again one day and will certainly be staying at the Hyatt Centric. Thank you for helping make our holiday so pleasurable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Walking distance to almost everything, (Central Park, Times Square, 5th Avenue, Rockafeller Center, theater district, so convenient! Helpful, friendly, genuine staff. Beds and linen were crazy nice, Slept like a log! Great pillows! This hotel provided EVERYTHING we asked for with promptness and friendliness. Staff greeted us as if they knew us, always gracious, smiling, and willing to please. No way to say enough about this hotel. Jeff at the desk helped us get an upgrade as a Hyatt Member. We were on the highest 53rd floor and had a great view! Walter and Ed at the door...were beyond helpful with cars, taxis, luggage and recommendations. Katie, who provided for our room, could not do enough for us. Maria at the T45 Restaurant was a doll providing hot water for my tea and a friendly smile every morning! The restaurant downstairs serves all meals. The rooftop restaurant is fabulous for snacks and drinks! The restaurant next door O'Lunneys was great as well. Lots of local places to eat close by. This is my 6th time to NYC and When I return, this is the place I will stay! There is a spa in the hotel as well as a workout area. You will not be disappointed if you stay here. Thanks everyone!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Enjoyed our stay. Rooms were very modern, updated and clean. Location was amazing right in Times Square. Room view amazing. Whole wall of windows with a great view of Times Square. Walking distance to so many sites.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The only reason I wouldn't stay at this hotel during every trip to NYC is the very busy Times Square location. It's perfectly situated in Midtown, close to many places of interest and near the pivotal Times Square subway station. The hotel itself is quiet, very clean and fresh. The rooms are fresh, peaceful, thoughtfully-designed, and include all the amenities you could want. The gym and restaurant are both very good and a notch above most hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I treated myself to a long weekend in NYC to see Broadway show. This hotel on W. 45TH was located perfectly. Near good restaurants (including a great bar & restaurant in the hotel. Room was good size.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our second stay at the Centric. We were very impressed with the level of customer service we received during our stay. Claudio one of the managers made sure that one of our special requests was taken care of when we checked in. The room was quiet (for New York) and was very clean. The roof top bar which we didn't get a chance to enjoy on our last trip has an incredible view. You shouldn't miss it especially at night! One of the house keepers and I am sorry I didn't get her name was so very helpful on the first two days of our stay, 10/6-10/7. All in all this is a great location just steps away from Times Square. This is one of the better Hyatts we have stayed at and for NYC you get a lot for your dollars! See you again next time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: perfect location, new and nice rooms, friendly and helpful staff...we will definately come back to this hotel for next vacation, B54 bar is very nice with breathtaking Times Square view on 54th floor

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Final stop on a 2+ week trip before heading home. Second visit to the hotel when last one I paid to upgrade and got a double sized room and this one booked using Hyatt points. Positives- Location location location but that may not suit some travellers. If you want to see all the touristy things and go to the theatre this one is it.- Room is a standard size probably tending towards small as is the bathroom ( no bath only shower)- Hyatt brand : free water, decent wifi though I note that if I was not using Hyatt points I would have been charged an additional $25 per day fee for this so probably would not have been happy- Check in easy and they ensured our Hyatt points booking and one additional night were linked and offered a late check out without us requesting- We were on a high floor ( level 50) with a view over building sites - not an issue as we were up so high and there was no problem with noise outside but not a great view- Gym is well appointed and free towels are provided with a good selection of equipment- Level 54 Bar great views and service but you will pay for the convenience- Breakfast at the downstairs cafe is generous and the service is great but again its not cheap and they put a 20% gratuity on the bill automatically which is more a practice of a Hyatt resort rather than a hotel Opportunities- Hotel is looking tired as compared to the first time we visited they had recently opened. Lots of traffic in the hotel is starting to show in the cleanliness and general maintenance- House keeping was bit hit and miss, one day it looked like it was half done and the cleaning towels were left in the room - very random. They also need to use less bleach as it leaves a strong smell in the room afterwards- Sheets, pillows and towels are all showing their age. We did ask for additional pillows ( they only provide two on a king bed) and a blanket but only the pillows arrived. Pillows were awful - way too soft even with two of them- Air conditioning was so loud and rattled even when placed on eco and low fan - in end had to turn off whilst sleeping- Gym TV on equipment no longer works so you can only bring own ipad or if u are a US citizen log in to your hulu etc account which seems strange for a hotel with international visitors- On check out no asking whether stay was any good, did we need to store luggage etcHotel is becoming more of a budget ( big groups and lost of turn over) hotel rather than the Hyatt brand which tends to be more personalised service. Whilst I booked with Hyatt points did not feel there was any recognition of being a Hyatt member compared to another other guest that had booked hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked a room for a girls weekend and although the price was outrageous ($650.00) for one night, the location, convenience to Theater District and service made for a very enjoyable weekend. The room was big by NY standards and the bathroom was very nice, large with soaking rub, separate shower and 2 sinks. 3 cups of coffee at the attached restaurant were $18.00 and a glass of wine at the roof-top bar was $20.00.. So not a cheap place to rest your head, but if you are willing to splurge, it's worth it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked this hotel a month in advance for my bf’s bday. It was his first time in NY and our first time traveling far together. I specifically requested high floors and a good view of the city/Times Square. I was given Lupita’s contact who is in charge of their VIP guest experience and I communicated with her what I had hoped in making my bf’s bday memorable. She went above and beyond. Upon checking into the room, we were welcomed with a bday gift, a personalized card for my bf as well as for me. In the bag was wine, a NY souvenir frame, and more treats. The room was on the 47th floor with a great view. It also had a separate soaking tub and rain shower which we loved! I also want to say I appreciate the front desk for letting us check in sooner since our flight arrived so early. We were able to check in by 130pm. Also, Dede in the front desk was very accommodating when we needed a microwave to heat up bday dinner left overs (the food was expensive lol) and last but not certainly least- Coco who helped with our floor with housecleaning was extremely attentive and very sweet! She took care of us as well. Thank you, Hyatt Centric!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We paid extra for two queen size beds on a high floor but it was well worth the money as we stayed 9 nights and had a very happy stay.John, one of the assistant managers, checked us in, provided a bonus when he realized how long we were staying and personally organized our bags to our room and made sure that we were happy with the room. This gave an excellent first impression and it lasted until we checked out as the comfort, service and convenience were all first class.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt corporate has every good reason to be proud of this facility; the members of the Centric team are dedicated and committed to customer happiness, satisfaction and comfort. It is a well maintained property; where customer service is a priority. It is now my go-to hotel when in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I didn't climb into bed until late at night, and at that point, I found the sheets to be a little torn, and had a few stains. Oddly, this hotel doesn't use fitted sheets; they have the flat sheet covering the (disgusting looking) mattress topper, so you have to sleep between the blanket and the flat sheet, which I found to be gross. I figured it was a hotel policy and not a housekeeping error. It was too late and I was too tired to complain about the state of my bed. I told the front desk the next morning and they didn't really seem to care.Late night security is abrasive. I get the reason for having them (the elevators don't have a card security). Many people have mentioned this prior to my stay, and security was still abrasive. So hey management, when you respond to this saying "you'll work on it," I won't really believe you until there's notable changes in the reviews, sorry.This hotel looks a lot newer than say, Hyatt Grand Terminal, and overall wasn't THAT bad, but considering it's proximity to Times Square (the noise wasn't an issue, just the foot traffic to get around is a nightmare of course), the subpar service and cleanliness, I'll look for a different hotel to at in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was just there for a girlfriends theatre weekend; this place is a hidden treasure. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave--the entire staff cannot do enough to welcome you and ensure that you have a terrific stay. The front desk and every member of support staff are dedicated and committed to your experience. The Hyatt Centrc will now be my go to hotel when in NYC. It is centrally located; and, with great rooms that are clean, well appointed and this level of dedicated to guest services there is every wonderful reason to return. Hyatt Corporate has every good reason to be proud of this property!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right upon check in everything was handled easily for everyone in my party. No issues. Clean rooms. Was able to get hypo allergenic pillows (hugely allergic to feathers) - but feather pillows is my only complaint. Everything else very nice and a great location!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful room, outstanding staff, great location, amazing roof top bar. The hotel is 5 years old, beautifully decorated, and located a half a block from Times Square. The hotel is very quiet. You don't hear noise from the street/city. The beds and bedding are high quality. The room was extremely clean. The room came with complimentary water (bottles) and coffee (Keurig).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great property in the center of Times Square. Really helpful staff and a great concierge who helped us get fantastic tickets to a MLB game in awesome seats. Very close to the Metro and great restaurants. Everything you need is within walking distance including a range of theater shows. Great restaurant for breakfast and great rooftop bar. Awesome stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a very nice stay here. It is in the middle of time square with easy access to everything. The views are NY views. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice, comfortable and nicely appointed. I slept really well. The TV was personalized with your name and welcomed you. You could also just check out on the TV.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The most comfortable bedding! Modern looking rooms. Clean and well located beautiful hotel. Hospitality was lacking. Front desk and some of the hallway/elevator staff not so welcoming. Room service experience was disappointing too (charged $36 for 2 glasses of wine that came in plastic cups). Wine in plastic cups at such a nice hotel? Also, the concierge area is practically hidden and I didn’t know it existed until our last day. If hospitality improves, it would be a perfect hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in Sep 2018 for 5 nights.Overall a good experience. Neat & CleanQuick service at receptionGood location ; less than 5 min walk from Times SquareGood Indian Restaurants near by i.e. Utsav & MinarRoom size is pretty small ; even though have got room at 46th floor , view was not greatBar at 54th floor gives you awesome landscape view ; must visitComplimentary Coffee was helpfulOverall recommended ~

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I celebrate my birthday last February and everybody there celebrated with me!! Love it. Thanks to the wonderful staff (I remember Eva , very nice girl @ front desk ...but the whole staff made me feel great) . Rooms are great, comfortable, bathroom is excellent (warm floor for cold weather is really a nice touch !!! ) . Great and cool restaurant/bar at top! Location is amazing! Hope to come back soon. This hotel is a gem!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Elevator full all the time, and dirty. no phones in lobby, had to use a cordless phone from the front desk as my cell wasn't working. At least front desk rep was nice. It was raining so hard and they had a limited umbrella for guests. I've stayed at Endaz which is also a hyatt and that seems like it's a much cleaner, newer hotel, they even have free Sodas, bottled water and sparking at the front lobby free of charge for guests. Not bad for NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family of 3 came to NYC (first time all three of us together) for my 50th bday. The hotel not only decorated the door and flowers on the bed and a gift! Amazing.Everyone was so pleasant, the corner suite was spacious enough for all 3 of us. Plenty of closet space. Plethora of places to plug in your various technology. Great location as well. Being a block off Times square i was a bit nervous but we were not bothered at all.Housekeeping could have been a bit more thorough but it wasn't enough to damper our spirits

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently stayed for my first, long-awaited visit to NY. The hotel's location is just fantastic, just a minute away from Times Square and close walking to distance to almost everything.The room was immaculately clean and the bed was super comfy. Appreciated the coffee machine and pods! Only downside was I overlooked the street which was really noisy from around 5am when the binmen started their duties! Bar 54's views are amazing, cocktails are expensive but for me it was a one off experience so worth the money.Would definitely recommend based on location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I try not to have too many expectations when I walk into a hotel. I’m not of the mindset that every guest should be treated like a king or that every aspect of every experience is going to be perfect. When I stay at a Hyatt or other higher end chain hotel I do hold them to the standard at which they advertise themselves. Generally, I look for a few key indicators to tell me how a hotel really approaches their responsibilities of providing guest service and providing a level of guest experience commensurate with their brand. First, are the rooms and common areas of the hotel clean? In this case yes, even the grout lines in the shower were free of mildew( a common problem in my travels). How are the towels?
