That may seem silly but to me the quality and condition of the towels gives great insight into the quality expectation of management. In this case epic fail. The towels were way past their useful life. All of the 4 bath towels were frayed, with big pulls and had lost any hint of softness from what must have been 1000s of washings. What about guest service? I always forget something when traveling, usually a toothbrush or razor. This time I asked for a razor. It never came. I went down to the desk and 2nd time was a charm because it was in my room when I returned.Next room service. This is always great. The menu states that the kitchen is open until 11pm. I called at 10:53pm and was informed they were closed. Sorry, at a Hyatt that is a fail. I know it’s annoying but at the very least offer something to a hungry traveler if they are calling during your stated operating hours even if it’s a very limited offering. Checkout. Did they ask me how my stay was? Nope. This is the trademark of a hotel that gets a lot of complaints. I’m not saying that is the case here but asking every guest about their experience is guest service 101. It should be as 2nd nature as breathing for a front desk employee. Another weird thing about the Centric brand, according to the front desk they don’t believe in top sheets. The beds only have a bottom sheet and a duvet. This grossed me out a little because it makes me put a lot of faith in housekeeping that they change that duvet cover after every guest. Also,as someone who runs hot, I like a sheet not a duvet. Generally this was a fine hotel but honestly I would stay elsewhere in the future. If you do stay here request a high floor. I was in 710 and opening the curtains was a dark and depressing experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is located few meters from the time square and Bryant park.welcoming stuff, good security, very quiet inside the hotel.The room was clean, new and bright, all furniture are new and made the room look larger. very nice shower and bath room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for our family vacation this year. We were celebrating our youngest child's high school graduation and our vacation included her surprise gift of seeing Hamilton at Richard Rogers Theater. What a great visit! The hotel is perfectly located for travel with young adults. We were not interested in Times Square, but knew they would want to see it. We wanted to be near Broadway in order to walk to Hamilton when that incredible time finally came (Hamilton was definitely worth the hype-best production I've ever seen!), but did not want to deal with the noise and Times Square traffic. Since Broadway is by Times Square, I had found investigating which hotel to select presented quite a challenge. The Hyatt Centric proved to be the perfect location. We had great access, with little walking to a couple of main subway stations, providing access to all of the historic sites we did want to include in the trip. We had a large room; city view on a high floor. It was spacious for New York, clean, and well appointed. The cleaning staff was very professional and polite and we enjoyed leaving our room in their hands, which made those late night returns to our room pleasant as it was clean and welcoming, thanks to them. I will stay there again on our next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern and well kept Hyatt near Times Square and the subway. We stayed for 5 nights and had an upgraded room and it consisted of a bedroom and a separate living area. One of the nicer and more spacious room layouts I've experienced in Manhattan. Very modern with newer furniture. The lobby, however, is very small and constantly crowded. If you want to find a place outside the room to read (if you have a companion who sleeps in), there is really no where to go. The desk staff were nice and helpful (loaned an umbrella on a rainy day). There are not enough elevators, so there is always a wait. Overall, very nice hotel in busy Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for a bit more than a week ! Nice rooms and great experience. The staffs were warm and friendly. Great location- like a minute walk away from times square. Very close to the subway stations and the theatres. The Room and Rooftop bar had great views of times square and it was fairly quieter than expected. Oh forgot to mention, the super fast elevators are amazing :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with teenagers on their first trip to New York. The location of the hotel was ideal given that it’s right on Times Square. Despite being so central it wasn’t noisy. Staff was very friendly and rates were reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. The twin rooms are a large size with great renovated bathrooms. Would visit again here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I with very happy with the hotel location. We were a comfortable walking distance to all the theaters and great restaurants.We really enjoyed our evening Moscow Mules made by Justin and Justin at the B54 roof top bar. Great service, great view!Thanks from the California olive growing couple!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in this hotel once before. It was much better. Now they charge for the “complimentary” wifi, water etc. 25 dollars per day. What I found really funny was that they say you have 20 dollars discount thanks to this extra charge per day in their spa. I went to the spa. Had the pedicure. The bill was 95 dollars so when it’s below 100 dollars you can’t use this extra discount!!! :-D wtf??! And than you know what :-D .... at the end I payed for this spa treatment 118 dollars because they charge the extra tip for the lady which done the pedicure to me. But the basic bill was 95 dollars so you can’t use the discount for the spa The air condition runs like a crazy everywhere but ok., that’s NY. Besides this you obviously pay this extra NY tax. :-D What is good is the rooftop bar and the gym is ok. Not new, not fresh but ok. I will go for the different hotel next time....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room condition was very bad despite the high price. Service was rude or rather non existent. Definitely not worth the money and there are lots of choices nearby. Only good part is the location was good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazing hotel in a wonderful location. Rooms are fairly spacious for a New York hotel, with a great view! Located right in Times Square but the block its on is fairly quiet and we had no issues with noise etc. There is security before you go up to the rooms which makes you feel secure etc. and there are bottles of water available if you ask.There's a nice Irish bar Connolly's a few doors down which is worth a visit for a drink.We did visit the rooftop bar which has amazing views, drinks are expensive but you are paying for the view and experience! Would visit again if price was right.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the hotel September 2018. The hotel staff was very friendly and despite what is mentioned in other reviews, anyone who books the hotel is made aware of the $25 a day fee. Personally, I think it's dumb and would rather they just charge an additional $25 per night for the room, but I'm guessing that they do that to promote a more competitive room rate. Regardless, if someone books a room and doesn't pay attention, that is their fault and not the hotel's. We had a great stay at this hotel. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. I took away one star because I felt that the carpet in our room was worn out. Not terrible, but not what I expected. Everything else was great. The sky bar was beautiful too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: At the check in desk was the first shock when it was explained that it was a $25 a day "Destination Fee added" to the stay , when i challenged it it was explained it was for WIFI which i didn't require as i have data roaming and then water ! after a battle it was removed . although when booked i asked for a view of times square it was not as described ,on challenging the reception staff to honour my booking the operation manager got involved and admitted that the Hyatt website does not properly reflect our room as there was no bath as described either ! i had to crank my neck to get the slightest view. on suggestion from myself as we were part of a wedding party of 8 that as a goodwill gesture that a least a drink each would be nice on the roof top bar and $100 was credited to my room , due to the prices on the rooftop bar it did not cover 1 drink each ! On 3 occasions i had to ask for the room to be serviced as the tea and coffee was not being replenished and the toilet paper was getting low.....it wasn't until i came face to face with the maid and explained in no uncertain terms please SERVICE THE ROOM it was then done , on return i then found dirty pillow slips on the floor. at this point i gave up. In conclusion there must be better Hotels in N york to stay this was my first time and it goes without saying i will not return on these findings

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall, this hotel delivers updated spacious rooms for reasonable NYC prices and most of the staff are both authentic and attentive. We very much appreciated the lobby restaurant waiter and his (very tall) Manager because they made every attempt to make our family feel comfortable. One of the women on the housekeeping team was amazing. We wish we had her name because she was so kind and even made an origami towel arrangement for our kids and their stuffed animals! Overall, the front desk team was mostly quite helpful and the doorman was super friendly. The compact size of their front desk is a challenge and that does cause delays on occasion. There were a few disappointments which are the reason that we couldn't give a five circle review. First, the lobby area is extremely tight. When we were waiting for our car to arrive to take us to the airport, there were several people that had taken up all of the seating so our entire exhausted family was left standing with our luggage for about half an hour against a wall next to the front desk. On a few occasions we needed to utilize the lobby restrooms and each time they were in terrible condition. It is obvious that they have quite a bit of traffic and they are simply not cleaned often enough to keep up. Finally, we found it odd that the property does not provide a top sheet for the bed. We had to go to the lobby to request one, but it was a bit alarming when we arrived late at night and didn't have one. We DO recommend the property especially if your trip is planned around attending the theater. The staff is putting in a solid effort and we are hopeful that it will continue to improve.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square is my favorite hotel in the theater district and midtown in general. Great location, excellent quiet rooms and a fantastic rooftop bar. I have stayed there 3 times this summer and I am looking forward to returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely hotel , friendly staff , Betty kept our room tidy also making sure we had enough coffee ,got us slippers and dressing gowns (no extra charge) if you forget anything like toothpaste, razors etc don’t worry the hotel will provide , internet connection excellent, location was perfect , room was spacious with fab views, lovely big shower , great hairdryer , nice toiletries lots of nice white fluffy towels, I would recommend this hotel for location, comfort, staff friendliness and willingness to make your stay exceptional, I hope to visit you again Hyatt Centric you where a big part in making our New York experience one we will never forget for all the right reasons.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at Hyatt Centric in Sept, with my 3 teens. Room was very clean and hotel staff very helpful. We stayed at the 43 floor and has a wonderful view. the hotel is located in a very close to Times square, so everything was really close by. Planet Hollywood was just steps away, that was very convenient for dinner. We would definitely stay again at this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Back to New York and the Hyatt Centric Times Square. Check-in was a breeze and within a few minutes I was off to my room. For this stay I went with a Deluxe Suite over my normal selection of a Deluxe View Suite. The room (4901) offered a king size bed with small lounge area with floor to ceiling windows and views of the Chrysler Building and Freedom Tower. The bathroom was a little smaller than the ones in the deluxe view versions and if you wanted to take a bath you would have to enter through the shower- a very weird set up. Even though this room was just by the elevators I never heard them. On the day of departure I had a delicious breakfast at the hotel restaurant.When I stayed at this exact same property last October they yet have added the daily $25 destination fee. Other hotels in Times Square have started this but as a member of the Hyatt rewards program in-room Internet was always complimentary but now is included in the daily charge along with a few other things. The front desk clerk did not mention about this charge at check-in but I already was aware of it.The reason for the 4 star review is I attempted to reach out to the hotel a few times before this stay via e-mail and got no response. The email address used was the one listed on the website (timessquare@hyatt.com). Will I be back to the Hyatt Centric Times Square, yes but did expect to hear something back even on the day of arrival when I emailed and said I’m on my way and will let them know if my flight gets delayed or canceled.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric has all the hallmarks of a great hotel. Great service, nice gym, clean rooms with all the great amenities and very close to Times Square.However- the one thing that sets this hotel apart was the rooftop bar on the 54th floor.It was just lovely to be able to have breakfast , coffee or a cheeky drink on the rooftop and see into the distance across the New York skyline.There are a lot of hotels near Times Square but this one is special and we would recommend it all day long!Stunning!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel offers a great location just minutes from Times Square. We found the hotel staff to be very attentive. However the lobby area of the hotel and elevators and hallways etc. seem to show the heavy use the hotel justifying gets.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I recently stayed here for 10 days. The room itself was lovely, amazing view down to Times Square and well serviced.Unfortunately the staff are horrendous - definitely the rudest and most uninterested hospitality I have ever had from hotel staff. Do NOT expect any help with information or bookings from them, the guy on the desk was super unhelpful and only interested in pushing one company (for the open top bus)- which turns out you could get a better deal buying from one of the street vendors straight outside the hotel.On another day we wanted to go out to the Woodbury outlets - he told us the only way to do this was via bus (the same company he recommended above)and it would be $42 - we took his advice and went to catch the bus - however the was a HUGE line and no seat available, was on a first come first served basis with no notice given to times booked on your ticket. We did some googling and got a private shuttle the next day for $49 instead. This is something hotels should help you with - especially one that charges what this one does. On the positive side, if you want to be right in amongst it all the location of this hotel couldn’t be beaten. We enjoyed the rooftop bar (a little $$ but that’s just NY) and the service from the staff there was great! Not sure I would recommend as I’m sure there are others just as close to time square who have polite and interested staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel to stay in. This was my first time visiting New York so I really did not know if I had chosen a good hotel. The location of this hotel is great. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel dozens of times. The reason I have been coming back is the greatness of the staff and the awesome quality of the hotel itself. Jenny and Rachel are wonderful! Very recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a really wonderful hotel. Right in the middle of everything, in Times Square, and though truly quiet and peaceful. Our room was huge, we chose the two queen beds with a view over Times Square and...what a view!!!!! We were in room 2503.It was very clean, and Betty, our chambermaid, was always there to help us get what we needed.We had a coffee machine in our room (though it was very hard to connect to the power), but it was excellent to have a good coffee when we were back from walking all the city!Rosalba, in reception, was the best of the hotel!!!!!!! So nice and sweet, helping us in every possible way with a smile on her face. I wish her all the best, she was exceptional.The breaskfast is the worst part: it was very, very good, but the price was astronomical!!!!!Also, the retainer they take from your account isn't so nice.All in all, a great hotel, I'll go back my next time in NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned from 5 night stay at the Hyatt Centric, fabulous hotel. Rooms decent size. Two big beds suitable for 4 people and very comfortable. Clean towels and bed linen everyday. Room had a little fridge, ideal for water, snacks and drinks. Bottled water supplied everyday and there’s a coffee machine, we asked for extra coffee which was no problem, you can ask for a kettle if you prefer to bring your own teabags. Iron, ironing board and hair dryer all supplied. Staff very friendly. We didn’t visit the rooftop bar as one of our party was under 21 but we did go up during the morning to have a look at the view (just wait in lobby from 10.30 am and someone will take you up)Excellent location 2 minutes from Times Square, would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: first of all , i have to tell you about their clean room , they had hardworlk staff that they cleaned room every day . their lacation is near Times Square that you can go there on your foot . if you want great restaurant its near the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed there with my wife and son. The location is excelent. It is very close to Times Square. Although it was just a l few steps away, we were not affected by the noise of the crowds and traffic when we were at our room. Our room was clean and bright, size was ok. It had excellent view of Times Square. Having coffee and tea maker in the room was nice. There was free internet in our room but it was quite slow. Staff was polite. I recommend this hotel for the good balance between price, location and the quality of the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We came to NY to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and stayed at the Hyatt Centric 4 nights. We loved it, we were welcomed, acknowledged, taken care of. The room was above expectations, new, clean, modern, spacious, quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel (this was not our first time in NY). I should mention as well the 54th floor lounge bar with a breath taking view of New York...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Best hotel experience in NYC. Great rooms, caring staff, central location. Never had a better experience at any NYC hotel. You will love it! Personal service (they know your name), caring and friendly people who make you feel so welcome.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for our Daughter's 15th birthday trip.Lupita Davis and Marian.P. went all out to ensure we had a spectacular time. Lupita decorated our suite , had a cake and surprise gifts for my daughter. Could not have asked any thing more . They made our trip memorable. We'll be definitely staying here next time we're in Times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has everything you could want. You enter and there is a scent that refreshes you from the less pleasant odors of the outside air. The checkin/out process is easy and pleasant. The hotel feels new and is maintained well. The rooms are modern and not stuffy. The views are great. The bathrooms are great and the beds are the most comfortable ; especially the pillows. The restaurant is laid back and unrushed and provides respite as does the gym and spa. The roof deck it really nice but a club at night if you want excitement.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for a business trip. The location was one block from time square and easily within walking distance to broadway shows, restaurants and shopping on fifth avenue. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Hotel staff was very courteous with efficient service. The lobby restaurant and rooftop bar definitely enjoyable. The meeting rooms worked very well for our group. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We choose Hyatt for the reputation of cleanliness, affordability and helpful staff. This location exceeded my expectations with their gracious staff, wonderful room and easy travel to all top NYC destinations. I highly recommend this Hyatt Centric for first-time or any other NYC visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I found the hotel to be a great value, fantastic location. Rooms where very clean and the staff was friendly. I would strongly recommend the hotel for either business or pleasure stays. Thanks for the great time

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything about my recent stay at the Hyatt Centric was excellent! First, the location superb! Located about a block away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square - close enough to be convenient, but far enough away from the chaos to be quiet (by NYC standards).I arrived by cab, and was greeted at the street by the bell staff. Throughout my stay, I was greeted by them each time I arrived back at the hotel. They provided great local tips, and great service, including arranging car service back to the airport for my departure. Security - I appreciated the presence of hotel security in the lobby, requesting to see my room key, prior to being able to go to the elevators. My room was modern, and was very clean. The views of midtown were fantastic! Location is convenient to multiple subway stations - each about 2 blocks away. Very close walking distance to numerous attractions - Top of the Rock, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, etc. Bar 54, an indoor bar with a rooftop patio, is located on the 54th floor. Pricey, but the views are well worth cost.I'll definitely return to this Hyatt on my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My first trip to NYC and I was accompanying a friend who was attending a conference in the city, so we stayed around Times Square. It was a good intro to NYC as a lot was within walking distance, however if I ever do go back to NYC again I would definitely NOT want to stay anywhere near Times Square.. It's very touristy, crowded, and tacky, eventhough it's a must-visit for first timers. Lot's of homeless people and panhandlers on the streets as well - not that I'm not sympathetic, but this is just something non-locals won't be used to seeing.The hotel had a very small plain lobby that was always busy due to the location and restaurant, and the rooftop bar. Otherwise though the rooms were clean, newish, modern and well-thought out (albeit a little tight but this is NYC right..?).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When I came into the lobby and up to the room, I was immediately impressed. Then, it went downhill. Why? Security for one. They have a lovely rooftop bar. That ANYONE can get to in the main hotel lobby elevators. So, if someone follows you back to the hotel, they can get a pass to the hotel bar and get immediate unfettered access to the entire hotel! HUH? In this day (and in Times Square) is that really a good thing? The security would ask me for my key before I went up, but then I would share the ride up with people who were not staying at the hotel and could walk off the elevator at any floor. Second - I found old fruit under the drawers area by the TV. Me thinks it's not so clean then. The lobby was very, very, very small. There was one seat in the entire lobby that was in a very busy area. That was it. Room was nice, bed was a good night's rest and bathroom was lovely. That is the only reason I gave the hotel 2 stars.I would not recommend staying here with kids because of the security issue and club people going up and down the elevator every day. Disappointing for a Hyatt to be so lax in people's security.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having booked in three weeks in advance what was advertised as a 4.5 star Hotel, we arrived at the Hyatt Centric at 02:30 am after 2 long hours queuing in immigration and a 8:30am business meeting ahead of us we were all ready to go straight to sleep. The night manager asked for our ID, looked at the computer and then disappeared leaving us standing in the lobby for 25 minutes. After insisting to the security guard that she ask the manager to come back out she returned and said, sorry, no room at the inn!! The hotel double had booked. I insisted that she must be mistaken since we had prepaid but she was equally insistent that there would only be 2 rooms available the following day. I spoke to Agoda who were equally shocked and after another 30 minutes (now 3:30am)we were transferred to the Grand Hyatt Central. This hotel is a three star (although ranked higher) hotel, not well maintained with dirty carpets. Still at 4:00 am, with 3 hours to sleep, beggars can't be choosers.The next day we returned unfortunately to the Hyatt Centric. The room was on the 6th floor and the windows paper thin, so we consequently heard every car, ambulance and noisy drunk as if they were in the same room. Double glazing obviously wasn't in their budget, neither was maintaining the room, training the staff, or cleaning the stains from the carpet. The walls are paper thin and you can hear your neighbours, cough, and flush the toilet......The only redeeming feature in the Hyatt Centric is the soft pillows. Other than that, take my advice from a person that spends half their life in a hotel, and do not book here if you want peace and quiet, modern luxury and a clean neighborhood. If you want to stay at a Hyatt then go to the Andaz.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Surprised at how comfortable and clean this hotel was. I’m not the biggest fan of staying in Times Square because of the noise and lights, but this hotel is very quiet, very clean and made it a great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: In this day and age it takes a lot to impress me, and the Hyatt delivered for our 25 anniversary. I happened to mention it was our 25th anniversary and it took off from there. We were given VIP service and some great ( I mean GREAT) memories. I never thought I could be won over like this, but now I’m a loyal customer to this brand because they hit a home run for me. I can’t say thank you enough. So far everyone has been awesome! Roses and gifts...sweet! This is a great choice for your Big Apple anniversary. Room 3606,,, nice! Corner room view of Times Square. Not too high, not to low. Perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice time at this place, but get ready to get ripped off at the rooftop bar, insanely expensive.. the room was clean staff is great, including door person gave us a complimentary wine for my wife’s birthday which is a good plus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: fantastic! could go on forever about the service we recieved but i wont. just know location is central to everything, staff are friendly, and will make your stay as pleasant as possible. highly highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hotel made and effort to make me feel welcomed and the manager on duty was Super accommodating and did her best to anticipate my needs. The bell-men were also great and courteous as well I could tell that they had a customer service mindset.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked a room for my son and daughter-in-law for their first anniversary. Hotel had the room ready, welcoming them into their rooms with petals on the bed, wine on the table, and treated them with daily complimentary breakfast. They had an absolutely wonderful stay. I am very grateful to the hotel for arranging for the couple a stay they will never forget.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The roof top bar is a great view except if you are not a smoker your experience will be ruined. There a people smoking left right and center. No one tells you that is a smoking area. The drinks a supper expensive (2 drinks- rum and coke and a mojito = $60)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A category 6 Hyatt hotel? Literally a joke. The hotel was very disappointing. We booked two queen rooms and requested the rooms to be connected beforehand through Hyatt's official website. Upon check-in at 5pm, there were only two staffs at the counter despite a line of people and the actual check-in process with the staff took more than 10 minutes. The male staff who checked us in informed us that our rooms are connected (note we didn't ask at the time when he told us that but at the end of the process, we wanted to double check and he confirmed a second time that our rooms are indeed connected). And it turned out when we went to our rooms, the rooms weren't connected. We then had to go down to the lobby and ask what was up. Another male staff at the counter explained the room that was supposed to be connected was occupied but he would check with his manager what he could do. He went into the room right next to the counter and didn't come out for another 10 minutes. When he came back to the counter, he informed us the best thing he could do was to upgrade us to different rooms with a fee. It's ridiculous how bad the service is with the false information and wait time. It's not even a category 1-4 hotel....but a 6. What's more annoying is that the hotel has 4 elevators but each one is small and always takes over 5 minutes to arrive. The hotel is basic but overpriced. I get it's close to Time Square but that's the only good thing about it. Each of our rooms had 2 queen beds but the rooms aren't big. Parking is $70/night and apparently one room had a fridge and the other one didn't.Won't be staying here again. I'd rather stay at the Herald Square one.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel for location originally but keep returning here because of the staff, and the condition of the rooms. 1/2 block from Times Square, close to shows and 10 blocks from Penn Station, NYC are major reasons to stay here. Staff here is friendly, hard-working and courteous. Rooms are clean and comfortable. 5 elevators help access.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely hotel, close to the theater district, appreciated security officers in lobby and even 2 at night, good restaurants nearby for breakfast, lunch and dinner, complimentary bottled water was fabulous. We look forward to returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very easy access to Times Square and all the touristy attractions that are in the middle of New York. Our room had fantastic views and we were on a high floor. We didn't like the fact that in or room, the shower handled came of the wall as we were trying to have a shower on the night we arrived and the light system was really weird. If we tried to turn on the side table light, the bathroom would lit but our bedroom would turn off. We went to BAR 54 and that was a rip off, I wrote another review for it, I wold certainly not recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were here for 4 nights over last weekend. The location is great. We had a corner king suite with floor to ceiling windows with great views of Times Square and surrounding area. A Keurig coffee maker in the room was a great convenience so we did not need to go to Starbucks. Great large stall shower with rain shower and hand held with good water pressure. The mattress is very firm even with the pillow top. We had 2 large flat screen LG TVs that had excellent picture quality. Our room was very quiet even though it was next to the elevators which are fast and you don't have to wait long for one. Housekeeping was excellent. All of the staff was very helpful and friendly. Security is good as you need to show your room key to get to the elevators. Check in and check out were fast and easy. Our 1st night we had drinks at the roof top bar with spectacular view. Drinks at $26 are very expensive. We had breakfast one morning in their restaurant and it was good. Be aware that 18% gratuity is already on the check in bar and restaurant, so no need to add a tip. We will definitely stay here again when in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location, location, location says it all. I am a female alone on a business trip and felt super safe going out in the evening after work. So much to do and see all within walking distance. Shopping is a plus!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked 2 nights stay with Hyatt Centric Times Square hotel via hotels.com and paid in full in advance. However, after I checked in, I got message from my bank (Chase) that the hotel charged me another $622 for room. I checked with the hotel and they told me they didn't understand why it happened and it must be due to an error, and that they will correct it if I called my bank. So I called my bank and let them talk with the hotel manager, after the call, she confirmed that the error charge will be released in the same day.5 days later when I got back home from the trip, the error charge was still there, no action was taken. I called Chase card, they acknowledged that they know about the incident which was noted in my account, so Chase will give me temporary credit of full error charge $622 immediately and send this case to dispute department and Chase will send me update info regarding the disputed amount after 2 billing cycles.I was so impressed with Chase card customer service (I'm not working for Chase) and very disappointed in Hyatt Centric Times Square hotel service.I wrote the same review on hotels.com via the link they sent me to leave a review for the hotel, however, for some reasons hotels.com did not post my review even though I called them and ask why. Hotels.com admitted that I already submitted a review for Hyatt Centric Times Square hotel and said they will report to the management and get back to me in 24 hours and they never did. Thanks tripadvisor for letting me write this review.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Check in was a breeze! It went quickly and they will hold your bags for you. I requested an early check in and they were able to accommodate me at noon! The location was ideal! It easy access to the center of Times Square without all of the noise and flashing lights. Everything is at your fingertips including Starbucks across the street. Communication was constant via email and phone notifications. The elevators are speedy and you don't have to wait long.The room was very spacious, clean and modern. The floor to ceiling windows brought in so much light and gave quite the view. I also want to mention the air quality. It wasn't stuffy and the air conditioning was steady all night. (A lot of other places tend to shut off in the middle of the night.) The elevators Check out was simple too!I also have to add that I feel very comfortable bringing my young son here and i'd return in the future. Tip: Meet in the lobby at 10:30 for a trip to the rooftop for an exceptional view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I were in NYC for a work conference, I have worked in Hotel management for a number of years(although not for a few now :))and I have to say this hotel stands out! Walter, the front door gentleman, sets the standard for “First Impressions” he was GENUINELY happy to see us, a warm smile and opening of the door was a great start. The front desk team was efficient, helpful and friend. A rare combo in a big city hotel. Service during our stay was equally up to the task. Afterwards, when I realized that the postcards my wife bought for friends and family back on the West Coast were packed and came home with us, Rico, front desk manager at the hotel, was gracious enough to let us have them mail them for us after we sent them to them to be mailed! Great place, great staff!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was visiting NYC for business and the Hyatt Centric was an amazing home base! The rooms were crisp, contemporary, comfortable and clean, yet homey and the staff were very helpful. The hotel values your security and ensured to check for room keys to access the elevators and the elevators were like lightning, which is important in a building with 40+ floors. I would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have never been to a Hyatt I didn't Love, EVER. I plan my vacations around where Hyatt locations are. I highly recommend this location as well as any Hyatt location. Def sign up for the points program.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful hotel with good size room. The bathroom was large, good closet space, water and Keurig coffee maker a plus! The location was close to everything but very quiet. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a week in July before traveling around. Firstly the welcome and all the staff we encountered throughout our stay were so friendly and helpful. We stay with our 2 children and our family room was really spacious and had everything we needed. The location was perfect for what we wanted, and there is a great deli next door for snacks and food to pick up on the way to the park etc. The roof top bar is really cool, kids are not allowed unfortunately but they were allowed to pop up in the morning to see the view. I can not recommend this hotel enough. We stayed in 7 different hotels over our holiday break between New York Cape Code and Boston and this was by far the best. Thank you for an excellent stay- we hope to be back again next year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazing location. Clean and modern. Even though hotel is right in the heart of Times Square the rooms is quiet. Our luggage was lost by the airline. The hotel staff were very accommodating and provided us with the basic necessities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is very well located - just 5 mins walk from Times Square/Theatre district.It suited our needs perfectly. It was comfortable and the staff were very helpful.My only issue was one with their housekeeping that failed to replace used glasses, etc. even after bringing it to their attention.Our package did not include breakfast, but that's never an issue in NYC as there's generally an Italian deli within a 5 min walk from wherever you may be.Overall a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you're looking for a centrally located hotel in NYC, look no further.. the price and value is perfect here. Everyone working at the hotel is nice, welcoming and hard working. This place is a homerun!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in New York for 6 nights, celebrating my 50th, before flying to Vegas for the weekend and then onto LA.The Hyatt Centric is well located, just 1 min from the main part of Times Square - perfectly away from the craziness but within touching distance.It is also a great base for exploring the rest of New York either on foot or on the subway.Our room was spacious and really clean, the main did a fantastic job looking after us.A really nice touch was the birthday gift that was left in my room by the hotel management - thank you again Thomas Blundell.One of the main 'must do' things in the hotel is the 54th floor rooftop terrace bar, even if the drinks are a little pricey (to be expected at a venue like that, but worth it). The views, especially in the evening, are amazing and we only had to wait around 10 mins to get a seat on the outside terrace, sitting next to a piece of floor to chest height glass with a 54 floor drop to your side.Altogether a fantastic place and a hotel I would definitely recommend and return to.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel.Staff very nice.Keurig in room too.Good location if your a touristBathroom was nice, except the shower door bottom had some rust and the plastic guard on the bottom was cracked. Should have been fixed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked two rooms. The second one was only available after several complaints after 9 pm. Snappy communication, unfriendly approach, not willing to help, no recognition, even after 6 days. Definitely not worth the 5000 dollars we spent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was in New york for a work trip but invited my girl friend along to visit the city. The hotel was so close to time square. Personally I would not stay here again because time square is so hectic but location wise it cant be beat if you want to do all the touristy stuff. The Subway is just 2-3 blocks away and it is centrally located. The hotel lobby is small and there is a ton of people drifting in and out. The hotel rooms were small but eligant, typical for New York though. The roof top bar can not be beat, an absolutly amazing view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. Friendly staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Always checking our room key so felt secure as you came into hotel. Conceriere was very helpful getting us the tickets we needed to do tours

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Opted to stay here because I’m a fan of Hyatt and it was a great location for my wife and daughter to have a safe quick walk to see Hamilton. I believe it was over priced. But it’s NYC at Times Square. Staff was very friendly and personable. Lupita came out and greeted us with a welcome package. We had a free breakfast coming, but with the late night and the very comfortable beds, we all opted on sleeping in and missed breakfast. The shower is amazing. The room very nice. We’d stay here again but look at getting a cheaper rate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were attending a show on Broadway so wanted to stay close by. Property is beautiful and wonderfully clean. We were warmly greeted by the check-in person who alerted the Concierge of our arrival. We had been in touch during the week about some specifics and she came out to greet us and gave us a small gift! What a nice touch. Room was very clean - balcony room! Lovely and clean. Maid was nice as well. Bed is very comfy, room was cool, quiet and dark!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was recently had a midweek trip to New York for business. My sister came for a visit while I was in town. All I can say is this hotel is amazing. It was very centrally located, and the rooms were pristine. I would recommend it for anyone trying to stay in Manhattan

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There is nothing but praise to bestow on this hotel, from staff welcome, exceptional room with rare two queen beds, and more, we have rarely been so welcome in a big city. Members of the Hyatt travel program receive over the top great treatment.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel from all point of views. It’s placed just next to Times Square -what can you wish more. The people in the hotel are friendly, helpful, the view from our room on the 47th floor was incredible (especially during a storm), rooms are modern, spacious and the bathroom was huge and great. Hotel to be revisited !!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There were two options for us how to spend our time between flights at JFK:• To have a calm relax somewhere close by• To drive to Manhattan through traffic jams, crowds, etc.Option No.2 gad been chosen by a majority of votes (2 of 2). So, Hyatt Centric Times Square became our night refuge that way there. Upon checking in the receptionist kindly reminded me about my deliveries which I’d ordered from Amazon – some vinyl and CD’s – the preparations for the next Hard Rock trips. Many thanks for that, ‘cause I’d almost forgotten of them...The next mandatory stage at Manhattan hotels – the first imagination of a view. And it was fantastic with a piece of Times Square from a 30+ floor!Our try to have a short walk failed as it’d been practically impossible to hew a passage through crowd around Times Square, and then we recalled about a bar at the hotel’s 54 floor. Once there we took the point that our room view wasn’t seriously worse. It made us go downstairs to the hotel’s T45 bar & restaurant where we spent a marvelous hour sipping Bourbon (myself) & Chardonnet (my wife).The next morning, we were permitted for a late check out having had an opportunity for one more (and more successful) walk near Times Square – due to too early time for the most of the rubbernecks...Good relax, even it was too short – just between the flights.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want a great view of New York city try Bar 54, the tallest rooftop bar in the city atop the Hyatt Hotel. Drinks are expensive, but worth it to spend some time looking across the city. Bring you friend/lover to impress!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a week. The location was excellent. The room big (from Manhattan standards) and clean. We didn't get to try any of the dining options within the property as there were plenty of choices outside. From halal food trucks to Juniors just a little walk away, and Shake Shack and Hell's Kitchen a little further down there is no dearth of dining options in this location.Overall, we were satisfied with our stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time I have stayed at this hotel. Conveniently located to Times Square, Shops, and Broadway. Large health club. Nice size hotel room. Ate lunch in the hotel; delicous quinoa burger. I will definitely return

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Home away from home, I was very happy and so was my family. The hotel staff greeted me very well and took care of every need of mine. I would definitely stay at this hotel every time I go to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent experience through Booking.com. This hotel has an excellent location and accessibility to a myriad of fun activities, food, drinks, entertainment, last but not least, the view is breath taking. Love New York City

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was clean, smelled exquisite and was in a great location! Highly recommend! The staff was courteous and helpful. Rooms were in great condition and clean. Would have liked to have more variety of food for room service. Limited menu. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a wonderful boutique hotel located adjacent but not directly in Time Square. Wonderful staff, great on site restaurant and just wonderful stay. The higher floors offer the best view and the top floor bar is amazing. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had never heard of Hyatt’s Centric brand. This hotel was terrific. Great staff. Rooms were very clean and appeared new. Incredibly comfortable bed with a great quality mattress and pillows. And a Drybar brand hair dryer, so much better than the typical hotel dryers. Located just off Times Square, but heard no noise as my room was on the 36th floor. There is a rooftop bar, which was packed and had great views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is excellent, walking distance to all the major attractions and there are good restaurants close by. Our room is surprisingly not small. We like the heated bathroom floor and the ceiling water faucet. The service people are very nice despite being busy. The front desk also has a nice arrangement for airport transportation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location in NYC next to Times Square. Staff are attentive and gave great service. The room we had was a little tired and in need some tlc but this didn't detract from the overall experience. We would return here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location - good hotel - nice room with great view. The staff were very nice/ helpful despite being very busy. The only negative was that it was very expensive due to the excellent location right next to Times Square. If we come to New York again would probably look to pay less and pick somewhere further away from Times Square given how easy it is to get around the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The personnel worked hard to forget the fact that the hotel isn’t excellent. The room was small, the bathroom wasn’t clean the ventilation is weak. No minibar, the elevators are small and busy. When we were there on of them was out of order so we had to wait sometimes 10 minutes. The restaurant is good but extremely expensive compared to the others in walking distance. But the location is really excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The destination fee of $25/room was not indicated at check-in and obviously was not discretionary. It is annoying to be charged for things which are part of the normal rate (eg a room coffee machine), and it is deceptive. Spoilt the stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A nice hotel located between 6th and 7th Avenue.Its location is good for those who are looking to spend a lot of time at the Times Square.The room was so small for me. But it was clean.The price was relatively high compared to other hotels.It is a good choice if people don’t mind what I mentioned above.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel for location. 3 second walk right into the heart of times square. The staff at this jotel are extremely friendly and very helpful. The roof top bar is amazing as well... the rooms however were quite small but thats to be expected in the city. The bathroom in these rooms are incredible though. Amazing shower and a good size. All in all I would stay here again when i next visit NYC. We arrived early expecting to not have a room ready and to just drop our bags. However when we arrived the front desk said they had a room available for us! Many thanks to the staff at the Hyatt Centric. We will be back and we will stay here again. Also try the moscow mule at the bar.... excellent drink!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Shawna and Mickey were very helpful and accommodating! The entire staff was a pleasure and I will definitely be making the Hyatt Centric my go to hotel when visiting NYC. Could ask for a better location! Thank you for everything!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms were large for NY, clean and staff was extremely nice and helpful. I was traveling with my daughter and liked the safety factor of checking room keys prior to getting on the elevator. Room service was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms in this hotel were reasonably priced, clean, and in walking distance of Time Square, Central Park and multiple Broadway shows. The staff were all extremely pleasant and genuinely cared about their service to customers. At different times of the day, there is a bit of a wait for the elevators but people are nice about squeezing in together or waiting for the next elevator. When I checked in, I was given a debit card for $75 to spend in the hotel. There is a cookie jar at the front desk and water and cups in the lobby. The food and drinks were a bit pricey in their restaurant so we only ate there once; however, the food was very good. If you want to book the spa, do it the day you check in as it gets filled up quickly. Cleaning staff did a good job. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room we had was nothing short of spectacular. The balcony was was the cherry on top with views of Times Square that were absolutely breath taking. The staff here was always ready to go the extra mile. We had a fantastic stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a week and always found the staff both helpful and willing to go the extra mile to help. The room was well furnished and clean and everything worked as if should. The bed was almost too comfortable which made getting up even harder. The food in the T45 restaurant be it breakfast or lunch was very good. with a nice range to suit most people. Special thanks to the lady on concierge, (I wish I had noted her name) that sorted out my helicopter trip problem.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is well located, half a block from Times Square and close to many restaurants. Valet parking employees are very friendly and helpful. The facilities are well kept. Love their mattress and pillows. Timeless Spa products at the bathroom makes the stay extra special. The front desk was great, and jumped into helping everyone at the lobby in the middle of the rain, giving away orange umbrellas or everyone. They definitely know how to keep the guests happy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a friendly hotel - from the valet meeting you at the door, to the check in desks, right through to the ladies cleaning the rooms. Everytime we say someone we were greeted with a smile and a friendly hello. Nothing was too much trouble for anyone. The room was larger than was expected in New York with good amenities and plenty of bottled water, tea and coffee in the room.Beds were so comfortable, great to snuggle down in after a day and evening sightseeing. Very near to Times Square and the subway. We were on floor 25 which was great as it was serviced by all the lifts 1-25 and 25 - 54. They have their own cars to go to the airport as well which was clean with a very polite driver - couldn't ask for better. Thank you to everyone, a hotel for us to remember when we are next in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Jeff was checking us in and had some complications but Mia was able to straighten it out. Took awhile but worked out well. Location is great. Rooms were clean, spacious for NYC. Bar on top floor expensive but views are wonderful. We didn't eat and meals here as there are many great places locally. A bit pricey so check for deals.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful hotel to stay at in Times Square. Second time I have stayed here and everything is consistent. The staff is extremely knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating. You are 50 steps (literally) from Broadway which is much better and quieter. You can see everything from your hotel room window and rooftop bar. I would absolutely recommend his hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was nice and service was good UNTIL the housekeeper woke us at 9am. We had a do not disturb sign on the door and had not checked out...why wake us at 9am? VERY poor service from housekeeping! PLEASE train them!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 3 nights and picked hotel for location and decent room size. After a long flight from AZ we just wanted to relax but was told room wasn’t ready and will be notified by text. An hour of waiting in the lobby, we hadn’t heard anything. I asked a different front desk agent and was told our room was ready when we checked in and why we were told different was a mystery. After mentioning that it was our 10 year anniversary trip and first time to nyc, we were only offered a $15 credit. The room had a deflated balloon and toiletries were not fully stocked. Housekeeping finally restocked toiletries the next day but left a cleaning rag in the restroom on the shelf. Also noticed employees in lobby are too comfortable with each other and reflects lack of professionalism. I felt like I was intruding on their conversations to ask for anything. I guess I was expecting more as a honor rewards member and chose this hotel based on the great reviews of upgrades and over and beyond hospitality for celebrations but was greatly disappointed. Other than this we loved NYC and will return but will choose a different hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the place is a dump old property trying to look nice ..I order food in the morning came in a paper bag and it was 40 dollars are F*****ing nuts and ICE COLD. no one picks up the phone at guest services day or night had to call 7 times to talk to some one your security looks like TSA rejects. The only person that had a clue is the door man

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I can’t fault this place for location right next to Times Square great shopping nearby. Very comfortable beds and rooms and great maid service and a good gym but those extra bits just not there. Can’t get a decent coffee or tea sent to room handed kettle and tea bag to make our own Staff at front desk and around lifts really not friendly with kids Food for dinner super spicy and inflexible when asked to make less spicy ??? Avocado toast and Rice can be made without chilli but also just really chaotic side of town constant noise from cabs and cars will stay quieter side next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the hotel for one night using Hyatt points. Great location, great room, very clean, comfortable bed. The room has coffee machine and a mini fridge which is very handy. Welcoming and helpful staff. The 54th floor roof top bar is very nice on a nice evening, but it gets very busy and has very limited food service. The prices for drinks are outrageous, but perhaps that is the NYC rates. I would recommend this hotel (prices permitting).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room was made available quite early...very clean and comfortable bedsExcellent location ....ladies at the reception could be more welcoming ..nice stay will definitely go back next time I go to new york.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was very pleased we chose the Hyatt Times Square. Excellent location & we could come back for rest in middle of day if necessary. Room standard was excellent and kept that way every day (special mention for room servicing staff btw). Had warm welcome initially at check-in. We were early so didn't necessarily expect that rooms would be ready so no problem with this. Went off to explore for a few hours. However when we returned after check in time we had a different receptionist who was off-hand and no apology that room was still not ready. It is a shame because the isolated negatives impact the overall positive experience. Bar staff not great and one really not competent but otherwise restaurant good if a bit over-priced. But overall was pleased and would recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited as a family, booking two rooms. We have stayed previously in NYC, and many of the rooms have been "snug" to put it politely. At this venue, the rooms are very spacious, and spotlessly clean. As you would expect, there countless eating options in the area, including one on-site. As a suggestion, you'll find better restaurants if you turn left (ie:away from Broadway) There's an excellent breakfast place just before the next intersection. In our many visits to New York, this is the pick of the bunch - by a long way. There are two sets of lifts: 1-23 and 24-53. Try and book a street-facing room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our first Hyatt Centric experience was fantastic. A modern, clean, quiet yet hip oasis in the middle of the Big Apple has need to be seen to be believed. As a well traveled we were treated to service and personal attention the likes of which we have rarely experienced. Don't miss the opportunity to stay at this jewel of the Hyatt family/

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Still staying here as I do the review but felt I needed to thank the hotel for making my daughter and I trip so special. We had been staying in the Royalton on 29th which is also a very nice hotel with roof top pool and stuff but when we got here things stepped up a few gears. A beautiful hotel with everything just perfect. My daughter said thank god where in a Hyatt now dad, there’s a clue there somewhere. Great room on the 42 floor with lovely view. The sky lounge on the 54 floor is something else as well, sunning at nighttime. Amazing staff all round but would like to give a special mention to James and Liz down at T45 bar. So friendly nice people and James was treating my daughter to special drinks and chocolate brownies. They even sent the one we did not eat up to our room for us as we were off out for dinner. These are the things that count and why we always try to stay with Hyatt. Thanks again to all at this tremendous hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, quiet, and accomodating. Staff is very responsive and helpful. Great location! I will stay here everytime i come to the city! Management was awesome as well. And its right in the middle of all the sites.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great stay, great view, great service! We stayed here for 3 nights, enjoyed the great location, almost at times square without litlle infiltration of the noise pr business of the square. 2 min walk to the subway and connected to the whole city. We couldn't have had a better place to stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a nice hotel in a great location. Room are decent size and beds were great . Staff pleasant and had umbrellas - which was welcomed in the rain. Our biggest disappointment was that the rooftop was adult only - even before 6pm. Not family friendly at all

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Close enough to Times Square and Broadway shows, without being dead center in the chaos. Couple of Irish Pubs/Restaurants on either side of the hotel, as well as a little convenience store to grab snacks or hot sandwiches if needed. We had a high floor room with a city view, could see the Chrysler Building but the view overall wasn’t spectacular. Small room but OK for just 2 people. Soaking tub was a bonus after walking NYC for hours. Shampoo/conditioner/body wash all terrible, and impossible to get out of their containers: definitely bring your own! Room A/C was pretty decent, but hallways, elevator, and lobby were not. Overall, an average hotel that's fine for a short trip where you're not soending much time in your room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently stayed here and the woman at the front desk was friendly and upgraded our room at no extra cost so that we could have a view of the city and even gave us a voucher for drinks at the rooftop bar- which were very helpful considering the drinks were outrageously overpriced (you’re basically paying for the view- not the drink itself, but to be fair the view is great). I didn’t like how there was a line to get into the elevators just to go up to my room. The gym was very large and had several different machines, I was actually quite impressed. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again as it is close to many attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent full service hotel in the middle of it all. Great service and very welcoming. Food was excellent and concierge very helpful. Attended theatre and explore city with lots of fun shopping. Could not have been better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent all around property. Well laid out room. Property is well-maintained. Amazingly quiet despite being so close to Times Square. Folks I shared the room with complained about the shampoo and conditioner. Be aware of 25$ per day destination fee.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I took our 16 year old twins for a Broadway weekend. Three shows in two days with fine dinning between. The Hyatt Centric was the best. A suite with large balcony, two bed rooms and three bath. WOW, triple the size of my apartment when I lived there. We have stayed in many NYC hotels, location and quality makes this the best. Will return soon

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We couldn't have felt more welcomed by Lupita Davis and her team at the Hyatt Centric. Some love Times Square and some hate it, but all can agree that it bursts with frantic energy. The Hyatt Centric is a beautiful respite from the madness, and the staff made us feel superbly welcomed. We were celebrating our twin daughters' birthday, and the team decorated the room in a fun and festive way. Many thanks, Lupita, and thanks as well to Steve at the front desk!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hyatt property is a Hidden Gem off the hustle and bustle of Times Square. From the moment you walk in, the staff is welcoming and ready to accommodate your needs. The rooms are comfortable and appealing, giving you a place to rest and call home for the time you spend in the city that never sleeps. Great value for the money at a hotel brand that will never disappoint you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel is great and the staff very helpful. Our room was spacious for 2 adults and 2 teenagers.The room vue was wonderfull (stairs 45). The breakfasts are varied and hearty. It is a good starting point to visit NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location for our 4 day trip to New York, was able to walk to most of the attractions we wanted to visit. Only problem was housekeeping didn’t come one day and had to call guest services to be told sorry didn’t have enough staff we will come tomorrow-thankfully this was rectified and our room was serviced. Other than this a great place to stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I were there to celebrate her birthday. Lupita Davis created a memorable moment forus. Upon returning to our guest room after a day of sightseeing my daughter was surprised with balloons and a birthday gift. What a way to celebrate turning 17! Thank you Lupita and Hyatt Centric!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We got a room over looking the corner where Good Morning America studios are. It was real fun to watch people outside the studio trying to get attention of the cameras. The room was small but very clean and the AC worked nicely and without much noise.For Manhattan the price was reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Obviously the location of the hotel is marvelous for any tourist. But this group went way above and beyond.I celebrated my birthday in NYC and decided to vacation close to Times Square. I have 195 nights at the Hyatt and used to be a Globalist until recently. I have to say, this Hyatt is by far my favorite out of all of my visits!!Upon check-in, the manager came out and personally greeted me to wish me a happy birthday. That was first class on their part. They also upgraded me and fixed my room quickly so I could check in. The crew also lets you stow your bags up front (they do that for all guests) so you can walk around NY until your room is ready.When I got to my room, the crew decorated my room!! The door had a happy birthday poster and inside there was a nice cake with a happy birthday chocolate and a gift bag of touristy items. WOW. To top it off, they helped me celebrate at the rooftop bar upstairs. I was speechless with this type of treatment.It didn't stop there. Jessica, my room attendant, was working (8mos pregnant) and still managed to get me and my guests waters and anything we wanted. She was so attentive and nice to us. I wish her well with her little miracle!The final day, they let us do a late check out and kept our bags downstairs as we toured the city. What makes me love this place is the service everyone provided me.I truly had a very memorable experience and can't thank Hyatt Centric Times Square enough for the excellent hospitality and care for me and my guests. THANK YOU!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric was the perfect place to stay. The staff was amazing, the rooms are beautiful and the location is perfect. It was my son's first visit to NYC and Lupita Davis and the staff at the Hyatt Centric made our stay exceptional.We will definitely stay at the Hyatt Centric again when we visit NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Enjoyed staying here - the Hotel is in a central but very busy position. Rooms are very comfortable and have everything you need. Food in the Restaurant was very good too but the Wine prices are way over the Top.If you don`t like crowded areas then this hotel is not for you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as part of a package we won at an auction. The location was very convenient to everything. The staff was friendly and helpful. We left an item behind when we checked out and were very pleased that the housekeeper turned it in to the lost and found. We appreciated the honesty and helpfulness of the staff in returning our lost item. I would recommend this hotel for anyone staying in the New York on business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Prior to booking the Hyatt Centric in Times Square, I had researched all the other hotels around the area - Westin, Marriott, etc etc. However I decided to book the Hyatt because I am a Hyatt Member.I booked our trip (anniversary trip) online and a week before our visit I received a welcome email from Lupita Davis of the Hyatt welcoming us. She asked us if there was a particular reason for our trip. I told her . Upon our arrival we were greeted with such warmth. We were told that we were VIP's and Lupita had asked that we be treated as VIP's. We got to our 47th floor room and it was absolutely amazing. WOW! the view was phenomenal and it was a gorgeous suite overlooking Times Sq. The bedroom had been decorated with rose petals and there was a bottle of chilled Rose waiting for us with a lovely note from Lupita. The staff was amazing and so welcoming. The rooftop bar was simply breath taking. We arrived a couple of times and their patio was full, but they made us feel so welcome and found us outside seating so fast. The room was quiet (no noise from Times Square) and the housekeeping was amazing. All in all I would go back again. We are considering going back in August. Do yourself a favor, book the Hyatt Centric. Oh! most importantly it was on Times Square but set a few feet back which made all the difference in the world because you could step away from the noise, get Uber rides easily. Lots of great food places nearby and my favorite Bryant park was a few blocks away. We went to see The Phantom of the Opera, it was just two streets away. What an amazing hotel in the most convenient location. wow!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here on our honeymoon for 3 nights in July. Couldn't fault the staff or the cleanliness of the hotel. The amenities were good too. We didn't experience any problems or issues whilst staying at the hotel. My only advice would be not to bother with the sky lounge. It has great views, but the prices were ridiculous, even for New York. It also slightly annoyed me that hotel guests had to wait in the queue to sit outside, when I feel that paying guests should have priority of this. I would stay here again if (hopefully when) we return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hard to find many faults with this hotel, the rooms are great - large comfy beds and nice views from the floor-to-ceiling windows, bathroom was modern with large shower, room was cleaned spotlessly daily and plenty of bottled water and other amenities available.Staff couldn't be faulted either, all polite and friendly and happy to help with anything. We had a late flight so our bags were kept in a back room after we checked out until we needed them, and they were happy to sort a car to the airport for us too.Location is fantastic too, just a minute's walk from the hurly burly of Times Square but the hotel is surprisingly quiet considering. Would recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I requested an early check in due to a long flight from Australia, and a nice view of Times Square. We weren’t disappointed. The staff were exceptionally accommodating, and made our stay a memorable one. The location was good. Most sights were within walking distance. My only regret was not being able to have a cocktail in the rooftop bar because it was too crowded at sunset.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff, The Hyatt Times Square has some of the best people in the hospitality business. The rooms have always been spacious, clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are large & shower water pressure is like a fire hose. Splurge for an upper level floor for some of the best views of Times Square & the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Extremely good spacious, clean rooms with really comfy beds with the best sheets, must be Egyptian cotton, after a busy day in New York City it was a real treat. Situated in Times Square provided a good base to explore New York, the room were extremely quite given the location. Staff were amazing and very welcoming, huge thank you to Laura on the front desk who kindly booked transport for us to the airport.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is our first stay at this property. Check in was easy. We had pre-checked in online through the Hyatt phone app. Prior to our visit we received a number of emails from the hotel staff welcoming us. Lobby is small and a little conjested but a minor complaint. Free water in the lobby. Casual restaurant/bar off the lobby with very nice staff. We had a room on the 44th with a small slice view of Times Square. The room was very well thought out. We have had bigger bathrooms in New York but only if we spent $100 more per night. The bathroom was great and very modern. Everything was new and worked and linens very nice. Coffeemaker, fridge and free bottled water very nice. Large screen tv. We did get some minor street noise but slept great with ear plugs. It is NYC after all. Our room was spotless when we arrived and kept that way during our stay. Staff checked with us to make sure we were happy several times. Rooftop restaurant/bar very nice. Auto checkout was easy. They hailed us a car for the airport and before we got there the hotel checked with us to make sure we enjoyed our stay.We would definitely stay there again when we need to be very close to Times Square or the main subway lines.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here this past weekend for our honeymoon. They let us check in 3 hours early. They gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne with rose petals in our room. Also a $50 credit to the rooftop bar. Honestly everyone there was so nice the place was very clean the view was amazing. We will definitely be coming back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric at Times Square is a top notch hotel. Clean, well kept, friendly and efficient staff. Very nice top floor bar, super location for Broadway shows and Midtown attractions. Of course you pay accordingly for the location and the high quality of this hotel. The lobby is small and easily becomes congested at busy times of the day is about the only negative I can think of.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our first visit to New York and we had a fantastic stay at the Hyatt Centric, the hotel is just off Times Square so a great location but still quietI contacted the hotel in advance of our stay as it was a special trip to celebrate our Daughters 16th birthday and the end of her exams and Winnie arranged for us to have a high floor ( the 53rd ) which had fantastic views of the skyline , and when we checked in there were a couple of special gifts and a birthday card , such a lovely touch The rooms were spacious and serviced every day and I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again , all of the staff that we came into contact with were friendly and welcoming Thank you Hyatt Centric for making our first trip and truly special one

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just spent a few days here for business travel. Room was very clean and comfortable. Had dinner in the bar and it was very good. Great location for those who want to be close to Times Square. They have a rooftop bar but I did not make it up there.
