There are a lot of nice details - flavored water in the lobby and cookie jars at check-in - that make it a little more special than some of the other hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean and lovely room. Seamless check in, check out. Loved roof top lounge, a little pricey for drinks and food, but view is worth it, especially at night. Rooms cleaned daily. Complimentary coffee, water. Security at all times.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My 5 year old son has been enamored with NYC all year so we wanted to give him an authetic NYC tourist experience by staying close to Times Square. With the vast amount of hotel options it was hard to make a selection but I'm glad we stuck with Hyatt based on prior experiences at other cities. The hotel is close to Times Square but not on the Square so it gives a bit of a buffer from the noise and

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spent 7 nights here and the stay was just perfect. The room was surprisingly spacious, always spotless and plenty bottled water. Room 3903 had a great view of the city and World Trade Centre. The staff were always very polite and friendly. Check in and out were both a breeze. Definitely my place for staying the next time I cross the pond.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a really nice hotel in a great location. You are only about a half a block from Time Square The hotel is very clean and the staff is super nice and helpful. I will definitely stay here again the next time I travel to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My room was great. Everything seemed new. Very clean. Large comfortable bed—not too soft like lots of luxe hotel beds. Very polite and helpful reception for check-in. My room on the 35th floor had a great view of part of broadway. But there was some noise at night, even from that height. Curtains are heavy enough to block light from the street. If I stay here again, I’ll ask for a different side of the hotel to limit noise. The rooftop bar has a fantastic view, really impressive. It’s on the 54th floor, and you can see the Chrysler building and all the way down to One World Trade Center. The drinks are very expensive ($25 cocktails) but worth it for the view. On a weeknight I walked right in and had a great outdoor table. Did not have a reservation. The waitresses are not the nicest, but not atypical of waitstaff in this area. I would go back just for the view. The bar has some food, mostly appetizers, which were good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For our first trip to New York City, we could not have been more pleased with our hotel, our room, or the view. Exceptional service, quality and care. The location could not be better centered so close to Times Square - proximity to a number of Manhattan's finest features.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We felt very valued and stress free. A very clean and friendly environment with a professional and down to earth approach at the heart of TSQ. I’ve posted pictures on Twitter on @HyattCentricTSQ for those who wanted to check it out. An unbelievably smooth experience in every way!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here in Early July. Great location, just off Times Square. Room has everything you need but is typically NY size so a little small. Bathrooms are good with a spacious shower. Suggest letting the shower run for a few mins before you get in so the temperature settles. Bathrobes and slippers have to be requested from the front desk. Rooftop bar has amazing views but suggest you book to get a seat and it’s understandably very expensive. Slight disappointment is that we emailed hotel in advance and didn’t get a response... they have managed to email me several times since check out though asking me for feedback.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our bucket list cross off. We had a great time. Loved the location, staff is friendly and courteous. Housekeeping so awesome. We will share our experience with all our friends and family. So satisfied.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic location. Reception staff very accommodating and understanding. A nice welcome when you walked into hotel. Food very nice. Opportunity to enjoy breakfast outside. Lifts worked very well. Didn't have time to us but gym and sauna provided.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There is room for improvement. However, the prices are decent for a NYC hotel, there is a nice rooftop bar with a view, a gym, and very clean spa! I would consider staying again but would prefer a hotel to be more organized! My family of 4 stayed in the executive suite. There was supposed to be complementary water and coffee, but there was one 16 ounce water and one k-cup, and 2 towels. Also a pill bottle was left from previous guests. The lack of readiness for a family of 4, even with the room not being ready until 6pm, was disappointing. I'm also disappointed they don't have a late night menu. Otherwise- the staff were very nice!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just got home from spending a week at the Hyatt Centric. We had requested a floor with good views away from the lift and that is exactly what we got. The trip was part of my sons 18th birthday present and there was a complimentary bottle of wine in our room upon arrival also money credited to out account to use in the restaurant which made this whole trip perfect un every way. The hotel in in a great position and room so spacious for New York. Wish we had stayed another week.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a special part of our honeymoon, my wife and I spent the weekend in Manhattan and stayed at the Hyatt Centric. They went all out to ensure we had a spectacular time, from special treats and surprises on our arrival to attentive service and excellent results from every member of the staff, including the concierge who helped us arrange all our activities around town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our experience with the Hyatt is always great. New York proved to be just as good. The staff was extremely professional and helpful. Lupita provided me with help in preparing the room for my wife's birthday, she loved the decorations Lupita set up. The staff at the T45 restaurant were very pleasant, Mickie, Maria, they made our experience wonderful. The room was excellent, the view was amazing. Room 5302 will be our go to whenever staying at the New York Hyatt. Thanks for the GREAT experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The only negative thing I can think of about this hotel is that it's not grand. It's a newer hotel, so it doesn't have unique architecture. Other than that, it's all good.Newer is often better. So clean. Surprisingly large rooms for NYC (standard anywhere else). Friendly staff. Small, or non-existent lobby, but again, it's not grand. Security staff check for proof you're staying there (flash the room card) during the evening and overnight. It's hardly a nuisance and I think makes the guests feel safe.$15 lunch specials make the T45 hotel restaurant a bargain for great food.Would definitely stay here again.Hyatt does it right.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my second trip to Hyatt Centric Times Square to celebrate my anniversary and we had a great time. The service and room was exceptional as always and our anniversary welcome gift is always in our room when we arrive. We can’t wait to celebrate again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From valeting the car to checking out, our entire experience was great. The room was spacious with great views. We'll be staying here next time we're in the Big Apple. We will be checking out the Sky Lounge on our next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful. Great location. Great customer service. Beautiful rooftop bar but only 21 and up. Ask the price before you order a drink- cocktails between $20-25 and a sprite bottle was$5 plus tax! So as long as you don’t drink there, it’s a perfect spot with great amenities and friendly accommodating staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel couldn't have been better, right in the heart of Times Square. The amenities were great, the service was great. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because I thought the room was rather small. Not much room for 2 people to move around. But overall I have no complaints. I would definitely stay there again. We had a wonderful time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located to everything . Easy walk to theaters, restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was especially large and modern for a New York hotel. The roof top bar had breathtakingly views of the city at night- but be prepared to pay for that view. I feel it was worth it. The music selection at the bar was not our taste, but we weren’t staying there for more than an hour or two anyway. Perfect night cap.Overall it was a positive experience and we WILL return for another visit, hopefully soon!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a family vacation. The three of us in a king suite with a pullout sofa. We were on the 49th floor in a corner room. We could see Times Square and the NYE ball if we twisted our head a bit. Overall, our stay was good here at the hotel. We would stay here again. PROS:Great location! Half block to the chaos of Times Square....everything was walking distance. You can either walk, cab or catch the subway to where ever you wanted to go. We walked to Central Park, 5th Avenue shopping, Times Square, Lyric Theatre (and even from Battery Park- which I don't really recommend unless you are up to it physically but it can be done). Comfortable beds. The king size bed was comfortable and the pullout sofa was decent for a pullout. Two TV's and space to your own: we traveled with our 11 year old son, which had the pleasure of taking over the living room/pullout bed area. He loved that he had his own space. He also loved the fact that he could decide whether he wanted the blackout curtains closed for the night or to keep them open with all the Times Square lights glowing into his area all night long. This added space helped tremendously. Quiet floors: limited number of rooms on each floor. I think we counted about 11 rooms on our floor. We didn't here a peep from anyone on our floor, in fact it was kind eery. I know there were other occupants because we saw housekeeping cleaning the rooms daily. Housekeeping: they were very patient with us. There were days when we asked them to come back and clean the room later (several times). They were never put off and they always made sure to come back when it was convenient for us. Bellmen WALTER: he definitely made our stay. In actuality, he was the only staff member that went out of his way to take the time to talk to us a bit. He was awesome! During our conversations with him, he learned that we were planning on departing the day of the Puerto Rican parade. He made a special effort to let us know that we should try to get out of the city early to avoid the street closures and added traffic. He arranged for a driver to take us the airport that morning with no problems. So glad for WALTER and his helpfulness. It was nice to know we could come down and get advice from him on a daily basis. Bottles of water: loved that the hotel provided bottled water as part of the $25 per day charge credit. Housekeeping was intuitive enough to know how many people were in the room and left enough for at least 1 bottle per person per day in the room. They also replenished daily without us having to ask which was nice. 10:30am tour of 54: This hotel has a wonderful rooftop bar. Unfortunately, if you are staying here with kids the families can not take advantage of this night time view. BUT, hotel management does offer a FREE daily tour at 10:30am to take families up to the rooftop bar to see the view. The view is amazing! I would recommend taking advantage of this opportunity. The management staff leading the tour let us take our time and was not pushy about the time we spent up there. Cons or Opportunity for Improvement:Concierge: Not helpful at all! Tried to get help from them twice and after that decided that WALTER the bellmen was more helpful. Both days that I spoke to the concierge the employees both seemed to busy to stop and speak with me (although there was no other guests at the concierge desk). We did happen to get one concierge staff to give us a tip on where to rent bikes for Central Park, although disappointedly when we arrived at the bike rental company they asked how we learned of them. We told them our concierge staff referred us. They then asked if the concierge gave us any coupons for the bike rental (which is what I am assuming is the standard process) and we said no they did not give us any coupons. The bike rental company was nice enough to give us a discount anyway but it made me feel the concierge desk at the Hyatt Centric was subpar at the least, and really was not a resource for it's guests. The 2nd interaction was me inquiring about he REDBUS tours. Since I did not want to be bothered by all the people no the street trying to sell us the tours I asked our concierge. He simply told me "well we can sell you tickets here if you like." No further information or conversation at all. Hmmm....are we bothering you to do your job? I felt both interactions with the concierge staff were short and curt. Both staff members on different days did not seem like they wanted to go out of their way to help in any way at all. Very disappointing to say the least.Marilyn Monroe Spa: warming.....I would think twice and maybe a third time before booking anything at this spa. We have stayed and been guests at many resorts with high end spas (ex: Mandara Spas at different locations). The spa was disgustingly dirty (dirty towels laying all around the locker room), the front desk clerk very rude and lacks customer service training. My husband booked an appointment with the spa the day before we were departing. We wanted to use the spa credit the hotel gives for the $25 per day charge. Unfortunately, the whole situation was a disaster. My husband's appointment was for 11am. He arrived and checked in with the front desk clerk around 10:45am. He was shown to the mens locker room by the front desk clerk, never given a key for the lockers, a robe or flip flops and was not given any tour or directions of the spa. He went into the sauna for a few minutes and around 11;05am he decided to go see if they were ready to take him for his 11am appointment (since in other spas they have an attendant come and get you when the therapist is ready and no one seemed to come around 11am). When he finally found someone- the front desk clerk, he was told by her that "they had been looking for him and since he was in the shower (not) she did not feel comfortable coming in the locker room to get him." ??? It was now about 11:15am and he was told by her that his appointment was cancelled and he was going to be charged for the appointment as a no show. WHAT!!??!! Really? I ended up coming to the spa about this time and we requested to speak to the Spa manager (which was a male employee). He reiterated what the front desk clerk told us but after some discussion decided that we would not be charged for the appointment- wow! We then asked, do you not have a male employee to come alert male guests in the locker room that the therapist is ready for their appointment. The manager told us that the staff need to come get him (the manager) to go into the locker room to alert the guests their therapist is ready. REALLY? This was never done. In the end, we ended not being able to use our $100 credit for the spa (which was a waste). The hotel really needs to do some monitoring of the spa and please do not include them in the $20 per day credit for the $25 per day charge. It really made our stay at your hotel tainted. I did mention our situation to the front desk upon checking out and they were appreciative that we told them but it stopped there. They did not offer a credit on our room for the inconvenience. Very disappointing. $25 per day credit: useless except for the bottled water. I don't think we drank $25 worth of bottled water per day. Please re-think your credits for this charge. Most of it was just fluff and with the debacle we had at the spa....we did not recoup our credit for this $25 charge. Please take a look at other hotels in the area and see what they are doing. Most provide a $25 food credit per day from the hotel and/or bar.Shower: well let me just say this.... please pay careful attention to the shower. If not you will end up with a bathroom floor completely flooded! I had read reviews about this so did not feel as stupid when it happened to me. It actually is a flaw in the design of the shower door. After the first time it happened, I paid closed attention to this and it still happened minimally a second time. Design of hall/closet/bedroom door and bathroom door: we had a corner room so not sure if this is applicable to all rooms but the hallway area between the closet, bathroom and bedroom is ridiculous. There is one barnyard door which alleviates some of the problem but otherwise it is a mess. The doors all hit each other and it is impossible to move around that area when one of the doors is open. Not a deal breaker but it is a "what were they thinking when they designed this?' moment over and over again during our 5 right stay. Elevators: kind of a mess! Some elevators only go to certain floors so pay attention. It seemed that everyone needed the elevators for floors 25-54 so long lines and confusion almost every night. My son actually ended getting stuck in the elevator doors because of the confusion of people cutting the line to get an elevator and then half of our family getting on the elevator (because we didn't want to be rude and cut the elderly ladies off). Not sure how to fix this problem but something management might want to pay attention to especially at night when more patrons are using the higher floor elevators. Overall, good hotel and location. Loved that they offered suites in this area which seems rare for hotels in Times Square. Recommend that most of the staff go through some customer service training (maybe Walter and housekeeping can be the lead trainers) to meet the standards of the hospitality industry.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a World Hyatt member I expect nothing but the best staying at a Hyatt. When I arrived I was greeted by the concierge and the valet parking attendant. The valet parking gentleman was really nice. Upon checking in the front desk clerk checks me and NO greeting as a World of Hyatt member. She didn’t explain about the hotel she provided me my keys and that was it. I am not sure if thats how it is in New York but I did not derail my trip. After they took our luggage and we are waiting on the hotel porter and he took forever so we started trying to take our luggage ourselves. He then comes and says we can’t but he also did not know what room to take the luggage. At this point I just wanted to get to my room and I did. Once I arrived in the room it was definitely smaller than the usual rooms from Hyatt but it was clean. Overall, I would stay here again as the rooms were clean and the location is superb. We were in the heart of time square it didn’t even take us a minute when we walked from the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Aside from being centrally located, this hotel has poor customer service. When I reported that I was bitten in bed and asked them to change my sheets it never happened despite my request twice the same night. They didn't even apologize when I reported the incident.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a great experience for our family of 4. Rooms were big by NYC standards and were very quiet. Always greeted by the staff when we got back to the hotel. Just a block away from Times Square, yet the room was very quiet. Didn't have an opportunity to try out their restaurants or other amenities, we were always on the go. Pillows were too soft for us, but they gave us some different pillows which worked out great. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visit NYC every 3-4 months, and have stayed at this hotel for the past several years.The fact that we keep coming back to this hotel when there are endless choices speaks for itself. We have stayed at many other nice hotels in the past, but so far, this is the one that works best for us. Feel free to read my other reviews of this property. Overall, the location is fantastic. The rooms are comfortable and offer breathtaking views. The staff and service are great. Good assortment of room choices to fit your budget. Great value for the money.Feel free to contact me for info. Glad to help out and welcome you to my home in NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic hotel, spacious suite = amazing Times Square & Hudson River view from 43rd Floor. Location is brilliant and so very close to my favourite library in the world : NY and Bryant Park. Running in Central Park is bliss for the week

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Close to everything! Time Square, Central Park, Subways etc.. Parking was expensive and unexpected and should have be discounted for guest. The freshly made ice tea upon entering the lobby was very refreshing and delicious.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked Premier Suite for anniversary, most i have ever paid for a room. TV remote missing when i arrived had to manually adjust tv for 2 days.(not a deal breaker) However water leaking out of light fixture over toilet at 1am is. Stayed up 2 hours dealing with this issue. Hotel discounted my room by half for one day the day i complained about remote missing. I feel like room should have been discounted by half for entire stay after water leak.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hi, I'm Ralph Ciaio form USA i know this is the best hotel of NewYork has best system and cleaning services is best for our enjoyment and has location is nice place of newyork me and my family is very happy to going this hotel last month

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just returned from spending 3 days in this hotel. We booked 2 rooms taking our daughter and her family to all of our first visits to New York City to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary. The location was perfect for us as we were attending 2 musicals and were able to make dinner reservations ahead of time close to our hotel and the theaters. We thoroughly enjoyed Times Square and being so close. The staff were all very pleasant. Our rooms were both very very clean. The shower was wonderful. The rooms are not large but when you visit New York, you are basically in your room to sleep and shower then take off again. We were on the 34 and 38th floors--the view was not great but the rooms were very quiet--short hallways and few rooms on each floor so really nice and quiet to sleep. The elevators are fairly fast so not long time waiting. My hair dryer did not work but I always carry a small one as a backup and didn't request a different one--didn't have the time to spare and it was no problem. They have a computer so you can print out boarding passes--up to 5 with no charge, which was handy. The doormen all deserve a shout out as they were so friendly and helpful!! It did rain some one of the days we were here and they had plenty of umbrellas to give out, which was much appreciated. We would definitely return to this hotel if we return to New York, City. Highly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff were very helpful and friendly. I was upgraded to a room on a higher floor because my room was not ready at the time of check-in. The customer service was on point and the lounge on the 54th floor is a must see! Great views, good cocktails, good vibes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had just arrive from a difficult performance in DC and 8-hrs in the airport for delays and cancellations! The staff made sure I had a quite and restful room. The location was perfect close to many things. I had to leave to perform a show in the Hamptons at 5 AM and the staff was very helpful!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was great! It was right in the center of time square and we loved it walking distance from everywhere. If we needed to go far we took Uber. Rooms very clean and nice and bar on the roof top amazing views. The also had spa services and room service!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When we checked-in, nobody greeted us inside, nor did anyone offer to take our bags, because surprisingly such a hotel did not have any bell desk who took your bags, so you have to bring them yourself. The check-in person was also quite unpleasant, but at least she was quick.The room itself was quite okay, it was not dirty in any way. The beds were reasonably comfortable enough for the price range. The views were pretty good. Wasn't times square, but good enough. All the staff other than the check-in were friendly, though the housekeeping staff always, and I mean ALWAYS, forget to restock some amenities. Whether it is forgetting to restock the keurig coffee capsules, or something else to their liking.The location though, was what it was all about. It was great, only a few dozen steps from Times Square. Keep in mind though, that being in Times Square for such a long time isn't good, and you'll find it boring if you stay too long.But if you insist on staying in Times Square, this hotel shouldn't completely be off your list.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We love this hotel and have been staying here every time we visit NYC in the last few years, which is once or twice a year. Great Rooms, great views, great location! We love the lounge on the roof. Very close to all the mid town action.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Traveled from upstate to see DEH. Hotel location is perfect-quick and easy from GST (we walked) as well as to the theater and Times Square. Staff was courteous and professional-offered a rush to our room (and delivered) even though we were almost 2 hrs early for check-in. Asked for a late check-out, something I typically try not to do during very busy holiday times, and were accommodated an extra 1 1/2 hours--which, wow. Spacious, clean room; room's a/c worked like a champ; loved the walk-in shower (clean-yeah!); beds were huge and comfy--I never sleep well when traveling, so my teens and spouse said to give it a big thumbs up; and the view was great. Our room's noise level was perfectly fine and on par with being smack in the middle of the city. You hear construction from surrounding rooftops and em. sirens below but nothing out of the norm. Foot traffic in the halls if people are loud, also the norm for us. Were asked in the lobby to present our key each time before going to the elevator banks for added security (or maybe we're just a little hillbilly looking, ha). Elevators were efficient, no horrendous wait times like I've seen for other hotel reviews, so that was a huge plus. Getting to the top floors is quick, in case you have an ear pressure issue--yawn or pop gum. *perhaps don't open the room window (very small opening, neat to hear the city below or have a breeze) if you want your afraid-of-heights spouse to ever travel with you again. ahem* We ate at the restaurant once, which was delicious, but then stuck with the cafe very close to the hotel for other meals due to our teens being picky eaters. Just a decent, quick visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square was a great find. The hotel was clean, spacious, and well-appointed. The staff was always friendly and accommodating. The T45 restaurant was fantastic, with great breakfast options and service. The location was key, very close to the PLI Center, Times Square, and 5th Avenue.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for a week.Had a perfect stay with no problems whatsoever. The staff was helpful and our needs were met. The location is great for a stay at Times Square. Rooms were nice as well and spacey for a hotel at Times Square. The breakfast was delicious, however there was limited options.Overall it exceeds the Manhattan standard and offers a great stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The view from our window included The Freedom Tower. This hotel is perfectly located for Broadway shows, restaurants, shopping and walking. We felt safe outdoors at night, and walked everywhere: Broadway, Times Square, St. Patrick’s Cathedral for Mass on Sunday morning, and The Cranberry Cafe for our breakfast. Bobby Vann’s Steak Restaurant (wonderful) is directly across the street.We explored Midtown every day and still could easily walk back to the hotel for a break from the street noise and the heat (hot June days).The hotel staff was helpful, friendly and safety conscious. The room was bright, small but efficiently laid out and comfy. We plan to return and request the same room!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this property on a Sunday night in June. It was located just a couple blocks from Times Square and was my first time at a Centric brand property of Hyatt. This hotel was very clean and staff was accommodating and friendly at check-in. Room was large for NYC standards and very well appointed. Great view from my window on the 38th floor. Total cost for night was $248. I did not get an opportunity to try their lounge or restaurant area and they are a multitude of food options in area.This is probably one of my nicest stays in a NYC hotel. I would definitely recommend it if the price is right at the time of your travel. I noticed the price goes up quite a bit during weeknights.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: booked through virgin holidays a room with a view of times square I got a room (which was a great room) but it was on a middle floor with no view of times square but a good view of a carpark this was my only complaint of the hotel and couldn't fault the staff or hotel for anything else in my opinion you would struggle to get a room with a view of times square as its such a built up area the view from the roof top bar was amazing

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Besides the great loaction and the heated floor and the spacious nice bathroom I can not really find anything great about this hotel. Maybe the view, I suppose it depends on your room as well. It came across as a wanna be contemporary hotel, with modern decor, however the carpet is a horrendous nightmare and definitely completely unsanitary. Who has carpets in hotel rooms nowadays, carpet goes along well with the used and up beaten old furniture. After living in Dubai for and ex amount of time I feel my standard are different. The staff was very nice. I didn't try any food as the breakfast was extra and I choose to find a vegan eatery outside. Bed was way to soft for me, but I prefer as firm as possible ...difficult to find in hotels anywayOverall I feel this place needs a major renovation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The decorating is truly horrendous. Lamps looks so cheap and nothing matches. Our t.v. was mounted on a white board with graffiti. The carpeting is a tobacco (greenish brown) color and textured. Unfortunately, you can see how worn down it is on all room paths. Call for extra pillows because the two pillows on your bed are thinner than the "My Pillow" back home. Hallways feature brightly striped carpeting and brightly checked wallpaper. Now the good news...The location is great, a half block from Times Square. They have a fantastic rooftop bar, albeit expensive. They let us check in early, giving us a room on 7th floor and our friend got a room on 41st. I think the front desk felt sorry for our room location, because when I asked if they had any discount coupons for drinks at the rooftop bar, she gave us a $50 credit to use up there. (Our total bill for two drinks was $65 with tip.) The beds in the room are comfortable and the room doors close quietly. The bathroom looks to be recently remodeled, with beautiful black and white tile. The lobby had a nice water cooler, which was fruit infused, but that disappeared during our stay. You can ask for bottled water at the front desk. The room had a Keurig coffee maker and two bottles of water (complimentary). I would stay here again if the rate was low.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Always love the Hyatt, but this one is pretty high up there with respect to customer service and overall experience. We only stayed one night, but loved everything about this hotel. From the friendly and helpful staff to the rooftop bar. Within walking distance to Carmine's for Father's Day dinner, to a fun walk to Rockefeller Center and Starbucks is right across the street for that early morning cup of coffee. Highly recommended to all! And just an FYI, elevators are extremely fast, made my ears pop quite a lot.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just spent a week here for our first trip to New York. Great experience all round except that we had asked for the 50th floor but they claimed to have no record of the request and tried to charge us a $100 a night upgrade to do thatSo the hotel is clean and modern and our room was clean, modern and spacious on a quiet 18th floor which had a partial view over Times Square. The downstairs reception is small and there’s a nice bar off to one side which is predictably pricey but good. The location just off Times Square is fantastic and you can enjoy it all very easily yet quickly get away to the quiet of your room.The hem is the roof top bar on the 54th floor. Again the prices are high but the view is worth it and you should go early to get a chance at an outside balcony edge table.Overall yes we’d definitely stay here again but maybe we’d ask for confirmation of our request in writing this time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I took my daughter to NYC for a good bye trip before leaving for college in Louisiana. We have been going to NYC since she was small and we wanted one last splurge before she left. We always try to stay at a Hyatt as they never disappoint. This was no exception! Great trip and hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good, clean, well-located, hotel. Would be great for business, when your company was paying the bill. Not so great for a family vacation. We stay at Marriott's San Francisco Marquis for less than half the cost of this property

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I wouldn’t normally choose Times Square to stay in NYC but as I was taking my son to several plays, it worked out well. We walked to the theatres and the subway. Location is great. Room was clean and comfortable. Minimal noise (considering location). Room service was fast. Housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful. We went up to the rooftop deck and enjoyed the view. I’d stay here again - very happy with this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here 26-31 December and had a very enjoyable stay.The room was on the 42nd floor and was spacious enough to accommodate the 4 of us.This hotel is just around the corner from Times Square yet there was no noise or disturbance at all.The doormen were always very friendly and there was warm apple cider in an urn by the front doors to warm us on the bitterly cold days although this was frequently empty so could do with being replenished more frequently.The wait for the lifts was annoyingly long sometimes especially when you are cold and tired and just want to get to your room.Cleaning staff were very friendly and I thought it was nice to receive an email from the manager whilst we were there checking everything was ok.Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hotel was an excellent location as a jumping off point to see the city. The valet parking made the whole trip possible. The room was a little small and the view was nothing special. The cleaning crew seemed to use our room as a home base and was in the room every time we came back between 11 am and 2 pm (sometimes on the bed talking on the phone). The lobby folks were surly upon our return and requested to see a room key every time we entered the lobby. I would definitely recommend due to convenience but would never recommend this hotel as a feature of a trip. The least enjoyable part of every day was when we returned to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay (first time in NYC) - we were there for a week and still felt comfortable in our room at the end of our stay. Plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. Coffee and tea making facilities and supplies appreciated - as was the small fridge in the room. The floor to ceiling windows gave an absolutely brilliant view of the New York skyline - including from our room my favourite NYC building The Chrysler Building! Everywhere was clean and fresh. Large comfy bed and easy chair and large footstool. The walk-in shower was easy to operate. The free wifi gave very good speeds. Within walking distance of 5th Avenue, Bryant Square, Empire State Building, Grand Central etc

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good: clean rooms, housekeeping, lighting, outlets and bathrooms. Coffee, bed and bedding, improved front desk staff, darkening shades. Gym has machines and doesn’t seem depressing or dirty. Attempt at recycling. Decent TV channels, as the WiFi buffers, that is important. Swift elevators. Thankfully, no automatic elevators. Bad: Marilyn Monroe Spa is simply where you wouldn’t want to be caught dead. Seriously? Front desk dropped the WiFi issue completely. The restaurant T45 is wow, not a hotel restaurant in spirit or professional. Was rushed to close check early in evening so an employee could go home. Necessary? No. There is no lobby to sit in unless you like to sit in Grand Central in the main hall. You can’t meet anyone there. Just not classy or conducive to civility. Security is willy-nilly. One minute they are asking you to state your room number to them, which is considered not the greatest idea anymore- but not at the Hyatt Centric. Other times, , you just feel like you’re walking into Sephora. I’m surprised I wasn’t handed a basket. Ugly: worst WiFi that is unsecured ( despite what the offsite IT) even after login. The Destination Fee is simply an abomination in light that the property offers nothing akin to a resort. Calling it a destination fee is abusive. No decent WiFi? Only unsecured? How about matching the Grand Hyatt in this regard. In room amenities must be called down for. Not hospitality. No robes, slippers, tacky toiletries. 28.69? Full disclosure- I’ve been at this property before when it lacked the added Centric. I am starting to think that the adding of the suffix and concept advice was bad bad. It was just the Hyatt Times Square and if memory serves, the front desk was a mess. This time, check in was great. Straightforward. Likewise, my departure was handled well. The room was quiet for the most part and that is a huge plus. The bathroom has an overhead shower which I guess is another reason why management thinks it has the prerogative to charge a Destination Fee. The WiFi or lack of security obliterates that notion. Ditto no luggage rack. Hyatt Centric believes that fruity water in the lobby which, my goodness is a mess, makes the hotel spa- like. You can’t be a 4.5 star wannabe if your lobby is not welcoming or classy. Forget it. Be the best 4 star. Start there. The location is neither a plus or a detriment because it is ideal equally as it is problematic at best or horrific at worst. The riff raff buzz of tourists, traffic and noise is just well it depends. If you a from a quieter part of the world, you may love it. Maybe. Enough to pay through the nose? Hospitality is just a basic in any hotel. Forget a four star or above. The restaurant should be treating its hotel guests, as guests, not trying to close out their checks so that an employee can leave early. Bartender seems great but all of a sudden, someone has to leave and well.... the gentleman next to me had to ask if he could still keep ordering.. poor thing. It was 8:30pm, not two am in Times Square...They slapped an automatic Service charge for tip and wow, that is insulting if you are sitting alone at the bar reading. I was told that I could put that charge on the room to rush me even more...nice. I did speak to someone who listened but who knows. The Hyatt Centric is convinced of its own quality and that is inexcusable today. There are better three stars out there with better training and professionalism. Even for a Hyatt, this was lacking in quality or the perception of it. How tourists pay this fee is just embarrassing and again, abusive. Go to Europe and experience great service and you will soon learn that hotels like The Hyatt Centric Times Square are mediocre at best and just another tourist trap.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I loved the modern decor and fun lobby. The front desk staff was very welcoming (and funny!) and the check-in was quick. I was pleasantly surprised to see a vigorous room key check for those people entering the elevator lobby (in the evening, not all day), which added a nice level of security. The location can't be beat - easy access to everything! The rooms are really nice, well-decorated and the bathroom is great. Plenty of counter space, the shower has a huge shelf for toiletries and there is even a leg rest in the shower for shaving. My only negative comment is that the bathroom is fully stocked with single-use amenities, which I suggest should be available only on request, in order to try and help the environment. There is a recycling bin in the room, which is great, and the lighting seems energy efficient, so that's all great. We heard hardly any street noise, so the windows are really good at soundproofing. Excellent property!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was our first time to New York so we didn’t have a great idea of what we were looking for in a hotel other than reading other guest reviews online, but this hotel ended up being perfect for us! The location was perfect - just half a block from Times Square with lots of people around so it felt like it was a safe area. Also, from what I’ve read, NY hotel rooms tend to be pretty tiny but we had a king city view room and it was a great size for my fiancé and I! It was also a very nice, clean room and we were very happy with it. We were the second room from the elevator, which we could hear going up and down fairly regularly, but it was not loud enough to bother us and was well worth the trade-off for how fast the elevators were! We never waited more than a minute or two for our elevator which is pretty impressive. Check in and check out were also very simple. Would stay here again if we came back to New York for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stunning views from our balcony and the rooftop lounge. Room was lovely and clean. Interaction with staff very welcoming. Experienced great customer service from Mr.J of the concierge staff all of his recommendation were top notch. Highly recommend this Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are a great size and it was clean. The exercise facilities are great and it was never crowded. I did not eat at the restaurant so I cannot comment on that, but thought the price of the room was reasonable, given NY standards.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here while taking in a show. The check in was quick if a tiny bit chaotic (no lines) but after that our room on the 38th floor was lovely, well-appointed, quiet, clean, and had great views. The staff was super friendly and the location was excellent, just a half block from Times Square. Have stayed at this Hyatt and the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Terminal and I actually prefer this one more. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It seemed a perfectly ordinary place to me. Clean, at least any NY standards, and slightly less run down than the typical NY hotel, but really, in any other cities, this would have been hard to distinguish from a holiday inn. Except by the price. Which was awful. But $349 for a very basic room. But here is what really pissed me off. I shopped around on price, because I know NY can be really expensive. I picked this place because I think Hyatts are generally very nice. Sadly., this one was pretty ordinary. But then, salt in the wounds, at checkout they tell me about a mandatory $25 resort fee. I am sorry, if you do not tell me until I am there, especially if it is at check out, this is robbery. If it is mandatory, it was dishonest to advertise the room as only 349. It was actually $374 and should be advertised as such

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here to celebrate my 50th birthday. Loved every minute.Room was lovely and the view was amazing.The staff were friendly and the bar was great.sat in the igloo having cocktails was truly out of this world.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric did not disappoint! I would recommend spending the extra money ( depending on the time of year you go, it may not be as expensive) We spent 5 days walking the city and went home to the most comfortable room in NY. We splurged for a bigger higher room and it was worth every penny. Lupita went above and beyond to make sure our stay was great!! She's a keeper, Hyatt... better not let that one go!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my second stay at this hotel and my whole experience was not very satisfactory. I arrived at hotel at 5pm and asked by front office staff to wait at reception for an hour as my room was not ready.Also, I was charged twice for duration of my stay and while checking out I was assured by front office staff that refund will be processed in 48 hours but nothing happened...still waiting for my refund.I will not stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You can't beat the location. Convenient, safe and close to everything. Starbucks McDonalds and best of all Times Square. Hotel is clean. From desk is friendly, but lacks personalization. Rooms are on the smaller side, but are well kept and clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here during Easter weekend, it was a girls weekend with 4 best friends. The hotel staff was very friendly, the front desk manager Ms Lupita Davis even wrote a message before our arrival if everything was arranged or if she could assist anything further. We received a nice room, it was very clean, bright. Big walk in shower, spacious bathroom so that even the 4 of us managed well every morning and evening in the bathroom. 2 double beds were also nice and comfy, big enough to share with 4 girls.Nice rooftop bar, nice breakfast, overall perfect stay! Who does not want to pay for the expensive breakfast, Starbucks is right across the street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So I need to start this review by saying that the Hyatt Centric Times Square hotel has shown some of the most amazing customer service I’ve ever received. A huge shoutout to Lupita who is their Director of VIP experience. She made sure every aspect of our stay was perfect and even had a little gift for our girls at Checkin. Also the valet and bell desk was some of the best in the industry and very friendly. Even the hotel bar/restaurant was friendly. We had to run down and grab the girls milk and they filled them immediately without complaint. I can easily say that the next time I am in New York City, I will be staying at this property. Keep up the great work!Thank you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location for going to the theater! And there is a Starbucks just across the street. We enjoyed the afternoon cookies and would stay again the next time we visit NYC. All staff members were friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at Hyatt centric for seven nights Great location just off times squarebut no noise when in roomA Little disappointed with view from room only on 10th floor but from was fine lovely beds and clean towels every day along with coffee and water replenished every day What makes this hotel standout is the staff so helpful at all times and none more so on our last day when our transfer to airport failed to arrive problem for the staff Soon had alternative transport arranged and we were on our way Thanks to all staff you made our stay excellent and if we come back to NYC wouldn't hesitate to stay again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quiet. Very clean. Very helpful before and during the stay. Seamless experience with excellent service. Location is just 2 blocks from shows. Rooftop bar on 54 th floor was amazing. Free cookies when you go by the front desk!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a surprisingly pleasant stay in the middle of Times Square at the Hyatt Centric. Nice room, good service, felt away from the bustling crowd once we got to our room on the 42nd floor. The roof top bar was wonderful, particularly on our first night in the city. Mickie downstairs in 4T5 provided friendly conversation for our last morning delicious breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Centric Hotel on a family vacation. It was a greatstay and we would definitely stay here when visiting NYC again.Pros: 1. Location is 1/2 block off Times Square and 1/2 block from the Minskoff Theater if you are seeing Lion King 2. Despite being close to the action, room was very quiet 3. We had a deluxe queen room which was spacious and clean. The bathroom had a separate tub and great shower with good water pressure4. We were upgraded to the 49th floor which had a great view! 5. Breakfast was great at T45, especially the waffles which had fresh berries on top (strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries)6. All the staff were friendly and professional 7. Room was ready for us when we checked in at 3 PM Cons:1. The room was starting to show little signs of wear (carpet, dings in furniture and cabinets) However, this was minor and nothing that would keep me from staying here again. For those who may book through Visa Signature Hotels, they honored all the benefits with no issues. Thanks to Hyatt Centric for making this a great vacation!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in a corner suite on the 52nd floor for 5 nights. It was so roomy and larger than other hotels we have stayed at in NYC - by a long shot. The bathroom was huge and very clean. We had a pull out couch in the living area and a bedroom with a queen sized bed. The views of Times Square were amazing from the ceiling to floor windows! We could see all the hustle of the Square and the lit up skyline at night was breathtaking! My kids were excited because they could see the New Years ball. The staff were all very courteous and helpful. The rooftop restaurant/bar does not allow kids at all. They have a tour each day at 10:30am though where they are allowed to go to the rooftop to see the views. There is another trendy restaurant on the first floor as well. The location was central to so many things - you can walk to most of the touristy things - Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Radio City, 5th Ave shopping, theatres and of course Times Square. We would definitely visit again. Also, upon arrival, we had a gift from concierge with a bottle of wine, a NYC mug and magnet, and two pairs of fun sunglasses for the kids. Another perk is the free water bottles each day (most hotels these days want to charge like crazy if you drink the bottles of water in the room). We had the best time and absolutely loved Hyatt Centric!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fabulous room with fabulous view - 2 minutes and from Times Square and no noise in our room. Ideally located for other top tourist attractions. Abundance of nearby eateries to suit all budgets. Hotel has one of the best rooftop bars in the city - views are out of this world. There is also a bar next to reception. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric for 5 nights. We had a great view if Times Square and the hotel was in a great location, where we could walk to several of our planned activities. The rooms were great and the staff went over and above to accomadate our family party of 8. The picture is from the roof top bar, that we visited one night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are looking for a good clean and location in NEW-YORK City look no further.Booked this Hotel after reading some reviews good and bad but my experience with this place was great.Arrived with my family on time for checking in and was smooth best of all was when we got to our room on 51st floor a Conner suite with a view of TIME Square and it was amazing.The kids and wife were so happy!!!The staffs was great on assisting us by coming up to setup the sofa bed for the kids and giving us a toothbrush.The rooftop bar(outside patio)have a great view but with limited seating and can be crowded.The reason I didn’t give it 5starts was for the food, it’s ok. The personnel was nice, they gave me a bowl of crackers and a glass of water while waiting for my order which was a take out since we didn’t want to bring the kids up.I will highly recommend this place if you are looking for a great place in Time Square NY.Will be back with no hesitation.Thanks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wow have never known to get add on fees after the booking. Also had a night cap at bar at 10pm for two and with add on fees cost $43. Will not be returning to this Hyatt in the future. AccomOdTions were nice but did not appreciate the add on fees.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: An absolute perfect location to enjoy what NYC has to offer. The hotel and staff could not have been any more accommadating. Rooms were very clean with floor to ceiling windows and a spacious shower-bath. I will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is our third visit since Thanksgiving and we have loved it every time. Great location, lovely accommodations and unbelievable roof top bar with fantastic views!There are no negatives for this gem inManhattan

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful hotel and staff. Rain shower was great! I arrived very early and the staff had 1 room available and gave it to me right away. The fruit water and cookies at check out were a nice touch. Top quality!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location less than 5 min walk to Times Square, hotel very clean and modern. Beds very comfortable. Breakfast is excellent and reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend. Only downside is the price of the drinks in the hotel bar very expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is at the heart of manhattan. You can just look from the wi dow to feel the vibrant energy of time square. Great location. Impeccable cleaness. Delicious food. Comfortable bed. My family and I couldnt ask for more

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location for catching one of the plays and experiencing Time Square. Central Park and 5th Ave shopping was a short walk away. It was very close to the 42nd/Time Square station for catching a subway to lower Manhanttan.The rooftop lounge very cool.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our suite room had excellent views of manhatten. Excellent amenities , Ms Davis , director vip experience , made our stay very comfortable. The hotel has excellent location well equipped gym and close to all action with close proimity to theatre district and time square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really was happy here. It's a block off 7th on 45th. Perfect for Broadway. As close as you could possibly be without being in the mob. Not a traditional luxury hotel. There are people to help you if you need it but most everyone was doing their own luggage. Desk staff were fun. Everyone was nice. My housekeeper had left a personal note and asked me to let them know if I needed anything. That I could leave a note for them if I wanted. Needed extra coffee a couple times and got it easily once by asking my maid in the hall and once by note. Totally clean good sized room. The place is really new. Everything working. Good water pressure. Had a fridge. No minibar, don't know if it ever had one. Had reserved an upper floor Times Square view and the view was fantastic. Could see all the way to the Freedom Tower and the river by 12th St. Fantastic. Will go back when I'm in NY. Security was on the job. Didn't go to the rooftop bar but it for sure had amazing views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first time staying at this hotel, but I would definitely stay here again. It's a good location near Times Square - walk right on 45th St. out of the lobby and you're right in the hear of Times Sq., or walk left (and avoid the madness) and you're right next to Bryant Park and Grand Central. I think it's been open for approximately two years, but everything still seems brand new. The room and bathroom were spacious by NYC standards. I had a room in the '08' stack and it came with a great view. Another plus - although the hotel is 50+ stories, the elevators are very fast. There is also a nice lounge on the roof on the 54th floor - great views of the city, with drink prices just as high ($12/beer, $26/cocktail).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My partner and i just eloped in NYC and stayed at the Hyatt Centric at Times Square. The location is very central to the Times Square and Theatre District. The majority of staff were amazing and when they found out it was our wedding, went above and beyond with complimentary champagne and a voucher for the bar on the 54th floor (AMAZING spot). We booked a suite and it was spacious enough (remember this is NYC and space comes at a premium) and very modern. Literally the only minor complaint i had was our suite was right next to the elevators and you could hear them at night, not enough to keep you awake but just a minor annoyance. I would definitely stay here again and reccomend it to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Jeff at the front desk, and manager Claudio, healed a huge problem that We created with Priceline!They made a miracle happen. We booked on Priceline, thought we had the option of requesting a room with two beds (we have two children) but after booking were informed we had a single King. Major issue! Where were our children to sleep? In the Hall?Upon check in, Jeff and Claudio created an amazing solution (with only four rooms available in the entire hotel, on a Friday night) that saved us money and headache and regret. Thank you, Hyatt Centric, Jeff and Claudio!We have learned our lesson - book direct! And book with Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights. I had first booked from and paid for Tuesday (check in) to Sunday (check out). I later asked if I could move the 5 nights a day forward (check in from Monday to Saturday). They told me it was ok, but when I checked in they said I had prepaid for six nights. I complained about this and the girl at the check in told me she would discuss with her manager. I heard nothing further, so I assumed everything was ok. When we checked out, again they told us we had to pay for 6 nights. Again we complained heavily: we are good customers, staying no less than 5 days, but not willing to pay for a night we are not at the hotel. After complaining for a long time the girl at the check out said she agreed. However, when we came home, the extra night was taken from our credit card. Unbelievable. This is simply theft!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Service was excellent. Room was well appointed and clean. Although the room was somewhat small, it was adequate. Drawers for clothes storage were limited. Location of the hotel was superb, centrally located for activities and near activities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff at the Hyatt was so friendly and helpful, we were tired when we arrived and a friendly face and clean quiet room were exactly what we needed! The beds were very comfortable and made it difficult to want to leave our room! It was so close to Times Square we found it easy to walk all around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the doorman's greeting to the reception desk, Hyatt Centric was welcoming! My room was spacious, contemporary, and clean!I was on the 44th floor and the view was fabulous of the city, the noise level low.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was tops( TimeSquare )Services were good. No major restaurant inside. Lovely sky bar but private parties shut it down 3 times for business companies.Room service was different. More bag style.Expensive Smaller hotel which was nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros1. Location Location Location2. Nice rooms3. Incredible shower (I did not opt for the tub in the bathroom when picking the room)4. FInally a hotel with air-conditioning that matches the thermostat settings5. Good toiletteries6. Marriott - please take note of points 2-5 above :)Cons1. Front desk staff come off as unprofessional, impolite. I was particularly disappointed by the two ladies at the front desk the evening of 12-June, 20182. The Dial "0" operators need training too3. Botched cancellation of the morning alarm4. This is where Marriott takes the cake - their staff make you feel super special

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, only a block off of Times Square. I was pleasantly surprised that it wasn’t noisy in the room, except for some ongoing construction. Very clean hotel & extremely friendly staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I live in the city and booked through Priceline a few days in advance for my mother's birthday celebration, who was coming from the Poconos, staying on May 19th. I was a little nervous as you don't know what you get until after booking- but I could have not asked for a better hotel! The location was perfect- in heart of Times Square and a few blocks from Radio City where we attended a concert. It looks brand new, great decor, ambiance and aromatherapy from the moment you walk in the lobby. I believe it was one of the managers KiKi who checked us in, and I told her it was my mother's birthday and she had no idea what had been planned all weekend including the stay at Hyatt. My mom was surprised when a short while later they delivered a nice little gift bag with a handwritten note and also comped our breakfast the next day. Our room was beautiful and bed super comfy, with a nice partial view of Times Square.We enjoyed a delicious breakfast at their restaurant T45. After we caught the morning tour of their rooftop, which is the highest in the city and has amazing views. We were guided by another manager, John as the rooftop doesn't open until the afternoon. They have a large holding room for luggage which allows you to enjoy exploring the city more after checkout without having to lug around heavy baggage.Upon leaving a custom umbrella I had left wasn't found, so John took my info and would call me to pick up later. When I returned to my place, my mom realized she left her purse with valuables in a drawer in our room. I called and was immediately connected with housekeeping who had it safe in their possession. We took a uber ride back into the city, and John was waiting out front to hand me the umbrella and purse with all its contents still there, so we wouldn't have to get out of the car or wait for assistance.I have worked in customer service and tourism for several years before, and I have to truly say that from the moment we arrived until our departure we had an incredible experience and every staff person we encountered were friendly, welcoming and professional. My only complaints are that the check-in/check out process was a bit slow, with it being a busy time should have more hands on deck, and that there aren't any vending machines. I was unable to get a beverage late night without having to go outside to the store next door.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was amazing! The staff was very friendly and always answered questions we had. Room service for extra towels was excellent. They make you show your room key every time you enter the hotel which we loved was very safe.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is close to Times Square, which can be very noisy. The front desk staff are friendly, but the check-in process took 2 hours, we were really tired by then. There is construction nearby, so it can be noisy sometimes, but it is not the hotel fault. The room is clean and in decent size for NYC standard. The rooftop bar is the best attraction in the hotel, I recommend to have some drinks at night or during the sunset.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just spent four days in NYC celebrating two birthdays. It was our first time at the Hyatt Centric and we highly recommend it. Lupita Davis and her team (including Claudio & DeDe) welcomed us with wonderful surprises for the two birthday people. Great location, great views of Time Square, very comfortable rooms, clean and quiet. The rooftop bar is amazing!! Will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the fourth time we have stayed at Hyatt Centric and really noticed that customer care has fallen off somewhat. Upon check in the process went ok but the front desk was very unfriendly and really acted like they could have cared less. The room was very nice although we had a thermostat problem the entire stay. This said, would stay here again because it is a great location in proximity to Time Square with great restaurants and bars close by.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square is a great property. The staff, food and beverages are second to none. You're within a brief walk to the heart of Times Square, many dining possibilities and a myriad of transportation options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Times Sq isn’t my favorite part of town- it’s crowded and touristy and can be kind of skanky- but this hotel is a good value. I was traveling with my mom and 2 kids and actually picked this hotel because they have rooms with 2 queens - so nice! At other hotels we’d need 2 rooms but at this hotel a deluxe high floor room with 2 queens did the trick. Bathroom was big and nice; AC worked quietly. Room was very quiet. Location is nice in the sense that it’s very central but it’s still Times Sq. Driving into midtown was craziness. But as I said, good value and a very comfortable stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at hyatt centric on my business trip to new york. it was a very good experience. the staff was very friendly and the room was very spacious and clean. They have a very nice rooftop bar on 54th floor. quite good experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved our stay in New York at this lovely hotel situated right in Times Square. We were part of action, Morning day and night in a city which never takes a break. Our family enjoyed our stay in this Hotel. (Construction in Street downstairs was disconcerting)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is clean, modern, comfortable right in Times Square and near the big Broadway theaters. Staff was very nice, bed was comfortable and there was a nice rainfall shower. They have a great rooftop bar on the 54th floor with amazing views - including the lighted New Years Eve ball. Only note of concern would be if you have curious and rambunctious kids, our room had large windows that opened fully. We were on the 51st floor and I would never have left my boys unattended for a moment had they been with us. Other than that note of caution I would highly recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Thank you Hyatt for this wonderful trip and making it all more worth it with the comfort that was provided from the hotel! I was accommodated with my needs quick and with ease. I would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights with friends and loved everything about this hotel. Great location minutes from Times Square where everything is going on.Rooms were really comfortable air con huge bed lovely decor, coffee maker (could do with a kettle for tea) could have asked at reception for one but didn’t bother. The rooms were cleaned thoroughly every day and there was a huge tv on the wall. We were on floor42 so had a fantastic view of Times Square.We didn’t stay in the hotel much but did use the spa for a massage which was lovely but expensive (present from hubby) We did have a drink in the bar on the roof which again was very expensive but well worth it for the viewsThe staff were great and it was comforting to be asked to show a room key when we returned at night

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent 4 nights at this property and were amazed at how quiet the room was. Property was clean. Staff was attentive. GREAT location just a half block off Times Square, near Grand Central Station, 5th Avenue, theaters. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for a girls weekend and glad to have booked this hotel! The location is perfect. We were able to walk to a lot of the tourist places - Time Square, St Patrick’s Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Broadway Theaters and Central Park. Hotel has modern feel and super clean! Room was very spacious, it was four of us staying and we had plenty of room to keep our stuff separated and not on top of each other. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Check-in was a breeze. We arrived early but were able to leave our luggage with no problem.Service was great, staff was accommodating and always was greeted with a smile. I must mention Lupita Davis who was superb. She responded to my emails quickly and was checking on me throughout the whole stay. I have stayed at a lot of different hotels including luxurious and have never had that type of service. Definitely check out their roof top bar, it has spectacular views!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I were just in NYC for a long weekend. We have been to NY many times and have stayed in several great hotels, but our stay at the Hyatt Centric was the best yet. We had the deluxe suite on the 41st floor and were thrilled with our view of the Chrysler Building to the east, the Hudson River to the west and the Freedom Tower straight ahead. We have never had a view remotely as spectacular on any of our prior visits. The bed was super comfy and the living area was just enough space. Towels could be softer, but served their purpose. Everything about the room was perfect for us. We also enjoyed Bar54 for great cocktails and even more spectacular views. We have already booked our next stay for the end of September and are already looking forward to our return! Perfect location, perfect accommodations. I highly recommend this property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed at numerous hotels in Manhattan and on or near Times Square but this was by far the worst. We selected this hotel based on excellent customer reviews but were shocked by our experience. The check in process was unacceptable. When we arrived there were no less than 15 praise waiting at the front desk which was unstaffed for at least 5 minutes. Not a single hotel employee was at the desk to help anyone. Ultimately 3 people appeared and vegan to help guests but the front desk should be staffed at all times. This experience was repeated every time we went to the desk for anything. The restaurant was hit and miss. The food was excellent but the bar in the evenings was too full to allow for service despite a completely empty restaurant. The room was clean but small. The AC would never get cold enough for our taste. The spa could not accommodate us when we tried to go. We would never stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It’s tough finding any value in hotels in mid town NYC but the Hyatt Centric is a solid choice.Location is perfect without being very noisy even though you are steps from Times Square. The rooms are nice, good size for the area, and modern. Not sure why they have brown musty corridors but once inside the room, it’s great.Service is good, check in and the door staff. Genuine and not constantly milking you for tips like the bigger hotels in the area.Didn’t even use the rooftop bar or other facilities, might get 5 stars if I did. Would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros-Great location if you want to be near Times Square but not right in the middle of it (crazy!)Room is a good size for NYC. Not sure what people expect in one of the most expensive real estate places in the world where space is limited?Bathroom was good, well appointed with large shower Ok views from our 41st floor roomCons-Security - they check you have a room key when you walk in towards the lifts then let anybody get in the lifts to use the sky bar (strangers can get off on any floor including residents room floors). Residents - don't have any preferential treatment to use the Sky bar. In fact, I don't think they care if you are a resident, we certainly felt that wayNo Personal touch - it was my husband's 50th birthday we stayed for 5 nights. No mention from the hotel, nothing left in the room. We have often been away on one or other of our birthdays, hotels always acknowledge the fact as they have your passport details. Not here. Very disappointing Definitely 4 star, doesn't feel like a hotel in the normal sense. More like an up market Premier Inn, probably because it's NYCOverall, good value for money considering where you are. Excellent location, just don't expect too much

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: hotel was amazing with a great floor. will be staying here again.Dede at the front desk was wonderful person and i will ask for her next time. the rest of the staff was friendly and you could tell they cared about their jobs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved our stay at this hotel. The location was perfect for our trip. Steps away from Times Square and the subway. Walking distance to so many restaurants and attractions. The staff was wonderful and even had umbrellas for when it rained. Lupita went out of her way to make us feel very special. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very central location just steps from Times Square. Rooms are exactly as they look in the hotel photos. Large comfy beds and a lovely large bathroom. Breakfast was included in our rate, we had an allowance of $25pp, which meant we usually had extra to pay, the food was delicious and very generous portions. Roof top bar has amazing views especially at night, not very large so tables are not always vacant at busy times. Cocktails are around $20 each. All staff were helpful and friendly and had arranged for a gift and happy birthday display for my daughters 21st, a lovely touch that she was delighted with. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is in a great location for business or vacation with quality spacious rooms and gym facility. Best of all is the roof top bar during summer. A great way to meet people and relax at the end of a busy day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The pre-arrival welcome email from the management seemed a nice touch, but a total waste. I sent some requests back but got nothing (even not an email back). Why bother to ask if you don't want to do anything? Room is very small, but maybe normal for times square hotels. Location is pretty good, basically next to TS. Roof top bar is a ripoff; the view is so so, the the price is ridiculous. Not worth a visit. I will consider it next time though, if the price is below $200. Anything more than that is not a good deal (25k points/night, really?). This is basically a 3-star hotel with 5-star price tag.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was very please with my stay at the Hyatt Centric. I arrived at 8am after a very early morning flight expecting to only be able to drop off my bags but my room was ready and I was able to go up right away. The staff was pleasant and efficient, and I loved the signature scent of the entry. My room was larger than I expected and very modern. Loved all of the lighting options and the amount of and location of the electrical outlets. Everything was sparkling clean and the bathroom was nice and spacious.
