I popped up to the rooftop bar to enjoy the views at sunset, where like the rest of the hotel, the staff was lovely. Drinks are not cheap, but neither are the views. The location is great if you want to be in the Times Square area (which honestly was the only negative for me, and purely personal, I loved the hotel but the general location was too busy for me). That being said even though it’s right in the heart of things my room was very quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Made the reservation a bit last second so I wasn’t sure what to expect but our experience was fantastic! Staff went out of their way to give us a great hotel experience. We were able to check in by 12:30 on the day of our arrival. It was my daughter’s 16th birthday and they even gave us a credit in the hotel restaurant for breakfast to celebrate. What a surprise and a treat! Rooms and bathrooms are clean. They even had umbrellas available for guests on the day it was a bit rainy. Very convenient location. It is right at Times Square but tucked off the main drag enough so as not to be a hassle. Excellent dining options close by and Starbucks literally right across the street (my teenage daughters loved that part). I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I took a quick last minute trip to New York from the Bay Area for the long weekend. The staff is excellent. They allowed me to check in early and everyone working in the hotel was very attentive. If a line formed they immediately had additional staff come out to assist. For the price point I can’t complain about the room. Compared to other hotels in the area I paid around $250 a night which was great being we were only in our room to shower and sleep. The hotel is on a side street so there is no view. It is also a boutique hotel so other than the rooms and a small restaurant and lounge there is nothing more to this place. My room was very clean but the room is nothing to write home about and somewhat small. Overall a good experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the first time I have had a very bad experience in a Hyatt Hotel. I love the chain and normally there is nothing to complain.Unfortunately a lot went wrong. I have stayed there for four nights and I was on business in town. Good things first, location is great, rooms are clean.Overall the staff is very unfriendly and rude. There are view exeptions.1. I have ordered a car service twice and it both ended up in a disaster. The first car tried to over charge me and the car back to the airport did not show up. Both drivers had no receipts.2. Roof Top Bar, First night closed, 2nd and 3rd night private ventures 4th night full.3. I have asked the front desk politely to print an e-mail for me, it was only two pages but the lady did it unwillingly. She saw that I was dressed in a suite and I was on my way to a meeting, she handed me the print outs without saying a word. Something like you welcome or do you need anything else, would have been appropriate4. TV at the machines in the GYM are not working5. Carful of opening ours in the Bar downstairs. It closed one night at 11 pm. That night I was working with the laptop at the bar. I went to the toilet and on my way back, they closed the front door and did not let anyone else in anymore. The doorman didn't let me in also, and he very rudely told me, The bar is closed !! I had to get the manager and told him that my laptop is still at the bar and I am still working there. Nobody told me that the bar closes already at 11 pm. Obviously I was not happy when you get treated like that. I am not an enemy I was a client of the hotel.6. You have to show every time your badge when you would like to take the elevator. Even when you are fully loaded with bags, they stop you in a unfriendly manner.7. After all those experiences I have encountered in that Hotel, I will not return

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Prime Location: For the price I paid, you can’t beat the location if you want to be around Times Square guys. Great business stay hotel with a great boutique hotel ‘feel’. It’s definitely not a complicated hotel experience, But then again you don’t need it being this close to the Big Apple action! The rooms where functional, and with all other Centric’s, they are redesigned to be no-frills modern for the best business traveler. The top bar view is "one of the best" in the city, worth it for a drink (even in the heart of winter).I had my light breakfast at T45, the lobby bistro, and can recommend it! The service was great. I heard it get's busy during lunch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place does well delivering on its brand, but goes bounds beyond in defending it. It’s a fantastic location, great atmosphere, great staff, and awesome views.  My wife and I regret not enjoying at least one dinner up there, but at least we had a drink! Next time we will definitely stay for a bite!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent one night in the city and this hotel was right in the heart of it.We were able to rest, shop, walk and eat all within a short distance.The concierge was busy and we needed to get advice when theater tickets were sold- I think it may be part of their income!! When we did get his attention, he sent us to the perfect place for dinner- I would definitely stay here again- Almost forgot - the staff could not have been nicer!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel , comfy bed , clean , block away but close enough to get all the action . Hotel did not recognize request of high floor , and roll away bed , but very clean room , bonus of free water!! Shower was a rainfall I didn’t want to get out !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Check in is a nightmare. You wait hours for the room to be cleaned. Others come through with no issues but others wait for hours in the corner for their rooms. Other hotels near by offer better service and offerings.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel meet every expectation I had. First and foremost the people that worked there were great. They were so professional and helpful. The place is spotless. This may sound crazy but you almost feel as if you are in a sterile building it is so clean. The room are a good size especially considering you are in New York. There is a refrigerator and Keurig with pods for regular and decaf and also tea. The bathrooms were also a good size with a glass walking shower, with a over head shower head along with a hand held shower head. Quality towels and wash clothes also. They have a gym, restaurant and roof to bar which we did not use It was only a one night trip. The location is great if you want to be were the action is. Love this hotel hope to get back very soon. Hats of to the management.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My son, daughter in law and 4 year old grandson went for a quick trip to Times Square. This hotel was wonderful. Staff went out of their way to take care of luggage, car, sightseeing. It was a wonderful experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: it is not easy to select the right hotel in Manhattan, with loads of options and many points to look at. This resulted to be an excellent choice: it is two mins away from Times Square but neighbours are not such crowdy; rooms are incredibly large compared with Mahnattan standards; staff is great. Tip: take a room at upper floors, that will protect you from noise

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a great location. Right in the heart of Times Square. The rooftop bar has amazing views and is a must to visit at night! The room is modern, large and 5 stars. We were travelling as a family of 4, so the king bedroom with the separate living area (including sofa bed) was great as it allowed us all to spread out. All round a great Hotel and we would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Yenny at the front desk was amazing she went out of her way to assist me at check in and deliver my luggage up stairs. Bar54 was amazing but overpriced but what do you expect when your in time square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff responsiveness, the hotel room and the restaurant food were incredible. Have stayed many times in NYC but this was the best trip ever. The rooms were spacious and no street noise (amazing). The food at 4T5 restaurant was perfect every time we ate there. We will definitely be back and stay again at this establishment.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 1st time at this hotel, and we enjoyed it a lot. The rooms big (by NY standards) bright and nicely appointed .The staff were friendly and attentive.We will be back. We stayed at another Hyatt hotel during our stay.It was OK, this one was much better

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was the best we have encountered in a very long time. I told them they were spoiling us and that we may never leave. They were absolutely wonderful. We arrived to rose pedals, wine, a gift, and chocolate in our room; we were pleasantly surprised. We had a bar and restaurant credit waiting for us on top of that. Our room was great and well styled. Love, love, loved, the spa bathroom. The hotel is centrally located to everything we needed and visited. It was perfect in every way. I hope when you stay here you like it as much as we did.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently stayed for two nights to attend a business event. Friendly, professional staff. Terrific location, close to time square, the theatre district and endless restaurants. I found the room to be unusually large for NYC standards. The room itself was spotless and well stocked with free water, coffee maker, toiletries and a top notch blow dryer. We did visit the rooftop bar and were stunned at the high cost of cocktails ($133 for 4 martinis), but the drinks and service were great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Have booked the hotel for one weekend mainly for the gym and the location. The staff was super nice, our room was fairly big for manhattan standards, very clean & quiet.Before going out for dinner, take the elevator to the roof the bar and enjoy the amazing view (drinks are a bit too expensive). I would definitely go back there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Found a good deal on Priceline for this hotel. Great location, close to everything. Staff was great. Hotel room was comfortable. Has a decent gym to maintain at the least. Rooftop bar/restaurant is expensive but I guess you pay for the view and ambiance. They also have one in the lobby area. If you don’t care to pay the price, there are plenty of nearby locations to wine and dine. We found an Asian placed called Fuji Sushi about 10 short blocks away, 10 minute walk, that had reasonably priced food and drinks. In either case there are plenty of places to enjoy

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just wanted to share a few thoughts about our stay at he Hyatt Centric Hotel, just off Times Square. When we were looking for hotels we were torn between a few choices and finally settled for the Hyatt Centric. This turned out to be a great choice. I know Times Square hotels are a bit touristy but I can’t complain about this one. Good location, though busy and local bars are pricey due to location. A nice little bonus was that our rooms were nice and high, 38th floor, which gave us great views. The room was a good size very clean and well maintained, the same goes for the rest of the hotel. Staff were very helpful and good security in the building. The roof top bar 54th floor has impressive views, but it does come with a hefty bar price list. You couldn’t get drunk in that bar unless you have very very deep pockets. In summary a great hotel and would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel . Amazing views from the higher floor rooms and rooftop bar. Friendly staff, good food & drink but little pricey. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Has complimentary WIFI service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was very accommodating, and the location couldn't have been better.Big shout out to NYC's #1 Concierge, Jay who hooked us up with all our attractions and dinner reservations. Definitely recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first time staying here. The hotel was very nice. The room was comfortable and a good size. The staff were very friendly and professional. The hotel is in a good location for Broadway and Times Square. I recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: To place the reservation was a nightmare since they messed up the arrival date and departure date. The room was not ready. Check in was terrible. The Bar staff was rude and overcharged. How do you ask for gratuity and a tip for 2 people when standing in an area not in the bar? It was a bad experience, will not go back. I had plans to go for new year's but I will be going to a different hotel for that.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel several times and it is consistent every time. Depending on the time of year, it can be pricey, but the location and coziness is worth it. I fell upon it a few years ago and now it is my

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good hôtel, modern and nice design. Rooftop bar is really nice. View on Times Square and very close to all fun, activities and Broadway shows!Perfect place for a first visit to NYC.The parent bed in the Suite is very confortable. The pull out sofa was not confortable at all as you could feel the springs under the sheet. Fortunately this was for our young kids and they did not seem to care.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am currently sat in my room in the Hyatt Centric in Time Square on the 49th floor with fantastic views, the room is 5 star and the people who sort the place are 5 star but tonight we got told we had to leave the roof top bar at 6:30...we said why ?Private partyThe only reason i booked this hotel was for the roof top bar so after a day of walking mile after mile i knew i could sit back and enjoy a drink with a view like they say when you bookBut that is not the case. The bar is closed off tonight to guests as its a private party and we just got told tomorrow night is closed to everyone as a another private party as booked the bar forgetting about guests who are the bread and butter So basically its a lottery if you can enjoy the barWe spoke to the manger regarding the issue as we are only here 4 nights, and we was offered a taxi to a different bar in a different location which makes me booking a nice hotel in a nice area with a nice bar with nice views pointlessI never write trip advisor reviews but this takes the P ssMy advise is if you do like views and a drink on a evening book somewhere else who put the guests first Scotty

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Boutique style hotel in the middle of it all. Away from all the madness of Times Square but close enough to quickly get to Times Square/Broadway. Amazing customer service. Easy check in. Great rooms (coffee and fridge!). Front door very present to assist with everything from umbrellas to limo service. Restaurant has excellent breakfast menu and fabulous staff! Lupita deserves a shout out for welcoming us and making sure everything was perfect during our stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife & I came out from Chicago for an anniversary weekend to see a show & NYC. Little did we know that the Hyatt Centric put the trip over the top from great to amazing! Fantastic location & service ...especially the extremely attentive Director of VIP Experiences, Lupita Davis......such a wonderful asset for the Hyatt Centric to have !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Chose this hotel based on proximity to Broadway and value knowing it was a little more expensive compared to some of the older properties. Very clean modern rooms, slightly larger than typical Manhattan hotel room. It was exactly as I expected, slightly premium. Beds are very comfortable, the ac unit blows inconsistently, very breezy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stay in the NYC a lot and this first time at Hyatt Centric. We will definitely be back!! The hotel is the cleanest I have ever seen. The rooms are modern and state of the art. Bedding is it's usual Hyatt high standard. It's located in a perfect part of midtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel gets high marks for location--excellent for theater and shopping. However, it's downhill from there. The room was just OK--certainly no frills. We had no top sheet on the bed, had to ask for bathrobes, and the shower had mildew. Many reviews lauded the cleanliness of this hotel, but our room had a stained, poorly vacuumed carpet, scuff marks and stains on walls, and a thin coating of dust on many surfaces. We had breakfast at T45--don't waste your money. $54+ for a bowl of cold, over cooked eggs with stale toast on top (literally thrown on top) and a less -than- fresh fruit cup. The server, Kalif, was the worst we have ever encountered. He barely acknowledged us, could not have seemed less attentive or interested in doing his job. The 18% gratuity was built into the total price so he apparently had little incentive to please us. Same horrible service at their roof top bar where we waited at least 10 minutes for service and ultimately ended up leaving when we realized that we were going to have a repeat of the morning's service. (Mind you, the bar was not busy, which should have been a sign....) Better to burn your money than to waste it at restaurants and bars at this property. Would I stay again? No--there are so many options in NYC, you don't have to put up with shoddy service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel primarily for the location and what a great choice we made. I had e mailed the hotel prior to our arrival and mentioned that this was a special holiday to celebrate a big birthday for my husband and his return to full health. What a great welcome we received - a lovely hardback book and a birthday cake. The service we received throughout our stay was exceptional from all the staff we dealt with. The rooms are large, have great views and are exceptionally clean. The bed was exceptionally comfortable. Only a few steps from Times Square but felt a tranquil retreat from all the hustle and bustle of the area. Thank you for a wonderful stay, we hope to be back someday.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: first time @ Hyatt Centric Brand. This hotel location and facilities are great. Nice Breakfast, fast and efficient service. The gym facility was good and is 24 hours. The bar is very good. I will recommend this to anyone staying close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My friend and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric to celebrate my friends 50th birthday. Perfect location, excellent customer service, amazing roof top cocktail bar, spacious rooms and exceptionally clean! We enjoyed every moment of our stay and will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: apart from some work (noisy) around, everything was fine...rather big room...clean...good service...friendly staff...great roof top bar with a nice view of NY City...this hotel is just steps from the center of Time Square and all entertainment !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Don't expect a grand lobby or large rooms, but the Hyatt Centric is a fine choice for a business or modest vacation hotel in mid-town Manhattan. Our room was on the 53rd floor just below the rooftop bar on the 54th. It may take you a minute to get used to the floor to ceiling window right next to the toilet (it does have a pull down shade) and the small size (365 square feet) but it is a clean and modern room. We also appreciated that the windows actually open a bit to allow for fresh air.The views are spectacular from your room and even more so from the rooftop bar. The bar, not unexpectedly, is noisy, crowded, expensive ($24 cocktails) and has slow service.The big attraction of this hotel is the location. Just a short block to the glitz of Times Square, easy walking distance to most of the shows in the Theatre District, and 5 blocks to Rockefeller plaza. You will definitely hear city noise in your room even on the 53rd floor: the nearby construction crews start at 8am.The T45 restaurant in the lobby has some good meals including a wonderful avocado toast in the morning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amongst so many choices we could have made for our family long weekend, Hyatt delivered what we were expecting. This is very important to avoid unecessary concerns when the focus is to have a great weekend with the family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric has it all...location, vibe, modern and comfortable design, a nice restaurant plus great views from the rooftop bar, bigger than average size NYC rooms with a desk for business and nice shower and room amenities plus good meeting spaces for small business meetings.I will be back for business and pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good location,Very good Service,very friendly staff and Thank You Lupita Davis for your kindly attention,see you soon again for sure we will come back and stay in Hyatt Centric Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic location which is reflected in the price. Rooms were adequate but supposed to be in deluxe queen room with view but there was nothing deluxe about the room, just typical double queen bed room and there was no view, we looked out on to building works taking place! When queried this at reception didn't get any satisfaction. Be aware of city tax as this was quite expensive at an additional $70 per night. Staff in the restaurant were more friendly than the hotel who were not very accommodating. The views from the cocktail bar on the 45th floor were spectacular and worth a visit although my nephew of 17 was not allowed in the bar to socialise with us but could go on the balcony outside! Crazy. We didn't allow this to spoil our holiday but overall disappointing for the money we paid.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent a weekend near Times Square for our anniversary. The staff went the extra mile and outlined our bed with rose petals. My wife loved this beautiful gesture. View is great, service excellent. Location perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having brought my two adult daughters to shop for a wedding gown we were very happy with the hotel. Some staff bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. The rooms are lovely and bigger than I thought they would be. Thank you, Hyatt Centric!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Roof top bar was a joke- horrible experience and worst service EVER!!! Beds are rock hard with cheap sheets- if I would have known this I would have booked elsewhere as the rooms aren't cheap here. Even on the 37th there was a ton of noise (some people don't mind). Great location and they decorated his room sooo nice for his Birthday!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of the hotel at Times Square is great. We had a room with view toward Times Square on the 47th floor and the view was breathtaking! The room was large with lot of storage place and a big bathroom with a shower and a separate bathtub: perfect! The only drawback for us were the employees at the reception who were not particularly friendly nor helpful. In any case I would definitely recommend this hotel and come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our third visit to this hotel and definitely not our last. Each member of staff was very attentive and efficient, making us feel at home. The hotel is in a prefect location for first time visitors. Don’t be put off by being so close to Times Square. Once in your room you hardly hear the street noise. The rooms are very modern and clean. They are also very accommodating for families. We ate at the restaurant (T45) most mornings and the menu had a good variety of options. The restaurant staff were also always welcoming and friendly. There is also a rooftop bar with amazing views of the city. In all, you cannot go wrong with this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The quietest room I have ever stayed in when visiting NYC. The beds were comfortable, the room nicely designed, and the bathroom modern and attractive. Helpful staff. In the heart of the theater district, close to restaurant row in Hell's Kitchen. Will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms are clean and spacious, staff is very accommodating. The rooftop bar has breathtaking views. Times Square was right around the corner, and many attractions were within walking distance. Would 100% stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all, the welcome we got at the hotel was exceptional. I had alerted head concierge Lupita that this was an anniversary trip, and asked for a nice room with a bouquet of flowers in the room. We were greeted personally by the check in personell, and when we got to the room, there was not only a bouquet there, but rose petals beautifully placed on the bed and all around the room. Thank you!The concierge service was also something that stood out during the stay, with a professinal, easy approach to all our requests and questions. It simply made our vacation in New York a lot smoother. I must also mention the prompt and

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a great experience for me and my wife and a great time to see new york again I had the best time with your staff and the room was beautiful and I would like to you too know that I will be there in the beginning of next mth aa well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was a nice surprise. It was the first hotel I've stayed in New York that actually had a view, not just the brick wall of the next building. The rooms are spacious and the decor is very nice. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms are kept very clean. The location could not be more perfect. Even though on the next block from Times Square the rooms are still quiet. The Marilyn Monroe Spa is also nice (they could include the tip in the price, though). I recommend this hotel to anyone, who loves a bit of luxury but not too over the top.Thank you also for remembering our anniversary.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Well where can I start ..... !!! This has been the best vacation we have ever taken. Prior to coming I emailed the hotel and had a few discussions with Lupita from the VIP team and wow we was so well looked after it was incredible. We changed and upgraded rooms for our birthday trip and it was sensational, if you can upgrade to the premier room (great balcony overlooking times square with views to die for!!!!!). We met Lupita and the team at check in and felt like royalty from the minute we arrived to when we left. We had cocktails in the sky lounge (views are incredible!!) and a couple of meals in T45 restaurant on site ... all of which where superb!!!!. Every member of the staff were really friendly and made our stay fantastic... even Maria who was our house keeper made sure we had everything we needed. If you ever visit new York ....then this is the place to be!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent stay. Lupita Davis made my family and I feel like VIP’s. She did everything she could before and during our stay to make it a great experience. Hotel is clean, comfortable, and in a great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our 4 nights here and would definitely stay here again. We had a room on the 53rd floor which was very clean and modern. For 3 adults there was enough space though you wouldn't want to bring too much luggage. No noise either from outside or other guests. Beds very comfortable and loved having the coffee machine. Didn't experience any delays with the elevators. Okay so the "destination fee" is really annoying but all in all we had a nice time here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Anyone, who has stayed here???Please help!! I'm booking here February 2019, for my 40th birthday!!!!I'm bringing my teenage son, neither of us have been to New York before, and desperate for it to be special!!! Any recommendations on rooms/floors with amazing views??? Thankyou in advance

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt New York with 2 adults and our son. Location is good, very close to the Times Square. Check in was ok, we had wait 15 minutes for the room as they could not find the booking. Room is functional but very small and not really space for luggage. If you want Hyatt luxury this is the wrong place. It is ok, efficient, functional, good staff at reception but nothing more!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I try to stay here when I travel for business but they do sell out. The staff is the best in the city and the rooms are clean and quiet. The location is perfect just far enough from the craziness of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful hotel, perfectly located in Manhattan. Clean room (for 4 persons), with very good beds. Unlimited Coffee in the room was very much appreciated, as well as the large fitness room. Carefull and responsive staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here last week for 7 nights on a business trip. I must say, this was one of the best hotels I have stayed at for work. From start to finish, I had a great time staying at the Hyatt Centric.StaffFrom the moment I checked in, I was welcomed by friendly staff. I spoke to Ritchie when I first arrived, and he was so professional, friendly and welcoming. During my stay, the staff was always ready to assist with any questions and requests that I had.RoomMy room was nice, tidy and spacious. A nice big bed, with a good mattress and pillows. During my whole stay, I slept like a baby every single night. I had a room on the 39th floor, and I had a lovely view. The room had all the necessities; a mini fridge, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, coffee machine, and a small safe. And more, but these are the least basic things that I want and need in a hotel room.The desk had several power outlets, as well as an adapter for the UK/IRE plugs, which was super helpful.One thing I particularly liked, was that there were light switches/buttons placed at the convenient places in the room, that would control the lights in the whole room. I could control the lights when I was in bed, by just pressing a button next to the bed.BathroomThe bathroom was great, with a huge mirror. It had the basic toiletries: shampoo, conditioner, body was, facial cleansing bar, body bar (no toothpaste though).I loved the rain shower head in the shower, and there was also a regular shower head if you’d prefer that. The shower design is great, because of the glass door, the bathroom floor doesn’t get wet.GymLovely 24hr gym on the 4th floor, it had plenty of cardio machines, and a free weight area. Small towels were provided, as well as a water cooler in the corner.There were some machines to train the legs, shoulders, back, and chest as well.LocationIt doesn’t get any better than this. When you go out of the doors, it’s literally 30 seconds to Time Square. I had to be in the Hippodrome building daily, which was only 3-4 minutes away for me, so that was perfect.From the hotel, you could get anywhere easily, either by walking or by taking a subway/metro.  Conclusion5/5, I cannot fault anything. I had a very enjoyable stay, and would stay here again. I highly recommend the Hyatt Centric Times Square NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I love my stay, I feel welcome in the city. The room was clean and the bed comfortable with astonishing views. I recommend a corner suite because the views and the big windows. My favorite part was the bathroom. I also love the bar. The location was also perfect, and it makes my trip wonderful. I do not have any complaints about it. I can recommend this beautiful hotel to any of my friends and family. It was my first time in a Hyatt I usually stay at Marriot or Hilton, but I really enjoy it. After reading the reviews, I feel comfortable booking this room, and I get a suite deal. It was a very nice trip, the employees were very nice and they help me with directions. I do not have any complaints about this hotel, I feel wonderful, and I really like the big bathroom. The room was big compare with what you get in New York, I have never visited before but I compare the square footage with another options, and this was the very best option and at a competitive price. I also enjoy the food, it was delicious. The best part was the location, I could walk to all my reservations, and I was around the corner of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great stay between the 2nd and 9th of April. Hotel was clean and spacious and we loved the location. However, we were very disappointed to be charged a $25US ‘destination fee’ upon our checkout. We had booked through qantas.com which included all fees and services charges back in January and at no point were we told that this fee would be added at the end. Hyatt had our contact details and had months of opportunity to let us know that this additional charge would be added. We were under the impression that water and wifi were complimentary as mentioned in our booking however little did we know we were paying a hefty fee for this. we contacted Hyatt regarding this following our stay as we felt it was unfair to be charged such a fee with no forewarning not even at check in, as this may have altered our decision to stay. However, over 2 weeks later I have not heard anything back regarding this. Obviously Hyatt is just happy to take your money and wash their hands of you. Very disappointing probably wouldn’t stay at another Hyatt as who knows what it will actually cost you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square did a fantastic job in taking care of us! The staff and service was wonderful and provided us with a clean and comfortable room. Hyatt goes the extra measure to make it a great experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very elegant hotel right off of Times Square. Not my ideal location, but I'm sure it's great for other tourists. Very large rooms for such a central location in Manhattan. Floor to ceiling windows. I did not try the restaurant. Friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean friendly great locaation. Roof top bar has fantastic city views of nyc skyline, even more spectacular at night! Just steps away from Times Square, broadway and Central Park. Easy location and hotel is only 3-4 years old

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my second stay and this hotel is just great. The room was spotless and the maid kept it that way, nipping in as soon as we left for breakfast and restoring order. The location is great, just far enough off Times Square to have a little peace but so close to the action. The concierge was great, getting us fabulous tickets for a show. The one thing that lets this hotel down is the rudeness of some of its waiting staff,,,I guess that’s New York but needless none the less.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good hostmanship from all staff members!Nice quiet rooms.We appreciated very much thecoffeemashine in the room.Beautiful roof top bar with wonderful view overlooking Manhattan.Perfect location between 6th and 7th Avenue at Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in an ideal location, just off Times square. The rooms are rather small. The lifts can get really busy.. For the price you pay its not exactly luxury. Would I come back? probably not..The bathrooms are clean and tidy..The concierge desk again can get really busy although were helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rates were competitive for a good hotel near time square. Service was excellent. The staff was really welcoming across the board. I was there for business but saw that the hotel was enjoyed by many European vacationers. The food in the lobby bar was good and not overly expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Family vacation to NYC during Spring Break and this hotel was recommended by a friend. So happy we stayed here, it is a great location for seeing all the sights in the city! We came for the David Bowie Is exhibit on my birthday! Lupita welcomed us even before we arrived and made our week stay extra special! She is amazing!! Ritchie at the front desk was also great and remembered my name every time he saw me! All the staff at this hotel have excellent customer service. We had an awesome room on the 51st floor with great views and a very nice bathroom. There was a Keurig with an assortment of teas and coffee, a fridge and a safe in the room. Housekeeping was also excellent!We had room service during our stay and the food is very good!! I had the kimchi fried rice with steak, it was delicious! I liked that there was security by the elevators to make sure only guests were going up to the rooms. They also have a bar on the top floor that offers great views of the city and Times Square. It was our first time to the city and we will definitely choose this hotel again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a very nice weekend visit to the Hyatt Centric. The service was prompt and friendly, and we stayed in a large, corner room with a beautiful view. The desk staff gave us a restaurant and bar credit for my birthday, such a nice touch. The bath was spacious with ample counter space and a large shower. Clean, comfortable and the housekeeping staff was great. Walter and Yenny were fun, and the view from the rooftop bar was beautiful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was impressed by how spacious the room was. High-end and very elegant room. Beautiful bathroom and big stand-up shower. Not ideal for me being next to Times Square but I'm sure other people enjoy that.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a nice 1 night trip with the wife here. The hotel is very nice, very clean and the staff was great. Had a lunch and breakfast at the attached restaurant and the food and service were top notch. My only wish is that the AC would have cooled the room off some more, the thermostat said it was at 65 degrees but it had to be more like 70. Clean room, comfortable bed, all in all a great choice for anyone looking to be in time square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location. Hotel interiors is only so so. Could use some updating. Towels are really old and threadbare (at least the ones we received the 4 days we stayed there). Paying for the convenience of the location. On par with a Hyatt place type accommodation but paying full Hyatt hotel prices. Rooftop bar is really nice, very pricey for drinks but ambiance is great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From its key location to its food offerings, this is a beautiful Hotel that thanks to its Staff will offer you a memorable stay!The location was impeccable as I wanted to be at the Times Square and, especially since we had a car it was important that parking was offered. The dinner was delicious and the service top shelf!Most importantly, the Staff were remarkable in being attentive to all the details and making this a memorable experience for us!Thank you very much!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We love this hotel and stay often! Our last time was for the Holidays in December and we took our two young kids. The staff at the desk are always very welcoming and great to talk too. The prior time we came ( I forgot to review sorry!!) I took my mother for her birthday and the desk has a gift for her in the room and offered us drinks in the rooftop bar to celebrate! This time with our kids when we arrived to our room, the staff left us a selfie stick and treats and drinks for the kids. They were so excited and felt soo special! I love how this hotel goes above and beyond for their customer service. They make guests the top priority. The location is amazing also. They are right in Times Square so you are right near all the action. Our kids love to be in the city around the holidays and we lucked out with great weather to walk to see everything and of course take pictures!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location for sight seeing. Right next to Time square and Broadway, Andrew blocks from radio City and a few minutes from Central Park. Crazy affordable large room...that was super clean...and great viewa with floor to ceiling windows. Staff were available when need and not intrusive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel. Highly recommend. Will stay there again. Friendly staff. Restaurant staff very friendly and accommodating. Very safe location. Helped with directions, getting a taxi, room was clean upon my return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a fantastic location, clean, with an amazing roof top bar (second highest in Manhattan).What made this hotel stand out for us the most was the T45 restaurant. My son has many food allergies (some severe) and when booking a trip to NY we were hesitant that we would be able to find places for him to eat. I contacted the hotel before and they said it wouldn't be a problem, when we got there however, they really did go out of their way to ensure he was well catered for. They made him gluten and dairy free pancakes every day and even made him some choc chip and blueberry muffins, which were delicious. I have to give a special shout out to Syed Hussain (one of the waiters), he was so friendly and helpful and fully understood the seriousness of my son's allergies, he made us feel very welcome and comfortable that we could eat there without any issues. The only downside is that it is a bit pricey, but well worth it for the peace of mind.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located next to everything small hotel breakfast buffet included which was a lot of food and choices including cereals and fruits. They had waffles and eggs also While the rooms are small they are certainly adequate an d clean staff is friendly and helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location. Great views from the room! Very clean. Staff was friendly. We mentioned it was a getaway before our second child was born. Hotel staff went out of their way and gave us a really nice welcome basket.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved the location and the people working for the hotel were nice and friendly. Hotel needs to allow the guests to lower the a/c temperature as needed. It stayed uncomfortable most of the time and especially at night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: They Hyatt Centric Times Square is located between 6th and 7th Avenues just off Times Square. The building is a high rise and is a bit tough to see from the street because the sign is behind some of the other signs on the same street. Within 2 blocks are several subway stations so you are close to everything at that point.The hotel has 54 floors serviced by 3 elevators. Upon entry there is a bar/restaurant off the lobby where you can get breakfast, lunch or dinner in addition to a bar. Around the corner from the front deck is the Concierge who were very helpful. There is a bar on the 54th floor with an amazing view from the outdoor patio that you should take in. There is also a work out facility and spa but we didn't use either.The checkin process was relatively quick. They have three computer stations and were good about getting people processed. Once we had our key we went up to our room. After getting settled and going out to tour around Times Square we came back to get ready for dinner. That’s when we heard it. Because we were right beside the elevator, the vibration and buzz was noticeable not just in our room but the room next to us. After a discussion with the front desk, they moved us to another room on another floor further away from the elevator. Thank you Hyatt!Our room was a single king room with a TV, safe, small refrigerator, iron, ironing board. The bathroom had a single sink, walk in rain show with a hand shower also, makeup mirror and hair dryer in addition to the usual complementary shampoo, conditioner etc. The bed was comfortably firm, and we didn’t hear much from the street because we were high up. The room was small but didn’t feel cramped. We got a city view room which is higher up, so we could see the downtown skyline and part of Times Square. We could see where ABC films Good Morning America from our room which was cool.Overall it was a good place to stay. Proximity to subway stations and Times Square was nice. There are lots of restaurants in the area but if you want to get the real NY dining experience, get out of Mid-town. The hotel restaurant was just ok with service being hot and cold. We dined there for dinner which was great and then breakfast which was not…food and service. The 54th floor bar is pretty amazing with awesome views but consistently poor service. The hotel had just added an 18% gratuity to the bar and restaurant which was annoying since the service wasn’t worth it. The elevators are slooooooow. We waited upwards of 10 mins on one occasion so plan for that. The staff were very friendly and helpful and security was tight to get up to rooms which I appreciated.If you want to stay close to Times Square, definitely check out the Hyatt. Get a higher room away from the elevator if you want quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful experience at Hyatt Centric Times Square. Hotel is in a great location, super clean, staff is friendly, and my room was extremely quiet and had a great view! I'm very picky about hotels and I could not find anything to complain about here. Love the little touches like the Drybar hair dryer and awesome bath products. Bed is super comfy. Elevators are fast. The breakfast was expensive the one day I ordered room service but there is a Starbucks right across the street which is super convenient and I went there every morning during the rest of my trip. This will be my go-to spot now when I come to NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a perfect hotel, in an amazing location! Coming from hospitality backgrounds we know what we expect in a good hotel; however, this hotel exceeded our expectations!! Rooms are very spacious, thoroughly cleaned and the amenities are awesome! We couldn't find any fault in this place and we' ve stayed here for 10 nights. We've celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary and Lupita was amazing! She treated us a VIPs and the whole experience was impressive! Good job, guys!! And the hot apple cider , on a cold day( actually, any day!) works wonders!!! Thank you to all of you for making our stay a memorable one!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and were very impressed. The location is excellent and is in great walking distance to most places like Times Square but as it was on a side road, just off, meant that some of the nosiness was reduced and a lot quieter. We originally had a room in 5th floor and must admit that the view was not great and were overlooking another hotel building. However, we spoke to reception and this got changed on our second night and eventually stayed on the 15th.WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND ASKING FOR A HIGHER ROOM LEVEL TO GET THE BEST VIEWS!!The some of the kind of security people were very lovely, and would like to shoutout to the young man who works there who wears a black suit- he mainly works during the day, (we couldn’t catch his name). Very polite and welcoming! However, did feel kind of uneasy at times when the security near the elevator would ask to see your room key. I know this is simply precautions and safety but would of thought after 5 nights of going in and out of the hotel, they would of been able to recognise a family of 4?! Felt like sometimes the way they asked to see the key was a bit aggressive! Overall a very enjoyable stay & would definitely recommend Hyatt Centric to friends and family and would stay here on another visit!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Previously reviewed this property as great--- have been back several times. The cheerfulness of the staff has toned way down, the rooms are more 'tired' looking (and the carpet definitely scummy), and the overall experience was less satisfying. Same efficient check-in, can't beat the location for Bway. And one note--- it took about 40 minutes to get our car back from valet parking (not a busy time either), and when we did--- the radio station had been changed....no mistake (i didn't even know where the Grateful Dead station was on Sirius...) creepy feeling, but that's valet parking in NYC...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is such a perfect, centrally located hotel. Nearest to everything that you’d want to do...9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building & Time Square & lots of shopping! Many food choices as well as theaters for your entertainment. Have fun!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is ideally positioned for a first visit to NYC, within walking distance of most of the key attractions. Our room was clean and spacious enough, particularly for NY, and while we had partial views of Times Square, it was quiet. We didn’t eat at the hotel, but it had an amazing rooftop bar for drinks when we returned of an evening. We didn’t have to queue for the lift and the staff were pleasant and helpful. Would def recommend and hope to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just spent a 4-day holiday weekend at the Hyatt Centric with my teenage daughter and my parents (who are in their 80s). I can't imagine a better place to have stayed. The hotel is in a great location - close to Times Square on one side, close to a great deli on the other side (for convenient quick meals/snacks). The room we were in was spacious, clean, very quiet and very comfortable, with great amenities (e.g., room safe, small fridge, toiletries beyond the usual assortment). The front desk staff were all wonderful to deal with - very friendly and helpful. Made us all feel very welcome! Will certainly stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice place for family visit. Very courteous and professional staff. Proximity to Times Square makes it wonderful. Bit expensive but definitely worth the money. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you like staying near Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: An absolute stellar place to stay in a very central location. It's central enough to be able to walk everywhere AND get a great view of Times Square but just a bit off 7th and Broadway that you it's quiet enough. The staff were amazing! Customer service at it's best. Genuinely lovely people. I appreciated the extra mile Lupita went to make our stay special, with the room and the lovely card. Communication with staff was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly staff, clean, cener of everything, modern and convenient. My 9-year-old son loves this hotel and wants to stay here again on our next trip. Glad that I booked this hotel and worth the price. Thanks for the umbrella on a rainy day!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights with my cousin and two friends to celebrate my 30th birthday, as well as my cousin's and her friend's 23rd birthdays, and this hotel did not disappoint. Location wise it couldn't be better, literally steps away from Times Square, and a few minutes walk from Broadway theatres, subway stations and stops for Hop on/ Hop off bus tours. The room was great, clean, tidy and plenty of space for four women sharing (and plenty of hot water for everyone to shower in the mornings!), coffee/ tea maker was well used and bottled water is provided each day which is great for taking with you when you go out and about the next day. Can't comment on the restaurant as we didn't use it (I mean New York isn't exactly short of amazing restaurants though it seemed a shame to not have one meal there), but the rooftop bar is AMAZING. The views are incredible, the cocktails are little expensive but what I would expect for a cocktail bar and the staff will make pretty much any drink you ask for as long as they can google the recipe. Two thumbs up for that! All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. We did have a couple of long waits for the elevators in the mornings but as they're serving so many floors I'm surprised we didn't have to wait longer!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is good. Nothing extra ordinarily good or bad. Stayed there for a week. Housekeeping is one of he best I’ve seen. Rooms are modern, baths are like new, and bed is comfortable. Only three things to improve:1) The room service was among the most expensive ($50 for an oatmeal with fruit and GF bread for 1 person). They just purchase food from somewhere and take it to your room in paper bags with plastic knives, fork and spoons.... forget about the nice little table with everything nicely served. 2) The restaurant downstairs is the palace for anything BUT healthy food. And the service from one of the bar waitress was just non existent. 3) Overly expensive cocktails in the roof bar. I mean $28 for a hot bourbon cider? Wow!! Not even at the standard roof bar the cocktails are this expensive. So, if you stay in this hotel, cross the street and have breakfast at Starbucks, and definitively don’t eat at the restaurant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Third time in NYC and third time staying here, although this time I did split between here and another hotel.Stayed in a deluxe suite this time. The suite includes a living room area and a large bathroom with separate enclosed shower and bathtub. The room is the same comfortable room as I'm used to and the amenities are plentiful, and include bathrobes, coffee/tea machine and a small empty fridge. No microwave is included, but I saw one being delivered to another room. The room did exhibit some small signs of wear and tear. There were scuff marks on the table in the living room, a chip on the wardrobe door and the bathroom door self-locked once time. However, none of this could outweigh the positives. Staff were approachable and I had pleasant conversation with the housekeeping staff on my floor. I took advantage of the Bar 54 tour (at 10:30am) this time, and the views are pretty stunning. Best of all is a very good view of the Chrysler Building. No ESB though. I'm quite familiar with this hotel by now and really the only thing I find annoying is the wait for the lifts. However, this is only a minor annoyance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel during a spring break trip with my family. Its located very close - walking distance, to Times Square. The staff was excellent and were always ready to provide assistance when needed. Lupita, Director of VIP Experience, was awesome. She went out of her way to make us feel at home the moment we arrived and checked in on us through our our stay to see if we needed anything. Breakfast was good, with a number of items to choose from. The rooms were good size, clean and everything worked although we didn't spend much time there. Dont miss going to the 54th floor observation deck for a view of the city at night. Its pretty cool. I will definitely return to this hotel on my next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is best described as ‘functional’. Rooms, even those with a bit of a view, are fairly small. Beds are comfortable but carpets are worn and bathroom towels etc aren’t of great quality. In the UK the rooms are best compared to that of the Premier Inn.The roof top bar (Bar 54) is nice with some great views over New York and cocktails are about $25 each.Location-wise, the hotel is great. 2 minutes from Times Square so if location is more important than the quality of room, this will be a good choice. If you want a better room for a similar price, the Intercontinental on the other side of Times Square I think is a better option.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt centric last week for 5 nights, 3 adults shared a room and it was perfectly fine. 2 queen beds in each room, coffee/tea making facilities, hairdryer, safe and lots of wardrobe space. All our needs and requests were catered for too. Great location just off Times Square and right by a shop that you can grab all your basic needs. I’d definitely stay here again .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Location, Great Service! Would definitely return next time we are in New York!Travelled with two kids, room great, we were on the 36th floor, with a great outlook over the city.No more than 5 mins walk from Times Square and Broadway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I typically don't write reviews like this but I have to give credit where credit is due. Just spent a weekend at the Hyatt Centric Times Square to celebrate my sweetheart's birthday and all I can say is WOW!! The location is wonderful and the hotel staff was so friendly and pleasing. Management clearly spends a great deal focusing on staff training. We were upgraded to an amazing suite with phenomenal views. I loved that we could actually open the windows in the bedroom and living room to get fresh air. Lupita Davis (Director of VIP Services) did a stellar job making sure everything was perfect for our weekend celebration. She did not miss a beat and kudos to her for going above and beyond for us!! Staying in the heart of Times Square would typically not be my 1st choice cause of all the crowds and noise but we didn't hear a peep from the outside even with our windows open. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. My only regret was we should have stayed a bit longer and we didn't have time to check out the gorgeous spa. We loved the rooftop bar and the views were sensational. Can't wait to come back!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hi. My wife and I recently spent 8 nights at this hotel over the St Patricks celebrations. As stated we have stayed before in a 5 star hotel by Central Park but decided this time to be more 'in the thick of the action', and we LOVED it. Yes we were asked once or twice when returning at night to show are room keys if a different security person was on duty something that some people have commented on as annoying but we found it reassuring and certainly no trouble. The location is super central with everything right outside but even so incredibly quiet in the room at night. The room size was very generous by New York standards and nicely decorated. We found all of the staff very nice and helpful without being intrusive and we would like for the cleaners to be thanked for looking after our room so well during our 8 night stay. Also a massive thank you to Lupita for her kind welcome and assistance. Going to an unknown hotel especially in a major city can be daunting and expectations dashed but on this occasion every minute was fantastic and we looked forward to returning to our room every night after hectic days out. This is my wifes favourite city and we would certainly return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 10 nights with our baby, and would gladly stay again. A reasonable price for the location, right next to Times Square and easy access to the subway and all it's links.The hotel is neat and tidy with welcoming lobby staff. Our room faced another building off the back, but we could still see lights from billboards at night. The bathroom was very modern, only a shower (no bath) which was very large. The bed was large and easily fit us and our baby with room to spare.Complimentary water bottles every day and extra available from the front desk when we went out. Umbrellas for use on the day it rained.The view from the 54th floor sky lounge was spectacular, we went both during the evening and at night to see all the different lights come on.Made for a great holiday in a great city!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for five nights in an executive suite. Reservations promised me a great view and an extra bed - none was delivered. Puts the staff in a bad situation as the hotel was fully booked and we couldn’t move room.Location is great and prices are fair - if you get the discounted rate... Restaurant is actually pretty good and more quiet than the hectic Times Square atmosphere. Might come back...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was very clean and staff was very accommodating. They went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. Location was close to everything! Rooms were very clean and up to date. Would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric as a group of friends one of whom was celebrating his 40th Birthday. On arrival we had been upgraded to a view room which was fantastic, large, modern and the view over Times Square was great! Having stayed in New York previously we couldn’t believe how spacious the room was. The location is superb just 2 minutes from Times Square and lots of the theatres nearby too. All staff were friendly, especially Lupita who organised a few surprises for the Birthday by our request before arrival, she was very accommodating and really ensures you have a great stay.Facilities were fantastic as was security.Hotel bar and roof top bar very nice, views were great.The Irish bars next to the hotel were all great for food and drinks. We would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to book again if returning to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I can’t say enough good things about this hotel. Ritchie the front desk (manager?) is awesome! He went above and beyond service expectations for us. He is also very nice and professional. All staff wonderful. This hotel is in a great location. The rooms are bright and clean. The bathrooms updated. For New York, nice big windows looking out at Times Square. City view rooms were wonderful. My kids didn’t want to close the curtains at night they loved the view. We can’t wait to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family stayed at the Centric over St Patricks Day Weekend 3/17/18. The hotel is immaculate with a fresh smell that just says welcome. The room was lovely and even had heated floors in the bathroom ( We needed it. The weather was cold). The location is in the heart of Times Square within easy walking distance of theater and restaurant row. I would definitely stay here again. Super friendly staff and a rooftop bar that cant be beat anywhere. Beautiful views and sunsets. Love this place!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I couldn't fault this hotel. Delicious warm cider in the lobby after a cold day sightseeing. Had a view out onto Times Square. So great to look out onto in the morning. Felt totally safe and secure. Didn't visit the roof top bar but that would be a must see, I'd say.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great NYC hotel in the perfect location, just off Times square, so you can walk everywhere. Light and airy bedrooms with comfy beds and good bathrooms facing South is best for good views but not as good as the view from the Sky lounge on 54th floor - a must for a beer before you go out and a cocktail before or after dinner. It has a gym and a Spa and doesn't cost the earth, serves a great breakfast and the staff seem relaxed and genuinely friendly. I prefer it to the W across the square, which just seems to be trying too hard to be super cool to me, and it's too dark. This is perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Couldn't fault this hotel . This is my 2nd visit and would highly recommend it. Large spacious room, friendly and helpful staff. There was a pc and printer available to print boarding cards. Starbucks coffee available in the room also which was much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a one bed king suite on the 21st floor and it was very nice. Decent size of bedroom and living space. The maid was excellent and always replenished the water, tea and coffee. Location was just off Times Square. Lots of food places nearby. Would recommend. The only negative comment I have is the lifts were very slow.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Time Square is the epicenter of loud chaotic energy that is within walking distance of so many attractions. The Hyatt Centric is a half-block from this madness in a 54-story building with a small footprint. The half-block distance cut down on the craziness to a considerable degree, but kept you close to this unique location. The small footprint meant that there were only a few rooms per floor (guessing 10-11) - so not much through traffic or noise from other guests. The 54-story allowed for good views if you chose the upper floor option. There are a number of elevators dedicated to the upper floors, and the running times were very reasonable. The lobby of the hotel is very nice, but is neither grand nor elegant. The front desk is efficient and courteous, but doesn't exude great warmth. Our room was appropriately sized. The furnishings were modern, up-to-date and well maintained. The bed and bedding were very comfortable. The bathroom was clean, nicely tiled, and attractive. We had a large shower (not a tub/shower combo) with great water pressure. One wall of our room was floor-to-ceiling side-to-side window - giving great views. But this also let in some of the city noise (e.g., sirens, honking) - which was greatly reduced by being off Times Square. The large window made temperature control a little tricky (when the curtain was open), so you needed to play with the digital thermostat to get comfortable. Our room was basically for sleeping, bathing and interim breaks throughout the day as we toured the city. The location was great, the chaos toned down, and the room peaceful with few disturbances from either inside or outside the hotel. (A temporary negative was a nearby construction site generated considerable noise starting promptly at 7am as they were jack hammering the foundation to a new building - for us, it served as an alarm clock.)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed in a few different hotels in NYC, but this has been the closest we have stayed to Times Square. This hotel and its staff are amazing. The room size is brilliant. Most of the time we have literally just had a bed and the bathroom. But in this hotel you get that little bit more and its worth it. The rooms are kept to a high standard, and you can't hear any noise from the street below.You turn right out of the hotel and walk to the end of the block and your in times square. It's a great place to base out of with subways close by and a walgreens for all those peanut butter m&m's and cheetos :)If your considering this hotel I'd say just book it, you won't regret it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just returned from a weekend at the Hyatt Centric. The rooms are lovely. We paid extra for a deluxe room which has floor to ceiling windows with the bed facing out looking down Manhattan. Stunning views!!! The room was a good size, clean with a lovely modern bathroom.Rooms were quiet with no or little noise from Times Square. Great location to visit all Manhattan sights.Only have given 4 stars instead of 5 due to the ridiculous prices in the bar. T54 is a lovely rooftop bar with amazing views but $60 for the cheapest bottle of wine is crazy. I know this is NYC but we did not return after our first visit due to the silly prices. Would definitely recommend this hotel but it you intend on visiting the roof top bar make sure you bring stacks of dollars!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Got an opportunity to stay here in April last year. We selected this hotel because of its prime location. It is at Times Square and hardly 3-4 minutes walk from nearby subways, eateries & medical stores.We loved interacting with the helpdesk both while booking this place and after we checked in. They were polite and very friendly. While checking in, we encountered some technical issues with payment processing but the reception made the whole process of checkin very smooth for us.Hyatt also has a roof top lounge bar which is worth every penny because of their service, cocktails and city view.Our room was very comfortable. Be it water bottles, coffee machine, etc, the hotel took care of each and every detail to make our stay comfortable.Not to forget, the security & safety of this hotel is amongst the best I have experienced in USA.Would love to stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a mother/daughter trip to New York. My daughter turned 13 and this was her first time in New York. The hotel is in a great location. Just a quick walk to Time Square and 5th Avenue. Other then check-in the hotel staff was extremely friendly. Our room was on the corner of the 45th floor and we had an amazing view. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spa and gym very good. Front desk okay not that caring. Crazy elevator situation have to wait sometimes. I stayed in 43rd floor the heat and ac was weird. Sometimes cold and sometimes hot air blowing. Also hair dryer wasn’t working and I asked for another one and never got it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We are holding a conference nearby and most of us are staying in this hotel. The staff have been very helpful and understanding around all the logistics over the last few months. Now that I'm actually here, I'm glad we are staying. While not the biggest hotel & it does lack a lounge area, the hotel is very comfortable with some great views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family stayed at the Hyatt Centric over Spring Break and our stay was perfect. Great location for subways and walking. Extremely pleasant staff, especially the restaurant manager. Our kids (5 & 9) loved it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lupita, Walter, and the rest of the staff that we interacted with were awesome. They made sure all of our needs and desires were met. Clean room with a great view from high floors. Breakfast was expensive but very good. This hotel is a two minute walk from Times Square. Heated bathroom floors and comfy beds just add to this hotels excellent offerings. Treat yourself to a stay here, moderately priced!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were cared for by Lupita, she made us feel like royalty. My daughter, niece and me were in town to see a Broadway show. The hotel is lovely, brand new and stylish. It is centrally located and close to many food options. Great trip! I would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were a family of 4 and had a great experience with the hotel and staff. The room was a good size and was very clean and welcoming. Hotel is right in times square so was perfect for us 1st time visitors! Rooftop bar has amazing views but our 13 yr old was only allowed up for photos and then had to leave, which is fair enough. Is pricey though!! Suppose your paying for the view!. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have hesitated to stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square because of so many other fabulous properties in NYC and the unknown of this property, but I finally made a stay (three nights on a business trip). I was pleased and surprised with the quality of the property and location, but the service and "heart" of the experience were disappointing. GOOD:I stayed in a basic king room--I asked for a quiet one, was put on the 44th floor (4405)--it was quiet, away from the elevators (which are not loud--and they're FAST) and high enough that it was indeed quiet.The room's design is sleek and modern, but not too stiff/cold. It's comfortable. The bed is comfortable, linens are crisp looking, yet soft. The shower/bathroom is great (except a colleague staying a few floors down had cold water each morning and had to call to have something done (a fire lit??) that's unacceptable...more than one day in a row). Some towels are new and fluffy, some are tired and flat. The bath products are nice, though not always refreshed each day (?). Robes are not automatically provided in the room, which is odd. Wifi was free and fast. The HVAC was super responsive, quickly cooled/heated the room on demand, without loud sounds/breezy drafts. NOT GOOD:The carpet in my room needs to be steamed with stain removal... it's not been kept up. Cleaned, but never deep cleaned?The front desk staff, at check-in, had to be summoned to serve me--they were at the desk, but I had to ask them if they'd be willing to check me in (they were talking to each other, and generally inattentive).The "guest services" receptionists (by phone) were unaware of general answers to questions I posed (the time for breakfast, what breakfast services were available, the availability of room service, etc.) And, on the subject of room service--NO ROOM SERVICE IS AVAILABLE between 11p-6a. Each day, I was out by 6a for work, and had to find breakfast elsewhere--this caused me to leave the hotel to find a new hotel that could provide such service.Some large groups arrived for check in--it would seem plausible to have someone from the hotel take that group away from the front desk (which is very small and difficult to get service from b/c of its small set up) so other guests could be served. It would be great to have a greeter or someone managing the small lobby area to ensure people are in line for the right service, ushered to where they are needed, etc.I was contacted by email, several days in advance of arrival, and asked if I had any particular requests or needs. I wrote back to that email the day before my arrival (maybe the day of arrival) and said I was excited for the stay--needed a quiet room and might want to extend my stay beyond the existing reservation. The email was returned more than a day after check in, I was told nothing was available--it was a short, curt email. I'm tired of properties that send emails asking how they can help and then never being helpful...it's common, but it added to my disappointment at the Centric TSquare. The VIP Experience emailer did write and apologize--offering free breakfast...but as mentioned, breakfast is not available when I need it...so I can't stay at this property.A couple other minor issues: Elevators do not emit any sound when they arrive at the floor where I've requested...and they are hard to see at one time--so I miss them. They need to "ding." The gym was dirty--the floor looked as if it had not been vacuumed in weeks. The restroom in the gym did not have any lighting--so I used my phone's flashlight to see...the light was broken. (The gym's equipment was pretty good/updated)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hotel is very central few steps to Times Square. The only downside 'tipping' We didn't realise that you are meant to tip daily. We always tip at the end if we are satisfied. We noticed little things. Curtains not opened, coffee pods not refilled etc. We were very confused as stay at Hyatt's around the world regularly. My husband went on line and googled and realised we were being 'punished' for not tipping everyday. I feel it should have been written up somewhere as we genuinely did not know. Tipping is so hard to work out when you come from a country that doesn't expect tips. I would prefer it was built into the cost of the room and distributed evenly amongst the staff. Then if we find a particular staff member goes above and beyond leave a bonus. We will know for the future and I gather it is because the staff may change daily. I just found it very petty. Did we leave a tip at the end. Sadly NO. not this time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There is much misinformation that led me to believe this was some top of the line, extravagant hotel. My experience was not welcoming nor pleasant. The "accommodating" staff forgot my late check-out 3 times. I noted this on my reservation, spoke with 2 managers, know their names even, but will not list them to protect them from getting a bad rap. But along with those two, I told the lady at check-in at my 11pm check-in and even called the following morning after finally being able to get a few hours of sleep after the dreadful, torturous storm leaving me with no power and no heat for a total of 1 whole week. In the morning I called to verify the time given and they indicated no records. Talk about communication, or lack thereof. The hotel, very clean, very well kept.
