But for the outrageous prices and taxes and fees? Save that money to go elsewhere is what I'd recommend. It is not worth the headaches especially knowing I was going to get charged for their mistakes. Other things to note... I requested a king bed, of course that didn't happen. I requested a higher floor room away from noise and away from the elevator. That didn't happen. I asked how they fared on rooms, they were pretty wide open. So I know I wasn't cared for appropriately. I am very dissatisfied and disappointed and I do hope management resolves this and I hope this gets brought to their attention and to Hyatt as a whole.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So, Last my friend booked a night in this Hotel for US and next day we were traveling overseas. 1st thing was my friend got charged twice and they refund her money after. So we were kinda shocked starting of the day. When we came it was around 10, our rooms supposed to be ready but they were Not!!! So they told to store lugges and we said ok we'll explore and come back.When we came back around 2 and rooms were still not ready they gave us 1 room and asked us if we can go there with all the luggage once the other rooms are ready they will let us know. it was annoying.NEXT Morning! we checked out we stored our luggage again and this time I tagged all my belongings with sticker we went out to explore and came before 5 there was truck loading our luggages.We went to airport I was checking out my luggages and I noticed I'm missing my backpack luckily my Passport was with me!!! I called them asking if the can bring it to air port they said no! if they can shipped to my hotel they said they will charge me and add IT WAS THEIR MISTAKE NOT LOADING MY BACKPACK and I should've checked as well.I made a deal with Manager that I will be coming to pick my BACKPACK and she said sure and she was nice.I came back from overseas right away to the hotel and asked for my back and they said THERE IS NOTHING then insisiting on giving her name of the Manger or she can't help.I was so so frustrated I asked her if I can go checked myself she said I'm not allowed then I spoke with Manger which allowed me to go check one of the stores rooms not the other one.This Manager was nice, she said she'll take responsibility and if they didn't find it they will refund money. After I left hotel to take another flight home she CALLS ME AND SAYS SHE FOUND MY BACKPACK.IT TOOK THEM A MONTH TO SEND MY BACKPACK VERY FRUSTRATING !!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for work while teaching a workshop. While I have stayed here several times this stay was a bit disappointing. Despite asking for a quiet room was in a very noisy area, and while the hotel was clearly not sold out the management would not move me because of some aspect of my reservation. There was significant construction noise also. In addition the elevators were constantly out of service. At one point could not get to my room on 7th floor for 15 minutes. Staff would not comment on non-functional elevators.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything was pricey; however, that is to be expected in NYC. The hotel was so clean, comfortable, and safe. They accommodate with my itinerary change due to bad weather and flight cancellations. I definitely enjoyed the stay and the timely service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Convenient location for those wanting to explore Midtown/Times Square. Hotel premises are new, small room but clean and modern look. Hotel valet was very friendly (night shift), helping us proactively unload the several bags we had. Hotel front desk though was not that friendly in some cases, especially when we were leaving the bags for later pickup (morning time).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was a wonderful stay !! Set in the perfect place , a few steps away from Times Square !Professional staff , great Restuarant for breakfast , superb pool , the view from the Rooftop Bar was Superb !We had drinks and snacks st the Rooftop Bar to finish off my daughters 21 st birthday ! Clean fresh linen and helpful room service !! My second stay and I will definitely be back !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited on March 1-4, from Texas. Was our first time in NYC and we werent sure what to expect. I read reviews and did alot of research, so was a little nervous about dirty, cramped hotels, rude people and hidden fees on the reservation. We changed our hotel 3 times before deciding on Hyatt Centric. Booked on hotels.com and didnt have to pay until we checked in. We got the Standard room with a view. In the note section on the booking, i mentioned that it was our first time in NYC and we wanted a room up high with a good view. We arrived early, check in was at 3 but we went early, hoping they'd hang on to our luggage until check in, but our room was ready & they let us check in around 1:00. We were on the 32nd floor, one wall was solid windows with an amazing view of Times square. I had read about how noisy the city was at night with sirens, horns and trash trucks & I packed ear plugs that we didnt even need. When the window is open you get a good breeze, and when its closed you cant hear a thing. Blackout curtains kept the room dark from the flashing lights of time square and the morning sun. The hospitality team left us a gift bag with treats, and a coffee mug & keychain with a nice hand written card welcoming us to the city. The room was super clean, plenty of room, comfy bed, fluffy pillows & the duvet was so nice i wanted to bring it home!!! They provided a lighted make up mirror & a really good hair dryer so I didnt have to bring my own. The Cleaning staff was practically invisible. I never saw them, but they slipped in every day while we were out & replenished our towels & toiletries & cleaned up the room very nice for us. There were not robes in the room, but you can request them among other things if you call the front desk. There's a Keurig & a fridge in the room. The bar upstairs was nice, however expensive- (but its NYC what isnt) amazing view from the terrace outside the bar. The hotel is literally IN Time square, took us about 2 minutes to walk there. If you want to take Uber, it takes them about 2 minutes to be right at the front door. When you come in after a long day the doormen do ask to see your keycard to prove you are staying there, but that was added security that we appreciated. I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city. You might pay a tiny bit more than some others, but its TOTALLY worth it to know you have an awesome place to call home while you are visiting. Zero complaints. We had an amazing trip & will definitely stay here again! advice for first timers, if you arrive at LaGuardia, take a cab & its between $30 & $50 depending on traffic. Uber was $35 back to the airport on sunday. DO take the subway, just download app & its easy to navigate anywhere you need to go. There are at least 2 stations within close proximity of the hotel. Walgreens in Time square has everything you need, drinks, beer, or snacks for the mini fridge (cheap) & only a 5 min walk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We been here to celebrate my birthday i booked like 4 months earlier...We arrived and the girl at the reception was super rude, don t even done a smile responding yes and no...When you are in a hotel like that you would and pretend an efficient and well trained staff.The security guy always asking for the hotel card (because of the roof)Breakfast good but if not included very expensive...roof top super cool!Rooms are ok... nothing special they even forgot to give us slippers... i mean you are hyatt not the last hotel in the world .Need to offer a better service

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our choice of Hyatt centric Times Square was perfect.Dede the amazing lady at the front desk that checked us in was so welcoming and helpful,even though we arrived earlier than check in time she managed to find a room to accommodate us and it was just perfect.Very spacious room with amazing views.The housekeeping service from Pepe was really outstanding i give her a 10+++,so clean and perfect.All the staff was really helpful and welcoming.The hotel's location is the best since you are near Times Square and all the attractions.Even though it's in a really noisy area,the rooms are very quiet,you are not disturbed by anything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right in the heart of Times Square in walking distance to many shows, restaurants and Madison Square Garden, the rooms were very spacious for NYC and the staff was super friendly and helpful, even furnishing umbrellas to us to use. The restaurant was great and they have a roof-top bar. We would definitely stay there on our next NY trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in mid January on our first trip to NY. We requested a high floor room (level 22) which had an out look through the surrounding buildings. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. Staff were very polite and helpful including our room attendant.This hotel is positioned approx. 70m up West 45th St from Times Square so you are right there in the middle of the action. The roof top bar was also a great first experience of the New York skyline and the outdoor igloos gave some protection from the freezing temperatures.We enjoyed our stay here very much

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Placed 2 minutes walk from times square.Location is un replaceable.Crew is kind and supportive.Rooms are clean and nice.Upper floors have amazing view of a panoramic NY sky scrapers.Enjoyed staying

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed here while we were in New York celebrating our 10 yr wedding anniversary. We opted for a suite on the higher floors with a view. Our room was EXACTLY what we requested which was nice...sometimes you don’t always get what you’re expecting when you book a hotel! It’s right by Times Square, and super close to all of the touristy places like Rockefeller Center and Radio City. We were always welcomed with a smile by anyone at the front desk, and they had security checking for room keys before we got to the elevators. I would DEFINITELY stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and the bar/food was great. I booked a corner room which had superb views. Clean, warm and comfortable. Pricier than other hotels but I felt it was worth paying the extra. Bustling hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really nice spot with super vibe and friendly staff,great location. Will definitely stay here again. Comfortable room with great view of the big apple. Lots of great spots within walking distance, reasonably priced. Made a tough family visit comfortable. Many Thanks

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I attended the Little Big Town Concert at Radio City, so we were looking for something close to the venue. We couldn't beat the location or the price for a NYC hotel room. The room and bathroom were clean and spacious but what really stood out was the staff. Everyone from security, front desk, bartenders, were all friendly, helpful and nice! The rooftop bar is a must see - very chic and a fantastic view. Make sure to make a reservation. The only complaint was the wait time for the elevators but it shouldn't be a deterrent to stay there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this location hotel as it was close to Times Square which is a great location of your going to hit all the usual sites.This is a great hotel and all the staff are really friendly right from the word go and they go out of there way to help you with anything.We were celebrating a birthday and the gave us a great room with a view and left a happy birthday card, gifts and chocolates with a hand written note which was very special.Rooms were very good standard and beds super comfy and the whole hotel is of a really high standardWill come back again for sure and would highly recomend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a short stay in NY and found this hotel ideal for this. It has 54 floors , rooftop bar , 11 rooms per floor . Nice cafe bistro at ground floor . Rooms are fresh , clean and big . My room was on a 51 st floor with amazing view . Hotel use special odur and it has a nice smell. 1 minute walk to Times Square main lightings avenue. Recommended !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for one night this week. We had a corner room on the 37th floor overlooking Times Square. The room and bathroom were very spacious especially for NYC. The room was also very clean. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and professional. The rooftop bar is awesome and we got very lucky with a warm day in February to enjoy it. This will definitely be our go to hotel in NYC from now on!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt always does a great job and the Hyatt Centric Times Square is no exceptionLocation is usually a key factor and the Hyatt Centric puts you within a few steps of the action of Times Square and the Theater District. That being said, its still far enough away to keep it on the quiet side.The hotel is contemporary in style. The rooms have the look of being recently refreshed and are of average size for this venue. I strongly suggest a room with a balcony on a higher floor. The views and photos from the 27th floor were incredible.The check-in area is very small and gets crowded quickly but the process was seamless. The employees were friendly and knowledgeable.Don't forget to visit the club on the 54th Floor and bring your credit card as cocktails start at $20. The bartenders were outstanding and the drinks very good. The atmosphere and view are definitely worth it.All in all, I can't think of much I didn't like about the Hyatt Centric Times Square property. It should be on your short list when visiting the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just got home after 3 nights stay at this hotel. Had an exec room which was great. Location is perfect, couple of mins walk from times square and Broadway. Staff were really helpful. I forgot my contact lenses and they found me one close by and the opticians managed to source me some lenses. The bar on the roof was decent, with amazing views.Wouldn't hesitate in staying at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were here to celebrate my wife's anniversary so we had some family and friends joining from different parts of the World. The Front Desk staff was extremely friendly and willing to help, managing to accommodate all our needs and demands (fairly big group, different room types, different arrival dates). Also Concierge was very professional, same as F&B staff both in the T45 Restaurant and at the 54 Rooftop Bar. Housekeeping did a great job as well, preparing our rooms in great shape and offering very good service during our stay. The hotel itself is nice and very clean. Rooms are big enough and if you get a high floor facing Times Square, the view is jus amazing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this hotel it is beautiful room is very spacious which many hotels in nyc are not. The view was nice and the room has 2 queen beds not double which is rare in nyc. I would deff. Stay here again I loved the room it was nice and clean. Its location is perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Biz or pleasure ideal spot for central NYC 10 minutes from Macy's 2 from Bryant Park and Central Park is a leisurely walk away. Well appointed suite. Clean and tidy. Staff friendly in this busy hotel. Decent bloody mary in the bistro style bar. Roof top bar has great views though can be packed and could be cleaner when bust.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My 1st stay in an NYC hotel living in NYC. I selected this hotel for a quick stay for Valentines Day with my wife to get away from the kids. I was not disappointed. I have no complaints. Everything is modern and hi-tech. I just wished I could have spent the night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Value: For NYC, this is excellent value at <$250/night.Location: Our first time at this hotel and Hyatt brand. We usually stay at the Park Hyatt or Grand Hyatt; or Le Merdian. Central location, easy access around town. Loved this location. This is the perfect location for tourists and business. It’s on 45th street between 6th and 7th Ave (right in the middle o the block). It’s 1 block from Times Square but still super quiet. Entrance on 45th is a quiet street. I like this location better compared to the W Times Square, which is too close to pedestrian action, making it hard to get in and out of the hotel. Here, you can easily pick up taxis on 6th Ave to head uptown, or on 7th Ave to head downtown. For business, it’s a short walk from mid-town (Park and Madison). We had theatre tickets and hotel is literally 2 blocks away, which was really nice. All the shops in Times Square are open until midnight, which is so awesome. Lobby/Common Area: The lobby is relatively small, but has a nook sitting area. But I will say that service here is a bit uneven. When we arrived at 9pm, there was no bellman outside, so we grabbed one of the luggage carts and loaded our luggage on it. The front desk was full of people and we couldn’t get anyone’s attention to open the automatic doors for us (it was roped off and only the revolving doors were open). Finally, a cleaning staff who was emptying the trash can came to help us with the luggage. Standard Room: We booked a standard room, which only has a shower (Deluxe Room has a tub). The room was typically NYC room, a bit on the small side, but comfortable for 2 people. A large king size bed and soft linens. But the pillows were the flattest pillows I’ve ever slept on, very strange. The room has a club chair and ottoman. The bathroom is surprisingly large, with lots of counter space and a surprise, heated floors, which was so nice! The room however did not have robes or slippers. The bath amenities was a pleasant mango scent. Standard bath amenities plus shaving cream, mouth wash, and deodorant. Nice! Suite: We enjoy taking baths, so we inquired about switching rooms and used our suite upgrades. Note: Apparently, some suites do not have bath tubs. We’re Hyatt Globalist and hotel manager reached out to check on our stay, he was able to accommodate a suite upgrade for part of our stay. The suite is modern and has a spacious bedroom, but living room is oddly laid out with a curvy desk that takes up a lot of space in an awkward angle. The bathroom has a huge bathtub in an enclosure sauna like space with separate shower. This was such an indulgence and my favorite part of this room. The sink area is smaller than the standard room as a result, but that’s ok. The bathroom floors for the suite however are not heated. But there are robes and slippers. Other room amenities: bottled water, coffee and tea. TIP: Hotel has humidifier, which is nice since it’s so dry. The hotel also has umbrellas to loan, it was pouring rain for one day and glad to have them. Note: $35 each if you lose them.Food: As Globalist, we get free breakfast for 2, either at the restaurant downstairs or room service. Love this amenity! The food is quite good. We actually had lunch and dinner at the restaurant T45 a couple of time and enjoyed the bistro style food. We highly recommend dining here.Security: There was always security staff in the lobby in the evenings and they ask to see your key before letting you go to the elevators. However, no key card access is needed to access your floor. Had a very enjoyable stay and we would absolutely stay here again on our next NYC trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked through British Airways holidays with flights, was pleasantly surprised at the value we got.Rooms spacious and well done equipped. Huge shower, underfloor heating in bathroom, big tv, mood lighting,Bluetooth JBL speaker, concierge are extremely helpful and get anything you ask for in in minutes.Security are friendly too which makes a change.Only down point is you don’t see much of Times Square from your room, despite the name of the hotel, but you are literally 30 seconds walk away from it.Would definitely stay here again at the price paid

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice stay. Comfortable and modern rooms. Wasn’t noisy even though at Times Square! Would go again on personal trip as this was a business trip. The area is very alive and upbeat. Great for a weekend away!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great experience (again) with the Hyatt Centric Times Square. The location is perfect, in terms of being right in the middle of Times Square and with easy access to most subway lines and many popular areas of the city. Staff were friendly and efficient. The room was quiet and comfortable. The bed was the perfect combination of firm-soft, and the bedding was so nice. My favorite place to stay in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for a week and had a great deal with breakfast included, the staff are really friendly and nothing is too much trouble from the reception staff to the bartender to the cleaners they all want to make your stay special. The location is fantastic your close enough to Times Square without actually being right on it. This was our second visit to this hotel and I would certainly go back if we visit NYC again and would definitely recommend this place

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Agreeing with all the reviews before. Great location - walking distance to Time Square and the shopping area on 5th Avenue. Nice rooftop bar with a great view of the NYC skyline. Go before sunset to grab a view of the orange skyline and then the night lights. Great drinks, friendly bartenders. Rooms are thoughtfully designed. Lots of charging stations for the connected traveler. The service is impeccable. Well trained staff - polite (a rarity in NYC) and hospitable. Dede at the front desk was fantastic. Would definitely come back again when back in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is really in a good location, but unfortunately you have to deal with poor Front Desk staff who check in LATE & all what he has to say: “what can i do, they just finish cleaning the room”!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern hotel, one or two blocks away from times square, great stay for short visit to NYC. Rooms were clean, comfortable and good in size. Bathroom was modern, huge and nice glass shower room with rainy shower. Free unlimited water bottles in room was a bonus. Requested slippers but were not available. No toilet amenities such as cotton and ear qtip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the mixologists there have the most creative drinks....beso de coco was one of our favorites....at night you simply cannot beat the view.....some drinks may be on the pricey side but if you have expanded your taste buds to more than beer wine and gin and tonics...this is a good place to taste unusual drinks have been there several times and intend to return again.......place designed to accomodate all configurations of singles...groups etc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel centrally located near Times Square/theater district. We love it here and have been 5+ times. Each stay we are greeted with a smile and everyone is so friendly and helpful! The desk ladies who have helped us were Dede and Meram who were amazing! They pay attention to details and always make sure you are happy! They have had the same staff for years so you know they are being treated right. We also always have wonderful accommodations. We have stayed in the executive suite, the deluxe suite with a view and their standard room. All have been clean and comfortable. If you need anything, you just call and they are prompt and friendly when you request what you need.All in all our favorite hotel and we will continue to come back. Thank you!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, clean hotel, spacious rooms, comfy beds. Nice heated floors in the bathroom.But please fix the elevator situation! They were also filled to capacity and we had to walk and carry luggage.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently spent 2 nights (Friday & Saturday) at the Hyatt Centric for our 1st wedding anniversary. We had a "suite" (bedroom and sitting room) on the 51st floor next to the elevator. That last detail is important, but I'll get to that in a moment.Location: The hotel is just off Times Square. I'm always a little wary of staying that close because of the noise and crowds...but if you're looking for "action," you can't get much closer. LOTS to do/see - with plenty of restaurants and shows - within a short walking distance. And we had no problems with noise/crowds for our stay.Check-in: Quick and easy.Room: Our suite was fantastic! Yes - it was relatively small for a suite...but that's NYC. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the sitting room was very nice, and the bathroom was great: the tub with separate overhead shower (next to it) not only looked great, but made for great baths/showers.And the view... Wow! I've stayed in a lot of hotels in NYC, but this view was one of the best I've seen. Just breathtaking.Our initial concern about being next to the elevator was unfounded. Maybe no one else was on the floor? If they were, we couldn't tell - it was completely quiet!Another bonus: The hotel has a wonderful spa! We treated ourselves to massages, which were fantastic. The spa was clean and comfortable, with nice amenities, and the staff was warm, friendly, and helpful.Check-out: Quick and easy. There was a long line (it was 11am - check-out time), but they had 3 people at the desk and another person was working the line with a tablet, so everyone was taken care of quickly. Kudos to the Hotel for making it a smooth process.Overall: We visit NYC regularly, often staying someplace different just for a change. But we both remarked how much we loved the Hyatt Centric and will definitely return. The location, amenities, and staff just can't be beat. (And besides: we need to check out the rooftop bar next time!)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wow! Hyatt group never disappoint !! Stayed in Grand Hyatt Scott Road Singapore in 2016 and you have done it again this time in NEW YORK Times Square! Fantastic location! Beautiful views!we stayed on the 45th floor and the view from our bedroom overlooking Manhattan is amazing!..clean and newly refurbished room!the Rooftop Bar is a great place to watch the sunset! Maybe don't use the Spa,it can be expensive and the massage is rubbish!.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in a “suite” for a few days. Pretty tight accommodations for a suite, but comfortable. Bed was very comfortable. Bath good sized, no access from bedroom which is odd. Huge bath and separate shower enclosure with overhead and handheld sprayers. Single vanity. Keurig was not plugged in, had to fish cord through furniture to get it to work. Interesting multiplex lighting throughout suite. Room service akin to takeout delivery, brown bag and all, but good food. First stay in a Centric brand. A little more euro-minimal than I am used to but not bad at all. I’d stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel staff were very friendly. Our room was clean and spacious. The hotel is located just off Times Square meaning that the main tourist attractions are easily within walking distance. The rooftop bar is a must if you are staying here; amazing views!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Found in this hotel a spacious, comfortable and clean room, as well as its bathroom. It was a excellent surprise in Manhattan! Very good location to go to the broadway shows. Friendly staff (hotel and spa).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel has a super spacious and clean room (as well as bathroom), which was a pleasant finding in Manhattan. It also has a strategic location to broadway shows. I also used its spa for a manicure and the service was very friendly. Thanks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved that this hotel was so central and close to most things. Rooms are clean. Loved the hairdryer. Was the best ever in a hotel. The rooms are small and dark. Concierge staff not helpful at all, put me off the hotel completely.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights this trip. Check in was a breeze. Was upgraded to a deluxe room on the 44th floor. Beautiful accommodations. Love the amenities and was surprised by thoughtful treats sent up by Maya and was able to get a late check out. Short walk to all theatres. Saw 5 shows in 4 days. Bliss! Wouldn’t stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had the warmest welcome and the staff were great. Hotel was spacious and clean. Love, love, love this hotel. Very well situated. We stayed for 5 nights. The Bar 54 restaurant's food and service was equally as good

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was great. Our room on the 42nd floor was big and very comfortable. The bathroom was also large and modern. Everything was clean, the bed was excellent,and we appreciated having free WiFi, complimentary bottled water and a Keurig coffee machine with pods. The rooftop bar had amazing views but was pricey. The hotel location was near Tmes Square, the Theatre District, restaurants, and the subway. The staff was friendly and accommodating. My only issue with the hotel was the flat, feather pillows provided on the bed. It took 3 of them for comfortable sleeping.. I also thought they were an odd choice since many people are allergic. Perhaps guests can request a different option before checking in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place to stay if you want to be near the Times Square area. Very good service. Comfortable and clean rooms. The food is very tasty. The view from the rooftop is very nice. The staff is very friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here with my wife, the rooms were lovely and spacious for new-york ,we were in floor 25 and it was quite were little street noise.The restaurant and bar were also nice . It’s right next to time square,As other hotels are 2 blocks away and advertise there hotels as time square .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love, love, love this hotel!!!! Great location! We stayed for one night to see 2 pm Broadway Show and room was ready for our early check-in. John at the front desk was very nice and professional. We had lunch downstairs before the show and it was perfect! Maria and Nikey? ( male bartender ) did a great job! Thank you so much! We will be back for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Traveled up to the Hyatt Centric for my birthday, single solo traveling. I felt safe at the hotel and the minute I walked into the hotel and to the front desk and spoke with Steven and Jenny at the front desk I knew that the Hyatt Centric was going to be my all-time home away from home hotel. From booking my reservations online to calling in to make changes and asking questions about pre-paying my stay with Gloria the staff have been courteous and helpful. I originally had a king bed, but my sister decided to come up my last night to celebrate my birthday with me, so I made a change to two queens bed with no problem. I was upgrade to a room with a tub which I loved due to my knee problem from surgery last year. The room was big and very clean and had a refrigerator which is another plus and a microware was delivered to my room at no cost, so I could use it to heat up my heat pad for my knee. The hotel is in a terrific location, easy to get around Time Square and the subway. Loved the top bar which you can go on the balcony and look out over the city. Hotel send a bottle of champagne and brownies for my birthday which I had when I got home...Thank you Hyatt Centric Times Square for a wonderful birthday. Hope to see you again feb/mar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: These rooms are very big for NYC and so are the bathrooms. We come to nyc overnight in January for a broadway show. Staff is very nice and upgraded all 3 of our rooms to a nice view. The rooms are very big for nyc and bathrooms nice. The gym is big and clean with all new equipment and large windows. There is also a rooftop bar that has great views. We were in room 3202 and my only critique is the fan would rattle very loud in the middle of the night when the heat would go on. Despite this i would still stay here again. Great location if you’re seeing a show.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everyone from the front desk clerk to the cleaning staff were friendly and courteous. The room was clean and well appointed. I was obvious that management had sourced the right people for their hotel and the best amenities for the rooms. I was leaving with a smile on my face. I called the suggested 30 minutes ahead for my car and proceeded to checkout. My car took nearly an hour and a half to bring around from two blocks away. This disrupted our plans to meet with family for lunch and soured my feelings for the hotel. The hotel staff were quick to blame the garage service but did not take responsibility for sourcing the wrong garage. If they take such great care in sourcing all the other amenities why should they drop the ball on the garage service. I would have felt better if they had told me they would work to prevent this from happening in the future.I paid $65 to park the car for a night and their was no offer for any refund or partial refund despite the poor service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great hotel and the location is just off of Times Square so not too hustle bustle feeling, but close enough to restaurants, theaters and shopping.Go to top of Hotel bar and experience the city in the bubble.Rooms very clean and quiet. We love this hotel when staying in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I brought my two kids here for my daughters sweet 16. Never being to the city before, arriving here was a great start. DeDe treated us like we were the only guests there. So personable, accommodating and made my daughter feel so special .... as well as this mom! The hotel is immaculately clean, modern, beautiful. We only stayed one night and wished for more. Great location!! Can’t wait to come here again!Thank you Hyatt and DeDe!!!Kendra

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great “Centric” location. Step from time square, tour buses and major attraction. Starbucks was across the street and made breakfast a breeze. The staff was genuinely caring and helpful. Thanks Jeff and Mikey.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I sat for a while to recollect our stay in the Hyatt Centric Times Square and unusually for me I couldn't recall anything negative that impacted our stay. This place was great from the time we checked in until the time we left and then checked in again and then left again......I'll make sense of that soon.We arrived Dec 30 for a stay until Jan 4th. NY on NYE wasn't the reason for coming it just fell perfectly within our travel itinerary. We chose this particular hotel as it was central to everything. We arrived to the New York chill from DC that evening. We were checked in by a very helpful guy who's name escapes me. He was very informative about the details for getting onto 45th and back to our hotel after the NFL game and quick to have us checked in and up to the room. It's always nice when you're nodding your head with satisfaction before you've even hit the room. Tick!Now we've stayed in three different hotels previously in NYC and all have been basically show boxes regardless of the room type we selected. This time was completely different though. We had a Deluxe Room with 2QB which by NY standards was huge! I was very pleasantly surprised that this would be the room the three of us would be in for the next 5 nights. As we had three large suitcases, a couple of carry-ons and our large winter coats, boots and the like every square inch of space mattered. Tick!The beds were comfortable, the pillows weren't but I was getting used to the incredibly over soft downy pillows US hotels proffered to use. The bathroom was likewise huge for NY standards. A massive bench, a bath! and a huge shower, all clean and modern. We booked a high floor room for the obvious views over the city and were on the 50th floor out of 54. Later we were also on the 10th and that was still good. More on that later. Rooms were always cleaned and made up in a timely manner and complimentary water restocked.The Hotel has a small bar/ restaurant next to it. We had a beer and a hot chocolate there but didn't worry about a breakfast or dinner, there's just so many places around that area you could stay for a year and still not eat in them all. While we were there New York endured what we were told was a 'bomb cyclone' or something like that in which the temperatures one day dropped to 3F (-16C) with wind chill to -22F (-30C). It was insane! The average was around 14F (-10C) every day. Upon checking out we drove to the airport through the ever growing layer of snow. I wanted to see snow (we're from Australia, no snow where we we are ever) but this was crazy. Flights in all three NY airports were grounded and rebooking flights at the earliest was in three days time. Back to the Hyatt Centric where we re-checked, this time in a Standard 2QB room as the Deluxe were no longer available.So onto the standard room. Well this was definitely a let down from the Deluxe but you expect that. Much smaller room footprint, way smaller bathroom and just little things that make all the difference when you get to compare. Smaller rain shower head, no pull out vanity mirror on the wall, tiny bedside clock instead of large full function, just little things. Still nice, clean and modern, just not deluxe. This was a 10th floor room and we still had a nice city (I should say buildings) view and in future I can't see any real reason to pay extra to go up 40 floors. A few other things to note was security to get to the elevators everyday and checking room keys after 4pm. This happened all the way up until NYE and onward after so I gather it's an ongoing thing. Hot apple cider for anyone in the foyer. You have to try it, it's like hot liquid apple pie and when it's snowing outside it's a warm welcome back to the hotel.Like I thought before I started typing, this place is hard to fault. We had a ball in NY as always and would highly recommend the Hyatt Centric Times Square. Winner, winner, chicken dinner! Thanks guys!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I love staying at Hyatt’s. This one was no exception. Check in was a breeze. Our room on the 47th floor had a nice view, and the rooftop bar had an excellent selection of drinks with an even better view. Fast elevators meant a very little wait, if any, to go up or down. The location was great too, within walking distance to everything we wanted to visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, very central to major attractions, theatres, restaurants etc., and good value for the money. The view from the rooftop lounge on the 54th floor is amazing. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights at the end of a long trip at the States at the Hyatt Centric TSNY. This hotel is amazing. Only a few steps away from the whole buzz of Times Square, with amazing new rooms and excellent views. Everything seems to work smoothly and overall our stay was excellent!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As the hotel name suggests, this property is right in the heart of times square. Literally minutes away from all theaters and restaurants. The staff is amazingly friendly and while the hotel is busy, they treat you like your a vip. The bar on the roof is a must see view and the bar staff is excellent. The rooms are modern with touches that very fine hotels dont even have.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Brought my 11 year old for his first trip to NYC. Perfect central location! Although very close, the hotel was just far enough (and around the corner) from Times Square to get a peaceful night's rest. Had a room on the 36th floor with slight view of the square. Staff was friendly. Room was clean and spacious. Security on-site. Restaurant not really kid- friendly, but the Chick-fil-a around the corner and Starbucks across the street made up for that. - When the kid's feet start hurting, it's about a 9$ uber ride to most of the tourist attractions. Would stay here again, without the child, and take advantage of the nearby pubs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was going to be a weekend trip just so my sister could meet up with us from Boston and what better way to meet in the middle at Times Square !!!! Got here at 3:30 pm- check in was 4 and sipped on some warm apple cider that was ready for us downstairs !! Shawnea the hotel rep downstairs was lovely ! Thank you my dear for advising us on all my queries ! The 2203 room was far up and all away from the noise of Times Square ... we had coffee and water in our room and the room had a quaint view which was enough for us .... zipping out of this hotel to Times Square takes 5 mins - omg - I could not believe what a great location I chose ! Kept telling my mom that ! Good job guys !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the hotel from Friday, December 22nd to Saturday, December 23rd. I am a former Hyatt employee (worked with them for over 20 years) -- so not the easiest guest to have in a hotel.Hotel summary below - each item is on a scale of 1 to 5, with 1 being the lowest and 5 being the highest:Guest check-in/check-out - (SCORE: 3) - the reservations were booked under my friend that used some of her World of Hyatt points and no one at the front desk greeted her or treated her any differently than other guests. Check-in/check-out was ok - it would have also been nice for when she checked out for someone to say thank you for staying at the hotel and see you again. Room - (SCORE: 5) - nice, spacious, and cleanLocation - (SCORE: 4) - the location is nice as it is close to some of the main NYC attractions. The only reason this did not get a perfect score is because it is dark in some parts of the streets.Restaurant - (SCORE: 3) - greeting/welcoming needs to be improved. Great location and they should work to upsell...starting with a smiling hostess.Rooftop bar - (SCORE: 2) - absolute nice location; however, every location my friend wanted to sit she was told it wasn't available. If reserve seating is there or if only certain seats can be used by the number of people in the party - it should be clearly stated as such not only as you enter the bar but in the room as well. As for the greeting - absolute worst. Traveled the entire world and every never been greeted with are you guests in the hotel before someone says hello, good evening, welcome, etc. And the hostess that sat us - had her hand in the nuts. We just got up and left. On than the above items = recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hotel is in the heart of Times Square. Felt very safe. Plenty of security, Lots of Restaurants nearby. We really enjoyed our first New York stay. Very short walk to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park and Subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 5 Stars Always enjoy staying at Hyatt locations. I refuse to stay at any other hotel chain. I've stayed at dozens of Hyatt locations. This was one of my favorites. Highly recommend this location. Keep up the good work.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband & I booked two nights at the Hyatt Centric. The check-in process was seamless, & a room was available when we arrived at 12:30 pm, which was a pleasant surprise. This enabled us to freshen up before meeting friends for the day. The room was quiet, clean, & comfortable. The bathroom shower was great & the heated floor a big plus. We had an emergency at home that necessitated our checking out early & we were accommodated by having our rate for the second night adjusted. This was greatly appreciated. I highly recommend the Hyatt Centric in Times Square. The location is ideal & the nightly rate was more than reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel totally exceeded my expectations.. Totally awesome, I had the pleassure staying in the delux suite on 40th floor that has a balcony. From the check in to check out, this establishment was just amazing and all the staff was excellent.. Truly amazed.. Thanks you.. the only thing I missed was some more equipment in the hotel gym.. like a C2 Rowing machine.. a place to do chins and a free weights station...however the gym is already ok, just me being picky.. .. It was still awesome I loved my stay and it was so silent and great sleep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was staying with three other ladies sharing one room with two queens. Room was spacious with a large bathroom with lots of storage. Nice location. Wish there was coffee in the lobby, but there was a Starbucks right across the street!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights. On the whole a pleasant experience, nice room, lovely bathroom, all very clean. Friendly staff, although too many on security, why? Rooftop bar drinks very expensive, but i guess thats what you get in a major city. We booked this hotel via booking.com and got a great deal, as we are one of their best customers. It included 2 extra hours late checkout. On speaking to the reception staff at the hotel, they do not honour booking.coms offers, so just be aware. In the end, were told we could stay an extra hour, which was very unhelpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just a block from the madness of times square, while being cool without trying too hard to be overly cool (like the W).Huge state of the art gym, gorgeous and bustling roof top bar, big rooms and all modern decor. All for a great price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would just like to say how impressed we were with this hotel and will definitely be recommending it to family and friends if they ever wish to visit New York.The hotel was immaculate, it was very accommodating to our needs. I emailed the hotel before our visit as our trip to New York was part of a birthday treat for both my sister and daughter who were turning 16.On arrival both girls were welcomed with a “happy birthday “ from the receptionist. I had asked for a higher floor due to being in Times Square and what with it being noisy. Our needs were met and we were on the 25th floor with a corner room which looked right out to Times Square.When we got in the room there was a Selfie stick and a New York photo frame for both girls as a keep snake.We went out to explore and when we returned the Hotel staff had put 2 bunches of sweet 16 balloons for each of the girls.The Concierge were very helpful with assisting and advising us with getting about on our visit. We had unlimited tea, coffee, water and each time we phoned down for more towels etc we only waited about 5 minutes for them to be delivered.The hotel is also situated in a very good spot, close to the Empire State Building, the Rockefeller, 5th Avenue, Central Park. So in location alone I would recommend the Hyatt Centric.Overall I can not fault the hotel and catering for our needs whilst in NYC, I was just sad to leave and come home.So thank you for an amazing time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the perfect hotel to stay whether on business or vacation. Centrally located. Great service !the food is excellent. Rooms are large and comfortable. Roof top baria enjoyable. Highly recommend it

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I´ve been traveling a lot to NYC this year and I have stayed in many different hotels. The Hyatt Centric was a good choice. Good location if you want to be in midtown Manhattan. Everything is efficient, fast but impersonal. Don´t expect to come here to feel really pampered! It is efficient and good. The rooms are basic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel location is amazing. just 5 minutes far from the Times Square . Rooms are new and clean . Front desk staffs are so helpful . Special thanks for Mr.Ritchie he made our stay great .Upgrade the room with balcony or suite on the top floor .Try hotel restaurant Gym was okTerrace bar so cool

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The staff did everything to make our stay amazing. Ritchie at the front desk did a fantastic job. He helped to make our stay even more enjoyable! The hotel was very clean and updated. Also, the restaurant and rooftop bar are a must if you stay here! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I hope to stay here again sometime.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my 3rd time in NYC and I have stayed at another hotel in Times Square and the Hyatt Centric was by far the BEST! I cannot wait to visit NYC again and will definitely stay at Hyatt Centric! The doorman made it so easy for us to get a taxi when it was time for us to leave to the airport that really made the difference! Thank you!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place to stay would highly recommend for a short visit in the midst of Times Square. Highly recommend it had a lovely memorable experience. Will definitely consider visiting again in the future!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is located in time square . Reason why I booked this one was for the rooftop and great reviews it had. I wasn't disappointed, the view from the rooftop bar at sunset is dope! The drinks prepared by mixologist Brandon were crafted to my liking ( I just told him what I like and let him work his magic) . Wish room had extra pillows in closet , had to request them but overall this was a great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Centric. Great location and the rooms were spacious, clean and well stocked. The coffee machine was a nice touch and the housekeeping staff were fantastic. One nice little touch was complimentary umbrellas when it was raining. Restaurant and bar were both really nice as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights from 19-21st December 2017. We were greeted warmly and had a room on the 40th floor. The hotel is in a fantastic location, so close to Times Square but still fairly quiet. The room was very spacious and we had two twin beds - two of the biggest and most comfortable twin beds we have ever had. Plenty of room for 2 adults and 2 children (9 & 11yrs). The bed linen was great quality also. The bathroom was huge and heated, fantastic for December! We did quickly head up to the rooftop bar which had amazing views, but would be much more enjoyable in the warmer months. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here twice now April 2016 and April 2017 both stays were great, lovely modern rooms and bathrooms.We were given a room next to the lift both times but after settling down for the night all we could hear was the lift up and down. I went to reception and there was no hassle we were moved to another room. Even made sure all was okay after moving rooms! You won’t believe it but the hotel is right in Times Square and yet you’d never believe it as it’s so peaceful, great night sleep to be had!Can’t not go to the bar, try your hardest to sit outside and see the great lights of Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I absolutely loved this hotel. The hotel was very clean, and the staff was very friendly. The rooms were a pretty good size considering the location of this hotel, and the rooms were clean with a beautiful bathroom. Top of the hotel has a beautiful walkout patio bar that I had a few drinks at, worth every penny. If you're considering this hotel, it is probably one of the best in the Broadway region of New York. Stay here! Good for families, couples, and single travelers. Not too far from the airport either. Good restaurant in the lobby. Walking distance from EVERYTHING... including Tim Hortons!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was there for 3 days and the staff went out of their way to tend to our needs. Roof top has a view second to none and the bubble is an unforgettable experience. Food at T45 bar in the main floor is good and atmosphere is trendy. Cheese cake is great. Rooms are clean and unique . Good touch of retro meets contemporary. Staff is extremely helpfull and always look for ways to make your stay first rate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was walking distance from Times Square. We stayed on the 53rd floor. View was nice. I enjoyed being right near the action but at least a block away so I could sleep. Staff was very friendly and answered all questions and gave suggestions when asked. Thanks for making my first trip to New York enjoyable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in a great location close to everything in Times Square. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. We were missing our luggage for three days and the staff ensured we had the basic necessities. The check in and out process was very easy. The cost was very reasonable for the location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric November 29 - December 2. It was the perfect location for walking to Broadway shows, Times Square, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Plaza, Macy's at Herald Square, getting a taxi, or riding the subway. On our last visit to NYC, we stayed at a hotel closer to Herald Square that was on a side street and we had a difficult time getting a taxi. Hailing a taxi at the Hyatt Centric was never an issue. When I made the reservation, I had requested a room on a high floor away from the street because other reviewers stated that the rooms can be noisy especially when trying to sleep at night. Unfortunately, we were given a room on a lower floor fronting 45th Street and it was noisy. We asked if we could be moved to a different room. The front desk graciously accommodated our request and the next morning we were moved to a much quieter location. Both rooms were very clean and modern. The staff was great. The hotel manager went above and beyond checking to make sure we were comfortable and leaving treats for us after we were moved to a different room. We felt very safe in the hotel and the surrounding area. There are many good dining options for all budgets near the hotel. I had thought about staying at other less expensive hotels in mid-town/Times Square, but many of those reviewers stated that they had to wait a long time for the elevator. At the Hyatt Centric waiting for an elevator was never an issue and we were there at a very busy time of the year. I would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly, stylish hotel just off Times Square. We loved the location right in the centre of everything. The room was modern and bright with a gorgeously comfortable bed and a stunning view from the 43rd floor. We had breakfast in the cafe a couple of times and drinks on the rooftop bar which has an amazing view. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, we had bottled water daily and asked for a kettle as we prefer tea to coffee. Small fridge in the room was great for snacks and light breakfast provisions, which we picked up at a nearby market. Door people were always very friendly and welcoming when we arrived back after a day of sightseeing and added a level of security too. We absolutely loved our stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose the Hyatt Centric for its location and the valet parking. The room was clean and everything was in good working condition. The bed was super comfy and the rainfall shower was awesome. Loved the heated floors in the bathroom, too! We'll definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric over the Xmas and New Years period. Our 53rd floor suite had stunning views of the skyline out to the Freedom Tower and over Times Square. The hotel staff were fantastic. The Rooftop Bar is fantastic (especially when then put up the igloos). I'd would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The team at Hyatt Centric did an excellent job. Rooms were nice, location was perfect and the view from 53rd floor is amazing. They accommodated my every request without any negativity. Staff were amazing..Thanks Team Hyatt Centric

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Super friendly staff, well maintened, clean and organized. On the spot, you can do a lot of things on a walking distance.Concierge has great recommendations, not the turist stuff, but the real New Yorker stuff. Strongly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place is fairly great, close to Times Square with views of the billboards from certain rooms. The building is very tall and has a rooftop bar. Staff was decent, I got upgraded to one of the higher, larger rooms with a view of Times Square as well as the city south of their so Empire State building and Freedom Tower.The room was a decent size by New York standards, clean and modern appointments. I was high enough that I would not hear any street noise.The downside is that quite often you have to wait for elevators as the building has a small number and the high rise ones feed the rooftop bar as well.Overall though a great stay and am looking to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent one night here. The clientèle at least this week were mostly tourists from all over the globe. The rooms were modern and clean The front desk staff were very nice and printed out Broadway tickets I bought online for us. The valet parking for 24-hours was a little more than $60 which for the times square area is actually reasonable. The only suggestion I would have to the hotel is to have the valet staff have a hotel uniform or at least name tag so you know that you are not giving the keys to a stranger.. If you are here, go to the bar on the top floor for great views of Manhattan at night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the location of the hotel is pretty good and the room is good too. if I will visit next time, maybe i'll stay here. You can see the city view if you order the high floor room. The hyatt is much better than hilton around

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: checked in on 26th December and stayed through NYE to 2nd January. Our stay was pleasant not necessarily spectacular. The best thing about it was the proximity to Times Square. Our kids were able to leave just before midnight with no fuss to watch the ball drop in the bitter cold so that was good. we were on the 47th floor and our view was pretty decent and were happy to see the fireworks and ticker tape from there. We did not eat here as we expected the prices to be expensive. Were however able to sample various cuisines in Manhattan and neighbouring areas.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The sky lounge is turned to 3rd party for commercial use. It is closed for hotel guest and charges over $1000 to access during the NYE. It is still one block away from time squares so there is no help to watch the countdown event in warm. They do have rooms with city view, but it's not for point redemption. One of the staff sniggered "he doesn't have party" in an uncomfortable way to others right after I turned back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited new york back in Jan 2017 as part of our honeymoon trip. We had an awesome 6 night stay at hyatt centric... hotel was just at 3 min walking distance from Times Square...it was easy to access and close to all nearby attractions at a walking distance...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room with a view had barely a view. Room was not properly cleaned, and daily room service did not happen, or did not arrive till the evening. Staff had no idea what was happening on NYE. Completely ruined our night and friends we were meeting with for NYE’s. Staff were unhelpful, and uncaring. We were repeatedly told we were allowed to have 3 friends visit the hotel with us on the evening. This changed repeatedly on New Year’s Day until our NYE’s plans to spend with friends were completely ruined. Street was closed earlier than advised. Wifi did not work for 3 days with no apologies from staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place to stay. Location, service and facilities. The service is great at this hotel. The room facilities are great. spacious shower, refrigerator, blutoothe speaker and large TV. The hotel is very well located. In next corner is the time square. There is short distant to everything that you needs to viewed and in the middle of all the service that needs. Many good restaurants and bars in nearby but the best is on the 54 floor in the Hotel with exultant view. I resentment this hotel for all type of trips.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was amazing, as well as the peace and quiet of the rooms... not great for food. The demand for tips is incredible since since it should be at the discretion of the customer. The new years eve meal had so much fat on the meat that made me sick for the next few days.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was there for a full week in Oct 17. super smooth check in and Check out. A room with a view on the 50th floor, Spacious room with a separate sit out, friendly and helpful staff, 50 mtrs from the main times square...couldn't have asked for the better at place to base at NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We checked in here on 30/12. As a Hyatt globalist, I expected good level of service. Check in at 1230pm by Eva was fine, room was vacant, but not ready, expected. By 230pm, still not cleaned, not expected, no good. Manager Myer(if it’s the wrong spelling, I do apologise) intervened, offered room for us to rest and started turning around, we were checked in finally at 430pm. She also offered us a nice credit towards our first night accommodation, which was not expected. Thank you!Here is the thing, the hotel is yards away from Times Square, charged guests rates like the W or Marriott Marquis at Times Square for NYE celebration, but due to the Police security operations, a checkup point was set up in between the hotel and direct access to Times Square from 45th street(I also noticed there were exceptions by police to let through), you couldn’t get through to Times Square unless you walk to 38th or 49th street, then you have to queue up for security checks. With the weather it was, it put people off big time, it was beyond the hotels control and I do understand that. Room size wise, we stayed in a deluxe suite, view is Very good, with two children, the room size is not great, but acceptable, the standard upgrade to executive suite, if available, for globalist would be more spacious. The breakfasts offer by Myer was a very nice touch, thank you again! All in all, solid choice for Times Square visit. Not necessarily for NYE celebrations at Times Square, unless you could have a way through the police checks easy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was a nice hotel but room next door was smoking and I kept getting calls at night from kids! When we complained about the smoking in the room next door there was not really a good apology as my children were subjected to breathe in the smoke!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Even with all the letters and bracelets given to us the NUPF did not allow us to get to our hotel had to rent another hotel for the night. Take my advise do not book a hotel with in time square book right outside the perimeters

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From start to finish the stay was excellent. Easy to get to, quick and efficient desk, friendly smiles, clean and contemporary rooms, reservations that are on point, cleaning staff ready and available to accommodate, and a doorman who can laugh and assist at the same time....if there's better, not only would you not know it, but you wouldn't care!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in excellent location to Times Square, but that is not the best part. The rooms are clean, the staff is helpful, friendly and will go the extra mile for their guests. Safety is a priority as there is staff in place to not allow non guests where they do not belong. Housekeeping is more than efficient and does their job while being out of the guests way. A true gem as a homebase for your NYC visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay at the Hyatt was very relaxing comfortable. The staff was always friendly helpful and always ready to please. They provided a very clean and organized Hotel during a very hectic New Years Celebration. They truly had there plans well thought out and very well executed. This is my place to always stay when going to NYC!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here New Year’s day. Looked newly renovated. Shower was large and water pressure was good. Our room had 2 queen beds. Took other elevator bank to bar on 54th floor to show kids view of Chrysler building and Freedom Tower. Didn’t use spa but looked nice. Used valet to overnight car: $65 and a 30 minute wait to get it next day (they warned us so we planned accordingly). Overall satisfied with value for under $200 per night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was visiting New York for the first time for my 21st birthday with my boyfriend. We was supposed to arrive on the 18th Dec but due to issues with the airline we only arrived on the 19th December. I had reserved a King room with a View and had informed them why we was travelling there. We waited to see if we would receive an email from the hotel before we arrived to see if we had any requests however they did not get in touch so my boyfriend emailed the hotel a week before our arrival the arrange something special on my Birthday. I kept the hotel informed of when we would be arriving so that they did not give my room away. When we finally arrived the lady at the front desk tried to charge me $3000 for a room on the 20th floor. I thought i was being scammed. The room she was giving me didn't even have a view yet was trying to charge me something so ridiculous. Of course, i quickly informed her i had booked a room with a view. She spoke to her manager and just like that they found my room and suddenly the price dropped down to something more reasonable. They keep $50 each night in case you use any hotel facilities during your stay. They also only add the taxes on to your hotel price when you arrive, definitely something to bare in mind when making your hotel booking. We got to our room and there was no wine, no nothing, no birthday message or anything. Other than this the room was nice and the bathroom was modern. We had a really nice view, and could even see the One World Trade Center. We went up to the rooftop bar once, the views were really nice but the prices are way too extreme. Location of the hotel was brilliant. We walked everywhere. We even walked from our hotel down to Brooklyn Bridge. I cant wait to return to New York however my next visit will not be spent in the Hyatt Centric.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We went to NYC for a ladies weekend during the holidays. We were arriving in NYC late morning and I took advantage of early check in online and noted our arrival time 1:30 pm. I got an email at 10:45 am that our room was already ready. We were able to go straight to out room and not park our luggage at thr front desk. The hotel is only 4 years old and looks great. Very clean and well maintained. We did a lot of research on the hotels in the Times Square area and this one had the most consistent and good ratings. Our room was impeccable and was a nice size. The bathroom was a decent size and even had radiant heat floors. Extra points for that ! The lighting in the bathroom was not bright enough for putting on makeup. The only problem was the wi-fi went down the second day of our stay and they had a contractor there the following day and had not been able to correct it when we checked out. They have a rooftop bar with a beautiful view of Manhattan but the drinks were quite expensive. The staff was friendly and courteous. The bed was a little firm for me but I got used to it. The Keurig was full sized and the hairdryer was a very nice model that was powerful and quiet. These touches made a difference in our stay. We did not eat a meal there because of other activities but we did have the vegan chili one night and it was excellent. The cocktails are good. Our bartender made a very tart Cosmo and we were not able to correct the taste despite adding additional sugar water. The other drinks we ordered were fine. We were very pleased with the hotel. This was our first experience with this Hyatt brand and will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff allowed the guests in the next room to party until well after 3 am. Our room stunk of weed smoke and they didn’t even bother to send security up to the room when we called to complain. My wife never got to sleep and we left with our young kids at 4 am ruined a nice family trip to NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having stayed here in Aug 2014, we decided to return for 2017 Christmas and New Year celebrations. The hotel did not disappoint except for a +24 hr glitch where Wi-Fi was not available. John the manager was very helpful and set a great example of excellent and efficient service, backed up by his team. Comfortable rooms, in a great location. Higher floors recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked for a week 19th to 26th December. Booked on line and spoke to the hotel before our arrival regarding transfers from airport and was given advice on just to get a yellow cab at the airport as they have a set price they charge (would definitely recommend this as cost is only about $60) we also got an email from Alex general manager before we arrived which was a nice touch asked if him if we could get a high room.When we arrived great welcome from the hotel staff and had been upgraded to room on 34th floorWhen we got to the room it was spotlessly clean with a bottle of red wine.Each day 4 bottles of water were left as well which was a really nice touchIn room safe easy to use and small fridge to keep drinks coldAs it was quite mild outside found the room to be a little stuffy and family struggles sleeping with the air conditioning on.Decent size wardrobe (please take hangers with you as only around 10 hangers in there)Iron and ironing board in the room and a great make up mirror together with a good quality hair dryerWe were a family of 4 and found the room an okay size (apparently large by New York standards) but as only slept and showered there it was fineThe location was perfect less than a minute to time square and 5 minutes to Rockefeller, radio city, broadway and a couple of different subways.We used the subway or walked all week a 7 day pass on subway is $30 and well worth it.We visited the sky bar once whilst there we arrived at 4pm when it opened and ordered a glass of rose $16 or $68 for a bottle and a beer. Asked if we could get some nuts and was advised that the chef didn't start until 5 so couldn't oblige, about 10 minutes later they put a small bowl of cold nuts on the table cost $7.Dined in the T45 twice 1st time was ok food was really good but service was slow 2nd time both the food and service was very poorLove the Hyatt chains of hotels and would definitely stay again.If we ever visited new york again would stay further away from time square though as it was ridiculously busy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a newly remodeled hotel with beautiful rooms and a great location half a block from Times Square. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room was bigger than others we've experienced in midtown Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The best place to stay in NY in the centre of Broadway in Times Square. Very clean room very well equipped . Coffee complimentary in the room. Very kind and helpful personnel.. All the facilities a tourist needs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: With no more than a 15 minute walk to everywhere we wanted to go, the location was perfect. The general manager, Phillip, went out of his way to personally ensure everything was just as it should be. In particular, I would highly recommend Globalists stay here as the benefits were substantial.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice hotel right beside Starbucks and Planet Hollywood. The staff were rather friendly and the security was good as well. There was hot apple cider and cookies in the lobby during check-in times which was a pleasant surprise. However, the cleaning of the rooms was mercurial and sometimes there would be no tissue paper. The stay was enjoyable overall and the location was more than perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is kept in great condition, very clean and no bad smells. The staff is awesome, very cordial and kind and available 24/7. The maids are simply awesome and kind! Tip ‘em well!! We’re happy w/service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hotel is really well positioned in Times Square. Close to everything you need in the city that does not sleep. Good security service and just across the road from Star Bucks. The Director of Operations Alex is in regular contact and making sure everything runs to plan. Many thanks Alex. Your emails are really valuable when travelling from far away. A hidden treasure close to the hotel not on Trip Advisor is Great American Wash a laundry situated between 48th and 49th on 8th Avenue if you need a laundry stop off. Very clean and excellent self service laundry. Thanks Hyatt you made our stay very comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you’re looking for a Central location to call home whilst you’re exploring NYC then it doesn’t get much more central than this! I knew from reading other reviews that this was close to Time Square, but rest assured that the “30 second walk” is no exaggeration. The bright lights of Time Square really are on your doorstep. Upon arriving at the hotel it was late in the evening but I was thoroughly impressed by the warm welcome we received. Having explained that it was our first time in NYC the man on reception was only too happy to give us a map, restaurant recommendations, subway tips and just some generally useful information to help us make the best of our time - it really was appreciated. After a relatively swift check-in we were off to our rooms. We could see a little bit of Time Square from our window (see picture - don’t look down!) and I was impressed at how well the room was blacked out. I’m a light sleeper and didn’t worry that the lights would keep me awake - I need not have worried. This hotel is in the heart of Time Square and midtown which means that not only is it well connected to public transport, but lots of things are within relatively easy walking distance.We hardly spent any time at the hotel, it was just somewhere to get a good nights sleep and a shower and so with respect to that, I can’t fault it. If you are after something a bit more luxurious and atmospheric then this won’t be the hotel for you.Would I stay here again? Absolutely.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I recently celebrated our wedding anniversary in NYC along with our two girls. Paola and the front desk staff helped make our special trip even that much more memorable. We also loved the location of the hotel - right in the middle of Time Square and an easy to walk to Fifth Avenue and Central Park. The room was clean and beautiful. We'll be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed a couple of nights with a great deal I got at Christmas time. The hotel is small, kind of European style but it is QUIET which is very important in this hustle-bustle non-stop town. I have stayed in other hotels downtown and you could hear a constant "roar" of traffic and of course the sound of sirens from time to time as well, so I'm really appreciated the silence for sleeping. The bed and the pillows were comfortable as well. The only reason I don't give it a higher ranking is the front desk accommodates only 2 staff so at times there are back-ups waiting for check-in) check-out service. Good overall especially when you get a great rate. If you want a great spot for drinks close by pop in to the Marriott and have a cocktail at the bar overlooking Times Square.
