Beautiful with great views of the square, and the chandeliers are really cool; they look like pods of floating bubbles!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I stayed here for two nights in December. The decor and feel of the hotel was excellent, felt very modern and clean. The rooms were nice and comfortable with a ridiculous view of the city, however, I was expecting it to be bigger given the price of the stay. Given that it was in the middle of winter, the heated bathroom floors were a huge plus. The crib that was provided for our baby upon request was clean and new, free goodies were provided too! The Sky Lounge was also amazing for spectacular views of New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stay for 5 days during Christmas. The rooms were very clean. We stayed in a double queen room with my husband and 2 teenage boys. We had plenty of room. It was very cold and the heated bathroom floor was nice. Could of had more draw space for clothes but we just keep things in our luggage. It was nice being close to Times Square but not overwhelming in the craziness.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I checked in on Sunday December 17, and stayed through the 21st and we loved this hotel. Check-in was a bit slow, but we were checking in early into a Times Square Hotel the week before Christmas. The staff is very friendly, professional and helpful. We had requested adjoining rooms on an upper floor, and we were accommodated.The restaurant in the lobby is good and reasonably priced for New York City.One minor issue for us was the pillows. Wow - these things are THIN. if you have the space, you may consider packing your own.We are planning on returning to New York at the same time next year, and are planning on returning to the Hyatt Centric Times Square. It was a perfect location for us as we come to New York for theatre, so everything is within walking distance. For sightseeing during the day, the subway station is also close.Great staff, great views, great hotel, great location, lame pillows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed 2 nights between Christmas & New Years. Convenient location for walking to Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center, shopping on 5th Ave. Lobby is quite small and at times crowded. Staff is polite, not overly friendly. Room size is fine, definitely ok for short stay. Closet is a good size. Bathroom is tight, shower is nice & had rain shower head and a handheld shower wand. Bottled Water & coffee (Keurig) in room is complimentary. Ask for a top sheet, otherwise just duvet cover. Too hot (even at 15 degrees outside) to sleep with comforter on bed. Thermostat won’t go lower than 65. Pillows were thin & flat, had to ask for extra pillows. Rooftop bar is nice, but very expensive at $26 for a vodka/tonic. Great view from there and bartenders are very friendly. I would stay here again, but would definitely consider other options first.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel right in the heart of Times Square, Not far from Fifth Avenue and a short walk up to Rockefeller Center to enjoy watching the ice skaters and admire the Christmas tree and the beautiful department store window displays. This hotel is modern and updated. Room was clean, spacious and very comfortable. Personnel were friendly and helpful. The bar on the top floor has a great view of the city. Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: HIghly recommend this property. This particular property was centrally located. The staff was friendly and helpful. Checkin was fast and easy. They Accommodated our early arrival. The room was clean and airy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of the best locations in NY if you are heading to the attractions on Broadway and Times Square Spacious rooms One min walk to Times Square Few mins walk to most of broadway theatersThis time we have attended Chicago Musical and Phantom of the Opera .. it was just 3 mins walk from the hotelRooms are upgraded .. spacious and very neat

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We always look for hotels with two rooms, since we have two kids. This definitely fit the bill. Spacious room given NYC standards, centrally located, and very easy to stay here with a family. The manager checked in via email to make sure everything was okay (which it was). This hotel is definitely worth considering if you want to be in Times Square and need more space for your family!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First, let me say that check in was not terrible, Steven assisted me and he seemed sincere and happy to accommodate me although the hotel was sold out and he could not change our room, as we had a view of the roof top of all of the surrounding buildings. I am a Hyatt member, and after staying here I have to say not all Hyatt's are created equal in terms of comfort, amenities, and friendly staff. I read a lot of reviews before booking, as well as the features online and I have to say I was greatly disappointed. The bed was so hard and uncomfortable, the sheets were so stiff every moment sounded like trash bags being crumbled, and the pillows were so incredibly flat I was in disbelief this was being passed off as pillow. There are pictures of food on the website, but when I asked the front desk for information on food that just told me there was no restaurant/food service in the building. Lastly, when checking out I made sure everyone in my party was packed and ready at the time of checkout. I went downstairs to complete my financial obligation and they were swapped, and of course I understood. However, at checkout I asked Jeff how long does it take for our vehicle to arrive, he said the vehicle should be here within 20 to 30 mins. I waited 45 mins before going back to the front desk to inquire about my vehicle and Jeff replied oh you asked how long does it take, I didn't order your vehicle ( okay so there was miscommunication there). Now, I ask can you please order my vehicle, mind you we have been waiting 45 mins, it takes another 45 mins before my vehicle arrive. Working with the public myself, I find this completely unacceptable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We made a special trip with our oldest granddaughter, Princess Kate.Kate picked New York over any other possible destination. we all had a grand time. Being centrally located was important to us. We saw two Broadway shows and the Rockettes!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This property is in the heart of Times Square and was perfectly located for everything we wanted to do and close to subway station, etc. Property is well maintained, friendly staff and great beds! I would definitely recommend this location for anyone visiting!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked this hotel because of it's reviews, I suggest it to anyone going to New York, a bit expensive but it's only 30 seconds from Time Square, The Subway 1 and anything around Central New York. Rooms are very nice and clean, service is good, a bit cold but very good, I would prefer that Services will improve to a more warm welcoming but the Hotel is top of it's class.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful employees, When you walk in, the place looks immaculate and smells great! They had hot apple cider and assorted cookies in the lobby. The suite had an amazing view! It is close to everything! Though we were close to Time Square, the room was very quiet. We had a balcony that stretched along our suite. Love the decor!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at quite a very hotels in NYC, many of them very nice, and I must saw that my experience at the Hyatt Centric was awesome. The Manager, Alex DeChagas, reached out to me prior to even arriving and made sure my stay was more than expected. Mr. DeChagas even followed up after my stay to make sure everything went well so a big shout out to him for awesome customer service! The hotel is in prime a Times Square location. Blocks from all the main Times Square attractions, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, and Macy’s, this location allows hotel visitors to walk to pretty much anything they need. The hotel was clean and up-to-date and had a welcoming entrance. We got the room one step up from the standard room and it was plenty big. It also had a very nice bathroom with a bathtub and a shower. Overall, my stay was great and I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, comfortable beds and clean room. Only complaint about the hotel was the overly complex room lighting. Would stay here again. Irish pubs on each side of the hotel. I recommend the Red Flame cafe a block away on 43rd and 6th ave for some cheaper but still good eats.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Incredibly rude staff, extra unexpected charges to my card and constantly being asked for prove that we were staying in the hotel even though they weren’t checking other “richer looking people” are just some of the few reasons I’d suggest you don’t stay in this hotel.Me and my girlfriend came to New York for Christmas and writing this review on Christmas Eve right we feel like it has already ruined our Christmas this year and our holiday. We decided to stay here for the location, but it definitely wasn’t worth it. The staff constantly tut to any question and just arn’t interested in helping any tourists like myself. They also charged an extra $400 to my card upon arrival without telling me until after they had done it. After asking to speak to a manager she kept repeating herself saying “thats our policy”. Every time we kept coming back to the hotel the security kept stopping us and sled us for our cards to prove we were staying in the hotel. After the 3rd time I asked how come we have to show ours and nobody else seems to have to show the security guard just said “are you trying to be uncooperative sir”. It was like we were in prison trying to go back to our cell and the prison guard wanted to hassle us for no reason.There’s many other problems about this hotel but I won’t go on anymore. Just save your money and avoid this place at all costs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You wrote a review for Hyatt Centric Times Square 4 days ago4.0 star rating 12/20/2017I am a WoH Globalist member. This was my second stay at a Centric branded hotel. It is a smaller, boutique style hotel. The design and decor is modern. The lobby and check-in are rather small in terms of space. There is a restaurant to the left of the lobby with the elevators on the right. We received an upgrade to a King Deluxe suite on the 51st floor which consisted of two separate rooms, a living space with a sleeper sofa, and a bedroom with a king bed, along with a bathroom which included separate shower and tub. The bathroom has heated floors which is awesome. It would be nice for U.S. Hyatt hotels to add a bidet feature to the bathroom. Even if you cannot install the full fledged fancy seat bidet, it would be great to have the small handheld feature for cleansing.The room had beautiful views of Times Square and really the location is pretty cool. You can walk a few feet and be right in the middle of the action, steps away from Broadway, shopping, and the subway.There is a restaurant onsite (first floor) and we ate breakfast there a few days, with breakfast delivered to the room one day (another Globalist benefit as this hotel does not have a lounge so breakfast is included).. There were plenty of breakfast items to choose from and the food was pretty good. There is a rooftop bar with beautiful city views. Parking is usually $60 per night for valet, and $45 for self park. Customer service was really great as the agent who checked us in accompanied us to the room to make sure we had everything we needed. Paola was also so friendly and kind and really made a difference in how we enjoyed our stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel. Arrived at 10am and they allowed us to check in early upon our arrival. Our room was a great size and had all the amenities we would need. This hotel had an amazing roof top bar, which my boyfriend actually proposed to meOn which made it extra special. We would recommend this place as the staff and management were completely accommodating to everything we requested.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spend a fair amount of time in Manhattan on business travel. Recently, I brought my 14 year old daughter for a Christmas visit, and selected the Hyatt Centric. The team at the Hyatt Centric made our Christmas visit extra special. From our very warm welcome and greeting from Walter, at the front door, to our warm reception from Maren at the front desk, to our very clean, quiet, and comfortable room - our time in New York was fun, relaxing, and memorable, thanks to the team at the Hyatt Centric. This hotel is centrally located off of Time Square, but set far enough back to provide a beautiful view, and to also provide some quiet escape from the craziness. The rooms are clean, comfortable and spacious. The fitness room is well equipped and spacious. The staff are pleasant and polite when you pass them in the halls. I will likely make this hotel my home away from home for all business and personal travel in Manhattan, in the future. To the team at the Hyatt Centric, thank you for your hospitality. It was very much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You can’t beat the location! Very close to Time Square and Rockefeller Center. Had a King bed and it was a tight fit but worked for us and our two kids (2y & 6m). It was a small room for the price but luxurious touches. We had a great view. The floor in the bathroom was heated. The service during a very busy time of year was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, clean rooms and friendly staff. Would stay here again hands down!Within walking distance to almost everything, December is a great month to visit as every corner you round has beautiful lights and displays. Close to Bryant Park Christmas markets, and also Hells Kitchen for many unique cozy restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just got back from spending 3 days 2 nights in NYC at the Hyatt Centric Time Square Hotel and I couldn’t have asked for more! The location is excellent...right near most big attractions (Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall). We stayed in the Deluxe View King and it was breathtaking! We had a partial view of Times Square which was awesome and the noise wasn’t bad at all! It was our anniversary and in our room was a sweet card, brownies and wine which we thought was so thoughtful! One thing I also thought was great was that you can store your luggage before you check in and after you check out that helped us enjoy every minute possible exploring NYC. I would absolutely recommend the Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were given a friendly welcome by helpful staff. Our rooms were ready early, which was very convenient with a young child. Clean and modern rooms with great amenities. Perfect location for exploring New York. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A groups of us stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate our friend's 40th. The front desk staff were excellent, had local knowledge of New York and recommended places for us to go. I recommend .....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Enjoyed a wonderful time in a modern hyatt with great service and staff. We needed to check in early and that was no problem, check our luggage not a problem, dinner recommendations and quietness of room provided for a wonderful albeit too short of a stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location close to many of New Yorks favourite attractions. We walked everywhere or used the Subway. The rooms were spacious, modern and exceptionally clean. The heated floors in the bathrooms were a welcome touch. We were visiting from Australia to celebrate my daughters 21st and they kindly welcomed us with balloons, cake and prosecco. We had a lovely view and the room on the 35th floor was quiet and peaceful. I became addicted to the hot apple cider which was available in the lobby. We never had to wait long for the elevator which can be an issue in New York hotels. Overall we would highly recommend the Hyatt Centric Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great stay in New York excellent staff was cool good to stay there little busy in morning but it excellent lokqtion richee front reception is Cool he help me for my room great staff great location to stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently, I left a review for the Hyatt Ziva Cancun about a trip that I made in September 2017. I was very impressed by this resort and have been ranting and raving every since. Last Saturday (the 16th) my boyfriend and I took a trip into the city to celebrate his birthday, see a Broadway show and the tree at Rockefeller Center. After leaving the show we decided to grab a couple of drinks and stumbled by the Hyatt Centric Time Square. We kind of laughed and said "Look, its a Hyatt. Now we have to check it out!." not thinking that the service would be as phenomenal at it was in Mexico. Boy, were we wrong! We walked into T45 (the bar/restaurant) and were greeted by a super sweet and friendly hostess named Liz. She sat us a table at the bar and recommended the "Cherry Velvet" cocktail. I loved it! While enjoying our drinks we overheard Liz telling patrons that the hotel had a rooftop longue, B54, but they had a waitlist that was about 3 hours long. The bartenders and manager were very attentive which is impressive for a Saturday Evening in NYC. We left to walk around the city and about an hour later decided to go back for dinner. When we went back in and asked Liz if any tables were available for dinner she said that she could get us one then handed us an access card to have "a couple of drinks on the rooftop before dinner". Yes, the same rooftop that had a 3 hour wait just an hour prior. We couldn't believe it. The views on the rooftop were spectacular. It wasn't overly crowded with small, intimate tables placed perfectly. You had a gorgeous view wherever you sat. The drinks were delicious and not ridiculously expensive for this beautiful lounge. It was perfect. We went back downstairs and, of course, Liz had our table waiting for us. Again, this kind of treatment is almost unheard of for NYC during the Holiday Season. Our waiter was Asif. He was very attentive and he had the best food recommendations. Everything was delicious. We ordered Cheesecake for dessert. When he brought it to our table he placed another dessert next it and said "I know you wanted cheesecake but our Pecan Pie is outstanding. Enjoy this from us. Its on the house". BTW Two of the best desserts I've ever had. Needless to say, service from top to bottom (no pun intended) was nothing less than excellent. Once again the Hyatt gave us an amazing experience and made us feel like royalty. No, we didn't see the rooms but based on everything else I wouldn't imagine anything less than perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently stayed 2 nights for a board meeting in NYC. Location of this hotel was perfect for walking to our office, and proximity was also just as good for dinner and just walking around Times Square. You are in the middle of all activity but not right on the main broadway strip where you would have massive congestion of vehicle traffic. Rooms were clean and spacious. Nice bathroom and stand up shower. And I loved the breakfast ‘To Go’ concept. Excellent way to get room service if you want to eat in room or take it with you. And I enjoyed the rooftop bar on one evening - very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you're a tourist wanting to spend time in Times Square then this hotel would be OK. For business, it was a difficult checkin/checkout process, small room and average room service. The doorman was fantastic - he understands what service is. Pretty much the rest of the staff I interacted with, didn't understand what service was.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: wWalking distamce to many of the best Broadway shows and Radio City Music Hll. Great accessible wheelchair user roomsroll-in shower etc. Lots of resturants nearby including a restsurant connected to the hotel. This has brcome our go to hotel for New York theater trips. When we check out on Sunday but have a later in the day flight, the hotelefficiently stores our luggage.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a nice hotel about one block from Times Square...good or bad as that might be!!!..not quite in the hustle and bustle and that is good...Not much of a lobby, but that is ok!..Rooms are nice sized for NYC...Bed comfortable with nice bedding....rugs were a bit dirty and stained...Bathroom was very nice with a shower only..BUT...our bathroom had a funky odor that was not so pleasant!! Would probably go back if I got a very good deal..certainly there are better in NYC but this is fine!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is so well located for shows, sightseeing, shopping and restaurants! The room was a good size and facilities also good. The facade was not imposing like some of the higher end hotels but that was not a concern.....it’s the inside that counts! Helpful staff also important. We didn’t use the hotel restaurant but did have a mocktail in the Sky Lounge on the night it snowed....beautiful setting! We would use this hotel again if we visit NY. Our room was on the 33rd floor and had a view looking down towards Time Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a 2 night stay in New York to attend a concert and do some Christmas shopping. Staff was friendly and helpful, hotel one block from Times Square, bed comfortable, however, the pillows were a bit on the flat side. Would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After taking at red-eye from Los Angeles I arrived at the Hyatt Centric. It was raining but and I was extremely tired, but I was welcomed by great customer service and an amazingly scented lobby. The room was excellent - huge space! Which is super rare for even the swankiest hotels in NYC. Huge shower, plush bed, amazing toiletries and chic decor. I was only there for one night but I wish I could’ve stayed longer! It’s definitely a hotel to explore in the city - great location in the heart of it all without being too hectic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was very friendly, room was very clean. Also, we needed a safe deposit box for the morning we checked out. This hotel offers that service at the front desk so you can leave items there, come back later in the day to pick them up before departing the city. This was a very nice feature that many hotels don’t offer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: No late night food options in the hotel at all. Bad front desk service. Overpriced valet was unprofessional. No bell service/help with bags even though I told front desk I had heavy work equipment in my car to bring in. Noisy, sloppy drunk people all over the lobby, outside the front door, etc. None of the employees seemed to care about the overall state of the property or guest experience. I've stayed at many Hyatts all over the world, and in many NYC hotels, this one was over priced, underwhelming, and with so many wonderful options in NY, I probably wouldn't return to Hyatt Centric Time Square even if it were free.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. Beautiful hotel. Really enjoyed our time here. Far enough away from the noise of Times Square that noise was not a factor. Staff was kind, accommodating, and took care of all of our needs with speed and care. Great weekend getaway

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel, amenities, and staff are incredible! I arrived late on Sunday Dec 3rd, and decided to decompress and have dinner in the T45 restaurant on the lobby level. I was here for business, and did not know much about navigating the city. Liz, the hostess at T45 gave me a most warm welcome, and chatted with me and answered all my question and was quite encouraging. She even followed up with me after my meal (which was also great!). I've never felt so welcome so quickly anywhere else. I will definitely be returning here on my next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is conveniently located just off (1/2 block) off main area of Times Square. Convenient access too all of Manhattan. The hotel itself is extremely nice, as well as great staff. A little pricey during the holiday season, but it was recommended to us by a friend that had stayed here a year or two ago and gave it a great review. Well worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were very impressed with our stay here. There are no frills in the lobby but quick access to the desk, speedy elevators and excellent cafe. Our room on the 52nd floor (upgraded to a suite!) had huge windows and an excellent view. It was directly across from the elevator but was very quiet. The bed was super comfy and the bath was a nice size with a roomy shower. Excellent blackout curtains. All staff was very friendly and attentive. We will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was in a perfect location. Close to everything NYC has to offer and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Restaurant was very good and the bar on the 54th floor had a great view of the city. Overall a great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Go to NYC often and first time at this hotel. Can’t say enough good things about this hotel. It’s a small boutique hotel with personal attention and fantastic location. Everyone was so friendly and efficient from the valet, front desk and chamber maid, Jennifer. We were always wished a good day and the rooms are roomy, clean, and beautifully appointed. This will always be my first choice from now on.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took a red eye in from California and arrived at the hotel around 6am. There was friendly staff waiting for us take our luggage and email us when our room was ready I expected we wouldn’t be able to get in our room until late afternoon—but they had it ready at 10 am! This allowed us to rest and get ready for that evening’s play. Loved our room and free water,coffee and tea was excellent. Also, there’s a great deli (Cranberry cafe) a few steps away for great low cost meals & snacks. As well as great restaurants and theaters within walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My colleagues and I had a great stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square location. The beds were incredibly comfortable and the rooms very spacious, especially for a NY hotel. We had a wonderful time and hope to be back soon! Rave reviews from the group!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice rooms, great view from the roof, Great access to central Manhattan, Times Square and the theater district. We stayed on the 30th floor and the room was very quiet. Doesn’t have a restaurant, more like a bar with some food. Lobby is a bit cramped.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is beautiful and the staff where friendly and very helpful. The location is great to access Broadway shows, Times Square and all the other wonderful NY attractions. Our family had a great trip

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is my 2nd time staying at the Hyatt Centric Times Square, I have really enjoyed my stay both times and would recommend it to anyone. Great Location, friendly service and very clean. Love staying her and will visit again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just spent 4 nights ( on three rooms) at the Hyatt Centric . The hotel is at 45th street at 2 min to Times Square and just 4 walking minutes to 5th Ave. so a perfect location for a short stay in New York .Hotel is quite new ... no more than 4 years old so rooms are properly decorated and roomy although I would suggest either to change the carpet or clean them properly. They look too old and not so clean . The hotel changes 34 USD for person for breakfast but both quality and decoration of the cafeteria is worth to pay it . Our arrival was quite “ cold” as the check in process was professional but no extra information and they did not make us feel welcome at all . On the contrary I must mention that during the check out procedure Ms. Dede was just great!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location at Times Square and short walking distance to Rockefeller Center. The rooms were clean with comfortable beds. Heated floors in the bathroom are wonderful. Drinks in Bar 54 are over-priced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all when you enter the lobby- it smells incredible. Like a high end home fragrance -herbal and clean. The staff is professional and friendly. Everyone we spoke with seemed very happy to work there. Customer service is obviously a priority. Our room was awesome. Great view, great furnishings and spotless. The whole experience was better than most NYC hotels that are at least twice the price. We would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From check in to check out, we felt we mattered to the staff. Room was convenient, quiet and comfortable. The lounge on the 54th floor was a welcomed refuge from the activity outside. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros:1.) Rooms are clean, well laid out, and are pretty good size for New York City. I particularly was pleased with the room having a decent sized desk, a good sized bathroom, and an actual closet instead of a standalone unit, which is quite common for NYC hotel rooms.2.) Check in was a breeze. After a long day of travel, they got us in quickly.3.) Elevators are fast. I've often encountered slow elevators, and with our room being on the 45th floor, we were especially glad that we didn't have to spend lots of time waiting for the elevator to arrive each time we wanted to leave.4.) Internet was fast. This is such a big deal for so many business travelers, and I was glad to see that this hotel took internet speed seriously.5.) Location is fantastic. We did quite a bit of sightseeing including seeing Aladdin on Broadway, and this was a great central place to be.Cons:1.) Hyatt Platinum status was not recognized, and consequently, no room upgrade. This isn't a huge deal, but it's always nice to be upgraded when possible.2.) Traffic is so incredibly bad in this area that the Uber drivers often dropped our rides rather than coming to us. I'd recommend learning how to navigate public transportation or walking a ways to get an Uber or Lyft as this was incredibly frustrating. This doesn't necessarily reflect on the hotel, but definitely something to think about when staying in this location.Conclusion: We will definitely be back! Thanks for a great visit for my wife and I and our babymoon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved this hotel - convenient (quiet) location off Time Square, requested a feather-free room with a view - and actually got it!! Spacious, nice sized bathroom with excellent shower. Lighting in bathroom was not great for putting on make-up. Roof-top bar was great before the show - beautiful view and friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the 1st time I have stayed in a hyatt centric and I was very impressed - the check in and check out were super friendly and quick and the rooms are great like a New York style apartment and very spacious for New York! The free water and coffee is also nice and the beds are super comfortable, great shower and WiFi is super fast to every box was ticked! The best part was the restaurant! Amazing food and service some of the best in New York! I will be back for sure - great hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have just checked out after three nights at the Hyatt Centric. Trying not to be too negative, but some large disappointments soured an otherwise fantastic time in NYC.We (a party of 5), booked three rooms for a special occasion. We arrived 15 minutes after check in, and were told only two rooms were available as the third was still being cleaned...fair enough. It actually took three hours for that room to be ready, we chased it four times with reception staff that were frankly rude and disinterested, we were not given any sort of apology. The explanation was that this room was taking longer than expected to clean, but the room itself turned out to be immediately next door to one of our other two rooms and there was NO cleaning activity or members of staff coming or going at all so their reasoning sounds slightly iffy to me. I understand issues happen, but the attitude of the staff was very poor. I have stayed in hotels all over the world and never before have I been subject to such a poor and annoying check-in.I have mentioned that our stay was for a special occasion, over a month before we ordered and paid for a birthday cake to be in the room on arrival. When we arrived, no cake in sight. This was chased again with reception, and another less than pleasant staff member instructed the kitchen to deliver this as soon as possible. An hour later, the cake was delivered to one of our rooms but needless to say the surprise was ruined. Again, no apology (I must say the cake was very good!). Reception staff did keep referring to me as different names too, maybe some more confusion in regards to who we actually were?The rooms themselves were very nice, with good views over Times Square! They were also very clean, oh and heated floors in the bathroom! Hairdryer, coffee, safe etc all included, basically everything you need for a stay.Bar 54 is also worth a visit, but again a less than favourable impression with staff. One waitress was extremely abrupt when one of our party asked for clarification regarding serving drinks on the balcony (I quote “I have already told you once, I don’t need to clarify”) a shocking tone to a customer paying top dollar for drinks and service. There was also a problem with payment, upon checkout we were told that we had underpaid! We completely dispute this fact, but had no choice but to pay the alleged difference when we left.This was my fourth stay in NY in less than six years. By contrast, two years ago we stayed at Citizen M a block over for an anniversary. On mentioning this upon arrival, the next day we had a hand written congratulations card plus voucher for two free drinks in the room. Also (completely coincidentally), our room wasn’t ready on arrival! We were also given two free drinks in the way of apology. I appreciate issues happen, it’s the way they are resolved that count. The customer facing staff we encountered at Hyatt were very largely disappointing at best, especially considering this place has such a positive reputation.I love NYC, but will not stay here again. P.s the cleaning staff and the door staff (Walter especially) were brilliant! The reception staff should take note of this, and of the Hyatt’s competition.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric for a few days before Thanksgiving. We were given a room on the 49th floor and all my husband and I could say upon entering was WOW! Obviously the view was spectacular but the room as pretty fantastic too. Large for NYC standards, it contained a king bed, desk, a cabinet that housed a safe and refrigerator and a nice, large flat screen TV. The bathroom contained both a shower and a tub and again was large by NYC standards. Everyone we came in contact with was warm, friendly and accommodating. The location can't be beat -- close to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall and Bryant Park. Within comfortable walking distance of Herald Square and Central Park. Will definitely stay here again on our next visit to the Big Apple and will gladly recommend it to all our friends and family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I like to visit New York and go Broadway Shows.If this is what you like to do, then this hotel is where you should stay.It’s modern, clean, safe and service is excellent. The roof top bar with its fabulous views is unbelievable.But best of all is the Location, it’s easy walking distance toall theaters, restaurants, Grand Central Station, Madison SquareGarden, etc., etc.Even though it’s about a half block from Times Square, you would never know it. The rooms a very quiet.So, if you’re a theatre buff, and want a clean, modern hotelto use as your base, this is THE ONE!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was a very pleasant stay! The king-sized bed was large.The room was spacious, clean and the view of New York City was great! The best part is its location, right in the heart of the bustling New York City with many restaurants and departmental shops right next to the hotel! Security was good as the hotel staff stood by to check to ensure only hotel guests gain access.The only feedback is that the check-in staff should have informed us that there is a tour of the observation deck of the hotel as we were too late to register for it (guests are not allowed to go to the observatory deck other than joining the tour...)Overall, hotel staff were nice and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked for 3 days, this chic and modern hotel is a charm! I love the view, from the window ( you can see whole time square) clean, and spacious room. Plus complementary water, coffee and tea in the room was a nice surprise. Perfect location and staff very friendly. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was sceptical of my stay for the first time in New York but being. Hyatt member, we decided to take a chance on Hyatt Centric. The staff, AMAZING... The hotel AMAZING... And the location, 30second walk from Time Square, 5 mins to Rockefeller Center and minutes from a main subway hub at 42 and Broadway... we will never be sceptical of Hyatt Centric again... Thank you to the staff! Amazing hotel worth every cent we paid and will never stay anywhere else!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel located off 45th avenue not far from all the attractions. We walked most places and if we wanted to venture further the Hop on/off bus pickup was only 2 blocks away. We loved it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our 3rd trip to NYC and I could not have asked for a better location in NYC. Out of the 3 we stayed at, this one was by far my favorite. Wonderful hotel with great staff and atmosphere. Will definetly recommend this spot to friends and family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a snazzy hotel right on the doorstep of Times Square and Broadway. The rooms are trendy and modern and a good size too. I had a king room to myself and there would have been plenty of room for 2. The room was immaculately cleaned; and I’m fussy! I was on the 9th floor with no view to speak of, but this was actually a bonus as it reduces the street noise that goes 24/7. After all, you step out for the view!Breakfast in their restaurant was super. Very delicious with a good choice. Door men were wonderful, bringing a smile to my dial each time I went in and out. However, the reception staff never smiled and lacked good humour, but did their job well. The concierge was fabulous and always most helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location in walking distance of Rockefeller center, broadway shows, etc. Comfy rooms with ample space for NYC. Security checked for room keys before allowing on elevators. Pizza delivery was escorted to rooms by staff. Fabulous view from rooftop bar. Can’t wait for my next visit!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Can't speak highly enough about this hotel. Always a great experience and we have been staying here twice a year since it opened. The staff is excellent and the rooms are great. Perfect location for visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel in October and it was beyond amazing! So easy to get too, right in the heart of Times Square NY!! We LOVED it, and would return over and over again. The room was clean, and very modern. The front desk was lovely and filled us in on the rooftop bar - which we are glad we made it too!! Thank you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place has it all - great location, luxurious rooms, every amenity you desire, beautiful rooftop bar with delicious food, and most important, they have excellent customer service. I am especially blown away with their director of operations, Alexander DeChagas. He emails every day to check in on you and makes any of your request happen within a short amount of time. Really incredible. I have stayed here twice and loved it. I will definitely be back again in the new year!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I arrived to Hyatt centric Times Square with my wife - the first destination of our honeymoon trip.From the moment we stepped in this place the magic began. The receptionist was super nice, heard it’s our honeymoon and without thinking upgraded our room with no charge. He was really pleasant and explained everything we need to know about the hotel. We got a high floor king size room - amazing room, big and spacious, nice view of the city, bed really comfortable, big flat screen tv, room designed amazing, bathroom big spacious and also with a view to the city :)The breakfast was in the hotel’s restaurant- u get to choose from the menu a couple of dishes, everything was really delicious and fresh, I would recommend the salmon bagel, and American breakfast. There’s also a very nice gym and neat spa. The location - the best of the best. I would recommend it to anyone in the world and Hyatt centric be sure - I’ll be back !To summarize - a dreamy way to start our honeymoon, thank you!!!! ❤️

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Negative: The room was too small (we were 2 adults and 2 children) and were probably given a room for use by 2, not by 4; the carpet was dirty (with stains). The restaurant/bar of the hotel was extremely expensive. It is a pity that no children were allowed at the rooftop bar. Positive: quiet room; great position of the hotel right close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The first time I stayed in 2015, the hotel was the Hyatt Times Square (TS). The name change to the Hyatt Centric TS seems to be a fairly recent change.As mentioned, this was my second stay at this property, this time in a deluxe room on a high floor with a (partial) view of TS.I wrote a review of the hotel after my first stay where I detailed the stuff I liked and didn't like about the hotel's hard inventory, services, and location.Since this is a second review, I'll skip the part about the room inventory and all that and focus instead on the stuff that were different this time around. So, to start ---- I got a "Welcome back to the Hyatt Centric TS!" when I checked-in.-- my bathroom had a heated floor this time 'round. Quite a treat during cold mornings-- on one night, the tank of my toilet was not filling properly and I called house keeping for help. An engineer was down within 10 minutes of my call and got the problem fixed promptly. He was also quite courteous. -- the "art work" over the table was a stylized map of New York State and surrounds consisting of descriptions (in words) of the 5 boroughs and NJ. The descriptions were quite interesting to read through and a nice way to add a NYC vibe to the room.-- the view of TS is partial and from an angle. It isn't, quite truthfully, all that great. I'm not quite sure paying a premium for a TS "view" is worth it in this case.  -- the toiletries are from the Marilyn Monroe spa. They were okay but the stuff from Le Labo you'll get at a Park Hyatt or from Molton Brown at a certain other hotel are definitely much better.-- I think the ground floor restaurant's undergone a name change and, maybe, a menu change as well. i can't really say since, unlike my first stay, I didn't sample its wares this time around. I've still to try the bar at the top floor.Other than those, nothing else during this stay was different from my last stay and whatever I wrote then, well, it all still applies.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After a double booking in another hotel we quickly booked this hotel via booking.com as we were left walking around Times Square looking for rooms! What a pleasant surprise!! Clean, modern and so central!! The rooms are so spacious we were soo happy!! Only negative .. the security team who stand next to the reception desk are useless .. don’t help with directions or help with bags when they see people struggle!! Reception team are lovely though!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff is so friendly here. Their Skybox Lounge on the 54th Floor is so beautiful and watching the sun set on NYC is breathtaking. Although the drinks were a little pricey. It is in walking distance of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location aside, which was exceptional, this hotel was run professionally and included all the right ingredients for an enjoyable stay in New York city. The rooms were modest in size, but clean and modern. The restaurant was cosy and had great choices for breakfast. The concierge was very helpful and found us a great deal for attending a Broadway show, with good seats and dinner included, on Sunday evening. The rooftop Terrace bar is not to be missed for the view over the city, but get there early as it is extremely popular.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited Late July 2017, the rooms are great, clean and bright, the staff very helpful and pleasant, good food; made the holiday! We didn't have time to use the gym! We popped around the corner to see 'Charlie and the chocolate factory' Madame Tussauds, and walked over to the river to catch the river taxi, passing loads of shops. We saved a lot on cabs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall the customer service was fine but the room and lobby area of the hotel was very disappointing. The carpet was dirty and the room seemed so outdated. There are many better options at Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for our thanksgiving vacation to the big apple. We literally rolled out of bed and watched the parade. One end of the street was the parade route and the other was time square. Very convenient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Biggest complaint (and this is important to me as someone who travels 4 nights/week and likes to feel at home) - they don't carry real plates or cutlery. At all. Not even for room service. Even if you order meat, it is delivered with a plastic take-out box (not a plate) and plastic knife & fork (which is flimsier than most actual takeout spots).Apparently the rationale is to "get people to go outside and explore Times Square". Not an option for those of us who have to work. Or simply want to stay in for the night.Maybe fine for some people, but business travelers should take note.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very helpful staff, nice clean room, well stocked! Right on it with taxis or room items delivered upon request. Quiet street noise on 41st floor. Front desk had umbrellas for us to use on rainy day, thoughtful addition!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Half block from Times Square makes it the perfect location! Friendly staff and again great location. Also appreciated free bottles of water upon request. We have 4 kids (7-12) and location really worked out great so could rest from walking so much.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric. We visit New York with the sole intention of seeing the Thanksgiving Parade. This hotel was the ideal location for this! Times Square was a 1/2 block away! The parade route was another 1/2 block away going the other direction! How can you beat that?!We brought our 3 year old son with us, and we were apprehensive about the long parade wait with regards to needing to use the bathroom, being cold, and generally 3 year old complaints. Being so close to the parade route allowed my wife and son to stay in the room longer while I secured a spot against the rail.We had a dream vacation, and the location of this hotel definitely contributed to the success!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The bed was super comfortable! The staff was pleasant and helpful. One member meet us on our floor and striked up a conversation with myself and daughter. He was super sweet and gave us ideas about places to eat. The location is perfect for those looking to go to either Rockefeller Center or Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is very well located in Times Square. It was convenient to all of the long weekend activities we planned. Check in was easy and the room was ready when I arrived two hours early. The lobby area was modern and the attached restaurant was very good. The room itself could have used a carpet replacement, but overall was clean and comfortable. The hotel security team was diligent, but not rude by any means. They do ask to show your room keys before being allowed to enter the elevator area. The concierge arranged car service to LGA when we checked out. The $70 all in rate really wasn't bad for 4 people. Overall a very good stay in NYC with Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location to Times Square! In the heart of it all. We also walked less than 1/2 a block to the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade which was perfect for our visit. There is a Starbucks right across the street which helped fuel our action packed days. Overall a great experience in middle of everything. We were a family of 4 and had two queen beds. It was sufficient. The pro's were vast: hotel location, room was quiet on the 14th floor, great service, great housekeeping, helpful concierge, the restaurant, and the hot apple cider to warm us as we left for the cold outdoors. The con's (if any) would be very small lobby, a few things in the room like pillows and lighting but that could just be our personal preference. Yes we would stay again. We like Hyatt Centric hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, great staff and room extremely comfortable with modern furnishings. Housekeeping was wonderful and made getting extras easy. We would definitely book at this hotel again! Was in town for shows and could not have picked a better location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I always like Hyatts-- and this line ('Centric') did not let me down. Was in the city for a show (Springsteen on Bway!) and this location could not have been better for that purpose. The staff could not have been more cheerful (yes, in NYC!) and helpful. Great room, with floor to ceiling windows (but even the 32nd floor is not always a guarantee of a great view), nice fresh furnishings, clean, a good bed. The rooftop bar is the real gem though -- even if you'll have to hock yours to buy a drink- just don't look at the prices, go. The cocktails are 'creative' and the view is spectacular! We WILL be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel to visit NYC for the first time and do the Thanksgiving Day Parade. Hotel was nice and clean. GREAT location as it was one block out of Times Square, near many shows, eating locations and 1 block from the parade. The blocks between Avenues are longer than the blocks between streets - just as an FYI. The hotel was on 45th between 6th and 7th with the Subway entrance at approx 42nd and 7th that we used for most of our travel around the city. Bar54 on the 54th floor of the hotel was nice, music not great but the view was amazing especially for a "Ball drop". Will remember that for the future! Restaurant in hotel lobby was slow and service was basically awful. Food was ok but pricey. Convenience is about the only thing working for them. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Overall good value for price paid and what I generally expect from a Hyatt. Next time we will make sure to reserve a higher floor although our view was still awesome from Floor 24!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for nearly two weeks each on two separate occasions for work. Cosy hotel, not too big. Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are clean and comfortable, albeit small - but hey, it's NYC! Very close to all things mid-town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Hotel at Times Square is a beautiful property located in the heartbeat of NYC. The hotel is a warm environment with a staff to match it. The newly renovated restaurant provides a relaxing environment for a drink or dinner. The rooftop bar has outstanding views of Manhattan. You'll never regret a stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were steps away from all the action of the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The staff was excellent, the room was spacious, and the rest was peaceful. I was offered a late checkout after checking in early (12:00 p.m.) on Thanksgiving day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved staying at the Hyatt Centric in Times Square. It was one of the best parts of our honeymoon getaway. The service was amazing. They even had a bottle of wine and brownies waiting for us in our room. The location was perfect to visit anywhere in Times Square. We would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I usually never have any issues when staying here at the Hyatt Centric. This time I had a little issue with the movie channel late at night and when calling the front desk a couple of times no one would pick up. That was very annoying having to get dressed and have to go down to see what the problem was. The manager Michael I believe was very nice and helped by sending maintenance up and apologizing. It seemed like it was just that movie that had the problem. Besides that the hotel is always clean and nice to stay at. It's also within walking distance of everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Chose this hotel very last minute. Arrived very early and the hotel accepted my need to get to my room much before check in time and gave me my room on priority. Thank You! The delightful Front Desk Staff was always willing to Help Out, Especially a pretty & young Lady who works in the night shift. My room had a great view and the bar had an even better view right at the times square. The restaurant is very quick to deliver. Sucks that they dont have 24 hr room service and no smoking rooms. These are the only drawbacks on my otherwise an incredible trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Unfortunately I expected the hotel to be great, and clean and it wasn’t. Rooms were smaller then what I expected, not clean at all, would call for sheets because they only have a fitted sheet plus duvet cover and both days they forgot to put it on. Staff wasn’t very friendly and food in restaurant was cold but they were nice to comp it. Very disappointed

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great customer service. The hotel director of operations reached out to us before the stay and during.Second, great, great, great, location. Close to the action, but was still super quiet and restful!We stayed in a deluxe room which was large enough for me, my wife, and two teenage daughters. Plenty of space. We never felt cramped at all. Super comfy beds too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had to chose a Hotel in Times Square to wait for my flight back home. Just arrived from a Disney Halloween Cruise (did the same one last year and loved it again) and decided on the Hyatt Centric Times Square due to the reviews, location and the rooms that looked very nice and spacious.Really liked the hotel, the rooms were indeed very comfortable and spacious, the bathroom big enough with a lovely walk in shower instead of that dreadful bathtub that most hotels have. Very good lighting, nice hairdryer, overall very comfortable.I admit that at first I was a bit doubtful due to the size of the reception area, very small, not enough seating space. Had to wait for a bit for my room to become available and they were sopose to send a message when it became available and didn’t, no email nor sms, anyway since we didn’t go anywhere I went to see if there were any news regarding the room and it was already available, they apologise for the lack of communication and all was well.Fantastic LOCATION, just around the corner from the Disney Store, as if we didn’t had enough of that, but you can never have enough of Disney so it was handy, very nice places to eat in the heart of Times Square.If you stay at the Centric do not miss out on the Rooftop bar, its an amazing view, we were lucky with the weather, but even if it’s a bit cold it’s worth the view. Loved It.The bar / restaurant on the ground floor is also very nice, we had lunch just before leaving to the airport, already too tiered to walk around anymore, and it was very nice, the food was very good and can’t complain.It was a very nice couple of days and definitely will be back.Recommend the room with the view, it’s always nice the New York View.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for the second time for a weekend getaway. We were greeted by a bottle of Prosecco, chocolate, and a note from management expressing their gratitude for our return to the hotel. Great customer service and excellent location in the city! Highly recommend!! And of course the rooftop bar is a must!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for our anniversary. The food was excellent, service great and the staff was very helpful. The bar on the 54th floor is a must see especially at sunset. I only wish we had come here in the summer to take advantage of the outdoor patio. Perfect hotel and we really enjoyed our stay!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely hotel very nice staff ,comfy beds ,very central for sights and public transport ,roof top terrace has amazing sights especially as sun is going down ,drinks are very expensive up here but you can just go up for the view

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Consistently matters. So does cleanliness, caring, consideration, cooperation, convenience and Kindness! Hyatt Centric - Times Square has it all and is an excellent value.Our “Go To” NYC sleepover venue!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great hotel for your first visit to New York, easy to walk to site seeing locations, great restaurants close by and shopping. The hotel has a great staff and wonderful food and drinks and the sky bar can't be missed!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I chose to stay at the Hyatt Centric as we had tickets for a new Broadway show. I thought it would be easier to stay walking distance to the theater. Mission accomplished on that front...we were 7 minutes away from the theater and it was very convenient. Having said that, the hotel is a miss. We checked in on a busy Saturday afternoon at 1pm. Our room was not ready which i understood. The front desk said they would call us when it was ready. Yup, never received that call and only when we checked back with the hotel did they let us know that the room was ready. We were really jet lagged and would have loved a nap but it was not to be. I am a World of Hyatt explorist member. Generally, that means I am offered a choice of amenity or points on check in. I never received that even though I confirmed that they had my Hyatt number. Also, it means that I would ordinarily not get the smallest room, overlooking the alley on a low floor. I guess they figured that we wanted into a room so badly that they could get away with giving us that room. The net of it is that the hotel is convenient but a glorified Hyatt place. I would only stay here again if I got a really cheap rate. Also, ask for a room that does not overlook the alley.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel 50 meter from times square. Clean, new and luxury design. Great location. Very good gim. Free coffe and water all day. Amazing roof top bar on 54 floor with amazing view. Very good service all day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hyatt hotel is never consistent. Some days the service and staff are engaged and other days they could care less. This past week I stayed here again. First issue, get to the hotel at 6pm, get my room and go to the room it is dirty. Back down to get a replacement. Next, my wife calls the hotel to tell them it is my birthday...she gets the run-around and gives up. Third, I let them know the knob in the shower is falling off, please get it fixed. Doesn't get fixed. All the excuses in the world can't justify this behavior. 4 nights for a total of $1600.00 for this experience is a joke.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Walking distance to Times Square. Modern hotel very well located. Service is efficient for example the mobile check out facilitated too much. Rooms and bathrooms refurbished and new. The showers could be stronger but is good anyway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were looking for a hotel in the TImes Square area, so that it would be convenient for a Broadway play and within walking distance to theaters, restaurants, and Rockefeller Center. Our room was on the 28th floor, far away from any street noise. The rooms are nicely appointed and certainly roomy enough.The hotel front desk was very efficient in handling checkin/checkout and storing our luggage.We approached the concierge about finding discount theater tickets and immediately were faced with an attitude, meaning if you're not buying from me, I don't have to be friendly or helpful. I asked other questions about hopon/hopoff buses, and again, if you weren't buying from her, it was don't bother me. Not what I was expecting from a Hyatt Hotel.We were just trying to find tickets to Book of Mormon. All she was willing to do was sell them for $200 each, when we walked a few blocks to the theater and bought them for $69 each.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed on the 50th floor with beautiful views of Times Square. Try the King room with the Deluxe view! You will not regret it. The room was very clean, modern and the service excellent. The staff were professional and friendly. We felt that they cared. This is a great place to stay if you want to be in the heart of Times Square. The shopping is literally right around the corner.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt centric is a great central location within time square so easy to get to all the activities and Time Square great staff and customer service was phenomenal I’d highly recommend this to anyone traveling on business or pleasure

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location on W45th just off Broadway. Close to the 'action' but Times Square never intrudes. Very large, clean and well appointed room, easily accommodating three adults. Lovely bathroom and shower. Friendly staff, knowledgeable and helpful. Booked directly on Hyatt website; easy and a terrific value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is well located and in good condition but they must be understaffed because from our initial drive up, there was no valet available, to our room not being ready by 4pm. Nobody responded to my request for a broken shower and one of the 3 elevators was not working our entire visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a great 3 day stay on 24th floor. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and competent. All was great until leaving...Beware of taking car service to Newark airport. Doorman said tips included, but driver said not really and not fair. Also, surprised that using credit card involved $10 surcharge. Wish I had been warned at hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I travel to the city numerous time a year and have stayed in many 4/5 star hotels. We tried the Hyatt Centric recently and from reservations to check out it was an awesome experience! The reservation Maria was attentive, knowledgeable, professional, courteous, and assured us our needs would be easy to accommodate. The view was spectacular, the roof top bar over looking Time Square and the city was amazing. The room was affordable, spacious, clean, and had all the things you would expect from a top notch hotel. Check out was a breeze. The man who met us at the door was very welcoming, got us our valet parking and when we checked out the car was there waiting for us before we exited. The Hyatt Centric has clients for life!!! Frank Mele

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very short walk to Times Sqare and Broadway Theaters.Staff was extremely efficient and friendly.Room was very comfortable. Loved the rainfall shower. Great elevator service.Would possitively recommend this hotel to others and will definitely return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is our second visit to this hotel and again we were not disappointed. The hotel is well positioned being less than a minutes walk into Times Square.It is like a quiet oasis away from all the crowds and noise of the city, you walk in and instantly feel calmer. The staff on the reception and on the door are always very welcoming and very informative if you need any advice. My only disappointment would be that we paid to upgrade to a higher floor and actually only ended up a couple of floors higher. Next time I wouldn't waste the money on the upgrade. Will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: No regrets! So glad we stayed at the Hyatt Time Square. Service was great! The room was AMAZING! This location was the best and near all! This hotel has 54 floors including a very nice rooftop lounge. Very up to date and modern. We have to come back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great stay in Hyatt, centric location, comfortable bed and the best pillows ever. I went for a business trip and had a great stay. comfortable business area, the food was very good. Staff very friendly and helpful. It was a nice stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is steps away from the heart of Times Square. My room was right next to the elevators. I was concerned about noise, but never heard anything. All of the staff in the hotel were very helpful and polite. The room and common areas were all kept very clean. Loved the rain shower head in the bathroom!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just completed my third stay at this hotel (first stay November 2015). I go to New York on business once a year and add on a few days of personal time each stay. I love the location of the hotel, Times Square but away from the craziness! It’s perfect for walking to Central Park, the shops on 5th Avenue, Rockerfella Centre, Radio City music hall and obviously heaps of great restaurants (and for me, my office on Park Avenue).The staff are friendly and helpful, the decor is modern, the huge bed is really comfortable and the shower is great! The hotel Spa and salon is very nice and I love the rooftop bar.I’ll return for my next New York stay without doubt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in a room on floor 26. In spite of being in the very busy touristy section of Times Square, the room was so quiet! There was absolutely no street noise. The room was large, very clean, and the beds were very comfortable. It has a modern vibe and there is plenty to see and do, when you walk out the door. They do take note of people walking in, making sure they are hotel guests. The staff is also nice and checking in and out was very easy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first stay at the Hotel. We wanted to try somewhere different. We were celebrating my husband's 60th Birthday. I booked a High floor with a view. It was so worth it. Guest Services had my husband a nice little birthday card and gift when we got to the room. Out our window was Time Square to the right, the One World Trade Center straight ahead and the Chrysler Building to the right. Reception was really nice and friendly. We had drinks at the rooftop bar one evening and it was really nice. A little pricey, but you are paying for the view. We had breakfast in the restaurant every morning and it was really good. It is really convenient to the subway station, which is always a plus for me. I would really recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had two bookings at this hotel with a gap of 18 days in the same month. I hold a Hyatt gold passport. The first time I checked in the person at the front office said he had no room of my category available at that point of time and downgraded me without informing me. He said he was giving me a different category room. I asked him what that meant and was I losing any benefits and he said no. I also said I was in no hurry and I could leave my baggage and come back later to check in which he ignored. As a result our room wasn't as nice and there was no complimentary breakfast. There was also no extended checkout. The second time I went to the hotel I saw the difference with the lady at front office welcoming me, giving me a higher category room , complimentary breakfast and extended checkout. I asked her why I was not extended the same privilages during my last stay and she was flummoxed. The amazing thing was I got a feedback email only for my second stay and not the first. During my second visit the room was adequate and the breakfast was nice.The concierge really needs a rehaul. They know absolutely nothing and one instance they sent me to the wrong address for a show which led to utter chaos.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. Noisy but not unexpectedly so considering where the hotel is located. Reasonable sized room, furniture all a bit mismatched and top drawer of chest broken. However, the room was clean and the bed comfortable but nothing really out of the ordinary. Arrived in the afternoon having flown in from London with a 4am start so just wanted to order room service and catch an early night. Had to call housekeeping twice over a two-hour period to ask for a room directory/compendium of their services so I could see what their room service offering was. Gluten-free diets clearly not catered for, and no real interest in providing anything appetising. Ended up with a dry burger between two slice of GF bread and some plain salad leaves. All delivered in a cardboard box with plastic cutlery. Hyatt claim this is an environmentally sustainable solution but it felt bargain basement and decidedly down market. Didn't eat anything else in the hotel over the next four days. Called also for a bathrobe (they'll supply if requested) when it came it was very old and had a hole mid-way down the front (also a fairly largish slit in my duvet cover). Incredibly grumpy man on reception when I checked out (was reluctant to print my bill until after I had handed over my card!). Zero customer service skills and no social niceties. Shame really as concierge staff pleasant and polite. Wouldn't rush back to the Hyatt, but love NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For a four star hotel this was a very good experience. Very comfortable large rooms, excellent front desk and housekeeping staff; not to mention great location. For a five night stay couldn’t have been happier.The restaurant was resting on their laurels a bit. Could have been more imaginative; however was good value for money. Again well staffed

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We checked in super early due to an early flight over night from Vegas (9am) the hotel was very accommodating in terms of giving us a room. Although we paid extra for a high floor at least we could sleep after already travelling. The service was above and beyond. I had the a very senior manager email me before my arrival and asked if there was anything they could do prior to our arrival and on our arrival and stay I was constantly contacted by the the director of operations ensuring our stay was amazing! I've never experienced service like this. We were eventually moved to an amazing high floor with amazing views. Our room was stunning and I was super happy. Service was amazing and I felt like a super start based on the additional service as care from the operation director. The hotel location was right next to subways and Times Square was a crawl away! Our stay was for 6 nights and we were super central to everything including all the New York icons we did most of them .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There is nothing like a new and well maintained facility coming together with a caring and professional staff.First and foremost- location. Hyatt Centric Time Square is located 30 seconds walk from times square. The thing is that its so great. The rooms are so quiet that you even forget youre seconds away from the most busiest place on the planet...Rooms are in mint condition. Sheets, towels, bathroom are perfectly clean.King size bed was really comfortable and great.We got complimentary mineral water bottles everyday which was really nice.As for the staff, ill start with a small case- We ran into one of the maids when we left the room. We asked for a shower cap. The lady said "ok". When we got back, 3 shower caps were waiting for us.Seemingly- a simple thing but this maid was not near our room, she could have easily forgotten about it but no- she made it happen. This is one of these little things that matter. Show that the staff cares.Last but not least, as our flight was at 6pm, we wanted to leave the room at 2pm.Checkout time is 11am where it could be extended (per availability), until 12:00pm.We asked if its possible to extend and gave the reason.Alex the manager agreed to let us keep the room until 2pm.And again- these are the things which makes the difference between a nice visit to the city to an overall great travel experience.I think the staff at Hyatt Centric found the magic formula here and given the hotel's amazing condition and location, they can only win it from here.This is my preferred hotel for NYC. Period. (hopefully the prices will continue to be reasonable ;-) )

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My stay was great! The room was more than I expected, high technology (I loved the heated bathroom floor), great views, delicious complimentary coffee, the beds were really comfy, staff is friendly and helpful, I even got my printed boarding pass. Since the 1st day I received an email from the director of operations checking if all was well with my stay. The location is incredible. I am very happy and I'll definitely come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved this hotel. Location is perfect if you want to be near Times Square. We arrived on Nov. 3 for the NYC Marathon weekend. Not able to check in early (based on availability) when we arrived in NY at 7 a.m. We were tired, but not a huge issue. Went to breakfast, then called at 10 a.m. and we were able to get into our room. Lovely view of the city. Hotel is very modern, clean and close to major attractions. Lots of wonderful restaurants nearby. We would definitely stay here again. The doorman was also very helpful getting a car (suv) for our trip home via La Guardia. Much cheaper than a cab.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are looking for a great hotel, in the perfect location close to shopping, restaurants and theatre, this is the place to stay. My room was clean and comfortable! I would recommend it! We had a blast and the staff was wonderful!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Surprised my wife on her birthday by booking a few days at hyatt centric at times square. Special shoutout to Alex, the director of operations... for taking care of us that weekend. Everything from the little gifts on arrival to the credit for food etc were really appreciated. The hotel staff was nice and courteous and the view from the rooftop lounge is gorgeous.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had asked for an early check in, but there was none available, which was a shame. the staff were reasonably polite and helpful though.When we got our room it was on the 51st floor. It was small, which we were expecting, but it was perfectly comfortable and well equipped, and the views south towards the freedom tower were spectacular, and made the high price worth it.We went out with some friends in the village then took them back to our hotel for a nightcap. We went to the rooftop bar, Bar 54 I think it was called. this was the highlight of our short stop over. the views are incredible.
