You can go outside and have views of the Chrysler tower, Freedom tower, Times square. It was breathtaking, and it was surprisingly quiet, maybe something to do with the price of the drinks and the late hour. but we sat there for a good hour chatting and soaking in the moment.The location was perfect. Sufficiently removed from the madness of Times Square, but right in it at the same time.Overall, this place is not cheap, but if you're coming to NYC, you don't penny pinch, and this was good value in the end. I gave it 4 rather than 5 because of the delayed check in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When planning a business trip for 4 of our executives (and their wives) I was looking for a hotel close to the action that had a meeting room for our small group.I contacted over 15 hotels in the Times Square area and the Hyatt won out based on their exceptional service from the Event Sales Department. They not only provided us with a small meeting room at a great price but also exceptional service when booking the sleeping rooms for our small group as well.The location of the hotel was perfect for us to explore NYC for our first visit. Half a block from Times Square (closest subway station too) close to many restaurants and bars and about an hours cab ride in from JFK.Lobby area is on the smallish side, but they do offer a restaurant/bar right along side the area. We had drinks here on a couple occasions during our stay, but I must say, I am not a big fan of their 'gender neutral' washrooms. Front desk staff where friendly, and the bellmen where great as well. They suggested hiring one of their large SUV's for a day tour around Manhattan, rather than taking the double decker tourist busses on a Saturday -- EXCELLENT idea for our group of 8. Before you get to the elevators, you must present your room key to security, which was appreciated as well.I was a bit disappointed in the location of our hotel room. We where on the 23rd floor, and everyone else in our group was placed on floor 38 or higher, and all our room reservations indicated we would be on a higher floor. Due to the lower floor, we could hear traffic and siren noise all night - but that is to be expected due to the location as well.Room was on the smallish side, but that is NYC. Bed was comfortable, TV large and we appreciated the fridge in the room - something you don't always see in hotels now. Bathroom was very modern with shower only, great hair dryer and the in room safe was handy as well. We went to the rooftop bar on 2 occasions during our stay. First night and our last night. Both times the service was less than ideal. Hostesses not the most friendly, but once they realized we where hotel guests, suddenly a large 'reserved' table opened up for our group, after telling us 5 minutes before they where fully booked. Last night there, the bartender didn't want to serve us when we showed up a half hour BEFORE closing - he lost out on a large tip. The views are amazing, but service could use some tweaking for sure.Overall I definitely recommend this hotel based on the location and overall service.This was our first trip to NYC, and I didn't think I'd like it as much as I did, so will be back, and look at staying here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Central, nice rooms and a home base for exploring the city centre. Absolutely recommended... Skip the restaurant and go out for dinner... The rooftop bar has great views and is a nice place for a nightcap!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely modern hotel just steps from Time square. We had a room on 52nd floor and what a view we had... amazing. We had a small issue at check in with our prepaid room payment which got sorted out eventually. Staff were pleasant and we were given flowers and prosecco in one of our rooms as it was special occasion. Great location if you want to be in the heart of it all. Roof top bar seems a bit overpriced but was something we had to try.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a great location - near Times Square but in a side street so the entrance is not busy. The hotel is in great condition and seems to be brand new and very clean. The employees made our stay - they were helpful and so friendly! I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are visiting!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 4 nights & it’s in a great spot. Less than 10 Minute walk to 42nd St Station which makes it easy to get everywhere via subway.The hotel is modern & clean & typical size room (smallish) for NYC. Bathroom is compact, shower nice. Bed was ok on comfort level - pillows were crap but requested different ones & they accommodated. Odd that our bed didn’t have standard bedding. It was a down comforter, surrounded by a sheet on either side. Not sure why it didn’t have the standard actual sheet you normally cover with.Roof lounge is ok. Views are nice but alcohol ridiculously priced, even for NYC.Had some struggles with hotel services. Needed a few things, 2 hours later called back & then about 30 min after that, they finally delivered them.Overall, nice hotel for what you pay. Within about 5 minutes walk of tons of the broadway shows - so convenient if you want to catch a few shows. 2 Minute wall into heart of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The title says is all. It was a really nice Hotel. We got a really great rate for 6 nights. The location is perfect just a block off of Times Square. We could see times square from our corner room. Very clean and the staff was very friendly. I would stay again for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Usually hotels this close to Times Square are pretty cheesy. Hyatt Centric was anything bud. Tastefully appointed rooms with beautiful interior design. An amazing rooftop bar and lounge with breathtaking views of Times Square. Really, really great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Trying to make it simple: hotel is okay (nothing fantastic & not too bad), really really well located (heart of Times Square and easy to move around).Service is okay - everyone is always running in NY, so don’t wait for normal 4,5 stars attention. Nice style building and very good cleaners is a difference in this area, then for me this is a good point.I do recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square is a fantastic hotel in an ideal Midtown location. It is modern in design and old fashioned in its respect for its guests. They charge fair rates and refuse to engage in that industry scourge, the “resort fee” bait and switch scam. The staff is outstanding.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned from a fantastic stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Sq. Hotel was amazing the room a deluxe double double which had two queen size luxurious beds. Super comfortable. The room was spacious with superb bathroom with separate shower and bath tub. Lovely view. Massive TV great coffee maker and complementary bottled water. The staff were very welcoming and helpful and we felt very secure here on our return each evening you had to show your room key to access the lifts. With the close proximity to times sq approx 1 minute walk we were never disturbed by the noise outside. Would definitely return one of the best hotels I had stayed in over the last 12 years. Well done Hyatt Centric Times Sq.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt is ideally situated just off Times Square and the rooms are very spacious, well-appointed, and very user friendly! The staff at this hotel is superb! The hotel has security that checks every visitor before allowing entry beyond the front desk. The room was extremely comfortable! The rooftop is a must for travelers to New York. There is outdoor and indoor seating with views of NYC. Fantastic!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spend 6 nights with my wife to celebrate our October birthdays. We choose the Hatte for it excellent location, it turn out to be more than that. We arrived early morning and didn’t have to wait long for our room to be ready and gain the full day as a starter. Getting back late in the evening we have been surprised with balloons all over the room in addition to complimentary bottle of champagne and birthday greetings card, no need to elaborate on the good feeling like home away from home...that was a good start for enjoyable week in the “Big Apple”. All and all the level of comfort, security, atmosphere and location we strongly recommend the Hyatt Centric.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is located just around the corner from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. It is perfectly located on 45th (between 6th and 7th) making it easy to get pretty much everywhere. The room was modern and quite small with two queen beds a desk and compact fridge ( of note; the internet speeds were amazing!). We were on the 8th floor facing north. There was plenty of light coming into the room and the view was of a few near by rooftops and a couple of neon signs (I suspect fairly normal for New York)There is a nice restaurant (4T5) where we had our daily breakfast and coffee and for New York was reasonably priced.What stood out for us though was the service. Our plane was delayed and we didn’t arrive until 11:30pm and despite the room service kitchen closing they whipped up a few burgers and sent them up. This was a great start but we continued to receive great service through the 6 day stay.The service was fantastic- everyone on staff so friendly and helpful.Of particular mention was the delightful lady that made up our room. She was always so cheerful when we saw her and had noticed my 7 year old daughter likes unicorns. We were pleasantly surprised when we returned one afternoon to see a small soft toy unicorn in bed with her other doll (and a note accompanying it)Such a thoughtful gesture made a great stay beyond excellent!I would highly recommend the Hyatt Centric and am looking forward to returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay at the Hyatt Centric was great! It is right in the middle yet just far enough away you don't have the crowds bombarding you as soon as you walk on the street. Check in was easy and friendly. We had two rooms reserved and only one was ready, which was fine it was early. Our room was on the 15th floor and had a decent view, but we did not book the upgraded view. I was amazed at the size of the room for NY standards. The TV is a great size for the room. The bathroom was very clean, the shower was amazing. Our bathroom was only set up for 2 guests, (we were 2 adults 1 child) but that was taken care of by the housekeeping. Who by the way did a great job each day of restocking and cleaning the room. All the staff we encountered were friendly and and very eager to help in anyway they could. The elevators were great. We went once to the bar 54 (the roof top bar) it was very nice. The view is amazing! The drinks are high as well and to be honest were not mixed that well. But it was an experience. We ate breakfast at the restaurant one morning. It was crowded and seemed a bit short handed. The food was good, but very over priced. The server was fine but she seemed very bothered when we asked for items. I did notice most restaurants in NYC does not offer free refills. That is fine and i don't mind to pay for extra but almost every server seemed very annoyed by the request for extra drinks. We all noticed this. But back to the hotel! It was great! I would highly recommend if you want to be in Times Square but just a little away from the crowds. A great central location to everything!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Best Hotel right off of Time Square, walking distance to all sight seeing landmarks, best night sleep in a hotel bed ever, staff was so friendly and helpful with a 4 year old traveling, will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel before. However, my current stay on Nov. 1st disappointed me. The room I have been provided is quite dingy, carpet is dirty and room is smaller for the same room type and cost from prior stays. Consequently, I recommend rooms above the 25th floor and call the front desk to make sure you obtain the renovated rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This visit we stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square and were blown away with this property - Just half a block from the center of all the fun we quickly found a property with ample space int he rooms, heated bathroom floors - large walk in shower and upgraded lighting in the rooms to add for mood lighting or reading options. The lobby is small but with a downtstairs restaurant bar and a rooftop bar that offers views that would compete with the Top of the rock - we truly were spoiled. The front office staff of Dede, Michael at the curb and Jeff were always available to help.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights on a recent trip to New York. The room was on the 51st floor overlooking Times Square.It was clean and ideal size for the trip and view was special.Reception was friendly and informative and could not be more welcoming.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric Hotel, a 54 story tower, is in the very center of MAnhattan with walking distance to Times Square and other NYC attractions. We booked it since our flight was cancelled because of bad weather and the next flight was 24 hrs later. We chose Hyatt because we had good experiences in Hyatt hotels previously. We were happy with our choice. The room was very modern and clean just as we like. The view from 53rd floor was spectacular. The staff was helpful providing us with toothbrushes etc as our bags were stuck at JFK. There is a nice bare at the top and good breakfast at the bottom. The lobby is small and was cramped with soaking umbrellas as dashed in from the torrential rain.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: HYatt Centric is perfectly located for those wishing to explore NY. Staff very Professional and most willing to help at all times. I have no hesitation to recommend this hotell to anyone looking for value in what can be a stressfull City

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Awesome hotel. Around the corner from time square. Friendly staff. Efficient room service. Fast dedicated elevators. Spacious room. King size bed. Ensuite. Bathroom with under tile heating. Big shower. With hand held. Air con. Big screen tv. Coffee machine. Build in cupboard to hang your clothes. Quiet. Spectacular view from 54 floor. Next to And part of O’Lunney’s restaurant

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I loved this hotel. Easy to get to and from and close to almost everything you would want. Grand Central Station is right below with tons of shops and amenities and easy access to all the trains. Our room have a view of the Chrysler Building right beside us - no need to take the rooftop tour. Great bar and wonderful desk staff. Rooms are clean although starting to show their age a bit but well appointed and quiet. The security staff was a bit snooty at night but perhaps they have a lot to deal with. It was the only negative of the entire week we staid here. I would come back in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I loved my room and view of time square , staff was really nice and helpful lol. There is a great breakfast spot a couple blocks over Red Flames . About 5 min walk to time square , and parking garage across the street .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were greeted when we arrived at the hotel and offers of whatever assistance we needed. Check in was extremely easy and friendly as well. The rooms were big, the beds were comfortable, and the bathroom was wonderful! Whenever we would leave the hotel to go out for dinner and the theater and then come back to the hotel, we had to show our room cards to get past the lobby to the elevators to go up to our rooms. We thought this was excellent because it gave us safety the knowledge that we were safe. We thanked them every time they ask us for our cards! I will be going back to this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was really helpful and rooms are clean and comfortable. Close to lots of attractions and less than a minute walking distance to Times Square. Could use more menu options for room service but lots of great restraints close by. Great shopping close by too!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was great. Staff was very kind and helpful. Room service for extras we needed was quick and efficient. Most impressed with the quietness of the room for sleeping. I have been to NYC many times and have found it hard to sleep from traffic noise and hallway noise. Not here. Great sleeping because of the soundproof/quiet rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here as a family of 4 in a deluxe twin room in October. The hotel is centrally located just off Times Square an ideal base for sight-seeing and navigating around the city. The hotel staff are really friendly and helpful - everyone we came into contact with were great with us and the kids. The hotel is modern and our room was very spacious for new york standards and extremely quiet meaning we all got a great night's sleep! Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room and location were great, every part of it, looking forward to coming again. The restaurant next door had great vegetarian options for breakfast, I had a great view of times square from my room. Theatre in walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square. The location was a block off Times Square which made it a little quieter. We visited the rooftop bar (B54) each day around sunset and it was awesome! Staff is very friendly and accommodating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Many, many hotels in NYC are tired and worn out. Not Hyatt Centric. It’s fresh, clean, up to date and very comfortable. Also the location is Superb. Most of the hotels near Times Square are too far west. This hotel is perfectly situated between 7th and 8th on 45th. It’s a great place to stay and good value for the money

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt centric Times Square for four nights. The staff was amazing and attentive! Latoya helped us through a situation! I can’t say enough about the whole experience!! Great location....very central to all the sites! Beautiful rooftop bar too! The room was spacious and the bathrooms were inviting and even had heated floors!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric as a family of 4 (kids 8 and 10) in August. We wanted a central location and liked the idea of being close to Time Square. The hotel did not disappoint. Although we did not have a room with a full view of the square, it was spacious by NYC standards, comfy and quiet and modern. Location was convenient and staff were friendly. We did not mine the lack of breakfast options (there is a small restaurant in hotel but limited choice) as we found great options nearby.We enjoyed the roof top bar and the fact that hotel managers will bring kids up for a tour at 10am every day. My girls loved getting to go so high to take in the view. In the evening, the hotel keeps prime seats available for hotel guests so my husband and I didn't have to wait when we went up for a drink. That's a pleasant surprise as other hotel rooftop bars have long lines with tons of walk-in customers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean and excellent facility at Times Square! We stayed a night but felt wonderful location and service. Expedite valet parking service was impressive to my family. Good breakfast made us enjoy delightful morning. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved this hotel! The location is perfect, right off of Times Square. The room was large by NYC standards. It was very quiet and comfortable. We were on the 35th floor and the view was beautiful. I liked that they required the room key to get on the elevators. One criticism is that it doesn’t have much of a lobby. It was great, we will be back again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was chosen for me for a 3 night business stay and worked well. Check in/out was swift and efficient and the allocated room on the 23rd floor was pretty large for a city centre hotel, with 2 double beds. The bed was very comfortable. I was in a room at the back of the hotel, which was remarkably quiet from street noise. That said, sound insulation around the entrance door was not great. Shower was decent and towels fluffy (no robes) but I wasn't personally won over by the in-bathroom, Marilyn Monroe spa products.Wifi worked well, there was a work desk and the lighting arrangement was simple, not complex light other modern hotels.A visit to the roof top bar is a must for a great city view.As others have mentioned there is very little public space around the lobby (bars aside).I didn't eat in the hotel, so no comments there.All in all a decent stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Extremely very good hotel, in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the Times Square area this hotel was located in a quiet street. Very good rooms, large and airy with a free supply of bottled water, an added convinience. My family and self recommend this hotel54 bar on the top is a good place for seeing the city, especially at night, and has a very good selection of drinks and cocktails.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was conveniently located, the views from the rooftop bar are spectacular. It was nice having friendly staff, they were there when I needed them most. After walking miles around Manhattan I had a lot of blisters on my feet, they brought band aids up to my room as requested. The elevator ride up the the 54th floor can be fun for some but it freaked me out, I was not expecting it to go so fast! The valet guy was very nice and even helped us out when a random taxi driver was blocking us in. Thank you for everything, Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am a wheelchair user - manual self propelling Wheelchair but I get fatigued - and wanted somewhere close to Times Square and Theatre District but that also catered for me, (accessible wet room, wheelchair wide doors etc.) I found it. The hotel ticked every box. The staff are also fantastic - very friendly, can't do enough, hailed accessible cabs etc. I could go on, (and on, and on), but after researching what we needed for a frantic NYC break with very specific accessibility needs, this ticked every box.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our top choice, staff was very friendly and welcoming and the hotel was beautiful and clean. Housekeeping was perfect and so was front desk. So many great things and restaurants close, highly recommend Connolly’s pub next door. And Time Square as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is fantastic. It exceeded my expectations with a high end hotel in NY. Highly recommended! The room was spacious for New York. Will be back for sure. It was a perfect central location to go uptown or downtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in an excellent location and the service is very efficient. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Any request was positively answered.It’s not our first time in the hotel and seems the service is improving continually.Thanks

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My friend & myself had a 5 night trip to New York to celebrate her birthday. This hotel is in an excellent location - right on Times Square. We had a deluxe suite with a view - comfortable & loads of space with separate lounge. Refrigerator in room was great for drinks & coffee maker was good. The staff made this trip extra special - they were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We searched many hotels before settling on this one and I am very happy that we did. originally we picked a deluxe view suite. but a few days before checkin the hotel offered us an upgrade to the premier suite for a minimal charge. I am so happy we did so. the room is very big for times square standards, and has a large balcony on the 40th floor.I was contacted via email a few days before we arrived, by a staff member (alexander) of the hotel asking if he could help me with anything. We went back and forth quite a few times on email as he helped me figure out many things about the area including where to eat and how to get around. he also helped me by contacting a 3rd party delivery service and giving directions to insure the hotel could accept my package.i found this great level of service from the hotel staff to be the normal at this hotel. every person i interacted with was very courteous knowledgeable and extremely accommodating. as a simple example, i had flowers delivered to the hotel from proflowers. these flowers come in a cardboard box along with a separate vase. the hotel took the time to open the box and arrange the flowers in the vase with water and then delivered them to the room. this was a very nice touch and my wife really appreciated them.We needed some extra blankets. I used the Hyatt app to request it, and within a few minutes someone showed up at our door with two blankets. it was very easy and convenient. We went to NY for a broadway show as well as a concert at MSG and this location was very convenient. In addition, we spent saturday afternoon in central park, it was easy to get around to everywhere we went.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed on the 47th floor, the view was stunning. The Chrysler building on the left and One World observatory in front, there is one building blocking the Empire State but so happy with the view. We arrived late and the check in process was easy and quick. They took a $100 charge for the room in case of any extras, personally I never approve of this process as I have had to make complaints to get the money back. On this instance it worked perfectly fine.We didn't eat in the restaurants but had drinks at both, both brilliant for different reasons. Downstair T45 the streets are always busy and so interesting. Bar 54, the highest bar in New York was stunning for views, you can see the Times Square ball drop.The room was great, some marks on walls etc but nothing serious. The shower wasn't particularly clean and one day they didn't clean the room. Overall the hotels was worth a 5* simply because of where it was.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a hotel I stay at about 4-5 times a year on business trips. Very nicely located between 6th and Broadway on 45th....basically heart of midtown and times square within a few blocks. Hotel feels more like a boutique hotel than what you expect from a Hyatt. There is usually quite of bit of activity in the downstairs lobby and check in. Check in is efficient and you would benefit from staying on a higher floor with room facing times square. You will see the neon lights and signage from certain rooms in this hotel, some of which have small balconies, which you can request for. Rooms are designed well with good technology. The only negative comment is the rooms are getting a little worn even though the hotel is relatively new. Carpets are fraying and have stains, doors and baseboards are nicked up, and towels are well worn and flimsy. I suspect its because there is a lot of tourist traffic at this hotel. The upshot: no frills hotel located in great location in heart of midtown but one that is starting to show its age. It will come down to what price you can get comparable hotels at.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location for Times Square, literally just round the corner, room was excellent with everything we needed, very clean& first class service from all staff. Would highly recommend and will use this hotel again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our client recommended this hotel as we needed to be in downtown and boy were they right. Fantastic hotel fabulous view great staff and everything on walking distance We got a room at the 40st floor with a balcony Yes balcony amazing views on the Chrysler building the freedom tower and Times Square Amazing. They also have a magnificent Skylounge at the 54th floor. Our breakfast was served downstairs no buffet great menu and reasonably priced. Definitely recommend this hotel and we will be back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here in October for a long weekend in New York and was very glad I did. I've stayed in various hotels in the area and this may be the best.I arrived at check-in a few hours early but the room was ready and I was dealt with efficiently and helpfully by the staff at the front desk, and was given my room on the 28th floor.The room was really bright, clean, and modern, and had a large bathroom with a big walk-in rainfall shower. The large windows overlooked Times Square and midtown and was really quiet.The bed was really big and very comfortable, and the bathroom amenities were very nice. The shower was excellent, but one morning didn't have any hot water at 7:30am. 20 minutes later, the hot water was back.The bar on the 54th floor is excellent. The outside terrace has amazing views of downtown and midtown Manhattan, and as far as you can see (on a clear day!). The staff working in the bar are really helpful and always on hand for table service. The free internet was very good and never had any problems with connecting or speed anywhere in the hotel.I didn't eat in the hotel restaurants but the menus looked very good and there was always a number of people eating there.The location of the hotel is right in the middle of Times Square. 45 second walk and you're right there. The transport links are easy and only 5 minutes walk from the subway.Although I had an issue with the air conditioning in my room Alex was exceptionally and promptly helpful and dealt with it for me.I really enjoyed this hotel and will definitely stay here again, highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt centric Will be my future go to event place in NYC. It's location is wonderful for setting the city and experiencing New York. My stay was short but I'm looking forward to a return trip to attend shows as well as do much of the American history that it forever instilled and a part of the city

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel: central location, friendly staff, clean room, modern furnishings, impressive rooftop bar...so why a 4 instead of a 5?On the morning of my departure, I woke up to NO HOT WATER at 5am. I had an early flight so I could not risk wasting any time complaining to the management. This meant taking a miserable 30-second cold shower and leaving abruptly to catch my flight.Hyatt usually leaves me on a high note as you can tell from my other reviews. I'm not giving up on Hyatt just yet, but unfortunately this experience really left me on a low note :(

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For $500 per night you expect better service. No sheets on the beds. Phones and blow dryer didn't work. Front desk staff un-enthusiastic. Security at Elevators were rude. Restaurant 4T5 in the hotel were very good and the staff was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Business/personal trip. Great location. Friendly staff. Great amenities. Fantastic rooftop bar at the hotel and located next to it. I would definitely stay here when traveling back to New York next time

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at the Hyatt Centric several times and Hyatt hotels many times. I always know that I will be staying in a safe, clean, and comfortable hotel. The rooms are simple and quiet. The Hyatt Centric is close to Times Square with all of its hustle and bustle yet it is on a quieter street and away from all the noise. The lower floors you will still get street noise so I suggest requesting a floor 25 or higher.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this hotel! Check-in desk is well-staffed with nice people. Our room was clean, had more space than expected for a NYC hotel room. We were on the 30th floor, so very quiet. Elevators - pretty quick, easy. Bed was comfortable, bathroom also bigger than expected. Half a block from Times Square on a street with at least 4 restaurants. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent Hotel with a Wonderful Staff. Thank you Ritchie ... Best of the Best! Great food at the restaurant for breakfast with Excellent service. Thank you to our waiter 10-08-17. Close to Times Square, shopping, broadway and everything else.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We decided to spend a long weekend in NYC and found a great price on this hotel. We used a Hyatt Diamond Suite Upgrade certificate. We were assigned a lovely 2-room suite about halfway up the hotel. Room was great, though there were some technical glitches where even the maintenance staff couldn't get the lights in the room to shut off! So that was a bit odd, but we still give it 5 stars because of the wonderful location for us-- we attended three Broadway shows in three days, and our exact same plan was: go to the Hyatt's rooftop bar for a glass of champagne, then walk to the theater (all within about 10 minutes leisurely walk or less), enjoy a show. Loved it. Breakfast for Diamonds is a credit of $xx which was plenty for the two of us. Really lovely food, with both healthy and/or decadent options. Friendly service too. Front desk and lobby was not 5*, which is OK with us-- it's almost always full of people and busy-- so it's not a place to hang out; that's ok since the restaurant is a separate room and there is always the rooftop for a great place to have a drink and chill out. The prices can be crazy on some weekends, but we found rates that were quite reasonable, and loved our experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is the perfect place to stay in Times Square. The staff are very cordial and amenable to special requests. Convenient for walking to many places. Love the security of this hotel! There was a business center available to pre-check airline and print boarding passes. Valets were very helpful in helping to get taxis!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this hotel... our second visit. It is very close to Times Square but the main attraction for us is that it is a great hotel and convenient to the theater district and many great restaurants. A different theater and restaurant every night within walking distance and also convenient to many other NYC attractions. Lovely clean rooms. Excellent staff. One suggestion: We were disappointed and surprised to find that the carpets in our suite were in desperate need of cleaning or replacing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Have just stayed for 5 nights in this modern stylish hotel. Exactly what we required. Central location for most attractions and Times Square and Theatre land literally on doorstep yet quiet and secluded.Good sized rooms / big beds and friendly helpful staff esp with our need for extra tea / coffee in room to refresh after the hectic sightseeing. Food / Wine / Beer at restaurant very good selection and quality. Front end native New Yorker waiter top class guy. Roof top bar worth having a trip for great views.Recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed with daughter at Hyatt Centric Times Square in July. Although the hotel is 2-3 minutes walk to Times Square, the rooms are very quiet. I noticed that they have a special concern with security, because there was always someone checking the people who were coming into the hotel and going upstairs to the rooms.I had a king suite that was very good, with a room with a sofa, a desk, tv and refrigerator. The room was spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was small, but it was good. The lobby of the hotel was a little small, so sometimes it was very crowded, specially at check-in times. But the staff was friendly and helpful. The great things about this hotel were the location and the room. The greatest location, and a big and comfortable room, with very good prices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want to be near Times Square this is the perfect place. We walked to dinner and theater every night. The staff was terrific! The lighting is very muted, so bring your own mirror. Great rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent alternative if you are looking for a good hotel at Time Square. Excellent location just in the center of the main points of attraction and life in Time Square, extremely accesible to theaters in broadway. Great service with very cosy and modern rooms, making your stay more delightful. Very good security.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Alexander DeChagas together with his team,Rachel,Paola,Abbey and John made our celebration in NYC super special. They went above and beyond. Their warmth and sterling service will keep me coming back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location. Modern rooms, large for NY standards, wonderful shower. No minibar, courtesy coffee&water. Friendly staff, fast check in. Well set restaurant (there is also a rooftop bar I didn’t visit). Served breakfast (probably faster and cheaper anywhere around). In general a good experience, but... a) room not very clean b) tiny frequently crowded lobby, no place to sit and wait c) isolation poor, 45-50 dB constant background noise in room

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stay away from this hotel. Staff is cold. No amenity in the bathroom, food is terrible. They will charge you early termination fees which is equal to one night hotel fees. Outrageous! The room is noisy as well

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed in many hotels in NYC for business and pleasure. While I am not a big fan of staying at or too near to Times Square, this is the best hotel I have stayed in NYC. The staff were very helpful with suggestions and subway routes. The room was the largest and most updated I have been in in the City. Will definitely try to stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've never written a review while I'm still staying at a hotel but I wanted to do this one while everything is fresh in my mind. I've been coming to NY for 30+ years staying at different hotels eac time, but no more. Next time, I'm coming back here. 1) the staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. From our room upgrade to handing us an umbrella as we exit the hotel, they're a pleasure to deal with. 2) the room is really, really large, especially by NY standards. And the mattresses appear to be new (I always strip the bed to check out the cleanliness of the mattresses in a new hotel room). The bathroom is also huge, and everything is so clean. The blackout drapes keep the room so dark that you can actually sleep in! And I'm not sure what it is, but the room and the hotel lobby always smell so fresh and fragrant when you enter. 3) location - we are a stones throw away from Broadway, yet it's so quiet here. All in all, we really love this hotel. We are here to celebrate special time, and this hotel has made it all the better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location right down in Times Square. We walk or take the subway to everything we want to see. The rooms are very nice, but you can still here the sirens at times in this hotel. Each room has a little fridge with free bottled water and coffee. Love that! The bathrooms are very modern and bright and the beds are so so comfortable. We have stayed here twice, but have never experienced Bar 54 on the roof nor ate in the on site restaurant, so have no advice on either.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights in a corner suite. The room was spacious and comfortable and had great view from the 41st floor. We visited the roof top bar and the service and views were excellent. We were given a complimentary late check out and the door staff arranged a great car to take us to the airport. The location for us was excellent as we had a number of theatre trips booked. If I had to be picky I would say the overall stay was very impersonal. Good thing for some, bad thing for others. I felt that it was somewhere that we were staying but we had very little interaction as a valued guest.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved our stay. Great staff and great location. Shame there’s not an eating area for kids up near top of hotel instead of on the ground floor. Quite pricey but it’s prime location but next visit I’ll defiantly stay more out from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This location is phenomenal- right in the heart of Times Square. Also, the hotel is very clean (always smelled so great as soon as we would enter off the street) It has a couple of restaurant choices (they were very good) but my favorite memory of the hotel is because of Alex DeChagas. It was my anniversary weekend and he really made me feel special. I can't say enough wonderful things about him!! And I am just an average guest- nothing special, but he went above and beyond to make sure I was happy. Thank you, Alex! I really felt valued and you are such an asset to the Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, beautiful room. Helpful front desk clerks. They stored our luggage while we toured during the day after we had checked out! Very helpful doormen who helped our Uber driver find us at the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want excellence, this the right place.You get what you pay,service is perfect, romos are more than perfect. I would like to thank all the workers there that made my New York experience exceptional. I will recommend you and i will be back as soon as i will be in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our hotel for a 3 day visit to NYC. Very well located in the theater district. Walk to Time Square and easy access to Subway! Enjoyed local restaurants. Walked or used public transportation everywhere. Clean, Safe, great staff!!! Rooftop Bar was outstanding. Complimentary water!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I went to this hotel with my family and I am very satisfied with our stay. The concierge was very helpful with any questions and they even let us keep our bags during the day after we checked out. I was very impressed with the location as well as the room itself. I have stayed at other high-end hotels in times square including the Intercontinental and the Hilton, but the Hyatt holds its own. although I personally liked the intercontinental more because it seemed more private and personalized, The Hyatt view was much better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean, modern and super friendly staff that took care of any and all or our requests. From the doorman to housekeeping all personnel did their best to make sure we were comfortable. Concierge did an awesome job of restaurant recommendations and of the various things to see and do while in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We came to NYC to celebrate my sister-in-law's 60th birthday. We figured we'd stay in the heart of Manhattan where we can experience the feel, sound, taste and smell of The Big Apple! Hyatt Centric did not disappoint! It's convenient location in Times Square allows easy access to Broadway musicals, restaurants, bars, bike rentals, Central Park, subways, and my favorite gyro cart. Most importantly, the staff at Hyatt Centric are outstanding and do their best to make your stay as pleasant, enjoyable and memorable as possible, which is what they absolutely did with ours!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just loved this location and all about Hyatt Centric. Perfect spot to stay. The room was immaculate and the complimentry water a bonus. Very comfortable bed & pillows too. The view from the roof top bar & cocktail was the icing. Thank you for making it perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here this weekend. The staff was very courteous and helpful. Nice rooms, very clean and ample space especially for NYC standards. Restaurant in lobby was good for food and drinks. Typical NYC pricing, but worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you occasionally take long weekends to NYC and are overwhelmed by the choices of where to stay, then look no further than the Hyatt Centric. If you want modern accommodations in a convenient location close to all the action and Broadway, the Centric should be your destination. We stayed there for three nights recently and were so glad we chose this first class hotel. The restaurant offered delicious breakfasts to start your day while Bar 54 offered a full array of drinks overlooking a beautiful view of the city as a perfect place for a nightcap. The staff is friendly and very helpful and made our 72 hours in the city a delight. We will return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice, clean suite, good view. Just don't buy a drink from the lobby bar lol. $70 for 2 drinks lol. But it was a good location, friendly staff and doorman were super nice. We got a really good price on a king view suite. I would recommend. With Hyatt they have standards and you know you are getting a good clean place even in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great accommodations! The front desk staff were are friendly and most helpful with suggestions and directions. Mr. DeChagas welcomed us even before we arrived, and checked up on us afterwards, thereby making us feel 'real special.' This has become my favorite place to stay when in NYC. Food: the Kale Salad is a delectable must! The extra "birthday" touches in the room were a pleasant surprise. Thank you for a perfect mini-vacation for me and my three friends!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be walking distance from all main attractions that Manhattan has to offer.The team working here were so attentive and accommodating.Our room on 34th floor had great sights over looking the lights of time square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel - definitely spend the difference to be in a Deluxe View Room. Close enough to Times Square to walk, but far enough away to not be overwhelmed. Staff was excellent the entire time! Have stayed at several properties in New York and this one has been our favorite so far!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were going through nyc but had a long time between the bus arriving and flight departing.we arrived around 4 am and there’s nothing to do for several hours , plus because of tragedy the today show had sent us an email saying that they didn’t want anyone watching their show that morning so I looked up Day use of hotel room and Hyatt was one that will let you check in a room until around 4pm for a much reduced rate a great way to check out hotel and catch a nap the only problem I had was that when I arrived the person on duty said that they charge $150.00 more for doubles than the king which was not true of course he also said that the coffee in the room was free so don’t worry about drinking it? Did he think I was ignorant?.great views though and nice upgrades

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful hotel, modern, spotless, amazing views, great bathrooms, the view from my room in floor 50 was spectacular. Great customer service! Very attentive and quick time response for everything you ask. I will stay again no doubt (and I am extremely picky)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Have stayed at the Marriott on Times Square several times, but decided to try this one for the Terrace room option. A very nice hotel, staff was very accommodating. Fantastic rooftop bar, and the staff of the lobby bar was great. Our room had an excellent view. Terrace is completely worth the $. Close walk to Broadway shows, plenty of restaurants and pubs very close by. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: excellent...they too extra care....everyone could not be more helpful they were sure all of my usual request were cared for....check in was courteous...even door man went out of his way to be sure I knew where I was going

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: SIMPLY STATED, IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR: 1) Consistent Friendly customer service 2) Attention to detail that is UNMATCHED anywhere in NYC 3) Superior Staff which knows the meaning of the word PROFESSIONALISM then...THIS IS YOUR HOTEL!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in a great location - its as close to being in Times Square as you can get. Breakfast was great each day. Service was wonderful. Bar54 has an awesome view at night . Highly recommend this hotel . My only comment was we had to ask for a top sheet only had a comforter

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms are good size with great views. The location is perfect walking distance to everything, right in Time Square! The hotel is modern, clean, and the staff was helpful and friendly. We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hello, here is one of the worst nights spent in a hotel. the room 502 is invaded by a sewage smell. I understand better why when checking in they were trying to sell me another room than the one booked. it is a shame to put on sale, online, rooms of a floor that is out of service for technical reason. I will not hesitate to comment on all networks. Flee the Hyatt's 5th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great modern hotel with great staff. From the time we got in, we had excellent service until we left. We had a luxury suite on the 45th floor and everything was great. Large bathroom, a Keurig machine, complimentary coffee and water. If you want to be close to Time Square, this is a great spot. Little sidenote, if you are going to try the rooftop bar, you may want to inquire about the prices first for a drink; a double rhum and a beer was almost $50.00.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time to new York and stayed at the Hyatt Centric which is right next to Times square. The hotel is also a 5-10 minute​ walk to the Empire state building and the Rockefeller centre, which are both worth a trip. We stayed on the 38th floor which had a great view and on the 58th floor there is a rooftop bar and restaurant with amazing views over NY, best to book a few days in advance as it can get busy especially for the outside tables. The staff were always happy to give you ideas of what to do without being pushy and always friendly. The food was OK, we only ate their once as we wanted to go to some of the other restaurants. Definitely a great hotel and location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean and very comfortable rooms. Friendly staff and what happened after I left is what really made my stay memorable. I left some valuables in the room safe and after I landed home and realized I called, I was put in touch with their assistant Director of housekeeping. She had all my valuables and within a couple of hours had shipped them to me. Courteous, profesional and caring and I felt that through all the staff I interacted with at this hotel! I would highly recvomend this hotel if you are looking for a great look cation, clean comfortable rooms and amazing, friendly and caring staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Service was top notch from the front desk to the rooftop bar. Room was impeccably clean. Location is prime and well worth it. Rooms were very quiet. Could hear sirens occasionally but that's all. Staff was friendly and helpful. Ladies ages 30-83 loved it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great customer service! Friendly and welcoming staff just a few minutes walk away from Times Square action. I would definitely stay here again. This hotel exceeded my expectations. Would recommend to anyone wanting to be close but not on top of the action.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want a quality hotel near the subway, Times Square, and Broadway shows, this hotel is it. We have stayed here twice for several days and plan on returning. My only complaints are:1. The high prices for laundry services. 2. Night lights in the room did not work. I requested they be fixed. Unfortunately that did not occur. While this is not a big issue, I would check to see if they are functioning when you first arrive in your room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is terrific. Our room was spacious, clean, comfortable AND QUIET! I couldn't believe we could be so close to Times Square and there be no traffic noise. We were on the 47th floor but I think this is a modern designed hotel with good sound insulation. The staff were terrific. A pre- and post-arrival email from Alex the Director or Operations was very personable. They learned it was a trip for my daughters 16th birthday and placed a handmade card and gift in our room. Very thoughtful indeed and really appreciated. All the staff were helpful and wonderful to talk with. The rooftop bar is also spectacular FYI. Cannot recommend this hotel more. We will definitely be back! Sarah C

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a very special trip for our family made all the more special by our stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. The service was just outstanding, even by the usual Hyatt standards. Not usually a fan of Times Square but chose due to family preferences and would choose again just for the service. I wanted a special occasion for our family after a very difficult year and we got one. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have been staying in this hotel for 2 weeks for business meeting in nyc. The overall staying is ok, room quality and such. Location wise also strategic, very near to broadway and to times square attraction. To my business meeting place also very near.As usual, i order some stuff online, amazon and such. Probably 2 or three orders. One particular order i bought from jos a bank online store delivered partially.Ok, in brief, when i checked out, the reception told me that i have to pay for package handling. The manager at checkout date 23 September 2017 time around 7 am, name Paola Cano, just told me all the information is in the website.So for all packages, each package cost you $10 dollars. I had 14 packages and the hotel charged half of them. So total handling charges cost you about 70 dollars.The thing is, these charges are ridiculous. I ve been to.new york, stayed at marriot marquis time square, the lexington hotel and they never charge you like that.What unfair is, the information wasnt informed when in the check in process, and my colleague stayed in the same hotel asked whether he could send any package to the hotel, they say yes without revealing any charges.Well that is it so i would not recommend this hotel to anyone, at all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt has a terrific location in Times Square and the prices are very good if you shop it online. The rooms are in need of freshening up. The carpet in my executive suite should have been replaced long ago but this place is still a good value and you can walk to Broadway theaters, hundreds of restaurants including restaurant row, and the subway station at Times Sq. Is 2 blocks away. The standard room and the junior and executive suites are all good sizes and large for NYC. The things that bother me are the refrigerator is not really a fridge it is a cooler and does not get cold. Why even bother and why be so cheap as to not give me a fridge in a suite? The other is that this is yet another hotel that does not use top bed sheets, instead they give you a duvet. The duvet is to hot and heavy, why no sheet?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: as title suggests we were well looked after by the staff who could not do enough for us! the hotel location is superb just a couple of minutes walk from Times Square and very easy for the subway.. also convenient for most of Manhattan's attractions.I would recommend to anyone anting a stay near Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square is an outstanding property with amazing views of TS and downtown Manhattan. The rooftop bar is one of if not the highest rooftop bars in Manhattan, and is awesome. The hotel rooms are excellent, the housekeeping top notch, and the linens were devine. Highly recommend this property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a very modern hotel located conveniently in the heart of times square.The best value at the time of booking. However, there was no personalised service. Maybe this is to be expected in New York? It is walking distance to all of the theatres, attractions and restaurants in times square. The rooms cannot be faulted, very new and spacious for a family of four. However, our experience with the staff wasn't very great. At check in we waited forty-five minutes for suitcases until my husband decided to go down and get them himself. We were charged more than quoted on our airport transfer and the hotel never returned our calls nor replied to our complaints which I found very unprofessional. Also, every time we entered the hotel we were asked to show our room card, unlike many other local guests who were allowed to walk through. We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and the same bell man could not recognise us even on our last day. We had breakfast one morning in the joining restaurant, which I found very overly price for the quality of food. 120 USD for two adults and two children. Overall, great choice, just purely based on location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Never had a hotel manager ask by email how everything was going. Any questions or needs promptly solved. Outstanding. High floor room was small but nice. Rain shower and bedding great. Room location was very quiet, only a block from Broadway!Would like to see key entry to elevator for added security.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff, accommodations, food and beverage, location are all excellent. As a woman traveling on my own, I felt welcome, safe, and well-cared for during my 5 day stay. The bar on the 54th floor has a spectacular view and a good light menu.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hard beds that didn't have extra blankets in the room and called room service and they were out. Took a long time to check even with being a Hyatt member. Also they jacked up the price because of UN meeting typical corporate price gouging. No lobby to sit and wait in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here recently on business. Just off Times Square so pretty convenient for theater and usual tourist stuff. Check in staff were friendly and helpful and rooms are modern and definitely on the large side for NYC. Would definitely return and would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for a Saturday and Sunday night, Check in was very fast, receptionist was friendly and helpful, room was on the 44th floor and we were very satisfied with the accommodations. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, standard size for a New York hotel, room attendant was friendly and did an excellent job. Great location, central to everything. Room prices for hotels for the weekend we stayed were high because of a lot of activities were going on in the city but we got a good deal here. Would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right in the center of Times Square. Room was a little small but very clean. Staff was accommodating to our needs. Check in and out was a breeze. Lots of restaurants nearby and the hotel has a restaurant that is good for drinks and snacks, and small meals.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I like to visit NY city but when I get back home I have put my credit card to bed for a bit... This is not an inexpensive hotel but can tell you its a great place to stay for a few days. The location is perfict at Time Square and you can walk to anything. The hotel is clean, nice rooms and the roof top bar is great. Breakfast is real nice and the little bar on the outside is great to just sit and watch the people. Lots of places to stay in the city but why pay for a cab when you are in all the action.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would absolutely stay here again! It's such a nice hotel, especially for NYC. Some hotels in NYC are super small - this is not one of them. The decor is modern and definitely geared toward millennials, which is not a bad thing. Especially since that means there are plenty of outlets for charging phones, laptops, etc.! I thought the rooftop bar was really neat but it was foggy the night we could go up there, so if you have a clear night, you are in for something special. I can't recommend this hotel enough and look forward to my next visit!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square with three best friends, during New York Fashion Week. We have stayed other places in previous years, but after this experience, plan to always come back and stay HERE. Whether you're coming to visit with a group, or alone, here are some of the highlights & perks we loved about this excellent hotel:1. The SIZE! Wow, right off the bat every person who walked in the room said "This is massive, especially for New York!" At over 300 square feet, there was more than enough space in our two-queen-bed room for four women, all our suitcases, extra furniture like chairs and footstools, etc., and rushing around each other to get ready in the morning. There was also a huge double-door closet for all our dresses and shoes.2. The bathroom! Full sized soaking tub, separate huge shower, and a sink & counter area with room-wide mirror made getting gussied up a breeze. All four of us were able to do hair & makeup at the same time, with plenty of elbow room! 3. Location! We were literally a half-block from the heart of Times Square, which meant all the shopping, dining, transportation, and sightseeing we wanted to do was just a 1-minute walk away. This was hands-down the most convenient hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC! From the 41st floor we were able to hear some street noise, but it never kept us from sleep. Only once were we bothered by excessive noise, and it was by a bagpipe parade happening right in front of the hotel, so we just went downstairs and joined in!4. Views! I'm from Boise, Idaho, where our tallest building is only 18 stories, so I looooove rooms with beautiful views and rooftop bars. This Hyatt Centric has both of these things! Our room overlooked beautiful high-rise scenery, and the rooftop Bar 54 was simply the most gorgeous place to hang out in NYC. <3 5. The service! From the moment we arrived, this hotel's staff bent over backwards to make our stay wonderful, from fresh flowers in the room to bringing non-down pillows late at night for our allergy sufferer to sleep peacefully on. None of our crew had any complaints about hotel staff; every person we encountered was kind and professional, and always happy to fulfill any need we requested. They made us feel like family!6. Condition! Some hotels in New York are old. Some have been renovated, but you can still feel their past. The Hyatt Centric Times Square felt fresh and new, in every aspect, from pristine rooms to the hotel's high-tech look. We saw no mold, dirt, or wear & tear throughout our stay.Cons: Only two! I would recommend fans in the bathrooms, to help with shower steam. Also, some breakfast options would be much appreciated, even if it was just a granola bar and juice. We would have happily paid for room service breakfast options. XOXO Hyatt Centric Times Square & all your crew! We loved our time with you, and will be back again soon! <3

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I do get to New York quite a lot and have made Hyatt Centric my default hotel booking. Everything is easy and high standard. Check in is swift, small but normally chaos free reception area. Rooms have great beds and facilities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in the deluxe suite. The room was much larger than what you would expect in this area of the city. The room was clean, neat and seemed very new. Lots of electrical outlets. Modern, intelligent light switches, large flat panel, hidef TVs. Great views of the city. Very comfortable bed. Clean, modern lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I cant express how happy I was with this hotel. The rooms are very nice, but It's NYC, so I dont spend that much time in the room. What really stands out is the excelent customer service that this hotel provides. From the front line to the General Manager, they saw to every need and then some. I went for my daughter's 8th birthday and our anniversary. They went ABOVE and BEYOND my wildest espectations in order to make the weekend PERFECT. I will book nowhere else but the Hyatt Centric NY in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric is a brand new hotel located at Times Square. Clean rooms, good size and silent building although near to an extremely noise area.Rooftop opens at 4pm and give you good chances to shoot Instagram pictures from the top, looking up or down as mines :)Recommended for young and business people while there are better options for families with children.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great room with wonderful views. A must see is the view from Bar 54, just be prepared to spend over $25 for a cocktail, but worth it.Staff was pleasant upon check in, which was a first in a long time for me at Hyatt. The restaurant on ground level, T45, also very good for a cappuccino or latte. If you are staying in New York for the theater or just the experience, this is the hotel to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family of 4 stayed here in September. We booked this hotel very last minute as we were evacuating for Hurricane Irma. We planned to go to the US Open Finals and wanted to be near the 7 line. This hotel fit the bill. They also have 2 queen bed rooms while many NYC hotels have 2 doubles. The room was spacious and comfortable. Our flights home got cancelled several times due to the hurricane and we had to extend our stay. The rate was much higher for the extra nights than what we had booked. The management was able to work with us to give us a better rate which we greatly appreciated. We were able to see a bit of Times Square from our room on the 20th floor. They do offer a free family tour that we did at 10:30am to see the views from the top floor from their bar.The lobby is a little small and can get crowded. There is security standing near the elevators to check for room keys - which is nice. We would stay here again if we found a good rate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is just a few meters from Times Square. It is kind of awkward that the lobby is very small with almost no sitting area. There is only one restaurant, T45, and I recommend to avoid. I do not know about its drinks, but the food was not good. The room was at the 52nd floor with incredible views to the city. It was no very big, but enough for us and with a good bathroom and shower. The staff was very friendly at the lobby, housekeeping, security and room service. I am not 100% that I will book again this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square in September 2017. I was traveling for business and attended meetings I. The hotel as well. Everything was outstanding. I was greeted at the front desk with kindness and the front desk Associate was very helpful answering several questions. The room was clean and spacious. I loved the rain shower and the beds were very comfortable. The TV had many options, appreciated the free wifi and loved the huge windows! Our meeting rooms were also nice. The food at our meetings was delicious and unique. The wait staff serving the food/cleaning up were very kind and helpful and kept everything clean and tidy. The terrace on the 2nd floor is a great space! The hotel generously held our bags as we toured the night of our checkout. The only thing I wish were different is extended room service hours. I believe room service ended at 11pm, but a couple nights I would've loved a later in-room meal after a long night out. I also never located a vending machine. But overall an excellent stay and would recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first time to NYC and we wanted to be close to the Broadway shows. The prices for hotels in this area are high and I've read that most rooms are very small. Ours seemed like a normal size hotel room you would find anywhere in America. The bathroom was large too with plenty of shelf space. The room was always clean when we came back. The carpet looked a bit old, but felt fine under our feet. The shower was definitely low pressure, but had a removable sprayer so that helped. The hotel staff was always nice, friendly, and accommodating. I requested a quiet room and received it. The black-out curtains were fabulous! The view from the 37th floor facing 46th St and uptown was not so great. But from the rooftop 54th floor facing downtown was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Almost perfect stay, although the bed sheets had stains on when we arrived. Nice spacious modern rooms. Great views and conveniently situated right in Times Square. Has an amazing roof top bar which has great views and is buzzing. All of the staff extremely friendly except one who was extremely rude and patronising - quite frankly he let down the entire hotel. Otherwise great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed this hotel during our recent visit to New York City and more specifically to time square in the theatre district. The hotel was very convenient and the staff one out of their way to ensure we enjoyed our stay with them.  When we had arrived we had only put the tennis open and the concierge was able to fill in some of our free time with the theatre productions we were hoping to see plus some additional recommendations.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed here to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. The GM reached out to me before we arrived and asked if there was anything he could do to make or stay more special. I told him we where celebrating our anniversary and he upgraded our room and had Champagne and Roses waiting for us. The hotel itself has a decent amount of wear and tear on it but it's central location in Times Square is great for seeing the city. The roof top bar is great for a cocktail. I am a Hyatt member and opted for an advanced check in, however, when I arrived it meant nothing, I had to wait anyway and go through the tedious chdkcmin process at the front desk which took a good 10 minutes. Overall a pleasant stay, I would recommend if you want a central location, but it does get crazy as soon as you step outside.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently visited with three girl friends to attend shows at New York Fashion Week for a weekend in September. We shared a two-queen bed room, and were blown away by the room size! Having visited NYC before, we were expecting tight quarters, but at over 300 sq ft our room felt massive. We LOVED the huge bathroom as well, with shower, soaking tub, and a room-long horizontal mirror for hair & makeup! There was so much space in there, we never had to fight over bathroom/getting ready time! The staff at this hotel was also top-notch, with every person we encountered going above & beyond to make our stay amazing. Alexander, Abigail, Ben: you're fabulous! Thank you for your care & attention! Two quick things to note, that might be a concern for some: This hotel is a half-block from the center of Times Square, so no matter what floor you are on there is bound to be some street noise. It's not terrible by any means, and never once interrupted our sleep (Except for a bagpipe parade one Saturday morning! But we just got up and went down to enjoy it.) So sound might be a small issue for some very light sleepers. However, the advantage of being so close to Times Square means E V E R Y T H I N G is at your fingertips; food, drinks, shopping, entertainment, shows, and transportation! Our fashionista group adored this hotel, and we plan to be back again year after year. BEST place to stay in New York City, hands-down.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed there Labor Day weekend and our activities included Broadway shows, Yankee baseball game and the US Open. You are literally a few steps away from the show "The Play That Went Wrong" and a short walk to may other shows. Very close to subway way station for the number 7 train to Queens for the US Open and short walk to catch D train to Yankee Stadium.We ate at Irish Pub right next to the hotel and it was very good and reasonable, especially for New York.Our room was very nice with modern decor. Plenty of room and very comfortable beds. Large screen TV and free Wi-Fi. Room was cleaned every day of our stay very early and we had no issues. Front desk was very nice and helpful with holding bags, subway directions and getting taxi to airport. Only problem our entire stay was our safe did not work and did not get fixed before we left.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My stay was excellent. Staff was great, hotel clean, and the location was good. I didn't eat any food. The roof top bar is lovely. The closet was small, but I was able to use the drawers. My view at night was lovely. I had a great trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The assistant manager was very nice to us, we were upgraded and a wonderful flower arrangement in our room due to it being my moms 80 birthday trip.The manager also checked in with us while we were there. The hotel was spotless, the staff incredible and the location perfect. This was the best place I have stayed in NYC.Go up to the rooftop bar, it's amazing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is great but there are better hotels within the same location offering a better standard of accommodation. We traveled from the UK and we tried to check out within a few hours but the other hotels were already booked.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: as far as where the hotel was situated this place could not be better. literally 1 minute walk from time square , were you'll find classic hot dog stands theater shows and of course shopping , tucked in between two Irish bars, one of which is called pub connollys which are fantastic places tp eat and much much cheaper than the hotel.i understand you pay for ypur location but the bar in this hotel is horrendously expensive. fantastic views from the roof top bar called b54 as its on the 54th floor, 3 cocktails cost me nearly 90 dollars !!!so advise you to go out have a meal and a few drinks then just finish the night off on the roof.rooms where ok , bit basic but bathroom very modern and clean even though our room was not cleaned after the first day and we had to remind them of this .staff not very friendly just clinical and officiant .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: No flat sheets on the bed so how often are comforters changed and cleaned? Would have thought Hyatt could afford flat sheet. Security guys or guys who check to see if you have a room key are rude and unhelpful if you ask them a question. Also no concierge. Shower was awesome and room overall clean and large.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is a Must modern and very friendly staff, our stay was only for two nights but we enjoyed every second, the staff were experinced in dealing with gusts and were very professional, the cost of the accommodation was reasonably fair.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As first time visitors to NYC we could not fault this hotel or the staff, absolutely excellent ! Superb location (despite very close proximity to Times Square, we could not hear any noise once in the hotel ) friendly staff (especially Ritchie, Jeff on reception and Betty our housekeeper) good facilities, upgraded room due to our Silver Wedding and duration of our stay (room 2506 corner room) along with credit on the bill.
