Good sized room for family of 4 (two adults and two teens) probably the comfiest beds we have slept in, great bathroom, mini fridge, safe, excellent hairdryer and coffee machine,great list of complimentary items if forgotten/ required, iron and ironing board in one of the two wardrobes.Small gym which my daughters used on a couple of occasions. Roof top bar is amazing though a little pricey for regular use. We didn't eat in the hotel though this was just down to personal choice and itinerary, the bistro always looked popular. We stayed 11 nights and wished that we could have stayed longer, and would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to anyone interested in visiting New York. Thank you to all those who contributed to our wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a good location if you are going to Broadway. That's about the best I can say for it. The lobby is jammed with people...the check in line is long...the street has trash all over...the music in restaurants is ear deafening...and the value for what you get is way overrated. Rooms are average...clean and quiet...but no real sheets...so you have to keep the room freezing in order not to melt under the comforter. The shower leaked all over the floor, and the tv had to reload every time you turned it on. But, the room was quiet and sound proof...the elevator was really fast. The concierge gave us a really bad dinner recommendation...but the doormen were very nice. I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it. Rooms are pretty small! I would say it was not a good value for the amount of money it cost.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I found the hotel to be clean, the staff friendly, professional, and helpful. I would have preferred they did not have a short "extended" check out time. Makes it a challenge if you have a later afternoon early evening flight. \

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location. Close to great restraunts & theatres. The rooms are lovely. Staff is very helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. NY is beyond exhausting, so having a comfortable room to relax in is a must.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want to stay near Times Square, this is a good choice. Everything is walking distance. There is a pretty good restaurant in the hotel for those times you don't want to go out. Services were very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is excellent, the high floor deluxe room facing the south is perfect. Bathtub and shower and a great bed with skyscrapers as your only point of view. Amazing! Here, it is soundproof!Of course, you're in NYC, don't expect to be able to forget earplugs for the night if you love quiet places but it is fantastic regarding other hotels here in Manhattan. I spoke several times with Alex, director of operations. This gentleman is a real must for the hotel. He wants you to be well and to enjoy your stay. One only sorrow, no real lobby. Nothing friendly and welcoming to chat and have some drink with friends. I'll be back again and again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The friendly, efficient staff at the Hyatt Centric alone would've made this a wonderful stay but the hotel itself was better than I expected being so close to Times Square (half block). We had rooms on floors 18 (suite) & 20 (basic king) and both rooms were fairly spacious, as were the showers but only one sink in bathroom. From these levels, there were nice views of the Paramount bldg., especially at night. Beds were comfortable & I liked the soft pillows. In the suite for my friends, they came up to open the pull out couch. Unless the windows were open, the noise was minimal. We had food & drinks at both the restaurant downstairs and at the Sky Lounge - of course, high hotel prices but the only disappointing meals were at breakfast - definitely find somewhere else, if possible. We were able to walk to 2 evening shows off Times Sq and found it easy to grab taxis to go to other parts of town. We really enjoyed the Sky Lounge both in the late afternoon and after getting home. Great views and high above the noise & lights of Times Sq. Again, most impressed by the staff and especially appreciated that no one could go to elevators without showing their key card. For outsiders to go to Sky Lounge, they needed to check in. - this extra bit of security is appreciated given the location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Convenient location, clean and nice room... except its faulty lightening system. The engineer says he can't fix it, so the reception kindly offers me another room... only if I accept a downgrade, because "the hotel is full".Now, that's what I call a choice : keep a room with a faulty lighting system, or accept a downgrade (for the same price) Seriously !? Is that the Hyatt standard ?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a nice hotel, good staff and location. it would be 5 stars if not let down by a few things. These being... the hotel makes you pay them $500 upon checking for them to hold incase you use any of their services. This has cost me a lot of money in international payment fees to transfer the money too and from America. Our room had noises aircon and the Sky Lounge above it could occasionybe heard but only occasionally when chairs were moved. Parts of the bathroom (shower area) looked dowdy and tired. Other than this, it was excellent in every way. Despite the noise, we were comfortable and staff were nice. The Sky Lounge prices were a joke, way too high, this put us off using the facilities in the rest of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent place to stay and explore NYC. Staff pay attention to detail and make ones stay personable. Great central location to be able to explore Manhattan. Very good value, well kept, very clean, great views of the city. Overall, best NYC hotel experience we've had to date

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's all about location and this hotel is perfect. Right at the heart of Times Square! The rooms are clean and well maintain by their friendly housekeeping. Staff were great! Definitely will come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for the US Open last week and had a great time. The hotel was a walking distance from the Times Square and that was great. The hotel staffs were very nice and accommodating. We plan to go back to the hotel when we visit again. (The sleep quality - I prefer hard pillows and that's just my preference. If you like soft pillows, you will like them)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great family trip beds were comfy, pillows great in room coffee maker made it great in the morning bathroom was spacious and for a new york room, this is one of the largest I've ever been in, and i was in a family of 4

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Being recommended this hotel by friends, we decided to try it being the fist time in New York. Apart from the rather slow transfer from JFK, once arrived found the hotel to be a very pleasant and calming experience compared the mayhem that is "Times Square" - especially at night. The location is great to see this part of New York and get to Central Park, but make sure you don't miss out on Downtown. Staff are great, rooms are nice and I can imagine the "high floor" (35+) ones overlooking Times Square to be something special. Looking forward to going back, but possibly staying in another district and experience something different at night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a wonderful 3rd stay at the Hyatt Centric. It is located conveniently to Time Square, Theatre District, shopping and great dinning. The hotel has update the restaurant and bar and the roof top bar view is amazing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent Hotel. Nice Views. Very Professional and Considerate Staff. Good Value. Really convenient to the theatres, but in the middle of 45th street so all the noise and crowds of times square are down the block

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel perfect location staff awesome will most definitely tell relatives and friend most try this hotel will not let you down will be back to Hyatt Centric Hotel your 54th floor bar is awesome very satisfied

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great, clean hotel. Friendly staff and amazing views!! Definitely worth the money to get a higher room. Ours ended up being on the 53rd floor. Could see Time Square, the river, the Freedom Tower, and pretty much everything in between. Staying right in the heart of NYC means you're close to everything! Theaters, restaurants, shopping, and just a short walk away is Central Park!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location if you're in town for a show. Typical great service on all fronts. Stayed on the 45th floor so we had awesome views. Also checked out the 54th floor roof top bar and wow, what a view from there. When I travel, first class service is what I value the most and this Hyatt came through.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights and everything was perfect. Staff are super lovely. We ordered room service a couple of times food is great and not bad priced too. The rooms are big we had a great view of north manhatten looking onto Rockefeller building. I like the extra security put in place at the lifts and front entrance sadly in this day its needed and it made me feel very safe. Only complaint which is nothing to do with the hotel is you have to walk through times square to get anywhere and its very bottle necked and busy this started to become annoying it gets much busier at night. Would most definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, all the amenities, and the staff is so accommodating! The Bar on the 54th floor is an amazing spot also. Heated bathroom floor was a bonus...and stay on the higher floors to get the best view. Loved this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of the best Hotels. Service was incredible. Staff was amazing. You cant ask for more. My rating from 1-5 stars would be 10. If you want to be treated great, stay at this Hyatt. Can't say enough about it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we had to change our plans last minute for labor day weekend and decided to stay over night in nyc. since we were seeing a show, we wanted to be in the area of the theatre district. based on reviews, we chose the hyatt centric and i am so glad we did. it's tucked just feet from times square but you wouldn't know it. it's cute and quaint but the rooms are nice and the staff is even nicer from the moment you get there. even the bellman, who had to walk us around the block to our car because of a parade, was just simply lovely. honestly, i was hesitant because we stayed at another nyc hyatt property over memorial day, but this is a 180 degree difference from that property. i am already plotting my return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We travel to NYC 2-3 times a year for Broadway Shows and have done so for several years. This has given us the opportunity to try out numerous hotels throughout the City. The Centric is the PERFECT combination for us........close to Times Square, yet not in the middle of the craziness AND its beautiful, clean, has large rooms with floor to ceiling windows, super comfy beds, lovely bathroom, quick elevators, great security..... and all with a calm, quiet boutique feel to it! To top that off, Management could not have been any better! We were checked in early and received emails asking if we needed anything during our visit. When booking, I mentioned we were celebrating a Birthday and within 15 minutes after arrival, we were presented with a package of the most scrumptous assortment of brownies ever! Cannot wait to return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first trip back to New York in well over a decade, having lived their in my grad school days and early career. This time I brought my two boys with me, one in grade school and the other about to start high school. The six-day trip was important to me since it would be the first introduction for my kids to one of my favourite places in the world.There are many hotel choices in NYC but getting the best in location, room size, service and comfort/cleanliness usually involves a steep price premium. I was a little worried about where my kids and I would end up given the budget I had imposed on myself. I needn't have worried. I travel a great deal for work, usually of the Hilton and Marriott variety, and thought that it would be difficult to be surprised by a hotel choice. The Hyatt Centric surprised me on many levels. As others have noted, the location is exceptional being near Times Square but just distant enough to serve as a respite from the frenetic pace of the city. The rooms are very large by NYC standards. This meant more to me as I got deeper into the stay with two active kids. The decor was modern yet warm while the linens made it hard to get up in the morning. New bottles of water appeared every day and the toiletries had a wonderful mango coconut scent. WiFi speed was top notch and the business centre let me print my boarding passes and Broadway tickets. We had breakfast every morning at T45 and these meals were among the most memorable of our culinary experiences in the city; not an easy feat with the roster of restaurants that they were up against.There were other little things that impressed me; having to show my key card to security before getting on the elevator, the morning family tour of the 54th floor viewing deck of Bar 54 and the staff that were always smiling.However, the big surprise was the welcome e-mail from the Director of Operations, Alexander Dechagas. The e-mail wasn't a surprise since many of us get these automated messages as a standard operating procedure. The surprise was when I responded to the first e-mail and asked whether some preferences could be accommodated. Not only was I generously accommodated but Alexander checked-in with me during and after the stay. It was above and beyond and this alone will assure my return to Hyatt Centric.There are a lot of great places to stay in NYC and I've stayed at many of them, from the Waldorf Astoria to the Marriott Times Square. But for me, my next stay will be at the Hyatt Centric, my new home in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was really perfect, with great location. We had a room in 35th floor with a view on Times Square. Absolutely stunning. Besides the great view, the room itself was of very good standard. Fresh, big bathroom, and in general a clean and nice hotelroom. The food here was also very good, and I can't miss to mention the great view from the rooftop bar here. Would highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I liked the hotel location, the room and the gym. The restaurant in the hotel did not have gluten-free options so I was disappointed about that. I liked the complimentary water and coffee, I thought that was a nice touch

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Chose this hotel because it offered two queen beds, a rarity in New York City. So glad I did! The room was lovely. Generously sized, modern bathroom, very clean. Heat/air conditioning worked very well and was quiet. Payed for a high floor so we wouldn't have any street noise. The noise insulation between the rooms must be great, because we heard absolutely nothing from the rooms next-door. The only negative about the room is that the lighting in the bathroom is quite dark. If I were bothering to apply make up, it would be a challenge.The hotel is very tall and narrow. Over 50 floors, with only about 10 rooms on each floor. There is a rooftop bar with an outdoor terrace for adults. For families with kids they offer escorted trips to the roof at 10:30 in the morning each day. I took advantage, since I was traveling with my two teenagers. Nice views and phot op. Staff was very courteous, and check in and check out was quick and easy. Traveling mid week, checking out at about three in the afternoon, I waited about 10 minutes to get my car from the valet. Not bad! Would definitely stay here again! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is great from the staff to the clean rooms and the great food! But it's the little things that take it to the next level the personal interactions with the GM Philip. Last time I stayed it was really raining and I needed to walk to get cab as traffic was nuts. The doorman offered me an umbrella but I said I was not returning and he said "that's ok just take it". That's service, so cool.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I write this review with mixed feelings; we had an incredible visit to NY. We wanted to stay in the heart of everything and this hotel definitely ticks that box; in fact we underestimated how busy this hotel would be! Check in took a while due to it being so busy and it was clear the staff were feeling the stress since we didn't even get a smile! Our deluxe view room on the 35th floor was great but I did feel it was overpriced; we've stayed just around the corner for much less in the past; the additional taxes added each night are a real sting in the tail when you get your bill. All this was minor though to the fact we had items taken from our room! The hotel, after initially seeming quite blasé about this, did take us seriously after the second complaint and promised an investigation; hopefully they have found the culprit and held them to account by now. We were pleased that they did their best to replace what was taken yet it hampered our stay immensely; we've travelled lots and have never had this happen before. We will most definitely not be returning to this hotel on our next visit; the stunning rooftop bar, amazing smelling lobby and immaculate surroundings mean nothing if you're worried about the belongings in your room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location! Close to everything. We were able to walk to the theaters each night rather than take a cab. Even though Times Square is very crowded it is entertaining! I wouldn't consider any other hotel in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: On our recent visit to New York my family and friends stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for five nights. The hotels location is perfect, you are a one minute walk to the amazing Times Square. I believe the hotel has had a recent major refurbishment and you can see this, everything looks very new and modern. The entire hotel, halls, rooms, lifts, bar, reception area etc are all spotlessly clean and look new. We stayed in top floor rooms with views of the city through floor to ceiling windows. Theses rooms and their amazing views are well worth paying the extra. The service we received from all the staff was excellent. Overall a fairly modern hotel with excellent staff and excellent location, recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked this on priiceline at a fantastic rate, so I figured let's give it a try, the hotel is centrally located, we were created by valet parking and checked into our standard room within minutes, the room is small, but doesn't feel that way, king bed, mini fridge, free coffee and tea,safe well designed and laid out, the bathroom was very modern and the view was nice. They also held my luggage and provided umbrellas, I enjoyed my stay, thank you!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Don't even know where to begin. This place was great. Took care of the 2 problems i had. Would have no problem staying here again when we go back with family in the future. The staff and management took care of everything when a problem arose.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed staying at the Hyatt which was perfectly situated close to Times Square and within easy reach of attractions Our room was lovely clean and spacious We were made to feel extremely welcome and enjoyed the surprise of champagne and brownies as we were in New York to celebrate milestone birthdays

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We appreciated more the location than the hotel itself. You are litteraly 3 to 5mn walk from Times Square and can reach out to all the strategic areas of NYC from there quite easily. We were walking all the way to Central Park from there throught the main avenues and city highlights. It's convenient to visit NYC walking or by subway. If you intend to use Taxis don't stay there, to get in and out it's absolutely horrible (Many Uber drivers canceled the booking on us due to traffic).The reception staff and the doormen were really polite. The restaurant / café inside the hotel premises though is very average, we were surprised by the level of service we were getting by one of the waiters (No smile, lack of responsiveness), and the choice of food and beverages is limited there, so you definitemy need to get out of the Hotel for dining.One annoying thing was the lift system, they were taking long to come (Indeed there many floors) but whith toddlers to manage and strollers and sometimes shopping all together after a long day outside, waiting several minutes to get the lift is not ideal.Ask for a room with a Times Square View, this is to me the main advantage besides its location of this Hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've visited NYC 3 times now and this was my first high rise hotel I stayed in! I really liked it. The room had 2 double beds but was not very big for a family of 4 adults, not compared to the rooms we had stayed in in DC and Philadelphia! No sitting area, no room for suitcases etc. The bathroom was nice and big. Rooftop bar was lovely and the staff in there were very friendly! Check in was not good at all, we arrived after official check in time to be told that our room "wasn't ready". I do not understand how this is the case when it was after the check in time that they advertise, we had a river cruise booked for 7.30pm so couldn't wait too long, we told them this and they said it would not be long. 1 hour later we returned to the check in desk to see how much longer to be told again, not ready and wouldn't be much longer, and that they were giving us a "nicer room". We were told another room was available and the lady smirked when asked if it was also a "nicer room"? She said it was a higher floor? So in the end we took that room as we were already late to start getting ready and needed to soon, so we will never know what this apparently "nicer room" was. Other than that we had no issues, the doormen were lovely and very helpful, especially getting us a taxi to the airport on our way home. Would probably not return if we visit NYC again, but only because we like to try different hotels in different areas. The location was very close to times square, less than 5 minute walk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff: Friendly, approachable, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Hotel also provides Concierge services.Cleanliness: as soon as you enter the room you notice clean white bedsheets and pillows. Room/Bathroom: We stayed on 34th floor (aka "high floor"). The bathroom is practical with plenty of towels. The complimentary water bottles are free.Location: less than a minute walk from Times Square!!!! It is less than 20 min drive from Battery Park, Central Park, Grand Central Terminal and Empire State Building!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff at the Hyatt Centric Times Square are quite exceptional. From contact before our arrival through check out, the staff provided exceptional customer service. The rooms are modern and clean. The hotel provides complimentary water and umbrellas (this was very nice). Couldn't be more pleased with a hotel. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is modern clean and comfortable. The bed is a little firmer than I like but the rest makes up for it. They give you free water bottles every day which in this area saves you a fortune. You are two blocks from Times Square. The light switch is very cool and is lit up at night all over the room to push one button to turn on or off all the lights or make it mood lighting in the room. The bathroom is nice but the shower doesn't have good water pressure. The concierge is great and the person who greets you at the door (I didn't get her name today but she also helped with speeding up elevator lines). My advice is if you go two to five blocks out of the tourist area there's tons of amazing restaurants at better prices and quality. We used Yelp to find good local eats. Roof top is a cool night view but wish they had a cheese plate and better apps.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've stayed here before but this was the 1st time since it turned in to a Centric and I must say I didn't notice a difference. It's a very nice hotel in a great location, good, friendly service and at least when I stayed there very reasonable price. Breakfast is very good and they have a nice little rooftop bar with some outdoor seating and great views. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is a gem of a small hotel brilliantly located near Times Square and the theater district. Their accomodations were fresh and contemporary and we received personalized service above and beyond many fine hotels. Our thanks to Alex and his staff for creating a sanctuary in the wonderful madness of NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern hotel only half a block from the center of Times Square. Building is a tall, skinny design with 54 floors. Restaurant is adjacent to the lobby and a bar with a fantastic view of the city is on the top floor. Food and drink prices are highly inflated for both, but the food is good and the view at the top is worth it. Room was comfortable and offered a nice view of Times Square. Staff was professional and very attentive to any issues. Appreciated the complimentary bottled water for elite members. Security guards verify room keys for folks entering the hotel after dark, so no need to be concerned about safety. We found it to be the perfect location for exploring NYC and would definitely stay here again. *Note: There's also a spa and gym in the hotel, though we didn't visit either.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for business, it was my third stay and each time I've come to truly appreciate the property, its ideal location, the reasonably well-maintained property and the very friendly staff. Would recommend it to anyone looking for those qualities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've stayed in hundreds over hotels over the years and very few beat this when it comes to customer service. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, from the girls on check in, to the fantastic waiter in the restaurant, the concierge etc The rooms were really good, well stocked for a traveller and clean. I was really impressed with this Hyatt hotel and recommend any family going to NYC for a weekend to stay here. It's about 100 meters from Times Square, so perfect location for us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, very comfortable, good location right in the middle of Times Square so we were in walking distance to almost everything. The restaurant/breakfast buffet was just ok and over priced. The drinks at the bar were great and the atmosphere was perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Thanks so much for our great stay. Would give this hotel more than 5 stars if I could. It should be a 5 star hotel. Amazing staff, the most friendly people I met in NY (and that says a lot!), and thanks Alexander (Operations) for being so attentive. Of course the hotel has a top location, and amazing city views from the room. The room is a perfect example of how you can do the most with limited NY space: amazing beds (which cured my back), free additional bed for our daughter, wonderful luxury bathroom, great airco, nice big TV, fridge, safe, charging station including European adapter. Super comfortable stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with my sister and overall was a good experience. Food quality was not too bad, but not good either. We tried avoiding eating at the hotel as much as possible. Location was great. Very close to Times Square and we easily walked from hotel to sight see at museums, Empire State, some shopping at fifth avenue and even to grand central station. It's also very close to a subway terminal, which made it convenient. Only bad thing was the noise at late hours of the night from trash pickup trucks, police and/or ambulance sirens from the street. It is New York after all. I've been to other cities, but this is one of he first times normal city street noise actually kept me up. I think maybe the building isn't as sound-proofed as other hotels I've stayed at. We ended up asking to get moved to a higher floor and they were nice enough to accommodate us. All would've been well except the new room they moved us to seemed like the reject room. Broken vanity mirror and the sink was slow draining. I can only assume it's partially clogged. A little disappointing because I offered to pay to get moved to a higher floor. They moved us as a courtesy without extra charges, but it became very obvious right away as of why no extra charge. But on the bright side, it was a lot quieter and we got better sleep. I also had a chance to use the spa. Had a little hiccup at check-in when guy over-charged me right off the bat for my spa services. They like to make guests prepay before their massage. Also massage therapist didn't do it firm enough. If someone doesn't do the massage with firm enough pressure, then it just becomes uncomfortable because it's tickling at times. I wanted to relax and not get tickled. They also said that they'd have the steam room running when I get done with my massage, but that wasn't the case...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Oh, I love this hotel. My room was big for NYC, check-in staff were courteous and the maid was INCREDIBLY helpful, assisting me with my bags for no reason, fetching ice without request - I was bowled over. The hotel cost more than I typically spend and I could see why and it was worth it. However: it was a sweltering August day and I wasn't in the best health. When I arrived I was purple in colour and dripping with sweat (nice. also probably why maid took pity on me). I could not wait to shower and blast the AC, I was dreaming of AC. But the AC unit will not go below 67 F. I'm a warm-blooded person at the best of times. Also, sometimes I need to dress clients in heavy costumes and wigs - 67 would be too warm on a normal spring or summer day. Certainly when humidity is in the 80's a cold shower does nothing to cool you if you get out and start sweating again. I can understand the reasoning behind this but I just do need cooler options, if only for 15 minute blasts. I called reception and their suggestion was to send up a fan. I eagerly accepted but it never arrived. Secondly, the bathroom is beautiful with a rainforest showerhead and perfectly polished shiny floor!! -....!! The bath mat isn't close to big enough for this lovely design feature and despite precautions I went flying and badly hurt myself. I'm pretty clumsy and I love how stylish the floor is but bigger bath mats please, for the sake of health & safety!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in the heart of Manhattan and it is right near everywhere. All of the shopping and food places are around the corner. The staff was really nice and the rooms were very elegant and clean. Anytime we asked for something, it came up or was immediately replaced, like dirty towels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed for just one night on 4/18/17, because I was going to an early event in the Times Square area and didn't want to get up early to take the train to NYC from Philly. I liked everything about the hotel. It's in Times Square near the theater district, it's a 15 minute walk from Penn Station, it's modern, clean, and the staff is friendly and attentive. I signed up for the World of Hyatt membership to take advantage of preferred rates. A day before my arrival I received an email from hotel management welcoming me. The morning of my impending arrival I received an email asking if I wanted to upgrade my room at no extra charge. However I declined the offer, because I was traveling with my daughter and we wanted to sleep in separate queen beds as originally planned. The upgrade offered one king bed and one sofa bed. The front desk staff was friendly and check-in was fast. The only comment about check-in I have was I reserved 2 queen beds, high floor and the front desk agent assigned me to a room on the 22nd floor. I questioned if that was a high floor and she said this is what your reservation is for. I pulled out my confirmation paper to show her I had a high floor , 2 queen beds reserved. She said our assigned room was a corner room with a view and if we went for the high floor it wouldn't have a view. I let my daughter choose and off to the 22nd floor we went to our room with a view. There is a staff member who stands near the elevators whom you show a room key to day and night to access the rooms. There are 2 elevator banks to access high and low floors quickly (the hotel has 54 floors). The room was clean (it smelled fresh like it had been recently cleaned). However, housekeeping should check the chairs to see if they need a vacuum. Someone left coarse salt (like on soft pretzels) in both chairs. The beds are lush so you will sleep well. The bathroom is roomy and has a control to turn on the heated floor. There's a rain shower showerhead and a handheld showerhead. The toiletries in the bathroom were luxurious. There's an iron, ironing board, coffee maker, and small refrigerator in the room. Bottled water and coffee are complimentary. There was no bottled water in the room when we got there, but it was promptly brought when I called guest services. The guest floors do not have a lot of rooms on them. We never heard any disturbing hallway noise or any noise from the next room. It was raining at dinner time, so the hotel has a bin of umbrellas in the lobby you can borrow. For a nightcap, We tried the rooftop bar, B54. In addition to indoor seating, It has outdoor seating (weather permissible) and observation area so you can check out the lofty views of Times Square at night. We ate breakfast at the restaurant in the lobby. The breakfast prices were comparable to any other restaurant in the area and the food was good. The waiter was friendly and attentive. If I need a hotel in the Times Square area again, I would definitely stay here again! I do think I would opt for a high floor though, because I could hear police sirens a couple of times while sleeping.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This location is everything. It's only a 1/2 block away from The Heart of Times Square!!! Coming and going was easy. I was happy to have security at the door to make sure guest only went upstairs. The rooftop bar was a lil too expensive for my taste. Average price for a cocktail was $26.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square hotel is a great place to stay. Large rooms with big bathrooms and floor to ceiling windows with great views.The entire staff from reception who greet you,restaurants,bars and the entire wait and bartenders all have a great attitude.Prime location to everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed with family for a long weekend. It was a great getaway in a very good location to see the sights of NYC. Staff was very accommodating to us. The staff had a great amount of local knowledge which made the stay more enjoyable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square is the best Hotel I have stayed at in NYC, and I have stayed at many. It's a Frist Class Hotel, from the minute you walk in to when you leave. The rooms are so clean, fresh and modern, and LARGE, and the views, fromt he higher floors, where I stayed, blew me away..along with teh Rooftop Terrace..What a treat!! The staff bends over backwards to meet your every need, always smiling, warm and so friendly. Their attention to detail did not go unnoticed by me..when I checked out, the staff noticed I caught a cold, and ran to get me a box of kleenex for my flight home..how thoughtful was that?? Wow!! Alex DeCgagas, the dirctor of Operations, sent my short emails during my stay to check in on me and to contact him if I neded anything..very kind and attentive..Thank you, Alex!!!The facilities are beautiful..24 hour gym...Loved my stay at this hotel, and I look forward to returning..Forget to mention the excellent location, in the middle of everything..easy to get around..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location, 1/2 block from Times Square, very clean, modern, no noise from street (34th floor), comfortable bed, full spa on site, rooftop bar, broadway theaters and restaurants are everywhere surrounding the hotel. Subway is 1 block away. Couldn't be more pleased.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is very conveniently located. A little noisy, but staff is great. Room A/C a little loud and hard to control temp, but rooms are clean and well maintained. Very easy check in and check out process using World of Hyatt app

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just returned to the UK after a 5 night stay here. Our room was lovely, comfy beds, great bathroom products, complimentary water, coffee machine (and a super hairdryer) and very quite considering the hotel was 30 seconds walk from Times Square. But it was the professionalism and kindness of the staff that really made our stay. My daughter's teddy was accidentally swept up in the laundry Thursday and we cannot thank Paola, Abbey and the rest of the staff enough for how they tracked down and returned the teddy to her (at 4.15am Saturday, at our request of what ever time you can!) We really did appreciate your determination and caring attitude to solving this for us and made us feel valued and important guests. A hotel that goes above and beyond for their guests' happiness deserves a 5* rating!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location in Times Square. Walkable distance to all the sites we planned on visiting. Very friendly staff. Very accommodating and helpful. Room was very clean room as was the hotel as a whole. Hope to return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here as a family of four on a recent vacation and used it as a base to explore Manhattan. Although very close to Times Square (2 minutes walk), you are nicely down a side street so away from the noise. We found the hotel to be modern, spotlessly clean, with a good sized room and it had some nice touches that you wouldn't necessarily expect with a New York hotel (e.g. complimentary bottled water - just had to ring down to get more). The breakfast selection was wide, offering something for everyone whether looking for a big stack of pancakes or something a little more health conscious. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked and cancelled 3 or 4 other hotels before settling on the Hyatt Centric Times Square. The reason we booked here? What we got for the price. We wanted two queen beds which really isn't common in NYC. Most of the other hotels we looked at had double beds or a king and sofa bed. One of the hotels we booked into and cancelled was the Marriott Springhill Suites with 2 queen beds on 37th St. Why? Even though they included free breakfast, the price per night was about $50 more per night.While breakfast was not included at the Hyatt Centric, the central location and service made up for it. The Hyatt Centric had many nearby options for a breakfast at less than $10 a person. We were able to catch several different subway lines within a couple of blocks of the hotel. We attended 3 plays which were within walking distance, as was Central Park, Rockefeller Center and 5th Ave shopping.Service was great - there was always someone to help out. On our last day, we were able to leave our bags with the bellman until we were ready to leave, at no charge.The Hyatt Centric was a great place for us due to its central location, large clean rooms and service. We would definitely return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was an amazing stay from every aspect; accommodations to staff to a view to die for. We were treated like royalty and the hotel was able to meet our every need. I personally am wheelchair dependent and the staff was excellent at accommodating me. I did not select an accessible room specifically but the room still meet my every need. The Rain shower with slide shower nozzle combination was amazing. The bath products from the Marilyn Monroe spa made me feel so clean and pampered. What else can say but EXCELLENT

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staying at the Hyatt is a perfect complement to seeing the show, Hello Dolly on Broadway! Rooms were only surpassed by the friendly and professional staff. Rooms were immaculate, first class all the way!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is beautiful and the staff is excellent! The location is wonderful as it is around the corner from all the craziness in Times Square. It is a short walking distance to the theaters and many fine restaurants. We definitely will stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spotless. Friendly staff. Bed and pillows that can be bad at many hotels were very comfortable. Food downstairs above average. A great place to stay. Walk to everything. Service with a smile from check-in to check-out. Perfect for Broadway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Presidential suite is small and only contains one bedroom. It’s more like a Junior suite than the top room for the hot hotel. Is located on the 40th floor and offers nice views but nothing spectacular. Accommodations seem dated and need of a refresh. Save your money and book a standard room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 2 minute walk from Times Square so ideally located for Grand Central, Broadway, Chrysler Building, Bryant Park etc. Was initially worried it may be too noisy but no problems at all except the odd fire trucks horns. The room was well finished and had a good bathroom. All of the staff were extremely professional and mostly very friendly.The roof top terrace bar gives stunning views, but is expensive. Wifi was included in the rate, and you have 30 mins free use of the two guest computers in the lobby for printing boarding cards etc, but you pay for the prints.Didn't try the restaurant so can't comment on the food, but did try room service which was very quick and I thought a reasonable cost.Would recommend the hotel as your base for exploring New York because of its location

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am a true New Yorker so a NY hotel is not going to impress me much. I picked this based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and also I used Hyatt points. I was here while seeing two broadway shows. So close proximity to theatre district. First off I arrived earlier than expected and just wanted to drop off my bags. My room was ready! They wished my husband a happy birthday and honored my request for a high floor. No problem, corner view. No hassle. We get to the room and there was a birthday card for my husband a small gift. Mineral water was complimentary and there were two bottles of water by the coffee machine. I say this because I have been charged extra for these at a Hyatt. To summarize this hotel is a great place to say. Room was super clean and tidy. The area around Times Square is an absolute madhouse! But once you step onto your floor it is a nice oasis. If only all Hyatts can have staff like yours!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was so clean, very modern, rooms were an awesome size. The view from the rooftop bar was priceless. Would def recommend staying here over any other hotels in the area. Staff was awesome!! Also a close walk to Starbucks and Juniors so an extra plus :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location, services and room accommodations were all spot on. Not a great view and was not expecting one. Close to Times Square and Rockefeller Plaza. Central Park too. An overall good experience and would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was probably our best experience we have ever had. Jefferson in guest services was amazing. He helped me out with my engagement plans when other plans fell through. It was because of him that I was able to propose to my now fiancé on the rooftop (55 stories above Times Square). They also send us wine and a fruit trey to celebrate. This place was amazing. I won't stay anywhere else. Jefferson also deserves a raise

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Of the 15-20 trips I take to NYC each year on business, I stay in this hotel 90% of the time. Alex, the hotel manager, makes sure that my preferences are taken into account on each trip. The location is unbeatable, and the hotel is quiet, ensuring a reasonable night's sleep.
user_location: North Miami Beach, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed there for one week and extremely enjoyed it. The hotel is almost directly at Times Square but at the same time the rooms are very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooftoop bar is worth a visit, the view definitely makes up for the high prices of the drinks (expensive as you would expect from a location like this). The hotel is rather new, therefore the rooms were very nice and also quite big. I would definitely go there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is clean and very nice. The rooms were very comfortable and the service is outstanding. The staff are friendly and always willing to help I honestly cannot think of any negatives about my stay. Free water in the rooms, small fridges, keurig coffee pots. We asked for extra towels and water everyday and they were always accommodating. The location was perfect too!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I planned a birthday gift for my wife to see Hamilton. Booked a deluxe suite with soaker tub and times square view, also added late check-in since i couldnt make it till 9pm. My wife called the day before our trip to make sure our late arrival would not affect our reservation and were told that they see late check-in so we were fine. Left work early and fought the traffic to make it for 9pm super excited for our room since our new born keeps us from doing these types of trips often. We arrived only to find out that not only did they give our room away but we were DOWNGRADED! But " free breakfast" to make up for it. We ended up foregoing the breakfast and got a credit for $100. This would be nice if i had cared about the money, i didnt hence why i payed for nicer room. i would have even payed for an upgrade at this point but there was "nothing more we can do". Basically ruined the mood of our trip from jump and we are usually very happy to give rave reviews since i also am in the service buisness but this is unacceptable. Based on what we saw on our stay if you can get the room you want, the location is awesome and the hotel had great roof top bar. I would have returned but work prevents me from making check-in and room amenities are important to us, since as said before my wife and i dont get out much.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is very well located, just a few steps to the Times Square, very close to theaters, shopping arcades and lots of food joints close by.The hotel itself is average for being a Hyatt. Very small rooms, average maintenance and house keeping that is not worth writing about.I will not classify it as a five start hotel. Good value for money if you look at the hotel as a three star well located hotel.Getting to the hotel could be a task as traffic is very heavy specially during peak hours so i you have a flight to catch give yourself a lot of time.Staff is generally friendly specially the security guys at the entrance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel recently during a quick weekend trip to NYC. It was two adults (three for one night) and one toddler in a regular room. Finding the hotel was sort of tricky, as there was not very good signage. Had it not been for us meeting someone who had gotten there in advance, I may have easily walked past it. The lobby is basic. Just a front desk when you immediately walk in, and a small business center for booking your broadway tickets, or printing your boarding passes upon departure. There's also a door person to help open doors (Fantastic for when you're carrying baggage, and/or pushing a stroller), and also someone who asks guests to show their room keys before proceeding to the elevator. Also, walls are fairly thin. My crying toddler was easily heard from in the hallway, can't imagine how loud you could hear him in the adjacent rooms! Location is great, just off the main drag of Time's Square and Dickson Plaza, and three blocks away from Bryant Park and Whole Foods. Close to many of NYC's iconic dining options such as Junior's Cafe, or the Starlight Diner. Lyceum Theater is next door. There's also a fantastic, albeit very expensive, grab and go place called Cranberry Cafe two storefronts down. Rooms were fine, just a little small, and nicely appointed. Beds were comfortable. Floor to ceiling windows with blackout curtains. There's a small mini fridge in the dresser, as well as a safe. Complimentary water bottles and coffee were also provided. At one point, we also asked if there was a microwave available in the building to heat up leftover pizza. One was later brought up to our room. We also requested a crib, which came with sheets, a blanket, and a johnson&johnsons travel kit that contained baby shampoo, lotion, head to toe wash, desitin, baby powder, and a case of baby wipes, which was very nice. My only major complaint was the design of the beds. I forgot to take a picture, but the beds rest on a platform to elevate them off the floor. The platform itself has a wooden frame that sticks out at just the perfect height to scrape your shins on that is covered by the comforter, so you don't really see them. Eventually, we just pulled the mattress down to rest on top of the edge of the platform so that we wouldn't continue scraping our shins on it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place to stay, great location, 1-block away from Time Square. Fantastic views from the rooftop. Just a note that if you use Uber and stay here, make sure you enter the correct address, the GPS is not accurate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My fiancé and I went to New York for a week of fun and exploring. We selected the Hyatt Centric because of the room with the balcony overlooking time square and the great location. Well, that's all we got. Every single time we walked into the building my 100 pound finance and I had to open these 10 pound doors while 2-3 staff members watched-- never did they help us open a door or open it for us. No one, not one single time in 6 days, remembered that we stayed there. The hotel contacted me mid trip to see how my stay was going and I informed them I would be proposing. They said they were going to help make it a night my fiancé and I would never forget. They said "leave it up to us from here." As you can probably expect, we came back to a room of nothing. They had completely forgotten. I contacted them the next day and they sent us a complimentary mimosa then told us they'd make it up to us. 12 hours later, they put rose peddles on my bed. The first night that would have been nice but 24 hours later you might as well have done nothing. For the price, I recommend you get an airbnb. 2500 dollars for a small room with a nice view and below average service. Never again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We decided to stay at this hotel due to location quality and price in combination. The location for at NYC trip is excellentand the room we hav with a view over the Square on 41st floor fully gave us the impression of the life a day round.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Quick check in and check out. Lot of bars and restaurant options on the vicinity. Wish there were more variety in the in-room dining. Wish there was a swimming pool !!
user_location: Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt always holds a special place in my heart--and this location maintains that feeling--in fact, it probably secured a rightful spot because of this stay!.As a tourist/visitor one often hears about the rudeness of people in the city--or just not feeling the "warmth" from people--This Hyatt the team is trained well--everyone is friendly! I walked through the doors with a smiling doorman--and was transported into "another world"! Check in was fast and easy -- marking my late checkout for the next day --Great hotel with larger than normal rooms for NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was great. From the friendly staff to the amazing room and rooftop bar, we enjoyed every minute at the Hyatt Centric. We will definitely be back. We loved the floor to ceiling windows and the view of the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here last weekend - we had a wonderful stay! The hotel is in an excellent location very close to Times Square and is both modern and clean. In addition, we were very well taken care of by Alexander DeChagas, Operations Director and his team who made sure that our stay met all of our expectations. I would highly recommend this hotel and will certainly stay here again.Thank You Hyatt Team for making this the experience I hoped for, for my daughter's first visit to celebrate her 16th birthday!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall, we had a nice day there. The room is clean and comfortable. The location is excellent if you are love to stay around time square area. The staff are helpful and friendly. We did have some issue at checking in. We have booked a double queen beds room a while ago but we were told it was not available when we arrived there. Eventually, the staff did provide us a double queen beds room after spoke to manager. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a regular visitor to NYC as well as a Hyatt Globalist member, I've stayed at just about every Hyatt property in the city at least once and several of their properties such as the Andaz 5th Ave, Andaz Wall Street, Park Hyatt and Grand Hyatt, multiple times. Our favorites are the Park Hyatt and Andaz 5th Ave. but for this one night trip into the city, we thought we'd give the Hyatt Centric Times Square a try.The hotel is on 45th street about a block from the heart of Times Square. Weekends in the summer can be downright madness in Times Square in terms of the number of people on the street so being a block away provides a bit of relief while still only being a few steps from the action (if that's what you're looking for).Since we drove in, we pulled up in front of the hotel and left our keys with the bellman. Valet parking is $65 a night which is typical for just about any hotel in NYC. One of several "missteps" that occurred during our stay took place when we called to have our car brought up the next day. I called approx. 30 minutes before I needed my car (which you should always do at any NYC hotel), only to find a different car parked at the curb. While the valet numbers matched, the person who tagged the keys the day before had mixed them up with another guest. Credit goes to the desk associate who apologized for the mix up which added to the delay in getting my car brought up by removing the valet charge from my bill.Check-in takes place in a rather small lobby and the front desk always seems to have a lot of activity going on. There didn't appear to be a dedicated desk for World of Hyatt members to check-in (as is found in most Hyatt properties), although when I got up to the front of the line, there was a small World of Hyatt sign in the middle of the front desk however that position was just checking in the next person on line. After waiting several minutes in line and then for an available room to be found (it took several trips from the front desk into the back office for the associate I was working with to get a room), the entire check-in process was around 15 minutes.I had reserved a corner suite with what was described online as a "breathtaking view of Times Square", however in reality, the view from our 42 floor room looked downtown between two buildings. You could see a little bit of Times Square if you looked down and to the extreme right but I would hardly call it breathtaking. I assume that the corner suites on the opposite side of the building which are positioned more advantageously facing Times Square might actually have a better view but since I was here for one night and it had already taken a while to get this room that I'd just stay put.By definition I guess you could consider this a suite since there was a separate living and bedroom space but this was by far the smallest suite I've experienced at any of the Hyatt properties in NYC. Being a regular Hyatt guest, my expectations for the Hyatt Centric were not the same as they would be when staying at the Park Hyatt, Andaz or Grand Hyatt but still this was a pretty small suite and I'd say not worth the extra cost over a King room. With that said the room was certainly comfortable enough with ample storage space, two large TV's, and had a nice size bathroom with a "wet room" (shower and bath tub enclosed in the same area), with great water pressure. This can sometimes be a problem on high floors.Along with small gym and a spa, the hotel has two bars and one restaurant. Bar 54 is the rooftop bar on the 54th floor with nice outdoor views of the city and T45 is the bar/restaurant located just off the lobby and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. After having lunch the day we checked in and breakfast the following morning, I agree with many of the other reviews found here on TA that the quality and service is still questionable at T45. Our lunch was fine albeit it overpriced for the small portions offered but the service was prompt (although the restaurant was almost empty), Breakfast next morning was another story. The restaurant didn't look overly busy (there were more than a few available tables), but it took almost 45 minutes for two breakfast sandwiches and a bowl of fruit and when they did arrive, one was stone cold and utterly tasteless and the other looked as though it was just thrown onto a plate and was falling apart. As a Hyatt Globalist your provided with a $74 credit for breakfast and our two sandwiches, fruit, coffee and a latte (which was also pretty awful), came out to right around $70 with a tip. The only consolation was that I wasn't paying for this although I still expected a decent breakfast so my advice would be to go somewhere else to eat.A couple of days after checking out I received a guest survey from Hyatt which I filled out detailing some of the issues I had with the property. Within a day I heard back from Front Office Manager apologizing for the issues I encountered and offering me some additional points as compensation. This goes a long way in my book in showing the hotel is committed to improving their guests experience. Would I stay here again? Probably not and only becuase I prefer not to stay anywhere near Times Square and would rather pay a bit more to stay at the Park Hyatt or Andaz 5th Ave.. Even with a few missteps the rates against other other hotels I've stayed at in the Times Square area (Marriott Marquis, Renaissance Times Square, The W), were $100-$300 less per night at the Centric compared to these other properties and the overall experience was better at the Centric.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Although this is a Hyatt, it is more akin to a high-end boutique hotel than a chain. The rooms, are sleek, luxurious and surprisingly large. The rooftop bar - Bar54 - has the highest outdoor bar in New York with great cocktails and even better views. I am in New York frequently, and have stayed here twice in the last 3 weeks - it is one of my new favorites. Oh, and the staff is among the most customer-focused I have experienced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is really nice and clean. It's just a few steps from Times Square and from 4 metro stops. There's also a rooftop bar where the view is amazing, you have to go up and have some food. The burger is great, one of the bests I ate in NY and also you have to try the Mushroom Flatbread. There's a gym and compared to other hotels I stayed it is well equipped, not a fitness center but way better than the most.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this hotel! I stay here every year since the first week it opened. Convenient to shows, shopping, restaurants, and sight seeing, and Penn Station if traveling by train. Very clean. Staff very personable and professional.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The king bed could have been softer, other than that it was a great stay. Great location. No noise complaints. Great staff. Great food at their restaurant. The sky lounge has a great view. Great valet service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: that was a really nice experience at Centric. That it will be the first choice for next trip. The peronnal was really helpful and smiling. Don't hesitate to choose this Hotel. The room was so clean and so quiet. Francois

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of the best experiences we have ever had in a hotel. The staff was amazing, the rooms were super clean, the location is crazy good, the VIEWS!! OMG THE VIEWS are ROCKSTAR, and the desserts we ordered on the roof top bar were created by a chef that knows what he's doing. We got a room with a terrace and couldn't believe the view! We were really impressed with the friendliness, helpfulness of the staff and their sincerity. From Paola at the front desk to the cleaning staff to the waitress on the rooftop, all very impressive. I noted Paola's name because I was so impressed with her. We will choose this hotel every time now. I have never left a review for a hotel until now...we were that impressed. Thanks Hyatt for a great experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I start this post as I do every review stating I am a loyal Hyatt Globalist who seeks to give an honest view of his experience to help you. Like you, in NYC, I have my choice of hotels and have stayed at many across brands and neighborhoods.In my opinion there is no better value or view than the Hyatt Centric Times Square. An unexpected surprise, I was amazed by the property and the service alike. From the lobby restaurant where I had an amazing omelette on its sidewalk cafe to the breathtaking views of New York's Skyline as the sun set, the Hyatt Centric has a wonderful blend of food and view. I especially enjoyed the salmon skewers which were some of the best I have ever tasted.Unlike many in NYC, the room was a comfortable size that allowed me to work, sleep, and even do an active session of Insanity Max 30. In addition, the gym was expansive with plenty of open machines and free weights for those who prefer not to have the smell of sweat in their room. Ha!As I begin to travel to NYC monthly I will continue to stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. To me there is no better value for the location, space, or service you will receive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Even though I prepaid for this room on expedia, the hotel charged my card for a full nights stay after I explicitly told them I prepaid so please do not charge my card. I stayed at this hotel strictly for the view at the bar. However, I was surprised to be treated like a second class citizen when I went to their bar. Although I was staying at the hotel and the bar was not crowded, the restaurant staff would not let me order my drinks on the terrace at the bar with 99 percent of the patrons. Me and my friends, the only black patrons, were asked to sit inside and wait to bring our drinks out later. No one else in the entire bar sat inside but us. Then after we paid our bill and set it on the table like anyone would do, we were yelled at while walking out of the bar by two servers yelling, "did you pay the bill??". This was the worst experience for paying 300 bucks a night and 26 dollars a drink. When i complained they took the drinks off the bill but that just doesn't cut it for me. My wife and I felt horrible our entire stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location for tourists. Very close to time square and theaters. Walking distance to many attractions. Hotel is clean and staff is very helpful and professional. Don't order room service. Much better experience at the restaurant attached to the hotel. Safe environment for families. Hotel staff checks persons entering the hotel for a membership key.Rooms are nice, but not amazing. Counter space in bath is very limited.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel exceeded our expectations in every way, a haven in NYC perfectly located just around the corner from Times Square but was surprisingly quiet free from traffic noise and the madding crowds, added to an absolutely fantastic stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a get what you pay for hotel. I arrived with 2 large suitcases and a tote bag. There was no one from the hotel to help with luggage or even open the door. No traditional room service - only packaged foods. Bath towels were cheap and very worn. The safe in my room didn't work. Air conditioning stopped working and when it did work it did not function properly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I spent two nights here in early August. Every staff member is friendly, attentive and helpful, from the front desk staff to housekeeping. The room was spotless, the bed very comfortable, and incredibly quiet for NYC - we were on the 36th floor so I don't know how quiet the lower floors are, but we never heard any noises from the street, adjacent rooms or the corridor. Complimentary coffee and water in the room is a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric is a wonderful place to stay for those stepping out for Broadway shows. Convenient location a half block from Times Square. Well appointed rooms. Fantastic staff whose enthusiasm is genuine. Sometimes it is the little things that make all the difference - show up on a rainy day and they will have an umbrella for you. We cannot wait until we return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, great service - this is the perfect place for a family stay in NYC. We came to New York to see Hamilton, and this hotel is just a block from the theatre so the location is perfect. The rooms were enormous. Not just for NYC, but enormous for any hotel. The floor-to-ceiling windows really add to the space as well. The bathrooms were particularly large with spacious showers and a lot of options for lighting. The hotel was extremely quiet - we never heard another guest. We stayed in rooms 1003 and 1004 and had a bit of a view of Times Square - but without the noise and chaos. The staff was extremely helpful, storing luggage until 9 pm on the day we checked out. There is valet parking (not cheap at $65 for 24 hours, but oh so convenient). The beds were extremely comfortable. We felt very safe the entire time as guests have to produce keys to access the elevator. We never used the gym or spa, but we did make a quick trip to the rooftop bar for a photo. They were kind enough to let my children onto the deck for a quick picture. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Centric for 10 nights a couple with 2 children. Location is the best, just a spit of times squer. The hotel is modern , rooms are specious , and crew is super friendly and eager to help. Thers a nice roof top bar on the 53 floor with magnificent balcony and a view , but they dont allow kids there.Rooms are modern and highly maintained .Try to get the upper floors for the view.We loved the place and found it to be good value. Recomended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Level of service was more inline with what I would expect from a lower end hotel. The room was nice and clean but the bed and pillows were far from comfortable. Hyatt seems to ask their loyal clients for more and provide less with each passing year. I should probably move over to Hilton or Marriott.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful hotel near Times Square! If you are looking for somewhere close to the theatre district this is a wonderful choice. It was not a huge, overwhelming impersonal hotel. The staff seemed genuinely interested in our welfare and well being.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: good rooms (you have just to check what it's suiting you from the point of sizes), good facilities ( gym and spa), a variety of good and healthy breakfast, a very convenient rooftop bar , very friendly staff

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Went to NYC with my two teen daughters for a girls trip primarily centered around theater. The location was perfect. Helpful staff, sizable room plenty comfortable for three (would be comfortable for four), great security, plenty of elevators. Felt very safe walking to and from theater district. Newish hotel, modern accommodations, well-appointed room, very clean with the exception of carpet in our room being somewhat dingy. Great shower and nice lighting in the rooms. Beds were extremely comfortable and rooms were quite considering proximity to Times Square - we slept like babies every night. Traveling alone with my kids I appreciated that keys had to be produced to access elevators most hours of the day and that the doors and front desk were always staffed. And after walking around in the hot city the iced infused water in the lobby was most welcome! I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location less than a block from Times Square but quiet. Hotel is very clean and staff is top notch. Director of Operations Alex DeChagas was extremely quick to address our concerns and make our stay the best it could be. We will definitely be back the next time we're in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have always been a fan of Hyatt hotels, but this one is one to brag about. The service was great ... rooms were large for NYC hotels and the location was incredible especially if seeing broadway,shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is new in comparison with other hotels. Rooms are well made and comfortable and big as per NYC standards. They give you early check in if rooms are available. Staff is very friendly. Rates are reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location in the heart of Times Square/Theatres area. Clean, spacious, comfortable room. Exceptional quick and easy room service. Good food and friendly service at the restaurant, but the most of all, outstanding truly guest focused management resolving a problem quickly, efficiently, wanting their guests to enjoy the stay and visit to NYC. Would definitely stay again and highly recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really nice, modern hotel. Times Square is in my opinion the best location, very close to broadway theatres. Rooms spacious and clean. Bar 54 on the roof top is expensive but worth having at least one drink to admire the amazing views over NYC. Only negative, our room on floor 14 didn't have much of a view-looked on to the wall of building across. This wasn't too bad though as we went out every day and evening so the room was just for sleeping. Beds VERY comfy! I would return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I cannot thank Alex DeChagas, Director of Operations at the Hyatt Centric Times Square New York enough! He has gone above and beyond to accommodate us and has made our daughter's 21st birthday incredibly special!I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. The location is superb, the restaurant is excellent (Try the avocado toast for breakfast - delicious!) and The Rooftop bar views from floor 54 are sublime. Thank you Hyatt Centric. We will be back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family had a fantastic stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. Everything about our stay was pleasant. We have no complaints at all. The staff - especially reception and housekeeping - was attentive and very helpful. The hotel is modern and our room up to date and very clean. The hotel is one block from Times Square and Theater District, yet felt isolated from the chaos and noise that is Times Square. A wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel staff was pleasant; facility was well maintained and room nicely appointed and comfortable. Only negative was some staining on ottoman. Would recommend hotel to others; and stay here again if the price were right, as it was on this trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Arrived at 6.30pm in the evening to be told the deluxe room we had booked in December was not available. They would have a standard room ready for us in about an hours time and we could move to the deluxe room the next day. Refused and insisted they provide what we had booked over 7 months ago. Only in New York for 4 nights so our time was precious and we had a full itinerary of booked tickets the next day. After a few minutes of the lady apologising and us stating we wanted what we had paid for up front they eventually found us a deluxe room which included a bath as an extra.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, clean small rooms with out dated carpet, very quiet hallway. Concierge made a mistake, but management compensated.Told concierge I wanted to go to a certain museum. Took an Uber, a lot of traffic and Uber cost $25. I went into the Gift Shop and asked where I buy tickets for admission and was told the museum is Closed every Thursday. Either Concierge should have known this or he should have checked on computer. I didn't know the neighborhood so I took a Taxi back to the Hotel and talked to the Manager and explained what had happened. She said the hotel would cover my Uber/taxi round trip the next day in addition to picking up the tab for Breakfast the next day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved this hotel. We got two rooms because we expect NYC rooms to be very small but were pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms. Alex, the manager was so kind and helpful and the staff was wonderful and accommodating. The hotel is steps away from the magic on Times Square and very convenient to 5th avenue shopping, just a few blocks away from Rockefeller and so convenient to everything else NYC has to offer. Great pizza around the corner and lots of other restaurants and stores to choose from. The rooftop bar is absolutely gorgeous! Did I mention the staff was so wonderful. The hotel is sparking clean and the rooms are very updated and clean as well. If you're staying in NYC, do yourself a favor and stay here, you won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This might just be the best Hyatt property in NYC. Time Square isn't a great location but this hotel is an oasis amongst the craziness. Staff is very attentive. Rooms are clean and new. The SkyBar is a most see. Views are incredible. I have stayed here multiple times and will again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel with a great location! It is right in Times Square and only a few blocks from Rockefeller Center. The south facing rooms have great views of Times Square, The Chrysler Building, and One World Trade Center. The staff went out of their way to make our NYC visit fabulous!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So clean,so safe. So personal!From the moment you get out of the cab you are greeted by a Hyatt employee. During your stay the staff attends to your needs. When you depart a staff member helps you into the cab. A great Hyatt experience!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were very pleased with our stay at Hyatt Centric. We were visiting New York for the first time with our children and this location was great. Times Square is right around the corner and we were able to walk to Central Park and many other tourist spots.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a nice modern hotel a 1/2 block off Times Square.
