I was so stressed out because of the overwhelming amount of hotel options NY has but thank God I read a review and took a chance with Hyatt Centric and I literally felt like 5 star service! The view of our room on the 50th was just breathtaking. The staff and Alex DeChagas Made us feel first class! He is very accommodating and we traveled here for our first anniversary and we walk into our room with a dozen roses and a champaigne bottle. The location is just so convenient , after walking all day you are very tired and achy, it's nice to take the subway whether you are updtown or lower manhattan and being able to exit 42nd street. You exit 42nd street and walk a few streets up to 45th and boom your there. The lobby had this great scent everyone we walked AC cross it. There is a rooftop bar as well and we took advantage of the Marilyn Monroe Spa at this Hyatt location and wow!! It was a 50 min couples massage and during the massage I felt so relaxed I think I slept and woke up. Thank you Hyatt Family, for pampering us and Making my wife and I feel welcome!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location! Stayed here two years ago & was so impressed & happy stayed again. At $400.00+ a night you expect a little extra; like we did 2 yrs ago. Rooms need major updating. First room carpet was filthy! We changed our room to a little better room. Housekeeping has slipped. Somedays trash wasn't emptied. Floor not vacuumed. Towels thin & scratchy. They used to have such attention to detail & guest services. Not so much anymore. Definitely not $400.00+/night attention.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of my most favorite Hyatt hotels in the US. Since the Centric branding it's been a little less luxury (4 stars) but certainly on point. Pros: I visit frequently and the staff remembers me, my water preferences and (breakfast!) by name. Reasonable rates, great location Food is healthy and good Service is good in the bar downstairsThe lounge on 54 has one of the best views of the city Rooms are comfortable. Maid service is very good. Decent concierge services Free umbrellas when it rains Cons: for the frequent guests the centric name pulled some of its amenities. No free drink or 20 minute spa visit for globalists. Breakast is still included however (good) Much smaller menu selection than before but the food is still yummy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You would be forgiven for not even knowing this hotel was there but there it is right on 45th and Times Sq. Lovely rooms, excellent service and a great Location. I had a room on one of the high floors and you would never know that you were in Central Manhattan such was the peace and quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel. Great position just around corner from Times Square, the subway, hop on off buses & theatres amongst other facilities. Very stylish, rooms very comfortable, well fitted & clean. Staff very friendly. The bar & restaurant very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The entire staff at this establishment work together as a team to exceed your expectations when you come and stay in Time Square. We were very satisfied with the entire experience and will be returning soon. Thanks again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I had a great stay! The hotel employees were very accommodating and made sure our visit was memorable . Location of the hotel extremely close to Time Square and restaurants.We will definitely stay again soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the moment you walk towards the front door, to checking in, and arriving to my room ... the staff could not have been nicer. Sincere customer service is tough to cultivate ... and this team has it perfected . They aren't scripted in their conversations ... instead, they speak from their hearts. They truly want my stay to be the best possible. At every turn of my stay, the Hyatt employees treat me more like family than a hotel guest.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This facility is excellent in a great location, well maintained, staffed with universally nice professionals, is reasonably priced by NYC standards and does NOT engage in the despicable bait and switch scam...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we came as a family of four and stayed there for 2 nights. staffs are awesome. nice and friendly. room is clean and quite. the valet parking is quite expensive, $65 per day. guess there is nothing cheap in NY. 1 block to Time Square.. Will come back for the count down.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was very nice. The location was good, but it wasn't right on Times Square. The walk from Times Square was about 5 minutes. All of the staff was friendly. The room was nice with trendy decor, but we noticed a musty or old smoky smell upon entering the room. There was a Kuerig in the room, but one day it was only stocked with tea and decaf coffee, which was disappointing when we wanted caffeine to start the day! It was clean and updated. The Wifi worked well. We were only in the room to wind down at the end of each day. I had paid for an upper level room with a view of NY, but our view was of a tall building across the street. If we stretched our view out of the side of the window, we could see the corner of a jumbotron. Knowing that the building had 54 stories, we were disappointed with the view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a great location within walking distance to all of the Broadway theaters. The room was clean, quiet, roomy, updated, and there was tons of counter space in the bathroom. We were on the 18th floor (a lower floor without a good view which is fine) and it was very quiet. I highly recommend!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel with an outstanding location, hotel management that truly care, good room size, great views, comfortable bed and modern furniture. The only thing we missed was a pool and/or hot tub. They are so nice after a day of touring and sightseeing around the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the first impression to the last this place was really amazingSituated within yards of the heart of Times SquareThe staff were friendly, well informedThe hotel was very clean, the room was nice an clean and house keeping were great

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This property is amazing. The staff, ambiance, attention to detail... you name it, they achieve it. Highly recommend to anyone traveling for work or for individuals looking to explore NYC and Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Awesome property location is amazing rooms are very large and very clean staff are lovely take care of everything u need n yea If not stayed here do have apportunity to use the lift of this property it's insanely fast u will like it

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, right on Time Square. The staff is extremely professional, helpful and pleasant. The rooms were a good size for the location. The rooms were clean and the daily cleaning service was excellent. I would recommend this hotel. I would stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I traveled to New York to celebrate my niece's 8th birthday, and Hyatt Centric did an outstanding job of making her birthday special. She was very happy!The entire staff are very service oriented, The room was very spacious and modern. Maria did an excellent job in helping me with the room selection, very patient, and excellent customer service skills. Please do not hesitate to stay at Hyatt Centric, you will not be disappointed!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Location! 2 min walk from heart of Times Square. Only bad part was Top deck not kids accessible (kids not allowed, probably because they server the liquor). Overall nice clean hotel and great view from 30th floor or above. Very minimal upgrade fee. Enjoyed my stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a very tall hotel with many elevators going to specific floors in the middle. Bed was comfortable and AC controls were good. I like it cool, and the AC delivered. Business meeting food was also good. Rooms very clean and modern looking. The check in floor is not the ground level, which is unusual but efficient.Elevator system was different. You enter the floor number you desire and the display will tell you which elevator to get on. Once on your assigned elevator, the elevator knows where you want to go.Good security at ground level.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is a great hotel. My daughters and I stayed there five nights. The room was plenty big for us... the bathroom is huge and the views were wonderful. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. The bar on the rooftop is pricey but you need to enjoy a drink atop the hotel to see the beautiful sites. The workout room was great and so was the restaurant. We will be back. The location is great -- near Times Square so we could easily get to the subway. The only bad thing is that when you get to Times Square you are bombarded by vendors trying to sell you their wares. Be alert in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: "You only get what you pay for.......some of the time". Well this hotel is one of those times. If it's location, location then it's Hyatt Centric Times Square. You are right in the middle of everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square will be my hotel of preference when I come to NYC, the staff and the accommodations are excellent! I have allergies and they went out of their way to make sure I was comfortable, to the extent they shampooed the carpet in my room and in the hall walls. I have to send a special thank you to the management team of Ben and Alex. The front desk welcomes you with a smile and I instantly felt at home. The rooftop restaurant is wonderful and the ground floor restaurant is the best. The location is excellent, if you don’t’ want to be in the craziness of time square but be close enough to walk this truly is the place to be. All in all a great place to spend some time in the hustling bustling the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great modern hotel. Brilliant location. Rooftop bar pricey. Clean spacious rooms. Helpful staff. Central to Times Square and subway to get to downtown manhattan. Toiletries provided. Good views from glass windows

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I immediately got extremely happy to find out I was finally going to NYC for the 1st time! I went on to my Hyatt World app and randomly picked a Hyatt. Having this app I have learned to save my points and on level Discoverist in case I might need free upgrades for trips like this. I didn't really know where I was going or the location of the city that I was headed to so I picked this one because the price difference was cheaper. So I decided to take the $20 blue shuttle van instead of a taxi from LaGuardia to this Hyatt. Great decision! I was just stunned of the location of this Hyatt just a block from Times Square. All the lights were bright and knew I found the right place. Just walking in and knowing that I think I picked a decent place was a 1st impression. The Bar 54 in the Hyatt was exciting and lounge was decorated fancy. I then checked in with the nicest, I mean nicest and friendliest and helpful person I met on this trip. I was placed on the 51st floor (like I said those free upgrades help) and literally I was just WOWED!! The room had everything that was needed. But I must say the view rooms are just breath taking and I couldn't move past how nice and upgraded the bathroom was with shower and tub in the glass. The Timeless Marilyn Monroe products gave it the correct Spa feeling in the bathroom. This Hyatt staff, location and all together property is well beyond my expectations. They were kind and helpful in any way for directions and advice. Everything was in walking distance. This trip was fun, productive and worry-free thanks to this Hyatt. I'm coming back to NYC and I already know this is my place to be at. Thank you Hyatt Centic, Mr. Alex DeChagas major props to your wonderful property and staff. Perfect is all I can say!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Centric was a great location down a very easy side street on 45th Street. Great attendants outside. Indoors it's nice with the attendants making sure your staying there. Upon entering the beautiful smell encapsulates you. The check in went very smoothly. You can eat under cover on the street out front or indoors on the 1st floor. No problem holding luggage on last day for later flights. Large restrooms lobby level to freshen up. The beds are excellent! Meant to ask what they were. The location meant quiet rooms. Our high floor room was very spacious. Rooftop has a great view all the way to the other side of town. Easy to get an outside seat with the manager keeping tabs on who is next while sitting inside. Great appetizers up top too. So glad we stayed here & will pass my experience to friends traveling to NYC. Can't wait to stay here the next time a vacation allows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was well worth the money to stay in Times square. It was very clean and all staff were friendly and helpful. Be aware that if you take the subway to Battery Park to see Statue of Liberty on number 1 train, that you get into one of the first 4 trains before the last stop. I never saw anyone trying to sell CD's as mentioned in other reviews. Looking at at sightseeing places and reading reviews on the internet from people really helped. If anyone likes cheesecake, Eileen's cheesecake was a melt in your mouth experience, amazing. Just a bit far from hotel, so we took a cab.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved the Hyatt Centric! The rooms were so nice - contemporary but still very cozy. Great bathrooms - spacious sink and shower. The main restaurant T45 was wonderful - creative cocktails and some of the best food we ate! Will stay here again for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just Amazing, Best Location. Nice Room and bathroom, Superb Rooftop, friendly and helpful staff. All I can say is PERFECT STAY. We will most probably return to this Hotel.Just don't hesitate and chose it for your stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If I could give this hotel 10 stars, I would. I have been in New York three times, each time in a different hotel, but this is my new go-to. From the moment I arrived in my cab, I got greeted by the sweetest concierge, who took our bags and helped us inside. We were able to check-in an hour prior to time and it was so quick and easy, that a couple of minutes later, we were in the elevator. The whole hotel oozes luxury! From the lobby, to the rooms (bathrooms are heavenly) and the amazing city view, to the gym and rooftop bar. The room was spacious and amazing, bed perfect and big and the view was spectacular. No noise from other rooms and all amenities you could wish for

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely, modern hotel, minutes from Times Square. We had a large, comfortable room on the 28th floor. We were high enough to avoid the traffic noise from outside. Floor to ceiling windows. Large bathroom with spacious, rain shower - marvelous ! Comfortable beds. Concierge and doorman were both very helpful and friendly. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A modern and pleasing hotel right in the heart of NYC. Walking distance to all major sites but perhaps too busy for those wanting a quieter trip. Upon arrival the staff were extremely welcoming and even came up to our room to check it met our expectations - it did. We had a view of Times Square and a very modern, comfortable room. There was complimentary water and tea/ coffee. The whole room was immaculate with a range of tv channels on the in room tv. The lighting system was impressive too. We visited the rooftop bar which again gave impressive views of the city. We only stayed for one drink however as it is extremely expensive.Overall would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have had two excellent stays here in the past 6-7 months. The hotel is a clean, well-run oasis in the middle of the chaos that is Times Square. It is right in the middle of all of the action, but our room is always clean, quiet and comfortable. It's a little thing, but we appreciate the free daily water bottles in our room. I also think they have some of the best showers I have ever used. There is no place else I would rather stay in the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was right off the beaten path but so close to everything. Beautiful modern hotel. Staff was friendly and view from rooftop bar was amazing. My family loved this hotel. Bedding was so comfortable and all in room amenities were well done.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is centrally located & 1/2 block from Times Square.. I would reccomend a room with a view.. They also have an amazing rooftop bar & a downstairs bar restaurant.. Hotel & staff were all absolutely amazing!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We knew that we are going to get the beautiful view, nice and clean room, but WHAT A SERVICE! The receptionist welcomed me at the check in and congratulated me for my B days which I was going to have a next day! Than I have found a b day card in my room and a little present. Concierge was very helpful, the cleaner very friendly and professional. Don’t forget to reserve your table outside in the bar if you want to have a nice view. Staff is very helpful, they think about everything – you will even get the free sun glasses if you forget yours (it is pretty sunny out there). Drinks are very basic and as you would expect – overpriced for what they are but we were happy to pay for the location and view. I didn’t go to gym and spa. I didn’t eat at the hotel but the room service took a bit more time for the first time (we get our drinks for free in that case as an apologize!), second time they were very fast and brought our drinks to room within 5 min, nice and cold. The only downside is that the view is so beautiful that you don’t even want to move out of your room (we had a suit at 52th) . This was One of the best hotels I've stayed at

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was lovely, close to all the sites, view of Times Square. Surprisingly quiet given it's location. Friendly and attentive staff. The rooftop bar had an amazing view - expensive drinks and unfriendly wait staff, but the view made up for all of that. The room was very clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Enjoyed my stay. Felt like at home. Beautiful view outside the windows. Very well maintained rooms. Very friendly staffs. In house restaurant is also nice. The food was great but had to wait for sometime before being served. I highly recommend the place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I travel to NYC for business a lot. I generally stay at my standby favorite hotel, but said hotel was getting tired. I only chose the Hyatt Centric for the Spa, but what I got was a surprising new favorite. Check in was great. DeDe was very warm and welcoming. This hotel is fairly new. The room decor is clean and modern. The bed comfortable and crisp. The bathroom is sleek and complete with tub and shower with a rain fall shower head. The room comes with a Keurig coffee maker and Starbucks pods plus a mini fridge! That made my day alone until I noticed the hairdryer. Ok, I'm a girl and a good hairdryer can make or break a good hair day. Hotel hairdryers are usually 100 years old, cheap and weak. The Dry Bar hairdryer in my room was a salon quality hairdryer! I finally had a good travel hair day! Now for the spa! The Marilyn Monroe spa was a real treat. Expensive? Yes! Worth the splurge? I think so. The spa is small, but has everything you need to kick back and relax. Friendly staff and Elizabeth gave me one of the best relaxation massages I've ever had. It was the perfect end to my stressful day of meetings. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: location of hotel was awesome and had us at Times Square in just seconds. were able o run out late at night and get a sweet treat without taking a cab or trying hard to find something interesting to see. loved the hustle and bustle of new York and felt right at home being in the midst of it all. Hyatt had a great location for the purpose of our visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Not the best service!5 nights in, had to call the front desk for coffee refill, shower gel... heavy noise in the room that nobody could explain and obviously a lack of communication between the different shift. Late check out at 3pm, room door locked when i got back at 2.40pm. Far from the 5 stars services expected... beside platinium member to top it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You cannot beat this location! Around the corner from the heart of Times Square - you are located within steps of endless things to do and see but still within an area to escape for quiet unwinding. The rooms are modern, clean and offer amazing views. It looks brand new! Our trip ended in an unexpected family emergency which caused us to leave a day earlier than anticipated. The staff treated us so kindly and were generous enough not to charge us for our final night even though there was no way at that point that they would be able to rent the room out. That act of kindness during such a difficult time will not be forgotten and I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, awesome views, highly suggest this location. Right around corner is broadway and all the action. Great restaurants around area as well. Rooms are great not small like I thought they would be. And the shower!! amazing rain shower head bathroom is nice size with room. Has a great closet when you walk in plenty of storage area. Also great blackout curtains, almost need it due to the lights and billboards from Times Square. I never heard noise like some people have said. I was on the 14th floor so was perfect. Elevator is quick and no wait time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was great. They gave me upgrades with out asking. Entire staff was very accommodating and friendly. Location very close to Times Square without be on it. Bar on the roof was an excellent choice for seeing the City scape at a birds eye level.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would start by saying that if you are staying around Time Square, try to fly to La Guardia. Taxi fares (flat) from JFK runs about $59 plus tip....The hotel is very well located! Bar 54 is amazing!! had an issue with the AC in my room, but the overall stay was great! The staff is very friendly and helpful..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has it all! Midtown/Times Square location, you are in the middle of it and easy access to get around. Great food, 2 bars/restaurants - one on the rooftop and the other on the ground floor, plus room service! Spa, Fitness Center, etc... its home away from home for a weekend or work week.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I chose this hotel because it was reasonably priced, very close to the theater and it looked nice. I was not disappointed! We were in a standard 2-Queen bed room and it was clean, quiet and very spacious with an excellent view

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a very nice hotel at a nice location. The rooftop bar is nice but very expensive. The staff is friendly but a not very personal, no greetings by leaving the hotel. A good morning is something what you can expect no ?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed there between Christmas and Jan. 1. Thought it'd be nice to be near Times Square but that was a mistake - way too many people and lines everywhere. The hotel seems new and the service was very good although at times the staff was overworked and not enough to handle all guests. The rooms were small (including the suites) even by NY standards. The area at the rooftop was below expectations. Overall, nothing fundamentally wrong with the hotel but there are probably better deals in Manhattan for the offered price and room size.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of the front desk staffs was very rude. When I asked Ms Dede about how to go about printing our boarding passes, she spoke very rudely and banged the phone. Then I called about again and asked the front desk about her name.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After almost 3 years, we stayed at Hyatt Centric Time Sequare again in May 2016 and had a great experience. The location of the hotel is great, just adjacent to time square and walking distance to subway. The staff is highly professional in dealing from the time we checked in and checking out.The room are of adequate size offering a 5 star experience amenitiesThe restaurant at the ground floor offers great options for breakfast and sandwiches which are scrumptious. The staff at the restaurant are also very friendly and professional.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family vacationed in New York City for the second year in a row and we love it there. We stayed at the Lotte New York Palace last year and loved it. We would have stayed there again this year, but the price was much higher than last year. I decided to give the Hyatt Centric Times Square a try and we were not disappointed. The staff was top notch and the location was the best. It was within walking distance to everything. It rained a couple of days we were there, so they had umbrellas for their guest to use free of charge. There were always chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. It was a great place to stay and would have gotten 5 stars, but our room needed to have the carpets cleaned and some of the paint on the furniture was chipped up. These were minor things, but worth mentioning. I would definitely stay there again. Thanks Hyatt Centric for a great vacation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Awesome hotel!! Perfect location to subways and attractions. We were able to walk to most sites from our hotel. Staff was unbelievably nice- would definitely stay there again! Get the king terrace room if you can, was so nice having a balcony!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I travel lots to multiple locations, this Hotel is Managed properly and the staff are Excellent...perfect location in NYC, clean, friendly, fun, quiet .... my choice of stay. In time square ,five minutes from Central Park, in the center of the city hotel Rooftop restaurant/bar with excellent view of the city.Eddie M

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I travel to New York times square area quite often on business, and Hyatt Centric is, by far, my favorite hotel. Very close to Times Square, theaters, dozens of good restaurants and Bryant Park, but tucked in on a reasonably quiet street, with an intimate and peaceful vibe. Great bar with indoor or sidewalk seating. Lovely rooms and great service!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I had our first ever mother / daughter vacation in NYC. The Hyatt Centric was in a great location. We walked or took the subway to all of the sights we visited. The hotel is extremely clean and well kept. The staff was friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just stayed here for five days and I was not impressed, especially by the service. The facilities are great, nice room with a very nice view, nice location but I have found the service quite poor. On my arrival the room stinked of smoke..i didn't report it just left the windows open for two days and it was okay. On the second day I was late for work wanted to get a taxi, i asked Louis if he could fetch one for me. He started playing with his phone, finished a conversation with another member of staff..wasted a bit of time. When I pointed out that I was late and perhaps it was easier if I got it myself he said he was checking on his phone if he could get me a "better deal" with a blackcar and quite shockingly he said it would have been 85$ for a 5 minutes ride. I told him that the place was very near and that normally I would spend 10$..i then went to get a taxi myself totally unimpressed by his attempt to trick me. Another negative experience was at the bars - i had breakfast every days at the 5t4, service very slow even when the bar was empty I always had to ask for sugar, spoon, water..at the skylounge even worst, we were asked to share a table with other two people that we didn't know but we were brought only a bowl of nibbles. When we pointed it out the same waitetress replied very rudely that she didn't remember that we were not together, then made us wait a long time, came back twice to ask what we ordered. The situation was so surreal that we even laughed about it with the strangers that were sharing the table with us. On the third day the wifi was down for the entire afternoon, called the reception to ask what the issue was they replied in an unapologetic manner like we had bothered them saying that they were trying to fix it..i went to the gym and there was no water, had to come back all the way up to get the water....the gym equipment was also that cheap american brand and not technogym..when I checked out at the end of my staying they asked me how it was I said it was so and so but Victor didn't bother to ask why. Overall for 450$ per night I was expecting a bit more to be honest, I stayed previously in other similar hotels in the area and the service was soo much better! i don't think I ll go back or I would recommend it to anyone, it's a pity as I generally like Hyatts but not this one!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have recently returned from our honeymoon and honestly couldn't have had a better stay in New York. Upon arrival we were upgraded to an amazing room with a wonderful view of Times Square and were treated to a bottle of fizz and a personalised card to congratulate us on our marriage. Our room was very clean, this combined with the location of the hotel and the lovely helpful staff, makes the hotel a must stay, for us at least! We used both the restaurant (for breakfast) and the gym during our stay and couldn't fault either. The food was delicious and the gym is very well equipped. We cant wait to return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Being from a resort city, Las Vegas, we understand the resort service and what it takes to maintain a 5 star hotel. From the valet, Ed, that met us at the curb, took care of our luggage and vehicle, to the young lady that checked us in, personally took our luggage up to our room, and explained all of the services available at the hotel. Everyone was awesome and knew the resort from top to bottom. They made our stay truly exceptional!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were thoroughly pleased with our stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square NYC. The hotel was clean and ideally located. The balcony room views were spectacular, like staying in an urban treehouse surrounded by skyscrapers, yet quiet and restful inside the room. Comfortable beds! Friendly and accommodating staff but unobtrusive, just as we prefer. Really enjoyed the coco mango lotion/toiletries. Can't wait to visit again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and accommodations. Great bar . Linens, mini bars, robes, very nice. Check in and check out was very fast and easy. Would return to this location. Close to Times Square and easy for going to Broadway Musicals and Plays.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I enjoyed being in Times Square. Staff is super friendly and attentive to your needs. Rooms are very modern, a bit smaller than I am used to, but it's hard to find a room in TS for the price and location. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's our third stay here, 7 days, which is longer than the previous trips. Hotel manager Mr. Phillip Stamm emailed us upon arrival, asked what we needed. He took care of our reservation, we were able to get early check-in that Sunday morning, with upgrade to Executive Suite as park of Hyatt Globalist member benefits.A special thanks to Mr. Phillip Stamm, a lot of hotel managers are unreachable, or they only come when you experience some issues. But Mr. Stamm is more accessible, he took care our request upon arrival, asked our experience during the middle of my stay. Unlike many of the "diplomatic responses", the way that Mr. Stamm emails guests are welcoming. A manager like him certainly brings Hyatt Centric TS a great success. Front desk agent is great, hotel location is unbeatable. Rooms are modern, as you can see in the pictures, probably the best choice in Times Square area.I am looking forward to stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent Hotel, very clean and great service. Only here for 2 day but should have stayed for 4. When you step outside, all you have to do is walk and you are in the center of every thing. Central Park, Theater district, Time Square and so many other places. Nice gym and a fantastic roof top patio bar. If you want a very clean, place to stay in Time Square that has great service and is located close to may attractions, this is the place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, comfortable rooms with modern decor. One of the few hotels in Times Square that has rooms with 2 queen beds. Exceptional staff and services, great location.It was my second stay and for sure I'll be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric TS combines the glitz and excitement of Times Square with the quality you'd expect from a Hyatt and personalized service and hospitality that makes even a business trip special. I love the location, just off the strip itself, and I really like the ambience, a bit hip, still Hyatt-'esque', and the staff is super helpful and friendly. GM Philip Stamm welcomed us in advance and made sure all was ready for our stay, even to the point of offering with theater tickets and offering staff support. I'll be a frequent visitor here for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Although we have been to NYC many times and often prefer to stay out of the hustle of times square ~ this place was wonderful! clean, not too small, the staff were very accommodating.... and VERY central! if you plan to eat dinner on the roof top patio make sure you make a reservation a couple days prior using the OpenTable App. otherwise you will have to wait for a table.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If your visiting Times Square or going to Shows this Hotel is on our list again. We travel a lot and this was the best Hotel so far. We come every year and will be coming back to the Hyatt in Times Square next yer also.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is the perfect location. Half a block from the frenzy of Times Square, but on a quiet enough street that you could get good sleep without a lot of outside noise. Staff was friendly and we felt safe at all times. Rooms were average size for a hotel, which by NYC standards means that they're large!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My stay was exceptional. Everyone was very nice and respectful. The food and drinks were amazing. The staff was very helpful. I would definitely come back again. I also highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having stayed in NYC a number of times whilst visiting family, in mostly 4 and 5 star hotels, I have no hesitation in declaring the Hyatt Centric the best in quality of accommodation, service and location. The rooms are very comfortable in size and appointment and represent good value, in what is an expensive city for quality, well located hotels. Despite being only 200 metres from TS, it is in a reasonable street and much quieter than most other TS hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You never know what you'll get in NYC when booking a hotel. So many choices, so many reviews, so many locations. Times Square can be a crap shoot. I stay at nothing but Hyatt's across the country and this was the best one I ever stayed in. Rooms beautifully appointed, clean, awesome shower and high floor rooms with views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very hard to fault this hotel. Great tourist location and very modern design.Staff were young and energetic. Location was very safe and only 100 metres from Times Square precinct. 4T5 restaurant on Ground Floor was great for breakfast or even a late snack, whilst Bar 54 on the rooftop offered amazing views.The room we had was spacious enough, nice decor, modern amenities and a good bathroom. All in all it was ver hard to fault this hotel [especially as we got it at a great price]

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I made reservations at this hotel the day before my arrival for $215 a night. Admittedly I was skeptical about what I'd get for the price. However, the room seemed newly remodeled, nicely decorated and was very quiet. There is an awesome rooftop bar on the 54th floor with spectacular views. The Hyatt staff were very friendly and accommodating. My only complaint was the bed was a bit hard for my liking and the pillows provided no support.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel in heart of nyc. Easy to get around and back too. Good value for central location, clean and plenty of choices to eat or just have cocktail nearby. Times square outside your door or quick stroll to most theatres.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of the hotel is excellent for Times Square and Theater district/mid-town Manhattan. Unfortunately this is a high demand destination and the hotel rates in the area are all on the higher side. The room we had was on Floor 37 which was nice for the view, however the room was very small, very little storage for clothing and other items, very small/cramped bathroom. Free guest internet, but only worked occasionally and VERY slow. Not secured connection so only good for basic use when available. Very nice lounge/bar on the roof with a view. Great security for guests. Nice staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location - near everything but located away from crowds. Hotel room was quiet, modern, comfortable. Our room was on the 30th floor and there was no street noise and we have great views. Perfect for a week of theater, shopping, museums, and dining.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location. Excellent amenities. Wonderful decor. Very chic and comfortable. Friendly staff. A bit pricey but worth it. Restaurant is convenient, good menu and price. Liked outdoor patio option for warmer days.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited in March 2016, had what must be the best room in the hotel, level 53 and with a clear view of freedom tower, hotel staff very friendly and efficient. My partner surprised me with a marriage proposal, when we arrived back at the hotel there was a bottle of bubbly and chocolates in our room, very smooth service and very well received. Would recommend this to anyone wanting a central location without being too hustle and bustle.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Prior to arriving we received an email from the Director Of Operations, Alex DeChagas. I let him know it was my birthday week and my bf's first time there. They had put a bottle of wine in the room for us with a note. Very nice! Hotel is centrally located without being right on top of Times Square. Room was nice but unless you pay extra there's no bathtube. Our AC kept going in and out so sometimes at night the room was very stuffy. That was annoying as one of the days it was 92 degrees out. Other than that, hotel was good and we would return

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful stay. Central location to theatre and activities. Great staff and friendly. Gave us late checkout. Very accommodating. Food nearby and they have a great fitness center and spa. The mac and cheese was fabulous and we love staying here

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Two thumbs up with customer service all around, GM sent personalised welcome note prior to arrival to globalist world of Hyatt member, what a nice touch. Definetely recommend the corner suite and Premier Suite, stunning view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything perfect! The room was large compared to the normal size of new york and in the perfect conditions. As a member elite of world of hyatt before I stayed there, they asked me about special requests. I told about my plans for that night (very special occasion) and they made everything looks perfect. Special thanks and I tottaly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked here for a long weekend stay. Booked a deluxe room with city views...where the beds directly faced floor to ceiling windows..when my husband checked in, they told him the room that we booked wasn't available (!) and had upgraded us to a suite...sounded great but when he got to the room was on the 20th floor with no views (facing an office block) . My husband rang up and said it wasn't good enough as we had paid for a view...they then moved him to a higher room but was a standard room and not deluxe which again he said wasn't good enough. So eventually moved him to the 52nd floor suite (only 53 floors with the 54th being roof top bar) . Room was nice...but when I got there was still not happy we didn't get a room where the beds directly face the windows. But fine. When I checked in , I found the staff to be not friendly...the woman on reception was rude and not pleasantries or warm welcome. Had attitude. Didn't tell me anything about the facilities in the hotel.. no one offered to help me with my luggage. Very poor first impression and that stayed with me for the entire stay. No idea where concierge desk was until next day when we asked for a map..and even then they gave us a wrong map and gave us a metro/train map! Carpets in room didn't look very clean and power in shower was not strong. Didn't eat bfast as not included in room rate so better off going to cafes in NY. Had a coffee machine in room...which only had limited number of supplies...green tea and 2 coffees. I'm sure you could ring down and get some...if you don't mind 15 mins wait ...and they provide Starbucks paper cups (!!!) instead of proper cups....this was a Hyatt!!! Room included iron, dryer (was good) , robes and slippers. Free bottled water in room each day. TV /remote was not user friendly and took a few mins to come on each time. Great views from the room but expect that on 52nd floor. Roof bar which was nice and attentive staff but rained the day we went up so didn't sit outside. Location literally 1 min from Times Square and 10 mins to Rockefeller Centre and 20 min max to Central Park. Good location. We also walked to the High Line, Greenwich village, West Village and Meat Packing District. Overall had higher expectations and expected better service from the Hyatt...especially since I had checked out from another hotel arranged by work during the week to stay here at weekend...wasn't particularly worth it. However had we received good service may have thought otherwise. Whilst I was waiting to check out, a guy on reception was checking someone else in and the service he gave that woman was great, giving her details of the facilities available..which I didn't get. Marked difference to my experience. Doorman helped us get a taxi when we left and helped with bag...finally got some attention as we left! Rated it 3 (average) due to views...without that, would be rated a 2 (poor).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice room and professional, warm service team. Got upgraded to view king and was very pleased. The room is well designed and very spacious, especially given how tiny hotel rooms can be on Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric for one night using a free night through a credit card promotion. Given that the stay was free, we cannot comment on the value, but this property compared really well to other hotels we have stayed in in the Times Square area. Staff was professional and friendly. The room was excellent. By NYC standards, it was large (though not huge), the layout and design was excellent - two nightstands with multiple plugs, a large closet, a nice dresser and desk area, large closet with robes,excellent set-up in the bathroom, which was very well sound proofed (unusual in any hotel we have stayed in). The construction of the hotel seemed very solid - we were not disturbed by noise at all - from the city below us, or, other guests around or above us. Bed was very comfortable and it was a good place to come back after a busy day in NY with a wonderful view from the 28th floor. It is very close to Times Square - both a positive (if this is where you want to be) and a negative, only in the sense that it is a very congested area of the city. We wanted a hotel near the theater where we saw a show and it was right down the block, which was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is very convenient to Times Square, Bryant Park and Rockefeller Center. All are within walking distance. Public transportation was convenient as well. Hotel desk staff and housekeeping were great anticipating what we needed without our even asking.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: In the past we have avoided staying near Times Square because it is such a noisy, busy area. We had booked to go to the Theatre and therefore wanted to stay nearby, so Times Square it was. The Hyatt Centric Times Square is very modern with all the facilities that you would expect in a relatively new hotel, such as accessible power points by the bed to charge your smartphone. We chose a larger high floor King room which was a good size by the standards of downtown New York. The room was on the 51st floor and it had a good view south down Manhattan. We were amazed by how quiet the room was; the noisy sirens that regularly pass through Times Square barely registered. The bed was large and very comfortable and it faced the floor to ceiling windows, so you can enjoy the view from the bed but bear in mind that a couple of tower blocks overlook the hotel. The only minor problem was the awkward positioning of the television at the side of the bed. It could be swung out to improve the viewing angle at the expense of partially obstructing access to one side of the bed and in the afternoon it caught the sun and could only be watched with the curtains closed. The bathroom was a generous size, spotlessly clean, and had both a shower and a bath. The bar on the 54th floor is expensive but worth it for the view and we had very good breakfasts and an excellent pre-Theatre dinner in the restaurant. A word of warning about the billing in the bar and restaurant, as is common in New York the bill suggested tip amounts corresponding to 15, 18 and 20%, but in the Hyatt Centric the amounts are worked out on the total amount of the bill not the pre-tax amount which is the correct way of doing it. You don't tip for the tax man!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a really nice 4 night stay at this hotel. The room was nicely updated and a beautiful bathroom. Great location for Time Square, the Theater district, Rockefeller Center, shopping and subway stations. The only reason I am not giving it a 5 star review is because I reserved a Time Square View" and it was not a that at all. It really can't be unless your in the top bar in my opinion.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location between Times Square & 5th Ave, yet remarkably quiet.Fabulous room, tho we did upgrade to a Queen with a view....very spacious with great bathroom. Roof top bar has stunning views.But most importantly staff were amazing....we were celebrating my daughters 18th & the hotel organised a gorgeous cake & made a beautiful keepsake picture for her. Admit we did have an issue with payment that I didn't discover until we got home but the hotel sorted it all out with minimum fuss. Great time all round !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights at the end of April. We had a room on the 28th floor. The hotel was very comfortable and rooms a good size. The hotel restaurant was used twice for breakfast during our stay and was very good, prices were higher than nearby options but that was to be expected. There are plenty of places to eat as alternatives. The rooftop bar on the 54th floor was excellent. Three visits and numerous cocktails, beer and wines along with stunning views were hard to beat and all the better for being in our hotel.Check in and out went smoothly and all contact with staff went well. Remember to tip your room maid daily, it makes a whole lot of difference. One missed morning illustrated this immediately!Would happily return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff where very professional. Hotel was clean and is well positioned in an excellent location. Nothing was to much to ask on hotel staff and if we needed anything extra towels etc it was at our door in less then 5 minutes- I would definelty stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of the best friendly hotel in the city of New YorkStaffs are great. Food is alright. Will definitely recommended to to all travelers. Price is okay. If you want to see the city and rest after a day of walking. This is the place. Place that will treats you like you're home

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square is one of those hotels where your room looks exactly like the picture on their website... always nice not to be disappointed. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. Bar 54, the rooftop bar, is not to be missed on a sunny day or a warm evening... great views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have been to hotels all over the world, and I'm here to tell you that these people at this Hotel wrote the book on CUSTOMER SERVICE. From the Team Member who opens the door to the Limo when we arrive, to the Team Members on the front desk, to the Management Team, to the GM and everyone in between, they are all First Class and make you feel at home. The entire Hotel is clean spotless and in excellent condition. The location is excellent and the view of Times Square from the upper floors is spectacular, truly amazing. Highly Recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice hotel right in the middle of Times Square . Ideal location . Broadway within easy walk . Hotel staff were very good and upgraded our room slightly as it was my wife's 50th. Staff very helpful . Just a word of warning . Bar prices are stupidly expensive . Beer and a baileys $25. Small shop on same street you can buy any supplies after a long day without paying bar prices . Likewise the breakfast . Paid $70 and it was nothing special

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here in September 2016 and felt underwhelmed. During my stay this past weekend (May 2017), I can see that the hotel has made great strides in every aspect - customer service, how nice the room is, and everything else. Literally zero complaints on my end. I would choose this property over the other Hyatt properties I've stayed at in New York (Grand, Andaz, etc).It was a rainy weekend, and the staff did a great job keeping out the wet, dirty, touristy times square grossness. It was like stepping into a different world. Thanks for the great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beds are very firm, staff is friendly, view is gorgeous! Tips of 18% are included in room service. Room service is also delievered in take out style, which surprised me. The food tasted straight. The rooms do not have a lot of storage. Furniture is a little cheap. I kind of expected the room to be a little more luxury than it was.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place is fresh and modern. Location is the best - just beyond the hustle-n-bustle yet right around the corner from all the action of Times Square. Staff was fabulous. Take in the Bar at the Top Floor. Place was safe with obvious attention to security. We will book there again on our next getaway visit to the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just had two wonderful nights at the Hyatt Centric. The location is ideal, Just a few steps from Times Square, yet far enough away on 45th St. to be quiet. Check in was a breeze, and speaking of a breeze, if you stay here, you must check out the rooftop lounge on the 54th floor! Great views, with a well designed interior. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. If I return in the future, and I need to be in this part of New York, this is where we'll stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Location with amazing stuff who really wanted to assist with anything and everything. The restaurant stuff was extremely accommodating to us as well as to elderly guests that were sitting in the near by table!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, pretty much right in the middle of time square. We requested a higher floor which was nice but since we're Hyatt Platnium members, we expected a higher floor then the 35th floor since there's 54 floors in the hotel. The lobby is fairly small and the so call security guards were busier playing with there cell phones rather then watching the people entering. Front staff clerks were very friendly along with the valet attendants. Tho when we made our reservations, we were informed that the valet was $75. Per 24 hours with in and out services. That was definitely not the case. If you take your vehicle out and revalet it again, you will be billed another $75. Not very happy at all about that.They do give you free bottle water and coffee at request which was nice but still steaming about the valet fees. I believe you can literally park your own vehicle across the street in the parking lot yourself for $40. a night but we were to lazy plus we had our elderly parents with us so we paid for the valet service. If we decide to visit Time Square again, we'll probably stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel itself is located on 45th street, between 6th avenue and Broadway so it's just a few steps down to the popular place - Times Square. This is superb location - not too busy street but yet in the midst of all the happenings in NYC.Before I reached NYC, I was told not to expect much from hotel in NY but Hyatt Centric Times Square proved it wrong. As soon as I stepped into the lobby, the staff was so useful especially the staff at reception desk. They're friendly and prompt to attend to me. This is very impressive. It only took me less than 5 minutes to check in (though there're a lot of people checking in at the same time.) 5/5 starsMy room was on the high floor, so it's away from noise. I booked King Size bedroom and the size of the room is very spacious as you can see from the photos. The bathroom is very well maintained. The bed is so comfy. The interior design of the room is modern and sleek. This is really what I looked for.If you have time, don't forget to check out their rooftop bar on 54th floor. Great View!! I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and definitely when I come back I will stay at Hyatt Centric again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our trip to NYC this past week was a special milestone birthday celebration for my father. When we visit NYC, we usually stay uptown and this time decided to stay near Times Square. We were a bit nervous the hotel was so close to the hustle and bustle of Times Square however, after staying here, this will be our hotel of choice going forward. The hotel has a sophisticated boutique look and feel. The guest rooms are very clean with a mid-century modern design and floor to ceiling windows. We were on a high floor overlooking Times Square - do consider upgrading to a higher floor. It’s worth it. Also, we never heard our neighbours or any traffic through the hallways. The hotel’s location is perfect. You are between 6th and 7th Avenue on 45th Street. Although the hotel is right beside Times Square, it’s on a very quite and secluded street. The hotel is between 2 major metro lines, both in walking distance. It’s about a 10-15 walk to central park. Fifth avenue is a couple blocks away. Forgo the Empire State Building and head up to Bar54. The views are stellar. Additionally, we would like to sincerely thank the Director of Operations, Alex DeChagas for his personal touch and his profound impact on our experience at the hotel. Overall, the hotel’s location, rooms, staff are absolutely lovely. We look forward to returning to Hyatt Centric Times Square very soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have visited New York many times in the past but this was my Wife’s first time so I scheduled the trip as being a Pre-Birthday Surprise. Normally my wife is the Director of Operations when it comes to vacations, but as mentioned this was a surprise so it was all on me to make it the best I could. I started with a weeks’ worth of review Hotels On Trip Advisor, reading reviews etc. On the sixth day I narrowed it down to ten hotels. From there I narrowed it even further based on location and proximity.My end result was three hotels located in the Times Square area, which is where we wanted to be. Keeping in mind New York is not the most budget friendly place to visit so if I was paying I wanted to be sure the amenities were there and I wouldn’t be chastising myself later for a bad decision. So I bit the bullet and registered at the Hyatt Centric Time Square, within 2 hours of me registering on line, I received an email from the Director Of Operations Alexander Dechagas. It was the common return email – thanks for registering with Hyatt. However I had allot of questions about the Hotel, transportation from Airport. So I hit the reply and sent Mr. Dechagas a simple email asking where the exact location of the Hotel is and how far from Time Square. Not soon after I received another email back, Alex gave me the exact location and three options for transportation from the airport. Like many of us it’s sometimes hard to put your faith into someone else and the decision making but after numerous emails between Alex and myself he finally said, No worries on anything – my team is ready for your arrival I got this covered. With that I changed my focus on our 4 day itinerary and left the rest in Alex’s hands.We left Detroit around 8:30 and arrived at LaGuardia around 1030pm, there is allot of construction going on outside so traffic was a mess, after looking around outside for a bit we walked back into the baggage claim and there was a man standing there with a sign with our name on it. My first thought was Alex, wow wasn’t expecting that, I played it cool and told my wife, your chauffer is waiting for us. She smiled and said oh my gosh what did you do. Well off to the Hotel we went it took us approximately and hour with all the traffic but to be honest we were in a limo so we weren’t in a hurry. We arrived around 11:50pm at the Hyatt and the staff was already waiting for us, check in was fast, pointed us to our elevators and off we went. We were issued Room 4504 overlooking time square. The view was beyond amazing and my wife was smiling ear to ear. We put the bags down and off to time square so she could get the real feel of New York.So the Hyatt Centric in Time Square sits about a 3 minute walk off 45th street, once you get on the corner you are literally in the middle of Time Square. Our room was a mini suite with a king size bed, small living room and huge bathroom, it may sound expensive but honestly it wasn’t too bad – especially for the location we were at. I posted pictures in this review of our room and view. The hotel is very clean, very friendly staff. The only improvement I can comment on was the morning breakfast at the hotel. Our food wasn’t cooked properly and it is on the high end of the cost chain. Other than that I would really have to search for any other issues. As aforementioned the staff was incredible.Steve and Walter worked the front doors, assisting customers with luggage, hailing cabs always smiling, very friendly very professional these two guys were absolutely awesome, Abigail Kahl (Office Manager) at the front desk was undeniably the highlight of the mornings, always smiling greeting us and other guests as we walked by, asking if there is anything anyone needed offering assistance with directions, I can go on and on, she had everything covered.Check out was just as smooth as the check in, I actually did it on line before leaving our room, dropped my key the box walking out the front door and there was Steve and Walter waiting for the baggage interception. Perfect play all the way around.If you plan on visiting New York short or long term I strongly suggest Hyatt Centric Time Square – if you do tell Alex, Abby, Steve and Walter – Steve and Mary say hello This is the best service team we have encountered in a long time and they have raised the bar considerably – tough act to follow that’s for sure On a scale of 1 – 10 (10 being best) here is how I rate the Hyatt Centric Time SquareHotel Service = Solid 10Hotel Location = 10Room Décor = 10Room Cleanliness = 10Housekeeping = 10Hotel Restaurant Service = 7Hotel Restaurant Food = 3 Hope this helps if you’re traveling, please feel free to ask any questions Ciao for Now – Steve

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just returned from a 6 day trip to New York . The facilities are very good in the hotel . Great views from rooftop bar but drinks are very pricey here . We had dinner in T45 restaurant which was very good . Room was fine , clean with lovely bathroom . Great location

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I usually stay at the Hyatt Centric for my business travel. It feels more like boutique hotel with a small lobby and only about a dozen rooms per floor, but 54 floors high. The rooms and bathrooms are reasonable in size for Manhattan, especially Times Square. I've stayed in the suites, which are relatively small. The floor to ceiling windows offer nice views at higher floor rooms as well the rooftop bar. The decor is clean and modern, but not trendy. Service has always been good during my stays. Also, the dining at T45 is actually very good. I think Hyatt Centric is a much better hotel than the Westin New York in Times Square, which has smaller and outdated rooms, cramped bathrooms and poor service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have had an excellent stay in this very good hotel off Times Sq. the location of the hotel is perfect for exploring the city and the hotel itself is of a very good quality. I had a king room with a view which was simple yet spacious and very comfortable with a truly beautiful view of the Paramount building. The staff was very friendly, professional and very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Service was extraordinary. Especially appreciated the curb help when we were checking in. We had a rental car to drop off so were unloading a lot of stuff and then our husbands took the car and left. It was raining and would have been impossible for my sister and I alone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice modern hotel in a good location to Times Square and the theatre, ate breakfast in the hotel, nothing special and expensive, rooftop bar great view but again expensive $65 for three drinks!Our room was spacious not much storage space for 3 people, dust everywhere, towels not changed every day, too hot and air con noisy.The reason I wouldn't go back is because the staff were not friendly, would rather a small hotel with more of a personal reception stayed last time in Fitzpatrick grand central 10-15 from Times Square, 2 mins from grand central loved it. Only chose one off Times Square because I thought it would have been easier for my mum.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We drove to NYC over spring break and had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. The location was perfect for taking in a Broadway show and finding good food and shopping. The valet parking was seamless, and the accommodations were wonderful. Nice gym and good eats in the restaurant downstairs. Loved that the duvet is your top sheet like you might find on beds in Europe. So nice to have a crisp, clean cover on the bed! The only suggestions we would make are: 1. Be sure the bathroom doors are cleaned and 2. Please consider switching to different pillows! They're down, and they flatten to nothing the moment you lay your head on them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Phillip and Abigail and their staff were so terrific. We had received pre trip communication and they helped us w great NYC tips and recommendations and entire staff was friendly and courteous. Our room was quiet and clean and we loved the location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the time we arrived; everyone from parking valet to room attendant were superior. Personalized attention from front desk staff and everyone we encountered in the hotel. The staff was very well trained and extremely helpful and courteous. Nothing was left to chance. Clean, beautiful room and excellent, attentive staff. The breakfast was outstanding. Definitely my preferred stop when I visit NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The area is in the top ten. Customer etiquette needs to be improved at the front desk. My job is as an International Banking Manager Customer Satisfaction and I would not tolerate such interaction. In my role you treat the janitor with the same respectas the CEO.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My girlfriends & I had a lovely 2 night weekend stay. Our room was big, clean & very quiet. The location is very convenient. The staff was friendly without being annoying. it was a birthday celebration & we returned to our room to find brownies & champagne. What a nice surprise!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed two nights for business then an extra night for fun. Great hotel, good location, great room, fantastic view, friendly staff! There's a lot of hotels I could have chosen from in New York City, I'm glad I chose this one. Thank you Hyatt Centric!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location in NYC! Just off Times Square and within easy walking distance to several areas. Room and bathroom are very clean and modern. Very nice Roof bar but with pricey drinks. Very friendly staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I have just returned from a week in New York ...the hotel was central to everything we wanted to see most main attractions within walking distance ...check in was swift rooms are modern and very clean ...we were on the 8th floor ...our view wasn't great if you want rooftop views ask for a much higher floor ..the room had an ironing board ..iron mini fridge and safe ...a large tv room service was available at set times ...the hair dryer was excellent though the only place to plug it in was the bathroom ..in front of the mirror ...we don't have plug points in our bathroom but obviously something they have in the US...there was a full length mirror next to the large wardrobe but no plug points ...a coffee machine was available and pods supplied no kettle if you prefer tea...the coffee much too strong for us ...rooms cleaned everyday and bottled water replaced daily ...an ice machine located just outside our room too ...the room also had good air conditioning and easy to use all staff were helpful pleasant and courteous...breakfast was available on the ground floor eat inside or out very expensive but the setting was lovely ...bar 54 on the roof has amazing views over Manhattan ....cocktails again very expensive at $26 each we didnt mind as we did expect that wow factor but we only got that from the views not the drinks ...average cocktail prices between $10/$15 elsewhere....but this hotel is just a couple of minutes walk from Times Square and I would recommend it for anyone wanting to see the sights or take in a show on Broadway

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel rooms are spacious and the bathrooms and the shower are top of the line as are the electronics. Push one button and all the lights go on or go off. The staff is very responsive to questions or needs. We were on the 49th floor and it was very quiet even though we were close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My first stay at the Hyatt Centric Times Square, and while my stay was brief, the staff were pleasant and the room spacious when compared to some other Hyatt properties. The hotel is right off 7th Avenue and right in the heart of Times Square, yet far enough away that you don't get all the noise of being on Times Square. Overall good value and excellent location if you're visiting for fun.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Currently staying here with our two young kids. This is our first time staying in a Hyatt Centric. This property has a more boutique feel and doesn't seem like it was designed for family travel but hotel employees have all been very friendly and accommodating, in particular the front desk. Service has been wonderful.The location is literally just a few steps away from the craziness of Times Square, convenient for Broadway shows and the subway. There is a Roommate hotel next door. The rooftop bar seems very popular as evidenced by the number of people holding special key cards to take the elevator up in the evenings. As far as we've noticed the hotel seems to have one or two attendants checking to make sure people going up the elevators are either hotel guests or patrons of the rooftop bar holding the proper access key. Room size is in line with other NYC hotels with a modern decor. Our standard room has two queen beds, a mini fridge, small safe, Keurig machine, spacious shower (no tub). Our only complaint is the cleanliness of the room. When we arrived many of the areas of the room were quite dusty. One area of the desk had a layer of white particles on it. The metal shelf under the mirror in the bathroom also had a visible layer of dust as did the shelf above the bed. So far none of these area were addressed by the housekeeping that came yesterday. Worst of all though was the pair of dirty left behind underwear that the kids discovered next to the standing lamp. Really?! Yech. But one more positive thing - the wifi quality is very good and free.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We absolutely loved staying at this hotel. Explained that it was my partners birthday and could they arrange something special. We got above and beyond that. $50 to spend in the roof top bar, a bottle of champagne and brownies!!!! Every request was met promptly and effectively. Would 100% recommend this clean, stylish, modern, friendly hotel!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I did not realize it until midway through our stay that the staff was genuinely friendly and were happy to be working there. That made for a very comfortable stay. The hotel is clean and the food is great. Matched with the personnel you cannot find better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You won't be disappointed from management to cleaning staff. Makes you feel like you are the only guest in the hotel. It the only place to stay when in NYC. Make sure to check out the highest roof top bar in the city

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here 4-17-17 thru 4-22-17, we arrived early that morning and were going to store our luggage until check-in time which was at 4:00 pm. The receptionist checked to see if our room was ready, and it was, so she allowed us to go ahead and check in. We were on the 25th floor. The room was amaculate the view was breathtaking, the bathroom was large and the walk in shower was heavenly. The beds were very comfortable and roomy. Our room stewardess Ms. Betty, made sure we were well taken care of ( Very sweet friendly lady). All of the Hotel Staff were very Friendly. Anytime you enter the Hotel lobby, you have too show your room key before you can take the elevator. They have a restaurant next to the lobby that also spills out onto the sidewalk, it was very good, we ate breakfast, and Dinner there. It sits between 6th and 7th Avenue on 45th street. About middle ways of the block, just steps from Times Square.We are already anticipating our next visit. Stay here, you won't be disappointed!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Close to Time Square and Broadway, the hotel is clean with nice beds and WiFi. Bathroom is a decent size, and I liked the reading lamps and mood lighting. Try for a higher floor to avoid the street noise. 35 was fine.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First the location- perfect just off Times Square in a great road with a fab selection of pubs around. The downstairs bar was great for people watching but bar 54 was my favourite! Outside views on a great sunny day right down to the world trade centre and over to the Chrysler. Just stunningThe room was clean and well equipped. The bathroom was spacious, telly was huge and the bed was very comfy. The mood lighting was a great touch as well. We stayed in 1210 which was a great room at the back of the hotel very quite but no great view but it's New York so that didn't bother me as your never in the room really. All staff were extremely helpful. My only gripe would be that on three of the five mornings there a fire alarm announcement was made that it was being tested which woke us u two of the the three days. That being said I'd rather know that if there was a fire the alarm was working.My only other concern was the cleaning staff. They did a fantastic job but their personal conversations with one another in the hallways was both loud and unprofessional especially when they are talking about their employer and personal matters.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have done a lot of traveling over the years, (I am a Hyatt Gobalist and Diamond member with Hitlon). In my thirty years of traveling to NYC, and having stayed at many hotels, (including The Plaza and The Waldorf), no one, and I state no one, has treated us better than the way we were treated this weekend. The attention to my emails/requests prior to out visit, and the enjoyable time we had during our visit to the hotel, T45 and B45, left us not wanting for anything. This hotel is at the top of my list.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excelent choice for a stay in NYC. Close to all major turistic hot spots. Easy foot access to subway, train, taxis, etc. Nice and friendly staff. Rooms urban decorated with modern forniture. Upper floors south view are excelent. In spite of being located in Times Square, its calm and peacefull Hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited Hyatt Centric Times Square on 27-29 April 2017. The location is excellent. Its crawling distance from Times Square. We arrived with 2 suitcases and 2 handbags. The door wasn't held open by the doorman and he was just looking at us as we stumbled into the hotel. We experienced this as negative.Then we got our room key, 43rd floor. What a view! The room was nice and tidy. New appliances, clean bathroom and toilet and well isolated walls. Had no sound issues what so ever. The curtains let quite some light through though, so at 7am we would wake up. NYC is alive and kicking at 7am of course, but as we arrived at the hotel at 3am in the morning, would've been nice to be able to sleep at least 2 more hours.The sky bar was also excellent on top of the hotel. Again, what a view!Now the bad part was the price. For 2 nights we paid $680. The day before arriving at the hotel, we saw rooms for $220/night all around Times Square. So according to us, a little overpriced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is a great choice if you want to be in Times Square but don't want in the full flashing chaos of the center of it all. It is quiet, clean, modern and accommodating. Nice big rooms. The restaurant is solid and the bar has great views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was welcoming and helpful, especially Eva. The bar on floor 54 was a nice experience although the server seemed confused, maybe new. She was so focused on getting her menu back. We just wanted to keep it in case we ordered again. I consider this a separate experience from the hotel. But she was weird.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
