review_body: Hyatt Centric is in a great location, has tremendous staff, big clean rooms that are artfully and tastefully decorated, and is overall a great hotel! You will NOT be disappointed at all by staying here. It's perfect NYC everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here a couple years ago (Fall 2014) and had a good experience. Not so this time around. The hotel hasn't aged well. One of my drawers easily came off its runners. My colleague had a laundry list of things wrong with her room and didn't have time to get management to fix them. I think it has gotten fairly hard usage from tourists.Also, I stayed here for business. It's nicely located for tourists, just a half-block east of Times Square (so you don't have to cross Times Square, which is a zoo, to get to your hotel.) A half block from 6th Avenue and three blocks north of the 42nd St, subway station (Lines 1-2-3-N-Q-R-W-S and B-D-F-M a block away at 42nd & 6th.) So the location for transport is excellent. Three blocks north of Bryant Park, too, which is among my favorite places in NYC.The problem for me (up at 6:30 and meetings each morning ) is that, on each of the four evenings I stayed, late night revelers woke me up around 2 a.m. as they stumbled back from partying. One night a man in one of the adjoining rooms got into a screaming fight over the phone with someone.The staff were excellent however, from the front desk ones (I'm a Gold Passport member and they treated me well) to the lovely and efficient housekeeping staff. The room was clean, modern, the bed very comfortable. One must close the curtains at night or the lights from the giant signs in Times Square can keep you awake depending on how your room is oriented (I was on the back of the hotel and my bed was on the east wall. If you're on the back and the bed is on the west wall, as mine was during my 2014 visit, it isn't a problem.) The gym is well-appointed.I plugged the steam iron into the desk outlet and it wouldn't heat up. I called housekeeping as I thought the iron was broken. The attendant kindly pointed out that the desk outlets are low-amperage and I should plug the iron into the wall socket underneath the desk. That fixed the problem. Next time (in July) I'll probably stay up north off 6th. Perhaps the Park Hyatt on 59th or a smaller boutique hotel, away from Times Square and (I hope) the hordes of tourists.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having visited New York before we were expecting a tiny room with dated decoration, however we were pleasantly surprised to find a fairly large room with a nice bathroom and rainfall shower.It more than suited our needs for a girly shopping holiday and was better than the W in terms of standard of room.It's in a great location between Times Square and fifth avenue.The only downside I would say is that the staff are very impersonal as quite abrupt at times, but this did not spoil our time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visit NYC once or twice a year and have been staying at this Hyatt for the past few years whenever we visit. We like the location, the rooftop lounge and the rooms are comfortable. This time we visited family and friends and took in two shows. The staff is very accommodating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. we were on honeymoon and when we got back to our room after first day exploring they had left us a lovely bottle of bubbles and some chocolate. Staff are very friendly. The location is great for a first visit to NYC, I'm not sure having been now and got my bearing I would stay right in the middle of Times Square again but I loved every minute. The prices in the rooftop bar of hotel are really dear. There is a bar called Jimmy's corner on 44th (one street down) where drinks are really cheap! Do all your sightseeing, have a nice dinner and head to Jimmy's, it's really nothing fancy but great atmosphere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed for six nights at Hyatt Centric while attending performances at the nearby Times Square theaters. My room was spotless, conveniently laid out and quite large by Manhattan hotel standards. Our tour group enjoyed the second-floor meeting room for our post-show discussions, and hotel employees kept us happy on those occasions with snacks and drinks. The hotel's rooftop bar offers exceptional views (from Floor 54) and tasty (if overpriced) cocktails. Staff were pleasant and helpful. My only suggestion for improvement concerns the breakfast service in the main-floor restaurant, as there were frequent delays in getting orders filled on most mornings, and servers seemed quite territorial as to their stations. I'd happily return here the next time I come to NYC for Broadway shows. The principal theaters are nearly all just a few blocks away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We cannot praise the staff, the amenities and room service highly enough. Room view was lovely towards the Paramount Building in Times Square - the envy of our UK friends when they saw the photos!We stayed April 12 to 15 for my 50th birthday treat and it couldn't have been better with helpful staff and great location. Recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in a great location and is walking distance from most of the big attractions.The staff were very friendly on arrival and had me checked-in and out very quickly. I had already paid for my room in advance, so they only reserved $100 on my credit card, contrary to other advice I read on the internet before I arrived which said it would be $100 for every nights' stay. So that was good. I had a room on the 30th floor which offered nice views of the surrounding area - pretty at night when everything's lit up. The room had a large comfy bed with white linens. Slippers and a dressing gown were provided in the very large wardrobe which was handy. I really liked the coffee machine in the room, which came with Starbucks capsules. I personally don't enjoy the basic Nespresso machines usually provided in hotels, the taste of the coffee from this machine was much nicer. My only quam is that no tea was provided - although I was told just to ask for it if I wanted it. As I was constantly out and getting back late, I didn't bother troubling them for it, but I feel they should've just put it in the room to start with. The room had a fridge in it which was empty, so it was handy for storing some drinks and snacks if you're up early the next day. The wifi connection was pretty good - no problems there. Check-out time was 11am, which I think is quite early! But I suppose I could've asked if there was any leeway. I would recommend staying in this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I celebrated my 50th Birthday on April 24th. Richie met us when we arrived at the front desk. He really took care of us. He upgraded us to a suite. I found a Happy Birthday card and bottle of champagne in the room! Thank you! The executive suite on the 23rd floor facing 45th street was amazing. We could see a bit of Times Square from the window. Fantastic View. The hotel is literally steps from the Center of Times Square. The suite is large and the bathroom and amenities are top-notch. Very comfortable bed, large screen TV, fridge, complimentary coffee maker, very clean, etc. The Roof Top bar was absolutely awesome! The atmosphere, the bartenders, the servers - first class! And the view! Wow... ! We toured the gym, new equipment, towels, very clean, tons of weights and machines for everyone. The Spa floor - awesome. No massage this time - wasn't enough time. We had brekfast the next morning in the restaurant. Great food, presentation, etc! Thanks to all that made my 50th Birthday memorable in New York City. We will absolutely return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stay here and be in the thick of all the Big Apple has to offer. Stay here and save coin for plays and playing in the city that never sleeps. Stay here and feel at home with caring ,congenial staff and most of the amenities of the grand hotels without the 'tude. Do yourself and your loved ones a favor just stay here when visiting the world's greatest City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here last week. Overall very nice hotel. Stayed on 33 floor was quiet except for when sirens of fire trucks or police diving by. Stayed in in double queen room. Not much room for luggage, most NY hotels rooms are not real big. Was a good place to stay and explore the city. Near many attractions and close to Times Square subway station. Very nice views of city from rooftop bar. For breakfast I would recommend the cranberry cafe/deli a couple of doors down. I would stay here again. Recommend requesting a high floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here to be close to the church and venues for our son's wedding. The hotel was clean and beautiful; the staff gracious and accommodating. The only drawback for me was that I couldn't bring my custom pillow so I was not as comfortable sleeping at night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I could not be more pleased and impressed with this Hyatt hotel. They have truly gone above and beyond to make our stay memorable and I can not thank them enough for all of the extras and surprises. My wife thinks I am a hero thanks to them When they told me they would "take care of everything" I had no idea how true that statement would be.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were very happy with the noise level on the room, the location and how well the installations are maintained. The only drawbacks were that there was no hot water on our last day either on the shower and sink and also that the room had no drawers for clothes only a small closet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything was the way it should be on your holiday. Very clean and all the staff was very friendly and always willing to help you. Even if we were supposed to check in around 4 pm they checked us in earlier with no problem. They cared about usDefinitely we will go there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first time staying at the Hyatt Centric Times Square but it won't be my last. I usually prefer staying at Hyatts but this property went above and beyond. My husband contacted the manager to do something special for my birthday. Without asking, the manager arranged for a free suite upgrade and early check in. My husband requested rose petals be placed throughout the room and he wasn't even charged! They also have us a $75 food and beverage credit.The rooms are quite modern so don't expect a pre war room. It was clean and private, not to mention the fabulous view that included Times Square.The property is convenient to everything! So happy to find my new favorite hotel in the city!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: During a recent Theater week in NYC, friends and I reserved rooms at the beautiful Hyatt Centric on West 45th. Located in the heart of the Theater District, mere steps from many of the best Broadway shows in town, the Hyatt Centric provides a contemporary, comfortable respite just far enough off Times Square. Unfortunately, this otherwise wonderful resort with a full spa, and gorgeous roof top bar, is severely lacking in one area. Food. Room service, specifically. Like many hotels, their room service menu is shamefully overpriced, but what is particularly shameful is the method in which its delivered. Small portions squeezed into un-environmentally friendly plastic containers and paper bags. No plates. No linens. No silverware. No class, whatsoever. And absolutely NO jam for your toast (no matter how many days in a row you request it, and no matter how often you remind them). At best it resembles the cheapest possible take-out from the most unimpressive of diners (but at posh Hotel Brunch prices). At worst, something your bland Aunt Fanny might have packed for you in a brown paper bag when she was baby-sitting (which wouldn't last any further than the nearest dumpster on the way to school). Visit and stay at the Hyatt Centric for it's chic rooms & spa & roof top bar....but be warned. Do not order their room service. It will undermine your entire experience at this property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is an awesome location. It has a great outdoor eating area, steps away from broadway and Time Square and a super cool roof top bar. I loved it. The rooms were clean and updated. I would def come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Centric in times square helpful and friendly staff , hotel is very clean rooms are big and bright Location is great right next door is our favourite pub The Perfect Pint

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First and foremost the staff, they were all great, friendly, helpful and each seemed to appreciate us being there, From check-in to check-out and even a little assistance after check-out all was fast and smooth. Room was small by normal standards but fine by NYC standards. Room cleanliness very good-spotless, bed comfortable, options to plug in any device you need in room. Lobby and hallways also well cleaned, elevators needed a little work though. HVAC system responded quickly to change in weather cold damp to sunny. Shower could have been a bit hotter but everything else in room worked fine. Some rooms have great city views as does sky lounge. Location cannot be beat though you have a 6-7 good choices in the area I would put Hyatt Centric near the top,

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel meets all requirements and is 100% convenient. Nice rooms some with balcony. Fitness. Spa. Food. Rooftop bar hot. The location is in the center of everything and it seems so many things were just a short walk away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We've stayed here several times and recently stayed again. It's our hotel of choice when we visit the city. Rooms are modern, comfortable and clean. Love the bedding. It's a quiet hotel that has an excellent location. It's a 15-20 minute walk from Penn Station (even with luggage). It's 30 seconds from Times Square, but not right in it, which is a good thing. Walking distance to 5th Avenue, Central Park, and many other attractions. The T45 restaurant patio is a great place to do some people watching and enjoy a drink and some great food. Special mention to Rebecca and John for the great service. You made our last night in the city a memorable one. Much appreciated. The staff is friendly and helpful. There's always someone to greet you on the way in, and on the way out, and they have security measures in place to ensure the safety of the guests. I highly recommend this hotel and we WILL return again. Feel free to message me with any questions. More than happy to help you plan your trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights myself, husband and toddler ( 20 months) Had a room on 21st floor. Room clean, big enough for the 3 of us. Bed comfortable- bathroom good- v good shower. Travel cot provided when we arrived and duvet provided for our toddler when we asked for it. Coffee maker was a great feature and cups and pods provided each day. The small fridge was ideal for keeping milk etc for our toddler. We used the restaurant for some breakfasts and once for an evening meal. Was very nice but quite expensive for what you get. Location ideal for Times Square, broadway etc. But the great positive - room was very quiet considering how near we were. Italian restaurant on the floor above planet hollywood (just a few doors down from the hotel) is def worth a visit! Would stay again if looking for a hotel near Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: want a mid-town / times square experience with mid-west attitude ? Hyatt Centric is what you want ... great staff, excellent facilities, super restaurant and sky lounge ... walking distance to everything worthwhile in mid-town

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Centric last year. It was so good we came back. Hyatt Centric have gone above and beyond on our stay and we are so overwhelmed by the hospitality. My partner and I returned this year to be married and for my birthday. I tried my luck by contacting the Hyatt to see if a room with a view would be possible to surprise my wife to be. I didn't expect anything to come of it, but when we arrived.....wow.The view and terrace was out of this world. They have even hand wrote a note welcoming us and offered us a bottle of champagne and roses. This was above anything I expected! Our flight home was an evening flight so I enquired about late check out. They said no problem and asked us what time we wanted to leave! They also gave us a free first round of drinks for my birthday in the roof top bar! I never knew what real service was until I came here. Absolute world class.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is clean, comfortable, and in a great location. This is the second time we have stayed here and both experiences have been wonderful. Staff is always helpful and welcoming. There is so much to do within walking distance. We can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is new and in great shape. The rooms were just the right size and well decorated. Every employee we interacted with was kind and helpful. The hotel was quiet. We never heard any noise. The barrooms are spacious and pretty. Loved the spacious overhead shower.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I needed a clean updated place to stay than offered a quiet room in Times Square. This hotel fit my needs. I paid extra for a higher floor room and was given one on the 50th floor. Up here one could still hear the constant hum of the city but it was a lot more quiet than what I would expect on a lower floor. I'm a light sleeper so the volume of ambient noise was pretty low enabling me to get a good nights sleep. I think it also helps that the hotel is located just off Broadway itself - just half a block a way makes a big difference. Overall the place is pretty clean and has a contemporary vibe. Lobby is relatively small and not conducive to lounging. Rooms too were a bit small, which is expected however for its location. Bedding and mattress were comfortable. Front desk staff were pretty nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros: cleanliness, spacious, updated, friendly staff Cons: noise from street even on upper floor I would not recommend staying so near to Times Square unless you have to, and if you do, this is a very nice hotel at which to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very happy we chose your hotel for our New York vacation. The hotel is so welcoming, clean and perfectly located. We recieved a quite room in high floor with a nice view on times square. I would defiantly recommend your hotel to anyone asking me for a good hotel in NY. All our special requests were treated immediately and perfectly! We enjoyed our stay in the hotel very much!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Despite an initial mess up with the room we had booked (back in July last year) this was quickly sorted out the following day to the room we had originally booked and with a $100 credit for the hotel restaurant for the inconvenience. After this everything was great and the staff were very friendly and helpful. In a great spot 2 minutes off Times Square but still relatively quiet if you have a room on a higher floor. Three Irish bars and a Deli right on the doorstep too. Fantastic view from the bar on the 54th floor too. Would definitely stop here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was lovely. In a perfect spot to everything. Walking distance to where ever you need to go, subway, buses, food shops etc, etc. Stuff were lovely. Rooms were clean. Concierge was great, always very help full. Restaurant was good. Would be staying there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was a fantastic location for all attractions in times square and is also close to several subway stations. The rooms are modern, spacious and immaculately clean. By far the best hotel I stayed at while travelling the USA.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great experience, good location, could have used extra pillows and light sheets.Will be happy to stay again and recommend to others as well. Missed seeing the rooftop deck. Perhaps a sitter would have helped :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just got back from Easter weekend in Manhattan with my wife and teen daughter. The hotel was a great stay. We did not notice any of the 'problems' mentioned in previous reviews. The room (34th floor) was a good size for the 3 of us. The rollaway bed was in place when we opened the door. The room was clean, and we didn't notice any noise at all. The blackout curtains helped a lot. We did not go up to the roof top lounge, as we were scared away by other people mentioning high drink prices. The lobby bar has Happy Hour prices ($6 pints of beer!) from 4-6 pm daily, which compared to the rest of NYC is priced very well. We ate breakfast on the last day, and the food was good, but priced pretty high - typical for hotel breakfasts.The hotel was everything we expected. Efficient, clean and well run. Our room was clean and there were no disappointments. I would recommend that all guests not eat anywhere near Times Square, as prices are way too high for what you get.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean property, modern, and good location if you are looking for a midtown destination closer to Times Sq. Get a high room to reduce the the street noise. The manager Paola went above and beyond for us. Would visit again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What you need in nyc. Grate location and views. Good room, location and friendly personal.Godd gym My hotel for the next trip to nyc. There is some damage in de room. Need to mantein the rooms like years before.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There are no negatives with this hotel, the staff were excellent as was the location, at checking in we were offered water while we waited they also have complimentary fresh cookies at reception every day (nice touch) - room/bathroom was immaculate, very spacious and very modern décor. We were in a view room of times square. Would highly recommend and will defo stay here again if visiting New York. Abby & Julia were our main points of contact and they were refreshingly pleasant and efficient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and good sized rooms (for NY).Arrived at 5pm but only 2 of the 3 rooms were available. One couple had to wait until 6.30pm to access their room.Our room was not cleaned on one day.Some reception staff were officious and unfriendly.Doorman was very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: took my family of four for four days in New York. We stayed here because I had enough points to get a free night. Hotel was right in the heart of time square, which is wonderful if that's the experience you want. It's New York crowded with all the hussle and bussle you'd expect. Hotel was clean, well appointed. Staff was excellent. Service was great. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Awesome location, surrounded by restaurants and Times Square just around the corner. Rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. Views are wonderful from the bar located on the 54th floor, which is pretty cool!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The best part of the Centric Hyatt in NYC located on 45th Street is that is only a few feet from Times Square! Location is key, between Times Square and Ave of the Stars, super close to Broadway, easy to walk to locations. Very safe, always has hotel staff on the sidewalk to assist you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was staying at Hyatt Centric Times Square with my friends and being a Hyatt Globalist member I requested an early check in around 11 am at the Hotel, but the hotel did not honor it and we were given the room at 4:00 pm. I had booked a corner suite and requested an upgrade, which was declined right away and was told that the rooms were sold out but when I looked at the app the suites were available to be booked. The room was nice, but the customer service was not. I have stayed at Westin Times Square last year and booked a regular room, being a SPG Platinum member I was upgraded me to their corner suite and was allowed to check in early. SPG take care of there elite guests but Hyatt probably don't care. In the end I would like to say that it's Hyatt Centric location is very good but don't expect anything above what you booked or payed for even if you are their elite guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is located a block from Time Square. The subway stations are within a 5-10 minute walk. The hotel is very modern and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were on the 48th floor and it felt like we were the only ones staying on that floor. It was very quiet and didn't hear any loud noises or slamming doors from the other hotel guests. Had the opportunity to get a massage at the spa and it was great. We would definitely stay there again and have already recommended the hotel to family and friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I go to New York ever year for two weeks from Australia. I love every moment of my stays at the Hyatt Centric Times Square. This most recent trip, I had a room on the 38th floor with good views. The rooms are very modern but comfy and cleaned daily by wonderful staff. Coffee machine in the room saves $$$ and having free internet is also a bonus!The bathrooms are exquisite. The staff are lovely and so welcoming. Location is brilliant. Highly recommend this place! The restaurant is also really good!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked through BA and didn't really know what to expect. After a very long journey and a scary ride in a yellow cab we were dropped off at the Hyatt. Our bags were taken for us and check in was a breeze. We were directed to our room on the 39th floor. What a view! We had 2 queen size beds which were the most comfortable i have ever experienced in a hotel. There was a coffee machine, a fridge stocked with water and a fab bathroom. The bar on the 42nd floor had superb views over NY. The staff were unfailingly excellent and I would thoroughly recommend a stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a wonderful 5 nights in New York and chose the Hyatt Centric to be our base. I have to say this helped make our vacation a very special one indeed. We had room only but had breakfast every morning in the hotel and the quality of the food was excellent on every occasion. Some great staff working there as well

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt has a lot of good choices in New York. This one is in the middle of Times Square. It has great modern descent size rooms very nice bathrooms. Very friendly service good breakfast and a very nice rooftop bar and restaurant. I'm looking forward to staying there again this summer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is really great. Just a few seconds and you are on Time Square, two minutes and you are in 5th Avenue. I like security procedure to ask you for a room key, you can feel secure. Reception was helpful when we need assistance. Just a small remarck, they didn't ask us how was our stay and if we have intetion to come back. Mistake, from my point of view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and this is one of the best! Clean, modern, well-appointed nice sized rooms and bathroom. Within short walking distance of Broadway plays, restaurants, shopping on 5th Avenue and Central Park. You'll love it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just finishing a 4 night vacation in NYC with a family of 4 sharing a deluxe (2x queen) high floor room. This is a great hotel choice for midtown/Broadway location. The hotel staff were all excellent, very polite, friendly and helpful from check in to check out. The room was cleaned well every day with plenty of towels for the family and a coffee machine in room. We ate in the restaurant on the first evening which was OK but nothing special, better choices within 5 minutes walk.But overall a recommended hotel choice, would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Centrally located, clean rooms as spacious as you can expect from an hotel just few steps away from Times Square in NYC. I'd have rated as a 4/5 this hotel (not 5 because of its cost and of the rooms' size..but we're in NYC so that doesn't really count) if it wasn't for the breakfast. We (3 rooms, each with families with children) booked the hotel through our travel agency which showed "full breakfast included". Once we got there we found out that the "full breakfast" is capped to 35-40$ per adult so we had to pay for all the extras and having breakfast in a normal mid-level restaurant (the one on the ground floor) in NY can be quite expensive (pancakes starting from $17 without extras such as berries or cream...)....But what makes this breakfast time annoying is the poor quality of service: rude waiters, cleaning empty tables seems a cumbersome task that no one seems willing to undertake (long lines of people waiting to be seated with several empty tables that just needed to be cleaned), wrong orders, mistakes, food arriving in different times (2 times I had to eat alone because my family has long done because they have been served already), lack of coordination...in summary a bad experience.so I can confirm what other contributors say here: don't book the breakfast package and rather have a walk outside, it will probably cost you about the same if not less and you'll find much much better service for what you pay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt in March 2017. We chose this Hotel because of the central location and what a location! Just around the corner from Time Square, close to 5th and 6th Aves and not far from Penn Bus Station.We were upgraded to a suite on arrival which had amazing views of Time Square & the river. Thank you If you are gong to stay here ask for a corner room. The beds are very large and very comfortable.All the staff at the hotel are wonderful, especially Dede on reception and Janu in the restaurant. If it had not been for Janu I would not have had much in the way of gluten free food to eat.What disappointed us was the fact that the rooftop bar was closed every night we were there for a private function. What are guests supposed to do? One of the biggest attractions of the hotel & the guests couldn't use it, very poor. The other disappointment was the food in the restaurant, very over priced & hardly any choices for coeliacs. If it wasn't for Janu I would have had 3 minuscule pieces of steak no bigger than my finger with some lettuce. Thankfully Janu found me some gluten free bread to make a steak sandwich. Add that to the burger and two drinks we had & that was nearly $100 gone, never worth it. Needless to say we only used the restaurant once because of the prices. You can get much better cheaper food elsewhere.Although our room was lovely & the staff were great, the fact that an international hotel struggles to feed Coeliac guests at a reasonable price is very disappointing. I would suggest all coeliacs visiting New York find a Chipotle, they understand gluten free food and how to serve it and do not charge the earth.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here in March for a week and it was central to the theater district and Times Square. A lot of pubs, restaurants, and cafes near by. Close to about everything if you are wanting to walk to most of the attractions in the area. The room was nice and modern. It is not a large room and if you want a view you will have to pay the price for doing so. They have tight security at the front door. There is a roof top lounge that is really nice. The concierge desk clerks were helpful and made suggestions for restaurants and other activities. In all, we were satisfied with this hotel and would recommend it as a 4 star hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: NYC tends to be a bit cold and faceless. Not the case at Centric. Before I came to the hotel, I received an email welcoming me and asking if I had any questions or needed anything. Every interaction was on point. The front desk, the concierge, the amazing bar on the 54th floor... all top notch. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is located in the heart of Times Square (20-30sec walk away). 5mins from 5th avenue and Rockefeller plaza.When we arrived there was an issue with our room due to renovation, however they took care of us and upgraded our room and were extremely helpful and nice.Times Sqaure can be loud and bright at times but rooms are equipped with blackout curtains.The beds are comfortable and the rooms are accomdating with a range of complimentary items (incl a Keurig coffee machine with Starbucks pods)Washrooms come fully equipped with a huge spacious shower.Resteraunt located on ground floor and rooftop bar. Plenty of food and fun locations in area for family's/couples/sightseers.Can't recommend this place enough. Every member of staff greeted you with a smile and you really feel welcomed.5/5!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was very nice and modern. The staff was very friendly, helpful and attentive. Even the valet was helpful and nice. The room was very quiet and clean. Was a big room considering it is in nyc and so was the bathroom. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location for theatregoers. Room was very clean and the art work and decorations were very NY and contemporary. I would highly recommend this hotel because of its excellent location near theatres.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I leverage this property a couple times a month for business. This is a really nice NYC hotel. Great location (in the heart of TS), nice rooms (for NYC), great restaurant downstairs & roof top bar and very friendly staff. I will use this hotel when I bring my family to NYC - it's a no brainer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for our first visit to the big Apple,Fantastic location a few minutes walk from Times squareThe hotel room was great we were on the 30th floor very clean and spacious big screen tv coffee machine everything you need,there is a bar on the 54th floor never managed to visit,views are supposed to be spectacular We had breakfast at the Irish bar next great valueStaff were more than helpful Would I return,most defiantly

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A really lovely hotel in a great location and helpful staff. I actually don't have a bad word to say about this place. They have an outdoor bar on the 54 floor and although one of my party was under 21 they still let us go in and have a look outside and take some pictures.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was very nice, we did email the hotel before we left to say it was our honeymoon etc. but didn't find they went out of their way for us. They asked if we wanted a room upgrade but we had to pay for this. They do ask for a $300 charge which you will get back at the end of your stay. I found it is a lot to begin with though. We ended up spending all of this and more in the hotel. There is a rooftop bar it is amazing the cocktails are to die for but very pricey. We didn't eat at the hotel there is plenty around you. it is in a fabulous location just around the corner from time square. Rooms are a good size, Coffee machine, hairdryer, fab walk in shower. Staff are friendly and very nice. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The service was just wonderful!!! Everything was so clean!!! The staff really cares about you!!! I really enjoyed my stay At the Hyatt Centric Times Square, Everyone was so nice and took very good care of myself and family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful.The location is great for the theatre district any many good area restaurants are around to choose fromRooms are very well laid out and well decoratedThis is our choice hotel whenever we stay in nyc

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel for 5 nights the end of March. From the time we checked in to check out all service was A+++.First off the hotel is very clean and the rooms are great. We booked the 38th floor based on prior reviews in order to have a good view of the city. I highly recommend booking a higher floor for the view. Our room had two queens and 4 people fit in the room fine.Our flight arrived early Monday morning and we arrived to the hotel around 7am. Check in is not until 4 so our plan was to drop off our luggage and explore the city. When we arrived we were able to check in early without any issues. That alone makes this place a 5 star hotel for me. We were tired from the flight so we were able to rest before heading out.The staff was great throughout our stay. They also offered umbrella's since it rained most of the time we were there. They have an amazing bar on the 54th floor with a great view of the city. This hotel is also right in the middle of the city which was great since a lot of the things we did were within walking distance. I know other reviewers mentioned the noise from outside. However we did not have that problem at all. They also offered a car service back to the airport which was much cheaper than the service I was looking at. Make sure to check with the concierge.We will definitely be staying at the Hyatt for any future visits on NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a room on one of the top floors. Great view over Manhattan. Nice room with a spacious bathroom! Close to Times Square. Not many facilities in the hotel bit that didn't bother us.I would really recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From check-in to check-out we have only positive comments about our stay at this Hyatt. The staff was incredibly helpful & friendly. They made us feel as though we were the only guests they needed to attend to. For example, we needed directions once we got into the city, & a wonderful young girl from the Hyatt patiently stayed on the phone for over 10 minutes giving us directions as we maneuvered the rush hour traffic in the city until we arrived at the Hyatt. When we walked in she was at the front desk & greeted up with a smile. What a gem! The concierge was just as helpful planning an outing for us. Our room was quiet, modern & super clean --- & cleanliness is most important to me. I'd definitely stay here in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: + near times square + great staff + great rooms, with nice view - we would have liked breakfast buffet, but there is limited breakfast at the hotel. Although, you can find a lot of food near the hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Found hotel location was great 1 min from time square hotel staff both reception and door staff great helpOne downside was price of bar on top of hotel expensive but that's probably on par as the views were great room was on 41 floor and looked over downtown and view was stunning would stay here next time without a doubt big bed and very comfortable and room was large

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived around 11 am and we were expecting that we will be asked to wait for some time as check in is at 4pm. Once we reached we were very welcomed by Clifford who went the extra miles and assisted us. Clifford heard we were celebrating our Anniversary and my wife`s birthday and he upgraded us to a beautiful room. He made sure to come personally to our room after check in with a city map to help us explore New York. We were very grateful to him for the most needed first impression we had a beautiful stay and we will definitely go back. Kindly share our feedback with Cliff as he honestly deserve the best employee title.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Awesome hotel, one minute walk from Times Square. Professional staff, very fast check in/out and even gave us a complementary late checkout which is rare in NYC. Fantastic views from the bar on the 54th floor, not cheap but you definitely get what you pay for!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is my favorite hotel. I won't stay anywhere else in N.Y. The staff is amazing. Rooms are beautiful, clean , extremely well thought out and homey. Grand Hyatt Bed is super comfortable. Very quiet with gorgeous views. The wonderful staff always makes me feel like family and ready to help with anything you might need.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: i've visited new york on 12 occassions and this was our first visit to the hyatt centric because this visit was for 9 nights ,i really researched the other hotels ,before deciding on the centric & i'm so glad we did , from the moment we walked in we were happy ,the manager took his time making sure we had everything we required , the staff could not have been more helpful right up to the ladies making up our room ,on our new york return we will look no further than the hyatt centric

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family stayed at this hotel over Spring Break in NYC. We were all very impressed with the hotel, the staff (so friendly and helpful!). Our room on the 21st floor was clean and beds, pillows = all very comfortable after long days exploring the city! We will definitely stay again, and recommend to anyone staying in the area or wanting to see some Broadway shows (I mean, so close!!) ... you will want to stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My spouse and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square Hotel for 4 days. Our room, located on the 30th floor had spectacular views of the city. The designer of the room was thoughtful about the details and the needs of travelers when they are away from home. The location of the hotel was perfect...1 block from Times Square and surrounded by restaurants, bars, and theatres. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was delicious and the service was very friendly. Loved the caprese omelette and potatoes. The drinks at the rooftop lounge were a bit pricey, but it is NYC, after all. Nevertheless, the rooftop lounge is spacious, beautifully decorated and has spectacular views of the city so it's worth the experience. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. They even gave us $50 to spend at the rooftop lounge as it was my spouse's 50th birthday. Overall, I can't say enough about the hotel! It was truly AMAZING!!! Not only will I stay there again on my next visit to NYC, I will make sure to check if there is a Hyatt Centric hotel at any future destination.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic location,excellent customer service, great decor, great views. Couldn't ask for more had a great time up on the roof top bar even though it is a little expensive.Would definitely return thank you

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful hotel, great customer service, room was immaculate, and the views from the 54th floor bar were spectacular! Will definitely stay again and recommend! Everyone we spoke to had great recommendations for sights to see and places to eat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A definite must stay in NY times square. Roof Bar has a second to none killer view. Staff are professionally courteous and service is excellent. Staff will recommend on restaurants and sites to see. Went to Strip house for steaks and wasn't disappointed on their request. Right at Times Square. Have the breakfast sandwich for breakfast, a must. Make sure you go to the spa!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a great view of New York city from Bar 54. The location is great to see musicals and the subway was very close. Time Square is always busy and the shops stay open late in Time Square. Hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For a first trip to NYC we were very happy to have a comfortable stay at the Hyatt Centric. The room was smaller but very clean and modern. The service is top notch and the staff were very friendly. We were able to walk everywhere. The location is excellent if you like walking to all the main attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: WOW is all I can say. I can't find words to express my appreciation to the amazing staff - BJ (who responded to my FB message and put me in contact with the hotel's staff) and Ben (Assistant Operations Manager) who helped make my mom's birthday a truly memorable experience.I contacted Hyatt via Facebook to inquire if I can check-in early to bring flowers, balloons and decorate the room as I was surprising my mom for her birthday.Ben was super helpful. I honestly did not expect much and was ready to be declined the early check-in. However, not only did Ben helped with the early check-in but also did many more things to make my mom's birthday an amazing one. THANK YOU FROM THE BUTTOM OF MY HEART!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here at the beginning of December. The hotel is modern, clean, comfortable, the room was a decent size, the staff were helpful and the hotel itself is in a very good location. The rooftop bar was an added bonus. No complaints from us. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff at the hotel are tremendous. From check in to check out, they are warm, friendly and accommodating. The rooms, albeit small, are appointed fine, but what surprised us most was how quiet the room was and we're only 50 yards from Times Square! The roof top bar is a wonderful benefit, but be aware prices are high, as are the views!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel on a whim and I am so glad we did!! Perfect location for Times Square and the theaters! We were able to walk everywhere and enjoy the city!! The room was clean and really cute!! The restaurant downstairs has a great breakfast! The bar on the roof was nice but the drinks were quite overpriced, but tasted good!! I would definitely book it again if we went back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel, very convenient location in relation to attractions, very friendly and helpful staff. Tasty and nourishing food in the restaurant T45. Beautiful views from the window, I'm staying on the 24th floor. Quick check-in and check-out. Thank you so much for the quality of services rendered.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Customer Service is hard to come by anymore......but Hyatt Centric definitely puts it's best foot forward. We received great service from the front desk staff especially "DeDe", the concierge "J" and housekeeping. I didn't feel great pressure from the staff about giving tips.....it seemed like they provided great service b/c that's who they are at Hyatt Centric. The location is great...convenient to the subway....Times Square and many tourist attractions. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The roof top bar is a must do b/c the view is awesome. Beware the drinks are expensive but the atmosphere is nice. The service in the bar could stand some improvement to match the prices....it's not horrible...but definitely didn't leave a lasting impression. The next time I visit NYC I'll definitely consider Hyatt Centric 1st.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Absolutely brilliant stay at the Hyatt Centric Hotel. Cannot find one bad word about it. Staff were excellent and accommodating, concerige was extremely helpful in getting us a great deal on a two day bus tour, room was cleaned to a high standard every day. The rooftop bar is a New York attraction in itself ! Bed was large and comfortable, wifi was reliable and bathroom was excellent. Would recommend to anyone who asks!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just off Times Square, the Hyatt Centric has a great location amongst other great attributes. We were able to get in the room early, and all staff were quite accommodating.The room was spotless, roomy, and quite modern. The rooftop bar offers a breathtaking view of Manhattan, both the inside section and outdoor section.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights. Rooms are quite large for Time Square New York area and very quiet. The bathroom and rain shower were great. The building seems fairly new and everything is in excellent repair. Reservation process was easy and accurate. We arrived quite early and the staff was more than helpful in storing our bags. You are 3 blocks from Times Square and about 5 blocks from the subway. There is a bar on the 54th floor and at 10:30am each day, they offer the opportunity for those under 21 to go up and look around the city. The desk staff was always helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel let me book a 2 queen room with a view- for an upgrade- which I took- only to get there and none of the 2 queen rooms face Times Square?! False advertising! Also, the Sky Bar does not let anyone under 21 in- and the staff acts like it is a big time club- not friendly, $25-$35 drinks- the worst I had in NYC and most expensive- go over and stay at the Marriott Marque where you can get a large room, with views, and everyone in your group can go to The View- their restaurant on the 86th floor that rotates 360, and the drinks are much cheaper and the food is better. Sorry Hyatt, you should be honest with your patrons.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great and very quiet hotel despite all of the drama and sirens outside with a great location. I be already booked my room for New Years. I would recommend this hotel to anyone if it's in their budget..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beds and pillows were amazingly comfortable. View from our 51st floor room was good, but not it sure if it was worth the extra cost. The rooftop bar view was phenomenal and the staff up there were very friendly. Not sure about concierge service as it was not offered or suggested from the front desk staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed for 5 nights with my husband and 13 and 11 year olds. Chose Hyatt over competitors primarily because they offer rooms with two queen beds instead of two doubles. We stayed in a deluxe room with two queens on the 38th floor. View was good - not spectacular. For NYC the room and bathroom were spacious. My in complaint was a real lack of drawers space - just 3 smallish drawers. Tough for four people ( I like to unpack). Gym is very well equipped and was not busy. Great location for near Time Square. Very close to two subway stops. Easy subway rides to Battery Park, Lower East Side for Tenement Museum, and Central Park ( 2 stops away). Out the door of the hotel to the left a few door is the Cranberry Cafe - has anything you might need. Gourmet treats, tons of cold drinks, ice cream novelties, an amazing salad bar and good hot food bar and decent gelato.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My son and I arrived at 7:00 am from a red eye and although our room was not ready they really tired to make it happen. They had a king rm but we wanted 2 beds. No worries the doorman suggested The Red Flame for a great diner breakfast, then we explored Times Square sans traffic and crowds, walked to Central Park, MET Museum walked back and they helped with reservation for Italian dinner before a show"The Great Comet" Quiet clean room. We had a high floor room. Thank you Hyatt we will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This property is in a great location, nice clean rooms and a lot of room! Takes a few tries on how to work the lights, one button turns them all on or off..but the reading/mood lighting by the bed is very cool. Please be aware that if you have children the windows DO open. We were in room 4409 and the window opened wide with no guards. check the windows and make sure you let them know you have children in the room with you. Our service was inconsistent. No toiletries or water the first day, the next day overload toiletries and 3 waters for 4 people, next day nada! Make sure you get what you pay for! The room was quiet, the elevator was fast, all and all we had a great stay, just a few hiccups!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location incredible staff really nice room for the money with city view and sitting area with desk table TV frig pull out sofa separate oversized bedroom with hughe bathroomSuper clean great maid Servuce and frint desk staffAll a 10++++Would stay again in a heart bestRoom 4504. Must stay place

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in February for a 30th birthday vacation. We chose this hotel because of it's central location, close to Times Square and because it is a relatively new hotel and was not disappointed. Arrival - Had no trouble finding the hotel, although the signage is more subtle than some of the other properties on the street (head for the Irish bars and you can't miss it!). The employees on the door were polite however the lady on reception was a bit quiet which could have come across as rude but I think it was a one off as they were all very helpful for the rest of the stay. We were checked in quickly and given a room on the 53rd floor.Room - Again easy to find, just make sure you use the lifts on the right hand side if going to a high floor as the others only go part way. The room itself was clean and spacious and nicely decorated. They had even left a little card and gift for my birthday which was a lovely touch. There was a desk area with multiple connections for electronics, nice big TV and a coffee machine with free coffee pods. We didn't use the coffee but you can use the machine to just boil hot water if you have tea etc. Would have been nice to see tea included in the free options though. They provide a fridge and bottled water daily. Hairdryer and toiletries also provided (which smelt lovely! Think it was one of their spa ranges) and a great rain forest shower. Both the bathroom and main room have floor to ceiling windows which provide lovely views of the city...We often used the little chair & table in the room to watch the world go by. Room itself was pretty quiet, some noise from car horns and police etc but considering how close it is to times square I don't think you can avoid this. Only minor issue we had with the room was the heating was a bit 'off'. It often blew out very cold air when we actually wanted heat. Turned it off for most of the break. There is a heated floor in the bathroom though which was great.Location - Perfect for us, very close to times square and walking distance to 5th avenue, rockefeller centre and the tube stations. We even walked to central park. If you want a hotel out of the hustle and bustle of the city though I wouldn't choose this one. Better for tourists wanting to be close to it all.Food - we did not use the restaurant/bar at the hotel (or any of the other facilities) so I can't comment on them. However there are LOADS of options near by in various price ranges so very easy to find something. Cafe cranberry a few doors down was great for breakfast options.Overall I would use this hotel again as it was perfect for our site seeing trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: this property is situated in a great location. the room was well-kept, clean and had comfortable bed that allowed us all to get a good night sleep. the fitness center had enough weights, machines and cardio to get a good workout. the staff seemed genuine, friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for three nights using points I accrued staying at other Hyatts. I thought it would be interesting to stay near Times Square but really Times Square is awful - not as seedy as it was 40 years ago but now just mobbed with tourists. Not really much fun. By chance I saw that there is a Hyatt in Union Square, which I think would have been a much better choice. My wife kept saying that she much preferred the Hyatt in Jersey City (where we stayed last September) and I agree. The room we had was just barely large enough to accommodate a King-sized bed. I had read other reviews talking about the spacious rooms at this Hyatt but that was definitely not the case for us. There was a family of four staying across the hall from us so I am sure there are bigger rooms available.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at Hyatt Centric for 8 nights for my husband's 40th Birthday. A great hotel! We stayed in a Deluxe View King room on the 49th floor. Apart from the occasional siren, it was a quiet room with a view of Chrysler Building to the east, World Trade Centre to the South and Hudson River to the West. We used the gym twice which was well equipped. We didn't managed to get the SkyLounge due to jet-lag at the start of vacation and then Private Functions 3 nights straight - maybe an area could be cordoned off for residents when this occurs? We can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was there for a business meeting and took wife for weekend get away. Great hotel, only downside was the limited menu in restaurant. Great hotel bar, wonderful view of Manhattan.. The location is perfect, a half block off Times Square and theater district. Staff friendly and very helpful. Will recommend to friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. Convenient to everything. Nice hospitality and great food. Very clean and safe as well. Would highly recommend and would stay again. I felt like the staff went out of there way to make sure I had a great stay and managment was extremely accommodating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a lovely hotel. Very friendly and in a perfect spot. They couldn't have done more and the rooftop bar was amazing. A bit overpriced for drinks but didn't stop us having fun. They had all the answers. Right next to times square but not noisyet at all .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazingly responsive staff. Sparklingly clean rooms. Great view. I would highly recommend this property to anyone who wants a centrally located hotel. For a two night stay, the valet took our car and returned it in perfect condition. I always worry about that. The main beds are fantastic. The pullout wasn't terribly comfortable but overall it wasn't a big deal.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: fantastic hotel in a very convenient location, especially if you're planning to experience the theater. Bed was particularly comfortable, and street noise seemed reasonable, even for a lower floor. Enjoyed the rooftop bar, but the drinks are quite expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A hotel which is value for Money even a kind of pricey but is worth and no complain.. Good Security, staffs are friendly both at reception, bell Counter and even housekeeping, Express check out by phone save a lot of time, they provide starbuck coffee n bottle of water everyday. Room is clean and big, feel so comfortable to stay and sleep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great King room, clean, modern, good size, comfortable & quiet. Staff were helpful & friendly. No problem with early check-in & late check-out which was arranged through General Manager in advance. Hot & powerful shower, AC control worked well & nice to have unlimited water bottles & coffee available.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great rooms, fantastic views if you are high up and really very nice staff. The diner attached to the hotel offers good food (but room service wasn't great) and it's nice to find a super clean hotel in Times Square. The only downside was the elevators....I seemed to spend an eternity waiting to go up or down and for a new hotel, they weren't exactly express. A great NY option though.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel staff were excellent and rooms were clean and comfortable! The staff were very helpful, friendly and great at remembering us as we returned to the hotel. This hotel is very close to Times Square, many restaurants and shows. Well-managed hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first stay at the Hyatt Centric and it was planned around the shows we planned to see during our stay - Hello Dolly, Anastasia, Sunset Blvd - all a block away from the property.The hotel has a small but functional lobby and a friendly staff. We were upgraded to a Executive Suite during check in and we had a great stay. The room is spacious and spotless clean, the bathroom is also spacious and modern. Any requests - towels, pillows, water, mouthwash - are immediately sent over to the room and they are complementary, something rarely seen in hotels these days. Go visit the Sky Bar at the 54th floor. The views are incredible!A shout out to Alex DeChagas, Director of Operations, for the great costumer service and to make sure that we had a pleasant stay.It was indeed a great stay and we will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booking a room was a breeze. Hotel was very clean and staff was very friendly and professional. Perfect place to stay when watching a broadway show. Just avoid T45. There are other better dining choices around the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A sisters trip took us to New York and we enjoyed staying at the Hyatt Centric. After a long days of sightseeing and the hustle and bustle of New York, we knew once we entered the hotel we were in our oasis. There is a special aroma that permeates the halls and elevators. We found it to be very calming and refreshing! I highly recommend this hotel for their excellent location and also for their hospitality.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is 200m away from Time Square and 350m away from the subway. We stayed in a deluxe suite, room 5001 on the 50th floor and the views to Times Square and the surrounds are spectacular. Our room had a large bathroom with separate lounge to the bedroom.On the 54th floor is the bar with an open balcony to enjoy the night lights with a great atmosphere. The staff were fantastic and it would be the hotel that we would stay in again in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Location, Friendly Service, Comfortable Beds and Connollys Irish Pub next door for "The Full Irish" open from 7am... Perfect.Walking distance to all Midtown sights and attractions, also Central Park and a few subway stops to Downtown. Affordable Limo Service to JFK to accommodate 4 pax plus cases, tolls and tip at $75....great value.We will definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I love this hotel!The location is fantastic, literally a minutes walk from Times Square. Our room was huge with floor to ceiling windows so we had some great views. The staff and the concierge particularly were very helpful and friendly, everyone always had a smile and a kind word for you. We had a few cocktails in the rooftop bar, definitely worth a visit, we got some great photos of the Chrysler building all lit up at night there. I would absolutely stay here again no problem, we loved it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel when you have to be Times Square. Only 10 rooms per floor and a very civilized hotel with gracious service.Great bed and bathroom with nice bath products. Some of the rooms have Drybar hair dryers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a the most amazing time staying at the hyatt Times Square! Perfectly located with a very spacious and comfortable room. Staff were very welcoming and helpful. We also made use of the rooftop bar which was fabulous

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As they say, location is everything. Within easy reach of Times Square, this hotel placed me in the heart of NY and was centrally located for work and pleasure. The rooms and facilities are spotless and new.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is beautiful and very clean with extra friendly and efficient staff.There is a rooftop bar with great views. There is a restaurant in the lobby that is excellent, I can't remember when I had suck a great steak. It is located in the heart of the theaters. I highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here on a business trip for 8 nights....the room & bathroom are really nice, modern & clean. The staff at front desk are very helpful, check in & check out were very smooth, they have a nice facility to keep your luggage safe on check out. The room service was super quick considering the size of the hotel. The rooftop bar is worth visiting at night, super relaxing with nice view. The location is perfect, main time square is just 200meters away, central park is at just 15minutes walking distance.I would love to stay here for all my future business & family visits at NYC.Please keep up the high standards of Hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was excellent ( especially DiDi) , I took my son to NYC for his birthday, they made sure we had the best possible room, which was on the top floor. I couldn't have been happier with the service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Times Square is one of my least favorite neighborhoods in New York. But the theater is there and since we go to lots of theater we stay in that area sometimes. If you are looking for a good option in Times Square, this is a winner. I would call this a "boutique" hotel but it is not a small version of a boutique hotel-- it has lots of great facilities. Rooms are very nice and very well appointed. Restaurant at lobby level offers three meals daily and the food and service there is really good. Rooftop bar is amazing (54th floor) with spectacular views of Times Square and the city. Very nice fitness center on 4th floor. Highly attentive staff. As one of the newer Hyatt properties in the city, this one is beautiful and clean. Big plus are the great views from guest rooms. You are in Times Square, you have great views of it but you are so high above that you don't hear all the noise. Try to get a high floor-- great hotel choice in this part of town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in a Deluxe High Room with a view located on the 47th floor. The views from the room were absolutley amazing and were perfect for our fist trip to New York. The room itself was clean and functional, pillows could be improved on, but the bathroom was lovely with a bath as well as a shower.All of the staff were very friendly and helpful.Only complaint was that my credit card was authorised as soon as we got to the hotel and wasnt told how much was being put on it at the time and it was significantly higher than the cost of the room. No major issue just a slight inconvenience as would have used a different card.Overall loved the hotel and would happily go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you're looking for a spacious room near Times square this is one of your best choices. If you're in for business and want hotel amenities look more at the other Hyatt's. The square footage in the rooms is large for Manhattan. However it just has a boutique feel of a small hotel, not the offerings of the Hyatt standard I see elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Thoroughly impressed with this hotel they took care of us on more than one occasion including an error that I made on the reservation in which they didn't have to correct but did so anyway! Super easy access to tons of attractions and we never had to wait for anything: front desk, food, taxi, etc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Standard hyatt product.. rooms clean well appointed and comfortable beds. Location is great for theater district lots of tourists as such hotel is busy with constant stream of arrivals and departures. Nice bar on roof with good views of the city. Decent bloody mary in the ground floor bar. Friendly staff..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel at a great price. Best location in town just off Time square. Friendly staff always willing to help. No charge for holding luggage on our last day. Big rooms with large WC. Great rooftop bar with amazing views at night on 54th floor. Hyatt will never let you down.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Enjoyed my stay here at the Hyatt Times Square, fairly new and modern hotel with rooms having great views of the surrounding areas. Bedrooms are large for the typical location and have great in room facilities. Shower could have done with more pressure but other than that it was a lovely room and comfy bed. Loved the Starbucks coffee machine and oversized bed, helped for a lazy Sunday morning. Had breakfast a couple of days in the restaurant on the ground floor. Staff were friendly but was irritated on both occasions by little plates over filled with food, ramekins and pots containing individual items rather than just on the plate. In the end I tipped everything out. The cutlery is also too big so kept falling off the plate or made it cumbersome to eat directly from the dishes. Bar 54 is a perfect place. So much so I went three times. Great service and views. Would definitely recommend, even for just a look.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location , location in central Manhattan , New York New York . It was our first time in newyork city , we don't have a booking because we cannot go to lad Vegas as most airlines are fully booked . One of the busiest American summer school holiday . We managed to get a flight to New York and come across the hotel reservations desk . The lady managed to get us a good discount do we tried. Ohhh boy , the room was posh . You can see the Tall buildings and Manhattan mall and Times Square with billboards . Walking distance to most tourist area like Times Square , were you can watch Broadway show and walked to the Empire State Building. We don't want to meet as anything so we hope in tourist bus. It was just before the twin building gone . We went just a week before and still have picture of one of the building as we go higher up. Then the middle square where I bought some souvenirs from cart man . Hope his ok . Anyway at that time Hyatt in New York dominates posh of posh. We really enjoyed our stay but I must admitted that I had blown my whole savings and payed my cards with interest . But oooohboy . A hotel with attitude

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Oldie music as you enter, gorgeous people everywhere, wonderful service, the suite was excellent to work from, the WIFI was hot, the rice pudding in the restaurant was magnifique and the Brazilian beauty that I met in the lobby on day 2 kept me warm at night for the rest of my stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location of the hotel is perfect and the rooms are good BUT i made a mistake by booking the room including the breakfast. There were no details given about the breakfast on the website i booked and the front desk did not give any details during my check-in. There is no buffet so you order from the menu , first day we ordered whatever we normally eat in the breakfast without checking any price on the menu and the waitress or the manager in the restaurant didnt inform about details as well , she told me you that write your room no and you are ok. I received the check and wrote my room number on it. But i wanted check again with reception so i finally find out that it is limited with 37usd per person per day. They didn't charged me the extra as i called the booking website but i was expecting a personal apologize but nobody showed up.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was hesitant staying at a hotel so close to Times Square - but as I wanted to visit many attractions nearby - e.g. MoMA - I decided to give it a go. I requested a high floor as noise can be an issue in this area - I got the 44th floor - noise was no issue as a result. The hotel was great - good sized room, great bar on the top floor (although expensive as you would expect) and the location great. Had a great 2 days in this great city...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location 1 block to Times Square and 3 blocks from subway. Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms were very bright, clean and modern. Bathroom was a good size and clean. There is a cafe a few doors down which offers a wide selection of breakfast, lunch and dinner options to go or to eat in at a reasonable price. The hotel lounge on the top floor offers excellent views and you can request to take your kids up during the day when it is closed so they can enjoy the views too. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Myself my husband & 3 friends stayed for 5 nights. The staff were excellent, facilities clean & maintained as new, lifts super quick as was the wifi. The location is excellent, just off Times Square,this gave us the flexibility to get lots done in the time as we could come & go.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed overnight at the Hyatt Centric to enjoy a concert at Town Hall. We picked the hotel based on location. It was walking distance from Penn Station, Town Hall, Times Square, and a quick trip to Central Park. We were upgraded on arrival to a one-bedroom suite. It had a king bed and a sofa bed in the living room. Kind of disappointing that there was only one bathroom. The staff was prompt to our requests to get linen for the sofa bed and a problem we were having with the shower. We did not have anything to eat or drink at the hotel so I can’t comment on the quality or the cost of food/liquor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel for convenience - it was the location of the NYE party we were going to and it was close to all the broadway theatres & transport. What we didn't count on was the 56th floor room we had and the brilliant view of Manhattan - very special! The room was spacious, well decked out and very comfortable for our nine night stay. Hotel restaurant facilities are fairly basic but there is so much to choose from close by that this is not an issue. No issues with service though you'd expect some greetings during an extended stay.. That said .. the price point is much cheaper than a Grand Hyatt or Park Hyatt so you can't expect the same service..Great location, comfortable hotel and very good value for money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stay 1 week, on the third day of my stay i didn´t find $400. Anyway, I talked to the receptionist, and then I talked to the manager, they told me they were trying to know what happened with my money. Days passed, and my money never appeared.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent value for moneyLocation is brilliant, room size is very decent and staying at a top floor will ensure a beautiful view of the city. The room was clean and the service was great and friendly.Their rooftop bar has beautiful view and the the bartender definitely knows his job.The lobby on the other hand is small and really does not cater for business meetings so if you are looking for it you should look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric in Time Square is tucked away on 45th Street just steps away from shopping, dining, and entertainment. The rooftop bar offers a stunning night time view of the lights of the city. Staff are courteous and responsive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt was wonderful! The beds were comfy, the pillows even more so. The views from the floor-to-ceiling windows was awesome! I would open the window a bit and it was nice because it allowed me to clear out the smell of food when my kids would eat in the room. The bathroom was a generous size. Good, soft towels were available and the hair dryer was nice and strong. My only comment is that there is no exhaust fan for the bathroom. Oh, be prepared for a *lot* of static! Every time we would touch the door handle, bathroom door, elevator buttons, even each other (!) we would get zapped. Overall, the Hyatt was a great choice. I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful views from the rooftop bar; clean, modern rooms and a location steps from the heart of Times Square made this hotel a great value. The hotel is steps from dining options of all kinds and theater. Convenient to 5th Ave. shopping and Rockefeller Center.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
