review_body: Booked in by a very pleasant and efficient agent by the name of Clifford. Two adults and two teenage girls in one decent size room. Tea and coffee making facilities plus a good sized fridge in the room. Had a partial view of times sq. The location of this hotel is great as it's close to just about everything. Staff very friendly and concierge could not have done more for us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here because it was close to work out of an abundance of caution because of an expectant blizzard. I found the room very comfortable and welcoming, and loved that the bathroom also had a view out to the lights of Times Square without being overwhelmed, if one were to be situated right there. It's the perfect location. It's a perfect hotel to feel relaxed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Cenric on business. Our room type was accomdated. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The location was excellent, within walking distance to so much. We stay in NY often and somehow missed this place until now. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice location right behind Times Square. We stayed here for about one week. We had a comfortable room with a wonderful view of Times Square itself. It is also very close to shops and cafes, so the position is one of its main qualities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed here at one of the king suites with the balcony and I must say was not disappointed at all. I'm very picky and particular and I have absolutely not one complaint. From the moment you walk in everything is beautiful and modern and very very clean. Loved our room and of course the balcony and the bathroom was amazing as well! Will stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hyatt was very clean and very easy process for check-in. Right in the heart of the Theater District and steps away from Times Square. Very convenient. Lisa in the restaurant was very sweet and gracious. Willing to give us information on sights to see. Thank you Lisa for all that you do. The only reason for the 3-star... not 5 is because of the way the restaurant manager spoke down to his employees during their shift. I am generalizing here... I am not sure he was the manager. A young gentleman who was seating people.... always in a jacket and a tie.... Was very condescending to his employees. We had the opportunity to eat at this restaurant three different times and on three separate occasions we heard him speak in a derogatory voice to his staff. One particular episode was when he saw Starbucks coffee cup left on the counter from his staff and said...."are we running a Starbucks here now?" This could have been a humorous remark but it was all in his tone, very condescending and you could tell that the employee scurried the cup away as if being in trouble. This is not the Hyatt Staff/Management relationship that I have come to expect. Perhaps a manager may have to instruct his employees on proper behavior but definitely not in front of a Guest staying at the Hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Checked in here and was very pleasantly surprised. This place bent over backwards to ensure we were happy.They found out through our daughter it was our wedding anniversary and made it very special for us with a nice bottle of red wine and framed picture of us. This was such a nice surprise.One thing they could do is look at the rooms and lifts giving static shocks when you press the buttons.I believe this is to do with the carpets and types of shoes worn etc??!!Anyway all in all enjoyed our time there and would stay again if back in NYC.Keep up the good work guys top job!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It is really good location from times square. Room condition was good and the view was great. But the heater made some noise in the night. It made us to wake up sometimes. It was busy time but the staff was working hard to treat well all guests. Guest service was good and quick to respond. But, the price was expensive. If you consider to spend more time outside, then you should choose the cheaper hotel where has the room in fine condition and offers breakfast for the complimentary.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hotel and the staff are rude and careless. I was given one price on the internet and then charged double when i arrived. After discussing the issue with Management i was told i would be charged the higher rate and they would do nothing to lower it to the original agreed upon rate. Worst customer service i have ever experienced in my life. I was treated so poorly i checked out of my hotel early and moved to a different hotel where i was treated with respect. The best part is after telling the front desk clerk at other hotel about my stay at Hyatt she altered my rate to what i should have been paying . Not even Marriott’s mistake but they made it right. Hyatt Management treated me like i was a bum off the streets and my business was worthless to them. I would advise anyone and everyone to never stay at a Hyatt Property ever again. Even if Hyatt makes a mistake they will blame you the guest and make you pay for it. Stay at your own risk.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is expensive but worth it. Rooms were clean, well appointed and the location, WOW, steps to Times Sq, vibrant and heart of entertainment district. Lobby is small and unassuming, but that just fine. Check out the rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I stayed at the newly-renovated Hyatt Centric in Times Square last week. It was a fantastic hotel. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. This is a rare treat at a hotel in NYC. The staff was very friendly and helpful ... but not "overly" so. They allowed you your space. One thing I would recommend is the rooftop bar. It is absolutely beautiful up there and the view cannot be beat. Even if you have younger kids, (and it is a bar) go up around 5PM and ask if you can go out on the deck to see the view. They allowed my daughter and I to do that (she's 15) and it was beautiful. This is a great location. Great hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I don't really have any complaints about this hotel. My only criticism is that on some occasions, staff were really helpful and on others, they really weren't! The times that staff were uninterested in helping us, really dampened our spirits! Overall, the hotel is basic. But rooms are clean, comfortable and a good size with a large bed (deluxe room!) The bathrooms are lovely and have the option of bath and shower which was great for a Brit that loves a bath! If you don't mind basic, the rooms are worth their view of Times Square and the hotel is very central making it a great base for exploring the city. Simply consistently helpful staff would have allowed me to rate the hotel 5 stars!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had such high expectations with this hotel! what a disappointment! maybe it's a great hotel for a small group to spend a couple of days, but it wasn't a great experience for my family in a party of 7, spending 10 nights, though the rooms were nice. On our arrival, things didn't run as smooth as i expected regarding credit card matters, but we were very well treated. We were assigned to 2 diferent rooms, and as we realized that one of the rooms was too small for 4 people, we asked to be removed to one the same size as the other, wich was attended. But our fridge items, that were offered to be kept in the hotel's refrigerator while the change was made, ended up missing for some hours after we asked them back. That wasn't a big issue, but it was the first sign that the hotel had very poor organization. By the ocasion of check in, we asked if the hotel would receive mail packages, and they said they would, being the first two free and that the next ones would be charged. When the first package came, it got lost for some time inside the hotel before it was delivered. The next one never made it to our room. Amazon confirmed the deliver, even with the name of the person who signed the papers at the hotel. The ladies from the front desk assured us that the packed was indeed delivered and registered, they were very nice and helpfull at this time, i could see them putting effort in looking for it, but nobody managed to actually locate it. At check out, we had a really hard time with one of the ladies in front desk who showed absolutelly no patience in trying to understand and solve the mess that was made with our credit cards during check in, and was about to charge a duplicate amount, until another one offered to check the situation and got it right in 2 minutes. Thank you Odette! What a difference a person with good will can do! When i arrived at my home country, less than 2 days after check out, i realized i had forgotten an item inside a drawer in my room. It was a brand new bag with some other accesories inside. It was totally my mistake leaving it behind, but i have tryed to reach out to one of the managers in the hotel and he has given absolutelly no help at all with this (another person told me by phone that the only thing i can do is register my loss in a website, wich i did and haven't been responded yet) or with the mail package that got lost in there, wich now he says was never delivered. It's been two days now since i first reported my loss and no answer untill now. I hope that this problems can still be solved and that i can change my mind about this whole experience so that my only complaint can be about the soft mattress.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was in NYC for business and wanted somewhere between meetings in Times Square and near Central Park. This hotel fit the bill. The price was good and the room was very modern and clean. The lobby is very small and tight but I wasn't looking for somewhere to hang out or have meetings. Just needed a clean, safe place to sleep that was near to the locations I mentioned. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was great, right on Times Square, walking distance to broadway and fifth avenue. Front desk staff was very friendly and nice, they gave us an upgrade to higher floor and bigger room. However the bed and pillows were way too soft and we think is because it has been slept by too many people, me and my husband actually felt very sick and nauseous and we tried to ask the staff if there is any other better beds in other room but unfortunately they are all the same. For the price you pay and for Hyatt standard, we were very disappointed and we won't recommend staying here if you are staying for more than a few nights, we stayed here for 8 nights and did not get a good rest for our entire trip. So if you are not fussy with the bed, it is a good hotel, one more thing, the lifts do not have security, anyone can access the hotel rooms, we do not feel secured even there is a guard at the lobby asking to see your room key.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Would recommend this hotel as great base in midtown. Not the cheapest hotel but worth it. Lovely friendly staff and hotel very clean. Roof top bar a wow, just a little on the expensive side. Get a higher floor room for amazing views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Gr8 location if you're walking around the area, pricey menu, esp for breakfast, hard to get cabs even though its located slightly off the main street, staff very professional and prompt response to guest service requests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Newish hotel with very nice and spacious rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Great nights sleep on comfortable bed in room that was very peaceful. The location was perfect for broadway show with many restaurants within a couple of blocks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room looked and had the cleanliness of a dormitory room. Minimal amenities. Room service coffee served in paper cups. At $450 for one night with two queen beds I felt that I was robbed. I visit NYC often and decided to try this hotel because of its website and proximity to an event that I was going to. What a mistake. Over the years and in the very recent past I have stayed at hotels for half the price and ten times the satisfaction.The lobby is small, plain, crowded and noisy. If you want to relive your college dorm experience this is the place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Brilliant hotel in a fantastic location... Rooftop bar just added to the experience!!!Rooms were much bigger than we anticipated, the web pics don't do the size any justice...Daily maid service was great...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel, close to everything. Super friendly staff. Our room was beautiful, all new and spotless. The rooftop bar was great for unwinding after a day running around the city. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Worth every penny!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is on 45th st just off the square so a really great location for some of the main attractions. The room was a good size with two queen beds which were very comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: At somewhere just over $200 per night this hotel is good value if clean, newly furnished, spacious accommodation is your priority. The bar/restaurant just off the lobby is elegant and appealing, and there is a roof bar/terrace to enjoy in the warmer months. I had to ask to change my room as was first given a room on the north side of the building directly facing an inescapable, building-sized, flashing blue and white electronic sign, and the room I was then allocated on the south side had a partial view of Times Square. The room is a little beige-bland, but clean, spacious and the bed large and comfortable, and bathroom very nice. There are adaptor plugs, a good hairdryer and 'ok' toiletries.My only criticisms would be the lack of quality room service and the associated cost: the only option for breakfast room service is to receive everything in take-out packaging. This doesn't go well with boiled eggs and toast....no plates, plastic cutlery, cold toast. I ordered two boiled eggs, toast, tea and orange juice, in a paper bag it turns out....for $28 dollars this isn't good value, convenient or enjoyable. There is also no mini bar, and whilst tea and coffee-making facilities are in the room, if you want milk it is $5 for that paper cup of milk. I also got a static/electric shock every time I touched the card to the reader to open the door, so I guess the carpets are nylon?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From this hotel, you can go almost anywhere in Manhattan, Madison Square Garden, Hell's Kitchen, The Top of the Rock, The High Line, Carnegie Hall, Times Square, Broadway, even Central Park! All within walking distance! Plus it is a nice hotel and if you get a room on the upper floors, relatively quiet. The staff is also very courteous and nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is located in the busiest part of Manhattan, a few steps away from Times Square but at the same time in a quiet side street. Two subway stations are five minutes walk away.There is a terrace on the 54th floor with nice view which is free. Drinks at the bar are expensive. Breakfast was not included in the price and very expensive too.Room was very clean and large enough. Beds were comfortable. A complimentary bottle of water per person every day and coffee maker with Starbucks coffee free of charge in the room.Fast elevators with little to no waiting time.Overall nice and good hotel but a little bit overpriced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely hotel and very friendly and helpful staff. We asked for bathrobes and slippers which we thought were supposed to be in the room, no problem within 5 minutes they were delivered to our room. The room was quite spacious considering there were four women in it , lovely shower and plenty toiletries if needed, would definitely recommend to anyone visiting New York, two minute walk to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Flawless experience. Beautiful, updated, extra-clean rooms. Very competitive room rate. Universally courteous and helpful staff. Can't beat the location. Restaurants, bar, fitness center - all top notch. Can't wait to come back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time staying here, would recommend it. The hotel was great location right next to Times Square and subways. The staff are very friendly and helpful, when leaving we got offered a town car to get to the airport which included all tips, taxes for $75 which was great price as we'd spent $65 in a yellow cab. It was nice to just to have no hassle the man sorted all our luggage as we had 3 suitcases a stroller and a toddler it really took some stress away. The maids were lovely, always made sure the room was spotless and amnesties stocked up. The room we stayed In was a king room, the views weren't great as we were only the 18th floor but the room itself was a nice size for New York. A nice sized wardrobe but only 3 draws for clothes, didn't quiet understand the bedside draws though as you couldn't put anything in it was a bit pointless. Loved the bathroom floor as it had a heated and the rain shower was great the only thing I would complain about was the bathroom door opened inwards and if you pushed it to far it would spring back and hit you as it was an awkward sized bathroom with the toilet around the corner right in front of a big window. The bed was a nice size as we had to share with our son even with him starfished out there were plenty of room and very comfortable. Overall great stay, I would recommend this hotel but I personally don't see the appeal of New York at all, ive been twice now and much prefer Vegas. it's not very child friendly which is ironic you'd think vegas would be less child friendly but I would say vegas is way more child friendly than NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: To be truthful we just went up to the rooftop (57 floors I think) to see the view and have a drink. Well worth doing. Nice, clean, modern well-staffed hotel that couldn't be more helpful. Within a stones throw of Times Square this is a quiet place for a restful drink with a view on the side!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For location this place has it all, literally steps away from Times Square and all the hustle and bustle you want, but on the higher floors , we were on 25, just quiet enough. Rooms are big by NYC standards, very comfortable and well appointed. Never used the restaurant, but both the Bar 54 on the top floor (drinks expensive , but what a view) and the bar in the lobby were excellent, and the unseasonal weather, 20 Celsius on the Friday, allowed us to sit on the front patio and people watch with a cold beer. Even got to see Jake Gyllenhall coming out of the stage door of the adjacent theatre! Will stay again when next in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very modern and clean hotel without all the crowds and noise of some Times Square Hotels. Easy walk to the theater district. Good for families, quiet business types and serious theater goers. The hotel does not have their own garage for parking; however, there is a public garage directly across the street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Expensive, as you would expect from a midtown Manhattan hotel, but well located and extremely comfortable. Fun though laughably overpriced rooftop bar. T45 restaurant is excellent for breakfast and lunch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was part of a theater package. However, I would stay here again. It is very well located and we walked to every place on our agenda--including The Public which is about 3 miles from here. Taxis and subways are nearby in case the weather makes walking unpleasant. The linens are nice. The amenities are excellent. The hotel was also quiet. WiFi is free. And best of all, the staff was outstanding.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The front desk wad great offering cookies and water when ever you needed. The room was spacious, wonderful hot shower. Beds comfortable. The dinner was great and room service was speedy. Close to everything and the bar on the rooftop was awsone

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our second stay at the Hyatt Times Square and we were not disappoint bred. The hotel is very centrally located near lots of restaurants and theaters. The view of the Manhattan skyline from the room was very impressive, and the room was a decent size.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square is a well appointed facility in an ideal midtown location. It is chic and well maintained by a friendly and professional staff. Best of all, management respects its guests, which to say they do NOT engage in the despicable resort fee bait and switch that has become the scourge of the industry. This is the place to book on your next trip to New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you haven't been to NYC before, like me, this is your place, I'll guarantee! Just take the express Elevator to the 54th floor and see the stunning Skyline from downtown Manhattan. If you still have more questions ask pls. The breakfast is there, as well as the B54 Bar at night, so you will be there Minimum 2 times per day. I shot amazing Panioramic photos there and only this photos were worth the trip, trust me. A room in a higher floor is the best, and if you can afford it, book it in advance. We were happy to get upgraded for free, as well as we got an late check out for free till 1pm! Thanks again to the friendly Lady at the reception.Usually i dont post my photos here at Tripadvisor, but in the Special case i will Show you why you MUST book this Hotel. The Times Square is the perfect start to the central Park, or to the other direction, like the Ground Zero or the Brooklyn Bridge. Doesnt matter where you want to go, what you want to visit. You are right in the heart from NYC. Enjoy your stay Folks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was aScore. Located right in the heartOf Times Square NYC. The room was aNice size forManhattan. The beds were super comfortable. Staff wasFriendlyAnd courteous. They broughtMy children and I toThe roof top toCheck out the view andLet us check in early upon arrival. Would definitely return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square last week and were very satisfied with the hotel, overall service, location and our room. Right in the middle of the theater district on West 45th, this is the perfect location if you are in town for a show or want to visit any of the excellent restaurants in the area. We found our room on the 42nd floor to be clean and comfortable - they must have remodeled recently, it was very nice. The bar aon the 54th floor offers fantastic views of the city. The fitness center on the 4th floor is also a class act - a nice selection of equipment and well maintained. The service from the parking valet to the front desk staff to the maids were all friendly and in several cases, went above and beyond. Thank you - you earned our business and we'll be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed there during 5 nights in Feb. Location is ideal, on Times Square, minutes to Bryant park, and conveniently in between 3 subway accesses. Rooms are not like typical hugely sized americans rooms, but recent and nicely decorated. Bed mattress is great. Bathroom very convenient and well cleaned and maintained. Staff is very friendly and comprehensive (we had to shift our dates by 1 day due to plane delay and this has been possible at no extra cost!). Will definitively stay here again. I wouldnt recommend breakfast in the restaurant downstairs, since the food is just OK and quite pricey, even for the area (~35$ per person)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms very clean and modern, the bar on top floor well worth visiting for the views. We met the manager Philip Stamm in the lift and he was very welcoming and went out of his way to put gluten free goodies & subway passes in our room, which was a very nice gesture and created a wow factor when we got back after a day out and about.Would highly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room and bathroom are clean, a safe option to stay in New York.The location is very convenient, with easy access to the metro and by foot reaching all Broadway's shows, 5th avenue shops, Times Square etc.For sure would prefer it again in future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was a little worried at first about being so close to Times Square, but it was just enough off the beaten path for walking. The staff was very accommodating, the rooftop bar was fantastic. It also helped it was in the 60's in February as well a couple days. I would highly recommend staying here. The bed was a little firm for my liking, other than that. No issues.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric is a wonderful new hotel in a great location. The room was squeaky clean and the staff knowledgeable and friendly. My room was small, but then again I find most New York City hotel rooms small. Overall, it's a perfect place to stay if you have business in mid-town Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You cant get any closer to Time Square than the Hyatt Centric. You step outside, turn right walk 50 paces and you are in Time Square, ideal. As for the hotel, its clean, has lots of staff that are only too happy to help, whether its to clean your room in a short window or assist with an excursion and the rooms well presented with spacious bathrooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location , very clean hotel , wonderful friendly staff . We live on Long Island and wanted to stay overnight after seeing a show . Would highly recommend this hotel . My family of four stayed in a standard room which was small but ok as we didn't spend much time in the room . Very comfortable bed .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was such a wonderful hotel to stay at if you want to stay in Times Square! It's so close to many attractions: Broadway, Rockafeller, Bryant Park, Central Park. I loved being able to walk outside and immediately start exploring. The room itself wasn't anything special, but it was clean and had large windows for a nice view of the streets below (I think we were on like the 26th floor). All employees were friendly and helpful.My favorite thing about this hotel is its two bars. T45 was its ground-level bar. It had an indoor and outdoor area, and both looked out into the streets. It had snacks and of course, drinks. The drinks weren't too pricey so we stayed here until it closed at 11pm. At 11pm, we would head up to the hotel's rooftop bar, Bar 54 (on the 54th floor). Here, the drinks doubled in price, though the view and experience was worth it. We just got a pitcher to share, which was a much better value. This bar also had an outdoor and indoor area. The outdoor area had seats looking over the whole city, so perfect for spending your nights in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location but of-course very pricey hotel. Very small lobby as well as all other common areas like gym. We had Queen size room and that was OK in size but some other similar rooms seemed to be smaller. Lots of good breakfast places nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and friendly staff! The beds are very comfortable and the Keurig machine and refrigerator in the were a bonus! The bar on the 54th floor had an AMAZING view! High tech hotel! Definitely coming back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Only one exception to what was a great stay at a great hotel. Helpful and professional front desk, good food in the restaurant with good service and a location which couldn't be better. Really disappointed therefore to come with a negative. When we asked the very friendly and helpful doorman how best we could get to the airport he suggested a car as opposed to a yellow cab. It was only slightly more expensive, and the tolls AND tip/gratuity was included in the price we should pay the driver. But when we get to the airport and paid the driver he tells us that the gratuity is NOT included. So why were we told it was? Is someone on commission here to sell as many car transfers as possible? Or is the driver trying to get two gratuity payments? Just leaves a sour taste. Someone is being dishonest and trying to take advantage of tourists. Shame, as all other New Yorkers were so friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here on a busy holiday weekend, one night after staying at the spectacular Park Hyatt. We were afraid of being disappointed based on the inevitable difference in quality, but we had nothing to fear. This is a solid hotel. The rooms are quite large by NY standards, and the staff was tremendous. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff, everyone was incredibly friendly and gracious. And the location is hard to beat if you're in town to be a tourist. We were with our young kids, and they loved being right next to Times Square. We could walk to just about everything, and subway stops are always close by for going farther away.We wouldn't hesitate to go back -- this place is a safe bet in a city with lots of variability in hotel quality.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall we had a great experience at the Hyatt. I would stay here again. The price was right and the staff was very helpful with answering any questions we had. The hotel helped with complementary metro passes. This was a nice added surprise and much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I could not ask for anything more. The hotel was incredibly conveniently located and well priced. It was very comfortable with excellent service. I would definitely stay at Hyatt again the next time i come to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for friend birthday in February. The service in his hotel was excellent and the rooms were clean. We shared a family room which was too small for 3 people. There was no rom for our cases and not enough closet space to unpack which made it uncomfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've stayed in this hotel multiple times and every time is a great experience. The staff is welcoming and accountable and the hotel is clean, easy, and a great choice for any trip! Additionally, the location is central to any subway line making navigating a breeze.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It is always an unexpected pleasure when staff at a big city hotel are personable, friendly, yet very professional. The hotel was very quiet- no street noise and no noise from other guests. Room service could be improved on but there are many restaurants in Times Square to choose from.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just wrapped up our stay for my daughters 10th Birthday. I didn't realize that her birthday weekend was also a combination of Presidents' Day and Valentine's Day weekends. Even though the hotel seemed really busy with checkins, we didn't wait very long, and the front desk gave us plenty of their time and attention to answer my questions. The room was tastefully decorated, and the beds were so comfortable. We were on the 18th floor and had a decent view, but I didn't come to NYC to view it from my room, so what we could see was just fine. We got the girls settled into the room with dinner and movies, and ventured up to the rooftop bar. We really appreciated being treated like we belonged there, because we were two 30 something moms looking like a hot mess after running around the city with two 10 year olds all day. The cocktails are so well thought out, and I enjoyed every sip. After drinks we decided to go to the restaurant downstairs for snacks and another drink. Again, wonderful drinks and our small bites were delicious. Actually, it was the best tasting food we ended up eating the entire weekend. On our last day, we checked out and the hotel was kind enough to store our luggage for us. Every staff member I encountered was friendly. This will be my first choice on a return trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in September 2016! The hotel is located in central position, just few minutes walking from Times Square. The room is big enough, well designed and clean. Staff is friendly, professional and always available to answer all your questions. The view we had from our room was just amazing! There is only one thing I would like to say. As outside was really hot (around 30-35degrees) in the reception/hall was almost cold because of the aircon. They should have kept the temperature a bit higher to let the guests enjoy more this part of the hotel. Apart from that everything else was ok! We recommend this hotel if you wish to stay really close to the centre!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel very small rooms. Bath tub and bathroom quite nice. The amenities for the bathroom are very limited and smell too fruity for a hotel offering. The potatoes in the morning are pretty terrible and were consistently old tasting each day. I would stop serving these. I am being serious about this.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms are "large" by NY standards and the decor is comfortable. We had amenities, including two towels and slippers, that went beyond the standard room expectations. The bar on the 54th floor provides a spectacular view of Times Square. There are views of rooftops one does not get by walking around. All in all a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room was decent but not what I was expecting. Being that I booked the hotel through TripAdvisor, I felt like they didn't give me the best room possible for the price I paid however the stay was comfortable and my boyfriend & I had a great time nonetheless.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am a hyatt platinum passport holder and very happy for this membership benefits. When I checked in to hyatt centric NY, I checked in with certain level of expectation. Hence, these are my ratings for the hotel: 1. Location to the times square : very good 2. Room cleanliness: very good 3. Room size : just nice for 3 adult ( with additional of 1 extra bed ) 4. Service: as expected from the hyatt chain, although I was dissapointed due to confusing billing system that occurred during that period ( which according to the front desk is due to the maintenance of their computer system ). Understand about the upgrading but totally not expecting these kind of confusion ( not very pleasant) Tips for Asian travellers: All American hotels provide coffee maker in the room, but as my elderly mother loves her own instant coffee, hence we need a electric kettle, therefore prior to my trip I have requested the hotel to provide a kettle inside the room. Never tried the food inside the hotel, however few blocks from the hotel they have cafes that open for breakfast, lunch, dinner and supper...so food is not a problem.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, steps away from all the Broadway theatres & numerous places to eat. Within very easy walking distance of many tourist spots e.g. Rockefeller, Empire State, Macy's, 5th Ave etc. 6 min walk to Port Authority for buses to Jersey Gardens/ Woodbury Common. Good sized rooms, excellent bathroom with large shower & underfloor heating. Downside, ( and minor) the receptionist at check in gave us very few details about the hotel - we managed to listen in to what the guests checking in beside us were told- perhaps a new staff member?Lifts fast, a minute or 2 waiting time maximum. 2nd highest rooftop bar in NYC, can't comment as we did not manage to go - no mention of any facilities at check in which seems strange for a business not to encourage in house spending from guests! All in all, good experience & would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first stay at the Hyatt Centric. I chose it based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. The location is perfect. You are steps away from Times Square and all of the Broadway theaters. It is just a short walk to other midtown tourist sites. The staff was very friendly and security is ever present, which makes you feel safe. They limit access to the hotel elevators so people off the street cannot access guest room floors. I was upgraded to a room on the 39th floor with a view of Times Square and floor to ceiling windows. The room was modern, comfortable and very quiet. The bathroom was spacious by New York standards and had a rain shower. There were plenty of outlets in the room at strategic locations for charging cell phones and computers. There was also a coffee maker and refrigerator in the room. The bed was very comfortable and there is a large flat screen tv. I highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again on my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Few feet from Times Square/Broadway it's been ideal for our first couples trip to NY. We booked a deluxe city view room which was perfect for the two of us, my boyfriend likes the room with a view and it gives you that extra slice of room space. Bedroom modern, clean. Bathroom, large shower. Great hairdryer. Ticks all the boxes. Hotel has bar on 54th floor. Views are good and they keep nice tables for residents of the hotel but I think it's hugely over priced. Don't get me wrong, New York is expensive and you expect to pay 15-30 dollars for a nice cocktail BUT here they are 26 dollars (without tip) there was way better places across the town to spend that sort of money. It feels overpriced. For worth while spending try the rainbow rooms bar or something similar! All in all, good stay. Would come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff needs training on customer service. Rooms are clean and very nice.Restaurant and room service needs to be revised for hours of service. Great location of the hotel for work, plays and some restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in the penthouse suite & it was incredible from the views of Times Square to the comfy beds & wonderful bathrooms. We were one floor away from the rooftop bar which was breathtaking! The staff is very friendly & helpful. Loved my time in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great staff ,very well located and nice accommodations in center of NYC. Room was very clean. Hskping staff excellent. Convenient to everything in the Times Square area and only a quick subway or cab away from everything else.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a bar at the top that is a must for anyone coming to NYC. They have great cocktails and amazing views of the city. The hotel is in the center so its really easy to get on the subway and get uptown to the museums and central park, or head down town to Greenwich village, or over to Chelsea district.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a wonderful place to stay for a honeymoon!! We really enjoyed our stay with my husband. Hotel is exactly IN Times Square, it is just 2' walk. We had a double room with a nice view. It is really comfortable and there is a lot of space. We had 2 big suitcases and 1 smaller and they fit really good in the closet. As this was our honeymoon trip hotel putted in our room beautiful flowers (it was a nice surprise). Every day we had 2 bottle of water and coffee (complimentary) in our room and that was nice because after a long day you really want to drink a coffee and relax.There was security 24 hours and this made us feel really safe.Staff was kind but specially the housekeeping. A big BRAVO for the ladies!They were perfect and our room was always clean. It surprised me when I saw them few times and they asked me with a big smile if I needed anything. My husband and I would be happy to visit Hyatt Centric Times Square again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: this Hyatt hotel is a rather "standard" Hyatt without the luxury of the Hyatt Regency hotels ( especially in Asia); it is a down to earth, modern hotel with well equiped rooms, relatively quiet for a busy area. Bathroom and shower very good, excellent bed. When we stayed there this year ( it is our 3rd stay) the breakfastroom on the groundfloor was being refurbished so breakfast was in the bar on the topfloor which gave it an extra touch.so, reasonable hotel in a good location but don't expect a luxury 5 star feeling.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was awesome. Located only 1/2 block from Times Square, very clean and nicely appointed. Staff was outstanding...VERY professional and pleasant. Cant wait to go back. Great Hotel. Great People. Great Location. Cant wait to go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent experience with my family in the big apple. The room is very comfortable and clean. The view is great. The elevators are very fast. I recommend the breakfast in the top roof restaurant at the 50th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I scheduled a mother/daughter weekend to New York and wanted a hotel fairly close to rockerfeller center. The Hyatt was only about 3-4 blocks away from Rockerfeller center. When we checked in, we valet parked and the guys were really nice and informative! We arrived early and they had our room ready for us! It is a beautiful hotel. They brought our luggage up with no problems and the room was very nice! The location was great for it was close to the theaters and we walked to a lot of different shops and restaurants. We were able to take a cab easily down to catch the ferry to Statue of Liberty! The weather was beautiful and good thing we went first weekend in February for the next week New York had a ton of snow. When we checked out on Sunday, the hotel attendants stored our luggage while we went to the Natural History Museum, we had 8 pieces of luggage. We went came back 4 hours later, we got our luggage with no problem and they told us it would be a 20 minute wait until we got the car but the wait was only 10 minutes! The valet put all our luggage in the car and back to Virginia we went. When we got home , we discovered that we were missing a piece of luggage and I immediately called the hotel. I spoke with Matthew and he was very apologetic and told me he would find the luggage and call me back. Within a hour , he called and said they had forgotten to give us that one piece and was very sorry . They were going to fedex the suitcase to us and pay for the expense since it was their error. He was very nice and understanding and he even called me when fedex picked up the luggage to tell me it was on its way! I will definitely stay there again for the customer service was awesome!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt @ Time Square is one of my favorite hotels to stay when I come to NY on Business.The staff are friendly & courteous, the rooms are nice & clean and the location is great. The only thing this hotel is currently missing is a place to sit down and eat like a restaurant. According to the front office one will be opening up soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My fiancee booked a window table here to celebrate our engagement, the minute we walked in we were greeted with a glass of prosecco and congratulated (he had only proposed 30 mins prior). From then on we were congratulated by a number of members of staff and the service was brilliant. we ordered a sharing plate which was also delicious not to mention the superb view of the skyline. Would definitely recommend for Drinks and bites.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I are big fans of the Hyatt hotels. We've stayed in 20+ locations and this was our favorite one all around. The front desk service agents were so professional, friendly, and accommodating. One of the service agents, Clifford, went above and beyond. He was so pleasant and is such a great asset to the brand.We were traveling with our 7 month old baby and it was her 1st time in the big apple. Everything worked out perfectly. They provided a crib, extra bottled water, umbrella (it was raining), and baby products. Beds were super comfortable, in room coffee was great (Starbucks), view was phenomenal, and there's a rooftop restaurant/bar on the 54th floor that serves great food. I couldn't be happier!! Hyatt has a customer for life!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the moment we were allowed to check in early, then got a free upgrade on our room, to the wonderful modern amenities in the room including a heated bathroom floor, we were treated with consistent friendliness and professionalism. We were even given a nice umbrella so we could still enjoy the city on a rainy day

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern, luxurious room and wonderful friendly customer service! Easy walk to a variety of great restaurants, theaters and Times Square. Concierge was so helpful! We are planning to stay here each time we are in New York!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Doesn't look like much from the street but once the staff greets you, wow! From there on its top notch. Very nice rooms, great gym, fantastic sky bar. I will definitely come back. This is my go to place in NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hyatt Centric and we thoroughly enjoyed everything about our visit!As this trip was for my birthday they kindly upgraded us and the suite we had was beautiful with great views of the city!I must say a special thanks to Philip Stamm as he went above and beyond to make sure our trip went without a hitch!We're regulars at the Hyatt hotels and the service we receive really sets the standard which is why we'd be reluctant to use another hotel as they're just so good!Location wise this is a great choice, it's so central to everything that you can easily get to all of the top attractions on foot, it also makes for a welcome retreat away from the busy city!We can't recommend this hotel enough, the rooms are spacious, the views are great, it's very clean and the service is fantastic we'd definitely return!Thanks Hyatt for another great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a very nice hotel, due to its location it was very easy to get around and to all the main tourist spots. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and they also gave us an upgrade on our room when they found out we were on our honeymoon

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great experience all the way around, nice location convenient to everything in NYC. the staff was friendly and accommodating, I stayed one night a the W across the street and was extremely disappointed with the staff and overall attitude. I highly recommend this hotel to the business traveler or vacationer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in feb 2017. Location is ideal, just 2 min walk away from Times Square. Clean, comfortable hotel with crisp white sheets. Bathroom clean and modern. Towels a bit old tho. Keurig machine in room however no tea! Overall a good hotel with a great location

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We came for a special birthday holiday. Fantastic trip!Great hotel will definitely stay here again.!New York did not disappoint.we loved it.!!!!!Red flame dinner on 44th street East suggested by staff for breakfast has the most wonderful breakfast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a great stay but still waiting for my pre authorisation if my card to be paid back 10 days later. Emailed hotel a few times but no response. £250 on top of hotel price I feel was a bit extortionate and not being paid paid on departure was not expected

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place was great! I don't have one complaint and I'll be staying here always! From the staff to the restaurant on the top floor, everything was absolutely perfect! Would recommend to anyone in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was received well when I first checked into but he hotel. Then the manager was involved. Then a piece of my makeup was misplace from my room. I did not del comfortable after due to the fact that I felt like my personal belongings where being looked through.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Upgraded per Hyatt membership to a large, well appointed room with a great view of Broadway. Many nice touches included ample plugs, multiple light control, heated bathroom floor, walk-in shower, two bathrobes. Bed and blanket were comfortable and warm respectively, Staff was competent and friendly from desk to room. Spa and gym onsite (did not use). Very convenient to the show we saw and many good restaurants, yet quiet, and not just for New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just stayed here for 4 nights during a visit into New York and we absolutely loved this hotel.We were staying on the 24th floor in rooms 2405 and 2406. Both with spectacular views of Times Square.The rooms are very spacious and we had one room with a king size bed, and another room with Twin double beds. They are decorated very nicely and kept immaculately clean throughout our stay.The housekeeping staff are so good and very sweet, be sure to say Hi if you bump into them in the corridor. Our shampoo's and conditioner's as well as body wash and soap were replenished ASAP and the room was kept so nicely maintained.We had no problems at all, the air con worked great, TV's fantastic and the bathroom amenities were perfect. The Hair dryer works so well too and an Iron and Ironing board are kept in the closet.The safe is great and has the function to set your own code. This is quite large too, we were comfortably fitting a large MacBook, kindles, travel documents and a handbag in there no problem.I would definitely recommend this hotel as it's location is fantastic. We did not try any of the restaurants, however if they are anything like the hotel's service I can imagine they are wonderful.The hotel has a Spa called Timeless which provide the soaps etc. and they smell delicious. The lobby can hold your bags if you require after check out with no hassle and you get a nice warm welcome every time you get back into the hotel.BE SURE TO CHECK OUT THE ROOFTOP BAR, It's amazing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in NY for two night and I must tell you from the 42nf floor at Times Square, it is a site to never forget. Besides all the activity below, the lights & signs going up and down the sky scrappers fabulous. The curtains and shades allow for a comfortable nights sleep. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are large, very clean, and the staff was extremely friendly and easy to get along with. The Rooftop Bar and restaurant were very comfortable and relaxing. It might have been the thin air on the 54th floor. Highly recommended for its location to shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in very good conditions, the only thing will need to add it's a map that shows you where are the restaurants, bars, etc. by the other hand, it is an amazing place, some advantage we have, it's that the Times Square is like 20 steps from the hotel door to the right you can find everything so close.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel a few times already and always enjoyed our stay. This past weekend was no exception. Check in was quick and easy, and even though we arrived at 1:30 pm (check in is supposed to be at 4pm), our rooms were ready for us. We always like to get the king bed with balcony, even though it was really cold outside this past weekend. Although the staff are nice, they are not especially friendly. Maybe they are just trying to be professional...not complaining though. They gave us no issues during our stay and provided great service.The hotel is clean and modern and everything was comfortable, from the beds to the bathrooms. I do wish the water pressure was a little stronger in the shower though, and I do wish that the cordless phones were easier to use. There is a button on it marked, "Housekeeping" but when you press it, nothing happens. In fact, none of the buttons seemed to work. Later we were told to just press "0" instead. Minor, but annoying. And we were a little disappointed that the restaurant downstairs was being renovated, but the food was available on the 54th floor at the Sky Lounge, which is worth checking out for the views and for a late night drink if you can swing by. No kids after 10pm up there btw. Elevators are fast, staff is always around to fulfill your requests. What else can you ask for? Overall, great stay for us as usual.The location is great as it is steps away from the center of Times Square, but since the entrance is on 45th Street and not on 7th Ave or Broadway, I liked that we had a little separation from the crowds when entering and exiting the hotel. Bryant Park and Radio City are just a few blocks over as well. It is a really convenient location with plenty of eateries and stores to choose from including convenience stores and fast food options if you are on a budget. You really have so many choices when it comes to food, things to do, and sights to see from this location. This is NYC. Enjoy it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 1 minute walk to Times Square in the heart of everything New York has to offer. The rooms were spacious and clean with great views on the square. The roof top bar was nice but over priced and had to wait over an hour for a seat despite booking. Stay in this hotel if you want to be near Times Square, you won't regret it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We came to the hotel to visit Times Square and spend time at Central Park. Our room had every amenity we wanted and we were so pleased with the size of the room and its view of Times Square. The fitness room was also amazing. We will definitely come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric this past weekend with our tween daughter. It was in a perfect location to walk to nearby attractions such as Times Square and the Theater district. Check- in was very quick and pleasant thanks to De De who went above and beyond to make sure that we were happy with our room on the 51st floor. They also sent some treats and a nice card to celebrate my husband's birthday which was appreciated. The room was extremely quiet and comfortable. However, the only downside was that the bed was a little to firm for my taste but we had two queens which seems rare in NYC. This deluxe room gave us a lot of room to spread out in. It helps to shop around on parking websites ( we used best parking) as we were able to get overnight parking across the street for $20- by booking a few weeks in advance. There were no in/out privileges with this rate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past year, and it really is my favorite hotel in the Times Square area. It is far enough removed from Times Square that you do not have to fight crowds to get in and out but so close that you are there in less than a minute. The rooms are functional and clean and tastefully decorated - my last visit was in a suite using a Diamond Suite Upgrade, and that suite was simply out of this world. I love the rainforest showers. The beds are comfortable. This hotel provides everything I want when I am out of town. Do yourself a favor and stay here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Be aware there are 2 sets of elevators. One for lower floors one for upper floors. They didn't tell us that when we checked in and we got on the wrong one. They let you print your boarding pass and will give complementary Metro Cards. Be advised it is a NYC hotel, so don't expect a big room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, it's at a great location only couple blocks away fro Times Square. Hotel is contemporary and like a boutique hotel with one restaurant. If you are used to the larger hotels, this is not for you. The staff are friendly and helpful but the front desk staff need to learn about Travellers Cheques. The first time I asked the front desk to cash my Travellers Cheque they had no idea what it was. They had to ask for the manager and the manager just told them it's like cash, all it needs was my signature. The second day I went to the front desk to get my Travellers Cheque cashed, none of the front desk staff knew what to do. They said they don't know what it was and one of them said we don't do it at the hotel. I told her that they cashed it yesterday so Yes, they do; as all hotels and most businesses use these as cash. They said they have to get the manager; then they said the manager was at a meeting and they can't do anything. I said fine but they should learn what to do when a guest brings them Travellers Cheques. I was angry when front desk staff said NO, they don't have to learn. That is poor training and Hyatt being a well known brand should train its staff better. It's very poor customer service when the guest is polite and the staff became rude because he/she doesn't know how to do something and refuse to take constructive criticism. Just because of this, I will think twice before coming to this hotel again. For all the good things about the hotel, a couple of front desk staff can ruin your stay and the good name of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location on 45th Street. You are 2 minute walk from times square. The hotel itself is clean , the rooms are well sized. I was on the 17th floor and facing onto 46th Street and heard no noise from the busy street. The rooftop bar is very smart with a large balcony with superb views of downtown. The restaurant was shut for reburishment so can't comment on that. I did have a look at what breakfast cost and it was $25 for the buffet and $15 for the continental. TIP.... Go to cranberry cafe 3 doors up (east) from the hotel. Breakfast, lunch and dinner is superb. It's open 24/7I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel has a perfect location, it's located in the center of Time Square where you can explore from Times Square to Grand Central, Rockefeller and other top places just in walk distance. The staffs are very friendly and very helpful. The facilities are good, they have big concierge which is very important if you have schedule outside NY & coming back to the hotel. They provide Starbuck! : ) It's worth it to stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is perfect. Right in the middel of all the action, and just far enough away from Time Square for a little peace and quite. Hotel is very stylish and comfortable. The rooms are very private with the best views of the City lights. Stay on the upper floors for the best experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel for a variety of reasons, for one because of the Diamond suite upgrade and the nightly room rate but also because of the location right on Times Square and because it's an easy walk from the Port Authority bus station when coming from Newark airport.We had a nice welcome by Latoya at checkin who briefed us on the diamond benefits at the hotel - a nice touch and one that is conspicuous by its absence at times in other Hyatts. Our corner suite was way up on the 50th floor. Stunning views of Times Square below and the Chrysler building and One World Trade in the distance. The "corner" part of the room was tiny which makes for problematic curtain rails. A minor issue but annoying. Overall the room was great, a little small compared to other suites but a decent size for NY standards. The Kerrigan coffee machine is a nice touch too and a good upgrade from the regular coffee machines in Hyatts. Nice bathroom amenities and a good shower and the view, did I mention the view? Breakfast is free for Diamond members or $25 if you have the hot buffet. It's Ok but a little underwhelming compared to other Hyatts, but the basics are all there. I was a little frustrated by the inconsistency though, on the last morning I was offered fried eggs and Cappuccino which I wasn't aware were available on the first days, oh well, not a big deal. You'll be making a great choice if you choose this hotel for a NY visit, ty to get a high floor if possible. All of the bus tours leave from within a 2 or 3 block radius and there are literally hundreds of restaurants nearby (we opted for Chinatown though).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very central. Times Square is right at the corner. Fantastic location if you are seeing a show. Rooms are clean. We asked for high level room floor 47. No noise up here. Had brekky in the lounge on level 54- it was ok. Heaps of other places to eat so didn't go back next morning

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is super clean, the staff were just simply amazing and it is super easy to move around from there as it's centrally located. I had a room with a view and I could see the Hudson River as well as the freedom tower in lower manhattan.Definitely would stay there again with my family if I'm ever back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I chose this hotel for us to enjoy some R&R and downtime on our trip to NYC to see the sights and attend some Broadway shows.UPSIDES: Comfortable and clean, good night's sleep, and I just liked the layout of our room and bathroom. Totally roomy enough for us and comfortable for relaxing. I like how they had the outlets raised above the nightstand for your phone, just things like that were nice. Good shower, comfy mattress. Check in and out were both very quick and efficient. We were on the 9th floor (room 909 I think?) and it was by the ice machine which I was worried about with noise, but there was another door separating our part of the hallway from the machine, and open or closed I didn't hear ANYTHING from the hallway at night or late afternoon when we were napping or sleeping. Price was fair for the great location - off times square which is of course a touristy area (and not my favorite honestly), but since we were seeing 3 broadway shows, one each night, the proximity to the theaters was worth it for us. I also felt very safe for those who are concerned with that about being in a big city like NYC in a touristy area. Great housekeeping, also!!They have room service, a spa, and a gym, but we didn't use any of those things. There's also a rooftop bar/restaurant, but again, we didn't go ($24 cocktails is not my style).DOWNSIDES: were just that there weren't a ton of great food options around if you wanted to avoid the most touristy places (like just super tourist trap, overpriced food). We did get a great pizza nearby based on tripadvisor ratings, but the concierge recommendations seemed just to be on close places because when we looked at those recommendations on tripadvisor and google maps to walk there, they had like 3/5 stars. Odd for a recommendation. Same with chinese food - the concierge recommended somewhere to us we could call for delivery, and then when we called we were told they didn't deliver dinner. I thought this was the kind of thing the concierge was supposed to do, but it wasn't a huge downside because we just used websites like this to find alternatives. Just kind of a waste of time for unhelpful info.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location when you want to spend time around Times Square, which we did! Staff was warm and personable, rooms great and the roof top bar offer amazing views of Manhattan. They even have two igloos where you can sit outside and stay warm in the igloo. So much fun. Thank you all!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for a few days in the run up to christmas 2016, chose the hotel for it's central location and it is ideally placed on west 45th st between 6th & 7th, theatres on the doorstep and within few minutes walk, other direction a block to the rockefeller centre and then 5th avenue shops etc... The hotel lobby is quite small with a cafe on the side which is open long hours serving respectable food&snacks, fairly expensive but very convenient. Smooth check in and room decent, nice and clean with all the usual amenities, we booked an upgraded room for a view which was pretty average to say the least though the weather was miserable so not much lost. We always book non smoking and really didn't enjoy that next door was clearly a smoking room and had interconnecting doors, the whole floor literally stank as the people smoking in their room had the door ajar, for 2 nights the smoke was seeping in all directions, complained but hotel pretty full. Just poor to have smoking and non smoking in interconnecting rooms, never noticed it before but will make a point of checking it doesnt happen again. Maid service was a bit sporadic in terms of timing and didn't get done one day, very efficient when it was completed though. Nice hotel bar located on rooftop which was very smart, very expensive but you can understand why and worth a visit. The hotel overall is pretty good all be it not particularly big, it seems like everything is packed in together and the only thing you could say if your claustrophobic this is not the place for you. On the whole though its an ideal base to explore the city from.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Cant fault hotel or its location but if your taking cash take €400 more as the hotel requires this when checking in(holding fee) on top of the hotel bill, which to be honest i find ridiculous. But other than the above great hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square is a perfect choice for anyone wanting to be right on Times Square. It has an excellent location, only a minute’s walk from Times Square. The property itself is fairly new and still feels fresh. All the members of staff we encountered were welcoming and helpful.The rooms were a good size by New York standards, clean and in excellent condition. The bathroom was slick and modern.There is a restaurant to the left of the reception area, which serves breakfast but we did not try it. Bar 54 on the 54th floor serves bar food as well as drinks and has great city views from the outside area.There is also a good, well-equipped gym available. All in all, we had a great stay, close to all the attractions and would happily return next time we’re in New York if we want to be close to the theatres.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The beds are a bit larger than new york average which is the reason why we picked this place. The rooftop lounge is also very nice and offers a beautiful view. nicely equipped gym too. it's in time square so very near to Broadway theaters, the concierge helped us and found very nice tickets for the musical Chicago. I would really recommend this place :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Bday celebration for fiancée. Asked for a bday balloon in room and staff went all out. Although they made a mistake on bday name the bday card they provided at check in was a nice touch. My only complaint is the noisy shower

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we were within steps of times square. hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly. On our second day, our room key was not working and a service person was sent right away to fix it. we were back in our room within 15 minutes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall I was very impressed with our stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square. We stayed for 10 nights and found it to be a great base. Rooms - I thought they were quite large for NY. We had a corner room with 2 queen beds and there was plenty of room, including cupboard space. Bathroom was large and loved the heated floor, also very clean. Our cleaner (I think her name was Jennifer) did an amazing job throughout our stay. No request was too much. Even though it's only a stone throw from Times Square, the room itself had great soundproofing.We did snack and have a meal at the restaurant downstairs a few times. Food was great on all occasions and it was great knowing that it was always available. Doormen were always polite and helpful. Computers downstairs are free of charge for about 20 mins and makes very easy for booking shows, etc....Only negative was girl at front desk when we first checked in. Told us room isn't ready and checkin is at 4pm. Came back at 2pm and another lovely girl said yes our room was definitely ready. A smile always makes a difference.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very ideal location, room is very clean and well kept. Efficient check-in/check-out process. Very good for both personal and business trips. Rates are reasonable too. For exploring the city in the mid-town area, this is very ideal. But other parts of the city are accessible nonetheless. Best is if you are really there for Broadway shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall... a pleasant experience. It's pricey, but then again with its proximity to Times Square and the theater district it's not surprising. Staff is excellent, but often difficult to get someone to pick up the phone when calling either from the room or from outside.What I didn't like... Valet parking is $65... per night. That's a bit much. For that price they don't even allow in/out privileges. If you get your car and return it later it's another $65... inconvenient!!I'd gladly stay there again... when I can afford it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It starts with a reception very friendly and efficient. rooms are modern and very clean on a high floor you have great views of New York city a couple of more weeks to see the breakfast room renovated. if you are bored in your room Times Square is around the corner. ...an advice and be aware Don't go to the convenient stores located on the same block. prices are a ripoff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric in Times square was a terrific experience. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The location is terrific and close to many great sites. The room has a terrific view of the city and it's very quiet. I had a good night sleeping.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel. Room was luxurious & big with an awesome view. Bathroom was also super awesome as expected. And if I talk about its location, it's located in the heart of city & is 2 minutes walkable distance from Times Square. So, if a person wants to enjoy the top location in NYC, this is the hotel to go for. However, only con i felt was its location, for the people who likes to live in peaceful areas. And since area near Times Square is very crowded, some people might want to go for some peaceful area. That being said, my overall experience with the hotel was more than awesome since we stayed there because of the location & the luxury that it offers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hotel has a great location. Walking distance to times square. My room was also very cosy. The breakfast is great. You have to try the french toast. I stayed there 2 days and had the same breakfast cause i loved it so much! The bar upstairs was just okay- not that great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Can't say enough good things about the Centric Times Square. It's as central as you can get in mid-town Manhattan. Great walkability, can get a cab/uber/lyft/limo easily, very close to transit. Hotel staff were fantastic, it was an amazing weekend. Will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: love this property and highly recommend. Excellent location, modern rooms and attentive service. Facilities are also very good ( gym and roof top bar) . The food in the restaurant is good not great, get a room on a high floor (great views).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My reservation was connected rooms. By checking time Mr JEFF on the front desk told my that the hotel can't provide connect rooms this time but if I pay the hotel extra $25 USD for each room it can be available. Since I was traveling with my family and children I accepted to pay more, but in my opinion it was unfair and a very cheap business relationship with gusts.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We love the location and the overall hotel but were very disappointed with the comfort of the beds which we all found very hard and uncomfortable two of us had sore shoulders and sore backs the next day

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location - a few blocks away from the subway, Times Square and walking distance to many places of interest - Rockefeller Center, Theater District, Madame Tussauds, Radio City Music Hall & St. Patrick’s Cathedral. You will be right where all the festivities will be during Christmas and New Year. Great Service - Room Service & Housekeeping were attentive and wonderful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Parking was a breeze. (Thank you Walter!) Dede at the front desk was great. We were able to check in early, and then pay extra to leave the car in the garage while we explored after check out. Room was clean and large. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. The three of us shared room with 2 queen beds and had plenty of room. Bathroom was big enough, great hair dryer with a diffuser (which never happens!) The view was amazing. Roof top bar was upscale but not presumptuous. Lots of drink choices with comfortable chairs or tables if you prefer. View from up there was even better! (It would make a great place to watch the ball drop on New Years Eve.) Located close enough to everything, but just far enough from the hustle and bustle of Times Square to be able to relax. We went to the Empire State Building, Times Square, Broadway show, Penn Station, and Central Park. We walked everywhere without needing a cab or Uber. Would highly recommend and stay again if I had an opportunity to do so. Very impressed for the price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My partner got a great deal on this hotel for my Birthday in 2016. The room was amazing. The shower was fantastic and the bed was just wow! Could of slept there the entire time! On my actual birthday our room cleaner left some treats and a note which was a nice touch. We loved it so much we are returning this April!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Unprofessional and slow front desk staff. Hotel and room not clean and not cleaned on a regular basis. Low quality food for room service. This hotel is not up to par with most other Hyatts in major cities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I can't say enough good things about the Hyatt. Clean beautiful modern room in the heart of Times Square. Location is convenient to the port authority, theaters, shopping and a various assortment of eateries.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff were very good. We had need for medical care and they were very caring and helped arranged it for us.23 off our family stayed for 2 weeks and all were happy with their rooms. They were clean and serviced every day.Our room on our first stay was a bit noisy due to being too close to a neighbours cooling tower and the rubbish truck coming at 4am.Our next room was perfect.Even with the noise we believe the hotel to be excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We,had a total of six rooms and very happy with each one , the staff were very friendly and happy to help in anyway. The Hotel was perfect for Times Square and most of the shops and sightseeing buses .We would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location cannot be beat. Walking distance to theaters, Rockafeller center, and so much more. The service was excellent. Room service would arrive in about 15 minutes. Food was excellent. Bottled water is free. The rooms and beds are very comfortable and clean. All of the staff that we encountered (Front desk, doorman, driver, food delivery person and cleaning staff) were extremely helpful and polite. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our first time in NYC as a couple - celebrated our anniversary here. Got a high level room that had a great view of the city - including Freedom Tower in the distance and H&M right in front of us. Situated between Times Square and great shopping on 5th and 6th avenue. Thanksgiving parade was 1/2 block away...pretty cool to walk down and see that for a bit. Comfy beds. My husband loooooooooved the shower.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
