review_body: This hotel is in a great location a couple blocks off of Times Square and has a great fun vibe. The room design is very fun and modern (fabulous shower) with a great desk set-up for business travelers. It also has a great gym with enough machines to go around. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We went in November 2015 with my wife and two children. The hotel is perfect for what I like in hotels: very good price (with 25 USD pp for breakfast), excellent location (half a block from Times Square), modern, clean and with all services, including a good restaurant and a lounge on the terrace (not for children, of course). I will go again on my next visit, without a doubt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric has a great location. You are basically in Times Square and can walk to many places such as Bryant Park, Radio City Music Hall, all of the theaters. Many places to eat and drink. A hidden gem is Trattoria Trecolori at 254 W 47th Street- a short walk from the hotel. Delicious and inexpensive! The hotel/rooms are very clean and quiet. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Hotel in the center of Times Square in NYC close to all the shops and fun activities. When you visit ensure that check out all great restaurants all around you in Times Square. It was really a nice two days spent and it will not be my last as I intend to visit again and stay at the Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A wonderful Hotel to stay out .. Service was awesome.. It is right near Times Square. Walking everywhere.. Clean, friendly, and price was very reasonable... I highly recommend this Hotel.. It's near the great restaurants and bars

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is well located and the website gives a fair representation. However, I would have to agree with other reviews that claim the staff let the hotel down - they weren't particularly welcoming or helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved the room and view. The location and view from our room were exceptional. The staff was super friendly and accomodating. The only disappointment was the food in the hotel. We had room service breakfast and dinner and both were terrible. On our last night we tried the lounge on the 54th floor. The view was great, but the drinks were $26 each and the charcuterie plate tasted like it came from WalMart. Four drinks and the awful meat and cheese cost $160. I expected the prices, but not the poor quality of the food and drinks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a ski trip planned and due to the storm, we couldn't there. We had a room reserved here for later in the week so we called in hopes of getting a room that day and the other 5 days we would in the city. The management was very nice, we got a upgrade on our room which had an amazing view, and Bar 54 upstairs was pretty cool. From our room, we could see the H&M building, the Empire State building and the World Trade Center. We were walking distance to so many things even though it was super cold. We walked to Central Park and we walked to dinner almost every night. The only negative about this hotel was the room service. We paid $200 for dinner and the food wasn't worth it. My wife said her dish was "ok", but the steak I got was horrible. The actual restaurant is undergoing renovations, so only room service was available. But with so many food options around, hotel dining really isn't necessary. That was a bad choice on our part. But all in all, we will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in the hyatt centric for one night. The room was fine but I definitely wouldnt call this a luxury hotel. It is quite funky and I think would be more a young persons kind of hotel. If you were travelling for business I'm not sure I'd recommend it. I had stayed in the Grand Hyatt on a previous visit which I would think more suited to business clientele. The bar on level 53 is really expensive. Two g&ts + one tonic water was 46 dollars!! Breakfast on level 53 was ok. Service of staff not five star but good. When i go back to NY I wouldnt stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Average Hotel in great location. We did not go to the rooftop bar. Average price for one drink was ~$25. Staff was professional but not exceptional. Door man stood and watched as I tried to open the door with bags in my hands. Great location for Times Square and the Theatre District. Would probably stay again based on price and location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we stayed here for 5 nights the hotel is in a excellent location right next to times square we had room 3911 it was very large and clean with a very large bathroom with a bath and shower the staff is excellent.there is a bar on floor 54 with a excellent view we will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: hotel has declined from previous two visits. Heating worked poorly and getting a maintenance man late at night took so long i finally slept in my clothes as i had a meeting the next morning. Not sure why but room service breakfast, as expensive as ever, was served in a paper bag with plastic bowls due to some "remodeling". I loved the hotel on my previous trips but this trip was just awful. I had paid a real premium to stay here versus the Westin and others and truly regretted it

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place to stay . Convenient location. Clean and comfortable.No hidden charges or pressure. Helpfull staff. The bed felt awesome ,and was clean and white . I did not want to get up !All good.Many eateries nearby. Try the Italian place Buca toward Times Square. Did not try the hotel cafe, it had some odd hours.Thank you Hyatt !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This one of two hotels we stayed at in New York on two visits one week apart. This was the more expensive of the two, but it was worth it for the quality, cleanliness and location. We chose this hotel for two key reasons: Location - which was excellent; and the ability to have adjoining / interconnecting rooms for our family. The room configuration of a king suite connected to a queen double room was perfect for our family with plenty of space, privacy and two bathrooms. For the location and quality we found this hotel surprisingly good value. Staff were very helpful. We only ended up at this hotel after a very bad, if not terrifying experience with an Airbnb apartment we had booked. We now understand that Airbnb has some legal difficulties in NYC and we certaintly won't every try it again without doing our research first. Needing to 'evacuate' at from the Airbnb at check-in after being confronted by residents angry about the building being used for short term rentals, we booked this hotel at short notice and couldn't be happier with the outcome. A much better, cleaner experience in better location for a comparable cost.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. Central to everything, theater district, Rockefeller center, Bryant park all within a short walk. Hotel was very accommodating with an early Check in at noon for wife and I. There are many great restaurants and bars also with in a short walk. Would defiantly stay again for a night on the town

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just checked into the Hyatt Centric Time Square, paid extra for a queen room with a view, additionally requested a high floor. Got to room 2102 (54 floors but figured 31 was fine) only to see the attached view. I called the front desk to check if perhaps a mistake was made in room assignments and was actually told, this was a room with a view. Very disappointed for having paid extra. Will update this review if our stay improves.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean, centrally located located to Times Square & theater district. Great Irish pub next door with amazing food. I would recommend this place because of it's cleanliness and walking distance to so many attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was friendly, room was really nice. Enjoyed the top floor bar. Prices were a little high (even for NYC standards). The front desk was a understaffed at the time I arrived (there was a group that came in), but once I was able to check in, everyone was really great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent place to explore the city if going for tourism. Very central to Broadway, Rockefeller Center and other attractions. Cabs were easy to get and the lobby had a nice waiting area when waiting for a private car.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern hotel with chic decor and colors that uplift you in the "city that never sleeps." Hotel staff were superb offering early check-in, late check-out and fulfilled are various requests to cater to our kids.Pros:* Perfect location to make Times Square your hub; theater district, central park and great shopping and food is in walking distance* New facilities that makes the Big Apple trip pleasant * Young energetic staff offering proactive serviceCons:Hotel eating options were good (not great) but expensive with no sit in breakfast area except bar loungeI look forward to staying here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a place - the rooms were just as described, hotel staff extremely friendly and attentive, especially the concierge. Drinks very expensive at roof top bar but the view was worth it. Perfect location for exploring

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wasn't able to check me in at 2:00pm because there were no room for the low rate I got from hotels.com. Couldn't upgrade me either although she had rooms available. I asked when will the room be available and she said for sure 4:00pm regular check in hour. I said we might just wait in the hotel but was told I could leave a phone number and they will call back if room are done cleaning early. Comes 4:30pm and no phone call so o decided to go back and was told room wasn't available yet. Are you kidding me? Do I have not the right to have the same attention for someone who paid higher rate? Very disappointed at their services. But overall the hotel is great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My first ever visit to NYC...all i can say is that staying experience was awesome...hotel was worth every penny spent....great staff and room condition...location was amazing, about a minute walk from times square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I wasn't expecting such a large room in NYC. Pleasantly surprised. And for the price, this place was clean and the bathroom was brand new. The best shower ever! I will definitely recommend this hotel and I will return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms was ok but housekeeping was not good. She never change our bed sheets and the pillow cases. Shower had mold on the corners. I will never stay there. Lobby super small not enough space to seat and wait

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was so friendly. Women at the desk made sure we had the best experience for our one year wedding anniversary. She gave us a drink credit and gave us a high floor view instead of just a view king. Pedro at the bar waa so nice talking to as well

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything was great! I will definitely stay here in the future. The only complaint I have it that the room was very chilly and hard to keep at a comfortable heat. However, with that being said... we aren't use to the cold weather so it was cold for us regardless! Haha.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel in Times Square, Theater District, close to everything. Subway stations just few steps from the hotel. Complimentary water daily, coffee maker. I would stay in Hyatt Centric Times Square New York next time I'm in New York. I would highly recommend Hyatt Centric Times Square New York to couples, family, friends. It is excellent choice for business travelers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Did not like the hotel. Room smelled, hair on bathroom floor, shaky elevator , front desk understaffed. Lobby is not inviting. Location is great and my husband said the gym was nice. there are much better hotels for a price of this one

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed there on a Saturday night. We usually stay at the Omni but we wanted to stay closer to Times Square. You can not get a better location than this hotel. It is about a block away from Times Square. The views from the rooms are incredible. We had a south facing room that one out towards the Freedom Tower. The rooms are decorated in a modern style and are on the small side. However if you are staying in this area it is highly unlikely he that you would be spending that much time in your room. There is a deli several doors down where you can pick up sandwiches and some meals.  Overall this is a great hotel and we look forward to coming back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for a week with two older daughters and wife. Got the larger room with two big queens. Nice view and perfect location as we don't mind walking, taking the subway and exploring. Also we were in town to see shows, so the hotel made it easy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a very enjoyable short stay. Professional staff and very clean room and facilitiesDrawbacks were only some construction outside (noise) and the temporars unavailability of the restaurant.Finally a more spacious lobby was missing which gave it a crowded feeling at times.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Matt@ the Hyatt Centric Times Square was incredibly sweet. I had to cancel my reservation due to blizzard Brianna, and he was so sympathetic to our situation. I will rebook at some point and will definitely stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. Great staff. Simply Awesome! One of my favorite Hyatt properties! The location is very conveniently located near Times Square and The theatres. Bar 54 is awesome as well ! Trust me you will not be disappointed!!!!! Great Job Hyatt!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved the view and the price. Located 1 block from Times Square and TKTS booth. Got 1/2 price tickets for same day show! Bar on floor 54 vet expensive but with a look. Rooms are large by NYC standards and have great bathrooms. Very upscale and comfortable. Would stay here every time we come to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for New Years 2017. What an amazing experience! I travel to New York frequently for work so I have had the pleasure of staying at some of the best hotels in the city, but I have to say that the Hyatt Centric has been my favorite. The location, size of the room, and amenities are all great...but what really sets this hotel apart from any other is the staff. Everyone is so pleasant, helpful, and really makes you feel valued as a guest of the hotel. We had breakfast each morning via room service and the food was delicious and was always delivered within 15-20 minutes. I would highly recommend the Hyatt Centric to anyone looking for a hotel with a great location and stellar service near Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Whenever we can we try and stay at the Hyatt Times Square - good location, clean, modern and spacious rooms and there is a lot to be said about a hotel that can retain staff over many years. Not the cheapest but in comparison to other New York hotels which are older and not as well located, it stands out for value...plus, we feel at home every time we stay. So in the near 3 years we have known about this hotel (after fatefully stumbling over from the Millenium next door), we have not failed to be impressed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of the hotel is the best for exploring the entire area, we got around very easily using the subway system and walking a few blocks here or there. Hotel is on the newer side and if you can I would reserve a deluxe king view room, it's the only room in the hotel that offers a soaking tub, which was great after walking around the city all day, and our view was AMAZING! Rooftop bar for drinks too!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel twice as it is quite simply perfect! It's modern, clean, the staff are friendly and it is located a stone's throw from Times Square. The bar on the top floor has some great views of the city at night. Totally worth it - you can't go wrong staying there!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: All expectations exceeded at The Hyatt Centric Hotel during one of the busiest times of the year in NYC for Thanksgiving! Loved the Queen sized beds and the special touches i.e.: nice soaps/ shampoo/ fresh cookies, keurigs etc in the rooms! All staff very friendly and went out of their way to provide anything we asked for and more. We felt right at home - Midwest hospitality in NYC!! Thank you to all your staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here a family visiting our dream place - NYC!The hotel is clean and modern.The roof top bar is classy and offers great views.Maids were fantastic as rooms were always clean and tidy.Room service a tad pricey.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric was centrally located in Times Square. The staff are very friendly, helpful and professional. We will definitely stay here when we come back!!! A real bonus, the bathroom floors are heated!!! Loved it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From beginning to end our time at the Hyatt Centric enhanced out trip to NYC. Would not hesitate to stay there again and plan to do so. The staff was very welcoming and asked questions to understand our needs better and then met them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, efficient check in procedure. Nice clean rooms. Will definately stay there again. Staff was very friendly. Only negative was that mattress was too hard for my liking. Great NY deli right outside the door. Overall great experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Two minutes away from Times Square, this is a very nice and conveniently located hotel. I stayed on the 42nd floor and had no trouble sleeping although this is the noisiest part of New York. The room was very simple, modern and comfortable. Hotel features a very nice bar at its top floor with excellent views of the city. I highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I typically avoid staying anywhere near Times Square, but gave this Hyatt a shot and was pleasantly surprised. The service was exceptional, far superior to what I received at other Hyatt properties in the City.The rooms are large for NYC standards. I was upgraded to the Deluxe King which has a sprawling bathroom as well (I mean how many NYC hotel rooms have an enclosed shower and soaking tub).The hotel is located on the east side of Times Square so it is easy access to transit and attractions without going into TSQ. If you are looking for a quick bite on the same street two blocks East is Vanderbuilt Food Hall with many options to satisfy most.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location. We walked almost everywhere in the Manhattan area. Broadway shows, Central Park, 5th avenue, Madison Square and the Empire State Building are all within walking distance. Room is updated, roomy and comfortable. The view is amazing. Subway access is near by just in case you need to hit the China Town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Being New Year Eve I have to rate them as Great! Everything just sooo busy!Sirens at night were annoying. Not sure once again if that was do to time of year there. Security was insane but a great thing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was *very* centrally located. The rooms were clean and nicely set up. The gym was great. The lobby and check in process was a bit of a zoo. Not enough check in stations and pretty unorganized if you ask me. Overall a decent place, but nothing special

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay here was amazing. Great customer service and lots of amenitie. As soon as you walk out of the hotel you are literally a couple minutes from Time Square. . Highly recommend to anyone staying here in the city. So much stuff to do here with great staff and even security too. Bring some cash with you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff very polite and helpful. The room was very clean and comfortable. Location great for restaurants and attractions. Not far from subway. Would have appreciated tea making facilities in the room but otherwise happy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The lady checking me in was very difficult to understand on top of not very polite. I am a platinum rewards member and i spen a lot of money with this program and did not like how i was treated. I will not stay at this property again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice hotel. Very modern and clean during the busiest time of year. Parking at hotel was great. Valet made it easy to get rid of the car and got our car back to us within 15 minutes of us requesting it. We had a wonderful staff member on our floor who gave us fresh towels and got us a roll away bed. Overall, great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We went away for 3 days stay during December. Great location only 15 minutes walk to Rockefeller center and 8 minutes walk to Bryant Park . There is plenty of choices to go eat. An excellent location if you want to go see all the touristic places in New York City. Also the B54 roof top was really nice to take nice photos and a gorgeous view!The hotel has very nice and has a polite staff. If I have to stay in New York City I'll booked again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric is the best new hotel concept I have experienced. It's modern, uses technology, mood and nighlight controls, USB's everywhere, great colors, shower has rainfall head with shelving for all your goods and much more. The hotel has a small lobby and partitioned elevators so getting in and out of your room and hotel is quick and easy. I really enjoyed the place and will continue to use Hyatt Centric when I travel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel last minute, so we got a good deal. It was right before New Year's so it was very busy, but the staff was very courteous. The location couldn't have been better. The rooms were great - modern, clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is 1 block away from Times Square so walking to your attractions is very easy. The hotel is self it very nice and clean and the hotel staff was very nice and helped us with a few items. Our room had all the standard items you want/need in a hotel when the only time you are in the room is to sleep. We would stay at this hotel again if we wanted to be in the middle of the action for NYC! Expect a line when you arrive along with paying a premium to stay here for the location. Good Property!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As always, the Hyatt Centric Times Square was awesome! The location was beyond perfect. Only improvement would be to have better pillows and the rooms a little cleaner ... we found a lot of hair on the bathroom floor upon check-in. Other than that, loved it!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a great time. Friendly staff. Excellent views. The staff upgraded our room and made sure we had everything we needed. They held our bags in the hotel until we were ready to leave the city. We also had our car parked and they picked us up at the front doors.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have never been to New York so I had no idea where to stay. We stayed at the Hyatt Centric right off of 45th & 7th a 1/2 block from Time Square. The hotel was very nice and clean the beds were very comfortable and our view was amazing as we stayed on the 52nd floor looking at time square. The customer service is really good they were always willing to help me out when I needed something. The restaurant was pricey but then all the food in New York is expensive. The food was just ok. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric, just off Times Square for 8 nights over Xmas 2016 and it was just the perfect location! Yes it was a bit noisy, but what would you expect being literally steps away from Times Square? The double queen beds rooms were good, not huge but this is New York and the staff were friendly and helpful. I had chosen it based on other people's review on TripAdvisor and I was not disappointed. I would recommend it too!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a room with an awesome view for an even better price. I really needed to have a happy holiday & some r&r. It almost didn't happen. It was my first time in the city. I was alone. The ambiance definitely gave me what I needed in my small sliver of me time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Bookedthe Hyatt centric on a last minute site and it worked out beautifully! Had a bunch of kids with us and they worked it out so we had 2 adjacent rooms. Very nice and roomy bathrooms. Great location 1 block from Times Square!Only issue was the cost of parking at $70/nt for valet, but what can you say this close to Time Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderfully large modern clean rooms. Congenial accommodating staff despite the hectic Christmas seasonand crowdsparking was facilitated by an excellent bell captain despite crowded narrow congested streets  But certainly recommend this hotel or revisit it future date

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: T54 restaurant. Asked for a diet soda 4 times and he never brought it. Niece asked 3 times for her smoothie. Asked another waitress and she brought at end of meal in to go cup. Charged $5 for Diet drink. This was the worst service I've ever had. Stay away from this restaurant unless you love bad service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited NY for the first time just before Christmas and chose this hotel after reading many reviews.We were not in any way disappointed. The location is perfect for exploring. Our room was fantastic with a great view and the most comfortable bed. The rooftop bar was amazing, even if a little expensive.The service was outstanding throughout our stay and we'd give a mention and thank you to Dede who helped make our stay extra special.We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and will definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel to be near Times Square and at a reasonable rate. The hotel is 1 minute away from TS. It has a small lobby and a good concierge service with friendly staff. We are on floor 43 and despite the Big Apples 24hr noise we are cosseted away and hear very little. That may be different on NYE however when revellers rock the hotel at the Skylounge on floor 54....In all so good hotel in a great location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just returned from a week stay at the Hyatt Centric, and I just wanted to acknowledge how considerate and helpful the staff were. My son had contracted a very nasty cough, which I mentioned to our room attendant Diana, on my way to the pharmacist. Immediately she was on the phone arranging tea, honey, and lemon to be delivered to our room. A simple kindness that can make a difference. Also a thank you to Julia Ayres.Thank you Lisa for serving our breakfast with a smile, and helping us with directions.The rooms were comfortable and clean. Location great. However it is always the staff that makes the difference.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Bar 54 rediculous prices. $28 for a cocktail Lobby was actually cramped and unorganized. Elevators have no security and very small. Rooms are tiny Convenient location near Time Square and Broadway bring your own bottle!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in the heart of Manhattan. The Hyatt Centric is conveniently located a half block from Times Square and only a few blocks from Rockefeller Center. Easy access to multiple subway lines. The staff was friendly and the room was comfortable with a great view of the Manhattan skyline. The rooftop bar was very nice but very pricey, even by Manhattan standards. The breakfasts in the ground floor restaurant were good and the restaurant staff were also very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in mid-town Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed over Christmas and was very impressed with this hotel. We upgraded twice and it was well worth it we paid an extra $30 dollars per night and had a high room with floor to ceiling Windows when lying in bed the view was ioverlooking Times Square (to the side) and the 1 World Trade Center was in the distance. The room was 4602I wouldn't recommend eating at the hotel we only had breakfast but it was very expensive and not that good we went to a small cafe just up from the hotel which was good value. The room had a coffee making machine which was very good and a mini bar that we bought milk and stored there don't forget to bring tea bags. The staff at the hotel were excellent. Most of all the hotel position was in the best place. We can highly recommend this hotel for couples.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was great, well located and we had no issues at all. I read some reviews which said lifts were a problem due to time you needed to wait, never more that a few minutes for us. Bar 54 was a great way to finish each day

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You are in the middle of Time Square. Friendly staff. We only had breakfast at the restaurant once but it was excellent! The rooms we spacious for NYC and clean. I did use the fitness center each day which was typical.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square in New York City with my family and we had a great time. The hotel is clean and modern, with comfortable rooms and very good room service. The location is excellent - a block from Times Square and it is easy to get taxis. There also lots of excellent restaurants, theaters, and other attractions within walking distance. The best thing about my stay at the Hyatt was the staff. Everyone I interacted with, from the front desk, room service and bar tenders to the cleaning staff and front door staff, was very pleasant, friendly, kind, and genuinely helpful and sincerely concerned with the quality of my staff. Excellent human interactions at the Hyatt made my stay there a real pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great room, amazing roof top bar, and within a two minute walk to the middle of Times Square. The staff always helped when asking about directions, things to do etc. Gave perfect directions for us first timers on the Subway and how it works and what stops to get off (It can be very confusing). The highlight would be the incredible roof top bar, amazing views of the city!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was greeted with very friendly staff. Was upgraded free of charge to a suite since was my husband's birthday and our wedding anniversary. Room was nice clean. If needed anything they were very accomodating. The concerage was very helpful with tips and places to go. The resturant was very limited and pricey but in middle of a Irish resturant and a store that sold food also and beer and wine. Would definately recommend if you want to be in the heart of broadway and time square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our 3rd trip to New York and our first stay at this hotel. The staff are friendly and the rooms are clean and comfortable. It is in a perfect location for getting around New York and although it is close to Times Square it is still quiet. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Highly recommend this hotel. Complimentary coffee and bottled water throughout stay. The entire staff was very responsive to our requests and really made us feel like they cared about whether we were enjoying our stay. We stayed in a deluxe queen with our adults kids. Two closets and a large bathroom. Also comfortable beds with good pillows. Very close to the action in Times Square but once we got to the hotel, it was quiet and restful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First stay at this property. Pretty much a basic Hyatt Place but on a larger scale. Close to Times Square, but still quiet. Clean, with good bed and basic amenities.. nice choice for a good hotel near Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric is conveniently located in Times Square. This was a big selling point. The room was very clean and well serviced. I always found it a haven after the vibrant and hectic activities of the area. Eating places were also easy to find in the surrounding area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed here several times and every time it has been wonderful. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and in a prime location to all major attractions. The sky lounge is a great place to have drinks and check out an awesome view. We will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 2nd time staying here on my visits to the city. The best (if you want to be in Times Square)...Great staff @ B54 - especially both of the young men named Justin. Made you feel @ home - greeted you by name.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros: rooms were pretty clean, very close to Times Square New Year ball drop area. Staff were very nice and helpful.Cons: These are my personal experiences. It may not happen to everyone. I stayed for 1 night only. (1)Desk lamp was NOT working. Called for service and they fixed it. (2) power jack pack was not working.. Called for service and Nobody came to take a look.(3) Initially they gave me 7th floor with NO VIEW. Then they gave me upgrade option which I took (staff gave a very good suggestion on selecting) and got 47th floor with a great view.. oh! What a difference!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When we first arrived the lady at check in didn't even smile, greet us nor did she give any feed back about hotel. The next day we seen her again and same thing no greet. They had a jar of cookies and when we reached to get some she looked st us and made us feel very uncomfortable grabbing them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My mom and I went to NYC for 3 nights to celebrate my 50th and her 70th birthdays. We chose this hotel because of the location to the Broadway shows we were seeing (one every night!). While I'm not a big fan of Times Square and the crowds this place was nicely located off the main drag so we it was a bit quieter than the hotels directly on the main street. Very modern decor, great service and good value for the nice accommodations and location. I would definitely recommend this for a stay in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is about 4 years old and so convenient for Times Square. The staff were very accommodating and the rooms were light, clean and airy. The hotel was surprisingly quiet given the location with the exception of the traffic in the early hours. This is to be expected. All in all an enjoyable and comfortable stay. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful location for everything: Times Square, shopping, great restaurants, subways, theater district, parks, tours. Really enjoyed our stay here and plan to stay here next time we visit NYC. This was our first visit to NYC and of course we plan to return. Beds were great. Make sure to visit the bar. It has some of the best views in the city as it located on the top of the hotel and is very friendly Outside patio makes taking photos very easy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt for three night and really enjoyed our stay. Rooms were a good size and beds were really comfy. Brilliant location close to Times Square and Bryant Park. TipsTake a trip up to the top floor for a drink, incredible views. Grab a takeout breakfast at cranberries, left out of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed at other places in the Times Square area and this is now are favorite. We arrived and they tried to give us adjoining rooms which would have been great but not needed. We did request a higher floor , from past experience the higher the better. Rooms extremely clean, large and well appointed. The staff was exceptional from check in to the doorman and house keeping. My son left a brand new pair of sneakers and my wife left pants. Housekeeping turned them in and they shipped everything to us. My wife said it was the quietest hotel we have stayed at in NYC. For her to say that only means it was very quiet as she hears everything. Looked forward to returning. The roof top bar was amazing , very pricey but your paying for the view. It would be nice to have a basic beer on the list ( common domestic) and the restaurant on the first floor could be much better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in a great location, easy to walk to many area attractions plus lots of transportation options. The hotel is nice, doesn't feel like a gigantic hotel, easy and quick to get in and out. Only con is the rooms are small but it's New York so... ;-)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had to rush home for a death in the family on the following day. Was told I was going to be penalized because of having to leave early. Sheets had dried blood stains!! There are many hotels in the same location. Be sure to research before booking!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My girlfriend and I spent 5 nights in NYC recently and this hotel had to be one of the highlights of the trip. We stayed on the 46th floor facing south and the view was absolutely incredible. The staff were incredibly friendly and professional. The rooms were fantastic and modern, and were immaculate everyday. The location itself is great - you are just off times square with close access to the subway which makes getting around very easy. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It is very hard to find a room in NYC with 2 queens beds! Most of them either have a king or 2 double beds. I went on a trip with my mom and sister and we didn't want 2 of us crammed into a double so the room at the Hyatt was great with the 2 queen beds. I emailed the hotel a couple of days before my arrival and requested a room on one of the higher floors since my mom and sister had never been to NYC and we were going there to celebrate my mom's birthday. They were able to accommodate our request and put us in a room on the 19th floor (floors higher than 25 have a higher rate but floors 2-24 have a normal rate) and the entire staff signed a birthday card for my mom! So sweet! Everyone that worked at the hotel was super nice and friendly. The room was really spacious, I was very surprised about this since there is a limited amount of space in NYC. Room was very clean and then heated floors in the bathroom were a plus! We requested a microwave and wine opener when we first arrived and they brought it to our room with an hour. Definitely recommend this hotel if you don't mind being in the hustle and bustle of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We accepted the upgrade of the room on arrival, which gave us a larger room on one of the top floors. From here we enjoyed the view of the city skyline, with glimpses of water. Unfortunately the height did not stop the noise of construction which emits 24/7 so if you want to sleep soundly please bring and use earplugs. The bed itself is vey comfortable and conducive to sleep. Just a few steps away from Times Square, there is easy access to anywhere in New York either by foot or train. There is also a convenience store in Times Square which is very handy for that forgotten item or small nibble. With easy access to 6th street, it was easy to negotiate to points of interest without having to always cross Time Square.The extra room meant we did not have to trip over our suitcases. The bathroom was a good size with a seperate shower and a bathtub, so no tripping getting in and out of the shower, and with a separated wet area a suitcase could easily be taken into the bathroom and not get wet. The restaurant on site had a good vegan and gluten free selection for an evening meal or breakfast. The roof top bar had a great ambiance. Though New York has plenty to offer, if tired all you need(except a Laundromat) could be found in the building, very handy when jet lagged or tired.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was there Oct. 13, 2016 for 5 days.Although Times Square is not my ideal place to stay when I visit NYC, I opted for staying there because of location.It is a very nice place. There is nothing to take your breath away but the friendliness of the people working around the front desk and at the front desk. DeeDe was super in checking us in and all the employees from the lobby to the bar were extremely polite,helpful and plain nice!!!Fresh linen and a very nice mattress!! I always check the linen in the beds...even at 5 star resorts I have come upon sheets that had not been washed :(...I suggest travelers to do this...Our room was nice...so was the bathroom...everything was nice and clean and the bar is a nice place to see NYC from above....we were told it is the highest bar in NYC...we had a good time!Enjoy NYC!!!Best,

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My 8 year old boys loved it. Walking distance to everything. You shouldnt think twice. Good food service. The staff at T54 provided great bday present to my boys. (2 NYC books) Best NYC Hyatt property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Place was really nice and we were treated very well. The hotel was near everything, so if you are looking for someplace in the city that isn't filled with tourists this isn't the place for you. If you are into the crowds and the attractions around Time Square this is the hotel for you. Bar and food were exceptional, the staff was excellent, and the price was well worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We paid for a high floor king room and it did not disappoint. It was well worth paying extra for. Spacious room. Floor to. Ceiling windows. Spacious bathroom and fantastic shower. Our maid left us a little Christmas stocking/tree/santa sticker every day and wrote "happy holidays" which we thought was a lovely touch. We were given a $50 bar tab to use at the rooftop bar as it was my boyfriends 30th birthday during our stay. Drinks here are expensive but the view is stunning. We were able to walk to most places from our hotel and it is so close to Times Square. We also ate at the Evergreen diner (west 47th 2 blocks behind this hotel) for breakfast most mornings and it's great. The food at T45 in the hotel is great too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved this hotel. Friendly staff, great location. Rooms were comfy, good size for Nyc. Bathroom was clean. Modern rooms. The only thing I didnt like was the Duvet Cover, it made a lot of noise everytime we moved in bed but comfy bed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Incredible location, 1 min walk to TS. Quick/easy access to subways. Stayed x 5 nights in mid-December. Definitely cheaper than the nearby Marquis. Room was nicely decorated (modern), and I LOVED the complementary wi-fi and bottled water. Payed extra to stay on the 31st floor because I was worried about noise (there was none in my room). Didn't check out the gym as I was busy enjoying NYC! Would return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From front desk, to the quality of the room, to housekeeping this hotel is one of the best I have stayed at. I was left very impressed. The level of professionalism is EXCELLENT. I felt like royalty and I will come back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited The Hyatt as a surprise 30th Birthday treat for my partner. We couldn't have been happier with the whole experience. Location: perfect, accommodation: perfect, staff: perfect!Couldn't have wished for a better 1st trip to NY!And to top it off he even proposed to me in Central Park! Will definitely be coming back as part of our honeymoon!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location but the bar often closes for private events with no notice. They then will request that you just go to the ground floor restaurant for a drink instead. I'm very disappointed in this hotel but if you have the money to burn and want a good location then this hotel could work for you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip. The hotel is in a brilliant location in Times Square, close to the Rockefeller Center and all the shopping midtown has to offer. The rooms are on the small side but adequate and have everything you need. All the staff were very helpful, particularly the doormen. The room was clean and in good condition. I didn't eat in the hotel as the room service menu is kind of limited (and on the expensive side) but there are so many choices nearby that this wasn't an issue. It was a little noisy at night but not a problem. This is a comfortable place to sleep - when you are in the middle of NYC you won't be spending much time in your room anyway!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked 2 rooms and stayed here for 5 nights. Easy access to Times Square, Broadway Theatres and shopping outlets. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. The ground floor restaurant serves delicious food.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, friendly staff, mulled wine and mince pies in reception. Room fairly small, but very clean and comfy. The coffee shop is lovely and the roof top bar is awesome. Perfect location and helpful staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful hotel, staff very welcoming. The furniture in our 26th floor room was rather shabby as was the carpet but otherwise nice hotel. Very expensive for what you got but location great. The food and drink in the restaurant /bar was expensive for what you got. Steve the doorman was great got our transport organised for return to JFK.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is great for theater and shopping. We like to drive in to catch an evening show and a matinee the next day before driving home.The rooms are clean and comfortable. The heated bathroom floor and cozy rain shower was a welcome treat on the coldest day of the year.Room service was prompt and the food was good.12.95 for wifi!! It is free at a Holiday Inn Express or Fairfield. Annoying! Why?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Centric Times Square for a short vacation trip to NYC. This hotel is very nice. Rooms are very comfortable. And the location (mid-town) is a very short walk to Times Square. We will use this hotel for future trips to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. We had a room on a high floor and although views were not special the room was large and the bed was amazingly comfortable. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant which was good. The staff were pleasant and polite particularly the front doormen who were always so helpful. The hotel has a rooftop bar which is different but we found most of the tables with views had reserved signs on and the drinks were quick expensive- but definitely worth one visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. The room was a decent size, very clean, comfortable and did not feel cramped for two of us. Free internet, water, and coffee in the room is a nice plus. One block to Times Square yet quiet. Awesome rooftop bar on 54th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent one night there on a business trip. the location is great- 1 minute walk from Times Square. They have a valet parking service, which is a much-needed service there. The room is comfort, bedding and linen are top notch. You have a safe deposit box and a minibar (empty). The bathroom is well equipped (except for the lack of liquid soap or shower gel), and the towels are soft and large.I didn't have the time to eat breakfast or check the gym (if they have). It will be done in my next stay, as I will surely come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location! Easy access to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Radio City Music Hall. Room was clean with 2 very comfortable queen beds. Rain showerhead that felt wonderful after walking all day. Window cracks open to let in fresh air. We were on the 42nd floor and noise was not a problem. Great nights rest. Accommodating staff. Will plan to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Greeted by a friendly staff, we arrived extremely early. However as promised we were given the first serviced room far earlier than the normal checking time. Which was more than impressive. Always efficient and accommodating to our every need. As a matter of fact this will be the only hotel I will book while in New York City, for our yearly Christmas getaway!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location CANNOT be beat. Rooms are impecable! Service is beyond outstanding. Ask for Steve or Ed in Concierge out front, and they will tell you everything you need to know, where to go, call for a ride, and more..... and with a huge smile and wonderful personalities and customer service. ! All thumbs up!! Matthew and Rosalba at the Front Desk couldn't have been more helpful and nice. Hyatt Centric is VERY fortunate to have these 4 it's team. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Full disclosure - I had stayed at this hotel for business a few years ago around the time of their most recent renovation. The room was clean, no stains, up-dated and modern. Based on that experience, I inconvenienced myself in order to stay at this hotel as the conference I was attending was at another hotel 2.5 blocks east. Unfortunately, on night one, immediately after check-in, as I ALWAYS do, I checked the mattress for bed bugs (and the rest of the room for any other critters). Good news: no bed bugs; Bad news: the terrycloth mattress cover had an approximate 12in x 12in yellowish stain in the upper right hand corner, basically where you lay your head. I immediately phoned the front desk who instructed that they would send housekeeping up to change my linens. It took 20 minutes and 2 phone calls down to the front desk before 3 house keeping staff arrived. They did not apologize for my inconvenience or for the disgustingness that was my mattress cover, nor did they speak to me while in my room. They, did however, continue to speak amongst themselves in a foreign language. In addition to all of that, one of the house keeping staff dropped my new "clean" sheets on my not-so-clean floor and then continued to make up the bed with them. It took all of my might not to request new sheets. The hotel made no accommodations for this disgusting inconvenience; they acted as though this was a common occurrence. Needless to say - greatly disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Its a nice hotel in a great location. Quiet but almost luxurious. I will stay here again, and I usually stay at the Grand Hyatt over Grand Central, but pricing sometimes makes a difference. I have no problem coming back to this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in a king bedroom on the 42nd floor with a partial view this past weekend with my daughter. Our view was mostly of the H&M building, with a partial view down into the heart of Times Square. The room is small, but we weren't planning to spend much time in it. Limited space in the bedroom however for your suitcase..and all the winter clothes needed for a weekend walking around NYC. The bathroom shower is large and there was a full sized bathtub as well which I'm not sure anyone really needs, but okay...The room was clean, but there were visible stains on the carpet which grossed me out. The bed was pretty uncomfortable. Marriott has much nicer mattresses.My biggest complaint in this hotel, and the reason I will not stay there again, was the noise. This hotel is not built with noise cancelling design. The windows must not be thick enough. The noise of Times Square interrupted my sleep all night on Friday. Honking horns, even yelling voices were audible all the way up on the 42nd floor. I've stayed in Times Square before and didn't have this problem at the Marriott Marquis.We did not eat in the restaurant in the hotel. It's quite small and seeking breakfast and dinner elsewhere seemed logical. The hotel is well located on West 45th Street. Easy access to the heart of Times Square and reasonable walking distance to Rockefeller Plaza, St. Patrick's Cathedral, and Radio City Music Hall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was In a good location. Walking distance to so many places and shows. Clean rooms and quiet for being in the middle of Times Square! Outrageous price but that is expected for this time of year. Overall great stay, minus them delivering room service In to go boxes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is very guest oriented. The suite was very clean and spacious. We enjoyed the restaurant several times. Be aware these rooms are pricey if you're in a tight budget. Very convenient to all sightseeing and shopping. We walked everywhere except took a taxi to One World Trade Tower. We felt very safe in this location even at night. Times Square and Rockerfeller Center were packed with tourists and shoppers. All around wonderful trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A different kind of Hyatt experience, but typical high quality you'd expect. Great location for tourist, particularly those interested in Times Square/Broadway. Everything you need is close and the view from upper level rooms are spectacular

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed here along with our two girls (6 and 8 years of age) for a long weekend in the city. We chose this hotel due to the room size and fact that they had queen beds when all the other hotels in the area around the same price had double beds and closet-sized rooms. The choice was a great one as it turns out because the hotel was wonderful. The location was superb being half a block from Times which allowed it be extremely convenient without being overwhelming the second you stepped out the front door. The hotel itself is attractive, clean and appears well managed. On our way out for breakfast one morning in the rain, we were offered complimentary umbrellas for the day! And one evening when we were too exhausted to seek out dinner away from the hotel, Bobby Van's across the street was an amazing alternative to the lobby restaurant. I think the best thing I can say about the hotel is that I wouldn't hesitate for a minute to book another say here in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is nicely appointed. Nothing flash, but all basic needs are covered well. Room service is interesting - delivery is made "NYC café style", including the Starbucks drip coffee. Staff were always pleasant and hotel was clean. All you can ask for really. Wouldn't say upper luxury, but definitely very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is one block from the jumbo tron in time square! Great location, very clean and large king beds. The views are amazing! You can still hear the sounds of NYC but it is very cool. They have a sky bar lounge at the top of the hotel where you can go and have drinks or just look at the NYC skyline. Would recommend this hotel for sure. We have stayed there three times and love it! We come every year around the middle of December. The weather is very cold but had a great time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here nov 14-19. Spend a few extra dollars for the deluxe view king. Look at the pics it's a Wall of glass!!! Incredible view of manhattan skyline. These room are above the 41st floor nice and high. And quiet. Windows crack open inward a couple inches to get fresh air, great! My south facing room towards freedom tower had a peek of Times Square too. Room modern and very clean. Bathroom first rate. Rain and handheld shower was nice. Bed super comfortable. Tv swivels out so you can see it just fine. Mini fridge handy. Did not hear a peep from any neighbor in 5 days. And the hotel was book up. Business travelers would love this hotel. My wife and I loved it,2-3 blocks from all the theaters. Small army of friendly/professional staff waiting in lobby if you need help with anything. Near zero elevator waits. Good restaurant in lobby. This is an easy 5 star review. So glad We stayed here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Here was our last stopover in America before returning home to the UK on the Queen Mary 2. It was also where we would spend my wife’s special birthday.The hotel was superbly centrally situated for exploring New York, in this as in other aspects it met our expected requirements.The concierge service was the one area that fell short in meeting our expectation, this we attributed to the fact that the service was operated by an outsourced facility, this regret was, as it transpired, amply filled by the very friendly and knowledgeable door personnel.The staff were very welcoming and ensured that one’s requests were where possible met in full.As Gold Passport guest one was immediately upgraded and free internet was allocated through the hotelOur room was in a very quiet area of the hotel as requested it however did not occupy a location to facilitate an appreciation of the views of New YorkThis was in some way compensated by the views offered from the roof top bar.The one major drawback was the singular absence of a lobby lounge area which one felt let the facilities badly down.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved our stay at the Hyatt Centric. VERY cozy and hip. Great food, comfy, quiet rooms! I'd recommend it to anyone! Particularly loved their restaurant and the friendly staff working in the restaurant. Superb, varied, interesting menu and great take-out-room service delivery for late night or during times I needed to work a little or rest.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Me and me wife visited NYC for a 3 night stay in December. The hotel is in a perfect location to explore the city. A stones throw away from all the main attractions. The all the staff are friendly and welcoming. I would highly recommend the sky bar at the hotel. The views are spectacular, the drinks and refreshing and the bar snacks are delicious. Just what is needed after a busy day exploring. I would also like to say a big thank you to the 2 doorman who were on the door on the 8th December around 6pm, when our pre arranged ride to the airport did not turn up they helped us to secure a ride to enable us to get to the airport on time!10/10 for this hotel if I ever return to NYC I will be staying here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. Friendly staff, quick check-in, efficient valet, and very clean, modern room. Fabulous location super close to Times Square. We definitely recommend this hotel and would surely stay here again in the future!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the first time I've stayed at this property and was very pleased with the location, room quality and terrific staff. Ask for a room facing the alleyway (07) as you avoid direct noise from the main cross street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt quality hotel located just off Broadway. Easy walk to subway, 5th Ave., and Central Park. Great restaurants nearby - look beyond the chains and you will find some gems. Can't go wrong with this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just come back from an amazing 5 days in New York. we came to celebrate my 40th birthday and our wedding anniversary and it didn't disappoint. The hotel was perfect, literally a two minute walk from Times Square so ideally situated. We upgraded a few days before to a King view room on the 21st floor. The room was spotless and had everything we needed. The bed was very large and comfortable and we slept very well throughout our stay. Upon check in we were given a $75 free bar bill for the roof top bar by Clifford. This was very much appreciated and we had a wonderful meal and drinks in the bar. The rooftop bar had breath taking views and a must see if you are staying in the hotel. Drinks are on the expensive side but we didn't have to pay! The lobby area of the hotel were always clean and doormen on hand if you needed them. Upon check out our bags were looked after until we were ready to leave. The hotel also provided a chauffeur driven car to take us back to JFK airport for a cost of $75. A taxi this time of day would have cost $65 so it was a no brainer and the drive to the airport was lovely and relaxing. The driver was the friendliest person we had met during our stay. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone who is thinking of visiting new York. We are already planning our return visit! As for New York itself it was 10/10, we are in love!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I were very pleased with the experience we had at this great hotel as were some friends that we introduced to this hotel. We could not find anything to complain about. The staff are great and the food is super.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything was beyond all expectations. From the moment we checked in to the minute we left, we were just blown away with courtesy from the front desk, to the bellman, to the mgr of housekeeping. Julia Ayres should be given special recognition due to her extra effort to help with a special request we had.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our overall experience with the hotel accommodations and staff was extremely pleasant. From the guest services personnel who ensured our needs were taken care of, to the cleaning staff and concierge making our stay in NYC an eventful and fun time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are staying At the hotel, be sure to Visit the B54 bar on the penthouse level on the 54th floor. While you are having your drink be sure to try the appetizer pretzel bacon with pecan bites. They are truly delicious.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You don't go to New York City to get a deal on a hotel however this seemed to be a descent price considering it was New York. It had an excellent location with walking distance to many things including some theatres. The room had a nice view and was very clean. The lobby or check-in area was pretty weak and crowded. It was also very spartan in appearance. The rooms were very quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked this hotel because I was in town for the Rockefeller Tree Lighting. The location is very near to Times Square and a short walk to Rockefeller Center. It's a perfect location because it's close to everything. Upon entering the lobby for check in the front desk agents were attentive and quick with the check in process. Upon entering my room, which was on the 26th floor it was spotless. BONUS the bathroom had heated floors which is always a plus!! Room service came from the restaurant inside the hotel. It was a little pricey but again it's NYC. I also liked that the windows opened so you can hear the sounds of NYC. This is the first time staying at the Hyatt Centric and yes I would stay again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was pessimistic about staying at a Hyatt in NYC as I usually stay at the Loews Regency uptown however I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby is beautiful- offering cookies and hot cider every afternoon. Staff is extremely friendly and the location is amazing- right up the block to times square- super close to bryant park and 5th avenue. We stayed in a deluxe room which was very roomy- separate shower and bathtub- dresser drawers- plenty room for me and my son. I did see a regular room which was smaller but do feel that we would have been happy in that room as well because- lets face it- how often are you in the room while out exploring new york.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great choice for a NYC vacation! Location is central to most things we wanted to do. We could walk to Central Park, Madison Square Garden, 5th Ave, Grand Central Station, etc. and were right on Time Square. The only place we had to take a cab to was Ground Zero. The service and rooms were great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was about $483 per night but there are several "Tax" ad-ons which add on about anbother $70 per night. The hotel is very ice and has a great location in Times Square. A few hiccups but overall very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We are frequent travelers and based on previous reviews I thought I was going to be very welcomed at this hotel. But customer service can really be improved. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is clean and the beds are comfortable (not the pillows) but there is so much that left me unhappy. The reception counter was always full staffed and yet they did not smile once, but only followed your request. Even tho I was there to celebrate my bday, we got charged for a higher floor room after we checked out our first room and told them we were not happy. Also, Alyssa who answered the phone after she had just checked us in said there was nothing available and after only we waited on hold 5mins and insisted ,then she transferred us to somebody else and out of the sudden they had availability (again, maybe because we were paying for it). The rest of the stay was just average, they left me a little box of chocolates (i don't eat chocolate) and a bday card. Another thing I don't recommend you do is the rooftop bar unless you want to spend $59 for 2 drinks. It is extremely overpriced and the music they play is to help you go to sleep. Bartender was great but I don't think is worth the price. Lastly, the 2 or 3 questions we had about locations, nobody in the lobby area was able to answer since they said "they don't live there". Anyways, overall great location (like many other hotels around) but I will not be staying in a Hyatt again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived in New York as the 3rd leg of our honeymoon, exhausted we checked in to the hotel our travel agent had booked and found it to be unsuitable even for the cheapest backpackers let alone honeymooners ! We instantly returned our room key and called the Hyatt where a room was made up immediately and the early check in fee waved. On arrival we were visibly upset by our previous hotel experience and the staff were so lovely in checking us in, arranging us cool beverages and seeing us personally to our new room - which was ultra modern, clean and comfortable. It ended up being a blessing in disguise as the Hyatt was in such a good location just metres from restaurants and times square, had an amazing roof top bar with the best views and cocktails and we felt ultra safe due to the doormen and concierge manning the entrance at all times. Right down to the car organised for us back to the airport at 5am the service here was fantastic. Lovely service and amenities and we will be back for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great stayBeautiful upgrade to a view room, welcomed with a smile and a very pleasant valet attendant, would definitely stay here again. We felt pampered for our quick 1-night getaway, it was worth the stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very comfortable business hotel. Great staff that really cares about the guests. Rooms are nice. Good size bathrooms. Not enough elevators and room service is not the best assortment and sent up in cardboard pkg.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, hard to beat for the price. Steps away from Times Square... take a right out of the hotel and 45 seconds later you are there. 10 minute walk to Grand Central.Very clean hotel. Not very friendly at check-in but check-out was quick and easy.It's NYC so the rooms are smaller. Bathroom also small for two people but clean and modern... heated floors are a nice touch.Rooms have an empty mini-fridge and wide safe (laptops) for use.We were on the 19th floor (room 1910) facing north, not the best view. Higher floor and facing south might be better for city views.Overall a nice hotel for a weekend trip, at the right price. Can't beat the location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have been here many times. The location is great. The rooms are like new and spotless. I love that the beds are made with duvets and no dust collecting pillows etc.just clean white bedding. The lounge on the top floor has wonderful views and drinks. My California family love the feel of the diner in the restaurant for breakfast, very New York. The food and service are great. Don't miss the French toast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice, well maintained, high rise hotel steps away from Time Square. They also have double queen rooms which feature I guess is relatively rare in downtown NYC. There aren't too many rooms on each floor, which makes the room more quiet. Windows can be halfway opened up, I like this feature, hate to rely on force venting only. Skip the package with breakfast and go eat somewhere else. I would come back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stay at this Hyatt about once a month. it is convenient and because it is new the shower and the technology are terrific. i love the roof top bar and entertain there regularly . the staff grat me by name and they are unfailingly helpful and thoughtful. My home away from home.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everyone on the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Fantastic service and great view of Times Square and just far enough away to avoid the craziness in Times Square. Hotel is immaculate. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of the hotel is perfect as it's steps away from Times Square.The hotel is well kept as well. The staff at Hyatt is very helpful and polite from the guy at the front Ed to the receptionists inside, but there is a specific member of staff who has managed to over the 3 times we have visited ensure our stay was awesome. That member of Staff is Yenny...exceptional customer service!! Customer service at it's best! Ensure you ask for her when you visit. The rooms are spacious to for NYC rooms, the bed is comfortable and the bathroom is very clean! Overall i would recommend this hotel to every and anyone who visits NYC!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our second time staying here at the Hyatt Times Square. We loved the location of the hotel which is one block from Time Square and theater distinct. The room was spacious in New York standards, and it was clean and quite. In room Keurig coffee and tea cups are complimentary which was a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel hits its mark with compact, yet efficient rooms in a very central location. I stayed here for a business conference and the conference facilities were average. The word that best describes this hotel is efficient - it was designed to be efficient knowing that guests would not spend a lot of time in the room or hotel.Breakfast was surprisingly good and by NYC standards not too expensive - e.g. $20 for a basic breakfast.We lucked out with nice weather and the rooftop bar is very nice - albeit a bit pricey.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was great that they were able to give us 2 rooms next to each other, but they were on the 6th floor facing the street. so it was a bit noisy in the middle of each night when the garbage trucks did their thing! we had asked for a quieter room but guess that's an oxymoron in the city that never sleeps! I think you can get a quieter room way up high but those rooms cost a bit more too. Was hoping they'd give us a break and get us on a higher floor. Oh well. The rooms were prepped exactly as we had requested -pack n play, extra towels, blankets, etc, which is wonderful because it's a rarity in our experience, so was very much appreciated. We really liked that bottled water was free, saved us from having to lug a bunch to our hotel each day. The location was perfect! Close yet not too close to the middle of things - just a little over a block to Times Square, a couple blocks to Broadway, a few more blocks to Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park and even quite walkable to Grand Central Station for the train. And no bugs!! We check the beds, so worried but they have the mattresses enclosed in a bug-proof zipped up thing. Not quite sure how that's supposed to work, as in, do they wash it after each new guest? But anyways, checked and all was good. whew!! Beds were comfortable, decent amount of space for NY, even 2 double beds in each room! Only thing was the carpet was a bit stained and spots here and there. It was faint but you could see it. Not what I'd expect from a Hyatt but it wasn't overt but the stains were there. Overall a great experience and location, with wonderfully caring people. Glad we decided to stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Easy access to Times Square as well as 5th avenue or a longer walk to Macy's or Central Park. Our executive suite was very spacious especially for NYC standards and easily fit our family of four (two kids on sleeper sofa). Would return next time

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice and clean hotel in the heart of NYC. You are right down the street from Times Square which is a quick easy walk. The staff is very helpful and very polite. I had exceptional service from Ritchie at the front desk, this guy knows how to take care of guests right. He offered me a good deal to upgrade to a suite because my room wasn't ready yet. If you get a chance to upgrade take it, definitely worth it! I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to everyone visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a great experience with this hotel. The location is excellent. It's right on Times Square but at the same time there was no issue with the street noise etc. I was staying on the 14th floor. I arrived way before the check in time and Steve from the front desk was extremely kind and tried his best to get us a room early. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was great. Room were decently sized. All in all a great experience and I'd definitely stay here again. Steve was exceptionally helpful with everything and I'd highly recommend this hotel to all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The best in Time Square. Everything was close by. The rooftop Bar was beautiful and the drinks were great. Ritchie the front desk concierge was very helpful and took very good care of us. I had two rooms and they both were upgraded.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel. The check in was easy and quick. The room was all new and fresh. The beds are comfortable with soft sheets. The shower was deluxe with fantastic spa shampoos. The floor in the bathroom is heated! Big tv and a built in refrigerator to conveniently chill your beverage of choice. The roof top bar is too cool. We were less than a block from Times Square. Warm cookies and water were offered at both check in and check out. We were offered early check in and late check out. Even though it is in the middle of everything, it was easy to pull up our car to the lobby to load and unload. We loved it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very comfortable little hotel right off of Times Square. I stayed here on business and it was the perfect distance from the office and on-site location.
