Easy access to 6th Ave so I didn't have to fight the tourists in Times Square every day. Room was spacious and clean. Staff was courteous. Drinks at the rooftop bar were outrageously priced, but so is everything in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location near Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, Central Park, Macy's Parade! Check in staff were awesome and very friendly. Room was very clean, no noise at all! Two minor complaints... the lights from Times Square shown through the cracks around the black-out curtains so the room wasn't as dark as I'd have liked it, and the bed was a bit firm for my taste, but nonetheless I'd recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel on past reviews of it being quiet even though it is centrally located. VERY true!! We were about to explore the city and the hustle and bustle and then come and relax in our tranquil room. We were on the 51st floor. Staff is very friendly. Room very clean and comfy. Great stay!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location!!!! I dont have anything negative to say about this hotel. The hotel was great. The staff was great!! Highly recommend!!!!! They have a wonderful gym. A spa is also on site, but I did not visit it but would love to try it next time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I go to Nyc a lot and have been to several 4 star hotels around Times Square and this is the first time I have no complaints about a hotel. The Hyatt is absolutely wonderful, excellent location, very efficient and polite staff, great amenities, spacious rooms (which is quite unheard of in Manhattan), functional fitness center. I didn't get to use the spa, but they have one too.I stayed there for 8 nights, over the Thanksgiving break. After 2 nights I had a problem with the room, as a family with a small child in the next room was being really loud and kept me up all night. I spoke to the manager and they immediately upgraded me to another room, no charge. The maid were very attentive and my room was spotless and tidy.I would go back and I would highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Ok so I booked this hotel with a lot of hope considering the amazing reviews. Well, I'm usually picky so it's very easy for me to be disappointed, but the Hyatt Central surely did not disappoint me at all!The view was one the best I've seen in town, we took like a hundred pics. The staff is very fast, formal but friendly at the same time. Note: my boyfriend asked at the desk where to shop all the staff to shave, but they've provided all the necessary for free, so nice! The room was very clean ( 1000+ points for this ) and pleasantly spacious for 2 people. I loved the huge cabin/shower big enough for 4 persons with the bathtub that turned out to be a benediction since we were walking an average of 14 hours.I'm considering to book this hotel again on my next trip to NYC, because it really contributed to make our trip more special.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My girlfriend and I checked into this hotel on Thanksgiving. The staff was very nice and upgraded us to the room with the best view. He even remembers me the next day and asked about my stay. The interaction felt very personalized and great. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I find this hotel suitable for my needs. I like the central location and that I can walk to many of the places that are of interest to me. Rooms are comfortable. Avoid the café. Limited menu and overprices. Many more reasonable places to eat nearby. Not a hotel to stay at with family. Staff service is excellent. They are friendly, efficient and seemed well organized.They were quick to supply a tea pot and tea when I complained about there only being coffee in the room. Also maintenance was speedy when I had a problem with the shower. They really do go out of their way to please you. This is a fine hotel for a solo traveler and for business purposes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Let's start with the location, which is just about perfect. It's 1/2 block from Times Square. We came here for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, and that route was 1/2 block in the other direction. If you want to take in a show at one of the many theaters, do some shopping, hang out in Times Square, it's all less than a five-minute walk. And if you want to go farther afield, no worries as there is a subway station in Times Square from which you can get anywhere in the city.The rooms are good size with a very large bathroom with a heated floor. The shower is big enough for two (or more?) with a hand-shower AND a rain shower. The TVs are nice and big and get a good selection of channels in real HD (not expanded SD). The beds are firm, but also a little cushy, which is just perfect for me. The towels are plush. The rooms were cleaned well every day. There is very little with which to find fault. (If I were to complain, I would complain about elevator backups at peak periods. Maybe nothing else about which to complain.)We had coffee and dessert in the little coffee shop off the lobby. It wasn't cheap, but the coffee, dessert, and service were nothing short of excellent. The lounge and observation deck on the top floor is the perfect place for an evening drink. (Again, it wasn't cheap, but this is NYC, after all.). There is a small deli/restaurant just up the street with fantastic pastries and bagels in the morning and excellent coffee and lattes. The hotel's entrance is flanked by two (yes, two) Irish pubs and, of course, hundreds of restaurants are within two or three blocks.Now, about the staff... Everyone from the front desk to the consierge to the maintenance personnel to the room service staff says "Hello" and "Have a good evening", etc. The consierge even made Thanksgiving dinner reservations for us at a local restaurant (of his recommendation) weeks before our stay. This is a full-service hotel in the center of it all. Sure, there are many fine hotels around Times Sqaure. I would not hesitate to recommend this one and would not complain if I had to stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a fairly new hotel and the decor is quite beautiful within the rooms and public areas. The room is a generous size considering the location of this hotel, just minutes from Times Square and Central Park. We could not fault the room, it was immaculate, tidy, clean and modern although some fresh milk for our coffee would have been beneficial.The staff are really friendly, specifically Gabbi, Mafus and Max whom helped us to feel very at home within the hotel.Overall, this was the best hotel of our trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was our first time in NYC together and we were celebrating our anniversary. We selected a high floor room and could not have asked for more! Great service. Fabulous view. We could look over and see part of Times Square and Good Morning America location on right and on left was 6th Ave, where the Thanksgiving day parade went by. Not direct views but still good. Bed and bath were wonderful. This is a perfect location for those who like to walk NYC. We walked from Penn Station to hotel and then later to Central park. Just perfect location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Centric is great if you want to stay right in Times Square and get great views of the city. Recommend getting the rooms above the 40th floor facing south. Cool rooftop bar for the adults traveling is a nice addition.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great service. Great location; a few steps to Times Square. very quiet rooms. Walk everywhere. Super comfortable and clean rooms. Will definitely stay here again. Very professional, helpful, courteous and friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved staying at the Hyatt! Great location, we walked to dinner, to our broadway show, shopping through Times Square... very cool roof top bar. also! Great stay! Would stay here again...the staff was attentive, friendly, and helpful too!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had the pleasure of staying here for 3 days. It was my first time in NYC and the location couldn't have been any more perfect. The staff was amazing, from check in to check out, they were spot on. The service was spectacular! The bell attendant was always so ready to assist us with directions or advise us on where best to eat or visit. Oh and the view was amazing! The ceiling to floor windows made it perfect! It was a bit small for what I'm use to but that did not stop me from enjoying the room! Did I mention the food was delicious?? Would definitely stay here again when I visit NY!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had called into the HYATT and had spoken to Wendy and let her know that we would be arriving later than expected for check-in. She assured me that there would be no problems with our room reservations. Once we arrived at the HYATT, we were not sure where to park and there were no valet or anyone to greet us. Once I checked in, Latoya let me know that our room was not available and we had been upgraded to another room, which we did not ask for. I was not sure why our room was upgraded because during the week I had received e-mails regarding an upgrade, but we chose to keep our room for the view of the city and the deep-soaking bathtub. Once we figured out the parking situation and went into the room, we realized we did not have a view and we did not have a bath tub at all. We went to the lobby and spoke to Latoya who indicated that the hotel was at full capacity and we would not be able to get our Deluxe King Room with the city view and the deep soaking bath tub. We do not understand why our room was given to someone else when we had made reservations a week in advance for that exact room for a reason. We do appreciate Richie giving us a $60 credit towards meal and drinks but we are still upset that we were not able to get the room we had reserved.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Highly recommend for family. Great location! No problem with elevator (fast - no wait). Bathroom Clean. Room Clean. Comfy Room. Great views. Hotel Service Excellent! Friendly staff. John was amazing in helping us out right after we arrived from New Mexico from a Red Eye flight with two young boys. I will return with family, friends, solo, or work related. Already planning my next trip back. Central location and so close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Got lucky this last weekend! Had a fabulous stay at the Hyatt Centric, - can we say Hyatt lite?? the heated floor in the bathroom is an amazingly lovely feature in a very nice hotel. I guess you have to weight the price of similar properties in the area.... Right off Time Square, tons of amazing restaurants in walking distance... Bedding is awesome. Hotel is unlike any other Hyatt we know, but perfect for a weekend getaway - we will be back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spontaneous NYC weekend and being a Platinum member in their Gold Passport program and the good reviews booked this hotel. Pros: - AMAZING weekend with my best friend- Great location- clean and updated room- friendly and helpful housekeeping staff- friendly and accommodating bartender in the lobbyCons:- Treated very rude at check in- Phones in room not working at check in- At check in struggled with oversized suitcase and other bag when simply entering hotel and no one offering to open the heavy doors - this was consistent every time returning to hotel.....service like a hostel not a Hyatt- Front desk staff made no attempt at recognizing us including no eye contact - Bell-staff were even more elusive- Small room and not at all representative of the photos on the Hyatt.com website when booking- Inquired about of inaccuracy of room and in short was told I was mistaken and while very sorry could do nothing.....have a nice day......dismissive- The young man who was checking room keys to enter the elevator area was very tacky- The terrace of the rooftop bar is very nice but drink service not offered. The seating area at the rooftop bar was minimal and waited to be served and never happened. Prices toooooo high.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel in November 2016. What a cute gem. Sure, my one bedroom room was not large, but truly, I didn't care. It was so nice The TV was large, the bathroom was nice with a heated floor, and the bed OH SO comfortable. The front desk staff were so helpful and friendly and the location... right at Times Square. Literally. You're right there. Food options and theatre galore.Shower is rain shower (above your head)The one complaint!!! (and this is a weird one). When someone would flush the toilet.. it would take 10 mins for the toilet to fill again. Strange!!Would I stay there again... YES.. if i could verify they fixed the toilet issue or is this the same in every room.So if you stay there, don't tell anyone because I want to keep this gem affordable and ensure I can stay whenever I come back to NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall an excellent stay with a great location right by Times Square. Be warned that Times Sq crowds can be a bit overwhelming. We were in for a 2 day 1 night stay with 6 people total (4 adults 2 kids aged 6 and 8)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a Diamond member we have stayed at a few Hyatts around the US. This Hyatt from the Seinfeld you walk in to the moment you leave the serivice is wonderful. I felt like I was a special guest and everyone went out of there way to make sure my family was happy with the experience. Will definitely pick this one again during our next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Found Hyatt Centric a few years ago on a NYC trip to see a show. Instantly became our go-to for New York trips. Very clean, consistently helpful staff, very quiet, well thought out rooms. Great food: reliable, tasty, unpretentious meals when we want to eat in. Best part: unbeatable location. 9.5/10

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric has an outstanding location in midtown Manhattan. Not 100% consistent but mostly very nice staff (thank you Jeff and Clifford for being very helpful). Our room on the 23rd floor was very comfortable. Noise insulation from the corridor and adjacent rooms is excellent.Noise from the busy street seems to be unavoidable mostly everywhere in Manhattan, this Hyatt included. Perhaps the highest floors provide better shelter from that.Bathroom isn't great...too small.The room wasn't spotless clean when we checked in and again when we came back on one of the evenings. All in all - definitely a recommended place to stay in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I loved this hotel! The location was perfect, the room was amazing. We upgraded to have a balcony and it was so worth it. Sitting out there enjoying the view. Awesome. Would stay here again for sure. (Also we stayed here in Aug 2015.)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved our stay at this hotel for a quick weekend getaway. Can you say - Heated Bathroom Floor? Wow great perk for a standard king room. Hotel staff is extremely efficient. Beautiful decors, simple and modern. Plenty of room to maneuver around bed, rare in NYC. Empty mini-fridge, safe, large closet, fancy room lighting. We loved this room. I was tempted to get the deluxe room, but saved $70/night and the standard room did not disappoint. 1 block to Butter Restaurant by Alex Guarnaschelli, yum!! 5 blocks from GCT.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Would not recommend staying on lower floor level. I was on the 7th floor, and it was extremely noisy. Was not provided body lotion for two days. Caffeinated coffee was never replenished. Had to request ear plugs for 2 days before receiving any.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is certainly in the right spot. Turn left out of the lobby door, and you're 1 minute from Times Square, turn right and nearly at Bryant gardens. My first impression of the hotel was that it's bit of a glass and chrome affair! Whilst the hotel is typical of a major city centre establishment, for me it lacked that cosy atmosphere feeling. The staff however, were friendly and professional at all times and food in the restaurant was very good. If all you want to do is use this as a base, then it most certainly will fit the bill.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room with 2 queen beds is extremely spacious with large bath. Heated bath floor. Very quiet in room 1207. Complimentary wifi and bottled water and in room coffee. Staff was ready despite our late arrival.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stay in NYC often and try to always book at the Hyatt Centric, clean, great location and staff is always helpful! I also bring my kids and husband to my location. It is good for business and personal travel. Will be staying again very soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt has 54 stories. The elevators are the quickest I have witnessed. We never had to wait on an elevator. The maid service was good. The room had a refrigerator. The view of the city was good. The bed is great but does not have a top sheet. The thermostat only went down to 65 degrees for air.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had issues with A/c. Management seems unconcerned. Good location close to Times Square. Good eats nearby. Good clean rooms. Breakfast choices are fine but expensive. Noisy street at times .. lots of construction activity.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I wanted to stay in Hyatt for a long time, this was a perfect time to do it. Check in was fast and a surprise Baloo greeted my on my home language - really didn't expect that! Room on 44th floor with great view on the city. Very comfy bed, good wifi, huge TV, all you need... breakfast is served at the first floor restaurant. It is not a buffet but you order from the menu. I prefer buffet breakfast, but this one was nice too. In the room the only bad part is the contstant noise, but hey, you are in the middle of the city that never sleeps... Location is perfect for anybody who wants to be in the middle of nightlife in NY. Recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place . Good service. Gym was well equipped and very clean. Handy to the square and 5th avenue. Attached cafe/ restaurant good meals. Plenty of other places to eat on neighbouring streets. Close to. Two subway lines so easy to get around. Walking distance to Central Park20 minutes and Wall Street area, about 30 minutes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Bar54 (rooftop bar) has great views, & drinks are excellent. Very close to Times Square (1/2 block away), & a very nice size gym. T45 breakfast is a very good choice. & FREE bottled water daily in your room- i suggest to put in mini frig as soon as you can.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were greeted by friendly security guards and front desk clerks as soon as we arrived. The rooms were bright and immaculately clean. Each time we reentered the hotel we were stopped by the security guards but never intimidated. I felt safe and welcome all at the same time. The rooftop bar was a unique experience. I would definitely stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a really good hotel right next to Times Square. It is a very busy area of New York with people and vehicles.We had a nice suite on the 49th floor so was reasonably quiet.Bar 54 has great views with a large balcony.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed in a room with a terrace. I was hesitant about the splurge, but I really loved it. It was nice and chilly outside and we even slept with the door cracked to get some fresh air. The location is right off of Times Square, but the noise level in the room was minimal (terrace is on the 27th floor). We would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time in the hotel and was skeptical as most of the other hotels we have stayed around Time Square are too busy for my taste. But this one is exceptional! Quiet street, quiet room, and only 5 minutes walking from Time Square. As for the room, quite big to NYC standard-- Super comfy bed, big clean and modern bathroom, large closet, good lighting. Staff were OK. Overall a great stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall, good impression of the hotel, service and room. We did notice a distinct odor when we first checked in - I would guess they use some type of deodorant to cover a worse smell. All ok after leaving the window open for the day. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was modern & had a heated floor. The hotel has a very cool bar on the 54th floor, unfortunately with hotel bar prices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time in this hotel, long time Hyatt member and visitor to NYC. Great hotel and great location with two Irish pubs nearby and not too noisy given how close you are to Times Square. There were three of us in a single room and we had the option of upgrading for a small fee before we arrived - so we were in an Executive Room on Level 20 that had a seperate lounge with a sofa bed in the lounge and two TVs --perfectly suitable for 3 adults or a family of 4. Room was spacious and plenty of storage - for all that shopping! Room has free wifi ( as Hyatt member) and free water provided daily. Concierge staff were great and very helpful. Special call out to Paola @ Housekeepng who absolutely looked after us with extra towels, coat hangers etc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A perfect location but you sure pay for it. I guess we are just small-town people not used to big city prices. We were surprised at how quiet the room was even though it faced 45th St. very nice overall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was beautiful and very centrally located. However the difference with this hotel and the many others I have stayed at was the friendliness and efficiency of all staff from check-in to check out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel with great staff. The room was spotless with a great view. We will stay there again. The bed is so confortable, the bathroom was fantastic, the comfort of the room should be a model for all others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 5 of us stayed here in 2 rooms. The hotel was clean and nicely furnished, the front desk staff helpful and the location was great. The 2 queen bedroom was really spacious, the king bed room was fine. All staff were welcoming. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a few days just before the election. Our intent was to wander around Times Square, take in a few shows and visit the Carnegie before it closes. This hotel is close to everything. We were pleasantly surprised at the nearby Bryant Park with an ice skating ring, the nearby Fox studios where we could peak into the windows and see the commentators, and the nearby Trump Tower, which became the center of attention due to the election.The rooftop bar has incredible views. Once we sat down, it took the waitress half an hour to bring the menu. The mixed drinks cost as much as a meal, so we decided to leave.Negatives: We broke a glass in the bathroom and informed the housekeeper. Unfortunately, when we returned, there were still a few small pieces on the bathroom floor and in the rug. I am rating the cleanliness as poor because the rug was stained and the glass was not completely cleaned up.We were on the 26th floor. The elevators were slow and one time we had wait more than 10 minutes.There was no microwave in the room.Positives:The staff was very friendly. They always greeted us and smiled.We were unable to get a seat in the Carnegie, so we bought Take-out and ate in our room. A microwave would have been nice for reheating. The refrigerator was wonderful. It was empty and we could fit in a small cheesecake from Juniors as well as sandwiches and corned beef and drinks. The Keurig was tucked away. I enjoyed the K-cups they provided.The king bed was comfortable and there was plenty of room for the two of us. We enjoyed opening the window slightly so we could here the city sounds.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful and quiet hotel that located right off of Times Square! Very welcoming!! Staff is friendly! I stayed on Hyatt stay certificates but there was still a hold on my debit card for all three nights! There was only supposed to be a hold for incidentals of $300 instead $1200 was held! Very disappointed! So be meaningful of that if you use them! Everything else was comfortable. Less than a two minute walk from Times Square! Located on 45th so it less noise! Great location

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I came in to new york city to stay from long island with my sister and niece(they are from Dallas). we had theatre tickets for that evening. As my sister is a diamond level customer, we were given free breakfast. The breakfast gave us $37 each. the restaurant was extremely expensive and the food was fair. the menu did not tell you all the prices, and when asked, the waiter had to ask. Some of the food came to us cold. As to the hotel, there was no body wash, cotton balls or swabs. We were told there would be water in the room but there wasn't. The room was somewhat small. We were needless to say very disappointed in this visit with Hyatt. We (my sister and I) have stayed in numerous hyatts in the past few years and were underwhelmed by this one. This hotel was recently updated. The price of the valet garage for one night was extremely high at $65 a night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent. Great location, Quiet hotel with great staff. Would recommend this hotel if visiting New York. Understated Lobby but with all facilities required for an enjoyable stay within walking distance of Times Square, 5th Avenue, Underground Train statuions and Broadway shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great, updated, clean Hyatt hotel located in the heart of Times Square. I was pleased with the size of the room - big king bed AND some extra space! Bathroom was good size as well - our room had a small fridge and coffee machine as well. Service was superb as well! Will definitely be staying here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The terrace rooms are with the extra money, and are all located on one floor. The bar/restaurant on the 54th floor is awesome- sit outside. The lobby is very small and mainly consists of just the front desk, but we weren't planning on hanging out in the hotel lobby. Nice place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staying in New York's most happening place 'Times Square' makes life simple for the tourist with superlative service to boot. Front desk is most helpful so are the floor housekeeping staff and the restaurant staffMaking the whole experience wonderful with superbly appointed rooms

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Never even got to see the bar they're selling in the pics on the roof. Apparently they only took kids up there for a tour at 10:30 in the AM. Unfortunately that was a time we always had other things planned. Would have been nice to check it out but I didn't want to go alone and hurt my 11 year olds feelings by excluding him. When paying for a "view" watch out. Wasn't really a great view so you might save your money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely, spotlessly clean room. Required wheelchair-accessible room, all was as it should be, large bathroom with adequate turning radius (not always the case), roll-in shower, well-placed grab bars. Outstanding staff who offered help with bags, wheelchair pushing, everything. Absolutely wonderful people.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've stayed here multiple times now and it's my choice of hotel every time I am in NYC. Out of curiosity one time, I did choose to stay at a competitor a few blocks away and didn't like my experience there at all so I came back to the Hyatt Times Square. The staff is all great, they always give me a great room honoring my room location requests. There is no fuss getting to the rooms via the elevators. Location is great, if you want the noise of Times Square, you turn right coming out of the hotel. If you want nothing to do with Times Square, you turn left. A nice running distance as well to get to Central Park area and back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything in this hotel was just awful! I arrived at 5am after a 15 hour flight and although I informed the hotel a day before that I am willing to pay extra for early check-in it took them 6 hours to check me in my room. It wasn't as bad if i could shower and change somewhere but they don'y have such an option, if you want to refresh before your meetings you'll have to wait until your room is ready. The staff was so rude and unhelpful and the front desk guys kept telling me they will "call me" when the room is ready although they didn't even have my phone number nor checked anything. Nobody has made a single effort to help me or make me feel comfortable while I was sitting at the lobby for 6 hours. Also, during my stay there one of the elevators didn't work and i had to wait 15 min every time i wanted to go up or down to my room at the 19 floor. Its the worst hotel experience I had in my entire life and I would never ever come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in an amazing location and the decor is great! The staff is friendly and they give complimentary water bottles everyday which I loved! Our room however could have been cleaner and the bathroom smelled moldy. They only use a top sheet which they shove into the mattress.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for a week. Its a decent hotel with a mix crowd of business as well as leisure travelers. Rooms are relatively mid size as compared to its peers. Bathroom is also mid size but functional. Bottled water is provided on the house, which you generally do not see in NYC. Hotel has a very good Sky Lounge on the 54th Floor which serves cocktails and spirits. Overall a nice hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was clean and the rooms are nice size for NYC hotel.Amazing view from the 54th Floor Bar Since we had tickets to the theater the location was great just one block off Times Square. The hotel is just a short walk to the subways.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel for business & family vacations. The location is excellent, rooms are modern nicely done up. The staff at front desk & for room services are excellent. The bar on the 54th floor is the place to hangout with friends. The internet is good. It is very near to the subway station, just 3 minutes walk. This hotel is surrounded by restaurants, theatres so after work hours you are not bored

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If your major objectives are Times Square and the Broadway theater, as ours was, this hotel has the perfect location. A short walk to 5 and 6 Avenues where buses can take you to most museums. Staff is extremely accommodating. Rooms are large and very well maintained.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much. It was clean and comfortable with nice size rooms for NYC. The beds and bedding were terrific and we had a floor to ceiling city view - terrific!The staff was always helpful and friendly, we especially enjoyed the nice amenity they sent to us.The location is absolutely outstanding, one block off Times Square so it was very convenient to the shows but also a decent walk to the subways.We would stay at this hotel again in a heart beat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric is very conveniently located to my office and the excitement of times square. It staffed with helpful and happy staff willing to assist as needed. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. This was an excellent visit!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first time staying at the Hyatt Times Square and I wanted to make sure we had a great view of the city skyline so we booked a Deluxe View King room. Our room ended up being on the 46th floor and faced the H&M building, but we had a straight shot of the NYC skyline all the way down to the Freedom Tower...I couldn't have asked for a better view. We spent the first 30 minutes just taking pictures out the window. Not only was the view from the room great, but the rooftop bar was absolutely unreal. Having drinks on a roof deck 54 floors above Times Square is something you won't ever forget. 100% recommend this hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a Hyatt Platinum member, I was very disappointed with the quality of this hotel. The elevators are a disaster. There are 54 floors and 5 total elevators. Many times we had to wait in excess of 10 minutes to get an elevator and then it would be packed because they are so bad. There is limited signage and even though the elevators on the first floor say you can go to the 54th floor on them...if you are on a floor less than 25 you cannot get on the elevator going to the to without changing on 25 or going to the first floor. This may sound simple but the elevator has a button and no signage on the other floors. So, I waited and pushed the button several times before deciding to go to the first floor--very frustrating.By the way, the view from the 54th Floor Bar is great. This is a nice place to have drinks at sunset and enjoy the day.I expect Hyatt to have wonderful towels and bed linens. This hotel does not meet the quality level I have experienced at other hotels in their chain. The towels were like something you would get at a 2 star hotel and the bathroom had few amenities. However, it does have a great shower.The hotel is very noisy if you are on the street. We had an Executive Suite and the jack hammering on the street woke me up at 5 AM. I would normally suggest you request a higher floor but the elevators are so bad that is a limited option also.This is an overpriced hotel for the mediocre quality.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was lovely with great views of Time Square. The location is perfect! Didn't really see much of the staff, but that's expected of a city hotel. I had room service one night which was purchased (and delivered) from the cafe downstairs, which sounds quirky but was actually delightful! The bar on the top floor is definitely a highlight, however as hotel guests we were a little disappointed we weren't given a better table.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all, this was a great central location. Close to times square, close to the subway station, you can get almost anywhere in the city very quickly from this location. Second of all, the hotel staff were really nice and helpful. They always had smiles on their faces, and were just lovely people all around. The rooms were probably average size for New York, had really big TVs, impressive bathrooms with a rain shower, and awesome views of times square. Honestly, my only complaint is the bed. The bed was TERRIBLE. It was so hard, sometimes i thought the floor might be just as comfortable. The hardness of the bed might have been overlooked if the pillows were not equally as terrible. They give you four pillows per bed, and trust me, you'll need all four because the pillows became so flat that stacking all four together might have equaled one pillow. I don't know, maybe hard beds and super flat pillows appeal to other people, but it was not my thing, and the other people in my party had the same issues with the beds. I just feel like for the amount of money for those rooms, I had better have a good nights sleep, and the beds made that impossible. I've stayed at many hyatts and the beds are always comfortable, I don't know what the deal was here. All in all though, this hotel was clean, had great staff and good views and location. I would recommend to a friend if they can get over a hard bed

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is great, few minutes walk from the Times Square. The room was fair size for New York, well appointed and clean. Unfortunately our room was on the 6th floor so it was quite dark all the time. The roof top bar has great views. We did not have breakfast included, but there are some nice places nearby. Cranberry cafe only few meters walk away in the same street was our favorite. Wi-fi was free and worked well in our room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took my daughter for her 21st birthday, we upgraded to a bigger room great decision with fantastic views,we really had an excellent time at this hotel which was located right off of Times Square and right in the heart of the theater district.. All staff were super helpful nothing was a problem they even gave my daughter cake and a birthday card for her birthday which was a really nice touch, the rooftop bar was great just could not sit outside due to the weather although we were allowed out for pictures. I came to this hotel on a friend's recommendation and would not hesitate to stay again, once again a huge thank you to all staff for making this a memorable stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really had an excellent experience at this hotel. Location right off of Times Square was perfect for catching tour buses, the theater district and everything else. For such a large hotel/busy place, I was amazed at the speed with which a few personal requests were fulfilled (my wife wanted a foam pillow...we had some additional water bottles brought up, etc). The Keurig was a nice touch. The window that could open was excellent. The TV was really nice. The large shower was a real plus. The staff were super helpful, even out front of the hotel (which is really where the brand promise begins!). The concierge was helpful. Baggage claim was perfect. Wi-Fi was a real treat (especially with teenagers..and one of the reasons we moved our reservation there). really quiet too! We really could not have had a better experience. Well done!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It would be difficult to find a better location if you want to be near Times Square, the theatres and hundreds of restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was very pleasant. The fitness facility was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited NY For two nights and stayed at Hyatt Centric as a family of four... we arrived early morning to just drop our bags for our 4pm check in but we're greeted by this lovely staff who not only offered us an immediate check in but also upgraded us to a King suite. The room was cozy and I loved the quirky decor! We were well looked after for our small needs being a family with small children. The staff were always smiling, warm and eager to help. Thank you Hyatt (again!)!! Highly recommend this place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: An excellent hotel, great location. Broadway and all the theaters are just around the corner. Bryant Park is also pretty close for a more quiet walk. Yes, we love walking around. We went from here to central park, nice walk by 5th Ave. An extra tip, the bar at the roof top: Amazing view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room very comfortable and clean but not as large as other Hyatt's . I've stayed in but this is NYC Room had a fabulous view of the city. Very nice bathroom. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would come back here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When the staff found out we were bringing our 4 month old twin boys they were super helpful. They even upgraded our room to better accommodate two cribs. They staff was very friendly! Fantastic views with the Chrysler building!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We highly recommend the Hyatt Times Square. You’re right off of Times Square, surrounded by fantastic restaurants, close to the Metro, and right in the heart of the Theater District. The rooms are well-appointed and modern. The accommodations comfortable and more than adequate. Our only complaint was that we tended to stay up far later than we should, and, overwhelmed by the magnificent sights, well, sleep always eluded us. Morning came far too fast! The staff was very accommodating. Room service was quick and convenient, and the rooftop lounge met our every need.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, great location. Best bed ever. And lovely shower. Loads of construction going on in the area so I imagine it will be even better when they finish all the work. When it was raining they loaned us an umbrella, when it was cold our room was warm. When it was warm out our room was cool and the bar on top is pretty cool. Although only open at 4. Not sure bar attached to lobby has a clear identity. Looks sophisticated but self serve Pepsi and chocolate bars at the till but also then serves $15 cocktails.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel check-in staff was wholly inadequate and rude. Our reservation confirmation clearly said when we were checking out, but the front desk agent simply refused to believe us, telling us that we had to check out a day early. We were forced to call Hyatt Gold Passport, but he refused to listen to them -- the Gold Passport agent had to call us back, apologize, and say she was going to have to call the following morning to speak to the agent's supervisor. No one ever followed up with us, but an automated email from Gold Passport showed our confirmation again. Then, on the last evening, all of our keys were deactivated, requiring our party to wake each other up in several attempts to get into the room. No apology was offered at any time, and we are Hyatt Platinum members. I cannot recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice sleek hotel less than a block from Times Square. Only big issue is getting a car to it due to traffic back up and construction. I had to walk a block away to get my 5AM car to the airport due to the road closure. Aside from alerting me to it the Hotel did not really have a gameplan. Although nice this accessibility continues to be a challenge.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a fabulous location, it seriously doesn't get any better than this. Times square is about a 2 minute walk away so getting to theatre show was a breeze. The staff were always friendly and the rooms were clean, well appointed and very comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location, comfortable well-equipped room, but the thing that made this hotel stand out for us was the staff. Travelling with two kids, one took ill the day we were due to fly home. The staff were brilliant, letting us use the hotel phone to contact our insurers, finding out about local doctors and giving us complimentary late check out to enable our son to rest before the flight home.A stressful time, which could have been so much worse if we hadn't had the support from the hotel. We will definitely be back - hopefully with well kids next time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first stay at the Hyatt Centric. We were very pleasantly surprised. The location was fabulous, right off Times Square, and the atmosphere was modern and chic. The executive suite we were given was upgraded with a very modern bathroom, bedroom, and living room complete with a leather couch, desk with all the tech gadgets, and smart TV. I wish we had time to stay longer! A definite must if you are coming to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything about New York was big and grand. Tour buses were large and spanned the city. Great food and luscious accommodations. Concierge service very helpful and knowledgeable for things to do. Soft, comfy beds and spacious shower area. Room service offered and great check in with no wait time. Shopped everywhere and returned with much more than needed. Really enjoyed Hyatt and will stay there again on my return trip coming up.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: At $500 a night, I really thought I would be staying at a nice hotel. However, the carpet was very worn and the wallpaper was peeling off the walls. Both would be acceptable at a lower end hotel, but not in a suite at the Hyatt in Times Square...Staff was fantastic though!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel in October and had a great time. Very spacious rooms, new furniture and decor, very nice bathroom (simple but functional). Rooftop lounge had great views. Very close to everything in Times Square - theatres, food, subway stations etc.Only minor issues: very long wait for the elevators in the morning and check out lines at check out time were insane.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location right in time square ! Lovely room with an amazing view of time square. Book a corner suite if you can as very spacious. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Quite noisy at night even on the 42nd floor but that's a trade off for being in the heart of the city. Would definitely stay again !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel, had a room on the 30th floor which was extremely quiet, the hotel seemed to be extremely well sound proofed, we could barely hear the sirens and dustcarts outside. 2 very comfortable king-size beds (referred to as queen-size in the states). Large walk in shower with rain shower or hand held shower head. Under floor heating in the bathroom which was lovely due to cold weather during our stay. Large screen TV with excellent picture. Coffee and tea making appliance with complementary, coffee, tea pods and bottled water topped up daily. Friendly reception staff were on hand at all times to greet and provide assistance. Hotel is located within a two minute walk of the hustle and bustle of Times Square. All the main Broadway theatres are within a five minute walk.Didn't use the hotel restaurant as it seemed expensive compared to the restaurants in the local area.Subway within a five minute walk of hotel for transportation to all main visitor attractions.Summary - great location, very comfortable, very clean, very quiet hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for two nights for a business trip that included meetings in midtown and a play. This hotel is well located. It's only two years old, so everything works. It's small, with 10-11 rooms on each floor, but it's 50+ floors. I stayed on the 38th floor and could still hear some street noise, but that's probably unavoidable. The rooftop bar is a must-visit, but be forewarned: I paid $13 for a basic beer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Gorgeous hotel, had the deluxe king view room on the 43rd floor. Great service, great location and awesome staff. The food in the hotel restaurant was overpriced and underwhelming. Considering we were on our honeymoon, we wished a expression of congratulations had been given (verbally or written) but overall a great stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located right in the middle of midtown, next to Times Square. It's a busy hotel, small lobby and can get a little crowded in the lift lobby but the staff are generous with their smiles and very friendly. Ask for a room on the higher floors so you won't hear anything from the bustling street. Depending on which rooms, the lights from the big screens can be seen - but there are blackout curtains so you won't be kept awake at night. Amenities in the room are a little more limited than I expected - you get the basic shampoo, conditioner, soaps and lotion but there are no shower caps, cotton buds etc. There's a coffee machine but no tea. Plenty of bottled water and ice bucket are also available. International power converter plugs are available throughout the room which is great. The bed is comfy and cleaned well everyday. There's a great rooftop bar with awesome views, a cafe in the lobby which also serves as your in-room service kitchen. There's a gym which is sufficiently equipped and a spa on site. Overall great for location, comfortable and reasonably priced for a manhattan hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Three qualities best describe the Hyatt Centric Time Square: excellent location (right in the heart of Times Square), excellent amenities, and outstanding service. Located on West 45th, my family and I found it to be the perfect spot for a walking holiday. Great restaurants, shops and attractions are all within close reach. Our room was spotless, very modern, well-equipped, and excellently soundproofed. Considering the hotel's location is in a VERY busy part of New York, not a single peep could be heard in our room. Lastly, service was impressive. Everyone was warm and friendly and they were all quick to help. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is ideally located in time square with Friendly. The hotel have a Great gym open 24 hours which is very practical. The room is confortable and clean with adequate amnesties. Will recommend this hotel as a four star stay in NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we had a corner room with great views over Times Square. Staying above the 25th floor however meant long waits for the lift sometimes, so be aware at busy times! Also the cocktail bar on the 54th floor is well worth a visit. Great views!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located just right. Everything is in walking distance of the hotel. My girlfriend and I enjoyed our two evenings there. My room, had a good view of the city. Rooftop bar was a nice touch to impress upon my girlfriend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric was perfectly suited for us. We had made arrangements to see a Broadway play and dine out in the Times Square area so the location of the hotel was very convenient. Also, just two blocks from 5th Ave Shopping. The experience was awesome! Would highly recommend this property!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed as a family of four with two teenagers. The room was nice - reasonable size for central NYC. Bit of a lack of storage but very clean and tidy. Staff were all very pleasant and friendly, helpful and polite. View wasn't great but we didn't spend much time looking out of the window! Really good location god getting around- as long as you don't mind the madness of Times Square. For a better variety of places to eat walk over to 9th Ave or jump on the subway. We got from hotel to lovely Mexican restaurant in the Village in around 25 minutes. An enormous thank you must go to the thoughtful staff who presented my daughter with card, fruit and cake for her birthday - much appreciated.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I love this place because of its amazing location and super unique and cool rooftop bar. Rooms are a bit small, and the bathroom was tiny. I cant imagine sharing this room with another person. Everything clean, room had pretty cool and modern decoration. I would go back just for its bar and location right on times square, but i would keep the room size in mind if I travel with more people. Service was great and bed was SUPER COMFY!!....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I cannot praise this hotel and its staff enough. This gem is METRES away from the hustle and excitement of Times Square. Rooms are very clean, oversized and very trendy with big LCD TV and great bathrooms. Their restaurant is T45 which doubles as Breakfast and Dinner and both were faultless. Their Rooftop bar is B54 and the highest in New York. As always, a hotel is only as good as its staff. All were welcoming and Friendly. Matthew, the hotel manager, clearly has a great team. Should be your first choice to stay in Manhattan and I would undoubtedly stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Best thing about the hotel is location .rooms overpriced for the accommodations and the included amenities . Out dated furniture and decor.old towels ,old rundown bedding , unsatisfactory and short on toiletries

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel, amazing views, yummy breakfast, friendly staff.Floor to ceiling glass on the 51st floor made me feel a little dizzy at first but I was soon acclimatised and drinking in the view of the amazing cityscape. Lights action, Times Square, Manhattan.View of the one world tower in the distance along with so much more.Would most certainly come again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms were huge for New York standards. The hotel had a good location near Times Square. Our room had a decent sized balcony and we could see the comings and goings on Time Square from it. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. The Wifi worked well. Bar 54 had amazing drinks and views. My only complaint is that the beds were too hard for my taste.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our room had a nice view of the city and Times Square. The thing I most loved about this hotel was the Closet and bathroom door details. Bath was finely appointed. Unique in our room was the shower and bathtub in the same cubby. Would have like a TV at the soaking tub.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location near some of the well known sites such as Empire State Building , Top Of The Rock and Broadway. Hotel is modern with comfortable beds and a small fridge . Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My favorite Hotel in NYC (stayed 4 times in the last 2 years). I stayed at the Andaz (amazing hotel) and GH before but this beats them in terms of price/room size/comfort/location. Mr. Jeff who checked me in is very professional, Thank you for the nice room. Mr. Rahman at the Restaurant takes a good care of us in the morning at breakfast. Ms. Dede at checkout was very prompt and professional and I don't want to forget Mr. Josh and Mr. Baloo who extended my stay during a very busy time in NYC while the hotel was sold out. Will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room is pricey, but of course that's NYC; however, I paid with Hyatt points so cash damage was minimal. We stayed in a 2 room suite that had the Times Square view. 49th floor and yes, very nice view indeed. The room had a bathtub so my wife was able to soak every night - huge plus. Keurig coffee pot in the room with free refills. We has king size bed which could be shut off from the living area where our 2 adult size children slept comfortably on the pull out sofa. The staff was very friendly. Held our luggage for us upon early arrival and upon check out until we caught car to airport. Had zero issues. Everything clean and nice. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square treated me extremely well, upgraded to level 33 with great views.Easy walking distance to 7th Avenue to catch M20 bus up/down to Battery Point & Lincoln Centre. Walking distance to Broadway shows. Bar 54 fabulous as was their ground floor cafe. Felt safe with security at front entrance all times.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Some family and I stayed at the Hyatt for our first visit to New York, needless to say I will be staying here again on my next visit, amazing hotel and the staff are so welcoming and friendly. Very clean with a modern interior design. Also the restaurant food is delicious!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of the best hotels in NYC. Great location. The staff makes visitors feel at home and are knowledgeable about New York City attractions. The restaurant leave visitors wanting but there are great places to eat near by.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Exactly what you’d expect from a Hyatt…great service provided in a modern, hip environment. The location is fabulous if you want to be right in the heart of Times Square…this is about as close as you’ll get to the action…and there is a lot of action!! The front desk staff is very helpful and the rooms are decent sized. There is also a rooftop bar which is cool (but pricey…but hey, that’s NYC).Stay here if you want to be in the midst of throngs of people taking in Times Square…do not stay in Times Square if you are looking for a more quiet experience in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed this hotel for first trip to NYC. It is conveniently located in the heart of Manhattan. I liked the narrow lobby that did not allow anyone to enter hotel without being seen and greeted by hotel staff. The room was small but very attractive and clean. Comfortable bed with pristine linens. We were very impressed with the recognition we received for our wedding anniversary... framed Times Square pic with hand-written note left on pillow, plus wine and brownies in room with another hand-written note, plus credit at spectacular roof-top bar. Very friendly staff. We had a great 4-night stay. Will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean, well-appointed bright room. Our room very quiet. Never heard another voice outside. Appreciated the coffee maker and Starbucks coffee in the room, as well as the refrigerator and the largish closet. Nice-sized bathroom. All the amenities. Every staff member friendly and helpful. Our room always made up for us when we returned from breakfast. Good security which we really appreciated in such a busy area. Many good places to eat right in area. Easy to walk to subway, Grand Central or 5th Ave. Plan to stay here again in spring.
user_location: Los Ranchos de Albuquerque, New Mexico

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would highly recommend the Hyatt Times Square for a stay in NYC. It is centrally located....literally steps from Times Square, a couple blocks from the Subway station, a few blocks the other direction to 5th Ave. Any sightseeing tours that you might want to take originate within blocks of the this hotel. Not to mention the hotel itself was fantastic.....clean, comfortable, very helpful concierge. Great stay....would definitely stay again. Price wasn't too bad either.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would recommend the Hyatt Times Square to any one! Great location right off Times Square walking distance from many major sites. Nice, clean, modern design but not cold. Rooms are generous size for NY. Large bathroom, free coffee and bottled water.Staff is very attentive and friendly. Roof top bar has great views of the city. I recommend going up there at night to see all the buildings lite up. Spectacular!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Cannot say enough about the friendly staff who were always smiling and willing to help. Very clean and modern. The location is very convenient to everything and if you are fortunate, the view of Times Square and One World center is amazing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The deluxe room is fantastic! Over 40 floors up with magnificent views of Times Square, the river and 1 world trade cente. Floor to ceiling Windows. And quiet! Great location and bar 54 is even better! Expensive drinks, but great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, Comfortable and off the noisy crazy Times Square caccophany. Taxis a bit problematic so planning is important as hotel on one way street. During road closures (parades etc) or rain is hard to get taxis as road clogs up. Staff from reception to bell to housekeeping very helpful and friendly. Downside was cafe on ground floor. Try other food options for better prices and taste. Fortunately many options within walking distance. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I just returned from 3 nights in New York. We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square and we enjoyed the hotel stay. The hotel had an excellent roof top bar with a great view of New York. There was a cafe on the lobby level incase you wanted a quick drink or something to eat. There was a spa at the hotel called the Marilyn Monroe Spa which looked really nice but we didn't have time to check it out. The hotel is in the middle of everything. Bars and restaurants everyone within quick walking distance. Shopping and Show are outside your door step. I would highly recommend this hotel for the location and great service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location - close to shops, restaurants, subway, theatres, etc. Hotel staff were polite, friendly and helpful. Generous size room with clean, modern and minimalist decor. Ability to open window and control room temperature were bonuses. In-room Keurig coffee maker, Starbucks coffee, daily bottled water and refrigerator were nice added touches. Room was very quiet and beds really comfortable. Totally satisfied with our one week hotel stay at the Hyatt Times Square New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent rooms and they help you alot. Thing get done fast there so you can go places and explore. People get your extra towels and supplies fast with very little waiting. Excellent Excellent!!! Go there

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, comfortable, extremely quiet rooms with all the amenities one needs. Especially enjoyed coffee maker with Starbucks coffee, window that opens, quiet heating/cooling system, refrigerator, free wifi, and safe. Friendly, helpful, courteous staff throughout hotel. Good security.
user_location: Los Ranchos de Albuquerque, New Mexico

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for a work meeting. I came in the weekend before to meet my mother who took the train in from Boston. The location is GREAT, if you like being less than 1 block from the heart of Times Square. Not sure that's my favorite place in the world but it was pretty cool to be that close. The international people coming in for the meeting loved it! The room was larger than others I've had in NYC and it seemed pretty recently decorated. Nice mini-fridge to use which was appreciated. I didn't find the staff that friendly, well, I should say the front desk staff. The bell staff was quite friendly. I had a weird situation when I arrived and due to a random street festival the taxi dropped me a couple of blocks away and I walked over. This guy saw me and was being a smart Alec and then, it just so happened a guy on the bell team was walking by. He could tell I didn't believe he was really with the hotel so he showed me his ID and then he helped me the rest of the way. Forget his name but he is pretty tall and bald. So that should help the manager, if they read this, to recognize him. Apart from him and another guy outside and one manager who approached me to ask my feedback (which I gave him!), I'd say I gave them an Average review vs. Very Good because of the staff. Also, on the day I checked out I put on exercise clothes and walked around until I had to go to the airport. I left my bag at the front desk. I came in to ask a question and I asked the "security" person inside near the front desk and it was a woman who had a pretty bad attitude. I started to speak and she pointed to the front desk and cut me off. Pretty rude. I wish I had her name. Anyway, the roof top patio is nice. I guess my main complaints were that there is no business center. There's a computer or two in the lobby hooked to a printer that didn't work at all. So if you are there for work, and many people are, you have to walk a couple of blocks away to Kinkos. It's a killer Kinkos, which is good, but they really should have a business center, even if it is small. Also, the room service...was fast enough but it comes in all disposable containers in a paper bag. I guess that's the "in" style now but for the prices you pay, it seemed pretty cheap to me and like it was a way to cut down on people costs picking up the trays after people eat and leave them outside the doors in the hall. I ordered cheese fries and they came with the fries in a plastic container and the cheese in another one, and it just wasn't cool to put the cheese on the fries myself. I'm sure this sounds super crazy but I mean you are paying a fortune for them, at least bring them all prepared with maybe some garnish on it or something. Although on a positive note, I saw how much cheese they brought up and I pretty much lose my appetite. LOL Anyway, again, if you are paying over $400 a night for a hotel, I'd expect the room service order to be delivered on regular plates with normal cutlery and not plastic. OH! One more thing as an FYI...they take no prisoners with your check out time. Don't play with it at all or you will be charged. Not that I blame them, but I've not seen other hotels be so strict...be careful!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything from checkin to checkout was superb. Polite staff. Beautiful room. Comfy bed. View was magnificent. Location in the heart of all the action. Close to stores, restaurants and tons of attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 5 couples visited NYC for the first time and we could not have picked a better location and can't say enough about overall impression of this hotel. Exception service and we have stayed at a lot of hotels and none have had better beds or pillows, the rooms are very modern and clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a recently renewed Hotel that looks like new. The staff (reception and maintenance) are one of the best in the Industry. Almost in the middle of Time Square at walking distances of all the best restaurants and attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the best hotel I have been to in New York. That too it's located in Times Square. Everything like Central Park ,Rockefeller centre and many other buildings are located in a minutes walk from it. The staff treats you very well and room service does not take a long time. The view from the rooms are amazing (Hehe I had a peak in others rooms). The food is crazy. Also visit the Nintendo centre which 2 minutes away from it.This hotel is massive and the rooms are also massive. I have been to many hotels in New York and this the best.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Exceptional location and amazing room. Was upgraded to a room on the 27th floor with an outdoor balcony. Fitness room was clean, with new equipment, and lots of choices. Phenomenal view. Would highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were celebrating my 64th birthday in the city. Upon checking in - I was recognized with hyatt membership and was gifted with upgrades in accommodation (higher floor) and a $50 bar credit at the rooftop bar! I was quite flattered!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great stay at the Hyatt. It has a great locations and the staff was very helpful in all situations we may have had. Would highly recommend this place to stay in the heart of Times Square. They have a great restaurant in the hotel if you want a quick bite instead of going out into the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great hotel and great location!!! Quite hotel!!! Love the staff! We have been going to the Hyatt Time Square for years! Very highly recommend! Very clean hotel! Time Square in the best area to stay in for all the broad way shows!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First impression= clean,fast service,safe secure & even a roof top terrace.The terrace is a wonderful place to see the sunset,Time square and eat with friends and have a good time. The hotel has many good amenities like bathrobes,sandals and even coffee. The beds are comfortable and bathroom are some of the best of all Hotels.Love the Hyatt highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love, love, love this hotel. Clean, classy and friendly staff. Minimalist decor and great location! We frequently visit and have stayed here several times and we are Never disappointed. If you can swing it, go for the corner sweet....it is well worth the upgrade.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stunning trendy hotel in the heart of Times Square. Only a 2 minute walk to the centre of Times Square itself, I could not think of a better location. Does not serve breakfast, but there is a little cafe/restaurant next to reception that serves food. We did not avail of this, our large party went next door to one of the two Irish bars either side of the hotel for an amazing hearty Irish/English breakfast. There are plenty of delis nearby where you can get food, but we had to search for a proper american diner that served pancakes, but the one we did find, the food was delicious!The rooms are modern and spacious, and nearly everyone from our party had two double beds in there room. We were on the 49th floor, and had spectacular views of the city. All rooms had flat screen TVs, a good selection of channels and a lovely modern bathroom with walk in shower. The hotel has a very trendy rooftop bar, that provides breathtaking views of the city. The bar itself has a great selection of drinks, cocktails and snacks but very pricy to stay there for more than one or two drinks.Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. I would go back again in a heartbeat, absolutely loved it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a clean, minimalist style hotel from the lobby to the rooms. Check in was so so,the Spanish speaking front clerk that checked us in said room was not ready even though we are Hyatt club members, while the other lady Dede and Loti (Asian) let their customers check in right away, not Hyatt club members. Wished I had the other 2 checking me in.They also answered all queries by their respective guests. Room was nice, clean, with a coffee maker, regular toiletries. Night was noisy with police sirens, emergency ambulances, etc. Concierge was helpful in a way and also not up to date in other ways, I had to show him something from my IPad . You have to go out to dine something decent to eat. Security good and pleasant. A bit of a walk from subways and Times square- Marriot marquis Times Square is better in terms of location. ThisHotel also poor signage until you are on the actual street in front of it, my taxi driver from the airport passed it, we has to walk back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We selected this hotel for a long weekend stay in NYC based on the trip advisors reviews and it did not disappoint. From Newark airport we decided to find our way by taking the train and subway. Maybe next time we will try a cab, this time we hesitated as we were not sure about the traffic. Train is $13/ person from Newark airport to Penn Station in NYC and the subway one-way fare is $3/person. We bought the tickets from the local ticketing machines. The train had 2 stops and the subway was only one stop. We found Penn station confusing and ask for directions a lot. At night work is getting done on some of the subway lines and we wanted to make sure our one stop ride was not affected. The hotel is really close to the subway station through Times Square. Subway station is on 42nd the hotel is on 45th. We arrived after 10 pm on a Saturday night and it was busy. The lobby area is fairly small and Check-in took a bit longer with 3 line ups and 4-5 people in each. The lines moved fairly fast and within 15 min we were in the room. By the time we went to the 54 th floor lounge the kitchen closed and we only had some drinks and olives. The view was spectacular and the service friendly and quick. Our king room at the 28 th floor facing north had a nice view of the skyscrapers around ( without the hustle and bustle of Times Square). We actually discovered the Haven Rooftop restaurant this way and we enjoyed dinner there one evening. We counted the blocks from the room and knew exactly how to get there on 47th street. The room was clean, not too big and not too small, the bed and pillows very comfortable. The bathroom had a very efficient layout. Staff always greeted us as we were leaving the hotel or coming back. Many restaurants only a few steps away for a variety of budgets. From hot dogs to the high end restaurants. Walgreens is You can do a lot of touristic attractions walking form this hotel. A short walk to Rockefeller centre ( going north), a few more minutes to MoMA and another few more minutes to Central Park. In opposite direction Empire State Building at about 13 -15 minutes away. We quickly learnt to avoid 7th avenue with Times Square and take a left exiting the hotel towards 6th avenue. Once on 6 th we would take left ( north) or right ( south). We did not opt for the breakfast at the hotel and went to Bryant Park instead for coffee and sandwiches. Bryant is less than 5 minutes walk going south on 6th.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Every single staff member treated me like royalty! Staff makes or breaks a business, and this staff absolutely set the bar up very high!Only thing I didn't really like was the way food room service was delivered--in brown paper take out bag, like at a Central Market. I prefer delivery to be on trays and cart, not like pick up yourself grocery store.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel location was just close enough to Times Square without being in all of the a rush and busyness of the actual Time Square area everything within walking distance staff was exceptional very accommodating the food was excellent and reasonably prices. Had a room on the 51 floor with a good view. Was Modern and contemporary and had all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay. Charging station and refrigerator came in handy.  Only disappointment was the cost of the drinks in the bar on the 54th floor I guess for the view but the drinks were outrageously priced

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt had a great location. Close to Broadway and 5th Avenue. The rooms were extremely clean and well appointed. We traveled with my mom and the hotel staff made sure to rearrange rooms so that she could be next door to me and my husband. I was grateful they did that. When I venture to New York again, I will definitely stay here. Great hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was there twice, once last year for our honeymoon and agin we booked this year. The hotel is so close to time square and also very nice and friendly staffs. We had nice time there. I highly recommend this hotel to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place is in a great location,very friendly Staff,occasionally ask for room key for safety reasons thought this was great idea,very clean rooms and the view from roof top bar was spectacular at night,Highly recommend this hotel.Thanks to staff and door guys and gals for all of the great recommendation for dining and shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 10 nights to explore New York City. Nice, fresh, clean hotel. We had deluxe view room at 43rd floor. Good view to the paramount building at times square and south of Manhattan. As we entered the room the noise from outside (street, aircon, etc) hit us in the face. BUT you get used to it quickly and we felt this hotel provided us with excellent sleep and no noise from the corridors. The location is convenient if you can handle passing the Times Square 24/7 rush while getting to the metro. Could stay here again.Ps. We had no problems with the elevators!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my second trip to NYC and both times I've stayed in the Times Square area. The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms are nice and the service staff is very accomodating. Even when we needed to delay cleaning until 4:30 in the afternoon to get work done. The rooftop bar has amazing views, however, the $24-26 price for even a simple drink takes away a bit from the enjoyment. Overall, would stay here again, the ease of navigation of NYC from this location makes it great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited New York in January this year (I've only just started reviewing on TripAdvisor sorry for the delay) for my boyfriend's 30th Birthday. I chose the Hyatt in Times Square for its excellent reviews and great location and it really did not disappoint! Even before we had even begun our trip the service was just fantastic; I emailed the hotel requesting a room with a good view and bath. For the room type I had booked this was not possible but they suggested I upgraded and offered this to me for a reduced price as it was a birthday surprise which was a lovely touch.
