When checking in the friendly chap behind reception wished my boyfriend a happy birthday and confirmed my room had a great view and he was right! We were on the 50th floor and could see as far as the One World Trade Center, the view was mind blowing with floor to ceiling windows! We barely closed the curtains even at night time so we could enjoy it. The room was beautiful, spacious, really clean and the bathroom was amazing with a lovely bath and a shower! On the 54th floor they have a rooftop bar which we visited a couple of times for cocktails and the views there are even mor magnificent especially at night time. The cocktails were excellent too! We also enjoyed drinks in the bar downstairs as well ( they are also a bit cheaper too!) the staff in there were wonderful as well, recommending and making all kinds of cocktails for us. New York will go down as one of the best trips I have ever been on and without the comfort and service we received here it would have not been the same. Thank you so much for helping to make our stay so enjoyable and when we return to New York in the future we will definitely be staying at the Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A fantastic Hyatt, very new and modern, steps from Times Square and theatre venues. Great views from the rooftop bar, excellent food at T45 restaurant in the lobby area, and great service. Overall, a highly recommended property for a mid-town Manhattan stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, wonderful staff, beautiful rooms, and quiet. The wait staff in the restaurant was friendly and prompt and the food excellent. I would definitely stay her again and recommend this hotel to friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff are all extremely helpful and pleasant, from the guys greeting my cab to the reception staff to the maid service, etc. and the rooms (including bathroom) very clean. My third stay this year and looking forward to booking my next visit in December

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel is perfect if you are looking at options at Times Square. Room was clean and comfortable considering the general size of NYC hotels. We had booked a deluxe view king room and it was a good room. The room had a full glass wall with a good view of times square. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel also provided water and starbucks coffee in the room unlike most hotels in NYC. The rooftop Bar was amazing but the host was reluctant in giving us an individual table of two and wanted us to share a table with another couple !! If you are are looking at a no fuss stay, convenient and lively location, then this is a good option.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel just a few steps away from Times Square and yet it feels like a world away from the mayhem. Lovely room, very comfortable with A GREAT SHOWER. Pop up to the 54th floor for a cocktail in the tallest roof bar in NYC, Jacques the mixologist will mix you a great cocktail. Nice cafe on site too for breakfast offering healthy options like oatmeal. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here October 6th through the 8th and it was a great stay. The staff is the best. They are all friendly and helpful. The check in process was quick and easy. We had a super view. Being that the hotel is steps away from Times Square we had immediate access to all the fun that Times Square has to offer and more restaurant choices than we thought were possible. The room was clean and modern. The beds are on the firm side, but comfortable. The room offered free coffee and bottled water. There was a refrigerator in the room. Upon request they brought us a microwave within minutes. The room staff not only restocked our towels but cleaned and straighten our room (our daughter had some stuffed animals, books, and clothes scattered on the bed that they organized nicely). If there was one drawback it would be that the fire alarm went off briefly just after midnight one Friday night. The fire department showed up to determine what triggered the alarm. There was no fire and no need to evacuate, but it was startling.We will definitely be staying here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of my favorite hotels in New York City- The Hyatt Times Square delivered again during my most recent stay. Situated in the heart of Times Square and within walking distance of all the Broadway theaters, Rockefeller Center, the Empire State Building and a wide array of shops, restaurants and other popular tourist sights. Upon arrival my room wasn't ready but the young lady that checked me in offered to stow my luggage (which I took advantage of) and to call as soon as the room was ready which she did. Because of my delay she included a $40 credit to be used during my stay at the hotel restaurant or rooftop bar. The hotel lobby is much smaller than the nearby Marriott Marquis and the InterContinental Times Square but they get you checked in and off to your room pretty quickly. Took advantage of a 50% off sale on the hotel's suites and booked a Deluxe View Suite which I really enjoyed. The room- 4504 was very spacious and featured a separate seating area with a couch, chair and a desk right off from the main bedroom which featured a king bed and views of Times Square. The modern bathroom featured a rain shower along with a separate tub and heated floors which I didn't take advantage of.This is my second stay but needless to say when my travels bring me back to New York i'll look at the Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First visit. My husband and I stayed overnight here to attend a function in Manhattan. My husband asked to stay on a high floor and wow! were we accommodated! My ears kept popping on the elevator ride up to the 53rd floor, but what a view overlooking Times Square! The room was NY small but completely adequate, clean and modern. Lots of windows to enjoy the view. Nice bathroom with heated tile floor - just loved that! Also loved the bed which I think was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in! Staff was exceptionally welcoming and friendly, opening doors, helping with luggage and hailing taxis, anticipating your needs before you asked and always with a smile. Breakfast the next morning in their casual lobby-level restaurant was expensive, but no more so than one would expect of any hotel restaurant and the food was good, though not especially exciting or exceptional. Best and worst aspects were location. Times Square is bristling with energy and right in the middle of all the action, but a disaster as far as traffic, both vehicle and pedestrian. And the worst of the worst times to get around is Friday night, so if you stay here, FYI, best way to get around during high traffic times, is by subway or foot.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our second visit to this hotel in as many years. It is pricey but it's worth every penny due to the service, quality of hotel and it's location right in the heart of Times Square. Right from the moment you walk into the hotel you feel welcome. They even gave my wife & myself the same corner room on the 33rd floor overlooking Times Square which was a nice touch. The hotel is spotlessly clean and you feel safe and homely in this fabulous establishment - I could not recommend highly enough!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location if you want to be in the middle of everything. Beautiful building, fresh, modern and clean. Very friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful views from the room and roof top bar. Rooms are nicely laid out and clean. I thought the roof top bar was pricey ($26 for a cocktail). Some would say this is average in NYC. Maybe for a rooftop bar with views in Times Square. There are plenty of other places just outside of Times Square to explore that won't cost as much.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a one night stay at the Hyatt Times Square. It was my girl friends Birthday and was meeting her in New York after a week in Baltimore for work. We had a GREAT stay. I cannot say enough about the entire front desk staff, very personable, helpful and very kind! We thought the room was great, 42nd floor, one bedroom suite. Made use of the rooftop bar with a beverage and a sunset. The location was great, walked to Central Park, Empire States Building. A solid Irish bar and New Yarrrrrrrk pizza were just steps away. HYATT continues to SHINE, Love ALL my Hyatt trips both for work and pleasure! I have stayed at the Andaz 5th, the Grand Hyatt, the Hyatt Olace in NYC, THIS is my favorite so far! All do a great job, the service and the personality of the front desk made it for a memorable visit! Will be back in the Spring.......

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Best staff anywhere in NYC. They are so friendly, customer focused, and accommodating. The view of the city is breathtaking which also overlooks parts of Times Square. Please consider this wonderful hotel when making arrangements to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice friendly and helpful staff, beautiful views from roof bar, Was unable to give full stars as the 'luxury' sofa bed provided in the apartment room was old, saggy, soiled and uncomfortable so it made our experience with a room requiring a 3rd adult very unpleasant. Could hear street noise but did not affect our sleeping etc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights and couldn't have asked for a better location. The staff was very courteous and room was also very clean and came with all the needed amenities. Overall a very good experience and would love to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here in March for my daughters 13th birthday The room was lovely the bed was amazing we had full satellite tv , the view was poor tho that was The only thing that let this hotel down the bar staff and restaurant staff was really friendly an the food was amazing , we had a few issues with the fire alarm while we was there and it was really scary as people were running down fire escapes and going crazy in the lobby and the alarm was going of till the early hours apart from this I would stay there again I think , I just wish they would of made more of an effort for my daughters 13th birthday I thought they might of at least mentioned it or wished her happy birthday

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is ideally located, just 50 Meters from Times Square. It is right next to multiple modes of travel. Lobby is a bit small but the stout of the restaurant compensates for the same. Staff was extremely helpful and any service request was met within minutes. Room services were very quick as well. A very enjoyable experience indeed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are interested in sleeping close to Times Square, this is a good option.The hotel is on 45th W, and it's not very visible from the street, since the hall is quite small.Rooms are new and well equipped; prices are quite high, but you are in the heart of Manhattan.Metro station is just a block apart.We were in a company meeting and reserved a meeting room, with very good service and great catering,

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right in the centre of times square, beautiful inside and great rooms.Upgraded for free on arrival with a balcony over looking times square.Perfect for a getaway and an ideal base.No noise heard from the city below but views to die for.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room was like new, very clean and modern with a peaceful, crisp feel in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Next to everything, Central Park was only a 20 minute walk. The rooftop bar had tasty cocktails with a cool ambiance and excellent view. What impressed me moth was how the staff was always friendly and helpful with a warmth missing from other contemporary hotels in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel located a block from Broadway. Staff was friendly. Nice bar on 54th floor with great view. Rooms good size especially for NYC. Shower very nice. The breakfast area was expensive but not by NYC standards. Waiter exceptional and did not mind me working there for couple of hours.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is in an ideal location - not located on a really busy street. The hotel staff are very professional and accommodating. The best part of the hotel is the view and the rooftop bar/lounge on the 54th floor. It's the ideal place to unwind after a day at the office or walking around the city!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just stayed here for a short weekend vacation. The room was modern, clean, and had everything we needed. It was also very quiet at night. The location was central to Times Square, Broadway shows, and public transit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: a trip with 3 daughters. Knew we wanted to stay in a central location and picked Times Square as we knew that area. Both rooms were very clean and well maintained by the housekeepers. Food in the roof top bar and the first floor cafe was very good. Not cheap, but nothing in NYC is! Close to Broadway as we went to a play, and close enough to subway that we could get to other parts of the city without any trouble. Times Square is always crazy, but exciting. Room was very quiet, plus it had a window that opened! Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are traveling to Manhattan on a mission to see as many Broadway plays as possible, the location of this hotel is hard to beat. However, if that is not the case, pass on this hotel. There are many other much more interesting locations. Hotel needs renovation. Staff is indifferent. Somewhat unfriendly, to be perfectly accurate. Housekeeping is spotty. And it is a very tough location to get in and out of unless you are concerned with Broadway shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall I'll give a perfect 5 stars for this hotel! From Check-In, Room to Check Out. Staff are really accommodating especially Richie! woohoo! Great Job to the staffs. I'll recommend this hotel for sure! Fitness Center is a thumbs up! opened 24hrs. We'll be back here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Haytt is always my 1st choice in hotels, and Hyatt times square is a great hotel that I can call home. Location is amazing a bit off times square yet so close, the quality of material used in the hotel is good the room design is perfect from the location of the closet to the bed and the mirror in the bathroom and most importuned the heated floor in the bathroom. Got a room on the 49th floor amazing floor ceiling windows The bed was extremely comfortable; the room was very clean every time we come back to it. The staff was friendly and helpful specially the doormen/valet. We would defiantly stay at the Hyatt Times Square again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed 5 nights during peak season, in mid September. I returned back to this hotel following my experiance previously. While again the rooms and service was excellent there was an issue with the bed. The bed was very very firm and found very hard to sleep on. Even thought about sleeping on couch instead. Even with extra matress overlay still proved too firm and unfortunately will need to take this into consideration when choosing to stay in NY next time. Felt very welcomed as a Hyatt plat member.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the hotel is only 3 years old and it shows. It still feels new. The decor is extremely modern. The foyer is a small affair with a restaurant/cafe off to the left. The doormen/valet are very helpful and a credit to the hotel. Check in was fast and easy. We stayed up on the 42 floor and we had a great view. The hotel is located one block from Time Square so you are in the heart of the action. The room was a two room suite. It was a proper sized suite unlike some you get in New York. The lounge had a couch that converted into a bed so ideal for the kids room. The master had a full sized king and the bed was excellent. Large open bathroom was very well laid out. Excellent wifi. Full sized ironing board and steam iron. The desk was also functional. It is also worthwhile dropping in here to go to the rooftop bar. Great views and knowledgable staff serving great cocktails.An excellent choice in new York. I will be back......

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent 5 nights in this nice modern hotel. We stayed on the 39th floor with a spectacular view. Even better in the Skylounge on 54th floor. Could have a better restaurant. A Clean hotell with a friendly personell

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were lucky to get a room in a very busy timeHotel was clean, crew was nice, surprisingly quite, only down side is the price that was high but that is NYCRooftop bar is very nice though extremely expensive

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel has a great customer service, the rooms are big enough and always clean. The hotel also is located very close to time square and there is easy access to subways and other attractions. Proc a weren't cheap but it was worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed on the 50th floor room 5003 & omg the view is amazing . They take $200 off your card on arrival for any damages , again thought this a bit weird as we've strayed in superior places with non of this .Room a bit weird you have drawers either side of the bed but only a tiny space not a full drawer . Space not the best in drawers ect & tv area again could of used the space . Only coffee so take your own tea & you have a fridge so buy some milk . Rooftop bar again amazing & the staff especially Sheriff what a lovely guy always spoke going in & out . The best , give him a pay rise , others who work there should take note of how mint he really is . A few notes left from the maid but felt like a hint with ! & I hate ! marks , to leave a tip & there was dust & she didn't leave tea as once asked & left her a few dollars but she only left the tea once . We had a issue with a lost passport & rang reception to be cut off , rang back & they said they'd ring back but never did . Luckily we found it . Bed really comfortable & sheets ect . Loved our stay & would recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent a night @ the Hyatt Times Square for a business. I rated it as average, but it really falls between average & very good, but there is no option. The hotel is nice, great location for Times Sq and the room was nice, clean, comfortable. The cost was brutal @ $700/night. I know that The UN General Assembly was in session, and it was the end of Fashion Week, but seriously? $700?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is really good, I really enjoyed my staying at Hyatt time square and the location is just perfect and close to everything. The staff there are very helpful and willing to assist. I highly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: New hotel in Times Square. Good size rooms with a large bathroom. Kudos for the heated floors. Nice lounge with a rooftop bar. Drinks were very expensive though and it was tough to get an outside table even if a hotel guest. Fun and entertaining bartenders. Restaurant on the main floor was just okay. Hotel staff was very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We went to celebrate a very special occasion, our 10th wedding anniversary. The Hyatt at Times Square surpassed our expectations. I'm a Hyatt Gold frequent traveler, and have to say that this one in particular recreates the Hyatt experience in a perfect way. The location is perfect (theatre district, walking distance to main spots in Midtown), hotel standards are very high, the people at the front desk, concierge and bell boys are super friendly and willing to assist you with reco's, reservations and all you might need to make your stay special. The B54 (rooftop bar) is a must go to enjoy Manhattan at night while having a perfect made drinks. Will come back every time I'm in town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with the Mrs. and is right at the Times Square. The rooms are understandably compact and true to new york real estate prices, but when you are on a holiday in NYC, space is not really a big deal. Its 3 blocks away from the Subway station and the view of the famour TS can be seen right from the windows ! Room service is a little sloppy and bell boy service either not available or slow. Concierge is helpful and quick ! Check in process was a breeze. I used up all my Platinum Passport Points to stay in the middle of all the Times Square action, overall a great stay !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel in good position for the likes of the subway so good as a tourist hub. Clearly a luxury hotel but there are parts where it is a little faceless. No real interaction when we checked in and the hotel itself has no real character. The roof top bar although expensive was a great place to end your day. No real complaints there is just something personal missing from it.Why is there no shower gel in the bathroom, so in a luxury international New York hotel you have to take your own?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful staff and a perfect central location to walk everywhere. Bathroom is an excellent size and the sky lounge was great to visit. Staff were always eager to help where needed. Coming from Australia, the coffee is very average.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was a definite departure for us from where we might usually stay, but the location turned out to be ideal for my husband who had business meetings nearby, and for theaters, Central Park and Madison Square Garden which were all within walking distance. I didn't personally care for the tiny, rather stark lobby, or the strange color scheme on the room floors, but the elevators were exceptionally fast and I enjoyed having New York at my doorstep once I went out the lobby doors.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is a gem tucked away on a side street in Times Square. Very professional front desk staff and an amazingly friendly, fun, professional and attentive guy standing just inside the front door. (We assumed him to be security). He always made us feel welcome and important. The rooms were sparkling clean, well-appointed and very spacious for New York City. The hotel is in close proximity to restaurants, shopping and Broadway yet still far enough away from the hustle and bustle. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and will stay there again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just stayed at the Hyatt Times square and do they know how to do service.Every single person at the Hotel is friendly and more then willing to help in any way they can.A short distance from Times Square this is a Hotel that knows how to be a Hotel....you want it.......... you ask for it........... it is done in a quick anf friendly way.The Hotel is typical of the Hyatt brand and is quiet and walking distance to most Theatreson Broadway.The management at this Hotel is first rate ........they know how to hire people likeLatoya who not only brought my bags from storage but carried my bags outside to help me get a Taxi............... and she works at Reception.Thank you Latoya for being so friendly and so wonderful and thank everyone at thisHyatt for making me feel welcome in your property.I felt like a honored guest.Do not hesitate to book a room at this property you sometimes get what you pay for.Great job guys I love you all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hyatt Time Square is good place to stay for those who pursue to enjoy NY musicals and to travel midtown New York for business. The conditions of room are good and satisfied for my business trip. The only some of frustration was lack of good dining in hotel even if there was a casual dining restaurant in first floor near by lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel isn't the cheapest place to stay in NYC by a long shot, but the quality of the Hotel including service, rooms & location make it worth every penny in my opinion. This was our second stay at the Hyatt Times Square (Previously stayed in October 2014). We enjoyed the first stay so much that we had to come back - they even gave us our previous room because I mentioned how much we enjoyed it on our first visit! From the moment you are greeted by the staff in reception (which incidentally has the most incredible smell! - can you buy it in bottles?) you feel comfortable, relaxed & safe which for me is so important in this incredible city.The hotels location really captures the magic of the city and the views from our room overlooking Times Square we incredible! If you visit Bar 54 you will be in the highest terrace bar in NYC! The views from the terrace present the H&M & Bank of America Buildings immediately in front of you, stretching the length of lower Manhattan to the Freedom Tower WTC1. You can even see the Hudson River to your right and the Chrysler Building to your left. We hope to stay in the future when we can afford to. I will not stay anywhere else in NYC because of the incredible experience we have had on both of our previous stays here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Probably our best "busy" holiday, had a fantastic time although our feet hurt on a daily basis? Everything was close to hand and accessible. Underground, eateries all very close. Couldn't find a miserable member of staff, all extremely friendly. A truly great week.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in Sept 2016 in a junior suite on 44th floor. We asked for a room up high to avoid street noise and were glad we did so as traffic noise is fairly continuous. The room was surprising big and very well equipped. A couple of nice touches were a complimentary bottle of wine on the second night and a $50 credit for the rooftop bar (B54 - on the 54th floor). The views from the higher floors are exceptional and from our room we could see parts of Times Square, the Chrysler Building and One World Trade Centre. We also used the rooftop bar on one occasion for a (very) high-priced drink, but was we we're on 44th floor, it wasn't that exciting to be honest.The beds were very comfortable and there was excellent WiFi in the rooms that actually supported proper streaming services. We had bath and shower. Bath robes and slippers were provided, as was a coffee machine with refills. The staff were very pleasant and security was good, but not intrusive which was reassuring for us as guests in a high quality hotel so close to Times Square. The location is excellent, close to all of the attractions of Midtown - restaurants, Broadway, 5th Avenue, Circle Line Cruises, Central Park, etc. All are within walking distance. The subway is close-by and the No 1 line bring you down to Battery Park, where you can get the Staten Island Ferry or the boat to Liberty Island,etc.A great hotel if you want to spend a few days in this really busy and lively area of the city. No complaints from me!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had originally booked a deluxe view room. The day before our visit I received an offer to upgrade to a suite for an extra $100/night, which I took. Glad I did.....had a great suite overlooking Times Square on the 53rd floor. The views were beautiful. The rooftop lounge is great! Everyone we encountered was very courteous, welcoming and helpful. As we were headed out one morning, one of the ladies on the cleaning staff gave us a couple of waters to take with us.....:) It's little things like that that will make me return. My one and only complaint is there is no room service. We attended a concert at Radio City and we were looking forward to ordering a late dinner......and the downstairs restaurant had already closed. We had to go back out, which was kind of a drag. But overall, a really great experience!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stay 5 nights great hotel and great service and staff all very helpful we was on the 30th floor so great view over Grand Central Terminal we would definitely stay again you have to pay 3 dollars per bag to level with the bell boys If you have a late flight

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square is located in the heart of the theater district and a short to many of NYC's highlights. Recently renovated and very,very clean! A place where you can get a good nights sleep in a comfortable bed in the middle of Times Square. Great staff, kind and friendly enhances the experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 3 weeks stay and I have only one thing to saythank you to the staff. hotel very well managed. nothing much to say when your stay has been perfect. 5 excellent points for service ,!cleanliness ,location,value, rooms and sleep quality should say it all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked a room for 3 people, but it has only 2 queen beds, and they don't have extra bed or bed-sofa.The room was clean and large compare to other hotel in Time square.The view is not really a view.The bathroom what I liked the most.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for my birthday weekend, and loved every bit of our experience. Our room was a Deluxe King (4902), and it was perfect. We did experience a bit of a problem with the air conditioning, but the hotel got it sorted out and all was well. The second maintenance guy who came to the room even returned an hour later (as promised) just to make sure all was ship-shape. It was. All of it. And the rooftop bar? Just go. After reading the reviews and being forewarned about the high drink prices, I grudgingly agreed to go up to the bar with my sweetie on our first night in town. For JUST THE ONE. Just one drink, and one night. We arrived and got through the disinterested gauntlet that is the front desk (super yawwwwwwn), were given a crappy table, and I was prepared for a crappy overpriced drink. This, dear reader, is where the experience takes a wild and unexpected turn. I ordered a (very cold) Manhattan. I braced myself for a mediocre and overpriced drink. What I received was the BEST MANHATTAN I HAVE EVER HAD. (And I have had more than several). ::::heavens opening and angels singing:::: Oh my. I said it out loud and the bartender, who apparently has satellite dishes for ears, overheard me. We then met JUSTIN - World's Best Mixologist. He imparted to us his superpower for making drinks extra cold (and I so appreciated that he actually listened to my preference and delivered 100%), and turns out to be a lovely and interesting guy as well. And, yes, you guessed it, we visited Bar 54 every night of our stay. Spendy, but totally worth it. Can't wait to visit the rooftop bar and Justin when I am next in town. We also ordered a few appetizers and the food was DEEEE-LISH. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have no complaints or issues. The staff was very welcoming, helpful and polite. They helped us find a great restaurant for an enjoyable night. The room was very relaxing, clean and roomy. We will certainly come here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of our frequent trips to see a concert! We live coming to the city for a show or concert. We always stay at the Hyatt Time Square. And try to get as close to the top floor as possible! The views are the best! Last year we had the suite on the 53rd floor!!! The best ever. Doesn't really matter the rooms are all impeccibly best and clean!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent Location. Easy access to the world's renowned street Times Square. Good atmosphere. Even it is near to the busy street, you feel comfortable in staying. Good room service & Great Dining. Free Wi-Fi, after all it is awesome to stay in Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms are fine, and suppose good for New York. My room carpet was dirty, housekeeping never replenished the amenities. I found the reception staff very rude and abrupt and unwilling to help. The concierge was always alone and busy and the reception staff all seemed to be talking to one another and would not assist there at all.As mentioned before I think it is goof value for New York and the position excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is ideally located to take advantage of all that the Big Apple has to offer, dining theater, museums, etc,,,, The staff is courteous and efficient. The rooms are modern and very clean. The bar on the roof has amazing views of the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A half block in from Times Square itself, this high rise hotel is one of the better finds for anyone looking for a theater area stay. Avoid the Marriott Marquis and its hassle. Avoid the chaotic and dingy NY Hilton this Hyatt has great rooms, terrific and friendly staff, rooms with robes and our 24th floor suite has two large screen TVs. One minor shortfall -and surprising one at that! -was that "movie" choices are limited to only 3 choices,....and no YES channel to watch the Yankees! But I highly recommend this hotel, and will stay here again when traveling to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our seven night stay here. The staff are exceptional and make this hotel a welcoming and wonderful oasis in a very hectic city. The rooms are clean and modern with several nice touches upon arrival. Ask about an upgrade. We did and we were very happy we did.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Thanks to the extraordinary time I had at the Hyatt. You know when you walk in to a hotel and you know it's gonna be a great experience. That's what Hyatt Times Square felt like to me. From start to finish such a great time, checkin, room, view, appointments, pillows, you name it, it was awesome!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a few nights whilst visiting New York and were utterly disappointed.The location is great but that's about as good as it gets.As a Hyatt member I would have to say this is the worst Hyatt hotel I have ever stayed in.The service was terrible.The staff were rude which was surprising considering the US consumers normally would expect a high standard of customer service.Any requests were met with a sour face and to get a smile from a staff member was a rarity.It's clearly obvious some of the staff don't want to be there.Sorry to say it but stay well away from here as you will leave disappointed with the Hyatt brand.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, almost at Time Square (near to subway). Very helpful and friendly staff. We had deluxe room on 29th floor. The room was very spacious with window wall. We had a nice Manhattan view . I love the bar at 54th floor but the cocktails and drinks were very expensive there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Second time in this hotel. Loved it all over. If I could take the bed, pillows and rainshower home, I would. Stayed on the 47th floor, perfect view. Easy check in and myst easier check out. Next time we visit New York, for sure we choose this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We came for our anniversary and it could not have been nicer! Great location and great staff! The rooms were quiet. The room was clean and comfortable. The roof top bar was amazing! It was perfect on all counts!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel. The staff are very friendly and will go that extra mile for you. We stayed seven nights and we were delighted to be given an upgrade and complimentary spa treatment when we arrived. The location can't be beat. It is close to Times Square, but just far enough away to be a quiet oasis in a very busy city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We needed a place with two beds but wanted to be centrally located. The Hyatt was perfect on all counts. It was a nice respite from all the crowds. The room was quiet and comfortable. The staff was very helpful and always very welcoming.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were here at this hotel for Labor Day Weekend 2015 and we returned again for the Labor Day Holiday weekend again 2016. We love the location for a few reasons. The subway lines are so close and they will take you anywhere. the Bronx, Brooklyn All over MAnhattan and even Queens. We are theater goers and was 3 shows on our last trip (Sept 1-5 2016). So convenient to the theaters and then afterwards we are right at our hotel. The 'only' downside is the crazy crowds in the evening in Times Square, but that is not enough to deter us to another location. We have stayed in other locations north and south and then have to rely on the subways to get back to the hotel after the theater. but not at this location. Our room was only on the 7th floor but it was large and clean, so we were happy. We were thinking about going to D.C. next year, but now we still might come back to NYC and stay at the Hyatt Times Square. At night, it was quiet and we were on the 45th street side of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The property is well kept and appears freshly remodeled. The location is perfect for theater. It's just blocks from the subway. We did have some difficulty using Uber/Lyft because the street is one way and currently there is construction in times square. We found if we walked up a block to 6th the process was better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I went to New York City for her 40th birthday. Our stay at the Hyatt Times Square was great. My daughter was even given a credit of $50.00 for the restaurant as a birthday treat. Nice touch. We would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to family and friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked with Hyatt Gold points and didn't make any room charges or other hotel charges. However, the day after we checked out our credit card was billed almost $800. We called a manager who verified this should not have been charged but were give no explanation as to why it was charged.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 10 nights great location near Times Square but after a couple of days developed raging toothache. So asked reception if any dentists nearby answer I got very disappointing was told no idea and I should Google it.Now I had come from Sydney by myself and in a lot of pain. When I did check out dentists there were several close by within walking distance.It would be an excellent idea if a hotel like the Hyatt would have this info available for guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staying here for 2 nights, took a room with a balcony, which is about 370$ per night with tax on 27th floor. They don't include breakfast which was strange n I didn't expect that. Receptionist couldn't explain why they don't include it into price now. He kept saying they don't include it "this time" so it's weird for me. Not a great service, asked for tooth brush which is still hasn't come. Better to take a higher floor it's cheaper, without a balcony. With a balcony nothing impressive, same thing. Location is great, u can reach all shopping stores or Times Square in several minutes by walking.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in a Suite at The Hyatt Times Square for three nights and on the last night we decided to go to The Rooftop Bar, BIG MISTAKE! We came back from dinner and decided to explore the Rooftop Bar. We saw a table and sat down since nobody even acknowkedge our presence. Soon came a very arrogant person to let me know I was in his way and that I should move my chair. After a long wait for a waiter, this girl with an attitude came and nagged us because "we should have waited for someone to accomodate us", that "someone" never showed up. Then came the arrogant manager, Paul, to tell us we should have waited inside. We told him we were staying in the Hotel and nobody had told us there was a waiting line or list. He was rude and unrespectful. WE ARE NEVER COMMING BACK TO THIS HOTEL AS MUCH AS WE LIKED THE ROOM AND LOCATION JUST BECAUSE OF THESE RUDE EMPLOYEES AT THE ROOFTOP BAR.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked to stay here for two nights, we ended up staying nine nights.Location is great.Rooms are modern, bathrooms were clean and also modern.Staff were also friendly, the guys at the door WERE EXTREMELY FRIENDLY and always so welcoming.The rooftop bar was nice however drinks were expensive.I could not fault this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having never been to New York before, we booked this hotel as it was near where it all happens in New York. On arrival at the hotel unfortunately our bags did not arrive with us, the hotel staff could not have been more helpful in assuring we had everything that we needed. The rooms were amazing, with floor to ceiling windows and an amazing view of the city. The roof top bar was just as breath taking especially at night. Staff were efficient and friendly, we could not have asked for more. I thoroughly recommend this hotel, turn right and you are in the hustle and bustle of Times Square, turn left and you can saunter down to 5th avenue. Perfect location

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A fantastic hotel in a prime location just off central Time Square.Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean, spacious and modern rooms. The rooftop bar has amazing views of Time Square and the Manhatten skyline.If I am ever lucky enough to return to New York I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved this hotel and were able to book 24 hours ahead when our other accommodations fell through using points and the telephone Hyatt customer service -- thank you Hyatt! The hotel is clean and new and the rooms are a good size, particularly for NYC. We had one with 2 queen beds on the 22d floor with a great view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is one of the best I've ever stayed in. Rooms areImmaculate with a nice view. Staff are extremely nice and friendly. You will feel like this is your home. The rooms are very modern and location of the hotel is perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very Clean Hotel. The gym equipment seemed brand new. I made reservations through booking.com and had to pay an extra $650 when I arrived at the hotel. It's best to make reservations directly with the Hotel.The hotel was just under one minute away from times squareEstefania the housekeeper was very pleasant everyday.The restaurant in the hotel T45 had great food and excellent service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location and comfortable beds. The roof top bar had horrible service and it was so over priced it was nuts . We were celebrating our anniversary which we mention, nothing at all was done for us let alone a happy anniversary

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square is close to everything! We walked to Central Park, Times Square, 5th Ave, Natural History Museum, The Met, Broadway, etc. Subway stations are close, for everything else. Staff is courteous and very helpful. The hotel is clean, modern and amenities are plentiful. The bed and the linens were soft and comfortable. We had a room with a view of the city, not really Times Square, on the 46th floor. The floor only had 9 rooms, so very quiet. The roof top restaurant was expensive for us, but the view is very nice. We felt safe and secure at this property. We would definitely go back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed 18-21st August in room 1806. We booked this trip for my birthday and our wedding anniversary, my husband even emailed in advance to see if something nice could be done eg higher floor for a view, nicer room, chocolates or wine like we've seen in other reviews. I don't expect a lot but there was no mention of our celebrations at any point during our trip which I found a big let down. Our room was on floor 18, we could use the lower floor lifts (elevators) which were quieter than the lifts for the higher floors. A large group often formed waiting to use the lifts to the higher floors which crowded the small lobby. Small number of rooms on each floor is a bonus as the doors have a very loud closing mechanism which is a real shame for such a newly refurbished hotel to have not remedied this. Bathroom had a nice walk in shower and modern units with toiletries. There was a small refrigerator, a coffee maker along with complimentary water bottle, coffee (and supposedly tea but we never had this in our room) daily. The television is large with a wide range of channels. The bed was fairly comfortable however I found the feather pillows to be very hard and uncomfortable, I'm not usually fussy about pillows but woke with a sore neck each morning. Large floor to ceiling windows provided a view over the Lion King Theatre at Times Square. The location is very good for sightseeing if your preference is to be in the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just returned from a 7 night stay here and it was superb thanks to Josh the front desk manager. We were allocated a room on a lower floor and had requested one on a higher floor. One phone call and Josh was so helpful words can not say. This guy is one of the nicest humans we have had the pleasure to meet he was so helpful throughout our stay and a fantastic asset Hyatt have. Thank you Josh for everything! The location and the hotel is great. Very central and yet so relaxing away from the buzzing TS. Rooms were top quality and so were the maids. Just a quick thank you to Glenis for making our rooms look amazing. Great hotel and a must stay. Thank you for providing us with an amazing stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time in NYC and choose this hotel because of the positive reviews and location close to times square. We were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary along with our 2 children and booked a suite for 4 nights. Upon check in we were informed that they had a unit overlooking times square from the higher floor. However as we entered the suite my wife noticed a strange smell in the room and as it was almost around 9pm we did not call the front desk and figured we would not be spending much time in the hotel. The next morning we asked about this strange odour and they offered to clean the room with their ozonator, to their credit they did this right away and the housekeeping manager was very pleasant and understanding of our situation.However when we returned that evening the odour was still present and we asked to then move rooms which they did the next day. The front desk manager was kind enough to offer us another unit on a higher floor. Oh and don't bother mentioning to them that you are celebrating anything as nothing was mentioned to us during the duration of our trip, not even a card in the room which would have been a pleasant surprise. I was not expecting anything else but having stayed at many luxury hotels worldwide they always acknowledge a special time in our lives. I guess being a Hyatt gold member doesn't have its perks.There are many other hotels to choose from in Manhattan which we will definitely visit again. If you do stay here make time to go to the rooftop lounge for a drink as it has amazing views on NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for nine nights and have to say one of the best hotels that we have been to, this hotel is very modern.The rooms are cleaned every day, sheets changed every day, rooms spotless, beds really comfortable and loved the air con in the room on full blast.There was a fridge with and a coffee maker in the room which were great. Bottled water and coffee makings in the rooms were complimentary which is a nice touch.All the staff at the hotel were amazing always so friendly pleasant and polite, from Clifford at check in to the cleaners.A fantastic base to see all the sites of New York, all the subway stations within walking distance, so easy to get around, we walked to central Park taking in some great coffee shops and bars.A nice deli called Cranbury a few buildings away from the hotel that served up some delicious snacks. Would defiantly stay at the Hyatt Times square again and recommend to friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a last minute booking after Expedia canceled our booking at another hotel. From the moment we checked in with Baloo everything was amazing. He was very helpful with us extending our trip for another night and not having to change rooms, and informing us of all of the hotel amenities. The rooms were very clean, beds comfortable, and you cant beat the location in the heart of time square. The rooftop bar lounge was great, the views were amazing again service great and the pitcher drinks were delicious. We will definitely stay here for our next NYC trip, thank you Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Ritchie at the front desk always welcomes Gold Passport Members with a smile and recognition. The few times that I have stayed and interacted with him he answered all my questions and did not make me feel rushed. Isn't that what a hotel stay comes down to? Feeling at home away from home but still a vacation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very new and clean hotel! Great location! Nice and friendly staff! The only thing I don't like about this hotel and give it a 4-star is that they put extremely strong perfume in the lobby, every time when we walk thru the lobby, or even when we are on the street walking close by the hotel, we can smell it and feel sick. We always have to hold our breath and walk quickly to pass the lobby area. Some people may like perfume smell, but it's way too much, especially for myself who gets really bad headache from perfume, and my kid who has asthma. We stay at this hotel two years in a row and they are still doing the same thing, hopefully they don't do this anymore when we go again next year, so that we can enjoy the hotel lobby more.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here one night over Labor Day weekend. Room was small, but very clean. Nice bathroom with rain shower. Very quiet- did not hear a sound at night. Friendly and helpful staff. We will stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in New York to see Hamilton. Wanted to be within walking distance of theater. The hotel we originally booked was horrible so we found the Hyatt and it saved our trip. The staff that answered our call and checked us in was fabulous. They made us feel comfortable and gave us a great room. It was everything you expect a Hyatt to be. The room was modern, clean and came with surprise and delight features that took the experience over the top. This is the go to place for a great Times Square stay.The bathroom was so well appointed and the beds were plush and comfy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Totally impressed with this hotel - both in terms of its location and the service we received from it's very friendly, competent and helpful staff. From the friendly welcome we received when we arrived, to our checkout, all the staff we encountered could not have done more to help (from check-in, to maintenance, to housekeeping to the concierges). We've stayed in many high end hotels throughout the world and would put the excellence of the staff at the Hyatt Times Square at one of the highest levels (which we did not expect and were very pleasantly surprised by). The hotel itself is in an excellent location. Brilliantly close to the excitement and buzz of Times Square, far enough away that you can get away from it if you want to. Easy location for the subway, easy walking distance to many great attractions. Lots of restaurants and bars in the area, but if you're not into them, you're equally not disturbed by them. The rooftop bar is amazing. Great ambience, great service, incredible views, but a bit pricey even by NY standards... All in all, an excellent stay, we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in NY for business or leisure. When we come back to NY, we will most definitely be booking the Hyatt Times Square again. Whatever it is they're doing, they're doing it right. 10/10.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights while celebrating our wedding anniversary. We were very happy with our stay. From our smooth early check-in to the brownies and bottle of wine, complements of the hotel. Our room was clean, spacious and had a great view from the 32nd floor. The location is perfect. Just off the very busy streets in Times Square and close to subway stations and main attractions. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here recently and loved it! The room itself is beautiful! The view was wonderful outside our room. The bed was so comfortable with pillows that were perfect. The bathroom was very modern and had everything you could want! Highly recommend this hotel!The location was great - right around the corner from the excitement of Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really struggled to find a hotel for 3 families in August in New York so we ended up paying more than we would have liked, but it was an excellent hotel. The rooms were lovely and in great condition for a city hotel. They were a decent size and the bathrooms were really great. Staff were so friendly, especially the doormen. We were worried that they would be noisy rooms having read so many reviews about Times Square hotels, but thankfully they were so quiet. Go as high as you can for the views as they are great from the rooms. The rooftop bar was fab. There was no problem with storing luggage for a late check out either.Would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: In NYC for US Open with friends. Hotel location is a "ten". The Hotel was ok. But not great. The comforter/sheet standard is one bottom sheet and comforter for the make up of bed. It is too cold with AC not to have a top sheet and the comforter makes it too hot. The Pillows are feather like and hard and uncomfortable. If I'm only in the room to sleep - I want the room sleep experience to be great. Refrigerator in room is a great feature!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was impresed by the hotel quality, very clean rooms,rooms quit big, the check in and check out very smooth.the location is perfect, 3 minutes walk from times square,but, in the same time, very quite.the bar on top very nice

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in excellent condition with a first rate staff. Very challenging to access with your own car; parking (other than valet) impossible. Wonderful location if you're in town for the NYC theater district. Otherwise, other NYC Hyatt hotels likely more convenient for getting around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt times square is literally blocks from times square between 6th and 7th ave so it's pretty quite by NYC standards. The reception area is smallish. The staff was extremely helpful. I took the Red Eye from the West coast so arrived at the hotel around 9 am. The staff checked my bags and checked me in although my room wasn't available. They took my cell number to text me when it was ready. I took off for a day at the Met museum and got a text around noon. When I returned to the hotel around 4 pm I was asked if I wanted a higher floor than was originally assigned to me. I was put on the 19th floor, no view but who stays in their room while in NYC. The room was smallish but the bath was great. There was no dresser drawers so I had to keep some items in my suitcase and place others on a shelf in the closet. There was a large flat screen TV, refrigerator, free water, coffee and WiFi. The linens and towels were nice. Lots of bath amenities. A few days in to my stay I need to print something off my phone and the front desk let me send it to them so that they could print it for me. Walk up calls worked on time and every time I saw a staff member they smiled and greeted me. There is a coffee shop attached to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There was only one (1) sheet on the bed covering the mattress what's up with that? Also, with all the tile and marble in the lobby with the piped in music and voices really echo which makes it hard to hear.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the best business hotel I've stayed in in New York. Not boutique, but has everything for a successful business trip. I especially like the fact it was quiet. Only slight disappointment was the breakfast that could have been more varied.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Must try the rooftop sky bar, but don't be surprise about the price, as it is a bit over charge and service was average. Location is great, just between 6th to 7th Avenue. Easy to access to all tourist attraction. Hotel is clean, only too much bleach smell.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took our 4 teens to NYC between Xmas and New Years Eve and left on New Year's Eve itself around 2 pm. THIS is an excellent plan. Given that this hotel has the bar with best views of NYC and specifically, Times Square, we had a New Years Eve experience without the $1,500 price tag! Because the checking in and checking out was so difficult given security for Times Square celebrations, guests were asked to kill some time in the roof top bar with complimentary photographers, pastries and beverages. We got to enjoy views of the ball a few hours before it would drop and we never had to wait in a security line as we were already checked into the hotel. We grabbed our car around 2 and had very little traffic getting home. The days leading up to that, we had a fabulous location for visiting all the Xmas sights and sounds of NYC. This hotel is contemporary, quiet, clean, comfortable, offering valet parking and amazing views. The prices were excellent given all of that. If you go during Xmas, definitely consider this spot. You won't get the fabulous lobby decor, but you will get the value and the views!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent the best 4 nights at this hotel from 27/08/2016 in a deluxe King Suite on the 43rd floor. The short break was for our first wedding anniversary and what a great way to start it with a world class hotel. Very spacious room. Large bed. Large bathroom with rain shower and complimentary water, teas and Costa coffee. The views from the ceiling to floor windows were breathtaking and Times Square all lit up during the night was a view like no other. Staff at the reception were very welcoming and all for a stone throw away to the worlds most famous square. The only snag about our stay was that we had visited the rooftop bar one evening and had just sat down on the balcony not knowing that we had to be wait for seating. A member of staff came over abrupt and sharp asking us to move. I felt that her approach could have been better since we did not know and it was our mistake. As a result it put us off going to the bar, something we had looked forward to prior to our visit. After all we are all guests having paid a lot of money to stay at this hotel and therefore a little courtesy and respect can make or break a great holiday.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is amazing! The staff goes above & beyond to make your stay wonderful!The rooftop bar is breathtaking, the staff and drinks are wonderful. We ate lunch at the cafe, was delish!The best place to stay in the area!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent a weekend here with my wife and two teenage daughters. Not a 5-star hotel (and not advertised as such), but for a NYC hotel steps away from Times Square, I have no complaints. Valet parking was easy, staff was courteous (held bags before check-in, after check-out), and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Zero complaints. Not inexpensive, but what hotel is in that area...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Comfortable, friendly establishment. Ideal location for restaurants, theatres and attractions. Easy transport links through the whole of Manhattan. Rooms immaculately maintained. Hotel bars pleasantly laid back, food and drinks first class. Good value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is just off Times Square great location for the subway and theatres and all the 5th avenue stores. We had informed the hotel it was our sons 9th birthday celebration and they had balloons in the room happy birthday signs. A signed photo of Times Square in a frame and some chocolate brownies a lovely touch, the room was clean and tidy each day. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend pencil and pad in room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is a great place to stay in Manhattan. The location is great and the staff is helpful and friendly. The rooms are quiet and well appointed. The restaurant is convenient, clean, and has good food.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square after our wedding. The staff was very accommodating and the room was clean and comfortable. The room was located on the 52nd floor and the view was amazing. We would highly recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently stayed with my family for 5 nights on our first trip to America as we wanted to be in the heart of Manhattan, As somebody that works in the hotel industry myself back in england i can honestly say that i have never been to a more beautiful and excellently run hotel. With Fantastic service from the concierge to Waiters and Receptionists they made us feel so very welcome. With it being our first long haul holiday with my very ill sister my mum and dad thought they may as well make it worth while for her and requested rooms on a high floor and to my surprise they accomidated, the view was spectacular!! I can say with no doubt that when returning to America Next year i will be staying again the the Hyatt Times Square as i have them to thank for helping create so a truly amazing holiday for me and my family!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed her for 5 nights in August 2016.Check in was hectic and had to wait for a Manager to come along to speed things up. We eventually get to our room, no offer of concierge to take our luggage to our room.The room was spacious, quiet and cool.They have plenty of lifts so you're never waiting too long. However as a wheelchair accessible room I'm not sure what accessibility alterations that were made. The bathroom was not particularly wheelchair accessible and my husband wasn't able to use the shower. Also, for a 4 star hotel I would expect better towels and toilet roll. In particular, the towels were quite rough and not fitting with a 4 star hotel.The location is great if you want to explore the city and the member of the security team, Sharif is a great asset to the Hyatt team. He always provides every single person that comes into the hotel a warm welcome and you look forward to seeing him on your return.One major problem, when asking for a wheelchair accessible taxi the front of house isn't able to help you. When you ask the concierge they call but having had to chase up 5 times we nearly missed our flight. They didn't seem to care when I chased it up. Luckily I managed to wave one down. It's well located for exploring the city but I imagine that there is cheaper, better quality and a more impressive customer experience hotels nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The middle of Times Square is all crowds, energy, and noise. Everything is big and brash and fun, but at the Hyatt Times Square we also found a boutique hotel feel, calm and charm amidst the chaos. There to see two shows, the location could not be better -- a short walk to every major theater. Yet the small number of rooms per floor, the insulated windows keeping out the noise, and the stylish sky bar (tallest in NYC with awesome views) made us feel like we were cocooned. The rooms were beautifully appointed and the view from the 52nd floor was terrific. As always, staff set a hotel apart and everyone we met was warm and friendly and quick to address any need. Melissa Ortiz stands out -- she's a star. We often look for hotels that have all the amenities and service of a high end chain (often turning to Hyatt) with the character and size of a boutique. The Hyatt Times Square fit the bill perfectly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The cleanness of the rooms and hotel are always above expectations. Very friendly staff in the heart of Times Square. Prices are very competitive and hard to beat based on the location. Rooftop bar with an observation deck. What else can you ask for when staying at NY, NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was wonderful! Room was very nice and the staff were great. BUT, that was the hardest mattress I've ever had in a hotel room. Like sleeping on a granite block. Liked almost everything else at the hotel, but after three sleepless nights, we will not be using this hotel in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Time Square in New York from 8/26 - 8/28/2016. I did not expect the Hotel was going to be right in the middle of everything that I wanted. It was a block away from all the Broadway shows, shopping area, and even a street fair on 8th Ave, which I never knew was going on until we happened upon it after doing a charity run which was in honor of the late Persy Sutton. My husband was very pleased and he is a hard man to please. We eat at The Famous Juniors Resturant, and also at The Havana Resturant. Everything was so close and convenient. We will be returning in the near future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel and it's rooms had an upscale, newness feel to it...clean...for the two of us we had a great spacious room...high floor/nonsmoking as requested...staff from Doormen to Front desk personnel to Caretakers were both friendly and attentive to customers wants and needs....great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was extremely friendly and willing to help you out in any way they can. The room was very clean and quiet for the location in Times Square. We had a problem with our air conditioner but the HVAC engineer fixed the problem while we were out shopping for the day. This is a great hotel if you want to be in the heart of Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights in August and the hotel delivered all you need for a visit to New York. Check in was quick and courteous, and all staff were friendly and helpful throughout the stay. The hotel is just metres from Times Square but a welcoming and much needed peaceful retreat away from the heat and crowds. Our room for four was adequate, kept very clean (the cleaning cloths and sprays were left in the room on a couple occasions) and had a great view. Overall a convenient location and good choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was clean, comfortable, and the staff was very accomodating. Location near enough to Times Square for convenience, yet not so close that the noise was an issue. I would stay at the Hyatt Times Square again and would recommend to others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took the family to see Motown the Musical which was excellent. The trip was enhanced by our great stay at the Hyatt Times Square. The staff was excellent. Our corner suite provided splendid views and the rain shower was to die for preparing you for a great nights sleep on a super comfortable bed. We enjoyed the rooftop bar immensely. The views, service, appetizers and cocktails will bring us back whenever we stay in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It is such a delight when a hotel delivers on its promise. We arrived early so I anticipated having to wait, but we did not. The front desk attendant was pleasant and funny. We booked a room with a view and terrace and we got both on the 17th floor. When we arrived in our room, it was spacious and modern looking. The elevators were speedy so there was no wait time to get to our room. There was a very pleasant security guard just before the elevators ensuring all those entering were guests.The bed was large, the linens crisp and clean and the bed soft. The furniture was clean and the room well maintained. The television was large and mounted on the wall. There was plenty of close space and a fridge designated for guest use. I love it.The terrace was spartan so I would have loved to have seen the same furniture featured in the pictures. But the views were great and being able to step outside gave our stay a wow factor.We went to the roof top garden after we went to see a Broadway show. Wow, what a view, it was fantastic. We were seated at a great table. They have a fantastic drink menu so we ordered a couple of glasses of wine with appetizers. It was the perfect end to a fabulous day.The check out was equally smooth as our check in. We would stay at the Hyatt at the next available opportunity. Love it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 1/2 block from Times Square, so a little removed from the crowds. Exceptionally friendly staff. Super clean room (accidentally dropped a bar of soap behind toilet, and it was clean when I picked it up!) We found the air conditioner fan to be a little strong, and wished it had a low setting. If you need to be near Times Square, we recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were really impressed with the standard of this hotel and cannot fault it. The room was a good size for our family of four, very clean and nicely decorated and the beds were a good size too. The coffee machine and free bottles of water were a bonus (and I was able to heat water in the coffee machine to make my cup of tea too which was good!). The wifi and airconditioning worked very well. Nice big shower in the bathroom. Staff very friendly and helpful. Felt like a really nice haven to retire to after a busy day of sightseeing, Would definitely stay again if ever back in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I visited New York with my teenage son. This hotel was a perfect location for walking toTimes Square, Theatre, Central Park etc. The hotel was clean, quiet, nice room with comfortable beds. We arrived early and the room was ready and they were able to accommodate a late check-out. Great overall experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I loved it here. Fantastic location if you want to be in the heart of Times Square. I was in NY to celebrate my 50th birthday and was delighted to receive a bottle of wine, delicious fudge and a signed picture of New York as a momento. I had booked two rooms - two double queen deluxe rooms on the higher floors but thought the room had views of the Chrysler Building. However it is the King deluxe which offer the beautiful floor to ceiling views. The manager immediately offered me the option to view that room and it was sensational. She was so lovely and nothing was a bother. So we enjoyed six nights on the 51st floor with views of the One World Trade Centre, the Chrysler building and even views of the river. Our adult son had a rollaway in the room which was very comfortable and worth it for the view. The double queen deluxe does have more room but I suggest going for the King. I didn't want to leave the bed. The service was excellent, the rooms spotlessly clean and very well appointed. If you are a tea drinker they will bring you a kettle and tea otherwise they have a coffee maker in the room. The porters were very friendly as were the front desk staff. The female concierge wasn't particularly friendly or helpful but that is the only fault I could say. The bar on the rooftop was really nice, expensive but nice ambiance and views the same as my room just a few floors higher. Highly recommend the King Deluxe room and this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This well situated hotel have spacious clean and well equipped rooms. The bathroom is also nice with floor heating. The only remark is the tiny lobby. The restaurants is not cheap and there are many other options to eat breakfast around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is perfectly located close to the Times Square so it can be reached easily by metro.Staff is friendly and professionalThe rooms were nice, clean and offered enough space and great views (room no. 3404).We would defiantly come again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved our location close to Times Square and walking distance to many sites and tours. The hotel staff was professional and very helpful. The night staff checking our keys when we returned made us feel very safe in the area. We highly recommend this lovely hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was wonderful and so welcoming. The only exception was the Concierge, who seemed put out or bothered every time we asked a question or for assistance with a tour. The location was great and the room was really nice and clean! I had a good night sleep on the comfortable bed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Air conditioning was out our entire first night there and in retrospect out when we arrived. We arrived late in the evening exhausted, noticed the room was hot, turned the air condition down to lowest temp, went to bed, woke up in a full sweat shortly thereafter, suffered through the night because we had an early morning appointment. I will credit the hotel for promptly responding when notified and fixing the problem. The repairman was friendly, professional and thorough, it took approximately an hour to repair. While I can't discredit his professionalism or the timely response, it was an inconvenience since we were showering and readying for dinner and a Broadway show. No concession was offered for our inconvenience. Later in our stay, we ordered room service. We found the food was way overpriced for the amount received, and diner-quality. Housekeeping did a great job. We found it odd that there was no top sheet on our bed, only a duvet. The porters were sweet, and attempted to connect with my 12 y/o each time we came through with a fist bump and/or asking him about his day. Finally, I needed to mail some large purchases home and went to the concierge for help. She directed me to a business that I discovered wasn't open after I walked there with my large purchases. All that to say, while we didn't have a horrible stay, we were disappointed and didn't have the quality Hyatt experience we've had in the past.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Times Square. We had a one bedroom with plenty of space and great views of the city. We loved that the windows cracked opened a bit to let in some fresh air. The bathroom was spacious, but because of the placement of the faucet for the shower, it was difficult to dodge getting a bit wet with cold water before actually getting into the shower. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel spa/salon was lovely. The location of the hotel is great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's located close to the corner of 45th and 7th ave (Times Square) so it's in a perfect location and 2 minutes from the centre of Times Square. Check-in was easy enough. We stayed in a deluxe room king close to the top. The view was amazing through floor to ceiling windows. The room and bathroom was all adequate. Unfortunately we didn't go to the rooftop bar as there's too much to do in NYC lol. The rooftop does however open till 2am. We didn't even have time to use the gym or the indoor pool. Sad I know haha...oh well.Service was really average hey. There's one porter that was really nice and welcoming to everyone but it wasn't genuine as he just repeated the same thing to everyone that walked past and was never really interested in asking how your day really was or where had you been etc. It's always nice when staff show a genuine interest in you. The rest of the staff or porters just basically talked amongst themselves so that one friendly robot porter stood out!Our package had breakfast included but we would've happily skipped it. Our package included up to $70 per person but we never came close to that figure. It's a la carte so it also limits your options and nothing to write home about. It was fine though and the waitress gave us some good tips about where to go (including Bill's Place in Harlem).Would we stay there again?
