We'll definitely return to NYC as it's one of the best cities I've been to (and I've been to a lot of Asian cities) but we would try somewhere else. And that's coming from fairly devout Hyatt clients. Hope this helps you make your decision somewhat. Cheers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Time Square did not disappoint. The staff is very welcoming and genuine, the rooms are cute and if you get a high enough floor there is a pretty good view. My only critique of the room is the bed is hard and the pillows were overly squishy. Bar 54 is a must see. The view is spectacular and the drinks are great, just on the pricey side- $26 for a cocktail. Great hotel and location for a 1st time visit to Manhattan!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room was nice clean but most terrible service everMy room door was out of service because of battery and I had to wait engineer for an hour in the corridor!!!!I visit the lobby to tell them more than 3 times during an hourIf they told me engineer is now busy, I didn't waste a time and physical strength like this!!!very tired, exhausted hotel ever....방도 깨끗하고 생각보다 넓어서 좋았습니다만 서비스는 기대하지 않는게 좋을것 같네요..방 문 고치는데만 한시간 걸렸고 그동안 아무런 얘기도 없이 복도에서 앉아 기다려야 했습니다정말 최악의 경험이었어요..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's a nice Place to stay in. Comes to cleanliness and budget excellent.It's more than you pay for, and your inside the city.Near in everything food, park, shopping store.There staff are very helpful and accommodating.We caught a lot of Pokemon and my kids are very happy with there vacation.We enjoyed are stay in New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took our daughter for a 21st birthday treat, this hotel is a great little bolthole in a perfect location. Only 9 rooms per floor so it never felt noisy despite the mad location in the thick of it very close to Times Square.Rooms a good size, bathrooms modern and refurbed, as per usual in NYC go for a high room for a better night's sleep. Not a huge lobby, with more of a modern feel and no valets outside to call cabs, but with that locate it was never really an issue.Staff very helpful, organised a private airport transfer for us at a very good rate and were efficient holding onto our bags after check-out so we could still enjoy our last day in the city.Would definitely recommend this hotel for people that want to stay in a times square location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a fun time we had. The Hyatt was in the center of Times Square. Everything w/in walking distance. Soooo fun!! The Hyatt was absolutely beautiful & the Roof Top Lounge was unbelievable. Quiet & beds were so comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first trip to NYC. We chose to stay at the Hyatt and we had a wonderful experience. The first thing that I noticed when I arrived was that the hotel smelled and looked very clean. Our room was very nice and clean and we were so glad that we chose to stay here. The staff was so friendly and accommodating which we really appreciated. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel to my friends and also my business colleagues. My company has an office right down the street and I am going to let our Travel department know what kind of experience I had as well. I would give this hotel a 5 star rating!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located about a 1/2 block walk from Times Square. The location is close enough to all the excitement in Times Square, but far enough away to have peace and quiet when needed. Also, the hotel is only about 2 blocks from a subway station and from Broadway. The staff is extremely friendly and willing to help with any requests you may have. The hotel is also very secure, as there is a staff member checking room keys when you walk into the lobby. We stayed in the executive suite which was perfect for our needs of four. The suite had a bedroom with a king size bed and pocket doors that closed for privacy. The living area had a sofa that pulled out into a queen bed. The bathroom was very large and had nice amenities. Overall the location of this hotel, cleanliness, friendly staff, and security can't be beat. We will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is wonderful! Staff is SO accommodating. The facilities are pristine. I would stay here again (every time!) if we returned to Times Square. Josh the manager went above and beyond to ensure my birthday weekend spent with two other couples was indeed very special!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: overall could not have asked for a nicer room. Most everyone seemed to enjoy working there. It felt like small town hospitality on a grand scale. Great views, parking your car was a breeze, Valet parking with personality.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were celebrating my daughters 25th birthday and notified the hotel. we told them that our plane was delayed and our daughter would arrive before us. Rachel surprised her and decorated the room with Happy Birthday signs. What a nice surprise! The hotel couldn't do enough for us. Terrific! Location was great for Broadway shows, great restaurants, five avenue shopping. Definitely we will go back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location with a wonderful facilities, safe and clean.The check in was quick and efficient.The privacy was kept at all times.The concierge was a great help with supporting our needs and request.What a great choice

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Went to NYC to be a tourist and this couldn't have been a better location. Walking distance to excellent restaurants and nightlife. Easy access to transportation. The staff was excellent and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here with our 2 teenage children. Most reviewers have covered the ground on this hotel, so I won't go over it all again. The priorities for us were a good location, and this really is a hotel near Times Square unlike some that have Times Square in the name that turn out to be some distance away. That said the room we were in was quiet and we slept well. We stayed on one of the higher floors where the rooms are a bit larger. Shower and separate bath - a good space. It was a good sized room. We had expected New York hotel rooms to be a bit small and were pleasantly surprised. The wifi - an essential for us to avoid howls of anguish from the kids who cannot, it seems, be out of touch for any time at all - was fast and included in the room price - not all rooms have this. The facilities were all good and the staff were friendly and attentive. In making the booking, my wife had mentioned that our son was having a birthday while there and we were pleasantly surprised by a hand written card and present of Fat Witch brownies. Very nice they were too. A wonderful touch.Sadly, we didn't get to the 54th floor bar with views, as our kids are not old enough to drink alcohol in the USA, but the view from our room was great and just what you'd want staying in NYC.In summary: a great place to stay and explore the city. I would certainly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is an interesting hotel, but I like it, mainly because it is relatively new and hasn't been worn down yet. The lobby is more like a budget hotel lobby (small, no real lounge or sitting area), but is very sleek and modern, and the room service literally is a delivery person showing up at your door with a bag containing your order. So this isn't a true luxury hotel; maybe it's what Hyatt believes millennials on an expense account want. That said, the rooms are very comfortable with all the necessary amenities, and the location is very good. It's much nicer than the Hilton Times Square, and much more manageable than the Marriott or Westin. Just not as luxurious as the Intercontinental.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would have given an excellent rating for Hyatt Times Square except for One main reason which I will give below but whatever the case it still remains on the topside of very very good. First the highlights:Check in was a breeze. Even before my date for check in, I'd been introduced to a team of staff who were responsible for making my stay very welcome and Lauren was just a call away to meet every request. They had online check in which simplified the whole process. The customer service was impeccable, I didn't have a sour moment with any of the front desk staff even though we stayed for 4 nights. They were courteous, polite, helpful, even when they had a lot of people to attend to. There were atlas 3 of them at any point so someone always was there to attend to you. We Stayed in the Deluxe King Room and had an amazing view of Manhattan from your bed. The lighting was to the T, the Air-conditioning was great and quiet (although there was no mobile remote control and you had to stand up to adjust it on the wall, however if you set the required temperature you should be fine). There was a table and more than enough socket points, shoe space, a say, a shower and a Large bathtub which could fit me even though I am on the Tall side (6ft 2IN+). The bed also just made you want to stay in.The Lift was really fast so though we were in the 53 floor you were up and down in less than a minute. which was good. My Wife experienced the Marilyn Spa and it was an interesting experience (Though must have been a little too pricey). There was really a lot to enjoy about the Hyatt and its right there in the heart of manhattan with all the buzz in the heat of the summer but once you step into your room, it seems to just drown everything away and keeps you in a world of your own.That brings me to the downside, THE FOOD. This was the only place where I would say they had a flaw. Perhaps it was the meal we ordered but it was a first impression that left us not eating at the hotel until we left. Besides the fact that the food was pricey and you had to pay an additional 18% of your charge to have it brought to your room (which we didn't mind cos we were tired from a journey) but the Kimchi Fried Rice was too oily, too salty, and really didn't come with any memorable taste. However the deserts where great and so we tried almost every desert they had on the menu but we didn't eat at the restaurant again although there were also a lot of places to eat around the area which was a consolation. So if you don't mind the food, and you are looking for a bit of Luxury then HYATT times square has you covered. Being my first time at a HYATT, its endeared me to the brand and will definitely return and most definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Times Square as a family of four -- two adults and two teenagers. The hotel is in a very central location -- right off of Times Square and the subway station where you can catch a train to just about anywhere in New York, including the shuttle, which goes straight across to Grand Central Station. It's close to Central Park, Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Center, the Empire State Building and the New York Public Library. The only downside to the location is that it's proximity to Times Square means that you need a lot of patience to walk through to the subway; Times Square was extremely crowded. As usual for a Hyatt, this hotel was really clean and up-to-date. Our room was a good size, even for four people, and the bathroom was very modern and stylish (as was the room itself). The staff at the hotel was really friendly and helpful. I would stay here again for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Location - clean - very helpful staff Spacious and clean room with excellent amenities, fridge and 2 tv's Would definitely stay again. Close to Rockefeller Center, Times Square and easy access to public transportation

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We checked in and they gave us a complimentary upgrade to the 49th floor! Our view was amazing to wake up to every day! They concierge service helped me surprise my boyfriend with wine and cupcakes for his birthday! Very clean! Great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 4 days in July. Great location, just steps from Times Square and walking distance to lots of other attractions. We ended up getting breakfast each morning from Cranberry Cafe which is just a few doors up towards 6th Ave (or Avenue of the Americas). Lots of food choices there for great prices and a big seating area upstairs. Hotel staff were very friendly & attentive. Concierge recommended an Italian restaurant on our last night there with a quick walking shortcut to get there without going thru Times Square. Restaurant was Tony's Di Napoli's and food was excellent!! Complimentary bottled waters left in our room each day were very much appreciated. Weather was extremely warm during our stay so we did lots of indoor activities, such as 9/11 Memorial & Museum, Radio City Music Hall tour & Rockette show, Aladdin show on Broadway. Only negative was that wifi at the hotel was not complimentary. Everything else was fantastic!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right in the middle of Times Square with quick access to the metro system, Hyatt is a great place to stay. Very easy to get all around, great location. ALL of the staff is very helpful and pleasant to interact with. My family enjoyed their stay. Thank you Hyatt Times Square Team.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: With all sincerity, one of the best hotels in which I have ever stayed. The customer service is superior, cleanliness is impeccable and location is prime. From umbrellas available at the front desk, to a call the day before our check-in to confirm our travels, to maid service that made our room with three children look like new each day. Job well done Hyatt Times Square!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights in April. Great room with floor to ceiling windows and super comfy beds! Great shower! Really handy for the subway. Nothing too much trouble for front desk staff. Even offered umbrellas to borrow free of charge for the day when it rained, no deposit, just trust! Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we stayed here and did the room upgrade we were on the 53 floor and the view was the best floor to ceiling windows never once turned the tv on. staff are friendly and helpful always quick with a smile and hello. central to everything time square clean room wifi worked well again best hotel staff I have every came across in al our travels

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is well worth the expensive price tag. Great location, great service. The rooms are very quite. I felt like we were the only ones in the hotel when we were in our room. The windows are great and block all sounds, we slept great. Great showers. thank you Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed there in mid-July. We like to pig out on Broadway shows, so the location is excellent! Half a block from the Times Square area, yet far enough away from most crowds and noise. For the price we paid, things should have been better. We splurged for a suite, which was lovely - except for an odor. Eventually what seemed to be the offending part of the carpet, near the door, was shampooed and that made a difference. The small but adequate living room and bedroom are separated by a wall and a door, which is great for us, since one is usually up an hour or more before the other. Good enough view looking downtown toward World Trade and New Jersey (remember, there are skyscrapers all over the place). The bathroom is terrific. The Housekeeping room attendants were very good (especially Katie). Someone needs to check the electrical wiring in our room (5301), as we had problems with a tea pot not working except when plugged into the socket near the floor (which greatly limited where we could put it). The desk outlets just couldn't handle it. Mentioned it to staff but no one knew quite what to do, although once we were told an electrician would try to fix things - never saw or heard from him. The cafe/restaurant in the lobby is just not up to snuff. Tried to have breakfast there twice. Once was not good. The 2nd time (on a Saturday) was a disaster. Luke warm (at best) food; inattentive and inept wait staff (e.g., asking for marmalade does not mean I want strawberry jam). Be aware there is no lobby to speak of, and no Hyatt club room. We knew that because we stayed at this Hyatt last year. We had some problems then, too, but figured things would be much better with them having another year to improve. I don't know if we'll stay here next year, although, in spite of our problems, we enjoyed being there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently stayed at hotel with my wife and family as part of our 30th wedding anniversary. The staff could not have been more helpful, especially the desk staff and porters, and our rooms were lovely and as on 39th floor we had fantastic views of Times Square. The restaurant on the ground floor was also handy and good value. We also used the roof top bar which was beautiful but expensive. The hotel was excellently located for our holiday, close to everything and especially Times Square which really helped make our holiday. We would highly recommend Hyatt Times Square and thank the staff for making our holiday so great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and friendly staff the valet parking is very good giving it is in the center of new york city. The are many good restaurants around the hotel, including breakfast. the broadway show are just a few blocks away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: New York Gem, this hotel has everything, excellent accommodation clean, good house keeping excellent staff very informative, has the highest rooftop bar in New York, good location near Times Square, good for all theatres and restaurants would recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a 1 week of stay in this hotel and I cannot complain of anything. Very well located, great room, friendly staff and it has a good rooftop bar, which is expensive but due to the location, we could not expect something cheap! They also have a 24hs gym and complimentary bottles of water daily.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is an excellent location if you are visiting NYC! However, expect traffic going in and coming out of the area. parking fee is $65 (no in and out). We did not have food in the restaurant as there are so many other choices around. Service is awesome. Great place to stay right at the Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Traveled from Illinois to NYC to Cooperstown, NY. This was the best hotel of our entire trip. Staff was great. Loved the room! Good clean luxurious rooms! Ate breakfast at the hotel. The rooftop bar was awesome! Great view!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Times Square end of July and absolutely loved it. On checkin the young lady was excellent and so friendly. The room was clean. The maids were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. I was on the 44th floor and could see Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in the hear of the city. We stayed here with our two children and had everything we needed to "DO" New York. The location was the best part so we could do more activities. It is easy to recommend this property to any family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay at the Hyatt Times Square was wonderful. The hotel was very updated, extremely clean, housekeeping did a great job keeping our room clean. The hotel staff (front desk, Concierge and bellman) couldn't do enough for us from restaurant suggestions, directions or arranging transportation. The beds were very comfortable but the pillows were too soft for my liking. While the hotel was in the Times Square area it was just away from all the hectic Times Square crowds. Would definitely recommend this hotel for a New York visit and would definitely stay again on a future visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our favorite place to stay in NYC especially for theater lovers. Also convenient location for business. Restaurant has improved dramatically so the overall experience was better than ever. Recommend corner suite on a high floor for spectacular views of the city and Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just finished an 8 day stay at the Hyatt. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Great location, good size rooms( we were on 23rd floor) Very helpful staff, great security guard- soooo friendly. Modern hotel with a wonderful bar on the 54th floor - stunning views. From this hotel you are 200 yards from Times Square , you can walk to Central Park, Top of the Rock, Empire State, Madame T, Grand Central Station, Broadway theatres and shop . Well recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a lovely stay here. I have stayed in this and grand Hyatt by Central Park. Much preferred this hotel staff where friendly hotel was beautiful and the bar staff are happy to recommend so great beer/cocktails can not complain. See you at Christmas again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We decided to stay at the Hyatt Times Square due to American Express Platinum Concierge Service recommended their rooftop bar so we decided to stay at the hotel as we were going to visit the bar with my cousins for part of my birthday celebration. Everything about the hotel was very enjoyable from the service we received when we checked in to the condition and cleanliness of our room. Our room was very high-tech and the view couldn't be beat. We would definitely recommend this hotel if staying in the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The service was good and location is great for a touristy long weekend. Hotel rooms are clean, but basic, definitely not upscale. Platinum status doesn't get you much here - no surprise - though we've gotten better treatment as mid-tier status at other chains in midtown. It's a fairly new hotel and the location is what makes it category 6 (would be category 3 or 4 in a smaller city). Overall, solid but not memorable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights last week . Very good location close to action but quite enough to sleep. Small room but good enough for new york standards.Clean and friendly staff. Very helpful and welcoming .We would recommend it! Nice sky bar for drinks at night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed there for the weekend.The hotel have all what you need (even free umbrella when the NY rain is surprising)Grate location (Times Square), Grate service, Grate gym and marvelous rooftop.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel great location, only 1/2 block from time square, good accommodations, and excellent staff. King bed room accommodated rollaway for our granddaughter quite well Beds very comfortable and room quiet,.Couldn't hear street noise on 20th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed this hotel and the location. The rooms were very clean and the staff and service were excellent. This trip was for our 14 year old grandson and he wanted to be in Times Square and we could see all of the lights from our room. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location right in the heart of NYC all the iconic buildings are close to Hyatt hotel.The buss you get when you first arrive is a once in a lifetime experience. Do your homework before you arrive so that you have a good idea where you want to visit, this hotel is one of the best placed for sightseeing, the T45 restaurant is excellent for breakfast before you set of on your day trips and the staff could not be more helpful and very efficient nothing is any bother to them, also make sure you go to one of the many theatres and enjoy the shows especially Radio City the Rockettes are well worth seeing this is with in the Rockefeller centre close to the Hyatt hotel less than 10 minutes walk away.Jardine & Agnes Ralston

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed at Hyatt hotels in multiple countries across three continents. This one was a total outlier -- and not in a good way.Starting with the positive: We are quite sure that two exemplary staff members Ms Odette at the front desk and Ms. Sabina, the housekeeper would do very well at any hotel anywhere.But then...the room:Two double beds means that it is supposed to be fit for a family. However, there was absolutely no place to hang up any clothes. There hardly was any drawers and no closet. What are families supposed to do in wet weather seasons -- especially winter when everyone carries large jackets, gloves, hats, etc.?The beds:The mattress is shorter than the wood platform by just enough to expose the sharp corners of the hard-wood platforms -- ready and waiting to feast on a shin or knee!The pillows were the strangest anywhere. They look strong enough but within minutes they become pancake!the staff:There is something to be said about having everyone use the same script, but not like this: at 5:20 PM, two staff members standing near each other, said exactly this as I passed by them: "Good afternoon! Have a good day!" [By the way, there was no language problem.]The first morning, we went to the bagel place Ms. Odette suggested (pick a bagel) and that was great. However the next morning, I asked another person for another suggestion because Ms. Odette was busy. His answer was: "Just go down the street, and I am sure you will find one!"

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful hotel steps away from Times Square. Check-in was simple and quick, staff was very quick to assist in any manner requested. The beds are so comfortable, it's hard to get up. Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in the view room with a balcony. The room had a king bed which I found quite comfortable. The room was a good size too. The balcony was a good size with a good view. There is a workout room but no pool. The staff are helpful and always willing to give out free water bottles. I ate breakfast in t45. It was expensive but was good. The hotel gives free wifi which is a bonus. The location is very good, right in times square. If you don't mind spending a bit of money, then you should def. book this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 10 nights and overall the Hyatt was great. Staff were attentive and helpful, esp doormen. We had a fantastic view from 51st floor and the room was quite spacious. I will say that the bed was very firm, just too hard for my taste. The location is great for walking to theaters, restaurants and subway stations but, Times Square is packed, and I do mean packed with tourists. So, use the subway to explore the rest of NYC. Overall the Hyatt was an excellent hotel at a relatively reasonable price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is clean and new looking but expect to wait while checking in and checking out. They do not allow express check out even if you are a Hyatt member.Despite only having 11 rooms per floor I was awakened several times this morning with guest room doors slamming. They need to put dampeners on the doors to slow them down. As for location, it is convenient for some things. But if you like to be near central park (I do because I run), it is a mile walk to the park and about a mile to Hell's Kitchen.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the location is ideal (6th ave for business and times sq for crazy).The staff is terrific and forever helpful and gracious.The spa is terrific (haircuts by Claudio)The rooms are very nice, modern and predictable

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You select a damn good location, right at the Times Square. You check in, great staff and everything is fine, rooms classy.They just want you to order a la carte from the breakfast menu, which is alright for a change (I enjoy buffets in such hotels otherwise). But they want you to eat upto 70$ per room everyday.You spend 5000$ + for a 3 nights - 4 room stay and you get to know that you have a price tag for your breakfast, how is that? Not what I like from a Hyatt in Times Square, New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay at Hyatt Times Square was incredible, and Maren at the front desk made our experience even better! Maren gave us a beautiful room with a gorgeous balcony view when my boyfriend told her we were visiting for our second anniversary. She so genuinely congratulated us on our anniversary and made sure we knew that we could call her if there was anything we needed during our stay. I can't even tell you how beautiful the room and the view were! After we sat on the balcony for a while, we went to the rooftop bar. The bartenders and waitress were so outgoing and fun, and gave us a reason to head back up to the bar again after we went to dinner. When we left, one of the housekeeping staff asked us how our stay was and engaged in some small talk. When we left, one staff member called a cab for us and then loaded my bags into the back of the taxi. The entire staff at this hotel was amazing, and we will definitely be back to stay in this hotel the next time we come to the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently went to New York with my younger sister and brother. When we were checking in there was some sort of mix up(they no longer offer queen beds) The guy at the front desk Richard was more than helpful trying to ensure that our first trip to New York was amazing. As tourist we wanted to see the city right away, but the rain was hindering that the hotel provided umbrellas for their guest. The entire staff was amazing. Connie the housekeeper was super sweet as well.!!! Thanks for making our trip memorable!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice staff Amazing view well worth a visit if you need to chill over a fine wine, would definitely consider staying here if we went back to NYC, we stayed across the road & yes it was only just across the road but they offered free wi-fi & the service was very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a great location in time Square. Our room was a good size, with a view of Time Square. The hotel staff were very attentive and friendly.The room had a small fridge and coffee maker, which were handy. The hotel's rooftop restaurant/lounge was a great way to finish off a day of sightseeing, with a cold drink and great view of the skyline. Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is very convenient but the hotel is not comparable to other Hyatt hotels in terms of luxury and overall appearance. There is no lobby and the check-in counter is just a few steps away from the entrance. Too much foot traffic - people entering & leaving, checking in/out or waiting for transport, leaving no place to sit or talk before heading out. Some staff are really friendly & helpful and some simply answer your questions without providing additional information. Staff that watch the entrance don't even open the door for you even if you're carrying a lot of shopping bags. Room was clean (thanks to Eva) but carpets need some work. I paid for a High Floor with a View but when i checked in, I was told none was available as they're full. Then why was it even offered to me to begin with when I booked two months prior to my arrival? They then put me in a room with a terrace that i could not enjoy - it was too noisy and very hot out. One more, the hotel is hard to find - my family and car service could not find the hotel until they are right in front of it. Compare that to the Marriott Marquis with a sign that is so visible from Times Square. I will try other hotels when I come back to New York. I still like Hyatt hotels but not this one.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location was excellent in time square and close to everything. The staff is the nicest I have ever seen in a hotel. The rooms are nice and clean, we had a family of 4 stay in the executive suite and it was the perfect size, we brought air mattresses for the kids to sleep on in the living room area. It was really an excellent hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel, the space, and design is so refreshing and calming especially after our journey on the train and walk through Times Square to get to the hotel. The checkin was easy and welcoming. We got a deal on an Executive Suite and it had great closet space, high ceilings, and even though we were only on the 26th floor it was fun to look down on the city. Our king bed was a little firm. We were often tired after a busy day walking through the city so ate at the hotel restaurant (T54?) several times and it was really good. The desserts were so yummy. All the staff were really positive. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had an amazing stay at this hotel with great views and located right by Times Square. The 54th floor bar/club has impressive views of the city, open air. Parking is valet only though. Nice bathroom and bed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was a short 1-day stay at this hotel but was an excellent experience from start to finish. Room was comfortable and spacious. Got everything needed for the night. Breakfast was delicious. Will stay again if got the chance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Man, that lobby was small, one busy hotel though. Every member of staff was helpful/cheerful. Room was clean and comfy, and quiet too especially since we were on 5 and facing the street.Did not try any amenities other than room. Hear there is a bar on the roof, but never got there. Great location in NYC especially for sightseeing. Right at Times Square on a side street.Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We, family of five (mom,dad three daughters 14,14 &18) stayed in two connecting rooms for 6 nights on the 22nd floor.ProsThis is a newer hotel (under 3 years old) so everything works well This hotel is VERY quiet. Very little street noise and virtually no hallway noise.Very comfortable beds and nice size modern bathrooms, very good showerThe location is the best. A half block off Times Square on 45th streetConnelys bar is next door and Cranberry deli is just beyond that. See my reviews.The entire staff is awesome. Friendly and helpful are the best staff descriptions.The rooftop bar on the 54th floor is the best view in town. Ask and the will take you upIn the morning as well for a daytime view. Of course, the drinks are expensive.I also enjoyed the little coffee counter in the morning. I thought the elevators were super fast. Never waited more than a minute ever.Oddette at the front desk is awesome. She checked me in, carried our bags up, was there every morning and then checked us out. What a great employee for Hyatt. ConsThe lobby is tight and small. It's the way they build hotels now but there is no place to have a coffee in the morning and hang out. The rooms are nice size but not huge. I'm guessing under 400 sq ft. But they do have queen/queens which are great for families.All in all, a great stay at a very nice Hyatt property in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 1/2 a block away from the madness that is times square, great location. The rooftop bar was great. The breeze up there is great when its 90+ degrees. Cocktail prices are a bit steep, but I guess that's normal for a crafted fancy cocktail these days. 9-10 bucks for a bottled bear too. But you are paying for the view. Views from the rooms are great. A/C was ice cold, room décor was modern and nice. There is a fridge in the room WITHOUT minibar items!! So nice to have a useable fridge. Staff was nice and made the trip a great one.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for two nights with our 11 month old this July and the staff were super nice. They are very welcoming and always smiling. The room was clean and the view was amazing. We stayed on the 46th floor with the view of the city skyline. The hotel is right on time square and easy to get a cab from 45th and 6th. If you're taking a cab get off on 45th and 6th to avoid getting stuck in traffic as 45th if going straight to time square. The hotel is just right there less than 5 mins walk. We will stay here again when we're in NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of the hotel is the key and me being a Hyatt member for 8 years now helps when it comes to room upgrades and other facilities rendered. In New York, the key is booking hotels for mid-week stays or on Sundays when the rates are lower. This property's location is very convenient for both business and tourists alike with easy access to the subway system, theatres and Manhattan's famous restaurants. The bedrooms though small were comfortable for 2 nights for myself and my girl friend. One big compliment needs to be given to the bed sheet and duvet cover which were heavenly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Me and my daughter stayed here on our yearly trip. It was a beautiful hotel and also I'm a great location. We had so much fun just walking getting lost and jumping in the subway getting off wherever. This hotel was good because it was always easy to get back too where ever our adventures took us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I absolutely loved Hyatt Times Square especially my Deluxe View King room (with a wall of windows and a great view from the 48th floor). This is now my place of choice for all visits to NYC! I stayed in room 4802 but would prob opt for a room in the middle of that same hallway next time for an even better view. Staff members were great...room was great...housekeepers were amazing...everything about it was (again) super duper awesome (and I'm pretty hard to impress).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent stay! Very clean and comfortable room. Great view. Reasonable price. Hotel staff was very nice and helpful. Very close to many sights. Within in walking distance of anything you would need. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I snuck into the city for a date nite to see a show. Up until 2013, I worked right around the corner from this location, and the Hyatt didn't exist. So, needless to say, this is a sparkling new hotel.Like so many of of smaller hotels being developed in NYC, the lobby itself is very small. But the staff behind the desk is very accommodating, and check in took a total of about two minutes. And they were also very aware of our membership in the Hyatt Passport program, and the associated 'benefits' that go along with it. And to make up for the tiny lobby, the adjacent dining area T45 is great. We had a very nice, fast, well priced meal that we were able to finish with more than enough time to make show time. And Angelo behind the bar made sure that everything moved smoothly.The rooms were fine-small, but modern, clean and comfortable. (But a little odd for me personally that the window looked out to the window of my former office...)For visitors to the Times Square area and Theater District, this spot can't be beat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Four childhood friends stayed at this hotel 7 nights,staff and hospitality was above and beyond in every way.I recently retired after 32 years as an employee of a Hilton property and base this review on what is expected of a hotel and this surpassed all expectations.Hotel room was large as were the bathroom.Hotel was within walking distance of time square and Broadway shows which we saw four.We packed so much in our visit 3 day bus tour,pedi bike in Central Park,Empire state bldg and so much more!Lasting memory we will have forever.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I will definitely stay here again! The terrace view was amazing- the room and bathroom super clean and spacious. Great value for being right in the mix of midtown. Rooftop bar is a must but be careful of those $30 cocktails. Yikes!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean, friendly staff, comfortable beds, modern bathroom. It was no problem whatsoever to extend our stay one night when our flight got cancelled due to Winter Storm Jonas. Would definitely love to stay again next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for five nights to attend a conference at the Javits Center. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Two sets of elevators, left bank only goes to 25th floor (I think) so if your on a higher floor make sure you enter the right hand elevators saw a few people get messed up with that. Yes there are signs . Shopping, food and entertainment are all around you. Even a Walgreens incase you forgot something. You are half a block from the top of time square, you are less then 10 minutes from the Rockefeller center. Blocks away from any subway you may need, including Grand Central station. Walking distance to Central Park, and in the opposite direction you have the Empire State Building, It a great location! It has a fancy little bar on top to take in the sights but, we didn't partake since coming from Canada, the 26 dollar drink would cost us somewhere around 100 dollars after exchange hahaThe house keeping staff do a great job of cleaning and ensuring you have everything you might need. The gym is roomy and very well equipped. With windows overlooking the street.The rooms are comfortable, and contain a small fridge, bathrobe and slippers and even Windows that partially open.I really enjoyed my time with this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We brought our family to NY city for the first time. This Hyatt holds up to the high standard of all Hyatt hotels we have stayed on the past. The location of this particular hotel was great because we could walk to many of the tourist spots on our list. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful, and courteous. Bar on the rooftop is magnificent. Manager allowed us to bring our family to the top. Hotel allowed for us to get the real Times Square experience we were looking for!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For $300/night in NYC this is about as good as it gets. No real amenities or service to speak of but a decent updated room with views on higher floors (34 plus). Front desk staff is kind of clueless and don't expect much in the way of help with your luggage - but if you view it as a self service hotel it definitely works for that price point.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Hotel! We loved the friendly people at the front desk and the great concierge service that helped us with everything we needed! The maids were so sweet always supplying us with towels and FREE water! At the concierge desk we could buy tickets, they helped us figure out the subway and were just so helpful! We took a 9 year old with us and he loved it, the sights from the room were beautiful! So many places to eat nearby, If you have a child the King room we had was huge. We put a roll away in and had plenty of room to walk around!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our second visit to the Hyatt, having stayed in August 2015.This is a very good hotel. In the heart of New York with friendly welcoming staff.We stayed on the 53rd floor and had a fantastic view from our room. The room was always very well serviced and the amenities and standards are very high.I would not hesitate to recommend staying at the Hyatt and look forward to visiting again when we next come to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed 4nights at the hotel. Room is clean, spacious and modern room. Despite the close proximity to Times Square, sound proofing is fantastic! We could barely hear the street and traffic noise throughout our entire stay. The beds are big and comfortable. Overall we had a great stay at the hotel. The only negative feedback we have of the hotel facility is with regards to the high speed elevator which makes loud groaning and cranking sound. On one occasion the elevator suddenly jerked and stopped out of the blue. We had to reset the floor button and thankfully it continued to work normally after. Perhaps management might want to look into the elevator issues to ensure the safety of the guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Chose this hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. We stayed 5 nights on the 42nd floor with floor to ceiling windows and good views. Great location and only a very short walk to the heart of Times Square. Rooms are modern and clean. Definitely would stay here again if we come back to New York. Only negative is that the room did not have sufficient drawers for clothes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for a business trip and hotel was great; modern, clean, comfortable and very conveniently located. A 30 second walk to times square and two minutes to 5th avenue etc. Friendly staff who are happy to help you with any additional requests. Highly-recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I choose this hotel for it's location, primarily! But more than that, they have VERY friendly staff and nice rooms with great views. I stay here at least twice a year for a week at a time. I have no plans of trying out differnt hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Although this was a flying business trip, you cannot help but to get caught up in the energy of this place and the Hyatt is right in the thick of it! It is a very modern and comfortable Hotel with great views over the city especially from the roof bar, a must place to chill after a hectic day with a cool glass of Chablis.The rooms are extremely clean and are well equipped with a coffee machine, TV, phone, hairdryer etc., and the air con was very efficient even in the intense heat, amazingly given the location the hotel was relatively quiet and both nights I had a great night sleep, although that may also have something to do with the very comfy bed. The food was fine and the staff very helpful, the only down side was that the drinks were very expensive........£28 for two glasses of wine!It was my first trip to New York and I have to say that I was quite shocked at how expensive it was, far more costly than London prices so be prepared to spend. I didn't get a chance to do a lot of sightseeing, but we did manage to go up Freedom Tower which replaced the north Twin Tower which was a very mixed experience bearing in mind the events of 9/11, but as this Tower was built in remembrance by people who were involved in the tragedy I am glad that we did this. The views from the top are amazing and the restaurant at the top was very good. The trip in the lift was something else as well..104 floors in less than a minute!!We also went to the Waldorf Astoria - wow but take out a second mortgage!, and visited Maceys', although I found the latter not particularly special and was like a tired English department store, I believe Sak's and Bloomingdales are more premium.Getting around the city was relatively easy with plenty of the famous Yellow Cabs , but if there are 5 of you it is better to call an Uber which can take more passengers but is still expensive. I went back in one of these to the Airport in New Jersey - approx. 20 miles and the cost was $140.Overall I loved my trip, Times Square is crazy, crowded and somewhat a little tacky, but the rest of the city is majestic in it's architecture, I would definitely go back again and stay in the Hyatt, but the next time purely to sight see!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has been refurbished and is very nice, new and clean. The bathrooms in the rooms were very well designed and roomy considering other times square venues we've stayed in. I highly recommend the hotel and its wonderful, helpful staff. Great location for the theater district. Good restaurants on both 44th and 46th street. Of course you'll have to pay the usual Times square ransom for a nice room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel room was a good size beds were comfortable, Air conditioner kept shutting down at night room was very warm, View was good form the west side, staff was great. Only complaint was we ordered a smoothy from the restaurant and it was the worst that we have ever had. I would recommend this hotel to friends and I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I chose this hotel due to location, price and most of all, floor to ceiling windows on a high-rise hotel in the heart of the city. I liked that they had valet parking so I didn't have to worry about finding an available garage. The room was spacious enough for 3 of us with 2 queen beds on the 29th floor. It was very clean and we were only a block away from times square. It has a restaurant serving all 3 meals and a rooftop bar but we didn't use either one since we had planned out restaurants that we wanted to try in the city. Although we were happy with the hotel and location, my kids mentioned that they wanted a hotel that allowed you to see over times square. Considering the price I paid in comparison to other hotels, I'd stay here again. Service was great all the way around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is my fourth of fifth stay at this hotel over the past year or so and it is still my favorite in this mid town area. The rooms are efficient but not to small and they have all the amenities needed; good lighting that is adjustable, a desk, a lounge chair, adequate closet, etc.The staff is great, helpful and friendly (DeDe and Clifford)Highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel staff was awesome, food and beverage was great, especially the fries, according to my daughter but location is, in my opinion, possibly best in town. My family and I will definitely use this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We usually do not stay in Times Square out of concern with noise and traffic. This Hyatt was quiet and just enough off of Times Square to allow us to walk around the crowds instead of through them when we needed to get to the theaters or the subway. There are a few equivalent-class (4-5 star) hotels in the area that can offer the same thing on these points, but what has made us want to come back to the Hyatt is the people! The front desk staff was friendly, helpful and efficient on check-in and check-out, and they do everything themselves, so you know it gets done (baggage storage, feedback, etc). The cleaning staff was genuine and helpful - really made our day when we interacted (and, of course, the room was clean, well stocked and a comfortable temperature because of their effort). The security staff (there was unobtrusive security between the lobby and the elevators at all times) was very courteous.Overall, we were very pleasantly surprised that a major brand hotel could deliver a better experience than the upscale boutiques we have tried in the past.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having tickets for Hamilton, we chose to stay here for a night. It was a great choice for a short stay. Close to theaters and restaurants. Lovely roof top bar. Rooms are comfortable. No room service. We had a marginal breakfast in their restaurant.Staff was nice and accomodating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel stay was amazing! From the beginning of our booking to check out the experience was so enjoyable! The staff was so accommodating and relieved me of my worry of bringing a 1 year old for the night when they ensured an early check in and placed a pack and play all set up in the room! The pack and play even had a travel pack of Johnson&Johnson baby products, which was the sweetest little touch. The room was very clean and the decor was fun and bright. The room is equipped with tons of amenities such as a flat screen tv with plenty of channels and movies, unique touch dimmer lights, and a universal plug in station for electronics. There was complimentary Starbucks Coffee and the bathroom even had heated floors with a beautiful walk in shower! I could go on and on and I recommend you stay here 1000 percent!!! You can't beat the location either!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square was a real find! The hotel staff is very accommodating from the bellman to front desk to restaurant staff. Everyone is cheerful, helpful and efficient [what else can you ask for?] I was upgraded to deluxe room on 50th floor with an AMAZING view of the NYC skyline! Rooms not huge or small, but felt bigger because of an entire wall of windows! the bed was comfortable and bathroom well appointed we Went to the Sky Bar on 54th floor, really lovely space with extraordinary views. Drinks are very expensive, but your paying for the view and ambiance. . the hotel is just far away enough from times square to be quiet, but literally a stroll to all the action. I will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently returned from our stay at the Hyatt hotel in Times Square, everyone is so friendly and helpful from the guys that greet you at the door/reception to the bar and room staff. They also pre-arranged with me a reserved table with champagne in bar 54 (views are incredible especially at night) where I proposed to my girlfriend - they made this easy and special and even delivered a congratulations card and more champagne to our room!!In short I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in New York and will definitely be returning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent staff and room. Was disappointed not to have a microwave. Was great to be so close to Time Square as I cannot walk far. Room had a great view. Would definately reserve a room again to take my other grandchildren.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my fist time staying in Times Square and I was a bit concerned about the noise but to my surprise it was very quiet. It's located within easy walking distance to many of the surrounding theaters. The room was bigger than I thought judging from the pictures I saw. The bathroom has heated floors which I'm sure feel marvelous in the winter. The service was top notch as always. The bed was a hair on the firm side but plenty comfortable. The pillows felt great but for some reason I couldn't get them right for me, could be a personal thing. Everyday I was greeted with an incredible smile, good morning and is there anything I need from Rose the housekeeper on my floor. She definitely added to the great vibe I had with this hotel. There is a rooftop bar (a bit pricy) with a great view of Times Square and a reasonable priced restaurant near the lobby. The elevators never seemed to be a long wait but boy do they move fast. I would gladly stay here again if visiting NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 2nd time, and still as good as 1st time.Having stayed before, I spent a while searching for other properties for my 2nd trip to NYC. After every search I came back to Hyatt Times Square and so booked it as not to waste anymore research time. My second stay reaffirms what I initially loved about the hotel. It's the hard to beat mix of comfortable clean rooms, great views, free in-room Wifi and excellent location that really do it for me. I had a corner room on the 33rd floor, nearest to Times Square, and didn't have any problems with noise. I managed to interact with more staff this time round, and all were friendly and had no problems with any queries I had. The elevator wait remains a minor problem, but how much of a nuisance that is is down to personal preference. Stayed in a View King room #3306.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in the hotel last August. It was my 3rd time in New York but the first time in this hotel. I had booked a king room with Times Square view. The room was nice we were on the 35th floor. the view wasn't that great as you are high up and really you don't look out of the window that much after the initial viewing at night.It is have an Applebys which is handy if you don't want to eat at the hotel The staff are very welcoming and take every measure they can to ensure you enjoy your stay there. I had a noisy neighbour partying next door to me and as my room had an adjoins door its was extremely noisy. I rang reception and they asked security to attend immediately. I was given a complimentary late check out as a good will gesture.The hotel is in a great location. Highly recommended AAAA

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: New York is the land of over priced hotels offering small dated rooms with inferior service. That is unless you stay at the Hyatt Times Square !As you'll know, rates in New York can vary dramatically depending on when you book and what else is going on in New York. But, if like me you can snag a room at this Hyatt for sub $300, I think you'll be very pleased.My room on the 48th floor was clean, quiet, very comfortable and provided everything I needed. Housekeeping was excellent, with timely, polite service being provided each day.I ate breakfast everyday in the hotel and again, quality and service was hard to fault.If the rate 'fits' I will be back.I'm really struggling to identify areas to improve .... perhaps a little more choice in terms of TV channels ?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first trip to New York, after much researching we decided to stay at the Hyatt Times square and it was the best decision! We are even returning to this hotel when we return to New York as part of our honeymoon next year. From the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble. We were able to check in straight away and use the computers provided to print out our Knick's ticket and we were also advised by the concierge on bus passes etc.. so helpful! As we have never stayed in New York before I am unable to comment on the room size compared to other hotels but we found the room and bathroom to be of a decent size with everything we required. Our room was very modern and clean with a very comfortable bed and a great coffee machine! The location is excellent, only moments away from Times Square in one direction and Bryant park in the other. We visited both the attached restaurant and rooftop bar. Whilst drinks are expensive in Bar54 the view certainly makes up for that!! I also had a delicious quinoa burger in T45 which was just what we needed to refuel upon arrival before exploring the city. All in all this is a great hotel and I cannot wait to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staying at this hotel was literally a dream come true. I'm from a foreign country and of course growing up as a kid I always wished to visit, if not live, in New York and watch the sun set from one of the highest buildings with a sundowner in hand. Couple of years down the line, there it was, right in front of me. The Manhattan skyline from the B54 rooftop bar itself seated next to the man of my dreams. They made it happen. Everything else was perfect as well. Great location! Clean room! Great staff! We even got too lucky and got ourselves an upgrade to the 51st floor. Made me wish I could stay longer but bills won't pay themselves lol. Highly recommended this place!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel could not have made us feel more welcome......from our arrival through our departure. We were welcomed every time we walked through the door......loved the Cafe Verona coffee in our room.....loved the shower. King bed overlooking Times Square.......could it be any better?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: nice place. good location nearby times square. poor cleaning of the suite eventhough we gave tips every day. staff forgot towls , coffee, water ect. Tables and carpet were never cleaned or vacuumed during the whole stay. Housekeeping not good enough for a hotel of this standard!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Hotel if you are attending a convention at the Jacob Javits. If you are on vacation and are in town to see a play or musical then it's perfect. They are located close to Time Square and the theatre district. Despite being that close there was no noise problem and I was only on the 5th floor. The staff was very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights. We arrived at hotel aruond 10:45am and our room was ready.Location of the hotel is great, few minutes walk to Times Square, 5 minutes walk to fifth ave and 20 minutes walk to Central Park. I like the heated floors in the bathroom. One thing I didn't like was taking the same elevator with non-hotel guest going to the rooftop bar. One time when we took an elevator, it was full. Everyone was going to the rooftop bar except us. We had to line up for the elevator as there was no separeate elevator exclusively for hotel guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is located in Midtown Manhattan and has clean and easy rooms. It is not a luxury hotel but offers good service quality. Elevators can be busy during peak times. If that disturbs you, choose a room at the parting floor level (reached by all elevators). Otherwise, higher floors give a nice view even topped by the outdoor bar at the top. Breakfast in main restaurant free for qualified GP Diamond. Considering the location, the hotel is a fair offer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It seems i cannot find an Hyatt I like in NYC. It is all good but somehow not perfect. Housekeeping has limited hours, the spa opens late and closes early. You need to ask for all the amenities, nothing is there waiting for you. No in room music device...But the rooms are nice, clean and well kept.A good choice if it comes at a decent rate but definitively don't pay premium rate for this.Have fun.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great hotel, irish bars eitherside which is ideal for quick tasty food and beer.hotel was clean beds where comfy and aircon was good, view was good and not noisey on high floor, great rooftop bar especially at night

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited in 2007 and 2012. Location is supreme. Close to Historic Central Station and Times Square. Fits reputation of Hyatt Name and expectation that comes from the brand. Rooms ate spacious and modern. Coffee shop at mezzanine level with the street view provides huge breakfast spread . pricey due to location and amenities but worth it if budget permits.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked through Costco, so the price was quite good. I liked the location, although it is not right next to the subway. The room was clean, and the beds were comfortable. There were a couple of decent, low-cost delis close by, but I would recommend venturing further away from TS to get better food at better prices. I would definitely stay here again if the price is right. My only gripe was the wait for an elevator; during peak check-out times, we could end up waiting 10 minutes for an elevator empty enough to accommodate us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of the hotel is perfect! Right in the heart of time square. The doormen always greeted us when we came in and out of the hotel. A simple smile can go a long way. Checking in was really easy especially when the front desk people are friendly and courteous. The smell of the lobby to me was fantastic lol. The hotel has about 60 floors I think but the elevator was QUICK which saved us from waiting. The room was in great condition and cozy and we had a great view from our place. My wife and I spend two nights here for our 10 year anniversary and it was money well spent. We will definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 5 days and loved it. Great view from our room, but definitely had to pay a lot for the nice view. I'm glad we decided to stay in Times Square since this was our first time visiting NYC. This was a good base to walk to every site we wanted to see. We only had to Uber a handful of times to locations that were too far for walking.It's to be expected that the rooms will be a bit smaller since it is New York City. So yes the room was on the smaller side but the bathroom was a good size, really comfy bed and great view. Great service, really nice view from the bar at the top too. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is clean. Staff is courteous and professional. Great roof top Bar. Food is great but expensive. It is secure and in a great location! I am in NYC a lot and I would say for the money this is a great hotel! Room size is good. Bathrooms are clean and set up well. I'd recommend this hotel to both business and tourist travelers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recent stay for business at the end of June - had a room on the 52nd floor with floor to ceiling windows and pretty good views of the city. Service on checking in was fine, recognizing my status but not obviously giving me anything as a result - e.g. better room etc. Location is great for all the action around Times Square, though personally i've decided I prefer the Westin Times Square for it's convenience to the subway. It's a several block walk to the ACE lines from here, whereas the Westin is right next door. Room was fine, with a nice bathroom with modern fixtures and fittings. Air conditioning was a bit weird, room was really hot, and I had to lower the temp down to 66 or so to make it actually reasonable. (normally have it at 72) this caused a pool of condensation under my door which I noticed upon leaving each morning - so maybe it was just the hallway that was hot, but whatever it did what I wanted it to, just had to have the thermostat set lower than I expected.  The elevators - urgh - often a several minute wait for the elevators, with occasional lines on the ground floor - I guess people were headed up to the bar on the 54th floor around the times I was going, but it was a definite inconvenience even with 2 elevators just for floors 25-54. (the third appeared to be out of service on the 33rd floor the entire time I was there)Overall fairly nice, good location, plenty of food options, nice rooftop bar, and it was fairly quiet for NYC up on the 52nd floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel in early July. They were very accommodating and offered us a 1:00 check out since we didn't get to the hotel until 4:00 AM (flight delays). Held on to our bags after we checked out so we could walk around NYC for the day before our evening flight out. Not a lot of time spent there but the few hours we did spend there it was easy to tell that we'd stay there again the next time we're in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed there from the 28th June - 6 July '16 and it was great, just off TS but not a problem for us as we've been to NY a few times so we've experienced it before.We arrived at 8:30am from a 15 hour flight in, our room was ready by about 1pm which was great as there usual check-in is at 4pm. (we did request an early check-in)We by mistake booked an ADA room and Dede at the front desk was very friendly and she accommodated us by changing our room seeing as though we were there for 8 nights - thanks Dede!The room was a decent size for Manhattan and clean, the free waters was also a nice gesture. No complaints here.Being on the 40th floor it was nice and quiet, not much of a view but we were not bothered by that. The free-wifi was fast and we never encountered a problem with that as we were adamant to stay in a hotel with free-wifi. It rained and the hotel were kind to give us umbrellas to use as we did not bring with us, these were available to all guests and after staying at other hotels in Manhattan i've never seen this before.On our last night we were packing at around 12:30am as we had to leave for our flight home to South Africa at 6:30 we realised 2 of the items we purchased still had the security tags on and we didn't want to risk travelling with them. We phoned guest services to see what they suggest as the store we purchased it from was definitely not open. 2 men from the hotel came to our room and within a few minutes and quickly got them off, it was so late but just shows how great their hotel staff are, we were always greeted with a nice welcome whenever we came in contact with hotel staff. Really can't fault anything major, maybe the only thing was that there were only 2 lifts working but it wasn't ever an issue as we never waited long for a lift.I'll definitely be back to this well run hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Second visit to NYC.Had a better experience now than last visit (was not a Hyatt!).Thanks to Ritchie and Tim for being helpful.Gorgeous views from roof-top bar.Close location to Times Square but quieter.Many subway stations within walking distance, so easy to get around NYC from the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here 2 nights and had a great experience. Staff was friendly and knowledgable. Rooms are small but very efficient and comfortable. I love this place. Great location. I cannot wait to come back. You might think it would be noisy but isn't.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful hotel for my daughter and I. Close to all the attractions and transport. Start of the bus tours . Many shops, sites and shows within walking distance. Safe for night walks and dinner out. Hotel is very new with pristine rooms and bathrooms. Silent air conditioning, and no noise heard from other guests. Floor to ceiling views across New York skyline. Lovely friendly staff who made our stay very special. A real delight for such a great price. Other hotels looked very old and dated compared to the Hyatt which is new and modern.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the middle of the action, 60 seconds walk to the centre of Times Square. The hotel is very clean, rooms very comfortable, staff very friendly and the views from the roof top bar are breathtaking. We will be back!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Three of us stayed here on April 2016 for 5 nights. The location is perfect, only a few seconds walk from Times Square. Subway is also very close by. There are lots of great places to eat and drink nearby. It was our first time in New York so obviously did all the main tourist attractions, many of which are within easy reach of the hotel. The staff were polite and helpful. We had an executive suite so one of our group was sleeping on a sofa bed in the lounge area. It wasn't the most comfortable but I guess you can't expect much from a fold out bed.The hotel has a roof bar, which we visited a couple of times. Views of New York are great. Service is quick and drinks are good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is literally steps from the craziness of Times Square and is a great place to stay. I highly recommend it and their is a great view from the bar on the 54 floor that is well worth it. This was my second visit here and I will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here in 2015 for a graduation trip. When we got there, our room was not ready. We were offered a different room, but we wanted the one we originally booked. So, they escorted us to the connected restaurant and paid for our meal while we waited on the room to become available. It was ready about an hour later. The room and service were great while we were there. I actually got viciously sick while there on our last day and the staff was awesome in trying to get me some Pepto Bismol! We will most certainly stay here again next time we visit NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family of four (mom, dad and two teen boys) stayed here in June. The hotel is a in a great location - right at Times Square. And relatively speaking - on the affordable side for this location. For had a normal room, not a suite, and felt for no more than we were in the room that we had adequate space. We are not light packers so this is impressive. The bathroom was particularly large with lots of counter space which is a huge bonus when four people sharing. Lots of windows made it nice as well. This is not a luxury hotel but that's okay. only two negatives - wish there were more outlets near the beds - the outside of the beds away from night stand in the middle had no outlets close by for phones to charge, etc. Also, when we got ready to check out - no one answered the phone at front desk or bell hop - my husband finally went down and they were not busy - they apologized so not sure if phone problem of what?? Otherwise would highly recommend as a nice, clean, practical hotel with a great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is exactly located at heart of Time Squares NYC. Everything you need is just steps away. Late night dining and shopping is available nearby. Great view, Nicely decorated, very friendly staffs, from check in counter, until end of stay. Very clean and tidy rooms, all you needs are provided. You will never need to worry of forgetting to bring your things, from razor, comb, toothbrushes, free self service starbuck's coffee. Literally everything is available. Nice interaction with hotel staffs Including the housekeeping staff, she is very nice and helpful. Definitely back here next time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location just around the corner from the Times Square proper. Room was clean and reasonable size. Having a "wall" of windows was a plus as well. A/C acted weirdly (more than one room as I was with a group) as it would pump in some hot air at the end of each cycle for some reason. But that's the only thing I can say was "wrong" with the stay. Price was reasonable given similarly outfitted hotels in the general area. Free wi-fi was also a plus. Elevators were very fast and had two banks - one for low floors and one for the upper floors. Bar54 (rooftop bar) was very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a nice hotel and a great location. staff are helpful and friendly. rooms are clean and modern. Wifi is good. And even got to watch July 4th fireworks from their rooftop. We went for the breakfast however on the last day, and that was a complete shock. For start, the breakfast finishes at 9!!!!!!!!!!!!!9!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!And the breakfast room was like feeding time at the zoo! you're made to line up in the longest line to even get to the food, and then you have to try and find somewhere to sit! which just wasn't going to happen. And the food looked horrific anyway so we chose to skip. Staff would just put some food down and within seconds all the food would be gone, I've never seen anything like it. Like people had never eaten before. other than that it's a great hotel. Just skip the breakfast!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A professional en very quick check-in kicked of our stay. Guided by the concierge who informed us where to watch the firework and has dinner let us continue our stay to fully exceeding our expectations. In the end it was raining and we watched the firework for the rooftop bar. Also the next day arrangements of car hire and visiting the freedom tower where taken care off by concierge. In short all perfect

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am a regular visitor to NYC and have been trying different hotels. I decided to try this relatively new Hyatt hotel because of its location - right in the heart of Times Square. I booked a Deluxe Suite on the top floor, which was one category below their largest Suite. The Suite was relatively small (about 460 sq feet I think), with a small separate sitting room and a bedroom and a good sized bathroom. In room amenities were limited however. The view of Times Square from the room was quite impressive and I suppose the additional price tag was for that. Check-in was efficient and the staff were polite enough. The room was generally still in satisfactory condition, but some wear and tear were already showing. The bed was firm, which I liked and appreciated. Breakfast was fine, though the menu was rather limited. The hotel seems to have many floors, but is only served by 2-3 lifts, which puzzled me greatly. I could tell that a number of guests were frustrated with the lifts. All in all, a typical business friendly hotel, not much frills, well located, functional and rather "cold" in terms of atmosphere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room had enough for the 2 of us to stay for a week. It was centralized in time square which means we had walking access to all areas around Times Square. Rooms were cleaned every day and the desk staff were always very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
