review_body: Its 45th street location gave us easy access to all parts of Manhattan, especially the Theater District. Desk attendants graciously welcomed us on our arrival, telling us that our sister had already arrived and was waiting in the room. Service and room were just right.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently stayed in a Deluxe Suite (room 4901) for a week. Hotel was great well located and we couldn't have asked for more. Bar on the top level was a good place to end the day. New York is expensive but you get what you pay for and we were happy with our choice. We read a lot about the lifts but we had no issues when we were there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Being a Hyatt passport member, I decide to house myself in this hotel. It is located very close to Broadway and Times Square. Yet, despite being so closed to a bustling area, it was very quiet and seem immune to the activities of the Big Apple. The rooms seem adequate and slept well. Like any NYC's hotels, the rooms were rather small but this hotel was modern. It has a great contemporary furnish but one must be careful and not to be too rough. I pulled the drawers too quickly and it kind of dropped out. Beds are firm, lighting bright but pillows were kind of thin.The reception could have rendered better service and more polite. I must say the folks by the door were great, polite and offered great service. As this hotel is so well located, there were lots of guests. The lifts seem insufficient to cater to the load and typical wait for a lift can take about 5 to 8 mins.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: booked a room well in advance with two queen size beds; however when we arrived room was not ready; was told to wait in lobby; then was told they only had a room with a king sized bed and a pull out sofa; was very disappointed. now to find out our credit card was overcharged $100.00 then the booking price. called and customer service was not to kind nor helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was an outstanding hotel a 1/2 block off of Times Square.Our family was vacationing in NYC and this was a great hotel centrally located to many of Manhattan's best sites and just blocks from many Broadway theaters.Subways, breakfast cafes, lunch & dinner options, open tour busses and Broadway box office / tickets are just short walks from the hotel.We primarily chose this hotel because finding two queen beds in a hotel in Manhattan can be a challenge. The room and bathroom were spacious and clean. ( I believe it's a new hotel ).There are several floor plan options so ask when checking in if you have any special requests. Their front desk was very accommodating to our request for a higher level room, a nice view and extra space for our teenagers. ( Thanks Kimberley at the front desk. )One pleasant surprise was that their Internet WiFi could handle up to 6 devices per room. This is awesome with all our mobile devices in tow. There are incredible views from the roof top bar. You can even see the NYE ball! Drinks are very pricey, but it's definitely worth a visit. We did not try the restaurant on site, but it looked great with outside and indoor seating options.Overall, we enjoyed the service and amenities at the Hyatt Times Square and would seek out this hotel again on a return trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern style hotel with great location. I'm a fan of Hyatt brands and thought we would stay at this hotel rather than Andaz for long theatre weekend in NYC. As expected, the rooms were modern, clean, and had nice comfortable Hyatt beds. The bathroom had a great rain shower and good layout, but bathrobes were provided on request only. Also, the wall had a full window view which was extra nice as we were on the 44th floor. However, to my surprise, service at this Hyatt hotel was a big disappointment. First (and a minor thing really), we returned to the room to find the duvet was still very damp from being washed. So much so that it made our clothes wet when we sat on the bed. We called room service and they corrected within the hour. However, the biggest disappointment was the lobby interactions. The lobby of the hotel is quite small, but always had a large group of front desk staff on duty. Unfortunately, the staff always appeared to be chatting in groups of 3 and rarely greeted or acknowledged returning guests or made eye contact. Understandable if this happened a few times and easy to overlook as we are low maintenance guests for sure. But we noticed this repeatedly during our 5-day stay and also heard similar comments from other guests in the elevators. I recognize the hotel must see its fair share of one-time tourists, but the lobby and 1st floor restaurant didn't feel like a Hyatt managed property. We did get some stares/nods from the security person at the door (Times Square area gets it fair share of homeless/panhandlers). Once a front desk person provided the wrong information when they suggested we use a public PC/printer in the lobby outsourced to non-Hyatt company for some last minute tickets. It resulted in an extra charge of $21.95 (the PC/printer was not free for first 15 minutes of use!). An Amex alert popped up on our phone, but they did not apologize for the wrong advice, nor offer to provide adjustment, and were unfriendly during the entire exchange. It occurred to me afterward that we simply weren't treated as actual guests of the hotel and I suddenly recognized there must be no formal concierge in the lobby! On a positive note, we did try the small roof-top bar around 10:30pm one evening and thought service was good. We were seated fairly quickly as hotel guests and the open air roof patio was nice to gaze at skyline (3 drinks and nuts were $75 so keep in mind). Overall, the room accommodation was nice and the hotel location great. But the service level was disappointing enough that we will stay at the Andaz our next time in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My stay was absolutely amazing! Starting with Richie (FRONT DESK), who was very sensitive to our long flight and provided us with compassion at understanding. He treated us like family, always asking if we needed anything and always providing eye contact when greeting us. WoW!! I would have recommended this hotel on his service and attentiveness alone. Then there was the HOUSEKEEPING staff Glenis took me over the moon. She was the sweetest, kindest person ever. We forgot almost everything from qtips to tootpaste. She provided us with everything we asked for and always providing service with a smile. We laughed together at my Spanish, but she let me practice (always encouraging). No matter what we asked for she provided it with a smile and without frustration on her face. I could feel her sincere heart. SECURITY staff always greeted us with a Welcoming "welcome back" noticing the flow of people. We always felt self. They were also approachable and considerate. One time offering us an umbrella cover and also pointing our daughter in the direction towards 42nd street:) Upon leaving Jeff FRONT DESK was more than courteous.CONCIERGE: Tess worked hard at helping us enjoy the city inside/outside our new york passes. The Liberty Cruise Rocked. The final day, in a panic I realized that our car left later that day. He calmly secured our bags in a safe place until the car arrived to take us to the airport. SECURITY/BELL HOP? staff: Finally, there was Steve, the gentleman and perfect professional. He provided the Brawn assisting us with bags, directing places like FedEx, Broadway, always providing his assistance not like it was a job, but like we were family. In conclusion, if I could use one word describing our stay it would be "Hospitality." We saved up a lot of money to go on this girls getaway as a graduation gift for our daughter. My husband could not get off work. This trip was everything we expected and more. Partly due to the service here and the other part NYC itself. For 6 day Hyatt was our Home Away from Home, for that we are truly grateful. We hope to see you soon with my husband/daddy in the near future and maybe make it either a family affair or a 2nd honeymoon. God Bless You ALL and thank you for listening. I hope my long response lets you know how important and how much this vacation meant to us. #Chattanooga Courtesy:)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I visited Times Square for the first time and stayed at the Hyatt Times Square. The rooms were extremely quite for being so close to Times Square. The hit of the stay was the bar up on the top floor. Drinks were a big pricy, but great views. Room was comfortable and very clean. We will go back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A friend and I stayed three nights at this hotel over Memorial Day weekend. Upon check-in, our room was not ready, and I was told we would be put next on the list for our room to be cleaned. Ok, so we dropped our bags off with the staff and went to explore Times Square and get some lunch. Three hours later we returned to the hotel expecting the room to be ready and it still was not. Ritchie at the front desk was absolutely wonderful at making sure we were taken care of, and he let us know the minute we could get into our room.... I just wish he would have been there to help us when we first arrived! When we got to the room, it was immaculately clean, and the view was decent. We were on the 22nd floor, and I feel if we were much lower we would have just been looking at other buildings or their rooftops. The room had windows that could slightly open which allowed us to hear the sounds of the city. We really appreciated the heated floors in the bathroom as well as the desktop fan that was in the room. I have never stayed in a hotel that had a fan... Kudos Hyatt! The elevator service was often slow and unreliable (I think one was out of order). The real disappointment came during checkout... I had a gift card that I wanted to apply to my room service charges and the staff member could not figure out. I had to wait for the manager two separate times because she did not know what to do. Finally she applied the gift card to my account and then threw the gift card away rather than giving it back to me- THERE WAS STILL MONEY LEFT ON IT!!!! In this process, I nearly missed my ride to the airport because she was taking so long. This left a very sour taste in my mouth about my experience there. I contacted the hotel regarding the issue and got the typical response of... sorry this happened, we will provide our staff with more training. I would expect such a high-end hotel to have a better system of satisfying their customers. Overall, I would probably stay here again due to the cleanliness and proximity to Times Square, but beware of the flaky customer service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean and friendly hotel, large comfy beds, Bottles of water were provided daily . Great location central to all bars, shops and Major attractions within walking distance or by use of the nearby Subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked this hotel because I wanted to be near Times Square and the theatre district. My husband and I arrived at noon and were warmly greeted by Alyssa. Alyssa was very professional and made the check in process quitesimple. We were so grateful as we had been traveling for 5.5 hours and we wanted to rest up before stepping out in the city. Alyssa was able to find us a room! The rooms are very clean with modern furniture and a comfy bed with nice linens. The room wasn't huge but was well laid out for two people. The room had floor to ceiling windows so there was plenty of natural light coming into the room. The bathroom was large and had a long counter to hold personal items. Shower was nice and large with a wonderful shower head. Being summer, I was happy to know the a/c system works great!My only negative was the restaurant on the lobby level. I was disappointed in the lack of customer service skills by the bartender and hostess. Food was very underwhelming. You can do better outside in one of the restaurants near Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I really liked the location. It was convenient to Broadway. Even though it was close to the hustle and bustle it was very quiet.The room was clean and the bed/pillows were very comfortable. I appreciated the staff's ability to make conversation and eye contact...very personable!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times square is a great place to stay in NYC. 54 floora hotel with a great roof bar on the floor 54. Rooms are large enough. Thereare high quality stuff in the room, service and the staff are good and adequate. Just a few steps from times square. I strongly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family truly enjoyed the accommodations, customer service, and location. Block away from the main shops on Times Square. Conveniently located to Subway. Luxurious hotel and felt treated like first class experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The first impression of the hotel is very impressive to me. Location is great. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. Nice room and service. The sky lounge bar is incredible. I was expecting a bathtub but I guess that doesn't match this hotel's modern cozy style, especially in the center of New York City. Overall, a great experience of stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was great, rooms were very modern and floor to ceiling windows on time square made me look like a hero to the kids! Location is great right in the action if you like that but you can escape by going away from TImes Square. Gym was nice and worked out great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I totally forgot to rate this hotel, me and my friend visited the hotel in January for a break, the hotel is one of the best I have stayed in really clean and everything you need for a hotel especially the rooftop bar, the staff are really friendly and helpful especially the female security guard ( thanks for the slice of pizza) if she reads this she knows what I'm on about, we will be returning to this hotel next year 5 star rating

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was pleased overall with my choice. The rooms are well appointed, comfortable and modern . The floor to ceiling window inmy room was a real treat. Less impressed with the quality of food both in the restaurant and room service nevertheless there are plenty of good dining options in the area surrrounding the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff of the Hyatt Times Square were so incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was decent sized and very quiet for it's busy location. We loved that they gave family tours of the rooftop restaurant in the mornings since children are not allowed in the bar during operating hours. Spectacular view!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent Hotel I will stay here every time I go back to New York Staff was fantastic Room was clean and ready when I arrived. Easy to get to Times Square and subways Had no problems leaving my bags with staff because I wanted to sight see more after check out Easy check in and check out no hassles and no problems with my reservation

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Taken me a while to post this but we had brilliant stay at Hyatt Times Square. Location excellent just off Times Sq. From a very friendly welcome at reception to a beautiful, roomy and very comfy room we could not fault it. We booked through BA which entitled us to a higher floor and we had no problems with noise whatsoever. Concierge couldn't be more helpful. Out the doors and straight into the buzz of New York. Our first visit and we will be back. Be aware though that under 21s not allowed in rooftop bar. One word of caution: always always always use yellow cabs at airports.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As mentioned by most other reviewers, this hotel is in a good location if you want to be in the Times Square area. Some subway lines are close by while others going to places like Brooklyn are several blocks walk from the hotel. The rooms are small but the beds and pillows are very comfortable. I was unimpressed with the first concierge representative that we dealt with as he didn't seem to have a good knowledge of basic information. However, the next day we had a different individual and this young man was very helpful and courteous. Our room was on the 40th floor which was wonderful for the view. However, waiting for an elevator can be a test of one's patience! I agree with other reviewers regarding the Rooftop Bar. It sported a stunning view of the city. But be prepared to pay $25 for a cocktail!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights. We booked a king high floor view room; we stayed in the 38th floor. The room was very nice and clean. The bathroom was great also. The view was good but I think a higher level would be even better! We would have loved to check out the roof top bar/restaurant but my daughter was too young. The staff are very friendly and helpful. My daughter got sick as soon as she stepped out of the cab on our arrival and the doorman was so helpful and kind! We ate breakfast 2 mornings at The Hyatt and I ordered the French toast each time; it is excellent. I do recommend sharing because the portions are big. The location is great close to Rockefeller Center, st Patrick's Hotel, Bryant Park etc...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed for 9 nights in the Hyatt Times Square.Being used to European hotels we were disappointed that a buffet breakfast was not provided.The room was fresh and clean. The bed was huge, leaving little other. The shower and toilet were modern and of a high standard.We are not coffee-drinkers and the Reception sent up and electric kettle for our use. We found the Receptionists very helpful, especially Lotis.I was able to use my IPAD after logging in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My sisters and I took my mom to NYC to celebrate her 60th birthday! The 4 of us shared a "deluxe 2 queen beds" room. We paid about $20, per night, Extra for the deluxe room, completely worth it! It was very spacious for a NYC hotel in Times Square! Plenty of room for our bags, the bathroom was big with a large counter space for all our toiletries. It was in walking distance of everything! The view of Times Square was great, the train station was very close! Has a great rooftop bar. Perfect for our girls trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Went to NYC with my wife and family. The trip was for business and pleasure. The hotel is very busy and the front desk staff very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are standard Hyatt rooms with the amenities that come with the standard room. Cleaning staff are very conscious not to clean while your in the room. I appreciate that since we would get up and leave around 1100am after a long night on the town. You are close but sufficiently far away from times square. They have good security procedures at night to keep anyone who is not staying there from coming in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned from a trip to NYC where, along with friends, I stayed in the Hyatt Times Square for 3 nights. Hotel is in a prime location, really easy reach of Times Square itself. The staff were very welcoming and nothing was a problem for them. We got a lovely complimentary upgrade to queen rooms with a view and they absolutely did not disappoint. We had drinks in the rooftop bar one night which was lovely. The only negative I have was about the room service. We had some burgers and claires delivered to our room and it wasn't that great, the fries tasted like they had been reheated and the burger was just OK. Would have expected a bit more for the price we payed. Apart from that, great trip and we are already looking at returning in April next year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Situated just 500 yards from Times Square sits one of New York's finest hotels. A hotel home away from home with a staff that makes you feel like family. You feel the pulse of the city, a convenient walk away from theaters, tourist attractions and some of New York's best restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Well located and close to all the action. Had an excellent stay. The price was good. The hotel was clean. the staff was great. Could not ask for much more than that. Highly recommended. If I could pick on something, i would say the concierge service could do with more variety and their recommendations generally cost much more than other options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square on a long vacation weekend this summer. Super location... Walking distance to many sights. We had a marvelous time! From the moment we checked in on Friday morning until our departure Monday afternoon, everyone did their best to make our stay as comfortable as possible. When we did experience some problems with the late night restaurant staff and an unfortunate problem with allergies to the down pillows, the staff went above and beyond to make sure that the issues were addressed immediately. The Sky Club is incredible and worth a visit even if you are not lucky enough to be staying at the hotel. Rooftop views of Time Square at sunset are breathtaking! We even received 2 complementary rounds of drinks and dessert on our final evening to help smooth over the previously mentioned hiccups in service. Big shout out to management and concierge staff for their time and attentiveness. My only regret is not trying the spa... We'll just have to go back!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here 29th of May to 3rd June 2016. The hotel is in a great location just round the corner for times square and within a short walk of everything else. The room was great my husband had a double and our grown up children had a double queen but these were next to each other. I requested the same floor but was really pleased we were next door. The free wifi was great too, the breakfast is really good quality a bit pricey compared to deli's but hotels always are and you get what you pay for, good service too. I really liked the fact you could print boarding passes at no cost. The rooftop bar was lovely and the view was great. I would really recommend this hotel, the staff were really helpful and friendly. There was tea and coffee in the room, the coffee was good but American tea is not like English tea I was not a fan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was "overbooked" so our reserved room (Deluxe 2 Queen Suite) was not available. The only "suite" available was a King with a pull-out couch which was HORRIBLY uncomfortable. I must say, the staff did their best to accommodate the situation (providing additional pillows and several comforters to "cushion" the bedding) but to no avail. Also, as "Gold Preferred" members we thought they would have been able to accommodate, especially since we booked directly with the hotel. In addition, they charged me an increase for the larger (king) room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This in an excellent location and the staff is very helpful and constantly welcoming. The rooms were very comfortable and the view is terrific. The only negative is the elevators sometimes took 5-6 minutes to arrive. Not a problem if you plan accordingly, if you have a time constraint.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We all loved this hotel. Before we even got there, they lowered the price of the room by 100. When does that ever happen?! When we arrived we were able to valet the car with the hotel and when we left we were able to call, give our ticket number and have the car ready and waiting for us with the bags inside it. Even though it's right at Times Square it was very quiet. We even loved that the floor and door signs were designed as digital clocks. Very clever. The room was immaculate and modern and beautiful and a pleasure to be in. The staff was the nicest we have ever found. We don't usually stay in Time Sq when we're in NY but if we do, there is no other hotel we would stay in now.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, great staff and fabulously close to theatres. Our room, #5305, was on the top room floor with only the lounge above us. Nice to have a view and despite lots of noise on the street, the room was very quiet. The room was adequately sized, not one of the new tiny rooms that some places offer, and nicely decorated. A comfortable chair and ottoman to go along with the great king size bed. Terrific mattress and pillows!!! The night stands were a puzzle; no drawers just a surface on which to write? And, while the three drawers in the "credenza" sufficed, a longer stay might need more storage space. The bath was great. Lots of counter space, something which is often lacking, and an over-sized shower with dual heads. No tub, but who takes baths in a hotel? Overall, we highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed one night in a king bed room on the 31st floor with my tween daughter, her first NY overnight. We had a blast and the hotel had a lot to do with it! The staff was so friendly and helpful, from the doormen to the front desk. Every time we had a question they always answered with a smile and when we returned would always ask my daughter how she enjoyed it. The room was super clean and new, loved the shower head which hangs from the ceiling. Can't wait to bring my husband so we can have a drink at the rooftop bar. I went up and peaked and it is beautiful and comfortable. Thanks Hyatt Times Square for making our 24 hours in NY so memorable!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 7 nights at the end of may for my sons kindergarten graduation present, and couldn't have been more pleased! The location was convenient to a lot, and if it was further than you wanted to walk there are multiple subway locations close by! I loved that they had someone standing by the elevators to check that everyone had a room key before they were allowed to go up! Traveling with just us two, safety is a must! We stayed on the 51st floor and the view was awesome! The room was spacious and the bathroom was just as nice with a soaking tub and rainfall shower! We have previously stayed at Park Lane Hotel, but I am glad we tried this place out, we will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this location because it was fairly close to subway stations and the Broadway shows. We were able to navigate all around NYC and made it to 4 of the 5 boroughs in 2 days. We enjoyed the location and the room was very nice and quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel can't be beat - less than a block away from Times Square. Our family of four stayed here for two nights. The two queen bed room was very spacious. Not much of a view from our room, but the Skylounge on the top floor had an incredible view of the city. Got some great pictures from here! The hotel is a bit hard to spot - it could use better signage. Also some really wacky light switches in the room. They were all on or all off, and more that once someone in the bathroom was left in the dark. Enjoyed having free wi-fi and a mini-fridge. All the staff we interacted with were very nice and accommodating. Overall, this hotel was a great choice for our visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in June. We were treated with the upmost impeccable customer service from Pablo and Josh. They both went above and beyond to ensure that our first stay in NY was an unforgettable one. The location was great, customer service was amazing and room cleanliness was top of the line! I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel and I will definitely be returning back in the future! Thanks to Pablo and Josh for making my first NY trip a memorable one!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want a Times Square hotel, but don't want to have to hack your way through thickets of gawkers and the lost every time you step outside the door, this may well be the place for you (as it was for us). A well-hit ground ball away from Times Square itself, but just far enough east that you can get in and out of the entryway without pushing thorough a crowd. All the amenities and quality of service that you'd expect at a Hyatt. Surprisingly quiet, which, given the location, is a real consideration.Would stay again, particularly if focus of trip was, again, a Broadway play.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited new york for the first time for my birthday. On arrival found out that we had been upgraded to a room with a view!Room was modern and clean and very quiet.Didn't use the hotel restaurant as we ate out everyday.Can't wait to return to new york!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, minutes away from Times Square. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The room was comfortable and clean. We had a corner room with a great view of the city. Will definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms are very clean and well-appointed. Quiet too. For a reasonable price, you can get the amenities you need but not have to pay for the ones you can live without. And the bar at the top of the hotel is quite fun to visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Briefly: the rooms are great and so is the location. But, I would stay away for the following reasons: (1) lax security to the guest room towers-there is a popular rooftop bar that draws lots of non-guests. There is no hotel key requirement in the elevator to prevent anyone from getting off on the way to the rooftop bar. (2) elevator service-again the rooftop bar is an issue. There are 3 elevators that service the guest rooms and the bar. The bar is so popular you wait in line just to get to your room...EVERY TIME! And, there was a private bar party so they took 2 of the 3 elevators as express bar elevators at the expense of the hotel guest. We waited 15 minutes for an elevator to arrive. (3) poor service at the bars. Just terribly slow and inattentive. I am a platinum member of the hyatts program and this is a property I will never stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square on our first ever visit to New York City in March and it did not disappoint! We stayed for 10 nights and the hotel was clean, comfortable and better than I had imagined. We stayed in a standard King room, which was spacious with a generous sized bathroom. There was plenty of room in the wardrobe to out our suitcases out of the way, and plenty of ledge storage in the bathroom, so we could completely unpack and feel at home. Housekeeping was excellent and really looked after us. The hotel is situated on W45th St, right between 6th (right near Broadway) and 7th Avenues (Avenue of the Americas). When you turn right out of the hotel, it is a short walk to Times Square, and you are literally in the thick of it, so location wise, you can't get much better.It was a short walk to the subway- 42nd St- which is handy if you want to get to Macy's Herald Sq (34th St) or head down to Brooklyn. The hotel also sports the highest roof top bar in NYC and although we went in March when it was still quite cold, we had a couple of beautiful, warm sunny days. A visit to the bar, sitting outside, is a must if you visit during the warmer months, but get in early, as we had to wait for a table outside. All in all, I would definitely stay here again for the hotel itself, more than the area and would certainly recommend it for a first time visitor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took our daughter for her 21st and got a room with 2 queen beds with floor to ceiling windows . Everything about the hotel was great especially the location right on Times square . we will definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in May. We arrived just as there was an unseasonable cold snap hit. We were traveling with our 2 teenagers and I didn't realize the room we had booked was only a queen bed with a sofa bed as the 2nd bed. We tried to change but there wasn't anything available. For 2 teenagers sofa bed was really uncomfortable. The room size itself was really good and I loved that you could open the windows to let fresh air in . The food was ok from the restaurant down stairs , we pretty much ate there every night as it was too cold to go out at night. Staff were ok, we would've appreciated a little more sense of urgency, as we were going to Philadelphia for the day and needed our passports out of our In -room safe, but the batteries went dead in the safe and we asked if they could come and open it asap as we had a train to catch, and when they finally got to us he said " I thought you forgot your code so now I need to go back and get a drill to get it open" it was easier to call Amtrak and explain what's happened and ask them what else could we use for identification. Thank goodness Amtrak were very understanding so we had to go and we dealt with it when we got back to the Hyatt later that afternoon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From arrival to departure, everyone was stellar. Very accommodating and courteous. The facility was beautiful and nice touch with the TV welcome. Love the rooftop lounge...definitely a re-do. By the way the French toast was to die for and being right in the heart of Times Square gave you the excitement and relaxation back at the hotel. Loved it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for my Birthday and it was amazing! We got a high up, window view room and are so glad we did! The views from here of Times Square are awesome! The room was pretty large (for NYC), the service was great, and the location could not have been better! Highly recommend, worth the cost.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The entire staff was great and provided excellent customer service. We had a positive experience at both check in and check and we treated professionally. The location was perfect and felt safe. The roof top bar provided a great view and perfect setting to see the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were two people staying at Hyatt Times Square for four nights and we were very satisfied with the hotel, the politeness and service of the staff, the cleanliness of the room, etc. We had no complaints whatsoever.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, was easy to get around and the staff was kind and knowledgable. The restaurant and outside bar were awesome! My main issue was that only one elevator was operating that went to our floor, which got annoying! But, overall it was a great place to stay with comfortable amenities...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Returned today after 7 nights to celebrate husbands 60th BirthdayAB FAB time from moment we arrived Alyssia checked us in so helpful nothing too much troubleThis does apply to all the staff though. Perfect room with view of Times Square but not noisy Perfect locationI arranged Prosecco, Cake, Fruit etc for husbands birthday all sorted by staff for me. Alyssia arranged $50 credit for us in the rooftop T54 bar which is a must to visit and was a very nice touch. We also on our last night received a bottle of Wine and chocolates from Rose our housekeeperCheckout was just as good sorry did not catch the very help full member of staffs name although she remembered ours when we went back to collect our luggage☺No need to look any further for accommodation if we can hopefully return in the near future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located in the center of it all in Times Square, an easy walk to just about anything in midtown. The room we had was huge for NYC standards and very well appointed. They also have a rooftop bar with great views of downtown. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for five nights last week. Very smart contemporary hotel. Close to Times Square, but far enough away to be quiet yet convenient. Room on the fiftieth floor was very quiet and had a view of times square. King size bed was very comfortable with good pillows. Great and roomy rain shower. Free wifi one of the fastest we have experienced on our travels.The in room refrigerator was an added bonus for keeping your own snacks in. Lifts worked fine longest wait about 2 minutes, so no problems there. Hotel is easy walking distance from empire state, central park and grand central station. Finally being British we had to have a kettle in the room, which arrived within 5 minutes of being requested. Well done Hyatt we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Awesome service,hotel staff top notch. One complaint the Gray Line tour which the hotel highly recommended was way over rated compared with other tours of the city! The fact that u had tons of paper to deal with was ridiculous!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Directly in Time Square/Theater District. Within walking distance to all tourist destinations, Grand Central Station, Shopping, transportation and great eateries. The Rooftop bar is very cute, not over packed with people with great views. I ate in the lobby café which was also very good. the staff was very personable and friendly. Rooms were very spacious for new York hotels and kept very clean with regular room service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Absolutely amazing hotel!.. Couldn't fault one bit!.. Staff where second to none! Couldn't do enough to please you.. Excellent room and the views were amazing! The rooftop bar.. Bar 54 was great!.. A 5 star experience highly recommended hotel!.. Made our trip to newyork Perfect!.. Here's a few pics!☺️

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything was great from the moment I checked in to checking out. Room was spacious, clean, and hotel was in walking distance to many locations. It rained one of the day of our stay and the hotel provided umbrellas for us also. It would be nice if they provided breakfast, but overall I'm extremely happy with the Hyatt hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location for all tourists.On the doorstep of Time Square which is amazing.Short walk to Empire State building, Rockefeller, 5th Ave etc.The Hotel is busy, but reception is very professional and helpful.I do recommend a room on a higher floor, just to avoid street noise, but I must admit the rooms are lovely, so quiet.TV and media are very good, IF you plan to spend time in your room.The restaurant T45 is great, lovely food.Bar 54 amazing views – sit outside and admire the skyline, sunset etc. Cocktails are expensive but it’s worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would stay again, not one single complaint. The staff appeared genuinely helpful and nice. The room was clean and room service came regularly. Any special requests were accommodated. There was an issue with the phone service and the cable when it was storming out though, so I couldn't even call down to complain about it but that was out of the hotels control.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We've made many trips to NYC, either staying at the Waldorf Astoria or upscale hotels in the theater district. By far, this was our best hotel experience! The room was very large (especially by NYC standards), luxurious shower, great view, and wonderfully friendly hotel staff! It's conveniently located close to Times Square (important to us for attending 4 Broadway shows in 5 days!), 5th Avenue shopping, Bryant Park, subway stops. Service was impeccable (snaps to Paige and Laura!).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We went to New York to this past March. After much research I booked the Hyatt. It's location in the heart of Broadway is ideal for city exploring. We stayed for 7 nights in all and wouldn't he's its to return. We arrived on St. Patrick's Day and while the hotel was very busy, the staff were highly efficient and we were checked in with ease. The amazingly fast elevator brought us to our room on the 38th floor. It was very spacious something I was apprehensive about as I had read reviews of rooms in NYC being cramped. It was immaculately clean and had a huge bed. The views of the skyline and Times Square were ones we will hold in our memory forever. During our stay the staff were most attentive while not intrusive. We visited the roof top bar which is a must. It had an exquisite atmosphere and lovely cocktails. I used the Spa on one day for hair and make up and again the staff were most accommodating. We did not eat in the hotel as we were happy to explore and eat out. The hotel was an ideal base close to tube station, and within walking distance of Central Park. An amazing hotel. We would highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Time Square for 5 days. Having been to NYC several times we wanted to be central and Hyatt was not disappointing in any way.This hotel is a great base in New York, half a block to Times Square and walking distance to most of the attractions in midtown and even Central Park could be reached by foot. Extremely convenient for sightseeing in NYC. Many good restaurants within a short distance from the hotel.We stayed in a king size room on 47th floor with a view. Modern room with a good size, clean with a very nice and big bed. Great view of the street below, we could see the Empire State building and the new One World Trade Building.I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great location and comfortable rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stay here on a semi-regular basis, and always get good service. I once left a nice pair of sunglasses and a water bottle in the room, then checked out. Several hours later, a visit to the front desk had my items returned in a few minutes. Room condition is generally good with excellent blackout curtains and quiet air conditioning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great hotel just a half block from the center of Times Square. Everything was just as one would hope it to be. Nice, updated modern room, comfy bed, nice amenities, quiet, secure, great service. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: what a great base in New York it saved our holiday as we had booked into the grand Hyatt but it was far from Grand it was a disgrace so we checked out and into this Hyatt it out preformed the grand Hyatt at every level from the warm greeting every time you return back from a day out to the cleaning all the staff are friendly and outgoingwe had an amazing view from our 52nd floor room and the roof top bar is pricy but you get an amazing view I would have to say after staying at allthe hyatts in New York the time square Hyatt is the best and the grand Hyatt should be removed from the Hyatt brand if staying in New York treat yourself to the time square Hyatt totally worth the price

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a great hotel. This is not a party hotel. It is a nice, clean, quiet hotel with everything you need and great service. We upgraded to a corner suite on our second night, but both rooms had great views and were clean and comfortable. I have nothing bad to say about our experience here and I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful, quiet and peaceful hotel in the midst of all the noise and traffic of Times Square. Staff was exceptionally helpful, and our room was lovely. Never had to wait more than 5 seconds for an elevator, and we were whisked up to the 33rd floor quickly. The Hotel was so convenient to the theater district, with a minimum of walking on our part! Hope we are able to make a return visit to the Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The overall hotel is nice and closely situated to "Times Square". The rooms are spacious and decorated nicely. However the beds were not very comfortable and I needed multiple duvets to make the bed even remotely possible to sleep on.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely hotel. Excellent location for exploring New York. It was fabulous being able to pop into Times Square every day. Very relaxing room with free wifi and coffee (maid happy to provide extra supplies on request). Doormen/women very helpful. Only fault was the lifts were very slow and one day one of them was out of order causing problems. Would happily recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms were big and modern with everything we needed. The hotel is in a great location yet the rooms are very quiet with no street traffic noise. Only downside is that valet is $65 a day. We would highly recommend staying here and would book on a flash if we are ever back in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Take a bite out of the big apple on a budget in this clean and comfortable room. As all millenials do, I read a ton of reviews prior to booking at Hyatt Time Square. This hotel turned out to be even better than we expected. The inviting and accomadating staff offered an upgrade to the 53 floor upon check in. The small fee (cost of one cab ride) they asked to upgrade over 20 floors higher was WELL worth it. We could see EVERYTHING from the floor to cielling room wide views. Time Square, Chrystler Building, One World Trade Center, the water and more. The location is ideal, size of the room, decoration, and roof top bar were all stellar. Well done Hyatt Times Square, you made us feel special in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Travelling by myself heading through NYC for two nights on business I usually steer well clear of Times Square but thought I would break my rules I was pliantly surprised the hotel was very central I walked to MOMA, Central Park and all the 5th Avenue shopping. The hotel was very clean, the bedding amazing (slept very well) and on the top floor the views were fantastic. Its not a five star hotel or anything but adequate facilities, great gym, no pool and rooms were a good size for price and being in NYC! Don't order room service - go out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is located in the busy New York Times Square! Easy accsess to all the major attractions and public transport! The hotel staff were very friendly, room was clean safe and we felt really comfortable and happy with our room. We stayed in a deluxe room and the view overlooking the city was amazing. From morning to night we enjoyed the view. Great stay and would recommend this hotel. If your looking for a great hotel this is defiantly one to look at!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So just gave my first review of a hotel and I didn't want to just have a negative review without a positive one. So I just left Night Hotel Times Square as I could no longer stand it there and came here to Hyatt. My god what a difference $40 makes. Totally worth it. Beautiful clean rooms, quiet, very friendly staff and great location. So much happier!!! Thank you Hyatt for saving what would have been a sleep deprived and miserable weekend! You guys are the best!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here while attending a conference in the city and wanted a hotel that was centrally located to explore as much as possible. All of the major sites are either walking distance or a short hop on the subway. The rooms are not massive but perfectly fine given you'll probably not spend much time in the room. The bathroom only had a shower cubicle but that is fine with me especially as the mirror had some magic quick clear function. One downside was the lighting was not great in the bathroom and my room was rather overlooked by the apartment building opposite. The staff offered great service as they managed to find alternative pillows with the one provided being too soft for my liking. Despite the location the room was very quiet allowing a chance to recharge ready for the following days adventures.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be near all the action of Times Square and Broadway. Staff is very helpful; front desk gave us a complimentary upgrade as the room type that we had requested was not ready at the time of check in, even though we were trying to check in early and people manning the Concierge desk were patient and assisted with suggestions for places to eat to booking tickets for a Broadway show.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room was great, we had 2 queen size beds and it was very roomy and the bathroom was excellent. Everything was very modern and thought out to provide the best accommodations. The personnel were extremely helpful and friendly, they couldn't do enough for you. I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again if I go back to NY city,.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is located 100meter from Times Square, perfect location. Very friendly hotel with great comfortable modern rooms. On the 54th floor is a rooftop bar, awesome place to hang out for few drinks. A great hotel to stay within Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Time Square because of its location and proximity to Time Square. it was a great hotel, friendly desk staff as well as friendly housekeepers. I took the $20 upgrade to a higher floor and we stayed on the 51st floor and it was fantastic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed 1 night as in transit & easy access to Penn station. On checking in offered free upgrade at no extra charge. Friendly staff from reception guy to chap who took our luggage for storage on the day we checked out - great cap! Good quiet room with comfy beds & view of the Empire State. Free Wi-Fi. Rooftop bar with great views. Good base.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's not very often that I can fault nothing! Great location, great rooms, friendly staff. We had terrific views from the 53rd floor. The suite layout is great for kids. The bathroom had a separate shower and underfloor heating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazing staff and Clean rooms. what more can you ask for in a hotel in NYC. specially in Times Square. Most importantly the staff was extremely helpful and kind. From the check in process to the check out process the staff meet our every need and question. the rooms were really clean and nothing was broken.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was our first time in New York and we wanted to see a lot during our short stay.The hotel is walking distance to the Broadway theaters and a short walk to Times Square.The hotel rooms were spacious and the beds very comfortable. Mel, the assistant GM, the concierge and the doormen were very helpful. We wish we could've stayed longer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt doesn't disappoint, and this hotel was no exception, with comfortably appointed bedrooms and bathrooms. A few things of note -- I liked the double hook that was on the wall by the TV; it came in handy to hang my bag, sweater, etc. (I wish all hotel rooms had such a hook). I also appreciated the daily 10:30 "tour" that was offered to hotel guests to visit the bar on the 54th floor which affords a nice view looking north toward Central Park (it costs $6,000 if you want to spend New Year's Eve there to watch the festivities below -- and that doesn't even include a single drink or food item!). My only complaint is that despite their purported "2nd fastest elevators in Manhattan", there were only two elevators that served our floor of the hotel and unfortunately during our stay one of those two were out of order so we frequently had to wait up to 10 minutes just to catch the elevator from our room which was pretty irritating and inconvenient (almost missed that 10:30 tour of the 54th floor bar!).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We tried this relatively new hotel again after having some problems last winter. The elevators worked much better, but they were still a little scary because they are so noisy. The room was clean and the views are spectacular. They do not offer room service, robes, in- room safes or magnifying mirrors. Location is very convenient to theaters and subway stations.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt over the Memorial Day weekend and had a great time! The location was perfect for what we were doing (seeing a few Broadway shows) and then easy access to the the subway to get everywhere else in the city. Our hotel room was great -- excellent size and awesome views! It's very modern with beautiful rooms and had all the necessary amenities (mini fridge and safe in the room). Even being right next to Times Square, noise was surprisingly miminal and they had good black out curtains to keep any bright lights out. While we didn't eat/drink at the bar at the top, we did go up there to checkout the views and they were awesome. So I highly recommend checking it out. Overall it was a great stay and if we ever go back to see another show, we'll be staying there again. Thanks!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square Hotel for our first visit to New York City and we were very happy with everything about this hotel. The king size bed was great and I woke up feeling refreshed and without a backache. We got as much free water as we wanted and the internet was included. The noise level on the 19th floor was minimal (you can't get away from honking horns). The location was perfect for a first visit. We highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was surprised that the hotel was so small. Came off of the street right into a small reception area. Small elevators of which one was not working during our stay, rooms were comfortable and about average size.In any case, the service was good, the restaurant was very good and I had an enjoyable stay. Very comfortable bed and shower. The only thing I didn't miss was a concierge lounge.As far as location, you can't beat Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Currently staying at the Hyatt what can I say apart from an amazing hotel staying on the 53rd floor looking out my window to see freedom tower and Times Square,its breath taking,never dreamed of having such a fantastic time in New York,hotel staff are amazing will do anything for you,nobody can say a bad word about this hotel!!Don't read any more reviews just book this hotel you won't be disappointed!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a flawless experience at the Hyatt and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to be in the heart of Times Square. On recommendation of another TA contributor, I sent an email to the staff ahead of time explaining we were celebrating my daughter's 13th birthday by visiting NYC for the first time. Baloo assured me he would do something special. When we arrived (early), they immediately acknowledged that we were celebrating something special and were preparing a great room for us but that it was not quite ready - I had asked for early check-in and got a very prompt reply that they would do their very best but could not promise that it would be ready by the 11am time I requested. They checked our bags with the concierge and got my cell number and said they would call when it was ready. We walked to Grand Central Station for lunch and within an hour, Lauren called and asked if I could talk without spoiling any surprises and proceeded to tell me our room was ready & they had put some special things in the room for my daughter and had a special dessert for her and would like to come and sing to her when it was convenient for us. The room was on the 26th floor, was great and had a good view of Times Square so we could see all of the lights at night. There were some classic NYC items on the bed along Keith a card signed by all of the staff. The room was extremely clean, quiet and decorated nicely. Every time we would go down stairs, it seemed someone would recognize my daughter and say Happy Birthday. And, as promised, the second day we were there, we scheduled a time and the staff came and sang to her with the most delicious chocolate dessert. The hotel is walking distance to everything! We saw a show at the Winter Garden theater as well as saw all the main sites of the city and getting to/from the hotel was always a breeze. We would absolutely stay here again - mainly for the excellent staff and location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When travelling, location comes first but service just after, Both qualities were carried in full at the Hyatt time square.Although I arrived around noon time room was ready and I had a choice of floors. Location is right by times square but away from the noise. Reception, concierge, bell boys and even the maintenance guy , who came to fix the washing room door were all smiling and helpful. Room is new and well equipped. The sky club is lovely but have a limited space , I would imagine that hotel guest should get some priority but that’s the only “spot” I could find.Will sure stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are great, with a very comfortable beds. Location is fantastic. You're literally a stone's throw from Time Square. What more could you want. The view from the bar on the 56th floor is simply amazing!! Will be staying here again on my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Accommodations were excellent, clean and centrally located to Times Square. Most all on and off Broadway performances were within walking distant. Security was great. Front Desk employees were great. Rooms were very, very clean. Very memorable experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here from 4th - 10th May and found it to be a great place to stay. The rooms are smaller than what you think but this is quite normal for New York even though you are paying around $530 AU per night. The rooms are very updated and all the amenities are there. The staff are very helpful and anything you needed was no problem. I asked for firmer pikkowss and they were delivered within 5 minutes which I thought was exceptional. The distance to Times Square is about a 2 minute walk so location is perfect as it is just far enough away to avoid the noise. We stayed in a 1 bedroom King - High floor. We were a little disappointed with the view as the cheaper room guaranteed you a view of Times Square where as we had views of office buildings. Overall this is a great hotel and would recommend it if coming to New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is decent for NYC. Rooms recently refreshed. Rooftop bar nice but drink prices are outrageous. I've got no problem paying NYC prices, but $25 for a watered down drink is ridiculous. Went once and never went back (you can save about $10 a drink by going to the bar in the lobby). Expect to wait a long time, a very long time, if you want to ride the elevator to your room (which of course you have too). Ridiculously long, annoying waits. And nobody seems to give a damn.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent a week at the Hyatt and found it extremely convenient for sightseeing in NYC. It was surrounded by good restaurants, close to Broadway shows and subway stations. The room was comfortable and very clean. The desk staff were always helpful. We were on the eleventh floor so there was some street noise, but it never bothered us and we could see the signs of Times Square from our window. Nice view of downtown from the rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great views, brilliant showers, central, and friendly staff. Breakfast is expensive, go down the street or around the block to a diner, worth it even just to get the more local atmosphere. The hotel is worth the stay. Rooms are great. The water, tea, coffee is free - if you need more just call down (you may need to do this as rooms appear to be stocked for single people). The staff are friendly and approachable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent three nights at this Hyatt location and was delighted from the time we checked-in to check-out. Beds were extremely firm, bathroom included a shower and separate bathtub, request for water and other personal needs were handled promptly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 2 nights. It was our first overnight stay in NY.We had visited for day trips but had never stayed overnight. We were very pleased with this hotel. The location is great, very convenient to all of Times Square, We had a room on the 44th floor with a great view of the street below. We could see the Empire State building and the new One World Trade Building(both are beautiful at night). The room wasn't large but it was very clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful with our tourist questions. The only negative was the rooftop bar. We went there to have a drink in the evening . The views were great but we felt the drinks were overpriced for the quality. They weren't anything special ,certainly not worth the $25.00 per drink we paid.  I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great location and comfortable rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: All five of us recommend this as a great place to stay while in New York City! Friendly helpful staff and clean spacious rooms. The room that had three people staying in it was plenty of room for them. They did have to request extra towels twice but the staff responded to the request.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 4 nights 18-22 og may. We stayed in a king size with a view and it was beautiful! The room was big, clean and cozy, a very nice and big bed. The bathroom was more than big enough for us both to get ready at the same time! The staff was very poilte and help with every question we had, they even payed our first drink in the beautiful skylounge (B54 rooftop bar) The view from up there was breathtaking! The bartenders up there are sweet and observant - is you go there, you should ask for Justin. Brilliant drinks and very polite! Overall a very nice stay and we will most definitely be back - may next year!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is new, modern, clean and a great location especially for the price in NY. The use of the space in the rooms are practical and more roomy than most hotel rooms in NY. Many outlets within reach from the bed for charging devices, many lighting settings accessible from bedside. EXCELLENT view from the rooftop bar a must see.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a platinum member and Hyatt Visa holder, I was offered a basic double room accommodation with $65 p/day valet parking only option. From my 6th floor room, you could hear all the outside noise. I will say though the bathroom was a pleasant surprise and outstanding feature.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here over christmas 2015. What can i say, everything was perfect. So close to times square and the rooms were perfect. Jeff on the front desk was friendly and polite. The skybar is also fantastic with some great views.10/10 absolutely perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was worse stay i've ever had in the Hyatt hotel. I love staying at the hyatt until my stay at time square poor room standard customer service is horrible, the condition is horrible. there was no water, coffee noting i paid for a view there was no view. Very disappointed i took my wife for birthday.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I give it five stars because our experience was all positive to the extent we used the hotel. That's not to say its a five-star hotel - it's not. It's more of a four-star, but we found nothing on the negative during the stay, hence no deductions of review stars. Arrival - Valet was easy, and got an early check in because we arrived early (arrived at 10 a.m., got into the room at noon, standard check-in time is 4 p.m.). Hotel staff stored our bags between arrival and actual check in. We took a walk to Rockefeller Plaza while waiting, and they called us to let us know when the room was ready. When we returned, the bags were already in the room. The room itself was clean and comfortable, with a great bathroom - large shower *and* a tub. No quirks with the TV, and the view was nice from the 35th floor. We had breakfast at the restaurant on our last day. All good. Staff was attentive to all our needs. Would definitely stay here again - half a block to Times Square and easy walking distance to trendy 5th Avenue, Madison, etc. P.S. It's a bit pricey, which is standard for NYC I guess. In terms of Value, I gave it a "Not Sure". I mean, I knew the cost, and was fine paying it, but Value is a relative term in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was perfect for our last visit to NYC. It is right in Times Square, but down the street a bit so you just have to walk a block up and there you are. This is great because while you are still right there, you don't have as much noise or lights at night when trying to sleep. This hotel is walking distance to everything. We walked from Penn Station with luggage and walked to the trains everyday during our trip, so easy to get around! There are restaurants all around you and shopping as well. The hotel was also very comfortable, clean, and quiet. The bathroom was really nice and updated. Bed was comfortable. We truly enjoyed and would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt at Times Square is a very conveniently located property offering great service, great rooms and consistent service. This is my preferred hotel in the city. Not the richest food offering but what they have is really good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Family of 4 stayed. The room was a decent size and modern. The reception staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our room faced the Barclays build on the 43rd floor. Nice.Based on its location, it's an area of clam ( when in your room ) compared to the madness outside. Book a room at the higher levels and it is quieter and get used to the lifts issue - it's a tall building !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room was small but really clean. We were able to check in before noon. Staff was really nice. Roof top bar was nice with a great view but VERY expensive. The restaurant in the lobby had really good food. The location was near Times Square and there was a festival in the am on the street so it was closed to traffic. Lots of great things to do around the hotel. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights to celebrate my 30th birthday. Whilst the hotel is in a great location, the room comfortable and I would definitely stay here again I was slightly disappointed with the service we received.We paid for an upgrade to a King City View Room. My boyfriend emailed the hotel beforehand twice (they didn't respond to the first email) and we were assured we were to be given "the highest floor possible". Upon arrival we were given a room on the 22nd floor. There are 50+ floors in this hotel - so I'm not convinced the 22nd floor was the "highest" floor we were able to be situated in, especially reading some of the reviews here and given we were there for a special occasion.I have stayed in numerous hotels and felt the personal touch was really lacking here. Given it was my birthday whilst actually staying on property (and an email was sent before we arrived) I was quite surprised for a brand like Hyatt nothing was done to acknowledge this. Not sure if that's standard practice or not?The rooftop bar is great, however, be prepared to wait a while for the lifts. The lady who works up there was a great host, the drinks however are very expensive.The room was also extremely hot. The duvet is VERY heavy so even with the air con blasting at full volume all night we both still woke up feeling very sticky. Of course, opening the window is not really an option due to street noise.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a great trip. There is so much to do and see. The hotel was very convenient. The staff was very helpful. Easy access to cabs, subway and close walk to many sites. I would recommend a visit to New York and a stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Location Was Perfect Just Off The Times Square. Big Room,Good Cleaning and Excellent service. The Bathrooms Are Spacious and Modern. Friendly Helpful Staff.Would Definitely Stay Again. Highly Recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Close to the heart of Times Square but still on a side street. Newly refurbished facilities and friendly staff. Great view from floors + rooftop bar. Expensive but that it is Hyatt and it is NYC. Def recommended! Also great deli's only a couple of meters up the street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed one night on my way back to Toronto. Check in was easy and friendly. The room was very nice with some great features, particularly the lighting options. Comfortable bed, quiet room, nice bathroom but could upgrade the towels. Would definitely return

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a great location! Walking distance to everything and in the middle of it all! With Bar 54 the highest rooftop bar in the city makes this place such a treat to stay! Heated bathroom floors and around the clock room service my husband and I absolutely loved our stay here and will stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location just steps from Times Square. Rooms were clean and updated. We enjoyed the hotel and the location. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to friends/family. Wifi, fridge and bottled water were included in the price - a great bonus compared to other hotels we considered.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we booked this hotel through British Airways site after searching through Tripadvisor for feedback but also based on locality and price for our ageing parents! Young at heart the pair of them enjoyed trips to the theatre, restaurants and usual sites. This hotel is perfectly situated and has been refurbished - the rooftop bar offered good views and cocktails - though it was freezing when my parents stayed, they could still appreciate everything offered at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, excellent location, right in the heart of New York but still quiet enough for a good nights sleep. Even refunded us when overcharged by a taxi company even though they were not to blame. Would recommend to anyone wanting a great central hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Almost a year later, me and my partner stayed here for three nights in July 2015 before we started our trip across America. We arrived at the hotel little early for the check in time so we put our bags in there storage cupboard which is a well organised system as they come to the desk and take your bags off you, giving you a token for later to get them back. (Stops guests going in there & taking things or the wrong bag) The lady that checked us in was very welcoming and polite! We couldn't wait to just get out and explore New York! This Hotel is around an hour away from JFK, we hired a town car with a driver as we didn't wanna keep stopping at other hotels just wanted to get there ASAP but of course we got stuck in traffic.We came back later after our adventure out on an open top bus! I asked if possible for the highest floor possible & that's what we got! I payed that little extra for a city view room it was beautiful waking up every morning to look out from!! The location of the hotel is perfect!!!! Right around the corner from the red steps in TS!There is always a couple of guys on the door into your hotel checking your meant to be coming in here & also they managed to get us a private black jeep on departure day for a deal to Newark! They were lovely guys, very friendly and chatty. We were spoke to every time we went in or out the hotel by staff. The room had everything you needed!! Perfect size as well, there were a greetings message on the TV screen which added that touch! :) The bed was so comfy. The rooftop bar can get really busy, we had a quick look but there were no seats, it's rather small up there in terms of seating. I would return here without a doubt & highly recommend this hotel if you want a TS location!! *****

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We come to NYC at least 2 times per year, but first stay at Hyatt. The location cannot be argued, so if you wish to be in Times Square, you got it. Big rooms, good cleaning and excellent service. Free wifi and complimentary water in the room. The only thing missing for a hotel this standard are decent plush towels, that you get in other hotels.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location for business and pleasure. Close to subway stations, major tourist attractions, and to offices (center location among uptown, midtown and downtown). Spacious fitness center. Clean, simple and contemporary rooms. Staff was professional and nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I stayed 6 nights here when visiting NYC. What a fantastic hotel. The location was ideal to be in the heart of the Big Apple. Located just off Times Square, meant you didn't hear all the noise from Times Square, but was 50 yards from it. The rooms were spacious and very comfortable. Huge bed (we opted for a King Bed Room). We didn't opt for a view, because for us, its about being in New York- the hotel is literally just to rest for the next day of adventure! Checking in/out was very straight forward. The hotel has a Rooftop bar on the 54th floor. Drink is very expensive, however you do get an amazing view. Cracking view of the Chrysler Building and the One World Tower. Best time to be at the Rooftop bar is at dusk- you can watch NYC begin to twinkle with all the lights and the noise. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a central location hotel. We would definitely stay there again the next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is one of the best hotel's I've ever stayed at. The rooms, the service, the food and the atmosphere exceed my expectations. I've come here every month for the past 2 years and the quality is highly consistent. I recommend this hotel and make sure you eat at the ground floor restaurant and have a drink at the rooftop bar

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked a two night stay here for our regular trek to NYC. The hotel's location can't be beat. Right in Times Square. Although being in Times Square Means that the area is crowded with people all the time. This is of course not an issue for us. Hotel looks new. I would say the room size is larger than the average NYC room. We had the king room. Modern decor but basic. Bathroom is very spacious compared to other hotel we have stayed at in NYC. Internet is complimentary and fast. They assigned a room on the 17th floor us. No good view except forThe building next door and maybe a few of the big screens In time square. There is a bar on the 54th floor with amazing views of NYC. The only thing we did not like is that check in starts at 4pm and check out at 11am. They did not allow us to check in at a later time when we asked to check out at 12noon. First time that ever happened to us and we do travel a lot. Also when we checked in we did not feel any welcoming attitude from the front desk. We thought that maybe theywere tired for the day. Price is expected for a hotel in that location. We would stay in this hotel again mainly because of the awesome location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is about 5 minutes from Times Square!! The hotel is beautiful and rooms clean and nicely appointed. Staff is accommodating and wonderfully / quickly responsive. Lots of special touches to make the visit easy, enjoyable, and very pleasant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt for 4 night at the end of Feb.Great location just to the side of Times Square and away from the main noise. Planet Hollywood/Hard Rock I forget which was a couple of doors away and Broadway theatres very near.The rooms were excellent and I was very impressed with the security, no one got passed the guard with out showing proof of occupancy.Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love the room and service at this hotel - Hyatt Time Square New York. They offer awesome services!
