I forgot to bring hairspray for the trip and they delivered to my room with no additional charge! The location of this hotel is money! I have nothing but good things to say about my stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellant hotel, fab location .clean throughout, friendly helpful staff, lovely bars and nice bedrooms great beds and all facilities. Great stay. Would definitely stay again. Right in Times Square, no need for anywhere else

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Sensational views at night of New York, and particularly Times Square. Inside or outside the bar is a good meeting place. Attentive staff, and good bar food.The sliders are really good, along with the cheese stuffed pretzel! Located on the quieter side of Times Square, but easy to get anywhere including the subway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location was tremendous as we were able to walk to all shows and close enough to Times Square but just off the main drag. The hotel staff was very attentive and upbeat. The facility itself was in top shape and the room was perfect!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A pleasant little hotel, the rooms itself are clean spacious and the beds are very comfortable, the service was very good and there is a really good selection of healthy options of food on the room service menu, there is also a rooftop bar with great views of the city

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 4 days in March for a short break. Having been to nyc a couple of times before I wanted to be central and Hyatt did not disappoint.Good size rooms, modern and the staff were amazing. We loved the igloo on the roof terrace which meant we could enjoy the views whilst having a drink despite the freezing temperatures We are returning in September and did bit hesitate to book here Well done Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is ideally located in the heart of Times Square NYC. Location made everything very accessible, subway, resturants and shopping were just steps away. Rooms are well apointed and with only 11 rooms/floor the hotel is extremely quiet. Staff was friendly and accomodating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a real find. The staff was great from early check in, to leaving 6 bags for hours, to providing information, etc. The only exception was the doorman, who when I told him I needed a taxi, totally ignored me for other guests in fancy cars valet parking. But that aside, everyone was warm and welcoming.The room was spacious by NYC standards. I loved the female amenities from the makeup mirror to the shower ledge to rest your leg while shaving. The Starbucks in-room coffee was another nice perk.However, there were no top sheets on the bed!! Just a fitted sheet and a comforter. Now I am always warm and never sleep under lots of bedding so this was a real problem. I have never ( and I travel extensively for work) been a hotel without a top sheet. The bed was a bit hard as it is one of those platform beds, so no box springs. There was a fridge and safe in the room.Now the roof top bar was beautiful, not cheap (glass of wine about $16) , but worth it!! You can sit inside or out. You MUST go if you are there. It wasn't clear if you need to be a hotel guest, but they did check our key before boarding the elevator after 4PM, and did ask when we entered the bar.It is a convenient location right in Times Square and across the street from famous Juniors' cheesecake.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is walking distance to the heart of Times Square. It is nestled on 45th Street and you can walk to Times Square's best attractions. There is an onsite restaurant which is great for business or family gatherings. The rooms are elegantly appointed. The bathrooms are spacious and modern. About the only thing missing is 24 hour room service. Good place for business travelers or families.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked a deluxe suite for 4 nights at Hyatt Times Square, and had a view of the Empire States building, World Trade Centre, and the bright lights of Times Square. The staff are friendly and helpful. Never felt the hotel was overbooked, and it was very quiet. Many of the major tourist destinations are within walking distance, just make sure you get a map and familiarise yourself with how roads are laid out and numbered. If you need to travel regularly via subway buy a weekly metro card, it's more cost effective. For the more popular destinations go before 12 noon, after that be prepared to queue or wade through hoards of slow moving tourists. Didn't use cabs, so can't really comment other than traffic always seemed slow moving so I can only imagine how expensive journeys might be. Delis were cheaper to eat at than restaurants, but I found the restaurant prices were about the same, particularly for breakfast. Really pleased with the location and recommend the hotel, it's central and easy to get to.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel, particularly for NYC. If you read my other reviews, rather than provide my opinion, I try and give some information that I think would be helpful and is not otherwise easy to find. This hotel is on 45th just steps away from Times Square. It does have good views from higher floors...but...don't let the "Time's Square" views fool you. Its a bit of an angle and down at best. Not the entire area. That said, this makes it a great location to base a trip focused on Broadway shows. Also, being on the East side of Times Square makes it less congested than say the Marriot on the West. You are also withing easy walking distance of everything else in Midtown. The hotel is clean, and updated (by virtue of it being so new). However, it lacks quite a bit of the usual services. No room service for example. Also the hotel restaurant is relatively limited. Of course, when in NYC few eat at the hotel, but if on business that's important to note. The rooms are small/tight like many in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a native New Yorker, I tend to generally avoid Times Sq whenever I can but for a job interview, coming in from Pittsburgh, I stayed at the Hyatt, in a deluxe view room (42nd fl), and it was a nice stay. The hotel is very Euro-modern... which may explain the ubiquitous European tourist staying there. They have valet service ($65/day), and a nice rooftop bar; stay here if you want to mingle with Europeans and/or want to take in a lot of Broadway shows and have only a short stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square Hotel is a fantastic place to stay. While I was there for business, it would easily be great for couples as it is close to times square and Broadway. The modern furnishing is clean the sleek and the rooms were very quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited NYC with my Husband in March 2016. It was our first holiday without our Daughter and we had spent a lot of time researching the finer details to make this a trip to remember. Before we travelled I had contacted the hotel to request a high floor room, and they were quick to respond and accommodate my request.On arrival at the Hyatt Times Square we were really impressed, beautiful clean. modern reception with a very helpful and friendly receptionist. Even better that they had upgraded us to a room on the 45th floor, we had a great view over NYC. The room was spacious and clean with all of the amenities that you could wish for, including a Starbucks coffee machine! perfect for a quick coffee before heading out in to the freezing cold weather that we had.Highlight of this hotel is the bar on 54th floor, the views are AMAZING, not cheap (so come armed!) but totally worth every penny. LOVED the outdoor bubbles to keep warm inside and the place had a great urban vibe.I wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel to any of my friends and family, and work in the Business Travel industry so will be adding this to the top of my list of places to stay in NYC. Thanks Hyatt for a wonderful stay and sorry for the late review!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights, the location is really fantastic just off Times Square. The room was lovely, large and clean with a good size bathroom which had a bath and shower!The roof top bar offers great views but quite expensive.We only ate from the restaurant once and that was a takeaway breakfast, the staff were very rude and unfriendly, we didn't even get a "morning or hello".Don't expect to much chit chat from the staff, a couple of them though are friendly and welcoming but that's it!Would stay again. The complimentary water and coffee is a nice touch, make sure you ask reception when you want it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel. We paid for an upgrade that landed us on the 51st floor. The views were incredible. The room is NY in its size but it was very cleverly fitted out and oh so new. The bed was amazing as was the bathroom which had a separate bath and shower. The roof top bar was a bit snooty but the restaurant was excellent. Apart from the roof bar staff, everyone we met were extremely friendly and helpful. Will definitely come back one day. Hopefully this will not be edited out - Bernie Sanders was also a guest while we were staying!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the first time in which we stayed in the heart of NYC. The location couldn't have been any better. They honored my request to be up high and a view of the city. The staff was super friendly and really seemed to care about you. Almost as if you were the only ones there. I would definitely suggest this place. We will hopefully be back in the fall. If not it will be a tradition to say the least.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I got here because Grand Hyatt at 42nd had double bookings. It was a very decent alternative. I got a large room wit two double beds and amneties. Too bad it didn't have breakfast because I had to leave early. I did like the rooftop bar for a night cap. All in all happy to stay here and I came back with my family 4 months later to enjoy the view from the top.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is in a central location for a visit to NYC. It has large (for NYC), comfortable rooms with all of the amenities. It is near Times Square but enough removed that you are not in the thick of it. There is a Spa, Gym, 1st floor restaurant & the best rooftop bar with an unmatched view!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt TS a few days ago. The hotel is amazing... clean, updated and surprisingly spacious for NYC standards. The staff was super friendly and helpful and I loved that they check to make sure you are a guest before going up the elevators for added safety. We stayed in room 5302 and let me just say: views views views. Wow. The location is perfect, walking distance to all major sights and the subway is close too. Overall, we were super happy with our choice and we will definitely consider staying here again when we return to visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A comfortable enough hotel, well located for Broadway and close to various subway stations. Nothing about it made me smile particularly but no complaints. A bit soulless is probably the main negative. Next time I would probably stay a little further away from Times Square simply to avoid the crowds.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: In the heart of Times Square. Close to very good restaurants and bars. Our room was extremely clean and we had a wonderful view being on a high floor. The hotel provided complimentary water and coffee on a daily basis. Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here 4 nights from 28 April 2016. Booked as part of a British Airways package based on location and price. Location was just what we wanted for exploring the Big Apple - 100 metres from Times Square. For all of the hustle & bustle, it was very quiet and spotlessly clean. The hotel staff were all helpful and polite. Our room was a decent size and, again, spotlessly clean. Bedding changed each night. Also free WiFi. There is a rooftop (floor 54) terrace with good views, although some were aspects were blocked by even taller buildings. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was our first time to New York and it could not have been a better experience. Hyatt Time Square was the perfect location to experience all of New York city. Easy access to the Subway, Food, entertainment and right in the middle of all the Time Square action. Loved it! we will remember this trip forever.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have staying in over a dozen different hotel properties in New York. Though not a fan of the Times Square area, I found the hotel very convenient. Although it lacks the grand entrance of the Waldorf, it makes up in room size and "newness".

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I'm a native New Yorker, so it always feels a bit awkward staying in NYC, especially Times Square. Normally, I would do anything possible to avoid the area, but I had a business meeting nearby. Plus, my preferred hotel would have been the Andaz on 5th (to get Hyatt points), but that hotel's rates were double for the same night. This is a very solid hotel. Well staffed and clean lobby. Efficient elevators for the height of the building. Very nice room with optimal layout and top-notch bathroom. Comfortable bed. Nice lighting features and excellent view. Honestly, the room was far better than I expected for the price point of a large chain hotel in Times Square, which often leave much to be desired. The only downside of this hotel is the idiotic "delivery style" room service. Rather than serving you your scrambled eggs and toast on a tray with silverware, they bag it for takeout with plastic utensils as if you were going on a picnic. Regular room service is not that hard, and delivery style doesn't seem to make it much easier for the hotel. Hopefully this is not a trend in the hotel industry. I never knew how much I appreciated a plate, fork, and knife!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having spent ages considering different hotels near to Times Square we finally settled on this one and were glad we did.The hotel is right in the thick of all the action of Times Square yet in our room on the 46th floor we had a lovely quiet room and didn't hear a sound from outside. In fact in the 4 nights we stayed we didn't hear a soul in any of the other rooms around us.Room was modern, shower nice and hot. Comfortable bed. Also very good blackout curtains.The safe and wifi was free and we found wifi good and fast. There is a small fridge in the room which is handy for drinks and snacks.Housekeeping very efficient, bringing us a kettle and teabags and anything extra we wanted. We did try the rooftop bar and the views are amazing it was just a little too chilly to sit in the outside area.I would recommend this hotel, it's ideal for Times Square and not too far to 5th Avenue and Central Park either.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked stay at the Hyatt Times Square through Trip Advisor for two nights. They advertised a great price, and I booked it as non refundable...however the hotel offers the same two nights for $108 LESS than Trip Advisor...and there is not way to contact trip advisor to talk to.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms were mediocre. My room had stains on carpet as soon as you entered the room, with several large dark drops, not very comforting. Shower wall had hair on it. The absolute worst part of my Hyatt experience: the room service. No where on the menu are you told that it is actually a 'to go' service. I arrived late and ordered room service which included a New York medium rare steak, Caesar salad, and tres leche dessert. I received my meal in a 'to go' bag, in small plastic containers, with plastic silverware. Not sure how you are supposed to cut through a $35 steak in a plastic container with plastic silverware! I called and asked for at least some regular silverware - after 20 minutes of no silverware, my meat was hard and cold. I literally felt like I was a dog, who had to pick up the meat with my hand and take a bite! The salad was just as unsatisfying but I ate it for purpose of having some food to eat. The only good part was the tres leche. I have never called a hotel manager to complain about room service (or anything for that matter), but had to call regarding this experience. They reimbursed me for my meal and I asked them to pick up the meat. I was truly disappointed and disgusted with the whole experience. I had expected much better from Hyatt - and have to admit, I don't plan to ever stay at the Hyatt Times Square ever again, and I discourage others as well! 2 thumbs down overall.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is good - close to Times Square and Broadway shows. Room was nice. Concierge repeatedly failed to help us sending us to restaurants that were closed down, forgetting to make reservations for us, unable to reserve/print tickets for us, choosing subpar restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I went to spend time together after finishing a very busy tax season. We chose the Hyatt Time Square because of the location and the ease of getting to the places we wanted to go. The bartenders were all very friendly and were very easy to talk to. Front desk and Housekeeping personnel did an amazing job every day. I had left some very important things behind when we checked out, lucky for me the hotel is partners with ileftmystuff.com in order you reunite people with their belongings. I had no problem with the system, and even received a personal email from housekeeping management reassuring me that my stuff is on its way. I have sense received all of my stuff. I really look forward to retuning to the Hyatt Time Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Times Sq on West 45th Street during our trip to NYC! The staff were exceptional! It was very easy to book our trip and special occasion and the rate was very competitive with other area hotels! We stayed on the 39th floor and had a great view of Times Sq and One World Trade Center in downtown. The T45 Restaurant was very good for a light lunch and the 54 Lounge was just as good for drinks at the end of a long day! I would highly recommend staying here even if only for the convenience of being so close to Grand Central and Times Sq.!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for our honeymoon after originally booking an awful hotel and leaving.Spencer was incredibly helpful in finding us a room and ensured we had an amazing room with incredible views.We ended up with a suite which had everything you could possibly need. The beds are massive and really comfortable, bathrooms are stunning and all the amenities you could want. The room was spotlessly clean and the view was amazing.Teas, coffees and water bottles were replaced daily, room service were really helpful with any extras we wanted for our room.The restaurant downstairs does the most incredible French toast - ended up eating there every morning as the breakfasts were so good, had dinner one night and food was brilliant.The roof-top bar was lovely, beautiful views and good selection of cocktails.All the staff were really helpful and kind - cannot fault the service.Recommended for a friend to stay there, they got engaged whilst there and I contacted concierge to buy a bottle of bubbly to go in their room - they did it for free instead - such a lovely touch.Would highly recommend this hotel, amazing facilities, perfect location and lovely staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel with awesome rooms and great location. easy access to all the popular spots. The hotel is very well maintained and modern designed. Located in the hear of Times Square, but still very quiet. You can reach any of the city spots within 15 mins. Location is just unbeatable. Great for both business and personal vacation. Rooms are at the large side compared to other hotels at this price and location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I looked for a hotel around Times Sq for a while but eventually settled on an 4*/9+ Express Deal by Priceline. We were very lucky to get the Hyatt. Between location/cleanliness/service it really was just right for me and my family. We paid an extra $25 to have two beds but it was definitely worth it. A friend was staying at the Paramount at the same time. Their room was about a third of the size of ours. I have stayed in many NYC hotels and this one really did surprise me. Very bright and cheerfully decorated. If your looking for a hotel in the Times Sq area look no further.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in April. Our room was very spacious with 2 Queen size beds, lots of drawer and wardrobe space and a large bathroom. The room was very clean. We had been upgraded to a view of Times Square, which was lovely, but could be a bit noisy at night. The room had floor to ceiling windows. The staff were always helpful and polite and gave us a free breakfast and some room credit as it was my birthday. The Rooftop Bar and restaurant were apparently very good, but unfortunately, children weren't allowed in there of an evening, so we never got to go as our kids are 8 and 10. The gym facilities were very good too so we hear. Overall, the hotel was well maintained. An excellent position for great transport links and for Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is great, but be prepared that the road outside could have traffic jams at times. I had ordered an uber and the driver suggested pick up a couple of blocks away to avoid traffic. We also got off the cars and walked a block as that would be faster than sitting in the car. So if you do not mind walking, I suggest you walk a bit to avoid frustrations caused by heavy traffic.The hotel elevators can stop multiple times for other guests so expect some delays.The staff is friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were a group of 8, ( 6 adults and two children). We were all there for a surprise birthday treat as it was our daughters 40th. My daughter and her family arrived first and we arrived on the next flight.The hotel has a fine location, (if you like crowds) as its very close to times square.All staff we met working on the reception desk were at all times polite and very helpful, concierge also very helpful.Rooms are spacious and very clean, excellent gym and spa.The rooftop bar and restaurant on the 54th floor had amazing views. Food in the restaurants was ok but not amazing.Overall we had a lovely four night stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having visited NYC many times we found the perfect hotel this time. Tucked up a side street off of Times Square it was perfect. Rooms were of a generous size, well appointed and had high quality amenities. Staff friendly, helpful and always willing to offer recommendations for restaurants or places to visit. Good Irish pubs with excellent food for a quick meal after a hectic day sightseeing or shopping. Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights at the Hyatt in Times Square. The hotel was very nice and the service was excellent. We could see Times Square from our room 2306 great view and the room was large for New York Hotels. Loved our stay there and this will be my hotel of choice for my next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Let's start with the good:1. The rooms - very clean and an attentive housekeeping staff. Beds were like marshmallows, very soft and a dream to sleep in.2. The management - if there's something you don't like or something you need improvement on, tell them there and then. Don't wait until checkout and leave a review of your subpar experience.3. The bar - very nice and a very professional crew, particularly the bartenders. Choice of booze was very nice and quite a range to boot.4. The location - super close to Times Square. Incredibly convenient.5. The door staff - they are the folks to turn to when you want a cab.Now onto the not-so-good:1. The phones in the rooms - six days into our stay and calling out to an international number was painful. It took a number of attempts by staff to fix the issue.2. The front house staff - some of the folks behind the counter were a bit blasé about being there. I get it, this wasn't your first choice in careers but at least attempt to not show that in your tone toward me.3. The restaurant - really, takeaway containers for room service? Looks cheap and that you're trying not to keep your overheads down. Also, had a part of the coffee machine in my mother's coffee when we ate in the restaurant. Food was a hit some nights and a miss for the rest.4. The weird charges - charging twice on some things and confused the bejebus out of us. We were assured they were "holding charges"

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our 1st trip to New York , after reviewing hotels in the city we choose this one and what a great hotel it was , had a king room on 10th floor room 1009 , the bed was fantastic the bathroom excellent , enough to room to store all our clothes, a fridge, big tv , safe and hairdryer iron and iron board , everything u need , the only thing it did not hav was you could not hav a cup off tea only coffee making machine and coffee was supplied aswell , the view was not the best , but it did not effect our time there we hav only just returned home today after a 4 night stay if we do return to New York,we would stay here a,gain , the roof top bar was lovely but expensive other than that overall a fantastic hotel fantastic staff xx

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first trip to New York and wanted to do as much sight seeing as possible. This is a newer hotel, so it was nice and modern, very clean. The rooms were a good size and we had a beautiful view of the city. We were in walking distance to the theatres, Time Square, 5 th Avenue, NBC, Rockafellow Center and Junior's Cheesecake & Deli. Also, make sure you visit the rooftop bar (54th floor) it has a beautiful view of the city! I highly recommend this hotel.. The hotel staff were nice and friendly, too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After reviewing numerous hotels that were comparable in quality and price, we landed on this one mostly because of the balcony room option, but also because of the location and ability to get a MLife credit/Hyatt Gold points. I'll start with the pros:Good price, especially for a room w/a terrace.Great location; close to many great restaurants, theaters (on and off Broadway), and bars, and walking distance to many other attractions.Friendly, helpful staff from the front desk to the restaurant and bar, and housekeeping.Average-sized room by NYC standards at 350sf.Colorful, fun, artsy decor.Complimentary bottled water.Glass-enclosed shower w/rain shower head.Secure; they require you to show your room key when entering after dark.Restaurant, bar and spa onsite.Our request to get a room on a high floor w/views (and away from the elevator) was granted. They had us on the highest floor with a balcony.Cons:Some things in the room seemed cheap, like the shower handle (that came off the first time I showered), to the A/C control panel that flipped out and shot up to and got stuck at 80 degrees, to the phones not working. One night, we tried calling Guest Services from our room phones and cell, and their phones weren't working. Also didn't care for the tiny travel alarm clock that you could never see the time on.Rooftop bar has some of the best views in NYC, but the drinks are ridiculously overpriced, even by NYC standards. Manager seemed a bit uptight, and the music was so loud, you could barely hear yourself talk. No top sheet on the bed, so I was either too hot or too cold all the time.Strict on late checkout. Typically, we get a generous late checkout when we stay with brands that we're rewards members of. Not here. Normal is 11am and they gave us until noon. (We asked for 1pm.)Overall, the hotel met our needs and aside from the phone issue, nothing was worth complaining about at the time. Though we'll likely stay with friends next time or try one of the boutique hotels to mix it up, we would stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved the room pictured, with King bed facing wall of windows (two of which opened!) Had high-floor, Times Sq view - but really too far East to see much of the Sq itself. Bathroom was cool, but first I've seen of a "wet room" where shower door opens to a shower AND a soaking tub, separate from sink, vanity and toilet. Linens/Bed/Towels of good quality, rug was industrial and hard on bare feet. Building is a small footprint, and easy to miss - and leaves only a few rooms per floor, making the hotel seem more intimate than it is. Lobby is deceptively small for a Hyatt, and it's only utility is check-in/concierge. Sky Bar is really special - but $25.00 specialty cocktails are a but of a stretch. Gym is a cut way above most hotel gyms - which led me to use the SPOTLESS soaking tub in the "wet room" after all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for three nights last weekend. The staff was friendly, the rooms clean, and the view from the rooftop bar was amazing. The only downside were the bar prices...I guess you pay for that great view. I highly recommend this hotel if you plan on staying in the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt times square is great hotel in new York city...View from the Rooftop Restaurant at the hotel is Amazing...fitness centre is also large with modern machinery...Overall it's a fine property to stay there...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were down in NYC every three weeks for chemo treatment for my husband. The staff here made us feel like celebrities! They assisted us more than I can say. Anytime I or anyone I know visits NYC, this is where I tell them to stay.Amazing customer service!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took the family to see Springsteen in NY for my son's 21st birthday on my Gold Passport Points. Everyone involved at the Hotel seemed to know our family story and made us feel comfortable. The rooms were clean and comfy...they were attached in such a way that it felt like a suite. If you go to Manhattan you couldn;t do much better than this place

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Attention to details in the room was quite impressive...dimming lights, gentle closing doors and drawers, light in closet comes on when you open the door, alarm clock, heated bathroom floor, outlets for every kind of device, frig, safe, comfortable bedding. Roof top Bar 54 was fabulous! Great staff...gave us great recommendation for a restaurant to accommodate a party of 15. Close to all the action in Times Square. Pricey, but worth every penny!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic modern and luxurious hotel really close to times square. Beds are so so so comfortable. Rain shower head that can be switched to a handheld shower head. Light switches are also fun, a single button by the front door and by the bed can turn all lights on/off, mood lighting, nightlight, etc. The rooftop bar/lounge is a must, it has a fantastic view. Free water bottles come with the room, ask the front desk for more and they will give them to you for free (don't ask the restaurant because they will charge you). The absolute MOST IMPORTANT thing is that you check in early if you want a high room or room with a view, even if you paid extra for a view/high room. We paid extra but didn't arrive at the hotel until around 8pm so we ended up with a partial view room (still had a view, but not as spectacular as it could have been).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel in January this year. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We loved the location so close to Times Square, Broadway (this was important to us as we were there to see many musicals), The Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and other attractions such as the Chrysler building, Empire State etc. The rooms were comfortable, had a mini fridge and modern bathroom. The rooms were kept very clean and we were provided with bottle water daily. We also had free WiFi which is another important aspect for us. The view from the roof top is fantastic and recommend that you go and see it. The restaurant was great and the staff were very attentive, we had great service and enjoyed the food. We would go back to the Hyatt Times Square NY and would not hesitate to recommend it to anybody.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel directly via the hotel website. Everything was perfect for my 50th birthday celebration. The staff are all incredible and go out of there way to ensure your stay is perfect.We had 4 breakfasts and 1 dinner in the restaurant T45. We really enjoyed a relaxing start to the day, great coffee and a nice ambience. Yes there are cheaper options nearby but the food and atmosphere are not comparable. The hotel is well placed between Two subway stations so easy to get around to major attractions.The roof top bar is beautiful and well worth a visit. The cocktails are expensive at $25. Would like to see a few more Australian wines on the wine list. The view is so spectacular.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned to the UK after 3 amazing nights here. The hotel is lovely. Rooms are clean and modern. The location is perfect for so many places and only 1 minute from Times Square. The irish bar next door was perfect for popping in for a quick bite to eat after a long day exploring. Would love to return to New York and will definately stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hyatt was located just steps away from Times Square and several subway stations. It was a central place to stay as we toured Manhattan. If you're not up for crowds, skip the entire Times Square area though. There are people everywhere all hours of the day and night.We stayed 4 nights in a double queen room on the 49th floor. The room was large with floor to ceiling windows for a great view. The bathroom was nice and large with a rain shower and large tub. There were 2 closets. The desk had ports for every kind of plug/usb/hdmi you'd need. We had a mini fridge and they kept the room stocked with bottled water. We also received it complimentary at the front desk. The bar on the roof had a great view of the city. There were security guards at the front desk only allowing guests up to the rooms. The exercise facility was well stocked with a variety of machines, free weights, mats and more. They stocked it with fresh towels, head sets and water. We didn't eat at the restaurant downstairs.I'd stay here again as it was clean, the staff were helpful and professional and it was a great location for us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was in the heart of it all. All within walking distance. The hotel and accommodations was amazing! There is a lot to do and restaurants in the area. Will definitely be back here again. I'm a native New Yorker who moved away but always love being back in the city. You'll definitely love this location and hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My first visit to NYC, and it was amazing. It lived up to every expectation. The Hotel was very good, check in was seamless and the staff very friendly. We were on the 12th floor, 4 in a room which worked as we were there for 4 days. There was not much storage, only 3 drawers and enough hangers for 2 but as I say, for 4 days it didn't matter. The location was superb. We were just off Times Square, close enough to the action, but far enough away for it to be quiet.The Rooftop Bar was elegant and sophisticated, the prices what you would expect of a rooftop bar. With very good views over the City. We didn't use the restaurant attached to the hotel, for breakfast we used the Cranberry Deli, just up the road, which was did the best breakfast. Your typical New York Deli, lots of choice for breakfast or lunch, healthy options as well as traditional waffles etc. and very reasonably priced. We also went to Ellen's Stardust Diner, we got there early before the queue's started, again great place to visit. A little loud for breakfast, but nonetheless it didn't stop us from enjoying ourselves.If I were to stay in the Times Square area again, I would return to the Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was beyond happy with this hotel. It's kept so clean and the staff are so friendly and welcoming. Beautiful room, great location and the rooftop bar (bar 54) has an incredible view, you may only want to stay for one drink though as it's very expensive. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived at the Hyatt hotel on 5th of April for the start of Scottish week in New York.The hotel concierge was extremely helpful and friendly, we checked in quite quickly and went up to our room. The rooms are not large but the bed was. The room had bottled water in the fridge, which was replenished daily. The room was also cleaned to a high standard. It is a nice and modern hotel just 500 yards from Times Square. The bar in the hotel is on the 54th floor and aptly named Bar 54, the staff are really friendly and the service is excellent. Gaby and Jay are couple of hostesses who were brilliant with us, professional and friendly. The view from the balcony on the 54th floor is stunning, you look over to the Chrysler centre and all the way down to One Trade Centre. The view is even better at night when all the lights come on, a great place for some photographs. The lifts in the hotel are the fastest I have ever been on, they must be some sort of turbo lifts, fast but not unpleasant. There are normally 2 security guards, just before you go into the lifts, which is a great idea and makes you feel secure. The guards stop people and ask them if they stay in the hotel and if they answer yes, they want to see the room card. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be close to Time Square in a modern hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The best part is location. This hotel is located right next to the Time Square. If you have only few days in NYC and your primary goal is enjoying its brilliant nightlife, this is the hotels you must consider. You can literally 'walk' to many main attractions of NYC - Time Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire States Building, Central Park.. etc. Rooms are also very nice and clean. I experienced many disappointing hotels in NYC, but this one truly deserves 4 stars (or even more). It also has Free-wifi, which was pretty fast. I would say that this is one of the best value hotels in NYC.Cons: Rooms are small and not equipped with bathtub (but this is typical in NYC).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited for four nights from Aberdeen and were very pleased with the hyatt. Reception staff were welcoming, as were the door staff. A particularly positive mention to Lauren on reception ( at least i think her name was Lauren).We were given a room on the 23rd floor which had a good view.The room itself was well appointed and a good size, the beds were very comfortable. On check out they were happy to keep our bags until our flight time. We'd be happy to stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved it. So close to Broadway shows/restaurants. Short walk to Rock Center, St Patrick's, Bryant Park. Quick cab to Metropolitan Museum. Longer ride to 9/11 Museum. Easy to get cab in front. VERY FRIENDLY STAFF-doormen, security, cleaning, reception, cafe & bar. VERY CLEAN & beautifully appointed. Quiet room on 44th floor, overlooking 46th St, nice view. Extremely sensitive to noise but heard nothing from other rooms. Rainfall shower, comfy bed/pillows, lots of outlets, big TV, desk, fridge, safe. Sidewalk cafe w/great food & drinks. Rooftop bar w/great view. Two computers on 1st floor; free use for 15 minutes. Bags held before/after check-in/out. We loved it. Only a few minuses: only three small drawers in a double room. Only a desk chair. Air conditioning blows on bed next to the windows; we turned it off & opened window. Our stay was going to cost $1622, which I was splitting with my friend; however, when I checked in first, they held $2022 on my credit card, and the extra wasn't released until two days after departure. But all in all, loved it and will return. Nice to have everything so new. Only open about two years. Oh, FREE WIFI.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: our trip to the hyatt times square was perfect in all aspects, staff hotel, room, food, etc. this was our first time back to ny in over 10 years. also our first time at a hyatt. we were able to choose which room we preferred, a higher view or something closer to the lower level, we enjoyed the 10th floor suite.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic hotel booked as a surprise for husband's 50th birthday. Deluxe view king was bigger than anticipated with fantastic views. Room 4203 was spotless and cleaned each day and any requests were attended to very promptly. Enjoyed the roof top bar, food excellent there but drinks were more expensive than other venues we visited. Didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as preferred to get out and about. Would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend to others. First time staying in a hyatt but definitely not the last. Thank you for a lovely base for a memorable trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Times Square hotel. Reasonably priced. Professional and friendly staff. Very quiet and nice sized rooms. Very clean. Felt safe and secure. Could walk to anyplace. Nice restaurant (only had breakfast). Will definitely be back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at at many Hyatt's and each is unique. First the downsides - no regency club, lots of traffic out of front and a small lobby. That said - its a fantastic place to stay. Staff was great getting me in early after a red eye flight from the west coast. I had a very nice corner suite on the 52nd floor with amazing views. Given that it is NYC - rooms are small but the to room suite was enough for me. Room was quiet and staff did a great job even though Bernie Sanders was staying there and there were lots of secret service, police, etc - yet staff still treated the guest as though the guests were the VIP. Room top lounge was very nice. If you are traveling solo you feel as though you are you may be taking up to much space at a table by yourself.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a lovely spacious suite. The views were great from the room and we almost didn't want to leave the hotel. The bar on 54 had great views over the city and it was nice to chill up there in peace without hundreds of other people trying to climb over you to get a photo like at TOTR or ESB.The service was spot on. Concierge was extremely friendly and helpful in suggesting places to go and directions. Restaurant breakfast (for Hyatt Diamond) was awesome. We had a set value to spend each morning and we could choose off the ala carte menu. With the exception of 1 staff at the restaurant, most of the staff we encountered were lovely and eager to please.Location is perfect being just around the corner from Times Square, away from the hustle and bustle yet a stones throw from its amenities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I often stay at the Hyatt when I have business in Midtown Manhattan. The Hyatt is located on 45th Street, near 6th Avenue. It is less than a block away from Times Square and about a block and half from 5th Avenue. The location is great for tourists, being near the heart of the city, but also for business people. Being New York, restaurants and street vendors, practically surround the hotel. The Hyatt also has a small cafe / restaurant.The rooms are new and modern and relatively spacious by New York standards (not anywhere nearly as big as the Marriott Marquis, but certainly bigger than the Sheraton and other competing hotels). It's the typical neutral color scheme and dark wood furniture that is the trend in newer hotels. The bed has always been comfortable. The bathrooms are well appointed and have a pretty good "rain shower" directly overhead.Given the proximity to Time Square, noise and traffic have not been a problem. If one gets a room on an upper floor - there is hardly any noise. The hotel has about 5 relatively small elevators - so during peak hours (e.g., when tourists are headed out for the day) - the elevators can take some time to shuttle one from their floor to the lobby.Service has always been great when I've stayed there. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The fitness facilities are typical for a hotel of this caliber - it includes several ellipticals and treadmills and some freeweights.If one has a desire to stay near Times Square, or Mid-Town Manhattan, then the Hyatt is a great choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We book a Deluxe Queen room on the 49th floor with 460 square feet. There were 4 of us for a girls weekend and the room was plenty big. The bathroom is huge with a big rain shower and massive oversized tub. The counter are super long and plenty of room and shelves for all 4 of us. There are 2 closets in the room which is super nice. And the view was fabulous! It was VERY clean and I'm super, super picky. No dust, the carpet near the edges vacuumed all the way. The feather pillows go flat so ask for extra or request foam (which is what we did). It was cold in NYC the weekend we went but the hotel ran very warm. We actually turned on the AC and after that we were very comfortable.The staff at the front desk and concierge were all great. This hotel really deserves 5 stars, however I took off an ENTIRE star because not ONCE did someone offer to help with our bags or doors. No one is outside the hotel except security. When we got out of the cab, when we checked in...no one there. The HUGE glass doors are heavy and they do not have a doorman so no one is there to help open those massive doors. No one is outside the hotel except security. Inside to go to your room you do have to show your room key before boarding an elevator which was nice.They seriously need bellman and doorman. And if they do exist (which I never saw) then they are MIA. We stayed for 4 nights.On a good note, the view from the 55th bar is so pretty! You can see all the way to the Brooklyn Bridge, the Chrysler building at night is bright and just asking for a pic! Our view from the 49th floor was awesome overlooking Times Square just to the right.Free bottled water in the rooms which is nice. We asked for bottled water several times a day - 4 of us - and staff was happy to oblige at the front desk or via maid service.Obviously everything is at your fingertips. You can walk to 42/Bryant Park, 42nd/Times Square, or 51st/Times Square to hop on subway in less than 3 minutes. Restaurants are everywhere. Their is a eatery/deli/grab quick stuff just a couple shops down that has everything under the sun. 5 minute walk to Broadway show, 5 minute walk to Bryant Park.Free wifi with Hyatt Gold Passport and it was plenty fast to download whatever we needed and also stream.Our favorite restaurants included Shake Shack, Joe's Pizza, Home, Ess-A-Bagel, Eataly, Emporio, and Little Cupcake Bake Shop. We ate our way through NYC and would return and stay here again. Next time hopefully my hubby will be with me to help with luggage.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great central location, superb diner and rooftop bar good size rooms didnt try spas.Drinks pricey but all hotels are similar, very busy around outside but quiet in room we were on 29 th floor.2 minutes to time sq5 min to 5th aveue5 min to broadway10 min to bryant parkDo try rooftop especially around sunsetVisit soho, chelsea, highline, ground zero, little italy.Make sure you leave at least 3 hrs for return to jfk traffic is horrendous

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location and easy to access other areas. Room was pleasant although not as spacious as others we have stayed at in U.S. Bathroom very good with a powerful shower. Enjoyed Bar 54 and views were amazing - as were the prices! 25 dollars for a small and not particularly good cocktail. Had booked transfer from JFK which was appalling so suggest you take the hotel transfer by private car - it was brilliant and well worth the extra few dollars especially as our driver took a diversion through Queens which enabled us to see another area of New York.Overall, we would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my 3rd time staying at the Hyatt Times Square when I've travelled to New York for a show at the convention center. I look forward to it every time as the staff is phenomenal and meet my special requests with a smile on their faces. The rooms are impeccable and comfy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I brought my eight year old grandson to experience the wonders of NYC. The Hyatt is well located for exploring the city both on foot and with easy access to subway and bus lines. The room is quite large so you don't feel cramped when you spend time relaxing. The staff were some of the best I have encountered in all my travels. They were beyond courteous and welcoming. The ground floor restaurant is convenient, reasonable by NY standards and comfortable for a child. They prepare meals for take-out or to deliver to the room. Less stuffy than traditional room service. I would recommend this for families or friends travelling together.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of April. The location was ideal, a few hundred yards walk to the centre of Times Square. Upon arrival, the only 2 rooms that were ready for us were on the 6th floor. These rooms did not offer any sort of view which was a little disappointing. The lady in reception did say we could upgrade to a room with a view if we wanted to pay for it!The rooms however were very nice indeed. The beds was very comfortable and the bathroom was a good size with a walk in shower, no bath. This was fine for me but some might like a bath to soak their weary limbs in after a busy day sight seeing! There was a coffee machine and the front desk were happy to bring more coffee to your room upon request. The one thing that was missing was a mirror in the bedroom. The only mirror was in the bathroom!The hotel had a lovey roof top bar offering fantastic views over the city.The staff were friendly and helpful. Would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff went above and beyond at each request. They were the best resource on finding 'insider tips' about Times Square and Manhattan. Plus, the roof top tour by the manager was a very neat experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I staid there with my wife for one week, the location was amazing , the staff where great and especially Tes the Consular that helped us allot , the only thing that was disappointing was the fact that we needed to leave eventually and because of its great location we didn't had the chance to stay there for longer time everyday (we where busy walking all day and night)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Well located and rooms and entire hotel relatively new. Did not use the restaurants. Gym facilities very good and the staff were very helpful . Will stay there again on my next visit. Only down side was the people who stalk you in Times square dressed as Disney and film characters

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: location is excellent, easy to get anywhere, right next to times square, very busy, hotel is priced similar to a luxury hotel but does not feature the same benefits, all those extras you expect need to be requested, e.g. shoe horn, bath gels, a kettle and tea, rooms are comfortable and beds are big, shower is a bit of a joke, a shower curtain i'd expect in a motel not a place like this, gym was adequate, no heavy weights, kitchen was nice downstairs, al a cart, not much in the way of health choices, the granola had more sugar than oats, oh well that food in NY I guess, stayed the week, couldnt ask for much more, bar on level 54 has nice views but very expensive, guess you need to pay for the view some how.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location so close to everything in Times Square and easy access to sightseeing and landmarks. Our room was very clean and given the location it was very quiet. I would stay here again. The top floor bar is worth a try.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our 2-queen deluxe room was unusually large for an NYC room, had floor-to-ceiling windows, two closets, mini-fridge and a spa-like bathroom with separate tub and walk-in shower and plenty of counter space. Everything was immaculate. Husband used the gym every day. The swanky roof-top bar has spectacular southern views.We didn't eat at the restaurant because we were out and about. Two Irish restaurants, an Asian-fusion spot and a deli market are on the block, along with Planet Hollywood.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Paige at check in was very helpful and also Mahfuz at Lounge on 54th floor who, entertained us while waiting for empty table. I loved the room, view and bedding. Overall it was great stay and I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in a deluxe with view room. It was very comfortable and modern, we had partial views of Times Square.The hotel is situated 2 minutes from Times Square and 5 mins from the subway, giving easy access to all attractions/places to visit. You must have a drink in The Bar 54, as you probably won't experience a bar at this level anywhere else. Take a deep breath before you look at the cocktail prices, but believe me it's worth it!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Firstly, this hotel is in an excellent location! It is close to everything and the view from our room is amazing! It can get a little noisy with sirens from the street, but otherwise, it's been great.My one main criticism though, is about buying tickets through concierge. I contacted concierge over four months ago to get tickets to a Yankees game. I paid $110USD per ticket (I bought two) and had seats and everything confirmed in early January. One day prior to the game, I went to pick up my tickets. They had been misplaced. Concierge chased it up for me and told me that they were going to get my tickets reprinted ready for the game. Okay, no problem, same seats and everything, I asked? Yes, the concierge told me. So my tickets arrived about two hours before game. I took them to my room and double checked it since we had so many problems with it. They were not the same seats. Prior to heading out to the game, we went down to ask concierge about it. Firstly, each ticket was priced at $60. Concierge told me there was a brokerage fee for getting the tickets ($100!!!!!) and secondly, the seats were different because "with what happened to your tickets, we had to get the 'best available' given the circumstances". I was not happy because these tickets were not anywhere near as good as the ones I had booked FOUR MONTHS IN ADVANCE AND PAID $100 FOR SOMEONE TO GET! My recommendation is, of course, to source the tickets yourself.Other than the ticket dilemma, everything else has been pretty good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my second stay at the Hyatt Times Square and like the first one, everything was basically perfect. My mum and I met up for a Broadway trip and I arrived after a delayed flight from London to find that they'd upgraded our room to the 45th floor, which was a nice surprise (the multiple elevators are super fast and get you up and down in no time). Every bit of the room was impeccably clean, the beds were super comfy, and the room was well-stocked with coffee and bottled water. The location can't be beat as a short half-block walk puts you in the heart of Times Square (but even with all the hustle and bustle down below, the rooms are very quiet) and the hotel's restaurant is a delicious and very convenient option (and the mini-fridges in the rooms come in handy for leftovers). While we didn't spend any time relaxing in the bar/lounge on the top floor (having just eaten downstairs), the view from up top is a sight to see. You could probably stay somewhere else and pay a bit less (a very little bit, since it is Manhattan), but the great location, the super courteous staff, and the fabulous rooms definitely make the Hyatt worth the price. It'll be my go-to place to stay when next I'm in Manhattan for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived at the hotel before the stated check in time but our room was ready and we were swiftly checked into to a room. The trip was for my girlfriend's birthday and we were kindly upgraded to a room on the 28th floor with views of times square which we were very greatful for. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The Starbucks coffee machine in the room was a good touch along with the mood\night lighting. The bathroom was very modern with underfloor heating and a large walkin shower. The room more than suited us for our stay. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful the concierge arranged my return travek to JFK and also helped print boarding oasses for return journey. The one minor thing was when we checked in no one offered us help with our bags to our room ( although it was a short walk) so was not a major thing but after a long journey it would of been greatly appreciated. The hotel itself is located seconds from Times Square and has plenty of restaurants, bars and attractions located nearby I really was impressed with the location it's perfect. Bar54 located on the hotels roof is worth a visit and offers amazing views of New York.Overall an amazing stay would highly recommend The Hyatt Times Square to anyone and hopefully I will be returning in a year or so.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in the Hyatt Times Square to celebrate my partners first time in New York City, her first time in the USA, and most importantly to celebrate our 11 year anniversary. We had planned a trip to Amsterdam to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and had to unexpectedly cancel it due to illness, so we always promised we would make our 11 year anniversary trip everything our 10 year trip would have been and more. We choose the Hyatt Times Square based on an article that I stumbled across about New York rooftop bars, as views and especially outdoor high views are something that my partner and I are suckers for. Our travel agent secured us a place in Hyatt Times Square 9 months ahead of our visit and we sat back and began to look forward to what we thought would be the trip of a lifetime. Little did we know we would come back saying that this trip was the best thing we have ever done, and that we feel that our experience and stay in Hyatt Times Square was likely one that will be impossible to top, and I mean ever. I say that very seriously. We always like to meet a certain standard for accommodation on any trip, but the stars truly aligned during our stay at Hyatt Times Square, and while normally the goal is to feel as special as possible on any given trip, I would go as far as saying that I felt like the most valued and special customer during our stay here. I even joked I felt like a celebrity to my partner.Prior to arriving, I emailed the hotel a few questions, to ask if there were safety deposit boxes, times and advice for getting to and from the airport and my email was picked up by Melissa. Melissa was so immensely helpful from the start, and I told her what we were travelling to NYC for and she was so patient in answering my likely seemingly never-ending flow of questions. I also had a query about getting some craft beer from a California based company that only deliver within the US, delivered to the hotel and Melissa helped me through turning that to a reality. Weeks before we even got to the hotel, I already felt so welcome and it really just added to the anticipation of our arrival.On arrival, having taken Melissa’s advice regarding transport to the hotel we were checked into our room and discovered that we had been upgraded to a 52nd floor Corner Suite. Words can’t describe our reaction when we entered our room and saw the view the whole way to the end of Manhattan looking out our floor-to-ceiling windows. This was so immensely above what we ever expected the standard of our room to be, and unlike anything we had ever seen before. If we looked left we could see the Chrysler Building, if we looked straight ahead we could see One World Observatory at the end of the island and if we looked right and down, we were overlooking Times Square. We were speechless for a few moments and then joked, “Well, we don’t need to go up any buildings for a view now!!” Melissa had upgraded us due to the occasion and background to our trip and my partner and I simply can’t thank her enough for helping us achieve our goal almost instantly of making sure that our 11 year anniversary was everything our 10 year anniversary should have been and more.This hotel truly is the most spectacular and lavish hotel we have ever stayed in. The reception staff were impeccable from check-in to check-out, any questions we had they answered. Our room wasn’t ready on arrival (we arrived well ahead of check-in so didn’t expect it to be), and they got us in quickly and let us know even though we had gone out for a walk, when it was ready. They kept our bags secure, they showed us how to operate the excellent air conditioning and heating system in the room and they also accommodated a very last minute request to have some orange juice delivered to our room on the morning of our anniversary to make mimosas with the bottle of bubbly Melissa had arranged for our room for our anniversary. A tip for your stay – do not go home without waking up to the fresh orange juice from the T45 restaurant bar at least once, but ideally do it everyday. It is exceptional and truly got you ready for the day. The hotel also had fabulous staff on the door later at night, who would from time to time check room cards etc. to ensure the hotel guests safety. Obviously they got to know your face, and then didn’t need to ask, but this was a lovely touch that really made us feel secure.I can’t say enough about the hotels location either. Aside from getting to and from the airport, we walked everywhere, and felt as central as you could want. Times Square was literally steps away and everywhere up and down-town was within walking distance because of your location. We felt like we were at the epicentre of the city that never sleeps, but when we wanted to sleep, we just went 52 floors up into the sky, away from the sights and sounds and slept in luxurious comfort.We also spent an afternoon in T45 the hotel bar / restaurant at a window seat just people watching while I drank Amstel Light and my partner vodka and Diet Coke! Ever since we’ve left, we just wish we were back there people watching and being merry!! The hotel TV was fabulous too, the Good Morning programs and Late Night Talk Shows became my go-to programming after a day strolling about in the heart of the Big Apple, and the best part was, we had a TV in our bedroom and one in the lounge area of our suite, if we ever wanted to watch something different!!The room we were in was so spacious without being too big so that you feel far apart if you are in different areas, and the décor was so crisp, modern and clean which I completely adore. Our lounge area was comfortable and I felt like a powerful business guy counting what money we had left each day at the desk workstation while looking out over the city. The room had a spacious fridge, lots of storage space and a wardrobe that our case fit in, which really helped keep the room look tidy all the time with any mess out of the way. My partner had access to a hairdryer and the bathroom was spectacular, with a large couple’s bath and walk in shower area, which I loved using every morning. The maid service was amazing – I joked it was as if it was performed by ninjas, as we were never disturbed, and every afternoon when we came back, our room was as if we were just walking in on the first day. I’m a neat freak and love this kind of cleanliness. The room had a selection of books and magazines too which I really enjoyed reading, one of which was pointing out lots of the stuff we could see from the hotel window view and nearby stuff to add to our to-do list. We actually had a conversation about beds when we arrived home to Ireland. Now my partner and I love our bed at home, and always consider it the most comfortable bed we ever get to sleep in, but Hyatt Times Square, well, let’s just say now our bed at home is our second favourite bed to sleep in! The level of comfort in this hotel and attention to detail is just mind-blowing.We had a pretty packed to do list and got through most of what we aimed to do in NYC, all of which was walkable from the hotel. We took in Times Square, and would recommend the Hard Rock Café for food (and particularly for service), we took the Downtown Bus Tour, walked the Brooklyn Bridge, took the free Staten Island Ferry at night, visited the Body World Exhibit, the MSG Tour, spent our anniversary afternoon in Central Park and visited the zoo before heading to the Natural History Museum and so much more. For quick lunch bites, if you aren’t in the hotel and can’t go to T45, try Just Salad in the Rockefeller Centre, or there is a busy but lovely deli a few doors to your left when you exit the hotel.Our only regret is that we didn’t get the chance to have a drink at the Rooftop Bar, Bar 54, at the Hyatt Times Square Hotel. We laughed about this as it was the reason we picked the hotel. We laughed about it more when we realised that the reason we didn’t get in was because Melissa gave us a room with such a spectacular view that we could see the view we craved from our bed!! Lol! We did peek in the bar and it looked spectacular, and Max from the bar was so helpful with answering any questions I had ahead of our visit.We also never got the chance to sample Chef Nick Pelliccione delights in the hotel either, we were just so busy seeing all we wanted to see during our stay.I could write about this hotel and indeed our experience for pages and pages, but I’ll sum it up by saying that if you are visiting New York City, for the first time or have been before, I don’t think you’ve done it properly until you have stayed at Hyatt Times Square. I can say with conviction that it was the best hotel that I have ever stayed in in my life. I can in addition say that the Customer Service, and indeed personal Customer Service, that we received from Melissa ahead of and during our stay was the most professional, exceptional and welcoming that I have ever received in my life also. While making grand claims, I will reiterate that while we always like to set a benchmark when we travel that we like to beat the next time we go away, whether it be a standard of hotel, a view, etc., I am confident that the view we had from our 52nd floor Corner Suite in Hyatt Times Square is likely never going to be beaten. This hotel, and the experience surrounding it, was phenomenal.When we are back in NYC, I know where we’ll be staying.Thanks you Hyatt Times Square for everything! xx

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in room with 2 double beds. Room was large by NYC standards and had a great view. On 44th floor also meant it was quiet. Hotel has been recently updated, which was very obvious from the convenience of the room. Outlets by the bed, useful refrigerator and coffee maker. Bathroom was large with both bathtub and shower. Surprisingly carpet looked a bit worn. Looked at many other hotels and with senior discount, it was a pretty good deal. The bar on the top floor had great views, but drinks were very pricey; did not try any food. The location just off Times Square was very convenient. Could walk to many attractions and subway was also nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good hotel. Some staff need to be improved in regard of the interaction with the guests. They need to welcome and smiley faces. Overall, it is good hotel with new facilities. Also it is very close to the heart of the time square and the other activities there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I reserved a high level room and paid for a viewthe hotel is UP to 54 floorThree days before arriving I sent an email to the customer service to ask for a room with a nice view the answer was : "You are all set in a high floor room with a king size bed and floor to ceiling windows. I am sure that the view will exceed your expectations!"But when I arrived they gave me a room at the 29th floor with one of the worst view i've ever had.I had to pay an additional cost of 50$ per night to have a nice viewso be carefull if you choose this hotel !!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The entire hotel is clean, room has good size, however, it lacks a lot of things to be a luxury hotel. I would expect the slippers, dental kit, bathrobe, cotton bud etc. provided in the room, not have to ask everytime we need something. For room service, it is terrible in term of food quality as well as the foods are delivered to rooms by take away bag (just like fast food). I only ordered room service once. I don't know if it is American style all over the country, or it is Hyatt Times Square room service style. But I would expect the foods is good enough to eat and be delivered in hot plate, not in a take away bag.Our highlight in the trip is the driver recommended by the concierge (Mr. Rafael) who was kind and nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Worth paying the dollars for. Great location, only a minute walk to time square and only a 5-10 minute walk to Grand Central Station. Rooms and toilet/bathing facility are very comfortable and modern. Great spa and gym facilities also. Complimentary wifi, tea and coffee included. Great roof top bar also for drinks and a social chit chat. No negatives at all, go ahead and you will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You can't get better than staying at the Hyatt Times Square. Location is perfect for getting anywhere in Manhattan and impeccable customer service. Beds were comfortable and the room was quite large for New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I didn't get what I hoped as far as room size but the view was stunning looking right downtown through the H&M sign.Fabulous location, staff is very friendly really what I look for in a hotel. A definite place to stay if the price is decent at your time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Superb staff...no question one our best experiences with hotel staff members ever. From the moment we pulled our car up to the front door, to the moment we drove away...everyone was so helpful and friendly. Very responsive. Room was clean, very updated and contemporary. Cannot say enough. Have already recommended to friends. Will certainly stay here next time we're in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quick weekend getaway to see a show, the hotel is very clean the rooms are quite nice and the views are out of this world. The staff was courteous and welcoming. Be aware if you drove in the valet is $69 per night which is a tough pill to swallow.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 44th floor, Deluxe King View room... unbelievable! The best room we have ever stayed in with views that will last a lifetime and more! Utterly breathtaking. We only stayed for 2 nights as this was our second time to NYC on a brief detour from Orlando but wouldn't hesitate to come back in a second. Worth every single penny.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our 3rd stay at this property. Take a look at my previous reviews for more details.The fact that I keep staying here speaks for itself. I've stayed at many properties in NYC. When they stop being good, I move on. This is my "go to" hotel. The location is terrific! Close to everything. Easy to pop in for a break, change of clothes, or to drop off all those bags! The rooms are modern and clean. The view is WOW! Staff is helpful and friendly. Looking forward to the next stay! Drop me a line with any questions you might have.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is a great place to stay right in the midst of all the action! Very convenient to the Subway and all the Times Square attractions. Nice sized room especially for New York and the restaurant / bar on the top floor has fantastic views of the city. Enjoyed our stay here and would definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Prices of hotels are expensive in the middle of Manhattan, but it is certainly worth it if the hotel is in the middle of the action and you can efficiently move around without noticing that where you stay is out of your way. I only stayed here for a night transiting thru New York, but I certainly got my money's worth staying here. Lunch down at Katz's deli, Macy's, Times Square of course, 5th Avenue, and got to go to a Yankees game all in one afternoon. With the hotel basically midpoint of all these places, I got to drop by "home" for a quick breather, change, before recharging and exploring the city once again.It's not cheap, but then again, with limited time in the City, do you really want to take an hour or so going to your hotel somewhere uptown to save a few bucks?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: everything is extremely clean, the décor is great, the view (I was on the 38th floor) was excellent! Staff is friendly and very accommodating. It is located very close to Times Square - leaving the lobby you are about 1 minute from the heart of Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Awesome location for sure! This will definitely be my Hotel of choice when I visit NYC again! Front Desk Staff are very Hospitable! Rooms are clean and we'll kept. Love the modern interior! Our room had the terrace/balcony over looking the Paramount Building and Times Square skyline!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights on a family visit from Scotland. Location excellent, room on 7th floor very good and quiet as located at the back of the building. We did not use the top floor bar as daughter under 21 or the diner on the ground floor as quite expensive.Staff were efficient and helpful and as from UK offered to send up T-bags and a kettle as the room only had coffee. It was my 50th birthday and receptionist signed and sent up a card and chocolates which was a nice touch and appreciated. Only grumble was that our room was not serviced one day however this was not an issue as we were out all day and on our return we had a voicemail with an apology from the housekeeping manager.Hotel us bright and modern an an excellent choice in the heart of the city. For breakfast we visited the Red Flame Diner on 44th and Evergreen Diner on 47th both of which were excellent and well priced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned today from a 7 day family visit to New York- our first. Opted for the Hyatt when we booked as a package through British Airways several months ago mainly as it had good reviews, was centrally located and recently built. When we arrived we were checked into a room on floor 23, the view was a bit disappointing especially as I had paid extra through BA for a room with a view, however when I checked the small print from BA it seemed that floor 26 was the highest we could be allocated. However when I mentioned this to the reception staff nothing was too much trouble and they changed our room straight away for one on the 50th floor for no extra cost, the views were spectacular. Throughout our stay the staff couldn't do enough to help us, from late check outs, a complimentary bottle of wine left in my room for my birthday and the doorman walking in the pouring rain with us to the end of the street to make sure we got the correct cab to the airport. The hotel is modern and clean with nicely decorated rooms with floor to ceiling windows, 24 hour security was always present and the hotel is less then 2 minutes walk to central Times Square. We never ate in the hotel as there are 100s of eating places within a 5 minute walk and we liked trying different places for breakfast and evening meals. We did visit the sky bar on 2 occasions and it is well worth a visit.Can' wait to visit New York again and will definitely be stopping in the Hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took family (wife and 11 & 16 year old) to New York for spring break. We stayed four nights. Excellent location for sightseeing and accessing Time Square and tour busses. Hotel was well kept and fairly new. Very clean and secure. I liked the way hotel staff monitored everyone entering building.
