Very accommodating, allowed us to check luggage on last day so we could see more sights and do lunch before leaving for airport around 3:00 p.m. Great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This trip was booked as a birthday treat for my twin daughters 21st birthday, we researched thoroughly and this ticked all the boxes, 3 weeks prior to our departure I contacted the hotel to request breakfast in bed as a surprise treat for my daughters on the actual day of their birthday to make it extra special, i received 2 emails on this request firstly from the global team then secondly from the front desk manager, but nothing was fully confirmed to me by the hotel, the day after check in I then spoke to concierge on duty to repeat this request and he assured me that he would get food and beverage to address this for me...the morning of the birthday came and to my disappointment sadly the breakfast in bed did not....I went and spoke to a different concierge and expressed my displeasure of the situation, Tes the concierge was very apologetic and helpful but sadly once the event has passed its too late to be able to rectify and if tbh if it wasn't for him the review could have been far worse, so thanks Tes if you ever get to read this. This did mar our whole stay in regards to the hotel, and I expected more from the Hyatt chain. This was a real disappointment to us as we had this trip planned for almost 3 years and this hotel stood out as among the top ones in NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited Manhattan between 30 March - 4 April 2016. Hotel is very central on West 45th 6th Avenue. Swift friendly check in, clean, smart rooms, fabulous shower, floor to ceiling windows and large TV. What you see on their website is what you get.The doormen were all first class, friendly, approachable, helpful and reliable. Would love to visit again and have already recommended the Hyatt Times Square to friends and family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was out first time in NYC and picking a great Hotel for both location and service was so important. Having completed a lot of research, we chose well and this Hotel is perfect for visiting Times Square and Broadway in one direction and 5th avenue in the other.We had a deluxe twin queen bed room on the 43rd floor, views over the City and loads of space. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff including a kettle and tea (as well as the in room coffee maker). We enjoyed the ground floor bar / lounge facility most days and had a drink before or after our evening out but for views, check out the top floor bar, surely as good as many tourist attractions and the views they offer. We were travelling with a 14 year old so he could not come in with us but the staff very kindly allowed us to take some aerial views (with my Son) as we went up at 4.30pm one day when they had just opened, again, excellent customer service.Wifi was also very very reliable and passed the critique of a 14 year old boy who needs to be connected.... and unlike some hotels, was complimentary which was a nice gesture.We have nothing bad to say about the Hotel, perfect for what we wanted. We chose to eat nearby as there is a lot of choice and while drinks are expensive, I didn't think anymore so than the local Irish pubs that flank this venue.Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend to others, great job by all of the Team and thanks from a very satisfied UK family !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 6 nights at this hotel at start of April 2016 and were delighted with our decision to stay at the Hyatt.The hotel is located right in the heart of Times Square and just just a few steps lead you directly into the hustle and bustle. The hotel is only a couple of years old and it still feels new, with the facilities and our room in great condition. Rooftop bar has amazing views.Our room (4506) was located on the 45th floor on the back of the hotel, so although not the main view of times square, the view was fantastic - we could see the Rockerfeller, the Barclays building, a small view across to he Hudson and also a part of Times Square.The room itself was a reasonable size, although we stayed as a family of four in one room so it did feel a little compact with us all in it. Storage for four was also a little limited, especially after a week of shopping in NYC! As said this was more due to us choosing to book just one room and not two, and was more than manageable.The room was very clean and housekeeping each day was excellent. Beds were large and very comfortable. The temperature control was also great and quickly cooled or heated the room, the latter being most welcome given the very cold start to April. The bathroom was excellent and again spotless.The room also had a fridge and safe, and free bottled water provided daily - a nice touch.The room rate we had didn't include breakfast so we opted to have breakfast elsewhere, although the hotel option looked good . There are many good value options close to the hotel - we found Cafe Europa just round the corner on 6th Avenue to cover most bases, plus if you are prepared to venture further to 51st Street the Cafe Europa does European style pancakes (crepes) too! Staff were all friendly and helpful and printed tickets for attractions we had purchased on line. They have also been really helpful in helping us try to locate my daughter's lost soft toy we left at the hotel!All in all an excellent choice and certainly based on the rate we paid a top value hotel for its location, facilities and cleanliness. Thanks very much

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When I chose a hotel I just care about cleanliness and position and Hyatt had both qualities. It's close to Times Square and the room are really clean and comfortable. Normally I don't care about the behaviour of people at the reception but in this case I was so disappointed and annoyed. I never found so impolite and arrogant employees in any hotel I stayed. Except Walter and the guys at the security, all the other were unbelievable unfriendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right in the hearth of New York, a great place to stay - in close proximity to major highlights, with very confortable and quiet rooms. The roof top bar at 54th floor is a nice surprise with indoor and outdoor seating, to enjoy a drink and great views.. exquisite cocktails and snacks..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After thoroughly researching reviews of this and other hotels on tripadvisor I decided this would be the perfect hotel for myself and my daughter (her 21st birthday present), in terms of location and room facilities.The hotel certainly lived up to expectations. Check-in was swift and we were in our room within 10 minutes of arrival. We stayed in a deluxe queen room on the 38th floor - could hear a few horns honking early in the morning but this was to be expected; this is a large city after all! The room was extremely large with plenty of cupboard/hanging space (with iron and ironing board if needed) and had a large laptop sized safe and a small refrigerator. Beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows. The bathroom was amazing with a full sized bath and separate shower; plenty of shelving too. The room was thoroughly cleaned every day we were there. The free WiFi was a bonus! We encountered no problems with waiting for lifts - I think the longest we waited during our five day stay was about two minutes. All the staff we encountered were friendly and professional. Emails I sent to the hotel (both pre and post holiday) were responded to quickly. The location was perfect for Times Square (just a few steps away) and several of the cities attractions (we walked to the Rockefeller Centre, Empire State Building, Central Park and the Museum of Modern Art) and just a short walk away from several subway stations, ideal for exploring the city. I would have no hesitation in recommending the Hyatt Times Square and would certainly return again for any future visits to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square We were in room 2902. Room was adequate but rather small. I was somewhat disappointed with the view and noted there were (54-29) 24 floors between us and the roof. You did charge a premium for a higher floor and 25 floors below the highest floor is rather far; don't you think? As far as our housekeeper - Francis - she is great. Friendly and helpful demeanor and she kept our room tip top! Francis gets an excellent rating! Gym was adequate, clean and the equipment that I used was in good working order. Front door man Luis was top notch. Concierge desk extremely helpful. When we left at noon (thank you for an extra hour), we left our luggage at the front desk. Everything pretty good so far, except for the room value. Here it went south: When my wife went to get our bags at 1:30 while I got the car, the woman at the front desk could not have been LESS HELPFUL. She did not offer to help my wife with the bags after making her wait for me to come back with the ticket. She could have at least let my wife point out our bags and bring them to the front until I came back with the ticket! Then she let my wife struggle and offered NO HELP! Oh, did I mention that our bags are bright red matching American Tourister? My wife is not a young woman. In any event, I expect better service than that especially at your front desk! I will say the doorman went in and gave my wife very gracious help, but the woman at the front desk left a really bad taste! The rest of the staff was very good.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spent 4 nights here and experienced one problem after another. The worst was the lack of working elevators. Only 1 elevator reliably worked to service about 25 floors. In the morning, they gave tours to non-guests of the lounge on the top floor. The problem with that was they locked at the elevators so they would not stop on guest floors. I had to repeatedly call the front desk from my cell phone to tell them I was stranded because the elevator would not stop. After about 20 minutes, security would come up to escort us down in the service elevator. Other problems: drafty room, no top sheet on the bed, insufficient towels for 4 guests in the room, concierge frequently missing from his post, front desk always crowded, lobby too small for number of guest room, guest room lighting was difficult to control (there were switches that controlled all the lights in the room, but not individual lamps). While not a problem per se, I was not a fan of the modern decor - it just looked cheap.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great hotel in a great location! Ive been to NYC quite a few times and I must say this was the best hotel experience I have had in this city. Great size room with a modern WC. The reception area is very small however on arrival we were attended right away and the service was excellent. If you are looking to stay in the Times Square area this hotel is a must.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time in NYC and wanted to be close to Time Square, perfect choice! The staff was great, room was nice and clean and the beds were so comfortable made it hard getting up in the morning. Only downfall was the wait for the elevators. I highly recommend this hotel i'll be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This stay was a great experience! Extremely clean, great location, friendly personel, good food, quiet (even in Times Square) nice ammenities, wonderful shower. Close to food, broadway shows, shopping, GMA. Pay a little extra for the view, it's worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great, clean, quiet, friendly hotel in the heart of Times Square. Super location, walk to restaurants and the Theatre. The rooftop bar has a fun vibe for a nightcap. Rooms are a decent size by NYC standards and very clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a great place to stay and pop all over times square it was spacious and the rooftop bar overlooks the city and is awesome!! loved our stay and would def return. The lobby is a bit small but didnt affect anything. the work out facility is nice

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed 2 days and it was excellent. The front desk always able to solve every thing. The breakfast is payed and a little expensive. There is not enough room to have a buffet breakfast. Nevertheless all other facilities from this hotel were excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Check out the Hyatt Times Square. The hotel is centrally located but manages to provide a quiet restful sleep. The hotel may have a central Times Square location yet it has a serene peaceful atmosphere that we found very enjoyable after a late night out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Still have 3 days left, but this is a fabulous hotel, really super clean, (I always check bathroom first, and it is pristine), staff very friendly and helpful, nothing too much trouble (as with Laura on reception when checking in). T45 good quality food and professional service. Concierge and Wayne very knowledgeable and good tips. Room maids very smiley and beds big and comfortable, we got extra pillows and hangers as myself and 2 daughters in the room - one in rollaway bed which is a proper single size bed and very comfortable she says. Fabulous view from our 50th floor room, near the lift too (great) slightly small for 3, but as it is so clean and comfortable, we don't mind. Great large shower. I would highly recommend and would stay again if back in NYC. Location is also superb, 2 mins walk to Times Square centre and restaurants/theatres all within easy walking distance. Subway 5 mins walk too. All in all, just perfect (if the rain would stop!).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just arrived back from NYC and we were delighted with our stay at the Hyatt Times Square. It's located within 100 yards of Times Square and Broadway which was a brilliant place to be. The hotel was clean and tidy with a modern edge and the roof top bar (the highest in the city) was a real wow factor. If your headed to NYC, you have to stay at the Hyatt, you won't regret it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent! The location is perfect to visit Time Square, Central Park, Subway station, Nasdaq, Rockefeller Center, MOMA, etc. There are also many theaters and restaurants to visit. The hotel itself is designed elegantly and the rooms are very family-friendly. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to visit NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stay at Hyatt was awesome! Hotel is a great location. Easy walk to many sights or hop onto subway. Street noise was a bit loud with honking (New Yorkers use their horn a lot) and garbage trucks but expected in midtown. Didn't bother my sleep.We had executive suite which was a separate bedroom from sitting room. Teenage boys had the sofa bed. When we called down the desk after first night, they provided a mattress pad and extra blankets to make the bed more comfortable.If you ask, Hyatt will provide a microwave free of charge. And we asked housekeeping to provide 4 bottles of water (Free) everyday and they were very accommodating.Gym was great and open 24 hours.Wifi was excellent and elevators fast.At 10:30am each day management will take family up to top floor 53rd to enjoy the view. There is a bar up there so kids not typically allowed. My kids not into views so this replaced empire and top of Rock. Saved me lots of $$.Excellent stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked hotel months in advance on expedia.com got what I thought to be a good price for a New York City Hotel. Upon arrival I was not disappointed in the room it was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom did lack a bathtub only contained a shower which disappointed me a little bit. If your plans for a hotel in New York can wait till the last minute book it through a different website and you should get a better price. The Hotel does Supply free Wi-Fi during the course of your stay there. I would stay at this hotel again providing I could get it for a cheaper price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for one week with my family in the Hyatt Times Square. Overall a good hotel, a solid choice if you want to stay in Midtown.If you have a family, rooms have 2 queen beds instead of 2 full beds like many other NYC hotels. Staff is available and helpful, we were sent to a dirty room upon check-in, they quickly gave us a new room and gave us a free breakfast (I had to remind them at checkout, though). Room is large, bathroom excellent, nightstand drawers useless (very shallow space), but good closet space. Beds were ok, I slept well, my wife did not sleep so well.Location is great because it is a half block from Times Square yet removed from the crowds and the noise. Would return again, better than other choices right on Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent rooms and great location. The Hyatt is very close to Times Square and has an excellent restaurant next door in addition to the fine fine in house restaurant. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quietest room we ever had. Great staff. Great rooms with big screen tv, fridge, safe, and modern bath. Location is awesome - many theaters within a block. Great deli's and pubs on the street. Hotel bar on 54 has fabulous views. Really enjoyed our stay. A+++++++

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I don't have huge expectations from a hotel or the room I stay in:A comfortable bed (at least queen size);A clean bathroom that can accommodate two people getting ready;Enough space to open my bags and still move around; andA safe, central location. Having stayed twice at this brand's Melbourne hotel, and having read positive reviews of this one, I booked in for all 7 nights of our first stay in NYC. I didn't realize what a treat we were in for. To begin with, the staff were friendly and so helpful throughout our stay. When we arrived and each time we returned to the hotel, we were greeted in such a genuine way and if we needed assistance with anything, it appeared to be no problem! We were given 4702. The room was immaculate, with enough space for us and our bags, although we elected to utilize the drawers for our clothes and pop our cases in the wardrobe. The Windows opened (a real hotel treat for us!) and there was a super-comfortable, King-sized bed. The height provided a great view and probably contributed to a good night's sleep, sound-wise. I could lie in bed and see clear downtown to the Freedom Tower. Looking out the window to the right was the Chrysler building and to the right was Times Square, the Paramount building and beyond that the river and Jersey. The bathroom met my demands of being very clean and I loved the layout with the bath and rain shower being separated from the rest of the bathroom by glass partitioning.The location was ideal for tourists like us. We were walking distance to almost everything we needed and if we needed to catch a cab, Luis and his team had us sorted out in a matter of moments. Being on the doorstep of Broadway was really perfect for us wanting to catch shows during our stay. There was a restaurant downstairs that we ate at for a dinner and a lunch (both delicious) and we enjoyed the rooftop bar on two occasions where we enjoyed fantastic cocktails and a great view. Unfortunately my post-Orlando feet did not find the time to try out the spa.We both ended up with pretty bad head colds in New York but, thanks to the comfort of this hotel and our room that we returned from each outing to, we really didn't bat an eyelid!I would definitely return to and definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights with our 3 year old son. Our room was high up and had two beds. The hotel location was perfect for us, right beside Times Square!We requested a room on a higher floor and did not hear any noise from the outside.The facilities were lovely and staff very friendly.We did not use the spa, fitness centre or room service as we were out most of the time.The house keeping staff did an excellent job. Very modern facilities and the right size for us.Location wise it is a minute walk to the heart of Times Square. The hotel is conveniently located so everything you need is only a short stroll away.If we were to return to New York again this would definitely be the place we will stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had eyed the Hyatt Times Square before in previous visits to New York and was most attracted to the floor to ceiling windows. I took a chance on this trip and fell in love with the hotel and the extremely nice personnel. My room was on the 50th floor and those windows also extended into the beautiful washroom. What a view!! I loved the atmosphere, the personnel and found the price to be reasonable given other less than accomodating hotels I have stayed at. I especially liked the big tv that welcomes you BY NAME. A nice touch which exemplifies the attitude of this hotel. Personnel I met were Noah the Asst Manager and Steve the doorman/taxi getter who arranged to have a town car waiting for me when I left...with a large handwritten sign in the window with my name!! Another great little touch. The hotel is 2.5 years old and is very clean and modern and quiet. I was extremely pleased and will definitely be staying at the Hyatt on my next trip!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the reception staff, especially one young lady were extremely unfriendly,bed sheets were only changed after 3 days.i had asked for a view to the times square, but obviously this was not even mentioned at check in.the ridicolous behaviour of the lady at the reception ruined it for us and we would definitely never stay at this hotel again.Thank god there is enough variety in New York and maybe this hotel needs to realise, that only the location is not enough to call themselves a good hotel.+ rooms were very nice and modern. the location of the hotel is very good, it is literally around the corner from times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I went to Trip Advisor to find an NYC hotel for an extended weekend trip for my daughter and I. I read a number of excellent reviews specific to The Hyatt NYC Times Square and decided to go ahead and book a room. Shortly after booking the hotel room at the Hyatt Times Square, Lauren Hentschel (Front Office Manager) reached out to me and asked if there was anything she could do to enhance our stay at the Hyatt Times Square. I told Lauren that I am a single dad, bringing my oldest daughter to NYC for an extended weekend (a daughter-dad trip). In turn, Lauren arranged for a beautiful room with a great view of Times Square, a late checkout on Tuesday, and even gifted us with some incredibly delicious treats (thank you Lauren). Lauren’s hospitality before and even during our stay, was exceptional to say the least, and made our trip to NYC nothing short of fantastic. The location of the Hyatt Times Square is perfect. Check-in was quick and easy. Kimberley was very nice and had us in our room in a matter of a few minutes. The hotel is spotless, the rooms are spacious and contemporary, and there are plenty of electric outlets for all your goodies. The hotel fitness center is VERY nice - and very well equipped. You are a short walk from Times Square. Better yet, the location allows you quick accessibility to virtually every subway line in the city. I can’t say enough about the Hyatt Times Square other than I can’t wait to return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We wanted to go to Waitress (the Musical).So we choose the Hyatt for our overnight stay. A beautiful modern room with a view of Times Square.Quiet room and we loved the heated floor in the bathroom and large walk-in shower. Room enough for TWO!!Stop by the lounge on the 54th floor.Wow - what a view !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent stay. Nice, clean rooms. Great Location. Perfect gym. Free bottled water and internet. Wonderful and friendly staff. A great place to stay. Our fourth trip to NYC. Like this place best. A++++++++

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the Hyatt Times Square is a little island compared to its mammoth hotel neighbors. Yet it exudes a level of charm and warmth. The staff is genuinely and sincerely helpful no matter how small the request is. The hotel is conveniently located to shopping and the theater district. Had a very nice week in this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We found the Hyatt Times Square to be very clean, friendly and convenient to all our scheduled appointments. There was a hiccup with the elevators but the staff professionally escorted us to the service elevator and expeditiously took care of concerned guests. Twenty minutes later we checked out - all elevator issues resolved. Valet parking was a real treat since the city was so crowded over Easter weekend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel awesome location. Felt very welcome. Everyone was friendly. Clean efficient hotel. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. The restaurant was also great. We had a easy check in and check out. The staff was very helpful, The only down side was the concierge was not as knowledgeable as expected

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was upgraded to a higher floor, the bathroom was great, but the chair provided to sit on was uncomfortable to say the least... What will get me to comeback is the people there, they are great... The food was good, but what's with not peeling an onion...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a week with some friends. We shared a large room without any problems. A must is to visit the roof top bar but a drink is not a must since they have a policy for a minimum of 2 drinks and they cost $20 each.The location could not be better if you want to get the feeling of beeing in the middle of things. Very good transportations is possible and the hotel also helps to arrange tranfser to the airport.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Ok have a lot to say about this Hotel which i finalized almost at the last moment..This is one of the best properties in a city i have stayed so far in terms of the LOCATION,SERVICE, HOSPITALITY AND the most Important THE ROOM SIZE..It is always a big question where to place yourselves in a city as you always end up in a good hotel with small room which is never a value for money and service is the last thing you would be looking for...1. The Hyatt is practically in Times Square.2. They have a very helpful concierge service.3. Room Service is impeccable.4. Any form of transport is Easily Available just outside the Hotel.5. The rooms are very clean and well furnished.Couldn't have asked for more and at last all the food joints are also around this Hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are offered anything including points on your gold passport loyalty card, GET IT IN WRITING.The customer service is great until you have an issue then its SHOCKING. Or should I say lack of customer service, they fob you off.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took a quick two night getaway trip to see a couple Broadway plays with my gf. Arrived late afternoon with our first musical booked for 7pm. At check-in asked the reception desk clerk for a decent restaurant. He personally escorted us to the concierge desk where we were asked what type of food we wanted. The concierge listened, asked where our play was (Lincoln Center), made a recommendation, and booked us at The Smith, which is directly across the street from LC. Our steaks were fabulous and we easily made it to our event.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent a week here in a suite on the 52nd floor for my birthday. It was an amazing experience we will never forget.On arriving at the hotel quite late in the day after a horrible delay in immigration control at JFK we were greeted warmly and checked in very swiftly. I think the reception staff sense how exhausted we were.When we arrived in our room there was a bunch of a dozen long stem red roses and a chocolate birthday cake for me which hubby had asked the hotel to arrange. They were totally beautiful and the cake tasted amazing.The suite was good if a little basic. I've stayed in some wonderful hotels and given how much we paid I would say this is only just ok for the money we paid. The bathroom was large and we had a separate lounge and bedroom which was helpful when dealing with jet lag.Despite being so high up the noise from Times Sq was still clearly audible. It also meant that the moment you left the hotel you were in the thick of it. So if you're looking for somewhere VERY close to the action this is great, but I think if you want a quiet retreat from the craziness of Manhattan then it's is perhaps not the right choice. I would say not to bother too much with the restaurant in the hotel. There are far better restaurants just a short walk away that cost far less. We found the food wasn't brilliant and the service was a little slow the times we visited. Just a little tip, try Juniors just a 2 minute walk away for breakfast. It was way better.We did visit the roof top bar but only once. Whilst the view was amazing, the drinks were overpriced and the seating uncomfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel location is great. I had to change rooms because the temperature of the bedroom was terrible - too hot and then too cold. I literally woke up 18-20 times to readjust the thermostat. There was also a draft in the bedroom. The lights would come on by themselves at odd hours. My room was changed and the temperature issue was mildly resolved. The hotel did reduce my rate by 20% per night but I did not sleep well at all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am writing this review as I lay here in the Hyatt Time Square. It is unfortunate how uncomfortable the pillows in the rooms are. The pillows have zero body and flatten immediately when you lay on them. I call the front desk to ask for extra pillows and they suggested I try their foams pillows. After sitting on hold and waiting for them to check I was informed that all of their foam pillows are out. What's even more concerning is that, the foam pillows are in such high demand. I asked the lady who answered the phone if they regularly heard complaints regarding the pillows. I explained she must have I couldn't see how people wouldn't say anything. She confirmed and admitted they do hear complaints regarding their pillows. I personally think it is poor service to knowingly put subpar pillows in the bed. After a long day of touring New York the most important thing to me and I am sure most people is a great night sleep. The lack of quality pillows has resulted in restlessness and I am sure I will wake in extreme discomfort. Que the stiff neck. I recommend you beware before staying here if you value your rest

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quick check in and straight up to our room. The room was a nice size for a NY hotel and had everything you needed. It does have its own coffee machine which is nice to make your own drink when you wake up. The cocktail bar on the top floor is great for views and cocktails. The hotel is in Times Square but you don't hear any noise at all. It is perfect location for all siteseeing, shopping, broadway and restaurants. It has 2 irish bars either side which do good food and breakfasts also plenty of diners for breakfast. We used the subway a lot to get around and this is so easy and quick. The staff were polite and friendly. Would definitely go back and would recommend as perfect for a city break..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I visited The Hyatt over the Christmas/New Year period. I spent several weeks prior to booking checking out the hotels and finally decided on this place due to the very central location, I have visited NYC previously and stayed in the Upper East Side area which was beautiful but I found somewhat difficult to navigate around the city without using public transport or cabs ! I had an early flight from LHR, and arrived prior to the check in time which was not a problem for the staff who were great, the check in was quick and efficient which is exactly what you want after a long flight, they had our room ready. The rooms like many of the hotels in NYC are compact, however having an upgraded 'View' room meant I had a higher room (39th floor) with the floor to ceiling windows which let in a lot of light so it didn't at any stage feel claustrophobic. The hotel location is a major selling point, from leaving the hotel you could be at any of the Broadway theatres within minutes or in the heart of the action with crowds of people I found their were things going on most days, lots to see and do in the area with a wide choice of places to eat, or you can head over to Hell's Kitchen which is a short walk away.There are several Subway stations within a few minutes walk, however from my stay I would say it is a a very walkable place with Central Park 15 minutes walk, the Rockefeller Centre, Tree and Ice Rink a must see if your here over the festive period a stones throw.Fortunately/Unfortunately it was the warmest 'winter' on record so we didn't see any snow, which I was hoping for ! Lived up to all my expectations about visiting this fantastic place over the christmas periodWe went down to 'Times Square' for the Ball Drop and it was mental, security is stringent as you can imagine with people starting to enter the area around 10am as it is closed off and you are have to queue up to be checked by the police before entering the area. Great atmosphere and experience however its not for everyone as once you enter the area unless you come prepared you can't leave for food/drink or pop to the loo without leaving the area and starting the process again, so if you head down to this be prepared ! After checkout I had a full day in the city, and the hotel stored my luggage which was a nice touch.Visit the roof top bar, fantastic views to be had ! I would recommend this hotel to anyone for pleasure or business.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is in a great location. Right off Times Square on 45th. The service was excellent, from checking in/out to the cleaning staff. All kept asking if there was anything we needed to better our stay. From ice, to slippers, to a wine cork, it was all ours for the asking. A great place to stay while in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really good location, no noise, fast lifts and great rooms. All staff really helpful and its so close to time square, subway etc... Shame the roof top bar is not open for children / families but the tour at 10.30am was great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms I was given were not what I had booked despite my having called multiple times to confirm, then I was told I had no choice but to accept essentially the last available rooms and I had to stay several rooms away from my own childen.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We planned a trip to New York for Spring Break. I had a list of things that I wanted our hotel to match. The location, updated, huge windows and a awesome view. The Hyatt Times Square met all of those requirements. My husband and daughter both agreed that this being our first trip to New York, we felt the Hotel would be a part in making out trip perfect. I researched trip adviser, analyzed the review and photos of many hotels. We picked the Hyatt Times Square. We arrived at 1pm and checked in and went right up to the 39th floor to our room. We were extremely pleased, everything was perfect. Unpacked and headed out for site seeing and dinner plans.The staff was extremely welcoming, check in took 5 minutes. We will return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My friend was coming in from North Carolina and we were doing a weekend of theater. The hotel is within walking distance of most Broadway theaters and some fine eateries. The staff was very cordial even as i checked in. The atmosphere in the lobby is warm and friendly and one certainly feels welcome.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice hotelFriendly staffRooms are clean and tidy,central to most things Would return,there's a restaurant in the hotel where you could just have a coffee and chill,the staff are really friendly they were helping us with directions and giving us good advice on what to go and seeHighly recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a great location for those going to a Broadway show and Times Square. They upgraded us for free to a room with a room viewing Times Square. Everything was extremely clean, and the staff was helpful. They held our luggage until our flight, which was nice considering our check out time was noon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here in February 2016 for 5 nights. We were on holiday and was a party of 4 adults, split across 2 rooms. On arrival check-in was very smooth, the staff polite, friendly and welcoming. We were quickly checked-in and we requested that the 2 rooms were located near each other. The reception staff fulfilled that request and gave us one room on the 33rd floor and one on the 32nd. The view from the window was pretty good, we could see some of times square and the surrounding streets. The room was very clean and included a king size bed, which was very comfortable. The bed was quite firm, but that is our preference anyway (apparently it is good for your back).In the room was a safe, a coffee machine and huge tv on the wall. There were also dressing gowns, slippers, flannels, hairdryer and a fridge. There was also very good air conditioning, which ranged from around 16 celsius to about 32; so a good [temperature] range. The closet is big enough to hold all of our clothes (and jackets) and our suit cases. The bathroom had a very large shower, which had an overhead outlet or side outlet, which could be changed by the flick of a switch. The most impressive thing about the room was the underfloor heating in the bathroom. THIS IS A GAMECHANGER. If you get up in the night for the toilet, the tiles are not cold under your feet! My partner feels that I hold this in too high a regard, but honestly, it was great. It's one of those things that you don't realise you need until you experience it.I digress...The location was brilliant, right around the corner from times square. However, if you have never been to Times Square before then a word of warning: there are people trying to sell you stuff at every turn. Bus tours, comedy shows, boat tours, photos with people in costumes, mixtapes of local rappers etc etc. Being British I spent the first two days politely saying "no thank you" to everyone, but I soon learnt that it was far more effective to just walk through them without making eye contact. The WiFi is free and very good.It is around a 15 min walk to Central Park and there are several nearby subway stations to get to other part of Manhattan or indeed Brooklyn, Queens, Jersey and the Bronx.Broadway is a couple of blocks away, as is a lot of the shopping places.There are hundreds of food outlets nearby, although I would recommend heading over to Hell's Kitchen (it's the name of an area), which is on 9th Avenue, where the price is a little more palatable...There is a bar on the 54th Floor. It is very nice and offers views of the city. The drinks are over-priced, but it is worth it once or twice to finish off the evening and have a nice view of the city. There is a gym but we didn't use it.There is also a bar/restaurant on the ground floor, which we used on our last day between check out and leaving for the airport, it is reasonably priced and quite nice to relax in. All in all it was a great stay and we would stay here again without hesitation. Downsides: No tea making facilities in the room, only coffee. (however I am lead to believe that if you ask, you can get some).Late checkout is $50 per hour.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am not a big fan of Times Square (as compared to other parts of the city) but what a great spot to stay for a theater weekend. You can enjoy Times Square once and then readily walk up or down 5th or 6th Ave.to the Park, the Village and less touristy restaurants. You can leave your hotel and be at a theater in as little as 1 minute. So many theaters are close by. The hotel itself was great, the staff was helpful and very welcoming. The rooms are small (typical to NY) but our room had floor to ceiling windows and a wet room with a rain shower and standalone tub. There are some good restaurants the in the area and it was a great spot to explore all of Manhattan. I considered the Parc Hyatt but it was 3x the price and, in hindsight, we were rarely in the room and our room was just fine with a comfortable bed. Check out the rooftop bar--gorgeous views and cool igloos.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: excellent rooms and staff .secure.quiet.location good for first time NYC visit.Over st patricks day bedlam the hotel was a controlled tranquility.crowd control well done. very impressed .as good as any 5 star hotel we have stayed in.Our first hyatt stay(eat in Park Hyatt chicago frequently)but will Hyatt in the future travels

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family of three stayed at this Hotel for 8 nights. We enjoyed our stay completely. Staff were accommodating and friendly. The location is excellent and close to everything: subway, theatre, shops, and restaurants. Our room was spacious and had an beautiful, updated bathroom with two queen beds that were very comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: On arrival we were upgraded to a double deluxe room on the 46th floor - hotel is less than one year old and everything is clean and new, very modern hotel. Room was really accommodating for 4 adults - very spacious and not at all small. View was good and roof top bar - Bar 54- had spectacular views. Didn't eat in the restaurant so cant provide a review however the hotel is just a few minutes walk straight to the heart of Times Square - would definitely stay here again !...also free wifi throughout the hotel, bonus for both 21year olds who were with us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a motion activated HVAC, meaning that it doesn't do anything unless it senses someone in the room. If you are sleeping, it shuts down entirely. It can get very cold in the room at night and result in a miserable experience. This hotel had 3 elevators that served floors above the 25th floor. One was never operational and another worked only part of the time. There were lots of people waiting in line to use the 1 remaining working elevator.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for the St Patrick's Day Parade. Great location next to Times Square. You can pretty much reach all of the NYC sites from here by foot. Do visit the roof top bar, the highest in the city. Make sure you have plenty of dollars though, two drinks will set you back about 35 bucks!The staff are friendly and obliging. The rooms are modern and spacious.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent the weekend visiting Times Square and chose to stay at the Hyatt Times Square. Our hotel room was upgraded to 38th floor with a great view below. The staff was friendly and we loved that we could leave our stuff in a locked toom to explore the city after our checkout.I would recommend this hotel to anyone for pleasure or business. What can I say, we spend a great time in the world's best known square in one of its best hotels. We had a great time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Superb hotel located in perfect walking distance to Times Square. The hotel was clean and tidy and the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. I visited this hotel for my girlfriends 21st birthday and safe to say I would highly recommend to anyone who is staying in New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a fabulous hotel in a great location. Located directly off of the square, it's close to absolutely everything. It's a very easy walk to the theaters and all sorts of food are well within reach. Subways, too, are easily accessible. The rooms are nice with good space for 2. Probably a bit cozy for a family trip. The 27th floor has balcony rooms that we utilized a LOT. A tough find in NYC. The rooftop bar is great for picture ops and drinks, but skip the food. It was average and overpriced. If I had to state a negative, the lobby is tiny and gets super busy around happy hour due to the popularity of the bar. I would definitely book again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a wonderful 5 night stay at the Hyatt Times Square. The location is amazing and the service is even better. The hotel provided free wifi; valet parking; and spacious rooms for nyc. I would give it a full 5 star but the house keeping was satisfactory (I found the room was not cleaned effectively and the rooms were not vacuumed or swept daily). It was not horrible house keeping, so in fairness, I would say that the hotel is 4.5stars. There was also no doorman or anyone to help us with our bags on arrival (The front desk receptionist was nice enough to help us after our long drive, but I did feel bad asking her to lug our luggage upstairs), and valet parking did not allow in/out privileges (not sure if this is common in the city). We had an opportunity to visit the restaurant and bar 54. The breakfast at the restaurant was delicious and our server was quick to accommodate our requests. Bar 54 had a phenomenal view of the city and I am sure in the summer time, sitting on the patio would be amazing. The drinks were a bit pricey, but you are in time square on a roof top patio, so we did expect this. What truly made our stay memorable and created a total brand loyalty of us was the front staff, specifically Lauren (the front desk manager). She accommodated our needs for the rooms and went out of her way to ensure my family was comfortable and happy. We were upgraded to a beautiful room on a high floor as per our reservation. She remembered our family throughout the trip, was always pleasant and friendly to our children and continued to ensure our comfort for the 5 days we stayed at the Hyatt. I also wanted to recognize the concierge service as they assisted us in tour tickets to the empire state building and the hop on/off buses. This is a must buy at the hotels as the line ups can be horrible if you buy on the streets. During our stay we enjoyed an evening view from the rock, empire state building, WTC, memorial museum, central park and of course shopping. If you are looking for excellent dining options, check out Empire Steaks, Hakkasan, and by far the best, Balthazar (in Soho). For family style itaian, we enjoyed Tony Napoli and managed to get amazing tickets for Aladdin... I highly recommend all of the above. If you are unsure where to stays, I would totally recommend Hyatt Time Square... hopefully you will get the service we received... Please ask for Lauren.. she is amazing! I would return to this hotel. thanks hyatt time square!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very small room right in the heart of times square, very convenient to walking the square. Didn't care for the "complimentary" things (internet and drinks) that when the bill came cost 25 dollars, very uppity, if your kids came to be silly don't stay here, they'll get in trouble! (no racing in the elevators here!!) The service is great but you PAY for it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay here at the Hyatt was wonderful. I made reservations at first though the Hyatt Reservation line. However had some questions about the room and a possible upgrade. I called the Hotel myself and spoke to Josh at the Front Desk. He was so very helpful about helping me decide about the upgrade. I took my two daughters (who are in there twenty's) and am very glad I upgraded to the suite type room. Rooms are small but having a little more space for 3 of us was great, even though we didn't spend much time in the room. Our room was on the 50th floor so we were definitely away from the street noise. Never had trouble getting an elevator. All the staff from the rooftop bar, restaurant, Concierge and front desk were outstanding. I loved the location of the hotel. Easy to get to and right in the middle of everything, making it easy to catch a cab or subway. No question I would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nothing better then being in the heart of the big apple :) also claimed to have the highest open bar in New York the views are stunning to sit back and relax .Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and location proximity to times square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived from uk as a birthday treat from my lovely aunt. We were greeted outside by concierge on arrival who then took our bags.After booking in we went up to our room on the 23rd floor.Nice clean bright airy room lovely bathroom.the view was nice but very high up hotel is perfect for 7th ave where it all happens.Loved this hotel and the staff were very helpful and friendly nothing was any trouble to them would most diffently come back here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just had 9 nights here on a "bucket list" trip to NYC.Excellent location if you want to be close to theatres and restaurants. We packed so many sights into our trip and all were very easy to get to from our hotel.Room was very comfortable and larger than we expected. Slightly disappointed that we didnt have a great view, but rooms were very quiet and bed super comfy.The concierges were invaluable throughout our stay, helping us negotiate the subway, recommending restaurants and clubs, and generally guiding us on how best to get to where we wanted. Thanks so much, especially Tes, who was very helpful.We didnt eat at the hotel, instead choosing to explore lots of other food options in the city. The Cranberry deli close by was good for breakfast bagels and the Irish bars a few doors down handy for a restorative afternoon pint!We did try the high-rise hotel bar but were not offered seats with a view and felt our money was better spent elsewhere. Perhaps hotel guests could have been offered preferential seating? Only small complaint was when handymen worked on a job on our bedside tables when we had just arrived home cold and wet from a big day out exploring.Overall we would rate this hotel very highly and recommend it to anyone wanting a great midtown location, with very comfortable rooms and excellent service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Comfortable, quiet respite from the hustle and bustle, yet close to all the NYC action! Very pleasing and attractive scandinavian inspired design. All the modern updates and conveniences you would need

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our hotel experience, booked on tripadvisor. First, to note: we are a family, so our room with two queens totaled around 400 square feet, had two closets, a desk, a settee with table, and a large bathroom. The bed was hugely comfortable so we slept perfectly over our 5 nights. The elevators work well, with different sets for lower and upper floors. Our check-in and front desk experience was great, and I found everyone friendly. The empty refrigerator was a plus! We snuck upstairs to the beautiful bar (w/o teens) one night, where we had delicious drinks that were pricey but worth it. The location is good, esp. for a first time; though I tend to deplore Times Square, it was so convenient to walk three blocks to our theater show. If you decide to stay, and really like food, do some research because the area lacked immediate great food (head over to 9th and 10th or 3rd and 4th streets). The hotel lacks a huge lobby and the glamour of some hotels, but makes up for it in sleekness, modernity, and newness, which worked great for our family. The one downfall, but not enough to knock the hotel itself, was the spa experience included in my room rate--the massage experience was nothing like what a nyc experience should be like. But I can save that review for another site. So overall, very recommended, it was a nice retreat into our room in the evening and the views were fantastic as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly staff. Modern room with great design features. Great rooftop bar space.Great location to walk around! Overall very pleased with the room size for NYC.I need to know where do hotels get their lighting system and lamps with the electric outlets for phone charging from. They r pretty slick!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived from the UK for a week to celebrate my 40th, check in went well the only thing I feel was lacking was our greeting was quite cold and efficient, nothing to make you feel welcome or as if they appreciate your custom. The room was great and I can't fault the cleaning staff they did a fantastic job. The location was very central, but be warned times square is very busy 24\7 so if you prefer some breathing space possibly not the best place for you. Saying that if you don't mind busy it is central to everything and easy to get around. I would recommend visiting the top floor bar, but I felt that the cocktails weren't worth the price. We didn't eat in as we wanted to try other restaurants whilst in the city so I can't comment on the food. All in all good hotel just perhaps need to work on the check in and check out and make people feel valued and individuals.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 1 minutes walk from Times Square. Good food places all around, suiting all budgets. Hotel rooms very comfy and very clean. Quiet from all traffic noise as long as windows were closed. Only small issue is that air conditioning had a lower limit of 18.5 degrees which for me is too warm for sleep, I prefer a couple of degrees cooler. Bar54 is stunning, but beware it is costly. A beer was $12 plus tip, however it was fine for one drink and to get a couple of photos. If you want a sit down breakfast go to O'Lunneys which is is next door to the hotel. A full and very large Irish Breakfast for $13, or if you want something lighter then another door up go to Cafe/Deli Cranbery where you can select what you want, pay for it, then either sit upstairs or take back to the hotel, or eat on the go. Hyatt Times Square is in the perfect location. Free and good wifi in the rooms, only disappointment was the exorbitant cost of $50 per hour if you wanted a late departure after midday.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel is excellent. Close to many attractions, shopping; convenient to Port Authority Bus Terminal and Penn Station. The hotel is very modern and clean with a very friendly staff. Our room was well appointed and roomy. The restaurant was excellent (very unusual for a hotel restaurant!) The menu was a pleasure for me since I am a vegetarian and there were many delicious offerings. The rooftop bar on the 54th floor had a gorgeous view of the area, down to the river.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Furnishings are of high quality specifications, and bed is comfortable. Space is smaller than hoped for, but adequate for a city centre hotel.However, the best thing about the hotel is its location: 2 minutes from Times Square is nearly impossible to beat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I reviewed many hotels before picking the Hyatt. Stayed in an executive Suite so was somewhat disappointed to get a low floor since there are a limited number. Check-in was easy. The room was spacious enough for a NYC hotel as space is hard to come by. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and modern. Bathroom was a little on the small side, but hey, not that big of a deal. The hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. Right off of times square, easy walk to many attractions. Doormen were great with questions or helping get a cab. All of them were super friendly and attentive. Free bottled water was a nice bonus and didn't have a problem with Wifi. If you get a chance, check out the rooftop bar. The view is simply breathtaking, but don't look down!! Pretty windy up there. Just went up at night to get a view and order a drink. Kind of busy but not overcrowded. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is great being just around the corner from Times Sq, easy to get to all the tourist places.Staff were very friendly and helpful and polite.The rooms were spotlessly clean and had everything you need except tea bags which I'm sure if we had asked for them they would have been supplied.The rooms have a bank of different plug points and you can plug your iPhones etc in for re charging.Everything was exceptional can't find fault with anything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I can't say not one bad thing about this gem of an hotel. I put a lot of time and thought in trying to find the perfect hotel and narrowed it down to 3 as it was a birthday surprise ..needless to say, I'm extremely happy I picked this one. Here's a long and thorough review:Arrival: Check in was nice and easy and greeting was great. A nice girl in training took care of us, forgive me as I forgot her name. She went over the bar, restaurant, and the essentials of the hotel. Room: Had a king deluxe and I requested the 51st floor but we ended up on the 46th in room 4603 which was incredible! The views were breath taking and my girlfriend was blown away. Clear view of times square, freedom tower in plain sight, and the sunset over the hudson. Doesn't get any better. Room was clean, very modern, no stains anywhere, and the Bed was the most comfortable bed I've slept on at a hotel, and I had to confirm this with my girlfriend as she agreed as well. Bathroom was fantastic! Separate tub and shower and the rain shower was EVERYTHING. I just want to point out there was no water leaking onto the bathroom floor when we showered as some other guests reported. Rooftop bar: Highest rooftop bar in the city and it's amazing. If you're guests of the hotel, they'll seat you as soon as possible and they'll serve you drinks while you wait but if you have friends with you, you have to wait just like everyone else so keep that in mind. We had 8 people with us and there was a cancellation so we got right in. Be ready to spend money because it's pricey. My girlfriend and I shared a punch bowl which served 3-4 people at $69, best bang for the buck. Our entire bill was $141 which was cheap for our party and gratuity was added in. I think everyone else had beer lol. Server and everyone was attentive and friendly. Miner gripes: Being on such a high floor, be prepared to wait for the Elevators with the frequent stops. We stood there for a good 5 minutes waiting to get on. Also I emailed the hotel about the occasion and asked if they offered anything complementary and I didn't hear anything back. Not enough to dock a star, but I feel it should be mentioned. Overall: Can't beat the location, can't beat the views, this is the place to go. Plenty of Irish pubs surrounding the hotel and steps away from times square. My girlfriend was extremely pleased and even became a gold member just like myself lol. We'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel suffers from a significant staffing issue. The customer service staff have a lack of empathy towards hotel guests. Additionally, although the hotel is on the newer side, some rooms are in disrepair already (i.e. it can take 5 minutes for hot water to arrive) and the cleanliness is not up to par. If you are a tourist, you might find a good deal here. If you are a resident of the US, do yourself a favor and avoid entirely. The staff doesn't care because most of the guests are one offs. If you're a Gold Passport member of Hyatt this property will treat you like a disease. Avoid at all costs unless they are offering bargain basement prices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited NYC the week before Christmas. I cannot say enough good things about this establishment. The rooms in this hotel are fantastic with great views of Times Square. The staffs were phenomenal and seem to go the extra mile to ensure everything is perfect. We loved staying at this hotel due to its in a good location, within walking distance to Times Square & all the local attractions. It's the perfect place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took our large family (2 parents/6 kids) to NYC for 3 nights, 4 days. We wanted our children to see some of the museums, a few Broadway shows, and all the classic sightseeing spots. We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square. I was a little nervous about the location, because of potential noise. However, the hotel was unusually quiet, and we were not disturbed by noise at all. The rooms were small, but consistent with most NYC hotels. Beds were very comfortable, and everything was very clean. We really loved how pleasant and accommodating the hotel staff was to our large family. Sometimes we can be met with disapproval because we take up so much space. The Hyatt staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome every time we entered the lobby. Lots of smiles and requests as to what they could do to make our stay more comfortable. We really loved staying at the Hyatt Times Square also because we could walk to most places around the city from this central location, which helped us save on cab fares. I would highly recommend it to large families as a good place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Check in process was efficient and friendly. Rooms decently sized for NYC and comfortable. Very long list of amenities in room available to keep, borrow, or buy - pretty much anything that you could have forgotten - nice touch. Only glitch was fire alarm went off. After walking down numerous flights of steps the door to the street would not open. Several people tried it and it was only when a member of the staff came later that it was explained that one needed to get a running start to thrust open the door - what would have happened had it been a real fire?? I went to the gym for about an hour after the fire alarm had been cleared and then tried to return to my room as a fire door had automatically closed shutting off the hallway to my room and one other. I had to call down to the desk to get someone to open it - I would have thought that in the hour after the fire alarm had been cleared that staff would have gone through the building opening any fire doors that automatically close in the event of an alarm, rather than waiting to be called. Overall it was a nice hotel and the likelihood of being there during a fire or false fire alarm is small - however, my impression was that their response to a fire alarm could use some improvement.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I stayed at the hotel just for one night and we had an awesome time at the hotel with the beautiful view of the city. The staff are very friendly and was very easy to check in before arriving.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for six nights in early January, just before the big blizzard arrived. The location is great , with many attractions well within walking distance. Times Square is a few yards away, and a 10 to 20 minute walk will put you to Central Park, Bryant Park, Empire State Building, Broadway shows etc.As it was probably going to be our only trip to New York, we had asked for a high room with a view and were delighted to get a room on the 47th floor, with a view over Times Square and looking south at the One World Trade Center. Having never been in such a high building before, we had to cautiously creep up to the floor to ceiling windows to enjoy the scene. The room itself was also very impressive - massive (very comfortable) bed, large TV, large bathroom. It was also surprisingly quiet - no sound from surrounding rooms and very little noise from the streets below.The staff were all very happy and helpful (as was almost every New Yorker we met - I hadn't expected the place to be so friendly). The rooftop bar was very good - stunning views, nice ambience - yes the drinks are expensive, but they were very good and the accompanying view makes it worthwhile. We would definitely recommend staying here, and if visiting New York, January seems to be a great time to go - never had to queue at any attractions and it's much less expensive for travel and accommodation.Tip for British people - bring your own teabags - very hard to find a proper cup of tea in New York! :-)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in a great location. The rooms are nice and large enough considering that it is in Times Square, New York. I prefer the bathroom layout with no bathtub (which I really don't use). The 24 hour gym is a plus. The hotel also has free high speed internet. The lobby is area is small but who hangs out in the lobby anyway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this Hyatt on a weekend with my two daughters because we had tickets to several Broadway shows. The location of this hotel is very close to the center of everything but not noisy at all. The service was excellent and we definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in an Executive Suite, which was fairly large and nicely appointed with contemporary decor. I was told that there is just one Executive Suite per floor so being that the hotel was pretty booked, we ended up on a low floor. The location is close enough to the hustle and bustle of 7th ave/Broadway, but far enough so that when you step out of the hotel, you're not swallowed by a sea of people. The rooftop bar was nice, but it was always busy. I had asked the front desk about making a reservation for snacks and cocktails, but was told that no reservation was needed and to just head on up. Upon getting to the rooftop bar, it was packed and the host said that I should've made a reservation. Now why didn't I think of that? Anyways, we opted to go out on the very windy patio, which was standing only. Being that we were having some pre-theater champagne and wasn't going to stay long anyway, we didn't mind all that much. Overall, good stay and I'd probably stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My partner and I booked this hotel for a fun city break and were very pleased with it! The hotel is right in the centre of Times Square and has a great number of amenities such as a spa, roof top bar with incredible views and a restaurant. We had complementary internet throughout the stay and the staff we're incredibly friendly and helpful - one even wished my partner Happy Birthday in advance. I would definitely return. A few tips for the surrounding area: 1. The subway is pretty easy to use and there is a station on 42nd Street (Bryant Park) that runs trains to most popular locations. 2. We bought the Green tour bus service, however it seemed as though it was the less frequent bus route so best to take the red bus. 3. We bought comedy tickets on the strip - barter as much as you can as we ended up getting a deal for $15pp instead of $30pp. 4. Tax isn't added to the total price in most shops so bear this in mind when walking to the checkout to pay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 10 nights in February. The Hotel is modern and the room is a good size. We stayed in room 1211 in a standard king. Housekeeping was really good and the lobby staff friendly and helpful. The room had an iron/ironing board, hairdryer, bottled water, coffee maker with complimentary starbucks coffee and was topped up daily. It also had free WIFI good enough for contacting back home via FaceTime. The room also has a safe for valuables. Rooftop terrace is slightly pricey but worth it for the view, only downside is there wasn't much seating

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Absolutely gorgeous hotel! What a lovely experience from check in to check out. After an initial mix up with our room, we were taken up to the room that would be ours for the next 4 nights and WOW!! We had room 4502 and we had an absolutely cracking view!! A view of a little of Times Square and a direct view of the One World Trade Centre in the distance. Nothing was too much trouble for guest services, the room was immaculately cleaned every day, and the bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. We were asked to show our room key before getting to the lifts, so no problems there despite some previous reviews. Given the fact that it's right next to Times Square it was also very quiet. Jimmy "Director of Rooms" took very good care of us after the room error, but thank you so much to ALL the staff who all contributed to making our stay in New York feel so special, we WILL definitely be back!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is perfectly located just a minute walking distance to Times Square, 10-15 minutes to Madison Square, Macy's, Rockerfeller Centre, Grand Central Station, Broadway, Central Park and Fifth Avenue and more! The only disappointing bit was that our bathroom did not have a shower screen/door which meant our bathroom floor was constantly wet everytime we had a shower and that the water pressure was very very weak! Our room was fully stocked with amenities on a daily basis and was kept clean and spotless. Most of the hotel staff were very friendly and polite but some were rude and disinterested which made us think if whether hospitality is the right job for them. The hotel doormen were very friendly and helpful in helping us get a cab for JFK airport! I will definitely stay in this hotel again on my next visit to NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. It is a new property and everything is clean and shiny. The rooms are huge by NY standards and the facilities are perfect. I was lucky enough to get a room on the 52nd floor due to my level with the Hyatt loyalty program. The view from the 52nd floor was awesome but obviously the view from lower floors wouldn't be anywhere near as good. There is a bar on the 54th floor with an outdoor area where you can get some nice photos over Manhattan. The bar is very trendy and a little pricey but well worth a visit even if you just enjoy a beer and the view for a little while.There is a café/restaurant on the ground floor where you can get a coffee and snacks or have a seat for a meal. I found both the quality and variety of food to be good and the price to be reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We are here right now and just loving this hotel, so helpful at check in, the rooms are so big for New York, when I come back again we will be booking this hotel again The room are full of mod cons with a full size hair dryer in ours

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was there for christmas break until new year, the location is great, esp given the time of the year. I fell in love with the bed a little and lots of pillows which is super awesome because I read. It's Hyatt, enough said!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took a family trip to Midtown in late February to enjoy some Broadway shows. I normally would not stay so close to the noise and the lights of Times Square but I wanted to use some Hyatt certificates. First let me say that the staff was very friendly and accommodating. They communicated with me via email before my visit and made sure I had my choice of floor. I do not like to be higher than the 12th floor in hotels so I missed out on what I am sure are great views. We were on the 9th floor and it was NOISY. But, my fault and my choice for wanting a lower floor.There is a deli type cafe nearby that has grab and go items. We did not try the hotel restaurant as there was no need. The room was VERY clean and serviced every day. We were given 4 bottled waters every day - possibly part of Hyatt Platinum status? Plenty of towels. Floor had obviously been vacuumed. Beds showed zero signs of critters! The room was small but had two queens and exceeded my expectations.The reasons for 4 stars and not five are:Location: Too close to Times Square for me. The noise (typical NYC) but I might try a district further out next time. Street noise - the hotel itself is quiet. If you want to see Broadway shows it is terrific but I found the whole area just too much.Security: The staff was friendly but I would have liked to see someone checking keys or ID. A room key is not needed to access the elevator or floor and the lobby is on the main street level. We had friends staying in a nearby hotel who walked right up to our floor without being asked if they were guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights and could not have picked a better hotel and location. The staff are very attentative and helpful. the rooms are spotless. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Times Square. PERFECT STAY . Thanks Hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Where do I start. For the past 2 years business has brought me to NY for business week after week. I don't often write reviews for locations I stay or eat, but the Hyatt Times Square deserves another great comment. It's never easy to travel for work, especially when your family is home thousands of miles away. But the staff does everything possible to make you feel like a family member. From the staff at the front desk to the housekeeping and crew at Bar 54 everyone is so welcoming. The rooms are great, if you have ever stayed in a NYC hotel you know that space is a premium. The rooms are big have wonderful views with large windows. As for the location....you couldn't ask for anything better. The hotel location is within steps of Times Square and close to many subway lines. As for how wonderful the staff is....if I named them I would need the Hyatt Times Square full employee list as they are all great. For those adults in your party, visit the highest rooftop bar in the city at the top of the hotel, Bar 54!If you are in NYC stay here, you won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location with great views of the NYC, especially from the bar at the top. Hotel was clean & stylish. Staff friendly and helpful. I appreciate that while they don't fill the bathrooms with tons of toiletry items, (just the basics) that anything you could need or want will be brought to you promptly with just 1 call to housekeeping! Will make this my go to Hyatt for NYC from now on!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the second time I stayed here in the past year and have to say that the service is excellent. Was surprised that the room service food was as good as it was. Rooms and bathrooms are updated and clean. Highly recommend and will definitely stay here in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently had the pleasure to stay at the Hyatt Times Square. I have also stayed at a few of the other options and can say this is now my favorite place. The hotel is completely new interior. The room was quite as well. Everything was very relaxing. The guest services was very nice. The location is great for times square just a half block away. Had a great lunch at the restaurant that is in the hotel. Really enjoyed my stay and look to return again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: GREAT STAY! This was our first visit to NYC, and we came to celebrate our daughters 16th BDay. The staff had a card and sweets in the room upon our arrival, which was great. Our room was on the 44th floor(King suite) with a south view and also a Times square view. The hotel is right in the middle of Times Square and within walking distance to alot of the attractions we had on our to do list(Lion King show, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Empire State Building). We had a great time in NYC and will be staying at the Hyatt Times Square on our next trip. I would like to give a special Thanks to Lauren for upgrading our room for our daughter's Bday, and for also corresponding with me via email prior to our stay and answering my many questions. Thanks for a GREAT stay and a memorable trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had two suites (king and double queen) on the 53rd floor for a week during February, for family of four adults.We were very pleased with the arrangements and the views of Manhattan from all the room was terrific.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable (both temperature and furnishings - heated bathroom floor) and clean.The location is a perfect home base with easy access to times square metro for up or downtown travel, or easy walking. Very convenient location for shows "on broadway" too. The Irish pubs on either side are OK too if you can't venture far for a good meal, very handy.It's not a huge hotel in terms of footprint, lobby etc. If you are looking for a 'grand' hotel this is not it, but it is modern and functional.Also, because it is on 45th with other accomodation opposite and parking both sides (one way) it gets congested in terms of pick up and drop off (taxi, limo, car, whatever) despite the reserved spaces directly out the front.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
