review_body: I am a Gold passport member for Hyatt and I decided to celebrate my birthday with my family all together we reserved 4 rooms. My parents are elderly so I decided to get them room service. My father ordered the Flat Iron Steak $31USD and my mom the Kimchi Fried Rice. The presentation was awful for the steak, it was placed in a bowl, i never seen something like that I mean for a 31 dollars plate, the should do much better. My mother was pleased with her Fried rice. We went out at night to a rooftop an dee asked the front desk for a taxi, she referred us a Spanish lady who appeared to work a security. She quickly direct us to this guy who has a SUV, there were other SUV parked in front of the hotel just waiting to make a fortune from their guests. He charged us $40.00 for a run to 29th street and 5th Ave. We had a reservation so we decided to go however we were trying to negotiate the price but the driver firmly reported $40.00, in the way back we catch a taxi who only charge us $8.00 UNBELIEVABLE!!!. I think the Hyatt staff have these people working there to rip off their guest. The hotel was clean and very well located but be aware of their restaurant overpriced and unworthy. Also about their famous taxis.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this hotel on 2/26/16. From checking in to checking out everything was great. The front desk clerk was friendly and made me feel welcomed, I think his name was Jesse, if not please forgive me as he did have on a name tag and he also told me his name. My room was on the 20th floor, and the view wasn't that great but I was satisfied. My room was nice, clean and very cozy, the bed was very comfortable The bathroom and shower area were also very modern, a good size and clean. There was an empty mini fridge that you can use to stock up on your own little snacks and beverages. There's free in- room Wi-Fi which worked fine. I ordered room service and it arrived quickly and was very tasty, I must stop by the restaurant T45 to have another piece of the carrot cake, so delicious! I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, and I look forward to returning when the weather is a little warmer, and I can enjoy the rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights during February with my husband. Beautiful hotel, friendly/helpful staff. Perfect location. Cannot fault the hotel. However, I had booked this holiday as a surprise for my husbands birthday which was on February 14th. I wanted to make it extra special for him and contacted 'ebookers' where I booked the holiday from, I spoke to costumer services and explained the situation. I was told on the phone that they will request for something complimentary on mu husbands birthday and later received an email from 'ebookers' confirming ''Please be advised that as per your request we have informed the hotel to do something complimentary on your husband's birthday which is on the 14 th Feb and room on high rise floor'' I was very happy about this and looking forward to it. However nothing happened ?? I was not able to speak to reception regarding this as my husband was with me all the time. Apart from this disappointment the hotel was perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was very pleased to have a separate thermostat in the bathroom. It's nice to get out of the shower and feel extra warm. The greeters at the curb were outstanding, Walter and Steve. The concierge staff was very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location if you want to be central and midtown which we did - nice rooms, great top floor cocktail bar and excellent cafe serving quite amazing breakfast on ground floor (albeit for family of 5 was pretty expensive - charging for 'large group' as an extra! Hey we are just an average family number not a large group!Negative comments - lifts were really slow and broke down - we had theatre tickets and were trying to get two blocks in half an hour - quite stressful so we ran down several flights of stairs.And .... The absolutely dreadful greeting with our three children at 10:30pm on arrival after a 9 hour flight and a two hour transfer to be greeted with 'we allocate rooms on arrival' which is terrible pre-planning and not customer focused when we specifically requested rooms near to our children and were offered rooms 3 floors apart - night Manager was rude and perhaps inexperienced in handling our complaint. Hotel was full. Shame as we had made the request many weeks before and Hyatt knew we were coming as we had paid in full for our rooms and flights - a quick check with the airline would have notified them that we were 'in transit'. I suggest to Hyatt Hotels that you could improve the customer experience by considering families travelling with children and give them priority room allocations as they then can be adjacent or at least on the same floor. Singletons and couples can then be allocated according to preferences specified or upon arrival. Assuming you never have rooms for 5 - which you don't! Improvements suggested - train your staff to welcome guests with a pleasant greeting after their 14 hours of travelling ... Something like "Hi there and Welcome to Hyatt Hotel Times Square in New York City" would have been a great welcome!! Oh, and first impressions count so when our stretch limo from the airport couldn't pull up outside because the Linen Truck was taking up the whole front of hotel parking we weren't impressed - I suggest linen deliveries should be routed around the back of your hotel leaving the front to make the big statement to paying guests.Saying all that the concierge team were fantastic organising helicopter flights, theatre tickets to see Bruce Willis at short notice, dinner reservations at Del Friscos and Bills Burger bar and lots of other advice - they were really fantastic and we spent over £2,000 based on them securing us tickets and organising stuff that we wanted to do.Shame the welcome and first impressions were poor and we were tired after a whole day of travelling.New York did not disappoint however - it was a great trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights mid Feb. Beautiful modern clean room, comfy bed. Cot provided as well as baby towels and complimentary baby toiletries. Perfect location with 2 very nice Irish bars either side. Staff friendly. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wow, if you want to be close to the action, stay here. The hotel is about 200 feet off of Broadway(good to be away from the noise) at 45th, right at Times Square. What an experience to hang out in the area. Entertainment, bars and restautrant, shopping all within 5 minutes. The energy of the city is crazy. I love the lights, the excitement, the people. If you have never been to NYC, this is a great place to stay.The rooms are great, love the rain forest shower head. Amazing views. I was on the 24th floor.The roof top bar is great to hang out at. The drinks are a bit pricey, but the ambience is perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was drawn here after doing some work in the Chelsea area. I originally was after the views from the rooftop deck, but nature had other plans. However, the cleanliness, efficiency and vibe of this hotel was exactly what I was after to relax following a work week. Thanks to Mgr Noah and Brendan, the gopro bartender photographer, for the extra attention and banter. You should be proud of your property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked six nights in a corner suite on the 45th floor for my honeymoon. Overall, we had a great experience. When we called to request something, the guest services staff would pick up the phone and say, "Hello, Mr. Rogers, what can we do for you?" DOPE. The food in the lobby restaurant (T45 Diner) was actually pretty good. We ate there a lot and ordered room services frequently. The rooms were beautiful, the views were to die for, and the rain shower in the suite was awesome. Kinda made me hate my bathroom at home. The only thing that really bothered me was that one of the elevators was out of service for literally our entire stay, making getting to and from the lobby to our room sometimes a 10-minute ordeal. I mean, six days without repairing an elevator when you only have three to begin with? C'mon, son. Other than that, we had a great experience. Would totally stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a great stay here as we came to NYC with friends. Rooms were spacious and up to date. Bathrooms were clean and had everything we needed. Cool lounges /sky bar in the hotel. Front staff was very accommodating and friendly. Will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just completed a weekend in NYC at the Hyatt Times Square. This hotel is in the center of the Times Square action and well located for shows on Broadway. Everyone was very friendly, especially Paige at the front desk on check in. Comfortable and updated room that was well maintained. If you want to stay in Times Square, this is a really good choice. Rooms have Queen size beds, which are so much more comfortable than rooms with Doubles. My only complaint is that they do not have a Regency Club, which would be especially welcome in NYC. And don't miss the view from the 54th floor - it is incredible!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is well situated in Times Square. It is an ideal location for a tourist. The staff are helpful with any requests. There were a few unusual or undesirable features. For example, there is a slip which suggests what should be in your room eg. Shower cap, soaps etc. however on arrival our room was bare. I think maybe it wasn't prepared properly. However when I rang the desk she said you needed to ask for what you wanted from the list. This wasn't indicated on the paperwork however in fairness they did bring up promptly what I asked for. It was unusual to have to ask for bare essentials. Annoyingly I had to pay $5 for milk to be able to make a coffee with the coffee available in the room. The coffee provided is Starbucks and delicious. It was our honeymoon and this was indicated on our booking. However the hotel didnt do anything for us until we had to ask them if they did do anything for honeymooners. they then offered us a drink in the bar but then tried to charge us for this at check out. This was quickly corrected but annoying. They did give us brownies and a wine later too. Be warned the roof top bar is phenomenally expensive. Questionable whether it's worth it .Room is a lot more spacious than the Edison hotel. Where we stayed last time and was tiny. There is quite a lot of street noise from works in the area from early morning.So a good hotel, quite basic interior, but I think they need to pay attention to detail more. Have a room ready with the basics and make it clear that guests need to call if they want the items listed as already in their room. Also pay attention to booking details. It's the location, coffee and room size that makes this four stars for a tourist.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Well maintained facility. Excellent roof-top bar overlooking Times-Square. Great service and customer care. Free bottle waters and genuine care of customers staying at this hotel. Definitely will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very spacious room for the centre of New York. Spotlessly clean every day with good supply of toiletries and complementary toiletries. Great location in the centre of New York but our room on the 12th floor was very quiet. King size bed was very comfortable. Hotel staff very accommodating. Would definitely recommend to others and stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Travelled from Australia, so after flying for approximately 23 hours, the King Bed we had was absolute HEAVEN! Stayed on the 32nd floor with views of Times Square. Minimal noise from the streets below and no bother from our neighbours on our floor. Our room was extremely clean and amenities were stocked daily. We have stayed in NY before but at a different hotel, and we can confidently say the room was very spacious and the rain shower head was to die for. They even provided us with complimentary coffee each morning! The rooftop bar (although quite pricey) was definitely a unique experience complete with stunning views of the city. The hotel gym was adequate in size and provided us with the essentials for a quick workout. The computers located behind the front desk were very easy to use and had quick internet service. We were able to print our pre-purchased tickets with absolute ease and for free. The in-room free wifi worked perfectly and the room was always at a comfortable temperature, no matter what the weather was outside. Every time we returned to the hotel, we were greeted by the security and front of house staff, and they always took the time to say "welcome home". The restaurant/room service food was one of the best we had in the whole of the city! Times Square is literally about 40 metres away and access to the subway was super close and convenient. The wonderful staff even helped in organising roses and sparkling wine to be delivered to our room while we were out exploring! Travelled as a lesbian couple in February 2016, stayed 10 nights.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Four nights stay in a King view room.Can't fault the room as it was very spacious, clean, good amenities and a spacious bathroom.Was worth paying a little more for the view room as looking out onto Times Square on an evening was great, as was the sunrise and the distant view of the Hudson.Unexpected experience of a fire alarm one evening was a little disconcerting, especially looking out to see the fire engines on site, but the situation was handled very well with information and reassurance conveyed to keep guests updated.Overall very happy to recommend the Hyatt and will stay again if a future visit is planned.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at Hyatt Times Square twice. It is a very good location to visit New York and see the Broadway shows. Our family will stay again this hotel next year when we visit New York again. $65 Valet parking is a little bit high but very convenience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having stayed at the impressive Grand Hyatt next to Grand Central on our first visit to New York (from Australia) 2 years earlier, we decided to mix things up and try the Hyatt Times Square on this trip.Sadly we immediately wished we had gone with the Grand Hyatt again. While the front desk staff were very friendly, it felt somewhat less professional than all other Hyatt properties we have stayed in and they more so wanted to be your "buddy".The whole hotel had a feeling of the kind of place college students would come to party in NYC on a weekend, in fact upon getting into our room it was exactly that in the room next door with a lot of loud laughter, loud talking and music! Fortunately the staff were helpful and moved us to a different room where we didn't experience that issue.The styling of the rooms reminded my wife and I of your average airport hotel, with drab colour and décor choices, not to mention wallpaper peeling away in a property which supposedly underwent a complete renovation a little over a year prior to our stay.We stayed 2 nights out of our 8 night booking so we didn't face a one night penalty and moved to the Grand Hyatt as soon as we could. We thought we'd lift our spirits and try the rooftop bar/lounge for a drink, but ended up leaving due to the outrageous drink pricing. For the record, we are a young married couple (28-33) who don't mind paying for an upper level hotel or holiday experience, and understand everyone is looking for something different in accommodation choices. However, as Hyatt Gold Passport members we expected much more from a Hyatt property charging over $300USD per night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Small rooms, no bellman, lackluster design...the carpet looks like something out of a 1970s hotel. As diamond members, we were completely underwhelmed with the service. No club lounge, had to ask for water every night, just don't bother.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First impressions it seemed a very soulless place, minimalist design. Staff are great & all requests & questions answered promptly. Rooftop bar not very impressive so wouldn't book this hotel if that's your main attraction for you. Restaurant overpriced $6 for a takeaway tea !! Room average size, housekeeping brilliant no complaints. Great hotel if you just want to sleep & go, not so good if you want somewhere to relax & enjoy a drink or mingle with other guests.Security guys very friendly & visible

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I come to NYC often for business and find this hotel perfectly fits my needs. Location is central to the city and is close to the subway. It is easy to travel both North and South in the city. It is also convenient for mid-town locations. The gym is large for NYC and is rarely crowded. I like the buzz of Times Square and like the floor to ceiling windows which are filled with the advertising lights.Usually the pricing is reasonable for NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived a week after the storm not knowing what to expect. It was like spring! Seriously warm, and we found our thermals and thick coats too much. That aside the hotel is very nice. We originally booked a king with a view, but after checking in were appointed with a double queen, as we had our 7 year old with us. Much better, and more spacious, I was concerned whether any of us would get any sleep in one bed. We were on the 29th floor and found it lovely and quiet. Lifts were ridiculously fast, and we had no issue. Room was clean, had good temperature control and supplied all the tea and coffee that you needed as well as free bottled water. There's also a list of free items you can order if you need them. Room service was impeccable and though not needed, we left a couple of dollars tip each day, out of courtesy and left a note if we needed extra coffee etc. the bathroom was very swanky, stylish with a big walk in shower. I personally would have preferred a bath with a less posh shower over it, that's my only gripe, I never have time at home for a bath so having one on holiday is luxury for me. It was my partners 40th whilst we were there so I rang to reception and asked what they could do, Winnie replied that they could send a complimentary chocolate mousse cake up that was one serving with a candle and it would be waiting in the room the next day when we got in. We got in around 5pm the next day and there was no cake waiting. A quick call to reception whilst other half was in the shower soon rectified that and a card and cake(which was delicious) was duely delivered. Overall if you have to stay in times square(I personally wouldn't next time) then the Hyatt is a great choice. I just found the area very busy and expensive. There is a deli next door to the hotel that serves about every type of food under the sun, but personally I didn't find it that cheap. the hotel restaurant looked lovely, we only sampled a takeout Mac and cheese from there for the little one on the night we arrived, expensive but probably the best we've ever eaten! great security at all times who always greeted us all with such friendliness and enthusiasm. So a big thank you to all of them, reception and the maids who work so hard and are a credit to the Hyatt name.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived here for a 6 night stay on Saturday evening, check in was prompt although nobody seemed particularly welcoming. I had requested a room high up and instead have a room on the 9th floor, the view from our room is disappointing to say the least, there is construction going on and it's really quite noisy, especially as I have a young child.My daughter and I have a king room which is fine, but not what I would call big and drawer space is limited ( only 3 drawers) which doesn't seem adequate in my opinion.I requested a tea package from reception, which was brought to our room but then was unable to locate any milk.when I rang down to reception they said that I could get some from the store? Or wait until the restaurant opened at 6.30 am ?? after being up for over 20 hours this wasn't an option, so I went without.I've stayed in many Hyatt's over the years and have worked for Hyatt in Birmingham U.K so was expecting much more from this hotel but have been disappointed so far.On the plus side, the room is nice and clean and close to Times Square, otherwise a bit of a let down if I'm honest.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Myself + my daughter have just returned from an amazing time in New York. We have been before but never stayed in a Hyatt hotel. We arrived on the Friday night + it was snowing hard which was lovely. Arrived at hotel late, check in was quick + reception staff polite + friendly. We was given a room on the 49th floor, spacious + spotlessly clean, very modern too, which I like. We partially looked out onto Times Square with no noise from the very busy streets below. We went to the roof top bar once during our stay, amazing views over New York + cocktails very good to. You could eat at hotel if you wanted to but we ate out every day as we shopped till we dropped. Hotel is very central to a lot of the attractions which we found out by exploring. We did buy tickets for the hop on hop off bus for the days we was there but didn't need to for every day because some attractions we walked to. All in all we had a great time + will go again + defiantly stay at the Hyatt again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I visited with a family of four. Room was great. We loved the rain shower. Room was clean, decoration was a whimsical & fun. Room was also quiet. Centrally located. Staff was very helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but we enjoyed the bar on the top floor. Gorgeous view (but adults only.) I would stay there again. My only complaint would be that the beds were a bit firm, but we all slept well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I have just returned from New York having stayed at the Hyatt Times Square. The trip was organised by our daughter as it was my birthday and when she told the brilliant customer services team stvthe hotel thru very kindly upgraded us the hotel sits just off of Times Square so is a perfect location from which to explore the city. Our room was large and very comfortable and the hotel staff went out of their way to assist us and make our stay that much more enjoyable. The bathroom was also big with a separate walk in shower as well as a nice deep bath. With heated floor it really was a nice bit of tic after waking all around the city. We were on the 48th floor and the view was spectacular (ask for a high floor room when you book). New York like much of England was very cold so make sure you wrap up if your going in the dec-mar period. The city itself is a treasure of sights with so many contrasts in both the architecture and the people! We did the usual tourist bit and the best value for us was the New York big bus tour. It was $62 each but you get unlimited hop on hop buses with guides that cover up town and down town. A perfect way to see the sights if you've not been before. That said getting around town is much better on for as the traffic at times was pretty dreadful! Times Square in the evening is brilliant and if your a theatre lover you will think you have died and gone to heaven! A couple of minor issues that could annoy. All the guide books seem to stress thst you must tip as its expected almost for everything particularly in the service industry- restaurants , cabs , cafes etc. no surprises BUT what we found almost all the time was that in say a cafe, you order coffee and say a sandwich and when the bill comes they either automatically add upto %18 service charge or they print on the bill a recommended gratuity based upon the bill ; so you see 10% $ 6 , 15% 8 , 20% 12. After a while it does become a bit of a pain. There is world of difference in leaving a tip for exceptional service than being emotionally blackmailed into effectively contributing to low paid workers salary. After a couple of days we adopted a simple policy of lea bing $3 as a standard tip no matter where we were. The other thing is a bit annoying is how much you think something costs. If say you see a baseball cap shown St $ 15 you expect to pay thst. What you seldom see anywhere is that you also need to pay local and federal taxes which add in this instance another $2-3 on top!! Be aware. Cabs are plentiful and all yellow cabs are on the meter and are regulated . Be warned though the fares can go up quite a bit if the traffic is bad. We arrived and departed from Newarks Liberty airport and the fare to Time square was set by the can controller . It was I think $57 BUT you have to pay the toll booth charges there and back which were another $20. If your departing from Newarks Liberty airport they have a great range of shops BUT they don't take cash! You go to a pay point machine (much like you see in the supermarkets in the UK) where you scan your items thensy be debit or credit card. Final coment on the Hyatt Times Square. The only issue we had was that as we had an evening flight we were hoping to secure a complimentary shower and change facility we could use before our flight. The hotel were quite adamant they could not provide any such facility which forced us to pay over $ 189 (with taxes ) which seemed a bit harsh when all we wanted was basic wash and brush up factual. That aside a really great hotel which we are definitely going to back to.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this hotel. Whether you're in NY for business or vacation, this is a great hotel - Has a great vibe, rooms are modern and clean. The Spa is full service from mani/pedi, hairstyling, facials,massages, its Marilyn theme is inspiring. Love the Sky Bar Lounge. In the heart of Times Square makes it easy to get anywhere from here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was for a one night stay with my daughter and friend. They had a fun time liked the room and space. When I ordered room service they were so quick seemed as I hung up they were knowing on the door. Breakfast was placed the night before so in the AM was up and they brought it up quick and still hot.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's nice to stay in a place where people enjoy their job! The room lighting was super modern with it's preset options for mood, night time, reading, etc. The bed was perfect, the room was extremely quiet - no hallway noise, no street noise, and the gym was very well equipped.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights in Feb 2016. If you want to be close to Times Square but not feel like you are staying in Times Square, this is a perfect location. We had 2 Queen Beds and the room size was good for our family of 2 adults and 2 young children. It lack a little in terms of storage space for the 6 nights we stayed. The noise from outside was minimal and we had no issues with noise to disturb our sleep I am happy to recommend. The hotel staff were all extremely helpful and the housekeeping was excellent too. The wifi was free in all areas of the hotel and was very reliable. 2 minutes from Times Square and about 15 minute walk to Central Park

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I love this hotel. Clean and NEW. About two years old. I have stayed here many times. Very nice gym, which is clean and has lots of equipment. About six treadmills, about six bicycles, free weights, lots of room for stretching and yoga, superb gym. The gym is the key for a lot of business travelers. I wish the older hotels in NYC would get a clue on the gyms. I used to stay at Sofitel which is nearby and awesome -- but the Sofitel's gym has really run down based on a recent stay. Very good sleep quality. Showers are the rainfall kind and bathrooms a clean and bright. Quiet for sleep -- which is a challenge given NYC and Times Square outside. But it is bright -- so if you are light-sensitive bring a mask. T45 is the express diner downstairs; they do a very good job with breakfast. For something that keeps you on the hotel property, it is very practical. Not a romantic restaurant like in the Cary Grant era of hotels, but servers are always nice. If you want a more exotic (but slower) breakfast, cross Sixth Avenue to the Sofitel, which also has a great bar. But T-45 is fine and open now until Midnight. The Sky Lounge bar is nice if you make it up there. A little bit awe inspiring at 50 stories up to be open air, but you'll adjust. My only pet peeve is that I always have to provide my Hyatt frequent flyer number, despite having stayed many times. So I wish there was better tracking of return customers in the computers here. I am a big fan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square - I don't know which way Hyatt is going these days - but signing contracts w hotel developers which are not up to the usual international standard don't help brand reputation. Service was good at the reception, even so the welcome was a bit robotic in the night, overall however good. They seems to shut down elevators over night as we needed to wait for a bit when coming home late. Room was super small, like almost all middle class hotel rooms in NYC, the bathroom shower area however a waste of space, fits easily 3 pax at once! Missed that space around the bed or entree. Keep windows closed as its noisy due to some renovations next door and street excavation. Great views also from lower floors. No restaurant - only a outsourced Starbucks kind of coffee place not open 24/7. If not too high in expectation and just need a bed - go for it! Otherwise pay less and stay in Novotel or similar. Oh, Internet was free!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Close enough to Times Square to easily get around the city but 1 block off the main drag so it is quiet. Clean and comfortable rooms, staff was great. Even had a small refrigerator in the room so you can store cold snacks or drinks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt is located just steps from Times Square and most of the major Broadway show venues. The rooms are spacious by NYC standards. The front desk team and other staff members we interacted with were very friendly. The check-in was very quick, possibly too quick. It was not explained to me that they charge $100 per night to your card for incidentals and then refund what you don't use. That doesn't make much sense to me. Our suite had a good view of Times Square and everything was cleaned well each day. The rooms are looking a little worn. Although the furnishings are modern the carpets are showing wear and the finish on the furniture is also showing heavy use. That said these are small items and we would stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had high opinions of this hotel before we even landed in New York.Having been unable to secure a high floor room with our travel agents and as it was our 10 year anniversary while away we wanted it to be special. So we decided to email the hotel direct and request a room with a view.This was responded to very quickly by the front of house/reservations manager that she would be able to upgrade us free of charge to a king deluxe view room with great views.....wow what more could we ask for.When we arrived this was honoured and we found ourselves after a very speedy check in riding the very speedy lift to the 51st floor. Room 5102!! (Ears will pop)What a room...what a view!! From the bed we could admire the beautiful One World Trade building and the H&M building. From the window looking left was the 'chrysler' and to the right was Times Sq and on a morning we could see the crowd and the presenter on 'GMA'.The room was a really good size. The bathroom was lovely with bath and shower options. The amenities were all you could ask for but if anything else was needed you could request off a list.The bed was beyond comfy. Very hard to get out of, even with all of NYC to explore.Very little noise from the corridor although i think the fact that there aren't many rooms on the floor really help it stay quiet.Maids were great and whenever ever we passed them in the morning they were very polite and friendly. Reception staff although we didnt have much to do with them, did seem pleasent. And the two doormen that we saw most of the week were very friendly.The lobby is very modern and has a nice seating area.Little gestures such as lending brollys when raining.Computers in lobby and printer were handy and first 15 mins were free.Didnt use the resteraunt but im sure it lived up to the standards of the whole hotel.Location for us was amazing. Steps away from Times Sq. Very close to Bryant Park. Subway stops very close.Not far up the street was a great deli where we had breakfast most mornings.Loved the hotel so much. Would definitely return....tomorrow if we could!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Longtime checking in did not bode well for a short stay and sure enough my room did not have any of the toiletries (except for one body lotion container - no soap, shampoo etc.). The rooms are nice, great ambiance, comfortable (but should be at $ 300 per night). One saving grace is that guest services did bring me real milk for my cup of tea (instead of that powdered crap).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: During Christmas week 2015, we had a family stay in the Hyatt. We found our rooms very comfortable, the staff were wonderful and very helpful. The locations is great, just off Times Square so a number of interest points were within easy walks. The subway station was close and easy to find our way around. The in house eating was expensive, but there are a myriad of all types of eating places nearby, so this was easily fixed. All in all, a wonderful stay and we would happily stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was staying at another hotel around the corner during the big January 2016 Blizzard. The other hotel I was staying at was a little too small for our family of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids). When we realized that the city was going to be shut down and that we may be staying in NYC for a few extra days... we booked a larger hotel. We came to the Hyatt and let them know our situation. They were absolutely accommodating! They gave us a large suite and we were all so excited to have such a large room. It was a great view of Times Square and a great way to ride out the blizzard. This hotel had a nice restaurant and coffee shop. The staff was unbelievable nice and made our stay one of the best times we have ever had in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed at this particular Hyatt many times since they opened and we are Diamond members. They are always pleasant when we check in but I have always felt that nobody goes out of their way to make us really feel welcome. The "lobby security" guys cannot even be bothered to say hello when you walk by them. The hotel is only a few years old and is clean and a great location if you are looking for Mid-town. They put us in a regular room on the 35th floor, facing a large lighted billboard on the 46th street side. (So much for diamond members getting better rooms) The changing bright light seeping in at night was a bit annoying. Would suggest higher floor and maybe facing 45th street. Views from the bar on the top floor are spectacular. We do get a great breakfast included in the restaurant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Couldnt be better! Close to Broadway and easy access to Ground Zero, and other landmarks. Great Irish pubs on either side of the hotel.Will definately stay here again on next trip.Hyatt is a first class hotel and very reasonably priced.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in room 4102 - the view was amazing - try and get a high room as the views are so worth it. The room was immaculate, had a mini fridge, coffee maker, hairdryer, iron and iron board, TV, The sky bar is amazing however - the prices for drinks will make your eyes water! New York however is expensive anyway for drinks but the measures are huge. The service was excellent, the location - steps away from Times Square - so very central. Irish pub a few doors up near the deli was our breakfast choice each morning. Would I return here - you betcha!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with family just for one night when in New York for a pre-Christmas stay. We wanted somewhere central for Broadway and the sights and the location of this hotel fitted the bill.Also wanted somewhere where we could have a room that could accommodate 4 people, and once again the Hyatt obliged.Because this hotel is new (open less than a year) everything in the room looked fresh and contemporary. The design is what I would describe as "modern-funky". It looks fine at the mom went but not entirely sure how well it will age. But the room (and especially the bathroom) has all the bells & whistles one could wish for so no complaints there.Our room was only on the 6th floor and faced the street so we got quite a bit of noise, but hey you're only 100 yes from Times Square so you sore of expect that. (Go for a higher floor to have a quieter room...)The public areas in this hotel are fairly small and feel crowded at times. The lifts too suffer from under capacity - especially in the morning peaks. For a skyscraper hotel this could be an issue...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in December 2015. The location is great, and the the bar at the top has great views. Staff is friendly, the rooms clean, but a bit dated. However, value for the money is great, and we would definitively stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel with a great view for an average price. We stay on the 23rd floor and had a great side view of times square. Shower was nicer than most, with a waterfall shower head. Would not recommend eating at the hotel, or ordering breakfast to your room. Our bill for the 3 breakfast meals came to $94, and it was ice cold. If I would have known it was going to be overpriced for under average food, I would have ventured out in the freezing weather, and gotten breakfast elsewhere in the city. Some of the employees when we checked in had attitudes, and didn't make us feel welcomed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were on the 29th floor and all was quiet. The mattress was comfortable, the bathroom modern, and the view interesting. I would definitely stay here again. It was the perfect spot for a theater weekend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice for the purpose of attending one of the near-by theaters. New York City is expensive. On that basis, it is a very good value for cost. Nice wait staff in the modest restaurant and bar. Fun-looking bar on the top floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was a great value. Location is perfect. Always something to do or eat in Times Square, but about a 1/2 block away to unwind from the lights and action. It is a short walk to the subway which was very convenient. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms were extremely clean and well furnished. Bathrooms were fantastic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location easy walking distance to 5th avenue Times Square shop till you drop and just drop of your shopping as you pass hotel hotel staff really helpful with every request we had tickets to Woodbury common shopping mall ,directions Broadway tickets nothing to much trouble would recommend this hotel great value for money will be returning again on our next trip

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed there for 2 nights. For the prices of NYC hotels, it was great for the money. We got a suite, i believe on the 44th floor? (and a very fast elevator) ;) It had a HUGE balcony with amazing views. Very clean. An amazing bathroom, with heated floors. The rooftop bar/restaurant had the most spectacular views, I believe it's the highest bar in NYC. Right in Times Square, you have everything available; a perfect location. Will go back again. A very friendly staff, taxis right in front of the door. And for anyone concerned, it's not noisy at all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel is spectacular. Our room faced south on a high floor and the view of the city was fabulous. Our King Deluxe room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. As we were leaving one morning, we passed housekeeping in the hall and she offered us bottled water to take along. We will definitely plan to stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms are very nice and clean. I had a great room on the 45th floor. The view was great of Broadway. The Staff was great and even took me up to see the room I had booked to make sure it was what I wanted. Laura the general manager was great and very friendly. She ever sent me an email thanking me for staying at the hotel. You walk right out the door and Broadway is to your right and 5th avenue to your left. Enjoy your stay!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We ended up here by accident as all of our friends were staying at the Grand Hyatt by Central Station. As it so happened, we were in the best location. Just a block off Broadway and Time Square it made for easy movement around town. There is a restaurant and a coffee shop located just off the lobby. It was functional and notthing fancy. The best part was the roof-top bar. Even in the dead of January there are two see through igloos with heaters so you can sit outside. The inside bar seated about 100 at small tables and couches. They had a professional mixologist cranking out bizarre concoctions that you would never think of personally but were quite tasty. Rooms were above average with the top half of the building serviced by one high speed elevator and the same for the bottom half. Security was excellent with everyone being required to show a key after 4 pm. HINT: if you just want to go to the bar you must go to the counter in the restaurant and ask for a pass. The pass is no problem and no charge. The bar opens at 4pm (at least in the winter).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stay in this hotel for 6 nights in January and it was amazing . The location was exactly what we were looking .We wanted to be in times square and we only had to come out hotel door turn right. Walk 50 meters and we were in the heart of times square . We booked a executive on the 48th floor with views of times square and we were looking right down on times square . There is amazing roof top bar in this hotel as well and the views from this of new York are amazing . The room was spacious for new York with sitting room and separate bedroom and top class bathroom . The staff could not have been more helpful anything we needed was sorted straight away.We also used the hotel shuttle service . The driver was waiting in the arrivals hall of jfk airport for us and the car was waiting right outside the door.This service is well worth the extra money it cost compare to getting a taxi.It was about 50 dollars more then the cost of a regular taxi.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was selected after reading numerous reviews for various hotels in the area. I spent a few hours making the selection to ensure the getaway would be a special one. It indeed was! Arrived on a Friday evening about 8:30 pm, drove up, handed my keys to the professional and very friendly Door Man/Valet employee. His demeanor was reassuring and one of confidence, I never thought twice about my car throughout the weekend. Check in was a breeze and in fact we were upgraded to a King with a View without asking. The room was spotless as were the hotel hallways and elevators which were super quick, and even talked! The amenities granted guesst at this Hyatt were amazing and they were not afraid to tell you what you could use for free. For me, this hotel was about making you feel welcomed and wanted, this was management at its best. The employees were happy and friendly. And I don't mean give me a tip friendly. They were fun people, happy and smiling and EXTREMELY HELPFUL. The employees working the "Door" outside were simply amazing. This is who you interact with most during your stay. Again, they were professional, down to earth employees. They could not do enough for you and again, not stuffy or tip expecting individuals. They carried on meaningful conversations and took the time to answer questions and give advice and suggestions. We were super impressed by this experience. The front desk employees were smiling,happy and friendly. Security was sure to say hello each time you passed as well. The Spa was equally friendly and accommodating and provided an awesome massage. Our room was super clean, bright and airy with a spacious and gorgeous bathroom. Bar 54 on the roof was intimate, costly yes, but who doesn't like to see the view from the 54th floor. I do concur with other reviewers that the fees charged at Bar 54 may exceed the experience. T45, located on the main level, dining experience was great. Good service, quality food, and warm atmosphere. The Hyatt exceeded our expectations while demonstrating class, professionalism, friendliness, sincerity, and a genuine care for the guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I did not book this hotel my self and it was a nice surprise for me.The hotel is basically on times Square, just few meters around the corner.The staff was really nice and willing to help us with what ever we needed. You can almost get what ever you need from the reception, just fill out a form were you could receive special kinds of pillows, bathrobes, slippers, and almost what ever...The rooftop bar was nice and the view was amazing.The only thing I can complain about is that we had to pay for the wifi in the room but free in the lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt is our preferred hotel chain and we stay at various Hyatt hotels quite frequently. The service at this hotel has to be some of the best I've seen. The staff were very warm and welcoming when we arrived and continued to impress us throughout the entire stay. The rooms aren't huge, but definitely more spacious than some of the other NYC hotels I've stayed in. I would absolutely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great great location. Nice and clean. Very expensive restaurant. Fabulous deli a few doors up. Great for breakfast and essentials.What annoyed me was 3 nights no sleep. A room full of kids next door screaming and banging on wall. Now I was travelling with my 5 year old son and he wouldn't scream or bang on walls. I called reception several times. I was offered a different room but moving room would have been a problem.Put a damper on my first trip to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square is the fifth among the Hyatt hotels I stayed and experienced in. I like Hyatt's ultramodernistic decor and rather cold ambience; yet, this Hyatt is trendy and plain in terms of typical Hyatt interior designs and vibe. Therefore, you cannot find a majestic Grand Hyatt or a luxurious Park Hyatt or an eclectic Hyatt Regency in Hyatt Times Square. However, the location is great for young or thrifty travelers to make a tour of Manhattan area; next to it lies Times Square- it's literally within a stone's throw. Besides, the room charge for a night is affordable with the room quiet. On top of that, I was able to check out at two pm with the perks of my Hyatt membership, which made me feel good. All in all, it's a great night out from an apartment I was staying in in New Jersey. I made a tour of Times Square at night, which I'd been longing for. One thing I don't like is when I checked out, a staff had a long face, even not saying goodbye nor offering a gratitude. What happened to the staffer?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent a night at the Hyatt after a trip to the NYC Ballet in Lincoln Center. It is well situated for theater or Lincoln Center. We arrived in the morning and our room was ready for us. It was clean, very comfortable and quiet. After the ballet we went up to the rooftop bar, which has great views and expensive drink (not a surprise). There is a Starbucks in the lobby and plenty of places for dinner or breakfast close by. It is a great location if you want to be near it all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We opted for a higher floor and found our room to quiet and the beds very comfy which was very nice after a long day of sightseeing. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends! The staff was friendly and gave great recommendations for dining.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was fantastic. We were surprised at the proximity to Times Square and the size of the room was much bigger than expected. Despite being so close to the hustle and bustle the room was quiet overnight and we had no issues with noise. The staff were friendly and always helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Superb service, noise control, cleanliness. Right in the heart of Midtown without the hassle and noisiness. Close to good food (Virgil's Barbecue is just a block away). Everyone treated me kindlly. Don't let the modest reception area fool you, this is a great hotel for a decent price in the best location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Only hotel to give you free waters, half a block from Times Square!! Well worth the price as compared to the other hotels in the area! The rooftop bar is amazing! The staff is extremely helpful and stored my luggage for 8hrs after my checkout while the Mrs shopped around Times Square. We came back a few times to add more bags to the cart and they were fine with it all. Valet held the car in the parking lot till we were ready to go as well!. Absolutely perfect stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned from my second stay at the Hyatt Times Square. 9 nights this time! Really has become a home away from home and I found it even improved on my last stay back in August. Things to note - the location - if you are visiting New York it is perfect. Turn left and hit Times Square, turn right and walk up to Midtown. The subway is right there and there are myriad of restaurants and delis closeby. The hotel itself is a world away from Times Square once in your room.The room was very clean, the bed super comfortable and huge, the housekeeping excellent and flexible regarding my odd working hours. The view from my room made me extremely happy, the food was superb - everything from the restaurant to the room service was delicious, unpretentious and filling - super good value for hotel food. I was made to feel very welcome, the staff go out of their way to ensure you are happy - a special shout out to Sonita - one of the Managers - she delivered exemplary customer care and service - after a previous manager whilst friendly was not as helpful regarding my check out.I am coming back in March and very much looking forward to my stay. My New York home from home.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed on level 31 with great view. The room was ok, no bath, and main complaint was the long waits for the lifts: there are only three to the higher floors. The View from the bar on the top is amazing.The other thing was that the wifi barely worked and I had to go to Starbucks in the foyer to get a decent connection.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked into the Hyatt Times Square on a recent business trip to New York City. Location: walk to everything, yet far enough down the block from the craziness and noise of TImes Square. Hotel: new, modern, very, very clean, The rooms - large by NYC standards with extremely comfortable beds and bedding.The bathroom was huge with great rain shower. Amenities, including bathrobes and slippers, were super and more than expected. Friendly and helpful staff. Great terrace (lounge) on top floor that is useable in the winter and affords a great view of the area. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation for business travelers and vacationers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had an amazing four days in NYC staying at the Hyatt. I arrived on the day of my birthday and I was immediately upgraded by the beautiful and very polite Aerial. The lifts to our room were super fast and every day the room was cleaned to perfection. They have a bar/lounge as well which was brilliant with an amazing view of NYC and also a ground floor restaurant that sold the best bagels and cream cheese I have ever had. From the room we could see Time Square and in the distance the One World Trade building which made me speechless (to my bf's delight). Zero complaints and my expectations were over exceeded.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very peaceful and quiet. Clean, well cared for and comfortable. Great staff. Beautiful furnishings and very comfortable bed and linens. Very close to restaurants, Times Square and things to do. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really lovely hotel...Sleek, modern, comfortable and reasonable for New York. Ask for a room with a view, Quite spectacular!. Great Bar on the 54th floor with an outdoor terrace and another great view! If you're having a theater weekend in NYC, I would definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic hotel perfect location really couldn't fault it. Saw all the attractions. It was a non stop trip from the moment we landed. The bus tickets are a must to get about but also be prepared for lots of walking. Take plenty of $dollars as it's not cheap. Will definitely go again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Me and my partner just returned from 5 days here, it was a surprise trip for his 30th birthday. They upgraded us to a king suite on a high floor and the room and facilities were lovely, very modern and exactly what I wanted. All staff were really friendly and helpful. It has a lovely rooftop bar for cocktails and food. The location is brilliant, literally around the corner from Times Square but quiet in the room at night. It was brilliant for getting around the places we wanted to visit, such as top of the rock, Central Park, fifth avenue, Broadway etc. I would definitely recommend staying here and will be staying here again if we visit New York in future!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I had a great weekend at the Hyatt Times Square. I had a great view of the clock of the Paramount Building from my room. It was not noisy even though the hotel is in the heart of the Theatre District. The view of the city from the 54th Floor Bar was unbelievable!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good quality in general. The hotel is recent so the room are in very good conditions and well maintained. 2 exceptions the restaurant is not that great but being in Times Square, you have plenty of options around. And with only 2 elevators at some time you can wait a bit to get one. It is expensive but you are in Times Sq!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect hotel for an overnight to New York. Steps from Time Square and a 10 minute walk from Grand Central. Had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, which was pricey, even by New York standards, but very good. The 54th floor bar is fantastic for a drink or two! Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It is great hotel situated at times square new York city... housekeeping & room service are awesome. Must visit terrice restaurant at 54th floor. Gym is modern with all the workout machines & trademills.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This property and its staff consistently delivers five star service in the heart of Manhattan. I try to stay here whenever I travel to Manhattan on business as it is very convenient to clients, entertainment and dining.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are looking to be right in the heart of Time Square and experience the city from that vantage point then this is a great hotel to use as your home base.Centrally located, good amenities, cost effective and walking distance to everything.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros:- good location the 'right' side of Times Sq;- great Midtown views;- good value compared to equivalent Midtown West hotels (eg Le Parker Meridien, Intercontinental Times Sq, London NYC) and better in many ways too;- good sized comfortable rooms with modern amenities;- amazing (albeit pricey) rooftop bar;- friendly helpful young staff;- reasonable gym facility.Cons:- tiny lobby area which felt crowded at times;- seemingly insufficient number of elevators leading to regular waits.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I loved this hotel and was absolutely pleased with every staff member I encountered. My friend and I met in NYC on Jan 20 for 4 nights of theatre, great restaurants and sightseeing. Was upgraded to a beautiful double room on the 53rd floor during check in. We were there during the blizzard my flight was cancelled. Scheduled to leave on Sunday with no rebooking options till Tuesday. The hotel happily extended my stay and made sure to check in with me during my time alone (my friend was able to fly out on Monday.) They also helped arrange my airport ride for Tuesday. Along with fantastic restaurant recommendations, directions all over the place and the most helpful attitudes, these people are just NICE. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in NY after this experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were a group 6 from the UK staying at the Hyatt Times Square for 5 nights over New Years Eve. The hotel is in a great location just steps from Times Square with really friendly staff. We had 3 View King rooms which all had great views of Times Square and were clean and modern. The bathroom was really nice with a large shower with great water pressure. The slippers and robes were a nice touch and the bed was really comfortable with feather pillows.We visited the Bar 45 on our first night for a drink before going to dinner and had to agree that 29 dollars for a cocktail was a bit on the expensive side.I'd have to recommend Cranberry deli just a few doors down for breakfast and O'Lunney's next door for drinks.Will definitely stay here again on our next visit to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel and is very close to Times Square. Room are modern and very comfortable. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Great view from the bar at the top of the building where on New Years Eve they had free hot chocolate and donuts as well as a free photo with the city in the back ground. Would highly recommend Hyatt Times Square to anyone looking for a great place to stay in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wow we had great time here at the Hyatt Times Square. All hotel staff very professional friendly and helpful. Thanks Jeff for the late check out it really helped as our flights were cancelled due to the snow. Lauren Baloo Spencer all the staff front desk would go out their way to help...... nothing was too much trouble. Special thanks to Tess at concierge... so helpful with great advice really enhanced our stay thank you. There is nothing like a bit of local knowledge! Steve and all the staff at Lobby thank you so much for a great stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights over the famous blizzard in January! Location is within a few feet of the hustle and bustle of Times Square- brilliant for food/drinks/entertainment on your doorstep. Check-in desk very helpful. Outside doorman was very polite and friendly throughout the stay. Rooms were clean, modern and well decorated considering the vast number of rooms they could have scrimped on fully furnishing them all with ornaments/pictures ect. but they didn't.View was fantastic from all sides of the building. Bathroom was lovely with fantastic power shower. All amenities you could want were provided, Starbucks coffee machine was a bonus. Did not use downstairs restaurant during stay but did visit the B45 rooftop bar which had incredible views of the whole city, very expensive, but what you would expect from a central hotel bar. Definitely recommend a visit. The maids were very friendly and left little notes in the rooms wishing you a nice day- nice touch On check-out they let you keep as many suitcases and bags as you liked in the storage rooms- very helpful so we could enjoy the last day. Would recommend highly

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Noticed a decline in this hotel since my previous visit. If you have an allergy to scent/perfume, do not stay here...a strong scent is piped into the lobby that is noxious. Location is amazing if you are visiting New York to stay in the Times Square area or see a Broadway show. Other hotels in the area, i.e. The Premier are much better value for the money if nightly rates are similar

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, new and the perfect family hotel. Walking distance to everything. Amazing cafe's and deli's. Amazing restaurants on every street. Beautiful Catholic Church a street away. Cabs outside your door. Locals selling beanies and scarves on the corner of the street for the snow season. Couldn't have picked a better hotel and location for our family . Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Myself and my friend stayed here from 21-25th January and had a fantastic time. The hotel is perfectly situated for Times Square and central for most tourist attractions in Manhattan, yet there was very little road noise in the rooms. The staff were all friendly and helpful, we had the best room service fries ever, the two double beds in our room were wonderfully comfortable. A bath would have been nice but the shower was great. The roof top bar is fantastic, with amazing views from the terrace - even during the blizzard! Very reasonably priced for the quality of stay and service, I'd stay here again and I'd recommend to a friend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife wanted to go to NY for our honeymoon. I"m a loyal Hyatt guest so we stayed at the Hyatt on Time Square. As always with most of my stays in Hyatt Hotels we were very satisfied. Perfect location and the staff was very friendly. We enjoyed it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent five nights in Manhattan to celebrate my wife's 50th Birthday.I chose this hotel on tripadvisor reviews and its great location. This is a fantastic hotel. Quite new. We stayed on a room only basis which was ideal for us as we wanted to try out different restaurants throughout the area. The room was immaculate, very large and the bed enormous.It is worthwhile asking for a high floor. The view from ours on the 46th floor was amazing.Bar 54 is great although prices are VERY high.All the staff are very friendly and helpful.I would highly recommend this Hotel.We shall definitely have another trip to NY and stay ay Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt has got it almost 100% right with this hotel, the room features and lighting, the food service, the staff, check in and check out. I had no issues and will return. The bathroom has a night light that you can turn on from your bed as well as heated floors. The towels could use an upgrade though.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel, especially for Hyatt Gold Passport members, is an outstanding property. I was impressed with the staff at every single encounter. The rooms are well appointed and tremendously quiet. Once inside, you'll forget that you're less than a block away from a bustling Times Square area. This is a highly recommended hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was beautiful. We had a terrace with a view of the city, it was breathtaking. The front desk was awesome and accommodating. They let me keep my luggage in storage all day so I could still explore the city. Only negative was the elevators were slow, we were waiting so long we actually walked down a couple of floors to try and catch the elevator. Overall a great hotel!!! Would stay again and recommend! A block from Times Square and located next to great bars! Awesome!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern hotel that's situated close to times square. Prices are quite reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. Stayed in a deluxe suite (upgraded), which I've been told is quite big and nice for NY standards. Planning on revisiting the hotel soon, hopefully the next visit will mimic the first.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in NYC to celebrate my wife's birthday and our 8th anniversary - the wife and kids first time in the Big Apple. Prior to arrival, we outlined our needs to the hotel staff (by twitter feed, emails, and actual phone calls). This hotel replied with a promise of adequate accommodations for a family of 4. Although we were upgraded to a corner suite on the top floor, the accommodations did not fit our needs as we travel as a family of 4, two adults and two children. This was the only problem we encountered: the cramped accommodations and the children did not have comfortable night sleep as they only gave us one rollaway bed and removed a round table from the tiny living area. To hotel staff's credit, however, we were shown two other types of rooms and given a choice to move. We declined both as the first was a two queen beds in one room on the 44th floor facing other high-rises to its north that lacked privacy and the wow-factor. It was a room that you can find at any typical Holiday Inn type of property. The second room we were shown was an executive suite with ample space but it was on the 5th floor with plenty street noise and adjacent buildings' HVAC humming noise that gets magnified during the night.Great location right at Time Square in the Theater District with walking distance to 42nd Street subway station placing the entire city at your fingertips. The room at the 53rd floor in this fashionable high-rise hotel offered amazing unobstructed views of the city. Our room was facing south and thus we could see the newly built One World Trade Center from both rooms. As it was a corner suite, to our west we could see the Chrysler Building. Our room was well appointed with comfortable bed and adequate water pressure in the bathroom. Minor issues with housekeeping but overall, the service was great from the staff at T45 Restaurant (especially Ms. Lisa) to the front desk manager, Mr. Aris, who kept a vigil on our room situation and he also made sure we get transportation to the airport on time. Upon check-in, for our anniversary, we were also given a welcome gift that consisted of brownies, fruits, and wine. This was a very nice gesture of a property that knows how to treat its Hyatt loyalty program members. The food at T45 was a pleasant surprise offering a number of options including Omelets, traditional fare such as eggs in a variety of choices, Pancakes, etc. During our 4-nights stay, we tried something new every morning and it was a pleasure to our palates. The service was prompt, courteous and friendly.Concierge staff was helpful on the most part and had some good recommendations, such as Tony Di Napoli Italian Restaurant. They also provided accurate directions to many points of interest in the city. Another plus for this hotel is the rooftop bar (BAR 54) which is facing south with expansive views of the city that stretch across Manhattan from the Hudson River to the East River.This hotel would have earned 5-stars in this review if the accommodations for the kids was adequate. Recommended especially for couples or the single traveler.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wow where to start...... The Hyatt Times Square is situated just off Times Square (2 min walk) to subway. Rooms where lovely and spacious and kept very clean..... Room came with iron and ironing board, hair dryer and you can also request numerous other things from reception. Bathroom was spotless and toiletries topped up as you use them. We absolutely loved this hotel right from the offset. We ate at T45 twice and was lovely and we thought prices really reasonable when compared with other restaurants in times Square, we also had drinks up on bar 54 views are amazing!!! And definitely worth a visit.....Now for the best asset to the hotel - Once we booked we emailed the hotel with a few requests and received an email immediately back from Melissa..... I hope whoever reads this can feedback our comments on how amazing and accommodating she was..... She even left some brownies and a bottle of prosecco to welcome us, what a lovely personal touch.... Melissa your a star!!!! And we can't thank you enough for making our first visit to New York so special....We really can't recommended this hotel enough.... We loved it and can't wait to return....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first time staying at this hotel and the service could not have been better. The hotel is located just off Time Square on 45th Street. They have a very good restaurant attached to the hotel and the food and service was also excellent. . I would absolutely stay there again if I ever need to stay in Midtown.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family stayed here over the Christmas break and it was right in the centre of Times Square which was brilliant. They didn't put my family on the same floor which was ridiculous and very bad organising from the hotel, so my sisters and I were 3 floors away from our parents, other then that it was a beautiful hotel. Maybe need to get more lifts as only one ever worked.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Arrived at the Hyatt at 1:30am and the staff on reception were so helpful. Got a complementary upgrade to a suite (2101). Room was amazing had a separate sitting area. We had a view of Time Square which was amazing. We stayed here for 6 nights and i did not want to leave it. The bar is amazing too, lovely views but its slightly expensive for drinks ($55 for two cocktails) but it is worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For Times Square the Hyatt is quite good. Great location and the rooms are decent if a ltttle worn. I've stayed at most of the smaller hotels between 45 and 50 on the West Side and ths is better than them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent 2 nights there during a weekend. First room assigned to us had some issues. Despite we checked in at 10pm, we got a new room assigned within a min. The staff did a great job. The corner room on the 36th floor was very comfy and had good view. Bed was amazing and I am now thinking of buying one of their bed for my home!Location is also great for whoever wants to be close to Time Square. The hotel's bar on the 54th has stunning views and you quickly forget the premium you pay for a drink up there!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When we arrived at about 3pm after what had been a very long day of travelling from England we were quickly checked in and me and my mum were upgraded to a double double room which was beautiful and had an amazing view of the city as we were on floor 28. A kettle and tea (also any other amenities we needed) were brought to our room within 10 minutes by a very polite man called joe. The following morning we happened to pop back to the hotel about half 10 and noticed the sign that said there was a tour of the rooftop bar and considering I am only 19 I wasn't aloud up there to have a drink in the evening (obviously) so we sat down and a lovely lady called Lauren who I cannot thank enough for everything she did for us, took us up and took photos and showed us round and answered any questions etc. We then saw her a few times afterwards and as I was not very well she fetched me some throat sweets to help me feel better and to let her know if there's anything we needed, if we needed directions or advice she'd be brilliant and it's just so nice to have someone who will go above and beyond. She's wonderful! It was my birthday on the Friday and in the afternoon when I arrived back to my room I found a lovely note and present of some beautiful brownies left for me, we both thought this was incredibly sweet of the hotel especially when I didn't want to cause a fuss, they still made me feel very special! All members of staff that work at the Hyatt in Times Square are lovely and I want to thank them for making our first visit to America and my birthday extremely special. We certainly will and can't wait to return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good location , friendly and helpful staff. Nice clean room. We moved to this hotel as our previous one was too noisy. It is New York but the hotel was quiet enough to get a good night's rest. Ideally placed close to Times Square and with easy walking to Macy's and 5th Avenue for shoppers. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed 4 nights on pleasure trip to NY. Great location !! Rooms were modern, very clean and spacious. Bed was a little firm for my liking but was acceptable. Unfortunately my wife and I both developed food poisoning from a nearby restaurant(NOT the hotel). The hotel staff went well beyond what would have been expected checking on us frequently and catering to our every need. I cannot say enough about their caring and response.I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From landing exhausted, after a long trip from Scotland, to leaving, this hotel was fabulous! The guy who checked us in could see we were tired, so kept check in short, sweet but friendly. Got up to the room, and it was lovely, couldn't have asked for more. Nice and modern, and very clean. Surprisingly quiet, considering location. It is practically in the heart of Times Square, but the only thing I ever heard was a siren, and you're supposed to hear those! Bed, pillows and bedding were excellent. Had an amazing nights sleep every night.Nice coffee maker in the room, and a fridge, and an iron and ironing board,hairdryer and mini toiletries.They will also supply free of charge, any little things you might have forgotten, like a ladies razor and shave gel. You dial, they send it up-nothing is too much trouble.There is a restaurant attached called T45. Although we ate here only once for dinner, and once for breakfast, both were very good. There is a rooftop bar, Bar 54, with views over the city. You can get a drink and food there. Cocktails a little on the pricey side, but hey, you're on holiday! If ever I were back in New York, I think this is the only place I'd want to stay. It will also make me consider using Hyatt in other locations too. All in all, a fabulous comfy stay, in a nice clean, modern hotel, with lovely staff. What more could you ask?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a former air hostess, I've stayed in lots of hotels in New York, as I used to come here a few times a month on stopovers. This is probably the BEST hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC. Location is fantastic, 2 minute walk from Times Square. However, you would think it would be noisy, but no! The room was so quiet, I couldn't believe it. Bed was fabulous, bathroom had no bath which is common in New York hotels but it did have an amazing rain-shower. The staff in the lobby are so nice and greet you every time you go out and return. I didn't eat breakfast here as I like to go out and go to a proper New York diner when I'm here. The best place for breakfast is The Brooklyn Diner, which is nearby (actually if you google it you'll see there are 2 or 3 branches) The absolute best thing is the bar though: Bar 54.It's the highest bar in New York with views to die for, both indoor and out! Lovely at night when it's all lit up. A word of warning though! The bar is on the high side price wise, but I suppose you are paying a premium for the view and the table service. They really know their cocktails here, so get something you've always wanted to try, don't go for your usual cosmo, any monkey can make one of those and you can get one anywhere! Get something special! I hope this helps!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel, located well and with excellent staff. The rooms are excellent and very clean, and the staff always seem to remember you. The food and Bar are also great with the highest sky bar in town I believe.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just off 6th Ave the location takes you away from the crowds of 7th,8th aves and makes for a great stay. Plenty of parking in the area and easy access to all of the midtown attractions. They have a great sky bar on the 54th floor which has outdoor seating in the warmer months but is open all year weather permitting. Their cocktail menu is loaded from standard to exquisite brands. Rooms are spacious as well as the bathroom. Security is tops as they require rooms keys be displayed to access the elevators. We were upgraded without asking which was a wonderful surprise. Hyatt has always treated me well and this location did not let me down.
