hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We normally stay at the Hyatt at Grand Central Station but decided to stay a little closer to Times Square this time. The room was fantastic and the staff was great! Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very modern and clear decor with great location near times square and the theaters. The restaurant/cafe offers great selections for breakfast or you can order it and take it in the room. High speed internet, good for streaming was also available. The rooms are surpisingly quiet, given the location, with nice views! It has the highest bar in NYC, in terms if height, of course, with good views, but average drinks. I have stayed there several times and the only thing I would change is the elevators, it could take 5 minutes to wait for one or get on one, lines usually form in front of the small elevator area. Eh, small price to pay for an excellent stay otherwise.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here over New Years Eve, and the location was perfect. Everything Times Square has to offer is just around the corner. The facility was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The rooftop bar, although pricey, is definitely worth checking out as the views are phenomenal. We did not eat at the attached restaurant, so I cannot comment on it. The only complaint I had was the rooms were too warm and I couldn't get the thermostat to go any lower. This is most likely because the weather was unusually warm for December/January. We will definitely stay here again if visiting Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall the experience was great. The staff, room and facilities met my expectations.Couple of thoughts from me:Didn't use the restaurant as it looked like it wasn't a "signature" part of the hotel as other restaurants can be. However massive selection within a 15 min radius be it walk or subway, my suggestion is to get out and eat in some of the other neighbourhoods like lower east side, tribeca etc rather then settle for tourist time squareBreakfast I would suggest walking East on 45th and going to one of the delis or cafes for a morning takeaway breakfast or for a good sit down the French place un, deux, touis (spelt wrong sorry!) in w44th.Went to the bar - here the only let down, seated next to a grossly intoxicated person, throwing things in the floor etc. in NZ the bar would be up for a loss of license. The staff seemed to oddly tolerate this behaviour... Drinks also very pricey, maybe a visit for the view and a drink, certainly wouldn't want to have a few here.For a drink the Irish pubs close by are great - cheap and friendly, wouldn't choose to eat here but great for a few cheap drinks before and after dinner.Hotel has pc and printer that can be used, 15 min free and 5 pages per day. I made use of this for Broadway tickets etc.Overall great place to stay - very happy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in NYC post cruise and didn't have much time to soak up everything. Staying at the Hyatt Time Square saved us time as it was at the heart of everything, we could walk to many attractions, broadway shows and restaurants.We were very early to check in (10 a.m.) and logically our room wasn't ready. But the very very friendly front desk gentleman recognized how tired we were and did his magic and gave us a room right away.There was a street festival in front of the hotel that day with lots of ethnic food and that was a fun way to start our short vacation.The room was very clean, nice bathroom and super fast elevator to the 49th floor.Only minus was the fact that the fire alarm went off at 1 a.m. 49th floor is then VERY high.I would definitely stay here again, but will request a lower floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 5 nights and it was a pleasant stay. We stayed in a suite which has a nice sized bedroom, small lounge and bathroom. The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable but not luxurious. All requests from guest services were dealt with promptly and the staff were polite. The best part of the hotel was that it was so close to Times Square. The hotel itself is very basic with a tiny lobby and small restaurant, this was disappointing as we are used to hotels with many restaurants and lounges which you can relax in especially when travelling in a group as we were a family of 8, however there are several restaurants and bars just outside the hotel which made up for this. There is a roof top bar which we didnt get to see as we had a 2 year old and children are not allowed. Overall it was a pleasant stay and it was nice to be so close to Times Square however i prefer a hotel which is more luxurious and has more facilities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very convenient. We had a great view, a clean room, and we were treated very well. Every request was met, without any hesitation. The staff were friendly, and really wanted to help any way they could. The food was good and was delivered very timely. Even the restaurant staff was friendly and eager to please,

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I chose this hotel because it was close to the office. It's location would also be perfect for anyone keen on being on Times Square and everything it has to offer.The room was good, clean and functional and relatively quiet.I used the gym everyday and while it was basic it was sufficient for my needs. Only two bikes but I was able to secure one or the other at 6.00 am each day.I used the restaurant each day for breakfast and again it was fine.There is a bar on the top floor with great views and ridiculously priced drinks. Maybe it is just what you are used to but I had one class of wine enjoyed the view and then headed out to something more in my price range.Overall I was happy with the hotel and will probably stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just spent twelve nights in the Hyatt Times Square and wasn't disappointed. Hotel staff were all really helpful and always spoke or gave a friendly wave.Is in a great location for getting to fifth, Times Square and only a 5-15 minute walk to the top of the Rock, Maddison square garden, Empire State, Macy's etc.Was in room 3605 with a good view of Times Square. Was very spacious and cleaned every day even when we had a long lie in after the night before and also took away all are boxes and bags from all our shopping .Will stay here again when we return.Thank you for a pleasant stayRegardsMichael FraserAberdeen, Scotland.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff were really friendly when checking in. We checked in really early and to my surprise our room was ready in an hour. Very impressive. We stayed here for 7 nights. Room had a decent view and was really spacious. Very clean and modern feel to the hotel. Really enjoyed the room. Large TV with great channels. And we heard no noise even though we were on the 17th floor. My husband was a very disappointed when we went up to the roof top bar one of the evenings to see the view and grab a drink, with my sister, brother in law and parents and they informed him that it was a seated bar and there was not availability at the moment. .....which he said was not true as he could see there was space available. He also insisted on seeing identification of my sister and brother in law, who are a married couple and well to do actuaries! very strange! He was upset and said he felt that the staff member did not want us to be there and had a bad attitude. We were hotel guests, well dressed....maybe too many jackets as it was really cold. But we would have taken this off in the bar, so we were unsure what the staff members issue was exactly...a bit of a damper on a great stay otherwise. Checkout was smooth and reception staff kept our luggage till our flight out of JFK in the evening. Really convenient for the hop on hop off bus as well as all the times square attractions. Starbucks is directly across the street and great for a quick brekkie.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked as a package deal with flights through BA. We stayed 5th to 9th January. We were VERY pleased with the hotel. Stayed in a 'view' room on the 31st floor. Excellent room, very comfortable king size bed, very comfy pillows and bed linen. Massive flatscreen tv, the same as the one we have in our home!! Nice bathroom ( no bath but great shower!) lovely towels, robes etc. Best hair drier and iron we've seen in a hotel!! Coffee maker. Alarm clock and fridge. Lovely view from room. Efficient and friendly staff throughout the hotel. From reception staff to the room maid and the door staff, all were courteous and very helpful! There were comforting security checks by staff ensuring people going in and out are actually guests or were using the rooftop bar, which is definitely worth a visit. The drinks are indeed a little pricey (but I imagine you can go and have a look at the view without staying for a drink!) The hotel itself is moments from Times Square, which is full of restaurants, shops and bars. There is a good Irish bar next door and a Starbucks opposite the Hotel lobby. Main attractions are either walkable or very easily accessed via the subway. ( the subway can be accessed just walking 5 minutes from the hotel) All in all I would highly rate and thoroughly recommend the Hyatt Times Square, New York! After our experience here I would definitely look to stay in a Hyatt hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a 7 night stay over New Years with a family of 5. Some rooms have a Times Squre view, be it Limited.We upgraded to a suite and also bought a standard room for the kids. Our suite was small and a waste of money so we down graded to a deluxe room and saved $1000. All rooms were the same size.Hotel is clean, hotel staff are excellent, bar on top level is excellent, however drinks are very expensive.Internet speed is good, around 8 Mbps. Elevators can be slow. We have stayed in a number of hotels in times Squre, this is one of the better ones

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had excellent service from the entire staff. We have no complaints in any part of the service. Front desk was wonderful and friendly, bell boys were always there to help open doors and help with luggage. cleaning ladies were very polite and ask several times if we needed anything. Pleasant stay! Thank you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having travelled lots but never to New York we were very excited.Husband emailed hotel beforehand to notify of honeymoon and my 30th birthday email response back quickly and were upgraded to a room with a view. View was lovely so nice to sit in bed looking out at big city!Check in was quick and friendly. Yenny was very good, paid for late check out until 3pm at check in.Room was clean and ample for our needs quite modern not huge but your in New York who stays in room anyway!!!! Bathroom v nice, linen comfy and room cleaned daily. Only downfall was previous guest sock was left in room within the curtain!!!! Didn't mention to hotel as really didn't impact our fantastic stay at all. Location for first time tourists was perfect we could walk most places and enjoyed doing so. Concierge desk were very helpful used on number of occasions. Nothing done special for birthday but then didn't ask to do so either just informed incase of any upgrade in which we got and were more than happy with! Thank you!!All staff encountered were very friendly and helpful always smiling liked the security coming in to hotel asking for room key at night was pleased to see that happening. Didn't use hotel for food as was out exploring lots however menus looked good. We did go up to the rooftop bar each evening which was stunning views great, few people commented on drink prices but o thought for upscale bar on New York were as to be expected! All round great stay and would return thank you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked a room with 2 double beds for 4 people. I advised the hotel of our late arrival and to ensure my preferred room was available. Upon check in, we were "upgraded" to a suite which meant my children spent 5 nights on an uncomfortable pull out couch.I also requested the hotel to arrange my pick up and drop off at JFK. They provided a quotation which was accepted. Upon check out I found my credit card billed for double the quoted amount. The hotel explanation was that the quote was for one way travel but was not clear on their quote.The rooms are small but they are clean and comfortable. The staff are very helpful particularly the Concierge section.The outside of the hotel was filthy when we arrived but was being cleaned the next day.New York was brilliant and should I return, I will NEVER consider using Hyatt Times Square because of the problems I encountered.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice hotel and staff with unique location (at few steps away from Times Square, Rockfeller Center etc...). Enjoy also the roof top bar at floor 54! Amazing view!. We had a very very nice stay in December 2015 for Christimas, in one word : magic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location near Times Square. Functional and clean, ample spaced rooms. Great bar on 54th floor with superb views. Loved popping into Starbucks opposite to pick up my eggnog latte to kick of the day. Dined out st local diners for breakfast. Service was efficient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location and price were a perfect combination. My wife travels frequently to NYC for pleasure and has decided to make this her go-to hotel for future trips. The room was rather large compared to what either of us were used to in the city. Bathroom was also well-sized. The bellman were very welcoming, especially Tim. Breakfast at the downstairs cafe was good. Views were great - a nice way to see Times Square from above without having to be directly in all the hustle and bustle.The only problem I had was during check-in; there was no mention of my status with the chain. I was not offered a choice of welcome amenity and was given points by default. I spoke with the front desk the next morning and they apologized and informed me that the diamond local amenity was for my choice of two free glasses of wine from the rooftop bar or a free 20 minute massage. There was also a billing issue at checkout, but this was handled quickly and discretely (Due to recent IT glitches at Hyatt I wasn't surprised).Overall, great property. Will probably return in the near future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was on a business trip and brought my wife, as soon as we arrived we were offered a hot chocolate. Our room was readily avail. Service/staff were professional and very helpful. A staffer overheard my wife saying you forgot her toothbrush, that night, on our doorknob was a "goody bag with toothbrush. Room was clean, had all amenities. Check out was quick, I was even handed a newspaper when leaving hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was amazing. Good modern bathrooms. Good linens. Nice wall mounted flatscreen. Minimalist with amenities. Nightstands did not have drawers. Only three drawers in room. Average size room for New York, but efficient and clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we wanted a hotel in or very near times square . The hyatt hotel was perfect . Our room on 51st floor was looking right down on to times square.The room was very spacious and had everything we need for our stay.The staff were were so nice and did everything to make our stay perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel! It's location and service are outstanding! Good looking, clean, and helpful staff. It has a restaurant in the lobby really comfortable, and with good plates. The only recommendation would be to offer better pillows. The one we had we too thin.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel pampers you from the second you walk in; modern and relaxing space with plenty of room and excellent views of the city; you would not regret spending the extra money for a room at this place. Lastly, be sure to check out their rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything from staff, rooms (very nice bathrooms), gym (really good gym) to rooftop bar is top. My favorite place to stay in NYC, beats much more expensive hotels. Food at the restaurant is amazing too (try the Reuben if your are a Reuben fan). I travel for business so Time Square is not my favorite location, but I still stay here without second thoughts.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Under pressure to visit New York after travelling on business/pleasure for 25 years to the USA without passing through. Had put it off for years.Booked the Hyatt Times Square. It was a lovely hotel, and the staff were great, but if you go to New York expecting or wanting anything other than a box to sleep in you'll be very disappointed (or have an empty wallet)! I saw a lovely triple glazed boutique hotel 100 yards away with triple glazing to keep the road noise to a minimum, for 1/3 of the cost. If I ever go back, I now know. No offence Hyatt, as other than the waiting time for elevators, it was a really nice place to stay with great staff, and a truly pleasant experience!Saw everything we wanted to see, including Broadway shows, and having done it, probably would not go back other than to see NY in the summer rather than the winter. Xmas is special in NY and they do it really well, so highly recommended. The World Trade Memorial is peaceful and tasteful, and well worth a visit to pay respects and appreciate the scale and impact, which is very sobering.We used the tube service throughout, and walked for miles. The New Yorkers we came across were absolutely excellent, offering unsolicited help whenever we managed to look like stranded tourists, and really responsive when we managed to sneak up on them and not be seen as newbies to NY. It's clear that they live in a manic city that never sleeps, but the ones we met had time to help and chat.None of the iconic sights and locations disappointed! We had a great time, nice digs, and would really recommend NY as you can only truly appreciate the scale of things when you're in the middle of it looking at the landscape from the One World Tower or the Empire State building.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first time in NYC and my husband and I loved it! The Hyatt is very conveniently located in the heart of Times Square and there are a couple of restaurants right by the Hyatt. We enjoyed getting coffee and bagels every morning at the Starbucks located directly across the street from the hotel. The hotel was very clean and modern and the room we had on the 44th floor had a ceiling to floor window that overlooked NYC - simply gorgeous and worth the extra money we paid for the view. I loved the roof top bar but found their prices rather high. The view from their though was phenomenal and we did take some gorgeous pictures up there. The prices for the drinks up there were pretty high, and the restaurant on the ground floor was more like a cafe' and very small. There were major issues with the elevators while we were there and out of three elevators, only one was working the majority of the time. At one point all of them were broken and we had to take the service elevator up to our rooms. I prayed every day that the darn things would keep working and not break while we were in them. We are going to go back to NYC this October, but I don't think we will be staying at the Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent venue to stay in Times Square for New Years Eve! The security and hotel staff was exceptional. We were right in the heart of the festivities and the Hyatt was very well organized for New Years Eve.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel location is awesome access to Times Square 20 steps away. (I counted) .The only downfall. It was unknown to me and my party all 8 of us that the sky lounge was unavailable to us because it was rented to a 3rd party to bring in the new year. Very Disappointed. The main reason we choose this hotel . But we have to make other and improvise.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: NEW YORK IS AMAZING! Stayed at this hotel for 6 days in December. Rooms very nice size, beds are huge and very comfortable. Location is absolutely perfect within walking distance to everywhere! Seconds from Times Square. We had room 0810 which was at the back of the building, no view but we were not fussed. The hotel is always peaceful. Rooms cleaned very well everyone inside and outside hotel very friendly and welcoming. Would definitely recommend this place. The rooftop bar is very nice great place to get some pics with a view. Free wifi throughout the hotel very good signal. We also got the couples massage at the spa which was also very nice and the staff were fantastic. 5 stars from us!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was renovated not that long ago and has a really new, young, friendly, vibrant, hip feel to it. The staff are very welcoming and accomodating from check in until check out. Several staff members treated us like friends, always greeting us each day and paying particular attention to our daughter (especially Dede and Ravi) who looked forward to seeing them each day and missed them on her days off (especially Dede).. We also made friends with Melissa (exec admin at Hatt) and her lovely family who showed us around and treated us to breakfast New Years day which was very kind of them. This hotel is in a great location, just off the corner of 45th St and Broadway, enough to be away from the noise of Times Square but still in the thick of it all. The rooms are soundproof and relatively large on New York standards. We had a corner room overlooking Times Square, just missing the view of the ball drop (we had room 3303). If you are looking at going to New York for New Years, you can get a great view of the Ball Drop at the hotels rooftop bar (buy your tickets early and they are not cheap - but nothing is in New York..also children are not allowed, which was a shame but is law in NY we believe). It is very difficult to get out in the square on New Years unless you head out there very early (by 1200) which is difficult with little kids and the cold. Overall we would not hesitate to stay again or recommend Hyatt Times Square hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel. First class. Visited NYC with daughter and grandkids just before Christmas week. Beds were great, heated bathroom floor, rain shower shower, big fluffy towels and bathrobes. Beautiful view of city and Times Square from the 52nd floor observation deck. Would stay again in a New York minute.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Extremely pleasant stay enhanced by incredibly friendly, responsive and helpful staff throughout our stay. From the front desk to valet to dining/room service to the cleaning staff -- absolutely everyone was delightful!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Tried a number of hotels before in Manhattan for business trips and found it difficult to find one which is central and not so noisy (i.e. has good noise-isolation from the street): this one has it. Never slept so well in New York!Location is perfect. Staff friendly and professional. Top-roof bar (open terrasse!) is an additional plus.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We've been to NYC many times, stayed in many hotels. This one is a great value for the money. This was our second time staying at this hotel. The location is excellent! It's close to many attractions, subway stations, shopping, without being right in the middle of Times Square. I'm not a huge fan of TS so that is a bonus! Times Square is just around the corner if you happen to like it lol. We walked from Penn Station. Takes about 15 minutes. Lots of great food and drink in the hotel and the immediate area. The rooms are clean, modern, and offer fantastic views of the city. The bed is very comfy. Housekeeping was efficient and friendly. I didn't feel like I was in a closet (which can happen in some NYC hotels). Check in was fast and easy. There's always staff available to help with any questions, directions, etc. Although it's a tall building, the elevator is super fast. I would stay here again in a heartbeat! Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a nice four night stay at this primarily tourist-oriented hotel back in mid-November, while on a business trip. For those familiar with Hyatt's Gold Passport guest program, I was a Hyatt Platinum not a Diamond at the time, so didn't have a Hyatt upgrade certificate or otherwise try to upgrade. But I had a decent travel budget that allowed me to book a suite, though not a corner suite.My impressions:Service: Excellent. Friendly and efficient front desk, and equally responsive and competent folks when I called the customer service line (or whatever it's called) at the hotel. Location: This is where I think one's perspective on the hotel can depend a lot on who you are and why you're in NYC. As a native New Yorker who's been back to NYC lots of times for work and play, I'm not a big fan of the crowded Times Square area. (I picked the hotel to begin with because I wanted to get some Hyatt points out of it and because I was in a rush when making the booking.) But it could be great for tourists who want to be in the heart of things.View: This is another respect in which the jaded New Yorker in me might see things differently from a tourist. I wasn't wowed by the view I had looking toward Times Square from a fairly high floor (sorry, can't recall, but maybe half-way up the hotel?). And after seeing it, I turned down the top floor room (not a suite, though at about the same price) facing north, which the front desk helpfully offered me instead of my booked suite when I first checked in and asked for a very high floor. In both instances, I was mainly looking out a just some other tall buildings nearby, rather than some great NYC vistas I'd gotten from some other hotels in the city. But again, I want to emphasize that for folks who are visiting NYC as tourists or for the first time, the views might well be fine.Room: Nothing fancy, but fine. And very quiet, which I really valued. Heated bathroom floor, which was a nice feature. Both bedroom and living room were decent-sized. Elevators: I didn't have any problems with the waits or crowds others have reported in a few posts. But I wasn't on a very regular schedule. I can see how waits/crowds could be a problem certain times of day. Restaurants nearby: For what it's worth, even in the touristy Timed Square area not known for great dining options, a few friends and I chanced on a very good, modernish, Italian/Mediterranean place a block or two away. It's called Etcetera Etcetera.Bottom line: Probably not my first choice for my next business visit to NYC and certainly not if I visit there on vacation with my wife and want to spend some points or $$ on a nice place. But, as explained, this is due to my own perspective and preferences, including how I feel about Times Square. I nevertheless liked the hotel and would certainly recommend it for tourists or for business guests working right nearby. And I'd even consider go back on business if the price were sufficiently low compared to other options.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 6 nights from Boxing Day to New Year's Day. We had a wonderful time and as a first visit to New York we did lots of exploring. The hotel is the the centre of most of the attractions and location is perfect for first time visitors! The concierge was extremely helpful with directions and tips. We enjoyed 2 nights in the rooftop bar. It is certainly something special. Our only niggle is the lack of storage in the bedrooms!!! My fiancé used the small wardrobe to unpack his shirts so I had to live out of my suitcase! There is no drawers for smalls or socks however there is space in the bedrooms to include drawers somewhere!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I didn't want the year to end without writing this review. Even though we were there in October I wanted to say thanks to everyone there for a great vacation. Wish we could be there to watch the ball drop from the bar on the 54th floor. We enjoyed talking with everyone there. Special thanks to Melissa who shared places to eat nearby that she liked. Hope we will get to have drinks and talk with you again someday. Everything about this hotel was perfect for us. The rooms were big enough and the view from our room was spectacular. We looked right out on everything in Times Square. Housekeeping was excellent too. We ate daily at the restaurant for breakfast and the food was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect from the hotel service to the elevator service to the front desk service, to the hotel accommodations, to the floor to ceiling windows, to the location, to the view from the 54th floor, to the hot cider and cookies/brownies offered, to the comfort of the beds

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice modern hotel situated just off Times Square. Helpful, friendly staff who gave good recommendations and travel advice. Easy access to subway and all the main attractions. Overall a good base to explore the city. Would definitely recommend or visit again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a four star hotel. In a great location, the hotel provides great amenities including gym, concierge service, ample toiletries etc. rooms are spacious, clean & comfortable. The hotel wins its five stars on service & all the little extras it provides such as umbrellas in rainy weather, apple cider in the lobby, friendly helpful front office staff, doormen & bellboys. The cons: escalators are very slow/ sometimes there was a 10 minute wait.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Girls trip to NYC, two of us. We stayed in the Deluxe View King room. It was awesome. Plenty of room. Nice bathroom and room. Comfortable beds. Bed faces window. Floor to ceiling windows with a view of Times Square in the corner. Everyone was super nice and always helpful. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: a good number of the staff are rude and mislead you from start to finish...then they nickle and dime you to death!!! If you valet park it's $64 a day...or so I thought...later learned it's $65 every time you take your car out and put it back!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was very worried about the voice level staying in Times Square, but I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet this hotel was. I am a Hyatt Platinum member and was very pleased that this Hyatt has roomy rooms and felt quite new - almost at the Andaz level of sleek. I will definitely return here as it was convenient to many of my meetings. The concierge was very helpful in advising about unique restaurants that I may not have otherwise found.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at many hotels in Manhattan and the room size was great for NYC standards. Stayed in a view room which was worth the extra. Staff were amazing especially the guys out the front. Ate at bar 45 which was quick and friendly service. Roomies were really quiet especially being near Times Square. Fantastic location if going to see any shows on Broadway. Highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We are on our final night stay for our weeks stay in New York for Christmas. From check in to check out, this hotel's Staff have been exceptional. I would like to make a special mention of Jeff at the front desk. From the second we arrived, he went out of his way to help. We had a long flight from London, on which 3 members of our Family were very ill. We needed a 2nd room for the entire stay, and Jeff organised this very quickly. He was even able to arrange for interconnecting room to our booked suite.Free wifi, and the speed was excellent. The hotel also had free bottled water, which I have never encounter before. Even when we ran out, the reception had plenty more on hand.The rooms themselves are very well maintained, and have everything that you would need. The location is excellent - at the end of the street is Times Square, which was crazy busy, but this is to be expected Given the time of year.Would I stay here again? Absolutely. Would I recommend this hotel? Most definitely.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One of very few hotels with rooms with two queen beds, good for families with teenage kids. Nice rooftop bat, walking distance to Times Square, grand central, Bryant park and shopping! Recommend Carmnes for Italian one block away, and use Uber!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lightening fast valet and check-in. I bet we were in the room within ten minutes of showing up outside. Walter took the car and was there when we needed it - he provided great local advice with a smile.The room was classic Hyatt, no complaints. Location was perfect if you are there for a show and touristy stuff. Value was excellent and we had no complaints at all. Thanks Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed last year at this hotel; and, decided to stay there again this year. The hotel is so convient to Times Square, Broadway shows, and Bryant Park which we love. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Hotel staff members are friendly and do their best to accommodate your requests. There were two little girls in our group and the hotel staff was so sweet to them. All in all, a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We requested an early check in and high floor for views, as our flight from SA landed at 11:30am and estimated arrival at hotel was 13:00pm, no such luck!! We prepaid our booking in October!!We were told to take a walk and come back at 15:00pm at the latest as check in is 16:00pm, after flying 24 hours!!! We obliged and came back at 14:30, had coffee in their shop as it was freezing cold!!! We waited until 15:15pm and then questioned the receptionist about the status of the room, only to be told it will be ready in another hour!! We were extremely tired and just wanted our room to rest and shower, we were offered a downgrade to a queen deluxe room from an executive suite!! I obviously declined as we were traveling with our sons, we were then told that the room that was allocated to us, 1401, was still occupied and the manger was trying to get the guest out to clean the room! We were then approached by a manager, Sunita who offered us a meal while we waited, we accepted, at 16:15pm she handed us the key to 1001!!! Really, why was this room not allocated earlier if it was ready???? So neither of our requests were honored, why have it on your web page in the first place???We eventually settled in our room, the next day an amount of $1000 was reserved on our credit in addition to the $500 that was initially reserved on check in! On questioning the reception, they were informed us of a glitch in their system and would immediately reverse it, no one bothered to call it us and advise us of the outcome. So we enquired at reception again the next morning, only to be met with arrogance!!!! The staff advised that they had done their bit and it was now up to our bank as it was a foreign bank... duh??? So we on holiday and have limited funds for spending!! So we were visibly upset and were threatened with security and management!!!!! Attitude of note, definitely not what we expected after researching the hotel and reading all the great reviews!!! Will never come back to this hotel!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There's no better location if you're planning on seeing a Broadway play or enjoying the energy of Times Square. Have a drink at the rooftop bar, the highest in the city. The drinks were $25 each, a steep price, but the view was worth it for a special treat. The room was so quiet. The room service is more like takeout delivery than typical hotel room service but the food was good. There's a little fridge and a deli down the street if you need to stock up on supplies to save money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here four nights in a deluxe view suite. View was great. Heated bathroom floors were great. Spa and gym were great. I recommend the location and the rooms were quiet. The only noise we heard were the fire engine sirens. We were surprised by the amount of wear and tear on the carpets and furniture since this is a relatively new location. There was a maze of doors (bathroom, shower, closets and living room) which posed a problem unless you were staying by yourself. Bed was comfortable. Staff seemed a little indifferent. Unstocked fridge included. Elevators didn't work Saturday night. It took us 20 minutes to get from our room to the lobby. Almost missed our Broadway show. Expected more from the Hyatt brand and the amount charged for a suite.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you're looking for a hotel perfectly situated in Times Square at an affordable price, this Hyatt is one you should check out. The hotel is located around the corner from all the bells and whistles of Times Square. However, if you're looking for a comfortable room with a nice comfy bed then you should probably look elsewhere. I've never in my life slept in a more uncomfortable bed. Pretty sure this bed resembles what Fred and Wilma Flinstone slept on. Also, the AC in my room (2605) would not cool...at all. I slept with the window open which was really annoying because like I said, Times Square is around the corner and therefore it's bright and loud!!! It's a great location and otherwise the hotel is fine, but I probably wouldn't stay there again because my back is on fire and I desperately need a massage.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall, a very comfortable stay. Pleasant room, bright and roomy although my first option was smaller and dark. Great staff, all very courteous and seem genuinely happy in their role! Close to shops and Broadway theaters. Good central meeting point.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We decided to treat ourselves to a nice hotel for our Christmas visit, and the Hyatt was everything we expected. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, especially Spencer, who we found out graduated from the same high school as my wife. We upgraded our room to a higher floor, the 44th, for almost nothing. We arrived around 11am expecting to have to store our luggage, but our room was ready. Easy walking distance to anywhere in midtown Manhattan, and there are subway stations about three blocks away in any direction. We had a king sized bed, with a roomy bathroom and shower stall, and the shower had a rain shower. Large TV, refrigerator, and connections for all electronics. There is a restaurant adjacent to the lobby, but also several delis and restaurants with various cuisines on 45th St. toward 6th Ave. Make sure to visit the lounge on the 54th floor and check out the view. Definitely not a budget hotel, but we felt it was worth the money.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Sevice is really terrible.No communication spa and reception so they do not want to heard visitor's question.I booked 2days spa pakage and I understood spa treatment 1time each night staying of course spa pakage was more pay than other options,Marriot Hotel is, if I book 2 days, I can take 2times spa(couple), each day each treatment, they gave a clear information but Hyatt spa, they said you booked 2 night but only one time treatment for one person.Even if you stay a week you can take only one time treatment. This rule is very strage and stupid. Why should I pay other night more?I need to know more clear information(cuz web site there are no detail) and asked reception about this pakage.Right side last receptionist said 'I can see only your staying spa pakage, you should ask spa. I tried to explain again but she more roudly answer, I do not know, ask spa' It was unproffecial and impolite attitude.Maybe they did not take training for service and how to communicate with other team.After spa, I ask again(receptionist could not answer) spa staff, he said, understood but only general manager can answer it. I feel, spa and front desk does not want to talk so I should ask myself go here and there again and again. No communication, no managing internally!!Just will not go Hyatt branch anymore and when you book spa pakage you should check the deatil. I want to share for all visitor about Hyatt spa pakage,Hotel did not give clear information but as Spa manager answer was,ONE TIME for ONE PERSON per NIGHT it does not matter how long stay and how much you pay more for spa pakage. What a great pakage.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were really worried about overpaying for a run down, undersized room. So we decided to spring for the Hyatt and it was well worth it. Clean room, friendly staff, and great location. My only complaint is the elevators were down half the time but the staff tried to divert people to the freight elevators which was a nice effort (though still slow). They need to get thy elevator situation sorted out. The drinks at the rooftop bar are very expensive but the views are nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place to stay in NYC. Perfect location right off Times Square in the heart of Broadway. Amazing view on top of the hotel in the lounge. Rooms are expensive but clean and very comfortable. We make several trips to NYC each year and this is our preferred hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Traveled on business, had just been in the same area March of 15. Great location if you want to be near Times Square and Mid-town. Previously I had stayed one block up town from this location. From here you can get to Rockefeller Center, Park Ave, Times Square and the theater districts easily. The bar on 54th floor is something to go check out. It's one of those things that you can be staying a block away and you wouldn't know unless someone told you. Great views from the bar--would recommend that as part of the stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really loved this hotel, when we come back to New York this will be where we will stay again. Great staff, good location and beautiful room. The terrace was lovely! Glad we upgraded to that. Not right in Times Square but just off enough that the bright lights and noise aren't bothersome at night. We loved this trip and this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You cannot get better - from the rooms to the facilities to the location and not to mention the service. It was all simply fantastic. Worked just perfectly for our 5 day city exploration. The hotel is in an excellent location from which we explored so much of New York City. The staff were so welcoming and polite - without being overally enthusiastic and fake like many places in NYC. I cannot recommend this hotel enough - the bar was also incredible!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great spot right off of Times Square. The rooms were very nicely appointed and surprisingly room for New York City. The window opened slightly let in the constant sounds of the city, but a closed window insulated them quite well.This property has been recently renovated and looks great. Service was excellent as well. Beware that proximity to Times Square also means traffic can be very congested right in from of the hotel and getting a taxi could be tough at times.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our company often helps visiting clients find accommodations when visiting the Big Apple. The Hyatt in Times Square has always been able to not only take exceptional care of our guests but have always added unexpected amenities that cause our continued support.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location close to Times Square but without the noise. Some light did come in but not bad. Decent restaurant with all the basic stuff. Close to many restaurants including a few quick service places as you exit to the left. Very low key hotel and small. Great service and attitude. Super clean rooms, nicely appointed and good size. Great gym with Life Fitness equipment, not the Precor crap like in other places. I would return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location for family vacation close to Times Square as well as subways. No complaints about room. Service was fine. I do appreciate more amenities and a wider variety of room service choices, so this would not be a top hotel in my view. But I would certainly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I took my daughter on a special Christmas in NY trip in mid December, and selected this Hyatt over my standby WEstin Times Squre after reading reviews about its new condition and relatively young age. In showed! The rooms and common areas are very fresh and updated looking, as compared to Starwood properties that have that over-conventioned feel and staleness to them. The staff was friendly and you can't beat the location - that said, if I was on business, I'd probably select a location a tad farther off Times Square, but for a family trip - it was perfect!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for s business trip but definitely did some personal exploring also. The location is excellent. You're half a block from the main part of times square. I had a high floor room and had a view of W 46th street (a bit of Times Square). I wanted a view of all the lights of Times Square but after having seen just a few of the billboards from my room, I was happy with not having lights flashing through the windows every night. The room was very large and nice. The water in the room is complimentary and they have a fridge to keep things cold. They offer complimentary shampoo, conditioner, deodorant, make up wipes, razor, shaving cream.. basically anything you may have forgotten to pack. My only complaint with this hotel is that the elevators take forever. I was on the 29th floor so taking the stairs weren't really an option. One morning I was on my way to work and it took my 5 minutes to wait for the elevator to get downstairs. It happened multiple times and drove me nuts. If you stay here, make sure you account for that time when planning to leave.Otherwise, nice hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazing hotel & staff, the check-in went smoothly and they were able to let us in our room on the 47th floor a little early. Room was very comfortable, up to date and clean. Great rooftop bar.....perfect for viewing the city! Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If we could give 4.5 stars we would, and the only "complaints" are minor. The front desk staff was of mixed friendliness--while some were friendly and helpful, others were, at best, indifferent, and, at worst, clearly bothered to have to even answer a question. The organization was somewhat nonexistent, and there seemed to always be a large, disorganized "line" (more like a crowd) at the desk. It was never clear where one was supposed to be. Very confusing and awkward, especially as this area of the lobby was very small for the crowd and the many comings and goings. Even just a corded off area with a clear line/order would have been helpful. To have finally made it to the desk only to be greeted (sometimes) by impatience made it all seem much worse than it actually was. The only other complaints are that the elevators were on the slow side and the room carpet was perhaps not the newest.These relatively minor issues aside, we couldn't have been more pleased with the Hyatt Times Square. It is in a perfect location right in the center of everything you could possibly want, and the doorman was quick to help us out of or into a cab. The room was enormous by NYC standards, with very comfortable beds and a lovely view. There was even free in-room coffee--amazing here. The bathroom was also large, with both a tub and a separate step-in shower, and the sink area easily accommodated two people at the mirror. A small window opened so we could listen to the traffic sounds below, but other than the noise we chose, there simply wasn't a sound. Bliss! The fitness center was very good sized, better than some full gyms we've been in, with a wide variety of good quality machines and weight equipment so we never waited for a machine to use, plus plenty to read, televisions and music, and clean towels. The rooftop lounge was excellent, with truly awesome views (even the one night it absolutely poured rain) and surprisingly good appetizer-type food--the salmon skewers were about as tasty as it gets--and the salty snack mix was always welcome. The only food we had in the downstairs restaurant was a morning muffin, but it was fresh.All in all, a very good stay at a very good place. With a little work on the lobby area--and some hospitality re-training of some staff--it would have been perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel after having found a perfect offer for me and my fammily. We stayed at a deluxe view suite and had a corner room on the 46th floor. As it was the first time in NYC for our kids they were impressed by the views on TS, freedom tower and chrysler building (leaning forward). The hotel is located perfectly and metro, TS and bryant park are all in walking distance. The rooms are in perfect state, clean, open, light and comfortable. The one thing that could be better in my opinion is the coffee. A n old fashioned coffee maker should be replaced by an Nespresso machine or similar. The personel is firendly and helpfull from doormen to housekeeping. Gym is okay but lacking weight machines and free weights in my opinion. B54 is okay but overpriced for the service and quality of the food and beverages. Overall this is definetly a hotel I would recommend for families and consider for my next stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel with excellent location. If traveling to NYC for a few days then this is a great place to stay. The staff are very accomadating to your needs and wants. Visit the revolving restaurant and take in a 360 degree view of all the splendor that is New York. The food is as wonderful as the view. Visit the hotel bar downstairs and you never know who you will meet. A friend and I meet a guy from Australia one time and hung out until 3am with him just drinking and telling great series about our 2 different cultures. We would have stayed longer except the girls we had waiting upstairs for us were getting paid by the hour. (Gets expensive quick). Just kidding they were our wives. Come to think of it , it would have been cheaper by the hour!! Everyone in life should be able to treat themselves to a little indulgence once in awhile so let this be it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I visited NYC for the first time and I've always enjoyed Hyatt brand so I used some points to take care of half my four night stay here.The hotel was excellent. It was just completed in 2013 and it shows. Everything is gleaming.Location was amazing. You are literally a minute walk to Times Square. A few more minutes and your to any other area you could possibly want to visit. Subway stations are very easy to get to.Down side is traffic...not the hotel's fault...but we arrived on Saturday and literally spent almost as much time in the street inching towards the front of the hotel as we did driving from airport.Staff was nice and check in easy. We arrived early for a 4pm check in. Staff tried very hard to get is in early, it just didn't work. The effort was appreciated. The room was excellent. We were in a king size and I expected a small room, being in NYC..the room size was perfect.Cleaning staff did an excellent job. We felt like it was a freshly prepared room each day we returned for the day.The gym, on the fourth floor, was bigger than expected and had great equipment. They have a high end bar on the 54th floor. Be warned...cocktail and alcohol prices are quite high. Enjoy a drink and the great patio!They have a restaurant in the lobby, I didn't try it though so I can't speak about it.I would absolutely recommend this hotel for any leisure trip. I will use this place again for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a regular visitor to NY. We decided to give the Hyatt a whirl. First impressions. Average. Check in was quick. We didn't want to pay the $400 incidental charge which was met with some resistance. My first impressions of the entrance/lobby was how small it was and how it lacked any sort of comfort. The room was extremely small, bathroom smallest we've ever had in NY. We where there with our 18yr old daughter so had a x 2 bedroom high floor. No additional chair in the room and no real room to move about in, so very disappointed with the room and bathroom size. House keeping was inconsistent. Trash not moved on some days. The lifts we always had to queue for but as it was a busy period this is understandable. We had a major problem with a very rude member of the roof top bar : I believe her name to be Debbie. On arrival to the bar, no staff were on hand to assist us, so following a brief moment on the outside terrace to take a couple of pictures, we noted a table had just been vacated. We sat on the table to be set upon by a very rude, unprofessional member of staff, who spoke to us in an appalling manner, telling us " you can't sit there, move from the table you have too book and there is a queue so move now. Disgraceful attitude. Then sashayed off, only to be then overheard telling other colleagues about the incident at the bar in earshot of myself and family. We did complain, and we where offered a glass of complimentary apple cider in which all guests have as a complimentary perk. A few days later we relieved A voicemail from a member of the hotel team apologising for the incident and it had been dealt with. Sadly for us this tarnished our stay. The doormen where the best asset of this hotel. Very courteous and friendly. Overall, this hotel lacks finesse and some sort of identity. We won't be recommending to any of our friends and family. It's the Knickerbocker for us next visit. Regards

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our second trip to NYC.... first with our 3 boys. We arrived early on Saturday morning by car. The valet worker was so nice and helpful. They unloaded luggage and set us on our way as our room was not ready yet.Someone called us about 2 hours later letting us know that our room was ready. We walked back, found our luggage and went to our room. We were on the 10th floor, which was great for me. I do not do well with heights and small kids.The beds were super soft and warm. The heated floor in the bathroom was fantastic! And we also loved the rain shower. The view wasn't the greatest, but I didn't expect it to be since we didn't pay extra for one.The staff was very helpful when needed! I dislocated my toe on the first night. I called downstairs and someone was able to find some bandaids and gauze and then bring it to me. I needed something to keep it in close to prevent it from happening again.We called for towels several times and they were always brought straight to us. We called and asked questions about the city and just general things and everyone was always helpful. We were always greeted when coming back inside the hotel.The proximity to Times Square and Rockefeller is great! Only one complaint.... and it is minor. When leaving early on Monday morning, we called valet. Someone told us it would be 15 minutes. We didn't go downstairs until that time frame was up. We waited another 15 minutes after that for our car to be brought to us. That was a little inconvenient with 2 young boys and a sleeping toddler.And to add to that, when I went looking for a luggage cart that morning, the sweet girl at the front desk said she would be glad to bring one to us. She was at our room within 5 minutes with a cart and even helped us load our luggage.Overall, a great stay and a great hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. A few steps from Times Square. All transit system near by. Great hotel staf. Great rooftop bar for the view. Thanks for the upgrade! Felt safe walking at night alone. Often chose to walk rather then take subway since it was faster and close by.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the best hotel we stayed at in NY (we go every year) great room, comfy beds, everything is there to make your stay enjoyable, one little detail though, the roof top bar, we couldn't stay because of my under aged daughter, we only could have a quick look and had to go! during the day, they could allow families to enjoy the view too

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location in Times Square, the rooms are comfortable and not noisy for being in a busy area. Bathroom nice with rain shower. We ate breakfast at the lobby restaurant and was very good, my favorite eggs with potatoes and kale. Small lobby, didn't have time to go to the rooftop bar. The only bad thing is the traffic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel for a December Holiday getaway. The location near Times Square is excellent as we were able to walk for shopping and shows. The rooms are spacious, clean, and quiet. The bedding is most comfortable. The over-riding negative I found was the lack of professionalism of the hotel staff. I felt more like I was checking in to a two star hotel. The lobby and entrance was not impressive. When I called the desk for room service, the phone was never answered. The concierge gave erroneous information on more than one occasion. With a few fixes, I'd rate it a 4 star.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a smaller, quiet hotel, located about a half-block from Times Square. It is standard fare for a Hyatt: clean, quiet, minimalistic. I was traveling with my mother for a "Ladies Do Broadway" weekend, so the location was perfect as we never had to walk more than a few blocks to arrive at any of the theaters. We were also within walking distance of Central Park, several museums, Rockefeller Plaza, etc. The hotel staff was courteous and friendly, and as we didn't spend much time in the hotel, I can't fairly evaluate the amenities. I've stayed in comparably priced hotels in the area previously, and this one lacks some "sparkle," but meets needs for peace and quiet.The room itself was fairly large, especially by NYC standards. We took advantage of the large soaking tub after long days of sightseeing. The was a mini-fridge which was also a nice amenity to have. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for two nights on the first leg of a family holiday.As we are a family of five, we splurged for the Premier Suite.All I can say is - WOW.Great sized two room and two bathroom suite on the 40th floor.Great modern furniture.Unbelievable views of Times Square, both from the king sized bed in the bedroom and from the huge private balcony.Very large cutting edge TV's in both rooms.Tons of storage space.By far the best suite I've stayed in in New York. We didn't eat at the hotel. Nor did we utilize any of its other facilities, except for the fitness room, which was very good.However, the combination of the room and the hotel's location just 200 meters from Times Square make it an easy choice for my hotel of choice for future NYC vacations.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is perfect -- we walked almost everywhere!!! Checked out the view from the 54th floor bar ... amazing!! The weather was clear and perfect for viewing the city. Visited St. Mary's Episcopal Church on 46th (?) St. ... beautiful!! Go there instead of St. Patricks!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel, as expected, was clean and comfortable.Some tips:If your budget can stretch to it you should definitely choose a room with a balcony/terrace. My wife and I couldn't get one for the first night as they were fully booked however we managed to change rooms (27th floor) the following day with the help of the exceptional front desk agent Jeff, for an extra $100 a night it was well worth it.Other exceptional members of staff include Kimberley and Spencer who could not do enough to ensure our stay was pleasurable,Don't bother trying to book a show through the concierge there is a large premium on the face value of the tickets and you are located so close to the shows it is very easy to walk up to the box office at 10:00am on the day of the show and purchase tickets for that night - often for a discount on the normal price.The roof top bar B54 offers exceptional views however, for 3 of our nights the bar had been booked out for corporate Christmas parties and therefore we were unable to use it.Being so central (W45th and 7th Ave) you are literally 150yds from Times square and within easy walking distance of Macy's/Empire State Building to the South on 34th street Radio City Music Hall/Rockerfella Centre to the North on 51st street, The USS Intrepid museum to the West on 12th Avenue and the Met Life Building and Grand Central Terminal on Park Avenue to the East. Even Central Park is only a 5 minute walk away.Traffic is an issue during the rush hour so if you are planning to travel by car/taxi do it before 8:00am or wait until after 10:00am and before 4:00pm and after 7:00pm.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For an NYC hotel, this was the best experience I've had staying in the city - the front desk was quick, efficient and friendly, the room was spacious with a nice bathroom (stall shower with a rainforest head was a nice touch), the bed was large and comfortable, the elevators were quick, and of course the location was perfect. The restaurant (located right off the lobby) was good, but pricey. Upon departure, checkout was again quick and efficient, with great service. If you read my reviews you'll see that if I don't like a hotel I am not shy about saying so, but when I like a hotel I also "tell it like it is". You will not be disappointed at this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed here on a trip to NYC in December. While expensive, the hotel was very nice and clean with modern rooms located within a few steps from Times Square. Upgrade to a room with a view if you can. Be sure to check out the roof-top bar as well if you get a chance (with beers starting at $12). The staff was also very professional. One thing I would like to compliment the hotel on was bag checks, in which they tagged your bag and put it in the storage room themselves.Having said all that, I would not stay near Times Square on return trips to NYC due to its congestion. If you prefer this location and can afford it, I would recommend this hotel. If you are coming to NYC with an open agenda (and don't like crowds), I would suggest looking for hotels in another area of the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms and bathrooms are outstanding. Spacious and well equipped with AC and technology for international and US travelers to NYC. Check in was lighting fast, even with Times Square packed with travelers for the Xmas holiday. The weather was 63 degrees so the streets were packed in Mid-December. Elevators were fast. The gym was a perfect size and well kept and clean. The pricing is not for everyone and I was only there for one overnight. The lobby is smaller, but security works around the clock to check everyone heading to the elevators. Finally, it's right in the middle of Times Square and the Theater district.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed on Sat. night Dec. 12th. Check-in was a breeze and the view from the Top of the hotel on 54th floor was awesome (but, be warned-the drinks are very expensive)! Didn't see any Santa-con bozos up there so that was nice! Hotel room was clean; King size bed was firm and comfy and the bath/shower was quite clean and easy to negotiate. Nice, new towels and many of them along with sample lotion and soaps, a magnifying mirror and a hair dryer! All in all, a very good experience. We will come back to the Hyatt at Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you're visiting NYC for the first time you need to stay here! I arrived at the hotel in a taxi, tired after a long flight and was greeted by a friendly doorman who grabbed my luggage and started chatting with me straight away. Check-in was a really lovely experience, once I'd told the hosts it was my first time to America and New York City they couldn't have been more welcoming, offering to help me find my way around and make recommendations on where to go. Our room was outstanding, on a high floor we had impressive views of the city. The room itself has been furnished to an incredibly high standard, very trendy, modern and almost executive whilst still feeling homely. There is a Nespresso machine in the room and if you leave a note for your housekeeper and a good tip they'll keep you stocked up with plenty of coffee throughout your stay (Branded Starbucks).The bed was massive and the bathroom was a very good size with a rainfall-style shower. A list was left in our room in case there was anything we needed, some free of charge, some required a small deposit. We were really glad of this when we realised our hair straighteners didn't seem to be working and the hotel brought us some to use free of charge for the rest of the week. Our housekeeper (Shoutout to Francis) was fantastic, always leaving our room in immaculate condition! Another person we need to mention personally is Customer Host, Spencer. He made our stay extra special by always being ready to help us with anything. The only negative we experienced at the hotel was that I had arranged for a birthday surprise later on in the week for my sister of wine and cake to be delivered to the room, unfortunately due to miscommunication with the kitchen it was brought up on our first night. Spencer dealt with us personally, apologising and arranging for the cost to be taken off the bill. The 'Sky Lounge' is really the highlight of this hotel, currently the tallest hotel rooftop bar in New York City it has impressive views across the whole city when it is lit up at night and is a great suntrap in the middle of the day. Be mindful though that here you will pay more for convenience of it being exclusive for guests. We paid $65 for one pitcher of cocktail and that was minus tax and tip but it's worth going up there if even only for one night during your stay just for the views. The staff in the bar were lovely and even gave us some free drinks on my sister's birthday which was really kind. The location of this hotel is absolutely superb! Across the street from Starbucks and Planet Hollywood and less than a 2 minute walk to the heart of Times Square where you will find an array of shops, restaurants and entertainment. The nearest subway is at Times Square and this is a great starting point to get you around - We got the subway from here to get to the Mets Stadium. There is also a Walmart for all your essential needs. The hotel really is right in the heart of everything and is in a location which you can easily get to places slightly further afield. Radio City Music Hall and Empire State Building was about a 15 minute walk from the hotel, Central Park was about a 20 minute walk. We got an Uber taxi from the hotel to Downtown Manhattan when visiting the One World Trade Centre and the 9/11 Memorial and it cost us approx $45. The hotel offers free-wifi throughout which is really useful. If you have time, make sure you book in advance to eat Breakfast/Brunch at Sarabeths near Central Park (only 20 minutes away) for an unforgettable meal! This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in and for my first visit to America and NYC made it an unforgettable one, especially as the price wasn't anywhere near as extortionate as some of the other hotels nearby. You really get what you pay for here and more and the staff are a real highlight, absolutely superb stay! Will definitely return if I'm ever back in New York City!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is a half block from Times Square, yet we were never bothered by the noise. The room was great - attractive decor, clean, comfortable bed, empty refrigerator, nice shower, great lighting, security,... There is a little deli/market just a few doors away for coffee, water, snacks,... My only negative, and it is pretty trivial - there are no drawers in the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is an excellent hotel and it is in the best location in Manhattan, located close to Broadway, restaurants, shopping, Central Park, MOMA, St. Patrick's and more. Don't let the hustle and bustle of Times Square fool you, when you're ready to sleep after a long day of sightseeing or business meetings, you won't hear a peep from the outside world. The bedding is lush, the pillows and mattress are made for sweet dreams. The rain shower bath is a refreshing way to wake up. Room service delivers hot fresh coffee just as soon as you hang up the phone with guest services. And let's not forget the young, hip and very friendly Hyatt staff; they could not have been nicer or more welcoming. If you go, be on the lookout for Hyatt staff Josh, Paige and Noah, although everyone I encountered there was amazing. And do NOT miss a visit to the Hyatt's Bar 54. The view is so incredible it rivals that of the Empire State Building, and you can sip a cocktail while you're there!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited New York overnight to see a show and for some business. Selected the Hyatt for its location in the theater district, same street as our threater. Hadn't stayed here before. Could not have been happier. Streamlined checkin process for Hyatt Gold members. Room was on an upper floor, clean, comfortable bed/sheets/pillows, good TV, modern bathroom, soft towels. Lounge on the 54th floor overlooks the city, great view. Staff were extremely courteous and helpful. Have stayed at the W, Palace, Intercontinental, Westin, Marriott, Sofitel and others over the past 10 years. We were wowed by the qualtiy we got for our money. We are always looking for a high quality at a good value and the Hyatt absolutely delivered.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We LOVED this hotel. Just returned from a holiday weekend in NYC and have zero complaints. We were within walking distance of everything. The staff was wonderful and accommodating. Our room with a direct view of Times Square was clean and comfortable. The bed was clean and comfortable. Best of all? The price was extremely reasonable! Would DEFINITELY stay again. Thank you, Hyatt Times Square New York!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent 4 nights here over Thanksgiving and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We are a family of four with boys ages 12 & 7 and it was our first trip to the city. Served as a perfect home base to explore. The Macy's parade comes down 6th street a half a block away which was extremely convenient. We walked to the ESB, a Broadway show, Times Square, Grand Central, RCMH, Central Park, St. Patrick's, 5th Ave and Rockefeller Center. Times Square is half a block away and close subway stations can take you anywhere else in the city. Felt very safe even late at night. There are a couple of great deli's a few doors down with low priced options for meals and a Duane Reed less than a block away for essentials. Our room was on the 12th floor so out view wasn't great but we enjoyed watching the activity on 45th. I did get "room service" one night from the restaurant and I can highly recommend the rueben sandwich. The hotel is newer, clean, and very nice. Rooms were nice but not extravagant but who says in their hotel room in NYC? Paid exclusively with Hyatt points so we couldn't beat the value. Overall we had a very positive experience and would recommend other families stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked two queen rooms. Rooms are very nice size (big) for NYC standards. Compared to Sheraton Midtown, room was almost double. Awesome! The bath was large and rain shower was amazing-big enough for at least 2-3 people. :) Service was very attentive & friendly when asked questions & toiletry items were delivered promptly. Room service was very quick-like very fast compared to most hotels. Location is perfect for Times Square, 5th Ave, Radio City and major restaurants/shops/theaters in area. Would definitely return again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a short trip to NYC during Christmas time. The hotel is very modern and well kept. Staff was very friendly and the room was very nice and clean. They stored our luggage for us on the last day because out flight was later on. Will definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here between 6/12 - 10/12 - The hotel itself is lovely, a fantastic location with nice big rooms & great views of the city.It boasts the highest roof terrace in New York which was one of the reasons we booked - however on a couple of occasions we couldn't actually go up as they had private functions - would of been nice if they had of given us the heads up when we checked in so we could of plan accordingly - Its a bit useless when you cant actually go for a drink in the place you booked the hotel for!The cocktails are very good but you will be looking at around $26 each!Overall the staff are great & the hotel is very nice so i would recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: With such a wide range of 4 star Hotels in Central NYC it can be hard to choose one. We eventually chose the Hyatt Times Square & it proved to be a fabulous choice. The rooms are large, well equipped & extremely comfortable & include a fridge for keeping the wine cool. Our room (we paid slightly more for a view) was a corner one on the 31st floor & looked down into Times Square.The staff service was impeccable from the cleaning staff right through to the doormen. Our TV locked up during a movie & having reported the issue at Reception a member of the Engineering team attended within 5 minutes, sorted the problem & arranged for the pay movie to be put on for another day free of charge.In short, the next time we come to NYC the Hyatt at Times Square will be our default choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, good value for its location and the comfort provided. Very centralized, so everything was withing walking distance including the main bus interchange. It is a very busy area, which is perfect for tourists that want to be well immersed in the NY vibe. We were only there for 2-3 nights so it was just right because we were planning to go around Manhattan so it was convenient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly check in staff. Beautiful view of the building where the ball drops. Loved the rooftop bar. Room was larger than many hotels in Manhattan. Great location near Times Square. Quiet sleep and the room was tastefully appointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was a very pleasant stay at the hotel, we stay for 8 nights, had to say I was impressed abut the spacious room we got, tho queen beds. The only complain was the lack of storage space.Personal was friendly and efficient enough. Free wifi, complementary bathroom items if you forgot something.We didn't try room service but seems to be pricey, you have plenty restaurants and cheaper options near tough.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: LOVED this hotel. very new and the staff was so welcoming and friendly. location is amazing as far as being right next to time square and down the street from most broadway theaters. would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were in NYC for our wedding and wanted a nice hotel with good location.The room was big and traveling with an infant that is what we needed.It was clean and the bed was very comfortable.The security was high as all guests had to show a roomkey to enter the elevators. Very helpful and nice doormen. BUT Before our trip I sent emails to the hotel to make some arrangements for our wedding. None of my emails were answered untill I sent them to the Hyatt group.And not that I expected them to make a big deal out of it, I did expect them to congratulate us on our weddingday. No one said a word, exept the doorman. Walking thorugh the hotel in my weddingdress other guest congratulated us, but none of the staff members did or said anything. Everything was nice, but dont know if I would stay here again as the price is higher than the standard you get. It is all about the locaion and that is what you are paying for.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel and security were great! The service was great! The hotel was clean! But, when you plan a trip to the Big Apple you expect the rooms to look a LOT nicer than they did. One of the decorations in our room was a plastic balloon dog...I mean - WHAT??? I'm guessing it was a contemporary design but quite frankly...it was ugly. Other than that - this was one great place to stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
