review_body: This hotel is in a really good location. Easy to walk to all areas of the city even with two children. The standard of the hotel is very good. The housekeeping service was excellent and the staff really helpful, especially Walter who was really friendly and helpful when assisting us to get back to the airport.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My mother, sister and I were just in town for a girls weekend and the Hyatt Times Square was a perfect hotel for us. Great location, close to the theatre district and Rockefeller Plaza but not too noisy or crowded because it is set back off of Times Square just enough. Excellent views (but very pricey drinks) from rooftop bar. Staff was friendly and accommodating - quick and easy check in and check out process. The room was a nice size for NYC. Clean, bright, comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Although we would have liked to have had a room with a better view of times Square, the room was very comfortable and the service was great. The room was very comfortable and clean. The service to the room was excellent and Hyatt personnel were very friendly and willing to assist in any way.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel from the 29th November for 4 nights and was very happy with it. We had a Deluxe King room on the 52nd floor which was south facing which meant that when I opened the curtain I had a fantastic view over Manhattan with the new One World Trade Centre standing proud in the centre. The room was large by NYC standards and had a large Super King size bed and a bathroom which had a separate bath and shower. There was a large wardrobe, desk, chair, fridge and safe in the room but the view was the real standout feature.The hotel staff are polite and efficient and the roof top bar is definitely worth a look, although the all the furniture has now been brought inside due to the time of year. The location is great being only about 100yds away from Times Square and everything that goes with that. There is a restaurant/Bistro built on to the side, I did not have a meal there but did have coffee, Wine and beers and, once again, the staff are very pleasant.I can highly recommend the Hyatt Times Square and would have no hesitation in staying there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spent 3 nights on a business trip at the Hyatt, I usually stay at the Intercontinental but it was sold out the week I visited. Overall I was happy with the Hyatt. The staff were friendly, the location was convenient to walk to my office and the street was away from the hustle & bustle of Times Square. They offered free WiFi which was an added bonus. The Hyatt has now become a go-to in my Times Square hotel searches, I will definitely return. Ps. the carrot cake from the room service menu is to die for!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the hotel is the worst hotel in my like i don't like to recommend to any body to this hotel is because the porters at the lobby the watchman are running the business in there own with becoming the travel agent for cab & black car they simply wants to earn money with cheating the guest

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is in a fantastic location. It is in the heart of the action but the rooms are still quiet. The hotel is presented well and very clean and tidy. The rooms are excellent with a comfortable bed and modern bathroom.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked the Hyatt at the last minute and were not disappointed. While it is close to Times Square, it's just off the main roads which makes you feel like you're out of the way of the crowds of people, while still being close to the theaters, restaurants, and actual "Times Square" area (where the ball drops on New Years Eve). I thought the staff were actually some of the friendliest people we met in the city; extremely helpful, professional and accommodating. We booked a deluxe Queen room for 4 people and had plenty of space, which is saying something for a NYC hotel room. Beds were comfortable, shower/ bathroom was very nice with a large bathtub and decent water pressure. Although check-in wasn't until 4:00 they happily kept our bags for us until our room was ready, and after we checked out kept our bags, again, for the good part of a day. Starbucks across the street, for easy coffee access! Cabs were easy to come by out front when we needed one. Would highly recommend this Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is about 300 ft. from Times square. We stayed there because of the Macy"s parade which was one-half block away. So it's a great place to stay to go to the parade.Rooms-small but excellent. Only about 10 rooms per floor. Great view of Manhatten.Staff-all were friendly and very good. Wifi was free and fastThis hotel is only 2 years old. We ate at the restaurant. Just had appetizers and soup but it was good.54th floor-we visited and the view is very good but you cannot see Times square.Times Square,Radio City Music Hall,Macy's & theate district all walkable.We were upgraded to a room on the 51st floor.I would definately stay at this Hyatt again. You can't beat it for location and quality.Note-If you do not want the full breakfast there is a Starbucks across the street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just arrived home having spent 5 nights at Hyatt Times Square. This hotel could not be in a better location. Two minute walk in to Times Square. Fifteen minutes to Central Park, ten minutes to Grand Central and Bryant Park. Plenty of bars and restaurants within easy walking distance.The hotel room was big, bright, spotlessly clean and well equipped.Every member of staff we spoke to was pleasant, helpful and certainly a credit to the hotel. Nothing was too much trouble.This was our sixth visit to New York and our first stop at this hotel, we would not hesitate to return to this hotel as it certainly exceeded our expectations and did not fail in any area.If you want the ideal hotel don't look anywhere else.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family (10) stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Nice and spacious rooms and bathrooms (ask for upper floors) and the family rooms were really nice. Staff were not over friendly but that's expected in NYC. Bar on the top floor has stunning views of the city but quite expensive. Only negative - Time Square is very busy. If you prefer a quiet area its best to avoid this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband, daughter and I recently stayed at the Hyatt Times Square New York over Thanksgiving. We came specifically to see the parade and this hotel put very nearby the parade route. I found the hotel to be very nice. The rooms were very clean, generously spaced and the beds/bedding were very comfortable. I am a seasoned traveler and this was the quietest hotel that I have ever stayed in! I didn't hear ANY noise from other guests while I was in my room. This was amazing to me given that it was a very busy weekend. The curtains completely blacked out the room and there was no noise from the busy street below either! The shower was nice and there was plenty of counter space for getting ready. The bathroom even had a makeup mirror, however the lighting in the bathroom was inadequate to really use it. We didn't eat on property so I can't comment about the restaurant but the concierge staff were very helpful in assisting with reservations for Thanksgiving dinner off property and they were very helpful in directing us where to see the parade and what time to go etc. Overall I was very impressed with my stay and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff were friendlyThe rooms are modern and spacious and spotlessly clean, with crisp white linen, heated floors, satellite TV and an amazing view, I even managed to visit the gym which was brilliant. Modern and full equipped.The 54 floor bar is busy and playing jazz. Service was amazing. Outside balcony My only critique was the food. I found it extremely over priced. Breakfast was $35 on average, but you have lots of choice outside the hotel. Location is perfect. All sites in walking distances

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We checked in sunday 15th of november, and had booked a Deluxe Suite because their website stated that those rooms were located in the top floors of the hotel, now it even says that its located above the 39th floor. We got a Deluxe suite located on the 24th floor (#2401) so thats obviously not true.. The guy at the front desk who checked us in did not really take us serious when i showed him their own website.The room was was very nice and clean, had great space and the bed was excellent.The bathroom was quite big but the under floor heating was just not possible to adjust anywhere so the floor was icecold.(maybe i'm blind) The elevators was fast, and there was never any waiting for that. We had breakfast two times in the diner on the ground floor, and the service there was very good, and we just charged it to our room when we finished eating.The doormen were fantastic and very polite, but the last day when we checked out (19 nov) I asked the guy standing outside if he could order a black car to take us to the airport at 6 pm, no worries he said, a car will be here with your name in the window.When it was 6:15 I was starting to worry and asked the new guy who was outside if he could check the status on the car for us, and he did, but he said that no car was ever ordered so he managed after a while to hail down a yellow taxi to take us to JFK, so we ended up checking in to our flight 8 minutes before it closed, quite stressed..Would stay again, due to the hotels location

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is 1/2 block off of Times Square which allows a little breathing room from the crowds yet walking distance to all Times Square and Theater district. Central Park and SoHo are just quick commute or good walk away.The hotel staff were the highlight and the rooms were quite adequate. The rooms are a bit simple and may need an updating of decor, carpet, paint in near future but all was clean and well maintained. Trip up to the 52nd floor view is well worth it. We reserved 2 deluxe rooms, 1 2Q and 1K. They upgraded the King to a corner suite King, up 45 floors and right on 45th st with nice views of Times Square and 6th Ave for the Macy's Day parade. Wow, well worth the upgrade.Tip on reservations. We booked 6-8 weeks in advance at the $400ish rates. Gulp, but that's NYC. About a week before we checked current rates for the same rooms and they were about 1/2. Hyatt cancelled old reservation and booked a new one saving us hugely!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are after a central hotel, this one is for you. Walking distance to subway, Empire State, Rockefeller, Central Park. Also very close to Times Square without being in the craziness! There were no higher floor rooms available when we checked in so had one on floor 7. In hindsight I am glad we didn't pay extra as we were only in our room to sleep.Hotel concierge were fantastic and booked us a restaurant for Thanksgiving dinner and gave us lots of tips.Bar - well, its a bar with a high balcony. Unless you are on the balcony you could be in any bar. Its also ridiculously priced so only had one drink in there. I don't think the lobby has a wow factor at all. Personally I preferred the Hilton Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family came to NYC over thanksgiving weekend. We stayed at Hyatt Times Square New York and had a wonderful time. Always love Hyatt properties and this one was no exception. Delightful staff who truly care about your stay. Went to the bar on the 54th floor Beautiful! Pricey, but what isn't in NYC?? Thanks again Hyatt for a wonderful experience!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed 3 nights in September 2015 and the room was very clean and new. Just like the photos. I especially liked the bathroom which has big shower booth with heated floor. I would absolutely book again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took my wife and two teen daughters for fall break to this hotel. Room had adequate space by NYC standards and was very clean and well appointed. Restaurant downstairs very accommodating if a little pricey. Plenty of other places nearby also. If you are looking for large, opulent lobby, this isn't your place. If you want location, great room, high rise bar with breathtaking view of the city, and extremely helpful staff, this is your place. I wouldn't call this place a bargain by any means, but you definitely get what you pay for.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect hotel for family.rooms were clean.it had almost everything what you expect when you check in any hotel for holiday.it was quite surprising as you get such hotel in world most expensive and busiest city

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location. Fab comfortable and modern rooms. Staff very friendly and smart. The real plus is the cocktail bar on the 54th floor...what a view. Wouldn't hesitate to return. Fantastic shower and facilities throughout

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent service from everyone I encountered at this hotel. Check in was easy, room was ready. Clean room with good quality fixtures. Large bathroom with nice walk in shower. All was clean. Water pressure and temp was very good. Bed was wonderful and very comfortable. This hotel was quiet even though it was close to Times Square. You could not hear any outside noise and the black-out curtains kept all light out. Restaurant downstairs was very good with great coffee.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times. And I've loved every stay. As a native New Yorker, a spacious room is a luxury. This hotel gives you a spacious room that is nicely decorated. The bathroom is nice. The pictures are accurate.The staff is great! From the moment you walk in to the time you're ready to leave.My only issue is the check in (4pm) and check out time (11am). It would usually be a deal breaker but they are accommodating when they can.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square hotel was a brilliant find. Our room was nice and spacious and had lovely views. The bathroom was nice and clean with a brilliant roof top shower. There was a lovely roof top lounge on the 54th floor where we went every night. I would definately recommend going there. There was a restaurant in the hotel for breakfast and dinner. There were restaurants on the same street too which served breakfasts and dinners. Hyatt Times Square was central to all the sights we needed to see. It was lovely being able to walk in Times Square, my jaw dropped everytime with the big screens and all the lights. Times Square on a night time is like a party with the shops blasting their music and shoppers dancing away. We went to New York during Thanksgiving and saw the Macys Thanksgiving Parade which was amazing. I would also like to recommend watching a basketball game at the Madison Square Garden. Amazing atmosphere and great entertainment.If you like roof top bars we went to a lovely bar in the hotel Ink 48 called the Press Lounge and is 20 minutes walk from Times Square. This gives spectacular views of New York from outside the Times Square area. They play lovely jazz music too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location was great and convenient for our itinerary. The staff was polite, professional and attentive. Room was clean. The price was reasonable and competitive compared to other hotels in Times Square. I would definitely stay here again when visiting New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My now fiancé and I made arrangements to travel to Manhattan, New York a few months back and struggled with picking a hotel due to our want to be in the heart of time square. We finally agreed on the Hyatt, Time Square due to location and price point. What my fiancé did not know at that time was that I intend to use this opportunity to propose to her so I wanted everything to be perfect.I reached out to the hotels staff a few days prior to our trip to explain what I was hoping to do and how they could help with making this experience happen the way I envisioned it in my mind. I did request a room on a high floor with spectacular views and that the staff not say a word to my girlfriend and potentially ruin the surprise so I was not sure what to expect once we arrived. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Steve the doorman, whom at the time I had no idea was going to play such a pivotal role in making my proposal go off without a hitch. The manager on duty was waiting for us and had already arranged to put us on the second highest floor with the most unbelievable view of the city skyline and Time Square and as promised the staff did not say one single word to tip off my girlfriend so the plan was in motion.When we arrived to the room we were taken back by the views which automatically took our attention away from all the great things the room we were staying in had to offer. We quickly noticed the amazing bathroom that comes with the Deluxe Suite, View. The rain shower head and heated floors were amazing to use during stay. I actually miss that bathroom now that I am thinking about it. The bathroom was very large and quite honestly may be the second largest room in that suite. We did not take advantage of the soaking tub but if you are someone who loves taking baths the tub they have in that bathroom will make it difficult for you to leave when it's time to check out. We had a king size bed in a perfectly sized bedroom that allowed us room to move around without stepping on each others toes. The view from the bedroom was as spectacular as the view from the main living space (upon entry to the suite) which seemed to the smaller of the three rooms but nonetheless functional. I'm told for New York standards we had a large hotel suite (coming from Chicago I couldn't complain which to me speaks volumes about the sq. ft. of the room) which most definitely satisfied my standards.After getting settled in I ran downstairs to catch the concierge before they left for the day to find out how far Central Park was from the hotel if we walked. During my conversation with the concierge he mentioned I should speak to Steve the doorman about getting a ride there so I can make it in time for my proposal. After sharing my plans with Steve he told me "not to worry" and to be downstairs at 8:30 A.M. I figured he was going to get us a cab or shuttle but Steve did WAY MORE than that and set us up with a personal driver (Latest fully loaded Suburban model) who picked us up promptly @ 8:30 A.M. from the hotel and drove us to Central Park. The driver was awesome and pointed out places we may want to see during our stay as he drove us to Central Park. Steve was running point on this so all I had to do was communicate with him via texted message.After I successfully proposed in Central Park (she said "YES" by the way...) and we took photos with a professional photographer I was able to texted Steve and the same driver located us on a busy Friday late morning in less than 15 minutes and took us back to the hotel where everyone (including Steve and our driver) was waiting to congratulate us. To cap things off the manager had a celebratory bottle of champagne with two glasses and a beautiful note awaiting us in the room upon our arrival. Unexpected but truly appreciated by my fiancé and I. What a kind gesture from the staff at the Hyatt, Time Square.I am so thankful that the staff went above and beyond to be so helpful whether it was inquiries about recommending a great place to eat Italian or how to navigate through the subways they were accessible and willing to help in all ways possible. We were able to see so much during our stay due to close proximity to tourist destinations, restaurants, shopping and means of transportation (e.g., subway). I most definitely will stay at the Hyatt, Time Square the next time we are in Manhattan, New York and HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone looking to visit Manhattan, New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: it is close to the heart of the time square, so the view was really nice, very comfortable, the hotel was practically new, I didn't see any trash, front desk were very helpful to find me a room. the price was really nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned from a trip to New York, we stayed at the Hyatt,Times Square, perfect location. Staff very friendly, hotel immaculate. You must take the Big Bus Tour of the city, we paid $90 for two tickets, money well spent, the guide Gene was fantastic, made the tour exceptional! Full of info about the city, you can hop on and off all over, buses arrive every 15 minutes or so. On the return journey we had Johnny, again great guide full of information. Great city to visit, you will come home exhausted but it was worth every minute, my favourite places were Central Park and the Christmas tree at the Rockafeller Centre, just spectacular!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location to get to so many places in NYC. The room and bathroom were larger than I expected for an NYC hotel room. Staff was friendly and helpful. Service at the restaurant was a little slow, but friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location, great, helpful staff. The room was average. Carpet was not clean at all p, we stains and my feet became black after walking on it. Toiletries in the room was bottle shampoo and a bottle of conditioner and 2 bars of soap. Nothing else, which I've never experienced in a hotel before, especially a Hyatt. No cotton ball,s cotton buds or anything which I never expect to bring normally. Also, need some racks to store luggage. Ours lived on the floor as we had 4 of them. The staff were great though and friendly and obliging. Would sta there again but would stay in a suite next time, depending on the condition.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square Nov 23-26. We had a great view of Tines Square from the 41st floor. The service was impeccable and the room was very clean. The restaurant at the hotel had a great menu selection. The concierge did an excellent job of making dinner reservations and suggestions for excellent restaurants.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I cannot thank the staff at the Hyatt Times Square enough for all they did for my family and myself last weekend. With several rooms booked and all of us arriving at different times, Lauren and the rest of the staff made sure we all had the proper style rooms and that we were all on the same floor together. Location, location, location! The Hyatt Times Square is about a half a block from the heart of Times Square and just a couple from Bryant Park. Two doors down you’ll find Connolly’s Pub for the BEST Shepherd’s Pie and go one more door down you’ll find the Café Cranberry Deli (opened 24/7). I’ve said this in past reviews, but I wanted to compliment the Housekeeping Staff at the Hyatt. They have always been fast, professional & friendly during my past stays.The Front Desk Staff (DEDE) are always busy but never rush you. They make sure you have all the information you need and listen to your questions. Room Tip: When you book, try to secure a high floor room facing south. Great views of the city & the Freedom Tower. Lastly, DO NOT BE AFRAID to visit NYC. Not only is it the Greatest City in the World, it is the Safest as it is protected by the Greatest Police Department in the World.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location just off Times Square. Rooms are quite small but overall a good standard. Stayed for 10days. Requested a change of floor due to construction noise which was handled professionally and efficiently. Rooftop bar is lovely and worth a visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were quite pleased with the rooms, the location and the price that we were able to secure on Trip Advisor. We have come to trust TA for travel recommendations, so we all need to give honest reviews whenever possible. Thank you to NYPD for keeping all of us travelers SAFE IN NEW YORK!.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After much research on the internet and trying to find a great place to stay I finally thought I had come across the perfect place.Unfortunately most of the stay was below the standard I was led to believe.Some Pro's of the hotel though.Fantastic location. 10 mins walk maximum to most things.Close to SubwayGood viewsNow the Con's which are down to my personal experience.When I booked, I booked a Deluxe View King room which said it would be on the 41st floor or above. I paid for this and this was what I expected. On check in at around 1300-1400 I was told the room was not ready yet but they would put us in an equivalent if not better room. This was a lie. I was put in a View King room on the 31st floor which was a smaller and cheaper room. I did not realise this at the time and as our stay was only short we did not want to waste time moving rooms. I was most disappointed that we had been downgraded but been told that it was supposed to be a better room.I tried to contact the hotel to arrange surprises for my partners birthday. This was ignored. Do not try to get in touch with the hotel via timessquare@hyatt.com because they just won't answer.The staff by the lift were most unfriendly when asking for proof that we were guests at the hotel. Overall some good but most bad points which equated to a most disappointing stay in this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful view from room, convenient to Times Square. Clean and Quiet and Comfortable. A great jumping off spot to get to sights. Safe and friendly. Only thing to improve would be airport transportation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Found my stay at the Hyatt Times Square very pleasant. Could be close to being a 5 start experience with a few "small" fixes. Generally speaking:The good:- Good location off Times Square, though a bit closer to the action than I'd like, but overall centrally located- Diamond breakfast is great, as you get ~$40 pp for breakfast (more than 1 person should be able to use- Good, well-priced food - had one dinner and multiple breakfasts and was satisfied with both- Clean, decent sized standard rooms- Decent sized gym with free weights and enough machines to get a work out in- Great value for such a nice hotel in NYC (3-4 star and up)The "bad" (improvement needs):- Lack of proactive (or any) room upgrades - I've had most Hyatt properties pre-upgrade me or offer me solid upgrades, but here I was only offered a higher floor (with no real views still).- A bit close to Time Square - makes walking to/from the hotel during busy times a bit hectic

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want to be able to walk to Times Square, theaters, and Rockefeller Center, this is your hotel! And for other attractions, it's easy to catch a tour bus or subway nearby, or a cab right out front. Starbucks is directly across the street for a quick breakfast or afternoon refueling and a variety of other restaurants are easy walking distance.The hotel is modern and smells great. Very refreshing after a long day in the city. Rooms are clean, functional, and very quiet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Tried this Hyatt for the first time; nice change, smaller than the mega Marriott Marquis, but also it lacks some of those amenities. Great location, friendly staff, nice modern rooms. Nice rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square was perfect for one night in the city. The staff was warm and friendly and the front desk check-in young lady (Yenny) was great! The hotel is clean, modern and well kept. I enjoyed the high floor King room with a north facing view. The room was a bit small but perfect for 1-2 people. Great pressure from the shower which has rain showerhead or hand held options. The sound proofing betweens the rooms is great and you don't hear much from hallway noise. Beautiful and sexy but overpriced rooftop lounge (with indoor seating as well).Cons: Because of the location Times Square sometimes the noise of nearby construction can hum in the background. It is not completely overpowering but it is present. Hotel Bar has great views but is ridiculously overpriced even for Manhattan. Check out the view but drink elsewhere Wish hotel had a pool.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just stayed here this past weekend. The hotel and room were excellent. Everything is very contemporary. We had one of the "view-two queens" rooms. Hard to call it a "view" since it was not facing Times Square, so that was probably the biggest disappointment and why I'm not giving five stars. We were on the 30th floor, but facing north, so all we saw were other high rises around us - certainly nothing of note or interesting. I thought the room was fine - it seemed big by NYC standards compared to a couple other times I've been there - and plenty of room for three of us. The bathroom had a tub and shower. The hotel staff were very courteous and attentive, and one minor problem with our room was fixed almost immediately. Our room rate included free Wi-Fi.Two slight downsides, neither of which would keep us from staying here again. The restaurant, like many in NYC hotels, or most big city hotels for that matter, is grossly overpriced. Breakfast would have run at least $25 each for basic bacon, eggs, and juice. Lunch and dinner significantly more. Three diet cokes in 8oz bottles while we were waiting for airport transportation was almost $15. Fortunately, there are tons of less expensive restaurant options close-by. There is a deli just up the street, and an excellent Irish pub just a couple doors down - bacon and egg breakfast about $8, and a massive traditional Irish breakfast for $13.There is a very nice rooftop bar on the 54th floor. The view is fabulous and shouldn't be missed. However, you should pass on the $25 and up "mixologist" cocktails. I'm just not paying that much for a couple ounces of booze and fruit juice, and again, there are too many options in the area to pay that much.So - great hotel, great location, great staff, enjoyed our stay. Others may not care that much about the food and drink prices, but NYC is pricey enough already.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's all about location, location, location. The hotel is within easy walking distance of 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, Broadway theaters, Times Square, and restaurants galore. And the staff are always very pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We wanted a hotel near the theater district for a weekend in NYC. The Hyatt Times Square turned out to be just perfect. At first, we thought that the room was a bit sparse. We missed seeing the closet, thinking that the door was for entry into the adjoining room. After a quick call to the front desk, we realized that the closet door was sticking. A quick yank and voila! We also initially missed the refrigerator, safe, and coffee maker -- all disguised behind doors of the main chest in the room. Our initial impression was wrong. The room was organized with all of the conveniences; they were just not readily apparent. On the 35th floor, we had a wonderful view of the city. The bathroom (shower - no tub) was quite nice. Staff were wonderful. A trip to the rooftop bar is a must. If you are afraid of heights, beware! I would return to this Hyatt again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After a few visits at the Hyatt Time Sqare Hotel i would certanly keep on staying at this hotel. The staff are vey polite and helpfull , Amazing location and sevice highly recomended hotel in New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great central location hotel, good roof top bar, great cocktails and outside area ( and you can smoke there too) near to al the central marathon places, staff are lovely, helpful and friendly. breakfast at T45 is good but occasionally long wait . B4 lovely roof top bar but be careful half is not shut for a function

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Another solid Hyatt property. It was a short stay for us, but we had a wonderful time. If you want to be in the middle of it all, but be able to escape to a quiet, relaxing room, the Hyatt Times Square is for you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first time visiting New York. After reviewing many hotels, we decided to stay at the Hyatt Times Square. Let me first start by saying great customer service. One employee especially stood out his name was Ravi. He made my stay very comfortable and enjoying. Every issue I had he was on top of it. He always smiled as well. The decor was very modern, chic, and upscale. The beds were very comfortable, room was really spacious. The shower in the bathroom was absolutely heaven! I loved the black tile on the walls. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel. As well stay here again myself for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel July 4th weekend. We asked for early check in as we had an early flight and our room was waiting when we arrived at the hotel. The room was very modern and kept clean the whole weekend.It included a mini fridge, a coffee maker and a safe. The rooms had wifi which we also had no issues with. We were always greeted with a smile when entering or exiting the hotel. This hotel is right in the middle of Times Square. The rooftop bar, Bar 54, was amazing!! The views were spectacular, a must see forsure. We would defiantly stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I like that the hotel has a coherent NYC design sensibility to the rooms. I dislike the location, particularly the maddening crowds of Times Square.The Hyatt T.S. was the third Hyatt property I stayed in during a recent swing through the US and Canada. It was also the best of the three.I booked and got a room at a lower floor (8th) overlooking 45th. (Had hoped to upgrade but availability on the day I checked-in was shot.) The room was a bit smaller in size (28 sqm) than my room at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver (30+ sqm) but was way nicer and more distinctive. I liked the shelf above the bed with the glued (or bolted?) -on orange dog figurine and the "T" picture frame. I liked the TV baseboard with its numerous NYC snapshots. I liked the room numbers, with their analog alarm clock vibe (flipping numbers, like an old style departure board at an airport). I even liked the view from my room, watching people 8 floors below going about their business can be soothing (or at least a good way to gauge the outside temperature and what to wear).I liked that the room wasn't all design over function. The king sized bed was comfortable, lighting was bright, desk space was good, the TV an up-to-date LCD with HD channels (selection was limited though, no HBO, for example), drawer and closet space ample, and Wifi speed okay. As with other Hyatt's at this level, there was a paucity of stationery and only an empty mini-fridge. Amenities wise, I liked that I got free bottled water daily. I also liked that housekeeping was thorough.I liked the bathroom as well. It was smaller than the one at my room at Olive 8 but it was nice nonetheless. The bath's done in dark gray tile and had a stand-alone shower. Water pressure was strong, the heater worked, and the towels were good (not spectacular). I did not have a heated floor though (at least not that I could tell).I ate at the on-site restaurant for breakfast once and, while it was good; for my money, I'd go to the Brooklyn Diner a block away. What I didn't like - the location. I've been to New York City often enough to have a love hate relationship with T.S. I'll concede that the crass commercialization is spectacular and the area offers great transit access but T.S. is a place you want to visit, then get the hell out of. It certainly isn't a place you'd want to stay in. Indeed, there are nicer, far more tranquil and "authentic" areas in NYC,-- SoHo and LES come to mind -- that host nice (way nicer) hotels.Still, when all is said and done, the Hyatt T.S. was fine, as was my stay. It wasn't spectacular but I wasn't expecting spectacular anyway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed with wife for her birthday. Managed to arrange a surprise for her with some flowers and a birthday cake in the room for when we arrived. The room was well sized and being up on the 52nd floor meant we could see the Times Square New Years Ball from bed! Looked out all across downtown Manhattan. Would recommend to anyone looking to stay in NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spent 2 nights at this hotel last week! It was very quiet! Clean and comfortable and the staff were extremely nice and very helpful! Would definitely stay there again as its only a few blocks from my grandfather!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I'm so glad I chose Hyatt Times Square as I was thinking of Grand Hyatt. We stayed here for 8 days! Not only is Hyatt TS is located right smack in the middle of Times Square it's also walking distance to many attractions. And to top it up, service from door to room has been excellent .. Always greeting, smiling and welcoming you back to the hotel. I had a friend staying at Grand Hyatt the atmosphere wasn't the same. Grand Hyatt reception was cold and snobbish! Also rooms in Hyatt TS were modern and large and though we are at the doorstep of the hustle bustle of Times Square, it was very quiet and we couldn't hear any sirens and noise from the street. And they also had a very nice rooftop bar! Truly enjoyed our stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Checked in for 2 nights in mid-Nov. Very busy in the city. I'm a Hyatt Diamond, but there is no Regency Club. My upgraded room consisted of a room on a high floor. Reserved a king, but got 2 doubles without much chance of a change. Overall, rooms a somewhat smaller than Hyatt average. Carpets in the room were very warn, and need to be replaced. Case goods looked tired as well, and it seemed very difficult to find a newspaper anywhere (the doorman gave me his). But housekeeping was fine, and the breakfast option in the restaurant (Diamonds can have whatever they wish) seemed fine. And the staff were pleasant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights and loved the location. Pro:-You can't beat the opportunity to walk to the theaters, museums,great restaurants.-Hotel rooms are very clean, very comfortable beds, what is most important for me personally- no comforters, just white cotton duvet covers. -Staff was very friendly and helpful.-fridge and coffee maker in the room.-we were enjoying temperature control in the room, which is usually a problem in older hotels.-despite being located in the middle of all "action", you can't hear the street noise, so we were able to rest at night.Cons: -price. For that price you will expect more.-It was advertised that bath robes and slippers are provided. When we arrived- none were found, we had to request. Eventually they were delivered.-Horrible !!!! grey ( former white ) towels, which are long overdue to be retired for rugs.They were so bad, that I had an impulse to go and buy a towel ( then realized that I will have to wash it as well prior to using anyway).-no shoe polish in the room or cotton swabs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square was the perfect place to stay for our New York adventure. Our room was very quiet, though right off Times Square. The rooms are sleek and sophisticated, shower great, service friendly and professional.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: At first sight the room seemed fine. But we then found used straws underneath the bed and there bathroom sink had leftover something from the previous guest. The rooftop bar was amazing!! The views were spectacular.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I paid for a Deluxe View Suite. My suite looked directly into a large building with a neon HM sign on it. When I questioned the view I was told that the view was "the best the hotel had to offer." If that truly is the case than I don't know why so many people rave about views of Time Square, the Chrysler Building and Freedom Tower.Other than my disappointment with the view, my stay for the most part was fine. Doorman were great except there wasn't one to found on Saturday when I needed to ask directions. When they were on duty though they were very friendly and helpful. Had a good experience with the concierge both prior to checking in when I got help with a theater ticket and also after I had checked in with booking a tour and dinner reservations. Housekeeping was attentive. Both the restaurant and roof top bar provided good food and drinks. The best part of the hotel is the location to the theaters. I was able to walk to them with in 10 minutes of the hotel. If not for that I would have been unsatisfied and disappointed with my stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The room itself was nice but when looking out the window you see duct work, HVAC was unsightly considering we paid $400 for a night.....totally ridiculous. The location of the hotel was centrally located for Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, great staff, well located. Clean, fresh modern and not a complaint. Can't wait to go back. Free fast Wifi, free bottles of water, fast elevators. King room with a view, 29th floor, loved it ALL!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our room was on 31st floor, no view but there was Bar 54 for that, and it was a lot of fun up there!Ravi at the front desk went above and beyond to get our room ready and acknowledge out "special" trip to NYC. He was great with suggestions and directions, We wold happily return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was upgraded to roomy deluxe suite on high floor with views of Freedom Tower and Chrysler building. Very quiet and comfy. Got a great night's sleep after a long day. Definitely recommend. Good service, good room service. Clean and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Couldn't fault this hotel.Paid the extra and had a room on the 48th floor. Worth every penny. Having that view to wake up to each morning and go to bed to each night was priceless.So well located near Times Square which is a sensation in itself.Concierge were very abiding and the spa team were exceptional.Stay here if you want VIP but not pay the cost of some of the more luxe hotels. The views and location are it's strengths.I know a few people have issues with the lifts but fortunately we were normally the first ones in as we up so high.Would stay here again, no questions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My hotel room was huge...not just by NYC standards...but by any hotel room in general. I stayed in the Deluxe 2 Queen room on the 49th floor. The bathroom was also an usual large size with a full soaker tub and a separate generous shower. As usual, the beds were very comfy with lots of pillows. But I haven't found a Hyatt yet that did not have a comfy bed. For comparison, my co-worker stayed in a King Deluxe room but their room was about half the size of mine.I was able to open the window for a few inches to get some of that city noise. Once I closed the window, though, the room was a quiet as could be. I was placed in a room that was right next to the elevators and was a little concerned about that possible noise. But I never heard the elevators at night at all. The staff at the Hyatt was super friendly...from the check in/check out, the doorman, and the servers at the rooftop bar. The views from the rooftop bar were spectacular but the drinks were kinda pricey. The crowd on a Sunday night was mixture of tourists in their printed sweatshirts to the caked-on makeup, dressed-up young ladies w/ their older men. Very eclectic.The location is just around the corner from Times Square. There were several close subway stops in Times Square and at Bryant Park. I was on a business trip and having to go thru the tourist crowds in Times Square to get to the subway was a little off-putting. I loved the close proximity to Bryant Park. The park had already set up their ice skating ring and there were little shop kiosks surrounding it. The smell of waffles, hot chocolate, and other assorted delicacies drifting thru the air was wonderful. Very festive atmosphere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location and friendly staff, when we arrived at the hotel at 11 am the receptionist told us the room was ready,that was a good news after a plane ride.the room was really comfortable warm and clean. I will definitely go there again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I really enjoyed everything about my stay! I will stay again when I come back to New York. I found the staff to be very helpful and engaging at all times. the rooms were great and the location was perfect!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this Hyatt for five nights the end of October. Check in was easy and we were given a room on the 34th floor with a partial view of Times Square. The room itself was very nice and updated. It included a mini fridge, a coffee maker and a safe. The king bed was very comfortable. The roof top lounge was also a nice surprise, it gave a beautiful view of NYC. All the staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful.We were very impressed with the free wifi. It workded wonderfully.Check out was also a breeze and they held our luggage until it was time to head for the airport.All in all a great spot to stay, within walking distance from many things.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a well appointed hotel in a great location near Broadway. The staff are very courteous and efficient. . Very comfortable beds and pillows. The concierge service is extremely helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, very nice clean/modern and spacious rooms. My only beef with the hotel is the concierge - my wife and I both experienced very mediocre concierges at the hotel. Not that knowledgeable friendly or helpful, and often had to wait without being acknowledged. Since you're paying top dollar for a good hotel I would expect a better concierge. Our doorman was more knowledgeable and helpful (which is great except that probably means the doorman should be the concierge). But all in all you'll be happy with the location and quality of the hotel, which is most important.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt two nights. The room was great, nice beds and a very nice bathroom with beautiful amenities. Had a room on the 17th floor, view towards the back. Didn't get disturbed by neighbours. Had a drink at their roof top bar, nice views but the prices - 26 dollars for a drink - can only be in New York?! The only downside was that I took the hotel car to the airport, which was arranged by the hotel door man. It would cost 90 dollars including all tax and toll. But I ended up being charged 101 dollars (11 dollars for using my credit card). Felt quite cheated by the hotel/driver. And driver being quite shady about it, only when I asked for a written receipt, he gave me one and when I questioned the extra charge, he said it was for the credit card...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights and its in a great location. The room was a very good size, great facilities and kept clean. The roof top bar is a must, even if it is a little pricy but worth it for the view, the staff were the nicest Americans we met the whole holiday! Would defiantly recommend and will book again for a future New York trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a week and the room was a great size and quiet. The staff couldn't of been more helpful and friendly. Seconds from Times Square and convenient for subway stations. Brilliant base for our all action stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a great location, around the corner from Times Square. The rooms are large for NYC, clean and nicely decorated. Large bathrooms with a rain shower.The view from the roof restaurant is amazing don’t miss it if you stay there or just go up to see the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having stayed at a number of Hyatt properties including the newest Park Hyatt in New York, I was prepared to be underwhelmed on this last minute trip at what I thought was going to be a lesser quality hotel given the price point. Was I surprised at the nicely decorated room with comfortable bedding and sheets. Definitively a nice business hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a wonderful time at the Hyatt Times Square. Would definitely recommend it. The staff was friendly and the rooms were comfortable and tastefully decorated. The location made it very convenient for us to travel uptown to Central Park and downtown to Soho. The proximity to Broadway shows enhanced our Broadway experience as well (we would also recommend watching Matilda).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff and hotel were exceptional. Location was ideal just of Times Square being the centre of activity. We were treated as VIP 's at all times and would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel again in the future and highly recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in New York .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has an excellent location, right around the corner from Times Square. The hotel is very clean, nice room, great bathrooms. The staff was excellent and offer us late checkout to 2pm at no charge.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel as part of a package booked through British Airways to celebrate my 52nd birthday. Having previously stayed in another hotel in the Times Square area on our last trip to NYC in 2013 we were intending to go back but were won over to the Hyatt by the positive reviews and reasonable price.The Positives: The hotel is in a fantastic location for those looking to enjoy the hustle and bustle of Times Square and major attractions such as The Rock, Empire State Building and Central Park are all within easy walking distance. The room we stayed in on the 11th floor was ultra modern with contemporary decor and a lovely shower. The view from the bar on the 54th floor (of which more later) is great but comes at a price and some of the key highlights of the NY skyline such as the Empire State Building are not visible as hidden behind the H&M TowerThe disappointments: We arrived on my birthday (Halloween) and had already seen on their website that the hotel was holding a fancy dress competition in the rooftop bar so came prepared with an outfit intending to celebrate. We found the party to be a somewhat subdued affair so left after a short time and had more fun out on the streets watching the processions of trick or treaters. Despite supplying my room number and asking to be notified I still don't know who won the fancy dress. We had also intended to spend our last night with a farewell cocktail on the 54th floor. Having arrived to find the inside busy we indicated to the host that we were happy to sit outside but were told this would not be possible due to weather conditions. As New York was enjoying an unseasonable warm spell there were already a number of people sat outside so we queried this and were told that as the temprature was below 65 degrees drinks could not be served by staff outside but that when our drink was brought to us we could take it outside if we chose. We opted to wait to be served inside only to see a tray of drinks being carried outside by a waitress at which point we left and enjoyed a far more relaxed (not to mention less costly) evening at the Heartland Brewery a few blocks away. If you want great views save the money you would have spent on a round of drinks here and use it to take a trip to the One World Observatory in World Trade Centre One. You will still have sufficient change for a cup of coffee whilst enjoying far more spectacular views.Several times in our visit staff failed to replenish coffee or water and we had to ask the front desk for more and on our last day the room had still not been made up by 6:00pm with the room maid arriving just as we were preparing to go out for an evening meal. In fairness all issues were quickly rectified but I would have expect more attention to detail in a hotel of this class.When checking out we were asked if we had enjoyed our stay and did mention several of the issues again but this was brushed aside with little by way of apology.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Big room with good view. King size comfortable bed. The food from room service was from the bar/restaurant at the lobby and it was very good, though a little pricy. Great location close to the subway and to Time Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My flight was cancelled and I needed a hotel--fast. While I normally would never stay in the Times Square area (too busy and touristy), this was the only Hyatt with availability in the city. My apprehension about Times Square was quickly dispelled as this Hyatt is a short distance from all the craziness. The staff was friendly and I was upgraded to an upper floor room which was shockingly peaceful given the proximity to Times Square. The room itself was comfortable and the bathroom modern. The decor feels fresh; everything in the room felt brand new. The restaurant was perfect for grabbing breakfast with virtually zero wait. I would definitely stay at this location again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Convenient location and great staff make this the place to stay in Manhattan. You can walk to all theaters and Times Square attractions very easily. Bar 54 is an idyllic spot meant to appreciate the beauty of this city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our first time in New York City. Room was not huge, but definately had everything we needed. Very modern and comfortable. The fridge can in very handy and the complimentary water was a plus. All in all this is a modern, well run hotel. The wifi was the best we have ever had in any hotel, large or small. Thanks to Hyatt of a quiet refuge away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is located just off times the intersection of Broadway and 7th Ave and has easy accessibility to all of Manhattan, walking, subway, and taxi. The room we had was on an higher floor with the outside wall being a wall of windows for a fantastic view of the Manhattan skyline. it was quiet and comfortable. All the staff were friendly and helpful, with suggestions on how to get around and things to do. We ate several meals in the on-site restaurant and the service, quality, and pricing were all good. We used the spa services as well with massages, steam room, and exercising and weren't disappointed. There is a roof top bar with a great open air seating section and another view of the skyline. Pricing was fairly steep at this bar so we didn't stay long with so many other options available in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff were friendly, welcoming, and consistently helpful. Can't beat the location--steps away from Times Square. Quiet. Great view. (Don't miss the 54th floor!) Room had all the necessary amenities. Relaxing rain shower. Only miss--the carpet was stained and grungy looking.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently stayed at the Hyatt while in NYC to run the NYC Marathon. The hotel accommodated an early check in and late check out. They also had a great marathon package which was very helpful. The room was immaculate and very comfortable. I visit NYC once or twice a year and will make sure this is my new place to stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: In the heart of Times Square but a 3 min walk to the Avenue of Americas. Cleanest hotel room I have ever had. Large room, lovely large bathroom with a rain shower head. The desk in the room was the right size. Office chair was comfortable. Sufficient room to through a presentation with another partner. I can't wait to come back with my family to this hotel. The lounge on the 54th floor is a must-do. Mixed drinks are expensive but the selection of beers is good and well priced. Was enjoyable to see the ball that comes down on New Year's Eve displaying a colour show. The restaurant at the lobby level is solid.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 8 nights in late August beginning of September as a family of four.Could not fault the stay. On arrival check in quick and efficient. Had requested a high room via email and we stayed on the 42nd floor. Great view from the room and also from the roof top bar.Room and amenities very good. Very clean and modern.Position wise you are right next to Time Square, a couple of minutes walk. I'm not a huge fan of Time Square itself. Very busy, road works everywhere and difficult to navigate. However turn left out of the hotel and you are on your way to 5th Avenue and the Rockefeller centre area which are nice to stroll around.Didn't eat in the hotel, but you are spoilt for choice in New York.Would not hesitate to stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff, rooms, service, internet made my trip to NYC on business the best ever! I highly recommend. When in NYC what isn't pricey, but there are times when you give in and the establishment makes it all worth it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were welcomed when we arrived with no long lines. We were allowed to check in early. I asked for an upgrade and received one with little hesitation and much ease. The room was spotless and all of the facilities were plush and modern. We stayed 4 nights and despite the fact that the hotel was just off Times Square in the heart of the city our stay was restful and peaceful whenever we entered the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt, other than an issue at checkout, the staff was fantastic, friendly and welcoming. The doormen were fantastic and we were in walking distance of anything you wanted to do in NYC. Conference space was great and so was the service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The entire stay was fantastic from beginning to end. First, they had our room ready when we arrived near noon. A big shout out to Sean at the front door, who had a comp bottle of wine (for our anniversary) waiting in our room when we came back in the evening. Great guy. Front desk staff very friendly, courteous and efficient, and the concierge people were also helpful. Everyone made us feel welcome. Room like new and everything very clean; nice high up view of part of Times Square out the window; really liked the lighting controls for energy savings and different levels of lighting; From our room, you didn't hear any street noise; Air conditioning kept room comfortable. Really a good-sized room for NY City. Very comfortable room to hang out in. Chairs, Beds and pillows comfortable. Quiet (except wife said she could hear the ice machine when I went to get ice). Only drawback was only 1 of the 3 elevators to the high floors was working for the a couple days, but they had 2 of them working the rest of the time. (Not sure if they got the 3rd one going on the last day.) With only 1, it was a pretty long wait, but with 2 going the wait time was ok. The bar on the 54th floor was nice to sit outside ( a bit chilly), with mostly the same view, except toward the Chrysler Building was a nice view, and a little more toward the main part of Times Square. Easy to walk to subway stations or bus stops, or walk to some sites and shopping. And the walk to Broadway shows was easy. A couple of the restaurants nearby were good. Overall, very convenient location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose the Hyatt for an overnight summer stay because of the favorable rate and location. This review is limited to our room, as we didn't take advantage of the amenities.The accommodations were terrific. Modern room with clean lines. Nicely appointed bathroom. Nicely maintained. The pillows were not substantial, but my fault for not requesting a few more.The room was fairly small, but workable. I guess this is to be expected for a newer hotel in NYC due to the cost of real estate.Next time we're overnight in the Big Apple, we'll think of the Hyatt first.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved the hotel with shopping all around,the theatre district and restaurants galore.The hotel was located in the centre of everything.The staff took care of us and our time passed so fast we just took in stride.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We traveled to NYC for my husband to work at the NYC marathon so had to stay closest to Times Square area. Was able to book very good price. Given room on 45th floor with great city view w floor to ceiling windows, view of Empire State bldg on one side and Times Square on other. Check in super friendly & easy. Didn't have any problems at all. Had to check out the roof top bar for the views. Drinks ridiculously pricey at $30/ea!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved the room. The rooms were spacious, spotless and the heated bathroom floors were a winner. The hotel has been renovated to perfection. The location is great and the staff is very helpful. I'll be staying here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: NYC hotels can be overpriced and absolute nightmares but boy was I pleased with selecting this hotel! The Good Stuff:- You really get the bang for your buck, really good value for money.- Awesome location. In the middle of the theater district, the location of the hotel is perfect if you're around for a short stay. Upon stepping out you're immediately surrounded by the buzz of the city and Central Park, Herald Square, 5th Ave shopping is all a short walk away. - Hotel has a modern look/feel. The rooms are just as advertised in the pictures: spacious, clean, modern, with awesome views. Having a room with floor to ceiling windows was one of the best things about the stay, the view is something one could never get tired off. The bathroom was large and well equipped with a great rain shower and toiletries. A hair dryer is provided and the hotel also has a list of items you can borrow if you need for no extra cost. We requested a hair flat iron and it was brought to our room within 10 minutes. - There is a rooftop bar on the 54th floor with some breathtaking views of the city, we dropped by late one night and it wasn't even that crowded considering it was chilly.- Housekeeping was top notch, rooms were made up early in the day and were immaculately clean. They leave you new bottles of water everyday as well.- There is a charging dock in the room with various outlets for overseas travelers. - Elevators are very fast and our wait time was pretty much non-existent even though the hotel was busy and we were on the 30th floor. - Noise was not an issue despite being in the heart of Times Square. - Wi-fi was easy to hook up to & fast.- The staff was extremely friendly and pleasant and remembered us by name every time we returned to the hotel. Umbrellas were available to borrow which was convenient as it poured like crazy one of the days during our stay. Bell hop was really enthusiastic and helpful with moving/watching our luggage upon check out. The Bad Stuff: - This isn't specific to the hotel really, but traffic in the area can be terrible and moves slower than a snail. If you're a walker this isn't an issue at all, but short distances aren't worth cabbing it in this location.- With regards to the hotel, absolutely nothing to complain about ! Our 5 night stay was faultless, would recommend this place to all and can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You cannot dispute the location of the Ryatt. A 2 minute walk from the spectacular lights of the infamous Times Square. The hotel itself is very smart and classy. The entrance into the foyer is minimalist but very smart. All hotel staff including the check in staff and the concierge are very knowledgeable about the city and its numerous attractions and are always on hand to help.The rooms are tidy and included subtle extras such as heated flooring in the bathroom which was a lovely benefit.The only criticism I could have of the hotel is the fact that you have to purchase the privilege of using their WiFi. As a foreign visitor, this was quite crucial to have access to to have access to. I would have expected this to be included, given the price paid for the rooms in the first place. There is however a Starbucks with free WIFI, a minute down the street.Although pricey, I would recommend this hotel. Be sure to check out the elegant roof top bar with spectacular views of the big apple, particularly at night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a 4 night shopping break with my daughter at this hotel! The hotel very centrally & conveniently located, easy access to all tourists sights as well as restaurants & Times Square......... Bedrooms are huge with very clean & nicely decorated bathroom with walk in shower.Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was very very good. The location is Times Square which makes it very central but amidst a bit of a traffic nightmare. Of course not the hotels fault! The staff were friendly and very helpful, the cleaners thorough and helpful and very good at their jobs, the place is spotless. There is an excellent roof top bar and downstairs restaurant. I'd certainly stay again and loved everything. Beds comfy, extra amenities brought to my room on request (slippers, mirror and kettle).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt for the night and we couldn't have aaked for anything better. The rooms was clean and they had everything we needed. The view from our room was magnificent. The location is perfect. Literally around the corner from Broadway/Times Square. Only a few minutes from Penn Station. I would definitely love to come back!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just returned from our first fantastic 5-day break in NYC (myself, husband and 11 year old son). We chose this hotel through British Airways holidays mainly for its location close to Times Square and the location did not disappoint. Perfect to get to all the sights and attractions via foot with Empire State and Top to the Rock only 10-15 minute walk.From the minute we arrived at the hotel we experienced nothing but fantastic customer service which started with a speedy checkin. We had a room with a view on the 39th floor with 2 x queen beds. Standard of the room was far in excess of what we expected, the room with clean, modern and very spacious. Water was provided daily and once housekeeping realised that there were 3 occupants she provided 3 bottles of water per day.The hotel restaurant on the ground floor nice but expensive for breakfast and that welcome beer at the end of a hard days sight seeing and shopping.The only slight downside is that the hotel has an amazing rooftop bar and restaurant but having a young son meant that we could not take advantage of this great facility. However, the we were allowed to take our son onto the terrace to take pictures of the view.The staff were also cheery and nothing was too much bother: from helping us book excursions to Woodbury Common,to sorting out postcards back to the UK, though to finally printing boarding passes and getting a taxi organised for that journey back home.No hassle,no issues all made for a memorable stayWhen we return to the Big apple we will definitely book to stay here again and would also consider Hyatt hotels for other holiday locations based upon this experience

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was my first visit to this hotel. It was a wonderful experience - from check-in to check-out. Room was very spacious , bathroom was also big - especially be New York standards. The room service was prompt , and any requests from guests services were taken care of quickly. Nice gym as well. Location is superb. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was very chic. felt very clean and new. spacious room, big bed. Good location - easy to find - very near theatres, etc. great staff. great service. everyone was very nice, friendly and helpful. Times Square just had too many people, but it's Times Square, so it was expected.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first trip to NYC and we wanted to stay in the Time Square area. We found this hotel to be a great location and felt it was nearby so much of what there is to see.Hotel:We were always greeted when we came in. They offered free water bottles from the front desk which was great for our daily excursions. We were given an upgrade to a higher floor and a corner room which had an extra window on the side. We could see a bit of Time Square from the room. The room itself was very modern with the lighting control and heated floors in the bathroom. Plenty of outlets for plugging in electronics. The bed was very comfortable. They offer an array of complimentary items you may have forgotten, even slippers! We utilized the free late checkout as we had a later flight. Verify first though that this is available to you.Location: We were within walking distance to so much in the area. Once we had the area figured out, we realized how conveniently located this hotel really is. I would highly recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked this hotel improvised during my last night in NYC (Plans Changed) and was amazed of what it offers VS other city options. Stylish, Well Kept, and spacious. WOuld totally recommend if staying in the Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 10 nights in 2 rooms and the Hyatt made for an enjoyable stay.The rooms were a good size, and as we were on a 40+ floor, the views were impressive. As a relatively new hotel the rooms were clean, modern and had little signs of wear and tear. The bathroom was a particular highlight, being a decent size, with separate show and bath. At first glance the hotel doesn't offer much in the rooms, but there is a comprehensive list of complimentary items that you can request that covers everything you'd expect (toothpaste, slippers, tea/coffe etc). A bottle of water was provided each day.Didn't use the hotel restaurants, so can't comment on those. Aside from being very close to Times Square, it is also close to the Rockefeller Center, 3 subway stations (11 lines and a Shuttle to Grand Central). Highly recommended and would like to come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location to site see in New York City. One half block from time square. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Great stay, will stay there on my next visit. My wife and I felt very safe at the hotel and in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I returned to New York after two weeks after staying at another hotel.The Hyatt Times Square has a lovely Diner T45 & Rooftop Bar. The Room I had lots of room which was perfect considering I had just traveled through parts of America and Canada. The only issue I had was the elevators are fairly slow. Two out of Three were working for two of the four nights I stayed there. The housekeeping was absolutely amazing and the doorman was also very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the moment we stepped into the hotel, we were treated with respect and care. The view was awesome and we were upgraded to a high view floor. Because it was our wedding anniversary, we were given an $80 gift at B54. The weather was great and Angelica REALLY helped us with some entertainment packages. We felt like royalty.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed 5 nights in late October at the Hyatt Times Square. We checked in early (Around Noon) and were able to go right to our room. They even upgraded our room to a high floor room with view. This was much larger than the room we stayed in 2 years earlier in a boutique hotel for about the same rate. Beautiful room with large newly updated bathroom. We spent some time at the roof top bar and the T45 Resturant. The Roof top bar is the highest arond times square and has a real nice view. Drinks were a little spendy ($26) but the experience is second to none. The resturant was great for a late breakfast. We will probably be back if given a chance!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent 6 days at the Hyatt. Loved our suite. Loved the central location. The views from the rooftop bar were fantastic. The restaurant served a good quality breakfast but was significantly overpriced and should be avoided as there are lots of reasonable alternatives nearby. Service was variable. The door staff and concierge services were excellent. The front desk seemed less friendly and less focussed on guests coming by. Overall highly recommended and would certainly stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Only stayed here one night but it was a great stay. The room was clean,modern and a beautiful bathroom. Hotel is close to all broadway shows and many restaurants. Staff was friendly and would stay again when in NYC. You have to check out the 54th floor roof top bar.....amazing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I picked the Hyatt from past experience and I used Gold Passport points for a portion of our stay. The hotel is very convenient to everything I needed to do in the city and is located close to the subway. With the exception of Bar 54 -- the roof top lounge the service was very personal and efficient. We were especially impressed with Steve the doorman and Alana ( I may have that wrong) at the front desk. I slo highly recommend using the hotel limo service i=f you are returning to LGA. The all inclusive fare $60 is a bargain and will be a pleasurable trip. The taxi drivers seem to have recently become bitter and nasty. I am told because of Uber and the construction projects that delay traffic more than usual. Give the Hyatt a try and enjoy your time in the city

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a family trip booked on the spur of the moment as part of a BA sale package. After booking I started to do some research on New York and never having been before was a bit worried by the number of people advising against staying in / near Times Square. On arrival booking in was quick, staff were lovely and we were quickly in our room on the 22nd floor. The room was a double queen which was spacious with very comfortable beds and floor to ceiling Windows. The room had a mini fridge with complimentary water, a coffee machine, safe, ironing board and iron. There was also plenty of hanging space and room to store bags without tripping over them. In addition there was a multi media centre on the desk, great for charging phones & I pads etc. The bathroom was also spacious, however was a bit short on shower gel. Also in the room is a card with a list of other items that can be supplied to the room. Room service was a little sporadic, ie we had been out all day and arrived back to find that the room had not been cleaned, a quick visit to reception and this was soon remedied. I believe there had been problems with the lifts that day which may have had some bearing in this. We visited the rooftop bar which has stunning views, but is a touch expensive 14$ for a glass of Prosecco. I didn't try any but cocktails appeared to be about 26$. Although children aren't allowed in there the staff were happy for our son to pop up between 4-7pm to look at the views / take photos. Now, to Times Square, if you want to be in "the thick of it" then I don't think you can go wrong with this hotel, although not directly on the square it is a welcome 2 minute walk away, you still get brief views from your room. However being on the 22nd floor we did get a bit of noise, but not enough to keep us awake. I am led to believe that this isn't an issue the higher up you go. In conclusion great staff, all were really helpful, polite and friendly, but if you want peace and quiet perhaps book somewhere else. Wifi was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A rare combination...a great hotel, with great service, with great staff at a great rate. I couldn't be more pleased. Only issue was the elevators were having problems. This is an excellent hotel. And I am a very picky customer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square in October 2015. Check in was smooth & quick which is what you want after a long flight. All staff were friendly & helpful,with the added benefit of the lovely roof top bar.
