Great location in the heart of Times Square, only a 20 minute walk to central park & subway stations within a few minutes to anywhere you want to go. Check out was also quick & easy. Thank you to all the staff,hope to visit again in the not too distant future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So close to the theatre district!. Room was great and quiet. Desk staff at the hotel was really attentive and pleasant. I will definitely be back. You need to look around in the room for all the hidden free stuff- water, security safe, blow dryer. It is all there- but hidden away in the sleek room. Bathroom was beautiful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stay at the Hyatt Times Square for a first time trip to NY. On arrival the front desk staff tried to downgrade me to a lower category room than I booked with no rate adjustment (booked direct). Only after my refusal was I actually give an upgrade. I guess the place was booked solid for the room category I booked. Would be far better to start off with an upgrade offer than try to low ball somebody. Upon entering the room first impression was overall very nice. However after settling in I came across some room defects. I couldn’t turn off the lights in the bedroom and had to unscrew them to sleep (I could have called but couldn't be bothered, after all I was just upgraded). Air conditioning blew directly onto the bed.Showered in the morning and shower handle came off in my hand. Went to leave the room and waited for the room to self close. It did but I didn’t hear the click of the lock. When I went back to check, the room was not closed. If I hadn’t checked the room would have been accessible by anyone (note if you stay here). After a full day out I came back and somehow I had missed house keeping. Room was as I left it, No big deal I was alone and had more towels. Again I had just been upgraded so don’t complain. Next day again a full day out and came back around 18:00 to have again somehow missed house keeping. Privacy sign was not on. OKKK, so I went to front desk and asked for a couple of new towels as I wanted to shower before my flight the next day. I also informed I would be leaving the room now and heading to dinner. My expectations were that at the least the towels would be placed and a quick straighten up of the room done. Nope…I returned to the room to find two towels on the table. All the trash from my two days shopping still there, all the dirty towels still there and no attempt to straighten the room up. A bit disappointed I went to bed as I had a 5 am flight. Then at 9:30pm just as I was watching TV before sleep there was a knock at the door “ House Keeping”….. . I laughed and turned them away. After this I thought you’ll never remember all this so write it down so you can add it to the stay questionnaire all these hotels give you online. I went to write them down and the pen didn’t work. So no doubt there was more as I do remember leaving thinking the place is a nice hotel but the actual full experience of staying at Hyatt Times Square is not great. All these things are not huge but they are compounding to give a negative experience in some areas. On the Staff they are very good both in the Hotel and F&B.Lastly as mentioned I would normally only add my comments to an online questionnaire sent via the hotel so they are aware of defects. However I have decided to write this review as when I did fill out the review online I was contacted by Joshua, Assistant Front Office Manager, from the Hyatt Times Square who apologised for the short fallings and offered me to contact him directly. I have now emailed Joshua twice with no reply. Please be aware the hotel does not really care about your stay or repeat business.So all up hardware very good, Staff excellent, maintenance poor, house keeping can’t comment as I didn’t get to experience them. Trustworthiness to offer room booked and follow up on issues faced non existent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The best hotel in NYC. The staff was so helpful and friendly. The best view from the Sky Lounge. Steve, the doorman was the best. Helped us in so many ways. He made the trip so enjoyable. Gave us the directions and the low down on each place we wanted to see. He is the best.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all, the location was just great. Especially for tourists, it's perfect!The staffs were very helpful and friendly that made my stay comfortable. Room is modern and a good size for being in middle of NY. Very clean and bed was nice and comfortable too. Nothing bad to say and definitely would love to stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Hotel in Times Square (NYC) is a great location with excellent hotel staff. Their friendly staff, clean and quiet rooms make this a great location for those visiting the area. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visiting New York for the first time , we were careful in choosing the right hotel, and we did, right from the start we were looked after by Jeff at reception who gave us an upgrade to an incredible room with a New York view after hearing that we were celebrating our Anniversary . The room was very spacious and comfortable with all the modern facility that you would expect from the Hyatt group. The service at every level was great , nothing was a bother, whether it was for the wifi code ,a restaurant recommendation or how to get from Y to Z . The hotel is only a two minute walk from Times Square, and conveniently placed for your New York city life. The roof top Bar is a must, a little pricey maybe but its a BEAUTY , it is New York's tallest roof top bar so the view is great as is the service. We enjoyed it four nights out of seven. Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, excellent location if you want to do the touristy things in Manhattan. Easy and quick access to public transport, bus tours, cabs, restaurants, shows, etc. clean, modern, spacious rooms. Very well appointed. Pros: location, proximity to Times Square and Broadway, good price and great rooms. Cons: rooftop bar was very snooty, elevators took a long time

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my very first trip to New York City. I'm use to suburbia life and city life has always felt overwhelming to me, but when we checked into the Hyatt, the staff was welcoming and helpful. They gave us tips on how to get around and their personal recommendations of where to eat. The rooms were modern and felt spacious even in the big city. And the location was perfect. Getting around was easy and getting back to the hotel was easy since Time Square was always are starting and ending point.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in an excellnt location being just 2 minutes walk from Times Square, but far enough off of times Square to avoid it being too hectic. its also in easy walking distance to many of th main attractions and theatres you may wish to visit. Our room was beautiful. Big by NYC standards with 2 double beds and a large spacious bathroom. An excellent selling point of this hotel is the staff - knowledgable & friendly where nothing is a problem no matter what you need and whrn yout need it. The Spa is also fabulous. Will definitely be back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is a 2 minute walk to Times Square and about a 5 minute walk to the subway station. The room exceeded our expectations. Beautiful, modern room with two double beds (which seems to be hard to come by in New York). Very clean and quiet. We were on the 33rd floor so not sure if that helped with the noise. Staff was very helpful. First we were able to check into our room at 9:30 a.m ( I had requested an early check-in because I knew we would be arriving early in the morning, but didn't think our room would be ready that early!) Staff was very helpful in giving us directions to our various destinations. The room was a bit pricey, but compared to other rooms I looked at in New York, it was well worth the money. If I ever went to New York again I would definitely look at staying at the Hyatt again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square is a fairly new, modern hotel in a great location. Easy walking distance to Times Square, theaters, and Rockefeller Center. The Cranberry Deli nearby is a gem! Rooms are well appointed and spacious. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only problem we had was some inaccurate information from the concierge. Everyone makes mistakes and this was the only 'hiccup' during our stay. Great hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After booking online for a room and having it confirmed I got to the hotel to find I 'didnt' have a room booked for me. After finally getting a room the next day I found they had charged me 3 times for my room which led to my credit card being maxed out and not getting refunded until a day after my stay had finished!! This left me out of pocket not only for my trip but in fees.They were however great with giving me a small discount off my bill at checkout, but I am still yet to receive my credentials for my stay that were held incase of room service use etc (which no room service was used) this equals me being charged $840 extra on top of my room cost (and yes I'm aware of international fees and that put aside doesn't equal to $840) and yes I have been in contact with the hotel but to no avail.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt is in the heart of Times Square. It has a wonderful roof top deck to have a drink to end the day. The staff is friendly and helpful. My only disappointments/surprises were the hotel rooms do not have safes, coffee makers or clocks in the room.We were also surprised the beds only have a comforter no top sheet or blanket. Not sure how they are cleaned daily but that was the same for the beds In our friends room as well.The rooms are good size for New York . Would love to make this my "go to" hotel in NYC but I prefer a safe in the room and keurig coffee maker in the room

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We liked this modern hotel, just a block off Times Square. The room was very clean with good lighting and cooling, a very comfortable bed and nicely functional bathroom. The staff were helpful and kind. We would definitely stay there again. Tip: stay in a higher room to get away from city noise if that could be an issue for you. We could hear very little on the 39th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located two minute walk from Times Square. Very clean, friendly, helpful staff. Would stay here again if I ever went back to New York. We arrived early in the morning and I had requested early check in. When we arrived at the hotel at just shortly after 9:00 a.m. I didn't expect our room to be ready. We were pleasantly surprised that they were able to check us in and we dropped off our suitcases in our room. Very modern room, comfortable beds.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This location is absolutely wonderful. The rooms are comfortable and quiet - even the typical city noise you were surrounding in comfort and quiet. The roof top view is breathtaking. The T45 restaurant provided very tasty meals. For dinner I would recommend the Mac and Cheese with everything; fried calamari; and shrimp quesadilla. The burgers are also very tasty and the perfect size. The subways are a short walk to get to and the theaters are very close by with tons of restaurants and pubs for food and beverages. A nice walk to Central Park was a nice touch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great one night stay! We were allowed to check out at 2pm the next day. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. We stayed on the 43rd floor which was very quiet. Check in was efficient and everyone we encountered was friendly. We will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited this weekend for joint birthday celebration. From the first moment walking in they make us feel special. We were upgraded to a room on the 51st floor. Amazing view. Everyone was smiling, helpful, and overall happy. The room was super clean and the rain showers make for a romantic touch if you go here as a couple. Location was beyond perfect not to close and not to far away from times square. I would come here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights during the Pope's visit. Location is fantastic. Just a half a block from Times Square. We had one standard room and a corner suite. There were no connecting rooms available although I'm a Platinum member and had requested it well in advance. The standard room was your average hotel room. The corner suite was a little on the small side but very nice. Decorated modern. Very clean. Bed was very comfy. We had a great view- Times Square and the Freedom Tower. The staff was very friendly. Check-in and check-out were super easy. Highly recommend. I didn't give it 5 stars because it is very pricey. Hallways are worn and need freshening. The bathroom was small and needed more shelf space for two people. There also isn't much of a breakfast selection- we left the hotel everyday to grab breakfast. The rooftop bar was great but crowded. I will review that separately.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quiet, comfortable and well staffed. My visit was for business but I did meet my son at a local restaurant which took us through Times Square on Columbus Day. I was amazed at how quiet the room was even though the noise outside was loud. The rooftop bar offers a great view of Time Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had 4 women staying in one room. It was very clean, big enough, and we had a great view. The staff was so helpful in giving us directions and recommendations on nearby restaurants. We were so close to everything-Times Square, our theatre, bars, restaurants! It was an enjoyable time, and we all agree that when we go back to NYC, we will stay at the Hyatt Time Square again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this Hyatt is amazing for a short stay in Manhattan. Steps from Times Square and the metro stations, this hotel's location is hard to beat. Their staff was very friendly and professional as well. The room space and other amenities were of high quality as well. The rooftop bar has spectacular views and in a nice sunny day it is an absolute must.The only thing that makes me not give a fifth star is the fact that when making a reservation (and paying) well in advance of the stay and specifically asking for a room as high as possible with as much view as possible, I believe that the hotel should be more accommodating. The 14th floor with a back view was not was I was expecting when you are staying in a hotel with more than 50 floors with some amazing views on the other side. Very disappointed on this one!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square has a good location close for Midtown Manhattan and Times Square. We had a room on an upper floor looking south, and it was breathtaking - if you can be at the top, the extra cost is worth it. The room was a very nice size and well laid out. Front desk staff was courteous, friendly and efficient. We were there over Columbus Day weekend, and on the down side, did not have hot water on Saturday morning; apparently the boiler broke. And on Sunday night, our sound sleep was interrupted by a fire alarm triggered in the roof top bar. If I stay again, I will ask how to not have the air conditioner shut off in the middle of the night so that the room stays a comfortable temperature.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here over the Columbus Day weekend with my teenage son. It was a great experience. Hotel is in a great location just a short walk from Times Square. I was amazed at how quiet the rooms were especially considering the short walk to Times Square. We were on a high floor with a city view which was great. Blackout drapes kept out the bright lights when we wanted to sleep. There is a a fabulous view from the bar at the top of the hotel. It is a short walk to most of the theaters and there is very easy access to the subway. Lots of restaurants within walking distance as well. We felt very safe here as staff checks for room keys near the elevators. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and updated. Only two of three elevators was working during our visit which made for quite the wait a few times. Also, the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night and could only be shut off by the fire department even though they announced we didn't need to evacuate. I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here during our last visit to NYC, and we chose it again this time. It’s a great modern property, the reception staff were wonderful, and they had ample orange umbrellas for guests during some recent rainy days. Our room had a partial view of Times Square, which was sufficient for the benefit of being in the Theater District without needing to deal with the hordes of tourists actually in Times Square.The room was spacious (for NY standards), and the elevators fast. No room service, but the little place downstairs is convenient for a casual meal or snack. This is a great option if you want to be in a nicer, quieter, chain hotel convenient to the midtown mayhem. We'll come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hotel is a 3 minute walk from Time Square. If you need to stay in Midtown for business this is not a bad choice. The rooms are a good size and the heated floor in the bathroom is a nice addition. It has all the things you would expect from a 5 star city hotel. Except it has no mini bar, but plenty of places close by to get drinks and snacks and the led me out with car service and restaurant suggestions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location was fabulous with easy access to everywhere we wanted to go. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Was upgraded to a bigger room and the accommodations were great. There were four of us and we had enough space. Food in restaurant was very good. Rooftop bar is overpriced but what you'd expect in NYC>

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt in Times Square for 4 nights from Sept 8-12th. On a girls trip, 3 of us in a room. We all obviously brought a lot of stuff, I shopped before I went down for new clothes because the Canadian dollar to USD isn't that great now. I like to unpack my suitcase when I get to hotels, hanging up clothes and putting in drawers. On the day we were leaving, we were in such a rush to get to the airport and i completely forgot about clothes in a drawer. I left them there and didn't notice until I got home the next day (our flight was cancelled and we were sent out on the next morning flight). I immediately called the hotel to tell them about it, knowing my room would have been cleaned and they would have found it by now. The lady told me to fill out a report on the ileftmystuff website, the system they file everything through. Fine. Went through the process and waited for a call, expecting I would get one the next day. I did not. I called back the next day wanting to speak with someone who could help with my situation, the girl on the phone said she would put me through to head of the maid service. Got no answer. So i hung up and called the girl back and explained what had happened and that it was just a couple days ago so it shouldn't of went far. She proceeded to tell me she didn't know and then transferred me again. No answer. I called back again she picked up the phone and hung up. I called back several more times and no answer. Obviously the clothes would have been picked up by the maids but instead of reporting it, they kept it! Which by the ignored and rude experience with the girl, can see she knows about it. I can't believe she hung up on me and ignored my calls!! It was the rudest thing I've ever experienced with a hotel!!! It was 5 pieces of new clothes I had.. $400 dollars or more!! I'm so upset, why would they keep my clothes?? I would even pay to get them sent back but clearly they kept them. Make sure to check the room top to bottom if you decide to stay here because nobody will be helping you out. Also the maids didn't clean our room one day.. said we had too much left out. Which was not true at all, where do they expect us to keep our stuff.. stored in our suitcases 24/7? We had a few things on the nightstand and desk.. that's what it's there for. Thanks but no thanks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good service, ample rooms, great location within walking distance of Broadway shows. Exceptionally quiet rooms in a very noisy location. Really appreciated several of the servers going out of their way to provide what we wanted.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel to be in the middle of the action of Times Square and really loved it. We chose the executive suite and it was great for a family that might need a bit of separation as it has siding doors that separate the sleeping area and the sitting area. We have a teenager that likes to stay up later and he enjoyed having his own space. Beds are comfortable and the room was quiet. The hotel is right in the middle of everything. We walked or took public transit everywhere. The nearest subway station is about a 10 minute walk away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staying here for 2 nights as a surprise for my wife, right in the heart of the city in Times Square. Easy walking distances to restaurants, shoppnig, theaters and fun places. We definitley be back. Convient to transportation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Times Square Hyatt. Offering a friendly and helpful staff, modern & artistic decor, comfortable - well appointed rooms, and more than anything - a location perfect for hitting nearby restaurants, sites, and shows in the theatre district. The hotel's Bar 54 offers a knock-out view for it's patrons, although there are certainly cheaper places to grab a beverage. Starbucks is across the street making mornings easier, and the subway is close by to hit the town. Enjoy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in the city for 3 days while I had a heart procedure done at Weill Cornell Medical Center. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. You couldn't pick a better location to take in a Broadway show or two. It's also near most subway lines so it's easy to get to locations all over the city. Restaurants abound all around the location so It's easy to find food of any ethnicity. NY is a 24/7 city and Times Squate is the heart of it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just stayed for a flying visit in from London as I am English and my partner American it was an easy stop over to grab a couple of days. Let me start by saying the staff were lovely and the location of this hotel for being central is fantastic but we did unfortunately suffer a couple of problems.I had phoned ahead both the hotel and hotels.com who I booked through and made sure the room was paid for completely and that my partners name had been added to the booking as he was arriving in NY four hours prior to me after working nights wanted to check in and get some rest, I was assured his name was on the booking and there would be no problem, I landed to voicemail of him wandering around the city as he was informed he was not on the booking and could not check in. I had to phone the hotel from the airport and confirm his identity, I had an email conformation with his name on .. never mind at least he got to see a bit more of NY.The room is large by NY standards, very clean, the bed is lovely and conformable and we had a great view over Time Square. Problems: unfortunately two of the three lifts were out while we were there, so the time for lifts could testing, but they were working on that, so cannot be helped. Air conditioning in the room worked really really well, at times I though we had a gale coming through the room, that and the noise was equivalent to a small motorbike, needless to say that went off, finally we really struggled with the heating on the shower, worked fine the first day, very temperamental second, and just plane cold on check out, it could just be our lack of shower manics but believe me we tried everything.This was a short visit and as a convenient hotel, with large rooms i would recommend, i just think a few things collided not in our favor :-)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had to book a quick business trip to NYC and needed to stay near Times Square. I am a diamond member at Hyatt, so decided to try the Hyatt Times Square. I have stayed at other hotels in Manhattan, but it had been several years since I'd traveled to NYC. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room, cleanliness of the hotel, and helpful nature of all the staff. I have spent many a night in either a tiny pillbox hotel room in New York, or one that isn't very clean. This Hyatt rates high on my list, and I would definitely go back there and stay for both business and pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is what you'd expect from a top tier hotel. First, the location is perfectly adjacent to times square. Second, the rooms were modern, clean, and high tech. Finally, the staff is more than helpful. Finally, the rooftop bar is very nice with nice views and professional staff.I totally recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights on a trip to celebrate our Golden Wedding. The room was perfect and the staff did everything to make it a memorable stay.It was well positioned giving quick access to Times Square and the Theatre district. The subway was only a few minutes away giving access to all of Manhattan and beyond.We were on 39th floor with some great views of the Empire State Building and beyond.We have stayed in Manhattan before but his hotel was superior in every way.We have stayed

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were recently in New York for a wedding and stayed at the Grand Hyatt Times Square. The concierge services (Ryan in particular) was very accommodating and helpful. The location of the hotel was excellent - within walking distance of many shows and great restaurants. One restaurant called Room Service, which was Thai Food, was excellent and reasonably priced. We got the hotel at a discounted rate by being a Gold Passport Member - that made it a much better VALUE!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Been to New York many times, but this was my first stay at the Hyatt and it won't be my last. Beautiful room on the 34th floor. Floor to ceiling windows with a great view, dazzling lights at night. Dressing gown and slippers provided and an adequate supply of toiletries. Bed super comfy. Hotel staff are super friendly and very helpful. The hotel is a block away from the madness of Times Square, making it very quiet and peaceful. Do visit the roof top bar, for a spectacular view, especially when the sun goes down. Will definitely return to this great hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had some wonderful time in New York on october 2015. We had a splendid hotel Hyatt at Times Square! Everything was okay in this hotel. Our room was on 44th level and the view was amazing with wonderful large windows so you really had THE VIEW to New York. The room was very tranquille so we couldn't here any noise there. I warmly recommend this hotel. The situation was very also very good!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square New York is in an excellent location. My husband and I were there celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. We appreciated the quiet rooms and excellent housekeeping. The free internet is a plus! There are many restaurants and shops nearby. You are steps away from Times Square. We did not eat at the restaurant downstairs. The roof top bar gets crowded and is very expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our first visit to New York was made extra special by the reception we received on arrival. There was a slight booking problem but the lobby manager soon sorted it out and brought us coffee because of the slight wait which was a lovely gesture.The hotel is situated in the heart of Times Square but is like an oasis once you walk through the doors. It is definitely in our top five hotels we have stayed in.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is ideally situated 1 mins walk from Time Square. We were in room 3410. the view from the bathroom was fabulous. Just buildings yes, but the lights from them were mesmerising. I wanted to take it home and put it on my bathroom window, just so I could remember it. Although I don't think I'll ever forget it. The staff were all very helpful, pleasant but most of all happy and always smiling. We did have an issue with the guests staying next door, they came home at 4 am and were so noisy they woke us. I went and reported it to reception, they apologised and assured us they would sort it. And they did, within 5 minutes some went to the room. No more noise. So thank you. They have a roof top bar on the 54th floor and the view from there is stunning. I could have sat there all night. I know where I'm staying next time I'm in NY. Yes that's right The Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a wonderful stay we experienced at the Hyatt Times Square. The staff were exceptional, and the Concierge recommended wonderful restaurants in walking distance. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are very quiet, and the location is convenient to all Midtown attractions. A perfect stay in New York City. Drinks at the RoofTop Lounge are prohibitively expensive unless you are on an expense account, so unfortunately, we could not stay to enjoy cocktails, but the views are spectacular if you are willing to pay the price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is located in the heart of Times Square! By NYC standards, both my room and bathroom were HUGE! I booked a deluxe queen bedroom for business, and would stay here again in a heart beat. It was so clean, comfortable and spacious! The trendy entrance and helpful staff were icing on the cake. The rooftop bar has incredible views of the city and the attached restaurant T45 has the best veggie burger on the east coast (well worth the $17)! I went back again for business the week before last, and regret not staying here again. I'll definitely be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our first trip to New York couldn't have been any better. This hotel is in an excellent location. Every single person I encountered couldn't have been more helpful & friendly. The room was spotless. Our room had a spectacular view. I will recommend this hotel to everyone who mentions going to New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I visited NYC with my sister and brother in law from Vienna Austria. We decided to stay in Times Square for a great experience for them. The Hyatt Times Square fit our criteria perfectly as it is located right off Times Square. Our rooms were on the 27th floor and had balconies with views over the city and Times Square. We were able to walk to shows, restaurants, shopping, Central Park etc. Our schedule coincided with the Pope's visit to NYC so we were in the middle of that, but the Hyatt was like a quiet sanctuary to us from the thousands of people there lined up to see the Pope. We really had an amazing time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the first time I stayed at a Hyatt in Manhattan. We had asked for room on a higher level to escape all of the road noise and we were given a room on the 42 nd floor by yanny and it was fantastic levetgetgetaway from the noise and the front desk girl yanny away from all the road noise away from the lose. away from the noiseaway from the noise

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in the middle of times square. Rooms were spacious and clean, bed was amazing. There is a rooftop bar with great views, definitely worth checking it out. There are many bars and restaurants withing walking distance of the hotel. Staff was very helpful and concierge recommended some great tours and attractions.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this hotel and it was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful with everything from directions and what train to catch to go where.... to where to get the best slice of pizza. Ravi at the desk checked us in and pointed us in the right direction for some good local eats and what trains to catch to go places, great guy! If you go upstairs to the sky lounge, make sure you see Jack the bartender. He is from the french part of TN (inside joke he tells ppl, he is from Cameroon) he makes some great drinks. This hotel was very clean and easy to get to all the things we wanted to do in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for a few nights in a king room, high (42) floor. It's a large hotel with decent sized rooms (larger than the smaller Hyatt hotels scattered throughout the city). Check in and check-out were quick and easy. The room and bathroom were clean and fresh. No complaints other than flat pillows. Very near Times Square but noise was not a problem.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very happy with hotel room. Stayed in a deluxe room on level 23 [requested high level months ago - got level 23]. Room is quiet - we did not experience any street noise or hallway noiseExcellent professional cleaning services provide daily. Restocked shampoos etc daily.Comfortable bedGood bathroom (not large] with plenty of shelving for vanity cases and very good overhead mirror lighting. Shower is a walk-in which is large and has the standard wall hose and an overhead 'rainshower head'.Please note that the hairdryer has extendable cord - need to pull it out to be able to use properly.TV is great and has sports channels and news channels - so happy.Rooftop Bar views are worth seeing at dusk and taking some photos. We had two cocktails and not impressed with quality had better [but its a personal opinion ad depends on bartender].Had breakfast one morning downstairs and it was good quality and friendly waiterOnly negative is that we had been flying for 18 hours and although we had checked in early (around 9am) when we asked if we could freshen up in a general bathroom [public one would have been fine]. Told none available but to go to the Spa upstairs and pay $10 each and could have a shower there. Feeling very exhausted after flying long hours and 22000k miles and then immigration queques and travel from airport into NYC so we went up to Spa and paid $20 for showers. Came downstairs and stopped by reception to be told that our room was ready. Would have been nice if reception could have contacted Cleaners when we initially asked to see how far away room would be ready as I am sure we could have waited another 3/4 hour. Mgmt: This would be a great service to your long distance travellers if reception could be trained on this - 'service feature and will add value to you".

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stay was great from beginning to end. I called to request slippers and a robe for my week long business travel stay and by the time I returned from my morning room, both items were in my closet. Staff was friendly and helpful. If I had one point of improvement, the carpet could have been a bit cleaner. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I'm adding the Hyatt Times Square to my list of preferred hotels. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous and even upgraded me to a suite because I had arrived at 1am. I loved every part of my stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We ended up at the Hyatt Times Square via a Hotwire hot rate, so we were pleasantly surprised when we found out the property we scored.The hotel, only open for just a month or two shy of two years this fall, is just east of Times Square, so the action, lights, and craziness of the square is easily accessible, but it's not so 'in your face' that you're bombarded with it when you exit the hotel's front door. It was very nice having the choice to walk over to 6th Avenue if we wanted to avoid all the tourists and street performers.The welcome we received from Spencer at the front desk on our arrival was warm and friendly. He informed us of the amenities on offer and ensured that our rooms were upgraded as requested.The rooms are modern, spacious, and quiet (especially important given the constant din of Midtown Manhattan). The layouts vary a bit from room to room, but the product is solid. Housekeeping seems to run a very tight ship at this hotel.We dined at the T-45 restaurant most mornings and once for dinner. The food was very well prepared and portions were quite reasonably sized for an American eatery. Service ranged from warm and friendly to aloof and cool, depending on who was working the section.We also enjoyed a few cocktails at the rooftop bar, Bar 54, which is on the 54th floor of the hotel. The views are amazing, and the cocktails are handcrafted. Even the bar nibbles were very tasty.The door staff were also very helpful and friendly, hailing cabs as needed and quickly assisting with baggage.The only downsides for this property were 1) the small lobby, which had very limited seating options if you were waiting for a friend or fellow guest, and 2) the limited number of elevators serving each block of floors. For floors, 2 to 25 (about 250 rooms), there were two elevators, which led to long wait times for both up and down directions.Given all that, we would definitely consider the Hyatt Times Square for future travel to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place is in a super location. Staff was great and so friendly. Breakfast was good just go a little early to bet the rush. Rooms are very clean and well furnished. Would stay here again!! A block from time square and the subway. Great places to eat in all directions. Parking is expensive so to will not drive next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location, staff and size of room were all a pleasant surprise. The city was jammed with the UN General Assembly and the Pope in town. But all our needs in the hotel and for transportation were satisfied quickly

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed on the 52nd floor to ensure we got some light I think this is a must. Love the heated bathroom floor and room temperature control. Loved the walk in shower. Front desk always helpful . T45 restaurant service sub par. Tiny lobby made sitting waiting for a car or others bit difficult due to lack of seating. Bed is not comfortable very firm and pillows not supportive enough

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A smart hotel with smart decor. I like what the designer did, simple sleek furnishing offering a very clean smart look but not cold and "snobbish". It's just a very comfortable room to return too after a long day of work and meetings. That's all I needed and Hyatt did exactly just that. Although I'd wish they had 24 hour room service, so that after I woke up at 11:30pm from my jetlag nap I could have some soup or a burger. But being in Times Square at least there's a deli next door where I got some pizzas and beer which served me just fine.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located just off Time Square in the theater district across the street from Juniors. Nice size rooms and surprisingly quiet. Within a couple blocks of most of the top shows and a number great little restaurants and bars.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was looking for a place to stay and obviously looking at trip advisor reviews. Most of all of the reviews were right! Let them know about our anniversary and took very good care of us! And the rooftop bar 54 was reasonably priced compare to what other viewers were saying. We had an unbelievably great time!! Thx!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We only stayed one night, but it was very nice. The room was clean, check in was quick and we loved the rooftop bar. The late check in was honored and the location was just great!~ Walking distance to everything. We even left our luggage after check out and went to a show. They were very accomidating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt times square is a perfect location in the times square area and yet it is amazingly quiet in the rooms. The rooftop bar offers great views. The rooms are spacious and offer 2 queen beds which is hard to find in NYC. It's clean and the staff is well trained and very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Close to Times Square and good Pubs attached for drinks and food. Amazingly the hotel was very quiet as we never heard any noise from inside our room. Would love to go back and experience more of the hotel and its amenities

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic Times Square location. This modern and fairly new facility has large rooms with modern furnishings, high tech lighting and complimentary WIFI. Despite the location, the hotel is very quiet. The hotel's rooftop top lounge has fantastic views and is an escape from the crowds of Times Square. Great customer service from all the staff we dealt with.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Hyatt Times Square last week. It was our third visit to New York but our first to this hotel. Our hotel room was excellent, bed very comfortable, bathroom and shower superb. One thing which attracted us to this hotel was the rooftop terrace. We visited it twice. The first time we had to wait for a seat outside. The terrace is small but with an impressive view of the Chrysler building and the surrounding area. The drinks were however overpriced -$26 for a glass of wine and a beer. On our second visit after seeing a show, there was no seat outside so we left. Overall, a good hotel, excellent location but possibly overpriced generally especially for drinks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Aftet a great deal on Expedia we booked this hotel for our 7 night stay in NYC. Before our holiday we did read reviews and we're pleased by the sheer amount of positive reviews. On our arrival we were greated by Spencer a great asset to the team at the hotel he was very friendly and even seen if he could get us a room with a better view as we were here for 7 nights. So instead of staying on the 25th floor he bumped us up to the 45th which was amazing and we're very grateful for this as the views were awesome to wake up to. The rooms are very big and the beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are a great size with heated floors and an amazing shower which I loved. Our room was cleaned every day to perfection and always supplied with fresh towels and soaps/shampoos & conditioners. The hotel is situated in a great location and right next to times square but not so close that you get a quiet night sleep. I also want to say a thank you to all the staff we met whilst staying at the hotel you were awesome and very friendly and polite whenever we left the hotel for our excursions or arriving back after a long day out! I would definatley recommend this hotel to all my friends and family who will be visiting NYC in the future and we have already decided when we come back we will be booking to stay with the hyatt times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Reception efficient and friendly. All , staff helpful, nice bedroom, extra large bathroom, breakfast was excellent and it was table service not self service and the waitress was very helpful hotel was situated close to a lot of attractions. Lift was fast as our room was on 45th. floor this was a great help. We really enjoyed our three nights stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took a cruise from NYC and stayed at the Hyatt Times Square beforehand. The room and location were excellent. We could see the lights of Times Square from our room yet could not hear the noise. We were literally half a block from all of the sights and sounds of Times Square and close to everything else Manhatten has to offer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked an executive suite for four nights (a special deal from hotel website, USD600 per night) and I was not regret to stay here. The room is big enough for three adults and it is very modern and clean! Rooms come with free wifi and it is fast and stable. The hotel locates right in times square but we could barely hear noise from outside. Besides, staff members are very friendly and helpful! I was very impressed to end my stay here that the doorman tried very hard to get me a taxi during the peak hour.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently stayed at the Hyatt Time Square. I was greated by Yenny with a beautiful smile. She asked me about my day, what type of room I would like and make sure all my questions were answered. The room was great, view beautiful and location unbeatable for leisure and business.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed our stay from day one, it very close to all the attractions and also the hop on hop off stations, we always saw happy faces and everyone was very helpful, the concierge helped me a lot when I had somethings to print and then I needed to scanned them, he was very helpful and very patient. It was also lovely talking to Dee Dee at the front desk lovely. Definitely will stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter did our annual weekend getaway in August 2015. I love this hotel. It's right in the heart of times square. It's close to everything. The staff were truly amazing here and will visit this hotel again for our weekend getaway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The doormen were all extremely helpful. The restaurant on the ground floor has food that is excellently prepared. The 54th floor open air bar and lounge had only appetizers that were outrageously priced. The ambiance on top was excellent with views down to Times Square. The view out our room was of all the tall office buildings in Manhattan. I loved the rain shower in the bathroom of our room. Toilet flushed well. Bed was comfortable. Tough trying to outsmart the thermostat to keep the AC on. Storage was sparse, just one small closet. No drawers in any of the furniture. Desk chair was nice but the single chair in the room was uncomfortable. The elevators were prompt, fast and quiet. Location is right on Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I left another hotel I was displeased with and tried the Hyatt for the same price. This was a daddy daughter weekend, so it was important to me to have a nice room. I'm glad I did! The staff was very friendly and professional. I requested a higher floor and was put on the 53rd floor...this was greatly appreciated! The lobby was contemporary and very clean. My room was simply perfect. Clean, new looking, large and classy. In addition, we had a fabulous view. Last, the location was perfect for those wanting to enjoy the Time Square area, this is a perfect location. I can't see how anyone would be disappointed with this hotel! It is very nice and I've stayed in some of the best resorts in this country. This does not disappoint!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square New York is conveniently located just off of Times Square. It is moderately priced for a clean, comfortable stay. The staff was very welcoming and accommodated our every need. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quite and comfortable. Very responsive staff. Fast lifts, Location is just a half block to Times Square. The rooftop bar was a delightful surprise with amazing views. Parking was via attendant and great for our family of four.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is located very near the heart of Times Square / Broadway (half a block away). We had a Deluxe Suite, which featured a king size bed and separate sitting area with a desk and sitting area. Cost was $350/night in September, plus $50 per day city taxes. Bed was great, bathroom was recently updated and featured a rain shower and separate tub. Windows were floor to ceiling. As noted in other reviews, carpeting looked a little dingy, like it needs to be cleaned or replaced. Hotel staff was universally very pleasant and helpful.Rooftop bar (opens at 4:00 pm.) is restricted to hotel guests; part inside, part outside; nice views of the city. Not a crazy club scene, but a subdued place to get a night capy and enjoy some night air. Had to wait a few minutes for outside table on the balcony, but not a problem.Starbuck across the street; Cranberry Deli a few doors down to the east to pick up a snack, soda or bottle of water. Times Square a 2 minute walk. Could not be more convenient, yet far enough away that you have a buffer from the carnival atmosphere over there. Our view was mainly to the south, with Times Square off to the side, but after having been down there, we did not need to spend all night gazing down from the 43rd floor.This is probably not a high service hotel (we did not even try for room service), but a good place to stay, due to location and quality. If you are a first-timer to NYC, plan on getting back to your room late afternoon to sit down, grab a drink, and rest up for dinner.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, close to all the action in Times Square and all subways leading elsewhere. Although, the walk down 7th Ave is a nightmare with all of the tourists, panhandlers and companies soliciting the bus rides. Room was super clean, quiet and big for NYC. Amenities were nice and included a robe and slippers. WiFi was free but slow. Elevator was fast. Lights in room were complicated even after 3 nights I couldn't figure out how to turn off desk lamp so I unscrewed light bulb every night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms were very good. Service was good. My only complaint was the drinks on the roof top bar were priced out of this world. The service was very caring. I would definitely go back, just not use the roof top bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Four girlfriends who have traveled a lot all felt this was an excellent Hyatt and location in Times Square. The size was almost like a boutique hip hotel with a friendly, professional, genuine and fun staff. Everyone seems to enjoy working together. Everyone seemed to be aware it was our birthday and we loved the extra attention! Great to have a nice fitness room and spa. The restaurants had excellent menus. Go stay and see for yourself!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The front desk staff was busy talking to an joking with each other. They did not seem to be interested in the guests at all. The air-conditioning in my room was not working. The lady at the front desk forgot to communicate my issue to engineering. It took more than ten hours to fix the air conditioning. The attitude of the staff is horrible. I checked out early and moved to another hotel because of my problems. The front office manager tried to help and was good but it was too little, too late. It is annoying to have front office staff so busy in their own conversations that they treat guests like nuisances.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was my first time here and I wasn't impressed. The nearby Westin is better. Room size is fine, but the carpets in my room were very stained. Enough that I was glad to have an extra pair of socks. Room service was a joke - the menu looked decent, but the burger I got was fast food level and brought in a paper bag on disposable plate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Don't bother using the restaurant at all. Rooms are big by NYC standards. It was an average stay and I think for the price point other hotels may provide better value. The roof top bar does have very nice views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Below what I would expect of a Hyatt for the price. In my room the bar fridge was empty (except for a note from Hyatt suggesting I go shopping and stock it myself) and the toilet paper was of surprisingly low quality. These are things I could accept at a lesser hotel but not what I would expect from the Hyatt. I will not return and recommend looking elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first time to NYC. We went with a planned group and stayed at Hyatt. I cannot tell you how great the experience was! The people ALL affiliated with this hotel were fantastic! They all made the stay wonderful. It rained they handed us umbrellas. We had questions they answered. The room was clean and bright! Love when the TV comes on and welcomes you by name. Security is awesome and funny guys! There are plenty of outlets in the room. Love the night light setting! Shower was awesome! The location was perfect for Broadway! Love love love! We will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in nice location, wonderful stuff and service, clean and stylish rooms – everything was excellent. We have received complimentary late checkout and free internet. Specially I would like to note amazing city view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I landed from Honolulu off a 10 hour long haul domestic flight into JFK, got a taxi from JFK directly to Hyatt Times Square on the 8th September 2015. I unloaded all my luggage from the taxi and went to the front desk and was immediately greeted by a front desk agent " welcome Mr Wright!" what a great start to a week long hotel stay. I was in the hotel lobby at 9am and was aware that hotel check in time is 3pm and before I could even ask the question the front desk agent said to me "I have early check in available for you at no extra cost, I have 2 rooms available one on level 2 and the other on level 23, I have put you in room 2308" I caught the lift up to level 23 and opened my room door and was immediately gobsmacked at the size of the room and how functional the room was in the layout and design. I did my customary walk around the room inspecting for any issues. To my surprise I found absolutely none.The next thing I did was try the bed out. I laid on the bed and I don't think I have ever laid on a more comfortable bed ever. Once I had unpacked my luggage and made my hotel room feel more like home I felt like I had truly picked a winner. throughout the whole week any time after 4:30pm anyone walking into the lobby was asked to produce a room card which further increased the feeling of security within the hotel. I can honestly say this is probably the first hotel I have walked away from with not even a single negative thing to say about. from the very beginning of my stay until the time I checked out the service I received was truly 5 star without the feeling of being pretentious. I would go back without a seconds hesitation!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: right next to the times square, convenient for traveller, expensive, paid more than four thousand for a weeks's stay, room not big but understandable as it is located in the city centre. Complained about cleanness, where there were stains on the bed sheet and hair on the towel, floor wasn't vacuumed, the manager has been helpful and made sure that the later part of the stay will have the room cleaned properly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was excellent. Everyone we encountered was very pleasant. The room was really nice and very clean. The roof top lounge was great. We had a small issue with room service in the morning which was quickly rectified. I will definitely stay here again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A very good international quality hotel in great location. Staff were helpful and quality of the hotel was great. Close to the action of New York and would definitely recommend is hotel for any stay purpose.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: perfect everything position restaurant drinks bar service and price love this place on my 5th trip now and will be back for xmas shopping trip with the wife the staff are fantastic and help what ever you want especially if you tip well just love love love it

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great corner room, two TVs so I could watch ESPN at bedtime while my wife watched Bravo. Room was clean & staff really friendly. Warned about New Yorkers being unfriendly, but we only experienced helpful & friendly people everywhere. Phil and Melissa (manager & asst manager) were very personable. Besides all the sites to experience, you need to have a drink on the top floor of the Hyatt….spectacular view of the city. If you stay at this hotel & don't go to the top, you've blown it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were here for 9 nights in August 2015, and everything about this trip was amazing. We were given a room on the 33rd floor with a times square view, the rooms are huge! I've visited NYC on several occasions before, and have never had a room this big. The bed was beyond comfortable - several mornings I didn't want to get up!Noah checked us in, he was super friendly and really knowledgeable. The one day it rained, we were lent a free umbrella. The rooftop bar is something else! Crazy being that high up in the middle of Times Square.Back to the room - the bathroom was bigger than the first hotel room I ever had in NYC. When I buy my "forever house", I'm having that shower installed!Don't be worried about the location - the room was silent at night! The elevator took us from our room on the 33rd floor to the lobby in 17 seconds! That's got to be worth mentioning.Overall, if you want to stay in TS, I can't recommend this hotel enough. A great base for first time vistors and seasoned travellers!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt is just steps from Times Square and lots of shopping and theaters. We had a room on the 48 floor and the views of the Freedom Tower from one window and the Chrysler building from another were very nice. We could also see Times square from our room. Living room separate from bedroom. Very nice tub and shower enclosure with glass door and ceiling mounted shower head! They have a roof top bar on the 54th floor with spectacular views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and our 2 young children stayed here on a visit to see my brother, we wanted to find somewhere close to his apartment and this was perfect. The hotel is a 1 minute walk from the middle of Times Square and about 15min from Central Park which was brilliant especially with 2 kids. We stayed for 5 nights, Wifi was free and fast. The hotel and rooms were all very clean, we had a 2 Queen bed room booked. The bar on the 54th Floor had amazing views, drinks slightly pricey but you'd expect that! The staff were always helpful and imformative

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first time staying at this hotel and it was better than expected. The hotel is located very close to Times Square and the subway station. We arrived early and expected to just leave our luggage but our room was ready and we were allowed to check in early. The room was better than expected and spotless and the staff was friendly. I also thought the price of the room was good considering NYC prices. I will definitely return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time in New York we have chosen this High class hotel in excellent location . Delicious food, lovely breakfast,stunning room. Nice friendly staff. Fresh fruit in the lobby. A luxury, but worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a suite with a small air-conditioned outlet on a pillow near the window. The air rushed out making a lot of noise even though the blower was set at low. Shower head could not stand on his own due to poor maintenance. Disappointing for a Hyatt. Rooms get to be cleaned in the late afternoon. Sofa bed is sinking so we have to placed the mattress on the floor and camp for 7 days.Location is great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband had business by the hotel, so we stayed here with our 2 year old son, it is in a great location. Room was spacious and comfortable, staff was super nice. It is definitely up to the standard of Hyatt Hotels, would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square absolutely scores 5. From the moment we set foot into the lobby, service was pleasant, welcoming, and hospitable. We were given a free upgrade to a suite so that we could afford better view of the city. The amenities in the bathroom, and room are amazingly clean and well designed. Wifi is free and fast.I had stayed in this hotel a few years ago when it was just built, and it is definitely one of the best hotels in the city as far as cleanliness and "newness" of the amenities, and I'm happy to see that they've maintained rooms well. Would definitely stay here again if I need to stay in Midtown next time. And a great value, definitely feels higher than 4-star hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just returned from 6 nights at the Hyatt Times Square. We had a 2 queen room which by New York standards was huge. We were located on the 12 th floor and whilst we had no view as we were at the back, the plus side was peace an d quiet.The room was lovely clean and nicely equipped.The location is just off Times Square perhaps a block from the utter madness that is Times Square which we found just right.The downside is all restraints are very busy and Starbucks is always full and seats are a luxury.We used the restaurant once save your self the bother it was awful , over priced rushed service no advice, we ordered a stake and the Salmon, my steak was supposed to have veg with it instead it arrived with some sort of artistic smear of mashed yam and the smallest bay leak I have ever seen, the steak itself was well cooked but no one took the trouble to advise we might need sides as the veg was just a decoration. The food was dumped down and we never saw the waiter again till we got the bill so no chance of ordering something then. Very strange as the place was empty, that should have told us something but we were tired and did not want to go out.I would not go back to the restaurant again it was a complete rip off you can get better value and service at any of the surrounding joints.As for the Hotel great, beds comfy friendly staff nothing too much trouble anything you needed it was sent up in minutes , not like other hotels I've been in when you might wait an hour or more.What more can I say , I know we will return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We love Hyatt and always try to stay there (we stayed in Maui Hyatt, Nice Hyatt in France). Nyatt never disappointed us. Times Square Hyatt also is excellent with great stuff.I I would definitely recommend the hotel to my friends. I fully share other reviewers opinions. Five stars to Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked 3 night in the HTS, our room was number 5202, a king view deluxe and the view was amazing with views right across to the financial district, over to the Hudson and down below to times square.Our room was a little late being prepared but it didn't dampen my experience.The hotel is extremely clean and comfortable and the staff were more than helpful at any point we needed them.The room provided all the essentials you need including free wifi, A large TV, starbucks coffee and a very comfortable bed which i could lay in and enjoy the views (see pictures)Located a 30 second walk straight onto the middle of times square.Definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I hesitated in booking this hotel. Others similarly ranked, where I had stayed before, cost less. But---the view is exceptional, even if you must go to the roof to get it. The location is great. Service impeccable. 2p late checkout quickly granted. Sign up for gold passport before you go. More perks if you do.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was clean and modern as you would expect for a Hyatt. The staff is what sets this property apart from others. Everyone was pleasant and super willing to assist in anyway possible to make our stay wonderful. The cleaning staff was especially pleasant and interactive with the guests. Always a good morning and have a great day. Would definitely stay here again. The rooftop bar seemed very nice but we were not able to get a drink because there were no seats available. You cannot get a drink without having a seat. Other than that we loved our stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just come back to the UK after stopping at the Hyatt for 3 nights. First impression wasn't good as room wasn't ready at the allocated time of 4pm , but they couldn't apologize enough and gave us a courtesy drink each in the sky lounge. Great view from the bar. The room 5202 a deluxe king view had amazing views and was definitely worth waiting for. Floor to ceiling glass windows.WOW.Security is good as nobody can use elevators without a room card. Reception staff very helpful and if you need to check in with your airline and print boarding passes it was all complimentary.The room was very clean and modern with the most comfortable bed, which was a pleasure to get into after walking all day. Times square only a stone throw away plus many bars and restaurants.We had a night flight and so was able to leave our suitcase at the hotel after checking out plus I paid $10 to use the spa facillities to freshen up before going to the airport . Well worth the money they had everything you needed showers,straightners, hairdryers, toothbrush and towels.I would def recommend this hotel. Very enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First class hotel,everything from the welcome you receive to your departure grwat location for all the local amenities ,most within walking distance central park rockerfellas centre empire state building ,plenty of subways for brooklyn and ground zero

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fabulous staff, very clean and spacious room. Room was super large. Bathroom was huge. Tons of closet space and storage. Pillows and bedding were better than my bedding at home. Great view from the floor to ceiling windows. So close to so many theaters. Air conditioning worked awesome. All and all just a fabulous stay way better than expected.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've been to New York several times now. This most recent visit was for 3 days/3 nights. The hotel it's self is in a fantastic location just steps away from times square, the rooms are clean, bright and modern. The service of the staff was great. I wouldn't stay here again though because I felt as though the hotel wasn't very personal compared to others i've stayed in within the Times Square area. Also considering the price paid, there are slightly cheaper alternatives in the vicinity that have a more welcoming/personal feel to them. I would say this hotel is slightly over priced so I wouldn't return, but overall our stay was pleasant but nothing outstanding.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for a week. Efficient and helpful front desk. Hotel lies between 6th and 7th avenues on 45th St so is very convenient for Times Square. We stayed on the 23rd floor and could not hear anything from the busy crowds to disturb sleep. Used the gym which was modern. Had breakfast one morning which was nice but very expensive. Used the roof top bar which was fantastic and should not be missed

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great location, wonderful staff, great bar at the top. Although in NYC, was not on the main drag in Times square as believed. Cost was pretty high for this hotel. The shuttle service advertised was no as described. we cancelled , lost our money and took a cab back. Horrible shuttle service to use, use a cab.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this location to have easy access to theater, shopping, and subway. Hotel staff provided assistance when needed. great weekend. Loved the updated fixtures. The bathroom had an excellent shower.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff were some of the best people I meant during my trip to New York City, The room was clean and from our perch on the 44th floor the views were just this side of spectacular. It's central location provides easy access to everything Times Square has to offer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, great location (if you're looking to stay in Times Square). Rooms are large for NYC standards and very modern/clean. Have stayed in various NYC hotels and most are pretty worn in given the amount of traffic that comes through. Highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time in this NEW Hyatt Times Sq hotel. Very clean rooms and bathrooms. Small rooms but adequate for our weekend stay. half block to Times Square and the theater district. only draw back is the crowds in the evening.....WOW just too many people in one location, but otherwise the hotel is very nice and convenient location to subways and theater.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: At first I thought this place must have an amazing management team, in talking with some staff it was indicated there has been management turnover. Well whatever, Hyatt has this place in order. It's a new hotel, about 1 1/2 years old. So everything is fresh and modern. Our room was top notch finishes and quality. But the point of my whole review is the staff. They are EXCELLENT. seriously from the pleasant demeanor of the young gentleman at check in to Walter at the front door. What made us happiest was the cleaning staff. First, they never bothered you. When you left they came in and cleaned the room thoroughly. Anything you needed and called for was delivered timely to the room and without question. It really was a great experience. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel located right in Times Square. Hotel has everything (restaurant, roof top bar on 54th floor, spa, gym). Felt very safe, security always at door and at elevators. If you want to use spa, call BEFORE you go as they were already sold out when we got there. Walking distance to everything (Bryant park, food, times square). Free wifi

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Most amazing hotel with a lovely spa, gym and the best roof top bar in the city. My husband and I have stayed here to times now (7 days each time), and we aboslutely love this place.Staff is so lovely and the rooms and everything is new, clean and nice! Love love love this hotel! And the location is perfect!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is located just a short walk across the street to Times Square. I was shocked to find, in my room on the 53rd floor, the window opened! (Only a few inches.) The room was elegant appointed, a bit small --typical for NYC hotel rooms--but had everything I needed, including a large bathroom with a beautiful soaking tub.The room service was so good I spent almost $900.00 in five days on food. Not a joke. They have a takeout kind of service, not the usual rolling cart they stick in your room, but it works wonderfully. It was probably the best room service food I've had in a hotel. The location is perfect for walking to major sight-seeing venues, and it's surprisingly quiet in the rooms. The wi-fi worked perfectly, I had an amazing view of the Manhattan skyline, the bedding and linens were excellent and comfortable; I had to drag myself from the room to go to my business meetings!If you stay here (or even if you don't), DO NOT miss the rooftop bar. It's a bit small, but it has an indoor and an outdoor area so if you suffer from vertigo you can still stay inside and enjoy the city views. Cocktails are pricey - my whiskey was $45.00 a glass, and a martini starts at $25.00 - but who cares when you're in such a magnificent location?From the moment I walked in the door, I felt welcome. The front desk staff are super efficient and friendly, the doormen literally jump to help you with your bags or get a taxi....this place is just great. Also I thought it was an excellent value compared to somewhere like the Ritz, because this hotel is just as lovely and has everything you might need.One last tip: If you're considering staying across the street at the Marriott Marquis, DON'T DO IT! That hotel is an absolute nightmare. A maze with elevators that never arrive and throngs of people. It's like being at Disneyland. In hell.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I always stay in great hotels when we visit NYC. We know what we like and do not like big chain hotels. Hyatt times square was a lovely hotel. The best part is the roof deck with the incredible views. It is amazing! Rooms are very small but that's New York. The staff was very well trained. Only issue is the street where it is located is filthy. We both lived in NYC and know our way around like its our backyard. We have stayed in the other Hyatt Hotels, and this would be on the top 5.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel check in was at 4PM. We arrived from South Africa on a connecting from London at 1PM. I did an online check in for 2:30PM and when we arrived Spencer check us in fairly quickly into our room. We had a 25th floor view of Times Square and the city. The room is fairly modern and trendy. Room cleanliness was very good and the cleaning staff were always friendly when leaving the hotel. The hotel is 5 minute walking distance to central Times Square, 15 min to Grand central terminal and Empire State building and 20 min to Central Park. We were super impressed with the hotel and we will definately return. The roof top bar is amazing, only downside is that no kids under 21.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooftop bar is a MUST!! The front desk staff is the BEST!!! Karen checked us in and was beyond helpful!! If you are Diamond, ROOM SERVICE breakfast is included and delicious! The location is PERFECT! Only negative is lobby is bare bones and small... It scared me a bit like is the hotel ok?? But it's AMAZING!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One year after my first visit, we was so happy to come back and our stay would have been nice except that we have found bed bugs in our bed. The consequence has been a huge allegy because of these bugs and all our clothes in the dry cleaner. The staff of the hotel considered this seriously but only gave us a free night which is a small thing considering such disagreements. So we recommend people to be very carefull.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having stayed at many luxury hotels, I've rarely slept in beds that comfortable as in the Hyatt. The views are amazing, too, especially on the higher floors. Everything is clean, new and quiet.But why, why do they ask guests who come to their room tired from a Long flight or day, wanting to relax, to call reception for the most basic items, such as slippers, shower gel, bath robe, drinks in the mini-Bar? Yes, there is a list of things to order for free, but sorry, when paying $400 per night or more, I just want these items to be provided, without the hassle of me having to order them. Do they really need to save this extra Money, i.e.if it's not there, fewer people will ask for it? That's not luxury, I'm afraid. I would have loved to give 5 stars and it could be so easy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We decided to stay here for our 3 day, 2 night trip after being dissapointed by the Grand Central Hyatt. We had a very nice room with a terrace, and good service. Only issue: we didnt realize that you have be 21 to be seated and served at the Sky Lounge (bar/restaurant on the 34th floor with gorgeous view).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a really nice hotel on Times Square. The location is great, the rooms are clean and spacious, and the staff was amazing. Every single thing we needed, they helped us out with. Everyone seemed like they were so excited to work there and honestly happy to help.It was a really nice all round experience. Surely my favourite in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel made our visit to NY a truly special one. The staff, location, amenities were all great. The bar of the 54th floor had amazing views and the rooms were superb. Just off times square, it was a great location to get away from the hustle and bustle. As well as the free coffee, we were really impressed by the additional items which could be ordered at no additional cost. Would definitely recommend, a top notch hotel with great staff - you will not be disappointed!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
