review_body: My son and I traveled to NYC for a VERY quick trip and I wanted something that was very close to Times Square. This hotel was PERFECT! Very easy to get to from the airport. Check in was a breeze. And our room was spacious, and quiet. The entire hotel is recently updated and very modern. We would definitely consider staying here again the next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed four nights here with our two children. I really liked the décor & the condition of the rooms & hotel. My favorite feature was the nightlight function. It lit the room just enough that you could get to the bathroom but still dim enough the sleep. What I loved was that either we were the only people on our floor (doubtful) or the rooms are just that well soundproofed. I rarely heard noise in the hall & never heard noise from next door or upstairs rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fabulous hotel. Great service. Great location. Exceptionally quiet. I've never slept so well in a hotel. The view from the lounge on the 54th floor was beautiful. The room and bathroom are a good size and it's nice to have complimentary coffee, water and WiFi.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It is hard not to overspend on hotel rooms in Manhattan especially close to Times Square but the Hyatt is an exception in my book. It is only a few years old and still in nice shape with clean modern furnished rooms and very generous sized rooms for New York. I like this hotel and it's short walking distance to Times Square, NBC, theater district, restaurant row, Chrysler bldg, and the subway. I do not like the 65.00 per nigh valet parking with no in and out privileges so I park around the corner at Icon parking on 46th and use "parking whiz" to book it at a discount. I saved 55.00 by doing this for 4 nights. When you arrive at the hotel by car just park in the valet parking area until you get you luggage into the hotel then got 1/2 block to the garage on 46th. The Valet's will yell at you to move your car but who in New York is not yelling, so just ignore them until you are checked in and then go park the car. One other tip is that the Hyatt seems to have adopted the European custom of not using a top sheet on the bed and just using a duvet and who know how often these get washed so ask for a top sheet be brought to your room when you check in. The beds are what they call in the hospitality business "a sleep experience" and they are just that and really comfortable. Closest best place to eat really good gourmet food without breaking the bank is Trattoria Trecolori 254 west 47th. Other than the parking and the sheet this is a great place to stay in Manhattan, Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed there for three nights during the last weekend of August. I have to say check in was quick and I was happy with my room. I'm sure most of the rooms in NYC are pretty small, but this room was a great size for my husband and I. Considering that we had no plans to stay our entire weekend inside the room. We had a view of tall buildings, nothing great, but while we were there we kept the curtains open during the night time so that we can see all the bright lights coming in from Times Square and from the rest of the city. The restroom floor was heated. Our bed was comfortable and we didn't have any problems with the hotel staff. The hotel was very close to Times Square. My husband and I hung out at the pub next door. We found that very convenient especially when we wanted to just hang out and have a few drinks. We could walk right next door without having to worry about getting a cab or walking far. Overall, I enjoyed my stay, but we didn't get to enjoy the rooftop bar. We didn't know we had to make reservations.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great service on check in, we got a really smart, clean room on the 19th floor. Housekeeping was excellent. The rooftop bar 54 had great views. The breakfast diner on the ground floor served good food with friendly staff. Check out was fast and efficient. The concierge also very helpful. If you are looking for a modern hotel, in a great location, this is perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt staff was very attentive. We upgraded our room and the view was terrific. The location was close to everything and to our theater. It has a beautiful rooftop bar although getting an outside seat was difficult. The only negative is a small lobby but since we did not spend time there it wasn't an issue.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Problems with A/C in room (didn't work properly), and front desk responsiveness, but a nice brand new hotel in a great location near Times Square. Nice roof top bar. Lots of great restaurants nearby and near broadway shows. Tall building!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our first trip to NYC. We were staying at another Times Square hotel and took a look at Hyatt Times Square as an option for the end of our trip. My wife stayed 2 nights at the end of her trip and advised me to book a room for the last night of my trip before departing NYC. So glad I did. Stayed 24th AugustThis is a very new property in a perfect location for the Madness of Times Square. It is just 50m from the action but what a difference that makes compared to stepping out of other hotels into a crowd crush.Upon arrival I was greeted by very friendly staff who recognised the fact that my wife had stayed separately just a week before. I had booked a standard King for 1 night but was immediately upgraded to a King room with a view on the 33rd floor.The room was perfect. Immaculately clean, large enough but wait for it...The bathroom, or more to it, the shower is awesome. So nice to get back from pounding the pavement of NYC to retreat to a luxurious bathroom even in a standard level room.Got to the roof top bar around 10pm and it was too busy to get an outdoor table for 1. Staff said to wait inside and they would move me once outdoor table became available. 20 minutes later I was seated outside. Great view and atmosphere. Expensive drinks but hey, it's NY! Didn't leave until 1pm...Wifi was free and fast. Upon checking out I had all day to spend in the city before heading to JFK. The staff were more than happy to store my luggage in secure storage for me. There were even change rooms behind reception where I could sort myself out before heading to the airport.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for four nights mid August and didn't regret a thing. The location, the staff, the rooms and the breakfast were all great in every way.This is a hotel group that has very well trained and motivated staff. The whole feel of the hotel is excellent.They have a great bar (Bar54) on the 54th, with spectacular views. The downside of the bar, is that your children cannot join you even for a non alcoholic drink, even if they are 18 years old! We ate breakfast in the restaurant and outside each morning and I have to say the food quality was excellent as was the staff who waited on us.All in all, this is an excellent choice of hotel and we will definitely be returning there on our next trip to NYC.Thank you to all who made our stay a most enjoyable one, especially Robbie and Trish on reception, Tess on Concierge and the lovely people in the restaurant at breakfast time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms are very well appointed and a great value relative to other places I've stayed in times square. Staff is pleasant and efficient. Rooftop bar is a nice option for an evening cocktail (hard to beat the view)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel iand location is top of its class. The rooms are great size compared to other NYC hotels. They are new clean and have everything you need for a wonderful stay in NYC. Be sure to check out Bar 54, the highest roof top bar in the city. The views are wonderful of the city. Instead of paying for the Empire State building, have a drink at Bar 54 and relax with a great background.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have not yet stayed here but I've been in touch with the assistant front office manager Noah to ask some questions. He really can't do enough for his guests even before they arrive. Very reassuring. Really cant wait to go now. Just wanted to let others know that it is worth booking this hotel as they go out there way to help so much.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I have just got back from a week staying at the Hyatt Times Square and from arrival to leaving this hotel was nothing short of fantastic! It's really modern, clean and just looks really cool. The staff are all very friendly and always willing to help too. Our room on the 31st floor was superb with plenty of space, a lovely bathroom with walk in shower, the most comfortable bed ever, a great view of Times Square and free Wi-fi for the duration of our stay. The rooftop bar on the 54th floor, we were told its the highest rooftop bar in NYC, is also a must. Not cheap ($20 for a couple of drinks) but the views of Times Square and the Chrysler building while relaxing after a long day are sensational. Tip: the terrace isn't the biggest so make a reservation. If it's full though, they will take your room number and ring you when a place outside becomes free which is pretty cool. Located just off Times Square this hotel is in a perfect location as well. Only short walks to the Empire State & Rockefeller and with a metro just round the corner at 42nd Street and 7th for those sites a little further away or for those just wanting to rest their feet a bit!This was our 3rd time in New York and we're not normally people who stay in the same hotel when going back to somewhere we've already visited as we like to try different hotels out but this hotel was so good that when we next go back to NYC, providing the prices haven't increased too much (it's around £200 a night for 2 people) we'll definitely look at staying here again. A superb stay and we can't recommend the Hyatt Times Square enough!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first time in New York and we didn't have any idea where to stay. Other friends had suggested other locations but I am glad I kept looking. This is an amazing gem in Time's Square that has fabulous reviews. The staff are friendly; the room is quiet; and the view was amazing.(The beds and bedding are super comfortable). We were in the midst of everything we wanted to see and do. Even Good Morning America was only one block from the hotel! I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great value in the city that never sleeps!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Kind of a funky property. Location is right down the street from Times Square, but set away from it (so you avoid the crowds). Except on St. Patty's Day, when I found out the Hyatt was also next to 2-3 Irish pubs. Each floor only has a few rooms, but you still want to avoid the room right next to the elevators. Very small reception area; the seating area is actually on the 2nd floor. Great skyline views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a suite, which came exactly as advertised. Great location, just on the edge of Times Square and walking distance to Broadway theatres but very quiet. Rooms are well appointed and spotlessly clean. Great bathroom amenities plus a list of items upon request for anything you may have forgotten to pack. Staff was welcoming and eager to please and make our stay the best possible experience,

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice location and large rooms for a Times Square property. Nice rooftop bar though its not a direct view of Times Square. Cocktails are exotic and the bartender made for lively conversation. Very good WiFi. Good a good deal via Hotwire's secret deals. Will stay again. Hotel is brand new as this is only a 1.5 year old property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of the hotel is ideal if you want to be close to major attractions whether it is Times Square, the Empire State, or any other place that's the place to stay. Great Service by the staff and very nice view of New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location , right on the Times square. Smiling and helpful staff, the roof top bar is a must visit excellent view of the city in the night and the bartender makes some very good cocktails. Very well appointed rooms. All in all a great stay & hotel. Thank you for all the hospitality.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 2 nights from Sun-Tue. Was on 46th floor, quiet, and nice view at night. Bed was comfy and lighting was good. Bathroom was good size, with a lot of counter space. Shower was bid, with rainfall and handheld. Check-in was quick, and no looks despite booking from 3rd party site. Location was great and walkable to all the shows, and to public transit. Would stay again and would recommend. Wifi was fine. Did not use restaurant or bar, but nice view from the rooftop.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Answered everything we needed for a 3 day visit to New York. Times Square is an amazingly busy area but that's not the fault of the Hotel. The weather was good, warm but not stifling as it can be in ?New York in August, so that helped our enjoyment. Roger Dean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For those who want to be in the center of Times Square with the highest rooftop lounge, this is a great location. My room was on the 47th floor so I did not hear a sound when I slept but had the convenience of Times Square. Unfortunately, that is not my favorite location but I certainly see why it is a key location for most guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First off the rooms are amazingly beautiful and comfy beds. Also very clean. Nothing tops the service at this hotel. All those smiling faces and genuine care from every single person made my stay great! Thank you Spencer, Chester, Yenny, Walter and the friendly Security guys. I shall return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I met my sister here for a quick overnight birthday dinner/play. From the moment I arrived (harried from a difficult travel day) the service was exceptional. Brian's warm smile and helpful attitude made the day end well! The room was very clean, comfortable and welcoming. The service at both the rooftop bar (a must see) and the restaurant was exceptional (I don't use that adjective lightly as my expectations are high). The staff, particularly Brian, Odette, and all the restaurant staff were friendly and efficient. I will be back as soon as I can!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel for a weekend getaway as we wanted to focus on Times Square and Central Park as our focus - could not have asked for a more perfect location! Even though you're in the heart of things, our room was very quiet and comfortable. National chain, but it feels like a boutique hotel. Central Park was just a few blocks away, and even the Empire State Building was an easy walk (in the other direction). We had two kids with us (age 10) and they fell in love with NYC. We didn't eat at the hotel, but they let us bring the kids up to the lounge for a few minutes to see the view (they just asked that we reserve the seats for patrons). Super nice staff, clean rooms, and great location. One final note - we passed this hotel by at first as we thought it was a bit too expensive, however we ended up booking late (3-4 days before arrival) and got a great rate (well, great in NYC dollars!) Already planning to stay there next time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you're debating on hotels in this area of the city, within the price range of the Hyatt-- trust me, choose this hotel. Sometimes it is worth spending a few bucks extra to get miles of improvement in a hotel room. This is one of those examples. I just left a horrible, absolutely hideous hotel in NYC located on the Upper West Side-- rated 4.5 stars on Expedia-- and wow, was it ever a dump. The walls were peeling, the linens ripped...the rooms so small that you couldn't open your suitcase-- no wifi, air that didn't function well. it was a hole. THEN....I BOOKED THE HYATT. Holy cow. This is more like it. I'm so happy, I might actually sleep tonight. I got a great deal on Hotwire (I like to book discount)-- it was rated 4.5 stars I believe, and it is definitely 4.5 stars! The room is huge-- by any city's standard, but by NYC standards, it is enormous. We have two Queen size beds, free wifi (that works!) and it is spotlessly clean, modern, with a large flatscreen TV. Trust my review-- a traveler who has stayed at all kinds of hotels, this is top tier.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wow! We were right in the heart of Times Square, but were able to find a beautiful, large (for NY) bright and immaculate hotel room at the Hyatt in the heart of the chaos. Staff was exceptional.........friendly and knowledgeable.........Would definitely recommend if you like craziness but want to escape to an oasis before you are ready for more!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location with easy access when driving in and out of Manhattan. Parking service was easy and car was safe for 2 days while we walked to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park or used used the metro just around the corner at Bryant Park or longer trips. Friendly staff and expected Hyatt quality.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel! I booked at the last minute after having a terrible experience at another hotel. The staff was kind and understanding and did everything they could to make sure that I could extend my last-minute booking for the entirety of my trip. Clean, large rooms, a haven in the middle of Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed in Hayatt times square for 3 days during my visit to New York, I did not expect that the hotel has this amazing location. It’s very new to Times Square which really made our lives easier specially with the kids. It’s really convenient that you return at night from your all day activity to reach your hotel in five minutes’ walk.Our room was in the 10th floor which is not very high with relevant to New York (specially the hotel is over 50 floors high) but the view from the room was nice.The service was very good and responsive and the room was excellent and very clean.The staff (reception, concierge, bellboy, and security) were very friendly. They provided us with all the help we need, and cared to ask us more than once if everything is going fine and if we need any recommendations or help.Definitely I would stay there again in any future visit to the big apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved the location and the relaxed style of the hotel. Staff were fantastic and very friendly. Loved the room styling and very clean. We had a double double with a great view from 36th floor. Loved the fresh Starbucks coffee machine in the room. All of the complimentary toothpaste, shaver even deodorant were very handy to order free of charge as our bags were delayed by 12 hours. Location is fantastic and 2 mins away from the crazy Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt time square is a new hotel with beautiful rooms and amazing rooftop bar. It s closed to time square but far enought to avoid noise and turists. Rooms from 25+ floors are recommended for the view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A 2-night trip to show the big lights and buildings to the kids. They were in awe! Of course, they suggested the electricity bill might be pretty big in Times Square. ;-) Hotel is really clean and quite modern. We had reserved a Deluxe King Suite but ended up in a King Deluxe -- the hotel managers cleared this up for us and compensated us back as all the rooms were sold out. We were okay with that seeing that the view from the room was that spectacular -- and may I say, the 53rd floor! (So high your ears popped going up and down). One floor beneath the highest rooftop bar in all of Times Square! The bathroom is clean and modern, rain shower (optional handheld + a bathtub) .. pretty large bathroom. No microwave, but it did have a small fridge tucked inside a cabinet. The small fridge could barely fit a take out tray..but it did hold our water bottles and small things. Because its a king Deluxe, it was more like a studio - one room, with a small desk and a chair and ottoman. It was fine for a family of 4 (w/ add'l rollaway bed), for only 2 nights. If longer, I would have demanded the suite (LR + separate BR) since that it what we reserved. My personal favorite part of the hotel? THE GYM! As I walked in, the heavens opened and the light came through! I walked in at 0530 and I owned the place. Not another anxious exercise enthusiast around. Dumbbells, weighted bard, lifescape treadmills (the kind that have a tv screen and you can "pretend" you're running in Germany or New Zealand. Plenty of cardio machines and weight machines, all size kettle balls, towels rolled up and ready for the next sweaty person at each machine. I was impressed and quite happy for 2 hours. Overall the hotel is a 5! And even though there was a room mix-up, the Managers (Noah) + Jeff at the front desk, did try their best to accommodate us - its a trip the kids will remember. RECOMMEND YES! Did i mention the location location location???? Valet parking is $65 a night but well worth it! Parking garage is directly across from the hotel. We walked EVERYWHERE and EVERYTHING was close! PRIME LOCATION in center of Times Square! Toni DiNapoli's, Richard Rogers Theater (Hamilton Show -- AWESOME!!!!) ... subway to 911 Memorial was a breeze! , biked in Central Park (lunch at the BoatHouse in CP), fun fun fun...will do it again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel twice, and you could not pay me to stay again. I'm a Diamond Hyatt member. Each time my reservation specifically request a high-floor as I'm a light sleeper (even several months in advance!). Upon check-in, I reminded this request, and was given what is essentially a street-level room. I could hear the band from the Irish bar right down the street. The staff is friendly, and apologetic, but also seemed apathetic (sorry, there is nothing they could do). The hotel itself is a nice facility. This hotel is not worth the price in my opinion. Opt for the Grand Hyatt instead.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location (1 block from Times Square) and service. There is a difference in the HYATT experience... I felt like a treasured customer. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Safe, Clean, Beds are absolutely comfortable. Starbucks in-room coffee. WIFI is no issue. Nothing but good things to say. Can't think of one thing to complain about.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First thing is first: What a great location! Right in the center of everything and within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, museums and Penn Station. The check-in process was quick and simple with the front desk staff being incredibly friendly--something I look for in a hotel but don't always find. The rooms: Very clean! Bathroom was nice with a tile floor and rain shower. The beds and pillows are very comfortable and the room is surprisingly spacious in comparison to many other hotels that I've stayed at in the city. I also have to mention the rooftop bar--on the 54th floor. It is absolutely breathtaking! Too bad the drinks are very overpriced, but they can get away with it because of the beautiful atmosphere. One of the best parts of our stay. The cons: The thermostat in our room was either broken, or kept being reset at designated times each day. I stayed during a week where there was 90-100 degree weather outside with intense humidity so I wanted to come back to a cool room, but it often stayed in the 70s (went up to 78 one day!) even after manually setting it at 65 (the lowest it lets you set it). We called the front desk the first night and after about 90 minutes without anyone coming to our room, we called again. They finally sent someone up to our room and he changed the filter but it still didn't seem to do much.They also messed up my bill upon check out and it took several calls to accounting and the hotel manager to finally get it fixed. The walls are thin so it can be very noisy for people traveling on business. I could hear other rowdy guests and people watching tv in rooms that were adjacent to mine. Overall it was a very nice hotel and I would recommend it to guests looking to stay in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Brand new hotel. Well located near Times Square as the name suggests and near the shows and theater. Excellent facilities. good rooms. Efficient and polite service. We'd booked a suite but were offered one on the lower floors. On request we were moved to a higher floor - with a better view. Breakfast wasn't included. The food at the restaurant was excellent. good choices and quality but pricey .. 20 bucks per person.The top floor has a nice bar with open space. Our experience was marred by a squabbling, complaining guest. Other than that (not the hotel's fault), a fantastic stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is just around the corner to Times Square. Close enough to it, but without the crazy crowds. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms were absolutely quiet. The only negative that I noticed is that the hotel lobby is way to small to accommodate the guests during check-in/check-out. All in all, would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be close to Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quiet and peaceful, which I didn't expect for a Times Square Hotel. Decent sized rooms for NYC. Very comfortable workout facilities, and a great rooftop bar view. Staff made sure that everyone entering the elevator area had a room key, which made me feel safer. Elevators moved quickly even though the hotel was sold out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the hyatt, very friendly staff from valet to room service. Good location for Times Square. I would recommend the hotel. Times Square is obviously very crowded, but to access a show this location is key. Brant Park was a nice short walk. Big international crows during our stay which only added to the experience. Lounge on the 54th floor could get more attentive and friendly servers. The hostess was on it though. Gym was clean and uncrowded.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt in Time Square for 7 nights in August 2015. The hotel is within walking distance to several stores and places to eat. We went to 4 Broadway plays and all 4 theaters were within a 5-10 minute walk. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. I would stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The roof of this Hyatt in West 45th Street has New York's highest bar. Dazzling, open air -- spectacular like Niagara Falls. The nicest bar staff we've met in New York, up on the 54th floor serving drinks half the price of the Peninsula Hotel 's Roof Bar ($12 dollar wine, instead of $24 wine). They gave us birthday treats and lots of smiles, as we watched the sun set on the Chrysler Building and Times Square. This dazzling roof bar is one of New York's best secrets, not yet discovered by the crowds. Highly recommended, just not for anyone afraid of heights.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Right in the heart of Time Square. Close to all the action! Check in was super fast! Rooms with great views and very clean. Beds were very comfortable. Quick on guest services. Friendly staff who always greeted us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a decent stay at this brand new hotel in the heart of Times Square. Location can either be great or really bad - great to walk around the tourist mecca and bad if you took a cab anywhere. Traffic was pure hell to and from here.I did this stay solely on points as if not, the four night stay would have been over $2000 easy. Thank you, Gold Passport Points!! My bank loved you. For a four diamond hotel, it is just modern and plain. The room was just clean and sleek. There was no frill nor extra luxury feel to it. The bathroom was nice though. I totally loved the standing shower and the shower head. I took a lot of showers there because I loved it so much.I was meeting friends here and they were on a high floor. They told me to ask to be placed in the same floor. Nope! Front desk didn't even humor me on it. They put me on the 7th floor - way way way low. They probably were like you asked for too much though you used points. Excuse me - I had points because I was loyal and stayed a lot at Hyatts. That was not very warm and fuzzy. They even had a separate elevator to go to the "low" floors.It was still a decent stay. It was too much money to stay here if you're paying with real paper money. Not sure I would shell it out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Easy to get in and out. Nice rooms with excellent view. Very friendly staff. The view from the rooftop bar is amazing! Their T45 restaurant is also a plus. Modern room decor with spacious bathroom. Great amenities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great stay at the Hyatt in the heart of the action. It's in a perfect location just a walk away from the main action of Times Square. The hotel itself is clean and modern with spacious rooms. Despite being close to the noise of Times Square, we couldn't hear any of it from our room. Concierge was great and very helpful. The views from the rooftop bar were incredible and the cocktails were just as good! Wouldn't hesitate to return on my next visit to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this Hyatt for 9 days, and had an amazing time... though the room was cosy, which is understandable given its location (overlooking Times Square), we had the highest room in the hotel, on 52nd floor! The service was unfailingly polite, almost always helpful, the staff very courteous, and the hotel cheerful and welcoming! I would love to go back and stay at this Hyatt again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spent ages choosing a hotel for my first visit to NYC and USA. Eventually I settled on the Hyatt for its modernity and location and the excitement of the roof top bar. I envisaged my evenings sipping a cocktail , eating tapas, looking over the city lit up at night. I did loads of research as I was travelling with my teenage daughter and knew there were possible issues with under 21s but still booked so imagine my disappointment on check in to be told she could not go in the bar. Even one of the check in staff said there was nothing on the website but there is now! Fortunately other bars were happy to take us so my money was spent elsewhere. I went up once on my own at night to look and it was fantastic.That said the hotel is perfectly located just steps from Times Square which made it a great base for everything we wanted to do and close to subways. The hotel is very modern and contemporary and spotlessly clean. We had room 2606, a twin double with view at the end of the corridor. Despite how close we were to the hustle and bustle we found the room very quiet. I liked the fact it was not a huge hotel, easy to get in and out of. Concierge was great, arranging tickets for a show to be delivered to the hotel, giving advice and issuing tickets for the Empire State Building etc. The room was spacious with two wardrobes, full ironing board, iron, safe, fridge and coffee machine. Bottled water was provided every day. The bathroom was lovely with a big shower with overhead shower and a standard shower head on the wall, lots of toiletries, hair drier and a heated floor option. No shortage of towels either.We only ate once in the hotel in the ground floor restaurant for breakfast. Again very modern and clean and great service but a bit pricey eg. Smoked salmon bagel $21 which we later found at $10 in the nearby Cafe Manhattan.I did use the spa for nail work and everyone was helpful and friendly.Free wifi as spot on.Had we been a couple who could enjoy the rooftop bar I would rate this higher.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first trip to New York and the Hyatt off Times Square was everything I could have hoped for. The Building staff were fantastic and could not have been more helpful. They offered to assist us with booking shows, Tours etc.. The room was excellent, and the service was second to non. If you want to stay in a top hotel but not break the bank then look no further then the Hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family checked into this hotel for two days starting on August 12, 2015. We weere driving and had a bit of a hard time looking for the hotel since it was not clearly visible from both the times square side and the opposite side. We had to ask an Nypd officer for help. As soon as we found it, there was a valet area to park. The valet, chester was very kind. Unloaded all our baggae and assisted us to the front desk. Check in took less than 5 minutes. I was a bit disaapointed because I had booked an executuve suite thinking it was on the higher floors with a great view so my 4 year old will enjoy the views of times square. That wasnt the case and all suites were on the lower floors. We wereon the 7th floor. The room was very clean and had an ok view of the side street. There was a king size bed and a seperate living area. The room was big enough to hold 5 people comfortably. As far as the walk to time square, it was less than 3 minutes. The hotel is at the heart of the times square, very close to toys r us and within walking distance to many places. The views on gbe rooftop is outstanding. They even allowed my to bring my son up despite it being a bar. The staff was friendly and helpful. They do have a parking garage but it cost $65 a day and you get charged everytime you pull out the vehicle. This I fell is very excessive. I hope management re evaluates this since I was a guest, paid for parking, I should be able to get the vehicle without being chraged. There is no shuttle to the airport, so a cab or your own rental may be necessary if traveling with family with lots of baggages.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: made a quick overnight business trip and decided to try the Hyatt. Right on 45th less than 50 yards from Times Square, I was pleasantly surprised to find an exceptionally comfortable room with some of the most comfortable beds I've experienced in a long time. The decor was clean, simple and bright. the room other than the normal fan from the AC, was silent, and incredibly restful. The staff were friendly, check in was quick, valet parking drop off was handled expertly on one of the most busy streets in the city. The rate was very reasonable though parking remains pricey as it is with all hotels in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned from a week staying here. Firstly the positives, great location in the heart of everything, excellent free Wi Fi, lovely clean spacious rooms with coffee making amenities etc and friendly staff from the cleaning crew to the concierge. However - I booked a view room in April and emailed the hotel asking for the highest floor possible in line with my booking as this was my girlfriends birthday so wanted it to be special but on check in was given the 28th floor - 28 floor of a 53/54 floor hotel is barely past mid way!!! I am aware that everyone will want a higher floor but as I booked months ago I was disappointed that I wasn't given a better floor. The view from my room was disappointing and as this was the main reason for booking this particular hotel (along with its location) I wasn't impressed. Secondly, I ordered room service once - I was aware that there was a 18% gratuity attached for the delivery to the room but once my food arrived I was told that that was a 'delivery charge' and it did not include a tip to the 'waiter' so by the time I had tipped the waiter I had spent $55 on 2 very average burgers and chips!!! Was not impressed. It's a shame but the great location failed to make up for a very poor room allocation upon check in. Unless you are getting a room with a view I would look for a cheaper alternative as there are plenty of hotels in the Times Square area that may not offer a view but are cheaper.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want to be in middle of action at Times Square, then this Hyatt location is great. It also is a Hyatt with the chain reputation and standards you expect. It is relatively new and clean and comfortable. Valet Parking is expensive $65/day, and NYC taxes fees surcharges really jack up the daily room rate

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for my wife's babymoon/anniversary.Check in was fast and efficient and the guy checking us in was very polite and informative. I did inform the hotel several times it was our anniversary but they failed to do anything over abs beyond not even a message to congratulate us!The only reason I could not give it for five stars is it really lacks on customer service side in a few areas. The check in concierge are nice but the door staff very unhelpful. My wife being visibly pregnant and having suitcase and the main door being very heavy the door men just stand and stare while you struggle! Really made me wonder what the point of them was apart from asking for your card to go up!  The bar staff downstairs were great and the drinks fairly priced.One of the things I did notice were the lack of shower gels, milk, tea, cotton buds etc and strangely these need to be order most of which are free! I couldn't work out if this was a cost cutting exercise or a environmentally friendly gesture to reduce on waste! Still undecided but was shocked at there being no mini bar at all and milk to the room was $4.There is a handy Starbucks and cafe/convenience store not to far however.Time square is a minutes walk or less which is what really counts. It's very very busy but if you want the touristy feel then it's the place to be. The bar on the 52nd had great views,the rooms very large for New York standard and places like Bryant park, Macy's, rockfella centre are all walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: a great location in new York staff always ready to help and rooms with fab views of new York a great roof top bar with best views in the city will return soon had a room on the 48 floor and no noise to worry about

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff was very helpful, hotel is new and very clean. Great location, near Times Square, Broadway shows, 5th Avenue,etc. concierge service is great. Although near Times Square, noise is kept to a minimum.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was a great option as it was clean, comfortable, roomy and very close to all the action of Times Square. It was a great base for our stay in New York with lots of restaurants and shop nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here July 27- August 1. The hotel is well kept, and in a perfect location, just one block from Times Square, and walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Central Park, The New York Library, and many more attractions.. And the rooftop bar has spectacular views!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My best hotel pick after 3 visits in NY. I was lucky and got my room on the 43rd floor so the view was great. Everything in the room was brand new and stylish without much exaggeration. I also took advantage of the Gym which I usually dont use while traveling. It was really specious and clean with all needed amenities (extra towels, headphones, etc) Friendly stuff and overall a great service level.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The front desk staff are friendly and efficiently. The locations is prefect. Definitely value for redemption. Breakfast quality at T45 is excellent - complementary from hotel. Unfortunately there is no club lounge.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: While not my favorite NYC hotel (Westin), the Hyatt Times Square is a good hotel. Let's face it, a Hyatt is a Hyatt. You typically know what to expect and it is a safe bet. I had a lot of Hyatt gift cards which determined this stay. I was please with the location, friendly and accommodating service, large exec suite and the quality of the food in the restaurant attached to lobby. The rooftop bar was awesome with great drinks and view but the service was slow. Drinks were pricey at $22 for a Long Island Tea...granted you only need one of those!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I lived my whole life in NYC and moved to the Bay Area two years ago. Now when I get back to NYC for work I'm always looking for that "perfect" hotel that's within my company's expense limits and convenient to the office in midtown. The Hyatt in Times Square fits the bill perfectly. The hotel is very recently built and the rooms are spacious, modern and very clean by NYC standards. The bathrooms are large and have big rain showers. The views from some of the rooms are outstanding. The wifi is super quick. The bar on the roof is stunning. This is a hidden gem. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Used this hotel for an overnight trip to see the 9/11 Museum and Penn & Teller on Broadway. The location is absolutely perfect, and is what you're paying for.The room was spacious and clean. The rain head shower was very nice, although the holder for the removable sprayer needed repair so that it could have stayed in place as a normal shower head.Like too many hotels, it needs unused, accessible, power outlets on both sides of the bed(s). This did have power outlets at the desk, but that is not as convenient as bedside.The roofside bar is nice, but I wasn't impressed with the service. We asked to sit outside, and were told there was a wait. We saw that there were seats available on the sofas, only to be told there was no 'stand up' service outside, whatever that meant. We went back inside to order drinks, and went back outside. Once the drinks were served, we somehow turned invisible. Completely, totally invisible. Maybe the staff thought we were a couple of country bumpkins, and not part of the beautiful people, so we were not worthy of attention. That was the one negative of the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is fairly new and it shows. The rooms are great - spacious (for NYC) with very comfortable beds. Great windows for lots of light. Good sized bathroom with fabulous shower. The employees are very helpful. Location is great if you are going to theater or other mid-town sites. This was our 2nd stay here and we will be back. Great value for the money. Nothing bad to say. Love this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful location in Times Square, walk to theater district, shopping and Times Square events. Awesome rooftop lounge with spectacular views and great staff. Nice way to celebrate a 60th birthday! Courteous, friendly staff

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We are a family of three with a teenage son. The hotel was right off of Time Square and within walking distance of major sights, Broadway shows, great restaurants and shopping. Our suite was spacious and very comfortable. Wonderful shower! We loved the security check in the lobby. We were on the 15th floor and we're not generally disturbed by any street noise. Fabulous, helpful staff. Will definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved the Hyatt Times Square! The location is perfect--you are so close to everything that has to do with Times Square. We could see Good Morning America from our window in the morning. We walked easily to Rockefeller Plaza. We found a 24-hour Fed-Ex place within a few blocks and mailed things home that we had accumulated during our trip. The close-by Walgreens was extremely handy. The subway was nearby. The TKTS booth to purchase tickets for Broadway plays was 1 minute away. The staff was extremely courteous, there was security at the elevators that checked for a room key every time we walked by--which we appreciated, and the view from the roof-top bar was amazing. We plan on staying for a week again next year. And great bed!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this Hyatt on a weekend trip to the city for sightseeing and a U2 concert. This is the most modern hotel I have ever stayed in. The front desk was pleasant and helpful. The rooms are small (typical for NYC), but did not feel cramped. The bathroom was modern and quite large and I enjoyed the rain shower head. The room is modern in style and VERY comfortable. We spent an evening at the rooftop bar, the drinks were expensive but delicious and the view was AMAZING. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel and will probably stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is unlike most Hyatts. It is a new hotel squeezed into a tiny space just a few metres from Times Square. It has a tiny modern lobby and just ten or eleven rooms on each floor. But it has 54 floors and a rooftop bar. Views are incredible. Many reviews of New York hotels comment on small room sizes. No complaints here. Bedrooms and bathrooms are large and comfortable. Everything you would expect of a Hyatt is available, including a kettle for tea as well as the ubiquitous coffee machine. Will definitely book again for next visit. Note, there was a market in the street outside the hotel on Saturday so cars could not pull up outside but contact the hotel and they will send a doorman to the nearest street corner to meet you and bring your bags to the hotel. Similarly for departure although it was easier to just cross the street and walk through the arcade of the Millennium hotel to 44th street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We wanted a hotel near the Broadway Shows and this was a perfect location. The corner room we booked had a closed off bedroom and a fair sized living room. Our granddaughter slept on the sofa (non sofa bed) and it worked out ok. Had the option of a rollaway bed but there wasn't really enough space for it. We spent 6 nights and we felt like everything worked out nicely. We could see Times Square out the floor to ceiling windows in both rooms from our 42nd floor. The rooms were very up to date and very clean. The staff was always helpful and provided five star service.  The reason for 4 stars rather than 5 stars was primarily because 1 out of the 3 elevators for our floors was periodically out of service causing long delays. We also had problems with the air conditioning. If set at 70 the air conditioner was constantly on pumping very cold air into the room. If set higher the temperature would get well above 70. We had it looked at but nothing we did differently helped.  Saturday a street fair closed down 45th at the front of the hotel. Glad we weren't leaving or arriving that day. We actually arrived on a Monday night and left Sunday morning which were the perfect times to avoid the horrible traffic in that area.  The hotel has a restaurant that was available if you didn't want to leave the hotel. Two great places within a few yards of the entrance were the Cranberry Deli and O'Lunney's Pub. The deli had all sorts of breakfast and lunch items. We bought milk, cereal, juice and pastries several of the days and kept them in the small refrigerator so we could get an early start. O'Lunney's had great pub food at reasonable prices and we had two dinner's there.  Lastly, we basically stayed at the Hyatt because we had Hyatt points that lowered the cost of the room considerably. Not sure I would have rated this as highly if I had paid the going rate of $400 a night for our corner suite.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed Friday through Sunday. Great location, right off of Times Square. Wonderful staff, very accommodating. I loved the security, you needed to show your room card to get into the hotel. Very nice clean and comfortable rooms! We stayed on the 28th floor and there was dead silence, great for sleeping! Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel had the most amazing entrance. The lobby was really fantastic and the staff were very friendly from the get go. The only thing was our room was smaller than we imagined and the noise from the ac were very off putting. It was very handy for the shows at night and just a stones throw away from the restaurants

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Have stayed at this Hyatt twice and both times have found it to be clean, comfortable with friendly, attentive service. Very convenient location on 45th and 6th. Short walks to Times Square, Rockefeller, and other attractions. Also rare to find hotel rooms in NYC with two queen beds. Ideal for family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very friendly service engaged in ensuring that you enjoy your stay in NYC Times Square...from check in by Chester at front desk, Rey in T45 (restaurant) and Betty (housekeeper). Hotel is modern and very clean. Perfectly located in Times Square...convenient access to everything. Our two children were made to feel welcome and comfortable as well. Awesome view from bar at top of hotel. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Trip to NYC with wife for a long weekend. Stayed at Hyatt Times Square. Awesome hotel! Perfect location right off Times Square and in Midtown. No car needed and walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller, Central Park, and Midtown sights. Easy access to NY Subway. Rooms were very spacious and clean and we loved the king beds and huge shower. High floor is better for street noise. Real gem of this hotel is their rooftop bar/lounge on the 54th floor. Awesome views over Times Square and lower city. We were up there multiple times enjoying the views and drinks (reservations can help secure a great table). We would definitely stay at this property again and highly recommend to those visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and two teenage boys spent three nights in NYC. We had a very nice spacious room on 44th floor. The room had two queen beds. We had the back view which was Ok but other view of Times Square is much better. Hotel breakfast was delicious but expensive. Try to get free with room. Location had many good restaurants in walking distance. Hotel staff was friendly and outstanding giving exceptional service. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt in a "Deluxe View" room. You literally get a full wall of windows facing the bed and our view was great - we spent some time on the rooftop bar, but the view from our room was better! The bathroom was modern and very nice, too. The hotel seems new, and everything is very clean. The location is convenient to Times Square but not actually ON Times Square. That's a good thing - it's quieter, and you don't walk out of the hotel to be immediately harassed by people in furry costumes trying to take a picture with you, or people selling bus tickets. There is also a rooftop bar and diner style restaurant on the ground floor. We had a nice experience. If we needed a place to stay close to Times Square we'd definitely go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I stayed for her Sweet 16. We were greeted with smiles and very helpful staff. The rooms were very clean, fully stocked and easy temp control. The front desk staff were so helpful with getting tickets and providing information and directions. We would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location was great, the hotel was nice and modern. The staff was nice and helpful (for the most part). One man in particular was extremely helpful. He gave us amazing tips as far as clubs, restaurants, how to get to places, what to do. Unfortunately his name escapes me right now. He is a bald white guy. Very cool guy. The only thing that sucked was the lack of a rooftop pool. But I guess that's asking for a lot lol. Overall great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had the opportunity to stay at the Hyatt Time Square and had a very pleasant experience. Compared to most NYC hotels it is not crowded & your hotel room is a nice size spacious as well the bathroom. My observation is that the hotel is well built to keep hall traffic & noise from other hotel guests very limited. Very clean, & well decorated. If The Hyatt can continue to keep their per night cost reasonable I will be a loyal customer and returning again in September 2015.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful hotel in a wonderful location. Friendly staff. The restaurant food was average but there are endless places to eat around there. There is a rooftop bar with beautiful views and exorbitant New York drink prices but hey, that's the price you pay in the big city. The location is just a few doors down from Times Square. We had a corner suite which seems like it should be a very large room and I guess it was by New York City standards. It was clean and there were no issues. I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking to stay near the action of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff were so friendly & helpful!! Great security with doormen/women always onsite..Nice big deluxe room w/queen beds..always clean linens and complimentary water bottles..very large room, big bathtub, good size bathroom with lots of LARGE towels that wrap around your bod,nice big tv and though the beds were too firm for my taste after exhausting days pounding the pavement we were all well rested the next day..well insulated from noise!! Restaurant for breakfast,lunch,dinner on site.. Rooftop bar was kind of narrow but beautiful views..It was full when we got there:( Well equipped fitness center w/cold water..Downsides that are easily remedied.. Some white lint pilling on beds..really not great if you're wearing black and sitting on your bed.. Bring a lint roller. I voiced this concern and they were so nice about it & glad to hear this was the first time they heard of this problem..See through glass door in shower .. Well just drape a sheet over before getting in if you've got a few people staying with you who might have to go..housekeeping was so friendly they gave us extra everything with a smile !! no microwave (oh well), tiny fridge(oh well)..coffee in room...not enough .. Bring some portable creamers,instant coffee packets & portable sugars you need..we saved lots of $$ by using the coffeemaker as a hot water brewer in the cups provided for instant coffee..or just go downstairs and pay whatever..fast elevator. The location is a 15 min walk from Grand central. 5 min walk from Rockefeller center. If we can ever get back we will stay here!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the first trip to New York City for our family of four, and we loved it! We arrived earlier than our check-in time, and the hotel was great about keeping our luggage until our room was ready. We received a phone call when our room was ready, which was 2 hours earlier than the posted check-in time. Wow! The room itself was great! There was plenty of room for us and our luggage. We especially loved the heated floors in the bathroom! Everyone we encountered who worked at the Hyatt was friendly, helpful, and approachable. This hotel is located right in the middle of the action in Times Square. We were able to walk almost everywhere. There were plenty of stores and restaurants nearby. The Cranberry Cafe a couple doors down from the hotel had wonderful bagels! We would definitely stay at the Hyatt Times Square again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This will be our go to hotel when we return to NYC. It is beyond 5 star in terms of location especially for theater lovers. Service was exceptional especially from Sean and Chester. The view from our 42nd story room of Time Square was spectacular. This is a New York hotel so the rooms and lobby are smaller New York size. The restaurant is the big disappointment. Food is just okay and service is uneven. Excellent service from Jayme and Venus, but abysmal service on our other visit. But for free diamond breakfast we would not have eaten at this hotel restaurant. Having said that, still recommend this hotel, just eat somewhere else. We liked St Andrews on 46th and the Kati Roll street vendor on 46th Street and 6th Avenue both within easy walking distance. In fact, everything you need is in easy walking distance. Nearly a 100 walkability score.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here from July 30-Aug3 and we loved it. The location is perfect the room was beautiful and the staff was very friendly. We got a room with a terrace and it was worth it for us to have that. We visited the rooftop lounge and the view was beautiful but didn't really like the drink menu and it was so busy we couldn't get a table out on the rooftop. Overall when visiting New York again we would come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As Diamond member in May 2015 I stayed in 3 Hyatt Hotels in New York: 4 nights at the Hyatt Time Square, 8 nights at Hyatt Union square and 1 night at Grand Hyatt New York. While the Hyatt Time Square fully fulfilled the Hyatt standards I am used outside the US, Grand Hyatt was ok, Hyatt Union square was a disappointment. Below I describe the experience of the Hyatt Times SquareThe Hyatt Times Square has a young fresh look. Team is young, friendly, service orientated and over average in New York. Location is great, very close to time square. Also for breakfast, they have a big variety of choices, again good atmosphere and friendly staff. In contrast to Hyatt Union Square no problem to have some extra wishes for breakfast at Hyatt Times Square. Recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We can walk to the restaurants, theatres. Price is not too high. The valet parking: $65/day We took a View King room in 33rd floor. Room is modern and very clean. We will stay in this Hyatt hotel again when we come back to New York city in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just off Broadway is located the Hyatt Times Square, a new well appointed hotel. Great rooms well furnished with magnificent views. Just steps to major Broadway's attractions, shops, bars and restaurants. This is a MUST in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms are very clean and comfortable well worth the money.Staff is VERY friendly and helpful especially Rave he was very friendly, helpful above and beyond what you would expect.The rooftop bar was too fancy for our taste $23 for a drink!!, Really??Location of the hotel was great close to everything, would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location to stay in New York City. The rooms are nice, not to big but this is standard in NYC. The hotel has a nice bar on the last floor. Great view and good coctails. The staff was very friendly. Only - would be the elevators.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hyatt hotel stays along the lines of the hotel chain's great reputation. The central location in New York's Theatre District makes it a convenient place to stay. It's restaurant and bar on the ground floor provides excellent service and fine food.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is my fourth time staying at this hotel and loved the whole experience. The hotel is perfectly located in Times Square (on 45th St between 6th and 7th Ave, which is just outside the overbearing crowds). The rooms are immaculate and well appointed. The standard rooms are small, but this is standard for Manhattan hotels, so by no means a negative on the hotel. If you spend a little more, you can get a deluxe room which are very spacious. The employees are amazing (especially the Valet men and the front desk). They are incredible professional, yet courteous and friendly. They have always engaged in small talk which brings a nice personable touch to my stay. One of the Valets actually remembered me from my last visit 3 months ago (he earned a nice tip for that!). Really love this hotel, and they have my business for future NYC visits.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights last week. The room and the bathroom were spotless. It's right in the middle of Times Square and yet so calm. The view from our room was spectacular. The staff is very friendly. We will definitely come back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with my son for a long weekend and was very impressed. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Security right by the elevators, bathroom floor was heated, beds nice and hard, robes in the closet, water bottles left daily, fridge and safe in room. Excellent large shower and barely a block off of Times Square. Quiet inside and never heard anyone. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is definitely in the mix in Times Square. There are great restaurants right by it and access to Times Square is just a very short walk. The views you get from the higher floor rooms are amazing and when you get to Bar 54, it is even better. The hotel rooms are very nice, but one thing that hasn't been totally upgraded since Hyatt acquired this property is the elevators. Getting up and down at certain times of the day can be slow so be prepared to spend a few more minutes at peak times.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located at a very convenient location (Mid-town) with superb friendly, courteous, and professional staff. Our room and bathroom were immaculately clean (loved the contemporary/modern bathroom & shower with rain shower head. The king size bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. The rooftop lounge is a must do! We deplore the tourist trap of Times Square, therefore, the W.45 St location allows you to avoid Time Square via 6th Avenue. We stayed on the 37th floor so street noise was a non-issue.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel, located at a stone's throw from the glittering neons of Times Square offers a variety of amenities, at the top of the list would be the bar with an open terrace on 54th floor. The view was breathtaking and the gentle cool breeze was refreshing. The rooms are large and well appointed by Manhattan standards, with queen beds. We will stay here again! Hyatt got it right!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for our Anniversary and had a wonderful time. Perfect location to the Minskoff Theatre. Highly recommend to anyone coming to the city. Perfect location for shopping and restaurants and all the the city has to offer!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has a good bar at the top, Bar 54. It's the old Millennium hotel and the highest rooftop bar in Manhattan. The service at the bar is not great, the prices are through the roof, but the view is excellent.I took my wife here for her 50th birthday, and as a Hyatt diamond member I called the concierge before our visit to inform the hotel of the date of her birthday. The hotel did not acknowledge this at all during our visit -- the guy in the cafe downstairs made more of a fuss, giving her a free birthday cake. Don't expect them to go out of their way for you.The hotel is centrally located, and if you like tourist spots, Times Square does not disappoint.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Non-chalant attitude of staff was inexcusable and unprofessional. There was no sense of urgency, nor customer satisfaction, regarding the dry cleaning which was hours late in being returned. I will not stay at this Hyatt property again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: SO very pleasantly surprised. We would absolutely choose the Hyatt Times Square again.Location - great location. Sure Times Square is a bit crazy but 45th between 6th and 7th Avenues is a prime location close to everything. You are short walking distance to Central Park, Empire State Building, Rockafeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Hell's Kitchen... just everything. Rooms - Clean, good size, modern and sound proof! The most important thing in a city like New York is whether or not your room is sound proof, at the Hyatt Times Square they are. Having said that, you do need to have your fan on high to muffle the garbage trucks in the very early morning... but if your fan is on high you won't hear anything. Great Rain shower and good water pressure. Comfortable bed and bedding. Cordless phones, all good in the room. Other plus, our A/C fan did not face the bed so you didn't feel the fan blowing in your face all night long. Roof top bar - amazing views from the rooftop bar, great drinks and comfy seating. This place is absolutely worth you checking it out. Just make sure you don't arrive hungry, the food menu is small and only finger foods. Restaurant - although it is small, you can choose to sit outside which is great for people watching in NYC and all outdoor seating is shaded in the morning. The menu and the food are great with lots of choices. Staff - very friendly and professional staff everywhere in the hotel. Although their front desk is small, we were checked in very fast. Never had a problem having a quick word with the consierge, no long lines. We've stayed at a few different hotels around town and in terms of value for your money we thought the Hyatt Times Square was excellent in comparison to other hotels of the same caliber. Extra tips - Bond 45, the restaurant right across the street also has a great breakfast menu. Plus their lunch and dinner are also very good. There's a Starbucks right across the street also and Hell's Kitchen is just a 5 minute walk away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We couldn't be happier with the hotel choice we made in the Hyatt Times Square. The people that worked there were fantastic! From our check-in with DeDe and Yenny to the friendly faces out front, the employees were great. As far as location, we were half-a-block to Times Square (the subway was only another block or two away once you get to Times Square). If you prefer to avoid the insanity (which we regularly did), you are only half a block away from 6th street, which you can take north or south to get to any number of places. Also, I can't forget to mention that the rooftop bar had an incredible view looking over South Manhattan! WiFi was included as well.All in all, the location was great, but it was the friendly faces (every last one of them) that made this such an enjoyable stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here last week with my daughter and her best friend on our quest to find the perfect wedding dress. I was extremely nervous about being in the city for the first time and the Guest Services staff could not have made me feel more at ease. My thanks to Bryan, Spencer and Walter for your patience and warm hospitality. I felt the rooms were spacious and comfortable. Housekeeping was thorough and efficient. The F&B staff was pleasant and accommodating. Thanks again for making this very special time in our lives nothing but pleasurable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There are so many great things to do in Manhattan and this property is a great place to stay. Rooms are good sized and well appointed. The property itself is very well maintained and extremely quite...which is a nice rest from the constant noise and motion outside. Every time I come to New York this is where I stay. This last trip we took in 4 Broadway shows, visited Central Park, went to the Top of the Rock, took the ferry to Ellis Island, and walked all around Times Square. The Hyatt sits right in the middle of everything and was a great place to rest between adventures.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First visit it New York memorable. Hyatt Times Square excellent location, central to all we wanted to visit in New York. Hotel clean, staff courteous, view fro room amazing. Rooms good size clean, staff helpful and friendly. Could not have picked abetter place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was our first time in NYC and do not regret staying at this hotel. The hotel is perfect. It has the best location, you are in the middle of Times Square. Pay a little extra to upgrade to a higher floor room with the view of Times Square, it is an amazing view and experience. There was no noise as we had read in other reviews before going. Staff were very polite, check in and check out was quick. And the most important of all is that it was very clean and spotless. Good size room and very happy with our stay so I completely recommend and I will be returning there soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has an amazing location, because it's so close to Time Square and a lot of the known theaters and good restaurants.The employees are very helpful and friendly. The rooms look pretty. The hotel also has a roof top bar, where the view of Manhattan is nice !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel if you want to stay right in down town. Not "Business Friendly" more of a tourist hotel. The rooms were small, the valet parking outside is non existent, and you have to show your key card every time you enter the property due to security. Overall the staff's friendliness as well as the rooftop bar makes up for everything!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Helpful personell, beautiful room. We were celebrating our anniversary, got a perfect room on the 53rd floor. Fast check-in and check-out. Good location near the Times Square. Unforgettable stay. Recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I like this style hotel. It was mostly modern, the staff were very friendly. The location is superb if you want to be in the heart of Times Square. Personally Times Square is not for me - but I loved how you would be literally enthralled by crowds, unable to move in the chaos and noise - and then go into the hotel, up into your room and instantly have peace and quiet and space.I had an executive suite - it was certainly spacious and it was clean. There was no view to speak of. My main concern was that although new, the carpet was an odd choice - dated and green as were the curtains which were a bit temperamental. The bathroom was the main disappointment - very few/measly amenity products and the shower was a walk in - but large and felt a bit old/bare with browns cement like tiles - similar to a disabled public shower, or like an outdoor camping shower.The air conditioning was excellent. The room service whilst quite tasty and a good size portion, was delivered in cardboard, plastic boxes and a paper bag. For this calibre hotel I think a plate and trolley would be more appropriate, along with better for the environment. Also, room service finishes at 11pm so no late night snacking!The Sky lounge was pretty cool - great service - great views.I like this product and this hotel, I would stay here again. They are a little mean on the late check out policy - expect to be charged $50 per hour for it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would recommend this hotel when visiting New York. You will be in the heart of Time Square and be in the center of all the activities. Walk to 5ft Ave and all the places to see. Excellent quality and friendly staff. Rooms are great and big.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this hotel! The room was a good size for NYC standards and we had a room with a view which was great. Bathroom very modern and beautiful . The best part about this hotel is their staff. Upon booking I received 3 emails letting me know when my room would be ready and points about the hotel. Each and every one of them was exceptionally helpful, friendly and very attentive . It made such a huge difference . Asked for a roll away bed while booking but they didn't have any when arrived but comped us free breakfast .It has the highest rooftop bar in the city and gorgeous. Pricey drinks but the view makes up for it and it's NYC. I would recommend this hotel highly and will stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a new hotel. It has clean rooms that are spacious for NYC. The floor to ceiling windows offer amazing views. The bathroom is fabulous with a rain shower as well as a deep soak tub. And the hotel is quiet. I did not hear anyone in other rooms and the hotel was full.Service is A+. The staff are all incredibly friendly and helpful!And location, location, location. You are right in Times Square. A ten minute walk downtown to Macy's/Herald square, or only 10/15 minute walk uptown to Central Park.Don't let the modest hotel entrance and small lobby fool you, this hotel is fabulous. I will be staying there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have to say, I never thought I'd get such good customer service in NYC, but since the fist phone call, to the front desk, to the staff everyone was very helpful and pleasant. We were able to check in right at noon when we arrived. The rooms are very modern and new. Pillows and bed were comfy and bathroom looked brand new. Lots of places to plus in all my devices. The lobby is very small, but if all you want is to check in and hit NYC it's fine. The roof top bar has nice view of downtown and the New Years Eve ball. get there early or reserve seat. No one under 21 though. the rooms have nice refrigerators also, a plus! the hotel is just a block off times square. Just a few blocks from metro stations. Lots of delis and restaurants and all the craziness of times square. oh and free wifi!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located a half block from Times Square - location is perfect. While the hotel front is on 45th St - it's location was close enough to feel like you were right there - and probably made the stay alot quieter. We were in a corner two queen bed room on the 19th floor - and we were very pleased with room size, the bed, the mini-refrigerator, rain shower, and cleanliness. This places lives up to being a Hyatt. For being in the city and given we weren't THAT high up, we thought the room was relatively quiet. Didn't hear hallway noises - just standard traffic background noise.Check-in and valet parking went smoothly - no issues. Parking is high - $65 per night without in and out privileges - but we checked some local garages while there and that valet rate only seemed to be a few dollars more than other close by places - so we felt the convenience of having parking through the hotel made up for those few dollars. Front desk had a subway map to hand out. We didn't use any of the hotel features - didn't dine there or use the gym or spa - so can't comment on those. We do go to the bar on the top floor to see the view - but we didn't stay for food or drink. We'd definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt was a great hotel! It was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. They didn't mind answering any questions that we had.It is also in a great location. We were very pleased with our stay. Our room was cleaned very well each day. If we needed anything, it was brought to our room right away. Would absolutely stay there again and will recommend it to our friends.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything is just nice and available and clean and friendly. Good size rooms and bathrooms spacious. Great aircon. Food is very good and reception extremely efficient. The bell desk amazing at helping with things to do. Will stay there again for sure

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Fantastic location, modern and spotless rooms. Friendly staff and very comfortable beds. A great rooftop bar with the best view of Downtown Manhattan and stunning in the evening. Location to the theatres is second to none.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you expect your upcoming vacation as a perfect thing in NYC, I strongly recommend the hotel, Hyatt Time Square. Nice employee, nice location, nice sleep... I satisfied thoroughly!! In addition, Hyatt Time Square generally provided to me early check-in and late check-out, these were very helpful to enhance my vacation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for a night with family. Very clean rooms. Bed was super comfy. Views of the city were spectacular. Gym was enormous. Plenty of room to do your work out. Rooftop bar was small., but chic. Glass of wine was a bit pricey but the views were worth it. Really wish they provided creamers in the room for coffee and not the powdered stuff though!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have been to New York City several times in the past. I wanted to prepare my kids for the disappointment most of the hotels are there. But everything I told them was simply not true at the Hyatt Times Square! The room was a double queen and bigger than a normal hotel room in most cities I have visited.
