The bathroom had a nice sized shower and a large soaking tub with plenty of counter space for 4 adults. Everything was spotless. The queen beds were actually almost queen size and we could share without anyone being squashed. There were no bed bugs, no bad smells and nothing broken. My only complaint about the room was there was no hangers in the closet. The staff was amazing! Anything they could do for us they would. They would bring you complimentary bottles of water, pillows, extra towels just by asking. The hotel was in a great location, steps from Time Square and many good restaurants. And the view was simply amazing. While the price wasn't cheap at $450 a night, it certainly wasn't the most expensive, more of an average in New York City. You just can't beat the location. We could walk to so many places, Rockefeller Center, Radio Music Hall, Circle Line pier and that saved hundreds in cab fare. Give it a try, I don't think you will be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location. New and clean hotel. You get the rite room for your money. Upgrade your room to a suite for better experience. Close to everything . Bar at the top is perfect for a stop before going back to room for sleep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family stayed here for a 1-night layover stop to enjoy NYC touristy stuff. American Girl, Nintendo World, Times Square and centrally located for subway too. Ravi checked us in, got our bags in baggage because we had to check in earlier before our room was available. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Bar on top floor overlooks city with beautiful view, and they let us go up there for a couple minutes to take a family picture. valet is super expensive $60 per 24-hour period. We ended up paying $120 in parking for one night because we arrived at 1pm and left at 6pm the following day. No baggage cart available to patrons, only staff can use cart it seemed. Ask the staff about the Brody dog in each hotel room, a balloon dog made out of wood... Kids loved the bathroom's rainfall shower-head. Don't pay the $25 extra for View room, not really a better room, just same room on higher floor. Definitely recommend this hotel if staying in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square location is in Times Square area but still there is no noise , nice view from my room I stayed it 53floor ,54Bar is nice with one of the best view in NYC , the room is small but new designs I really enjoyed Staying there and I will definitely consider to stay again ...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really enjoyed this hotel. Close to all of the action in Times Square, and an easy walk to most of the major attractions in the area including the theater district. Service here was very good. We upgraded upon check-in to a suite for a reasonable price - glad we did - very comfy! Room service was very tasty, and we enjoyed the on-site restaurant for breakfast twice. We tried the lounge on the 54th floor, but it was a little too "clubby" for us - no matter.Great place! Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spent one night at the most amazing Hotel. The Hyatt Times Square NY is by far the best place that I have ever stayed. Check in was very easy. The Roof Top Bar and the staff very amazing. So close to all the action that Times Square has to offer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Times Square on a quick 2 night trip to NYC. It is just off Times Square, so it is easy to get anywhere you want to do in the midtown area. Our room was very clean and surprisingly quiet. I would recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first time in NYC and this was a surprise trip for my 50th Birthday. The hotel itself is quite new and very clean and contemporary. The lady that checked us in was a little stand offish but apart from that everyone was lovely. The rooms were a good size and had everything you could need. We had a problem with our heating which in January was a bit of an issue but was soon resolved.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in a suite room which was very comfortable and affordable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The roof top bar was spectacular. Great location, times square, pubs and starbucks right across the street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed for 9 nights at the beginning of July for our wedding. We were in contact with the hotel prior to our arrival to assist with arrangements and plans for our big day. Initally the communication was poor but after a few more emails we dealt with the very attentive and thoughtful gloria. I won't go in to detail on what gloria did for us but she ensured that everything ran smoothly for my wife and her 6 bridesmaids on the day. On arrival we were informed that we had been upgraded to a suite which was nothing short of sensational. We were in room 5101 and the views were fantastic. The spacious room was complimented by a wet room style bathroom and wifi was free throughout the hotel which is a rarity in new york. On the day of the wedding we were supplied with a bottle of prosecco and a couples massage at the Marilyn Monroe spa on the day of our departure. Our wedding reception was on the spirit of new york and we had to get across manhattan in rush our traffic. If Aaron from the front door hadn't arranged suv's for us we would have never had found enough taxi's to get bus to Chelsea pier on time. Over all this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The view from the rooftop bar was fantastic and although some drinks were on the pricey side you are paying for the view. The location of the hotel is fantastic for its location to times square for all the lights and biz but also very close to 5th Ave and in particular bryant park which is great. Go on a Monday night for the free movies in the park until 22 August. Thanks again hyatt!Graeme and Julie Speirs!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is literally one block away from Times Square. The theaters are within 5-10 minutes walking distance. Stayed on a high floor and did not hear the street noise. There is a Starbucks across the street, pubs, Buca and other restaurants and a market that serves hot food by the weight ala Whole Foods - all on the same block. 5th Ave shops are two blocks away. The hotel is clean and rooms are spacious. Doorman arranged for our ride back to the airport. Entire staff is very helpful. I like this hotel as it is close to the theater district. There is no need to ride a cab or subway after a show especially since it is a zoo when the shows all let out around 10:45.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great location in the heart of the theater district... half a block off Broadway and two blocks from TKTS. Stayed in a quiet room with a great view ... comfortable and CLEAN bedding ... contemporary-style and good-size bathroom for NYC ... friendly helpful staff. (Have to mention that this property has the strangest room art/design that I have seen in a branded hotel property -- room very oddly appointed -- though must admit that it did make an impression....) One less star given as the light green carpet is sorely in need of cleaning and, in my opinion, there is no housekeeping excuse for mildew on shower tile grout lines. Overall, enjoyed my stay and recommend this hotel to other theater lovers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stay in Hyatt's all over the US and this is one of my new favorites especially in New York. This hotel is less than a year old and while it is small, only 11 rooms per floor, the rooms are larger than expected for a mid-town Manhattan/Times Square hotel. They are bright and quiet with fantastic views. The staff is friendly and helpful and make you feel almost like you are in your own New York residence. The rooftop bar, Bar 54 has a great view of Times Square down to Wall Street over to the Hudson. It is open to the public and sunset is an experience. The T45 restaurant has great fresh food, nice unique selections and at a great price. I recommend Bar 54 and T45 even if you are not staying at the Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved everything about our stay at the Hyatt. Wonderfully large, very clean and comfy room. Right at times square and so easy to get around from here. Staff were awesome. Highly recommend a stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Front desk was accommodating and helpful. Hotel in great location on Times Square. Rooftop lounge though was terrible - rude and unwelcoming hostess (walked out before we could even be seated). One suggestion for rooms - replace the old green carpeting.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just spent an extended weekend in NYC and stayed at this awesome Hyatt property. I would highly recommend it, it's so close to so many of the attractions. And it's right in the middle of Manhattan which makes it easy to go to things out South, and up North. Request a high room with a view, and check out the awesome rooftop bar on the 54th floor! Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for six nights while vacationing in NYC with the family. Was a clean, quiet room that was kept up well every day. The staff were very friendly & helpful - we used the concierge for several things, and they were all very knowledgeable and able to accommodate us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed with family in this hotel in NYC for the first time and it did not disappoint. It has excellent location, staff is very helpful, rooms are impeccable clean, and surprise, exceptionally quiet, despite the perfect location, two blocks away from Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a little late, but my wife and I went to New York for her birthday. It coincides with the 4th. I did plenty of research, but always nervous about where to stay. First off everybody at this hotel were great. Ravi (sorry if I mispelled his name) was the most helpful person you could meet on your first day in the big city. He works the front for the Hyatt and offered us so much help. When we came back in the evenings he always made a point to ask about our day. You couldn't ask for a friendlier group.The rooms are very clean, neat, and no bed bugs. Bathroom is really nice with heated flooring. The view is amazing so definitely ask for a room with a view! This is important.The only part of the stay that seemed off was our trip to the sky bar on the roof. It is so far over priced it is crazy. The staff that waits on you act as if they have never smiled in their life. We didn't let that get us down though. Just check it out. Be prepared for spending some dough on two drinks. I drank at so many places in New York and nobody came close to 22 dollar eight ounce drinks.Anyways this place is perfectly located to everything. The Perfect Pint is next door too. A great drinking spot on ther roof. Try it out

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed recently for 3 nights at the hotel.We had a king view room, view was not as much as i expected, but still ok.The room was kinda small, like most NYC hotels.Bed is comffy, large bathroom.but the shower did not had enough strength.I like the way room and hotel were appointed, but most of all I loved the location.Staff were very friendly and attentive at all time.Free wifi worked very good

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the minute I walked into the hotel, I was treated like royalty. Hyatt Times Square really goes above and beyond hospitality. My family had three rooms and each was impeccably clean. The beds were so comfy and the pillows so soft I never wanted to leave. The hotel provides a mini refrigerator which is great for left overs and drinks. And the staff is helpful and friendly. The Marilyn Monroe Spa was such a treat, my massage was wonderful. The bar at the top floor of the hotel (54 floor?) had such a breathtaking view of the city. This is my new favorite place to stay when I come to the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was nice to be in a hotel so close to the theatre district, yet not right in the middle of it all. So close to great shopping, Central Park, Metro right around the corner.Very comfortable rooms. Would definitely stay and recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is really super! Location is amazing - 2mins walk to Times Square and starbucks right outside the door! Staff very friendly and courteous - check in time really quick. Room was lovely - more spacious than other rooms I've stayed in in New York and spotless. Bed very comfortable and quiet. Definitely recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location: around the block from the heart of Times Square and the main theatres. The subway is only a block or two away.Good room: the bed was very comfortable, surprisingly comfortable pillows, very clean and spacious for New York. Our family of four (three woman, including two teenagers) was comfortable enough. The hotel feels new, trendy and modern.The bar at the top of the hotel has an incredible view. The elevators are fast. There was security in the lobby all the time.We are glad to have chosen this hotel and would recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location of this hotel is ideal for your NYC get away. Steps from Time Square, you are in the heart of it all. Easy access to the subway and cabs make this ideal. The rooms were amazing, the balcony I had was unbelievable to take in all that the City has to offer you. The up stairs bar was amazing, with some great views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A beautiful room with an amazing view. The rooftop bar was superb, and the staff was kind to me when I just wanted to appreciate the view. The attention to detail was great! No stains on anything, and the tiled bathroom felt like I could eat off it. Also, it's smack in the middle of Manhattan. If you have the coin, this is a fantastic place to stay at.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently stayed at the Hyatt during our trip to New York. What a gem of a hotel in a fantastic location. The room was lovely and so peaceful which allowed us a rest from the hustle and bustle of New York. We were right in the middle of everything and right next to two fab Irish bars. The staff are very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazing modern and new hotel in the middle of the city. Just for two days but the experience was very good. Nice staff and good condition. Location was great, everything is around, full of nice restaurants and shops.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I and my friend stayed at Hyatt for a night during our short visit to NYC. We checked in early at around noon-ish and received our key cards to a north-facing room on floor 24 if I remember correctly. I was very impressed with the room since it was very clean and somewhat stylish. The bathroom is large and modern with a really large mirror. Its location is pretty hard to beat since you are right next to Times Square although it could be quite tiring to walk pass through the crowd every time from 42nd st. up to the hotel. I found the noise from the street to be minimal and had a restful night. In terms of facilities, we went up to the rooftop bar and were kindly allowed to take a look at the view briefly without having to buy a drink (it was raining before that so the outdoor area was wet and unoccupied though). The fitness facilities are well maintained with plenty of fresh towel available. We didn't have the chance to look at the spa though. Overall I had a great experience at Hyatt Times Square (which is actually my first Hyatt stay ever) and would highly recommend it to anyone who visit New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a joke of a 4.5 star hotel. The staff were typical rude New York City-ites. Unbelievably they charged me $25 to "upgrade" to a double room, which is exactly what I reserved. They insisted on making us use the luggage guy to transport our luggage on the cart. When I tried to grab a cart they physically stopped me. Very poor customer service. They only get a three star because of the amazing view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great stay at this hotel. The room was very spacious and clean with a lovely view. The location is excellent, right next to Times Square and although in a busy area, the hotel is lovely and quiet. The reception staff were very helpful with directions and suggestions. We would love to go back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Only 2 minutes walk from the world famous Times Square and Broadway theatres. The surroundings includes Planet Hollywood, Hard Rock cafe, Bubba Gump, and some irish bar. If you want to experience breakfast like locals theres small coffee shop and food cart nearby. 2 subway stations are within 5 minutes walk, to get you downtown or uptown. I would say the location is very good.The room is modern. Presence sensor, no need to slip-in your card key everytime you come in. Free starbucks coffee maker. And the bathroom floor has heater which I think is the best feature here. The wifi speed is good.On the top floor theres lounge. On weekend its gonna be a lil bit hectic, needs to queue for elevator. The security is good. I stayed for 6 nights with my family. No complaints, except for a guy from the cafe at lobby who brought us bottles of water and asked for $11 tip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great Hotel, service is outstanding, rooms are great, outstanding personnel and they care about you. I recommend everyone experience a Hyatt hotel at least once in their lifetime. We have stayed in Hyatt Hotels for the last 40 years throughout the world and have never been displeased. They are all outstanding.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We came to NYC for some fun around Times Square. The Hyatt has a great location. We were a short walk from the theaters where we got a chance to see Book of Mormon. We also were only a short walk from Rockefeller Plaza where we got to be on the Today Show! The staff was very friendly, especially the valet when we arrived. He did a great job explaining all of the details of how valet worked. And he was super friendly. It only took like 5 minutes to bring my car around when I was leaving which is great for New York. Also, the rooftop bar on the 54th floor was really neat and trendy. Drinks were rather pricey though.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: went on a family vacation to NYC for the first time during the 4th of July weekend and booked at this hotel due to its central location and good reviews. We got a room with 2 double beds. We arrived to the hotel at ~10:30 am and the room was ready for us and staff was friendly. the hotel was just a few buildings from Time Square which is great if one likes super busy tourist traps. I would personally avoid the area at all cost and stay closer to central park or farther south, possibly around Grand central station. The lobby and room were very small, but the room was very clean, beds super comfy and extremely quiet. the roof top bar on the 54th floor had a fantastic view of the city and the Hudson river. I highly recommend going up for a drink

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is in a perfect location. Plays, restaurants and Times Square are just steps away. The hotel seems new and modern. The beds were comfortable and the room quiet. I would stay here again..The view from the bar area on the top floor is amazing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Times Square Hyatt is at the heart of the city. Close to Broadway shows,Rockeffeller building etc. The staff and the service was great. The rooftop Bar is awesome,the view is breath taking at night. The rooms are clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved the rooftop bar. Loved how quiet it was and near times square. Love how I could walk out into broadway and times square. Irish Pubs to left and right. Breakfast at cranberry next door excellent. Liked how staff checked for room keys upon entering hotel. Was clean and service was great. Would recommend to anyone and stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Central to many of the big sites: Rockefeller Center, Empire State, Broadway and a short subway ride/taxi to Statue of Liberty, Central Park and Museums. Concierge was well educated on sites and how to get to places given weather and event situations. The housekeeping staff were professional and quick. Everyone was just so pleasant to deal with. Would stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would definitely return to this hotel. Staff was friendly, rooms were spacious and very clean. Location was great, a few blocks away from anything and everything. Would recommend this hotel. 2 thumbs up

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We made last minute, on-line reservations for the Friday of the July 4th weekend. We requested early check-in. About 10 a.m. I received an email asking when I would like to check in, and with the push of a button, I had my room number. Upon arrival, I walked the front desk, and was seemlessly check-in by Trish, and offered a room on a higher floor. I was given a full explanation of the services, and was in my room and on my way back out in 10 minutes. It could not have been easier nor faster. The room was remarkably clean. It had everything you needed, yet was not "junky". The bathroom was spotless and the fixtures were quite nice. The bed was quite comfortable. All things considered, the room was crisp, modern, and did I mention clean! One of the most comfortable and functional rooms I have ever had in this type of hotel. I will certainly stay here again. I can not think of a single negative thing to say about the facility or the staff. I am hard to please, but Hyatt did so without a hitch. Book it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently visited this hotel with my friends this past weekend. This trip was my second time staying at this hotel. I stayed there previously in January of this year and did not have a very good experience. While the hotel itself and rooms were nice, the service was lacking. The check in took forever, and on top of that, we waited hours for our rooms to be ready. We were not dressed properly and had to quick change in the hotel bathroom before our luggage was put in a storage room. The next day, our breakfast took forever and we lost time out of our day. The service at the restaurant was also not very good. My stay this past weekend was a whole different story. The service this time around was great! They were very friendly and accommodating when we requested to stay on the preferred level. We also were able to get one room right away, but had to wait for our other room which was no problem since we had one room to freshen up in. The restaurant staff was also very friendly and our breakfast was served quickly, allowing us to go out and enjoy the beautiful day. Overall, i would recommend this hotel. It has a great location within walking distance of many attractions and the service seems to have improved.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Whatever you do... book a stay here if you are in NYC and want to do Times Square and a show. We walked to Phantom... 5 minutes. Rooftop bar is amazing... you have to see to believe. Just go and you will not regret the time...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here in March of 2015 and loved it. Upon returning for July 4th weekend we were less then pleased. One elevator was out for the upper floors at times causing 15 minute waits just to get to/from lobby and room. The restaurant was awful (my wife's bagel tasted like fish - ugh) and there was apparently a leak coming from our shower that engineering entered our room and removed the shower head (no replacement available) leaving us with only the rainwater head to shower with. This has minimal pressure and not good for washing and rinsing hair. Mgmt's offers of "making it up to us" were pretty minimal and, for what we paid, there are much better options out there. Again, loved it initially but based on this trip, we will go elsewhere where the hotel is better maintained and where we have no issues.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt for 5 nights last week. Got spacious king room on 53rd floor, 1 floor below the fabulous Bar 54 serving wonderful,refreshing cocktails with superb views of New York from the terrace. Room clean, bed very comfortable, bathroom spacious. Great view of the city from room. Ravi on reception was very helpful and went out of his way to make sure we enjoyed our stay. Hustle and bustle of Times Square only about 100 yards away with hotel almost hidden away down 45th street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a nice new hotel and staff was very friendly. We valeted our car and had a nice room that was a good size for 4 people. It's right in Times Square so you can walk to many different destinations and grab a cab easily. There is a roof top bar that has incredible views of the city. The drinks are super expensive but you don't have to pay to go up there like you do the Rock or Empire. My family also used the gym, which was nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You rarely go wrong with the Hyatt, so when you add wall to ceiling windows in beautiful modern rooms... plus great staff and a rooftop bar, you can't lose. Rooms were big enough that we weren't stumbling over each other. Great experience from check-in to reluctant departure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My sister, my niece and I visited NYC last week for our annual girls trip. We spent a lot of time researching the different hotels, and chose Hyatt Times Square, based on location, and reviews. The hotel did NOT disappoint! Our deluxe queen room was VERY spacious, including TWO closets! The bathroom was amazing. It was very spacious, with tons of counter space, storage for toiletries and a large walk in shower with with a glass door (no cheesy curtain)! The space was very clean and quiet. It was updated and modern without feeling cold. We had a room on floor 43, so there was zero street noise, and a great city view. The large window did have a handle, so you can crack it open if you enjoy the city sounds and air. Our two queen beds were very comfortable. The AC worked great to cool the room for great sleep. We had a coffee maker and a mini fridge in the room, which was nice as we bought fruit and yogurt from Cranberries cafe two doors down and ate breakfast in the room each morning. We didn't use the rooftop bar, since we had an 18 year old with us, but it looked awesome with a fantastic view. We used the concierge service for our show tickets, directions etc. We ate one meal in the patio restaurant and the food and service were both very good. To be a large hotel, we found the service was very personal and there was always someone to answer questions or help with anything we needed. We had a fabulous time in the city, and it was a pleasure to come in every afternoon to our clean spacious room for rest and refreshing.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We've stayed at this hotel twice. Always loved the location and the sky bar has amazing views! Would recommend this hotel. Just a few things that have REALLY bugged us:1: the elevators are horrible. We often wait 5+ minutes to get on one and because so few are working (usually only about half), it stops to pick people up on every floor. 2: the service at the sky bar isn't great. We visited at 4pm on a Sunday afternoon. The entire inside lounge was empty except for us. We were told that we couldn't sit across from each other... That we had to sit on the same sofa next to each other because these are communal tables. When it's busy, it's a great way to be able to seat as many people as possible, which I appreciate, but it was completely ridiculous to be asked to move when the entire lounge was empty except for us. The rude hostess said she would get in trouble if her manager saw us sitting across from each other. I would say she should get in trouble for the lack of common sense.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice views from our room. Also, the rooftop bar is pretty spectacular. For breakfast there is also a great little restaurant on the first floor. Times Square is about a one minute walk from the hotel, so you're right in the heart of the city. I would definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We reach the hotel at 4pm and the luggage guy response very quick to carry out luggage without saying anything, then we checked in took a second in that I can't imagine how fast it was. They provide me with all of my request like high floor and away from elevator. We went to the room the best thing is only 11 rooms in the floor so it so quite. The rooms are fully new furnished. The strange thing they do have a paper named "HYATT has it" just circle at the items and they will provide that. They do have a complementary WI-FI in the rooms.I would like to thank the manager of today he gave me late check out because of my surgery .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 2 nights at the Hyatt. Am sure i've stayed here when it was another brand. As far as NY hotels go its been well refurbished. Nice big showers. Good water pressure. Great beds. Fantastic views. Next time I will make sure I use the roof bar - popped in quickly to check it out & it looks amazing. Also notice you can book a glam squad to make you over in room. Great idea, so i'll definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed from Sunday nigth until Tuesday on June 2015. I was gave a room at the 51st floor, looking south. the view is incredible. You can see the One World Trade Center from your bed in the morning (please consider we are talking about seeing entire half Manhattan in a good day!) This is a very modern hotel. But at the same time I miss some of the perks a hotel of this category and location should have. For example, room service is in fact a room delivery in a "to-go" kind of packaging from the restaurant on the ground floor (which actually is half part full service and half part a grab and go service). I was expecting from Hyatt at least a couple of restaurants or a more personalized service.Elevators are really fast (state of the art) and bathrooms are incredible huge for NYC standards. Wifi and desk were perfect for business purposes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you're looking for a hotel that's right in the middle of the action, choose this Hyatt. Close to theaters, shopping and great restaurants. The rooms are modern and nicely appointed. The rooftop bar is expensive -- but it's worth one visit to check out the view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have travelled extensively and have enjoyed all types of vacations/hotels/resturants from extravagant to economical. My reviews are with an eye for understanding about where I am in the world and that there are a world of differences. Arriving at Grand Central Station, it was only a 10 minute walk to the hotel. Very convenient considering we were dragging suitcases. We were greeted warmly by the valet who held the door for us to enter. A little crowded checking in but not bad. We told the front desk person that we were Hyatt Gold Card members and that we appreciated that we were receiving 20% off our meal at the hotel as stated on their webpage. She said that we were mistaken and that there was no such promotion. In a condescending manner she told us she would look into this later, but we knew she was just brushing us off. We were quickly given our room key and sent on our way. A room valet was not offered but I'm sure if we wanted one there would have been someone to help. The room was perfect. Loved the spaciousness of the bedroom, the view, and the offer to provide us with any essentials that we might want delivered to our room. The bathroom was not very big, but it was fine. It really bothered me that the front desk clerk didn't help us, so after settling in I looked up the hotel's webpage and there was the information about the 20% off! My husband immediately went down to the lobby with my phone in hand to show them. This was mostly to demonstrate that we weren't trying to dupe them, because at this point we didn't think they were going to do anything. The Manager got involved and really was surprised to find out what we were telling them was 100% accurate! They were unaware of this promotion. They should have investigated immediately, because why would anyone make this stuff up? Anyway, we highly recommend their restaurant, but that's for another review. Make sure to check out their rooftop bar, it's so lovely and the view is amazing. The wait staff are wonderful and the bartender is fantastic. Drinks are $25 a piece, so bring your wallet! The location of this hotel at Times Square is perfect for venturing out and enjoying the city. It is a smaller hotel, so it's more personal. You won't be disappointed if you choose this hotel it's very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff were very friendly and welcoming, the roof top bar was amazing, great views of the city and you can walk around the terrace. The bar has a great selection of drinks and food. The room was lovely and views were good. The bed was comfy enough. Very good location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, just off Times Square. Stayed with a group of 6 girls in June we booked 3 double twin deluxe rooms. Luckily we had 51st floor rooms so great views of Times Square.Staff are all very efficient and very helpful.Visit to 54th floor roof top bar is a must however it does get busy so booking may be required especially if you want to sit outside.Have stayed in NYC 3 times now if different hotels and this one come top of my list and high key recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We are staying here at the penthouse suite. Very nice and generate people. The lady DeDe is the sweetest woman I've met here by far. Anytime you have a problem she and Zach has been Johnny on the spot and has also made it worth our time. My daughter is spending her 18th birthday here and they are going to make it work her while. DeDe is making sure and going to send me pics of making it a memorable moment of her 18th birthday.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Surprisingly quiet for a hotel right in the center of Times Square. Free wifi. Rooftop bar has a great view although drinks are pricey (around $20 - $25). You need to show your room key when you return at night which made me feel secure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square was worth every penny. All the staff were wonderful. Took 2 teens as a graduation/birthday present to NYC. We booked an executive suite since the teens needed separate beds. Room was good size especially in NYC, relatively quiet for being in Times Square, beds were very comfortable and everyone had a great night's sleep. The location was perfect. Close to Times Square, Fifth Ave and Rockefeller Center. Transit only a few blocks away and the concierge service was terrific. Very helpful with how to get to places and what the transit/cab costs should be. Roof top bar has a great night view (but no Empire State Bldg.). I would suggest going elsewhere to eat, but no worries, plenty of restaurants in the area from the deli a few doors down to high end places. Stayed 2 nights and worth every penny. Clean, comfy and friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent 2 nights here in early May and really enjoyed the hotel. The first positive item is its location, right at Times Square, we had a view of Times Square from our room, I highly recommend upgrading to a view room for this reason. Just a few steps from the entrance are many stores and restaurants. You are right in the middle of just about anything you could want, most all of the broadway shows are within an easy walk as well. If you are going to take a bus tour, Times Square is the primary location they start from, both the hop on and off tours as well as the others.If you stay here or not and are close to Times Square you really should check out the rooftop bar here. I was told it was the highest one in the city. The views are great and the drinks are as well. The service could be a little more friendly but that is most likely because I am comparing it to Texas hospitality. The rooms are nice as well, clean and modern, the hotel has only been open about 1 year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The customer service was out of this world!! Everyone was so friendly, so helpful, always with a smile on their face. Beautiful views. Convenient location. Great pricing. The room was clean and modern as well as spacious, had all necessities plus some more. Had an amazing stay at the Hyatt and would definitely book with them again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Even with a rocky start due to our reservation being incorrect, they were very eager to please and very professional about it. Absolutely beautiful room. Cleanest bathroom I've ever seen. The rooftop bar was very nice even though it was raining out. Everyone we encountered was very pleasant and kind and behaved as though we really mattered.The next time we visit the city and need to stay in Midtown, we will definitely stay there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt at Times square takes the Hyatt brand to a new level. Incredible service, Impeccable rooms that are quiet, clean and comfortable with all the amenities you require in today's world. The staff is professional, gracious, wanting to please and always asking what can be done to make your stay better. We have found our new home when we visit N.Y.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have traveled to NYC with my family a few times recently and am so glad we found this gem. Rooms are very nice size and bathrooms are really nice and modern but also spacious. Staff is really nice and accommodating. Left some clothes home in Fla by accident and had them shipped. They called the minute the package arrived. Love this hotel, we will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location, view, amenities all perfect. This hotel is CLEAN. If that is important to you, stay here. This hotel is QUIET. If you are a light sleeper or perhaps not a NY native & can't tune out the buzz of the city, this is the hotel for you. Stayed for our anniversary & received complimentary drinks at the beautiful lounge. I would recommend the lounge as a romantic stop for any couple - the view is amazing. A/C was a little noisy though.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Convenient, clean, great service...would definitely recommend Hyatt Times Square Hotel. Every member of the staff that we met was friendly and extremely helpful. You can walk to just about anywhere from this hotel (except for Battery Park).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time staying at this hotel. It is in a great location. We had requested a Times Square view and were planning to upgrade to a suite, if available. That didn't happen due to the hotel being fully booked for the weekend. However, at check in we were given a corner room to make up for it. Room was good size for NYC. Only issue we had were the electrical outlets that seemed to work on and off. Staff was very corteous and helpful. Overall, very satisfied with the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location, great service large and comfortable rooms. It doesn't get much better than this. We were pleased with the entire experience. Four girls shared a room with two queen beds and it was roomy and comfortable. Close to theater and restaurant row.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is located a few steps away from Times Square. That's the most attractive thing about it. It has also a rooftop bar (the highest bar in NY). The room was always clean and the size is quite decent. The staff was also very friendly with us. What I didn't like is that even though the the hotel is a bit expensive, you still have to pay for the wifi. That should be included in the deal. Overall, it is a very good hotel and I will definitely recommend it if you have the budget for it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in four different hotels in two weeks in the US, and this was the best.The biggest benefit is that it's new - less than two years old - so the rooms and the common areas are fresh and modern.That's a welcome change from some tired and rundown places I've stayed in.Although on square metre basis the rooms were probably the smallest I stayed in during my trip, they were the best designed, so were very functional.It's well located with the subway a couple of blocks away and Central Park to the north. Although you are extremely close to Times Square, it is accessible.If you're staying here, make sure you grab a drink at the rooftop bar as the views are magnificent.Breakfast was a bit pricey, but there are plenty of options nearby.The staff, as ever, were helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just off Time Square this hotel is ideally situated for all the attractions, and because its off Time Square (approx. 100 meters) it also quiet (we were on the 40th Floor).Staff were friendly and helpful.Rooms had two queen beds, plenty of space and well equipped. The walk in shower was good. The cleaner was friendly, efficient and left the room spotless.The room had a fridge for our use, with ice dispensers on all floors (if they were working)...ours wasn't.The bar on the 52nd floor was great for a drink.The gym was very good with up to date machines and basic weights for the 'keep fit'Absolutely no issues with this hotel, I would recommend it and will use it again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is quite comfortable and conveniently located. Rooms are spacious and very clean. BE CAREFUL not to be tricked into taking the hotel car back to airports... they want to charge $70.00 to La Guardia, and the bellman will tell you that the taxi will be "almost the same" that is NOT TRUE... even with heavy traffic, the taxi fare will be no more than $40.00 including a 20% tip !!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just 1/2 block from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but still quiet and well kept. Good sized room with comfy beds, a refrigerator and safe. Bathroom was very clean and modern with a rain shower and separate hand-held nozzle. Wi-fi was free in the room (yea!). Limited food at the hotel, but plenty of other places to eat right there on the block. Priced high, but apparently double rooms demand a premium price in the city...price is the only reason I wouldn't necessarily stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: But the service isn't good, especially at the front desk! I will give an example: If you arrive before 15:00 and try to make an early check-in, they will do it, but they try to put you in the lowest floors, even if you have payed the superior room! If that situation occurs, i recommend to leave the luggage there and go for a walk... When you return you will have the room on the correct floor that you have payed! The room is very good (check the photos) and the shower is excellent! The view... well, the view depends in which floor you could get!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall a pragmatic, functional place to stay. Great location and helpful staff particularly concierge, house keeping. Front desk can become more guest oriented. Better system of guest identification needed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent 4 nights at this hotel. The staff is efficient and friendly. The room was spotless and had everything we needed. The bed and bedding were very comfortable. The rooftop lounge is perfect for winding down after a busy day. It is about half a block from Times Square, close enough to do whatever you want, but just far enough away for a little break from the chaos. This hotel will be our first choice the next time we go to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt-Times Square for 6 nights and had a great time. Everyone from check in to the door man and concierge was super friendly and helpful. I would recommend staying here. We were on the 50th floor (Room 5006). Location was good. Not in the middle if the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but just around the corner which was nice. Room was very nice, too, just would have liked a little better view. From our room we couldn't see much except the Top of Rock and a bunch of rooftops. When I was using the elevator, I noticed that the room next to the elevator had a nice view of the Freedom Tower among others. A better view would have made the room even better, especially since we paid extra for the view on the higher floor. The t45 restaurant at the hotel was ok. Expensive and our waitress had no personality and didn't seem to be very interested in her job.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We picked this hotel because of its proximity to times square (we brought our two very young kids along so we need food, safety and convenience). Staffs were very friendly. Amenities are complete, we forgot our toothpaste and they are quick to provide us with one. Complimentary water bottles everyday. The design was excellent and rooms are spacious for NYC standard. Would definitely recommend it for NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel, with fresh modern decor, we absolutely loved the location. Our room was on the 8 th floor (804) and was just a standard room, but that said it was generous with plenty of storage and every luxury. It's a five minute walk to Broadway and 10 minutes to Central Park. It also has a get diner located on ground floor of the hotel,We stayed at the Sheridan hotel on our previous visit and found the Hyatt surpassed the Sheridan. It's a get hotel with nothing to improve.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The service at the Hyatt Times Square in simply super. My wife and I stayed there last week for eight days with our 13-year-old granddaughter and found the service to be consistently excellent throughout our stay. I could give many examples of outstanding performance during the week, but here's one of many. We arrived about 10 pm and I asked for a room on a high floor. They could not get us very high that night (understandable - hotel full and it was late) but the next day Noah the front desk manager had a bellman help us to the 51st floor at the time of our choosing. It was simple and seamless - in 5 minutes we were in the new room with new keys and the view in the attached photo. The iphone picture doesn't do it justice - we could see the Hudson on the left and the top of the Rockefeller building on the right. Don't be put off by the minimalist lobby and décor at this hotel - the service is definitely not minimalist. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First time in NY. Was a little worried about safety issues. No worries. From the time we stepped out of the car staff was amazing. Seemed genuine. Always someone at the door to either open it for you or help you out. Security was tight. Always 2 big but friendly guys at he door. Friendly but you wouldn't want to mess with them if you know what I mean. I felt very safe there. Housekeeper knew our routine and was very sweet. Great Rooftop Bar. Staff was amazing there as well. Hotel is in a great location. We had a balcony which is hard pressed to find for a Hotel in NYC. We will be Back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is perfectly poisitioned to stay on Times Square though you are actually a half block off the main square itself. From your room, esp upper floors, you can gaze down on the heart of the Big Apple and take in all the sights and sounds. Windows opened enough. Did notice a balcony room below us. Wouldve loved to have that except didnt trust my mischievous children with that sort of access. Rooftop Lounge has spectacular views, including that of the the famous NY Eve bell. Food wine too pricey for quality I would expect, but you pay for ambiance clearly. Staff service what you would expect from Hyatt. Kids loved it. Didnt try the Spa. Great food right outside the door and attached to hotel. Easy access subway and Grand central a 10 minute walk away. Unforgettable experience. Stayed Marriott Marquis. Much grander main floor, but to my personal taste overall Hyatt wins hands down.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel in a great location - it is just off Times' Square, so you avoid all the noise and craziness, but can walk one block to see it all! you can also walk one block in the other direction and walk along Avenue of the Americas, so it is conveniently located. Subway stations are not very far away, so that's helpful also. Stay on the highest floor possible - we were on floor 30 and that was OK, but I would have chosen to be on 40 or above to truly see over things. the high floors have an express elevator, that saves time and you get to feel your ears pop when you go up in it! Staff are quite nice. Lobby is amazingly small - don't stay here if you want a beautiful lobby to hang out in. the street it is on is filled with bars/pubs, so late nights can be interesting. But there's a starbucks across the street, so mornings are easy! Security is good and we never felt unsafe. Beds are great and the bathrooms are very nice with a rain shower. the building is new, so everything looks fresh and clean. Rooms are actually good-sized for New York and the price is more reasonable than the hotels directly on the square. The free internet is actually what made us choose this - the price you see is the price you pay, no "extra" charges for stuff like internet, as the other hotels tend to do. I would definitely stay her again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I liked its location 45th and 7th, a few steps to Times square. It feels safe. I travelled with a 14yrs old. The room are not large but we came for Times square and area. It's clean. Its cleaner than other hotels we were at before in Times Sq. Its quiet. You don't hear your neighbor. And the staff is very nice. I didn't like the air conditioning in the room you must keep running all night at 68 otherwise it gets warm. But 68 you are freezing. 69 it gets warm. There was no in-between. So if you like it cool you will be fine, if not like us you'll freeze all night. Another tiny-thing I didn't like about the room was a spot on my sheets that made me doubt they were changed between customers! Lets say I am wrong. My 14 years old ate a chocolate croissant the next morning in bed, from across the street Starbucks, and the sheets were changed the next morning! I liked the small terrace on the street for snacks and wine, called T45. hey also serve breakfast. They have a roof top terrace I didn't go to. Unfortunately its expensive, $14-20 a glass of wine, $15-20 a snack plate. No pool but a gym and spa that I didn't visit. Its walking distance to 5th avenue where more boutiques where opening up this summer. If you keep walking East on 45 you get to Madison, nicer boutiques. If you are a good walker, more boutiques on 5th going south, but its a big walk. Walking to 43 on 7th you get to the subway entrance, 3$ a ticket good 2hrs, you follow the red line 1 to destination .. Park, get off at 103, West End, its beautiful up there and sage, in a max 15 minutes subway drive and you can walk Central Park. I like the red line its safe. It goes up north and south south where its even nicer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We actually visited for New Year 2014 but it doesn't let you go back that far! The trip was amazing, the best I have ever been on, the hotel is beautiful. We stayed as a family of 3 for 5 nights in a double suite, and I got to stay in the double bed whilst my parents shared theirs. The room was very spacious and immaculate. There was plenty of storage and a lovely welcoming message on the TV when we entered! Although we were on the side of the building, the view was still spectacular and the window was huge, my dads partner was too frightened to stand by it but I loved it. The beds were very comfortable and were cleaned and changed daily, which was fine because we spent our entire trip out and about in the city even when it rained. The bathroom was beautiful with a plug for hair dryer which was provided. However I did manage to slightly electrocute myself as I touched the metal when it was in the plug, and in England this is not a problem. The room was an overall delight! One of the days was raining so we visited the concierge to help us figure out a plan for the day, they gave us a map of the city and helped out a lot. We also spent some of our time in the café area downstairs where they served us some delicious chicken that we had every time we went. The staff in the café were fantastic, attentive and very polite! They were more than happy to have a conversation with us and we got on really well! Also the door staff were so welcoming and made us feel very comfortable in the city! It is definitely the best customer service I have ever received! Overall this hotel is a fantastic place especially for location as well as it is a short walk down the road! I recommend it to anyone having a short break in the city!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent stay. Hotel is very clean and rooms are relatively good size for midtown Manhattan. Best of all is the Hyatt staff: Very friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. You get the feeling that the staff really cares that the guests are happy. A rarity in Manhattan and much appreciated.
user_location: New york Times Square, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a Company conference. I loved this hotel. Check in staff were friendly and efficient and the room was quiet and well appointed. Staff were very nice and would say hello and bend over backwards to help. Slight irritation was that the cafe on the ground floor that they use for breakfast does not allow outside dining until after 8am, which seems a shame.Overall, very impressed and will stay here again as opposed to the Hilton Midtown which seems to have gone downhill.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a great hotel - the size of the rooms for NYC is amazing. It is almost double the size of other Manhattan hotels. There were 4 of us in a room with 2 beds and we never felt confined or cramped at all. The room was clean and the hotel is in a great location. I think the most annoying thing was the elevators - there were times that the hotel was so busy and there was a line to get on the elevator. They are definitely on the slow side - so if there is a downside to the hotel, that was one of them (and really the only one I can think of).There is a rooftop bar which gets pretty busy (I'm sure depending on the night of the week). We were there on a weekend and it was busy. Each of the staff we dealt with was great and very friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is located within walking distance of Times Square and many of the theaters. The bar on the roof provides a fun view, but you can't take your kids up with you, which disappointed our teenagers. The doorman, Walter, was Great on arrival and departure. Everyone else was a disappointment. There was no flat sheet on the bed. When we asked for one, it was dropped in our room, not put on. When we inquired about how to get 4 people and lots of luggage to the airport, the suggestion was to stand out and wait for q large cab. Walter ended up scheduling the car we needed. Probably would look elsewhere next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As we were celebrating we decided to splash out on a balcony suite room at this hotel. Ive been to NYC a number of times and wanted a central location without being directly on Times Square.This hotel delivered on every aspect and everything still looked brand new.It was a few months ago when we stayed here and i can't honestly think of anything negative to say about it. The staff who assisted me via email to ensure i had the perfect room for us were exceptional - Zach and Melissa thanks again.The room - a mini suite was very cleverly designed, it had a separate room with work desk, fridge, nespresso, sofa and a wonderful balcony where we took many memorable photos, had late night chats and a nightcap.The location is a minute from central Times Square minus the crowds and noise, I would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again. In all fairness unless it was another special occasion i wouldn't pay over the odds for an upgraded room again as you rarely spend any time in it but to to sleep, Im sure even the standard rooms are wonderful.We didn't eat in the hotel but the rooftop bar is a must for an evening cocktail and more amazing views of the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want a clean and modern hotel with spacious rooms, then stay at the Hyatt Times Square. All of the staff were exceptional. One time during rush hour when we were unable to grab a taxi, one of the door men took us to Park Ave to hail a cab. We were on the 18th floor which limited almost all of the street noise. There is a Starbucks across the street.The T45 diner (hotel restaurant) is a great place to meet people for any meal. The salmon kale salad is especially good. We were not impressed with the roof top service or drinks. Having stayed at both the Hyatt and Waldorf, we prefer the Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel in the end of May for 5 nights. The rooms are nicly decotared, the size of the room is OK (in NYC standats....), the free WFI is good (strong signal) and the room service was fine. the only con is the location which from our prespective was to central (yes, in NY there is such thing as to central...) - the hotel was almost on the Times Squre, so the moment you went out you found your self in the middle of the most crowded streets on earth. for those of you who like it - its great, for us it was not so pleasent. one other problem with the location was the noise - we where ar a corner room at the 29th floor, and the noisem although not terible, still something one can not ignore....nice hotel = but next time in Manhetten we will look for a place somewhere alse.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited for six nights in December 2014.Rooms are huge and clean.Pay the extra for floor-to-ceiling windows and upgraded bathroom - worth it.Expensive but not in comparison to the other box-rooms on Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice accomodations, excellent service, free wifi, good food too! Bell staff very helpful. Housekeeping staff helpful and not knocking on your door in the morining. All good! Beautiful view from roof top bar. Hotel has all you need for a lower price than usual in NY C

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited New York for our 15th anniversary. I struggled to find the a hotel with the perfect combination of location, amenities and value. I found it in the Hyatt Times Square. If you love to be close to everything, and especially if you're taking in the theater, it's perfect. You can be in the center of all the hustle and bustle and walk a half block to an oasis. Be sure to get an upper floor for the best view. The service was great, too. We had a couple glitches, including the A/C not working properly the first day, and they fixed it promptly. We also received a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary. Very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a great experience.... To be in the heart of times square and with a top level suite with a wonderful view... I could also see the Hudson River from my room. The bedding was light weight down and it was perfect. Pillows were top notch too. We went up stairs to the bar and we enjoyed the setting and views.The hotel is on a side street so it isn't in heavy duty side walk traffic. Staff give great service too... bottled water is free. I absolutely loved it. For the rate hey I did great...my suite was sweet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all let me say that, Brian at the front desk was AWESOME!!! Best front desk person, ever!!! All of the staff that I encounter were great, friendly and professional. Now about the hotel itself. Just steps, literally less than half a block to the center of Times Square. Minskoff Theater a block away, so when I say close, I do mean close!The hotel was nice and clean, with a modern feel. We had a Deluxe View King room(45th floor) with views of Times Square and absolutely loved it. Our room faced south and on a clear day you could see all the way to Freedom Tower! When it was time to go to bed, the curtains/drapes were more than adequate to block out the lights of the city that never sleeps. As with any hotel in the city, parking is at a premium and expensive. We used the hotels valet, which didn't allow in and out service, so once we parked our car, we didn't use it again for the 3 days we were there. But, with some research into the city's transit system you can get around fairly easily using that as an alternative. And let me say that we found the subway to be a lot better that it's reputation and would use it more the next time we go. I would definitely recommend the Hyatt Times Square to anyone wanting to visit the area and be close to Times Square and the theaters. It was definitely one of the best stays I have ever had, great location, friendly/professional staff and clean/comfortable room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Highly recommend this hotel! The staff was extremely friendly, attentive and helpful with recommendations. Stylish rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Floor to ceiling windows offering the best views. Rooftop bar is a must! Spectacular views of the city. Great location close to the theatre district.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for our annual pizza and plays tour. Great neighbourhood, short walk to everything. Clean hotel, quiet room, superb service, everything was perfect The rooms were modern and spotless, and the halls were welcoming and fresh. We will be returning to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I wark almost of tour spot because of heart of new york. good dinner and fantastic spa. I can see to hurdson river in my room 4301. I want to try to go again. sunday good road market open in front of my hotel. good best of best hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location in the heart of Broadway. Restaurant and Bar 54 are excellent and menu items at T45 are innovative, delicious and health conscious. Hotel Lobby is always too busy most hours and elevator service is very poor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful staff, nice rooms. Starbucks across the street. Great views! We saw 8 Broadway shows in 7 days so this was central to the theaters. It's also just a quick walk to a couple of subway stations and to Bryant Park which was lovely and fun to do some people walking. (It's also away from the craziness of Times Square which got old quick.)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 1 night. We were in the city to see Larry David in Fish in the Dark. This is a Brand New Hotel, which is not common to find in NYC... Room size was goid, very clean, and quiet!!! Bathroom was modern, and well equipped. Radiant heat floors!!! WOW! Rooftop bar / lounge had spectacular views! Pricey drinks but thats NY for you... Staff from the moment you walked in were all courteous and friendly. Great hotel in the center of NY!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had never visited NYC before and was really unsure where to stay. I looked at the location of this hotel and it seemed close to most of the attractions that I wanted to visit. It was a great choice and I would not hesitate to visit this hotel in the future. Great staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel was neat and clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt standards in a virtually new high rise steps from Times Square. We upgraded to a corner suite on 44th floor. It was well designed with a big shower and bath. A bonus was 2 large tv's with Stars channel included.The empty fridge was great. We filled it up with drinks and snacks from a bodega 3 blocks down. The lounge on the 54th floor was hip and happening but with a caveat, it was hot in the late afternoon. The Hyatt had a standard good gym with floor to ceiling windows. The staff including housekeeping were very responsive. I have attached photos of room 4401 with views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Not a big fan of Times Square, but I was working at the Hard Rock and the Hyatt was very convenient. We managed a room in the back of the hotel and it was very quiet. The staff was wonderful, the food at T45 was great. The Hyatt experience remains in tact here. If you have to stay in Times Square this is the place to be.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is great. The staff is very helpful and work together to make you stay happily. The facility is super. Even the mattress is the best among three hotels we stay. My family really enjoy our stay here and wish all hotels like this. I'm also vey glad I joined the Hyatt gold passport program. Definitely looking forward to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for its proximity to Times Square. Nice hotel but the bed was SO hard, way too firm. The housekeeper was kind enough to add a mattress pad to the bed for me but it was still too hard. The guys on the front desk told me that they are well known for having very firm beds. I liked the hotel and the staff were very friendly and always welcoming when we returned. I'd like to stay again for the location but the bed really put me off. The rooftop hotel has a great view but the drinks are very expensive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had the opportunity to stay there with my family for my daughter's post-graduation trip to NY. The hotel is situated right in the close proximity of Times Square; very convenient and most of the midtown attractions are within short walking distance. The staff including doorman, checkin desk staff and concierge were very helpful. It is a modern hotel with large Guest rooms for the location, very clean and with excellent beds. We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and the staff was very helpful since we had extra luggage. We utilized the Hotel limousine service to the airport which was well worth the price. Highly recommended for convenience, cleanliness and value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. I was apprehensive about staying in Times Square but this hotel is on a side street and we did not find the rooms loud. The hotel is just a few steps away from Broadway, Toys R Us, Shake Shack.The doorman were all very friendly and helpful. The restaurant has patio seating which was particularly nice at breakfast.The best thing about this hotel is the rooftop bar. Fabulous views and casual ambiance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wife and I stayed here for a special birthday trip. This hotel is very conveniently located to broadway, good restaurants, sights. The service was outstanding - friendly and personalized. Highly recommend. Have already booked a follow up future stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the minute we arrived the staff were first class. don't forget to ask for the up grade to get a spot on the upper floors. we took an upgrade to floor 54 the view was breath taking. the layout of the rooms are very stylish. the roof top bar has an awesome view of the sky line. if your going to do the Big Apple do big it from the top

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent for Tulsa, average for Times Square: I was born-and-bred in NYC; nuff-said. All the Hyatt-Regencies I've gone to in this country are disappointing in one way or another - usually in the food, dining facilities, things like a place you can buy some magazines, etc. (In NYC I know there'll be a news vendor a block away; in Philadelphia there most likely won't be; in Cambridge - well, which direction IS Harvard Square from here, and is it safe to walk there?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros: - Very friendly & welcoming staff.-Hotel provides most of the needed amenities from a tooth brush to a shoe horn or cloth steamer.-high security- amazing view from top floors rooms.- great gym.- very convenient location. Cons:- elevators takes time. Thats it, couldnt think of anything other than the good things i've experienced in this hotel. I am a returning customer and will return again whenever i am visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in! The rooms were very modern, stylish and spacious that are equipped with a fridge huge TV and more! The beds were super comfy and huge! Including me there were 3 of us (i travelled with my mum and sister) so i shared one bed with my mum and my sister had the other.. even though i shared a bed it was that big it felt like i was sleeping alone! The bathroom was heaven! heated flooring was perfect after coming out the shower. The location was amazing, you could not get any closer to Times Square! So easy to nip out at any time of the day! The hotel staff were also so friendly and helpful, they would go out of their way to help you.. we found things to do from the reception for great days out! Would recommend this hotel to anyone! New York is an amazing city and i cant wait to return and will only stay at the Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is perfect, less than half a block to Times Square. The hotel is clean and seems brand new. The room was clean and comfortable. The room was all digital, including lights, phone, and TV. There was even a heated floor in the large bathroom. The roof top terrace had great views and wasn't crowded at all. Overall, a very spacious room. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Chic place enjoyed my stay. Wasn't given my newspaper though surely recommended for its location & proximity to Times SquareThe reception staff were cheeky but that's NY I guessDecor & room was very neat as expected & room size too was apt though it was on prime location

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We always try to stay at Hyatts and this one was not as nice as some others. We did, however, stay in a room located next to the elevators and could hear the operation periodically which also put a damper on my stay, and the view was of some buildings and rooftops which I didn't expect because we were upgraded to the "view" room. The website pictures are deceiving and definitely better online than in person. But it was pretty nice, it's after all a Hyatt, and was clean. There's a SMALL restaurant on the rooftop that they advertise, but you need a reservation. We went up for drinks one night and it was still very crowded and the view is mediocre because it's located on a side street.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here from 26 April for 5 days. Great location about 100 yards from Times Square. Check in was quick, easy and friendly. We had a suite on a high floor with great views. The room was not big but they never are in New York. But it had a luxurious bathroom and comfortable lounge area. The bed was superb, very comfortable. Housekeeping was brilliant, helpful and friendly (thank you Alba) and the room was kept spotlessly clean. I could not fault the staff. They were helpful, friendly and good humoured. The Concierge was full of ideas and advice on where to go and how to get there. The rooftop bar is certainly worth a visit. The drinks are expensive but what do you expect in NYC? Wifi was free and worked well at all times. This is a great hotel in a great location with great staff and facilities. I heartily recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived on 21st May and were greeted by Spencer at reception who was just lovely and very helpful. Check in was swift and easy. I had written to the hotel ahead of time to say that it was my boyfriend’s birthday on the day of arrival so could we have something in the room like champagne with a card etc. Spencer wished my bf happy birthday so it had been registered yet when we got to the room there was nothing in it. No mark of celebration at all which was very disappointing, especially as I had asked for it and was happy to pay for it. Anyway the rooms were clean and fresh with a fabulous huge bed (we had booked a kingsize view room). I chose this hotel over The Astoria (which was cheaper) because it offered everything we wanted. A coffee maker. Free Wifi. A fridge. Big bed. Floor to ceiling windows and a good location. the Astoria amazingly did not have coffee machines or free wifi. This hotel did not disappoint in any of these things. We went to the rooftop bar on the first night and the atmosphere was good and the view amazing. Unfortunately we got told off for moving seats though, as being English, we are used to being able to move seats in a bar (obviously not so in a restaurant) so we were unaware of the protocol. For this reason we didn't go back there and spent most of our evenings in O'Connellys next door which had a rooftop bar too, although not as elegant but a lot friendlier. We didn't use the Hyatt restaurant downstairs but it did look cool too and if we had had more time then we definitely would have tried it. The location was great with everything just a short walk away. We had room 2905 and it was so quiet (unless you open the window) with good sound proofing. The spa only had a steam room and treatments so I think it would benefit from a Jacuzzi, to ease our aching feet at the end of a long days sightseeing. Definitely recommended though and security was very good at the door. The housekeeping team were superb and topped us up with coffee and fresh water daily. Recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great stay at the hyatt times square hotel. location so good in Times square, services and staff great. Do not hesitate to book for the roof top lounge, unique experience!! fitness center is really pleasant, we didnt not try spa but it looks nice

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location steps from Times Square. The hotel rooms were large and very comfortable with luxurious bathroom. Reception and door staff were very friendly. The roof top bar has amazing views and lovely atmosphere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very cool hotel. Right in the middle of 2 Irish Pubs! The best part I think is the rooftop bar, it's really awesome up there. We spent a couple days there and walked to central park, it was only about a mile away. Great Stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for a couple of days over the Memorial Day weekend. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The location was great. It was just a quick walk down to Times Square and a few subway stations. The room was very nice. I was up on the 45th floor so I had some nice views of the square and of the Chrysler building. Overall it was a great place to stay and at a pretty reasonable rate for the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love this hotel. Great location and views. Beds made with duvets. Staff friendly and helpful. Restaurant Excellent and reasonable also quick if you are in a hurry with a wide variety of choices. French toast amazing and salmon at dinner also great. Ask for high floor, NYC is noisy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just got home from our 4 night stay. The hotel was very comfortable, the room was big for New York, we were on the 39th floor and the view was great. We were on holiday to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, the staff were absolutely fantastic and helped make our stay all the more special. It was clean,friendly and we had free wifi in our room. The hotel is in the perfect location for Times Square and a great base for seeing New York. The bars near the hotel were pleasant and the delis down the street are a good place to grab a quick sandwich at any time. I could not falt the Hyatt Times Square in any way.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
