review_body: Recently returned from a three night stay at the Hyatt Times square and wow, we loved it!We got the train from the airport into Penn station then walked to 45th street and arrived at the Hyatt. We were given a room on the 18th floor, but then offered us an upgrade to the 38th floor. We walked into our room and wow,,, what amazing views!The room was spacious and modern with a comfy large bed and a good size bathroom with a rain shower. All the toiletries we needed were there with alot more on offer.The lifts were a bit hit or miss, but unfortunately one of the three we could use was not working throughout our stay.We didn't use the restaurant T45 and was disappointed when we went to the bar 54. There were no tables available outside and we were told we could wait inside and see if one became free,,,, but how long would that take?!?!?Overall a lovely hotel in a great location for ALL the tourist attractions. We would definitely use the hotel on our return to New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great staff. Modern facilities. Wonderful location. Could not ask for anything more. The staff was friendly. The facility was very clean and modern. The hotel rooms were great size and the bathrooms were outstanding with a rain shower. For New York City this hotel is a dream and for any city this hotel is outstanding. I would not hesitate to stay here again and would recommend this hotel to one and all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great stay one of the best in times square. Excellent customer service. You cannot go wrong with this hotel. Everyone was pleasant and environment was very neat and peaceful . Loved my one night stay. I recommend the hotel if you are in times square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel with excelent localization, bedrooms very clean and clear, great view of times square, great attendance, very quick and efficient.The roof top bar is beautiful with great view of the city.Highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located on Times Square the Hyatt is a relatively new property. On arrival we were received by helpful and warm Chester . We were upgraded to a deluxe suit on the 24 th floor . Nice , spacious room with a living room and a separate tub and shower area. One of the very few rooms that had ample storage and enough plug points to take care of all our gadgets. They don't stock mini bars... That I love!! I rather stock it with stuff I like! All The guest relations officers were all very kind. One thing that I encountered for the first time is they don't have housekeeping 24 hrs...! So no housekeeping related services in the evenings. We missed visiting the rooftop bar that's the highest in the city !! Hopefully on our next stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location on 45th street. The staff was very attentive. We were in the wrong room to begin with. They couldn't move us that night but did the next and breakfast at the attached restaurant was comp'd. We had a room on the 50th floor. It was very quiet with great views of the city. The only complaint was the rooftop bar on the 54th floor. We must have been invisible and were never seated while other people were. I relayed my experience to the manager and they had a table reserved for us the next evening with a free drink each. So they remedied any problem I had as soon as I told them of it.Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is probably the most no frills Hyatt I've ever been to in terms of decor and amenities. But we still enjoyed it a lot. The pros: 1. Very convenient location for tourists. It's almost right off Times Square, but on a relatively smaller street. Our family of 4, including a 5 year old walked all the way to Central Park and United Nations (something like 10 blocks). Rockefeller Center is only a few blocks away. Buses to downtown and all major subway stations are no more than a couple blocks.2. Relatively quiet, compared to the hustle and bustle of Times Square at least, esp. if you stay on a high floor. I didn't hear any noise from next door either. 3. Generally clean. 4. Very friendly front desk. Always smiling and helpful. Offered early check-in and late check-out. 5. Complimentary wi-fi (pleasantly surprised)6. Double queen rooms are quite spacious, given how precious space is in this location. I don't think the Grand Hyatt nearby has two queens. For a family of 4 this is a great setup. Cons: 1. As I said earlier, the decor leaves a lot to be desired for this level of hotel. 2. The carpet and restroom tiles are already showing quite a bit of wear and tear, despite this being a relatively new hotel. 3. Parking is obviously expensive, at $65/24 hrs. So we parked at Edison FastPark one block away. Overall I think this is a winner for tourists like us, if you have Gold Passport points to redeem. The regular rate can be quite high.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff was phenomenal, very accommodating and fun! The bar in the lobby is so convenient and a great place to meet up with clients and coworkers. Convenient valet parking, central to everything and great views of the Empire State building too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's amazing how a hotel located bang on 45th street can be so insulated from the hub hub of Times Square. We stayed there recently and we're happy to recommend it to others. The hotel is well maintained and the rooms feel fresh. Housekeeping is good and Paula took care of our small personal needs sincerely. The street is teeming with people and traffic but not the drunks who frequent The Square itself. Needless to add Times Square is a world in itself filled with eateries, shopping and entertainment.Minuses: The one restaurant serves very limited veg food so he had to go out for all meals.Consolation: The nearby Pret kept us happy with organic veg food !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We love staying here with my family. The location is great and views are just exhilarating. The staff is very accommodating and I love how if you forget things like a toothbrush or shaving cream they will deliver it right to your door. I also love how they bring travel size baby toiletries when you order a pack and play. It's the details! I actually loved their coffee the last time we stayed so we actually chose it because of their coffee and was very disappointed to see they had changed from a local coffee shop from Brooklyn to Starbucks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We only stayed for a night but the location was ideal as sits on 45th street between Times Square and Rockfelller Center. Easy walk to everything. No Cabs or subways. There is a nice deli just next store for munchies and breakfast. Room view was amazing on 49th floor. The rooftop bar is worth the visit too. The room was huge for NYC and the bath was amazing. Everything was clean but it was not inexpensive. Would stay again no doubt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We loved this hotel. On arrival we were made to feel very welcome by the lovely reception team who were helpful from start to finish. Room we stayed in was great. Decent size, nice decor and very clean. Lovely rooftop bar with great views. Superb location for Manhattan sightseeing just a minute from Times Square and a short walk to many of the theatres on Broadway. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay there again if we are lucky enough to visit New York again. Fab!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here while in town to see a few shows. If you don't mind the crowds, it's the perfect location for attending Broadway shows. It's a block off of Times Square. The lobby is tiny, but the front desk staff were friendly and efficient. The major drawback is the decor. The carpet looks worn and cheap, both in the hallways and in the bedrooms. The wallpaper in the hallways looks cheap. The furniture seems cheap. The bed was quite comfortable, but the sheets and comforter looked worn. On the whole, the visual impression is of a hotel that needs serious cosmetic upgrades. By contrast, the Hilton on 42nd Street, which is a competing hotel, just shows much better and feels cleaner. The on site restaurant, T54, is nice and they brought up room service food promptly. I might stay at this hotel again, but only if the decor is improved. No complaints at all about the staff or the check-in/check-out process, all of which were efficient and competently handled. But it's time to call in the interior decorators!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hotel is great, convenient to Times Square, but quiet at night in soundproofed rooms. The rooms are beautiful and so comfy. But the real asset of this hotel is the wonderful staff. They go beyond great customer service to make you feel pampered and like family or something. My 8 year old grandson was on his first trip to NYC with us, and he just got off the train at Grand Central, and came to the hotel. He was overwhelmed with everything and a little intimidated. Aeriel, I hope I spelled it correctly, was so warm, welcoming, and sweet, that he was immediately at ease. She checked us in efficiently and gave us a great room. He kept reminding me, now make sure to give Aeriel a good review!! All the other staff was the same.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was very happy with my room (with terrace!!) on 27th floor. No noise from the street or surrounding rooms at all! The refrigerator was a help and the deli down the block had breakfast at the ready. The staff all seemed happy to work there and the craziness of Times Square did not flow over onto the property. Would def. recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently spent a week in the Big Apple for a family celebration, staying at the Hyatt TS. Located on 45th West, it is within easy walking distance of multiple restaurants such as Red Lobster, Applebees, Olive Garden and Bond 45. Major landmarks such as Empire State and Rockfeller are a few blocks away and take 15-20 minutes walking, Central Park is nearer 25 minutes and the nearest Subway station is 47th & 50th which takes you to areas such as Brooklyn. Pier 79 is the nearest stop for Water Taxis heading towards Statue of Liberty and One World Trade. The rooms are very spacious, well looked after and provide ample wardrobe area for clothes. However, hangers are in short supply and despite giving the impression multiple drawers were available, only 3 existed. The remainder, especially bedside are "filled in". The bathrooms provide both shower and bath facilities, there are multiple towels and are kept in excellent condition. The cleaners do a very thorough job!The Sky Lounge, located on the 54th floor provides an excellent rooftop view of the panoramic NYC Skyline at night. Numerous cocktails are served, as well as the usual beer and wine options. If you're under 30 just ensure you take your ID along as you will be asked at the entrance and possibly by the server.Restaurant T45 provides a reasonable breakfast selection and is also open for dinner although we did not try this option. However, the service is mediocre as staff can forget orders, take ages to clear plates and on one occasion no maple syrup was provided with pancakes despite requests to 3 separate individuals!!Overall, our stay in New York was very enjoyable and in general the Hyatt certainly enhanced the experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is a great location just off Time Square. It is short walk to all of the great shows. It is also easy to avoid Time Square and walk walk toward Rockefeller Center and 5th Avenue. There are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My parents and I stayed here over thanksgiving last year. The staff were unbelievably friendly. The room was very modern and clean. We had a partial view of Times Square which was amazing. Plus we couldn't hear a thing from outside the window.Only big issue was the Wi-fi. It was only freely accessible in the lobby. When it's freezing cold outside and people are constantly coming in and out of the hotel, it wasn't the best place to be.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everyone, including bell man, desk clerks, and housekeepers were warm and eager to be helpful. The location, of course is great for theater going. We walked to each of 3 Broadway shows (never over a 6 minute walk). Also just a block and a half to Times Square subway station and an easy walk to Rockefeller Center. We had a nice view from our 33rd floor room (we were offered the side away from Times Square in case we were worried about noise or lights, but neither were a bother). The roof top bar had a great view. The only negatives were the interior design- a bit stark. Also the lobby was tiny as were the hallways and common areas (this is a product of inner city space limitations, I am sure).This is a good choice if you want to stay right in the heart of the theater district.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, modern and surprisingly quiet even on lower floors. Rooms are large and newly decorated, modern style. Great beds/linen meaning a good nights sleep. Bathroom (shower only) was fine with a reasonable range of toiletries. Fridge in room (empty - no mini bar) plus iron/board, large HD TV and coffee. Reception staff friendly and helpful, check in/out very quick. Didn't use other facilities apart from the ground floor restaurant which was not great. Limited, fairly expensive menu and food quality average, service about as shoddy as I have received in New York (sat 10 mins before I was served at all even though there were several staff hanging around chatting, meal was slapped on the table without a word with no cutlery which I had to ask for and was generally just not a pleasant atmosphere - great pub next door serving better and cheaper food, go there instead). Would stay again due to rooms and location if price is ok, but will eat elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked this hotel for the view, paid for a high floor room and boy we were not disappointed. Time Square is iconic and this hotel provided a fantastic vista.We only spent one night after a cruise so did not spend too much time in the hotel, but location is perfect. Staff were excellent and dealt with a monstrous amount of luggage we had with ease and a smile.They also provide free online airline check in and boarding pass printing which was a nice touch.Now on a list of favourite New York Hotels

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this hotel visiting NYC on my own. First of all the location is fabolous, so central to everything. Room was clean, well maintained. Comfortable bed. Gym is great, worked out everyday. Good equipment, clean towels, weights etc. Very good gym! Friendly nice staff. Very good overall, will stay here again when I am back to New York. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here on a family holiday - needed a hotel close to the Times Square attractions for the kids - 1st time in NYC, but quiet rooms for me - I am a light sleeper. Hyatt worked perfectly. Good but small bedrooms - we chose TS view but not necessary as you are never in your rooms except to sleep. No noise from street which is a miracle in NYC - all the other hotels are Irish-built and not sound-proof.Only downside is the lack of free wifi in the rooms - USA needs to get with the programme and match the rest of the world. As a result the tiny lobby tends to be crowded. Some people complain about having to phone for all the other extras that some hotels put in their rooms - I think it is a good idea as cuts down on wastage. Service of staff was good and quick. Definitely will go there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hyatt Times Square on the 42nd floor. The rooms were clean and trendy. It was all about the location, just around the corner from times square and broadway theatres. Minutes away from the big bus tour pick-up/drop-off and hell's kitchen. Although it's quite pricey, but I do recommend it if you're gonna hang out in the times square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After reading the reviews I convinced my husband & our friends from Toronto that we really should stay at the Hyatt Times Square. We had stayed in Times Square on a previous trip & the location seemed ideal for restaurants, theater, etc. We were staying for 2 nights (Fri. & Sat.) before embarking on a cruise. We were given rooms on the 14th floor that looked into an alley & another building. The room was clean, bed comfortable, & average size. As long as the window was closed the room was quiet. There was a small refrigerator in the room & complimentary bottled water. Also a coffee maker with coffee. The staff at the front desk were friendly. The bar on the 54th floor was too crowded to get a seat on Friday afternoon, probably because the weather was sunny & warm. The wait for the (3) elevators was usually 3 - 5 minutes. On our last day the elevators were "temporarily" not working. We walked down the stairs, went out to breakfast, did a bit of site seeing & they were working when we returned. On Saturday the street was closed to traffic & street vendors had set up tables, etc. It was really crowded trying to get through all the people & "stuff".

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed multiple times at this hotel, and cannot say enough good things. The staff, location and views from the rooms and rooftop bar are all top notch. It is always a pleasure to book a return trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square is an awesome choice if you want to be 5min from all the attractions. You won't find a better location. It is extremely clean,modern, comfortable and staff is very friendly and efficient. There are parking garages within 10min walk from the hotel. You will also find many restaurants on the same street, which will be a lot more affordable than the options at the hotel. There is a Roof Top Lounge on the 54th floor of the Hyatt, but don't get too excited, cause if there is a 10% chance of rain, they will not let you sit outside and enjoy the view, they will make you sit inside and their prices are very high for an indoor experience. Other than that, it was an awesome experience. Brand new facility, brand new gym equipment, fast elevators, fast check in and peaceful rooms. I would definitely stay at the Hyatt Times Square again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Ideal location convenient close to restaurants, theatre and transportation. One night stay on a Friday night for $215 can't beat that!. Hotel room small but modern and clean, exceptional staff willing to help.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's an amazing hotel! confortable, beautiful, modern, relaxed! the staff is always smiling and willing to assist you beautifully! you wil fine a nice cup of coffe or tea at your room and a relaxed decor in the room. the 54Bar has the most amazing and breathtaking view of Manhattan! the drinks are excellent! and another thing: you are a block away from Broadway and Time Squares, the heart & soul of NYC life!!!! I will return!!! :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights for a conference. Very clean and quiet. Couldn't hear street noise on 21st floor. Close to many attractions within easy walking distance. Although LaGuardia airport is only 6 miles away, allow plenty of travel time- especially in the afternoon. Personnel at hotel were great. bar 54 is the highest rooftop bar in NY. The views aren't so great but the novelty of being up high is cool. Drinks are pricy, but so is everything else in NY. If you're coming to Tines Square and want to stay in the middle of it all, you won't go wrong with the Hyatt at Tines Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel on a several occasions now, and I guess it's time for a review.I think the hotel was renovated a few years ago, so it's very clean and modern. The rooms are small, which is usually the case in NYC, but they are setup well, and the bathrooms are a good size. The staff is very attentive and polite, and it's one of the reasons I choose to return to this hotel. . The hotel is extremely well situate, on 45th street just off of Times Square between 6th avenue and 7th avenue, so you have immediate access to the Broadway theatres in the area or to shopping nearby, A walk north to Central park or south to Macy's is only about 30 min in either case. I have seen the hotel rate vary depending on the season, but it tends to be more affordable for the value than many other hotels nearby. Valet parking is constantly expensive, but par for the area. I find the widely varying rate, as well as the inconsistent policies and prices relate to valet pricing and WiFi access fees, a bit annoying. This hotel has a roof top bar, and the view and the bar scene itself is very nice. You can also sit outside weather permitting. It is expensive, so not for everyday, but fun for a peak at the city skyline.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent place- clean, professional staff, great room with wicked nice views. The room was clean and spacious (which you don't often find in NY) and the bathroom had a great shower. The rooftop bar is a must, the drinks were great. Would definitely go back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the location is great if you are not considering driving around Manhattan, it's conveniently situated on W 45th between 6th and 7th Avenue, right next door to Times Square. You get to escape from the busy streets and crowd of Times Square and still be on the middle of all the hustle and bustle. The hotel is minimalist, modern, clean and trendy! We stayed on the 50th floor, the view was stunning, the room was big and beautiful. The washroom is also roomy, gorgeous with everything you look for in a luxury hotel. Aside from all this, the staffs were helpful, friendly and always greet you with a smile, I will definitely stay here again on my next visit, love it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is not a cheap hotel by any means. But it's extremely nice and incredibly well-situated if you want to be near Times Square. It is steps away from the heart of it. The service here was impeccable. Our room was large (and not just by New York standards). The beds were comfortable. Wonderful shower. The room had creative decorating touches, although the photo montage backdrop for the TV is really busy and distracting when you when you're trying to focus on the screen. The rooftop bar is absolutely fabulous. Tremendous views. Nicely-made drinks, although very expensive (views and quality don't come cheap in NY).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt is somewhat new. Very convenient to Times Square, major subway stations and Rock Center. My husband stays here often for business not fancy (compared to other Park Hyatt and Grand Hyatt properties) but new, excellent staff and service. Great Sky Bar on the 55th floor. Good views of Lower Manhattan from the upper floors.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed staying in this newish hotel (opened in January 2014). The room was modern, well appointed and clean (although the carpeting could use a shampoo). Our room had a great shower stall and good views of the midtown cityscape from the 33rd floor. Great rooftop bar with outdoor seating and terrific views extending all the way to the World Trade Center. Our only issue was excessive noise caused by a faulty elevator. We were in room 3301, adjacent to elevator shaft, and heard continuing scraping noises all night long. Hotel did not shut down faulty elevator until the next day, resulting in very poor sleep for one night. Hotel staff said that a number of guests had complained about the same noise problem, but the hotel made no effort to compensate for loss of sleep. Otherwise, a nice, new hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently spent nine nights in a deluxe room at the Hyatt. We were given as requested a superior floor and enjoyed the views and the distance from the street noises. The room was spacious and friendly, perhaps a shade impersonal. Absolutely no noises from other rooms. But we found the our air conditioning unit quite loud and rather draughty. Good beds of enormous size.Firendly, quick check in. Good overall impressions of staff attitudes on the whole - if not quite on the extraordinary level of the Chicago or the Berlin Hyatts. We were disappointed by the mediocre hotel breakfast, for which we paid 60 dollars, and which we tried only once. You will be well-advised to go to the nearby Cranberry, where you will find better quality and more friendliness at a quarter the price.And one last thing: unlike other guests we felt never let down by the lifts. We never waited more than a minute, and once inside, your were whisked up 40 floors in 21 seconds and down in 24. Another pretty amazing thing about this hotel.To sum up: a very nice hotel in the centre fo theatreland but just far enough from Times Square to avoid the hustle and bustle.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a great hotel~! stayed for business in April and this location is superb. Staff is friendly and welcoming, concierge is knowledgeable, and housekeeping and security are very nice. I felt very safe and the rooms are immaculate. What a great hotel! The best rooms are the terrace rooms on the 27th floor. Well worth the price!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first stay at this hotel. For comparison purposes, on past trips to NYC, we've stayed at The Michelangelo, Andaz 5th Avenue, The Morgan and Hotel Elysee. The location of this hotel was terrific. We were close to everything, but not directly in Times Square (which is a good thing lol).The property itself is modern, clean, trendy. The room was large, clean, comfortable. The view was breathtaking!The beds and linen were wonderful. Loved the bed! Our bathroom was large, well lit, and super clean. The free water and wifi was appreciated. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. Special mention to the two ladies in housekeeping (Alba and ?) who went out of their way to take good care of us. We enjoyed a drink and a light lunch on the patio out front. Loved the vibe but found it a bit pricey. Rooftop lounge offered incredible views, but the service was iffy. Overall, this is a great place to lay your head during a NYC visit. I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed 7 nights at the Hyatt Hotel with my sister. We had such a great time. The hotel is amazing, I asked for a special room and we had what I asked for. The hotel is super nice and very clean. The staff is at our disposal if we had some questions or need help. The rooftop bar has an incredible view over Times Square. Everything went really great

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is perfect. Just a few steps away from Times Square. The rooms are fabulous - large, clean and well furnished. Service is great (Thank you Chester for your kindness well beyond the call of duty). Hated to leave but if I can, I shall return. If you're in NYC for work or pleasure then this is the Hotel for you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: this is my new favorite hotel in NYC...great sized room, desk, fabulous bathroom and great service. the restaurant has excellent breakfast; there is free water in the room and the staff are very attentive. Security watched to ensure that only registered guests had elevator access which is a great extra touch fo rthe city. Very convenient to the Mid-town business district and the theatre.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I think I've stayed at every other hotel in Times Square, but somehow missed the Hyatt. Stayed here last week because all of my other standbys were full...and boy am I glad. Hotel is well located and the rooms were very modern, large (for New York), clean and well-kept. Great rooftop bar with phenomenal views of the skyline.Will now be in my regular rotation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: OH we were sent here because the original hotel we had counldnt fulfil there commitment...so they put us up in the hyatt time square,,,I must say what an upgrade this was the most amazing hotel i stayed in while visiting the usa, friendliest staff, beautiful room,We stayed 14 nights, and i must say after walking all day and seeing all the beautiful sights of NY, it was always nice to come back to the Hyatt to relax.....Great Location...Caring professional staff...exceptional rooms...ps 54th roof top bar amazing...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Able to walk everywhere with ease. Close to subway and great places to eat, Views are OK. Great Sky bar on the 54th floor. Rooms were clean and staff was caring and attentive . Nice street market in front of hotel on Saturday

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in a one king bedroom suite that also had a large living room. There were 5 people in our party so we also had an adjoining 2 double bed room. It was the perfect setup. The bathrooms are nice with a rainfall shower. We ordered dinner from the diner downstairs. The food was great, the service friendly, and delivery quicker than expected. The location is 1/2 block from Times Square! If you stay on a Saturday night and have a car, there is on-street parking after 6:00PM and free parking all day on Sunday through 7:00 AM Monday. As usual, Hyatt provides free wifi. The only con is that the mini fridge did not fit a wine bottle! Also there was loud music at night-not sure whether it came from one of the pubs close by or the rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great room view. Great 54th floor rooftop bar. New. Modern. Efficient. Location is walking distance to most theaters, Times Square. Nice baths. Big TVs. Not super expensive. In short, a very good deal. Rooms not huge, but big enough. Elevators very fast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the unexpected suite upgrade to the responsive service and caring staff, I am a fan of this property. They understand how to take good care of the Business Traveler. And the breakfast and food at T45 Diner is first rate. I will be back there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is very nice with a great location (between Times Square and Avenue of the Americas - 6th & 7th Aves). The rooms are clean with a modern bathroom. The staff is friendly and helpful. They have a great rooftop bar on 54th floor - $$$ ($9 beer, $23 Cosmo). We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the positive: good location and cleanThe negative: staff seemed stuffy and not friendly or helpful. The beds were so uncomfortable! Probably the worst I've ever slept on. And that's a problem after walking around NYC all day. The air conditioner is motion activated so it does not run while you are out and it does not run while you are asleep. Very frustrating to come back to a stuffy room and wake up sweating! There are so many nice hotels to choose from that my advice is to skip this one!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location for theatre or mid town business, very clean, bright and remarkably quiet for the location. Staff is very friendly and accommodating and the restaurant is excellent for breakfast. It's only a block or so to Broadway and near subways so easy to get around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was pleasantly surprised by the size of my room and bathroom- was on a weekend getaway revolving around a trip to see the Daily Show. This hotel was an easy walk to much of the city, as long as you went up or down a street or two and avoided Times Square. Clean room, and the elevators were plentiful and quick. I did not however like the rooftop bar one bit- it was the only time I felt claustrophobic the whole time I was in Manhattan. Check in and out was lightening fast, easily got a cab to the airport a block away

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for10 days and by the time I left, it felt like home. Even though the hotel is very close to Times Square, it was very quiet at night. The room attendant did a great job and the front desk staff were very helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The only thing that wasn't quite right for our stay here was the rather disjointed arrival at 9 pm. There was no bell service, and when one enters the rather small lobby one faces three cashier stands. Two were occupied on our arrival, but only one was working. I wasn't sure if I was at a bell stand, a concierge desk, or registration. A sign to the right said Concierge, so I asked the employee who was apparently checking out and she told me it was registration. She left, and a very nice man replaced her and checked us in. He explained all we could think of, also telling us how to use the wi-fi. We got a room on a very high floor that was a good size, relatively private, and had an excellent view.Nothing went wrong for the next 11 days. Oh, yeah- the A/C broke, but they couldn't have been faster to fix it. Extra towels? Right away. Forgot your safe combo? Right away it is fixed.So, count us as happy customers. The location was great, too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was clean and quiet and the staff were very helpful. My room had a wonderful view with ceiling to floor windows and blackout curtains. The room was so quiet that I never heard anyone in the hallway. Great mattress! Wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want to be in the middle of the action this hotel has a fabulous location, just a half a block from Times Square.The rooftop bar with outdoor patio is lovely and the perfect place for a spring evening cocktail.Staff everywhere throughout the hotel were excellent.The only small issue I had were the pillows, I even requested foam and they brought 2 up, not foam though.... Just didn't enjoy the pillows, no support. The bed was fine.Great bathroom and a very spacious room.I would return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I spent 3 nights at the Hyatt Times Square. From the moment we pulled up to the hotel we experienced exceptional service. Aaron, one of the valet's was very pleasant and helpful. The great service continued at the Front Desk where the staff were cheerful and welcoming. Upon entering our room we were surprised to see a personal welcome message on the TV. Our rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable. We dined twice at L45, the hotel restaurant, and had two phenomenal servers. Katherine who was engaging and warm and Angelo who instead of displaying his name on his name tag uses pictures. He played a game of "guess my name" and gave our boys a special treat when they did--with help of course. Angelo was also helpful in advising us of nearby family fun places to go. We look forward to our next trip to NY where we will definitely return to the Hyatt Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would like to thank the Hyatt Times Square for accommodating my recent request to use the Sky Lounge on the 54th floor for the purpose of a proposal (The rooftop is amazing, highly recommended!). The planning was made so easy by MJ and Max who provided an exceptional service in the weeks leading up to our arrival in New York and on the day itself. We'll never forget it for obvious reasons but I can't thank the hotel and especially MJ and Max enough for going above and beyond to make such a moment so perfect for us. Thank you so much guys.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at the Hyatt Times Square on more than one occasion. I find it to be a very nicely-appointed property with great finishings, comfortable furnishings and extremely conveniently located in Midtown. The pricing can run a little high, but the hotel as a whole is quite nice and well worth the investment. Best features: beautiful bathrooms, fast elevators, great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would highly recommend the Hyatt Times Square. Location is great. Staff was amazing. The rooms were decorated great and a good size. I was there with my daughter to celebrate her 16th birthday and the hotel staff went out of their way to make it special. When we go back to NY will for sure stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are looking for a great place in the heart of NYC to hold a meeting this is the place. If you want a high quality bed, quite room fun rooftop bar, this is it. Safe friendly staff, great meeting space, great food with outdoor patio

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For business or pleasure, this new Hyatt hotel is a superb choice. Reasonable rates, superb service, restful and well appointed rooms, excellent breakfast in lobby restaurant and rooftop restaurant/bar for ogling at the skyline of NYC. Perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, quiet, clean and the best hotel staff in the city without question. My goto place to stay. We had a great view of the city. We had snacks in the restaurant with our 3 year old daughter. The Mac and cheese was great as were the dry martinis for mom and dad. A 30 second walk to time square on a nice Friday night was a real plus. My final comment- can't wait to cone back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: we had a great time we had a great time we had a great time we had a great time we had a great ti we had a great timeme we had a great time we had a great time we had a great time we had a great time we had a great time we had a great time

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at Hyatt Times Square for 6 nights. New and fresh, with great location and walking distance to shopping and attractions. Very good service, cleaning and facilities. Will definitely stay at this hotel next time we are in NY!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I do not want to say anything negative about the Hyatt Times Square. There is nothing negative to say, but it still wasn't quite what I had expected. First the good: the rooms are adequately-sized, somewhat spacious for NYC. The decor is fun, kind of danish-modern. The staff is responsive and helpful. BUT, the lobby is more consistent with a Hyatt Place or Hampton Inn then what I expect from flying the Hyatt flag. Similarly, the hallways to the rooms are now and space-efficient like you would expect from a Hyatt Place instead of a Hyatt. While the staff was friendly, having to repeatedly show my room key for elevator access (to the same people) got tiresome. for my purposes, it could have been closer to the Subway (wasn't too far, but walking through Times Square gets tiresome). Great location for almost all Theatres. For lobby, room size and convenience, Hilton Times Square will remain my property of choice. Nothing wrong with the Hyatt, but no on-par with the Hilton property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were moved to the Hyatt as the neighbouring Room Mate Grace was still being refurbished - and whilst it lacks a swimming pool it was very pleasant! The bar on floor 54 has amazing views. Our room was clean, comfortable - liked the multiplicity of lighting settings! Good location - walking distance of most atrractions in mid-town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for four days on business. The room was quite large, very clean and well-designed. The room was exceptionally quiet, which surprised me a bit given its location. The staff was friendly and helpful. I go to New York about twice a year and will definitely consider staying here again. Getting to and from the hotel via taxi is a bit of a challenge because of the proximity to Times Square but it's a great location for walking to the theater and to restaurants, so it's a bit of a wash. Great stay, though.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent 3 nights at this hotel. Front desk staff is amazing. I have to say Trish & Ravi were wonderful; always ready to make your stay as best as it could. Kimberly, the concierge was extremely helpful in explaining how to get places easily and giving recommendations and reservations. The rooftop bar is to die for. While the drinks are way too expensive, the mixologists make it seem like an art when making your drinks; the are good pours and very delicious especially if you order one of their specials. Also, the view is spectacular! Wow! The only downside is the housekeeping, coffee maker is left on counter and not cleaned and dirty cups are not taken unless you "state" that coffee maker should be cleaned and cups should be taken down. The housekeeping manager and the evening front desk manager for Saturday night need to learn a bit of customer service skills. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Rooms are big (for NY standards) and the bed is awesome! The biggest plus in the rooms is the tile warmer in the bathrooms. No more feet touching cold tiles! You set the temperature that you prefer. The higher floors have amazing views. Can't wait to go back in the fall!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A perfect location just off Times Square. Close to Rockefeller Centre, a brisk walk to the Empire State Building and if you have a room above the 30th floor you will get a good view of some part of Times Square. The rooms are very modern and spacious. Bar 54 is a perfect place to unwind after a big day of meetings or sight seeing. Security is good at the building. A great location if you wanted to come to town to watch the New Year countdown. Many restaurants close by and the hop on hop off buses are just around the corner. Located between the Avenue of the Americas and 7th Avenue it is midtown in location. Friendly staff with a good sense of humour. Only downside is the restaurant on the ground floor has a very limited dinner menu but that is easily overcome with so many competing restaurants close by.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel on May 1st to 2nd and overall it was a great stay. I planned a night out in NYC for my partner and contacted the hotel prior to my stay to make special arrangements. I found the staff to be very responsive to my requests and they offered great suggestions. There was a small snafu with some of the arrangements, but when brought to the staffs attention, alternatives were made available that more than made up for the error. There are a couple of areas that are showing wear in the rooms and the carpets could use a thorough refreshing, but overall everything was top notch. The staff truly are the crowning jewel that make this hotel shine. Additionally, the wi-fi is stable and super fast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good business hotel . May get full on some days and the elevators may be packed as the hotel is quite large , especially on weekends the hotel would be teeming with activity. The views from the roof top bar are breath taking and the staff helpful. The location is also very good with all areas of interest very close.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Its a First of many visits to New York City! This multifaceted, highly developed City is AMAZING! Sightseeing was filled with spontaneity, the lights, the sounds, and of course the people-and well-labored to get all I could in. Smiling! I stayed at The Hyatt Times Square. This hotel is simply stunning! Its very modern, and the cleanliness I give high marks. I wanted to recognize some of the staff, serving as model employees. Ms Deneisha Davis, from the front desk, provided Exemplary Guest Service. I would recommend your company invest and offer progression to this young lady! She is a Gem! Angelo Daniels, T45 bartender, He also provided excellent guest service. I'm a native of South Florida, and I was freezing in your 50 degree weather! LOL! Angelo provided the warmth I needed for my tea, with a laugh to go with it! Sean and Aaron in Guest Services were incredibly accommodating, they were very helpful, and made my stay memorable. Brian, Overnight Front Desk, started with outstanding Guest Service over the phone, before I arrived. He is also very accommodating. I had a few small concerns, and I spoke with Noah Aris, Front office Manager, he assured me that he would address my concerns. He has a warm demeanor and a friendly smile! Thanks to One and All that made my stay so special! Sending Sunshine from SO Florida! Thanks Ms Davis

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You want a nice hotel, great and friendly staff, big rooms, clean, fresh and for a good price on 1 minut from time square and only 1 minut walk from Minskoff Theatre (Broadway show Lion King) the Hyatt Times Square is your hotel. 2 staps and we are on 7th street. We have fast internet, great room with a view. And you can eat everywhere you want.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I typically stay at another chain hotel 5 blocks over, this is a new Hyatt property. It is great!! The gym is HUGE, and for NYC, it is giant. Skies parted. Front desk - they are actually having fun. Imagine. Silent room. I hear all the honking from the street... a given. You're in Times Square. But my noisy neighbors? Nope. I heard them from the hall... SUPER loud rudeness. From my room? Nada. Big bathroom with a big shower with two options for water flow. YES! This is a really big room for NY standards, and the bed was very comfy. I slept like a log. I have also been very comfortable working in my room all night. The restaurant downstairs has good food, but pretty heavy for a Californian. That said, their morning Americano was mind-blowing and so was the croissant. Seriously. Maybe even better than France. Rooftop bar has very expensive drinks, but a view like none other. It's worth a drink. Really. (At least non-winter)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Over all this was a great hotel. There were a few things that were off, but for the most part was good. And I typically steer away staying so close to times square, but it's so quiet and cozy inside the hotel despite the location. 10 min walk to grand central, 5 minute walk to almost all subways lines....just ignore the annoyance of times square and beeline to the subway ha ha. The room itself was great. Bed was very comfortable and everything was clean, except the carpets could use a good cleaning and nightstands had sticky can rings in a couple of spots. There was a small fridge to house drinks and they provide you with water. Nice big tv. The lighting system allowed you to control all lights from the bedside and there were so many lighting options. We stayed in a handicap accessible room cause it was what was available for early check in, which was fine and appreciated, only downside to that was the shower was a roll in without the step or barrier that kept the water from flooding onto the bathroom floor no matter how you try to avoid it. But bathroom was clean and spacious. The front desk staff was so so friendly, as was housekeeping. There was always a guy standing by the door which we thought was a doorman but never once did someone open the doors for us, despite being right there, and even with our luggage. ..and they check for room keys to get to the elevator but of 3 days only did thay once so I'm not sure the protocol for that. Also they charge 100 per night for incidentals which seemed like more than I ever have had. It was fine for us, but if someone was staying for a week it seems like a lot to hold. Overall we'd consider staying here again. Location can't be beat, especially if coming from the train. And it was definitely comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I came here late march on holiday visiting New York for the first time. The hotel was nice inside with friendly front desk and concierge staff. We checked in past midnight and were given a lower level room and front desk staff suggested we check back the next day to move higher up the building giving us opportunity to see more as we were staying for a week. The next day I was told because its a Saturday the hotel was too busy and to come back Sunday afternoon, as a tourist Im busy sightseeing so dont have time to keep returning to front desk to ask if there are higher floor rooms available, why even make the suggestion we do this if it isnt possible. They put a note on my booking about moving us higher but I never herd anything back. The room itself was nice, clean and comfortable, the hotel gave us $50 to use at the bar upstairs which was able to buy us 2 very overpriced but nice drinks. The only issue i found was being on a lower floor it was REALLY noisy, it started up from 5am every morning until late into the evening. The hotel was in a great location convinient to everything

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked, as usual on Priceline and had to wait until the day of, to score the best deal we could for a 4-star in the theatre district. $200/night including taxes and fees, and valet parking is $65 more for 24 hours, which worked out well, as we checked in fairly late and were then able to leave it there the next day until we left in the late afternoon. Average size room was very quiet and had decent closet and drawer space with all the extras including Wi-Fi, in-room safe, coffee maker, etc. included. The bath was nicely tiled and large enough, with good towels provided. Didn't use room service, so can't comment on that. The lobby is smaller, but easy to access on the entry level and a nice restaurant is off the lobby. Valet service from your car is nice and for the location, parking fee appears in line with most lots. Front staff was very friendly and held our bags without a problem.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If your looking for the place to stay in Times Square this is it. The staff are awesome and the hotel is incredible. Very clean, modern and just all around fun place. Great location and spectacular views.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything from start to finish was wonderful. The desk staff was so welcoming, friendly, and helpful that is set a great tone for the rest of the stay. When we got into our room we were blown away by the 46th story view. The rooms are chic, modern, and clean. The rooftop deck was also a lovely place to end the evening. The free wi-fi was a lifesaver! Loved everything about this place. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My one week stay at the Hyatt Times Square has been a rather disappointing one and for sure not one aligned to the usual Hyatt experience.Let's start with the good, it's easy as it is just one aspect: location. The hotel is nicely set in the heart of NYC, 20 seconds walking distance from Times Square. Overall the hotel is brand new (they told me is only two years old) and features an amazing rooftop bar with views on the Crysler building and the Freedom Tower.First of all the room is lacking the basics. No toiletry, empty fridge, no slipperies, no laundry bag, no nothing. You need to ask for everything. I ended up calling three times the reception in the 10 minutes upon entering my room to have delivered what was missing as I discovered it. Very disappointing.On my second day they simply skipped housekeeping, so I was left with my room not done and I had to ask new towels. Nobody even bothered apologizing.Other disappointing chapter: room service. Food quality is horrible, I ordered a burger that was almost inedible. Shake Shack would be a smarter choice. But what amazed me is that for the price of the usual Hyatt room service (you know, rolling tray, metal spoons, ceramic plate, etc.) you are delivered your food in a paper bag where the food is stuffed in paper plates. Cutlery is made out of plastic.Again, no problem with this "urban approach", but at least they should downsize the price accordingly. Also, forget food at the ground floor diner. They only have unhealthy breakfast options and you are obliged to buy family size portions. I asked for a croissant and I received a basket with one croissant, one pain au chocolat and two muffins. Dinner food is the very same of room service: inedible (but here at least you eat it on proper ceramic plates).Finally, the day before departure I called front desk at 6pm to ask for a black car transport to JFK the morning after and they told me it was not possibile to book because "the concierge has already left". Unbelievable.So no, despite the great position and being new, I will never stay again in this establishment. It's crazy expensive for what it has to offer and overall it's a very unfriendly hotel for business travelers.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in! It looked brand new (we stayed only a few months after they opened) and the furniture/amenities in the room are very modern. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were very clean. The staff was excellent and you can't beat the location right next to Times Square! There are modern conveniences like multiple charging plugs all over the rooms and a shower that even includes a hand shower! The view outside our room was great and the view is even more amazing if you go to the top of the hotel at the restaurant on the 54th floor. Overall a great place to stay during our trip to New York and very highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We Stayed in a deluxe room a weekend in April, had a very nice stay. The hotel is centrally located to the theaters, times square. Check in was flawless and fast and front desk staff were very pleasant. We arrived before check-in and put our Luggage in the Luggage check so we could go enjoy the city. We had a room on the 14th floor but wished we had asked for a higher floor for a better view, still was not disappointed though.Rooms are modern and Very Clean, Nice Big TV in living room and Bedroom, We Valet parked our car and at check-out was told it could take 30 minutes to get our car, Steve at the valet stand noticed we had been waiting quit a while and called to see what the problem was, apparently there was a ticket number mix up. Valet guy (Steve) immediately apologized and offered to take care of the over-night parking fee. That is exactly what people expect when it comes to great service.(take responsibility and correct it). I will stay again and recommend this Hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked a room with a view, floor to ceiling windows, rain shower. Internet pics look terrific but it not what we got. We arrived and got a small room, one small floor to ceiling window, a view of the air conditioners on the adjacent buildings. We did get a rain shower but no tub. Staff in lounge were not helpful at all.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay at this hotel was fantastic. What a great location. So close to Broadway, 5th Ave - perfect location. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful and the café for breakfast and dinner was reasonably priced and the food was lovely. Only down side was at times, the long wait for the lifts. Recommend this hotel for your stay in amazing NY!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms were very nice and large, rain shower was large and bathroom was well planned out (plenty of counter and shelf space, towel racks and hooks, etc). Our room had two large closets which is a rarity in NYC. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Went to take a shower the handle to the hot water came off had to try to fix it , took 15 minutes for Hot water to come on . Other then that great location , very friendly front desk , be aware that they will charge your credit card a extra 100 for any room charges or damages . Never is that much anywhere other then New York . Very clean .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: ...not all about it, but roof top is excellent. Rooms and quality is very good! Also openable windows available! fitness center is good, can be enhanced by some additional equipment and fruits........

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in the heart of New York. Most of the a. ttractions were within the walking distance. The staffs were excellent and were there to meet my needs at any time of the day. I strongly recommend this hotel if you want a great service and a great place to experience the hustle and bustle of New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently took our kids on their first trip to NYC. This hotel had large clean rooms, free internet was a bonus, it was centrally located and the staff was amazing...they were extremely friendly and very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and will stay there again I am sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Was pleased to find a hotel that was centrally located and for the price, you get an excellent room/like new. Staff was courteous and resourceful. Handled our bags, transportation services. Printing boarding passes was a breeze.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For a generic hotel, this Hyatt exceeded expectations. The hotel is new, or appears so, and has very up-to-date amenities. The décor is crisp and comfortable. We loved the "rain fall" style shower and the bathroom flooring which was not cold on the feet. The inaudible bathroom ventilation kept the mirror completely free of condensation even when the shower was on. We appreciated the in-room refrigerator, two free water bottles, lighted make-up mirror, ice machine on each floor, in addition to the usual bathrobes, slippers, room safe, etc. The room had a very nice lighting system controlled from the bed, with different levels of lighting. Lots of handy outlets to plug in phones, Ipads, etc. Reception area was well-staffed and friendly. The elevators are extraordinarily fast. The check-in and check-out were efficient. We didn't eat there but there is a bar with an amazing view on the 53rd floor. You can go up, gawk and take a photo without taking a table. Obviously the location is good if you want to be in the Times Square area. Only downside is there is no valet parking service, so you need to find a garage nearby (in Times Square traffic!) and carry your own bags to the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I found this hotel to be a relaxing and quiet place away from the hustle and bustle of the area. It was tastefully decorated. The location was super for us as we were there to go to live theater; especially musicals. Also there were good restaurants in the area too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel. Clean, comfortable, trendy, and most of all great staff. We had an issue with our wifi and they were quick to fix it. Really great experience and will not hesitate to stay here in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent the weekend here with my son and wife. This hotel is in the perfect location. We had a view of Times Square and were a few minutes walk to 5th Ave. The staff went out of their way to make us happy. The decor is, as we heard a little boy say, "Swanky". Very classy. The rooftop bar (Highest in NYC) provides you with a spectacular view while you have a beverage ( a bit pricey, but worth it for the view alone). The rooms are big for NYC (Just as big as any other city). Also, we were on the 25'th floor so it was quiet at night. Can't say enough about it. We would definitely come back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great place to stay! The view of Times Square in the evening was amazing. The room was like new. The bathroom was incredible. Enjoyed the shower and bath. True luxury for a reasonable amount of money! Was better than being home! Regretted having to leave.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed with my 7 & 9 year olds and another family. Hotel location was convenient walking distance for all the Times Square sites we wanted to see. Rooms were clean and updated. The staff was friendly and courteous. We used the free wifi and enjoyed the complimentary bottles of water in our room. It was pouring outside and the hotel offered umbrellas to utilize while walking outdoors. My one complaint would be that the small round candies offered on the counter at check-in are not the best choice for kids. The size is perfect for a child to choke on (my son almost did so accidentally). Not a deal breaker for us but we'll steer clear of those candies next time. We will definitely stay here again if the price is right!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family stayed here for one night and enjoyed our brief stay. We got a discounted price and were happy with the value for our money in NYC. However, once the woman at the front desk found out we used an online discount website, her friendly demeanor noticeably changed. Otherwise, we had a great experience and enjoyed the proximity to Times Square and our Broadway show.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just stayed at the Hyatt Times Square with my two children, 9 and 11 years old. Great experience overall. While our room wasn't ready when we arrived at 11 (expected), they happily held our bags so we could tour around without their burden. When we checked back at 4, our room was ready complete with a great view (ask for a high floor), and was beautifully decorated, spotless and spacious (surprising for an NYC hotel). Only minor complaint -- like others have said, the roof top bar has a strict "no kids allowed" policy. Being a bar, I get it -- but why can't it be billed as a restaurant? They serve food AND drink... my kids and I would have loved an afternoon and/or a late night snack. But we weren't even allowed to sit down at a table. Given the great, panoramic view, we could have spent hours (and $$) up there, but were quickly ushered out.However... outside of that, it was a wonderful stay and we would DEFINITELY go back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This trip was for a special birthday and having a great hotel to stay in is a big part of making a trip perfect. The Hyatt did not disappoint. The room was spacious, well equipped and with a very comfortable bed. I booked a quiet room and it definitely was, we slept soundly when we finally made it back to our room from cocktails in B54!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: At the center of everything. Modern decor, room was clean and updated. Did not get to check out the rooftop but heard great things. Check in and check out was fast and seamless. Will definitely stay again. Room size is as expected for the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love the hotel, great rooftop bar, maybe best in NYC, but a little expensive on drinks even by NY standards. Very close to Times Square. Will stay there for business, when possible, and for personal trips for Broadway shows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I Liked the hotel. It is close to everything. Times Square , Shopping , Business . Good connection to lower Manhattan Close to Central Park. Service very good Had room on 50th floor with stunning view of Skyline Manhattan. Beds are very comfy and best of all you can open window and get fresh air.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located in the centre of manhattan just off time square in the heart of the city between 6th and seventh avenue. Easy walking the 7th avenue shops and lovely Bryant park near by. plenty of cafes,deli's for breakfast. A very modern hotel, clean and classic decor. Easy drop off point at the front of the hotel. B54 the roof top bar has an amazing view over lower manhattan, the Chrysler building and time square. Even has an out side trace to sit on a sunny evening .A great range of beers ,drinks and food.The staff were really nice , Helpful, efficient and friendly. The room i had was very spacious for a city hotel, great views from the wall of glass windows and a big bathroom and shower closet. I stayed on business but would also be a great base for discovering New York. i would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a same day book via hotels.com. The price was cheap for such an amazing location and everyone from the concierge to the desk assistant to the cleaning staff were extremely kind and helpful. The front desk bumped us up to a better room - for no reason! It was a fantastic experience and I would highly recommend staying here if you want a front row to Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Loved loved loved staying here so central so quiet staff so helpful. Nestled between two Irish pubs was exceptional on St Patrick's Day. Times Square around the corner was bliss. Rooftop bar excellent but too expensive to drink there.Loved it

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I picked it because of the great location - right off the Time Square, and because it's newly opened. Hotel was packed due to holiday season, but service was prompt and attentive. Lovely American Bistro t45 on the first floor - for quick lunch or breakfast - loved their chilli soup. Definitely try rooftop lounge Bar54 - nice views, beautiful relaxing atmosphere and delicious cocktails. Room had nice details, very thoughtful and clean. Concierge was able to get me last minute Broadway show tickets and even few reservations in super busy trendy restaurants. Would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I travelled to NYC with my mum & two children from Australia & stayed here on the 26th floor from the 23rd March - 1st April. This is my 5th trip to NYC in 7 years, & this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in by far!! The positives:1. Our room had plenty of space2. It was very clean & housekeeping staff were very friendly3. In a great location for Times Square & the subway4. All staff were very friendly & helpfulThe negatives:1. There was one night we were trying to get the lift down to go out for dinner. We waited over 20mins (& we could hear the lifts going straight past us) until I rang the lobby to find out what was going on? I was told they had a private function on & were using the lifts to transport the guests to. This was very annoying as we paid good money to stay here & didn't think it was fair to make hotel guests wait this long. Eventually the lift arrived. This one off incident still doesn't change my overall review of the hotel. I cannot wait to return to NYC & will definitely be staying here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: King bed room on the 10th floor, room was ready for check-in just after noon. Room size is small compared to Hilton Times Square & Millennium Times Square, likewise for the lobby. Elevators are fast, albeit a bit small in size too. Shower only in the bathroom, & water pressure is quite low. Mattress is quite firm, pillow is thin, carpet in the guest room looked dirty to me, desk lamp didn't work, ditto the hairdryer. Gym is ok, but no washroom nearby. Free wifi is nice, & the lighting control in the guest room is pretty neat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our room on the 50th floor was awesome! Great view of Times Square! Excellent customer service! Bar up on 52 floor is not to be missed! Times Square is just a couple hundred feet out the from door! Will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a hip hotel in the heart of Times Square. We LOVED IT! It was clean, and the staff was wonderful.The bar in the lobby was excellent, as was the rooftop bar. Hyatt never disappoints, and they definitely live up to the brand.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We a party of 3 were originally booked into a different 3 star hotel but were relocated to the Hyatt Times Square (right next door to our originally booked Hotel) a 4 star Hotel at no extra expense.Before our trip I had contacted the customer service desk with a couple of questions and was absoloutely blown away by the friendly an professional service I received from Jorge.When we arrived we were more than impressed with the Hotels proximity to Times Square and lots of other NYC attractions such as Grand Central Terminal (turn left from the Hotel Entrance and walk around 5 blocks and you are there!) The Empire State Building, Rockerfeller Centre, Bryant Park, Madison Square Garden, Central Park , Broadway etc. The list goes on!The Hotel itself was a very clean modern building and at check in we found that we had been given a free upgrade courtesy of Jorge! Our room was on the 51st floor and the view was amazing! We could even see some of times Square! I will say that the elevators are superfast and if your journey up or down from the high floors was uninterupted your ears would pop!The staff here are all professional, friendly welcoming and very hard working. the rooms are spotless and comfortable the bathrooms modern and bright. An onsite resturant and a fabulous roof terrace with cocktail bar only add to the overall experience!! Thank you Hyatt Times Square - all 3 of us would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting NYC. A brilliant visit to the Big Apple. we will certainly be returning in future!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in mid April and we're delighted with the hotel. The staff were lovely and helpful. The rooms were large and modern, with fantastic views of Times Square and the surrounding buildings. Bar 54 has spectacular views downtown and is a wonderful place to spend the evening watching the sunset. I will definitely return to this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent Location, New hotel, Super clean, room size better than expected for time square hotels, fair price. People super kind and helpfull, thing that you do not see very much in NY., The overall !!!! great!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Ideal location for everything Midtown and Times Square. Was not assigned a premier room but to be fair I requested early check-in and a quiet location (sort of hoping that would mean a higher floor). And a room was waiting when we arrived at 1:00 and we never heard a peep any of the four nights we stayed. The staff was terrific and the rooms are fresh and modern in every respect. Especially liked the lighting which was good for task, relaxing and a "night setting." Would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was wonderful, until you tried to order food needing a gluten free diet. In this day and age that is not ok! There are many restaurants around the hotel with gluten free options, thank God, but if you need something at the hotel you are pretty much out of luck. Get it together Hyatt!
user_location: New York Times Square, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location to all Times Square attractions..Property is less than 18 months old, everything is new, fresh,,Rooms are smartly laid out, no wasted space...Tall property, but narrow, so it never feels big, it feels boutiqueCool lounge at the top, killer views..great floor to ceiling windows in roomstons of light b/c no building is next door blocking the light. unique for NYCroom size was above average.staff was helpful, and engaging..I avoid big chains, I usually stay at the well reviewed French Quarter, but this hotel provides the best of all worlds, and I will definitely stay again- thanks !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel & friendly staff. We're going to stay out late & I decided to book a room for the night so we wouldn't to drive home. I checked in late but when we left Bar 54 & came to the front desk, the concierge staff greeting me w/ a "Welcome Home". That's a great way to be greeted at a hotel especially when it's your first time there. Will definitely return on another night out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 5 nights in March for my 40th Birthday. The staff and hotel were fantastic, on arrival we were offered an upgrade to a deluxe room on the 44th floor and the views of Times Square, Hudson river and the new Freedom Tower were amazing and well worth the extra. We had no problems with the lifts although some people have said they were slow we didn't find that at all. Our room was clean, spacious and well stocked with water, Starbucks coffee and bathroom toiletries by housekeeping daily. The rooftop bar on the 54th floor also has amazing views although it is quite expensive $23 for cocktails and $22 for a can of Sixpoint Crisp beer (which is a little steep considering in the UK Sixpoint Crisp is around £2 / $1.33 in Wetherspoons) but we did know how expensive the drinks were before we visited and went for the experience and views not to save money! The only shock was the cost to phone the UK from the hotel. I made 2 calls from our hotel room back home to check on our dog, 6 minutes in total cost $70 so if you think you'll need to phone home it would definitely be worth looking into other options. The location of the hotel is perfect for exploring Manhattan, just off Times Square and walking distance to most of the tourist attractions. We walked everywhere even to the Staten Island Ferry terminal and only took a subway to see the old City Hall Ghost Station. We didn't eat in the hotel as there are so many other restaurant / bar / diner choices around the area so can't comment on the restaurant but overall this is a fantastic hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed with my wife a could days after the new years eve.When we arrived, the reception was very busy, but the staffs work fast and efficient.Too bad, they don't have (of I didn't see) the premium check in for platinum or above dedicated counter ( I am a diamond my self), but it is OK since the service was quite fast.The room is nice, clean and fairly new. the house keeping staffs, are friendly, always greet us.Food is prettily good, we had some breakfasts in the morning.It was a rainy day…. the staff offer us to lend an umbrella, just when we need it.When we checked out, again, it was a busy time. It took 15 minutes or so, but fully understood.Overall, I am pleased with this Hyatt, I am a BIG Hyatt's fan for years, been a Diamond or Platinum at least for many years.Thanks Hyatt, to keep us happy during our stayscheers,

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights over Easter 2015. The location was great for subway stations and Times Square. The lobby/entrance to the hotel is underwhelming! Even our taxi driver had to drive round twice to find it. The rooms are clean and efficiently done. We were on the 8th floor and the noise from street level was fine. We visited the bar on the 54th floor but unfortunately you can't stay with children (even in the daytime) so that was a disappointment - although they did let us take some photos before we left. Ate breakfast in the hotel on day one - and am still shocked at the price! Lots of local diners as alternatives - or branches of Pret nearby.The biggest asset to this hotel was the lady who cleaned our room. So friendly and kept our stock of teabags high :-)In summary, good hotel, great location - but nothing that will stick in my mind forever.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 5 nights when visiting New York, what a fantastic hotel. Literally a 2 minute walk from Times Square and right next to a subway station too which meant ease of access to anywhere in the city!The reception & conciergestaff were very friendly & helpful, our room was always kept clean by the great house keeping staff.The room was a fair size with a huge shower, floor to ceiling windows, a queen size bed & mini fridge. The rooftop bar was also great, although maybe a tad expensive.Will definitely stay here again when visiting New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location, location, location. Perfect! What a great hotel, while 54 floors it feels intimate. We had a corner suite -- the view was fantastic, the two rooms, so very comfortable, although not huge, it was so well designed that we never felt cramped. The bathroom was the best we have ever been in. The shower/tub room was a great use of space and very practical. But again, the location near Times Square was ideal. Could get everywhere and mostly by foot. My only peeve (and this was a big one) was that the food service in the hotel ended at 11 pm...no room service, no restaurant food and none at the Bar. For the "City That Never Sleeps" that is unforgivable. Post Theater, and no food to be had. Hyatt: you gotta change that.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The actual rooms are great. Super clean and modern. Location is brilliant. Check in/check out was painful. Room wasn't ready on our arrival at 4pm. Lobby and lift area gets very crowded. We were on level 11 and it was so noisy that we were woken up several times a night (executive suite for 6 nights) with sirens, garbage men and construction work.
