Ask for a room high up to get away from the street noise. Bar on the roof isn't bad but expensive. Might as well go for a short walk, like we did and find better and cheaper bars.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice short "boy's weekend" with my 9 y/o son while wife and daughter were away on a girl scout trip. We do this city trip every year (although we live in the city LOL!!) We decided to give the Hyatt at Time Square a try. The hotel is located just off of Time Square. Not too far but far enough to get away from the touristy crowd. The modern decor was pleasing to the eye. The staff was very polite. When we checked in a staff member took my son next door to the restaurant (T45) and they gave him brownies. Our 1 bedroom deluxe view suite was located on the 24th Fl Room 2401. The room was nicely decorated with floor to ceiling windows. The bedroom was spacious and cozy it had a 47 inch t.v. and 2 large closets. The living area "lounge area" was also spacious, furnished with a 47 inch t.v., a work desk station, and a small refrigerator. There is also Starbucks coffee supplied with 2 bottles of water that the hotel provides free of charge. I opted for the real Starbucks across the street and my son opted to take the bottled waters. The bathroom was a bit dark with the black tiles and it was equipped with a stand up shower with both a “rainforest” shower head and one you could hold. The shower pressure was excellent. There was also a separate tub, located to the left of the shower, that we did not use at all. The only issue we had with the room was the fact that it was not soundproof as the hotel advertised. Even 24 floors up we could still hear the city's car horns and and occasional sirens from a passing ambulance or police car. It was not that bad but noticeable enough to raise the volume on the t.v. at night. The room was also located near the elevators. It we could hear the noise from the elevators going up and down. The hotel has some amenities that I was unable to venture out and experience such as the gym and the roof top bar. But the front desk did advise that I was allowed to bring my son up to the rooftop bar between 4-5 (not sure if that time frame is accurate) and we can take a look at the view from there. I opted to pass this up and took my son to the Top of the Rock instead. Overall our stay was pleasant. My son is already planning his return trip next year. He prefers this hotel over the W Hotel in Time Square that we stayed the previous year. I would agree with him but would opt for a room further away from the elevators.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked 2 queens rooms with 2 queen beds in each for 4 nights. I emailed the hotel to advise them that we would be checking in late and that we also wanted the rooms close together. We arrived at the hotel from our flight from Dubai fairly late but the check in staff were very quick and handled check in very quickly. Our rooms on the 15th floor were opposite each other and although the views were okay obviously the higher up you are the views would be better. The rooms were large for New York standards and the beds too. The artwork was very contemporary and the rooms were styling. The shower and bathroom were clean and new and if something was not there you just called and they delivered it straight up to your room eg make up wipes, toothpaste, teabags, water etc. I was impressed how comfortable the beds were. The bar on the 54th floor is worth a visit to with spectacular views but perhaps a little pricey. Its not as big as some of the other hotels but we preferred this. The gym had all the equipment in it required although it was busy the one time I did go in there. The staff on the whole were helpful. The hotels big bonus is it is right behind Time Square and even though that was the case we were not affected by the noise or the bustle of it all. Everything is very close by. The lovely attendant Lois gets a special mention for arranging our transfers on the last day and being so helpful despite it being so cold. I would say perhaps that there were a few staff that could improve their customer service skills perhaps its because the hotel is so new. I would definetely recommend this hotel and would go back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Some fundamental facilities are missing: 1) free wi-fi; 2) vending machine; 3) affordable breakfast restaurant; 4) snack and beverages in the room; 4) international tv channels. Definitively this hotel is by far too expensive for the service they provide. A big disappointment.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have recently stayed 4 nights in this hotel. The location is great, just steps away from Times Square. Rooms were decent sized, clean and modern. Now the reason for three stars:They charge $10+tax for handling your packages. And by handling I mean delivering your packages from their front desk or mail room to your room. What the heck? You can ship a small package across US by USPS for that price. As someone who is traveling every single week (IT consultant) I have to buy most of my stuff online and ship to my hotel. This was the first time a hotel charged me for handling my packages, I paid $54 for 5 packages. Seriously? What have you actually done to charge that? Took an elevator to bring a package to my room. No gas burned, it wouldn't take someone more than 2 minutes to do this. And the elevators... There are 2 serving floors up to 25 and 3 serving 26-54. And in the mornings and evenings you wait and wait and wait then get an elevator already full so you wait and wait again. So if you don't need packages to be delivered to you or if you do not need to get in and out if the hotel in business rush hours, stay here. Otherwise, find another hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very modern,clean and a feel of something special.From the moment we arrived nothing was too much trouble for the staff.The room[45th floor] had a great view and had all the usual Hyatt extras.The location was fantastic,right in the middle of Times Square handy for many of the must see attractions.The bar on the 54th floor although expensive was a must have experience with views at night to die for.Special thanks must go to Mahfuz who made us feel so welcome each time we visited the rooftop bar.Should we return to New York we would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This visit exceeded almost every expectation I had. Sizeable room for NYC (the one exception: drawer space), and especially the bathroom/shower. Sleek, modern design, and essentially new everything. WONDERFUL service from the moment we checked in, and that makes all the difference. I even thought the art on the wall in our room was fabulous, and who ever thinks that about a hotel?! If you want to stay near Times Square, and are willing to pay reasonable money for lovely experience, stay at this Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is just steps away from the times square. starbuck coffee is just oppsoite of the hotel entrance. We were very satisfied with the service received from the hotel. I will return back to this hotel again in my next visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Mom and daughter trip to New York City - easy walk to Times Square, shopping, great restaurants and of course the shows! Great time. The rooms were clean and modern. The service was good and the views from our room were great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very new, clean, high tech rooms, extremely comfortable. Moderately priced for the high level of quality. Great bar/lounge on the top floor with excellent view. This hotel will not disappoint you in any way.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The valet was very friendly and helpful. The location was awesome. The rooms where clean. everything else left a LOT to be desired. This hotel is for the 1persent that I am not. issue #1 65 dollars for 24 hours of parking with no in and out privileges. #2 no shuttle #3 only allowed to use hotel computer 15 minutes a day before surcharges occur they even charge for making a copy on the printer.#4 elevators that were always long waits and packed #5 had to pull into parking garage across street as valet pull up was full additional 10 bucks, crossed street with family and all luggage checked in placed luggage on luggage carrier to get to room and was stopped by rude front desk attendant stating we where not supposed to take luggage carriers to room (maybe we just needed to pay someone to do it for us???) front desk staff was very worst I have encountered as far as helpfulness goes. always trying to send you to concierge (who you are supposed to tip) or valet (another tip) once I asked about a ny city pass (a book that you get into eighty different attractions for one price) the concierge had left so the front desk proceeded to tell me all about it. They said it was a rewards point system Hyatt had that your points added up and got you great discounts. Realizing she was clueless about what I wanted I thanked her and walked away.(no tip required here). The view at the bar on the 54th floor was neat but it didn't justify the big prices at the bar. The rain style shower heads were a drizzle poor water pressure throughout our room. Bottom line stayed 3 nights 2 where Free and still paid out over 700 bucks for parking a standard room with 2 queens and a mediocre view . I could go on and on but you get the point one presenter hotel everyone else skip it. Your wallet will thank you.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our recent stay at the Hyatt Times Square was great! The location was perfect for the theater district and for the show at Radio City that we attended. The hotel and room were modern.....updated.....and very clean. When we checked(which was well before the posted check in time) they gave us a $50 food/drink credit as we were celebrating our anniversary. We enjoyed drinks at the outstanding bar on the 54th floor. The views of the city and river from the bar and outside patio were fantastic! I would certainly stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square has a wonderful staff and very nice rooms. We picked it because of its location. This was my son's first trip to NY so we wanted to do something very tourist-y. Unfortunately, the outside noise is very disturbing - all night long cars would honk their horns, police would blare their sirens. It was hard to fall asleep and stay asleep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel and amazing location next to Times Square. It is perfect when you head out to see shows and look for great restaurants. The hotel is easy to reach from all airports and near the New York subway. The rooms are very nice and light and spacious. We booked the Deluxe Room with floor to ceiling windows and it is worth the extra money as the view is amazing towards Times Square and the New York skyline. The staff at the Hyatt are very helpful with everything, from booking shows, to finding locations and good restaurants. Don't forget to have a drink at the roof terrace and book a massage in the Spa. Worth after you have spend a day exploring the city. Can highly recommend and would book it again for our next trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room was clean and fine for size. The mattress was incredibly comfy.Staff were friendly and helpful.The lifts to get down to the lobby or up to your room are the slowest we've ever used. The longest we waited for the lift was ten minutes. Free wifi was excellent.Location is good if you like to be in the thick of things.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms were quite spacious for a New York hotel and well kept. Check in and check out were a breeze. The beds were really comfy and the free internet was a definite plus. if I had anything negative to say about the hotel I'd have to say that the lobby is small and a bit chaotic most of the time. But the staff were all very friendly and helpful. We never got to see the sky lounge because under age children are not allowed up there unfortunately.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for only 1 night as we were visiting a friend's daughter birthday party in Queens but we decided to spend a night in Manhattan. We had a 3 year old and everyone had a great time staying. The location is excellent. The hotel room is very quiet. No disturbance from outside environment. Rooms are nice and clean. Good amenities. Staff was helpful as well. Definitely recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location is perfect, but value for money considered I won't stay here again. We paid more than USD 300,- for a room without breakfast. Check-in and check-out was lightning fast. Staff was very friendly. Room was nice and big enough for two (see pictures). View was quite impressive. What I liked is that they repaired some small damages in the room. Eye for detail. You can order a lot of items via room service for free, but I think that it would be easier if a tea kettle was standard in the room. (Probably a way to increase tips.) Bring your own tea as they only had one type. Breakfast area on the ground floor looked quite old, so we ate elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt time square hotel is an excellent place to stay while you are in New York. The hotel provide top notch service and go beyond to satisfy your needs. The hotel is central located within walking distance of television studios, and the theater district.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I chose this hotel for my husband and 13yr old son's first visit to NYC - primarily for its location. Just a short walk up the street and you are in the middle of Times Square! We were also within walking distance of Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Broadway Shows, Museums, and so much more. This really was an ideal location for sight seeing without having to use the subway much. The only day we used the subway was when we visited the 9/11 Memorial and Little Italy. We checked in early and settled for a 17th floor view - but we weren't disappointed since we were still able to see parts of Times Square. The view from the top of the hotel/bar at night is stunning also, so don't miss that if you chose this hotel! I was expecting a more cramped room since its NYC, but we had 2 queens and the room felt very spacious, comfortable and beautifully appointed - similar to what we've come to expect from other Hyatt locations we've stayed. The staff were all very friendly and helpful - we would definitely stay again and highly recommend to anyone wanting to be close to the lights and action of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My first meal was dinner at T45. I was seated by Nia, and Rebekah was my server. Not only was I treated with exceptional courtesy and professionalism, these ladies went out of their way to make me feel at home. On subsequent visits, these ladies not only remembered my name, but spoke with me as though I were an old friend. The bartenders at T45, James and Ryan, were very personable and went out of their way to accommodate. I also spent time at Bar54, and Brooks was not only a fantastic server, but we also discovered that I had seen a production of WAR HORSE in Portland, Oregon in which Brooks was a cast member..small world !!! Jonathon and Mafus, the management/host staff, were jocular and professional. These ladies and gentlemen were exceptionally gracious and they are the reason my stay at Hyatt Times Square was the best hotel experience I have ever had, and made my 60th birthday trip truly memorable. For that, I thank them. I chose this hotel for its proximity to the Theater District. I was able to walk to all the theaters I had tickets for. The Metropolitan Opera, at Lincoln Square, did necessitate a Cab ride, the fare was a modest $10 before tip. All in all, the perfect location to access the Arts.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My "tween" daughter and I went to New York to see Wicked and enjoy a little daddy-daughter time. In researching hotel options, I saw that Hyatt had a new hotel that looked well-positioned for our admittedly-touristy interests on this trip, so we gave it a try.The property was new, the elevators were fast (2nd fastest in Manhattan, I believe), the walls and doors were thick (no noise), the room was very comfortable, and our favorite part was the bathroom's floor-to-ceiling window with a roll-down shade that made every part of the room open and airy.The service was impeccable. Everyone was fantastically polite and attentive throughout our 4 days on property (we were greeted at least 2-3 times whenever we entered or departed the hotel). There were good food options, and we enjoyed the room service as well as the quick dining option (coffee and pastries) downstairs. One night, I snuck up to the rooftop bar for a nightcap. The bar was smartly appointed, run by great bartenders, and had an excellent view from the uncrowded balcony. The location was ideal. As others have noted, the hotel is on a side street near Times Square, so it is a short walk to Times Square and only a slightly longer walk to our other interests (Broadway, the Carnegie Deli, etc.). Although further still, the location allowed us to comfortably walk up to Central Park and back down Fifth Avenue for shopping. Whenever we came back, it felt like a refuge from the hustle.When we decided to venture further out to see the Guggenheim Museum, Little Italy and the East Village, we discovered the hotel's one, small issue: The advantage of the location on a side street is a disadvantage when you need a cab. However, it wasn't always an issue (there are LOTS of cabs driving down 45th Street on their way to Times Square) and, to give you an idea of the dedication of the staff, at one time we had a doorman, concierge and manager all standing in the street trying to get us a cab. Whenever we couldn't readily get a cab there on 45th, we simply walked over to 6th Avenue.I have stayed at the Hyatt at 48th & Lexington (another great property) and various Hiltons in Manhattan. I really think the Hyatt Times Square has the best location and amenities, especially if you are looking to see and do the sorts of things my daughter and I enjoyed on this trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived at the Hyatt Times Square in the middle of the St Patricks Day celebrations and thought that as the Hyatt is positioned between 2 Irish Pubs we would be in for some noise during the night. Fortunately the soundproofing and the fact that we were on the 11th floor didn't cause any problems, the Hotel is very smart with quite a small footprint but has 54 floors with a roof top bar and outside terrace that has amazing views over Manhattan. Bedrooms were very smart with everything that you need including Tea/coffee maker and a fridge, tea and coffee sachets were available on request along with paper cups and mixers etc, food and drink were quite expensive but just typical of any 4/5 star Hotel so to be expected. Position wise the Hotel was perfect, literally 2 minutes walk to Times Square but being down a side road meant that noise was at a minimum, easy walking distance to the Subway so made use of the 7day unlimited Metro pass quite a lot and really got our money's worth out of it. All in all an excellent stay in a very cold New York, but you can never tell in March, we were in New York 3 years ago in March and although it started off cold within 3 days temperatures were up to 70F for a while.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed in numerous NYC hotels, I must admit this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The price was very reasonable, the staff were very friendly and very helpful. The room was clean with wonderful floor to ceiling windows, even in the bathroom. There was a refrigerator and safe, coffee maker in the room, also warm robes and slippers. The location was a short walk to TImes Square at the end of the block. We did not dine at the hotel, but, there were plenty of great places to eat within a few blocks. The upper room was quiet. There is a fabulous fitness center with excellent equipment, water, towels, TV's everything you would ever need for a great workout. We will be back without a doubt, this will be our new "go to "place to stay in NYC !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just back from a six night stay. Absolutely fabulous. Our room was on the 53rd floor so had a fantastic view. The room was spotless and the bed huge and so comfortable. I did miss having bath to soak away the aches after a day's walking round New York - that was my only niggle. Hotel staff were so friendly. Checking/ out was fast and the hotel is convenient for so many attractions. The roof bar is a must and the hotel gym was very well equipped.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt made our stay quite special. the concierge and front desk were well staffed and quickly helpful. They gave us a 50th floor room that overlooked the heart of Times Square such as the "red stairs", which made for great picture taking for my kids. The rooms were nice, new, and clean. The only drawback is that the room service twice got minor parts of our food order incorrect. The top floor lounge/restaurant is terrific for a glass of wine and a view of the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here from 17th to 23rd March on our honeymoon. I had read many reviews before travelling, all reviews said that the hotel was great and we totally agree! We arrived and were checked in straight away, as it was our honeymoon I asked if there was any chance we could have an upgrade. Unfortunately all of the superior rooms were booked, but the hotel put us into a corner room on the 36th floor that was very spacious and clean. The room was great with a huge king sized bed and lovely bathroom. Also the rooms were cleaned every day and also complimentary bottles of water left in our room. We visited the roof top bar on a couple of occasions, yes very pricey but the views are absolutely amazing so makes the drinks worth every penny! I would recommend going up there for a couple of drinks at sunset, watching the skyline go from daylight to the bright lights of the city is a truly amazing thing to see! The staff in the hotel bar were lovely, very helpful.The hotel is located right next to Times Square, we couldn't have chosen a more central location! Walk down the street and you're on Times Square, walk up the street and you're on fifth avenue, perfect! Great hotel, great staff, great location! Couldn't recommend this hotel enough!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at Hyatt Times Square in March 2015 celebrating our Honeymoon. We chose the hotel based on the location, seemingly modern design and rooftop bar - and we were not disappointed. All the staff are a true asset to the place, always so friendly, happy to help - nothing is too much trouble. A special mention to Ryan, the concierge, who was such an amazing help during the stay booking us book bus tours, restaurant reservations, and trips. The hotel itself is beautifully clean and modern, great WIFI in all areas, and fab views (We had a corner room on the 37th floor). The bed was huge and comfortable, the bath had a lovely shower and underfloor heating. I cannot speak more highly of the hotel, and would 100% return to stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: During my recent stay, I was locked out of my room for 30 minutes when the electronic door mechanism failed. This was after a full day of meetings and immediately before an important company dinner. What was most appalling was that despite repeated phone calls from a staff member, it took a full 25 minutes (from the time the reception clerk confirmed it was not my key card but rather the mechanism that was not functioning) for a maintenance/engineering person to come address the problem, which turned out to be a dead battery. My questions:1. Why employ a door mechanism that cannot be overridden by a master key, which all staff members have? What if there had been an emergency?2. Why cannot the staff check door batteries daily, as they (should) do the lights in the room, for example? 3. How could the responsiveness of maintenance/engineering team be improved? The above event took place at 5 pm on a weekday....I can only imagine the delay were this to take place late night on the weekend.While the reception clerk who helped me (Spencer) was helpful and extremely apologetic, I believe the situation above merits the attention of the GM (whose name I was able to extract from front desk only after repeated questioning) or other senior management. The follow up call I received from the desk manager following the incident is simply insufficient given the delay/inconvenience that resulted in this case. I cannot imagine that this has not happened to other guests and would hope it would be addressed at the corporate level.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights last week and the hotel was great. Quick check in ( did have to come down and collect my bags but they were very busy ). Front desk staff were great and very helpful, organised a helicopter ride on our last day for us @ Port 6 south street heliport which was superb!Some great complementary items available such as toiletries/bottled water etc. Hotel/room was spotless, would definitely come back next time we are in New York. The fella's outside that organise cabs etc were great as we were a party of 6 and needed bigger vehicles, they sorted this in no time. Hotel is 1 minute from times square with 2 bars either side and a great deli next door. We treated ourselves to a few drinks up on the 54th Floor roof bar on last night, very pricey but well worth it, in the summer that bar would be amazing sitting outside and the views are superb.Great hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Like any hotel in Times Square you will have a great location and nice view. This does come at a cost though, the rooms are very expensive and all the amenities cost you another fee. If money is not option, this is your place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights.Location was awesome. Nice and clean like it should be. Bed was very comfortable.Checkin was great. I asked if a high floor was possible. Was told it was not possible as most guests have checked in earlier. I arrived at 7pm so this must be considered late. Though I was given $50 credit to use at the Bar on floor 54 as a token of not having a high floor.When checking in I asked if a late checkout was possible of 6pm as I had a flight at midnight to South America and wanted a place to have a rest before going to the airport. I was advised that 12pm could only be done and a charge of $50 plus taxes each hour after that. If I had of known this I would have booked another night as this option is a lot cheaper. A day us room was not offered at checkin.I checked out at 12pm and left my bags at the hotel for the afternoon. Before collecting my bags I had time to visit the bar on the 54th floor and had a drink. I mentioned I was given credit on the room which I had not used. The staff said they rang reception and was told they were not able to locate the credit I told them about and suggested I pay for the drink and go check with reception myself.I collected my bags and then was going to see reception but saw my ride to the airport had arrived so I was not able to sort this out at reception.I did enjoy my stay and would stay again. Though I would not trust the information given by staff. For a Hyatt brand I was expecting better service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Talk about being steps from the most exciting place on earth...Times Square. We chose the Hyatt Times Square because we know Hyatt always provide quality product with good value. We could walk out the door and be at any of the Broadway Theaters in less than 5 minutes. We saw two of the best plays (Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time and Gentleman's Guide to Love and Murder) ever. While at the Hyatt, make sure you go to the rooftop bar. the veranda and views are breathtaking. It will save you the $30 it costs to go to the Top of the Rock! Be sure to sit window side for breakfast at the street level restaurant. You can watch the world go by.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good service, attention to all details, perfect location. Very educated employees, ready to help and to give you a better advise. 100% aproved. I recomend. Great for business, near of main activities in NY

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So the good things - location is great, just off Times Square and with our 'view' room you did get a high floor (34th) and a view of Times Square and am sure this gets even higher and better as you go up the room categories. The room itself was very nice - large for New York, modern and large bathroom as well. Really smartly done. Coffee maker with complimentary mineral water was a nice touch. Gym on site as well and free wifi.The not so good things - the 'Hyatt has it concept' is great - room includes the basics and then there's a list of items you can order from housekeeping for free, e.g. shower gel (instead of soap and shampoo), kettle, vanity kit, foam pillows etc. The problem is the execution of delivering what you order - we ordered 4 things and it took 4 calls to get them all, each time we ordered we got the first thing requested but none of the others! Felt a bit sorry for the poor housekeeping guy who had to make 3 additional visits because the Guest Services person couldn't process the order properly! The other issue which really annoyed me - we asked Concierge to book us a restaurant for the evening as we were meeting up with some friends. He confirmed that it was all done, great we thought, until we got to the restaurant and they had no confirmation for us......they later discovered that concierge had booked us in to the restaurant 4 days later - luckily the restaurant were able to seat us after a 30 min wait but very embarrassing for us and annoying when we wanted an early dinner as we had our 9 month old daughter with us - we did complain to a different concierge gentleman on our return to the hotel so hopefully the person in question has now been taught how to use his fancy online booking system!So in summary, hotel location, rooms and features were superb, Guest Services and Concierge let it down on this occasion.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for a long weekend. We were checked in by Nico, who was professional and very personable. He is an asset to the corporation. We were also impressed with the door men, who greeted us every time we left and arrived back with "have a good day!" and a smile. The location is great. The room was nice, with a great view. It was a little small, but we enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took our 6 year old daughter as I am expecting in 2 weeks. Last hooray before baby for here. We valet parked which was easy. The valets were very kind. Check was great Ravi got out daughter a chocolate bar and I asked if we could upgrade to a floor with a good view, a reasonable price to do so. We got a corner unit on the 30th floor that was great. 1 king bed, my daughter slept on the chair with ottoman which she liked. Ravi made sure we has lots of pillows for me as pregnant ladies need and a large feather duvet cover for my daughter. He also brought up some chocolates. He is really a great asset to Hyatt. Going in and out of hotel the valets always opened door. Walter was great. Staff in hotel and restaurant were great. Only complaint lies with no kids in rooftop bar- which I understand and the hotel restaurant. We were way to tired after American girl store, toys r us and Lego store to go out and eat. The prices are on par with Manhattan and hotels- the food portions are not. I had the onion soup which was overly sweet and the watercress salad that was so tiny maybe 3/4 cup of watercress and 2 small slivers of apples. My husband had carrot soup which was good and flat iron steak which was 3 maybe 4 oz tops that came with a grilled green onion for $30. If it weren't for the bread that came with soup we have gone up hungry. My daughter enjoyed her pasta. We live only across the river- we will be back for an adult weekend when I can drink. I'm usually a Marriott fan- never have stayed in Hyatt properties- I will know. Whoever runs this property does a great job with employees. They are all happy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I travelled to New York with my now husband to celebrate my birthday and our marriage (both occurring while staying at the Hyatt). The only thing I found really disappointing about our stay was that there were very clear notes in the booking stating the above (I'm a travel agent, I put them there myself) but neither of these events were ever mentioned - We weren't fishing for upgrades or anything but a "Congratulations!" would have been nice.We checked in late due to a flight delay and the staff member at the front desk (Brian) was very hospitable. He gave us some recommendations for restaurants that were still open as well as some advice on how to get well-priced Broadway tickets. He also spent a good amount of time figuring out which room to allocate to us with the best view which was nice.Our room was located on the 32nd floor on the corner of the building and had a great view of Times Square which we later found out is a blessing and a curse, especially for light sleepers. The curtains don't block out all of the light from the street below and combined with the noise of the loud heating I struggled to fall/stay asleep. Heavy sleepers wouldn't have an issue. This particular room was well appointed, more than spacious enough for the two of us and the bed was very comfortable. I had a slight issue with the bathroom as there is a great big beautiful shower with a tiny little shower head, making over half of the space wasted. There is a rainfall shower head but it's not entirely useful for women not wanting to drench their hair in every shower and still creates a huge wasted space.The elevators are an absolute nightmare when you are located somewhere towards the middle of the high rise. 3 out of 5 elevators are designated for rooms 25 and up however one of them remained on level "C" and wouldn't budge. We found ourselves playing a lot of games of Chicken and seeing who would crack and make a B-Line for the stairs. Often we would be waiting for 10 minutes + to get down to the lobby which was frustrating as we could hear both lifts going up and down without stopping. Going back up was worse on the weekend because of regular guests as well as the general public making their way to Bar 54.Location-wise there are few other properties comparable to the Hyatt. Literally steps away from the middle of times Square and Broadway it made the perfect base location for us as we wanted to see a lot of shows. Walking distance to other points of interest like Central Park and there are subway stations within a few short minutes as well.All things taken in to account the Hyatt is great in a lot of ways but there are a few kinks that need ironing out such as attention to the purpose of travel, the shower heads and the issue with the elevators. We'd definitely stay here again if the price was reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just spent 5 nights at this hotel over the St Patricks Day celebrations. Modern clean hotel with spacious room for a Time Square location. View from roof top bar was good with The Chrysler Building just off to the left and Time Square down on the right.Staff were friendly and more than happy to help.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very close to Times Square. Fabulous reception staff we dealt with Ravi just the correct amount of friendliness mixed with professionalism. Our room was on the 52nd floor and it was just perfect. Wifi strength brilliant. Cleanliness brilliant the maid must polish the chrome it was amazing. Bed just so comfy after a day of lots of walking so welcoming. My only slight negative and I do mean slight was the concierge service very knowledgeable but sometimes as tourist we are not quite sure what is always best so just because we ask about one thing dont be afraid to advise a similiar alternative we may not be aware of, I only say this because we did a tour that we asked the concierge to book, later just talking with the hotel restaurant staff they mentioned something else and we thot wow we should have done that. But its only a slight negative and on my return to New York I will definately return here and would advise anyone to stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff are serviceminded,effective and nice. The rooms are great. You can get almost everything you want. If you are missing a yogamat, curlingiron etc they will provide it There is a good spaced and well equipped fitness room. Open 24 hours Feels like everything is close from this hotel

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you search a very good hotel in time square, which remain nevertheless calm : this is the place to be. The rooms are pretty new and very clean. And the roof top bar is nice even if it is not cheap. The snack bar at the entrance proposes very good salads. We hope the hotel will keep the same quality levels in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean rooms, attentive service, great concierge recommendations. My only complaint was the food for room service and the restaurant. It was sub-par, especially for the price but many other options in the area..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for six nights last November. We had originally booked another hotel but had second thoughts at the last minute, and I'm so glad we decided to stay here! The location was fantastic!!! This was my first trip to New York, and I had initially thought I would prefer a hotel away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. But as it turns out, I love the energy and excitement of that area! Our room was pretty high (we were in a deluxe view king), and we could hear some street noise, but certainly not enough to disturb our rest. The rooms are set up so that you really don't hear noise from the adjacent rooms (which to me, is often the most annoying thing about a hotel). The room was very nice - not huge, but plenty of room and the bathroom was pretty roomy. I thought the bed was very comfortable. I had read a couple of reviews prior to our trip where some people complained about there being only a fitted sheet and a comforter, but no top sheet on the bed. That was a little concerning to me because it seemed strange, but it turned out not to be a big deal at all. Women may want to consider taking a makeup mirror because I wasn't crazy about the lighting in the bathroom, but I may be more picky than most about that kind of thing. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful except for one conversation my husband had with a concierge concerning transportation in the city. He found her to be less than helpful. But for the most part, everyone was great! Like I said, the location is great! Just a few steps from the excitement of Times Square, but also close to Rockefeller Center and even the walk to Central Park wasn't bad. I would definitely stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for my birthday weekend and it was perfect. From Chester welcoming us late on Friday to having toothpaste delivered (there's always something) to the rooftop bar and te charming doorman that put us in a cab on Sunday. Great room, very spacious for NYC. Floor to ceiling windows with glimpses of Times Square. Will return

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed there with friends, the view from the 20th floor was amazing. The room in general was very comfortable, so was the bed and the lightning was really cool. Not only the location is the best part of the hotel. It's a great place to spend a fancy weekend in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square was the best host hotel EVER for my NYC wedding! From speaking with the events team (Marisa Judge) prior to the wedding, through each phase of our stay was PERFECT! We were treated like ROYALTY! I am so impressed by their customer care-- I have to break it down:1.) Marisa helped me plan every part of my pre- and post wedding events. She even coordinated with me to meet with my florist the evening before our ceremony, and took great care of our flowers before and after the wedding. The night before the big event we had a small, pre-wedding reception in the VIP area of the beautiful Bar 54 at the very top of the hotel. My guests were amazed by the view and the wonderful food-- I was amazed by the exceptional service. The staff went out of their way to cater to our every need. A great way for our families to mix and mingle.2.) The hotel General Manager delivered a hand written card congratulating us on our marriage, and later sent a gift of champagne and strawberries. So special.3.) Everyone on staff treated us like CELEBRITIES....and we had a small wedding group ! I have never had such wonderful customer service (and we are super picky)! Our families are very well traveled, and everyone remarked on the superior service and quality food (watch out for the bar punch...it sneaks up on you! LOL!)4.) I had a post- wedding breakfast at the hotel restaurant, T45 , which was consistent with the excellent service of the roof top lounge. The food was great, but most importantly-- they placed my wedding flowers (which had been graciously stored in the hotel coolers) ON THE BREAKFAST TABLES! So sweet and kind.5.) The hotel has wonderful, clean, modern rooms with the best views. All of my guests were wowed by how large the rooms were-- considering this was NYC. The housekeeping is immaculate.6.) Finally, and most importantly, we stayed well within our budget for a very upscale, lovely wedding weekend in New York.Every detail was covered by the Hyatt Times Square, and I cannot thank them enough. I look forward to spending my 1 year anniversary there. Marisa, the GM, and the entire team are an example of hospitality at its best.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here during a quick business trip to NYC and was not disappointed. From the lobby to the hallways to the rooms, everything was clean and updated. Customer service was always available with questions and very helpful. The location is pretty amazing if you are planning to see shows in the Theater District, eat in Hell's Kitchen and cruise Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We Hotwired a night here and have only positive comments. It deserves to move up in the TA ratings—very little to fault at all. (Yenny at the front desk was a sweetheart.) Management has thought of everything that today's traveler wants, from soundproofing to international adapters to a quiet, quick-flush toilet to easy climate control. I particularly liked the handsome bathroom, with both rain shower and hand-held, plus lots of room for toiletries. The room wasn't enormous but it was well laid-out, with both an armchair/ottoman plus a desk chair. Great king bed with perfect pillows and linens. Stylish, solid, comfortable. And the rooftop bar is a stellar hangout for a drink overlooking Midtown and Times Square. Overall this is a truly great choice in the heart of NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you want to experience Times Square there is no better location. Easy to get anywhere in Manhattan and walking distance to most places. The hotel is everything you expect from Hyatt - modern, clean and stylish. Add a great diner in the lobby and a rooftop bar. Finally the staff are exeptional and make you feel welcome and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: There for business, great location for shopping, dining or just hanging out. The staff really cater to taking care of you. I enjoyed my stay as this is a great hotel with a perfect location with aview and clean rooms. I have stayed at hotels that claim to be 4-star, well lets just say this establishment is the real deal. The reason for 4 stars is my meal wasn't the greatest, it was just ok I had breakfast. I hope it was just a fluke, because the place is without a doubt really nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect stay. The location was great, very near train stations, Minskoff Theatre and many others but (thankfully) a block over from Times Square so the room was actually peaceful. Every hotel employee we interacted with was helpful, friendly, just all around pleasant. Well done Hyatt - you greatly exceeded my expectations. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visit mid January 2015, arrived late due to Heathrow losing cases, upon arrival front desk were informed of the dilemma and were most helpful. Most of our clothes and toiletries were in the missing cases, the hotel sent to our room (50 floor) everything we required all toiletries, phone chargers, makeup mirror and items i did not realise i needed... brilliant .the room was large, bed large windows floor to ceiling looking up to the rockerfella building and a side view of times square. Four days with luggage still lost the hotel reception staff did there utmost trying to locate the luggage, finally tracking it down and having it delivered to us at 02.00am.jfk new york is as bad as Heathrow. Food in the hyatt is excellent, although we did eat out quite often.highly recommend the hyatt times square. Will be there again next year. Ps ask for the higher floors for the view over the city ,and take the bus tour to get your barings, if you like walking you can walk to most sights from the hotel comfortably. Hope you find this helpful. 10/10 for the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Arrived 2 hours early but was able to check in with ease. Staff were friendly and efficient. Our room on the 19th floor was spotlessly clean, and very welcoming. They provided a safe, fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. The location could not be better and everything is on your doorstep. Stayed 4 days and didn't have a single issue whilst there. When checking out they held our luggage until the afternoon so we could make use of the 4 hours before we had to leave for JFK airport. Requested the doorman to hail a cab for us, which would be $60 flat rate plus tips, and was offered a private SUV which was already parked up and waiting for $85 all in. Luxury ride at a bargain price. Great holiday, great hotel. Would most definitely return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel, you can't go wrong. Property is definitely up to Hyatt's standards. Arrived early from overnight flight form west coast and received a room well before check-in time. Very accommodating. Much nicer than the Marriott times square or intercontinental times square --stayed at both before. Very cool rooftop bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is right in the heart of the action. It is super close to several different metro lines which makes navigating the city a breeze.The rooms are generously sized for NYC and have all the expected mod cons. The amenities are great - I especially appreciated getting things like complimentary mouth wash and lint removers.I definitely recommend going up to the 54th floor bar for a drink. The view from the top is amazing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived to the hotel earlier than the check in time, however that wasn't an issue at well, the checkin process was really quick and fast and with a smile. It's always nice when front desk staff greet you nicely and make you feel welcome on to the property, it sets a nice tone to the rest of your stay. The room surpassed all expectations, great views, a king bed, an actual king bed and not just two beds pushed together, great amenities, massive tv, a multimedia station on the desk providing ports for devices and to connect your devices to watch through the tv. The bed was comfortable and the room was serviced to a very high standard. Beyond this, there were extra toiletries that the hotel provided free of charge if and when required. The location itself is brilliant. Close to Times Square but around the corner away from the glare of the lights so you don't have the lights reflecting into your room as you try to sleep, 3 mins away from Broadway theatres that stage the most popular shows like Book of Mormon, the lion king, Chicago etc. a 10 minute walk to Hell's Kitchen and best of all, really close to the 42nd and 49th street metros which will get you anywhere in Manhattan and beyond. I can't rate this hotel highly enough, check out the bar on the 54th floor as well. The staff were really helpful and awesome, at no point did it feel like we were burdening them. The only critique I would have is that the concierge always had a wait time when we tried to use the service, maybe have another concierge for the busier periods during the day.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Second weekend we were here this month and loved the hotel both times. Had to write this time because I was amazed how wonderful & friendly Yanni was when I checked in. The hotel was great! We had a standard king bed, both times, but this time it was a smaller room, but adequate. Clean, modern room and the best is a fabulous location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Arrived at this lovely hotel to be greeted by very welcoming reception staff. Room was lovely and clean and had a great view. Very close to Times Square. Loved the roof top bar which had great views. Shower was really powerful. Would definitely staff here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a week and chose the hotel based on a mix of the design, location and great reviews. The location is fantastic and the staff really are good, for me this makes or breaks a hotel. The staff were genuinely warm and friendly on check in and regularly wished us a good evening or welcome back on leaving/returning to the hotel. We were on the 35th floor in a corner room with views of Times Square. Great view and although this isn't why we chose the hotel it was a really nice feature. We were in a standard King - the room was a very good size for the location and the look of the room and bathroom were great. The room did look a bit tired but this was mainly due to poor design - there were lots of softwood surfaces which had suffered lots of watermarks through use, likewise the bathroom could have benefited from some thought put in to the tile grouting which looked tired. There could also be more attention to cleaning - there were a couple of stray hairs and strangely half a green humbug on the bathroom floor which was really obvious so not sure how it was missed. Usually these things would turn me off a hotel and reduce the rating but everything else, staff especially, were excellent so I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again. I probably wouldn't recommend the bar though - not that many seats have good views and there are far better views and drinks around Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This new Hyatt is great for travellers wanting to be close to Times Square and Mid Town NY. You are half a block away from Times Square and 2 blocks from the Rockeller Center. The hotel is new and the rooms are very nice, great beds!. The room has a small refrigerator for you drinks. Bathroom is fine. It has a very good 24hr gym. The Skylounge at the top has a great view as did my room from the 41st floor. The lacking point is their is only one small restaurant in the lobby and room service is limited, but who wants to have room service in NY! There a lot's of place close to eat, including a Starbucks.Staff is friendly and helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were blown away with this hotel , affordable, clean and new throughout. The views from the room were amazing. The staff were so nice and always up for a chat and there to help you with anything you needed. The in room service was great , quick service and good meals. The rooftop bar had the best views of New York and great drinks and meals as well. Every time we returned from our day we were welcomed back with a smile . It was smack bang in the centre of everything. I would never stay anywhere else ! 10 stars !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed 5 days. Staff is very friendly and helpful . They treat you as if You are important . Very pleasant. All questions and request were speedily handled . They provide bottles water As much as desired to your room. There is a refrigerator in the room . The rooms are large and fresh. I almost forgot I was in New York. I ordered food from an outside location which was allowed , and the delivery guy was escorted to and from my door. The hotel is 2 blocks from Times Square and 3 blocks from the subway station. Being from NOLA I never expected the Big Apple to Be Big Easy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Got stranded in NYC for a couple of days due to recent winter storm Thor. So thought we make the most and head for Manhattan. Despite having our trip interrupted and my wife's luggage lost the awesome staff and comforttable Hyatt Times Square room made us forget our troubles and our unscheduled visit to NYC a real treat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt was located in good walking distance to almost everything. Food is right around the corner and I had complementary Starbucks in my room everyday. The SkyLounge is also very nice and has a beautiful view of the city; as did my 51st floor room. The doormen have been particularly helpful; Aaron went ABOVE and BEYOND to help every afternoon I went out! I travel alone and he easily told me the best places to see and how to get to each one. I would have had a much tougher time getting around if it weren't for his expertise. I even saw him run up and down 45th street to aid other hotel guests in catching Taxis and Uber Cars. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel location, staff and service were great! Ravi saved us after a miserable day of travel with delayed, cancelled flights due to winter storm, March 6, 2015. New York hotel rooms are a little smaller; however, sleek, stylish decor was classy and CoMFORTABLE! Staff was friendly and very helpful. Restaurant food was tasty, but a little pricy. Have no fear! There is a wonderful deli two doors down that serves fresh, WONDERFUL goods. This hotel is located steps away from Times Square and the theater district! Rooms are reasonably priced compared to other hotels in the area. From our room on the 50th floor we could see some of Times Square. We put our $$ into location, saving on cabs and time. Just do it! You will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good: The location, decent rooms, novel MoMA inspired décor and a bar upstairs that is a wonderful spot for a quick drink and light bite. Rooms are quiet. Bad: New hotel but broken handles marred experience in shower. No coffee maker in room. ( Starbucks across the street). The lobby is not provisional, it is non-existent. Ugly: Although some may appreciate smarmy front desk clerks. I do not. Making inferences and judgments about a guest from their ID is not cool. Not even if it is part of their "well we try to make small talk". As a frequent traveler, I noticed a similarity between this bewildering lack of finesse and tact as reminding me of a Boston Hyatt property that has done the same on multiple times. Turns out they have same GM. UGH. It goes beyond tact- some of the questions are basically ignorant and indicate a lack of observation. There is a reason talking about the weather is safe! Other hotels, more modest ones handle this basic facet of hospitality. coming in and out of the hotel, the chatter from the Banana Republic staff is interesting and questionable. The bedding was fine and the room was nice and quiet despite its proximity. Some recycling considered. Ample outlets. The bar upstairs is nice though seating is frustrating. All the seats had reserved signs on them early in the evening so the one is stuck with limited options. Host tried to do his best. Servers were kinda not with it. Must be the height. If you get this property or choose to stay here, you will notice that the room itself and the location are best. The people- not so much. I felt like I could walk around the bed and I am not under the impression that I was given any nice room. I called about the handle and they offered to fix it in the wee hours.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with my wife and friends ,had free room upgrade courtesy of checkin receptionist Ravi, fantastic view from 44 floor , great location just 200yds from centre of time square. Rooms large enough and very clean , Great roof top bar just a bit priceyWhen at airport realised we had left our passports in hotel room , phoned the manager Noah who was so helpful and arranged courier to deliver to airport in the nick of time to catch our flight !Can't speak more highly of the staff

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After having my flight out of NYC cancelled thanks to yet another blizzard, I had to quickly find a room for the night, and was excited to see a very reasonable rate for a Hyatt in Manhattan.In terms of the positives - the check in staff were excellent and got me a lovely room for early check-in - I had to take a twin rather than a king room in order to check in early, but it wasn't an issue. The room is large for Manhattan standards, and everything is nice and new and for the most part works (one electrical outlets in my room didn't work but the others did). The negatives - having to call the front desk to have things like shower gel and tea delivered seemed ridiculous for a Hyatt hotel. Not only that, but the card on the study desk in the room which tells you to just dial 0 for anything you need, also says "we'll place the items in a bag on your doorknob". This implied to me that housekeeping would just leave the items in the bag and not disturb me. But I ordered and heard the housekeeping knock - they knocked three times before then trying to enter the room. I assume the whole thing is a ploy to not only save money for the hotel, but earn additional tips as well. This is not what I'd expect from a 4 star NYC hotel. Not only that - but when you realise you forgot to order something, then you have to deal with the whole rigmarole again.The other negative is the room service - I was looking forward to a nice, good quality burger given that it's a Hyatt in the US. I was delivered a meal in a bag with plastic cutlery and a surly delivery man who could have come from the fast foot joint down the road. The meal was barely edible, and for almost $25 for one cold, mediocre burger I would have been better off going to McDonald's around the corner. In addition - the room service menu clearly states that 18% service charge is added to the bill - yet the slip I was given to sign stated "suggested gratuities" of 15-20% and the delivery man looked angry I didn't leave more. My opinion of the Hyatt has gone completely downhill and it's made my IGH/Hyatt Gold Passport dilemma easy. It's IHG from now on.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: my company booked for me in this for 4 days , and was a remarkble place , however It was crowd at evening , but it still a nice place. I like the view in my room , and the weather was really nice their. I hope I will visit this hotel again , because I will discover new palces their.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: New hotel at excellent location. Room and bathroom (shower only) of good size. Nice decor. Very comfortable bed. View is just OK (view room). Price is OK (NY style ☺) Friendly and helpful staff. Delicious breakfast with good service. Free Wi-Fi. Bathroom has a floor heating – but control panel not easy to operate. Empty minibar fridge – but I guess it’s OK at this location.The only very significant and weird disadvantage for 4* hotel is it’s policy to provide amenities-free room to the guest: there is no shower gel in the bathroom, neither any other basic bathroom’s stuff, nor slippers or bathrobe etc. All these are available. But you have to call and ask! I believe it lets the hotel to cut costs, but it completely unacceptable to my mind. I would even was considering to put 3* to otherwise almost perfect hotel…

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The size of the room was incredible for a NY hotel, we where 4 girls in one room. The hotel was so clean, all the staff was super friendly. Loved it. Close to the theather district.Would highly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Newly built, bang up-to-date with a swish, urban feel and sleek, contemporary-designed rooms. It's smack-bang in the middle of the Theatre District and just a hundred yards or so from Times Square proper. It has a ground floor café and top floor observation deck with a late-opening cocktail lounge. The rooms are arranged eight per floor lending a boutique-feel and have full floor-to-ceiling windows. The décor is very modern - pure white linen! - and cleanliness/housekeeping is excellent. We only stayed 2 nights and on the first night accidentally got a splash of drink on the bedcover - the bed was completely remade with fresh linen before the second night without us even asking. The room had a HUGE flat-screen TV with plenty of channels, the bed was enormous and very comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. We stayed on the 20th floor and found there was really good sound-proofing, we had a great night's sleep. The only addition we would have enjoyed (being soft Brits, unused to -9C!) would be a blanket for the bed - I'm sure if we'd asked the staff they would have found us one but it wasn't a big enough deal to put anyone out. The staff were really helpful - especially Nico - even looked after our bags for us after we checked out so we could do some more shopping before going home. We would stay here again and would recommend it to anybody.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent four days at the hotel. It is a great and central location for holidays as it is close to all theatres, shopping and public transportation. The hotel is very modern and offers free wifi, a new gym and spa. We had a Corner Suite with a great view. A downside was certainly the check-in. The check-in time is at 4pm. We informed the hotel in advance that we arrive from a longhaul flight between 3-4 pm. As we arrived st 3.30pm the room was not ready and no other option was offered. We were told to wait and no refreshment was offered. At 4pm we checked again and the room was still not ready. We asked for another employee as the woman at the reception was very unfriendly and did not show any enthusiasm to find a solution. We insisted that we get a room and we were offered an upgrade to a corner suite by Anthony who was extremely friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: nice friendly staff, go out of their way to please and oblige. The reservations dept were good and they had the adjoining room organized for our kids. Clean rooms and good servicing. The location is great for going around the area. Good security and it makes you feel safe in New York. The chocolate cookies in the coffee shop downstairs were delicious. It sells out quickly too. The corner suites are nice, but they have only one bathroom. Wished they had one for the guests too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Trip Advisor prompted me to review this hotel so here we go. We stayed just one night, driving up from Maryland for my daughter's birthday. My wife and our othe daughter saw a show (Aladdin) which was only a few blocks away. I guess I have some Hyatt status because they had a room for us at 11AM (and gave me a really nice oom on the 53rd floor). The reception was grand. The young lady at check in can't remember name) picked up it was said daughter's birthday. She sent up brownies and a voucher for a manicure. Sold for life! Beds super comfy, dad was happily snugged in (the temp was 3 degrees that night) while females soaked up the lights. Fantastic stay. Parking about $60, but we did not take the train so that was cool. Departed early on a Saturday morning..no traffic, 8 minutes to the Lincoln Tunnel, abd back home in 3 1/2 hours, even stopping for gas. Oh, and the doorman was an exceptionally cool young guy too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this property in December 2015 when visiting the city at Christmastime with my niece. Had a top floor and an awesome view. Rooms was clean and very quiet. The check in team was awesome and the room we were assigned was the best! Although we wanted to visit the rooftop lounge, we could not get in because my niece was only 16. I thought we could go in for tapas, but you had to be 21. The bell team was great and very accommodating when taking our suitcases and bags. We saw a show while in town and the bell team kept our bags all afternoon. Will say our bag of Sprinkles cupcakes were in perfect shape after coming back for our bags five hours later. The doormen (Steve I think his name was), was very helpful and even shared a local restaurant for breakfast. The hotel is near a few excellent Irish pubs and two short blocks from Bryant Park which is nice to visit during Christmas. Very friendly and the experience staying at this property in December was one of the best! Location is excellent and central to many places we visited while in town.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here with my teenage son for 4 nights. We were so impressed. The staff are lovely, courteous and welcoming right down to the doorman outside the building. The Concierge was really helpful too telling us which trains to catch on the subway. The location is superb, central and within easy walking distance of the Empire State and the Rockerfeller centre. Our room on the 24th floor overlooked Times Square and we awoke to snow falling on day two. The view was so awesome we struggled to close the curtains! The room we had, deluxe 2 queens, was spacious for NY, spotless and quiet. Beautiful modern room and bathroom and comfortable beds. Good coffee maker for mornings. Could not fully enjoy Bar 54, the highest in NY because my travel companion was not old enough, but the view from the deck outside the bar is worth the visit. Could not fault the hotel, it was a dream trip!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is the best hotel I have stayed in so far in NYC. I ended up getting the property on Priceline during AllStar weekend and fashion week for $269 a night. We had an amazing view on the 45th floor. The room was clean, very trendy and the rain shower and heated floors in the bathroom were amazing. The temperature was really cold and wet outside to to come back to this retreat was great. The lobby is very small so don't expect much there. The front desk staff were really helpful and even upgraded us to a room with doubles. The room had a mini fridge which was great, only thing missing was a microwave. We even received complementary water everyday. Great stay very close to time square maybe a 3 min walk at most. Roughly about a 10 or 15 min walk to the gardens but you can always take the train.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Imagine a bunch of shoe boxes piled 54 stories high and that's the Hyatt. Cheap, modern design that will not wear well. There's no chairs in the rooms, so where do you go to relax? The hotel bar? Not here, you don't. The rooftop bar is packed with tourists, with no allowance for guest seating. The downstairs bar has diner- style backless stools, so no comfort there. The worst part of this hotel, however, is the elevators have horribly long wait times and are packed with non- guests. I waited over ten minutes to get to my room. Unacceptable. Don't bother staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: They say that location is everything and this hotel gets 4 stars just for that alone. A favorite of ours and one that is in the center of everything. A great roof top bar and staff who bend over backwards to what they can for you. We will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was phenomenal. Hotel was just around the corner from Times Square and down the street from a good size subway stop. Broadway shows were just a minutes walk away. Staff is super friendly and every accommodating. Stayed in a standard room with a king bed that was top notch. All the finishings were great and the room had modern-contemporary decor. Room service was good and priced similar to other restaurants in the area. The only complaint about this hotel would be their elevator situation. They only have 3 elevators that take you to floors above 25. At night, when everyone is trying to get to the rooftop bar, plan on waiting a while before getting in an elevator. Didn't seem like there would be an issue if you stayed on floor 25 or below, so if the floor your room is on isn't a concern, shoot for the lower floors.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is perfectly located by time square but on a side street so it's quite. The hotel was shiny clean, the room and the public spaces as well. The staff was super friendly and attentive.The room was large (for a NY hotel). I stayed on the 50th floor and it was perfect. I arrived very early and got the room before the "official" check in time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good location near Times Square, spacious and quite rooms. Super friendly staff. However, 4 stars because of the non-complimentary w-lan which should be for free in such a hotel (only in the lobby for free). But defenitely a hotel to recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 6 days just before Christmas - had one of the high level suites. Views were amazing. Bathroom looked brand new but room furnishings a little tired but service was first rate and the diner was great for breakfast. Obviously a great location. Had a blast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My D and I just came from NYC. We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square and had a great time. Everything was just perfect! The people went the extra mile to make us feel comfortable and happy, the room service was excellent, the bed amazing, and the location couldn't be better. I would definitely go back to this wonderful hotel, and I can't wait for November when I am planning to go back to New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just stayed 4 nights at this property. Can't speak enough about all the above in the subject line. I booked a deluxe suite online and was upgraded to a corner suite. The arrival was late and check-in was quick and pleasant. The guys out front and at front desk great guys genuinely care to help and make sure your taken care of. Location for me was perfect central to all the touristy stuff and work meetings. Gym was modern, clean and 24 hours. If you care for fancy lobby's then go stay at the Sofitel or Intercontinental. But if you care about the rest stay at the Hyatt Times Square. Looking forward to coming back with my family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have recently returned from a 5 night stay at the Hyatt Times Square to celebrate my 25th birthday.The hotel was in an excellent location, just off 45th street so not directly on Times Square. Everything was within walking distance, Central Park, Grand Central Terminal, Madison Square Garden, Empire State building etc. We took the subway a few times which was easy to use. This was our second visit to New York so have explored a lot already. We had a room on the 10th floor which was clean and comfortable and the size was just about right - How much room do you need? We only had a shower which was fine, but no under floor heating like I have read on some reviews! The room was actually quite quiet and we couldn't hear any other guests walking past or in other rooms which was great. The entrance lobby is quite small especially when there is a lot of guests checking in and out. The staff were fine, although they were not as friendly as I have read in other reviews though. I wasn't told about the free WiFi when I checked in but I knew about it anyway. We didn't use the other hotel facilities such as the gym, spa or rooftop bar. All in all the hotel is a great base to explore New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived early in the morning after a red-eye flight. So we were tired, and wanting for a nap and a freshen up. I didn't expect to be able to get into our room so early, but the kind man at check-in found us a room on the 18th floor. We got a nice room with 2 doubles, lots of pillows, and we just sank into a nice sleep for a couple of hours. The room is spacious for NYC, and the bathrooom was equipped with modern fixtures - best of all, a rainfall shower head. We were most comfortable and service was polite and welcoming. Free wifi worked well too.If I had to find fault with anything, it would be that there was no luggage rack in the room. I requested for one but no-one delivered on that request. Oh well, definitely not a deal breaker though. Also, I found the carpet in the room to be a bit stained and dirty, but I always bring slippers so it didn't matter to me much.It was a wonderful location. We were close to 2 metro lines, which took us uptown and downtown so fast. Lots of food choices close walking distance. Also within walking distance were theatres to major Broadway plays.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: About the hotel: Great Hotel. The property appears to be new and it is well preserved. Clean. Very big rooms for New York standards, we were a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids) and there was plenty of room for everyone and for everyone luggage. Big bathroom. Helpful and friendly reception desk staff. FREE Internet and (surprisingly) very good speed connection, usually when a hotel offers free internet the speed is usually lagging at the best and unbearable in most cases. Not here, I could connect through VPN to my office and work as if I was at home or at the office itself. This is a big plus to this hotel. Another bright spot on this, there is no limit on connected devices (nowadays it is quite common to carry laptop, cellphone, iPad and hotels that impose a limit of devices connected are just annoying). I had a package delivered at the hotel and they did not charged me for it (which it also appears to be a new trend at some hotels)Great location, you are half block from Times Square which is great because you are very close but avoid the noise the fuzz of hotels that are located at Times Square. This hotel is indeed very quiet. Good restaurants nearby. If you are planning to go to a Broadway concert you are in the right place, it is a walking distance to all major theaters. It is also very close to lines Q, R, N, 1, 2, 3 (at Times Square - two blocks from the hotel) and 7 and 8 (at 6th Avenue - four blocks from the hotel) which is very convenient. Some cons: (i) the lobby is very small, there is no place for more than 7 or 8 people, this is not a big deal and it does no ruin the good experience at the hotel but it is a (small) issue when you need to wait for your flight and already checked out of your room; (ii) doorman service is bad, as it appears to be a New York hotel pattern (not my first time in New York that I get this "doorman attitude"), but it is still annoying. What is the purpose of a doorman if they do not see to be willing to help you with your luggage on arrival and departure? I had a car booked and 20 minutes earlier I talked to the doorman to let me know if a driver arrives as I would be inside due to the cold, well, 5 minutes past the scheduled pick up time I venture outside just to found my driver there waiting for me and the very same doorman that I asked before there standing right in front of the car. Not to mentioned that I had 6 pieces of luggage and had to carry all of them to the car as the doorman did not seem to bother helping. Really this was my only complain about this otherwise excellent hotel.Great location, you are half block from Times Square which is great because you are very close but avoid the noise the fuzz of hotels that are located at Times Square. This hotel is indeed very quiet. Good restaurants nearby. If you are planning to go to a Broadway concert you are in the right place, it is a walking distance to all major theaters. It is also very close to lines Q, R, N, 1, 2, 3 (at Times Square - two blocks from the hotel) and 7 and 8 (at 6th Avenue - four blocks from the hotel) which is very convenient. Some cons: (i) the lobby is very small, there is no place for more than 7 or 8 people, this is not a big deal and it does no ruin the good experience at the hotel but it is a (small) issue when you need to wait for your flight and already checked out of your room; (ii) doorman service is bad, as it appears to be a New York hotel pattern (not my first time in New York that I get this "doorman attitude"), but it is still annoying. What is the purpose of a doorman if they do not see to be willing to help you with your luggage on arrival and departure?
