I had a car booked and 20 minutes earlier I talked to the doorman to let me know if a driver arrives as I would be inside due to the cold, well, 5 minutes past the scheduled pick up time I venture outside just to found my driver there waiting for me and the very same doorman that I asked before there standing right in front of the car. Not to mentioned that I had 6 pieces of luggage and had to carry all of them to the car as the doorman did not seem to bother helping. Really this was my only complain about this otherwise excellent hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After our cruise from Bayone N.J. We decided to stay for 3 nights in New York. We chose the Hyatt in Times Square. We could not have picked a better Hotel or location. The Hotel was brilliant, the staff on the reception were really helpful and the rooms spotlessly clean. The bed was really comfortable and the room was maintained everyday to a very high standard. The Hotel is in a brilliant location and ideal to visit the attractions a lot of them within walking distance. The views from the room were brilliant and even better from the Bar on the 54th Floor which is a must visit. I really enjoyed our stay and only wish it could have been for longer. If I went back to New York I would not look anywhere else and book the Hyatt every time. A really top class Hotel in a great location. Thank-You.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in a great location for everything, easily walkable to mid town and uptown and the subway is handy for anything further afield. The hotel is modern and the staff are superb, extremely helpful with everything, special mention to Nico who went out of his way to help.Albeit the room are not the largest we have stayed in you need to remember you are in a city hotel, but they have everything you need and the hotel are also happy to even lend you items if you have forgotten them. The bed was extremely comfortable and we even had underfloor heating in the bathroom. This was out third trip to NYC but the first time in this hotel however when we next go back to the big apple we would certainly stay here again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Came for vacation away from Carnival in Trinidad, although it was cold, and a record breaking winter storm in NY. My wife and I had such a wonderful time since this hotel is located exactly where it needs to be. it's clean, classy and first class.Ryan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My son and I stayed here for a week. We arrived late friday night, and the staff in the reception was smiling and made us feel very welcome. The portiers outside are there for you, and helps you with everything. Even though it´s extremely cold outside this week they where always smiling and helping the guests. We had a standard room with a view, and since it "only" was on the 29´th floor, it still was a nice view down towards Times Square and the Paramount / Hard Rock Cafe building.The room was clean and big enough for the 2 of us. The bed was nice and the bathroom as well.The hotel offers free Wi-Fi, and this worked(we had the antenna right outside our door). We had 4-5 items online all the time, and there was no problem watching Netflix. The 42" TV in the room, offers channels for kids and adults.The Movie rent in the room is like New York it self, expensive($13 a movie). I had breakfast only 1 time at the hotel, this was great. I don´t think this restaurant/cafe was run by the hotel, but you could charge you're meals on the room. The location of the hotel was perfect. 1 minute walk, and you´re in the middle of Times Square. Easy walk to everything and a safe place to go outside.Can´t complain on anything. The only thing I noticed sometimes, was the sirens on the fire/police/ambulance outside, but this I guess you have to live with in a big city. I will definitely recommend this hotel if you´re staying in New York.Oh!....don´t forget to check out the view from the bar on the 54´th floor. Excellent view. Kids are not allowed (21 years) but they are allowed to go out with an adult to see the view.Service? We had a problem with the toilet at 1:30am. I phoned the reception, and it took no more than 2 minutes before the help was outside my door:)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for one night and were impressed with the property. The check in staff was very nice and help our bags while we walked around the city. Our room wasn't ready until past 5pm but it was understandable because we made our reservation last minute (day of check in). It's tough to beat the location if you want to be near Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here in June . I have to say what a great hotel this is but the staff were even better , nothing was to much trouble for them and if I had a problem they solved it . I booked the hotel through Priceline and didn't notice it was a king bed which was no good to me as I was staying there with my 26 yr old son . I explained to the front desk and they immediately called someone who said it's not a problem we will upgrade to a suite compliments of the Hyatt . I've stayed in lots of hotels in many countries but never been as impressed as I was with this hotel . The location is perfect and the front desk staff are amazing they will advise on all the best places to eat write down directions for sight seeing . They even advised us the best times of the day to go to certain attractions . I visit NYC often and I shall definitely be staying here again .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this hotel while on a 4 day trip to NYC. The hotel is new so it feels new and clean which is always nice but there's something about this hotel that makes it less than comfortable. The hotel front desk staff is nice but nothing special. The rooms were nice but very modern and plain- again nothing special. Oddly, there was an obvious tear right in the center of our duvet when we entered our room- wouldn't be acceptable at other hotels. It certainly wasn't a deal breaker but details are key to stand out from the other hundreds of hotels in NYC. It was very close to times square, which is nice. I probably wouldn't stay here again, not because it is bad, but because there are so many more hotels to try in NYC that might leave a bigger impression on me.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a new hotel on W 45 th in Times Square. We were greater by the bellman immediately and our luggage was taken out of the taxi. The check-in process was very smooth. The room was ready, even at 9:30 am. We had a good view of Times Square. The rooftop bar was great and we were each given a complimentary drink. The view from the bar is spectacular!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for Valentines weekend with my wife. Greeted by excellent staff, who were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay.Rooms were quite clean, fancy, nice heated floor in the bathroom, roomy shower, but...(and we heard a few people mentioning this during checkin)..when you make reservations for a single bed room, they'll tell you they're booked with those and upgrade you to double bed room which is around 100 bucks more/night, and that you might be able to slide into a single room by checkin. Of course a single room never becomes available..so you're stuck paying for the more expensive room. Valet parking 65 or so bucks a day. Little fees here and there add up by the time you check out..prepare for sticker shock.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Ideal location for sightseeing, steps away from Times Square. Front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. We stayed on the 46th floor in a "Deluxe King View"-room with floor to ceiling windows, truly stunning views. Surprisingly large room, nicely decorated and very quiet considering the location. Very comfy bed. Modern bathroom.Overall this is a great hotel, especially if you want to be close to all the touristy things. Only thing that let it down a bit was the cleaning. Hair in the bathtub and bathroom floor almost everyday, that's just not okay. I found it a bit strange that we had to request most of their toiletries, like shower gel and bathrobes.We ate downstairs once and ordered room service one evening, the food was great. Veggie burger - yum! Don't miss the rooftop bar, lovely views and the drinks were very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Can hardly describe! Impressive staff, always available and willing to go the extra mile. From the bell staff through management all were genuinely engaged in making this a special experience. The location is unbeatable. Walking distance to theaters, shopping, Bryant Park and many other must sees!!The room was spacious, for New York City, and well appointed. Views were spectacular. We will definitely return and this will be our first choice for accomadations. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just returned from my second stay at the Hyatt Times Square and I have to say, it could not have been better. Well, the weather could have been nicer but I can’t blame the folks at The Hyatt for the cold & rain. The last visit I experienced, and wrote about on TripAdvisor, I ran into a couple staff members that were not very outgoing or welcoming. This trip was the complete opposite as I was greeted at the curb by a friendly, helpful Bellman. As I entered the building I was again greeted by staff and directed to the front desk. The female front desk agent who checked me in was very friendly and professional. She stamped my key card envelope with #POTF – She said, “Part Of The Family.”I upgraded this trip to a suite for the extra space as I had work to do during the stay. I have to stay, if you are able to, get an upgrade and relax. I was fortunate enough to get a corner room and the views were awesome. (Request 4901)Being on the 49th floor I was concerned about long waits for the elevators. At no time during the 4 days did I ever have a long wait. THE ROOMThe living room has a very comfortable couch, side chair and a work desk. Unlike other hotels in the city this room came with a ton of outlets for cellphones and other electronic devices. There is also a great view from the living room windows – windows that open too by the way. If for some reason you don’t like the view of NYC, just draw the drapes and the room can be blacked out. (Note: Do not pull the drapes, there is a string behind them to open or close them. I found that out the hard way.)A small refrigerator is also provided in all rooms and comes in very handy. The bathroom is large with an interesting enclosed bathtub /shower area. (see photos) As I said in my previous review the water pressure in the shower is awesome, especially while using the wand. The bedroom is also a good size with a comfortable Hyatt bed. You will also find plenty of outlets in the bedroom. There are two open outlets on either side of the bed for the guest to use. The telephone power cord goes under the desk to another outlet. There was plenty of closet and drawer space for your clothes and other items in the bedroom and even a hook on the wall for a jacket or two. There is decent wifi in the room and also in the lobby area of the hotel. THE RESTAURANT One night I grabbed a burger and fries from the hotel restaurant located in the lobby and took it back to the room. I was shocked by how good they were, the burger was full of flavor and fries were crispy just how I like them. I highly recommend you try a burger while you’re there. ROOFTOP BARI stopped in at the Rooftop Bar just to see what was going on up there and was glad I did. It has a very relaxed vibe, not loud and crazy. There are no velvet ropes and security guards posted at the elevators that can intimidate people. I am looking forward to my next visit with friends so we can go spend time up there and enjoy the view. HOUSEKEEPINGThe Housekeeping Staff is outstanding, friendly, accommodating and professional. I usually sleep in late, certainly past the time they would show up to make up the room. I will call when I leave the room for lunch and when I return the room has always been made up for me. While going for ice one day I overheard a housekeeper singing while making up a room close to the ice machine. She had a very good voice too!LOCATIONJust steps from the Times Square area and many Broadway shows. The hotel is also right next door to Connolly’s Irish Pub & Restaurant – great food & a Phenomenal staff. Check out the photos of the room, rooftop bar, gym and grounds. Then go ahead and book your own stay – ask for a corner room if possible and of course the higher up the better.Thanks to Zach, Brendan, Nico, Walter and the entire staff at The Hyatt Times Square for a great stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is literally 30 seconds walk from time square and next door to a great Irish pub which makes a great option for a last pint before going back to the hotel.The rooms are surprisingly large for the location. The hotel is very new so you get all the perks of newer fixtures. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. Price was also reasonable considering the location. This is my new go-to hotel in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent a single night at this Hyatt. Chose it because of the location - right off Times Square. Front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. Gym was well equipped. Room was comfortable with fairly interesting decor for a chain hotel. There was a good shower and a nice view. Exactly what I would expect from a higher end Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend when we came to NYC for a Broadway show. Location was great! We walked to the theater. Tons of bars and restaurants around and not just the cheesy ones in Times Square. Rooms were clean and nice. We ate downstairs twice and the food was great. Staff was very nice. This is a smaller hyatt so not as much of a zoo as some others in NYC. The best part is the rooftop lounge. Beautiful views, especially at sunset. Drinks were expensive (rum and coke $17) but that's to be expected given location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Quiet entrance which is steps from a hectic times square which provides an ideal location for fun/business trip from Boston. Room was clean and well appointed. Everything you need at your finger tips, outlets, bottled water, high tech tv, fridge for storing drinks.Food and T45 was delicious! It is a fun and approachable take on old school favorites with gourmet twist. Great option for to-go items like coffee & snacks. Nico at the Front Office was my first interaction and was simply amazing. He immediately took role of host. He personally brought up luggage and was on top of letting us know when the second room was available. Little things like making sure we knew the amenities of the hotel and if we had any questions go a long way when you are staying at a new hotel. Aaron, the bellman, was another friendly face. Every time we were coming or going he made sure he would yield a taxi quickly or offer an alternative route—all with a sincere smile and attitude. Scott from Marilyn was amazing and quickly allowed me to sneak into the spa for a manicure! There are endless other associates that we came across that I wish I could go on!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely people and located at the heart of Times Square, this hotel has a reasonable price, is close to the major theaters in Manhattan, restaurants, subway stations, 5th avenue. We enjoyed the rooftop at 54th floor with very nice view, where there is a bar. The gym is also very nice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed there during our east coast trip and we choose the hotel because of the strategic location. It's only one block away from the busy glimmers Times Square. We've got a room with a view however, if you need a privacy this room is definitely not for you as the big windows give you a very open view to the buildings next door. We drawn the curtains every time we sleep at night and it's solved the problem. They have a rooftop bar however, due to a cold weather this January we didn't pay a visit but I'm sure it'll be nice during a warmer month. The concierge suggest us to take a tour bus (hop on - hop off) if you'd like to use your time wisely as the traffic could be congested in NYC. We choose one of the tour bus company which offers a tour of the uptown, downtown, Brooklyn loops, night tour and free cruise from one of a package for 2 days passes. Choose a cover top at double decker tour bus as it could be very cold during winter month especially when you're taking the night tour of a beautiful Manhattan. This 2 days passes are worth it as you can managed your time accordingly and you can see lots of historical landmarks of NYC. A visit to the 9/11 memorial is a must, and prepare lots of tissue in your pocket. There's irish bar next to the hotel and the food quite good, Starbucks just across the street if you need your morning coffee. But otherwise the cafe in the lobby level quite cosy. If you have to catch early morning flight there's usually a standby yellow cab or the hotel staff will offer to look one for you. Overall impression, it's a very good hotel in terms of location, facilities and value.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here between Christmas and New Year's Eve. It was of course a very busy time to be at Times Square, however this hotel was very convenient. The room was nice, not overly large, but not cramped. The shower was very nice and the beds comfortable. We ate breakfast in the cafe downstairs and the food and service were good. The elevators seemed congested. The staff was friendly however and the hotel seemed clean and well maintained. The club on the top floor offers a nice view. It is also convenient to the subways and within walking distance of shows, shopping, etc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located just outside of Times Square. The room was nice enough and the staff was helpful. Something was making a humming noise in our wall which disturbed my husband, but I'm not a light sleeper so it didn't really bother me much. The valet parking was very convenient. We were given free drink tickets because there was some confusion with our reservation (which was resolved) so we took the time to check out the roof top bar. It was December so we didn't have the opportunity to enjoy the outside portion which looked very nice, but the inside was nice too. It was very busy and a lot of people had to be turned away, but we were able to find two seats at a counter. Overall, this was a very good hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed our time here. It was walking distance to many things we wanted to check off our list. We had late night cocktails in the rooftop bar. The service was great. Most seats had floor to ceiling windows. The view was stunning. Great option for people who want to do a lot.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for almost 3 weeks over Christmas and New Year holidays. Located right smack in Times Square where we booked th room at the highest floor (53rd floor) overlooking the New Year's eve ball drop. This may not be the best view of the area but, the warm comfort of being in the bedroom and the view are p artly what you paid for. Perhaps like any new building built in major metropolis, the room si small compared to other hotels we've stayed here in the US and overseas. Interior is very contemporary and functional, comfortable bed; though should have spend more on better pillows, and a treat of numbers of TV channels. Internet connection was strong and free for the whole duration of our stay. We were also indulged with a good well-stocked Nespresso machine.The staff are very enthusiastic, friendly and helpful during our stay. We had a very nice experience from the staff; from the front desk, call center, concierge, restaurants to the housekeeping. Amenities are good but, what I find weird is that most of their toiletries and service items have to be requested. They have drawers that are empty of basic cutleries. Coffee cups have to be requested and you'd be provided with Starbucks paper coffee cups.Ordering room service from their menu feels like they've ordered from pack-and-go somewhere. It will be delivered to your room in a paperbag with all the plastic cutleries too, ofcourse. However, I was very impress how fast they are at bringing things you requested to your room both from room service and housekeeping.  I can say Hyatt had this hotel pretty close to Times Square where you can get everything you need and see most of the things you need to see in Manhattan close to it. So perhaps there's the assumption most services can be found outside and close that they can just leave it off. A plastic cup for New Year's celebration Champagne wouldn't do it, so I have to request for a proper glass. They brought us wine glass but, good enough. So, I guess you can request for things, though frankly I'd rather improvised than wait sometimes. (using the trash with a full plastic bag of ice a a champagne bucket)  However, I feel that since it's a 4 star hotel, go all the way instead of having some services feels like from a no-frill hotel. Overall, if just for New Year's eve celebration book room here (from 50th floor and corner rooms on 7th Avenue side) and if you're going on a broadway musical binging like what we did. Otherwise, find some other place to stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a brand new building (opened in early 2014, I think), and is quite sleek and flashy. Looks like a place at which the Jetsons might stay. (Maid service was great; alas it was not done by Rosie, the humanoid robot.) The building is narrow, and the floors are small. Feels quite intimate. The upper floors have spectacular views of the city. Rooms are decent size for NYC. The suites are especially spacious and have nice balconies. Many of the rooms have heated bathroom floors -- really nice touch (figuratively and literally).Prices in lobby diner for breakfast are kinda high, but the prices for the drinks in the rooftop bar are insane. (Then again, the room rates ain't cheap, I suppose.) Perfect Times Square location. Good, attentive staff. Overall, a wonderful experience. I'd give it 4.5 stars, if TripAdvisor allowed the option.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here on our trip to NYC to see the Lion King with my 6 year old and 10 year old kids. The location is perfect if you are there to do the touristy thing in and around time square or to see a show. The room was clean and comfortable. We also had a nice view of parts of time square. The service was great. The valet was welcoming and friendly, the guy at the front desk was really good, quick and had a great personality (Nico was his name I think.). Checking out and using the baggage storage was quick and easy. I would definitely stay here again when we see another show.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at Hyatt over the Christmas/ New Year period for 2 weeks and loved it, I stayed on the 32nd floor and everyone from the front desk staff to the housekeeper were all friendly and helpful, our room was clean and Modern, not noisy at all considering the New Year ball drop countdown was below us, Location is fantastic, the restaurant and rooftop bar is quite pricey but other than that it is great, I will be booking in here again as soon as i go back to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A very desirable location only half a block from times square. On both sides there are irish pubs with a fun atmosphere. The beds and rooms are great and service was fab. Lobby crisp and staff helpful. On the roof there is a bar which opens after 4 pm with great views

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked 4 nights at this hotel as part of a package from JetBlue and we're pleased from the moment the doorman helped us out of the taxi. Everyone has been very friendly from the desk clerks to the house cleaners. Our room is not huge but very well designed with good lighting, numerous plugs and a very nice bathroom with two shower heads and a walk in shower and not just a tub.The best however is the incredible view we got with floor to ceiling windows facing Time Square. Would happily stay here again since the location is perfect. Although free internet does not begin till 2/14/15 the clerk at reception decided to give it to us which was a nice gesture.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good location - 1 minute walk from Times Square. Fantastic view from if I well remember 54th floor restaurant. They provide very good service, nice staff, very helpful and professional one. Hyatt hotel does not have an "Europe type" breakfast but it is unfortunately standard for U.S. hotels. You have to pay additionally for Internet. I think that for 400 usd rate per room, wifi should be included.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly staff, good check-in, rooms well equipped but slightly on the "cheap wood look" side.Modern and rooms with a view are cool, overlooking Times Sq.Doors slam, which is a pain.Bar on top floor cool and bet in the Summer v cool, with amazing views.I didn't have breakfast or try the wifi but i assume as with all Hyatts you have to pay!!!Gym, pretty well equipped too and a nice, modern space.Recommended, though Time Sq location not the best for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just like the title says, it's a solid hotel to stay while you are in NYC. It's in the perfect location for Rockefeller Center, Times Square (of course), and Fifth Avenue. We came Jan. 17th for a one night stay. As you first walk into the hotel, it's a very nice setup as the restaurant is on your left, elevators on your right, and straight ahead is front desk. Check in didn't take too long, and we received a room on the 38th floor with a nice view of Times Square. The room has a small fridge, bottle water, coffee, and that's pretty much it. The bathroom was very modern with a shower that almost reminded me of the showers from Fifth Avenue Andaz, but not as nice. Bed was solid but comfortable. It was a little chilly when we first walked in, but easily raised the temperature to fix that issue. We decided to check out Bar 54 which is open at 4pm. It is a really beautiful view. Right now, it's really too cold to stay out there, but I'm sure during the summer this will be the place to be. The huge downside the drinks are $25, I guess you are really paying for the view. The gym and spa look nice also, but we didn't have time either. The bar next door, O'Lunney's is not bad to be honest. They have good food and drinks so you can go there if you don't want to walk too far. There is also a Starbucks across the street too. The one annoying thing during our stay is that the two elevators broke so everyone on floors 25-54 was forced use to ONE elevator. You can say that we were waiting for a very very long time for the elevator to come. Other than that, it was a good stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived quite late on the 30th December for the 5 nights and we were greeted by Ravi at reception to check us in. We chatted away as he checked us in and said that he had the option to upgrade us but before he did, we could have a look at both rooms. Great sales technique! We obviously went for the upgrade as the room gave us a view over TS and we'd be able to see the confetti and hear the music with our window open (if we were brave enough to open the window). Housekeeping was fabulous. I asked her to change the sheets on after the first night as I'm a believer of new year, clean everything. She was so lovely in understanding that. Ravi was exceptional the whole time we were there, explaining everything to us, generally chatting to us about where to go, what to do etc. Location of the hotel is perfect for those who have never been to NYC before and want to experience the whole magic of the city. I have been over 10 times over the past few years and this certainly was the most exceptional hotel experience I've ever had. Not only is Ravi fabulous and deserves a promotion, the rest of the staff were great too. The organisation of NYE and the wrist bands etc was flawless. Hyatt TS has to be one to look up to for the rest of the group. After the disgusting experience I had at the Hyatt Etoile, this stay reached beyond my experience, but then its to be expected with the prices! I would certainly visit again if the prices are a bit lower. For a special occasion and for my first experience of NYE in the city it was perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful and all whom I encountered had a warm attitude. There are 54 floors so if you are looking for a view, naturally you will be up higher and I didn't realize this and have a little bit of an elevator phobia since it goes very quickly (just to warn other guests with similar issues) and the elevator did tend to take quite awhile to reach us when we were trying to leave especially on Sunday/Monday, however going up from the Lobby was never an issue to wait very long. The Wi-Fi is not free, you will pay between $10 and $12 for it depending on the type of service you want (average or premium) and the television does not have as many channels as I expected, just about 20 or 25. I was disappointed to find we did not have a bath tub (we have a 2.5 year old) but the room itself is very modern. I find with modern looks, functionality tends to take a bit of a back seat and focus on looks first. The noise was minimal and it was great to have access to so many things near our home base. Parking is valet and $60 a day ( I think!). Overall for the price I think it was a good stay for my first time in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location, great service. Although it's in Times Square, it's a little tucked away, so you don't hear the noise on the streets. Service was excellent. Clean rooms; the rooftop bar is a must! Drinks are pricey at the bar but the view is worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a wonderful evening at the Hyatt Times Sq. Was impressed with the decor, amenities, cleanliness and as always, excellent Hyatt service. The rooms are beautiful. modern with high tech light switches etc.. Great location! Literally in the midst of Times Sq and the theater district... The hotel is in the middle of 45th street so you only have a partial view of Times Sq but for the price and location, it is fine! Rooms are typical size for NY. Nice restaurant in the lobby, great breakfast... and more than accommodating staff! Parking is valet and $60 per night.. so figure that into the cost of your visit unless you do not have a car!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: just back after staying 5nights in the Hyatt Times Square. I can't compliment this hotel enough. From the moment we arrived, our receptionist Ravi welcomed us and couldn't have been nicer. He complimented the wifi for us which would have worked out at about $62. I believe the wifi will be free from Feb onwards. Our room was on the 43rd floor and had a view of the corner of Times Square. The decor in the room was beautiful, everything is new and fresh and it was so spacious. We had a little walk in wardrobe which also contained an iron and ironing board. Also included in the room is a safe, a coffee maker (coffee etc included), a mini fridge (which you can stock yourself). Bottled water is complimentary each day. The lighting in the room can be controlled in 3 areas. It has a few different settings (all on/off, mood, reading,nightlight). Air conditioning was easy to use. Overall the room was very comfortable and relaxing and was cleaned daily. The bathroom was also great and had a rain shower as well as a hand held shower. Towels were changed every day. The location of the hotel is great, just a short walk to Times Square, right in the heart of all the activities and close to Broadway theatres. The restaurant downstairs off the lobby does great food. After checking out at 11am, the reception kept our bags for a few hours until our pick up arrived to bring us to the airport. We found all the staff (receptionists, cleaners, security, doormen and restaurant staff) to be most helpful and very friendly. We absolutely loved this hotel and will definitely be staying here again on our next visit to NYC. I would have no hesitations in recommending this great hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a new Hyatt. It is just off the ruckus of times square, so if you want a good place to eat, you probably have to walk a bit otherwise you'll end up in a broadway tourist trap. There is a PRET close by for sandwiches as well as a pizza place just east a couple of blocks for quick eats. Overall, this is in a great location, close to the times square subway, and walkable (or citibike rideable!) to anywhere you want to go in Manhattan. If you get a good rate, it's a great hotel. Lacks personality of the boutique new york hotels, but for a standard hyatt, i give it 5 stars.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here 6 nights over NYE and we could not have chosen a better Hotel. Our room was on floor 36 front corner facing time square... just for the view Ill come back to this hotel! The rest is pretty much what you will expect. We did enjoy the rooftop bar, out of the few rooftop bars we got to see in our visit, The Hyatt's had the best view and service! Another plus was the standard of breakfast, everything we tasted on the menu was really delicious!! There was a concierge with the name Ryan who was excellent help in finding us special/unique restaurants which made a big difference in our NY experience. Thank you Hyatt and Ryan in specific! We will be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square has very nice and quiet rooms.Very easy check in as an Ambassador Club Member. Friendly staff. Good location.The shower heads in the shower were great being a hand held one and the rain shower.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a brilliant 4 night stay here from Jan 12th. The hotel is new and pristine and couldn't be in a better position right in the heart of all the activities on Times Square. We had a room on the 47th floor and the view was amazing although we were at the back and the front facing rooms would be better views of Times Square.. The sky bar at the top on the 54th floor is amazing and the views are breathtaking. Great stay and excellent hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really enjoyed short business stay here. Location is excellent. Room comfortable clean and relaxing. Bonuses are the attached restaurant which does a fine breakfast omelette, the 54th floor bar and the gym. Would have no hesitation staying here again for either business or leisure - indeed would actively seek to do so.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights. It is a good standard hotel close to Times Square but just located well enough that you can avoid that area getting to and from the hotel if you desire. When we were there the city was very busy so the ability to avoid Times Square at certain times of the day was good.The rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable but not overly large. The décor is modern and I presume this hotel has had a renovation in recent years.Downstairs there is a nice café/bar and up on the top floor there is a skyline bar which we went to once which while expensive provides a tremendous view downtown.My only real complaint was the check out which is advertised from 4pm (which is about 2 hours already later than most hotels) however we did not get our room until 5.50pm. There was no apology or excuse and even after the room attendant had finished cleaning it I took 50 minutes for the room to be "released" so we could check in. Sorry Hyatt not good enough.This annoyance aside as I said it is a good hotel and a good location and I doubt you would be disappointed if you stayed there. Having said that in this area there are plenty of good, well located hotels so they probably need to lift there customer service a bit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was such a cute, family-friendly boutique hotel in a great location. I loved the modern atmosphere and decor and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Will definitely be visiting this hotel again the next time I'm in the city. Our stay was very positive.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After staying in several Times Square Hotels over the years, I had practically vowed never to do so again. The general noise level and wave of people you encounter as soon as you walk out the door are not to my taste. The hotel was offering a very attractive rate, it is in the heart of the theater district and I was with my wife and son who love the energy of Times Square, so I went for it.Even though this Hyatt is literally right around the corner from the heart of Times Square, it is removed just enough. You walk into a very small lobby to check in (the service was great) and then walk right around the corner to the elevators. This hotel is not about the lobby or common areas. There is a cafe attached to the lobby where you can get a bite to eat or stock up for your room. You walk outside, turn left, and there are multiple deli's to choose from as well as other restaurants left and right. It's an easy walk to Roc Center, 5th Avenue, Central Park and many of the pre-Christmas things we wanted to see and do.My wife and I visited the bar on the 54th floor, and it is amazing! It was cold, but to have that type of view oudoors with the woman I love and a drink in my hand was amazing. For some reason, management comped our bill, so I was about as pleased a a person could be. In any event, this is a very cool place. Not cheap, but a must-see for a drink and view in the Times Square area.Our room was typical and comfortable. It was well appointed and furnished in the Hyatt tradition. By the way, it is one of a few places in Manhattan I could find a room with 2 queen beds. Certainly the best value for a 2 queen room.We were quite pleased and would stay here again if we sought to be close to Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our requirements = somewhere central, with a good bar and rooms with a bit of space that we could hang out in if the hangover or the weather forced us to stay in. Relaxed rather than stuffy.We are = couple of forty something's from UK with no kids looking to return to New York to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversaryour opinion = airport transfer handled over email and charged to the room (instead of asking for separate CC details which always annoys me) all went well ($170 I seem to recall from Newark Intl). Checkin one of the best I remember, very sincere and made me feel like I was getting a personal service, don't think I was upgraded necessarily but certainly walked away with smile and feeling special.Room = we had the ones withe separate small seating area and desk and have to say it was more comfortable/less austere than the pictures suggested - we had the east corner of the 44th floor which allowed a great view of the Chrysler building in the distance to our Left in the bedroom and a vertigo inducing view of Bubber Gumps/hard rock cafe and the"good morning America" crowds from the seating area to our right. Very comfy bed and plenty of wardrobe space etc. furniture going for Nordic chic and managing to feel just about a bit better than IKEA. We spent a comfortable Sunday morning there before heading out to brunch and found it a good place to be. Starbucks coffee machine with enough for one cup each per day was nice.Bar/ public areas - the bar on the 54th floor was a disappointment in that it was trying to be a bit too cool and lacked the sincerity and warmth of the checkin experience - given it was one of our requirements we only actually went there once and found it more attractive to take the lift 44 floors down to the street rather than 10 floors up to the bar...- the ground floor cafe/dining room/ shop is where you pick up the beer/milk/provisions to fill your minibar ...apparently....again found the feel of the place a bit confused and never really sure why I would go in there other than to buy a bottle of water on the way in on a night .everything else seemed in good condition/ well maintained. Other than the check in guy, the friendliest people in the place were the maintenance guys and the cleaners/room attendants, always smiling and genuinely warm ....everyone else including concierge seemed a bit jaded and fed up having to work over the new year weekend ....didn't spoil anything just didn't encourage us to spend much time or cash there.Dining recommendations = you aren't going to starve in NYC, just buy the latest Zagats but our choices wereBreakfast = Brooklyn Diner just round the corner on 43rd street - expected a tourist trap but given we couldn't get in anywhere else gave it a go, really glad we did, busy Saturday morning but maitre'd was a superstar and the food and bloody Mary's/mimosas just greatBrunch = peacock Gallery at Waldorf Astoria, it ain't cheap but it is the full Americana buffet brunch experience we were looking for for a long and lazy couple of hours of excess.Dinner = "Catch", meat packing district, 9th Avenue opposite Ganservoort MP hotel - the cool Manhattan loft restaurant you've seen on TV but never managed to find, certainly in our experience, really good seafood/fish, Surrounded by the rich and the beautiful, just go with it and we found the staff soon stopped pouting and started giving great service.Bar = so many to choose from but probably best experience was the bar at the Peninsula hotel for all the reasons that made us take the lift down 44 floors back at our hotel.Experiences - Harlem globetrotters at Madison square garden was pretty cool, but anything in the "Garden" would be a good experience I think given its relatively intimate scaleEmpire State still a great couple of hours - we saw the queues and almost turned away but on speaking to the guy at the door found that for $50 each we would, get in the fast lane and boy was it worth it, took at least 3 hours of hanging around in queues out of it, well worth it!If you have read all of this then you are obviously keen - get your credit card out and get it booked ;-)..........and enjoy!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: But the pillows have got to be the softest pillows I've ever experienced. They get flat as pancakes when you lie on them - and good luck trying to use them to prop yourself up to read in bed. Also there are no blankets - just a comforter which at first I thought was because it was a step toward saving water. This was not the case however since our towels got changed daily even though we left them hanging which is what I think is the signal to leave them as is.Fortunately the room has the thickest robes which when rolled up can be used as an additional pillow and when flattened out can be used as a blanket. It would have been better if additional pillows and blankets had been kept either in the closet or drawers if guests want them. I've had better sleep in hotels off the interstate but if you're not in NYC to sleep then this is the best location - Times Square, Broadway, etc. right at the doorstep. Can't get any better than that.Internet was not free when we were here but on the website it says it will soon be. We missed it by about a month.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt on 45th street for three nights during our visit to NYC. The hotel overlooks Times Square and is in walking distance from Central park, Rockerfeller center, 5th avenue, etc. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful with tourist information. Noel did a great job of taking care of us.Our room was on the 39th floor with a decent view of the city. I liked that the room was spacious and well maintained. The decor was uplifting too. The windows are well insulated, therefore NYC traffic is not an issue for light sleepers like me. The lighting seemed eco-friedly with central controls and different lighting options. We also liked that there was unlimited complimentary bottled water.Bar 54 has a great view of Times Square and the Chrysler building. We had two of the Fireside Drinks - the Hot Buttered Rum and the Gloog, though their expensive they were worth the money especially after a cold day of sightseeing.The only negatives are the lack of storage space for toiletries in the bathroom and the slow room services. Connection to Wifi is a little pricey but it's faster than that at many of the other hotels we have stayed at.Overall we enjoyed our experience at the Hyatt enough to want to stay there again on our future visits to Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in the heart of Times Square, the room was a bit small and wifi is not free (and quite expensive). The rooftop bar is incredible, I would recommend going there even if you do not plan to stay at the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My second time staying at this nice hotel nearly just a little over one year ago.Overall my stay was really nice. The lobby, diner and bar were finished and everything looked really nice.One year later, the hotel was certainly showing some signs of wear but I guess that this could be expected in a city like NY. In my suite, the carpet, which is embossed, shown signs of wear. Some of the embossed ares of the carpet have become flat. Unfortunately not everyone practices taking their shoes off while in the room. The bath had some small rust holes and the sofa some stains.Hyatt needs to work on their e-services and not just at this location. When checking in via the web, I received and error. When checking in at the hotel, I did want to try the kiosks on the wall but was quickly whisked to the reception desk where a friendly lady checked me in. Apparently the check-in kiosks aren’t used that much and are problematic. When checking out via the TV, I received and error. Reception said acknowledged there was a problem that needed to be looked into. So much for convenience! I did get an emailed receipt, so that e-service worked OK.Overall, it was another pleasant stay. Still a good place to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt is a clean new hotel that is a 30 second walk to Times Square. Recently stated there on a business's trip, nice clean rooms, little on the smaller side, lobby is also small, but if you need to be in the area, it's a great option. The staff were exceptionally grinder and I enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location; a special mention to the Chester and Steward who made myself and my son very comfortable. Rooms were always clean and large. Lovely view from our room. I will recommend this hotel. My only negative is the Wifi was very expensive on a daily tariff

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is not only in a great location, it is also new, very clean and the staff are helpful and polite. Our room had a great view (19th floor), the bed was comfy and the shower was clean and had great water pressure. I will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would first like to comment on the amazing location! It is literally 1 minutes walk to the Times Square! As soon as you walk out of your hotel, turn right and walk down to the end of the street you will see red steps from the corner of the street! On the opposite end of the stree you can see the Empire State Building although It is about 10 streets away. A few streets down is Bryant park which has lovely little market type shops and ice skating. location is fantastic but at the same time the street isn't too loud and busy. We had two rooms during out stay as we were there for 8 days. The first room was situated at the back and you could hear no noise at all! The second room was at the front of the hotel and was a little noisy due to the horns and people outside but once asleep and you never hear them! The rooms were both lovely and in particular our second room was very spacious. We had two queen beds and an infant crib yet had plenty of room. The room and bathroom both looked very modern. I loved the fact that they didn't have things like cotton buds, toothbrushes etc inside the bathroom yet were available ok request at anytime..this saves on space and unecessary waste. The room was always spotless on our return and anything we had requested would be delivered. There was a handy notepad in which you could write any items that you needed (memory foam pillow, flat iron, baby wipes) and they would all be delivered! We were there fromChristmas to New Years and even though it was so busy we never felt neglected! The hotel staff are one of the best I have seen; right from the bell boys to the reception staff, concierge and cleaners. All were very friendly with a big smile. The bell boys in particular were lovely and always welcomed you with a huge smile. New Year's Eve was amazing as we had wristbands and cards so that we could re-enter the street without any hassle. Staying here also meant that we felt the confetti drop on us at 12! And got to walk through to the middle. Hyatt has a restaurant called T45 at the bottom which not only do a good selection of food but also the best hot chocolate I have ever tasted! The only one negative and that is tiny is that the lifts took ages to come. Having said that when they eventually came they were super fast! All in all and amazing stay, we were made to feel very comfortable, always had a lovely nights sleep and it was made to feel like home! Would most certainly recommend to others and also stay again if visiting New York. Top Marks to Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything is great about this hotel. The location few steps away from Times Square. The view from the upper levels on Times Square and 6th Avenue. The fabulous price that i get against such advantages. The cleanness of the room and the modern decoration they have. Simply it is the best in New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 8 nights at this hotel. Very central. Near theatres, shops, coffee shops and of course near a few starbucks coffee shops which made life easy. Near to the balldrop location although you have to get to actual site very early( approx 9 hours before midnight. Unfortunately being a guest at the hotel does not secure you a place on the rooftop to view the balldrop as this venue is hired out to a private company which hosts a new years eve party which charges you. The room I booked had a partial view of Times Square. Very friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just came back from a week's stay at the Hyatt Times Square. Overall, I had a pleasant experience given it was around New Years. The accommodation was pretty good, was only a bit disappointed that we didn't get two rooms as requested (we booked 5 months ahead of our trip) and had to stay together in one room. Fortunately the room was quiet, spacious and with a view but we're still 4 adults so you can imagine we experienced some discomfort. The staff are very hospitable and friendly, the lady who cleaned our floor was notably kind and welcoming to me and my family. This hotel is in a very central location which is convenient walking distance to Broadway and Times Square. There are good restaurants and cafes around which is great for a quick bite as the room service and dining is lacking here but you can use Seamless online to order the food you want. You can find free wi-fi in the public sections of the hotel such as the lobby which is somewhat helpful if you don't want to get wi-fi in your room. My experience was a bit different here compared to other hotels I've stayed in but for our needs, Hyatt did a great job.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Second visit to Hyatt Times Square. This time just my daughter and myself. As previously experienced the rooms are spacious and the beds extremely comfortable. The hotel staff were very helpful and informative. They explained the best location to view the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade and were very helpful in providing easy directions to areas of New York we had not previously visited. this is my go-to Hotel for visits to New York. Great location,great staff. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 4 nights. We found the hotel's staff to be very warm and welcoming, helpful and well-suited for their jobs in the hospitality industry. I would like to give special mention to Chester and Floyd, two front desk staff who made us feel very welcomed. Nothing we asked for was deemed too much and they were so helpful. As we were a family of 2 adults and 2 teens, the hotel was kind to assign us one of their larger rooms, very spacious by NY standards. Thanks for doing that! All in all, the Hyatt Times Square was a lovely experience for us, a great memory of our time in NYC! Well-done!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at this location NYE 14/15 and all I can say is we were blown away when we checked in our room and saw we could see the stage from our room. On top of the great location their staff had outstanding customer service ..only negatives I could point out were the elevator ' s which stay packed and T-45 was $$$ for basic breakfast items. But I would definitely recommend this hotel if your trip is based around Times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked this hotel as a surprise for my husband and son. I purchased tickets to see the play The Last Ship on January 2, 2015. I have stayed in Hyatt Hotels before and I knew this place would be impressive. The room was quiet, clean, comfortable, and up to date. We had floor to ceiling windows that overlooked part of 42nd Street. The bathroom was a lovely surprise. The walls were tiled and the floor was heated. The shower had a rain shower head. It was great to see a play and stay in NYC for the night. We had breakfast in the lobby which was a little pricey but we did not have to go outside in the cold. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had non stop problems from the moment we checked in. We requested a crib on booking and didn't have the crib ready. We have a 9 month old and she needed to get to sleep when we arrived from our flight so this was annoying. There was very little space in the room so when they installed the crib I asked for the chair and stool to be taken away and stored but this couldn't be done so it was very squished.The lifts where so slow it took as long as 5 minutes for it to come and one time we waited 15 minutes for the lift as we had to pass 2 as they where full. This is just annoying they really have to do something about it.On one of the evenings our room key wouldn't open the door so we went to reception to get the key fixed. Went back to the room and it didn't work still. When we went back to the reception it turns out the battery had died on the room lock so we had to wait 20 minutes for maintenance to "break" into the room to replace the battery. Of course itwas sleep time for the baby so not impressed.We also asked concierge some advise on where to go in the city and they gave us the wrong info after going where they suggested. Turned out Google was better at giving us correct information.Travelling with a pram was hard enough but when the doormen where constantly talking to girls on the street and not helping to open doors was terrible service.There is no free wifi in your room and we paid a bomb for our stay this really irritates me for this day in age.We did complain to management and all charges from the restaurant where removed but our stay left a bitter taste in the mouth.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed on New Year eve with family at this hotel cause it is few steps from Times Square, I got a room in 52nd floor the view was amazing.the hotel was really crowded so I can't give good opinion about the service etc...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I only stayed there for one night but I wish I would have stayed longer. I really like the cool and edgy modern vibe that manifests in the hotel's decor and architecture. I can not emphasize this enough, GREAT LOCATION for tourists! Times Sq is just around the corner and is so easy to get to by foot. The view at night from my 39th floor room was amazing. Overall, this is a really good and contemporary hotel with a great ambiance and staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked a two queen bed room for 3 nights for me, my wife and my two teenage children (13 and 18) arriving on Jan 2nd so we could enjoy the holiday atmosphere without the crowds. The room was on the 36th floor so we had a fairly good view of the skyline. The room was large and the beds were truely queen size beds so my two kids had room to share a bed. We truely enjoyed our room for the entire stay. The initial impression you get when you check into the hotel is that the reception area is fairly small and the decore not as welcoming as most higher end hotels. Also their restaurant on the first floor is not very appealing (again more design and color choices). But with pubs one either side of the hotel, if you want to enjoy a drink or meal in a cozy atmosphere you only have to walk a few feet. My last note is the staff was excellent at extremely helpful. Overall I highly rate this hotel and recommend it for it convinence to Broadway plays (a relatively short walk) and Time Square (1/2 a block).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights in 2 rooms (12 room nights) from 12/22-12/28 & 12/23-12/29, respectively, three in one room (parents & teen) and two (couple) in another. The location was perfect for our vacation and activities. The parents room was on the 10th floor on the street. We should have requested to move the 1st night. The street noise was throughout the night and some nights worse than others. Plus, for a suite, although the room had pocket doors that closed off the bedroom from the pull out couch area, the view was null. We notified the front desk when housekeeping left dirty cleaning rags in our room 2 days in a row. On the flip side, they were quick to bring an extra blanket, pillows and towels when requested. Our adult children's room on 45 was a King, non-suite. Much better view. Nicely appointed, however as mentioned in other comments-no drawers. My husband made similar comments as others about the front desk area- small, not much character, cramped during busy check-in & check-out periods. The concierge was slow to respond multiple times and provide incorrect information in one instance. ***A special note about Aaron who worked the curb desk. We used Uber and the driver was on 7th due to the traffic pattern and could not make a left on to 45th. Aaron literally walked my 5 person family from the hotel to Times Square direct to the Uber that was waiting for us. Aaron certainly went above and beyond for sure. A point about the elevators...the were slow and on several days at least one was in maintenance. Fortunately, we could use the stairs from the 10th floor to get to the lobby quicker than the wait time for an elevator. A few times, we'd wait and when the elevator arrived it was packed to capacity. And the 3-4th time, we'd elect to take the stairs. Overall, we'd select a different hotel during our next visit, there are so many choices in the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: my family and i stayed here for my 18th birthday on 1/3-1/4 2015. the location was amazing, and so was the view, the restaurant was expensive, but very good. best cheesecake ever. however, the cleaning was only okay. i found the shirt of a previous guest in one of our rooms. also, we requested early check-in, which i understand was not guaranteed. however, guaranteed checkin was at 4. we got into one of our rooms at 4, but the other part of the party didnt get into their room until 5:30. checkout was at 11, and we wanted late checkout, so as compensation for our late checkin the night before, we got free late checkout for one room. but, we did not get to use it because they wanted to charge us another $65 for valet parking. in summation, good views, good food, but only ok guest services and cleanliness...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are looking for ambiance and elegance, look elsewhere, but if you need a new, clean and convenient place in Manhattan this should work for you. Despite the tiny, crowded lobby, the staff was super friendly and efficient. We upgraded to a deluxe king room and would definitively recommend you do so...floor-to-ceiling windows, plus you are high above the noise of Times Square. It seems like this hotel is trying to be "boutique", but it's not working. The hallways looked kind of 1970's, but not in a cool hip retro way...just tacky. The room was better, with a black, white and chrome bathroom with a deep tub and waterfall shower, and simple white linens on the bed. Enjoy you trip to NY!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just returned from an overnight at the Hyatt. It was wonderful! The location is perfect, steps away from Times Square! Every employee from valets to front desk staff were friendly and professional! Our room on the 21st floor was clean and modern. The only thing I can say negative was the restaurant- avoid at all costs! We went there because we were short on time before a show- big mistake!!! Overpriced for below average food and terrible service. There really is no need to go there as there are restaurants within steps outside the door. We will definitely stay at this hotel the next time we visit the city but just eat elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very friendly people, large rooms, quick elevators.It was a modern hotel and next to Times Square along with a couple of good pubs near by.We arrived late (had called), got checked in quickly and popped out for a quick meal and a couple of beers. Fitness center was very functional with not much of a crowd when we were there.The bar in the lobby was small but nice but was a bit pricey.I believe there was free internet in the common areas but we had to pay for the internet in the room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my second visit to the Hyatt Times Square and it did not disappoint. This time I upgraded to the Deluxe View King and absolutely loved my room on the 53rd floor. The difference between the View King that I stayed in before and the Deluxe View King is the bed faces out to an incredible view from a higher floor and the bathroom is bigger with a separate bath and shower 'room' within the bathroom.Once again the service was exceptional from all staff and the room was fresh, immaculate and well proportioned with a very comfortable bed. The nice touches include a shower with two different shower heads, an empty bar fridge (rare in New York) to stock up on supplies, complimentary water, in room coffee machine, floor to ceiling windows (which open slightly for fresh air) and comfy chair to sit and enjoy the spectacular view.I want to draw special attention to the staff - I stay at a lot of hotels and the staff at the Hyatt Times Square are by far consistently the most friendly and professional I have come across. From bellmen, front desk, and housekeeping, everyone was very welcoming and brought a personal touch to my stay (eg., the bellman checked my luggage tag when I arrived in the taxi to address me by name, the front desk employee described my room on check in, housekeeping remembered who I was and which room I was in when I walked past and kindly left additional water when I had a friend up to my room before a show). These are special touches rare in chain hotels that made my stay extra special.Times Square was absolutely crazy over Christmas/New Year, so it was good to be close by for the two nights at the theatre or to turn left out of the hotel and avoid it completely. I should note the lifts can get busy and be a short wait at peak times.I highly recommend the Hyatt Times Square for your Times Square visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel only one night. Used valet service, bell man was super friendly and welcoming. Check in was fast, we arrived early and they were still able to accommodate us. We dropped out bags and were on our way into the city in no time. Dinner at the hotel was pricy, $9" for two adults and a child. But that's NYC for you. Can't wait to go back if we could get same rate we got last time.b

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were her for 3 nights and loved the location. Its a new property and very well appointed. Some obvious flaws were the lifts and lack of good internet coverage (even paid). The trade mark Hyatt luxurious touches were missing I felt for some reason. Good place to stay if you want something close to the Times Square and Broadway but better options available at cheaper price I feel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited the Hyatt Times Square this summer, in August . Staff was very attentive and the hotel is where the action is! Easy walk to all the attractions. Rooms were very nice! Housekeeping sent up extra supplies we needed within minutes of our calling. Thank you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Superb location for visiting NY, few steps from Time Square. Hotel is fabulous, clean room with comfortable size, staffs are fantastic and really this hotel made everything more memorable. Defiantly will go back

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square has a fabulous location with excellent, responsive staff. We had zero issues with our room, which was quiet, clean and spacious (for NY). It was rainy while we were visiting and the hotel even provided complimentary use of umbrellas (thanks!). Staff gave great recommendations for dining and were always kind and courteous when we were going through the lobby on our way in or out of the building. However, the drinks at the rooftop bar felt kind of overpriced and there wasn't really any common space to meet up with fellow travelers. One evening, we brought our dessert back to the hotel, but there really wasn't anywhere that we could sit and visit while we ate. That said, the hotel gym was well-equipped (which we definitely needed after that dessert!) and open 24 hours. In addition, we had a very restful stay in a very comfy room with a just-right bed and nice view from the 53rd floor. What more could we ask!?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is our second trip to NYC around the holiday time, and we are so happy that we chose this hotel for our 3-night stay. The location is fabulous, the room was sparkling clean and the staff was super friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 22nd floor, and it was very quiet. Jennifer, our housekeeper, was so nice and it was a pleasure to see her every morning. Everyone from the front desk staff, to the doormen, to the concierge (who made me a handle out of packing tape for a large bag I had to transport home on the train) to the manager of the restaurant in the lobby was very accommodating to our family. We also enjoyed free WiFi because we are Platinum Hyatt members! When returned home we realized that we had maybe left my son's retainer in the bathroom of the hotel room. I called and spoke to an operator who said she would call back and let us know if the retainer had been found. Sure enough, within the hour we received a phone call back saying the item had been found and that it would be shipped to us the next day. I also received a follow up email letting me know that the retainer was packaged up and ready to go. Needless to say, I was very impressed with the customer service. We can't wait to visit the Hyatt Times Square again in 2015!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent one night at the Hyatt Times Square between Christmas and New Year. The location is perfect as the location is steps from Time Square. The hotel is styled as a European boutique and is different from most Hyatt brands. Gone are the large reception areas and huge atrium, with plants and trees. This lobby has a small reception desk and seating area. Check in time is 4 PM but we were allowed to happily check in at 1 PM when we arrived. Our room on the six floor had a street view in the front of the hotel. The room was small but very well appointed: flat screen TV, lighting options and multiple electric outlets for all of your devices. The bathroom was sleek and practical. We ordered room service and it arrived quickly in less than an half hour during the dinner rush. The food was plated in disposable dishes and arrived in a branded paper bag. How clever! As we are vegans, there were multiple meatless choices for us on the menu. The next day, we ate at the restaurant and we were also pleased with our food. We traveled with non-vegans and they also enjoyed their meal.The suggestion that I could make is that it was difficult to figure out what staff served in what role. We were unsure who served as the bell man, reservation clerk, or doorman.There were no clear delineation where to stand if you were checking into the hotel, or if you wanted to check your baggage. However, all of the staff friendly and attentive once we discerned who was who. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first stay at the Hyatt Times Square. We try to stay always at a hotel very close to Times Square because our trips are focused on theater going. Hotel rooms, staff, etc., were all very good, but the price is much higher than other hotels (e.g., Millennium Broadway across the street) without any obvious benefits. On this stay, we were not paying directly for the rooms as we used free nights we had previously earned with Hyatt, but the discount price (e.g, AAA) was $100 or more higher than Millennium Broadway. For that kind of price differential, the Hyatt needs to be closer to the St. Regis or Mark than to the Millennium Broadway.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and i like to go into the big city every other month or so for an overnight/girls night. This time we tried the Hyatt Times Square because we had theater tickets and its fabulous location to the theater district. We were running late and thought we were just going to drop off our bags at the desk and head over to the will call window at the theater but Pabelo was able to find us a room that was ready quickly and we were able to freshen up a bit before we headed to the show. Thanks Pabelo! The rooms were nice and clean and adequate for our stay. Robes,slippers,hair dryer in the room and just about anything else you could need at a phones call away. The only concern that i have with this hotel is with their security. You see, they have a very small lobby and there are people in and out all the time. They do have someone stationed by /near the elevators, but never once did anyone ask to see my key. I have stayed many places and that in my opinion is something they need to work on. Other then that,we had a great stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's literally adjacent to Times Square so it's super busy! Most of the staff is kind, except at the rooftop bar which is a little too snooty to really enjoy it there and the drinks are very small and pricey, more than the bars right next door to the hotel. The rooms are clean. It has the fastest elevators in the world! Very limited rooms service and it's not always available. The lobby is a bunch of kids hanging around using the wi-fi that adults need to use for real work--very small area there. The bathrooms in the rooms are fabulous and the bed was the most comfortable we've ever had away from home!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: On the face of it the Hyatt was a good hotel in a central location. The staff were the best thing about it, all super friendly, courteous and helpful. However, I had a few niggles! Firstly I did nt like the hotel lobby, it was too small with not enough amenities. Free wifi was only available here and many people used it. There was only a limited number of chairs so it could get very busy. Surely these days hotels of this standard should be offering free wifi throughout the hotel. The cafe in the lobby was also very expensive. We had a double room on the 33 rd floor. It was spacious with a decent bathroom but could have done with a few more drawers if I m being picky. Unfortunately, the carpet in our room was stained, and I felt that it would nt take much to use a carpet cleaner to clean it because it was nt very pleasant. Room service was a bit hit and miss, with a lack of consistency in what was left. Overall it very reasonable, but would I stay there again, probably not.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Many brand hotels in large cities often feel like a chain restaurant - long hall ways, room after room, pedestrian in their approach. We were nicely surprised by the presentation and layout of the Hyatt at Times Square. 53 stories high, but with only about 8 rooms per floor, the hotel has the feel of a boutique rather than a massive hotel. This is likely because when you exit the lift there is only a short walk to the furthest room. The rooms are small - it is NY after all - and well appointed. Good art work and design, comfy seating, and outstanding views. Up top is a great bar with even better views and a cool ambiance. We enjoyed our stay, and will book again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After a few hits and misses in NYC, while travelling for work, finally hit the jackpot with the Hyatt Times Square. The Staff are incredible - especially the lads who work in the restaurant - and the friendly bar staff upstairs in the great rooftop bar. Room was very functional, with my only downside being the charge for wifi, not great when you're on a work trip :( However, I will definitely be heading back time and time again! Thanks...Marko (ps..try the wings...)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel! The staff were incredible, the location in the heart of Times Square was perfect, and the hotel was beautiful!In particular, Floyd who checked us in was incredibly friendly, professional, and helpful. Steve, the door man was also very knowledgeable and friendly, and he gave us walking directions and advice on local attractions. The breakfast downstairs at the T45 restaurant was excellent, particularly the Big Apple French Toast, and our server on multiple occasions, Rahman, was phenomenal!We had an Executive Suite, which although a bit small at 530 square feet, it served its purpose quite well, and had incredible views! The couch turned into a bed, and the door separates the 2 rooms, so it worked well for us as we traveled with our 2 kids. It also has an empty mini fridge which is great! Just a note, it only has a shower, no bathtub, so for kids who re used to a bath, you will need to adapt. The hotel was appointed beautifully, and as I mentioned, the staff were just the best of the best! The noise level was fine, and although it is in close proximity to Times Square, you should be able to sleep just fine. My only complaint was housekeeping was not up to par. There were multiple issues during our stay including finding hair on the bathroom floor, an empty tissue box not being replaced, they threw out an entire closed loaf of bread we had left on a table, and they forgot our request for extra pillows so we had to call down again. Additionally, they did a pretty poor job cleaning, and replacing used items. All in all, it was a wonderful stay, and we certainly look forward to returning!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's a perfect base for sightseeing, shopping and theaters. It's in the epic center of Manhattan, close to everything. If you travel as a family the rooms works perfect for four. If your travel as a couple you will find the rooms in the hotel spacious and nice. The service is Hyatt standard so expect it to be professional.Michael

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at the Hyatt Times Square. Great location. New hotel - just a year old. So the rooms are sparkling, the lobby upmarket, and the view from the bar spectacular. We really enjoyed the hotel's location to Times Square, and the fact that it was new, modern, clean, and the front desk people very very friendly and helpful.However, two gripes spoiled the 5 start rating I would like to give it. First, they charge for Internet! I have a real problem with hotels who do this. While they might think it is clever and a great revenue stream, it just forces people to hotspot their phone to get around it, or go to an Apple store. Either way, I resent hotels who think that the Internet is some new way of ripping people off - because the cost to the hotel is a few cents, if that. As I was a Hyatt club member, they waived the charge, but only because they were nice and I complained.Second, when I left I was hit with a $36 "parcel charge". I had a few small packages delivered to the hotel from Amazon, as I usually do when I come to the USA. The first three are free, I was told, and then they charge for the rest. So for receiving two small additional packages, I was charged $36! This has never happened to me before, and this charge was certainly not visible when I booked the hotel.
