I looked on their website, and yes, it is there under one of the tabs if you go looking - but who does? I think it really rude to charge people when they check out for a service that a) they don't know about and b) they cannot do anything about because the packages are on the way.The hotel charges enough for the rooms - the fees here are not cheap. It leaves a really bad taste in you mouth to be slugged additional petty charges - I think the hotel seriously needs to review these sets of charges before they lose loyal customers like us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Pros:Location - half a block from Times Square...really couldn't ask for a better spot.Quality - the rooms were a decent size. Clean, well maintained. Lobby was nice.Cons:Bed and pillows - leave a lot to be desired. Could just be personal preference but we had a lot of trouble getting comfortable.Elevators - when it gets busy it can take a long time to get an elevator. One morning I waited on my floor for a good 5 minutes to get one down. The guy who got on after me said he'd been waiting even longer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great place to stay near Broadway, We spent a few days going to shows so location was lovely. We got an upgrade in room status which was excellent. Rooms very clean Hotel was fairly new therefore a fresh place to stay. Higher floors nice. Shower good. heated bathroom floor very nice for winter.Bed was wonderful for 70+ guests.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights, room on 42nd floor facing Times Square. Corner room, with separate seating area. Very modern and clean hotel with multiple power outlets and large flat screen TV's. Overall very impressed with this hotel and plan to return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel that is centrally located. Everything is new and clean. They provided umbrellas on a rainy day. We definitely will stay here again. Rooms were small, but most NYC hotels are small.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: On arrival we were greeted with a friendly welcome which continued throughout our stay. The staff were absolutely lovely. Room 4906 was modern and spacious with a great city view. The beds and bedding were super comfy, the bathroom was spacious with a separate shower cubicle hosting a fabulous shower, nice toiletries including toothpaste were supplied. Coffee maker with Starbucks coffee and bottled water were also supplied and replenished daily. The housekeeping staff were thorough with their cleaning and were ever so friendly. The hotel rooftop bar terrace has stunning views but as there was a no children policy we never got to sit and enjoy.Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and will certainly return.Thank you Hyatt Times Square!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great time at the Hyatt Times square. From start to finish the staff was wonderful, especially Nico.The view was great and the location was very convenient! We were close to the shows and the shopping! Our room was very clean and the staff was very accommodating! They sent up extra pillows when asked and attended to an issue with the bathroom right away. The only thing that bothered us was when we went to the upstairs bar/lounge we paid $50 for two cocktails. It would have been less of a sticker shock if the price were on the bar menu but not a deal breaker, even the bartenders were super friendly. We would definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Times Square in NY. It is located in a very convenient location, close to shopping and restaurants and the hub of Times Square. We stayed in a room on the 27th floor with a balcony. I was worried about the noise, but it was very quiet inside. Our room was modern, very clean, and just what we needed after long days of walking and sightseeing. Our only negative was the food. We ordered room service one morning for breakfast to save time, and what we were told would take 20 minutes, took an hour and some of things we had ordered were missing. I would definitely stay here again though! We are very particular about our accommodations when we travel, and we were not disappointed here at all!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When booking a hotel online it can be a scary process. Not being able to touch and see is uneasy when you're going to be putting your head on a pillow that god knows how many others did just before you. I had the greatest and most hospitable experience at the Hyatt not only from the internal employees but from some of the greatest doormen (CHESTER and WALTER) in New York City. I'm a regular to NYC and have stayed and lived all over the city and the crew at this hotel was superior to even the most POSH the city can offer. The room was amazing on the 50th floor with an incredible view, the bathroom was massive and the room was very comfortable. After a long day of walking it was a pleasure coming back to the hotel to get some much deserved rest. Thank you Hyatt Staff on 45th for a great stay and I will definitely be back soon. Ian (the guy who lost his wallet)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I hate Time Square but stayed here with two teen girls who love all of the action this part of NYC has. The hotel is new. Rooms were really clean and spacious by NYC standards. I was surprised it wasn't louder at night when we were sleeping given we were 1/2 block away from Broadway. Would stay here again if I stay in this part of the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Directly on Times Square, our room had a spectacular view of New York from the 48th floor ed the price was well the view!very large room, comfortable bed, bathroom super equipped.Unfortunately the system heating/air-conditioning was very noisy and did not work well.Value for money in line with NYC, only minus the fee WIFI in rooms with enormous price, surmountable problem with links free almost anywhere in the city ...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel as it was close to everything and at your doorstep. They have a great cafe which serves good food in casual fashion.Rooms were spacious and modern.Cons....housekeeping was not up to standard. They were not thorough with their cleaning and came late...after 3-330pm. Lastly, they tend to stinge a little with their toiletries.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Having decided on impulse to go to NYC on a Saturday morning, we quickly booked the hotel through Priceline a few hours before arriving. We've stayed in Times Square before and we're usually on the outside of the action. It's all about location. The hotel is perfectly situated. The room was gorgeous (average NY size hotel room), and really modern. The rooftop bar has a gorgeous view at night, and the feel is relaxing (although I'll ignore the pretentious aspect to it). The best part of the stay was the impeccable customer service. The staff were all amazing and super friendly.Special recognition to Angelo at the T45 restaurant who made our stay magical- while having mimosas to celebrate. This is a definite re-do! Staying at this hotel was just perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the most perfect stay I have had in a New York City hotel. They were sold out but they still managed all the flow of people without a glitch. We arrived early and they took our bags and put them up in our room when it became available (this was at 10 AM, check in is at 3 PM). The room itself was spacious, and everything was brand new (or at least it felt like it was just remodeled). Everything was very neat and clean and they offered all the complimentary water bottles we wanted. We highly recommend going up to the bar in the terrace, the view is magnificent and the atmosphere is nice. However the service at the lounge is a little sub-par. Overall we highly recommend it due to the quietness in the room, the view, the location and the great customer service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed with friends for a weekend and we all liked this hotel. Especially the bar on floor 54, spectacular. Our room was high up in the building and therefore quiet and also with a nice view. Located in the heart of 24/7 busy Times Square. (This area was a bit too crowded for my taste so next time I will chose some other part of the city.)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Not as elegant as the 5 star grand hyatts in Asia which is classy with their grand staircases and cavernous lobby, the narrow layout of Times Square pales in comparison!Notwithstanding that, TSH's location is great with entertainment, shopping, eating and mass rapid transit（at 42nd west) all within easy reach.The rooms are not that spacious but then again NY s prime real estate is among the world s highest n the extra elbow room would costs a higher premium.The main setback is they will charge another $18 to access their wifi from room but you can surf n download fromthe lobby or bar.Security in the lobby is very good n if you look out of place they might just breathe on you. Cabs to JFK comes with a flat fee of low $50+ excluding tips n extra sur charges .Overall I would come back again to this location as its near to many central attractions particularly near to Central Park, 5th Avenue Shops, Rockfella n Broadway. The 54th bar is also a good venue for a night cap w night views of part of the city' s skylineHave a good stay !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is situated in the heart of Times Square. From the moment my family and myself arrived, we were greeted with friendly smiles and great attitudes. The hotel is nice and close to a lot of new yorks attractions which is great if you are travelling with the little children like we were. Every time we arrived back to the hotel the staff always greeting my little girls and made time to interact with them which they loved. The room service good was great as it comes from the attached restaurant next to the lobby. Will defiantly be returning on my next NYC trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 2 nights here in December. Location is great, especially for taxis at peak times as 45th is a major run through for them. Reasonably well placed for subway should you need to use it.Best point is the height of the building and its location away from the major arterial roads. This has been my best quality of sleep in New York, and the room size is good with good beds. A/C is quiet.Downside, the restaurant is a deli/dinner on the ground floor, although the food is good and fairly priced, unlike the rooftop bar (highest in New York allegedly) which is properly expensive although the views are terrific.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had stayed in this hotel overnight. Absolutely perfect location. Beautiful and clean rooms,our bed was super comfortable sheets were perfect it was pleasure to sleep on this bed. View from the hotel window were really nice. I would really recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel! Would not hesitate to stay there again. Fantastic weekend. Great location for shows and shopping and entertainment. Hotel staff was kind and courteous and the room view was breathtaking. Cant wait to go again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I'm a bit torn on my stay. This was my first stay at the Hyatt Times Square since my usual NY hotel was booked. Location - Great location if you want to be in Times Square. 5 minute walk to Times Square or Bryant Park. Very close to Rockefeller Center.Rooms - Rooms are well maintained and new. Flat screen tv, comfortable beds, black out curtains that work. A nice sized desk, large bathroom (for NY) with a rain shower (see note below) and heated floors. Shampoos are some line from Gilchrest and Soams.Service - The staff is friendly, chatty and helpful.My issues - The hotel looks good. It basically looks like an Andaz with light colors, instead of dark colors, but it lacks any real amenities. First, there is no in-room dining that I could figure out. The hotel has a "diner" (basically a Hyatt mix of a diner and a store with prepackaged water and some snacks) in its lobby that offers take out. Supposedly they will deliver food to your room, but no menus are to be found in the rooms, so it defeats the purpose. There isn't traditional room service at this hotel. Second, the elevators are SLOW and small. I always waited for an elevator and it was always packed.Third, the room has no bathrobes. Not usually an issue, but the rooms have large windows and are quite cold (even with the heat cranked up) during the NY winter evenings.Fourth, there is a fridge in the room, but it is not stocked with anything. They tell you in the fridge to visit the "diner" to stock it. Not helpful when i'm thirsty at 2AM and no bottle of water is to be found.Fifth, they charge for internet. Really? Internet? $12 or $16 for the slow/high speed plan? I chose the high speed plan. It was decently fast and reliable, but struggled on streaming video. For $16 I expect some amazing speed.Sixth, the shower sucks. The shower is a nicely tiled walk-in shower, that is quite large, with a tiny rain shower head. Hyatt spent a lot of money on "Waterworks" shower equipment but the water pressure is horrendous. The rain shower is nothing more than a trickle. Overall, a nice hard product and friendly staff, but too many things are lacking to make me stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A one night trip to remember. Neat hotel, great room and a staff without compare. Made to feel at home from the minute we checked in. Steve met our car and could not have been more welcoming. Front desk staff was great and everything was perfect. No question we will be back soon

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have been to New York many times and stayed in this area but this was my first stay at this facility. I was upgraded without expecting it and entered a beautifully decorated and clean room. The view was wonderful and I was impressed with the response from the staff to all my needs while there. You could not ask for a better location in the Times Square area with all the food, shopping, and entertainment steps away. The price was reasonable for the area and I will definitely return in the future. Loved it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Beautiful Room on the 52nd floor, additional amenities just a phone call away, great staff and excellent bellboys. Bar on the top level was fantastic for a pre theatre drink! Very pleasant stay - we even extended for an additional night. If you are a musical lover like we were (7 shows) the location is perfect!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed as a family of 4 (2 adults & 2 teens), for 3 nights beginning of October. We had just finished your of Europe & stayed 3 nights in London before flying to NYC to what we thought would be a wonderful 5 star experience in a new hotel. We arrived by private car & went straight to reception to checkin. I informed them of our reservation (we paid for this room in advance); & the receptionist asked if I would like to pay the $17 extra for a view room (seeing as though this hotel is 55 floors high) I said yes. We were given the keys to our room which was on the 25th floor, room 2505. The view was overlooking buildings across the road & a tiny bit of Times Square. Now the room; bathroom was nice although had to ask for extra towel, shampoo, soap & all other toiletries. Our bed was comfortable however when the kids hopped into theirs we noticed the bottom sheet had all holes in it. The sheets felt just like $50 Kmart sheets, definitely not a Hyatt standard & especially since the hotel is only new. We left it for the night since we knew they would be changed the next day. After spending all day out the next day & getting back to the hotel late we retired to our beds & to our surprise the same holely sheets were there. Left note next day all sheets changed. Carpet in room covered in stains. Wifi is NOT free. Reception area feels very cold not welcoming, no offer to take our 4 suitcases up. Breakfast in restaurant very basic, basic eggs. Concierge desk is not welcoming with no maps on display or anything. To make matters worse we checked out of hotel & went to train station to depart for DC. Once there realised we left our Australian Passports in safe. My husband ran all the way back in pouring rain whilst I rang them advising he was coming. They said they would have them in reception. He got there, Reception knew nothing; housekeeping said they gave to security. Security didn't know anything. They got the Manager & everyone was searching for them. Eventually found them with one of the Security staff. This took well over half an hour. I'm sorry but we will not be staying there again & would not recommend it to anyone. Perhaps if we were in our designer clothes they might have treated us differently, but remember you don't judge a book by its cover.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at The Hyatt Times Square on a layover going to St. Maarten. Even though the flight left from JFK (a $50 cab ride away) we opted to stay in the city to see a few sights. On arrival there was noticeable excitement in the lobby area amoungst the guest. We left our bags in the room and quickly ventured out. A right turn and a few steps puts you in Times Square with all the lights and excitement you could stand. The area has been completely revitalized since I was last there years ago.The room was on the 8th floor and quiet, but the view was unimpressive as we just saw another building across the street. I'm sure there are rooms with spectacular NYC views though. The hotel is centrally located in walking distance to many attractions. There were 2-3 subway stations close by which made travel to other parts of the city convenient. There was a small restaurant in the hotel, but many places to eat cold be found in the area. In all a nice but short stay in the heart of Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed Thanksgiving week..Hotel is wonderful. The Location can't be beat.. I walked down, the half block to 6th to see the Parade. Perfect! Hotel is between 6th/7th..Times Square... Very convenient. Got a huge room on the 34th floor, which was very modern, very comfortable, and clean. Bed was magnificent..View magnificent.. They provide water, newspaper and coffee maker each day.. I was thrilled..The staff were exceptional.. A shout out to my housekeeping girl, ROSE, (she went above and beyond to make my room spotless), and Jorge Lazo the Reservation manager was super helpful. Thanks for making my stay enjoyable. I would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Bar Fifty Four at the Hyatt Times Sq on 45th St has fantastic views, from guess what, the 54th floor! Great service, decor with outside area to maximise the view / atmosphere. Not cheap but you are 54 floors up looking out at iconic buildings and down on Times Sq. Bar Manager, Brendon was an ideal host. Well worth a visit, dress code smartish to not feel out of place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Times Square. Location was ideal for first time visitors like us. We were able to walk to most of the sites we wanted to see. It was convenient to have breakfast in the morning at the hotel. We visited the rooftop bar one evening for a nightcap. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife & I are usually tropical travelers, but our "change of pace" stay in Manhattan blew us away!We spent Thanksgiving week at the hotel. Our stay was perfect! Customer service throughout the hotel, from check-in to check-out, was consistently friendly & proactive. Have a request, say, for more towels? We got them delivered within 5 minutes!It appeared that each floor has only 8 or 9 rooms. We decided to splurge by taking advantage of a standby upgrade (extra $39 per night). We had a king deluxe (#4201), and even though it was adjacent to the elevators, we never heard a sound during the entire 5 nights of our stay. Our views were: west toward part of Times Square & the Hudson, south toward Lower Manhattan, and looking east from the bedroom, we watched the Thanksgiving Day Parade on 6th Ave. without having to brave the snow! The hotel is positioned perfectly for exploring Midtown Manhattan. It is situated a 1/2 block from the heart of Times Square. We were within easy walking distance of numerous theatres, Rockefeller Ctr., St. Pat's Cathedral, the Empire St. Building, & Grand Central Terminal. If you choose not to walk, or access more distant parts of the City, it's made easy with at least 3 subway stations within a few blocks.Out of convenience, we ate our breakfasts at T45, the in house restaurant. The food was good, as were the portions. We also had a couple of very hearty lunches there. There are innumerable eating places of every variety & price in the surrounding area. The range encompasses fast food, Irish pubs, and neighborhood style ethnic fare, to medium & high end restaurants.At the spa, we both had massages. These were not your typically disappointing hotel massages; far from it. They were pricey (it's NYC, after all!), but they were also excellent! Both Manuela & Michelle are outstanding massage therapists. We recommend them both; you won't be disappointed.The bottom line: We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for a single night before leaving on a vacation. The hotel is right in the heart of Times Square yet is pretty quiet. The room is a nice size by NYC standards. But: the bed was the absolute hardest mattress I have ever slept on- or I should say tried to sleep on. My husband- who can sleep anywhere- even complained. And we couldn't get the room completely dark- we had to unplug one lamp and the nifty modern light switches stayed lit throughout the night. All in all made for a poor night's sleep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the second time I stayed at Hyatt Times Square. This time it was for my birthday. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating from check in to departure as before. Nice clean room for relaxing after a busy day out an about. I received a birthday card signed by many of the staff along with a bottle of wine. What a nice touch that helped make my getaway special. Thanks and I will return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I visited that hotel during a business trip for four nights,very quiet hotel with a larger and very convinient rooms.the staff was very kind ans helpfull,the location is amazing just inches from time sqare.i enjoyed staying there...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel. It's been open less than a year and they seemed to be trying very hard to please their guests. Room spacious, clean and new. Bed super comfortable. Gym very well equipped. I really liked the restaurant downstairs - staff super helpful and I had a very good breakfast. I didn't even ask for a late checkout but I was fine to leave at 4pm - none of this knocking on the door from 8am trying to harass you to leave. I was on the 34th floor - great view. They have a roof bar but alas I didn't get the chance to use it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed week end 21st Nov to 24th,great hotel 2 min walk to Times square.Rooms were excellent and bed super comfy.Had a drink roof top bar $23 a cocktail $11 a bottle of beer,however atmosphere and view were superb. A lot of attractions and shows were easily within walking distance,would not hesitate to book hotel again.  We flew into JFK and out of Newark,,, taxi from JFK $58 set fee + tip,for return we got taxi fromhotel top Penn station and train to Newark $6 taxi fare and $12.50 single per head to Newark airport.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here for three nights in November 2014 on business. While check-in staff could perhaps have been more friendly the room was superb. Big, spacious and extremely clean as well as a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was fantastic with a floor-to ceiling view of the city - NB. there is a curtain!! Having stayed in another chain hotel in New York recently this is far superior as well as being cheaperDelicious breakfast in the hotel restaurant and very good service there. I also had a drink in the rooftop bar which has outstanding views and is definitely worth a visit.My main negative comment would be that the elevators can take a very long time (my longest wait was 7 minutes). But I am impatient!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel registration was quick and staff were very friendly!! Rooms very clean and comfortable. My daughter said it was like sleeping on a cloud. Down comforters, each bed had 4 wonderful pillows, heated floor in bathroom, rain showerhead. People opened doors and always smiling!! Close to everything! We walked to Radio city music hall, central park, times square, penn station. Roof top bar has a nice atmosphere, beautiful view. Drinks are pricey but since you are on the 54th floor with a beautiful view who cares? We were walking to sight see and they gave us a map and directions. They explained the subway and directed us to the stations. . 10/10 !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are thinking of going to New York you have to stay here! It was my first time in NY with my family... it worked so well for us and the location was exceptional. We are different kinds of people and very different ages but had the most magical time in the Hyatt! The staff were amazing and the rooms were so clean and views beautiful. 10/10 without question.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just got back from the Big Apple! Not my first time there but my first time traveling solo. I booked this hotel mainly because of the price and location. (they do place a $200 hold on your card at check in and you are a 2 minute walk from the center of Time Square) I took the Amtrak up and arrived a few hours before check in.. HOWEVER they accommodated me with no problem...very friendly staff. The room was well appointed on the 32nd floor.. nice and modern. There is a restaurant attached to the lobby that most use for breakfast, dinner and snacks and I think the hotel uses them for room service. The roof top bar has breath taking views but the DRINKS ARE PRICEY!!! Over all it was a great stay for a 2 night get away in New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I spent a night at this hotel. It is located in the heart of midtown, making it very convenient to all the Broadway shows, many of the restaurants, and of course Times Square. The rooms are a nice size for Manhattan, and are modern and quite. The staff here is typical New York. Pleasant, efficient, but not overly friendly. Everyone is very helpful, if you ask.A nice surprise was the roof top bar. If you are staying here, make sure to get up to the bar. Besides a fantastic view, and outdoor seating, the bartender makes some very creative drinks, and the kitchen prepares some great snacks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a really nice hotel. Clean, well-appointed rooms (we stayed in a corner suite), nice location close to the theaters, with parking. Roof-top bar is beautiful but can get crowded. Staff was very nice and accommodating. Bed was very comfortable but it had no sheet only a duvet, I thought this was very odd. If it were earlier when I discovered this I would have called room service but it did not interfere with our sleep. Fan in bedroom was loud and if I were staying another night it would have bothered me. With that said, super clean! That is very important to me, other things are trivial. Not the least expensive hotel in the area, but well worth the price for the amenities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When we decided to visit New York (first time) I had no idea which hotel would be ideally located because they all advertise location, I looked into Intercontinental and Crowne Plaza but didn't book until last minute and I'm glad! When we entered NYC I logged onto Travelocity to look at last minute deals and came acroos Hyatt Times Sqaure which was discounted 20% plus allowed a Travelocity coupons ($40) unlike most hotels. I booked 3 days and called the hotel immediately to request a high floor and was told the usual of all hotels its honored upon availability. As we drove up to the hotel they had a valet parking spot which we used for our car, they took care of our luggage immediately, lobby was nice and bright yes on the smaller side but hey this is New York! As we checked in we asked if we could see an Executive Suite and they didn't have any available but she offered to show us a Deluxe Room which was bigger than the Standard, she showed us our room (gave us 38th floor with an amazing view) then took us up the 50th floor to show us the Deluxe Room which was just as beautiful, slightly bigger and it had a bathtub, since we didn't expect for our Standard Room to be sooooo nice we skipped upgrading and kept our room. The room was double beds with a stunning view, new bathroom with heated floor and probably one of the cleanest rooms we had ever booked, my husband and I travel alot with our son who is highly allergic and have issues with hotel room cleanliness most of the time, we we have traveled all over the states, Europe and go to Mexico twice a year and we can safely say this is the nicest room we have ever stayed in! It was very clean, nice bathroom and my God, bedding, the bedding, ahhhhh finally someone does good linens with down comforters!!!! The hotel was located a block away from Times Square, close to everything and probably one of the cleanest streets in the neighborhood, with street closure on Saturdays with many vendors and food stands, we loved it!!! The staff was pleasant and friendly, always acknowledging the guests and openning the doors. We loved our stay, some of the minor negatives were slow elevators, there was 5 of them I beleive but it was still a bit slow, nothing major, the bar/cafe in the lobby is overpriced, the smallest bottle of Pepsi I had no idea existed was $3! Ouch!!!!! Now, my biggest negative, a mothers point of view, mother of a 7 year old, was the window in our room, it was a stunning view with a window that could be opened, and I don't mean just opened I mean reached and opened by a 7 year old, no screen protection whatssoever, none, no security/safty lock anywhere! Wow what a mistake Hyatt! I keep an eye on my son and brainwash him about safety all the time but I found this to be a big flaw figuring we were on the 38th floor and again only because it was accesible and openable by kids. That would be our only flaw (mothers biggest) other than that we absolutely LOVED every minute of our stay and will definitely book again in the future!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location - minutes from Times Square, theaters, restaurants and shopping. I liked our room (corner suite) - huge floor-to-ceiling windows opening up a great view, nice bathroom and a very comfortable bed. The room itself was not very big for a suite. I did not like the lobby at all, it was small, crowded and awkward. There were 6 elevators, 3 of which were fast ones (they skipped quite a few floors and went to the upper floors fast), but we often had to wait for the elevator on the way down for a very long time. Had lunch at the cafe in the lobby and we all were very disappointed with our food, I would not eat there again. I can't say that I loved this hotel, even thought the room was nice enough.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I rarely write a review about hotels during trips. However, the Hyatt Times Square (not to confuse with the Grand Hyatt midtown) deserves it.I spent 10 days during a business trip. A brand new hotel in a great location: 2 mins. walk from Times Square. Super clean, friendly, service oriented staff. Spacious rooms (relative to NYC), real fast internet, and housekeeping dedicated to the comfort of the guest.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I recently spent 3 nights at this Hyatt. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is near Broadway so great for shows. The rooms are normal size for midtown Manhattan which means not large, but actually very nice. We had a room with 2 queen beds and were very comfortable. However, this is New York so not in room except to sleep and change clothes. Also the bathroom had heated floors what a plus. I will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were going to NYC to see the Christmas show at Radio City. This hotel is a perfect location. It is half a block from Time Square and six blocks from Radio City. A 15 minute walk from Penn, Station (33rd and 8th).The hotel is only 11 months old. Rooms, as in most Hyatts, are not huge but we needed two beds and it was just fine my friend and I. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms clean and new. The staff was friendly and helpful. I did hate the name tags they wore. Notice them, they are hand done by each staff member. It looked a little unprofessional to me. But that was our only complaint. Oh the elevators are slow. This was to my taste very contempory. Young people everywhere. It is not the Hyatt that you are expecting, not bad just different. It reminded me of a boutigue hotel. I would stay there again when visiting NYC. We were on the elevatory with some young men who were headed to the top floor for a sky view. They said it was nice up there. We did not go. We were to busy!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After being long-hauled by a cabbie I finally made it to the Hyatt Times Square around 3:30 last Friday. The first impression of the hotel came as I exited the cab with my bags and walked past 3 staff members – not one with a greeting or a “may I help you with your bags.” Entering the very small lobby of this large hotel I found 3 front desk agents assisting other guests. I was waved up and after giving my information the agent looked and said the computer shows my room marked as clean and ready but would have a manager check it first. I was asked to have a seat in the lobby while the room was checked. With limited seating and lots of other guests already waiting I claimed a spot in the center of the lobby and stood while waiting. I found it interesting the number of staff people they had standing post or walking around with suits on – yet none greeted guests or inquired if anyone needed help as there were several people just standing in the lobby. After about 20 minutes I saw the agent that checked me in standing behind the desk – I got her attention and she acknowledged that my room was ready. I wondered if I had stood there longer if she would have remembered me or not. I was given my keys to the 27th floor and directed to the bank of elevators. I was kind of surprised being a Platinum member that I was only getting a room on the 27th floor – but I wasn’t going to say anything and then have to wait in the lobby any longer. Elevators:Be prepared to wait…. And wait…. And wait. Especially during peak hours for sure. I found the norm was 5 to 6 minutes – shorter in the late night hours. The Room:I had a King room with the Terrace. The common areas were very clean but the hallways were extremely bright. The Terrace was very nice with two chairs and a small table with a decent view. The room itself was also very clean and typical of a Hyatt room. I didn’t find the bed to be as comfortable as other Hyatt beds and the pillows certainly weren’t like the others. I did like how they have electrical outlets on both sides of the bed. This is something any new hotel should be doing with so many people using electronics these days. Internet connection was very good in the room. The only issue I had with it was that they made you log in each day. At the Austin Hyatt if you are staying for 3 days it shows that you have 72 hours of usage. The bathroom was very nice and certainly a decent size for a NY hotel. The best part was the shower, I don’t think I’ve ever experienced such strong water pressure. From both the rainforest head to the wand it was the best for sure. It reminded me of the Seinfeld episode when the Super was changing out showerheads in Jerry’s apartment building. Housekeeping was amazing. I cannot say enough about their housekeeping staff – at least for the 27th floor. Even for waking up late each day the room was done by the time I would return and was spotless. I didn’t visit the rooftop bar or their lobby restaurant so I cannot comment on either of those. When I checked out on Monday I ran into the same issue as when I arrived – walked past several staff members who didn’t say a word. As I stood at the curb looking at the stopped traffic hoping to find a cab a bellman did approach and asked “what airport.” I told him LGA and he said, “would you like one of the sedans that we have…. I cut him off knowing what he was doing. You will see town cars or SUV’s parked out front; these drivers pay bellman cash to get passengers going to airports. Some bellman even charge cabbies a certain amount depending the airport – so in addition to your tip they are already receiving a couple extra bucks from your cabbie. To be clear, I am not suggesting that this is what this bellman was doing or that this deal is happening at the Hyatt Times Square. Anyway, the problem with hailing a cab in front of the Hyatt in the middle of the afternoon is heavy traffic. Even if I had found a cab I would have just been sitting in traffic heading into Times Square with even worse traffic. I ended up walking over to 5th Ave and jumped in a cab there. With this property being new I believe the Hyatt people will get the kinks worked out and get everything running smoothly. The two other agents working the frontn desk when I checked in, Nico & Danilo, seemed to really know how to interact with guests. I am in NY about 6 or 7 times a year, my go-to hotel was sold out during this trip. I might try the Hyatt Times Square again in the future, get upstairs and see their rooftop bar and of course for that shower!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are looking to stay in New York, want somewhere central to the buzz of Times Square, looking for something new, fresh, modern and comfortable, then look no further than the Hyatt Times Square. My first positive impression was at check in. Wow, so friendly, I was able to check in early, check out late, and the receptionist was just lovely, the warmest welcome on a cold New York day. My room was on one of the highest floors, with huge windows, I must admit it was the best loo view I have ever encountered. Room service dinner, served in disposable "to go" packaging, you can also order and pick up yourself. The food: delicious. The room was a decent size for New York standards. Had a lovely lunch at their in house diner, and once again had the best service. Well done Hyatt Times Square, after working in customer service roles for more than 20 years, I know it doesn't matter if you have the best product, it takes one person to give bad service to ruin a whole experience. The service I received here was flawless.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived early and they were able to accommodate us with a smile. All the staff we encountered was very friendly and helpful. This hotel is close to the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the Theatre District. We had 2 very comfortable queen beds. And a very clean room..Our room also had mini fridge which was nice for a few bottles of water. Only draw back no coffee pot in the room. A Starbucks is located across the street. The roof top bar has incredible views and is a great place for a night cap.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this hotel at the end of October. The rooms were nice and clean, albeit a bit small, and the location is great. The staff was pretty good overall. Those that seemed to be more senior and experienced were extremely helpful, friendly, professional and accommodating. The more junior staff such as those that were at the front desk at night seemed to be inexperienced. For example, a lot of hotels offer the option of pre-ordering breakfast in the room by hanging something on your door at night, and the reaction that I received when asking whether this was an option was as if I was speaking Martian. Still, I was eventually offered the option of having the front office staff submit my order ahead of time, but it did take the front office person having to check a few times with someone in a room near the desk to come up with this idea. Something like this seems like a pretty basic option, and I think the late night staff could be a bit better trained with what I would think is not an usual request. I also had to deal with one member of the concierge staff that was a bit condescending, but after her restaurant recommendation didn't have items on its menu that I specifically had said my friend and I wanted, I nicely gave her a card from a sister restaurant that was next door to her recommendation to let her know that maybe she was not quite as smart as she thinks she is. Other than her, however, the staff was very friendly and professional even if some need some more seasoning. I would definitely stay at this hotel again despite any minor glitches here and there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A good time was had by all on Times Square, "Off Broadway" at 45th. We were a group of 10 with mixed activities of business and leisure. We were conveniently located to everywhere we wanted to go. This property outperformed in service beginning with the doorman (we used some hotel cars and van's they procured for us) sustaining with the bellmen (very attentive) and over the top at the front desk (attractive, upbeat, on their professional game). A newly constructed, attractive - even stylish and superiorly located. The rooftop B-54 lounge , featuring both indoor seating and an outdoor patio - opens at 4pm, provides a great view of the city looking downtown - clear view of buildings and lights around the city. Highly recommend

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stay at Hyatts all over the world. If you are visiting NYC, this is located in the center of everything. You are in the Heart of Times Square, the Theater district and a short walk to Rockerfeller Center and 5th Ave. Tons of restaurants will keep you fed in style.The rooms are spacious with beautiful views on the higher floors. We were on 39th. Great bar and observation deck on 54th.Negatives - no top sheet on beds, only a comforter. Not the cleanest arrangement. The waits for elevators are unacceptable, especially with one of three out of service in our stack.Staff was excellent, except doorman who tried to get us to use a private car for $55 for a $35 trip to the River Cafe.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for three nights in a room on a pretty high floor that had a breathtaking glimpse of a corner of Times Square through the floor to ceiling windows. The night lights of the city were also great to see from the bed. The room was clean and had modern amenities. There is a bar on the top floor but the drink prices were outrageous, even for Manhattan. You'd think it was a Park Hyatt bar. We ate breakfast at a cafe south of the hotel that had really reasonable prices and great food. We were able to stay at $160 per night on a special deal which was more than acceptable given its central location and the fact that it was June which is a busy month for tourism. Would stay again definitely.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Last year when we stayed here and only had a comforter and bottom sheet on the bed, all of our hotel friends insisted it must have been a housekeeping mistake. Well, here we are again and NO SHEET. The bed and pillows are comfortable and the fluffy comforter is nice and snugly…but when you get warm in the night and toss off the comforter, it feels weird not to have at least a sheet over oneself. The room is nicely done and spacious. There is a large tile shower. We were in room 3905 and the view was great. Also, views are wonderful from their 54 floor lounge. But there are things that are not comfortable. No robe in the room. Check in is just a few feet from the front door so as you stand in line the cold air blasts you on winter days. And the concierge was sweet but not very knowledgeable. Also, beware of the front bellman. He told us we should take one of "his drivers" because a taxi to the restaurant would be $45 and his driver $55. We took the driver and later learned it would only have been a $35 taxi ride. We like Hyatts but I don't think we will stay at this one again. The Marriott Marquis and other good hotels are just as well located.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for a girls weekend! Was able to check in early. Room 5106 was amazing! Great view, very, very comfortable beds, quiet, nice after a long loud busy day. Excellent location! Very close to Times Square. Rooftop bar had incredible views. One martini is $25, but your paying for the view so totally worth it. Staff was very friendly. Highly recommend! Sushi and kiwi martini across the street at the Red Room was amazing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff are amazing here, Service with a Smile,,,Excellent service-all round, Hotels new & has beautiful decor,Loved the location close to everything. Very Hip Place, Kids loved it. Thanks will most definately be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 4 nights with our two children. The hotel was comfortable and the staff were very helpful. They accommodated our request to move to a higher floor without any problems. The location is great and perfect for accessing all of the main tourist destinations. The room was a bit small but that is to be expected in NYC. The standard of cleanliness was excellent.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here the first weekend in November for our anniversary. We arrived around noon on a rainy Saturday. Did not expect to have a room so early, but to our surprise, a room was ready and waiting. We had a King room on the 50th floor with a view of Times Square. The room was very nice with a surprisingly large bathroom with heated floors. The staff from the bellman to the concierge dest to the front desk were all friendly and helpful. The Hotel overall is very nice. Only negative I would give is the lack of a comfortable lobby/sitting area. Totally enjoyed our two night stay in this city full of life. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: In the heart of manhattan. The higher the floor, the better! Our view from the 47 floor was great. could see the Chrysler building and could see times square also. Walls of windows were amazing. Walk out the front door to a restaurants, and times square. Close to subway too. The rooms are modern and clean. The bathroom was large and well lit. There was a tub and separate shower head. The suite had a nice large couch that was a nice bed for our son and more than big enough and comfy. There is a large desk and tv in both rooms. The closet was also large.The rooftop bar is amazing inside and out! A sure bet and recommend going even if staying elsewhere. Kids not allowed to stay- but let them take a look at the view

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 7 nights in mid October - my husband and I and our 3 year old daughter. It is in a great location on W45th in the heart of Manhattan. Easy walk, train or cab ride to wherever we wanted to go but on a side street so not in the crush of the madness that is Time Square. Check in was quick and easy. We had a king deluxe room on the 53rd floor affording an amazing view of the city. Not sure which direction we were facing but we were looking straight out to the new World Trade Centre Tower. The view and the lights were unforgettable. The room was spacious by New York city standards with a full bath complete with shower stall and tub. My daughter delighted in her tub baths every morning. The bathroom could have done with more counters space. There was very little of it. But the room was clean, obviously very new although the carpet was already dirty in some places. The staff that we encountered were all very pleasant. We had dinner and breakfast a few times in the hotel restaurant mostly because it was convenience. Not bad but with some many options around, I would not rush to eat there. There is a small bar fridge in the room that was empty and this came in very handy for snacks and milk for my daughter. It was a nice touch. There is also a coffeepot and bottled water in the room. It was all very good. I should also mention that the hotel has high speed elevators and there was seldom any wait for one even though at times the hotel was busy. The 53rd was also quiet - obviously being so high up. I would recommend staying here if you want to be in the heart of everything especially if you are in town for Broadway shows. All in all a good stay. I am really more a fan of the smaller more intimate boutique type properties so although the stay was good, I am not sure that I would stay here again. I guess Manhattan has way too many choices to confine oneself to one place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 7 nights with our 2 kids in a Deluxe Double Queen on the 43rd floor. Checkin was very quick and the room was, for NYC, quite large and comfortable for the 4 of us.Breakfast is at the dinner downstairs, 42, and was good even though limited options. The Hotel has no lobby or business center, just 2 computers where you can print stuff. The Hotel is great for those who want a modern hotel in Times Sq as you are only 1/2 a block away from Times Sq. The majority of the guests at this property are there for only a couple of nights so there is a lot of guest rotation. Overall cannot fault this hotel as it perfectly matched my expectations for what a band new Hyatt in NYC should offer.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed 5 nights with our 2 kids (5 and 9 years old) in a deluxe double queen. Check-in was fast and efficient. Our room was available when we arrived at 1 pm and our request to have a high floor was fulfilled (we got a room on 47th floor with partial view on Times Square which was very exciting for the kids). This hotel is new so everything is spotless. We really enjoyed the room which was nicely design with a great bathroom with a shower and a separated tub, comfortable beds, large TV screen, good amenities (there was even toothpaste available), sufficient storages for our 3 suitcases and all our stuff. The location is very good if you want to stay close to the animation of Times Square. The good thing is that the hotel is not right on Times Square like some other hotels but still very close.We also liked the fact that even if there are many rooms in this hotel you don't really feel it as there are only a few rooms per floor, so you don't have to walk and don't feel lost in a huge building.The slightly negative sides are:- WiFi is not free. It would be nice to have a free standard WiFi and to have to pay only if high speed is required.- Lobby is quite small, but this is not really a big deal as this is not a place where you spend a lot of time anyway.- The windows are not so well soundproofed, you can still hear some streets noise at high floors. Anyway you are in New York and not in the middle of country side so, again, this is not a big deal I think.- The rooftop bar is open only as of 4pm and not accessible at all to children. This is a pity we were not allowed to have a drink with our children and enjoy the view. I understand that access could be restricted to children at a certain point of the evening but that would be nice to extend opening hours and allow families to enjoy this facility as well.Overall it was a very good experience. We would definitely return if we want to stay again in Times Square area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our first time to visit New York Times Square. The location was perfect for us to take in a show on Broadway, as it was within walking distance. While the accommodations are basic in that there are no microwaves, coffee pot nor a refrigerator in the room, but the room is exquisitely decorated with a fantastic view from the 31st floor. Quite modern with a heated tile floor in the bathroom, quiet, and super friendly staff, addressing you by name. Note that should you bring a car, it is Valet parking with a significant overnight fee. A small restaurant on-site is available but the neighborhood has many choices within 3 blocks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt for a fun week with friends. The hotel was great. Convenient to the drug store, shopping, subways and obviously...Times Square. The hotel was clean and the staff were great. We enjoyed our time there and had genre at service and always returned to a clean fresh smelling room. There is even a stand out on the street where you can ask for directions, suggestions for activities and other things. I kmow...you're thinking concierge service, but it's more than that. The guy that works there is great and I felt like we were old friends just talking to him. The Sky Bar is a great touch too. Imagine enjoying dinner and fun conversation sitting 54 floors up overlooking the city. You can clearly see the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building from the outdoor seating. They also have a different flavored popcorn each night. It was a great touch. This was a great stay at a fair price. I highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You can't beat this Location half a block in from the hustle and bustle of Time Square on 45th Street. Sleek new modern hotel with minimal lobby... Which means it's down right small. Staff from doorman to front desk are curtious and helpful. The rooms clean, modern, and comfortable. I had a deluxe view suite which gives you great views of the city and Time Square. The restaurant served a basic breakfast and service was attentive. They might consider upgrading the feel as it is a diner setting. I did. It check out the roof top bar but it seemed like there were a lot of people heading up there to catch the view of Time Sq. If you are looking for a great place to stay while hitting the theater or any mid town activity I would definitely recommend this Hyatt offering.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent 2 nights at Hyatt Times Square. Arrived about early, 11AM, but had available room. Front desk staff and doorman extremely friendly & helpful. Asked if we would like to be upgraded to a suite for $150 more total. 45th floor beautiful views--Sure,why not??--wow--- living room- leather couch, gorgeous desk/huge, also used as table, fridge, coffee maker/w Starbucks coffee. Huge Plasma TV, beautiful art work. View of One World Center!!!!(site of World Trade Center) Bedroom great, another huge plasma TV, lighting all over suite was great. View from bedroom--Chrysler Bldg!!!! Bath super modern. Negatives? Closet a little small,but ok, huge amount of drawer space. Whole hotel super modern & spotless! Walking distance to theaters, since it's on 45th St. But you don't see or hear the bustle of Times Square. We took cabs several times, & the doormen really worked to get them for us since it was a busy time of night. -- Fifth Av. is couple blocks the opposite direction, great!! I go to NYC couple times a year , this will be my new hotel!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was by far the greatest hotel we've stayed at in the city from the staff to the accommodations. We were there for 4 nights and got upgraded to a corner suite on the 52nd floor with amazing views of Time Square. Suite was spotless and so were amenities. The bathroom floors were heated and entire experience was wonderful!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for one night prior to a cruise out of New York. We had a suite with a separate bedroom with king bed. The kids slept in the living room on the pull-out couch which they said was very "fancy" and comfortable. The bathroom was my favourite - soooo nice, loved the rainfall shower. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating as well. I hope we get to stay here again soon! :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After researching where to pop the question for months, I found Bar 54 at the top of the Hyatt Times Square. It was a perfect day for the most important question. We got to the restaurant right when they opened, got a spot outside overlooking the NY skyline and Times Square. Knee, words, tears, hugs, happiness! I cannot thank Royce Eason, Assistant Food & Beverage Manager and Brendan Shorrock, Food & Beverage Manager for their service, attention to detail and thoughtfulness. The staff at the restaurant was gracious and very kind after witnessing the big moment. Without warning or request, one staff member, Jonathan Dicker grabbed his personal phone and took pictures of the proposal. The moment would have been a wonderful memory without his quick thinking, but now we have actual photos of the moment. We are forever grateful. Bar 54 is where my fiancée and I were engaged, but I strongly recommend it to anyone who is looking to see New York from a different point of view while sipping tasty beverages and trying great food. As for the level of service, see the previous paragraph. Thank you Bar 54 staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with my wife for a few days at the end of Oct/Nov and enjoyed the hotel and location immensely. The room was on the 42nd floor with a partial view of times square and the floor to ceiling windows, inc in the bathroom, were a great feature of the stay. Despite being right by Times square the noise wasn't a problem and the neighborhood has everything you might need for shopping and restaurants. One final word on the staff as they are a key feature of this hotel and they couldnt be more helpful and friendly, especially the big guy on the door and his colleagues.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just had a 5 night stay at this hotel. The location is fantastic - just off of Times Square and within easy reach of all major attractions: Central Park, Empire State, Macy's etc... The hotel is very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Coming back every day to a clean, tidy room with crisp sheets was very welcoming after a hard day in New York. The rooms are also a good size.The only downside is that you have to pay for WiFi in your room but it's free in the hotel lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times SquareI recently traveled to New York for a business trip and decided to go early and spend a few days visiting friends. On my last trip to New York, I stayed on Wall Street and did not like being that far south in the city. I decided to give the Hyatt Times Square due to the central the location of the hotel (45th between 6th and 7th Ave), booked a good rate and was able to secure a Corner Room a Suite upgrade. The Hyatt Times Square opened in December 2013 and is within a 5/10 minute walk of over a dozen subway lines. If you are traveling with large luggage I would not advise taking the subway as very few stations have escalators or elevators. Also, trudging through TimesSquare with luggage is a hassle. Upon arrival at the hotel, guests are given an option of using a kiosk to check-in or using the traditional check-in desk. I attempted to use the kiosk to check-in, but ran into issues because my room was not ready. Given that my suite upgrade was complimentary, I did not have an issue waiting for it to be available. I dropped off my luggage at the front desk to hold while I went out and grabbed a late lunch. The front desk called my mobile phone when my room was ready and I returned to the hotel. It would have been nice if the front desk arranged to have my luggage delivered to my room, but that did not happen. When I got back to the hotel, I completed the checkin process and was given my room key (RFID/NFC). The lady a the check-in desk inquired if this was my first time at the property. When I replied that it was, she seemed a little surprised and provided me with a free drink voucher (in addition to the 1k bonus diamond points). I then proceeded to the elevator bank, which is poorly designed. There are two elevators that serve floors 2-25 and three elevators that serve floors 26-54. Be prepared to wait during peak and some non-peak hours. Room 4907 is a corner suite room that faces South and has superb views of Times Square, Chrysler Building and the Freedom Tower. The living room and bedroom are sufficient in size (neither too big or small), but may get a little tight if you have more than two adults staying in the room. Both rooms contained lots of windows, even some that opened a few inches. As both rooms have southerly facing views, they receive lots of natural sunlight. The bathroom was quite large and contained a large soaking tub, separate shower and heated floors. The bath products were acceptable, but I was not interested in bringing them home with me. Overall, I enjoyed my stay (and the views) at the Hyatt Times Square and would consider staying here again. Hopefully the slow elevator situation will be addressed soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great hotel, stayed on the 42nd floor with a balcony amazing views, room was clean and big everything you needed just a phone call away, staff all great and very helpful. I didn't get time to go to the roof top bar . Would have loved to have stayed longer. Hope to be back soon. Shame the wifi in rooms isn't free. But is free in reception.Thanks for a great 3 night stay

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent one night at this hotel while attending a Christmas music special taping at Radio City and were completely impressed with the quality of the accommodations and outstanding service. Our room was clean and of adequate size and my request for extra bath towels was taken care of at check in. The rooftop bar was a pleasure wit unsurpassed views and great service. We asked the concierge Tes, to help with dinner reservations and he quickly took care of those for us. He also patiently answered our questions and held our luggage after checkout so we could take the rest of the day to see more of the sights in the city. I would recommend this hotel for any type of stay, it offers quality and a location convenient to Times Square, the Theater District, NBC Studios and Radio City among others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 1 night last weekend with 10 teenaged girls, in town for my daughter's birthday celebration. I was looking for a hotel with 2 queen beds (not doubles), a convenient location, and updated/modern rooms. I booked 3 deluxe queen rooms (small up charge from regular price). After days of searching the internet, I came up with the Hyatt Times Square, and was not disappointed. Everyone we came into contact with was cheerful, polite and helpful. I had requested that at least 1 of the rooms be ready for an early check-in, as we were taking a train in to the city, but needed to do a quick change to get ready to see a show. This request was granted, which made the turnaround much easier. The rooms were comfortable and clean, and the girls appreciated the fact that the bathrooms had a long run of counter, so that they could spread out. We were on floors 29, 30 and 31, and were not bothered by any street noise. The rooms were very reasonably priced, the location was convenient, the beds were comfortable, and the hotel staff was great. I have recommended it already to several people, and would definitely go back. I thought it was a great value for NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am now a walking commercial for the terrific hospitality, service and quality at the Hyatt Times Square. I’ve been to New York several times over the last two years to see theater. After staying at some other establishments, my second visit to the Hyatt Times Square confirmed that it is the real deal. The staff - from the front desk employees to the bell captain all the way to the manager - are helpful and professional. I am a Platinum Hyatt Passport member and the manager even called me in my room to welcome me to the hotel and thank me for my business. The rooms are a good size and the bathrooms are very roomy by New York standards. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms include a very large, wall-mounted high definition TV. T45, the diner in the lobby, is a great place for breakfast or a quick bite to eat at reasonable prices. If you are going to New York to take in plays and musicals on Broadway, this hotel is in a great location. I saw four plays in three days and never had to take a taxi as all of the theaters were within just a few short blocks of the hotel. Also, while this is a large hotel the lobby never seemed overcrowded and my room was very quiet. The elevator is one of the fastest you'll ever experience. I stayed on the 25th floor and the trip in the elevator was lickety-split fast.I can’t say enough about the Hyatt Times Square. It is my “go to” hotel for staying in New York City.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We would return! I don't think we could have been more pleased. My wife and I stayed here last week. Great location about a block from Times Square. Good restaurants within walking distance. Very pleasant staff. We had the room w/ a King bed and it was adequately sized for us. Spotless bathroom appeared recently renovated and was awesome - especially the heated floor. Elevators were among the fastest I've experienced. Roof top lounge on 54th floor- very nice and with that view I did not mind paying extra for drinks. Depending on time of evening, you might want to call up there for reservations. Criticisms? Hard to find one this time around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect location.New,modern ,comfortable,with perfect furniture and very clean.The view from its bar at the 50th floor is unforgettable.The only reason that I do not give 5 degrees ,is that there is no free internet in the rooms .only in the lobby it is free and there are no more than ten seats

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the best hotel I have ever stayed in visiting NYC. The location, personnel, and rooms were fabulous. Thank you to Brittany for making my birthday weekend special. Chester the doorman was so great and friendly. I can not say enough about how wonderful and friendly this hotel is!! Great rooftop bar! Cole the waitress was great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Visited this hotel for 5 days and was pleasantly surprised in a positive way. It's sort of a no frills type hotel with very good quality. Doesn't really have room service even though the T45 restaurant in the lobby with bring your food delivery upstairs in a shopping bag. But in this location, you are probably going to eat out anyway.We had a suite on the 40th floor that was about 800 square feet, which is a very nice size for the price that we paid. Newer furnishings, comfortable bed and heated bathroom floors which is a very nice feature for cold mornings in New York City. The one drawback was the lobby that was very small but had a very efficient staff that are friendly. You're going to like the super fast elevators that have to be one the fastest I've ever been on. Gets you to the top floors in a matter of seconds.Overall a nice hotel with courteous, helpful staff. Not luxury by any means, but if you're on a vacation or business trip, the location with price and services offered , this hotel cannot be beat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was a great hotel. It is more of a boutique hotel than a large extravagant hotel. We stayed here two nights and had a great time. The staff was genuine and helped us find restaurants and with general directions. . The room was very nice, a little small but that is expected in NY. They put us in a room with an great view as well. The free breakfast was a nice touch as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed overnight for a evening in the city and as always our stay was very enjoyable. The location could not be better if you want Times Square, the rooms are a good size for the city and well maintained. The Sky Lounge on the roof is the highest outdoor seating in the city. Pricey drinks but worth it for the view. Room rates are fair based on location and being a four star hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a wonderfully friendly hotel. The front desk staff was so friendly and helpful. They even mailed my post card and the stamp was complimentary. From the moment I arrived and the valet took my car to park I was treated well by such friendly, courteous staff. We were visiting NewYork with out of town relatives who had never been to the Big Apple. What a wonderful impression your staff left with them. The room was spacious and clean and had the most comfortable beds. We were able to leave our car in the parking the next day while we toured the city. The location is perfect right I in the heart of Times Square within walking distance of the theaters and attractions.Thank you Hyatt for a great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location in Manhattan, right in he middle of Times Square. If you like the quiet life, this isn't the hotel for you. It's always busy but very convenient to get to all the local attractions. The hotel itself has an excellent restaurant and the highest roof top bar in Manhattan, even if $23 a drink is a tad pricey! The gym offers spa facilities and access to a good free gym. Our room was spacious and had some great views of the city! If I had to criticise something, the lobby is extremely small so gets congested quickly around check-in time and free Wifi is only available in the reception and bar area. Overall, the hotel is expensive but very convenient in an excellent location to form a base from.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When you stay in New York you make a choice about the district and then you deal with it. I would not necessarily choose to stay in Times Square for pleasure but when needs must - you cannot go wrong with the Hyatt. The main difference that sets the Hyatt apart from other hotels - for my money - is the customer service. Yes, I know that many places have great customer service and that all staff understand that it is in their best interests to deliver great customer service as it is the bread and butter of the industry ... BUT not all make excellent customer service appear completely effortless and enjoyable. At the Hyatt Times Square it doesn't feel like customer service, it feels like just the way they do things as people.I want to make special mention of the door men who were charm itself and made friends with my Dad who has trouble walking and was suffering from a stomach bug. They assisted him in and out of the front seat of my sister's Prius and let him lean on their shoulders while it was being brought round. And they chatted with him about the weather, the army, laughed at his jokes. I wanted to invite them round for Christmas.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I usually stay at the Andaz on 5th Avenue, but it was booked. Booked this Hyatt property instead -- new and in Times Square. Great location if you want to be in Times Square. The hotel is new, however, it already shows signs of the volume of people that must stay there. Lots of stains on carpets in hallways. Rooms are simple and clean, and on the bigger side for NYC. I booked a Deluxe view. While it was on the 45th floor the view was just ok. It was largely of other buildings in the times square area. The bathroom was large, clean and new. The gym is nice -- new equipment and spacious.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The usual Hyatt standard where everything works. Easy walking distance from the many sights in Midtown. The king room size was typical of New York hotels, being quite small. Breakfast eating options in the area are limited, so the T45 restaurant provided a good alternative, if slightly expensive. However, recommend that you make a booking, as it is a popular venue for both hotel guests and passing trade. Surprisingly, there was no free WIFI in the hotel room, but it was available in the lobby. Hence the those seats were always occupied

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for only one night, but we had a great stay. We had a corner room , on 39th floor , so was quite large. We had also a great view of Time Square.The location is fantastic- right the corner from Times Square, so everything is there.We went to the top bar-expensive, but people are having a drink there just to enjoy the amazing view. Overall- a great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with my wife for two nights. Rooms are very small, but this is NYC. The hotel is very clean and modern. The location is ideal. Restaurant is too small for this size hotel. The wifi is free in the lobby, but not in your room. Wifi is indispensable in today's world, and all hotels should offer it for free to their customers. I dealt with Angelika on two occasions, and she was great ! The facilities at their spa is sub par, but my massage with Michelle was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Warm welcome after a long journey, free room upgrade with great view of Times Square Hotel situated on a side street away from the crowds and noise, clean rooms, no problems with Lifts, access to the gym, break fast a touch expensive, great base for family break in New York, walking distance to theatres, tour buses, shops, restaurants and all the Times Square sights and experience. Break fast in hotel good a bit on pricey side, for affordable super efficient breakfast worth trying out Evergreen Diner short walk on 145 West 47th Street, a Saturday market in front hotel was a surprise - food, fashion, music, souvenirs, for any one checking in or out of the hotel, access may have been limited on market day, Staff were polite and helpful, highlighting tourist attractions ( avoid SKY Line tours - poor experience ),checking out - was slow particularly where there was a cash deposit, overall great hotel, excellent location and great staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: lovely hotel in great location, amazingly quiet at least on the 42nd floor considering where we are. Only gripe is internet, at a hotel of this standard and price surely internet should be included. $12.95/day

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Not impressed at all. The whole place is starkly modern from the lobby to the rooms to the frankly unfriendly cold check in staff. Compared to the amazing service and elegance of the Hay Adams hotel in Washington where I Stayed the night before it is just chalk and cheese. Went from being a valued guest to a room number in 24 hours. Hyatt you need to do some customer service training here fast. Very disappointing

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Half block from the Times Square action!Four stars hotel with clean design, good room, with nice view and very well maintained.The staff was superb, but sometimes things got busy down the lobby,Very small lobby for living room, waiting in line spaces, concierge and elevators.No breakfast included with the room, but there's plenty of options nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is located close to everything. The rooms are stylish and the bathroom and shower are lovely. And...the elevators are quick! We did nt use the spa or exercise room. The diner off the lobby is very convenient to get coffee in the morning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Talk about being right in the middle of everything!Not only is this hotel strategically located, it is superbly managed. The staff is outstanding, the decor is modern without being uncomfortable (too modern), and the hotel is spotless.We stayed in room 5103 and had a spectacular view of Broadway, the Empire State Building, the Freedom Tower and the river - wow!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for long weekend with wife for 10th anniversary. This hotel was perfect. Location was steps from Times Square. Nico checked us in with great hospitality. Room was spotless with a great view of Times Square. Delicious breakfast room service. Super fast elevator. Huge television. Spacious bathroom. Comfortable king bed. Perfect, perfect, perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived to a very courteous staff who were genuinely interested in our stay to NYC. After telling them we were there for our 25th wedding anniversary we were upgraded to a city view of Time Square.We entered the room which was very clean and the washroom immaculate. Only small drawback was there's no closet but ample place to store your clothes. The room also had a coffee maker and fridge which was great. There is a charge for wifi but it's free in the lobby area. There's so much to do in NYC so who wants to be stuck on a computer in your room.Hotel is in a prime location and walking distance to attractions as well as easy access to the subway.Wouldn't hesitate in staying here again...we had a wonderful time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
