review_body: Sure this is a busy, clean,hotel and convenient if you are wanting to be at Times Sq but apart from that do not expect a memorable experience for there will be none.Staff are cold and impersonal. I rang up to ask for a hotel car for a pickup at JFK but was told there was none and that the cab would be my best option. The cabbie was not the least friendly so my intro to NY was not the best. It didnt help boost our expections in the Big Apple. We heard so much from reviews that the corner suite had views to die for. The booking office in Australia (I wouldn't exactly call them friendly nor informed) assured me there would be a Roll Away bed but was told on arrival that the corner suite was too small for one and that the couch would not be good for sleeping. However, they did move us the next day to a higher room which seemed more fitting for the name "corner suite". This was in the "right" or Times Square end of the building perhaps not as restricted in space and with the same couch but apparently this one is a couch bed - opens up into a bed. Do not ask the concierge or reception or anyone for advise for chances are you'll be given unbelievably bad ones: 1. according to one the best and only Thai is a Japanese fusion restaurant-bar across the road (fried rice and the fried noodles was of mid-primary school level, forget the rest). 2. according to another the best Thai, it had no taste whatsoever even though we over-ordered to minimise the risk of disappointment., 3. the third recommendation was a Chinese restaurant.Lastly, it was my wife's birthday so I asked Ryan the concierge if he could put a card or flowers or even chocolates in the room whilst we were out. He said he would see what he could do but fortunately I did not hold my breath.Oh, the takeout soup at the lobby store (this place is so limited for choice we did not bother after that) spilled out at the lid so my wife had to go back down to the store. We were told not to worryabout paying, it's free. But it wasn't free because it was in our room account and I did not bother arguing....I wasn't after a freebie. Don't expect fantastic views from the rooftop bar either - the picture at the top of this page would be the best perspective one would get.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This almost new addition to the Hyatt NYC portfolio was in just the right spot for a one night trip to the big apple. This a a handsome hotel right in the middle of the theater district. I arrived to at 7:45P to check in running late for a dinner appointment and thought I would just pick up my key at the Gold Passport desk - having per-registered on the web, check my bag,and be on my way. It did not happen that way. Firstly, there is no Gold Passport Desk. Secondly, only 2 of the 3 front desk stations were manned. My "just pick up your key" registration took the better part of 15 minutes!Aside from the check-in experience, this is a first class hotel. Excellent, well-appointed room, great bed, and bathroom with large shower. T45 is a great little eatery, right off the lobby.Not what

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 7 nights and weren't disappointed. From the time we booked in and until we checked out we found all of the staff very helpful and courteous. Our room was modern, spacious and clean and had spectacular views of the city skyline. Although the hotel is 5 minutes from Time Square it's reasonably quiet by New York standards. The only negatives: invest in some decent pillows. The ones we had were so flat they could have been filled with tissue paper. Also, the free wifi was useful but could only be accessed from the main lobby which was usually packed with people checking in or out. It's painful when you have to come down from your room on the 43rd floor. Maybe an hour's free access per day in the room wouldn't go astray.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very modern hotel. Centrally located within a 1 minute walk to times square. Very close to subway. This is a very busy hotel. The service was excellent and room were very modern. Heated floors, excellent bathroom, comfortable bed. In my opinion, the best Hyatt in the US that I stayed at out of 12 of them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very well situated. Close to Times Square. Rooms were a good size. The bar on the 54th floor is a great way to spend time looking over the city with drinks. Decor all clean and modern. Plenty of good eating places nearby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First impressions aren’t very favorable. The lobby is smallish and stark, black and white and without chairs and tables and felt rather cave-like. Maybe the designer didn’t want guests lounging around and cluttering the place up. Whatever the reason, it’s not very welcoming, so it’s a good thing the Hyatt staff made up for this by being very friendly.We’d booked on-line and opted for the $20 room upgrade “if available” but were given two upgrades. This got us a fairly spacious room with a good-sized balcony and a view over Times Square. Noise was not an issue: with the balcony door shut we heard nothing.The room itself was spotlessly clean and in excellent condition and the bed was very comfortable. Likewise the bathroom, which continued the black and white theme, was immaculate. (Incidentally, there’s no bath, just a very good shower.) Two very minor gripes were a lack of counter space to spread toiletries over and a towel shortage. (Yes we could have called down for more but it wasn’t that big of a deal.)One point to note: it’s difficult to get a cab from outside the hotel. We tried twice and failed, on one occasion walking up to 6th Ave and when we were heading to the airport using the hotel’s “limo” service. Bottom line: if you’ve a flight to catch give yourself plenty of time.Overall, a very good hotel, even if the Manhattan prices will make you blanch.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for a week in a Times Sq. view room. Great view, no noise as we were on the 46th floor. But, no draws to store clothing, etc. Having to pay $15.95 a day for Wi-Fi in room is outrageous in the 21st century. Free in the lobby, but it's a tiny place with very little seating. No business centre, just 2 computers that you need to swipe a credit card as only the 1st 15 minutes are free.Having the front desk staff doing the job of bellboys, some of them tiny young girls, is time consuming and creates holdups with both check-in/out and moving the luggage of guests. A big hotel like this should have more than 1 concierge on duty as the waiting time for information was ridiculous. We were told that there are two concierge on duty but every time we needed help, one was "on a break".The air conditioning was difficult to set, either turned to hot or cold without changing the temperature.We found an abandoned pair of stocking next to the recycling bin when we arrived, it was a bit of a concern, but our room was cleaned professionally after that.Having said the above, the bathroom was amazing, the B54 had great views, staff always smiling and the location was perfect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Let me start by saying that the front desk staff was extremely helpful and professional at check in and check out. The room I reserved was a King bed with a view and it was perfect. The size of the room and the beautiful modern bathroom were great. The only thing I found that I needed to change was their air system has an eco setting which can be turned off so the fan stays running, and after I figured that out It allowed me to sleep better without some of the Times Square noise affecting me.I wanted to check out the roof top bar while I was there but it was too busy. Maybe next time!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: welcoming lobby, and nice location with easy access to Times Square without the noise and congestion. Friendly staff, very spacious rooms, disappointing to have to wait excessively for elevators, but I suppose that's the price you pay to have one of the best rooftop views...definitely a solid choice if Times Square is your destination of choice

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed for 1 night post cruise. We arrived at the hotel at 9.30am and were able to put our luggage in the luggage store until our room was ready.The reception and concierge staff were very helpful and even wrote down directions to subway we need and trains to catch. Nothing was to much trouble. Our room was on the 47th floor with amazing views of Manhattan. The room was large (by New York standards) spotlessly clean and well stocked with toiletries etc. On the 54th floor was a restaurant and bar, again with the most amazing views. The bar staff were very friendly and took time to discuss the different cocktails and advise the one most suited to your tastes . The 'miracle on 54th' was one of the best cocktails I've tasted. The hotel is very conveniently situated, a very short walk from Times Square. Lots of bars & restaurants close by. Overall a great hotel to spend the night after a cruise. Perfect customer service from the minute we stepped out of the taxi. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We are extremely grateful for the outstanding experience we had staying at the Hyatt Times Square New York this September. For our first trip to New York City, the Hyatt staff made us feel at home and welcome from the get-go. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We were celebrating our anniversary and they made us feel special. From the excellent check-in experience, which included a greeting from the on-duty manager, to the follow up phone calls, excellent advice and responses to our questions and generally just pleasant interactions any time we walked into the lobby. We felt like true VIPs. Advice from the team ahead of our visit and during our stay was greatly appreciated. The recommendations allowed us to plan out our days and make the most of our experience. In particular, the neighbourhood suggestions were quite helpful (we would not have known about The Highline or great views and walk-ability of the Brooklyn Bridge without their advice); the overall willingness to help and answer questions really made us feel at home and like part of the Hyatt family.There were simple yet effective measures the staff took and we want to highlight them here in hopes that this kind of service excellence is mimicked at other hotels:- Quick response times to email queries ahead of our stay- Detailed responses- Smiles – everyone we talked to had a smile on their face. From the front desk to the bellmen, to the housekeeping and maintenance staff, we noticed everyone was happy and took time to say hello. Staff seemed to enjoy working. That’s rare for a guest to experience.- The value of a hello – we were greeted leaving and entering the hotel. It made us feel welcome and appreciated.- The value of a follow up call – within 30 minutes of checking in, enough time to get settled and unpacked, we were greeted with a follow up call to ensure everything was up to our standards. We had a second follow up call on the day after from a staff member.- Proximity – the location of this hotel in Times Square but in a spot where you have room on the sidewalks (so not right in the chaos of Broadway) is a huge selling feature.- Cleanliness – the hotel was spotless everywhere we went. Our room in particular was always spotless. - Modernity – the building and rooms were equipped with the latest in technology and modern amenities – we loved the shower head and the ability to plug in using HDMI cables.- Service excellence – from a sewing kit to help determining best times for travel, everything we needed was accommodated. Our experience was top notch and unparalleled. They went the extra mile and it will influence our future bookings. We will be back in NYC down the road and, with certainty, we will be using Hyatt hotels in the future for our travel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: great hotel lovely and clean and great ammenities, fluffy robes and slippers coffee and tea in room ,excellent view from window, Plenty of restaurants and bars next door. Pop over to time square cross a block and go to Juniors for a lovely breakfast,

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, right next to Times Square. Not very far when you enter NYC through Lincoln Tunnel. Parking lot right next to the hotel. All Times Square attractions, hotels, shops next to the hotel. Rooms and bathrooms are very modern, spacious and comfortable. Staff is very nice too. Good breakfast menu, also a nice roof top bar with amazing city view. Would definitely recommend this hotel for staying neat times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were two couples looking for a get away weekend in NYC, after couple of hours of searching , we picked this Hotel, at a good price. We Arrived by car at midnight and received a very warm welcome by the staff. The entrance and lobby was bright, modern. I was impressed by the new elevators in terms of quietness and the speed. The checkin process was quick. The room was spacious with floor to high ceiling windows and smart and nice lighting system.There is a fridge but not a mini bar, which I found it more useful. Complementary water and Starbucks coffee / tea is provided.Despite the location , the quietness of the room is a plus. The furniture was almost brand new and stylish. Feather pillow and good quality mattress. Bathroom had a decent size with stainless steel shelves and high quality faucet and toilet accessories. Sound proof walls if you feel gassy! :) .Rooftop lounge at the 54th floor with the a spectacular view of the city is something not to miss, however the ambiance was fairly quiet. Surely the positive points outweighs the negative , but I would say the housekeeping was a bit lousy, with glasses not being changed/washed and tissues not being refilled. Pen and notepads was a missing piece in the room. Last to mention it was a bit changeling to reach a desirable room temperature with the AC/heater system. I definitely would come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Three women friends shared bed with two queens (so nice to have 2 queens). Room was very large by NY standards and bathroom was ginormous. Very tastefully decorated with sleek,modern, and whimsical design elements. Good lighting, perfect temp, and didn't feel dry like so many hotels. Loved the heated bathroom floor and huge walk in shower. Extremely quiet. Nice view of Times Square. Loved the rooftop lounge. It's expensive but worth it for the atmosphere and view. Front desk staff very friendly and service was fast. I highly recommend this property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you enjoy walking around the city to go where you want to this hotel is perfect. It is centrally located and easy to walk to many places. Everything is clean and new. We had an amazing view from our suite. We originally had a standard room with a view but upgraded to s suite once we arrived. We both agreed that it was a great decision to have a little extra room to hang out in the morning and before bed. Bathroom is sleek and beautiful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We would have given this hotel a 5 out of 5 rating if the person who checked us out was polite or thankful. Unfortunately, he wasn't. He didn't ask about our stay, didn't thank us and was reluctant to give us a copy of our invoice showing we had a zero balance. I'm not sure if it was due to the fact we booked the hotel through Hotwire, but all of these things are important and it made us feel like our patronage was unappreciated. He was the only person at the hotel that was rude yet because he was the last person we dealt with, it left a bad impression. However, the rest of our experience was top notch. We arrived early and our bags were stored free of charge. The hotel also called us to notify us when the room was ready which was a nice touch. Our room was nicely appointed and very quiet. The television was huge for a hotel room, the bed was comfortable, the lighting options in the room were very nice (such as mood lighting), the washroom had a tall window (very rare to see that), the washroom floors were heated ceramic, the stand up shower was very modern, and the room was very clean. The elevators were some of the fastest we've been in which makes it easy for guests to travel the 50+ stories the hotel comprises.All in all, a very good stay other than our poor check out experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've been a Hyatt Gold Passport holder since 1983 so I've stayed at many Hyatt properties. This one has to rank in the top three. What struck me most was the friendliness of the staff. Everyone had a smile and we were greeted as if we were long time friends rather than someone who was passing through. Any concerns were dealt with quickly. (OK, other than the fact I only got my newspaper 1 out of 4 days but I could pick one up at the front desk.)The hotel location is great. One block off Times Square on a quiet street. (OK quiet is relative as this is NYC). The room was very comfortable, clean, and well appointed. Although we were on a lower floor facing the back of the building, this wasn't a detriment. We weren't in the room often anyway.Be sure to use your AAA/CAA card as this gave us a better rate than any of the hotel booking sites. It was also less expensive than some of the other hotels of far less quality in the vicinity.The Hyatt Times Square is our "go to" place the next time we are in NYC! Great job everyone!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here prior to our New England cruise departure. The location is perfect for Times Square, the theater district, etc.. It's extremely modern, excellent rooms, and a great staff. I can think of no reason not to stay here and I recommend it highly. Without a doubt this will be our choice for any future visits to the Big Apple. Again, it couldn't be better!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had previously avoided any hotel with Times Square in its title as had assumed the hotels were all tired and aimed at tourists. However, the Hyatt was superb - in almost every way. The room was modern and almost spacious (which for NY is pretty good). The staff were attentive, friendly and efficient. And the fact that it was below our increasingly challenging corporate cap rate must mean its good value. Would definitely stay there again on business.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had an amazing 3 nights on a family trip with my parents to New York City. I personally do not like the big city, but Hyatt Times Square made up for that! We were lucky to have a rather high guest suite on the north side of the hotel. Had a decent view of 46th street and some of times square. The rooftop bar was quite amazing and a great place to have a few Manhattan priced cocktails…. very good drinks, just New York prices. Haha. The staff was excellent, especially Walter the valet/doorman who greeted us upon our arrival and departure. Front staff was efficient and courteous. Big thanks to Noah as well for a great stay.It did rain one day we were in town, and many many umbrellas were brought to the lobby for borrowing. This was a very nice touch!Very close to Times Square, about 100 yards.Close to all the theaters, Radio City, Central park, Rockefeller center, MoMA, Intrepid museumSubway stops within short walk. 20 minutes to lower Manhattan/World Trade CenterOne tip, if you can get away with not having a car, keep it far, far away… This has absolutely nothing to do with Hyatt, just the fact that parking prices are insane in Manhattan, and the valet service can take quite awhile, especially when there is a street fair going on up Avenue of the Americas. Hyatt themselves do everything they can to speed this process up, just traffic in the heavy tourist area does not help with getting a car there quickly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel in the middle of everything. Very nice folks at check-in. Upgraded to a room on the 51st floor with a great view of Times Square. Walking distance to most attractions. I would definitely stay here again. Unfortunately we didn't get to have a drink at the rooftop bar. Were told that it was full with an hour wait. During our stay we watched many people walk in from the street and get on the elevator for the rooftop bar. Maybe they should save a few tables for hotel guests.Just a suggestion.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square went above and beyond our expectations. Helpful, efficient and friendly front of house. An amazing rooftop bar. Our room on the 44th floor was trendy, comfortable and clean. A bathroom I wanted to rip out and take home! A must for anyone wishing to stay in a central location. Thank you Hyatt Times Square for helping to make a fantastic stay in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We arrived into NYC on a red eye flight and were exhausted by the time we got to Times Square at about 10am. The staff were very welcoming and offered us an available room to check in early. We had an additional person than originally booked and the staff were more than accommodating. The location was perfect and right in the heart of Times Square, close to broadway and had the most amazing roof top bar. The concierge were very friendly and helpful and made some great recommendations for dinner. The room was clean and tidy. the hallways were a little dated but then again we obviously didnt go to spend time in the hallways. Nothing was too much trouble and I hope we get a chance to return to this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here last week for three nights. A wonderful hotel, great staff and the rooms are nice as well as the bathrooms. The rooftop bar and lounge is a great addition. We really liked the location of this hotel as it is so convenient to everything.I would stay here again and recommend the Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square was a great hotel, right in the middle of Broadway. The service was very good, staff were friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough to make sure our stay was exceptional. The room was well appointed, clean and very comfortable. The bar on the top floor had fantastic view of the city. Great place to see the sun set. This hotel is very central right at Times Square, so easy to get to everything. The subway is close by, which is a good way to get around.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our favorite hotel in NYC ever...very modern...front desk people were great...loved the bed...shower and bathroom (heated floor)...the bedding was locked inside the sheets...cool bar on the rooftop...it was great...but wifi should be free.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited NYC Thurs - Sunday to see Derek Jeter's last home game at Yankee Stadium. We chose this location because of its proximity to Times Square. We were VERY happy with our experience. The staff made all the difference in the world, so helpful from start to finish. Our room was wonderful. We were on floor 35 and didn't hear a peep. We ate at the diner near the entrance, which was very good - a bit slow and $19 for breakfast (but it was delicious!). We also visited the roof top bar and the view was very nice - again a bit pricey for drinks and service was slow, but we were in no hurry. We had to wait to get outside, but the hostess remembered where we were and found us as soon as a table opened outside. The elevators were a bit slow at times. The hotel is conveniently located to most anything you want to do. We will definitely visit there again and will stay at the Hyatt Times Square. It really was very nice. And it smelled wonderful every time we entered the lobby - fresh like a spa!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Well where do I start , I don't normally write reviews on tripadvisor only when they're either really good or really bad but on this occasion it was really good we got this hotel on a discount on expedia great value for money we had 4 girls in one room ( 2 queen beds) the room was spacious really clean the hotel is very new only 1 year old very stylish clean cut modern decor. The hotel was very accommodating late check out free of charge endless supply of bottled water and towels ice machine in the hall, safe, fridge , and a spacious bathroom with a magnificent rain shower not to mention a view of times square. Each room had an international plug which was very handy as we forgot ours . And reception even had a sowing kits when requested. There is so many bars and restaurants to choose from in the area after all you are in times square. The hotel has a fabulous spa and a great rooftop bar. we normally stay 1 street away at the millennium broadway hotel but this hotel gives it a run for its money we will definitely be back. To sum up really clean spacious modern hotel which is ideally located in the centre of all the action. Ps. A great recommendation for a restaurant is just at the opposite side of the street a little french restaurant called Saju bistro.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for a long weekend. Very updated , modern hotel. Rooms were a little small but expected being NYC. Modern features in the room, heated bathroom floors, different type of lighting and a big flat screen. The room also had refrigerator. Location is a minute walk to Broadway and Times Square. Very convenient to plays, shopping, and restaurants. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Worth staying at.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A friend and I stayed 1 night and we really contemplated extending our stay! Everything about the hotel was great! From the front desk staff (dede) to the guy who brought up a couple items to the room!! The heated bathroom floor and rain shower... SPECTACULAR!! I would definitely stay again! Oh one more thing the rooftop bar was very nice!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently stayed here with friends for a week long visit to NYC. It really did nothing for me. The hotel is clean and comfortable but I guess when we were paying over $4000 AUD for a weeks accommodation I expected a little more. One of the things I struggle with is having to pay for wifi in your hotel room. Honestly, in this day and age where wifi is free in airports and most public places to have to pay an extra $116 for our stay was ridiculous! I know that there was free wifi in the lobby but I also thought this really cheapened the Hyatt brand. It looked more like a Youth Hostel than a Hyatt. One of the positives is it's in a great location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: To start off the hotel has the most perfect location , close to the subway and all the Broadway shows. The rooms are amazing and the staff is super helping, especially the concierge. I even tried their spa and it was the best message of my life. Definitely will come back to this one!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My mum and I stayed in this hotel for our 7 night 6 day stay in NYC. The hotel was nice and close to Times Square but far enough away that there was minimal noise to bother you at night.The hotel is also surrounded by a few nice restaurants away from the square itself (which after spending all day there us very nice).The room was a good size - we had two queen size beds and still room to move. The room was immaculate! The cleaner kept it in great shape.The hotel is 40 minutes away from JFK (60 in traffic) but that would be much the same for most hotels in NYC!The staff at the hotel were lovely. All of the concierge staff were friendly and really helpful.The hotel is home to bar 54 which has stunning views of the whole city - but extraordinarily expensive drinks.The only issue I had (my mum not so much) is that there is only free wifi in the lobby. Wifi in your room cost $12.95 a day. In this day and age it does seem to be a bit silly to be paying for wifi - especially when you've paid for your hotel room.In saying that, that was literally the only issue over the entire stay.I'd absolutely recommend staying here!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the hotel from 21-27 July, and had a wonderful time. When we arrived we talked to a guy in the reception, his name is Danilo, and he asked if we wanted a room with a view. When we came up to the room, we were absolutely mind taken by the view. We had our own private balcony on the 40th floor, overlooking Times Square and all the way down to the Financial district. The room was spacious with floor to ceiling windows and had a very comfortable bed. Although the hotel was located right beside Times Square, we did not notice any noise from the streets. During the whole stay, the staff was very helpful with getting a taxi when we needed it. We will definitely recommend this hotel, and we will for sure come back the next time we travel to New York!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just off Times Square on W 45th the location is great, and being off Times Square is is very quiet. The views from the 54th floor bar (outside deck) are amazing - I tried to conquer my jet lag with several beers sat outside (did not work but had to be worth a try). The rooms are of a good standard and a few (about 4) on the 27th floor have terraces. Staff are friendly and the food in the downstairs diner is fine. Will stay here again. (only glitch - as with all 'better' hotels - is the charge on wifi - it is free in the lobby but costs in the rooms, and the really expensive laundry charges)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Where to begin. Well, as I often do, I research hotels I'm unfamiliar with here on Trip Advisor.To begin, I always look for the ratio of good versus bad reviews. In both of those types, I look for a common thread of positives and negatives.Anyway, that's how I arrive at my choice of hotel(s). If I have several candidates I like to give priorityto a new or newer hotel. My pick on my family's vacation visit to New York City was the Hyatt Times Square.It was a new hotel ( building) just 9 months old.We booked 2 rooms for a 4 night stay. One for my wife and myself and the other for our son.I should mention here that my son has a great deal of difficulty sleeping even though he is on a highdose of prescription medication.For this reason I reached out to Ryan who is the Director of Rooms at the Hyatt.What a nice, cordial gentleman! He could not possibly have helped us in our reservation requests any more than he did.We asked for a connecting rooms on a high floor away from corridor noise.While Ryan could not obtain connecting rooms for us, he did come up with a great alternative.He put our rooms on opposite sides in a private vestibule-type set up through 2 private doors from the hallway.The location of the rooms on the 50th floor gave us great distance from the noise of the Times Square area far below. Ryan also, asked if there was anything else he could do for us.I gave into temptation and mentioned our son enjoyed a special soft drink which we found difficult to obtain while traveling. He responded, "Well, I'll see what I can do."When entering our room, Ryan left a note on my desk saying to look in my son's fridge for a surprise.Yes, he did stock our son's fridge with a dozen cans of his very difficult to obtain favorite drink!Ryan is a marvel as is all the other personnel we met at the Hyatt. Nothing too little or too bigwas beyond their efforts for us.The rooms, while not the largest were larger than most in new york city. They were very well thought out. The beds at Hyatt are truly a comfort for the ages. The bathrooms while not huge are again, very well thought out. The closet space was excellent. My wife had three large suitcases fullof clothes and they all fit easily in there. The lighting in the rooms was everywhere and easy to operate from several locations throughout.The television was also very easy to operate and had a nice selection of movies and sporting events to offer.Housekeeping was always handy or a phone call away.My wife asked for a scale and a microwave oven which were brought up in a few minutes.We did not dine in the hotel as we had booked our reservations at various places before we left home. However, we did visit the hotel's rooftop bar and enjoyed several drinks along with popcorn, salty nuts and some chips with dip for a midnight snack.The hotel itself is in an excellent area of Times Square. Not too close but yet an easy stroll to the Square itself with a multitude of shops, restaurants, theaters, and so much more all around us.Cabs were easy to get as our doormen were always ready to assist night and day.All in all a most enjoyable visit to New York.Much thanks to Ryan and the very eager and helpful staff at Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After doing plenty of research on tripadvisor I chose this hotel for a 3 night stay. Although expensive compared to other destinations I have visited, it is NYC and the price was comparable to other hotels in the area. The hotel is modern with great rooms - huge tv and rainshower. No noise was heard at all. Airconditioning worked perfectly.Room was on level 30. Coffee maker and starbucks coffee complimentary in room and a fridge with complimentary bottled water. The staff were extremely friendly and you felt as if you were in a boutique hotel and not a branded chain. If Times Square is where you want to be then this is less than a block away.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: booked 2 rooms one beside the other on Sept 19 2014 got rooms far apart and one room almost half the size of the other also the rooms were to have a view and up high we had no view and very low but was charged full price and complained to staff and manager and they didn't care I was only told the hotel was sold out.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have now stayed in this hotel twice and both times have been an absolute joy. The staff have been very friendly and helpful. I have had packages waiting for my arrival and the staff have had them ready for me upon check in. The rooms are spacious and each has an individual piece of NYC-themed art on the wall. Coffee-making facilities were in the room and a tea kettle was available upon request. Any time I had to request anything a member of staff brought it up promptly. On both occasions I have been in a room which has looked out onto 46th St and not had a building directly opposite which was appreciated.Location could not be better for me as a theatre fan. The hotel is half a block from Times Square and no more than 6 blocks from any of the majority of Broadway theatres. There is a Starbucks opposite that is open until 11pm and you are also only a few blocks from the shops on 5th Avenue and Bryant Park. I look forward to staying in this hotel again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights in September,was made to feel so welcome from the minute we arrived,Yenny on reception made the check in process so easy and dealt with all our questions efficiently (an asset to the hotel).the rooms are a good size with comfortable beds and modern bathrooms.We were on the 37th floor with an amazing view of Times Square.We ate a couple of times in T45 and the food and service was really good,drinks on the rooftop bar was an amazing experience!!! What a view! I would definitely stay here again as the location is spot on. Thanks Hyatt

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Check is is simple and straight forward, but the entire reception area looks sterile and lacks atmosphere. Valet parking is available at ....$60.00 per day (plus tips).Service elevators are plenty, and room access is easy. My room (on 6th floor) was of medium/average size, well equipped (everything worked), with a comfortable and very clean looking bed. Bathroom/shower is very modern, clean, and perfect for single occupancy (second person may need extra towels).At over $500 per night, I would expect at the very least free Wifi (only available in the lobby!) - at $14.95 "slow speed" or $16.95 "high speed" this strikes me as a rip off!The breakfast/lunch cafe in house is adequate, but not really overly desirable in view of the fact that this is Times Square with many alternatives (including Starbucks right across the street).Overall, the staff is very friendly and helpful, which seems a bit of a (pleasant) contrast to the otherwise sterile looking interior of the entire hotel.The bar on the 54th floor is worth a visit - has a great view (and prices to match!).In all, a good hotel, well kept and serviced, but for $500 per night, you would expect that!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel has been recently renovated with a modern, lounge type of atmosphere. There is no surprise with location as the name of the hotel says it all. Obviously, you pay a premium price to be in Times Square.I had my room on the 14th floor (1405) right in front of Times Square. The room are spacious with good size HD TV, at right temperature when you walk in, not too cold or too warm. The bed was comfortable and everything was really clean in the room. The bathroom is modern with a nice glass door shower. I was disappointed to not find a mini bar in the room. There is also no safe. For professionals, the closet includes what you need to iron your shirt. Talking about professionals, I used Wi-Fi which was complementary and it worked fine for browsing and emails. If you need more speed you can buy their next package.I found the hotel to be a bit noisy but that won’t bother most people looking for actions at the heart of the Big Apple. I am not sure you can find any quiet hotel at Times Squares.I would return for business if I had to be at Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My first trip to New York, a fabulous time! This hotel was amazing, nothing was too much trouble, the room was fantastic, comfortable, very clean and a great view. Wonderful staff, so friendly. T45 provided the most splendid breakfasts and evening drinks, thankyou James and all the staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel twice within the past couple of months. First time was on business, had a room on 50th floor with a great view. Next time was with the family, where we had one of their deluxe rooms, which are basically the same layout as the standard ones, except they are a bit larger. For our family of four, it was nice with the little extra space. The staff was very friendly, and accomodated our requests for a crib and a kettle with a smile despite very late hours. The rooms are nice as they are brand new. Only tiny minus was that the lighting in the room was quite hard to figure out. However, concerns I have heard and read about the proximity to Times Square and the corresponding noise, should not weigh on your choice. Our room was very quiet and the hotel is half a block off Times Square, which helps a lot. I will surely come back - next time already in a few weeks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location , staff very helpful and friendly, rooms are it very big but you find you are not there much during the day. The hotel charges you to use wifi in your rooms but is free to use in the foyer. Would stay here again and recommend it .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you'd like to experience the madness that is New York, you can't miss staying at this new property in the heart of Times Square. For a rather reasonable rate (we're talking New York prices) you can enjoy a 'view suite' on the 50th floor for around $475-$500 per night. Walk out the front door, take a right and you're 200 feet from the heart of Times Square. Great views, and enjoy the incredible photo ops from the 'view bar' on the 54th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel is ok, new and modernHowever they charge for wifi which is almost unheard of now.Service was good, and room OK. Bed was very comfortable and elevators worked fastand readyStandard rates are very high for this property and I would only stay there again if I gota very competitive rate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love the location and the design. Having stayed twice since the opening, can say that they are going in the right direction but have a little work to do before they have everything running how they should. First visit had MAJOR elevator waits... this time was fine. On this visit had issues with having my room ready (at 7pm) and heat/air needed to be resolved before I could settle in which was an inconvenience... handled professionally by management though. Like the restauarant for Bkfst. Comfy beds.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wow! This hotel exceeded my expectations. Fantastic location - our room had a view of Times Square & the beautiful Paramount theatre and from the rooftop bar you could see the Chrysler building & 1 WTC too. Rooms were beautifully appointed - modern and stylish. Lovely tiled bathroom, luxurious linens and classy art (I especially love the polaroid tv surround). Room compact but space well used so it didn't feel poky. Price comparable to others we looked at but a bargain, given the loveliness of his hotel. We'll be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband, two year old son and I stayed here for 7 nights at the end of August. We were worried that nothing would meet our standards after staying at the Venetian in Las Vegas. We were wrong. This hotel is AMAZING! They must pump air freshener or something through the air con as it always smelt great in there! The rooms were large, especially for a NY hotel. The bed was comfy, we loved that we had an empty fridge to use, the bathroom was beautiful...I wan't mine at home to be exactly like that! Also, whilst the room was already well equipped you are given a list of all the complimentary items available to you at request, it has everything you could think of!BUT! (I bet you're expecting me to say something bad)....the staff!! They are beyond anything I have ever witnessed at any establishment. Hotel, restaurant, airport...anything. They are the friendliest, kindest people I have ever met. I will recommend this hotel simply for the staff, especially the doormen. My son, Tyler loved seeing them every morning and would run up and fist bump them. He even blew kisses to one of them, Chester. I can't say I was said to leave NY but I was definitely sad to leave the Hyatt and their staff. I will always have fond memories of them and want to thank them again for making our stay as wonderful as it was. Best wishes!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel has recently been refurbished. The hotel rooms (especially the bathrooms) were spotlessly clean and modern. Huge shower with heated flooring in main bathroom area. Had a corner room on a higher floor overlooking Times Square. It's worth paying the extra for a 'view' room. Lifts were quick and efficient - no excessive waiting even at peak times. Views from the rooftop bar very impressive. Staff were exceptionally helpful, especially Tess on the concierge desk and one of the doormen outside the main entrance (youngish chap - didn't catch his name?).Only area where the hotel needs to improve is by offering complementary WiFi in their guest bedrooms. Having to constantly go down to reception was very inconvenient. If free WiFi had been offered in guest rooms I would have given a 5 star rating. Would stay here again if visiting NYC, as location can't be beaten.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for only one night. I was impressed by professionalism and courtesy of the staff. Our room had a beautiful view, but no noise considering how close we were to the action of Times Square. Rooftop bar looked lovely but we did not have a drink there. Room with 2 queen beds was spacious enough for our family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hyatt just opened and it was beautiful, nicely decorated and furnished rooms with heated floors in the bathroom. Great views and close to all the action, as well as a great staff and a roof top bar that is incredible

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our America holiday last weekend. We absolutely loved it!!! From the moment we walked into the hotel we were made to feel our custom was appreciated. We had walked from Penn Station with our suitcases and it was a very hot and humid evening. We were greeted by Floyd on reception - who immediately produced two bottles of water for us whilst we checked in. We were upgraded to a suite (this never happens to us - we were really chuffed!) The room was lovely with a view across the city. The bathroom was amazing and the bed was huge! Housekeeping was brilliant - whilst the room was very clean and had everything we needed, there was a list of complementay items that we could request if needed. We were given a 20% discount voucher for the restaurant by Floyd on arrival but due to other commitments we didnt' get to try this. However, we did nip up to the roof-top bar for a drink and something to eat of our first night . Whist a bit pricy, I did consider it worth every penny for the experience - one of the tallest roof-top bars in NYC, and excellent service. It was an experience. When we checked out, we were pleased it was Floyd that then checked us out, and he arranged for our luggage to be stored whilst we did some last minute shopping in the city. If I were to visit NYC again, I would without doubt stay in this hotel again, and will be recommneding it to friends. Nothing was too much trouble and the location was fab. Thank you to Floyd, Housekeeeping and the roof-top bar staff who helped to make the end of our trip so memorable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was good but service lacked. Checked in to my hotel room and found a hole in the comforter. I called down and asked to have it replaced they said someone will be right up. No one ever came to change it. The next day housekeeping cleaned the room and put the same comforter on the bed. The hole was right in the center of the comforter and easily seen as it was not a small hole. Finally 45 mins after calling again they came up to change it. You would think the next comforter would be free of holes right? Well it wasnt. There was still another hole in this one in almost the exact same spot. Also their A/C system is very poor. After walking around the city all day we were tired and sweating. All we wanted to do was go and relax in our cool room. When we get in the room it was at 80 degrees not at the 69 degrees we put it at in the morning. There excuse was it is a eco friendly unit. Even when your sleeping we set it at 69 and in the morning it was up to 78 degrees. Not very comfortable at all waking up sweating. For a brand new property built from the ground up they could have made more spacious elevators as they were tiny and always crammed with alot of people. Was not impressed by this Hyatt and the only good thing it has going for it is that they are half a block away from times square. I would choose another hotel next time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I was lucky enough to enjoy this amazing property!! The modern interior and the staff made it a place that I will definitely be returning to!The roof top patio is one of the most gorgeous I've ever been to! Try the meatballs up there! And the Vesper cocktail!Brittany, the Director of Housekeeping was attentive and just a pleasure to be around from the moment we checked in, to the moment we left!! What a fabulous human being she is.Can't wait to go back to this property......coming around Christmastime!!!! Thank you so much for everything!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was clean and modern. Room was spacious for a NY hotel. It is in a great location. I felt safe in my room Staff was courteous and friendly. I would recommend this hotel. It was not real close to a subway, but close enough. Ate at the restaurant and it was NY prices but good with very friendly staff.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've been to New York many times and this is the biggest room I've stayed in for the best price. We used hotels.com and stayed for only $150 night. It's close to time square and was very clean and spacious. We very much enjoyed our 3 night stay and would be back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I visited New York in August this year for the start of my holiday with my 2 children (13 and 10) and my husband and we stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 5 nights. It was a very enjoyable experience. Location wise its great, very quiet and peaceful but literally minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. The reception is very nice and the staff incredibly helpful and the restaurant on the ground floor is fantastic for breakfast and reasonably priced. Our room was incredibly clean and a good size for a family of 4 and the bathroom was done to a high standard with lovely complimentary treats supplied and available on request. After a day sightseeing in New York it was lovely place to come back to. The bar on the 54th floor looked lovely, but unfortunately you are not able to drink up there with children under 21. They let us look out though at the view as it is the highest bar in Manhatten. My only bug bear is the charge for Wifi and something like $30 a day. As a tourist just wanting to look up a restaurant's menu or something simple like that once a day, its seems extortionate. This could put some people off. I had it as a negative when choosing the hotel as I think this should definately be part of the cost. However I did get a really good deal by callng the hotel direct and I am so glad we stayed. Anyway, if you want a lovely, clean hotel in a great location near Times Square at a reasonable price, you can't go far wrong with the Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this Hotel August 16th. First impressions was that it was just my style. I like everything new and modern. This hotel is just that. The staff were friendly and accomodating. I was able to upgrade to an executive suite for free (for being a CC holder) upon check in. I was so happy with the upgrade as the suite was probably the largest suite/room I've ever stayed in while visiting New York. The room overall was immaculate. Before checkout we ate breakfast in their restaurant and the food was very good. I won't comment on the price as everything is pricy in NY and it's to be expected. Only negatives are that the lobby was extremely small and there is hardly any seating. I didn't mind standing THAT much plus I found a small stool to sit on while waiting on my room. However, I couldn't imagine coming here with my parents who can't stand for long periods of time. One other small issue I had was, the seating area was kind of unkept. There was someone's dirty napkin on a seat and two or three water bottles around empty. Again, this isn't huge for me, but it looks bad that the entire time I waited (45min) no one came to clean it up. Hotels such as Hyatt should have employees actively looking for things like this. Other useful information:As usual, whenever I travel, I try to stay at Hyatts because I earn triple the points at Hyatt properties for having the credit card.I booked this trip back in April and I received a discounted rate, again for being a CC member.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Went to see a broadway show and hang out for a night in NYC so my dad and I stayed here. They have a 54th floor roof top bar with amazing views and crazy expensive drinks. Definitely worth having one drink. The rooms were nice and my bed was super comfortable. I didn't exactly get the decor in the hallways, but maybe that is just my taste. Overall, friendly staff, good location, nice dark rooms with a good bed. I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights with partner and our baby. From the second we walked up to the hotel we were greeted with smiles and friendly people. Check in was smooth and we got a room at 51st floor. There were 3 elevators to our floor, and the waiting time for them was not bad at all.Rooms were big! (So was the bathroom and shower). Plenty of room for us, our baggage and a stroller. View was awesome from our room! The room was very clean and housekeeping made sure it always was. It was a few noises during night, but that's what to expect when in that location. It didn't really bother us.We had breakfast at hotel twice, very good pancakes and friendly staff. Check out day we got to store our baggage, very smooth.Location is just off times square. Super central and close to shopping, restaurants and subway. We went up to roof top bar one evening just to take in the view - that was no problem at all. All in all an awesome place to stay and we would recommend to everyone. The only thing that could improve is that I think that in 2014 you should be able to get free WiFi in your hotellrom. (You can pay ~12$ for 24hr wifi access in your room).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: this new hotel (I think it was opened in October 2013) is one of the best hotels I've stayed in. Last week I stayed at Radisson Martinique on Broadway, and I regretted it. For my next stays in NYC, i'll try to stick to this hotel. I loved my upgraded room (I'm a platinum Hyatt member) - 31st floor, full glass window, Times Square view. the location is of course magnificent, the roof bar is awesome and I liked everything about this hotel. Also, I liked the modern washroom and the room design, especially the lighting system (which I haven't seen in any other Hyatt's around the world). One thing though is that late at night, 3-5am, you could still here noises from times square every now and then. if you're not a heavy sleeper, you'd hear them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt at the end of June, 2014 for 3 nights and had a terrific experience. First off, it is almost unheard of to have a room ready for check in at 9:30am! It was like getting a free day! Secondly, the room was large for a Manhattan hotel room; extremely clean, new, stylish without feeling cold. Thirdly, there was a huge window in the bathroom. Finally, I thought this to be one of the best use of lobby area and public space without wasting vast amounts of square footage. Loved the restaurant which also had a small take out coffee bar. And location...well that speaks for itself! Near Times Square and so many theatres and, oh yes, a Starbucks across the street. I'd stay there again in a second. A great location for the first timer in NY City for tours, shopping and information.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wonderful friendly staff. The hotel is right in the middle of it all.Rooms are spacious for the city, bathroom tile floor is heated - awesome for when you get out of the shower or up in the middle of the night.The elevators had some issues when we were there, but they brought in a service company immediately. The balcony bar with fireplaces is great!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Love the Hyatt Times Square. It is less than 1 year old. It is very modern and contemporary.Rooms are super comfortable and have a great design aesthetic. Very modern and unique. I would love to have my home decorated like this room. Bed is wonderful. Very quiet. The bathroom is outstanding. Love the wood subway tile in the bathrooms.Everyone is super friendly and helpful. Location is great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed in a number of hotels around Times Square over the years and I can honestly say that my stay in this hotel was one of the best experiences in this area. I was simply blown away by how motivated all the staff appeared to be and they all strived for excellence right from check in to check out and made our stay a memorable one. Nothing was a problem from early check in to a late check out. I note that a few people have commented on the size of the rooms, but this is as good you are going to get in this part of the town. The entire hotel is modern and chic and the rooms have some lovely touches such as night lights, a massive cupboard and an empty fridge; the views from the sky lounge on the top floor are stunning - not many hotels of the same category in Times Square offer you this.A word of warning about the café attached to the hotel lobby. It is prohibitively expensive even for Times Square. I paid $13 for two cups of tea!The location is just perfect - in the midst of Times Square but just off it away from the noise. I would strongly recommend people to try out this place -you simply cannot go wrong.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location is excellent, it is an incredibly busy square, but the hotel is in a quiet street and if you have a room at the back you hardly hear any noise. The rooms are a generous size and very clean.The staff friendly and attentive. Breakfast very disappointing...but why stick to the hotel when there are so many other nice places nearby?

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The drive from the airport is daunting and our anxiety was high as we drove up to the Hyatt. All of the doormen, (maybe 3 or 4) came up to greet us. They were all so friendly, especially Chester who really stood out from the rest. Then the check-in employees were also very helpful and cheerful. The staff at Hyatt had such a great energy, the bartender James even made fresh lemonade for us when it was not on the menu and my mother asked for it. The lobby was modern and clean and they let us check in early. The room was also modern and clean, with plenty of space. Our room was very quiet, and the umbrellas were a nice touch since it was pouring rain that evening. The bonus was that our play was on the same block, as well as a great deli. I highly recommend Hyatt Times Square. One negative, the young female concierge was not able to recommend a restaurant, but simply said there were “thousands to choose from.” The next night the gentleman wrote down 3 choices and wrote them down on a map. He was quite helpful, sorry I cannot remember his name.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is brand new! The rooms are very spacious for NYC standards. Everything was clean and well equipped. The location is perfect. It's located on a quiet side street with excellent views of Times Square. It's easy to get in and out of. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were really looking forward to staying here as there have been so many positive reviews. Let me start by saying we did arrive early for check in (around 1:30), so were not surprised that our room was not available. They asked for our cell number and said they would put a rush on it and call us soon. By 4:00, which is check-in time, we were told they were very backed up and our room would be ready "shortly". By 5:30, we still didn't have our room which was unacceptable. We had plans that evening and needed to get ready. To add insult to injury, the fire alarms went off and the hotel was evacuated. It turned out, there was a small fire two buildings down. Needless to say, we finally got our room, but it wasn't a great way to start the weekend. What turned this all around for us was Noah, the manager on duty. He made things right on several levels, and even called us later to make sure everything was ok. We had a terrace room which was absolutely fantastic - and very large by New York city standards. Because the hotel is new, the rooms are very updated and it didn't hurt to have a balcony with a view of Times Square! Also, the rooms were surprisingly quiet-we had no issues with noise whatsoever. We also never had any problems getting an elevator. All in all, we had an excellent weekend and would certainly return here. Thanks again, Noah!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff, from valets to doormen to desk clerks to housekeepers, were all professional, pleasant, and went out of their way for everything you need. The entire lobby, elevators, and rooms were spotless in a city that is filthy, which is a pretty impressive feat. I had a single bed room on floor 40, and it was amazing! Clean, comfortable, well lit and modern, and featured floor to ceiling windows on the entire outside wall. Street noise was very distant, the windows were very heavy. This hotel hands down had the best bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel - the bathtub was in the shower, and the shower area was so big it was the size of the bathroom itself in other hotels. The tv is on the wall but pulls out so you can angle it towards your bed. The bed was clean and comfortable, AC worked great, plenty of space for clothes and other luggage. Conveniently located on a lesser street from Times Square, which cuts way back on traffic and crowds and makes it easy to access the hotel. There is a pharmacy around the corner for any quick needs, lots of restaurants on the surrounding block. The restaurant in the hotel itself has good breakfast but the rest of it's meals leave a lot to be desired - Grubhub was my saving grace late at night when I didn't feel like going back out. I'd stay here again, and my stay here may have switched me from Hilton to Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It is amazing to be a just few feet away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square and find peace and quiet in a hotel room. There were minor issues with the fixtures and cabinetry. We opened the cabinet door to the safe and it fell off. The magnifying mirror also got unscrewed while I was adjusting it. These happened within 30 minutes from the time we entered the room. Maintenance came and fixed it while we were out watching a show. The room overall is nice and clean with a brand new feel. There is also a deli 2 or 3 doors away that is open 27/7, a great place to grab those little sweet treats to nibble with those ridiculously expensive beverages in the theaters.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt for 2 nights in May with a girlfriend. We were in NY to attend a Broadway play, and this hotel was perfect for that. We were able to walk from the hotel to the theater and back. The hotel was close to some great eateries, both sit down and fast food, as well as great shopping. We didn't need a car because everything was in close proximity. There was even a rooftop club/bar on the top floor which was really cool to go up to and look out over the city. The staff was very friendly. We didn't take advantage of the hotel amenities but if I was in Times Square again I would come back again. It was a nice, clean, accessible hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I selected this hotel based on location and also because they were one of the few I found that had QUEEN beds and not doubles. This was important because we were a group of 2 adults and 2 kids. We were doing a bunch of activities that included shopping, a show and museums. This was fairly central to everything we were doing. It was easy to get in and out of. Even though it was near Times Square, it was a calm street and quiet! The staff was very helpful and friendly. I think this hotel is fairly new and was in great shape. The rooftop lounge is very chic, but costly! I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms were spacious and well equipped but the infrastructure seems inadequate for the scale of this hotel and for the number of guests - four lifts for 53 floors means you are often waiting for a free lift. It really is in the heart of all the action but that does mean some street noise penetrates the rooms and getting back to the hotel requires a struggle against the crowd

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Super professional staff, always greeting you with a smile. Stayed on floor 50 with a great view of times square. The hotel is located on a calm side street to TS on W 45th street so it's easy to get in and out. Did not eat breakfast at the hotel but there are some good restaurants just outside. Like Bond 45 and some small Delis. Check out the rooftop bar on 54th floor for great views and fancy drinks!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I visited New York as it was my girlfriends birthday. We stayed at the hyatt Times Square. The location is perfect the hotel is clean and had excellent views. The bar on the top floor had breath taking views with excellent drinks options. Most importantly I wanted to highlight and cannot express enough the level of service I got from two individuals, Noah and Jenny both went out their way to assist and help us with anything. Thank you again for everything you had do e for us I will hope to see you guys again when I come back to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great room, great location and very helpful front desk. The host on the 54th was another experience. My daughter and I went up to the 54th floor lounge to get a view of the city. He said we had to show ID to get in. I'm 44!!!!, the place was empty and even after I told him my daughter was 16 he said ID was required. He then told us it was a bar and not a viewing floor. I guess he realized that I was getting rather upset because he said we could have a "few minutes". So we went out to the empty terrace, took a few pictures and left... Airport security was more friendly!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here four days at the end of August and had a wonderful experience! We were on the 21st floor... Our room was quiet, clean and adequate, for NYC in size. The staff was very helpful and attentive. The bartender in the grill downstairs sent a bottle of proseco to our room for our 51st wedding anniversary. We were in the heart of the theatre district and enjoyed one of the most spectacular views of the city from the rooftop bar! We will stay here again! Such a lovely hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently spent a week at the Hyatt Times Square, which is yards away from the lights and hustle and bustle. Fantastic location. Check in was haphazard but we were adequately compensated. Room was perfect for a family with young/teenage kids.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent location. Clean, modern hotel with generously sized and appointed rooms. Friendly, helpful service. Multiple ways to digitally interact with the hotel. In-house restaurant typically overpriced for Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: After my first stay, I wasn't sure if I'd be back to the Hyatt Times Square, but I must say they listened to my complaints and produced amazing results during my second visit. Bryan should be commended for his help with booking the room and making sure that everything was in line prior to my arrival. As a business traveler that frequents the Hyatt brand, I was blown away by the level of hospitality ranging from Valet Attendants to Front Desk Personnel, to Housekeeping and to Bar Staff. Everyone helped to add to a tremendous experience and I can say with great certainty that I will be back to enjoy the breathtaking views from the rooftop bar, the ultra clean and modern rooms and convenience to the Times Square area. Bravo!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Amazing location in Times Square but off a side road on 45th street, highly recommend a higher floor to get the beautiful newyork view and quiet in the city that literally never sleeps, my partner were shopping in foot locker and Disney store passed 1am... Just because it was open at that time! The service is 100% A+ all the way. From the moment we stepped out the shuttle service we were greeted and within 10 mins we were on the 51st floor room 5108. Immaculate, clean, spacious, modern, bathroom had heated floors. Every bit luxury. Room was fully cleaned each morning, as a lot of hotels now a days just change towels and soap bars, the housekeeping at this fabulous hotel changed bedsheets and pillow cases which was lovely. Well knowledgeable staff of the area and were helpful as my partner and I had particular points of interest on our New York trip. Roof top bar a must go to on the top floor, beautiful views of the Chrysler building. You don't need to waste money on taxi as it is literally walking distance from every attraction. As we are from london the subway was very helpful, aircon in the carriages, downside it is very hot on the platforms.. Overall fantastic hotel and we highly recommend to anyone in a large group or a romantic first trip like ours. Enjoy and many thanks again hyatt Times Square. Jester and Sharlene

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for the first time over the weekend. It is great. Location is very central without being in the madness of Times Square. They gave me a lovely room on the 47th floor which was bright, modern, very comfortable and all in all a great place.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I just returned from a four night stay at the Hyatt Times Square and we cannot say enough nice things about it. Hands down the friendliest hotel staff we have ever encountered! Beautiful room, breathtaking view, unsolicited perks (room upgrade, free water, free bottle of wine). A million thank you's to Pablo, Abel and Chester for their many acts of kindness. I wish we could rate this hotel EXCELLENT PLUSSSSSSSSSS! I hope we will be able to make a return visit!!!--CindyG

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is right next to Times Square, with all its advantages (close to many places you want to visit as a tourist) and disadvantages (so crowded that it can be a challenge to get back to the hotel at night). As tourists, we enjoyed the location overall. The rooms are clean and modern, and we liked looking at the city lights at night. Breakfast is not included and the hotel-own restaurant is overpriced, but with a bit of preparation it's no problem to find other places for breakfast in the area. Wireless internet access is also not included, which in my opinion is not OK for what it calls itself a luxury NYC hotel... maybe there are many NYC hotels that try to get a bit more money out of their guests this way, but why the Hyatt? It certainly doesn't make a good impression to charge guests for this basic service in the year 2014. For this reason I cannot give an excellent rating, which I would otherwise have.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had an opportunity to stay at the relatively new Hyatt Times Square on 45th between 6th and 7th. Kuddos to Hyatt for taking a fresh, updated approach to this hotel. Bright clean lines, modern spacious rooms, spirited casual staff. The hotel is tall, the elevators are super fast - but wait times can be high at peak hours. The roof top bar is a nice place to see the sunset but can be crowded with visiting tourists (ie; non-hotel stayers). The exercise room is notably large, equipment is new and it is very well maintained.All of that said, the biggest challenge or opportunity is the location. 45th is at least off the main hustle of Times Square, but it's a congested area and given 45th runs West - getting a cab in front of the hotel throws you right into the traffic and congestion. Walk to 6th and catch a cab or Uber at the corner. If you want the sounds, sights and lights of Times Square - this is a new, fresh creatively run Hyatt. If you prefer quiet boutique hotels in out of the way corners of the cities, not so much.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We visited last april this recently built hotel, it was very well situated if you like the Times Square location. The rooms are smallish but nicely equipped, lots of usb ports, a great HD TV, the bathroom is small but the shower is large. It was clean and always a pleasure to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. The staff was really helpful and kind. We didn't have breakfast on site, there are many options around the hotel for much less. A very nice 4 night stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights. On the upside, the beds were great, the front desk very friendly, helpful, fairly efficient. This is a 54 story hotel with a tiny lobby, very limited seating in the lobby. There is a restaurant, we only had a drink and snack, the service was good. Looked at the menu, expensive, a hot breakfast would have been $30 - $40 for two although this would likely be typical for Manhattan hotels. We did enjoy breakfast 2 blocks away at Pret A Manger. Went up to the 54th to see the bar with outside seating, nice view but not spectacular as there are many other tall buildings obstructing the view. Our room had two queen beds, but no armchair or couch, if you wanted to sit in your room at all, basically you were on the bed. The street was closed two days in a row, once for a street fair and once for a parade, which was a bit of an issue for my elderly mother. We had to have cabs drop us off a block away. Next time I would pick a boutique hotel a little further south. Near Times Square you are close to the theatres but not a big selection of good restaurants other than steak houses. Not the most appealing neighborhood!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 2 nights only and it was a nice stay. checking in/out was so easy and fast,all staff was so extra friendly and helpful. Room/bathroom was clean and beautiful with modern decor,with refrigerator and coffee pot, very comfy bed,.have great location ( close to everything). The only downside was pricey parking fee n no free wifi but heyyyy I was in NYC that's expected.Definitely would go back on our third visit to NYC. Great stay!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am a Hyatt loyalist, but this property may just make me consider looking elsewhere.No real lobby to speak of. Just a couch and what looks like a mini bar with 3 laptops where the front desk folks are standing. Not a fan of this Hyatt change.Told I was automatically upgraded because of my hotel status. Room is (currently staying here) clean but tiny for the price. Furnishings are "modern" if you prefer pieces that anyone can find at Ikea. Maybe I should be happy that I didn't get a non-upgraded room?B54 lounge on the 54th floor is nice but, again, small. The outside terrace is okay. So, stay here if location is more important to you than value for the money. Otherwise, the room rate only makes you think the hotel is "upscale" and you/I can find better accommodations at other nearby properties.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So many good things to say... where to start. checking in - super easy, efficient, friendly. The front desk personnel actually had read my Hyatt Passport profile and knew what I liked and didn't like - wow! The rooms are beautiful, modern décor, clean, spacious (yes, in NYC!), soft bedding, fluffy towels.. the bathrooms are ultra-gorgeous, marble and glass, with heated floors!!! (showers only, I believe). The electronic connector in the room let's you project your computer screen via HDMI to your 42"+ TV LCD screen. There are al sorts of adapters and other techie options to use for those who want. Beds are a perfect mix of soft enough to be comfortable, but plenty of support beneath - not too firm, not saggy.The service is fantastic - every response is catered to nearly instantaneously with exceptional courtesy. The concierge - he was fantastic. Scored us last minute tickets to the Book of Mormon through the hotel's broker and got me a better price than I had found anywhere else (and I know how to find them). Answered my 50K questions with interest and gave us lots of useful information, such as suggestions for getting to places faster, how to avoid the crowds when walking, where to eat before the show (without spending 2 hours on a wait), etc.Room service was a little underwhelming in terms of food - everything came on paper plates and in take-out format. My son liked the food, I didn't, but that could be personal preference. I have to hand it to the restaurant manager - Michael - though: I had a minor health issue with one food item and asked to have it removed. Not only did he call me back to remove that item, he removed the entire tab for that meal, sent me water and asked if there was anything else he could do or if I wanted anything else on the house. WOW! Exceeded my expectations completely.Location is great for walking to places nearby in mid-town and via close-by subway (and cabs) to anywhere in the city or beyond. Only a few blocks from Penn Station, it was a 10 min walk with our carry-on bags to get to the train to Newark airport (which is by the way the fastest way to get to the airport and by far the cheapest).Roof-top bar - awesome hosts and waitstaff, who found me a seat outside within minutes, even though the restaurant was full. Good food, great view, music playing in the background. On a summer day it's a great place to have a little night cap.The purpose of our trip was to visit Columbia University and do a little sight-seeing along the way, and we accomplished that with ease. Staying at the Hyatt made it even easier. Love this place and will most definitely be back when I am back in NY. (as opposed to the Westin Time Square, which I will avoid in the future).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
