review_body: Had a problem where another Hyatt could not accomodate the bed type we had reserved so we wound up here. Ideally situated just off of Tirmes Square, we could see some of the glittery signs from our room. Kudos to Noah, the manager on duty, for his caring customer service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We decided to tour NYC after our wedding, before the cruise left, and stayed at this hotel. The staff went out of their way to make us comfortable while we were there, and helped us tour the city after. Friendly staff, good location, comfortable rooms, and a beautiful view from the lounge. I'd recommend this place to anyone visiting NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a deluxe view room on the 53rd floor. The room did not have a coffee maker or fridge but was clean, comfortable and the view was spectacular. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Nico at the front desk when we checked in. The sky lounge while pricey is definitely a great place to relax and have drinks.Overall a good weekend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed there for 1 night on a business trip and it was a really nice hotel. The location is right around the heart of the Times Square but not where it's a constant crush of people. Visited the gym which was really nice and large with new equipment and very clean space. The rooftop bar of course has a great view of some of the iconic Manhattan properties. The meeting space was oddly laid out but it suited our needs. The room itself was large by NY standards. There was a comfortable king size bed with a workstation, a couple of chairs, large closet and well laid out bathroom. Everything is controlled on the wall at the push of a button which is similar to many rooms you'd see outside the US.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were lucky to get this hotel thru a Priceline bid. It was not cheap even for Priceline to get into a NYC hotel. The lobby is not "grand" by any standard,but we were pleasantly surprised by the room.Since we were a family of 4 and the only rooms available were king beds due to our late check in we were offered a suite for $100 more which we took. The hotel room was upgraded so I can only speak for room 1201 and it was very nice. Very large for a NYC hotel. No refrig. comfortable room. Good A/C. Helpful front desk.The hotel is new. The front desk said just 3 months old. Parking $60. Be ready to pay up if you have a car. No way around this issue.Location was excellent. In the heart of the action- which brings me to the "issue"... The issue is regarding NYC not this hotel; noise. It was a Friday evening hotel stay. We got to the room around 11 PM. Jackhammers were going all night next door. What kind of city allows nighttime demolition work? With the A/C on the sound was not bad. When the A/C clicked off the sound was terrible for my wife...the light sleeper. I guess this is not a reflection on the hotel. We traveled mid August 2014.. If you travel around this time,maybe ask the hotel if there will be construction next door all night.Rooftop lounge is a nice site to see. Nice views.. Check it out. We woke to a nice street fair for Saturday morning starting at the hotel and going for many blocks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for one night in May. Overall the hotel had lovely rooms and friendly, helpful staff. Despite these positives, everything else about the hotel was average and I walked away grateful for the staff's efforts but not wanting to stay there again. I should also mention that because I grew up in New York, I am perhaps more picky about my hotels there than in other cities. Details follow-I called the hotel in the days leading up to my stay to tell them that I would be arriving very early and because of a frantic travel schedule, I would likely not have slept the night before and asked if they could do everything they could to have my room ready for an early check-in. They assured me they would try but also warned that occupancy that week was very high so they really could promise anything. I understood that. I arrived at about 8:30 in the morning, heavily sleep deprived. The doorman was busy helping other guests so a hotel employee in a suit (later identified as the assistant F&B manager) came out and helped me with my very heavy luggage. I appreciated this. It is not every hotel where a member of management would step in for the bell team. The doormen were able to eventually assist me and were very friendly and helpful throughout my stay. Even the security guys around the door were friendly and got me an umbrella when I had forgotten one. All those ladies and gentlemen provided five-star service. I was checked-in by a friendly young man who was in his second or third day at the property so he was being trained by a more senior employee. I was informed that my room was not ready. I asked if they could rush a room as I hadn't slept. They said they would try and thought they could offer me a room in about an hour. Again, I thought that was reasonable and appreciated their efforts. Then things started to go downhill-The hotel has hundreds of rooms if I recall somewhere in the 500-700 range yet it has virtually no lobby so the lobby can comfortably seat somewhere between 8-10 people. There is one small couch and a handful of ottomans used as seats. That is it. That meant there really was no place to sit. Even the benches in the restaurant and service counter were often full. So, if I didn't want to leave the hotel, all I could do was pace back and forth or sit on the floor. After about 45 mins. I checked with the desk who didn't have a room for me. I checked back at 90 minutes, again no room and no estimate of when a room might be ready. I might be able to get a seat for 10-15 minutes before losing it again or having to get up to stretch, etc. When I used one of the lobby restrooms it was filthy. I notified the concierge who did not offer an apology. After two hours of largely pacing back and forth I asked again if they could get me a room and the desk still couldn't provide a room or an estimate of when one would be ready. Further complicating things was that the Wi-Fi in the lobby was not working so throughout the entire time I could not even get any work done on my laptop. Finally a little shy of three hours since I began to wait they found me a room. The room itself was lovely and clean with excellent water pressure, comfortable mattress, and modern furnishings. I had no complaints about the condition of the room. Pictures on the website accurately describe the state of rooms so I will not go into extensive detail here. After a much needed nap, I came downstairs to ask a couple of questions. I was meeting some friends for drinks at the Langham a well-known luxury hotel in the City. I had forgotten the cross-streets and asked the concierge to look them up for me. She provided me an address four blocks away from the actual hotel and I ended up being about 30 minutes late for my meeting. I understand mistakes happen but to get such a basic thing wrong was a surprise. I dealt with one gentleman at concierge who nice but the two ladies I dealt with were really indifferent. Another issue with service was that front desk staff doubled as the bellmen. This is the new "host" system Hyatt has and I must say I don't like it, particularly at a property this big. Hire a handful of real, dedicated bellmen, please. First, both times when I called for luggage assistance the two, very nice young ladies that arrived were smaller than the luggage I was asking them to carry. I felt badly for making them carry my luggage. Also, every time a guest called for luggage assistance or some other service someone at the front desk had to stop working and go the guest room, this meant that front desk service, while friendly, was slow. I know those front desk people were working as hard as they can and it undermines their ability to succeed by making them both front desk clerks and bell people. Finally, I ordered breakfast before i left the next morning and was told that they really didn't have traditional room service but they would bring me breakfast in to go containers: paper plates, paper cups, plastic silverware, etc. I agreed. The breakfast was good but not great and cost something in the range of $50. For $50 to be sipping a to-go cup of orange juice was really galling. Additionally, the quality of the smoked salmon and bagel was not very good (other items were more edible) but in a city where there are wonderful bagels and lox everywhere I was surprised the hotel did such a poor job (at such high prices). I eventually took my complaints to a manager who was kind enough to remove a couple of room charges because of the problems with my stay. This was handled very professionally. Overall, while the property has great potential, I was left feeling that there were better options for the money in NYC so unless you really have to be in Times Sq. or you can get this property at a substantially better price than others I would stay elsewhere.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I decided to choose the Hyatt due to its great location in Times Square. We knew we could just walk out the door and be close to the action. What I did not expect was to walk down the hallway to our room and see such fun colors along the way. Most hotels use browns and other blah colors, but this one had fun, warm, colorful designs. When we opened up our room, both of us commented on how cute the decor was. Not only was it modern, but the use of fun colors really brightened up the room. The decorations on the walls were so much fun to look at. The platform beds were huge and comfy with modern bedding. There was a mini-frig built into the desk and a safe. I would like to include photos of the charming room, but my computer is not allowing me to access my photos for this review. Must be a glitch with Trip Advisor?The bathroom was utra-modern with gorgeous flooring in black and off-white colors. The entire walls were gorgeous too and there was a rain-head on the shower. Although we were not in the room much, it is NYC after all, we really enjoyed this room. That night we went up to the rooftop bar and saw the spectacular skyline with all the bright lights. SO pretty! The next morning, we ate at the coffee shop. We really enjoyed our eggs and bacon. There was a healthy omelette option which I hope to try the next visit to this hotel. The air conditioning was amazing. Most hotels, you can't really monitor the temperature, but this worked beautifully! I really appreciated it in the August heat! The staff were all very friends, especially the guys helping us hail a cab! Thank you!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rating would be 3-1/2, if I could give the 1/2 star. Spent a week at the Hyatt Times Square in July, 2014 for both personal and business pleasure. Would have given it a 4 had it been more conducive to business travel and better elevator service. There is no business center but rather two computers set up in the hall behind the check-in desk/concierge - no privacy. Typically, this would be fine as I travel with a laptop, but in this instance I had several business docs to print out. The elevators are slow anyway. But, on two separate occasions during my stay, one of the elevators was blocked off for private access to the bar on the top floor. No one was waiting to get up to the bar. However, guests were waiting for the other elevators to get to their rooms. I thought it a real discourtesy to inconvenience hotel guests. Moving on.....the location is perfect being practically on Times Square, and near the theater district. My view was looking down on Times Square. The hotel/room is modern and very clean. Maid service excellent. Cafe downstairs and lounge on top floor - both good for either personal or business. The rate was really great for NYC and I would consider again due to the convenient locaiton, cleanliness, and modern room setup.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt times square has a lot going for it – No its not the location- In fact that is a bit of a dampener being so close to times square and hence effected by all the nonsense that goes around the place.The hotel really upholds hyatt service. The service staff from the check in to check out, concierge and all that goes within was top class. Well for me that makes a huge difference. The hotel neat and chic. Yes it has a really busy/ claustrophobic lobby mainly due to the shortage of space. The rooms though really tiny are neatly appointed well lit and bright. Lots of plug points to charge your phones/ cameras and tablets. The bed was comfortable, the toiletries decent and most so the room was brightly lit and decorated with really happy colours. We wanted the room early so we settled for a smaller room which was available before the actual check in time, it was a squeeze but was fine for us. The rooms like the ones in the pictures so you actually get what you pay forOnly thing that do not work for this property is the long way for the elevators. Wish they did something about that.In a nut shell I am so happy I stayed here. I am very cost conscious – especially in NYC because one is hardly in the room in this city… but staying here ensured that I walked almost everywhere which saved expensive cab fare… Also I moved to this hotel after a previous month stay at the dreary Hotel Penn and it was such a delightful experience.Recommendations, revisits – Yes Definitely. Just hoping they do not become too expensive for my merge purse.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When I reserved my 2 rooms a requested an early checkin for either one (the suite or attached room), reached the front desk at 09:00 AM and checked in, the person advised that I would be unable to get attached rooms because it was not available, I said no problem because I was alone but my wife, 2 kids and their grandmother was coming in on a later flight, so I requested the same floor. At that point she had assigned my rooms (I've just came off a long flight and did not sleep since about 30 hours), and said it would be a while that the rooms were being serviced from the last set of guest that left, which was very understandable, went and had breakfast at their restaurant went back about 11:00am (2 hrs later) and the rooms were not ready, went to time square for a walk and came back at 02:00 PM the gentleman I asked at the front desk was very rude and obnoxious he said why are you bothering me checking time was at 04:00PM come back then, that he has a line and I was told so.I asked to speak to a manager, after a lot of complaining and whispering to himself he got the manager about 10 mins later, the manager obviously tried to cover the other front desk clerk by agreeing with him but I was very persistent because I was tired and my family was going to arrive shortly. The manager said he will go up himself to check, came back 2mins later and said the rooms were ready and housekeeping did not have it in the system.For A suit average $500 and reg room $350. It was definitely not worth it. the carpet was very "old" or VERY VERY DIRTY, rooms are small.The only good thing is that the location is perfect if want to get in on the Broadway action.On One night Housekeeping did not service the room !!The manager keep insisting that the Privacy sign was on but it was not, because my wife was shopping and all day I was bringing bags back to the bell man to send to my room, and the bags were all there when we got back late in the night.THINK TWICE !!! I WOULD NOT STAY THERE AGAIN, AND WOULD START TO RECONSIDER HYATT ALSO.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It was incredible... We spent a beautiful time in this hotel.3 nights.We were at 51th floor with an amazing view on Time Square.The service is impeccable, the rooms are spacious and very cleans.Wifi in the rooms (paying) and the lobby.Try the B54 lounge bar, it's magic, with its incredible scenic view.Good location in Time Square Heart.We recommend strongly this accommodation !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel has only been in its location less than a year. Clean, great location and good service. Rooms are bigger than many NY hotels. Somewhat Small lobby area. Roof of hotel is a nice lounge. Many places to eat and see in walking distance. Shower head on ceiling.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Previews reviews are accurate, but no one mentioned any elevator incident. Well, there's nothing that dampens an otherwise perfect evening (on our last day) than getting stuck in an elevator in a high-rise building. The power went off somewhere on the 18th floor. Only the light was on or I would have totally freaked out! After we sounded the alarm (button), a voice came through to assist. Power came back after about 15 minutes. There was not a single word from management after that incident. I mentioned it on checking out but the front desk nonchalantly said "Oh, our newspaper man got stuck earlier too!" Like it happens all the time.The scary thing is that there are only 2 elevators assigned to each floor. That's a 50% chance of getting stuck! Getting stuck in an elevator in New York City is not a good thing. I wouldn't mind so much in other places every once in a while.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This property has it all. Location a half block from Times Square,solid customer service,great rooms. Dont hesitate to use the services of the concerarge. They were very helpful weeks before we arrived helping us with various activities. First time for us to NYC but would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent 4 days in NYC with kids. This hotel was in a perfect location Times Square is a little crazy but the hotel was quiet and private. The staff was so friendly but the best part was the size of the rooms, a rare find in the City. New clean and big enough for a family if 4.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a new hotel about 50 metres from the actual square so it is a very busy area. The crowds on the street get to high farce about late afternoon exacerbated by roads works within the square. The lobby of the hotel is equally as busy, which is further congested by guests using the free Wi-Fi that is only available there. Nonetheless the staff are very good and plentiful and the rooms are fair sized with nice modern bathrooms which are a blessing. The cafe attached is quite OK for casual dining but we found it strange to be told we would have to wait 10 minutes to be seated as the waitress was resting.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I love this hotel. Friendly staff, best possible location, spacious room, spacious bathroom, nice bedding, nice big t.v., etc. I had a "terrace room", which has a real outdoor terrace. Had a wonderful view, and view of Time Square. It is big and spacious. Lovely place to have coffee, have friends over, make your cell calls etc. I believe this is a rarity in Manhattan, and it's worth the extra money for this unique feature.The hotel restaurant, T45 was nice, great chicken dish, and good value for money. They hotel was giving 20% coupons to guests, making it an ever better value. The Bar on the 54th view has breathtaking views, and best of all, it's an OUTSIDE bar, as well as inside. But to be outside in the fresh air, with that view, relaxing, is a gem for Manhattan...and just steps from Times Square. There is a large 24 hour deli just down the street, Cranberry Deli, open 24 hours, with anything you could want. Hot and cold buffets 24 hours a day. Staff here were universally friendly and helpful. I liked when I checked in, they said "welcome back", since I was there a few months ago. Manhattan is not a cheap place for a hotel, but compared to other nearby hotels, I thought it was a great value for money. Don't miss that rooftop bar!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel as it was in a great location which was important as we were only in NYC for a short trip so wanted to make the most of everything. The location did not disappoint, being only a block or so from Times Sq, and not exactly in the heart of all the craziness so you could get a break from the crowds. The staff at this hotel are all very friendly, from front desk to the doormen. The hotel itself is functional and clean, the way my husband summed it up was 'functional, spacious but no frills', and I tend to agree as though it was renovated, you could tell it was done efficiently rather than with any design flair. The room is spacious for NYC, which we loved, but again very functional with no added indulgences. This worked fine for us on this trip as being a city break we spent more time out and about. Great for a base in NYC

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I'm a Platinum Gold Passport member; I prefer to stay at Hyatt properties whenever possible.Upon arrival, we were allowed to check in although it as before 3 PM. Arelis (great the whole time!) immediately recognized my Platinum status; for it, she gave me a room upgrade (view of Times Square) and a 20% coupon for lunch and dinner. We were also given free bottled water daily. The security staff was hospitable and present 24-7. Room service prices were decent ($17-19/entree for breakfast). The breakfast was tasty and large enough to feed 2 people. Service was also fast and courteous. Yenny was also great during checkout.Unfortunately, we had issues. Our A/C stopped working - it blew warm air even with the thermostat set at 65 degrees. Housekeeping left us with a lipstick-stained comforter for 2 days (I don't wear lipstick). There was hair in our bed. And, our bathroom floor mat was dirty. I also had to keep requesting an extra set of towels because they kept only leaving two sets rather than three to match our party of three. Zachary was kind enough to comp breakfast and take $75 off the bill. But, I think the entire last night should have been credited, especially since two of us are now having sinus issues.When I get to return to NYC, it is highly likely I will consider staying again despite the issues. Times Square is 3-5 mins away, yet the hotel is quiet. The decor of the hotel, the on-site restaurant, and and the rooms is very modern and appropriate.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely king bedroom on L47 with wonderful views, a well equipped bathroom and a huge flat tv screen on the wall. Excellent brasserie on the g/f for breakfast. First class gym. Great skyline bar on the top floor with outstanding views - try for an outside table. Attentive service and overall a good vibe. We enjoyed our two night stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I paid nearly $500 per night for our hotel so that we could have the lounge on the rooftop...just to find out anyone could go to the rooftop lounge whether they were staying there or not. That was disappointing. However the view was beautiful!!! Not sure it was worth the money, but it was lovely and clean. The doormen were kinda lazy because I, a female, ended up holding he door for a few people walking in with luggage as the doormen were holding up the wall they were leaning against.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I don't usually stay anywhere near Times Square when I travel to New York, but I thought I'd give it a try this time. The hotel is very nice. The concierges are VERY helpful. The location is good if Times Square is where you want to be.I did have a problem with my air conditioning, but they got it fixed as soon as I told them about it. The only complaint I have is that the air didn't work very well. I had the temperature set on 65 the entire week we were there and it never got that cold in the room. Now, I am from Texas and we have excellent air conditioning here. I've never been to New York in summer before and my experience was that the air conditioning didn't work very well in most places.The bar at the top of the hotel has an outstanding view of the city (especially at night), but if you do order a drink be aware that they are VERY expensive. We had 2 alcoholic drinks and paid $56 for them.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently stayed there in July and felt very comfortable and at home. Everything was a walk away from the hotel. The staff was very helpful and cheerful which is a bliss when you've been traveling for a day.The only thing i have to reproach is that wi-fi should be free with the price tag that comes along!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square staff is top notch. The front desk, concierge and restaurant staff are great. No club lounge, so breakfast included for Diamond members in the restaurant. Very good start to the day. Good Times Square location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Today my husband, myself and our 11 yr old daughter arrived back home from the Hyatt Times Square hotel. Based on all of the reviews I'd read prior to booking the hotel, I didn't know what we were getting. I am sooo glad I didn't take the negative reviews to heart. We checked in on Friday, August 1st around 3pm. We received our room right away--room 30-03 where we had a view of Times Square. Because they didn't have double bed rooms available at the time we booked our hotel, we requested a roll away bed--it was $35 per night however the front desk staff waived it for our trip. I am happy that they did since we hadn't planned on the $70 per night charge to valet the car. The hotel room has a refrigerator as well as a safe. There are two robes and flippers in the closet. The hotel restaurant was very good for breakfast. Very nice hotel with all the amenities of the Hyatt.Tip: There IS parking in the next block near the Lion King Theatre for about $35 per night. We were one block from times square. No WIfi--its $12.95 , not sure if its per day or per stay however it is free in the lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice new hotel, perfect located near Times Square. Comfortable rooms with working desk, mini refridgerator. Good diner Close to lobby and a roof top bar with a stunning view of New York Skyline. We had a nice view to Times Square from our room, the staff was great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights n was wowed.... It's rite on Times Square n has possibly d best rooms in New York... D rooms r cozy n the bathrooms r spacious n fitted with best accessories... D biggest issue is d checkin time, it's 4pm... N u won't get room before that...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As others have said, this is a very nice, new hotel in a great location. Staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms are well appointed and modern. Only issues we had were we needed to downgrade one room in order to be on the same floor as the other room (apparently there is only one deluxe queen room per floor) and we also had issues with the A/C working in one room.Since we ended-up with one deluxe and one standard room, I could appreciate the additional room with the deluxe. The rooftop bar was very cool. Not much in way of hotel dining, but there are good restaurants and a Starbucks right across the street. Free wifi would have been nice, but the data plan on our phones worked fine.Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is close to Times Square and all of the theaters in the Theater District. The staff is very friendly and helpful. My wife and I are looking forward to coming back here again to see more shows on Broadway. I only wish they would have free WiFi available in the rooms. That is the a small but important complaint that I wish could be remedied.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here a few months back and received terrible service and reviewed it as such. The manager responded and assured me that all would be set straight and they even awarded me points on my loyalty account.I felt they deserved another chance, but boy was I wrong! The same crappy service and non response to my reasonable requests despite saying they would deal with it.Basics that were wrong the last time are still evident, including but not limited to the replacement of laundry slips after first use. Not a big deal to most people but as a business traveller this is a must, plus you would think that as an income generator it would be in their best interest too.My room did not come with a 'do not disturb' sign so I kindly requested one this morning. They, as usual, said they would get right on it and as usual no sign of the sign. Lip service and no action again.I've also noticed that the gym have stopped providing bottled water so my first review covering deteriorating service and amenities remains consistent. The equipment is not serviced so many of the features including TV viewing while riding no longer work. I haven't bothered to tell them because I would just be wasting my breath.As a top tier Hyatt loyalty member I can confidently say that this is their worst hotel in their global portfolio, just a pretty veneer hiding terrible service.On the plus side, the AC problems I experienced last time is not an issue on this occasion.I'm still here until middle of next week and all I want to do is move to another hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A very nice chic hotel steps away from Times Square. Friendly and helpful staff held our bags when we arrived too early to check-in then called us as we were exploring the area (Empire State bldg.) when our room was ready (still three hours before official check-in time). Always friendly greetings inside and out and helpful pointers or restaurant recommendations. Very clean rooms and comfortable beds. Hardly ever heard a neighbor. Small but well appointed and modern room. Adjoining diner served very tasty food quickly--pricey but on par with the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Most friendly service. Everyone is always smiling and such a beautiful hotel. Close to all major hot spots. The rooftop is one of the best in Manhattan. Definitely will come again for the excellent service and beautiful first class rooms.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this awesome Hyatt for one week with two friends. Everything was perfect!!!We stayed in a room with two comfortable and big queen beds! The room was very large and new, the staff is great, everybody is always happy and ready to help you with anything!The bathroom is also large with a nice shower and a bathtub!Location? Oh location!!!! Perfect! You're 1 minute away from Times Square but it doesn't fell like it. We couldn't hear any noise from our room and it was awesome!We stayed at the 51th floor so we had a great view from NYC!I would extremely recommend this hotel for everybody going to New York!! Next time I come, I definitely have a place to stay! Perfect hotel and perfect week in the city!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One leaves the frenetic pace of Times Square/Broadway and enters the serene space of the Hyatt. This is a modern hotel which has been open less than one year. And it shows ..... Everything is clean, fresh and working perfectly. The room was of decent size (for NYC), well decorated with modern furnishings and bathroom. The bed was extremely comfortable and the linens were luxurious. The hotel is quiet throughout - I could not hear any street or siren noises. The staff was very pleasant and efficient. There is a lovely bar on the top floor with outside seating (great views) but unfortunately rather limited seating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Bar 54 --what can I say!! We have been there 2 days in a row... The view is spectacular and the popcorn appetizers (free) are delicious.. the flavors change daily, Sriracha, Thyme were great, but we hear that the bacon flavor is to die for!! Great romantic spot as the sun sets over beautiful New York... It is definitely worth stoping in for a cocktail. They open at 5pm

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just stayed for 1 night for a friend's show. Check in was great . We were upgraded to a king bed( very comfortable) on a higher floor. My wife is a platinum member, and we were offered a late check-out which we utilized fully. Thank You.. We were also able to check in early. The staff was great, and the location could not have been better to see all around Times Square area. We were on the 49th floor, and did not hear anything below. The curtains block the times square lights, but the view is great when curtains are open. It was easy to get around . All the attractions of Times Square. Bryant Park just a few blocks from the hotel was an unexpected surprise. The hotel has a great roof deck with a nice view of the city. They closed the outdoor deck the night we were there because of the threat of rain. We were out past 11 and it didn't rain. I guess the only recommendation would be better planning for the outside roof deck. We would have went back for a drink but didn't because when we checked it out before dinner they said it would not be open that night. I would definitely stay here again. I would recommend to anyone looking for a great hotel in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The service is terrific. Helpful, friendly staff everywhere. The location is great if you want to be near Times Square. But I wouldn't rush to stay here again, especially when compared to Hyatt's other wonderful offerings in New York (the Hyatt Lex and the Andaz Wall Street, especially). Many of the rooms are very, very small and, because the hotel is often fully booked, Hyatt Diamond members don't seem to get much of an upgrade, I'm a Diamond member but, despite repeated requests, couldn't get a room better than a lower floor without much of a view, and I was told by the front desk that I shouldn't be upset because this was pretty common.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a not to be missed. Rooms are beautifully decorated, comfortable with superb bed and bathroom. Hyatt is Hyatt!Also amazing rooftop with spectacular view. Location is not my favourite (too busy because of Times Square). Certainly one of the best on mid town!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I brought our 11 year old granddaughter to NY for her first visit ever from rural Montana, and this was the perfect hotel to serve as our base. Wonderful front desk person Danielle saw that it was a special occasion and booked us on the 43rd floor with breathtaking views. We enjoyed so many experiences in the city but also loved returning to our quiet, comfortable, beautiful room to "recharge." Our granddaughter was treated by hotel staff like a real person, not just a kid. Everyone was friendly and efficient. Can't say enough good things about the Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband I I just got back from a 5 night stay for my Birthday week in there corner executive room suite on the 42 floor looking out towards Times Square. ( Amazing view) We did have issues with our bedding right away as I'm a huge freak about looking for bed bugs etc ( even carry a specially made spray for them lol) Our top White bedspread was full of black hairs :/ really grossed us out!! Called down for new bedding, sadly we had to wait over 45 mins before anyone even showed up. But the maids were VERY nice and helpful even said if it was them they would have wanted there bed changed! On tues ( the next day) I had 2 priority mail packages I had brought from home, all ready pre-paid postage that I needed to ship out to 2 of my customers as I have a clothing website and I was shipping out two orders. On Tues mid- morning we asked the front desk where the closet post office was, they states we could leave the packages with them. Sadly I trusted them and did. Thinking nothing of it until Friday I get an email from my customer stating they still have no package. I have tracking on both packages and when I tracked there's been NO ACTIVITY. 4 days ago I gave it to the front desk? It should have already been to my customer with 2-3 day priority mail shipping. I ask the front desk they look in the room behind the front desk, nothing... So I talk with the concierge they are all SO SORRY!!! :/ well here it is Monday 6 days since I've given to " someone " at the front desk STILL NO ACTIVITY on either on of my packages. I could see maybe 1 getting lost MAYBE but both? I'm thinking someone is enjoying a new skirt and a new dress!! Which will cost me over $100.00 to refund my customer. Ok yes that was long. The hotel was nice, "some" of the staff was very nice, some didn't bother to look at us when we walked through the door. Don't give the front desk Anything you value!! We won't be back unfortunately....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The location was great, nice pubs were close by, the employees were friendly, and our rooms were CLEAN!!!!! Curtains kept the brightness of Times Square out, but we had great views when we wanted to look out of the floor to ceiling windows. The bathroom was well equipped and roomy. Noise was never an issue from the outside or in the halls. In fact we only ran into one or two people the entire time on our hall which seemed unusual in the middle of July. Elevators were rarely crowded. We stayed for four nights and couldn't find anything at all to complain about!!! We would definitely stay here again!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed already in a lot of 4 and 5 stars as a frequent traveller. But always it were some little things that I could complain about such as internet too slow for example. But this hotel has nothing to complain about. Literally Everything is just perfect.The moment you walk in the hotel you feel a warm and very welcoming staff that awaits you. The room has every you could wish for. High speed internet ( really fast) super bathroom, and last but not least : the beds. I don't know what they are made of but you really sleep in them like a princess :-)Super good and very nice hotel. Make sure you visit the rooftop bar once.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: If you are about to explore Manhattan, there is no better location than Times Square. You are just in the middle of the island, and have easy access to all parts of Manhattan. All the theatres as near by and 5th Ave shops are just around the corner. The only downside are of course the tourist crowds filling the Times Square, but these cannot be avoided.The hotel is brand new, and lacks the main faults of NY hotels. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are new, clean and tidy. We went for the deluxe room, which was well worth the extra money. The room is not huge, but has all you need. The deluxe rooms are on the upper floors with breath taking views over Manhattan all the way to the Freedom Tower.Remember that most of the NY hotels do not even offer the breakfast option. In Hyatt TS there is a breakfast restaurant on the ground floor, but you have also a variety of breakfast options around the corner from Starbucks and Pret-a-Manger to great diners like the Junior's only two blocks away. With the Starbucks coffee maker in your room, you get the caffeine you need in order to get you to the breakfast restaurant of your choice.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location (close to Times Square, Bryant Park, and Rock Center) and very clean, stylish rooms. The staff was incredibly helpful and kind; rooms were very clean and kid friendly. Few tips: about two doors down there is a great, small store- buy your beer and wine there as the food/beverages at the Hyatt are overpriced (but comparable to NYC hotel prices); the store also has an ATM (which the hotel does not have). Also, there are a few parking garages that are very close to the hotel---I would opt for self parking as the valet prices are absurd (but again on comparable to other NYC hotels) especially when I'm fairly sure the valet parks the cars in the same garage for like 40 bucks/night. No criticisms of the hotel or services and I would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is a great hotel. It has a prime location right in the midst of the action yet the rooms offered a peaceful respite from the city. My room was a standard double but I felt it was spacious for NY standards. The decor and fixtures felt fresh, clean and new. The room service from the T45 restaurant was of an exceptional standard. I ordered the portobello mushroom sandwich and it was easily the best room service meal I've had in years.Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hi everyone, I stayed at the Hyatt Time Square in June and the location was perfect, steps away from Time Square, the rooms were awesome ( a bit small but that is normal for hotels in that location) and the staff was very friendly especially Karen at the front desk who checked us in. I mentioned to her that we were expecting our 1st and by the time we got to our room there was a beautiful card and a gift from the staff congratulating us. It was such a thoughtful gesture. I would recommend this hotel to all!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I really enjoyed my quick stay at this hotel. My wife and I were in town for two days/one night for our 14th anniversary and the hotel was really one of the highlights of our trip. Our room had a modern look and feel but was very comfortable. The space and design were well thought out and the floor to ceiling windows really enhance the great view of the NYC skyline. We didn't come to New York City (particularly Times Square) looking for peace an quiet but the noise was not a concern (we were on the 47th floor). We didn't interact with the hotel staff much just because we didn't need to but they seemed very accommodating and I got the sense they were a fun group who enjoyed working together.If you're looking for a great place to stay in the general area of Times Square, you can't go wrong with the Hyatt. If you want to spend another $50 to $100 a night you might get fancier drapes but I don't think you'll get a better hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and 7yr old daughter recently stayed at the Hyatt in a Times Square. It was just perfect. Very sleek and clean. A contemporary vibe. The check in process was quick and efficient. We used the valet service to park our car for the weekend. It was smooth and efficient. Karen checked us in. She was very friendly and polite. My daughter told her it was her first visit to NYC. Karen then upgraded our room without us asking to a one bedroom suite and moved us to a higher floor. How nice was that, huh? The check in process was a bit funky in that the person who checks you in, also takes your bags to your room. I guess it's a single point of service. It worked for us, but I can see where bottlenecks could occur at busier times.The lobby is small, but we didn't need to or want to hang there, so it didn't matter. The room was very clean. Beds were large, fluffy, and extremely comfortable. Noise level was low. Nice TVs. Great showers. Well run and evenly controlled AC. No complaints at all.The location was amazing. Steps from Time Square. We could walk everywhere....Toys R Us for the Ferris wheel, M&MS store, Hershey Store. Broadway theaters, fine resteraunts, etc. We also walked only a few blocks to St. Patricks Cathedral, Rockafeller Center, and the American Girl Store. We took a longer, but very doable walk, to Central Park. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is in a good location; the rooms are decent sized. However; this hotel's major issue is incompetent staff. It is highly disorganized right from check-in. There is no properly formed line at the reception and it is a total chaos and waste of time waiting for check-in.The worst part of my experience was when I was trying to locate an item that I left in the room after check-out. I called the hotel 2 hours after check-out and let them know that I left a pair of jeans in the closet. Again, the way they dealt with it was a total chaos; they didn't know who to call; didn't return my calls. I decided to go to the hotel to talk to the housekeeping manager and at that point I understood that this hotel has no way of dealing with something as basic as lost & found. Either their housekeepers don't return found items in the room; or the management has no way of tracking them. Either way it is a shame for a Hyatt. Had gone through similar incidents in the past with other major chains and never had an issue finding the item (and most of the time it was shipped to me in no time!)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Now, I live in CT but work in NYC every week. I usually stay at Marriott as a platinum member but decided to switch things up a bit and stay here. Like all my reviews, I'm very picky. Here is what I need:Great AC-checkGreat bed-checkLarge room-checkFriendly staff-check check checkFrom Chester and Luis upfront managing your first expectations upon arrival to the front desk. But the best and one that got me hooked is Karen the Sales Manager. Man, what a special person and like no one in the hotel business that I ever encountered. She helped me with getting a preferred price for my weekly visit, left a beautiful card and brownies in my room and upgraded me on my consecutive visits. What a women. Great person and true professional. This terrace room with balcony is awesome. The suites are huge and new and the restaurant is awesome. So, make the switch here and enjoy the comforts of home with an amazingly caring and talented staff who all love their jobs. Hope Hyatt is reading this and passes this around the team. Love them. Marc Rodman

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The lobby is extremely minimal, so, if you are looking for a grand NYC lobby, this is not the place for you. Check in was extremely fast, courteous and professional. The room was large by NYC standards, approx. 350 sq feet. The roof top bar, Bar 54 was amazing. The views, the service, the cockatails all good. I do not understand why people are complaining about the overpriced drinks, the prices are perfectly in line with NYC bar prices, especially considering the view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent our first 2 days in the US at Hyatt and we were very impressed with the quality of this hotel. When we arrived the staff in reception were very friendly and helpful. We requested a quiet room and we were given a great room on the 30th floor with a view of Times Square. It was elegant, modern and clean, as well as completely quiet getting a great night sleep. The only small criticism is that wifi is only free in public areas, not in the room which considering the fact that this is an expensive hotel should be included in the room cost. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NY, it is a great place to stay very centrally located.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room was spacious, clean, and had a great view of Times Square and south towards the financial district. Found the staff friendly and helpful in all regards. Our air-conditioning stopped working in the wee hours of our last night but it was too late to change rooms so we lost some sleep. Of course those things happen and I reported it at checkout so hopefully it was fixed for the next guests.I would not recommend the hotel to business travelers as it is quite touristy and being near Times Square does get to be a bit "much' after a day or two. Overall a pleasant experience though and a good value for NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here on a business trip for a week. Aside from it being steps away from the craziness and tourists of Times Square, this is a great hotel. New, clean, with rooms that are large by NYC standards. Great room service menu and very quick delivery. Half a mile from Central Park so very convenient for a morning run in the park. The rooftop bar is an oasis from the hustle and bustle of the city - fantastic views and a cool, chill vibe that was great after a long day of meetings.Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the best hotel I have ever stayed in, while in New York City. The room was very clean and the beds were comfy. The lighting wasn't the best but, it was fine for us. Also, the view was great, which made some awesome instagram photos. I highly recommend staying here if you want a great hotel with all of the amenities of home!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Diamond member of Hyatt for about 20 years, so i know my Hyatts.This one was a MAJOR disappointment. I realize that the hotel is right off Times Square, but i never expected the crowded, loud, crazy lobby enviroment! The lobby is simply too small to accommodate the crowds at times. Its crazy! It as all the glamour, and the same crowd as the transit authority.if you are a businessman, RUN!Other hotels have done a MUCH BETTER job of opening a hotel off Times Square, while still holding on to their core values and 'brand' image. The Intercontinental Times Square did this BEAUTIFULLY. Hyatt really failed here.Aside from the terribly small lobby, the rooms are contemporary and clean. Nothing great, nothing bad. Could be a new Holiday Inn Express, Sheraton...anyone.Diamond Amenity never delivered. Not a big surprise...Dinner in the 'restaurant' was awful. Again, not your typical Hyatt...just a somewhat trendy 'diner' off the lobby. No cocktail lounge, nothing. Dinner was awful. I was the ONLY person there, and now i know why. Breakfast the next morning was fine. Great morning service. I have a gut feeling that this is not even a Hyatt Dining room....seems 'third party' to me.The health club was good, plenty of cadio machines. Never went to the SPA, and to be honest, would never want to go in this environment.There are much better Hyatt hotels just blocks away. Lexington, Andaz and even the Grand Hyatt are all much better places. Unless you get a great deal here, and just need a safe and clean place to stay....i would suggest another Hyatt Property.Really a big disappointment...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel in the heart of Times Square. Very appealing. Great staff and nice double room. Just be ready to pay for the location but if it's for a day or two, it's well worth it. I would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Conveniently placed on the fringe of Times Square the Hyatt was a perfect base for exploring the city.Rooms were well equipped and well maintained as was the rest of hotel fabric (the Air Conditioned lobby was particularly welcoming after a day in the city heat!). The diner style restaurant was ok (but no better). The 54th floor bar was well managed but service was a bit slow.The concierge service first class and provided good recommendations for tour bus companies and managed to get great Broadway theatre tickets at sort notice.The Hyatt fitted the bill perfectly for our needs and we would return without hesitation.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location for sight seeing/theaters etc., decent in-house restaurant, nice, compact well furnished room. Room may be considered a bit small compared to other comparable Hyatts. Friendly staff. Good value for the money paid.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took our daughter for her Senior Gift. This location was in the heart of Times Square. Took the Subway quite a bit with the fine instructions of the concierge. Rooftop bar is cool, no kids aloud though :( WE will stay here again!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I couldn't have loved this place more the whole staff was so nice and helpful the room took my breath away from the beautiful view on the 31 floor to the heated bathroom floors and awesome shower it was a big room too loved it so much if I ever get the pleasure to go back to NYC this will be the only place I stay!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Modern, clean, quiet, very comfortable, floor to ceiling windows, fantastic views, good gym, beautiful bar with amazing view on 54th floor and really helpful, friendly and professional staff. Despite it being a fairly big hotell it has a small quite personal feel, largely down the staff. Everyone from Cheston on the door to reception to housekeeping made us feel welcome. Nothing was too much trouble. There are many expensive but mediocre hotels in Midtown. This is expensive but excellent. If you want to stay in Midtown stay here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent four nights in late June and was very happy with our stay. The king sized bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and spotless. My college aged daughter was equally impressed with the room and view. We appreciated and early check-in since I had motion sickness from the flight. The staff was always polite and helpful. The cafe had delicious breakfasts and lunches. We enjoyed having Starbucks coffee in our room and a refrigerator for our water. We wanted to be close to time square (literally turn right and you are there). The price is worth the location!!! We appreciated the security at the elevators since we were traveling without my husband. We look forward to a trip next June to see more Broadway shows and we will stay again at the Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff were all very professional and friendly. The room was smaller than we usually enjoy in NYC, but it was fresh and new. We appreciated all of the connectivity (both sides of bed, etc.) One dresser drawer track was already broken, so the furniture may not last long. We stayed three nights and housekeeping did not vacuum any of the three days. They also forgot a coffee cup one day and did not empty the ice bucket the same day. Location is great.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Came to NYC to see broadway show and decided to stay overnight. Everyone at reception was extremely polite. Upon check in my our room was immediately upgraded to a corner suite on a higher floor. The view was fabulous overlooking Times Square. The room was clean with modern decor and furnishings, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and clean. Would definitely stay here again. Only drawback was the sky lounge rooftop bar which had limited outdoor seating and ridiculous drink prices ($23 for a beer, really?). Luckily there are plenty of other options in the neighborhood to get a cocktail.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is located right on the corner of Times Square. It's very well designed and the staff is very friendly and helpful to. The rooms are reasonably sized, especially compared to the average room size in other hotels in New York City.The room was very clean, including the carpet on the floor. The bathroom had a rain shower and was spacious. The only downside is the airco which made some annoying noise while it started. During the night it stops and starts several times so sometimes the noise woke us up. Although you're almost on Times Square, we hardly noticed by the noise from outside.On the 54th floor there is a bar / lounge with a terrace with a great view over Times Square. Unfortunately their is only free wifi in the lobby and the bar / lounge and not in the room.I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: As a native of New York City (born and lived in the Bronx for a few years) and having been brought up on Long Island, there has always been something strange but exciting about staying overnight in Manhattan. Usually, the end of a day in Manhattan meant the IND followed by the LIRR.Most of my stays in Manhattan over the last 30 years have been business only with my expenses paid by my employer and generally a typical, mediocre hotel room someplace in midtown Manhattan. However, this trip was strictly pleasure, five days in Manhattan with a number of shows and museums (and some kosher deli!) with my wife.The Hyatt Times Square was perfect for our needs. Can you say “location, location, location?” Excellent location on West 45th off of Times Square, but not actually on Times Square. Easy access to subways, theatres, restaurants, ...The Hyatt Times Square is a relatively new hotel with modern furnishings throughout. Our room on the 33rd floor was reasonably large and generally well furnished. The bathroom had an excellent large stall shower (I hate hotel bathtubs for taking showers - slippery and dangerous - and most guests take showers and not baths) and a shaving mirror (very helpful for men) and was both well lit and ventilated.Bed was very comfortable, room was very quiet (despite being so close to Times Square), and we both slept very well. Room ventilation worked very well (both heat and air conditioning) and relatively quietly.All facilities were exceptionally clean and well-maintained. Housekeeping does an excellent job of making up each room each day as if we were new guests.All staff we interacted with, including housekeeping staff, were very friendly and helpful (and I might add, English speaking which isn't the case in many hotels in the United States these days).This is not an inexpensive hotel. (If you are on a very strict budget, look elsewhere!) On the other hand, it was no more expensive than the other brand name hotels in Midtown Manhattan and the facilities were at least as good if not better than any other non-luxury hotel that I've stayed at in the area.Negatives? Very few, but for the record ... The room desk should have a comfortable desk chair, especially since many of the hotel's guests are either there on business or doing some business while there on pleasure (my case). The hotel offers complimentary internet access. It is reliable, but each connection is limited to 5mb/sec bandwidth, much slower than my cellphone's 4G/LTE service! Although this limitation is probably in place to assure that all guests can fairly share in the hotel's overall bandwidth, it is somewhat restrictive for business use.Finally, the hotel has a restaurant off the lobby at which we had breakfast one day. Food was OK but very much overpriced for what you got.We would definitely return to this hotel if and when our travel finds us in Midtown Manhattan again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This new Hyatt is a great choice if you want to be in Times Square. We were seeing shows and wanted to be centrally located, plus were looking for a hotel with two queen beds and a little more spacious than your average NYC accommodation. Checked in early on my phone-still had to wait when we got to the hotel by early pm. Check in was terrific with a welcome, took our bags and we went out for the afternoon and received a call when our room was ready. Recommend upper floors and front of building if you can get them, Elevators were a little odd if your room was lower than 29th floor you had to change on 25 for the roof top bar, which was amazing! Not to be missed....view was wonderful at sunset, evening and daytime....Service was extraordinarily slow - had to go to bar to order once evening because time was tight. A/C was slightly noisy and freezing, but when we turned temp up the heater came on! LOVED the rain shower! One of the check out clerks asked me to wait on line (11am is busy) then proceeded to take someone who walked up to the counter, which was annoying since I was trying to get to the airport. Full marks for check in, not so for check out or roof top so went with average.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Checking in with Yenny at the front desk was a breeze. She was welcoming, warm and friendly. Sh pointed out that we had to use the express elevators to the right as we were on the 29th floor. Elevators are fast we never had to wait to long for one. The room was surprisingly spacious for New York City, we loved the view. Contemporary decor, casual but classy, Great bed, firm but soft and comfortable. adequate lighting enough plugs. It iwas a great room for a good price, I've paid more for much less in the past... Now the bathroom.. I love, love, love Hyatt bathrooms. This one has a large -again, very large for New York- bathroom with a walk in shower and temperature controlled floors. I love warm floors in the bathroom. I have to mention housekeeping. They do a beautiful job and our rooms was ready early and toiletries and towels always replenished.Fantastic gym. Brand new equipment, clean, clean clean. There is a rooftop bar... meh... it was too crowded for a Monday night. The host was a bit prickly and the waitress was slammed but sweet and friendly. It was clear to me they were understaffed that night. We did not mind, we sat outside and enjoyed the great view.Breakfast at restaurant downstairs has a bit of a pricey menu but food is great and they refill your OJ (that tastes like it's fresh squeezed). I loved the "diner inspired" decor but mostly the service. Our server Rey went out of his way for us (it was a special occasion for us) which is nice, but seriously, it is this kind of service that makes one want to always return somewhere. All in all the best place I've ever stayed at this close to Times Square. We will be back. Strongly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hotel was in a great location, rooms spacious, great view from floor 34. Expensive for breakfast. Not much information in lobby but I'm sure if you asked the staff were very helpful. Would certainly stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here in early June. We booked a king room. The room was spacious (for NY) and extremely clean. Reception staff were efficient, very friendly and helpful. The hotel is on the doorstep of Times Square which is great for exploring. The only downside was the rooftop bar. It was expensive and the staff were rude and incompetent. We were really surprised by the contrast from everyone else in the hotel, who were professional and friendly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great girls weekend in New York! We arrived at the hotel at 7am to drop off our bags and go sight seeing and they told us our room was ready. Not only did we check in early but they also gave us a free upgrade. This was our first time in the big apple and the location was perfect. The hotel was beautiful and the service was outstanding....I will definitely stay here again. Thanks to all the wonderful staff for making our vacation memorable!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We couldn't have asked for a better location. Close to everything and an excellent rooftop view of the city. The view will cost you a few bucks at the bar but I guess it's better than going to the Top of the Rock for $29 just to ride the elevator, at least at the Hyatt we got a drink for a little less than that. It may take you a while to get to the roof or your floor in this hotel, the elevators take forever and many times you wait for 5 minutes and the elevator comes and there is no room in it to get in. The rooms are spotless, clean and shiny new. We were on the 39th floor, great view from the toilet bowl with a floor to ceiling window looking down 39 floors to the street. WOW. I would still go back even though the elevators were a nuisance. The concierge gave us 3 recommendations while we were there and they were all great. Top notch for service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Not much to add in terms of being new, clean, modern etc... Agree with most other recent reviews.Would have given 5 stars if 1. There was better service at the roof top bar. We waited long before we decided to go downstairs to the restaurant. The people there were kind enough to get us the same cocktails although not on their menu. However, cannot make up for lost views.2. Was charged after checkout for an upgrade which never happened. While the hotel apologised only a part refund was made and I had to raise a dispute with the credit card company to get the rest back.Suggestion: Customer service can definitely improve, especially for a hotel of this standard.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square New York offers unparalleled accommodations and magnificent service in the heart of Times Square. This new construction building offers a voguish appeal while at the same time offering a comfortable setting. The hotel is beautifully decorated with modern contemporary art in a fun whited way. The staff did an awesome job offering a high level of engaging customer service. I was fortunate to have the opportunity to have a mini suite on the 42nd floor with a mesmorzing view of the city! Bar 54 (on the 54 floor) is an absolute must visit. The bar offers a drink "lab" experience with fresh savory ingredients. The view is monumental. Make this hotel your only accommodation choice in Times Square. A big thanks to the staff of the hotel for making my stay memorable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: With so many hotels to chose from in NY on first visit, we selected Hyatt Times Square as it was new build,was in midtown & had read good reviews. Located on West 45th, a short cab ride from Penn Station. The staff immediately opened cab door on our arrival & took luggage for us. A very warm welcome at reception and although we had arrived earlier than check in time, our room was ready. We were on 43rd floor. Very good modern clean room. Everything you required. Liked to swivel chair, so you could easily swing around to take in views from room. Staff always greeted you in & out of hotel and were most helpful with tips on thingsto do or directions. Free WIfi in public areas - we used pc with concierge for return online airline boarding check in. Very close to Times Square and theatres - a few doors away from Lyceum, but just far enough to get away from hustle & bustle. We had breakfast & evening meal a couple of times in the diner. At first glance it seems expensive but portions are very large (compared to UK). Bar 54 was great - again not cheap but worth it. Great views of NY from hotel's 54th floor. The hotel is not the cheapest or most expensive, but for location, service & overall experience, I think it's a good deal. Would definately stay at Hyatt Times Square again and would have no hesitation recommending others to do the same.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Everything about this hotel is sleek, modern, and clean, and we learned that it has only been open for 6 months after being newly built from the ground up. Not inexpensive rates (though not as high as some other hotels), but that's what you pay to be a half-block from Times Square. And it was worth the price to have such a nice, clean hotel so close to the Broadway shows we were there to see. It was also a relief that the restaurant was not a high-priced swanky place, but rather a reasonably priced place a family could eat at, without having to brave the crowds of Times Square to find a restaurant every night. Also good is the touch-screen check-in (because they only seemed to have a few staff at the actual desk). The valet car parking worked well - they took our car away and brought it back promptly when we wanted it at the end of our stay. We would stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a great location in times square set back from the bustle. Very friendly staff from arriving to leaving always greeted with a cheery smile after long tiring day touring NYC rooms good size and modern large tv and bathroom complimentary water ,slippers and toiletries a nice touch too . Paid extra for room with view and was not disappointed looking right down into times square . Also having a drink at bar 54 a must with a table outside fantastic views must be best in new york for the price of a drink. Would definitely stay again

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I'm a long time Hyatt customer and because of business travel I'm able to redeem rewards at various times during the year. This year we elected to spend a few days in NYC at the Hyatt Times Square. We were delighted at the quality of the hotel, spacious room (had a suite) and the customer service. The staff was very attentive to us and helped us as needed. Highly recommended ... great location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When we entered into the hotel we were greeted immediately. Checking in was easy; the receptionist was incredibly friendly and informative. Our room - amazing! For us and our computers, cell phones, etc. - we were happy to find plenty of outlets!!! We did not have to go searching. The bathroom was extremely clean and designed for the traveler - lots of counter space! Even the lotions and soaps were fantastic. Then - the rooftop bar - friendly and efficient servers in a breathtaking atmosphere. Enjoying a glass of wine at Bar 54 was such a relaxing way to end the evening.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family stayed here for one night over Memorial Day weekend. This newly-built hotel is fantastic - modern, clean and it's right near Times Square which is convenient to just about everything in NYC (although it's too bad Times Square is becoming a little seedy again). The bathrooms are very nice and even have heated floors. We also had fun going to the top floor of the hotel to see the view and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's a new Hyatt Hotel (2013) with young and attentive staff, don;t expect a great lobby like other Hyatts cause you'll be dissapointed, I prefer this kind of Hyatt, more efficient, modern with helpful staff and with small but extremely comfortable rooms, I was in a king room on 45 floor. If you choose Times Square, this is the Hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First and foremost, I'm a Hyatt fan. My husband and I have stayed at a number of Hyatt hotels around the world, and will continue to do so. The newest offering in Manhattan from this reputable chain, is the Hyatt Times Square. Now, there are many Hyatts in and around Manhattan, and they are all good, but if you're a tourist and you want a centralized location, with easy access to Broadway and shopping, you can't do any better than this small and chic hotel.The hotel restaurant, t45, was designed by George Wong, and conjures up images of an old timey, retro diner. The food was very good and the service excellent. There is also a rootop lounge, bar 54, but unfortunately it was so crowded, we couldn't get in. We'll just have to go back another time.The room was a reasonable size, especially for New York City, where size is always at a premium. Sleek and modern, with minimalist decor, it suited us very nicely. The bathroom, although small, matched the bedroom in its modern decor, and always comes with standard amenities.We've stayed numerous times at the Grand Hyatt at Grand Central Station, which is enormous by comparison, and has a lot to offer, but for sheer convenience, the Hyatt Times Square can't be topped. One final note: We stayed at this Hyatt using our free night offered by our Hyatt credit card. It was an excellent way for us to check it out and decide whether we would consider going back. We did love it and will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this new NYC Hyatt for two nights in June, 2014. Having been a guest at Hyatt 48 Lex and the Hyatt Grand Central previously, I looked forward to experiencing this new Hyatt property. It proved to be the best of the three.Hyatt Times Square is an ideal choice for anyone who wants to be in the center of the Midtown tourist areas of NYC. The 45th Street location is very close to the hubbub of Times Square, and yet it offers rooms that can be surprisingly quiet. Normally a light sleeper, I stayed in an executive suite on the 10th floor. There were no big-time issues with traffic noise. If you can't sleep with any noise, try using Sleep Pillow or another noise-cancelling app on your smart phone.The place has a boutique feel, but the rooms are not glorified shoe boxes. They're comfy and well appointed. The hotel's small check-in desk is located immediately inside the entrance, staffed by energetic Hyatt employees who quite simply can't do enough for you. Need something? Just ask. A special shout-out to Floyd, who helped me several times during the stay. There is also a small restaurant called T45 in the lobby area. The food is OK. T45 will do room service for a fee, but you're usually better off just going down to the lobby and bringing the fare up to your room. I was particularly impressed by James in T45. He was cordial, quick in service, and very welcoming at the bar. Again, the overall theme of quality customer service was evident. I didn't get to the rooftop bar, but I understand that the view up there is spectacular.Room highlights from this executive suite:Mini refrig (not stocked - bring your own goodies - temperature varies)Rain shower (terrific)Plenty of outletsLight controls can be a little confusing, but they are clearly marked. Just keep pushing the buttons until you get used to them.Night light setting in the bathroom (a plus)Comfy sofa bed and ample desk in the living areaTiny ice buckets . . . a minor annoyanceClean, efficient room designNo pay-per-view movies are offered. Why??Great flat screen LGs in both bedroom and living areaSeparate bedroom in these suites offers privacy,Bed is very comfortable, and closet space is ample.(The rest of the room details are available on the hotel website.)There are several decent restaurants within a block of the hotel. I enjoyed lunch at Connolly's, a casual Irish bar and restaurant a few doors down, and the steakhouse across the street (Bobby Van's?? Can't recall the name, but I definitely recall the tasty filet).Bottom line:This hotel is new and welcoming and terrific. The location is also ideal for any tourists who want to explore Midtown. Recommended for couples, solo travelers or small family tourism (up to 2 kids).P.S. If you ever use hotel-arranged cars for private transportation to the airport, please read this section:The rates charged by this hotel's normal outside contractor for airport transportation by town car or limo are ludicrous. I was quoted $179 for a trip to Newark airport in a town car. Having lived in the NYC area for decades, I knew the price was out of line. I immediately mentioned that to the concierge and proceeded to find my own alternative. A simple search on my smart phone yielded a $109 rate from another vendor, and that option was the better choice. I rode to Newark with a smile.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked 6 months ago for a 10 night stay - booked via Central reservations and also spoke direct to Hotel re concerns noise. Was told room requested to fulfill criteria. Arrived 16 June and hugely disappointed. Informed a request just that and I should be assured there is a double glazing on windows - maybe the staff need to experience a stay 12th floor and below. Moved within 10 minutes - away from lifts and 2 floors up. So much for being moved to a higher floor!!! After 21 hour flight kept awake until after midnight with music from Pub next door and air con either blowing cold directly on you or you were sweating before it kicked back in. Night 4 - once again same situation woken by music at 2.20am and air con competing for noise.With Hyatt as a preferred brand disappointed the request could not be fulfilled especially as staying 10 nights!! This was on top of no greeting when arrived at Hotel - we were exhausted with 7 year old and had to take own baggage from hire car. I rely on Trip Advisor and was excited to stay at this Hotel. We dismissed poor reviews as few, surely this has happened to others??On the plus side room fantastic and spacious, great location. Such a shame about noise and air con. Disappointment also stems from conversations directly with a Hotel and a request seemingly like a done deal.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt with my wife and all I can say is I was impressed !!! Great location near Times Square and the roof top bar ... Amazing view ! And to top it off terrific staff ... As soon as we walked in we were immediately greeted by staff ... I gotta give it up for the security women who were in the lobby .. Very helpful and very welcoming ... Made me and my wife laugh and feel comfortable as if we knew them already ... I would recommend this hotel to everyone ... Thanks for making my stay a very good one !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I took a chance and bid on hotwire for a room with a 100% customer rating and 4-stars, and got this great hotel! Wow, literally a stone's throw away to the action in Times Square. If you want to stay in Times Square then choose this hotel. It is walking distance to major attractions in the city. My wife and I stayed for 2 nights and we enjoyed every minute of it.The staff is very accommodating and welcoming. Upon arrival, we were able to check in an hour early, and were given a complementary upgrade of the front-facing view.The rooms are spacious (NYC standards) and very clean. The bathroom is large and clean! The bathroom has heated floors! The hotel is brand new, it opened in December 2013.It is a little pricey,but that's because we are traveling in peak summer season. I would 100% recommend this hotel and I would return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Convenient, clean, hip and friendly... Perfect NYC hotel for a few nights! I love the Hyatt brand, while this is not a grand or park Hyatt.. It's an above average city hotel at a decent price, nothing but praise for this hotel!
