hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I took a chance and bid on Hotwire for a room and got this great hotel. The location is 1/2 a block off of 7th avenue...great location. The room was ready before check in time which was great for me. Super clean. Nice waterfall shower head.My only downside was the room service. It came from the little restaurant off the lobby. Just ok, wouldn't order again from them.The rooftop bar is nice..pricey, but its new york city, I wouldn't expect cheaper. It was nice to watch from above.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: modern nice rooms, great food and young and motivated friendly staff! i i can only recommend this place! From the very first moment you feel welcome as a guest. the service in the coffee shop as well as in the Sky Lounge is excellent and outstanding! Snacks offered in the Sky Lounge are of great quality and tase! The Jumbo shrimps were yummy as well as the platter with cold meat and cheese. The Drinks are perfect and even different and soecial gins are available. Great selection of wine by the glass. Overall a pleasant experience in this Hyatt Hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Recently stayed at the Hyatt Times Square and overall I would say that it is a very good hotel and one that I would consider staying at in the future.The location can not be beat if you are looking for a hotel in the Times Square area. The hotel is relatively new. The rooms, while minimalistic, were very comfortable (great bed and pillows), excellent TV and a very nice bathroom. The rooftop bar was a nice treat, but I would recommend heading up there to enjoy the view and buy drinks elsewhere as the cost is extremely pricey. You are paying for the view, which is understandable.But when I think of other NYC hotels, the Hyatt Andaz 5th Ave far exceeds this hotel. So unless you get a real good price for the room, I would visit the Andaz before this property. Overall, very good, but the Andaz is much preferred.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here in March - Fantastic location, right beside Times Square. - Large fresh room with an awesome modern bathroom.. plush towels... All of the staff we encountered were friendly and willing to help. Great value. - Would come back in a heartbeat. :-)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We went to NYC for the boxing fights on june 6 through 9 and stayed in this excellent property in the middle of everything. Although everything new is nice and pretty the security was very good, the rooms are very comfortable and the amenities are in very good standard. I would recommend thos hotel to friends and relatives without thinking twice. Will be one of our first choices in the future. Keep on going and keep it working as excellent i saw it. Congratulations!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This spanking new Hyatt is great! Lobby is crisp and white, staff are super friendly. There are 54 floors and the view from my 32nd floor was fantastic. The bar/lounge on the 54th floor offers great atmosphere and an outdoor patio that is heart stopping.The rooms are spotless, well appointed. Flat screen T.Vs and a bed that you never want to get up from. Overall this is a top drawer hotel in all ways.One issue, be patient with the elevators. It does feel like they needed one more cab for the higher levels. Anyway, a great place to stay if you want to be near the Times Square action.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square is great! This was our first visit to NYC - and we picked this hotel after a lot of homework online. We were not disappointed at all! The staff is wonderful - the room was clean - it's small, but not bad and the views! WOW! We spent the majority of our time out and about the city, but when we got back to our room, it was so relaxing and enjoyable. Very clean and comfortable. We would absolutely recommend it to anyone going there and stay there again in the future.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is terrific. Great location near Times Square (but far enough away so the front doors aren't on it!). Wonderful, friendly, professional staff. Beautiful, large rooms with great decor and furnishings. Very quiet rooms. Spectacular views from the 54th floor indoor/outdoor cocktail lounge (open from 4pm - 1am). Super-fast express elevators (no waiting). And I like it even more because it doesn't have convention halls -- so it's easy to get in/out of the lobby, unlike others in this area.. It's a large hotel, but feels like a boutique hotel. I can't say enough good about it, and will definitely be making it my new home when visiting NYC!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I like to stay in Times Square when my NYC visits include taking in a play or two, as the traffic... getting taxi's, etc. is a nightmare when dealing with the theater. This new addition is an excellent choice. Very modern, new, hyatt with a lot of clean lines... excellent service. We had a suite... small, but well designed, so perfect (with fold out sleeper couch) for my wife and our 11 year old son. Excellent bedding.Not many amenities... small lobby w/ very little seating, concierge desk (good, but not staffed with the pros that you get at higher end NYC hotels), heath club (very nice), roof top bar (nice, but small amount of seating). As others have reported, elevators became a problem for us too. Was ok (not great) when both were working... but then one was out of service, so only had one working for part of our stay... was very frustrating as it took forever to get one and often was full. If they can keep the elevators working, and make sure the staff uses the freight elevator, would be better.We liked the restaurant, T45 located off the lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were staying at Hyatt Times Square at the end of May 2014 for seven nights. The hotel is brand new - opened in December 2013. Our room was on 36th floor having amazing view over Times Square. There are no noises from the streets inside the room - it's very quiet. The rooms are big and comfortable. It's plenty of space and You'll also find a wardrobe for Your clothes and bags. Complimentary water and coffee is provided everyday. Shower is so big, that i assume, 4 people taking shower at the same time wouldn't be a problem:-) If You prefer to take a very cold showers, it may be a problem, because it's almost impossible to set the water to "only cold". Service is very good and staff is exceptionally kind and helpful. About cleanliness - rooms are cleaned on daily basis of course - however when we moved sitting sofa, we found a pack of unopened condoms! For us, it was just a reason to big laugh, but if more demanding customers will find such a "surprises" I am pretty sure that the management will hear about it in not very pleasant way. From our side - no complaints about that, but try to move furniture a little bit more while cleaning the rooms. This hotel has also a roof bar with stunning view over south Manhattan. I can't write more about menu or prices, because I simply had no time to sit there and enjoy a drink. I just went there to see the bar and view. Can't say more about hotels restaurant either, because I wasn't eating there this time. Location of the hotel is perfect! Just few steps from Times Square,Broadway theaters, subway, shopping etc. Highly recommend this location especially for first-time visitors to NYC. One thing about the rooms. Rooms with a view are situated above 25th floor. They will cost You slightly extra than rooms without view (from first to 25th floor i assume) but it's worth it!!! Elevators are pretty quick and not even once, during our stay, I've experienced any longer waiting times. Bathrobes are not standard in all rooms, however if You need one and ask for it at the reception, You'll probably get it delivered to your room, free of charge.I'll definitely check this hotel as my primary choice during my next trip to Big Apple. Recommend with no hesitation to everybody!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am very impressed with this hotel for the way it delivers and makes up for any missteps.The hotel is conveniently located to Times Square but surprisingly has excellent windows that keep out the noise of the city.The room is well appointed and although it is typical New York city size, the use of space an design were top notch and made the room much larger feeling. On my first stay, there was an alarm during the night time, but the next day, they staff were all very apologetic about the event and I had suggested to the Dir of Rooms that they consider the way it was handled. His speedy email response was very reassuring.My next stay a week later was great. The suite I got was big and the furnishings were what a modern apt would have! The bathroom was stunning. Unlike older hotels, the new Hyatts and Andaz hotels really go all out to make the bathroom a feature, not just a second thought. I was impressed with the staff and the Dir's response.The Cinco de Mayo part upstairs at the bar was great. It can be pricy, but like the rest of the hotel, they are top notch! Service pace is casual, but that gives you a great time to enjoy the view from the inside or on the outside patio.The restaurant serves some really nice food in a diner style atmosphere. They also are great for takeout and serve really nice lattes!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I decided to try out this hotel whilst I was in NYC, so shuffled over from the Bryant Park Hotel for two days here. The web checkin was great. I got an email early in the morning saying I could check in, once done, I then received another email about 10:30am to say my room was ready, so I could check in early. Nice touch.The express lifts are quite slow, and lots of waiting around for them, especially at busy times. Up on the 42nd floor, it was fairly quiet, with just the usual buzz of NYC that you can't avoid. It's a new hotel and everything still looks in good condition. Rooms are an average size, but missing a luggage rack (maybe it was just my room?) so nowhere convenient to store my bag.Comfy beds, nice bathroom with wet room area with a bath and shower. No free internet though, except if you loiter in the lobby, which a lot of people did, and there's minimal seating. Most of the time people are there surrounded by cables and devices. One woman was trying to use her iPad, Mac, iPhone and Blackberry all at the same time it seemed. Internet access should be free nowadays considering the room rates. Yes I know it's so they can rip off the business travellers on expenses, but it's still something that should be provided for free nowadays.Great location for the theatre. Short walk to most Broadway shows.Check out was quick and easy. The staff I met were all cheerful and pleasant. Would I stay again? Well if I get a decent room rate and free internet, I'd consider it, but with so much competition around it would need to be a great rate!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I visited New York with my brother over the Memorial Day long weekend. This is a brand new hotel centrally located in Times Square. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The property is very clean and environmentally friendly. The rooms have some great features. For example, the bathroom has heated tiles. The beds are very comfortable as well. The rooftop bar is a must visit. The cocktails are well made, the food is good, and the views of the city are incredible. The real selling point of this hotel and why I will be sure to return upon my next visit to New York is the service is outstanding. The staff at the front desk, no matter how busy, are very courteous and do not make you feel rushed. When entering the building I was always greeted by someone with a genuine smile on their face. The concierge was very patient and informed. The one person that really stood out was one of the doormen. He overheard me outside speaking with my friends trying to find a nice place to hang out. He saw that we were not sure where to go and without being asked walked over to us and happily gave us some great recommendations. These small touches really do make the biggest difference.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This new upscale hotel is in a great location…convenient to Times Square, but just far enough away from the crowds. We had a beautiful room on the 26th floor with two comfortable queen beds. This wasn’t a suite, but a huge room for NYC. So well designed…stylish contemporary with a touch of charm. They thought of everything…a comfortable chair near the floor to ceiling windows to enjoy the view, individually controlled AC that was quiet and efficient, a variety of settings for the lighting, a large flat panel TV with dozens of high-def channels, great Wi-Fi, and plenty of counter space and storage. There were even two closets. The bathroom was just as nice with high-end fixtures and a large shower. Almost better than the room itself was the staff. All were professional, but friendly and accommodating. For a large hotel, we felt like we weren’t just one of the many. The concierge service is in an area just off the lobby. They know everything and couldn’t have been more helpful. I don’t recall all their names, but a special thanks to Ryan F. Often hotel websites make rooms look much better than they are. With the Hyatt Times Square, this is what you get. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed one night at this hotel. The rooms were kind of small, but okay for NY standards. 45st street was closed that day for a festival, so valet parking was kind of a hassle. The staff was overall friendly, except for the host at bar 54. Don't get me wrong, the rooftop bar definitely has an amazing view of downtown, but first you have to suffer the interrogation from the host before getting on the outdoor patio. The patio is reserved space, so unless you reserved a table outside, they frown upon you going out there. Such a shame because you don't get the same views from inside. Being outside definitely makes the $25 cocktails go down a little easier.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The plus:1. Fantastic location - close enough to the Times Square madness without being in the middle of it. Also loved the proximity to Broadway and restaurants.2. Very helpful staff. Special thanks to Steve who walked to the next avenue with our seven bags in chilly weather and flagged a cab for us, as the street was temporarily close due to a fire truck. He was a trooper.3. The rooms were all newly and tastefully renovated. (We actually chose the hyatt over the hilton because of this.)4. The humidifier that one could get on loan on request. It had a big water tank which meant it could last the entire night. 5. Allowing us to check in early at 1pm instead of 4pm. (Thank you - we really appreciate it). We had flown a long way (24 hours) and were extremely jet lagged. The could-be-better:1. We are frequent business travelers and always wonder why many hotels in the US don't provide bedroom slippers as readily as Asia hotels. We were relieved to read on this thread that Hyatt Times Square could provide on request, hence we did not pack ours. Alas when we were there, the hotel had run out of them. The housekeeper was very nice to explain in a handwritten card that she wasn't able to get any, after our request for two consecutive days. Blame it on our fussy feet, but it was a small mark against our otherwise, generally positive experience.2. There is no swimming pool (which is fine), but it also meant there was no "shared" shower facility. We had checked out at noon but our flight was not till 9pm. It meant we weren't able to take a shower before our flight. I suppose we could have asked if we were able to use the spa's shower facilities, but we decided to take our shower when we reached Germany instead.Now the important question - will we return again? If the rates stay affordable, most certainly a resounding YES!, even if it means we have to pack our own bedroom slippers *wink*..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Floyd the front desk agent was AWESOME! We were able to check in early. We only tried this property b/c he reviews were great on bar 54- the highest bar in time square. We went there around 10:pm & stayed for 5min & left. No food no music, no atmosphere at all. Staff were friendly through- out the one night we stayed. The room service was good. Thanks Mr. Floyd.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just ended my five nights stay at the Hyatt Time Square and I loved it! We had a kingsize room on 19th floor well decorated and insonorised! Fast elevators, nice concierge service, lovely portier and helpfull reception desk! Location is ideal, bed and matress were just amazing! Bathroom is huge for NY and super classy. After three stays in the city, this is defenitely my favorite hotel! (Air conditionning a bit noisy but you can switch it off for sleeping) we will stay there again for sure!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were 3 women sharing a nice sized double queen room for 5 days of shopping and theater. Our room #2911 was modern, quiet and had an average view but we didn't spend much time there. There were 4 pillows of varying firmness on each of the comfortable beds. Beds are made with a white bottom sheet, no top sheet, just a comforter with a white cotton cover. No blankets no icky bedspread, it felt very clean. Nice large flat screen tv. Plenty of places to plug in and charge. Media hub on desk. Although there is no free wifi in the room which was a disappointment, I think you can access it in the lobby. 2 small closets with 2 robes and slippers provided. Our bath had nice sized tub and separate walk in shower. 2 shower heads, a rainhead with great water pressure, and a hand-held shower head which didn't work very well, it kept falling out of the holder. We had plenty of counter space for all our toiletries. Blowdryer and magnifying mirrors provided along with the usual travel sized products.What looks like a large chest of drawers is actually hiding a safe, a coffee maker (Starbucks) and an unstocked mini fridge which we liked, we put our own stuff in there purchased from a little market a couple of doors down.Housekeeping didn't provide extra paper products, we had to call down for toilet paper and kleenex twice during our 5 night stay, but they came within minutes to bring more. Hotel staff was exceptional, extremely helpful and friendly from the doormen to the rooftop bar, they treated us like they were genuinely happy to have us there, and isn't that how it should be? The Sky Lounge had the most beautiful view, but the regular Cosmopolitan we had, while it was one of the best ever, was $23. We did not use any of the other amenities. Lobby is minimalistic with not a lot of lounging space.You can't beat the location, half a block from the madness of Times Square, yet close to all the theaters and many restaurants. Walking distance to Rock Center, Moma, Herald Square and if you are a walker you can walk to the Met, Bloomingdales and so much more. Subway on 42nd will take you everywhere. I will stay here again and again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have no complaints, zero! My stay there was amazing. It is perfectly close, but out of Times Square. The location is ideal! It couldn't have gotten any better. Starting with check-in, the ladies at check-in were very accommodating and friendly. I forgot to get names of the staff, but I believe the lady who assisted me at front desk was named Yenny. She was wonderful! The view from the rooftop is breathtaking and the hotel restaurant is also great. The food was very good, I suggest the prix fixe meal if it is ever available. I was there two nights (Sunday May 25 & Monday May 26 late night) with a female server the first night and a male the second. Both were great. I ordered room service for Tuesday morning the night before for a friend's birthday and they came right on time with candles lit! Such a delight! The rooms are also so modern and well-decorated, beds are comfortable. As I said before, no complaints! I will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, close to great pubs, theater district, shopping. Seen rock of ages musical. Great show. Would have liked to see more shows, but they are pricey. Went to the top of the rock, was nervous at first because I don't like elevators or heights, but elevator was a quick smooth ride to the 67th floor and the view was worth it. I would do this again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent 5 nights at this hotel and after finding it, [the yellow cab driver needed the full address as 'there are loads of Hyatts in Times Square] really enjoyed the stay. The staff were excellent, smiling and helpful, the rooms modern, spacious and clean, bathroom big/bright with good toiletries and a great shower cubicle. The roof top bar was a bit pricey but the location was worth the extra. A great location for the central area, about 15 minutes walk to Central Park, the top of the Rock and Empire State Bldg. Would certainly stay again when in New York

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here and found it to be airy and spacy compared to other hotels in New York. There's a lovely scent as you walk into the reception area which is a great touch and all the staff were friendly and happy.Issue we had was with the lifts! There's only 3 if you're staying on higher floors and you end up waiting AGES and there's always queues there near reception. Once you're in the lift it seems to bypass some floors, even though you've pressed the button and stops at ones that no one's waiting at. It really was a joke - we had a group in the lift with us that wanted the roof terrace. They came from the ground floor, stopped at our floor (39th), then another floor with no one waiting, then stopped at a floor just below the roof terrace and it came back down to the ground floor again ! Weird - but really needs addressing by hotel as obviously you can't walk up the stairs ! Hate to think what would happen in an emergency though which should be a concern for the hotel.Rooms were decorated really well, with an inspirational quote in frame on the wall instead of random paintings you usually find. The ceiling pressure shower really makes a difference and you feel so refreshed after some dribbly showers I've had in other hotels! Flat tv screen was good too, though guess that's a standard in most places now. Breakfast in the hotel was a little pricy but really tasty and massive portions as you'd expect in the US.Location was amazing - just a few steps from all the action. Irish pubs either side of the hotel if you're after a quick drink or bite to eat and of course you're at Times Square so you're spolit for choice anyway. All in all, definitely recommend it and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: New hotel just off Times Square. Excellent location if you desire to stay near Times Square and Theater District. Short walk to Central Park or Rockefeller Center. Hotel done in modern decor and in excellent shape due to new construction. Has the typical Hyatt amenities. Higher floors have a good view and we found the room to be quiet. Room average size as NYC rooms go. Major drawback were the elevators. Club on the hotel roof draws people who aren't staying in the hotel. Club shares the same elevators as guests. Elevators were sometimes overloaded and the hotel did a poor job at managing the flow of people. Very disconcerting having the elevator stall and open between floors. The Hotel Gansevoort and The Standard Hotel manage this process much better. The hotel should have a designated elevator for the club and prioritize hotel guests as the guests are the ones that keep the lights on. I would stay here again, though.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is gorgeous, ideally located and spacious. The Hyatt folks built this new property from the ground up about 6 months ago. I found the service to be excellent. The rooms were the most spacious NYC hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. The price was extremely reasonable for a 4 star hotel. The decor is neat and trendy. The views are gorgeous.The only negative is that the restaurant is pricey and I found service there to be a bit poor. For example I have a 3 and 5 year old. The waitress came up to me with one kid menu (colouring paper and 2 crayons) and stated, "they can share!" Anyone who has two young kids knows that that usually doesn't work out so well. The whole meal was spent dealing with their fighting with each other. The price was also extremely inflated. Most breakfast entrees were 20+. Orange juice (which was basic tropicana) was $4.50 and tea $5.75. They also messed up my order when I asked the eggs to be scrambled. They did not discount my meal or address my concerns in any way. When I spoke to the manager, he told me they were sorry that they were out of kid menus and brought blank paper. All in all, avoid T45 if you can.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for a weekend getaway with friends. The location is excellent for theater going, restaurants, and shopping. We stayed in a king sized room and the bed was very comfortable. We were away from the elevator so the room was quiet. The amenities were what would be expected from an upscale hotel. The rain shower was nice. There's a restaurant on the ground floor where we had breakfast and a late dinner, both pretty tasty. There's also a nice bar on the 154th floor. The bartenders are friendly and efficient. The staff overall were very helpful and polite. It's a bit pricey but it is new and nice and clean. I would look for deals online and they do offer price match within 24 hours of booking. Read the fine print.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I usually stay at the Hyatt Grand Central, but on my last trip decided to stay here because the rates were better and because I wanted to try something new. The place looks great - not run-down like a lot of NYC tend to be. Hopefully they can keep it looking relatively new. There was a bit of a problem on my first stay, but the staff did a whole lot to make things right. So where did I stay on my next trip to New York? You guessed it. I'll also be staying here with my family during the NYC marathon in November and looking forward to seeing the sights from the great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in a king sized room and had a beautifully comfortable bed, and a spacious, new, highly pressurized shower. Two key things when you arrive from a long haul flight! The room itself was of a decent size, and the view from the window permitted a slice of Times Square below. Everything was very new and nothing looked worn at all (it is a fairly new hotel). Gym included in room prices and as much bottled water as you like from reception or the gym. Location fantastic, a minute's stroll from Times Square. No room service delivery which is a shame. You can order food from their diner downstairs and collect it for takeaway, but I found the choices to all be quite heavy - they could do with expanding the menu to include more snacks. Breakfast for two at the diner including two main dishes, two coffees and two juices was around $70. Rooftop bar is a massive selling point - stunning views of the city and tasty cocktails! The reception area is quite small, which is a shame as I like big, shiny, bustling reception areas in urban hotels. Wifi costs extra in the rooms but there is free access in the (small) reception area. Staff very friendly and helpful. Overall a solid choice for a new, centrally located, comfortable place to sleep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very good location in the heart of the city and easy access to well-known places by any transportations. Well-equipped and decorated room,with full amenities and minibar. The room was clean and the bed was notably comfortable. Helpful and friendly staff from check-in to check-out. Unfavorable we have just stayed for only one night. We expect to come back and spend more days at this elegant hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this brand new Hyatt for five nights as a passport member I had a free night and paid for the other 4. The hotel was kind enough to put us up in a view king room for the whole stay, which was very thoughtful. Can't say enough about the staff five * all the way. Rooms are modern and clean! Excellent beds and the really sound proof rooms bathroom with a stand up shower. It is obvious that the staff is happy working here it really shows. The sky lounge on the 54th floor is a must see! Some excellent drinks, while enjoying the view. Will definitely stay again! Well done !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband and I traveled to NYC for our 10 year anniversary and stayed at the Hyatt time square. What a great choice. The room was perfect. Nice size and the heated floor in the bathroom was a nice touch and very modern. The whole hotel was very, very clean. They even put us in a room with a gorgeous view at no extra charge. The roof top bar has a perfect view of the city. So don't waste your moneygoing to the top of the Empire State building, lol. You can even see the new years eve ball from the roof. The food was great, a little pricey, but it's hotel food. .. Also, they make the BEST milk shakes. The concierge was great in hooking us up with a romantic restaurant for our anniversary dinner. Be aware that you are in time square. .. Very very busy area. All in all, it was a fabulous place to stay. Great service and beautiful hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I spent May 23-25, 2014 at this fantasic hotel. From the time we arrived, until the time we departed, we were treated like VIPs--extremely nice and helpful staff. The hotel's location makes it easy to walk to a Broadway Show, Times Square, or the Empire State Building. My wife and I loved the Hyatt's restuarant--we ate there twice. Our room was nice--absolutely no complaints. I did not make it to the bar on the 54th floor, but several guests told me what a great place this was, especially the view. I would definitely stay at the Hyatt again an would also recommend this hotel to family and frends. Thank you Hyatt staff for making our 16th Anniversay and Memorial Day (we are both retired Army) special.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. The room and view were great. Friendly staff. BUT we were very disappointed with the Bar Fifty Four. Limited liquor options and the drink prices were outrageous. Popular mixed drinks at featured drink prices. Go elsewhere for drinks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed in Hyatt Times Square for only one night in mid-May. I had booked the hotel through a price comparison site as it seemed to have a high rating and reasonable price for NY standards, despite a very late booking only a few days before the stay. Had a smooth late check-in for the room which was on the 27th floor of 54 floors. Overall, the room was very nice - modern design and furniture, extremely central location (could see part of Times Square from the room). The room had a shower and not a bath, in case this is something preferred for some travellers. The room was close to the lifts but was not disturbed much by any noise during the stay. On exit, the reception happy to help out with my luggage to be stored for a few hours. Good experience overall and would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've been trying out the new Hyatts in NYC and this one is as good or better than the others I've tried (Union Sq, Grand). As others have mentioned, the midtown location is fantastic and just far enough away from Times Square to avoid the hassles. Front desk is very nice and efficient, the rooms are brand new and functional. The coffee maker and drawers were a big plus for me - hotels seem to be moving away from them for some reason. Big rooms for Manhattan, I thought. IMHO, the crown jewel of the place is the rooftop bar on the 54th floor. AMAZING views, and incredibly relaxing to be above it all after a long day. Expensive, of course, but you're paying for the view. I will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt over a late April weekend. The prices were on the high side on average, but offered reasonable value compared to other offerings.First impressions of the hotel was good, but I think there can be more done to improve the experience.Good points:Great location for many of the commonplace sights. The rooms were spacious and the facilities all reasonably well thought out. Had a good drink at the rooftop bar but it can get quite busy. The bedding was comfortable and clean, and a good selection of amenities were provided (although my mini-bar was not stocked (not a problem for me at all)).Feedback points for consideration:As many have alluded, for the price one pays for the rooms, I think it is not good value to have to pay for in-room internet. Anyone who stays in the hotel will only realistically be using the internet to check emails in the morning, and to do light surfing at night. It represents tremendously poor value for the light amount of internet traffic and strongly urge the management to reconsider. Maybe a "lite" package for US$5 might be considered more reasonable.Given the large number of walk-in customers to the sky bar, it may perhaps be a more efficient (and secure) proposition to have one dedicated lift to the sky bar which does not stop on guest floors. For guests who wish to access the sky bar, I'm sure the key cards can be programmed to provide access.Unfortunately I also encountered the fire alarm issue one of the reviewers alluded to which resulted in a very poor night's sleep. Issue raised and service recovery initiated, so I will consider the issue resolved satisfactorily, but I do hope that the staff members will be able to take some training points from the issue about how to manage the alarm system. It's there for genuine emergencies and guests will be grateful, but 4-5 false alarms a night might prove a bit too much...Work on these and perhaps this might become the leading Hyatt property in central NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Positives are great location just far enough from Times Square to be less touristy, and also excellent for Midtown business (me). Rooms are modern and quiet. I was on 46 and had a nice view. Bathroom is reasonably large for NYC. Very good fitness center. It was cold and damp, but I'm sure the rooftop bar would be great. I'm a frequent traveler to Midtown, and this hotel will be on my short list.Negatives are hopefully short lived. My first night the fire alarm went off several times. The complaint was acknowledged graciously and miles received. I'm sure that this will be fixed. The other negative was that I couldn't get the shower cool enough. Again, its a new hotel working out the bugs. Once worked out, this will be one of the nicer business class hotels in the area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My son, nephew and I spent a tourist weekend in NYC and stayed at the new Hyatt close to Times Square. The hotel is right in the middle of the hustle bustle of Times Square and the Theater District and was perfect for 2 boys who had never been to NYC. We could walk or catch the subway easily from this location. The room was spacious for NYC and the staff went out of their way to make our stay great. The doormen were kind and remembered you- the concierge was great and really knowledgeable and the view was really great. We were upgraded to a room with a view upon checking in- which was really considerate. I would recommend this hotel for tourists- walk to the MOMA, walk to theater, walk to the river- a great location!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my third trip to NY and I stayed here for five nights for a holiday with my mum to celebrate her retirement. We had a spacious room (which I've heard is rare in NY) with two double beds which were extremely comfortable. Room was clean and modern with slightly quirky décor, which was a nice touch and gave it a slightly premium feel. Bathroom was also a really generous size with a good layout. On a trivial note the bathroom products were all really nice and there's a list of extra items the hotel offers such as slippers/toothpaste etc that you can ask for at no cost or borrow, which is a real help if you've forgotten anything. Hotel staff were all extremely pleasant and helpful. The location was ideal as you're right off Times Square (literally round the corner), so easy access to tourist hotspots but had absolutely no trouble with any noise, which I think you might find if you were staying on Times Sq. We had both dinner and breakfast at the T45 diner which I really liked (I would recommend the steak). We also tried out the rooftop bar for afternoon drinks, cocktails were slightly overpriced, staff here were slow and not overly attentive, but the view alone was worth it. The only slight downside was that you have to pay for wifi in your room, which I think is getting uncommon in this day and age, but free wifi is available in the lobby if you don't mind squashing up on the usually busy seating area, or you could eat in the diner and access it more comfortably. Overall, really nice hotel, clean, bright modern feel and ideal for anyone's first trip to New York based on location alone. I would definitely recommend this and stay here again, very pleased I chose this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the parking valet to the bellhops, to the desk clerks - customer service and the customer's comfort seems to be a top priority at this hotel. Although I didn't want to pay this much for a hotel room it was a special occasion and I decided to go for it. Great location, great room, and felt very pampered by all the customer service. It is definitely close to Times Square, an easy walk to the Broadway show we attended and simply a great place to stay. I wish it was a little less costly so I could stay more than one night but for a special treat it was a great time.
user_location: Adams Basin, New York, United States

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great choice for a hotel in NYC. It's close to all the action without being "in the belly of the beast" (Times Square), but still very close by. I was pleasantly surprised that the room was much more spacious that I was expecting. Staff is friendly and very helpful which added to the experience too. The rooms are well-maintained and kept up nicely so you can tell it's a new hotel. The bed was firmer than I prefer but I still slept just fine. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Saw this Hotel while booking and was rated 4.8 out of 5 previously. I stayed here 4 nights during Mothers Day weekend . The Rooms, location, services, Food and staff were all 5 star quality! From the moment we entered the hotel , I knew this was the best kept secret in Manhattan. Located not even 1/2 block from Times Square, it's location was perfect to everything you need to experience while visiting NYC. The staff, from Steve the Bell Captain, to Karen at the Front Desk,to their friendly concierge, everyone was very attentive to all our needs. The 54th Floor lounge on top of the hotel, overlooking all of NYC, was a site to be seen, while relaxing with a glass of wine and appetizer. Great place to take a date!! The rooms were so amazing, with the most comfortable bed and amazing Large Bathrooms (which for Hotels in NY are rare) . Large Flat screen TV all HD with plenty of cable channels. Again a must stay here 5 of 5 stars. Forget the Waldorf, Plaza, stay here...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel with college age daughter for 4 days over Easter. If you want a Times Square location, clean modern rooms and friendly, efficient service you can't go wrong here. We didn't try the restaurant but did go to the rooftop bar- beautiful view, great bartender , but very pricey, even for Manhattan. Would definitely visit again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I guess this is a new hotel that opened in January of 2014. So of course everything was pretty new. I really enjoyed the location.As a Hyatt Diamond Member:**upgraded to a suite on floor 42 right next to the elevator (I think)**Awesome view from my bed (I took a picture and remember the HM sign)**Separate living room and bedroom**Bathroom had a soaking tub**Nice amenitiesRooms:**Very clean and modern**I heard the standard rooms are a bit smaller but I didn't see**superior staff**Minimal street noise**Nice new equipment in the Gym which was good sized. I worked out 3/5 days there. They provided bottled waters and apples I think. I didn't eat any though.Negatives:**Taxis were not easily accessible I had an overall pleasant stay. Didn't have anything outstanding to rave about nor did I have anything negative to say. I would recommend this hotel to people who have not been to NY before of it's location. If I stayed in a standard box room then I would say it was too much but being upgraded to a suite def made the stay worthwhile!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms are good. Recently renovated, everything works and is state of the art.The restaurant T45 on the ground floor is very expensive and you may have a lousy breakfirst.They are capable to make some scrambled eggs, but avoid anything with potatos or beacon, they just don't know how to handle it.Rood Top Bar is a vey good spot, the waiter need very clear and direct commands - otherwise they just forget what was ordered or make there own decission.Room and room servicing = goodT45 = change the person in chargeBar: staff need some training

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For $380 a night I'd expect to not have to pay an extra $17 per day for internet service. Apparently it's up to the individual Hyatt hotel whether Internet is included in the price. Bad practice. And in the heart of New York City???

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this hotel in April and enjoyed it very much. The location is great, lobby lovely and the restaurant serves a very nice breakfast. They upgraded me to a good size room that was well decorated and comfortable. The bar and deck on the top of the hotel was fantastic and well worth going up to as the view of the city was fabulous and the bar had a good wine list with NYC prices.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here afterbooking the Hyatt at the last minute because our first choice was fully booked. How glad are we? We would now never stay anywhere else when visiting New York. Hotel is lovely, Bar 54 breathtaking, location = excellent.However for us, most outstanding of all are the staff. The most welcoming, helpful and friendly team we have ever come across at any hotel anywhere. All of the team went above ane beyond to make our stay memorable. I have to mention Julian in the roof top bar, to the best barman I've met James, in the diner, and finally, the wonderful Walter at the front of the hotel. We're still talking about you Walter. Thank you aswel Ryan.Hope to see you all again later in the year with my husband.Kerry and Hayley.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Universally friendly and helpful staff. Great location just off Times Square and easy walking distance to Broadway theatres and subway. Rooms are spacious for New York and newly renovated with modern, clean decor. A significant step up from the Millenium hotel across the road after we had to move because of weather delays.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a fantastic hotel - we loved everything from the warm and friendly welcome from the valet/concierge team, to reception checking us in a bit earlier, the facilities and the room.The rooftop bar is amazing - make sure you go!!! Cocktails are a tad pricey, but it's worth it to sit outside on a nice day with a fantastic view over the city.Ask the guys for recommendations, they gave us a few great ones!We went to the spa and had some treatments there too. The massages were excellent - Brits, bear in mind that prices don't include a 20% service charge (that knocked the wind out of me a bit!)My only complain is that the free wifi zone is in reception only. For such a big hotel it can get a bit rammed in reception with people trying to access it at once.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel, clean and cozy. Very Modern. Friendly front staff. Very well situated. This would deserve a four stars, maybe 5. The average reason is the following: Over prize breakfast at the T45 and extremely, extremely bad services at the Sky lounge. These guys have no idea of what they are doing. We had to make a scene to be serve after waiting 20 minutes without no one even looking at us. We got free drinks out of it, which was nice, but it would have been better to feel welcome from the start, been long time guest paying a lot of money at the hotel. And bad set up for sitting at the terrace. Too bad, it’s difficult to have a seat. Could be easily much more efficient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed one night for my boyfriend's birthday. We went to see Motown. The Hotel is beautiful. It's pretty new and modern. The room size was bigger than most hotels I have stayed in NY. The service was great, all the way around. Love the room setup and the white robes!!! Classy all the way. Great location if you are in the Time Square area. Will go back. Really made the weekend special. The view from the roof top is breath taking. Your name shows up on the TV screen to welcome you, nice touch. :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This new Hyatt in Times Square is great, 50 floors and it feels like a boutique hotel.The rooms are spacious, well appointed and even though I didn't spend a lot of time in the room it was a comfortable place to return to after a long day.What surprised me was the number of international visitors that were in the hotel. I. Am a Hyatt Platinum member and only found out about the hotel a few weeks ago. In talking to one of the guests they knew as soon as it opened and booked right away.For me this is my go to hotel in the city convenient location and a great staff that made you feel welcome the moment you enter.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is very functional and clean/well equipped. Would fault it only on the W Fi which isn't available in the rooms unless you pay which I feel isn't really acceptable in this day and age. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar amazing and a must do if you stay here. The bar manager knows how to mix a cocktail. Challenge him! Stay as high as you can for amazing views. Would definately stay again. Didn't try the breakfast as it was all a bit new age and am a traditional American breakfast eater when in NYC. Fantastic location though and plenty to do and see around it. Well done to the receptionist who made us feel so special and welcome when we arrived. Lovely hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My boyfriend and I decided to spend a joint birthday weekend in New York and were so pleased we stayed at the Hyatt. Upon checkin were greated with a pleasant young woman named Karen who after learning of our bday celebration upgraded us to a suite on 46th floor. Beautiful newly renovated room with wonderful amenities to included heated floors in the bathroom and a large shower. The lobby area is nice with staff eager to please the guests. There is a rooftop bar with a beautiful view and again very friendly staff. We also returned to our room the first night to a bottle of champagne and a birthday card signed by many of the staff.I would highly recommend this hotel...staff and newly renovated (completed Dec 2013).There is no negative to the hotel but it is in a busy touristy area so if crowds don't bother you this is your place. Also as this is in the theatre district it may be difficult to get a taxi and traffic is bad around 8 so plan accordingly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I did a quick 36 hour trip to NYC. Loved staying at this hotel. The rooms were great- Rm 3311 had a nice bathtub if you want to soak your feet after a day of walking the city! The service from check in to the restaurant to the concierge was wonderful. And the location cannot be beat- right in the middle of everything. Great location if you want to be right in the theatre district, go shopping with teenagers and have access to good restaurants. We walked all over the city from and to this location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Well for starters, this was not my first time at a Hyatt. I usually stay at The Grand but figured I would give it a chance. Considering how ridiculously expensive it is to stay in NYC period I feel I should always try and get my money's worth. The Hyatt Times Square made me feel like my money was worthless. The decor is so bland through out the entire hotel. No towels in my room, hair all over the bath room floor and my room did not come with a "view" as advertised. The diner had to be by far the worst culinary experience I've encountered in NY. The breakfast was not good at all. Not only were my potatoes cold but over cooked!! And what kind of diner doesn't carry A1 sauce?! I ordered a steak for dinner and was disappointed that something so simple like A1 sauce was not available. Overall, never again Hyatt Times Square, I shall stick to what I know with the grand. You guys could take some pointers from them!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Somewhat of a unique review in that I am still at the hotel and this is my 3rd stay this year already.I was first given a standard room as booked but I felt that the size and particularly leaky shower was not going to cut it. I upgraded at my expense to a suite since I was due to stay for 10 nights. The new room on the 48th floor looked promising at first glance with a much improved bathroom and shower, larger space and 2 large televisions to keep me entertained.On the first evening the air-conditioning started playing up bringing the room to a sweltering 100 degree despite having been set to 70. The next morning I brought this to the attention of the staff who said they would get facilities to look into it. 6 nights later and it still has a mind of its own even when I switch it off.On the second night I ordered room service from the T45 restaurant, promoted in the room through a lamented menu. To my surprise this functions as a separate entity and the 'bag' my food came in could have better been supplied by a dedicated delivery franchise. There is no evidence of any formal affiliation, no plates, no condiments and the cutlery (metal at least) were still in my room 3 days later!I had my laundry done after the 3rd day, good service and reasonably priced but no replacement bags or paperwork so if I want to use the service again, as I do, I need to especially request this. Odd since this is an income stream and shouldn't be linked to turning the rooms over.The televisions have a convenient portal to connect your iPad or computer to view your own content but despite my technical experience and reading all the available documentation (none) I could not get this to work on any of my devices nor either of the displays.Last night we had a fire alarm go off at 3am. A loud announcement was made about 10 minutes in to inform us that it was a false alarm and not to evacuate the building. Problem was that this went on for another hour with repeated loud announcements.This morning I closed the bathroom door form the outside and found myself locked out having to jiggle the handle many times to get into my own bathroom!I'm starting to think I'm on candid camera since there are far too many incident for this to be a coincidence! I know this is a new hotel but having stayed on 3 separate occasions, I can vouch that its getting worse each and every time. This is likely to be my last stay here despite holding a high status on the Hyatt loyalty scheme. I will stick to the Hilton or boutique hotels from now when in NY.The staff have heard my issues and come across all apologetic but all the issue are still there.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt for one night after being bumped from another hotel. However, I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel has a fun vibe. The room decor is very hip and the bathrooms are great for a NY hotel! There are not a lot of frills here, but for someone who does not spend much time in my room when I travel to NY, I didn't mind. My room was quiet and very clean. The staff was very nice and friendly. Perfect for a traveler who doesn't need a five star experience, but wants to be treated well!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I made our first trip together to NYC and although we were only there for a VERY brief time, our stay was made so much more enjoyable by the staff and management of Hyatt Times Square! Our room was an exceptionally quiet resting place, especially given that is was just off of the hub of Times Square activity. However, what impressed us the most was the kindness, hospitality, attention to detail, and the incredible helpfulness offered to us by the staff. From the moment we checked in, until we departed, there was not a single staff member that was anything less than accomodating. Even if the amenities would have been less than adequate (which they were not in the least bit) I would have easily been able to overlook any downfalls due to the personnel that took care of us. What a great team that has been assembled at Hyatt Times Square! Please do not change a thing - unless you are trying improve - which would be very difficult to do! Thank you so much for making our first (and definitely not our last) trip to the Big Apple most memorable!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for 4 days for our honeymoon. The location was perfect for us, less than 5 minutes walk from Times Square, but down a side road so there was no noise. The reception staff were very welcoming and check in was easy which we appreciated after a 7 hour flight from UK! There's obviously plenty to do near the hotel and lots of restaurants, so we didn't actually eat at the hotel. Our room was clean and very modern, and cleaned every day. We had no problems at all and would happily return. Excellent value for moneyJulia and Ben Hale

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed with my husband for a week over Easter,,,Check in and all lobby staff were more than pleasant throughout our stay. There was always someone to great you on return. We were on the 32nd floor with great views overlooking Times Square. Our room was very spacious for a NY hotel and spotless, the only downside was the lack of draw space and the slow lifts..One morning we waited 15 minutes to go down then had to change tactics and pressed for the lift to go up first ! It worked!  Bar 48 on the 48th floor offered amazing views and great service, however the prices were high as you may expect. The outside area is a real sun trap early evening and had a real buzz. The hotel is in and excellent location and within easy walking distance to, Broadway, Macy's, 5th Ave etc...I highly recommend this brand new hotel. Thank you to all staff for making our stay a great one!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed for work and it was in a good location, clean, nice room and good check in. Everything was as you would expect for the price point. Didn't use facilities but as the hotel seemed new expect they were fine too

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here with family for 6 nights over the Easter period. Initially on a shortlist of hotels for our trip, a great offer from hotels.com made selection easy - though we didn't plan on staying so close to Times Sq.We were made to feel very welcome on arrival and check-in was performed quickly and professionally. The staff, it has to be said, were all very friendly and efficient throughout our whole stay. We'd upgraded to a double-queen 'view' room. The room on the 30th floor was at the rear of the building and whilst it had a 'view' it wasn't really of anything - just some tall buildings. Didn't feel it necessary to complain, but I have a feeling some may have.The room was large by NY standards, tastefully decorated and the bathroom very contemporary. Everywhere was spotless and the beds very comfortable. As with most reviewers, it took a while to get to grips with the lighting - but pretty straightforward really. The only negative with the room was lack of storage (for a family of three with three suitcases). There appears to be lots of drawer space - one bank of three turns out to be the fridge (nice to have though) - another a safe and coffee making facility. Other drawers in the bedside cabinets are there for show only and don't open (can't really see the point of that one). So that leaves you with three small drawers - though there is plenty storage (shelving) in the bathroom though so that helps a bit. The media charging point is a great feature and certainly cut out the usual charging clutter you usually have dotted around the room.We were surprised by how quiet the room was (from 30th floor). Heard nothing from the outside all stay - in fact can't say I remember hearing anybody along the corridors either - so it was all very peaceful and relaxing.We used the Diner a couple of times for breakfast and enjoyed it. You may well be able to get cheaper around the area, but for convenience you can't really go wrong.Whether you think the hotel is in a great location depends on whether you want to stay by Times Sq or not. If you do, there can't be any better. It's not right in the middle - just a block to the side - which means you don't get trampled by the crowds every time you step out.So, to conclude, if you want a hotel by Times Sq - this comes highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel in a great location for restaurants, some shopping, times square and Broadway. Room is nice, has a refrigerator. Drawbacks: restaurant predictably overpriced, but lots of other restaurants right outside. They charge for internet service, which is always annoying when paying so much for a room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: April 2014: Fantastic hotel. Staff extremely courteous and responsive. From the front desk to Doorman to restaurant staff. Quiet rooms ( if you are not on the Times Square side), clean and adequately spacious. Nice common restrooms off lobby. Very nice but expensive rooftop bar. Views are exceptional. Unusually large gym with a good assortment of machines. Complimentary towels and water in gym. Great location. Walked to a few restaurants, subway stations, Times square around corner, walked to Rockefeller, Grand Central and Central park ( this was a little longer but doable)Family of 4 with 2 teenagers. Great deli almost next door. Open late and reasonable prices. Will seek other Hyatts out after staying at this one.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hyatt Times Square is a brand new 54 story 4 diamond hotel that just opened in December 2013. Despite being a new hotel, I heard there are still some kinks that are being worked out.Requested an early check-in and was notified of my room number via e-mail ~10 am! My request for a higher level landed me on the 50th floor with a view of Times Square!Internet was free when I first got into my room although I was prompted to pay the $13/day later that night and the next night...The room itself is huge by NYC standards. The mattress is comfortable and the lighting in the room is bright.Some of the highlights include a heated floor in the bathroom, a window that opens, and ~9' ceilings?!? The room card key is actually a proximity key...so no need to swipe it in the door. The doors were heavy, per Fire requirements, thus caused some slamming when they were left to close on their own.The only issue with this property is that during peak hours, the elevators get clogged up and you may be stopping at numerous floors before getting back to your room, or the lobby.Service by the front desk staff was fantastic.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good hotel, really comfy beds, lovely clean bathroom and fantastic location. What a shame it didn't deliver the room with a view of Times Square which I had paid a supplement for. If they had done it would be five star however it didn't seem good value for money.The first room we were given was on 20th floor and was quite noisy from the fans on top of adjacent buildings, it did not have a view of Times Square or the city. We were given a room on 45th floor and had high hopes but sadly it was at the rear of the building so although quieter still had no view. I guess we could have tried again but it took ages waiting for lifts (there are not enough of them and they're often crowded) and lugging luggage around and after 10 hours travelling we couldn't be bothered.Aside from not getting the room we paid for this is a lovely hotel in a really good part of town, just steps from Times Square. The only other slightly annoying aspects were the fact you had to ask for everything. We had no shampoo or shower gel in our room on arrival and were given one tube of each (between 3) when we asked. You also had to ask for robes, slippers, tea and a kettle. Such a shame this could be a number one rated hotel with just a little more attention to guests needs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Room 4160 was perfect for our 3 person girl trip! I king , 1 roll away, large bathroom w tub, great views facing downtown, fantastic rooftop bar! Thanks for the upgrade Liam! Thanks also to Trish and the rooftop bar staff. I will definitely stay here again....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hi,We have just returned from a week stay at the new Hyatt Times Square (14APR14). There were 4 in our party (2 adults and 2 children) Overall good hotel but can do a few small things to make it great.Pros- location great for times square and broadway (just off times square so quiter)- rooms spacious and new. Good view (if you pay for it)- big comfy beds and great rain shower- many amenities available free on request- decent gym- free coffee, tea and water in room daily- concierge staff very goodCons- minimal storage in room for family of four- no free wifi in room, only in lobby - inconsistent cleaning of room (missing towels, no robes)- too few lifts and slow- expensive T45 restaurantOverall I still would definately recommend the hotel. Its the few cons that have stopped me giving this hotel a 5 rating.The management need to seriously reconsider offering free wifi only in lobby because it is clear all guests need it but are unwilling to pay the fee to have it in the room. The lobby is overcrowded as a result and not the most welcoming of sights for new arriving guests (its an accident waiting to happen). Also please consider adding a 'make my room' tag.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My 14yo daughter and I recently stayed for a long weekend at the Hyatt Times Square. Everything was perfect! The rooms and the entire hotel are spotless, which is very important to me (so believe me, I look). We had a corner King bed suite on the 41st floor. The view was wonderful! The suite had a bedroom and living room, and a big bathroom. I loved that the windows opened a little (not enough to scare my daughter, who was a little afraid of being so high up), but enough to feel the weather and get some fresh air. Outside noise from Times Square was not a problem at all. There were plush robes and slippers in the closet, and all the amenities you'd expect in the bathroom and for coffee. The employees are all extremely friendly and helpful. The front desk girl, the doormen, the waitress in the restaurant, the housekeeper... everyone was chatty, smiling and asked if we needed any help with anything. The location couldn't be better. Just a few steps from the craziness of Times Square, but on a quiet street. We ordered breakfast from the restaurant attached to the lobby. It came quickly, was delicious, and was not overly expensive (which is often the case with room service breakfasts). It wasn't on a rolling cart, but in a to-go bag and containers, which was honestly just fine. I'd rather it this way and pay the reasonable prices then have an overpriced breakfast on a cart. We were so impressed by this hotel, we already booked our next stay. The only thing I'd ask the management to consider, is to somehow allow families to use the rooftop area (it's a bar, so you have to be 21). My daughter and I would have enjoyed having the option of going up there for a soda or food at some point. Overall, a perfect stay... I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel does everything SOOOO RIGHT!!!!!! We booked this room at the last minute on Priceline for a recent Friday night. I can't say enough wonderful things about this place, from the minute we rolled in from the subway with our luggage and met Floyd at the front desk - who was awesome, so personable, helpful and welcoming. You'd never know we had a Priceline deal for our stay. This place is absolutely fantastic!. We had an immaculate king size room which was bigger than any room we've ever had in NYC. It was well appointed with really well thought out decor, great, full closet, big bathroom with a great rain shower, lots of great bathroom amenities, such a comfy, cozy bed with great soft linens, a huge tv, lots of space to spread your luggage out, plenty of counter/work space, dresser, mini fridge (not stuffed with all that mini bar hoo-hah, plenty of space for our own snacks and water), complimentary Starbucks coffee in the room, huge windows with great darkening blinds, tons of outlets and well thought out placement of ports, plugs, and all things tech. We had left a few things at home and they have an amazing "call for amenities" list of things you can request to keep and others to borrow - complimentary stuff delivered with a smile - fantastic! We stopped into the spa to see what the amenities were there and asked if there was a sauna, were told there wasn't but there were his/her steam rooms. We said we'd be back to check them out. When we returned just a bit later, the Spa ladies had already pre-started the steam rooms for us, got us into our robes and slippers and we each had a relaxing steam and shower with some great spa soaps and lotions, tons of soft, fluffy towels - was such a nice way to relax and catch a nap before heading out for a show. When we returned after our show, we headed up to Bar 54. Wow again for the staff! Everyone was amazing up there - it was a really cloudy/rainy night, but more than one server explained what the view is like on a clear night. The outdoor seating area looked amazing, if it had been dry - fireplace! We were seated right away and took in the room - what an amazing bar - tons of intimate seating areas and some open spaces as well. Lots of huge windows, great music, but not too loud, great chili popcorn and tasty cocktails. Everyone there asked how our stay was going and we were sure to let them all know we were thrilled with everything from the minute we walked in the door. We were sorry to go, could have stayed much longer, but had an early flight. We had to check out around 5:30 a.m. and the front desk called a cab to the door for us in a matter of seconds. This hotel is great - the rooms were so quiet - no noise from the streets or the hallways, the décor is great - very colorful. Every single Hyatt employee we crossed path with during our stay had a hello, a huge smile, an inquiry as to how our stay was and they were all more than happy to tell us what a great place they work at and all the things about this new hotel, we really felt that everyone we encountered was fully invested that we were having a great time and enjoying the hotel and our stay. We were sorry to leave, wished we had a few more days to spend at the Hyatt. For sure, we will be back! Thanks for everything - well done!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just got home Sunday and had to post a review as this is the place to stay. Everyone at this hotel was very welcoming and ready to help with anything needed. I asked for extra shampoo and conditioner and they left 4 of each, not just one of each. I was impressed. This hotel is in the heart of Times Square. The rooms are really big compare to the other hotels that I have stayed at in the area. Stay here, you will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff is all young and so nice, friendly and helpful beyond what you'd expect. I asked for an early check-in so we could elevate my broken ankle: done! No hassle, they just delivered. The rooms are normal NYC size, and are well-appointed with everything you need (except robes) and quite comfortable. The rooftop garden has a fantastic view of Times Square, you can see all the way downtown to Freedom Tower. You will have awesome pics! But be warned - your pocket will be lighter - very few wine selections and the cocktails are $23 each! I would still do it, unique. Hotel is inhabited by young, international travellers. All were well-behaved, our room was very quiet. You have to pay for internet, bummer. Easy to walk to the theatre or restaurants (unless you have a broken ankle!) in which case the hotel team got us cabs.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had an awesome stay: staff was friendly, efficient and helpful and the room was big and clean with a spectacular view. Gym facilities also clean and brand new. Location was great: walking distance to most attractions and subway. Valet parking pricy but hassle-free and convenient.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Brand new hotel, FANTASTIC location!We booked this hotel a few months ago as the location was perfect for the Broadway shows we wanted to see. The staff at reception was very welcoming, putting us in our room hours and hours ahead of check-in time. The room was pretty high up so noise was never an issue either within or outside of the hotel. The room had two beds and was perfectly comfortable for the three of us. The bathroom was fabulous with a rainfall shower, a lovely sink area that had room for all sorts of stuff. I wish we had booked for a longer time. The location was perfect!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Assuming you've made the decision that you need to be in Time Square, which is absolutely the craziest place in the world, the Hyatt Times Square perfectly suits the bill. We stayed there with two teenage children. That means four of us sharing a room with two queen sized beds. It was terrific. There was plenty of room, the view out the window was extremely pretty, the amenities in the room were first rate and the gym was just lovely. We had trouble with the internet service, which is an extra charge, and the hotel management was nice to waive the fee when we checked out.Great spot in Time Square--we'll be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were originally booked into another hotel (pretty much a "budget" hotel, although rather trendy & cool) about 15 minutes walk from Times Sq. Last minute we decided to have a look online at other hotels. We came across the Hyatt and actually saved money on what turned out to be much nicer, with a bigger room and you were on Times Sq on turning the corner out of the hotel!We arrived quite late and were immediately greeted by friendly and attentive staff. On checking in we were upgraded to a room with a view of Times Sq on the 31st floor. The room was clean and comfortable, with nice touches like complimentary water and a coffee machine (although missing Tea, which was available upon request) dressing gowns and slippers and a small fridge. There was even an entertainment dock with various ports including USB, AV, iPod etc. If you felt there was something missing from the room then there was an extensive list of extras you could have delivered to your room at no extra cost, and for anything you may have forgotten there was a list of things you could borrow, or pay for if you took them with you when you left (i.e. hair straighteners, adaptors for plugs etc.) The only downsides to the room was that there was no milk for your hot drinks, just powdered creamer, and if you wanted a bath you were out of look as the room only had a shower. However this posed no problem for myself as I prefer a shower - and the shower was actually amazing! There's no room service either, but being in Times Sq that's not really a massive problem. There are also ice machines on each floor, conveniently for us pretty much outside our door!We also ate in the diner T45 a couple of times for breakfast, it wasn't cheap, but neither was it very expensive compared to other places to eat in the city. The food was pretty good and the staff very polite. We went up to the bar one night on the 54th floor, an amazing view but VERY expensive for what you got. I've been to plenty of high end cocktail bars and this was very overpriced even compared to many other bars in NYC. I'd recommend it at least once for the view though!All in all this was good value for money considering how expensive hotels can be in NY, I'm so glad we changed hotel last minute after we saw the hotel we originally intended to stay in (some friends still stayed there.) It saved us $500, and the location was much better. I can't really say anything bad about the hotel, it was clean, it was comfortable and the staff were amazing - no request was a problem and it was dealt with quickly and politely. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, and next time we visit New York it will certainly be the first place we look for a room!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed for one night on business. Staff very good at check in and the room was a real surprise - great size and very comfortable. The rooftop bar/restaurant has great views down to lower Manhattan and it has a fab beer selection. Just off Times square, so an easy walk anywhere. Def recommend. Only negative was the time it took to get a lift - Three serviced my floor and there was usually a wait as it is a busy hotel - not much of a grumble though.....

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here to be close to the theatre district when we saw Newsies. It was a quick walk and there were plenty of restaurants in the area. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. We stayed on St. Patrick's weekend and our room was above the Irish restaurant below the hotel. The music and crowd was so loud we couldn't sleep. We called the front desk at 1am, and they promptly got us a new room on the other side of the hotel and we were then able to get a good night's sleep. I chose this hotel because it had guest rooms starting at the 6th floor, because I don't feel comfortable going up an elevator beyond the 20th floor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all, let's just say the location, cleanliness and ambiance of the hotel is great. The problem here is that there are major flaws with the rooms. I arrived on a Thursday Afternoon after a day of meetings and was promptly checked in with no issues. I found it odd that as a Platinum Hyatt Member, I was given a room with no view and no amenities on the 8th floor despite overhearing that there were numerous available rooms to upgrade to with views that had gone unsold. I was in no mood to whine and moan at that point so up the elevator I went. The room was nicely appointed and average sized for midtown. Now wanting to go grab a drink and a snack, I figured I would venture up to Bar 54 for a great hotel bar experience. The problem is that my set of elevators meant I had to return to the lobby and then wait in line again with a new group to head up to the higher floors. The lounge is beautiful but don't expect to find a large bar area for single travelers. Unfortunately the 6 seats at the bar were full so I ventured back down the 54 floors to the lobby and back in line for the elevators back to my floor. When I was in my room, I could not set my thermostat as it kept cycling through some sort of electronic reset and my lights decided to randomly shut off as I tried to do work, as if they were on a timer. The fun part was when I sat on the toilet and the lights went out in the bathroom and I had to navigate my way in the dark with my pants around my ankles (thankfully I didn't get that drink yet).I was so furious, I decided to leave but the manager on call helped out with an "upgrade" to a higher floor. He was very nice and accommodating and saved my experience to that point. Upon relocating, I continued my work and went out to dinner with no issues. When I returned, I noticed some water present in the shower area but I thought maybe it was left from the housekeeper earlier in the day. In the middle of the night, as I slept, I was awoken to the shower leaking water profusely to the point I thought somebody broke in to use my shower. Although it scared the hell out of me, I was relieved to see it was again just another miscue in a new hotel. All in all, I won't be back unless there is some amazing deal that is made available during one of my monthly trips to NYC. For anyone else, proceed with caution.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great 5 night stay at the Hyatt Times Square. Staff all very friendly and helpful.
