As my husband has Hyatt Diamond status breakfast was free in the T45 diner as was our internet access. T45 food good with big portion. Internet was fast in the room. We were upgraded on arrival and room was clean, spacious by NYC standards and well appointed. Bathroom was lovely with a big shower and bath.Hotel a two minute walk to Times Square and five minutes to Times Square Subway station making for easy access to all of Manhattan. Fifth Avenue a 10 minute walk and Central Park about 20 minutes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked our one night stay through expedia and got an amazing rate. We had originally booked a two queen room but upon arrival upgraded (small fee) to an executive suite. Arielle who works at the front desk was very helpful, patient and kind. Our room was on the 19th floor and had a queen pullout couch in the living room and a king sized bed in the bedroom area. There were sliding doors that separated the living and bedroom areas. The room was very clean and modern. The bathroom and shower were great, especially the rainfall shower head. Our kids were able to spread out and relax, after a long day of walking around it was nice for them to be able to watch a movie on "their" side while my husband and I watched a show on "our" side. We had a slight view of Times Square and were able to crack open the windows for fresh air. Also- there was a very nice man who worked outside who hailed us a cab and remembered us the next morning. I think his name was Walter? Kudos to the Hilton all around. We would definitely return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a modern, friendly hotel, and an ideal place from which to sight see Manhattan. We stayed for four nights - the rooms are spacious, comfortable, and well appointed. to avoid too much street noise request a room 15 floors up or so. The Sky Bar on the 54th floor is a delight and the Diner - off Reception - serves very good food and drinks. Staff are friendly and helpful and there is free wi-fi in the lobby.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family of 3 stayed in a suite at the Hyatt Times Square. It was a great location as we were there to see shows and dine. Our room was large with a king bed in the bedroom and a sofa bed in the living area. We still had more than enough room to walk around comfortably with the sofa bed pulled out. The room also many options for sitting other than on the beds. The bathroom, while not huge, was well appointed with a large shower. There was more than enough storage room so that luggage was neatly kept out of sight. The hotel is a comfortable walking distance to Central Park and just half a block west of much less touristy 6th Avenue. Of course, there was excellent customer service with every staff member we encountered, including the staff at the T45 Diner. There are very good and fairly reasonably priced restaurants in walking distance (Junior's and John's Pizza). Excellent stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for a week and had a great time. Haven't slept so well in a long time. Couldn't hear neighbors though did hear some sirens every once in a while. We were on the 35th floor. This Hyatt is close to every Metro stop and food and entertainment was everywhere. All the theaters are nearby as well so you can come back to the hotel, get ready, then walk to your show. Hotel bedding was comfortable and luxurious. Loved the rainhead shower and its modern look. Small refrigerator was a must for us and we used it daily. The gym was nice with free weights and cardio machines. There is also a very nice bar on the top floor which has great views though it was a bit windy and chilly in April. One negative was that the wifi was not free except in the lobby, so every morning the cheapskates were huddled in the lobby taking up all the lounge space. There is a small restaurant on the ground floor which serves beer and wine. The other negative for me was that the "business center"is not really useful for anything other than printing your boarding pass. Printing is free for the first few pages but you have to pay after that. Nonetheless, I'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Times Square only opened in early 2014 and we were informed by the staff the hotel is brand new "from the ground up" - so no refurb action here. The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk around to Times Square with the likes of TGI Fridays and Planet Hollywood also handily close by. The room was large by NYC standards and the bathroom was excellent, with a heated marble floor to boot. The hotel has a coffee shop downstairs and an excellent roof top bar worth a visit. Room cost was around £170 a night which is pretty cheap for NYC. Have stayed at the Bryant Park and Le Meridien and this hotel was not as boutiquey, but great value and well placed. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This new location is great especially the views from our room on the 35 th floor and from the rooftop bar. Staff went above abd beyond to make our stay special. If you drive to NYC pay to valet park the car in the Hyatt garage daily rate up to $70 per 24 hours for the large suv we had. Prices at other lots are a few bucks less but may limit you to 24 hours or less. Also no in out during day so if you dont need car leave at valet. Plenty of food choices and minimarts to get a taste of NY for quick breakfast lunch snacks drink etc. Akso their is a restaurant in hyatt and at rooftop if you like.we did not use due to dinner reservations at a few of local places. This location is great to go out walk around see a show shop etc then return to hotel to take a break or relax. Brand new opened a month or two ago. Rooms spacious comfortable modern and clean. Feels like a studio apartment. Staff awesome and great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: - Amazing Location literally a 20 second walk to times square itself- Excellent customer service- Brilliant views (we had the 31st floor)- The lift is a gem (super duper fast)- View from bar on 54th floor is incredible- Rooms perfectly clean cannot fault- Lively AtmospherePERFECT PLACE TO STAY IN NEW YORK!Wish I could re live my stay at the Hyatt!Will definitely be coming back!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I along with our 14 year old daughter stayed here from December 29, 2013 through January 1, 2014. The hotel wasn't fully opened and not operating at 100%. Only 34 of the floors were ready for occupancy. Our room on the 33rd floor was well appointed and the bathroom had heated floors which was very nice as the winter of 2013 - 2014 was long and cold. The staff were attentive and friendly but not very helpful when it came to New Year's Eve activities. We had hoped to see the ball drop as the hotel is literally less than a half a block away. No one seemed to know how we could ensure to see the ball drop. We ended up in our room watching the ball drop on TV while listening to the sounds of the revelers outside our window. I believe they had just reopened after an extensive renovation. Everything was new and shiny clean.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is literally just 100 yards from Times Square so you're in the heart of the action. The hotel itself is only 5 months old and the place is immaculate. Great furnishings and really helpful staff. Highly highly recommended

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very convenient location, good for travelers who would like to save time traveling; the hotel is less than 1 minute walk to Timesquare. Closed to shopping street, subway and walking distance (10 minutes) to Port of Authority or bus terminal. Rooftop bar has outdoor deck with superb view looking south of Manhattan, you are able to see the Rockefeller center very close, look down to bit of Timesquare and sight of One World Trade center on lower manhattan. In addition, there are many local Nyc restaurants nearby (not too far from ShakeShack if you love burgers !) if not the hotel has small cafe near lobby.Free wifi is available only at lobby area. In-room wifi requires payment.*Great location, clean and modern room interior and amenities

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, excellent value for the money compared to other hotels in the area. The extra charge for a room with a view is well worth it. Front door staff member "Chester' was a standout! Will book again when back in midtown area

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a relatively new hotel, I think it was opened late 2013. Room is spacious for Manhattan standard. Bed and bathroom are comfortable. Fantastic location for tourist attractions, eg Times Square. I used "yelp" to find restaurants and there are plenty of good restaurants around this location. This is 5th hotel that I have stayed in Manhattan, I would rank this as #1 or #2 (compared to Westin Times Square). Based on price, as Hyatt was more cost effective for the dates that I was after that's why I tried thus hotel and would definitely come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this Hyatt with my sister on the final leg of our 3 week Europe vacation to help eliminate jet-lag, be a tourist, and see a play. We booked the hotel because of the location and Brand, and recent opening. We loved the staff, very friendly~always smiling. "Rey" in the restaurant provided great service and also helped with some area Broadway play tips. Another very noteable mention is "Chester" who works the front of the hotel. He greeted us when we first arrived and made us feel like we had known him for years. He helped us with our luggage and also some area tips. Beds were very comfortable, and rooms very clean. Great hotel, we would stay there again on our next trip to New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I went to NYC to see a couple of shows. Normally I'd stay as far from Times Square as possible, but given that the whole purpose of this trip was Broadway, I decided we should stay nearby. This hotel is very new - opened Dec. 3rd (we were told this as we unloaded bags from the cab). The lobby is small but nice, and they understood we were in a hurry to check in because our flight had been delayed. Everyone we met who worked there was friendly and helpful. Our room was, indeed, very small. But this didn't strike me as odd given that it is NYC and real estate is expensive. The room was really nice - clean, comfortable bedding, very nice new bathroom - and Quiet. How on earth they made this room right in the heart of Times Square so quiet is beyond me, but it was great. Didn't even hear any hallway noise. The cons: if you are looking for a larger room (and yes, having more than two bags would have made things a bit tight) this probably isn't the place for you; when I got back from dinner on our first night I was surprised to find that there was no mini-bar. This really wasn't a problem; I had been looking forward to a glass of wine in the room after a sort of rough travel day, but instead just went to bed. There *is* a small fridge, so if you want wine or beer you can buy it and store it in that. There is a Starbucks across the street, a Pret a Manger just down the block and two Irish pubs (again, how is it so quiet??) on either side of the hotel. I'd definitely stay here again if we planned a Broadway-based trip.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was in a fantastic location. Room was clean. Received key upon check-in and found out the room was occupied already. (Would have been scary for the guest if he/she was in the shower when we walked in!). Went back to reception desk to get another room. Front desk staff was very apologetic, said there was a glitch in the system, assigned us to a different room and then personally escorted us to our new room. Noticed in other reviews that each room was supposed to come with bathrobe. Ours did not but I didn't realize this until our check- out day. We did request slippers which were brought to our room immediately. Beds were comfortable, bathroom was spacious. Light controls were funky and we often turned off all lights by mistake when we were trying to just turn off a single light. I would go back due to the newness of building and location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My sister and I stayed here for 9 nights this month. The hotel itself is 1 minute maximum walking distance from the infamous Times Square, and the subway entrances are endless around this area, making travel simple. We stayed in a double room on the 35th floor and the view is truly that of a concrete jungle - buildings as far as you can see. The room was cleaned daily to a high standard, and amenities were replaced as needed automatically. The hotel offers little extras (e.g. hair straightener) that can be used for the duration of the stay for no extra cost. Downside: the wifi is expensive and not included in the cost of the room. We also had an issue with our thermostat at around 1am on night/morning (one of the buttons stopped working), and had to call front desk twice to have a technician come and fix it. Room service is also VERY expensive and the quality does not meet the standard you'd expect for the price you're paying - you'd be better off going down to Applebee's Times Square (5min walk) where you get a good meal that doesn't hurt the wallet. However, overall the stay was fabulous, the doorman was friendly, and you could get back to the hotel knowing that your room is going to be in fantastic condition and that you can simply relax.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed our 5-day stay at the new Hyatt Times Square. The rooms were very well designed with a modern look. We had plenty of shelf space in the bathroom. We have 3 teenagers and needed connecting rooms, which were guaranteed by Hyatt. Check-in was easy and the hotel location is great. We definitely would recommend the Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hotel was absolutely fantastic! The location is amazing and just steps from Times Square, the Theatre District, Central Park and phenomenal restaurants. Dede at the front desk was wonderful and gave us 2 great recommendations to Carmines and STK. Both were great and at STK we recieved 2 free deserts by saying we were recommended to go there by the Hyatt staff. Chester at the front door was awesome and made sure we never went without an umbrella the 2 rainy days we were there. The rooms themselves were well appointed and modern. Ample outlets for todays gadgets and a beautifully modern and well done bathroom. We could even see some lights of Times Square. The Bar54 was nice. Excellent views but not cheap. A nice place for a nightcap but pretty low key in general and not designed for dancing.Overall a great place to rest in busy New York with friendly and helpful staff with proximity to everything and modern well appointed rooms. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I never post these reviews but felt compelled given my most recent stay. For a Hyatt this particular location needs some work. Upon check in the bath tub was covered with hair, NO cold water flowed from the tub...only scalding hot water. No robes, no magazines about New York and to top it off we had to pay for internet. Don't recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family of 6 (four kids - ages 15, 14, 11 and 8) headed to NYC for a week. The staff is accommodating and will work w/ families. Obviously, we needed two rooms and they went out of their way to get us next to one-another. Again the entire staff is family friendly. Only one-downside: The lobby is very small. However, the Starbucks next door provided a nice working environment. I'd stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at the Hyatt Times Square the week before Christmas and had a wonderful time. I've never experienced such a pleasant and friendly crew. The room (a king size corner room) had windows that went from the floor to the ceiling with a great view of Times Square. The room was tastefully decorated and large by NY hotel standards. Location was excellent for attending the theatre. Unfortunately the bar which supposedly is the highest in Manhattan and the restaurant had not opened yet. Looking forward to seeing both on my next visit. I've stayed at dozens of hotels in the Times Square area over the years and this is one of the best. Much better than the Paramount, Sheraton near 52nd and the Ameritania (worst rooms ever).

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This brand new hotel was everything you would expect. Extremely comfortable Queen size beds. The excellent housekeeping service left extra towels each day for our two teenage girls. Great location right off Times Square, walking distance to theatres and restaurants. The diner was excellent; lovely wait staff. Lucky enough to have free wi-fi during our visit. The staff could not have been more helpful, very sincere in their willingness to assist us in everything from theatre bookings to arranging a car large enough to transport us and our many bags to JFK. We visit New York regularly and would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Let me start with the front office staff. They were fabulous, especially Brittany who was extremely helpful. We booked an Executive Suite, and could hardly believe that it was indeed an executive suite. It was the size of a postage stamp. (Would hate to see a junior suite.!). We were a party of 3 and if the sofa bed was pulled out, we had to drag the chair and table down the short hallway to the front door in order to have access to the bathroom. The decor seemed to have been done by IKEA, with vinyl-covered sofa and an uncomfortable chair. The so-called amenities did not include robes as advertised on their website, and pretty much were what you would expect from a Motel 6 - shampoo, conditioner, and lotion. There was a long list of amenities that you could request, but if you get out of the shower and want a q-tip, do you really want to wait around for someone to deliver it to your room? The hotel decor is, overall, super contemporary so if that's your style, go for it. We went to the bar on the 54th floor and the view was very cool but the never-ending song (really, NEVER ending) with pulsating vibes sent us to the elevator. My companions and I have stayed at more than 100 Hyatts over the years and this one degrades the brand. The only thing going for it is location and the front office staff. We let them know he first day that there were 3 of us, but still had to call down each day to get a 3rd glass, not to mention that after the first day, they left 5 decaf coffees and no regular coffee, and never more than one small bottle of water. No mini-bar either. Pathetic of a Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The personnel is super nice and everyone really tried to help you if you needed something. The location is great if you want to be in the middle of everything. Only thing i did not appreciated was wifi not free in rooms. But i was charged only one day while i was hooked everday, so i don't know how it works. Great to have cofffee and tea in room, room was big, i was impressed! I found great also that they give you a list of things you can request (from shower cap, shoe cleaner ect...) and you find it in the room when you return, this is great so there is no waste on accessories you may not need. I surely will return as i travel to Ny about 4 times per year.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a great hotel with a good location! Time Square area is a Little congested but still a good place to stay! My only complaint is no free wifi in the rooms! Really? At this level and quality... Free wifi would make this place a 5/5! Theatre district is close by, rooms are nice... But lights from Time square a little annoying at times. Stayed during St. Patrick's day and was a bit noisy from the bars downstairs but not bad at all!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Currently checked into a Corner Suite on the 41st floor using a Hyatt frequent stay award upgrade. Arrived at 8:30AM on March 23 and was warmly greeted by the doorman, Chester. I was told that the suite I had reserved was not ready yet but was given the option of waiting for this suite, or using my suite upgrade award for a future stay and checking into a standard room that is available for early check-in. The front desk agent hinted that its worth the wait for the suite . So glad that we decided to wait! My luggage were stored for me while we walked around Times Square to kill some time and enjoyed a delicious breakfast a restaurant Chester had recommended. Dede at the front desk worked her magic to rush a room for me and was able to have me checked in well before the 4PM check-in time. The same front desk agent (Dede) also delivered my luggage to my room and took the time to ask and ensure that my family and I were satisfied with the suite.Great views, everything is in brand new condition, large bathrooms, in room Starbucks Coffee, and of course, staff willing to go above and beyond their regular duties to ensure that their guests are having a great stay.I'm only a few hours into my 4NT/5day stay and am already looking into making this my hotel of choice in NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I wanted to love this hotel, but it was really just above average. Because this hotel is new, we were able to upgrade from a basic 2 queen room to a deluxe suite for $49 extra per night (with an already good rate) It was freezing in the city and SO worth our upgrade for the few nights we were there. The view from the upper floors is amazing! The view from the bar is also amazing, as is the bar staff. The location is great, and I would probably stay again... but hoping they could improve the front desk staff. Ariel acted as if she was too busy for us. I know this is NYC, but you have visitors from all over the world, so act accordingly.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: At last a new Hyatt to give an option to staying at the grand central Hyatt which is way past it's prime. The Times Square hotel is new since Nov(?) 2013, minimalist, very pleasant staff, nice sky bar with small outside deck and a surprisingly decent though small restaurant off the lobby. Definitely my choice for a return visit to NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in March 2014. The hotel is new so everything is fresh and clean. It is in a great location for exploring Manhattan, very central. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they all seemed very well informed. The roof top bar has great views, however the drinks are slightly over priced. The room was very comfortable. We had a deluxe room on a high floor with great views of downtown. Nice large bed and brilliant rain shower in the bathroom. Sadly the room seemed to be designed more for the aesthetics than practicalities, lacking in storage space. Despite this a great place to stay and would recommend if you like being at the centre of all the action.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice modern Hyatt hotel just off Times Square. The hotel has a very minimalist feel and the rooms are spacious with a large bathroom and very comfortable bed. The 54th floor rooftop bar is a standout feature of this hotel which has only just recently opened, drinks are expensive but I guess you are paying for the views. In the summer I'd expect that the bar is well over-subscribed. Didn't use the gym facilities but they do have one, although there is no pool. Restaurant attached to the hotel is similarly modern in style with a 50's diner vibe, although there are plenty of options to eat right outside your door. Would stay here again for either business or pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We enjoyed a five-night stay at the Hyatt Times Square.First off, the location is excellent. Just around the corner from all the Times square and Theatre district attractions.Staff is really excellent, really friendly and helpful! We had a room on 41st floor, with floor to ceiling windows and a view that is stunning, quite simply!Bar at 54th floor offer nice atmosphere and a breathtaking outdoor terrace.We will definitely return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have nothing but great things to say about the Hyatt Times Square. Traveling to NYC quite frequently, I was expecting small "NYC" rooms. However, the Hyatt shocked me. Large rooms and clearly have recently been renovated. Heated floors in the bathroom, quality furnishings and a very techy savvy room. I could not have been happier with my stay and can't wait to make this my NYC "go-to" hotel. Also, the rooftop bar is worth checking out. The views are awesome!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is realatively new and has a great location to easily walk to Times Square. Rooms are smaller than normal for a Hyatt, but this can be expected in this area of New York.The staff seems to not be knowledgeable about what they are to do. The concierge was poor in recommending area restaurants and we had three bad experiences out of the four suggested. When we asked a different concierge (on three occasions) and told of our poor previous experience, we heard "oh, that's not the best place" each of the three times!Front desk staff knew very little about the rooms, views, directions, etc.Prices were consistant with other mid-range local hotels, but this Hyatt should be a higher-end hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: You cannot go wrong here! You will not regret this choice, I can almost guarantee! It's really and truly the perfect location! It's not right in the middle of blinking lights but right around the corner, you can be there! It's perfect location to Times Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center, shopping, restaurants, and not too far from The Empire State Building. Views are great! Hotel is perfect! New, modern, with everything you can imagine! Quiet, especially for the location proximity to Times Square! Staff are all extremely customer-service-oriented and friendly and helpful! The diner, rooftop bar, and drinks are great! We will definitely go back and stay here again! No need to doubt or look further! We've been to NYC about 10 times and it's our fave! Go see Justin at Bond 45 too (a restaurant close by!) we loved it!!!! Great job, Hyatt Times Square! See you soon!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Of all the choices available to book in New York this one is a safe bet for a reasonable price point. Effectively brand-new and with the added features of a gym, spa and a very nice rooftop bar it has all that anyone who's visiting the city needs to get by. Essentials (such as bottle opener, shoe polish etc....) are available for free on request and are delivered to your room. Internet is free in the lobby and rooftop bar. But the winning feature is the newness of the rooms and all without the usual gripes of New York hotels (noisy air con and such like) Highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here as a couple for 5 nights. We booked a standard room and got it from the 41st floor windows away from the Times Square. We woke up middle of the first night because of the water leaking problems in the bathroom. The maintenance tried to fix that problem immediately but he couldn't. The manager decided to compensate that inconvenience to gave us a suite the rest of our stay. I would say that was fair compensate! The suite in 46th floor was with spectacular views straight towards to Paramount building. The room were bit noisy because of traffic on TS even it was on the 46th floor. I think they had some problems with water pipes because of the water leak in our first room and poor water pressure and noisy water pipes in our second. King size bed was superb! Anyway both rooms were nice and clean.The hotel staff was friendly and professional. Concierge recommended two restaurants from SoHo and Tribeca when we asked good restaurants from the mid/downtown. Those were both good! Location of this hotel is perfect, but taxi drivers didn't aware of this hotel name and location (maybe cause they opened in dec 2013). I would definately recommend and stay this hotel again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here last week as a family, booking 2 roomsGood:1. Rooms were spotless (although I did find a receipt dating back to Feb inside the duvet cover)2. Everything was new and functional (they did only open a few months back). Had good lighting in the room and washroom. Beds were firm and just enough space for 2-4 ppl per room.3. Location is awesome. 2 min walk to Times Square, 5-7 mins to 5th avenue, and less than 10mins to rockefeller. The best part was for the proximity to times square, we didn't hear any traffic at night4. Friendly hotel staff. They held the elevators for you at all hours of the day, greeted you when they saw you. Not intrusive which was great5. Free water. You can ask the front desk for more if needed.Bad:1. The receipt in the cover was questionable and had me concerned2. I had asked for 2 rooms next to each other but when we got there, they indicated that they could only accomodate us 1 floor apart. It was a bit disappointing, but did not ruin the stay3. Wish they had a bath tub instead of a massive walk in shower4. Gym was great, would have loved a sauna5. Parking was expensive, was quoted $60 when we arrived, but charged $70 because I was told it is a minivanAll in all, a terrific place and I would highly recommend it to others

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here over Christmas. It was nice staying in a new hotel, with everything so clean and fresh. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Good lighting in the rooms and nice reading lights by the beds. Great shower - there was a shower stall, which I greatly prefer over bathtub showers. Room was very quiet. You need to look at the list in the room of available complimentary toiletries and other items and then order them. For instance, there were no bathrobes in the room, but when we called to the front desk, they brought them up immediately. The hotel could use a nicer entrance/lobby area, but I suppose it's the best they could do with a small area. A better selection of television channels would also be nice. I would certainly stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel , we stayed for 7 nights, the hotel was only a couple of months old. everything is as new, service was excellent by all staff. located just around the corner from Times Square and all the action. Would highly recommend this hotel if traveling to NY.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We were really pleased with our stay. The rooms were really comfortable, the staff extremely helpful and friendly and the location is great. Rooms were clean and everything is new. Broadway shows are all around, the subway is very close so you have access to everything in a very convenient way. We went there with our 2 teenage daughters and we all had a good time. Only thing that they need to improve is the bar downstairs. We had breakfast one day and it was really bad.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: So so pleased with our stay at this hotel. Not only it is brand new (3 months old) but the room size (with 2 double size beds) is just massive! My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay here and were even impressed by their bar on the 54th floor - even when the temperature was close to -10c!! The only downside to this hotel is the lack of FREE wi-fi in the rooms. Also I need to point out that there is a slight design flaw with the doors as our bags kept getting latch to them everytime we walk past and also the wardrobe door needs to have a proper lock to stop it from opening by itself unless you use a door stopper! Otherwise 5/5.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The concierge and reception staff in the lobby are outstanding - well done to Walter and Chester - a great job, boys and much appreciated. It's a terrific welcome at reception and everyone is helpful and obliging. The hotel is new and it's all clean and fresh, and you couldn't wish for a better location with Times Square literally just along from the front door.That said, the level of service in the rooms - bearing in mind we were on the 35th floor - was not so hot and everything seemed to take a long time to come. We rang on various occasions for toiletries, towels, bath robs etc, but they seldom came within 30 minutes. A shame really, hence the headline of this review that the hotel is better on the door when you come in than it is once you've got to your floor. Perhaps we just tended to ring at the wrong moment each time. The food and beverage offer isn't your traditional hotel arrangement. There's a bistro in the lobby which is quite expensive and doesn't have the kind of breakfast offer I'd usually go for. Happily, Starbucks across the street does, though, so no real issue. If you're thinking of staying here you'll be very much on what I've sometimes heard referred to as 'The American Plan', which seems to mean 'room only'.On balance we're glad we stayed here because it's new, they're friendly whenever you appear in the lobby, and it's handy to get places.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked Hyatt Times Square to celebrate our 23rd wedding anniversary. The location is ideal. The staff is VERY friendly and accommodating. I even had a "Happy Anniversary" card signed by many of the hotel's employees waiting for us in the room. The food and service at T45 was great. I only have positive things to say about this hotel. The rooms were larger than expected being NYC. I didn't experience the Spa or the Roof Top Bar. We wanted to go to the Roof Top Bar and it was closed for the hotel's photo shoot (as I understand the hotel just recently opened), but they offered us complimentary cocktail(s) at the bar at T45. The bartender was really enganging and charming. This hotel is gorgeous and the service was fantastic. Everyone was eager to help us one way or another. I am in the hotel business and many times a hard critic as I know what to expect. A+ for my friends at Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights for our city visit to NYC.First of all the reception staff were really friendly and they let us check in earlier than the standard check in time of 4pm. We were also upgraded for no extra charge to a larger room with 2 double beds!We stayed on the 35th floor. The room was spotless with great city views and the beds are so comfy! The bathroom was a good size and again it was really clean. The location is excellent - just minutes away from Times Square and no more than a 10 minute walk to the Rockefeller Centre. I would highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely be returning on my next visit!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location 1/2 block from Times Square. Rooms are reasonably sized with a large bath, including separate shower and soaking tub. The hotel restaurant serves a great breakfast that is reasonably priced (by NY standards). The bar on the top floor, including a terrace, is worth a look. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent three days on business --- less than a block from our offices -- and equally close to Times Square areas. They are stil completing construction / finishing top few floors -- but you wouldn't know any work was going on. Hyatt doing an excellent job with customer service from all staff -- front door, front desk, day and night managers, restaurant staff etc. Checked in quite late - shown to room --- noticed a few fixtures weren't quite properly installed --- as I was the first quest in that room. Even though close to midnight -- the night manager arrived with key to new and very well appointed room upgrade. Wonderful working and relaxing room, true working desk set up - plents of outlets for charging everything -- beds great and the best bathrooms of most any of the higher end levels of the recognized chain hotels. Breakfast was very good and reasonable. Location is simply as good as any of the very good hotels in the Mid-Town Times Square area. Well policed with staff tending to smallest details for guests and keeping their new facility well cared for. Still breaking in aspects of the fit out - going very well -- any issue resolved instantly. The Roof Top Lounge one of the best views - inside and from their outside patio - of mid-town with a clear all the way to the World Trade center --- will be "the" hot spot when weather permits all to sit outside -- where they have fire place as well. Hyatt a good pedigree to begin with -- their new properties looking to keep ahead of the times in design, function, location and amenities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is at a great location. We watched the Rocky Broadway show just nearby. We got a limousine city tour. The 54 bar located on the 54th floor is amazing! The sunset was very pretty in spite of the cold, cold weather. We had an awesome stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has only been open a few months but you can tell the staff has been trained well. Every single staff member was warm and friendly without being "plastic". The gym is one of the best I have been to check out the pictures. I love the light switches in the room, love that you can shut down all the lights with one switch. The bathroom is immaculate with a rain shower and a huge tub.Breakfast was included since I am a diamond member. The hash and Short ribs are AMAZING.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very nice brand new hotel, about 1/4 block from Times Square. I like the location, being on the East side of Times Square, closer to 5th and 6th Avenues, rather than towards 8th Avenue. The room was quite spacious, especially considering the very congested area around Times Square... nice desk area with good lighting. The sound insulation between rooms was excellent. It's sort of a high-tech basic modern design, especially in the bathroom, which had a very spacious shower. The lobby area is a bit small, not really any place that I recall to even sit down. There is a small counter area with a few prepared sandwiches and snacks, but not a huge selection. Fortunately, about a minutes walk from the hotel is a big 24 hour deli type place, that has everything, including a hot self serve buffet, salad bar, etc. Nice views from the upper floor rooms. Very comfortable bedding.The staff were all very friendly and very hard working. I was very impressed because it seemed that every single employee, without any exception, seemed genuinely interested in making sure everyone had a great stay. They seemed to be well-trained, and really happy where they work. The price compared to other hotels in the area seemed to be a much better value, but I suspect as the hotel gains in popularity, rates might creep up a bit. So many hotel choices in the area, but this was a particularly good one.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Planned a date night and the wife and I had a great time! We had dinner at a local restaurant then finished up at the rooftop lounge. The drinks were good a little pricey but the views were fantastic! The night was so clear it seemed like we could reach out and touch the Chrysler building. Even though it was cold we still enjoyed being outside for a little while and taking some pictures. Our room was quite comfortable & spacious. The staff were friendly and eager to go above and beyond. The following day we ate breakfast at T45's and ended a fantastic time. I cannot wait to repeat!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel. You can tell it’s a brand new hotel with the décor and design of the lobby area and rooms. I really didn’t get to enjoy the spa and lounge upstairs because I was walking around Time Square most of the time. It is really close to all the Broadway shows and shops like Forever 21, H&M, American Eagle, M&M Store and Express etc. There is also a Starbucks right across the street from the hotel, the Starbucks is pretty small but it does have a seating area compared to the other ones in the Times Square area that don’t have a seating area for you at all. I was a little disappointed that the hotel didn’t have a 24HR dining or kitchen area. However, there is a 24HR Deli/Café that is right down the street from the hotel it has a good selection of food and drinks. Also, I felt the dining area in the hotel was a little over priced for eggs and bacon, but there is a restaurant called Junior’s that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner they also have amazing food. I didn’t see any trains stations close by the area, but then again I wasn’t looking too hard. When you walk out from the hotel there is always somebody there ready to get you to a taxi to take you to your next destination. We did have a problem with are room not putting out any heat, when we informed them about this they sent somebody up to our room to look at it. That’s when he informed use that it would take a while for him to figure out what was wrong with it. When he went downstairs to inform the manager about our room situation she called use and told use she would be upgrading are room to one with a terrace. That room was huge and the terrace was also big, it also had a better view of Time Square. The staff was very friendly and accommodating to all of our needs. P.S. The pictures are from the first room not the second.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent 2 weekend nights here with 2 other couples on a NYC getaway weekend and were quite pleased. It is new, with eager-to-please service, and the rooms have exactly what we DO want and nothing we don't need. ROOMS: adequate size, with comfy king, built in fridge, safe, huge flat-screen TV, large shower, large closet. Lots of plugs for mobile, iPad, laptop recharging. Great view of Manhattan to the north (from our room). LOCATION: perfect. ½ block from Times Square, 5 short blocks from Grand Central Station. We took the train in, walked everywhere (theater, restaurants, shopping). FOOD: Bar on 54th floor has spectacular view of Manhattan. T-45 diner in lobby is fine for breakfast and lunch; they don't try to compete with the zillion restaurants within a few blocks, which is smart. SERVICE: Eager-to-please. Everyone greets you. Accommodated all requests. COMPLAINTS: Charging $13/day for basic Internet felt like nickel-diming us. We didn't buy it, just used our iPhones instead of our laptops.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I thought this hotel was very clean and new, we only had 2 problems with our stay.Problem #1: The phone just stopped working and we wanted to call and ask about a place to eat instead of going down to the desk to ask. This isn't a huge ordeal but could of saved us some trouble.Problem #2: The diner they have in the lobby wanted to charge 18$ for 2 eggs with some side dishes? I know it's NYC (I live here) but around the block I got the same thing for half that price. No need to jack up prices because it is only an elevator ride down. Go around the block to a local diner you will save some money.But at the end of the day we enjoyed our stay, the staff was very nice and helpful and the hotel it's self is in a great location with very a nice simple modern decor.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed four nights at this very new hotel and really enjoyed it. Everything is new, modern and clean, and the room was quite comfortable. Bonus: our room on the 27th floor had a terrace with great views! The staff was very friendly and helpful. For a newly opened property, they have their act together. Love the proximity to Times Square and the theater district. Lots of good bars and restaurants nearby. We didn't have time to check out the bar on the top floor of the hotel, but next time we will.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I travel to New York about 6 times a year. While I am loyal to certain hotels, I always check a site like Orbitz for a good deal. I knew for this trip that we'd be going to the theatre, so I centered my search in Times Square. I saw a great offer for the new Hyatt Times Square and decided to give it a try. When I checked in I enquired about a bath and the room I booked didn't have one. After just being in the hospital for two weeks, I really wanted a bathtub. The front desk manager was able to give me a deluxe room on the 45th floor for $25 a night more. It's the best money I've ever spent. Room 4509 is beautiful! It has a walk in shower as well as a beautiful bathtub, which ended up being a life saver. There is a little fridge and two closets. I don't want to leave! The floor to ceiling windows offer not only a great view, but lots of natural light. Our flight was canceled today so I had to extend my stay (darn). The rack rate was more than twice what I originally paid, but after speaking with the desk manager, they were able to offer me the room for the same price that I paid the prior three nights. I have met anyone who works here who hasn't been incredibly friendly and helpful. I love everything about it. I even made not of the the model of the hairdryer-I'm going to buy one when I get home. If I had any complaints, it would be the room service food. My adult children were coming back to watch the Oscars with me last night and we got held up and weren't going to get back to the room until 9:00. We decided to order room service. They were very friendly and it was prompt, but the food was not great. They got one of the entrees wrong but were very apologetic and sent up a new one in 15 minutes. It sucks to spend $100 on a meal that you don't really eat, but I can forgive this one thing. I don't come to the city to eat in my hotel. I am delighted with this hotel and I'll be back!!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great stay in the new hotel right near times square. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The in house restaurant and room service arrangement is a bit different, although if you are in New York, you really should not be eating in your room. Our room was characterized by clean lines and nice modern furniture, and the rain shower is fantastic. The roof top bar was under construction whilst we were there which was a little disappointing, as the views are supposed to be excellent. Good value for money in a great location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed two nights at the Hyatt Times Square and enjoyed a wonderful experience. The hotel appears relatively new and boast light switches that control light throughout the room and bathroom. One can even choose mood lighting or a night light. A nice touch. The hotel offers a long kist of things it will provide without cost during one's stay--including phone and laptop chargers, a rarity in my experience.Service was excellent. The person who checked me in walked me to the elevator and assured herself I had no question. My room was sufficiently large and comfortable with king sized bed, a comfortable chair and a desk with chair. The quality of soap, shampoo, etc. was a cut above many other hotels. One curious thing was the absence of drawers in which to pack clothing, etc. It was a minor matter and I easily set my suitcase on one of the standard stands found in hotels everywhere.The hotel offers a 24 hour gym and an adjacent restaurant.In short, it was a great stay. Prices in New York at the moment are somewhat lower than at other times of the year, so I enjoyed the Hyatt for would I would usually expect to pay at a much lower quality facility.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The new Hyatt in Times Square is wonderful!First and foremost, the hotel is new and so it is a bit of a luxury in and of itself to be staying in a new hotel. I stayed for 5 days for a little work but mostly play.The room was well proportioned and large by New York standards. The decor was smart, fresh and modern and added to the feel that this is a luxury hotel. I loved the window chair, although ended up turning it around so I could enjoy the Times Square view. The bed was incredibly comfortable. I was battling a bad chest infection when I arrived which had me spend more time in my room than I would normally. This is a room you can really feel comfortable just hanging out in. The bathroom was awesome - clean and spacious. I particularly loved the shower with the choice of waterfall and hand held shower head.A big plus in my opinion is the small quiet fridge in the room. These are a rarity for NYC hotels which for the most part have packed minibars or no refrigeration options. This is great for a longer stay in New York to be able to bring food and drinks back or have a juice and yoghurt as an easy breakfast in the morning.The staff were exemplary. Every experience I had was positive. From the doormen, the front desk, the elevator man, housekeeping, bellhop and maintenance - everyone was genuinely welcoming and friendly. I shared an elevator with a member of the maintenance staff who was keen to know how my stay was and offered that I could ask for her personally if there was any issues with my room. The Hyatt staff are to to be commended for their professionalism as it added to my overall experience that this was a special visit.The hotel restaurant (with diner atmospherics) has now opened. I ate a late lunch here the day I arrived (in a snow storm). It was fine, although the hamburger was small and definitely on the pricey side even for Times Square. It does however have a good selection and is a convenient option.There is a quasi business center option - a row of computers off the lobby. Printing boarding passes are free and up to 15 minutes and black and white printing is free (handy when I needed to print out tickets, an itinerary and a receipt).I found a great pre-paid deal that made the week very affordable. Their standard rates are a little higher, but I still think it equates to being very good value, particularly compared to other equally priced hotels I have stayed at in New York over the years.It has been a few years since I have stayed at Times Square, as I usually stay near Wall Street for work or Soho or Upper West side for play. The advantage of the Hyatt is that it is just off Times Square on 45th Street, so you are a little away from the craziness, but also just steps to the craziness, so pros both ways depending on what you are looking for. When I needed a new suitcase at 1.30am on a Friday, only in Times Square will you find stores open until 2am and 24 hour options to be able to pick up a suitcase. It is also very convenient to a variety of subway options. It is also an easy walk to 5th Avenue and Rockefeller Centre, and walkable south to Empire State Building and Herald Square or north to Central Park and Lincoln Centre. And, of course, very convenient to Broadway's shows.I did a lot of research to choose a hotel for this trip, and can say that my time at the Hyatt lived up to everything I had hoped for.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel within walking distance to so many things. Staff is great. Clean quiet rooms, worth the rate. Very polite staff even for NYC. The work out facility seems to be brand new. Had a great workout both days. Look forward to stay there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here over Valentine's weekend. Got a very good rate and were very satisfied with our experience. It is very close to Times Square, and that meant a great view on the action. It appears quite new so everything is in tip top shape and very clean. Pet peeve, wifi is not free, far from it in fact.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed there for a weekend in Febuary and got a promotion rate. There is nothing to complain, very clean room and comfortable bed and pillows. Good services. very much worth your every penny. will definately come back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've now stayed here three separate times and each time I'm impressed. That goes for the housekeeping, bellman all the way to the front desk attendants. Everyone is so polite,I just can't say enough about how much I adore this hotel.DID I MENTION HEATED FLOORS because those are kind of a big deal

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for four nights mid February 2014 with my 14 year old daughter. Hotel has fresh modern design. Standard queen room which had two queen beds. Good size room. Very comfortable beds. clean. Huge TV screen. not a lot of drawer storage space for clothes if there are more than two of you. Light switches took some getting used to. Booked through Expedia, which made it good value. All staff without exception were very pleasant and helpful. All requests dealt with very promptly. The WiFi in the room is expensive, I thought it should have been free. It is free in the lobby, but there are not many places to sit.The hotel wasn't very busy whilst we were there, but I suspect the lobby, which is not very big, would get a bit crowded at check out time at busier times of the year. Same with the diner at breakfast time.Excellent location next to Times Square within easy walking distance of most attractions.Diner food very good, especially the French toast and carrot cake, (had that twice!). Great view from the top floor bar. (have to be over 21 to enter). I would definitely return here next time we visit New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our visit began on a cold valentine's day with an extremely warm welcome by my hubby's new buddy Chester! The staff was extremely receptive and helpful. The attention to details in the rooms are amazing, our favorite feature was the 'All off/on' light switches by the night stands. The rainfall shower was a great addition. The view of times square was excellent. The docking station at the desk with the large television complemented our stay. The gym is well equipped. When we ordered delivery the front desk called to inform us that it had arrived and asked if we would like them to send the delivery person up to our room, when at the door, we were impressed that he was escorted by one the hotel's staff security. All in all we couldn't have chosen a better hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This Hyatt was only open 7 weeks when we stayed there. As a result, everything was in excellent condition. We stayed in an Executive Suite (two rooms: King bed + Queen sofabed), and were intrigued by the lighting system (labeled buttons on the walls in each room, various degrees of full and mood lighting) and the shower (rain-like). The King bed was comfortable, but the 7-week old Queen sofa bed was like any other sofa bed: lumpy and springy, therefore uncomfortable. On our first night I requested foam pillows, and while my request was given to the reception desk agent (standing in front of her), no foam pillows were ever delivered. We also had difficulty using the futuristic phones, which we came to find out on Day 2 were actually broken. The hotel sent someone to fix them, but he was unable to help; so the manager comped us a $35 restaurant bill to make up for it. All in all, I would consider staying here again if I need a Times Square hotel. The location was mere blocks from our theater and restaurant. Opt for one of the two delis just doors from the hotel for an affordable breakfast!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Wanted something between theater district and shopping and this was just the place. Room was equipped with coffee, refrigerator, large window and GREAT pillows. Quiet quiet quiet. Couldn't hear anything. Free Wifi only in lobby. Beds made European style but top sheets available on request :). Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay at the Hyatt Times Square was very comfortable. The hotel lobby is sleek and felt secure. The front desk was adequately staffed and made the check-in/check-out process very easy. The hotel is relatively new so we expected everything to be nearly spotless and show little signs of wear. We booked a standard room, but received an upgrade as Platinum members in Hyatt's rewards program. We were given a room on the 38th floor facing north. We didn't really care much about the views as we planned on being away from the room most of the time. The room was exceptionally quiet, very clean, and comfortable. The bathroom was well appointed and adequate in size. There was nothing lacking from the room.We stopped for a quick bite to eat at the T45 restaurant adjacent to the hotel lobby. The restaurant is a diner with a modern/upscale theme. We stopped in around 11:30 and had to order from the breakfast menu - that's when we should have left. $75 for 3 OJs, 3 pancakes, and omelet, and 2 coffees bordered on ridiculous. We were a bit pressed for time and I blame myself for staying, but that doesn't mean you should make the same mistake I did. I implore you to step outside just a few steps and you will find suitable options at a significantly lower cost.Overall, our stay was very pleasant and I would not only recommend the hotel, I would stay there again myself.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: New modern hotel steps away from Times SquareWell appointed modern rooms with a good set of amenities. Robes, large flat screen tv, Starbucks in the room. I didn't get the chance to visit gym or bar on 54th floor but told both are excellent.  Well priced. Good addition to hotel selection in this busy part on manhattan

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: When my husband told me that he had made reservations at a 'Times Square' hotel I groaned. Although we love being close to the Theater District, Times Square, with its noise and crowds usually makes us avoid this section of Midtown. The Hyatt Times Square changed our minds. This newly opened hotel, with its attentive staff and Zen-like lobby is an oasis of calm in this hectic part of Manhattan. We could not hear any street noise from our room on the 28th floor which made for a good night's sleep. We appreciated the extra touches like the plush robes and the heated bathroom floors. The room was well appointed with accessible bedside outlets for our many electronic gadgets. This one is definitely a keeper!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great property with great staff throughout. Only issue they have is their lobby has a wind tunnel issue when the door is opened but I assume they will find a fix. Their front desk staff and guest services folks are stellar; rooms are great with perfect bedding and spacious bathrooms. Cannot recommend highly enough; great new hotel in Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I took my wife to New York City for her 30th birthday. She loves Times Square so we decided to give this Hyatt a try. We stayed in Jan. of 2014. Our understanding was that the hotel had just opened in Dec. 2013. We love that everything was new and fresh and clean. The room was a very nice size for the price and we did have a tiny view of Times Square which was great. The shower was large, bathroom as a whole was very modern. Bed was comfortable. Staff was very friendly. The only drawback was no room service or anyway to make special accommodations so if that's needed you may want to stay somewhere else. There is a hotel diner in the lobby that's open till 11. I believe there is additional dining and nightlife options opening later this year. Overall it's a great value for being steps away from Times Square. We would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Spent a few nights here for business travel and it was a very enjoyable experience. Stands out most for the staff who are courteous, helpful and friendly. The room was large and comfortable, had the amenities I expected (look in the hutch for the coffee pot), and was peaceful and quiet at night. Nice view as well. Good location made walking to the office during the day and the night life in the evening easy. Many good restaurants in the area and Times Square is literally at the end of the block. I would stay here again, for both business and pleasure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I live in the New York suburbs, so stays in New York hotels tend to be few and far between. Every single person with whom I interacted at the Hyatt, both during and after my stay, was a consumate professional, and truly pleasant. I booked my stay at the Hyatt Times Square literally at the last minute last week. Tuesday night (the 4th) the weather was forecast to be miserable overnight. I had early morning meetings in Manhattan on Wednesday morning so at 9 p.m. I booked a room at the Hyatt. I got to the hotel at 11 p.m. and was greeted pleasantly and promptly by the folks at the front desk. My room on the 38th floor was a good size for a New York hotel room and was furnished simply and tastefully. The bathroom was also a good size and very modern. Overnight I couldn't hear a peep from Times Square - and woke up to the promised sleet and freezing rain. The one thing I had forgotten to pack was my umbrella so I prepared myself for a seven block walk in the rain. When I checked out both the staff at reception and the doorman insisted I take an umbrella, and I am so glad I did. The weather was miserable and I can't even imagine how much worse it would have been without that protection.Thursday morning I realized I had left my perfume in the hotel room so I called the hotel and the person with whom I spoke was great - asked my name and pertinent details of my stay. The housekeeper had turned in my perfume to the lost and found and they had made a note in my reservation - including what type of perfume it was. She couldn't have been any nicer and put my perfume at the front desk for me to pick up. When I went to pick up my perfume I also took the chance to return the much appreciated umbrella. They even checked my ID for me to pick up my perfume - which I really appreciated - wouldn't you hate to leave something behind and have someone else end up with it?So long story short - if I ever need to stay in Manhattan again this is the place for me.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: !!! Perfect for a Weekend Stay in the heart of New York City, Times Square !!! It should be said that all rooms are above the 23rd floor which means that you get to be in the belly of the beast and yet sleep soundly. Very new hotel with a boutique feel and small tastefully decorated lobby. The hotel is only open a few weeks old so the roof top lounge and a few other features still are not open. We were the first to stay at the Premier Suite given to us, which was pretty cool.The Bedroom, Nice Large Comfy Bed. Loved the white comforter that they change between visitors, no germs bedspread. Slightly odd ornamentation above the bed which included a small porcelain figure that looked like a balloon animal !!!The Hotel offers Great amenities in case one needs it, its the small touches that makes a 5 Star experience. The bathroom had a heated floor, which you could adjust. Bathroom had a rain style shower. Cool lighting options. Overall the room design was great. Suite features a private terrace, soundproofed floor-to-ceiling windows that overlook the Times Square area, one king bed and a 47-inch flat-screen TV. The sleek, residential vibe includes a spacious living and dining area, plus an eclectic collection of New York City-themed artwork complemented by a backdrop of neutral, light-toned fabrics and warm woods. The suite features a modern master bathroom with rain shower and separate soaking tub.The Negatives would be: The TV is using IP and freezes up constantly which became annoying while watching Morning news. The Toilet in the bathroom was not functioning well, required at least 3-4 flushes and had a odd odor coming from it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spent 5 days at this Hyatt on a business trip. The location of the hotel is great if you want to be near Times Square and the Broadway shows. It's also a reasonable walk to most midtown locations. The hotel is new, so the facilities are clean and in good shape. The staff was very friendly and professional. The rooms were functional, the bed comfortable, and the shower nice. Those are the positives. As for the negatives, the room service is below par. They deliver food in brown paper bags with plastic utensils and cups -- as if you were just ordering take out. The restaurant in the hotel is overpriced and underwhelming. I think it's supposed to be an upscale diner, but the food is average, the selections limited, and the waiters are made to wear awful uniforms. The décor of the hotel rooms and hallways reminds me of the things I don't like about 70's style. The rooms are fairly basic and bland. If you're looking for a special place to stay, this is not it. If all you expect is a comfortable bed and good location, it's a fine option if the price is right.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Took over 1 hour to deliver robe which should've bern in room upon arrival. When I askef why they said "we forgot"!!! Heating system blew hot and then cold air out making sleeping and being comfortable impossible. Checked out day early because it was so terrible. Never again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: From the moment we pulled up and Walter greeted us we only met smiling,happy helpful staff. Check in was a breeze and our room was spotless,and comfy. Refrigerator coffee maker and big stall shower, even a magnifying mirror.As for the restaurant we actually like it. One of the best steakhouses in NY is across the street and there is no lack of restaurants in the area. We love a NY diner experience for breakfast and the staff is very accommodating with special requests. Had a great salad with salmon done to perfection for dinner one night. Had a great steak across the street another night.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked 3 rooms in Hyatt Times Square for a week mixed with business and vacation.The rooms have nice decor, BUT...lack of closet space...in our room there was only 1closet door and 3 drawers.Bedside table has a mock drawer...when you open it is like a support to put your laptop and not a real drawer...when you checked in for a week stay during the winter, this can be annoying!They don't have room service...there is a restaurant that can deliver to your room in take out packaging and is not 24h.... but for the cost of room service. The first day we ordered breakfast (the order came all wrong!!) for U$ 70,00 for 2. Save your money and go to Starbucks across the street!The hotel is in soft open mode...ok...so they placed us on 28th floor, in which only 2 elevators could reach...on the 3rd day I was leaving for a meeting and I've got stuck in one elevator for a few minutes.On the 4th day I had to wait the elevator for 15min...And it only came up when I called reception for the second time. I've made complaints about this situation and the staff was nice...They removed some charges of my bill to make up for the situation. Be aware of street noise on lower levels.There is a very nice gym in site and they were about to open the spa....Maybe you should wait a little longer to stay there...for sure there are some adjustments to be made!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square for Super Bowl weekend. We had considered many options and happened upon a good deal for this hotel. We do not regret our choice. The room was good size, the bed was comfy, there was no problem with noise. We had a nice view of Times Square. We were put on the 32nd floor in room 3202. We were greeted warmly upon arrival, the concierge provided excellent directions to Penn Station including what subway lines to use to get to and from Penn. The doormen were excellent. T45 (on site restaurant) offered up tasty burgers and fries as well as a delicious chocolate banana shake. Was a little on the pricy side but we were visiting New York and using the hotel restaurant, it was what I expected. Justin, our waiter, was extremely helpful on both occasions we used the restaurant and T45 is very lucky to have him on staff. The comment about the elevators going to specific floors is spot on but, once used to it, it wasn't a problem. Our only disappointment was that the rooftop bar wasn't yet open. The next time we go to NYC, we will certainly be looking to stay at the Hyatt Time square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very last minute trip to New York for me; had to plan everything a day out. I had heard about this hotel but didn't realize it had opened yet (opened about 6 weeks before my stay). Newer Hyatt concept. I couldn't have been more pleased with my stay.For starters, I was greeted on the street by Pablo, the Asst Guest Svcs Manager. He knew my name and what time I was supposed to arrive. Outstanding service. Check in was efficient, very smart staff there. Express elevators to the 34th floor (what a view!). Hallway signage was like the flipping number/letters at Grand Central, very cool. Room was contemporary and just my style. Very cool lighting pre-sets like 'mood light' or 'night light'. Shower? Forget about it....colossal shower head form the ceiling...perfect for a taller guy like me; this was one of the best showers I had ever had in a hotel.Liam, another manager called to check on how my stay was going. There was a great Irish pub next door with roof top deck. The hotel was only a half block off 7th Ave, perfect location. It only took me 10 min to walk to Penn Station with my suitcase. This will be my new home away from home in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We spent a few days at this recently renovated hotel. As others have mentioned it is well done, clean and has everything you need without going overboard. The best part was the staff who are working hard to create a good environment. The hotel is still not yet finished, there are still many floors to complete and the roof top lounge is not yet open. Of course, when we where there it would have been a little too cold but it should be great by spring time. It is very handy to Times Square and the Theaters. We'll happily return as long as the price stays reasonable.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Rooms are really nicely appointed. Heated floors in bathroom are a nice touch. Very clean and comfortable with good gym facilities. I did not eat at the restaurant, but thought they could have a better choice with more of a bar to dine at. Also though brand new, the concierge was not aware of the bars and restaurants right next door to them. They should get to know the neighborhood (non-touristy choices) that frequent business visitors often prefer. Would get 5 stars, but for these minor notes.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I just completed a two-night stay at the Hyatt Times Square. The rooms are decent size for NYC and very clean and well appointed. I enjoyed my TV welcoming to my room with my name on it. Nice touch. The hotel is simple and it makes getting around it quite easy. No major lobby to mention, which means no globs of tourists loitering. Check-in was quick and easy with no wait. Elevators are probably the fastest I have been in while in NY - including most office buildings. This is a huge plus when trying to get down to get to a meeting. I had a King room with a 40 inch or so TV, desk, and lounge chair. The floors are small. Maybe 10 or so rooms on my floor. It was very quiet and did not hear any noise from either inside or outside. It was a pleasant stay and a much needed break from the craziness of the overly touristy hotels and the conference hotels. This is a perfect fit for the business traveler who must be in this area of NYC. It would also be great for couple who want a quiet get away and want to be near TSQ. Only downside at the moment is that the rooftop bar is not yet open. But should be soon.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in this hotel for one night during my weekend trip to New York. This is a new Hyatt property opened in December 2013. The location is very central, just steps away from Times Square. I like the design of the hotel, I immediately liked it as you enter the room. According to their website, there are only 11 rooms on each floor. Not sure how many rooms they have altogether, but the check-in area is too small and too standard. I am surprised that the refrigerator in the room is empty. The lounge at the top of the building is not yet opened. The staff told me it is expected to be opened next week. The price at weekends is very reasonable so I recommend it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed the night of January 24th. Pulled up and were greeted by very friendly doormen who assisted us with luggage (in town of a competition so there were quite a few bags) and helped steer the kids into the warm lobby. Check in was a breeze with the bar code scanning machine and the front desk staff immediately answered all of our questions.Stayed in room 702 - I was worried we were so low it would be noisy but it wasn't. I did hear a few sirens - but it's NYC! The room had 2 queen beds that were enveloped in white - duvet, sheets and pillows. How nice! Love that crisp clean look. There were ample outlets available at desk level and even a power strip built into the desk. An amenity list was available for items you forgot - we did need a few. What we requested was promptly delivered with a smile. (extra towels, shampoo, mouthwash etc). My only complaint was the lights....good concept - difficult execution. For the life of me I could not figure our how to keep just one bedside light on for reading!The bathroom was very nicely done - hooks to hang up towels, plenty of counter space, large, clean and spacious shower. I love that the shower had a small ledge for propping up your leg when shaving! It was a small space, but well designed. We left the next morning after a quick breakfast in the room. I made a run to the deli a few doors up and came back with a feast for a great price. Starbucks is across the street.All in all an excellent visit. You know how sometimes you stay in a hotel and think - Man this wasn't worth the cost...well this one was! And again, props to the staff at the hotel - everyone was very friendly and seemed very happy to be working were they are. Will not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my first stay in a top class NYC hotel. My first impression, of course, was of the staff who greeted us by name at the door and who took care of the car. It was a cold, dull afternoon in January but they gave us the brightest welcome. That welcome extended into the reception area. Everything was just right; professional, efficient, friendly and courteous. Everyone smiled at us and that was a pleasant surprise. It is a brand new hotel and everything was sparkling. The room was compact, but everything was there, slippers, robes and a perfect bed. The bathroom had every amenity and facility. We only used the restaurant for breakfast, there is so much competition in the surrounding streets, but again, everything was so right.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for four nights and just loved it. In the past, Times Square was never my location of choice due to the noise and general craziness, but after reading about the new building with sound-proof windows, and being a longtime fan of Hyatt, I decided to give it a try (the opening introductory price on Hyatt.com helped persuade me). Its atmosphere is similar to the Andaz Wall Street. They upgraded us to a View King on the 29thfloor due to my platinum status. The room had very modern décor, with NYC-themed pop art. We enjoyed all the modern amenities: super comfortable top-of-the-line Hyatt bed (not like the ones at the Hyatt Place Mid-town); robes and slippers; fast wifi and great TV; pretty quiet heater, etc. - all the things that you'd expect from a category six Hyatt/Andaz brand. The gym and rooftop lounge were not ready yet, but that was fine since when I am in Manhattan I must walk 4 or 5 miles a day. The location, of course, can't be beat. Subway stations were plentiful and close by, a Starbucks was just across the street, and all the theaters we went were within two blocks, crazy. The hotel is very well managed; someone is doing a great job. Young staffers were well trained in the best Hyatt manner, friendly and courteous. The assistant manager, Liam, was there the whole time of our stay; we were impressed with him and all the people working there. The only minor problem I noticed was that housekeeping was not always impeccable (unfortunately for the housekeepers, even a day's worth of dust is quite noticeable in a new walnut and brass-furnished room with white linens). I have stayed in many Hyatts of all levels and, overall, this one really stands out among other big-city hotels. We slept so well, it was like being in a urban retreat. Just to see what we were missing, I opened the window a crack (yes, they open) and the sound outside was what we would have heard if we had stayed at other hotels around Times Square. Thank you HTS. Looking forward to our next stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt Times Square. I was a little reluctant about staying there because of the location; I thought it would be so chaotic and not relaxing at all. To my surprise, the stay was quite the opposite. I think the windows must be sound-proofed because I didn't hear any noise from outside, despite the great Time Square view.
