(It was the best of both worlds.)The room itself was terrific. When I opened the room doors, I felt at home. (I love that feeling!) Everything was fresh and crisp and the décor was light and airy. The quality of all the furniture (especially the small coffee table) was noteworthy. The bathroom was elegant.The staff were all friendly and accommodating. The only not so great feature I'd say is the hotel restaurant. I agree with other reviews that it's a little pricey for what you get. It's not bad; it's just not great like some of the other Hyatt property restaurants that I've experienced.I hope to return again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just opened in December 2013; got a great deal on a view room by paying in advance; on the 34th floor; fabulous view of Times Square; one block from Kinky Boots, Pippin, and Twelfth Night; wonderful & attentive staff!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would love to keep this place all to myself but to do so would be very unfair to the wonderful people who staff this chic new hotel. Literally, the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome. From the smiling doorman to the cheerful maintenance man, everyone seemed happy to help us and delighted to be working there. The room was small but the bed comfortable and the bathroom sleek and immaculate. The location was ideal for dinner and a show. The only negative was that breakfast was a bit pricy at the diner on site ($22.00 for eggs, bacon, potatoes) but there are many places to eat within walking distance so not a huge issue. We have stayed in many wonderful hotels in New York but this place may just have the right combination of features to replace all of them!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A friend and I came to NYC for a girls trip. This was our first time in NYC and we loved the Hyatt Times Square. We were upgraded to a room with a view and heated bathroom floors, it was spacious and clean. The hotel is new and one of the restaurant/bars is not open yet. The restaurant in lobby had a great breakfast menu, I had the Plain Jane Waffles and they were delicious. Be careful the waitress came by when we sat down and offered us orange juice, we accepted and also ordered coffee. We were shocked when we received our check and realized we were charged $6 each for the orange juice and $6 each for coffee (it was GREAT coffee), but OUCH $24 in coffee and orange juice is expensive. The concierge was extremely helpful in helping us Texas girls figure out the New York City subway system. I enjoyed our stay and loved the hotel, but if I go back to NYC I will not be staying at Times Square. Times Square was to busy, to many people, to loud. Next time I think I will try the Hyatt 48 Lex in Midtown NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A couple of weeks ago, we spent Saturday Night in Manhattan to celebrate my wife's birthday. After dinner we went to the Hyatt, and to our surprise they upgraded us to an executive suite on the 22nd floor and extended checkout till 1 pm, We very much enjoyed the view and the big room! Overall a pleasant experience with the staff being courteous from the front desk to the housekeeping. I highly recommend the hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family stayed in this hotel for 5 nights during Christmas. The hotel was newly opened less than three weeks before we arrived. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room is a little bit small for two double bed. The bathroom is nice and clean with heated floor. We were a little bit disappointed with the Christmas decoration at the lobby. We didn't feel a Christmas touch there. We understand that the hotel's style is minimalist but Christmas days with a barely Christmas decors..? Aside from that, everything else was good. Efficient and fast check in and out. Elevator was also fast and efficient because there was an attendant there to flow the guests to their right elevator according to their floor. But, the best of all, is the location. It's right in the heart of Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff were extremely helpful and polite. Hotel was very clean. Not the most happening hotel bar scene if that is your thing. No gift shop but they provided us with toothpaste, newspapers, etc when asked so that was nice. Perfect location.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I are frequent NYC visitors and have stayed in many places and are big on Hilton hotels. Due to cold weather I wanted to try to get as close to TKTS booth and after much researching how many minutes to walk from each hotel decided to try the new hyatt. Rate was very good being MLK weekend, believe it or not weather does not stop visitors to NYC. We are very impressed, first let me say for NYC rooms these are big. Beautiful rooms, bathrooms were very modern, spacious, and great rain shower. For the reviewer who didn't like the lights control, we found it very convenient to have all the controls by each of our beds and loved the different ways we can have light. Also every time we travel we have problems plugging in electronics and they have multiple outlets on bedside table by both beds so you wont need to plug your phone in across the room. Love the pillows. The best tv I have ever had in a hotel room, crisp clear picture. Refrigerator in room with coffee maker if needed. Starbucks straight across street if needed. Very modern gym . Staff is very friendly and talkative. Safety is great, employees at door and elevators. Also it was raining and they have umbrellas at front door for you to use. I have never had a hotel anywhere do that. I can also state my room was right by the ice maker and I didn't hear a thing. but there is an outer door from where the ice maker is to the two rooms next to it but I never closed it. Housekeeping staff very friendly and efficient.. Most hotels due charge for internet , I didn't find the price unreasonable. I prefer a little luxury when I travel and cant say enough about this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Detailed review...Stayed at the newly-opened Hyatt at Times Square (W 45th Street). Service was wonderful... Friendly, accommodating staff. Rooms were more spacious then expected. Had two adjoining rooms on the 30th floor. Kids in the double, husband and I in the king. Mini fridge, safe & lg screen LCD TV are nice touches. Plenty of conveniently-located outlets for all my husband's electronics. In-room food svc avail, although we didn't take advantage. We ate lunch at the T45 Restaurant located in the hotel. Very good salads and spicy "fried" chix wings. Back to the room... We enjoyed the pillows a lot and to my delight, they allowed you to purchase ($65/per). Location to Times Square and Broadway, was ideal. Valet & concierge services are top notch. Only downfall is the cost of everything... $4 for a bottle of water (hotel) and $6 for a cup of tea (restaurant), but we've come to expect this during our visits to the City, especially in this area. Only other minor complaint is the "dryness" of the rooms which is common in large hotels. However, you can request a humidifier for your room, if this is problematic. Hoping the service continues beyond the "honeymoon" period. We'll definitely stay again when we visit in the spring.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My stay at the Hyatt Time Square was really nice. From check in to check out, the whole experience was lovely. The staff made my stay very pleasant. Such a friendly group of people. It added just that little bit extra pleasantness to my experience there. The room was nice! It was enough for me, just one person. Plenty of space and the room was well designed. The room was neat and super clean, with a really nice colorful chair. The TV, wow..at least 42 inches with a connection centre at the desk. The bed was cozy with quality pillows. Plenty of towels in the bathroom.The lighting in the room was really cool. The lighting moods are shown on each light switch. I found this very handy.I stayed on the 33 floor and I think that I did have to wait for like 5 minutes for the lifts to come at least two times. Not exactly a show stopper for me.The T45 Midtown Diner located on site: EXPENSIVE! It was empty when I went in to look at the menu and I could see why. There was mac and cheese on the menu and I think I recall it being over $10. I really intended on eating at the diner but it was just unreasonably priced. I went and had three slices of pizza and a drink for less. You can’t go wrong with the hotel and the location. Right in the middle of Manhattan,…in the middle of it all. The standard at the Hyatt with the amenities in the room is one of the best for hotel chains. I will certainly be back in the very near future!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first trip to NYC and we travelled in a big group. The hotel can accommodate our request to be put on the same floor. Location was amazing, just one block away from Times Square. Every staffs that we saw was very friendly and chatty. Rooms are clean and modern, though the size of the rooms are quite small. But hey, this is NYC, we understand :) Great gym, equipments are complete.The only thing missing was a sitting area in lobby. Since we travelled in a big group, we always set lobby as our meeting point and no place to sit.Overall it was a pleasant stay. Well done Hyatt Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife booked this hotel as it is newly opened and showed lots of promise being steps away from Times Square. And with our 4 spent nights here, it didn't disappoint! The staff were top notch and very helpful and so cheerful always sporting an unforced smile! Special shout to Steve the doorman who always had a smile for my wife and greeted us everytime we entered/exited, even in the minus 14 temperatures! Our 34th floor room had a beautiful view of the City and sported a superb state of the art entertainment centre of which the centrepiece was a huge 50" LG Smart TV! The only reasons I gave 1 less star is due to the 54th floor 'Sky Bar' not being open as yet and our room being just a tad smaller than expected as we struggled to house our 4 large pieces of luggage. Give this place time and it will be a must stay place in NYC!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location a half block from Times square is perfect, especially if you are going to the theater. It was so nice to just stroll a few blocks back to our room on the cool rainy January nights. The hotel is so new, and clean, and modern. Loved the bathroom. More hotels should do away with tubs, and curtains and use nice walk in stalls with glass doors and overhead rainshower heads. Very nice. The beds are very comfortable. Room is spacious by NYC standards, although there is not a lot of room for luggage. 2 bags for 2 people is about max that will fit. a very minor nitpick about the room...I really dislike the way the lights are wired together, with common switches. I could never figure out how to get the lights I wanted. Who wants to turn on the bathroom light and have the room lights go on?? Please, hotel designers...just put switches on the lamps. Its better that way.The staff is really unbelievably warm and friendly. Everyone said hello and had a smile for us, and helped. When we needed an umbrella, and the doorman had run out, the manager quickly found a new one for us to borrow. We ate breakfast in the attached diner and found the friendliness extended into there. The waiter knew our coffee preferences by the second morning, and was very nice. Food was good. A little expensive, but hotel restaurants always are. With the 30% discount it didn't seem so bad.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: New tall Hyatt just far enough away from Times Square to be a bit quieter, but so close to the heart of Broadway. Minimalist modern, which maybe isn't me but might be you. Can't really fault another thing. The best hotel lobby and wait staff interaction I've seen in years. You really might want to try this one yourself.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: very nice service with friendly stuff. The location is great and very close to times square. The hyatt title was knida small that it took me time to find it. The view was okay but can only see a little of times square. Nice and clean rooms and good fitness center. The stuff was very enthusiastic and we talked about where to visit. Btw, we had dinner at Daniel. It was amazing!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would first like to say Happy New Year to everyone... My family and I spent 9 nights at the Hyatt Times Square.. When we first arrived we felt straight at home ... we were warmly welcomed by Aaron and Steve ... who were always so helpful everytime we arrived back at the hotel or left to go somewhere... whether it was dinner or sightseeing..Thank you!! Than the warm welcome at Reception by all the staff... and the security.. they were all hospitable .. and as for the most wonderful and helpful Andrew.. The Concierge... Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! He really knows his stuff.. always on the ball and very informative..So.... so far.... So GOOD..!!The ROOMSBefore I made a booking for this hotel I did a lot of research for New York Hotels...The Room was spacious with 2 nice sized beds .. (most important..NEW... and NO BED BUGS!!)comfortable linen and pillows.. lots of space so pretty spacious with the 4 of us in one room..THE BATHROOM... We were there over New Years.. so it was cold... but the pro of the Bathroom was that it was SPACIOUS... WARM as it had underfloor heating..so when you step out of the Shower... its nice and warm... The shower was nice and spacious.. you could have a small party in there!!The view was Ok but really guys being in the heart of Times Square what view are we really gonna get.. unless you wanna see Times square itself .. and being on 45th .. we were really unaffected by our view we were in room 3007... Floor 30... it was peaceful..obviously on New Years Eve we heard noise.. Housekeeping were very tolerant.. seeing we would only leave the room round 11 some mornings.. we were never harassed.. and the room was always cleanThe ROOM has a safe and mini bar.. which is always useful to stock a few perishablesLocation..was fantastic I tell you why.. originally I booked for the Renaissance Times Square and after seeing the location I am very happy I booked the Hyatt Times sq reason being you will not be trampled on when you leave the hotel.. as the renaissance has millions of people passing the front entrance. I am sure its very nice if you want a view of Times Square when they have the Ball drop or you like the hustle and bustle..One negative.. I think that wifi should be free or there should be a minimal charge when staying at the hotel... there is free lobby wifi.. but all it does is make the hotel look shabby with Guests lounging around on their phones using the free lobby wifi...doesn't make sense..hopefully the hotel can change their policy on this one to make my rating 10/10 as this is really the most annoying thing out of my entire stay..I would like to Thank all the staff at the Hyatt Times Square for making mine and my families stay so memorable...Good Luck for 2014..

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One half block from the heart of New York City, Times Square. Great location. It should be said that all rooms are above the 23rd floor which means that you get to be in the belly of the beast and yet sleep soundly. Very new hotel with a boutique feel and small tastefully decorated lobby. Upon entering the hotel I immediately noticed the check-in machines. I've said this before; I like to think that these machines can augment the check-in/check-out experience and not replace the human touch that makes good hotels stand out. This was indeed the case here at the Hyatt Times Square. After noticing the machines I looked toward the check-in desk and was immediately greeted by one of the friendly staff members behind the counter who was willing to help me get checked-in. This is really the most interaction I have at any hotel and the staff here were ready and willing to help. The rooms feel new. The bathrooms felt very clean and modern. The room has a large 40"+ sized TV. There is the ability to open the window about a 8-12 inches so you can get a feel for the city below if you want. Other than that probably as you would expect. Slightly odd ornamentation above the bed which included a small porcelain figure that looked like a balloon animal(?).Although I didn't have an opportunity to dine there, the restaurant off the lobby had a menu full of tasty dishes. There was a special of 30% off menu prices for hotel guests for breakfast and dinner.The only other thing I would mention is that there seemed to be a lot of employees in the lobby at all times. I counted 6 minimum and at point counted 10 people! Overall the room was great; very clean and well maintained. A good solid experience from the Hyatt brand.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our stay at the Hyatt Times Square was very disappointing. There were numerous problems.We had requested a view of Times Square. When we arrived, whatever room we had been assigned too, obviously did not have a view. Terese said she would try to get us higher up for a better view. Hard to tell what the original view must have been. What we got with the higher up room on the 12th floor was a view of a white water tank and a gymnasium with people on a treadmill. We think the hotel should have called us and informed us that what we requested was not available so we could have changed to a different hotel. Next, we asked the Conceirge directions to Rockefeller Center so we could walk to it. The Conceirge gave us wrong directions and we probably walked a mile turning the wrong way as he had informed us in freezing cold weather. Thankfully, a homeless man on the street showed us the right way. We were most apreciative of him. The room (1207) was small. Not nearly enough room for 3 suitcases. The heater in the room went on the blink the first night. For well over 10 minuetes it would start and stop every 5 seconds. On and off over and over again every 5 seconds. Finally, it came back to normal operation. The electrical panel for the computer access area overheated. It was quite noticeable and my laptop cord got very hot as did the panel. We then only used one plug and it remained cool. The internet speed was not sufficient to support a skype call we made. The call stopped in the middle of it. There were no heated tiles in the bathroom as we had read about. The newspaper was not delivered as promised until we complained about it. After we had complained, Didi called our room and said she would have management contact us. To date that has not happened. The bathroom ceiling was not caulked in on the ceiling. The ice machine went haywire in the hallway and went on for the longest time making and or dispensing ice. We didnt go out to see what it was. The T45 diner did not appeal to us. It looked a little bit like what you'd see in a food court in an airport terminal. Didnt appeal to us. We didnt eat there. .On the plus side, the two outside doormen, Steve and Chester are by far the best employees. They really do a good job. The location of the hotel is good and only a short walk to Times Square but we did have to walk by piles of garbage that was on the sidewalk and street. Our grandson left his Elmo blanket underneath one of the sheets and we didnt realize it until after we had checked out. We called and the maid, Evelyn, must have found it and turned it in. Thank you Evelyn! When we called the hotel they said they would ship it to us but we would have to pay the air bill. Thought that was a bit cheap, but we were happy to hear it had been found. To date, there has been no charge for the shipping of the Elmo blanket. Special thanks to Laura L for shipping it to us. The welcome greeting on the TV when we entered the room was nice. Overall though, we were very disappointed. It was certainly not what we expected or requested. Several things did not work or happen and we wonder if there isnt an electrical problem in room 1207 due to an overheated eletrical panel and heater malfunction. The view was certainly not of Times Square as we had requested.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I give 5/5 for the service, the staff, the overall atmosphere of the place, the location, the cleanliness of the rooms! We were pleasantly surprised to see people who seemed happy to do their job. Everyone was friendly, cheerful and very helpful. Every question we had was answered in a remarkable way (roads to take, good restaurants, important things to know about the city of New York). Unfortunately, I have only one negative review to share. There is a charming little restaurant / bar on the first floor of the hotel, we were very happy to know that there was this place because we were in New York for work, and we thought it would been nice to eat breakfast in the morning at this place and drink a glass of wine in the evening ... But we were shocked to see the price, this is too much! I understand that the hotel is in Times Square and it is supose to be more expensive, we were willing to pay a little more because of the location, but it was just ridiculously expensive. So we did not get to enjoy this place ... Too bad! It was the only negative thing, otherwise everything is A1, nothing to say, we will return for sure! ;)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location was perfect! The hotel is new....actually our floor had only been open for two weeks. Extremely clean. The staff was incredible. So friendly and kind. Always willing to help.There is no doubt this will be my place to stay when visiting New York!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for my birthday. Wonderful stay. We had Broadway theater tickets so we wanted to be close...short walk to the theater. Near lots of restaurants. The room was new, clean in a Euro/modern style...great décor. The bathroom had a heated floor, which you could adjust. The flat screen TV was wall mounted and large. Bed comfy. Bathroom had a rain style shower. Cool lighting options. Overall the room design was great. Loved the white comforter that they change between visitors...no germy bedspread. Thankfully the cafe/restaurant had recently opened. It was nice not to have to go out in the snow for breakfast. The bar drinks were a bit expensive but that's NYC. The staff was very friendly and helpful...mostly young people. Excellent location. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Looking forward to the rooftop bar and the spa opening.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: WOW! What a treat. We came down from Montreal even though our flight was cancelled and had a fabulous week-end! Location is so convienent to discover Manhattan: steps from subway, Time Square, MoMA etc. The staff was great, always smiling and eager to help! The room was perfect with beautiful view: you have the feeling of a boutique hotel since only 10-11 rooms per floor. Thanks to Bryan and the front desk team, to Corey and Andrew at the concierge desk for great recommendations....cannot wait to go back and visit their 54th floor SKYBAR opening in February!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here for 2 weeks over Christmas and New Year and it was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The staff are all really friendly and helpful. The room was a very good size when compared to other NYC hotel rooms and was spotless and modern with a great view. The location is great for Times square, Bryant Park, Radio City and Rockefeller, and is only a few blocks from the subway. The hotel has a Diner that serves good food, and there is a rooftop bar due to open soon. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I came here, with a friend, for a two day getaway on Christmas Day and left the following Friday.Pros:-Very friendly staff-Conveniently located in the heart of times square-Rooms were comfortable and quietCons:-Certain elevators only go to certain floors, which was inconvenient being that I had to go down to the lobby to get up to my friend's floor-I am a clean freak and the room was not as clean as it should have been i.e. food left in the fridge from the last guest, hair on the bathroom floor-No free wifi-Poor tv receptionOverall, I enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed here over Christmas in an executive suite. New, stylish chic hotel 30 second walk from the front door to Times Square. It has the usual high quality, attention to detail and top service that we have come to expect with the the hyatt / andaz brand. The hotel is only open a few weeks so the roof top lounge and a few other features still are not open. The rooms still smell brand new and are stylish and comfortable with good quality features, comfortable bedding and stylish bathrooms. We were the first to sit at the bar downstairs and have a drink which was pretty cool. The staff in the new downstairs diner Justin and James deserve a mention for their friendliness and hospitality. All in all a top hotel in a perfect location minutes from all the shows and the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Would stay again no problem, good work guys!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just got back from staying here for 5 nights, firstly I would like to say that anyone who can write anything negative about this hotel need a reality check.Only just opened and yes the roof top bar and restaurant won't be ready for a month but this did not ruin our visit at all, there are plenty of places to eat and drink , it is NY.The staff were excellent , the doorman Steve and other doorman , reception, concierge and the staff in the diner , who only after being there one day they knew who I was the rest of the week, special thanks to the Barman who got me two ( English ) tea's every morning and had them ready for me when he see me walking in and to James who was brilliant.As for the Hotel itself , it's very modern,very clean and very welcoming.Can't wait to return there soon and would recommend the Hyatt to anyone.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This place really shocked me. Apparently its only open a week or two so you'd expect some disorganisation. Not at all the case. My lord what a team of people. So professional and just plain nice. The highlight by far was the Irish bartender in the 1st floor restaurant. Like myself he's obsessed with Bourbon and i couldn't believe he knew more about it than me. Doesn't ever happen. He made me the best Manhattan i've ever had in my life and told me tales of the motherland. Just the nicest, funniest guy. Go visit James every time you're in NYC, i know i will.Great job Hyatt Times Sq. See y'all very soon!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 2 nights between Christmas and New Years - staff was very friendly and helpful (especially Chester the doorman). Housekeeping noticed we had more occupants than towels and was quick to bring by additional linens. Hotel location was excellent, valet parking was easy (allow 30 mins for pickup), lobby security was reassuring, and early check in and late check out was provided upon request given my Diamond status.Will be back once the restaurant has opened, diner has limited options and it would be nice not to battle the TS crowds for dinner with small children in tow.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My family and I stayed four nights including New Years Eve. The hotel was not fully complete and only opened a few weeks before we arrived but you wouldn't know it from them service of the staff - each and every one we came in contact with was nicer ad more helpful then the last. The doormen - Walter, Chester and Aaron are the most helpful people i have met. The rooms are spacious, clean and have all that you need. The location is 1/2 a block from Times Square - close enough to be right there but far enough to be out of the way. i have no hesitation recommending this hotel. My only regret was that the roof top restaurant was not opened as yet. I thought however, the restaurant in the lobby is very expensive for what it is - $20 for a Jamisons is steep.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here a week before Christmas for two nights and had a great experience. The location of this hotel is ideal for all types of travelers. I was in an executive suite with my wife and son and we had plenty of room to relax after a long day of running around the city. Staff in all departments were friendly and helpful as can be, always looking to go that extra mile for you without even asking. The lobby was clean but a little under decorated, most likely due to just recently opening. Our room was clean, spacious, and quiet, which is always a plus.The restaurant was not open yet, but I will be sure to check it out at our next visit. Only negatives on our trip here I can attribute to just some growing pains for being so new. Elevators seemed out of sync, having to wait a little too long to catch one on more than one occasion. And valet parking, which when I was leaving took about an hour for my car to arrive since the cars are parked off site. But the more than helpful valet called numerous times questioning what was taking so long, brought a chair out from inside so we could sit since there are no seats outside, and even offered water.Overall I plan on staying in this hotel again on my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Times Square over the Christmas holidays. It was to be a trip of a lifetime. I purchased cancellation insurance due to the unpredictable weather at that time of year. Sure enough there was an ice storm and we were delayed one day. I contacted the hotel early in the day that we were supposed to check in and let them know we were desperately trying to get a flight into New York but it wouldn't be until the next day. We finally arrived and the hotel was very nice and everything we expected. The staff were friendly and helpful. We were disappointed in the fact that there was nothing compensated to us for paying for all 7 nights when we only stayed 6. I understand the policy of 24 hour room cancellation but I wasn't planning on canceling my room at all. I was on a plane headed to New York and became stranded. Any small gesture would have been appreciated seeing as the room was $400 a night. Even a restaurant voucher for the overpriced diner. But nevertheless, there was no Christmas spirit in the heart of the corporate Hyatt.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband, son and I stayed in this hotel for 7 nights in the view room with two beds. The location is great. Very close to Times Square, but enough off the square that you can avoid the mobs if you want to. Easy walking distance to Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center and most of the subway lines. Our room was on the 46th street side on the 30th floor and was very quiet. The Good: The hotel is new and clean. The beds are very comfortable with lots of feather pillows (foam available at request). Towels are luxurious too. The shower had a rain head and a hand held, good water pressure and constant temperature. The room has a large TV, safe, alarm clock, wireless phone, refrigerator and coffee maker. They will bring you a tea pot if you prefer and have a long list of things you can request (lighted make up mirror, curling iron, steamer etc.) Each nightstand had two plugs. The desk area also has two plugs, a USB port and a huge variety of other types of ports that would allow you to hook up all sorts of media to the TV I presume. There is a window that opens a bit which is nice. The Bad: Very little storage in this room. It would appear that there are 9 drawers in the unit at the end of the bed as well as three bedside tables (in rooms with two beds) but it isn't so. The unit at the foot of the bed has 3 small drawers. The rest of the unit contains the refrigerator, safe and coffee maker. The bedside tables have a false drawer that actually pulls out for additional table surface. A family of three, in winter, for 7 days, needs more than three small drawers and a closet with 8 hangers. (I'm sure they would have given more if we had asked, but we just folded everything and put it on the closet shelf.)The room has a complicated lighting system. While it's nice to have one button at the bed and door that allows you to turn off all the lights, and the mood lighting option was nice when getting ready for bed, if your spouse turns off the lights in the bedroom, you can be left standing in a dark shower, or alternatively, you select the nightlight option to go to the restroom in the middle of the night, and it turn on a light in the bedroom too. The TV is using IP and freezes up constantly. The beds had a lovely duvet, but no flat sheet which I thought was really odd. Just the duvet. No option to sleep with just a sheet if you get hot. The HVAC worked really well, but it does blow on you in the bed. My husband was sick and he ended up sleeping with his head at the foot of the bed to get away from the air blowing on him.Other general info: The only free wifi is in the lobby and there is only one bench there. The "business center" is actually two stand up computers and a printer. You can print boarding passes for free, but anything else requires a credit card swipe. Wifi in the rooms is available for a fee. The restaurant was just average, and for what you pay, you can find better food with a short walk. The staff was delightful. Everyone seemed as if they were really working to make sure we were taken care of. This hotel is a couple of blocks from my office and I would definitely consider staying there again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was my family's first trip to New York. We wanted to stay close to Times Square. The Hyatt is a brand new hotel. The rooms were clean and of good size. The decor is trendy, modern, and hip. The concierge was able to recommend good restaurants and assisted with the reservations. The only improvement i wish they put in was more elevators. There are over 50 floors but only 5 elevators. Other than that, this is a great hotel to visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First of all....great new hotel and what I usually expect from the entire Hyatt chain. Just a couple of things, it was the night of the snow storm and my flight was hovering between being cancelled or extremely late. I am Hyatt Diamond and when I called to explain that I may not arrive until the morning, the first response was that I was still going to pay for the night. Wait...I spend countless nights in Hyatt's a year, was coming from one Hyatt to another Hyatt....and the snowstorm of 2013 was delaying my arrival and you are still going to charge me?? Get real.The hotel itself was great...btw....the elevators don't work real well and take you to lots of destinations except where you really want to go. Restaurant wasn't open yet. Fitness club was perfect and immaculate. Rooms were spacious and clean especially for NYC standards. Surprised that there weren't USB charging ports in a brand new city hotel, but no big deal. Housekeeping staff was amazing, polite, and can't say enough good about them.Would go back except for one thing which is beyond their control...too close to Times Square...especially Times Square at Christmas time. Overall,....kudos to the Hyatt leadership. Nice job on this hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great experience in the hyatt times square, we stayed 8 nights the hotel is new, some areas o the hotel are not yet opened but it did not afect ua at all.Didi at the front desk checked us in ad was extremely nice, the manager in turn Bryan was also great and gave us a room upgrade, the staff on general is super friendly. The only bad thing and its not hotel related is how crowded times square is!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We booked the Hyatt Times Square in October before it opened. We arrived at 10am (way before check in) but they had a room ready for us which was great!! The room (King bed) was not big (to be expected in NYC) but had enough room and we never felt like we didn't have enough room. The bathroom had heated floors which was a plus. We never had any problems with the room. I forgot a few toiletries and the front desk helped me out with those. Also, we asked for a late check-out and were granted with it immediately. The hotel is close to everything especially Times Square. Closest subways are Rockefeller Center and Times Square. We could definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: On the plus side the room was good, clean and the staff excellent. The location was very central and great to walk almost anywhere. On the negative side i'd expect some common space in a hotel, a reception lobby, perhaps a bar, somewhere to sit and wait for family coming down, facilities that you'd think would be standard in a hotel. There was none of this - the ground floor had only 2 toilets for the whole ground both M/F facilities so only toilets for any one in the hotel - ground floor - they also served the new diner that had just opened - see below. Simply not enough.On the food side - when we first arrived they had set up the 2nd floor as a buffet breakfast and although it was small it was actually very good. 2 days in the diner on the ground floor opened and the breakfast buffet was closed. No notice at all we tuned up to eat and it had gone. We were guided to the diner that had just opened on the ground floor. We had eaten in the diner on the previous night (1st night it opened) and it was poor - the food was simply not great and outshone by the pubs to the left and the right of the hotel - so we went to the pub for breakfast - paid about half of what we had paid in the buffet the morning before but having said if they ran the buffet we'd still have eaten there.I'm hoping that they see sense and re open the breakfast buffet.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location just off Times Square, rooms nice, although the place has just opened, Times Square view from the room was not great and not worth paying extra for. Lobby shop was very expensive for soda, prob best use the cranberry deli next door, seemed to be a load of security staff on duty all of the time, not sure the reason. Staff were always friendly and courteous though, so no complaints. Internet seemed expensive at 17 a night. Overall the room was fresh and clean and the location was great to easily access the shops and attractions. I would recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I had reserved the room well before the hotel opened, and despite a few glitches, would highly recommend. We stayed for three nights mid-December. The room was new, immaculate and spacious, especially for NYC. Unfortunately we were given a room on the 9th floor without a view and couldn't change it. The elevators didn't always function well, and the TV cable repeatedly malfunctioned. We didn't get phone data connections in our room, so had to purchase a wireless connection. The staff was consistently courteous and apologized for some of the glitches. We were invited to a "trial run" breakfast prior to the opening of the new diner. Excellent food and service.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: What a wonderful weekend! The hotel was clean, spacious, modern and in the best location! Right outside of Time Square and short walk to Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall and a personal favorite Magnolia Bakery! We were in a king suite with connecting queen room and it was incredibly spacious. Good for a group of girls and mother of the bride! We stay in the city at least once a year and these rooms have more space than most we have stayed in. Bellman and Housekeeping were always kind and helpful with whatever we needed. The best part about the trip was the incredible staff. WOW!! My girlfriends had never been to the city before and Andrew was so helpful in getting them recommendations and information on what to do for our girls weekend! Thanks for being so helpful! Kerry, Yenny and Deedee were wonderful! They were so welcoming every time we walked in to the hotel! They are apart of our stories that we will have forever!Overall a wonderful hotel for any occasion. I cannot wait to go back when the rooftop bar is open! Hopefully we will be able to swing by for a night before we head to Europe for our honeymoon! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: One block from Times Square. You couldn't be any more central. For a brand new hotel, there were none of the expected glitches. The entire staff are outstanding. Any requests were delt with immediately. Parts of the hotel are still not available such as the restaurant, but there are hundreds of other restaurant choices within blocks. This hotel will be on our repeat list.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed in the Hyatt Times Square a week after it opened. The bellman made sure I didn't leave anything in the taxi. Check in was exceedingly smooth, and the staff at the Front Desk were very friendly and helpful, and made me feel right at home.The location is great - just a block from Times Square.The hotel itself feels almost like a boutique, a little rare for a Hyatt outside of the Andaz branded ones. The hotel was still ironing out a few kinks from the opening. The elevators were not working properly, and there were loads of workmen putting on finishing touches here and there.The room was a little on the small side, but the bed was super comfortable, and the bathroom had a great shower and heated floor tiles. Breakfast was relatively inexpensive, especially for New York. It consisted of a smallish but tasty buffet. It could have used a couple more healthier options like fresh fruit, yoghurt, granola, but had a variety of pastries, meats, cereals, and an omelet bar.Throughout the stay the service was great - not always what you expect in New York. I definitely recommend it and would stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We just stayed here last weekend for our first trip to NYC. The stay was absolutely perfect. The staff was great, the room was extremely clean and sylish. Use the knowledge of the concierge desk, they helped us book a helicopter tour and a broadway show. The helicopter tour (which I also highly recommend) was cheaper with them than it would've been booked online.The 2 headed shower and PLUSH robes are heaven. The only tiny downfall... although the lobby is beautiful and inviting, it isn't very big and waiting for someone downstairs isn't that convenient. We splurged for the guaranteed view and it was definitely worth it!!! The hotel is conveniently located only half a block from Times Square. Without a doubt we will be back! Especially when the rooftop bar opens :-)

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Yes, the hotel is new and beautiful, the rooms are a great size, great beds, loved the rain shower, and the location is perfect being just a few steps to Times Square...However, we were most impressed with the customer service: Professional & Personal at its best ~ The Front Office Crew was amazing! A special "Thank You" to Kerry and Liam for going out of their way on many occasions to make our weekend truly memorable, you were both incredible! The Bellmen and Housekeeping staff were equally as wonderful. It was a special bachelorette weekend for my daughter, and the experience could not have been more enjoyable for our family and her bridesmaids. (Danielle & Dee Dee thank you for taking their group picture and making great recommendations, the girls loved you!) We are definately looking forward to returning soon, this is an excellent hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt is in a great location at Times Square. The bed and pillows were awesome and I am all about comfort. The hotel is classy with a modern décor. Could not ask for a friendlier group of Hyatt employees. I would highly recommend this hotel for any length of stay.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Brand new hotel, rooms are new, clean and very stylish. We pulled up to the valet parking spot and before we could get out of the car the bags were unloaded and on the sidewalk. Checkin was super fast and uneventful.This hotel is a VERY short distance to the heart of Times Square. It's expensive but it is New York City and Christmas is a very busy time of year.I feel this hotel will be the new hotel for our annual trip to New York at Christmas time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really enjoyed my stay at Hyatt Times Square which opened Dec. 3rd. I was in town for the ICSC convention so I stayed Monday night. Hotel is conveniently located a half block from Times Square. Diner on site due (called T45 Midtown Diner) to open Dec. 22nd according to Richard the GM of the Hyatt. He and I bonded as we are both Phila Eagles fans and were hyped over the Dallas loss to Chicago on Monday night (which I didn't know until he told me)! Also the rooftop bar will be open at end of Jan. Rooms were quite comfortable and well appointed. The staff is very friendly and Richard even gave me a free Hyatt umbrella on Tuesday morning as a wet snow was falling in NYC then. I only had two basic complaints: when did hotels of this caliber stop putting coffee makers in room? Second, I wish there was some seating in the lobby/concierge areas as I was waiting for a call and after being on my feet all day at the convention, I was exhausted. I realize space is limited in lobby here but maybe seat benches back in concierge area? Otherwise a fine establishment. Spa is opening on 3rd floor soon too. Look forward to a return and see the joyful Richard again! Happy holidays to the Hyatt Times Square

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I and two other couples stayed for the final night of our vacation to NYC. We stayed at another hotel in Times Square the first few nights, which was nice, but this one was so nice. Everything new, perfect location in the heart of TS. We shared our room with another couple and the beds were nice sized queens and the room was much larger than other rooms we have had in NYC. The bathroom was great and fairly large with heated floor and rain shower. The room was so modern and high tech I actually had a hard time figuring some of it out. This is our fourth trip to NYC and we have stayed in about 6 different hotels but this one would have to be my favorite. Definitely worth it. The restaurant wasn't open yet and so I can really only speak about the room. Didn't try any of the other stuff. The staff was very friendly and accomidating.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I am a Platinum member of the Hyatt Gold Passport reward program. I stayed at this Hotel using my Two Free Nights after signing up for their Chase Hyatt Card.The Hotel is located between 6th and 7th Avenue on West 45th Street in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, bustling with Broadway patrons filing into restaurants nearby. And thick traffic honking thru Times Square.I used the AirTrain at JFK to reach the hotel via Jamaica Station where I switched to the E Subway Train, which is the Express into Manhattan. That cost me $7.50 one way.The Hotel did not have my requested room ready at check-in, which was to be a Double Queen Room. My nephew was joining me at the Hotel later. Steven, at the Front Desk, immediately offered me an upgrade for a King Bed with a view of Times Square, which I accepted. He personally took me to my room to see if I approved. And then 15 minutes later called me to let me know my original room request was ready. Steven, again, personally moved me to my preferred room, again, with a view.My request for late 2PM checkout was approved on the spot.The room is a good size and there is a desk with lamp. Floor lamp in the corner with a sitting chair and side table; reading lamps and night lights below the night stands, all controlled by buttons on the wall near the bed and desk area.The Flat Screen Television offered all Digital HD programming. There are 3 STARZ CINEMA channels to watch and a long list of the usual channels like Food Network, ESPN, CNN, etc. You can connect your personal devices to the Screen at the desk.Guest Services sent up sundries I had not packed—toothbrush, toothpaste, deodorant and mouthwash-- all gratis. As I put them away in the bathroom, I realized the tile floor is heated by control panel on the wall!! Fantastic in mid December NYC!! What a treat to return from the snow and wind outside and stand on the deeply warming tiles.The beds are wonderful. My nephew asked me if he snored all night, which he did. He only snores when he sleeps very deeply and soundly—and he greatly approved of the bed. I slept well, too.The restaurant is not completed. The bar on the rooftop is not completed. Steven offered to have sandwiches brought up from the tiny food market in the lobby. I think there is more option in walking next door to the deli which features everything you could want including a salad bar, deli counter, sushi and udon noodles, pizza, etc. Other nearby places to eat that we saw include Olive Garden, McDonalds, Planet Hollywood, Buca di Beppo, Subway, TGIFs, and many many other food joints.Everything is near the hotel. 30 Rockefeller Plaza with the famed ice rink and Christmas Tree, St. Patricks Cathedral and St. Thomas Cathedral, FENDI, Tiffanys, The Rockettes, Broadway Shows, and at least 3 different Subway lines with multiple entries in every direction steps from the Hotel. Great Police presence at all hours, too.I asked Guest Services where I could print documents. They directed me to computers near the Lobby behind Front Desk. I was shocked to see it was not free-- $5.95 for 15 minutes of Internet, charged to your credit card, and additional money to print pages. The machine would not read my card so I asked Stacey at Front Desk for help. She graciously let me log in to my Gmail at her Front Desk Terminal, and printed my document. So grateful for that small favor.Check out was quick and easy. They removed the Internet charge for my stay because I am Platinum Member. My nephew and I dove into a taxi out front, hailed by the doorman, and we were at Penn Station in 10 minutes flat—I timed it. Can’t wait to come back to HYATT TIMES SQUARE!! The staff rocks and the location is not to be beaten, for sure.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great new property, attentive and helpful staff, nice sized rooms and comfortable beds. The only exception would be the pillows, they flatten out to nearly nothing. All in all a good experience and would definitely return! Once the restaurant opens it should be even better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Even if the experience of staying in a brand new hotel doesn't sway you, the amazingly helpful and friendly staff of the new Hyatt will win you over. The beds are comfortable, the location is right off of Times Square with subway stops nearby, and the staff tripped over themselves to make sure that our needs were met. Steve and Walter were especially helpful, but truly everyone contributed to a great stay. I will definitely return to this hotel and appreciate such a great experience.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Really enjoyed my stay at the brand new Hyatt Times Square. When I arrived the very young hotel staff welcomed me with open arms and check-in was a breeze. I requested a king view room on an upper floor and that's exactly what I received. The room was very spacious and offered a superb view. It's location is in the middle of all the action and within walking distance of a huge array of restaurants, shops and the Broadway theaters. With this hotel only being open now for just over a week the diner style restaurant in the lobby along with the rooftop lounge have not been completed and the guest rooms are only available up to floor 29 but don't let that keep you from thinking about staying here.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The lobby is modern, minimalist, bright white walk to the elevators. Many happy staff everywhere on their third day open. We were the first to stay in our king room, 1811. The sleeping area was 13 by 15, with floor to ceiling window, full length mirror, safe, coffee, mini-fridge. Extra for internet in room. A hall to the modern bathroom, shower only. The location was perfect for theater. The hotel rooftop restaurant is not yet open. Hotel has Irish pubs on either side, but it was very quiet in the room on Saturday night. Manhattan hotel prices were very high on this tree-lighting weekend, but the Hyatt was a relative bargain.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Anytime you can stay in any new hotel in the Big Apple is a treat. This hotel is centrally located, half a block to Broadway and 2.5 blocks from Time Square. The staff is young, eager and helpful. The room still has the new room smell, small but no smaller than NYC standard. Room is functional and the bathroom is shower only so you don't have to deal with disgusting hotel shower curtains. Good for business and leisure. Good value too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Brand new hotel in a great location. The management and staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. Hyatt obviously hand-picked some of its best management to staff this new hotel for its opening. There were a few minor glitches on day one, but the staff put forth a good effort to resolve them. There is still construction going on to complete the upper floors and the main restaurant and rooftop lounge are not yet open. The hotel itself is modern and perfectly comfortable.
